Book of the generation of Jesus Christ, Son of David, Son of Abraham. @ Kơnŭng djuai Khua Yang Yêsu Krist, ană tơčo Đawit, ană tơčo Abraham.
Abraham begat Isaac; and Isaac begat Jacob, and Jacob begat Juda and his brethren; @ Abraham jing ama Isak, Isak jing ama Yakôp, Yakôp jing ama Yuđa, hăng ƀing adơi ayŏng ñu. 
and Juda begat Phares and Zara of Thamar; and Phares begat Esrom, and Esrom begat Aram, @ Yuđa hăng HʼTamar tơkeng kơ Parês hăng Sara, Parês jing ama Hêsrôn, Hêsrôn jing ama Aram; 
and Aram begat Aminadab, and Aminadab begat Naasson, and Naasson begat Salmon, @ Aram jing ama Aminadap, Aminadap jing ama Nahsôn, Nahsôn jing ama Salmôn. 
and Salmon begat Booz of Rachab; and Booz begat Obed of Ruth; and Obed begat Jesse, @ Salmôn dŏ kơ HʼRahap tơkeng kơ Bôas, Bôas dŏ kơ HʼRut tơkeng kơ Ôbet; Ôbet jing ama Yêsê; 
and Jesse begat David the king. And David begat Solomon, of her [that had been the wife] of Urias; @ Yêsê jing ama pơtao Đawit.
Đawit hăng bơnai Uri tơkeng kơ Salômôn. 
and Solomon begat Roboam, and Roboam begat Abia, and Abia begat Asa, @ Salômôn jing ama Rôbôam, Rôbôam jing ama Abija, Abija jing ama Asa; 
and Asa begat Josaphat, and Josaphat begat Joram, and Joram begat Ozias, @ Asa jing ama Yôsaphat; Yôsaphat jing ama Yôram, Yôram jing ama Usia, 
and Ozias begat Joatham, and Joatham begat Achaz, and Achaz begat Ezekias, @ Usia jing ama Yôtham, Yôtham jing ama Akas, Akas jing ama Hêsêkia. 
and Ezekias begat Manasses, and Manasses begat Amon, and Amon begat Josias, @ Hêsêkia jing ama Manasê, Manasê jing ama Amôs, Amôs jing ama Jôsia. 
and Josias begat Jechonias and his brethren, at the time of the carrying away of Babylon. @ Jôsia jing ama Jêkônia hăng ƀing adơi ñu, rơnŭk arăng atăt ba ƀing Israel jing mơnă pơ čar Babilôn.
And after the carrying away of Babylon, Jechonias begat Salathiel, and Salathiel begat Zorobabel, @ Giơ̆ng arăng ba krư̆ gơñu pơ čar Babilôn, Jêkônia jing ama Sêaltiêl, Sêaltiêl jing ama Sôrôbabel, 
and Zorobabel begat Abiud, and Abiud begat Eliakim, and Eliakim begat Azor, @ Sôrôbabel jing ama Abiut, Abiut jing ama Êliakim, Êliakim jing ama Asor, 
and Azor begat Sadoc, and Sadoc begat Achim, and Achim begat Eliud, @ Asor jing ama Sadôk, Sadôk jing ama Akim, Akim jing ama Êliut, 
and Eliud begat Eliazar, and Eliazar begat Matthan, and Matthan begat Jacob, @ Êliut jing ama Êlêasa, Êlêasa jing ama Mathan, Mathan jing ama Yakôp; 
and Jacob begat Joseph, the husband of Mary, of whom was born Jesus, who is called Christ. @ Yakôp jing ama Yôsep; Yôsep rơkơi HʼMari. HʼMari jing pô tơkeng kơ Yêsu arăng iâu Yang Krist.
All the generations, therefore, from Abraham to David [were] fourteen generations; and from David until the carrying away of Babylon, fourteen generations; and from the carrying away of Babylon unto the Christ, fourteen generations. @ Tui anŭn čơdơ̆ng mơ̆ng Abraham truh pơ Đawit hmâo pluh pă rơnŭk mơnuih; čơdơ̆ng mơ̆ng Đawit truh pơ rơnŭk arăng ba ƀing ană Israel jing mơnă pơ čar Babilôn hmâo pluh pă rơnŭk mơnuih; laih anŭn čơdơ̆ng mơ̆ng rơnŭk arăng ba ƀing Israel jing mơnă pơ čar Babilôn truh pơ rơnŭk Yang Krist ăt hmâo pluh pă rơnŭk mơnuih mơ̆n.
Now the birth of Jesus Christ was thus: His mother, Mary, that is, having been betrothed to Joseph, before they came together, she was found to be with child of [the] Holy Spirit. @ Tui anai, tơlơi arăng tơkeng kơ Yêsu Krist. Amĭ Ñu HʼMari hmâo djă kong laih hăng Yôsep, hlâo kơ gơñu dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt, HʼMari thâo ñu pô pi kian laih hăng Yang Bơngăt Hiam. 
But Joseph, her husband, being [a] righteous [man], and unwilling to expose her publicly, purposed to have put her away secretly; @ Yôsep, rơkơi ñu jing sa čô mơnuih tơpă, ƀu kiăng ngă pơmlâo ñu ôh, tui anŭn ñu pơmĭn kiăng lui hăng tơlơi hơgơ̆m. 
but while he pondered on these things, behold, an angel of [the] Lord appeared to him in a dream, saying, Joseph, son of David, fear not to take to [thee] Mary, thy wife, for that which is begotten in her is of [the] Holy Spirit. @ Samơ̆ tơdang ñu pơmĭn tui anŭn, anai nê hmâo sa čô ling jang hiam Khua Yang pơrơđah kơ ñu amăng tơlơi rơpơi hăng laĭ tui anai: “Ơ Yôsep, ană tơčo Đawit, anăm hwĭ ôh mă bĕ HʼMari jing bơnai ih, yua kơ ñu pi kian ană anŭn hăng Yang Bơngăt Hiam. 
And she shall bring forth a son, and thou shalt call his name Jesus, for *he* shall save his people from their sins. @ Ñu či tơkeng sa čô ană đah rơkơi, laih anŭn brơi ih pơanăn Ñu jing Yêsu, yua kơ Ñu či pơklaih ƀing plei pla Ñu mơ̆ng tơlơi soh gơñu.” 
Now all this came to pass that that might be fulfilled which was spoken by [the] Lord, through the prophet, saying, @ Abih bang tơlơi anŭn truh kiăng pơsĭt tơlơi Khua Yang hmâo pơhiăp laih mơ̆ng amăng bah pô laĭ lui hlâo:
Behold, the virgin shall be with child, and shall bring forth a son, and they shall call his name Emmanuel, which is, being interpreted, 'God with us.' @ “Anai nê, sa čô dra hmŭm či pi kian laih anŭn ñu či tơkeng sa čô ană đah rơkơi,
Laih anŭn arăng či pơanăn ñu Êmanuel,”
kiăng laĭ: “Ơi Adai dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing ta.” 
But Joseph, having awoke up from his sleep, did as the angel of [the] Lord had enjoined him, and took to [him] his wife, @ Tơ Yôsep mơdưh mơ̆ng pĭt, ñu ngă djơ̆ tui hăng tơlơi ling jang Khua Yang hmâo pơtă laih kơ ñu, ñu mă HʼMari jing hĭ bơnai ñu, 
and knew her not until she had brought forth her firstborn son: and he called his name Jesus. @ samơ̆ ñu ƀu hmâo đih pĭt hrŏm hơbĭt hăng HʼMari ôh tơl HʼMari tơkeng rai sa čô ană đah rơkơi, laih anŭn pơanăn ñu jing Yêsu.
Now Jesus having been born in Bethlehem of Judaea, in the days of Herod the king, behold magi from the east arrived at Jerusalem, saying, @ Tơdơi kơ HʼMari tơkeng kơ Yêsu pơ plei Betlêhem amăng tring Yuđa rơnŭk pơtao Hêrôt, anai nê hmâo ƀing kơhnâo mơ̆ng čar gah ngŏ truh pơ plei Yêrusalem laih anŭn tơña tui anai: 
Where is the king of the Jews that has been born? for we have seen his star in the east, and have come to do him homage. @ “Pơpă anih arăng phrâo tơkeng laih pơtao kơ ƀing Yuđa lĕ? Yua kơ gơmơi ƀuh laih pơtŭ Ñu pơ gah ngŏ hlăk tơbiă đĭ, laih anŭn gơmơi rai kiăng kơkuh pơpŭ kơ Ñu.”
But Herod the king having heard [of it], was troubled, and all Jerusalem with him; @ Tơ pơtao Hêrôt hmư̆ tơlơi anŭn, ñu laih anŭn abih bang plei Yêrusalem hmâo tơlơi rŭng răng. 
and, assembling all the chief priests and scribes of the people, he inquired of them where the Christ should be born. @ Ñu iâu pơƀŭt abih bang ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng hăng ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt laih anŭn tơña kơ gơñu: “Pơpă anih arăng tơkeng kơ Krist lĕ?”
And they said to him, In Bethlehem of Judaea; for thus it is written through the prophet: @ Gơñu laĭ glaĭ: “Pơ plei Betlêhem amăng tring Yuđa, yua kơ pô laĭ lui hlâo hmâo čih laih tui anai:
And *thou* Bethlehem, land of Juda, art in no wise the least among the governors of Juda; for out of thee shall go forth a leader who shall shepherd my people Israel. @ ‘Ơ Betlêhem amăng čar Yuđa!
Sĭt biă mă ih ƀu jing anĕt hloh ôh đơ ƀing plei prŏng amăng tring Yuđa,
Yua kơ sa čô khua wai lăng či tơbiă rai mơ̆ng ih,
Ñu či jing pô wai triu kơ ană Israel, plei pla Kâo.’”
Then Herod, having secretly called the magi, inquired of them accurately the time of the star that was appearing; @ Hnŭn yơh, Hêrôt iâu rai ƀing kơhnâo hăng tơlơi hơgơ̆m kiăng kơ thâo klă rơđah mơ̆ng ƀing gơñu hơbin pơtŭ anŭn hmâo pơrơđah laih. 
and having sent them to Bethlehem, said, Go, search out accurately concerning the child, and when ye shall have found [him] bring me back word, so that *I* also may come and do him homage. @ Ñu pơkiaŏ nao gơñu pơ plei Betlêhem laih anŭn laĭ: “Nao bĕ tơña pơñen kơ čơđai anĕt anŭn, laih anŭn tơ ƀing gih ƀuh laih Ñu, laĭ brơi bĕ kơ kâo thâo, kiăng kơ kâo ăt nao kơkuh pơpŭ kơ Ñu mơ̆n.”
And they having heard the king went their way; and lo, the star, which they had seen in the east, went before them until it came and stood over the place where the little child was. @ Giơ̆ng kơ gơñu hmư̆ tơlơi pơtao Hêrôt laĭ, gơñu nao mơtam. Anai nê, pơtŭ gơñu hmâo ƀuh laih mơ̆ng gah ngŏ nao hlâo gah anăp gơñu truh pơ anih ană anĕt dŏ. Pơ anŭn pơtŭ dŏ hĭ. 
And when they saw the star they rejoiced with exceeding great joy. @ Tơ gơñu ƀuh pơtŭ anŭn, gơñu hơ̆k mơak biă mă. 
And having come into the house they saw the little child with Mary his mother, and falling down did him homage. And having opened their treasures, they offered to him gifts, gold, and frankincense, and myrrh. @ Gơñu mŭt amăng sang laih anŭn ƀuh čơđai anĕt hăng amĭ Ñu HʼMari. Gơñu bon kơkuh kơ čơđai anĕt anŭn. Giơ̆ng anŭn gơñu pŏk hip dram gơnam yom gơñu, laih anŭn pơyơr kơ čơđai anĕt anŭn hăng khul gơnam: Mah, kơyâo ƀâu mơngưi, laih anŭn ia jrao phĭ ƀâu hiam.
And being divinely instructed in a dream not to return to Herod, they departed into their own country another way. @ Tơdơi kơ anŭn, amăng tơlơi rơpơi, Ơi Adai pơthâo kơ gơñu anăm wơ̆t glaĭ pơ pơtao Hêrôt dơ̆ng ôh, hnŭn yơh gơñu glaĭ hĭ pơ čar gơñu pô hăng jơlan pơkŏn.
Now, they having departed, behold, an angel of [the] Lord appears in a dream to Joseph, saying, Arise, take to [thee] the little child and his mother, and flee into Egypt, and be there until I shall tell thee; for Herod will seek the little child to destroy it. @ Giơ̆ng kơ ƀing kơhnâo glaĭ laih, anai nê hmâo sa čô ling jang Khua Yang bơrơđah brơi kơ Yôsep amăng tơlơi rơpơi hăng laĭ: “Tơgŭ bĕ ih, mă ba čơđai anĕt laih anŭn amĭ ñu, nao đuaĭ kơdŏp bĕ pơ čar Êjip, laih anŭn dŏ hĭ pơ anŭn tơl kâo či pơthâo brơi kơ ih dơ̆ng; yua kơ pơtao Hêrôt či hơduah kiăng pơdjai hĭ čơđai anĕt anai.”
And, having arisen, he took to [him] the little child and his mother by night, and departed into Egypt. @ Tui anŭn Yôsep tơgŭ tơdang mlam, mă ba čơđai anĕt laih anŭn amĭ ñu, hăng đuaĭ nao pơ čar Êjip. 
And he was there until the death of Herod, that that might be fulfilled which was spoken by [the] Lord through the prophet, saying, Out of Egypt have I called my son. @ Gơñu dŏ pơ anŭn tơl pơtao Hêrôt djai. Tơlơi anai kiăng pơsĭt tơlơi Khua Yang hmâo pơhiăp laih mơ̆ng pô laĭ lui hlâo tui anai: “Kâo hmâo iâu laih ană đah rơkơi Kâo tơbiă mơ̆ng čar Êjip.”
Then Herod, seeing that he had been mocked by the magi, was greatly enraged; and sent and slew all the boys which [were] in Bethlehem, and in all its borders, from two years and under, according to the time which he had accurately inquired from the magi. @ Tơ pơtao Hêrôt thâo ƀing kơhnâo hmâo pleč kơ ñu, ñu hil biă mă, laih anŭn ñu pơkiaŏ nao brơi arăng pơdjai hĭ abih bang ƀing čơđai đah rơkơi amăng plei Betlêhem laih anŭn tar ƀar tring anŭn čơdơ̆ng mơ̆ng ƀing hmâo dua thŭn pơ yŭ, djơ̆ tui hăng hrơi blan ƀing kơhnâo hmâo pơthâo brơi laih kơ ñu.
Then was fulfilled that which was spoken through Jeremias the prophet, saying, @ Tui anŭn, tơlơi pô laĭ lui hlâo Yêrêmi pơhiăp dưi hmâo tơlơi pơsĭt yơh:
A voice has been heard in Rama, weeping, and great lamentation: Rachel weeping [for] her children, and would not be comforted, because they are not. @ “Arăng hmư̆ asăp ur amăng plei Rama,
Hmâo tơlơi ur krao hăng tơlơi čŏk hia;
Anŭn jing HʼRačel dŏ čŏk hia kơ ƀing ană bă ñu.
Ñu ƀu tŭ ôh tơlơi arăng pơalum kơ ñu,
Yua kơ ană bă ñu ƀu dŏ hơdip dơ̆ng tah.”
But Herod having died, behold, an angel of [the] Lord appears in a dream to Joseph in Egypt, saying, @ Tơ pơtao Hêrôt djai laih, sa čô ling jang Khua Yang pơƀuh brơi kơ Yôsep pơ čar Êjip amăng tơlơi rơpơi, ñu laĭ: 
Arise, take to [thee] the little child and its mother, and go into the land of Israel: for they who sought the life of the little child are dead. @ “Tơgŭ bĕ, mă ba čơđai anĕt hăng amĭ Ñu wơ̆t glaĭ pơ čar Israel, yua kơ ƀing mơnuih kiăng pơdjai čơđai anĕt anŭn hmâo djai hĭ laih.” 
And he arose and took to [him] the little child and its mother, and came into the land of Israel; @ Hnŭn yơh Yôsep tơgŭ, mă ba čơđai anĕt hăng amĭ Ñu wơ̆t glaĭ pơ čar Israel.
but having heard that 'Archelaus reigns over Judaea, instead of Herod his father,' he was afraid to go there; and having been divinely instructed in a dream, he went away into the parts of Galilee, @ Samơ̆ tơ ñu hmư̆ Arkêlôs hrua ama ñu Hêrôt ngă pơtao wai lăng tring Yuđa, Yôsep hwĭ ƀu khĭn glaĭ ôh pơ anŭn; laih anŭn yua kơ Ơi Adai hmâo pơthâo kơ ñu dơ̆ng amăng tơlơi rơpơi, tui anŭn ñu nao hĭ pơ tring Galilê. 
and came and dwelt in a town called Nazareth; so that that should be fulfilled which was spoken through the prophets, He shall be called a Nazaraean. @ Pơ anŭn ñu dŏ amăng sa boh plei arăng pơanăn plei Nasaret, kiăng pơsĭt tơlơi ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo hmâo laĭ laih: “Arăng či iâu Ñu jing mơnuih plei Nasaret.”
Now in those days comes John the baptist, preaching in the wilderness of Judaea, @ Hlăk anŭn, Yôhan Ƀatem nao pơtô amăng tơdrŏn har čar Yuđa tui anai: 
and saying, Repent, for the kingdom of the heavens has drawn nigh. @ “Kơhmal bĕ tơlơi soh ƀing gih, yua kơ Dêh Čar Pơtao Plei Hiam giăm truh laih yơh!” 
For this is he who has been spoken of through Esaias the prophet, saying, Voice of him that crieth in the wilderness: prepare ye the way of [the] Lord, make straight his paths. @ Kơ Yôhan anŭn yơh pô laĭ lui hlâo Êsai hmâo laĭ laih tui anai:
“Hmâo asăp mơnuih pơhiăp kraih amăng tơdrŏn tač:
‘Prăp pre bĕ jơlan brơi kơ Khua Yang.
Ngă tơpă bĕ khul jơlan Ñu.’”
And John himself had his garment of camel's hair, and a leathern girdle about his loins, and his nourishment was locusts and wild honey. @ Yôhan buh ao blâu aseh samô laih anŭn hruă kơiăng ñu hăng hơdrăng klĭ. Ñu ƀơ̆ng kơtop laih anŭn ia hơni glai. 
Then went out to him Jerusalem, and all Judaea, and all the country round the Jordan, @ Ƀing ană plei pla mơ̆ng plei Yêrusalem, mơ̆ng tar ƀar kwar Yuđa, laih anŭn mơ̆ng abih kwar jĕ giăm ia krong Yurdan leng kơ nao pơ ñu soh sel. 
and were baptised by him in the Jordan, confessing their sins. @ Gơñu pơhaih tơlơi soh gơñu laih anŭn tŭ Yôhan ngă ƀatem kơ gơñu amăng ia krong Yurdan.
But seeing many of the Pharisees and Sadducees coming to his baptism, he said to them, Offspring of vipers, who has forewarned you to flee from the coming wrath? @ Samơ̆ tơ ñu ƀuh lu ƀing Pharisi laih anŭn ƀing Sadusi rai tŭ ƀatem, ñu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Ơ ƀing djuai ala tơpơ̆ng, hlơi pơthâo brơi kơ ƀing gih dưi đuaĭ kơdŏp mơ̆ng tơlơi Ơi Adai hil či truh? 
Produce therefore fruit worthy of repentance. @ Brơi ƀing gih pơrơđah bĕ bruă hiam ƀing gih năng lăp hăng tơlơi ƀing gih kơhmal tơlơi soh, 
And do not think to say within yourselves, We have Abraham for [our] father; for I say unto you, that God is able of these stones to raise up children to Abraham. @ laih anŭn anăm pơhiăp pơgao hăng laĭ: ‘Abraham yơh jing ơi adon gơmơi’; yua kơ kâo laĭ brơi kơ ƀing gih thâo, Ơi Adai ăt dưi pơjing rai mơ̆n ană tơčo Abraham mơ̆ng khul boh pơtâo anai. 
And already the axe is applied to the root of the trees; every tree therefore not producing good fruit is cut down and cast into the fire. @ Ră anai Ơi Adai ô laih jong ƀơi phŭn kơyâo; abih bang kơyâo ƀu mơboh rai boh hiam ôh, Ñu či drom hĭ laih anŭn glŏm lui amăng apui. 
*I* indeed baptise you with water to repentance, but he that comes after me is mightier than I, whose sandals I am not fit to bear; *he* shall baptise you with [the] Holy Spirit and fire; @ Kâo ngă ƀatem kơ ƀing gih hăng ia yua kơ tơlơi ƀing gih kơhmal tơlơi soh, samơ̆ Pô rai tơdơi kơ kâo jing mơyang hloh kơ kâo, laih anŭn kâo ƀu năng lăp ôh djă klĭ juă Ñu. Ñu či ngă ƀatem kơ ƀing gih hăng Yang Bơngăt Hiam laih anŭn hăng apui. 
whose winnowing fan [is] in his hand, and he shall thoroughly purge his threshing-floor, and shall gather his wheat into the garner, but the chaff he will burn with fire unquenchable. @ Tơngan Ñu djă čơngua, kiăng pơi pơrơgoh anih prăh pơdai Ñu. Ñu či pơƀŭt pơdai Ñu amăng atông, samơ̆ Ñu či čuh hĭ hơkam amăng apui ƀu thâo thăm ôh.”
Then comes Jesus from Galilee to the Jordan to John, to be baptised of him; @ Hlăk anŭn, Yêsu tơbiă mơ̆ng kwar Galilê nao pơ Yôhan ƀơi ia krong Yurdan, kiăng kơ Yôhan ngă ƀatem kơ Ñu. 
but John urgently forbad him, saying, *I* have need to be baptised of thee; and comest *thou* to me? @ Yôhan khă Ñu laih anŭn laĭ: “Tui hăng tơlơi djơ̆ kâo yơh kiăng kơ Ih ngă ƀatem brơi kơ kâo, samơ̆ hyư̆m Ih rai pơ kâo lĕ?” 
But Jesus answering said to him, Suffer [it] now; for thus it becometh us to fulfil all righteousness. Then he suffers him. @ Samơ̆ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ kơ ñu: “Brơi ngă bĕ ră anai, yua kơ ƀing ta khŏm ngă pơgiơ̆ng hĭ abih bruă tơlơi tơpă.” Tui anŭn, Yôhan tŭ ư yơh. 
And Jesus, having been baptised, went up straightway from the water, and lo, the heavens were opened to him, and he saw the Spirit of God descending as a dove, and coming upon him: @ Giơ̆ng kơ Yêsu tŭ ƀatem, hlăk Ñu tơgŭ đĭ mơ̆ng ia, ƀơi mông anŭn mơtam khul adai pŏk hĭ, Ñu ƀuh Yang Bơngăt Hiam Ơi Adai trŭn rai hrup hăng čĭm bơrơgơ̆m laih anŭn găm ƀơi Ñu. 
and behold, a voice out of the heavens saying, This is my beloved Son, in whom I have found my delight. @ Giơ̆ng anŭn hmâo asăp pơhiăp mơ̆ng adai laĭ tui anai: “Anai jing Ană Kâo khăp biă mă; amăng Ñu yơh Kâo hmâo tơlơi mơak biă mă.”
Then Jesus was carried up into the wilderness by the Spirit to be tempted of the devil: @ Giơ̆ng anŭn, Yang Bơngăt Hiam atăt ba Yêsu pơ tơdrŏn har brơi yang sat plư Ñu. 
and having fasted forty days and forty nights, afterwards he hungered. @ Giơ̆ng kơ Ñu ư̆ ƀơ̆ng huă pă pluh hrơi laih anŭn pă pluh mlam, Ñu rơpa. 
And the tempter coming up to him said, If thou be Son of God, speak, that these stones may become loaves of bread. @ Pô plư rai pơ Ñu laih anŭn laĭ tui anai: “Tơdah Ih jing Ană Ơi Adai, hrih bĕ khul boh pơtâo anai jing hĭ ƀañ tơpŭng.”
But he answering said, It is written, Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word which goes out through God's mouth. @ Samơ̆ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp hmâo čih laih tui anai: ‘Ană mơnuih hơdip ƀu djơ̆ kơnơ̆ng yua mơ̆ng ƀañ tơpŭng đôč ôh, samơ̆ ăt hơdip yua mơ̆ng rĭm boh pơhiăp tơbiă rai mơ̆ng amăng bah Ơi Adai mơ̆n.’”
Then the devil takes him to the holy city, and sets him upon the edge of the temple, @ Yang sat atăt ba Ñu nao pơ Yêrusalem, plei rơgoh hiam, brơi Ñu dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơi gor bơbŭng sang kơkuh pơpŭ, 
and says to him, If thou be Son of God cast thyself down; for it is written, He shall give charge to his angels concerning thee, and on [their] hands shall they bear thee, lest in anywise thou strike thy foot against a stone. @ laih anŭn laĭ kơ Ñu tui anai: “Tơdah Ih jing Ană Ơi Adai, kơdâo trŭn bĕ pơ lŏn; yua kơ Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp hmâo čih laih tui anai:
‘Ơi Adai či pơđar ƀing ling jang hiam Ñu wai lăng Ih,’
laih anŭn ‘Gơñu či pŭ Ih hăng tơngan gơñu,
Hwĭ kơ tơkai Ih tơhnač djơ̆ boh pơtâo.’”
Jesus said to him, It is again written, Thou shalt not tempt [the] Lord thy God. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ kơ ñu: “Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp ăt hmâo čih dơ̆ng tui anai: ‘Anăm lông lăng Khua Yang Ơi Adai ih ôh.’”
Again the devil takes him to a very high mountain, and shews him all the kingdoms of the world, and their glory, @ Giơ̆ng anŭn, yang sat ba Ñu nao pơ čư̆ glong biă mă, kơčrâo brơi Ñu abih bang dêh čar pơtao ƀơi lŏn tơnah laih anŭn tơlơi guh kơang gơñu. 
and says to him, All these things will I give thee if, falling down, thou wilt do me homage. @ Yang sat laĭ kơ Ñu tui anai: “Tơdah Ih bon laih anŭn kơkuh pơpŭ kơ kâo, kâo či brơi kơ Ih abih bang dêh čar anŭn hăng tơlơi guh kơang gơñu.”
Then says Jesus to him, Get thee away, Satan, for it is written, Thou shalt do homage to [the] Lord thy God, and him alone shalt thou serve. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ kơ ñu: “Ơ Satan, đuaĭ bĕ! Yua kơ Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp hmâo čih laih tui anai: ‘Brơi ih kơkuh pơpŭ bĕ kơ Khua Yang Ơi Adai ih, laih anŭn kơnơ̆ng mă bruă kơ hơjăn Ñu đôč.’”
Then the devil leaves him, and behold, angels came and ministered to him. @ Tui anŭn yang sat đuaĭ hĭ mơ̆ng Ñu, laih anŭn anai nê, hmâo ƀing ling jang rai laih anŭn buih bruă kơ Ñu mơtam.
But having heard that John was delivered up, he departed into Galilee: @ Tơ Yêsu hmư̆ arăng krư̆ Yôhan laih, Ñu nao pơ kwar Galilê. 
and having left Nazareth, he went and dwelt at Capernaum, which is on the sea-side in the borders of Zabulon and Nepthalim, @ Ñu tơbiă mơ̆ng plei Nasaret laih anŭn nao dŏ pơ plei Kapernum giăm ia rơsĭ, amăng tring Sabulôn laih anŭn Naptali, 
that that might be fulfilled which was spoken through Esaias the prophet, saying, @ Kiăng ngă pơsĭt tơlơi pô laĭ lui hlâo Êsai hmâo pơhiăp laih:
Land of Zabulon and land of Nepthalim, way of [the] sea beyond the Jordan, Galilee of the nations: @ “Tring Sabulôn laih anŭn Naptali,
Jơlan nao pơ ia rơsĭ, gah adih ia krong Yurdan,
Kwar Galilê lơ̆m kơ ƀing djuai tuai.
the people sitting in darkness has seen a great light, and to those sitting in [the] country and shadow of death, to them has light sprung up. @ Ƀing ană plei pla dŏ hơdip amăng tơlơi kơnăm mơmŏt,
Hmâo ƀuh laih tơlơi bơngač prŏng;
Laih anŭn ƀing mơnuih dŏ hơdip ƀơi anih hmâo tơ-u tơlơi djai,
Hmâo ƀuh laih tơlơi bơngač pơčrang.”
From that time began Jesus to preach and to say, Repent, for the kingdom of the heavens has drawn nigh. @ Mơ̆ng hrơi anŭn, Yêsu čơdơ̆ng pơtô tui anai: “Kơhmal bĕ tơlơi soh ƀing gih, yua kơ dêh čar pơtao plei hiam giăm truh laih yơh.”
And walking by the sea of Galilee, he saw two brothers, Simon called Peter, and Andrew his brother, casting a net into the sea, for they were fishers; @ Tơdang Yêsu rơbat kơtuai hang ia rơsĭ Galilê, Ñu ƀuh dua čô adơi ayŏng jing Simôn, anăn pơkŏn dơ̆ng jing Pêtrôs, laih anŭn Andrê adơi ñu. Gơñu dŏ dăng hơñual amăng ia rơsĭ, yua kơ gơñu jing mơnuih mă bruă trah akan. 
and he says to them, Come after me, and I will make you fishers of men. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Đuaĭ tui Kâo bĕ, Kâo či pơjing ƀing gih jing mơnuih trah mơnuih.” 
And they, having left their trawl-nets, immediately followed him. @ Tañ mơtam gơñu lui hĭ hơñual, laih anŭn đuaĭ tui Yêsu.
And going on thence he saw other two brothers, James the [son] of Zebedee and John his brother, in the ship with Zebedee their father, mending their trawl-nets, and he called them; @ Tơdang Ñu nao ataih ƀiă mơ̆ng anŭn, Ñu ƀuh dua čô adơi ayŏng pơkŏn jing Yakơ, ană đah rơkơi Sêbêdê, laih anŭn adơi ñu Yôhan. Gơñu dŏ pơsir hơñual amăng sŏng hrŏm hơbĭt Sêbêdê ama gơñu, Yêsu iâu gơñu. 
and they, having left the ship and their father, immediately followed him. @ Tañ mơtam gơñu lui hĭ sŏng wơ̆t hăng ama gơñu laih anŭn đuaĭ tui Yêsu.
And [Jesus] went round the whole [of] Galilee, teaching in their synagogues, and preaching the glad tidings of the kingdom, and healing every disease and every bodily weakness among the people. @ Yêsu hyu tar ƀar kwar Galilê, pơtô pơhrăm amăng sang bơjơnum laih anŭn pơtô Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam kơ dêh čar pơtao, laih anŭn pơsuaih djŏp mơta tơlơi ruă nuă, tơlơi dju djuam duăm ruă ƀing ană plei pla. 
And his fame went out into the whole [of] Syria, and they brought to him all that were ill, suffering under various diseases and pains, and those possessed by demons, and lunatics, and paralytics; and he healed them. @ Tui anŭn tơlơi hing ang kơ anăn Ñu bang hyu djŏp tring Siri. Arăng ba rai kơ Ñu abih bang ƀing mơnuih duăm ruă, ƀing hmâo tơlơi duăm ruă phara phara, ƀing yang sat ngă, ƀing hưt dư, laih anŭn ƀing rơwen. Ñu pơsuaih brơi abih bang ƀing gơñu. 
And great crowds followed him from Galilee, and Decapolis, and Jerusalem, and Judaea, and beyond the Jordan. @ Hmâo lu biă mă ƀing mơnuih đuaĭ tui Ñu mơ̆ng kwar Galilê, mơ̆ng tring Dêkapôlis, mơ̆ng plei Yêrusalem, mơ̆ng kwar Yuđa, laih anŭn mơ̆ng kwar gah dih ia krong Yurdan.
But seeing the crowds, he went up into the mountain, and having sat down, his disciples came to him; @ Tơ Yêsu ƀuh khul mơnuih lu, Ñu đĭ nao pơ čư̆. Laih Ñu dŏ ber, ƀing ding kơna Ñu rai giăm pơ Ñu. 
and, having opened his mouth, he taught them, saying, @ Yêsu čơdơ̆ng pơhiăp laih anŭn pơtô tui anai:
Blessed [are] the poor in spirit, for *theirs* is the kingdom of the heavens. @ “Mơyun hiam yơh kơ ƀing ƀun rin amăng bơngăt jua,
yua kơ dêh čar pơtao plei hiam lơ̆m kơ gơñu!
Blessed they that mourn, for *they* shall be comforted. @ Mơyun hiam yơh kơ ƀing čŏk hia,
Yua kơ Ơi Adai či pơalum gơñu!
Blessed the meek, for *they* shall inherit the earth. @ Mơyun hiam yơh kơ ƀing thâo luă gŭ,
Yua kơ gơñu či mă tŭ lŏn tơnah!
Blessed they who hunger and thirst after righteousness, for *they* shall be filled. @ Mơyun hiam yơh kơ ƀing rơpa laih anŭn mơhao kơ tơlơi tơpă,
Yua kơ Ơi Adai či pơhrăp brơi gơñu!
Blessed the merciful, for *they* shall find mercy. @ Mơyun hiam yơh kơ ƀing thâo pap drap,
Yua kơ Ơi Adai či pap drap kơ gơñu!
Blessed the pure in heart, for *they* shall see God. @ Mơyun hiam yơh kơ ƀing hmâo pran jua rơgoh,
Yua kơ gơñu či ƀuh Ơi Adai!
Blessed the peace-makers, for *they* shall be called sons of God. @ Mơyun hiam yơh kơ ƀing thâo pơjing tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua,
Yua kơ Ơi Adai či iâu gơñu jing ƀing ană Ơi Adai!
Blessed they who are persecuted on account of righteousness, for *theirs* is the kingdom of the heavens. @ Mơyun hiam yơh kơ ƀing tŭ tơlơi arăng ngă sat kơ gơñu yua kơ tơlơi tơpă,
Yua kơ dêh čar pơtao plei hiam lơ̆m kơ gơñu!
Blessed are ye when they may reproach and persecute you, and say every wicked thing against you, lying, for my sake. @ Mơyun hiam yơh kơ ƀing gih tơdah arăng hơtoh djraĭ, ngă sat laih anŭn pơčeh lu mơta tơlơi sat pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ ƀing gih yua kơ Kâo. 
Rejoice and exult, for your reward is great in the heavens; for thus have they persecuted the prophets who were before you. @ Hơ̆k mơak bĕ, yua kơ pri ƀing gih prŏng biă mă amăng adai, yua kơ arăng hmâo ngă sat laih kơ ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo, hlâo kơ ƀing gih kar kaĭ mơ̆n.”
*Ye* are the salt of the earth; but if the salt have become insipid, wherewith shall it be salted? It is no longer fit for anything but to be cast out and to be trodden under foot by men. @ “Ƀing gih jing hra kơ lŏn tơnah; samơ̆ tơdah hra rơngiă hĭ mơnâo mơsĭn ñu, hyư̆m dưi ngă brơi ñu mơsĭn glaĭ dơ̆ng lĕ? Hra anŭn ƀu thâo yua dơ̆ng tah, kơnơ̆ng tuh glŏm lui pơ rơngiao laih anŭn arăng juă hĭ gah yŭ tơkai.
*Ye* are the light of the world: a city situated on the top of a mountain cannot be hid. @ Ƀing gih jing tơlơi bơngač kơ lŏn tơnah. Sa boh plei prŏng dŏ ƀơi hăng ngŏ čư̆ ƀu dưi hơgơ̆m hĭ ôh. 
Nor do [men] light a lamp and put it under the bushel, but upon the lamp-stand, and it shines for all who are in the house. @ Ƀu hmâo ôh hlơi čuh apui kơđen laih anŭn gom hĭ ñu hăng kơthŭng, samơ̆ arăng pioh ñu ƀơi gơ̆ng apui kơđen, kiăng kơ ñu pơčrang rơđah abih bang mơnuih amăng sang. 
Let your light thus shine before men, so that they may see your upright works, and glorify your Father who is in the heavens. @ Kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n brơi tơlơi bơngač ƀing gih pơčrang ƀơi anăp mơnuih mơnam, kiăng kơ gơñu dưi ƀuh bruă hiam ƀing gih ngă laih anŭn pơpŭ bơni kơ Ama ƀing gih amăng adai.”
Think not that I am come to make void the law or the prophets; I am not come to make void, but to fulfil. @ “Anăm pơmĭn ôh Kâo rai kiăng pơrai hĭ tơlơi juăt ƀôdah tơlơi ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo čih. Kâo rai ƀu djơ̆ kiăng pơrai hĭ ôh, samơ̆ kiăng ngă pơsĭt hĭ. 
For verily I say unto you, Until the heaven and the earth pass away, one iota or one tittle shall in no wise pass from the law till all come to pass. @ Yua kơ sĭt biă mă Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, tơl adai laih anŭn lŏn tơnah rơgao đŭt hĭ, sa boh tŭt ƀôdah sa ară gat amăng tơlơi juăt ƀu či rơgao hĭ ôh, tơl abih bang tơlơi anŭn či krĕp djơ̆ soh sel. 
Whosoever then shall do away with one of these least commandments, and shall teach men so, shall be called least in the kingdom of the heavens; but whosoever shall practise and teach [them], *he* shall be called great in the kingdom of the heavens. @ Tui anŭn hlơi pô ngă gao sa tơlơi anĕt hloh amăng khul tơlơi juăt anai, laih anŭn pơtô kơ arăng ngă kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n, ñu či jing pô anĕt hloh amăng dêh čar pơtao plei hiam. Samơ̆ hlơi pô gưt tơlơi juăt laih anŭn pơtô tơlơi anŭn kơ arăng mơ̆n, ñu či jing pô prŏng amăng dêh čar pơtao plei hiam. 
For I say unto you, that unless your righteousness surpass [that] of the scribes and Pharisees, ye shall in no wise enter into the kingdom of the heavens. @ Yua kơ Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, tơdah tơlơi tơpă ƀing gih ƀu rơgao hloh kơ tơlơi tơpă ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt laih anŭn ƀing Pharisi, ƀing gih ƀu či mŭt amăng dêh čar pơtao plei hiam ôh.”
Ye have heard that it was said to the ancients, Thou shalt not kill; but whosoever shall kill shall be subject to the judgment. @ “Ƀing gih hmâo hmư̆ laih tơlơi arăng pơtô kơ ƀing mơnuih rơnŭk đưm: ‘Anăm pơdjai mơnuih ôh; laih anŭn hlơi pô pơdjai mơnuih năng lăp kơ tơlơi phat kơđi.’ 
But *I* say unto you, that every one that is lightly angry with his brother shall be subject to the judgment; but whosoever shall say to his brother, Raca, shall be subject to [be called before] the sanhedrim; but whosoever shall say, Fool, shall be subject to the penalty of the hell of fire. @ Samơ̆ Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, hlơi pô hil kơ adơi ayŏng ñu ăt năng lăp tŭ tơlơi phat kơđi mơ̆n; hlơi pô laĭ kơ adơi ayŏng ñu ‘Ih mlŭk’ či năng lăp jao kơ tơpul khua phat kơđi; hlơi pô laĭ ‘Ih mlŭk hưt’ či năng lăp dŏ amăng war apui. 
If therefore thou shouldest offer thy gift at the altar, and there shouldest remember that thy brother has something against thee, @ Tui anŭn, tơdang ih pơyơr mơnơ̆ng pơyơr kơ Ơi Adai ƀơi kơƀang ngă yang, hlăk anŭn ih hơdơr kơ adơi ayŏng ih hlăk dŏ hmâo tơlơi hăng ih, 
leave there thy gift before the altar, and first go, be reconciled to thy brother, and then come and offer thy gift. @ lui hĭ bĕ mơnơ̆ng ih pơyơr ƀơi anăp kơƀang ngă yang laih anŭn nao pơsir hĭ hăng adơi ayŏng ih hlâo; Giơ̆ng anŭn kah ih dưi rai pơyơr mơnơ̆ng ih kơ Ơi Adai.
Make friends with thine adverse party quickly, whilst thou art in the way with him; lest some time the adverse party deliver thee to the judge, and the judge deliver thee to the officer, and thou be cast into prison. @ Tañ pơsir bĕ hăng pô hmâo tơlơi hăng ih tơdang ih rơbat hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ñu ƀơi kơtuai jơlan, hwĭ dah ñu pơčŭt ih laih anŭn ba ih pơ khua phat kơđi, laih anŭn khua phat kơđi jao ih kơ khua wai sang mơnă, laih anŭn arăng krư̆ hĭ ih. 
Verily I say to thee, Thou shalt in no wise come out thence till thou hast paid the last farthing. @ Kâo laĭ sĭt biă mă kơ ih, ih ƀu či dưi tơbiă ôh mơ̆ng sang mơnă tơl ih kla hĭ sar prăk hnal tuč.”
Ye have heard that it has been said, Thou shalt not commit adultery. @ “Ƀing gih hmâo hmư̆ laih arăng laĭ đưm: ‘Anăm klĕ pyu ôh’. 
But *I* say unto you, that every one who looks upon a woman to lust after her has already committed adultery with her in his heart. @ Samơ̆ Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, hlơi pô lăng kơ đah kơmơi hăng tơlơi amoaih hưp kiăng ngă soh, ñu klĕ pyu laih hăng đah kơmơi anŭn amăng pran jua ñu. 
But if thy right eye be a snare to thee, pluck it out and cast it from thee: for it is profitable for thee that one of thy members perish, and not thy whole body be cast into hell. @ Tơdah mơta gah hơnuă ih pơsoh ih, blač hĭ ñu laih anŭn glŏm hĭ pơ ataih; yua kơ hiam hloh kơ ih rơngiă sa črăn amăng drơi jan ih hăng arăng glŏm hĭ abih drơi jan ih dŏ amăng war apui. 
And if thy right hand be a snare to thee, cut it off and cast it from thee: for it is profitable for thee that one of thy members perish, and not thy whole body be cast into hell. @ Tơdah tơngan hơnuă ih pơsoh ih, čơ̆ng glŏm lui hĭ ñu pơ ataih; hiam hloh kơ ih rơngiă sa ƀĕ tơngan hăng abih drơi jan ih dŏ amăng war apui.”
It has been said too, Whosoever shall put away his wife, let him give her a letter of divorce. @ “Ƀing đưm hmâo laĭ mơ̆n: ‘Hlơi pô pơklaih lui bơnai ñu, brơi ñu čih kơ gơ̆ sa pŏk hră pơklaih lui.’ 
But *I* say unto you, that whosoever shall put away his wife, except for cause of fornication, makes her commit adultery, and whosoever marries one that is put away commits adultery. @ Samơ̆ Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, rĭm čô hlơi pô pơklaih lui bơnai ñu ƀu djơ̆ yua kơ bơnai ñu jing mơnuih rih răm ôh, ñu pơjing gơ̆ jing sa čô đah kơmơi klĕ pyu; laih anŭn hlơi pô dŏ sa čô đah kơmơi arăng pơklaih lui laih jing mơnuih klĕ pyu kar kaĭ mơ̆n.”
Again, ye have heard that it has been said to the ancients, Thou shalt not forswear thyself, but shalt render to the Lord what thou hast sworn. @ “Ƀing gih hmâo hmư̆ laih tơlơi arăng pơtô kơ ƀing mơnuih rơnŭk đưm: ‘Anăm ih ƀuăn rơ̆ng hăng tơlơi ƀlor ôh, samơ̆ brơi ih pơsĭt ƀơi anăp Khua Yang tơlơi ih hmâo ƀuăn rơ̆ng laih.’ 
But *I* say unto you, Do not swear at all; neither by the heaven, because it is [the] throne of God; @ Samơ̆ Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, anăm ƀuăn rơ̆ng hơgĕt ôh, thâo dah hăng adai, yua kơ adai jing gre pơtao kơ Ơi Adai, 
nor by the earth, because it is [the] footstool of his feet; nor by Jerusalem, because it is [the] city of the great King. @ thâo dah hăng lŏn, yua kơ lŏn jing hnăl tơkai Ơi Adai juă, thâo dah hăng plei Yêrusalem, yua kơ plei anŭn jing plei kơ Pơtao prŏng. 
Neither shalt thou swear by thy head, because thou canst not make one hair white or black. @ Laih anŭn anăm ƀuăn rơ̆ng hăng boh akŏ ih pô ôh, yua kơ ih ƀu dưi pơjing ôh sa ară ƀuk ih jing hĭ kŏ ƀôdah jŭ. 
But let your word be Yea, yea; Nay, nay; but what is more than these is from evil. @ Brơi tơlơi ih pơhiăp ‘Ơ’ jing Ơ, ƀôdah ‘Ơ ơh’ jing Ơ ơh. Hơgĕt tơlơi thim dơ̆ng kơ tơlơi anŭn tơbiă rai mơ̆ng yang sat yơh.”
Ye have heard that it has been said, Eye for eye and tooth for tooth. @ “Ƀing gih hmâo hmư̆ laih tơlơi arăng laĭ: ‘Mơta kla glaĭ kơ mơta, laih anŭn tơgơi kla glaĭ kơ tơgơi.’ 
But *I* say unto you, not to resist evil; but whoever shall strike thee on thy right cheek, turn to him also the other; @ Samơ̆ Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih: Anăm pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ hăng mơnuih sat ƀai ôh. Samơ̆ tơdah arăng pah meng gah hơnuă ih, brơi ñu pah wơ̆t meng gah iao ih kar kaĭ mơ̆n. 
and to him that would go to law with thee and take thy body coat, leave him thy cloak also. @ Tơdah arăng phong kiăng mă ao amăng lăm ih, brơi ñu mă wơ̆t ao phyung gah rơngiao kar kaĭ mơ̆n. 
And whoever will compel thee to go one mile, go with him two. @ Laih anŭn tơdah arăng pơgŏ ih rơbat sa wang, brơi ih rơbat hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ñu dua wang. 
To him that asks of thee give, and from him that desires to borrow of thee turn not away. @ Pha brơi bĕ kơ hlơi pô rơkâo mơ̆ng ih, laih anŭn anăm hơngah ôh kơ hlơi rơkâo čan mơ̆ng ih.”
Ye have heard that it has been said, Thou shalt love thy neighbour and hate thine enemy. @  “Ƀing gih hmư̆ arăng laĭ: ‘Khăp bĕ kơ pô jum dar ih laih anŭn bơrơmŭt kơ ayăt ih.’ 
But *I* say unto you, Love your enemies, [bless those who curse you,] do good to those who hate you, and pray for those who [insult you and] persecute you, @ Samơ̆ Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, khăp bĕ kơ ayăt ƀing gih, laih anŭn iâu laĭ brơi kơ ƀing ngă sat kơ ƀing gih, 
that ye may be [the] sons of your Father who is in [the] heavens; for he makes his sun rise on evil and good, and sends rain on just and unjust. @ kiăng kơ ƀing gih dưi jing ană Ama ƀing gih amăng adai; yua kơ Ñu brơi yang hrơi pơčrang kơ ƀing sat wơ̆t kơ ƀing hiam, laih anŭn Ñu brơi ia hơjan kơ ƀing tơpă wơ̆t kơ ƀing wĕ wŏ mơ̆n. 
For if ye should love those who love you, what reward have ye? Do not also the tax-gatherers the same? @ Yua kơ tơdah ƀing gih kơnơ̆ng khăp kơ ƀing khăp kơ ƀing gih đôč, hơgĕt tơlơi bơni ƀing gih či hmâo lĕ? Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă ƀing ring jia ăt ngă tui anŭn? 
And if ye should salute your brethren only, what do ye extraordinary? Do not also the Gentiles the same? @ Laih anŭn tơdah ƀing gih kơnơ̆ng kơkuh tơña adơi ayŏng ƀing gih đôč, hơgĕt tơlơi ƀing gih ngă hloh kơ pô pơkŏn? Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă ƀing djuai tuai ăt ngă tui anŭn? 
Be *ye* therefore perfect as your heavenly Father is perfect. @ Tui anŭn, brơi kơ ƀing gih jing klă tum kar hăng Ama ƀing gih amăng adai jing klă tum.”
Take heed not to do your alms before men to be seen of them, otherwise ye have no reward with your Father who is in the heavens. @ “Răng bĕ, tơdang ƀing gih ngă bruă hiam kơ arăng anăm ngă ôh yua kơ kiăng arăng ƀuh ƀing gih. Yua kơ tơdah ƀing gih ngă tui anŭn, ƀing gih ƀu či hmâo ôh tơlơi bơni mơ̆ng Ama ƀing gih amăng adai adih.
When therefore thou doest alms, sound not a trumpet before thee, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, so that they may have glory from men. Verily I say unto you, They have their reward. @ Tui anŭn tơdah ih pha brơi mơnơ̆ng pap kơ arăng, anăm ayŭp tơki ôh kar hăng ƀing pơrup mă ngă amăng sang bơjơnum laih anŭn ƀơi jơlan glung, kiăng kơ mơnuih pơpŭ bơni kơ gơñu. Sĭt biă mă kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, ƀing anŭn hmâo laih pri kơ ƀing gơñu. 
But thou, when thou doest alms, let not thy left hand know what thy right hand does; @ Samơ̆ tơ ih brơi mơnơ̆ng pap, anăm brơi ôh tơngan gah iao ih thâo hơgĕt tơlơi tơngan gah hơnuă ih ngă, 
so that thine alms may be in secret, and thy Father who sees in secret will render [it] to thee. @ kiăng kơ mơnơ̆ng ih brơi pap arăng ƀu ƀuh ôh; kơnơ̆ng hơjăn Ama ih, Pô ƀuh amăng tơlơi hơgơ̆m či bơni kơ ih.”
And when thou prayest, thou shalt not be as the hypocrites; for they love to pray standing in the synagogues and in the corners of the streets so that they should appear to men. Verily I say unto you, They have their reward. @ “Tơdang ƀing gih iâu laĭ, anăm ƀing gih ngă kar hăng ƀing plơ̆m ƀlor ôh; yua kơ gơñu khăp dŏ dơ̆ng iâu laĭ amăng sang bơjơnum laih anŭn ƀơi akiăng jơlan kiăng kơ arăng ƀuh gơñu. Sĭt biă mă Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, gơñu hmâo tŭ mă laih tơlơi bơni kơ gơñu. 
But *thou*, when thou prayest, enter into thy chamber, and having shut thy door, pray to thy Father who is in secret, and thy Father who sees in secret will render [it] to thee. @ Samơ̆ tơdang ih iâu laĭ, brơi ih mŭt bĕ amăng anih ih, krư̆ hĭ bah amăng, laih anŭn iâu laĭ kơ Ama ih, Pô dŏ amăng anih hơgơ̆m. Hnŭn yơh Ama ih, Pô ƀuh amăng anih hơgơ̆m, či apah bơni kơ ih yơh.
But when ye pray, use not vain repetitions, as those who are of the nations: for they think they shall be heard through their much speaking. @ Tơdang ƀing gih iâu laĭ, anăm răk nanao sa mơta tơlơi kar hăng ƀing djuai tuai ngă ôh; yua kơ gơñu pơmĭn Ơi Adai či hmư̆ gơñu yua kơ gơñu pơhiăp lu. 
Be not ye therefore like them, for your Father knows of what things ye have need before ye beg [anything] of him. @ Anăm hla tui ƀing gơñu ôh, yua kơ Ama ƀing gih thâo laih hơgĕt tơlơi ƀing gih kiăng hlâo kơ ƀing gih rơkâo kơ Ñu. 
Thus therefore pray *ye*: Our Father who art in the heavens, let thy name be sanctified, @ Tui anŭn, brơi ƀing gih iâu laĭ bĕ tui anai:
‘Ơ ama gơmơi dŏ amăng adai adih hơi;
Brơi kơ abih bang mơnuih pơpŭ pơyom kơ anăn rơgoh hiam Ih.
let thy kingdom come, let thy will be done as in heaven so upon the earth; @ Brơi kơ dêh čar pơtao Ih tañ truh,
Brơi tơlơi Ih kiăng dưi jing ƀơi lŏn tơnah kar hăng dưi jing amăng adai mơ̆n!
give us to-day our needed bread, @ Pha brơi bĕ kơ ƀing gơmơi mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă djŏp kơ rĭm hrơi;
and forgive us our debts, as we also forgive our debtors, @ Pap brơi bĕ tơlơi soh ƀing gơmơi,
Kar hăng gơmơi hmâo pap brơi laih kơ ƀing mơnuih ngă soh kơ gơmơi.
and lead us not into temptation, but save us from evil. @ Anăm lui gơmơi lĕ amăng tơlơi plư ôh,
Samơ̆ pơklaih bĕ gơmơi mơ̆ng Pô Sat Ƀai.
[Yua kơ dêh čar pơtao, tơlơi mơyang, laih anŭn tơlơi ang yang pioh laih kơ Ih nanao hlŏng lar. Amen.]’
For if ye forgive men their offences, your heavenly Father also will forgive you [yours], @ Yua kơ tơdah ƀing gih pap brơi kơ tơlơi soh arăng, Ama ƀing gih amăng adai ăt či pap brơi tơlơi soh ƀing gih mơ̆n. 
but if ye do not forgive men their offences, neither will your Father forgive your offences. @ Samơ̆ tơdah ƀing gih ƀu pap brơi ôh kơ tơlơi soh arăng, Ama ƀing gih kŏn či pap brơi tơlơi soh ƀing gih lơi.”
And when ye fast, be not as the hypocrites, downcast in countenance; for they disfigure their faces, so that they may appear fasting to men: verily I say unto you, They have their reward. @ “Laih anŭn tơ ƀing gih ư̆ ƀơ̆ng huă, anăm bơrơđah ôh ƀô̆ mơta rơngot, kar hăng ƀing plơ̆m ƀlor; yua kơ gơñu bơrơđah ƀô̆ mơta rơngot kiăng kơ arăng thâo kơ gơñu ư̆ ƀơ̆ng huă. Sĭt biă mă Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, gơñu hmâo laih tơlơi bơni kơ gơñu. 
But *thou*, [when] fasting, anoint thy head and wash thy face, @ Samơ̆ tơ ih ư̆ ƀơ̆ng huă, pik bĕ ia klôñ ƀơi akŏ ih laih anŭn pač ƀô̆ mơta ih, 
so that thou mayest not appear fasting unto men, but to thy Father who is in secret; and thy Father who sees in secret shall render [it] to thee. @ kiăng kơ arăng ƀu thâo ôh tơlơi ih ư̆ ƀơ̆ng huă; samơ̆ kơnơ̆ng Ama ih dŏ amăng anih hơgơ̆m thâo ih, laih anŭn Ama ih, Pô ƀuh amăng anih hơgơ̆m či bơni kơ ih.”
Lay not up for yourselves treasures upon the earth, where moth and rust spoils, and where thieves dig through and steal; @ “Anăm pơkom pioh ôh kơ gih pô dram gơnam yom ƀơi lŏn tơnah anai, anih hmâo moa reh hăng bring ƀơ̆ng, laih anŭn hmâo ƀing mơnuih klĕ ƀoh pơnăng hăng klĕ mă. 
but lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust spoils, and where thieves do not dig through nor steal; @ Samơ̆ pơkom pioh bĕ kơ ƀing gih pô dram gơnam yom amăng adai. Ƀơi anŭn ƀu hmâo ôh moa reh, bring ƀơ̆ng, kŏn hmâo lơi ƀing klĕ dưi ƀoh pơnăng hăng klĕ mă. 
for where thy treasure is, there will be also thy heart. @ Yua kơ pơpă dram gơnam ƀing gih dŏ, pran jua ƀing gih ăt dŏ pơ anŭn mơ̆n.”
The lamp of the body is the eye; if therefore thine eye be single, thy whole body will be light: @ “Mơta jing apui kơđen kơ drơi jan. Tui anŭn tơdah mơta ih hiam, abih drơi jan ih či bă hăng tơlơi bơngač. 
but if thine eye be wicked, thy whole body will be dark. If therefore the light that is in thee be darkness, how great the darkness! @ Samơ̆ tơdah mơta ih răm, abih drơi jan ih bă hăng tơlơi mơmŏt. Tui anŭn, tơdah tơlơi bơngač amăng ih jing hĭ mơmŏt, tơlơi mơmŏt anŭn prŏng biă mă yơh!”
No one can serve two masters; for either he will hate the one and will love the other, or he will hold to the one and despise the other. Ye cannot serve God and mammon. @ “Sa čô mơnuih ƀu dưi ngă hlŭn kơ dua čô khua ôh; yua kơ ñu či bơrơmŭt kơ pô anai laih anŭn khăp kơ pô anŭn. Ƀôdah ñu či pơpŭ kơ pô anai laih anŭn bơrơmŭt kơ pô pơkŏn. Ƀing gih ƀu dưi ôh mă bruă kơ Ơi Adai laih anŭn mă bruă wơ̆t kơ prăk mah dơ̆ng.
For this cause I say unto you, Do not be careful about your life, what ye should eat and what ye should drink; nor for your body what ye should put on. Is not the life more than food, and the body than raiment? @ Yua kơ anŭn yơh, Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, anăm ƀlơ̆ng bơngơ̆t đơi ôh kơ tơlơi hơdip ƀing gih, kơ tơlơi hơgĕt ƀing gih či ƀơ̆ng huă ƀôdah mơñum; kŏn ƀlơ̆ng bơngơ̆t đơi lơi kơ drơi jan ƀing gih, kơ hơgĕt mơnơ̆ng gih či čŭt buh. Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă tơlơi hơdip yom hloh kơ mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă, laih anŭn drơi jan yom hloh kơ sum ao? 
Look at the birds of the heaven, that they sow not, nor reap, nor gather into granaries, and your heavenly Father nourishes them. Are *ye* not much more excellent than they? @ Lăng bĕ kơ čĭm amăng adai; gơñu ƀu hmâo jŭ pla ôh, kŏn hơpuă ƀôdah pơkom pioh amăng atông lơi, samơ̆ Ama ƀing gih amăng adai čem rong gơñu. Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă ƀing gih jing yom hloh kơ gơñu? 
But which of you by carefulness can add to his growth one cubit? @ Laih anŭn hlơi amăng ƀing gih yua mơ̆ng tơlơi ñu ƀlơ̆ng bơngơ̆t ñu dưi thim đĭ tơlơi hơdip ñu sui ƀiă dơ̆ng? 
And why are ye careful about clothing? Observe with attention the lilies of the field, how they grow: they toil not, neither do they spin; @ Laih anŭn hyư̆m ƀing gih ƀlơ̆ng bơngơ̆t đơi kơ sum ao? Lăng bĕ bơnga pông yang amăng đang hmua, hyư̆m gơñu rai kơ prŏng; gơñu ƀu mă bruă, kŏn mơñam lơi; 
but I say unto you, that not even Solomon in all his glory was clothed as one of these. @ samơ̆ Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, wơ̆t kơ Salômôn amăng abih tơlơi drưh kơang ñu, kŏn dưi buh mơ̆n sum ao hiam rŏ kar hăng sa boh bơnga amăng khul bơnga anai. 
But if God so clothe the herbage of the field, which is to-day, and to-morrow is cast into [the] oven, will he not much rather you, O [ye] of little faith? @ Ơ ƀing tơlơi đaŏ anĕt, tơdah Ơi Adai buh brơi khul rơ̆k amăng glai kar hăng anŭn, hrơi anai hơdip, hrơi pơgi arăng glŏm gơñu amăng tơpur apui, ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă hloh kơ anŭn dơ̆ng Ñu či buh brơi kơ ƀing gih? 
Be not therefore careful, saying, What shall we eat? or What shall we drink? or What shall we put on? @ Tui anŭn anăm ƀing gih ƀlơ̆ng bơngơ̆t đơi ôh laih anŭn laĭ: ‘Hơgĕt ƀing ta či ƀơ̆ng huă?’ ƀôdah ‘Hơgĕt ƀing ta či mơñum?’ ƀôdah ‘Hơgĕt ƀing ta či buh?’ 
for all these things the nations seek after; for your heavenly Father knows that ye have need of all these things. @ Yua kơ ƀing djuai tuai tui hơduah sem abih bang mơnơ̆ng anŭn; laih anŭn Ama ƀing gih amăng adai thâo laih ƀing gih kiăng abih mơnơ̆ng anŭn. 
But seek ye first the kingdom of God and his righteousness, and all these things shall be added unto you. @ Samơ̆ blŭng hlâo, brơi kơ ƀing gih hơduah bĕ dêh čar pơtao Ơi Adai laih anŭn tơlơi tơpă Ñu, laih anŭn Ñu či pha brơi kơ ƀing gih abih bang mơnơ̆ng anŭn dơ̆ng. 
Be not careful therefore for the morrow, for the morrow shall be careful about itself. Sufficient to the day [is] its own evil. @ Tui anŭn anăm ƀlơ̆ng bơngơ̆t ôh kơ hrơi pơgi, yua kơ hrơi pơgi či ƀlơ̆ng bơngơ̆t kơ hrơi pơgi. Tơlơi gleh hrơi pă djŏp kơ hrơi anŭn yơh.”
Judge not, that ye may not be judged; @ “Anăm phat kơđi kơ arăng ôh, kiăng kơ Ơi Adai ƀu phat kơđi ôh kơ ƀing gih. 
for with what judgment ye judge, ye shall be judged; and with what measure ye mete, it shall be measured to you. @ Yua kơ kar hăng hyư̆m ƀing gih phat kơđi kơ arăng, Ơi Adai či phat kơđi kơ ƀing gih kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n; laih anŭn hơdơ̆ hơnơ̆ng ƀing gih pơkă brơi kơ arăng, Ơi Adai či pơkă brơi kơ ƀing gih hơdơ̆ anŭn mơ̆n. 
But why lookest thou on the mote that is in the eye of thy brother, but observest not the beam that is in thine eye? @ Hyư̆m ih dưi ƀuh ƀruih amăng mơta adơi ayŏng ih, samơ̆ ih ƀu ƀuh ôh sa ƀĕ tơda amăng mơta ih pô? 
Or how wilt thou say to thy brother, Allow [me], I will cast out the mote from thine eye; and behold, the beam is in thine eye? @ Ƀôdah hyư̆m ih dưi laĭ kơ adơi ayŏng ih: ‘Brơi kâo mă hĭ ƀruih mơ̆ng mơta ih,’ tơdang anŭn tơda ăt dŏ amăng mơta ih đôč? 
Hypocrite, cast out first the beam out of thine eye, and then thou wilt see clearly to cast out the mote out of the eye of thy brother. @ Ơ mơnuih plơ̆m ƀlor, blŭng hlâo brơi mă hĭ bĕ tơda mơ̆ng mơta ih pô, giơ̆ng anŭn kah ih či ƀuh rơđah kiăng kơ ih dưi mă hĭ ƀruih mơ̆ng mơta adơi ayŏng ih.
Give not that which is holy to the dogs, nor cast your pearls before the swine, lest they trample them with their feet, and turning round rend you. @ Anăm brơi mơnơ̆ng rơgoh hiam kơ asâo ôh, laih anŭn anăm glŏm añŭ yom ƀing gih ƀơi anăp bơbui ôh, hwĭ dah ñu juă hĭ gah yŭ kơ tơkai laih anŭn wir glaĭ kĕ hĭ ƀing gih.”
Ask, and it shall be given to you. Seek, and ye shall find. Knock, and it shall be opened to you. @ “Rơkâo bĕ, ƀing gih či hmâo; kơsem bĕ, ƀing gih či ƀuh; khŏk bah amăng bĕ, Ơi Adai či pŏk brơi kơ ƀing gih yơh. 
For every one that asks receives; and he that seeks finds; and to him that knocks it shall be opened. @ Yua kơ hlơi pô rơkâo, ñu či hmâo yơh; hlơi pô hơduah, ñu či ƀuh; laih anŭn hlơi pô khŏk bah amăng, Ơi Adai či pŏk brơi yơh kơ ñu. 
Or what man is there of you who, if his son shall ask of him a loaf of bread, will give him a stone; @ Hmâo mơ̆ hlơi amăng ƀing gih, tơdah ană ñu rơkâo ƀañ tơpŭng, ñu brơi hĭ boh pơtâo kơ gơ̆? 
and if he ask a fish, will give him a serpent? @ Ƀôdah tơdah ană ñu rơkâo akan, ñu brơi hĭ ala kơ gơ̆? 
If therefore *ye*, being wicked, know [how] to give good gifts to your children, how much rather shall your Father who is in the heavens give good things to them that ask of him? @ Tui anŭn, tơdah ƀing gih jing ƀing sat biă mă, ăt thâo brơi mơ̆n mơnơ̆ng hiam kơ ană bă ƀing gih, ƀai jai Ama ƀing gih amăng adai ƀu či pha brơi ôh hă mơnơ̆ng hiam brơi kơ hlơi pô rơkâo kơ Ñu?
Therefore all things whatever ye desire that men should do to you, thus do *ye* also do to them; for this is the law and the prophets. @ Hnŭn yơh, hơgĕt tơlơi ƀing gih kiăng kơ arăng ngă kơ ƀing gih, brơi kơ ƀing gih ngă bĕ tơlơi anŭn kơ arăng; yua kơ anŭn jing tơlơi juăt laih anŭn tơlơi ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo hmâo pơtô laih.”
Enter in through the narrow gate, for wide the gate and broad the way that leads to destruction, and many are they who enter in through it. @ “Mŭt bĕ ƀơi amăng jang gơniă; yua kơ amăng jang hluai laih anŭn jơlan prŏng ba nao kơ tơlơi răm rai, laih anŭn hmâo lu mơnuih mŭt ƀơi anŭn. 
For narrow the gate and straitened the way that leads to life, and they are few who find it. @ Samơ̆ amăng jang gơniă laih anŭn jơlan anĕt ba nao kơ tơlơi hơdip, laih anŭn ƀiă mơnuih dưi ƀuh gơñu.”
But beware of false prophets, which come to you in sheep's clothing, but within are ravening wolves. @ “Răng bĕ kơ ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo ƀlor. Gơñu buh klĭ triu rai pơ ƀing gih, samơ̆ amăng lăm gơñu jing asâo tan juăt kĕ hek. 
By their fruits ye shall know them. Do [men] gather a bunch of grapes from thorns, or from thistles figs? @ Ƀing gih či thâo krăn gơñu tui hăng boh gơñu. Arăng pĕ mơ̆ boh kơƀâu mơ̆ng phŭn drơi, ƀôdah boh hra mơ̆ng hrĕ drơi? 
So every good tree produces good fruits, but the worthless tree produces bad fruits. @ Tui anŭn, tơdah phŭn kơyâo hiam ñu či mơboh rai boh hiam, samơ̆ phŭn kơyâo sat ñu či mơboh rai boh sat yơh. 
A good tree cannot produce bad fruits, nor a worthless tree produce good fruits. @ Phŭn kơyâo hiam ƀu dưi mơboh rai boh sat ôh; phŭn kơyâo sat kŏn dưi mơboh rai boh hiam lơi. 
Every tree not producing good fruit is cut down and cast into the fire. @ Rĭm phŭn kơyâo ƀu mơboh rai boh hiam, arăng či drom laih anŭn glŏm hĭ ñu amăng apui. 
By their fruits then surely ye shall know them. @ Tui anŭn, yua mơ̆ng boh gơñu, ƀing gih či thâo krăn gơñu.”
Not every one who says to me, Lord, Lord, shall enter into the kingdom of the heavens, but he that does the will of my Father who is in the heavens. @ “Ƀu djơ̆ ôh abih bang ƀing iâu Kâo: ‘Ơ Khua Yang, Ơ Khua Yang’ či mŭt amăng dêh čar pơtao plei hiam, samơ̆ kơnơ̆ng hlơi pô ngă tui tơlơi Ama Kâo pơ adai adih kiăng đôč. 
Many shall say to me in that day, Lord, Lord, have we not prophesied through *thy* name, and through *thy* name cast out demons, and through *thy* name done many works of power? @ Amăng hrơi anŭn či hmâo lu mơnuih laĭ kơ Kâo: ‘Ơ Khua Yang, Ơ Khua Yang, ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă gơmơi hmâo laĭ lui hlâo laih hăng anăn Ih, puh pơđuaĭ yang sat hăng anăn Ih, laih anŭn ngă lu tơlơi mơsêh mơyang hăng anăn Ih?’ 
and then will I avow unto them, I never knew you. Depart from me, workers of lawlessness. @ Hlăk anŭn Kâo či laĭ klă kơ ƀing gơñu: ‘Kâo ƀu thâo krăn ƀing gih ôh; đuaĭ bĕ mơ̆ng Kâo, ơ ƀing ngă tơlơi sat ƀai.’”
Whoever therefore hears these my words and does them, I will liken him to a prudent man, who built his house upon the rock; @ “Tui anŭn, hlơi pô hmư̆ tơlơi Kâo pơhiăp laih anŭn tui gưt, ñu anŭn jing kar hăng sa čô mơnuih kơhnâo pơdơ̆ng sang ñu ƀơi boh pơtâo. 
and the rain came down, and the streams came, and the winds blew and fell upon that house, and it did not fall, for it had been founded upon the rock. @ Wơ̆t dah hmâo hơjan, ia lip laih anŭn angĭn rơbŭ kơtang thut ngă kơ sang anŭn, samơ̆ sang anŭn ƀu rơbuh hĭ ôh, yua kơ arăng pơdơ̆ng laih ñu ƀơi boh pơtâo.
And every one who hears these my words and does not do them, he shall be likened to a foolish man, who built his house upon the sand; @ Samơ̆ hlơi pô hmư̆ tơlơi Kâo pơhiăp, samơ̆ ƀu tui gưt ôh, ñu anŭn jing kar hăng sa čô mơnuih mlŭk pơdơ̆ng sang ñu ƀơi lŏn čuah. 
and the rain came down, and the streams came, and the winds blew and beat upon that house, and it fell, and its fall was great. @ Hmâo adai hơjan, ia lip laih anŭn angĭn rơbŭ kơtang thut ngă kơ sang anŭn, sang anŭn rơbuh hăng răm rai hĭ abih.”
And it came to pass, when Jesus had finished these words, the crowds were astonished at his doctrine, @ Tơ Yêsu pơhiăp hơdôm tơlơi anŭn giơ̆ng laih, ƀing mơnuih lu hling hlang kơ tơlơi Ñu pơtô, 
for he taught them as having authority, and not as their scribes. @ yua kơ Ñu pơtô kơ ƀing gơñu hăng tơlơi dưi kơhưm, ƀu djơ̆ kar hăng nai pơtô tơlơi juăt ƀing gơñu ôh.
And when he had come down from the mountain, great crowds followed him. @ Tơ Yêsu trŭn mơ̆ng čư̆, hmâo lu mơnuih tui Ñu. 
And behold, a leper came up to [him] and did him homage, saying, Lord, if thou wilt, thou art able to cleanse me. @ Anai nê, hmâo sa čô mơnuih djơ̆ phŭng nao pơ Ñu, bon ƀơi anăp Ñu, laih anŭn laĭ: “Ơ Khua Yang, tơdah Ih kiăng, Ih dưi pơrơgoh kâo yơh.”
And he stretched out his hand and touched him, saying, I will; be cleansed. And immediately his leprosy was cleansed. @ Yêsu yơr tơngan, ruaih ñu, laih anŭn laĭ: “Kâo kiăng yơh, rơgoh bĕ!” Tañ mơtam phŭng ñu rơgoh ƀhiao. 
And Jesus says to him, See thou tell no man, but go, shew thyself to the priest, and offer the gift which Moses ordained, for a testimony to them. @ Laih anŭn Yêsu laĭ kơ ñu: “Răng bĕ, anăm ră ruai tơlơi anai kơ arăng ôh, samơ̆ nao pơdah bĕ ih pô kơ khua ngă yang laih anŭn pơyơr mơnơ̆ng ngă yang tui hăng Môis hmâo pơtă laih, jing sa tơlơi ngă gơ̆ng jơlan kơ abih bang mơnuih.”
And when he had entered into Capernaum, a centurion came to him, beseeching him, @ Tơdang Yêsu mŭt pơ plei Kapernum, sa čô khua tơhan wai sa rơtuh čô rai kơwưh rơkâo kơ Ñu 
and saying, Lord, my servant lies paralytic in the house, suffering grievously. @ laih anŭn laĭ: “Ơ Khua, ding kơna kâo dŏ đih amăng sang rơwen ruă kơtang biă mă.”
And Jesus says to him, *I* will come and heal him. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơ̆: “Kâo či nao pơsuaih ñu.”
And the centurion answered and said, Lord, I am not fit that thou shouldest enter under my roof; but only speak a word, and my servant shall be healed. @ Samơ̆ khua tơhan anŭn laĭ glaĭ kơ Yêsu dơ̆ng: “Ơ Khua, kâo ƀu năng lăp ôh jum ih mŭt amăng sang kâo; kơnơ̆ng rơkâo kơ Ih pơhiăp sa boh đôč, laih anŭn ding kơna kâo či suaih yơh. 
For *I* also am a man under authority, having under me soldiers, and I say to this [one], Go, and he goes; and to another, Come, and he comes; and to my bondman, Do this, and he does it. @ Yua kơ kâo pô dŏ gah yŭ tơlơi dưi kơ arăng mơ̆n, laih anŭn kâo ăt hmâo mơ̆n lu ƀing tơhan dŏ gah yŭ kơ tơlơi dưi kâo. Kâo pơtă kơ pô anai: ‘Nao bĕ,’ laih anŭn gơ̆ nao mơtam; laih anŭn kơ pô pơkŏn: ‘Rai bĕ,’ laih anŭn gơ̆ rai; laih anŭn kơ hlŭn kâo: ‘Ngă bruă anai,’ laih anŭn gơ̆ ngă mơtam.”
And when Jesus heard it, he wondered, and said to those who followed, Verily I say unto you, Not even in Israel have I found so great faith. @ Tơ Yêsu hmư̆ khua tơhan anŭn pơhiăp, Ñu hling hlang laih anŭn laĭ kơ ƀing tui ñu: “Sĭt biă mă Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, wơ̆t amăng čar Israel Kâo aka ƀuh djơ̆ ôh mơnuih hmâo tơlơi đaŏ prŏng kar hăng anŭn. 
But I say unto you, that many shall come from [the] rising and setting [sun], and shall lie down at table with Abraham, and Isaac, and Jacob in the kingdom of the heavens; @ Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, hmâo lu mơnuih či rai mơ̆ng gah ngŏ, mơ̆ng gah yŭ laih anŭn dŏ ber kơ tơlơi ƀơ̆ng huă mơñum hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Abraham, Isak, laih anŭn Yakôp amăng dêh čar pơtao plei hiam, 
but the sons of the kingdom shall be cast out into the outer darkness: there shall be the weeping and the gnashing of teeth. @ Samơ̆ ƀing ană kơ dêh čar pơtao arăng glŏm hĭ amăng anih kơnăm mơmŏt pơ gah rơngiao; pơ anŭn gơñu či čŏk hia laih anŭn kĕ tơgơi.” 
And Jesus said to the centurion, Go, and as thou hast believed, be it to thee. And his servant was healed in that hour. @ Laih anŭn Yêsu laĭ kơ khua tơhan: “Nao bĕ, brơi tơlơi anŭn truh tui hăng tơlơi ih đaŏ.” Ƀơi mông anŭn mơtam ding kơna ñu suaih.
And when Jesus had come to Peter's house, he saw his mother-in-law laid down and in a fever; @ Tơ Yêsu mŭt amăng sang Pêtrôs, Ñu ƀuh tơhmua đah kơmơi Pêtrôs ruă pơgrŭn dŏ đih ƀơi sưng. 
and he touched her hand, and the fever left her, and she arose and served him. @ Yêsu ruaih ƀơi tơngan gơ̆, laih anŭn gơ̆ suaih tơlơi ruă pơgrŭn. Gơ̆ tơgŭ laih anŭn buih bruă kơ Ñu.
And when the evening was come, they brought to him many possessed by demons, and he cast out the spirits with a word, and healed all that were ill; @ Klam anŭn, arăng ba nao pơ Yêsu lu čô mơnuih yang sat ngă. Ñu puh pơđuaĭ hĭ ƀing yang sat anŭn hăng sa boh pơhiăp, laih anŭn pơsuaih abih bang ƀing duăm ruă. 
so that that should be fulfilled which was spoken through Esaias the prophet, saying, Himself took our infirmities and bore our diseases. @ Tơlơi anai kiăng pơsĭt tơlơi pô laĭ lui hlâo Êsai hmâo laĭ laih,
“Ñu pô yơh mă ba abih tơlơi tơdu ƀing ta,
Laih anŭn glăm ba abih tơlơi duăm ruă ƀing ta.”
And Jesus, seeing great crowds around him, commanded to depart to the other side. @ Tơ Yêsu ƀuh ƀing lu jum dar Ñu, Ñu pơđar brơi găn nao pơ hang gah dih ia dơnao. 
And a scribe came up and said to him, Teacher, I will follow thee whithersoever thou mayest go. @ Hmâo sa čô nai pơtô tơlơi juăt rai laih anŭn laĭ hăng Ñu: “Ơ Nai, pơpă Ih nao kâo či tui Ih pơ anŭn yơh.”
And Jesus says to him, The foxes have holes, and the birds of the heaven roosting-places; but the Son of man has not where he may lay his head. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ ñu: “Khul pơja hmâo amăng, khul čĭm brĭm amăng adai hmâo hruh, samơ̆ Ană Mơnuih ƀu hmâo ôh anih đăl akŏ.”
But another of his disciples said to him, Lord, suffer me first to go away and bury my father. @ Hmâo sa čô ding kơna pơkŏn dơ̆ng laĭ hăng Ñu: “Ơ Khua, brơi kâo dơr hĭ ama kâo hlâo amơĭ.”
But Jesus said to him, Follow me, and leave the dead to bury their own dead. @ Samơ̆ Yêsu laĭ kơ ñu: “Đuaĭ tui Kâo bĕ, laih anŭn lui ƀing djai dơr mă mơnuih djai gơñu pô.”
And he went on board ship and his disciples followed him; @ Tơ Yêsu đĭ amăng sŏng laih, ƀing ding kơna Ñu tui Ñu. 
and behold, [the water] became very agitated on the sea, so that the ship was covered by the waves; but *he* slept. @ Anai nê, hmâo rơbŭ kơthel ƀơi ia rơsĭ tơl ia poh yă gom sŏng giăm pơtrăm hĭ; samơ̆ Yêsu dŏ pĭt. 
And the disciples came and awoke him, saying, Lord save: we perish. @ Ƀing ding kơna nao râo Ñu, laĭ: “Ơ Khua, pơklaih gơmơi bĕ; ƀing ta djai yơh!”
And he says to them, Why are ye fearful, O ye of little faith? Then, having arisen, he rebuked the winds and the sea, and there was a great calm. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Ơ ƀing mơnuih tơlơi đaŏ anĕt, yua hơgĕt ƀing gih hwĭ?” Ñu tơgŭ mơtam, khă rơbŭ hăng ia rơsĭ, laih anŭn dŏ rơiăt lơleh mơtam.
But the men were astonished, saying, What sort [of man] is this, that even the winds and the sea obey him? @ Ƀing anŭn hling hlang biă mă, laĭ: “Hlơi mơnuih anai jing tơl angĭn hăng ia rơsĭ ăt gưt kơ Ñu mơ̆n?”
And there met him, when he came to the other side, to the country of the Gergesenes, two possessed by demons, coming out of the tombs, exceeding dangerous, so that no one was able to pass by that way. @ Tơ Yêsu truh laih pơ hang gah adih amăng čar ƀing Gadara, dua čô mơnuih yang sat ngă rai mơ̆ng pơsat bưp Ñu. Gơñu hơtai sat biă mă tơl ƀu hmâo ôh mơnuih khĭn găn ƀơi jơlan anŭn. 
And behold, they cried out, saying, What have we to do with thee, Son of God? hast thou come here before the time to torment us? @ Gơñu ur kraih: “Hơgĕt tơlơi Ih hmâo hăng gơmơi, Ơ Ană Ơi Adai? Djơ̆ mơ̆ Ih rai pơ anai kiăng pơtơnap ƀing gơmơi hlâo kơ hrơi hmâo pơkă laih?”
Now there was, a great way off from them, a herd of many swine feeding; @ Ataih ƀiă mơ̆ng anŭn hmâo lu bơbui hlăk hyu ƀơ̆ng. 
and the demons besought him, saying, If thou cast us out, send us away into the herd of swine. @ Ƀing yang sat kơwưh rơkâo kơ Yêsu: “Tơdah Ih puh pơđuaĭ gơmơi, rơkâo Ih brơi gơmơi mŭt amăng phung bơbui adih.”
And he said to them, Go. And they, going out, departed into the herd of swine; and lo, the whole herd [of swine] rushed down the steep slope into the sea, and died in the waters. @ Laih anŭn Ñu laĭ kơ ƀing gơñu: “Nao bĕ!” Tui anŭn ƀing yang sat tơbiă laih anŭn mŭt amăng phung bơbui. Anai nê, abih bang bơbui anŭn trŭn mơ̆ng hơ̆ng čư̆, kơdâo amăng ia rơsĭ, laih anŭn djai trăm abih.
But they that fed them fled, and went away into the city and related everything, and what had happened as to those possessed by demons. @ Ƀing wai bơbui mŭt amăng plei laih anŭn ră ruai abih tơlơi hmâo truh laih kơ dua čô mơnuih yang sat ngă anŭn. 
And behold, the whole city went out to meet Jesus; and when they saw him, they begged [him] to go away out of their coasts. @ Tui anŭn, abih bang ană plei pla tơbiă nao bưp Yêsu. Tơ gơñu ƀuh Ñu laih, gơñu kơwưh rơkâo Yêsu đuaĭ hĭ mơ̆ng tring gơñu.
And going on board the ship, he passed over and came to his own city. @ Yêsu đĭ sŏng găn ia rơsĭ laih anŭn wơ̆t glaĭ pơ plei Ñu pô. 
And behold, they brought to him a paralytic, laid upon a bed; and Jesus, seeing their faith, said to the paralytic, Be of good courage, child; thy sins are forgiven. @ Laih anŭn anai nê, arăng čơkung ba pơ Ñu sa čô đah rơkơi rơwen dŏ đih ƀơi sưng. Tơ Yêsu ƀuh tơlơi đaŏ ƀing anŭn, Ñu laĭ kơ đah rơkơi rơwen “Ơ ană, kơjăp pran jua bĕ, yua kơ tơlơi soh ih pap brơi laih.”
And behold, certain of the scribes said to themselves, This [man] blasphemes. @ Hlăk anŭn, hmâo dua klâo čô ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt pơmĭn amăng pran jua gơñu: “Mơnuih anai pơhiăp pơgao hmiah hăng Ơi Adai.”
And Jesus, seeing their thoughts, said, Why do *ye* think evil things in your hearts? @ Samơ̆ Yêsu thâo laih tơlơi pơmĭn gơñu laih anŭn laĭ: “Yua hơgĕt amăng pran jua ƀing gih hmâo pơmĭn sat kar hăng anŭn? 
For which is easier: to say, Thy sins are forgiven; or to say, Rise up and walk? @ Hơgĕt tơlơi laĭ amuñ hloh: ‘Tơlơi soh ih pap brơi laih,’ ƀôdah laĭ: ‘Tơgŭ bĕ laih anŭn rơbat?’ 
But that ye may know that the Son of man has power on earth to forgive sins, (then he says to the paralytic,) Rise up, take up thy bed and go to thy house. @ Samơ̆ kiăng kơ ƀing gih thâo kơ Ană Mơnuih hmâo tơlơi dưi ƀơi lŏn tơnah dưi pap brơi tơlơi soh” — Yêsu laĭ kơ mơnuih rơwen — “Tơgŭ bĕ, glăm ba sưng ih hăng glaĭ pơ sang.”
And he rose up and went to his house. @ Tui anŭn gơ̆ tơgŭ laih anŭn glaĭ pơ sang. 
But the crowds seeing [it], were in fear, and glorified God who gave such power to men. @ Tơ ƀing mơnuih lu ƀuh tơlơi anŭn gơñu hwĭ, laih anŭn pơpŭ bơni kơ Ơi Adai, yua kơ Ñu brơi tơlơi dưi kar hăng anŭn kơ ƀing ană mơnuih.
And Jesus, passing on thence, saw a man sitting at the tax-office, called Matthew, and says to him, Follow me. And he rose up and followed him. @ Tơdang Yêsu đuaĭ mơ̆ng anŭn, Ñu ƀuh sa čô đah rơkơi anăn ñu Mathiơ dŏ ber ƀơi anih ring jia. Yêsu laĭ kơ gơ̆: “Đuaĭ tui Kâo bĕ.” Gơ̆ tơgŭ hăng đuaĭ tui Ñu.
And it came to pass, as he lay at table in the house, that behold, many tax-gatherers and sinners came and lay at table with Jesus and his disciples. @ Tơdang Yêsu dŏ ƀơ̆ng huă amăng sang Mathiơ, hmâo lu ƀing ring jia laih anŭn ƀing mơnuih soh rai ƀơ̆ng huă hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Yêsu laih anŭn hăng ƀing ding kơna Ñu. 
And the Pharisees seeing [it], said to his disciples, Why does your teacher eat with tax-gatherers and sinners? @ Tơ ƀing Pharisi ƀuh tơlơi anŭn, gơñu laĭ kơ ƀing ding kơna Yêsu: “Hyư̆m Khua ƀing gih ƀơ̆ng huă hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing ring jia laih anŭn hăng ƀing mơnuih soh lĕ?”
But [Jesus] hearing it, said, They that are strong have not need of a physician, but those that are ill. @ Samơ̆ tơ Yêsu hmư̆ tơlơi anŭn, Ñu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Ƀu djơ̆ ƀing mơnuih suaih prăl ôh kiăng kơ ơi ia jrao, samơ̆ ƀing mơnuih duăm ruă yơh kiăng. 
But go and learn what [that] is I will have mercy and not sacrifice; for I have not come to call righteous [men] but sinners. @ Nao bĕ laih anŭn hrăm thâo hluh hyư̆m boh pơhiăp anai kiăng laĭ: ‘Kâo kiăng tơlơi pap drap, ƀu djơ̆ mơnơ̆ng ngă yang ôh.’ Yua kơ Kâo rai ƀu djơ̆ kiăng iâu ƀing tơpă hơnơ̆ng ôh, samơ̆ ƀing soh.”
Then come to him the disciples of John, saying, Why do we and the Pharisees often fast, but thy disciples fast not? @ Hlăk anŭn ƀing ding kơna Yôhan nao pơ Yêsu laih anŭn laĭ: “Yua hơgĕt gơmơi hăng ƀing Pharisi ư̆ ƀơ̆ng huă, samơ̆ ƀing ding kơna Ih ƀu ư̆ ƀơ̆ng huă ôh?”
And Jesus said to them, Can the sons of the bridechamber mourn so long as the bridegroom is with them? But days will come when the bridegroom will have been taken away from them, and then they will fast. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Dưi mơ̆ ƀing arăng jak kơ tơlơi ƀơ̆ng huă dŏ rơkơi bơnai kơ-ŭ uăn tơdang pô han tao ăt dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng gơñu? Hrơi či truh tơ arăng ba pơđuaĭ hĭ han tao mơ̆ng ƀing gơñu, hlăk anŭn yơh gơñu či ư̆ ƀơ̆ng huă.
But no one puts a patch of new cloth on an old garment, for its filling up takes from the garment and a worse rent takes place. @ Ƀu hmâo ôh hlơi sĭt sa pŏk bơnal phrâo hăng ao so, yua kơ bơnal phrâo či pơtơĭ hĭ ao so, laih anŭn bluh tơĭ či prŏng hloh dơ̆ng. 
Nor do men put new wine into old skins, otherwise the skins burst and the wine is poured out, and the skins will be destroyed; but they put new wine into new skins, and both are preserved together. @ Arăng ăt kŏn tro tơpai phrâo amăng get klĭ so lơi; tơdah ngă tui anŭn, get klĭ so či pơčah hĭ laih anŭn tơpai či hŏk, laih anŭn get klĭ či răm rai mơ̆n; samơ̆ arăng tro tơpai phrâo amăng get klĭ phrâo, laih anŭn arăng dưi pioh abih dua anŭn dŏ hiam.”
As he spoke these things to them, behold, a ruler coming in did homage to him, saying, My daughter has by this died; but come and lay thy hand upon her and she shall live. @ Tơdang Ñu dŏ pơhiăp hơdôm tơlơi anai kơ ƀing gơñu, hmâo sa čô khua wai sang bơjơnum rai čon tơŭt ƀơi anăp Ñu laih anŭn laĭ: “Ană đah kơmơi kâo phrâo tơĭ pran. Samơ̆ rơkâo kơ Ih rai hăng ah tơngan ƀơi gơ̆, laih anŭn gơ̆ či hơdip.”
And Jesus rose up and followed him, and [so did] his disciples. @ Yêsu tơgŭ, hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing ding kơna Ñu đuaĭ tui pô anŭn.
And behold, a woman, who had had a bloody flux [for] twelve years, came behind and touched the hem of his garment; @ Laih anŭn anai nê, hmâo sa čô đah kơmơi hmâo tơlơi ruă tuh drah pluh dua thŭn laih, nao gah klon Ñu, laih anŭn gơ̆ ruaih ƀơi jih ao Ñu. 
for she said within herself, If I should only touch his garment I shall be healed. @ Yua kơ gơ̆ pơmĭn: “Tơdah kâo kơnơ̆ng ruaih ao Ñu đôč, kâo či suaih yơh.”
But Jesus turning and seeing her, said, Be of good courage, daughter; thy faith has healed thee. And the woman was healed from that hour. @ Yêsu wir glaĭ lăng ƀuh gơ̆ laih anŭn laĭ: “Ơ ană; kơjăp pran jua bĕ! Tơlơi đaŏ ih pơsuaih ih laih.” Laih anŭn, mông anŭn mơtam đah kơmơi anŭn suaih yơh.
And when Jesus was come to the house of the ruler, and saw the flute-players and the crowd making a tumult, @ Tơ Yêsu truh pơ sang khua anŭn laih anŭn Ñu ƀuh ƀing ayŭp đing klơt hăng ƀing mơnuih lu ngă rơông rơang, 
he said, Withdraw, for the damsel is not dead, but sleeps. And they derided him. @ Ñu laĭ: “Ƀing gih tơbiă bĕ, yua kơ čơđai anĕt anai ƀu djai ôh, samơ̆ gơ̆ dŏ pĭt.” Laih anŭn gơñu klao mưč kơ Yêsu. 
But when the crowd had been put out, he went in and took her hand; and the damsel rose up. @ Samơ̆ tơ ƀing mơnuih lu tơbiă pơ gah rơngiao laih, Yêsu mŭt, mă tơngan đah kơmơi anĕt anŭn, laih anŭn gơ̆ tơgŭ. 
And the fame of it went out into all that land. @ Laih anŭn arăng hmư̆ hing tơlơi anŭn tar ƀar abih tring anŭn.
And as Jesus passed on thence, two blind [men] followed him, crying and saying, Have mercy on us, Son of David. @ Tơdang Yêsu đuaĭ mơ̆ng anih anŭn, hmâo dua čô mơnuih bum mơta đuaĭ tui Ñu hăng ur kraih: “Ơ ană Đawit, pap drap kơ gơmơi đa!”
And when he was come to the house, the blind [men] came to him. And Jesus says to them, Do ye believe that I am able to do this? They say to him, Yea, Lord. @ Tơ Ñu mŭt amăng sang laih, ƀing đah rơkơi bum mơta nao truh pơ Ñu; laih anŭn Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Ƀing gih đaŏ mơ̆ Kâo dưi ngă tơlơi anai?” Ƀing gơ̆ laĭ hăng Ñu: “Ơ Khua, gơmơi đaŏ sĭt.” 
Then he touched their eyes, saying, According to your faith, be it unto you. @ Laih anŭn Yêsu ruaih mơta gơñu, laĭ: “Brơi tơlơi anŭn truh tui hăng tơlơi ƀing gih đaŏ.” 
And their eyes were opened; and Jesus charged them sharply, saying, See, let no man know it. @ Laih anŭn mơta gơñu ƀuh rơđah yơh. Yêsu pơtă kơtang biă mă kơ gơñu: “Anăm brơi arăng thâo ôh tơlơi anai.” 
But they, when they were gone out, spread his name abroad in all that land. @ Samơ̆ gơñu tơbiă nao laih anŭn ruai hyu anăn Ñu tar ƀar tring anŭn.
But as these were going out, behold, they brought to him a dumb man possessed by a demon. @ Giơ̆ng gơñu đuaĭ mơ̆ng anih anŭn, anai nê arăng ba nao pơ Yêsu sa čô mơnuih kơmlô yang sat ngă. 
And the demon having been cast out, the dumb spake. And the crowds were astonished, saying, It has never been seen thus in Israel. @ Tơ Yêsu puh pơđuaĭ yang sat anŭn laih, mơnuih kơmlô thâo pơhiăp. Ƀing mơnuih lu hling hlang laih anŭn laĭ: “Aka ƀuh djơ̆ ôh tơlơi kar hăng anai amăng čar Israel.”
But the Pharisees said, He casts out the demons through the prince of the demons. @ Samơ̆ ƀing Pharisi laĭ: “Hăng tơlơi mơyang khua yang sat Ñu puh pơđuaĭ ƀing yang sat.”
And Jesus went round all the cities and the villages, teaching in their synagogues, and preaching the glad tidings of the kingdom, and healing every disease and every bodily weakness. @ Yêsu hyu amăng abih bang plei prŏng plei anĕt, pơhrăm amăng sang bơjơnum, laih anŭn pơtô Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam kơ dêh čar pơtao plei hiam, laih anŭn pơsuaih djŏp mơta tơlơi duăm ruă. 
But when he saw the crowds he was moved with compassion for them, because they were harassed, and cast away as sheep not having a shepherd. @ Tơ Yêsu ƀuh ƀing mơnuih lu, pran jua Ñu glưh pap kơ ƀing gơñu, yua kơ gơñu jing tơnap tap laih anŭn ƀu hmâo pô gŭm djru kar hăng triu ƀu hmâo pô wai. 
Then saith he to his disciples, The harvest [is] great and the workmen [are] few; @ Laih anŭn Yêsu laĭ kơ ƀing ding kơna Ñu: “Bơyan hơpuă prŏng biă mă samơ̆ ƀing hơpuă jing ƀiă đôč. 
supplicate therefore the Lord of the harvest, that he send forth workmen unto his harvest. @ Tui anŭn yơh, rơkâo bĕ Khua bơyan hơpuă pơkiaŏ nao ƀing hơpuă nao pơ bơyan hơpuă ñu.”
And having called to [him] his twelve disciples, he gave them power over unclean spirits, so that they should cast them out, and heal every disease and every bodily weakness. @ Yêsu iâu pluh dua čô ding kơna Ñu rai, laih anŭn brơi kơ gơñu tơlơi dưi kiăng kơ dưi puh pơđuaĭ ƀing yang bơngăt grĭ hơƀak, laih anŭn dưi pơsuaih djŏp mơta tơlơi duăm ruă. 
Now the names of the twelve apostles are these: first, Simon, who was called Peter, and Andrew his brother; James the [son] of Zebedee, and John his brother; @ Anai yơh anăn pluh dua čô ƀing khua ding kơna: blŭng hlâo Simôn pơanăn dơ̆ng Pêtrôs, laih anŭn Andrê adơi ñu, Yakơ ană Sêbêdê, laih anŭn Yôhan adơi ñu, 
Philip and Bartholomew; Thomas, and Matthew the tax-gatherer; James the [son] of Alphaeus, and Lebbaeus, who was surnamed Thaddaeus; @ Philip laih anŭn Bartêlômi, Thômas laih anŭn Mathiơ mơnuih ring jia, Yakơ ană Alphê, laih anŭn Thadê, 
Simon the Cananaean, and Judas the Iscariote, who also delivered him up. @ Simôn mơnuih Kanaan, laih anŭn Yudas Iskariôt pô pơblư̆ Yêsu.
These twelve Jesus sent out when he had charged them, saying, Go not off into [the] way of [the] nations, and into a city of Samaritans enter ye not; @ Anai yơh pluh dua čô khua ding kơna Yêsu hmâo pơkiaŏ nao, laih anŭn pơtă kơ gơñu tui anai: “Anăm nao ôh pơ ƀing djuai tuai, laih anŭn kŏn mŭt lơi sa boh plei amăng ƀing plei mơnuih Samari. 
but go rather to the lost sheep of the house of Israel. @ Samơ̆ hiam hloh, brơi ƀing gih nao pơ khul triu rơngiă amăng sang Israel. 
And as ye go, preach, saying, The kingdom of the heavens has drawn nigh. @ Laih anŭn tơdang nao brơi ƀing gih pơtô bĕ: ‘Dêh Čar Pơtao adai giăm truh yơh.’ 
Heal [the] infirm, [raise the dead], cleanse lepers, cast out demons: ye have received gratuitously, give gratuitously. @ Ƀing gih pơsuaih bĕ ƀing duăm ruă, pơhơdip glaĭ ƀing djai, pơrơgoh ƀing djơ̆ phŭng, laih anŭn puh pơđuaĭ ƀing yang sat. Ƀing gih mă tŭ laih hăng tơlơi đôč đač, brơi bĕ kơ arăng đôč đač mơ̆n. 
Do not provide yourselves with gold, or silver, or brass, for your belts, @ Anăm djă ba mah, prăk, ƀôdah sar kong amăng hơdrăng kơiăng ƀing gih ôh. 
nor scrip for the way, nor two body coats, nor sandals, nor a staff: for the workman is worthy of his nourishment. @ Anăm djă ba ôh kơdŭng prăk, ƀôdah dua blah ao, ƀôdah klĭ juă, ƀôdah gai jra; yua kơ mơnuih mă bruă năng lăp hmâo mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă.
But into whatsoever city or village ye enter, inquire who in it is worthy, and there remain till ye go forth. @ Amăng plei pă ƀing gih mŭt plei prŏng ƀôdah plei anĕt, tơña hơduah bĕ hlơi năng lăp jum ƀing gih, laih anŭn brơi ƀing gih dŏ amăng sang ñu tơl hrơi ƀing gih đuaĭ. 
And as ye enter into a house salute it. @ Tơdang ƀing gih mŭt amăng sang hlơi, brơi ƀing gih hơơč mơyun kơ sang anŭn. 
And if the house indeed be worthy, let your peace come upon it; but if it be not worthy, let your peace return to you. @ Tơdah sang anŭn năng lăp, tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua ƀing gih truh kơ sang anŭn, samơ̆ tơdah sang anŭn ƀu năng lăp ôh, brơi tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua ƀing gih wơ̆t glaĭ kơ gih pô. 
And whosoever shall not receive you, nor hear your words, as ye go forth out of that house or city, shake off the dust of your feet. @ Tơdah arăng ƀu tŭ jum ƀing gih ƀôdah ƀu hmư̆ ôh tơlơi ƀing gih pơhiăp, tơdang ƀing gih tơbiă mơ̆ng sang anŭn ƀôdah plei anŭn brơi ƀing gih tơtuh hĭ bĕ ƀruih lŏn mơ̆ng tơkai ƀing gih. 
Verily I say unto you, It shall be more tolerable for the land of Sodom and Gomorrha in judgment-day than for that city. @ Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih sĭt biă mă, ƀơi hrơi phat kơđi tơdơi plei Sôđôm hăng plei Gômôrơ či hmâo tơlơi pơkơhmal plai ƀiă kơ plei anŭn.”
Behold, *I* send you as sheep in the midst of wolves; be therefore prudent as the serpents, and guileless as the doves. @ “Anai nê, Kâo pơkiaŏ nao ƀing gih kar hăng triu tơ̆ng krah khul asâo tan. Tui anŭn brơi kơ ƀing gih kơhnâo kar hăng ala laih anŭn rơun rơgoh kar hăng čĭm bơrơgơ̆m. 
But beware of men; for they will deliver you up to sanhedrims, and scourge you in their synagogues; @ Răng bĕ kơ ƀing mơnuih, yua kơ gơñu či jao hĭ ƀing gih kơ ƀing khua phat kơđi laih anŭn arăng či taih ƀing gih amăng sang bơjơnum. 
and ye shall be brought before rulers and kings for my sake, for a testimony to them and to the nations. @ Arăng či dui ba ƀing gih ƀơi anăp ƀing khua čar laih anŭn ƀơi anăp ƀing pơtao yua kơ Kâo, kiăng kơ ƀing gih jing ƀing ngă gơ̆ng jơlan kơ Kâo ƀơi anăp gơñu laih anŭn ƀơi anăp ƀing djuai tuai. 
But when they deliver you up, be not careful how or what ye shall speak; for it shall be given to you in that hour what ye shall speak. @ Tơ gơñu jao ƀing gih, anăm rŭng răng ôh hyư̆m ƀing gih či pơhiăp ƀôdah hơgĕt tơlơi ƀing gih či laĭ; yua kơ hơgĕt tơlơi ƀing gih či laĭ Ơi Adai či brơi kơ ƀing gih ƀơi mông anŭn mơtam. 
For *ye* are not the speakers, but the Spirit of your Father which speaks in you. @ Yua kơ ƀu djơ̆ ƀing gih pô ôh pơhiăp, samơ̆ Yang Bơngăt Hiam Ama ƀing gih pơhiăp amăng ƀing gih.
But brother shall deliver up brother to death, and father child; and children shall rise up against parents and shall put them to death; @ Ayŏng či jao hĭ adơi ñu pô brơi arăng pơdjai, laih anŭn ama či jao hĭ ană ñu pô, laih anŭn ƀing ană či tơgŭ pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ hăng amĭ ama gơñu, laih anŭn brơi arăng pơdjai hĭ ƀing gơ̆. 
and ye shall be hated of all on account of my name. But he that has endured to [the] end, *he* shall be saved. @ Abih bang mơnuih či bơrơmŭt kơ ƀing gih yua kơ anăn Kâo. Samơ̆ hlơi pô gir tơl hnal tuč či klaih. 
But when they persecute you in this city, flee to the other; for verily I say to you, Ye shall not have completed the cities of Israel until the Son of man be come. @ Tơ gơñu ngă sat kơ ƀing gih amăng sa boh plei, đuaĭ kơdŏp bĕ pơ plei pơkŏn; yua kơ sĭt biă mă Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, ƀing gih aka ƀu nao abih plei ƀing Israel ôh, hlâo Ană Mơnuih rai hĭ.
The disciple is not above his teacher, nor the bondman above his lord. @ Ding kơna ƀu prŏng hloh kơ nai pơtô ñu ôh, hlŭn kŏn prŏng hloh kơ khua ñu lơi. 
[It is] sufficient for the disciple that he should become as his teacher, and the bondman as his lord. If they have called the master of the house Beelzebub, how much more those of his household? @ Ding kơna jing kar hăng nai pơtô ñu, laih anŭn hlŭn jing kar hăng khua ñu, tui anŭn djŏp yơh. Tơdah arăng iâu Bêlsebul kơ khua sang, hloh kơ anŭn gơñu či iâu kơ ƀing mơnuih amăng sang anŭn hăng anăn sat hloh dơ̆ng.”
Fear them not therefore; for there is nothing covered which shall not be revealed, and secret which shall not be known. @ “Tui anŭn anăm ƀing gih hwĭ kơ gơñu ôh, yua kơ ƀu hmâo tơlơi hơgĕt pơdŏp laih arăng ƀu či bơrơđah hĭ ñu, laih anŭn ƀu hmâo tơlơi hơgĕt hơgơ̆m ƀu či pơthâo hĭ. 
What I say to you in darkness speak in the light, and what ye hear in the ear preach upon the houses. @ Hơgĕt tơlơi Kâo pơhiăp hăng ƀing gih amăng anih mơmŏt, brơi ƀing gih pơhiăp bĕ amăng anih rơđah; laih anŭn hơgĕt tơlơi pơhiăp phač ƀơi tơngia ƀing gih, brơi ƀing gih pơtô bĕ ƀơi hăng ngŏ bơbŭng sang. 
And be not afraid of those who kill the body, but cannot kill the soul; but fear rather him who is able to destroy both soul and body in hell. @ Anăm hwĭ ôh kơ ƀing dưi pơdjai drơi jan samơ̆ ƀu dưi pơdjai bơngăt ôh, samơ̆ hwĭ bĕ kơ Pô dưi pơdjai bơngăt wơ̆t drơi jan amăng war apui. 
Are not two sparrows sold for a farthing? and one of them shall not fall to the ground without your Father; @ Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă dua drơi čĭm gač arăng sĭ sa kak? Laih anŭn tơdah ƀu djơ̆ tui hăng tơlơi Ama ƀing gih kiăng ƀu hmâo ôh sa drơi amăng čĭm anŭn či lĕ pơ lŏn. 
but of you even the hairs of the head are all numbered. @ Laih anŭn wơ̆t kơ ƀuk ƀơi akŏ ƀing gih Ơi Adai hmâo yap abih laih mơ̆n. 
Fear not therefore; *ye* are better than many sparrows. @ Tui anŭn anăm hwĭ ôh, yua kơ ƀing gih yom hloh kơ čĭm gač anŭn.
Every one therefore who shall confess me before men, *I* also will confess him before my Father who is in [the] heavens. @ Tui anŭn hlơi pô pơhaih tơlơi ñu đaŏ kơ Kâo ƀơi anăp mơnuih, kar kaĭ mơ̆n Kâo či pơhaih pô anŭn ƀơi anăp Ama Kâo amăng adai mơ̆n. 
But whosoever shall deny me before men, him will *I* also deny before my Father who is in [the] heavens. @ Samơ̆ hlơi pô hơngah Kâo ƀơi anăp ƀing mơnuih, kar kaĭ mơ̆n Kâo či hơngah pô anŭn ƀơi anăp Ama Kâo amăng adai.”
Do not think that I have come to send peace upon the earth: I have not come to send peace, but a sword. @ “Anăm pơmĭn Kâo rai ba tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua kơ lŏn tơnah ôh; Kâo ƀu rai ba tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua ôh, samơ̆ đao gưm. 
For I have come to set a man at variance with his father, and the daughter with her mother, and the daughter-in-law with her mother-in-law; @ Yua kơ Kâo rai kiăng ngă brơi ană đah rơkơi pơkơdơ̆ng hăng ama ñu, laih anŭn ană đah kơmơi pơkơdơ̆ng hăng amĭ ñu; laih anŭn hơđŭ pơkơdơ̆ng hăng tơhmua đah kơmơi ñu; 
and they of his household [shall be] a man's enemies. @ laih anŭn ayăt roh sat hloh kơ ƀing gih, anŭn jing mơnuih amăng sang ƀing gih pô.
He who loves father or mother above me is not worthy of me; and he who loves son or daughter above me is not worthy of me. @ Hlơi pô khăp kơ amĭ ama ñu lu hloh kơ Kâo ƀu năng lăp kơ Kâo ôh; hlơi pô khăp kơ ană đah rơkơi ƀôdah kơ ană đah kơmơi ñu lu hloh kơ Kâo ƀu năng lăp kơ Kâo ôh; 
And he who does not take up his cross and follow after me is not worthy of me. @ laih anŭn hlơi pô ƀu glăm kơyâo bơrơkal pô ñu hăng đuaĭ tui Kâo, ƀu năng lăp kơ Kâo ôh. 
He that finds his life shall lose it, and he who has lost his life for my sake shall find it. @ Hlơi pô kiăng răk pioh tơlơi hơdip ñu či rơngiă hĭ; laih anŭn hlơi pô rơngiă hĭ tơlơi hơdip ñu yua kơ Kâo či ƀuh glaĭ.”
He that receives you receives me, and he that receives me receives him that sent me. @ “Hlơi pô tŭ jum ƀing gih, ñu anŭn tŭ jum Kâo yơh; laih anŭn hlơi pô tŭ jum Kâo, ñu anŭn tŭ jum Pô pơkiaŏ rai Kâo mơ̆n. 
He that receives a prophet in the name of a prophet, shall receive a prophet's reward; and he that receives a righteous man in the name of a righteous man, shall receive a righteous man's reward. @ Hlơi pô tŭ jum sa čô pô laĭ lui hlâo yua kơ ñu jing pô laĭ lui hlâo, ñu či mă tŭ tơlơi apah bơni kơ sa čô pô laĭ lui hlâo; laih anŭn hlơi pô tŭ jum sa čô mơnuih tơpă yua kơ ñu jing mơnuih tơpă, ñu či mă tŭ tơlơi apah bơni kơ sa čô mơnuih tơpă.
