And whosoever shall give to drink to one of these little ones a cup of cold [water] only, in the name of a disciple, verily I say unto you, he shall in no wise lose his reward. @ Hlơi pô brơi kơ sa čô amăng ƀing čơđai anĕt anai mơñum sa kơčok ia ƀlăng đôč, yua kơ gơ̆ jing ding kơna Kâo, Kâo laĭ sĭt biă mă kơ ƀing gih, pô brơi anŭn ƀu či rơngiă ôh tơlơi apah bơni ñu.”
And it came to pass when Jesus had finished commanding his twelve disciples, he departed thence to teach and preach in their cities. @ Tơ Yêsu pơtô kơ ƀing pluh dua čô khua ding kơna Ñu giơ̆ng laih, Ñu đuaĭ mơ̆ng anŭn hăng nao pơhrăm laih anŭn pơtô amăng abih bang plei gơñu.
But John, having heard in the prison the works of the Christ, sent by his disciples, @ Tơdang Yôhan dŏ amăng sang mơnă, ñu hmư̆ arăng ră ruai hơdôm bruă Yang Krist ngă. Hnŭn yơh ñu pơkiaŏ nao ƀing ding kơna ñu 
and said to him, Art *thou* the coming [one]? or are we to wait for another? @ tơña kơ Yêsu: “Djơ̆ mơ̆ Ih jing Pô khŏm či rai, ƀôdah gơmơi khŏm dŏ tơguan pô pơkŏn dơ̆ng?”
And Jesus answering said to them, Go, report to John what ye hear and see. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ kơ gơñu: “Nao laĭ bĕ kơ Yôhan hơgĕt tơlơi ƀing gih hmâo hmư̆ laih anŭn ƀuh: 
Blind [men] see and lame walk; lepers are cleansed, and deaf hear; and dead are raised, and poor have glad tidings preached to them: @ Ƀing bum mơta ƀuh rơđah dơ̆ng, ƀing rơwen tơkai dưi rơbat, ƀing djơ̆ phŭng hmâo tơlơi pơrơgoh, ƀing tơngil thâo hmư̆, ƀing djai hơdip glaĭ, laih anŭn ƀing ƀun rin dưi hmư̆ Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam. 
and blessed is whosoever shall not be offended in me. @ Mơyun hiam yơh kơ hlơi pô ƀu tơhnač ôh yua kơ Kâo.”
But as they went [away], Jesus began to say to the crowds concerning John, What went ye out into the wilderness to see? a reed moved about by the wind? @ Tơdang ƀing anŭn glaĭ, Yêsu čơdơ̆ng pơhiăp kơ ƀing mơnuih lu tơlơi djơ̆ kơ Yôhan: “Hơgĕt tơlơi ƀing gih hmâo nao lăng laih amăng tơdrŏn har? Djơ̆ mơ̆ sa ƀĕ trang bô angĭn thut rơyuh? 
But what went ye out to see? a man clothed in delicate raiment? behold, those who wear delicate things are in the houses of kings. @ Tui anŭn hơgĕt tơlơi ƀing gih kiăng nao lăng lĕ? Djơ̆ mơ̆ kiăng lăng sa čô mơnuih buh ao hiam rŏ? Anai nê, ƀing buh ao hiam rŏ dŏ amăng sang pơtao. 
But what went ye out to see? a prophet? Yea, I say to you, and more than a prophet: @ Tui anŭn hơgĕt tơlơi ƀing gih kiăng nao lăng dơ̆ng lĕ? Djơ̆ mơ̆ kiăng nao lăng sa čô pô laĭ lui hlâo? Djơ̆ yơh, Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, hmâo pô yom hloh kơ sa čô pô laĭ lui hlâo dơ̆ng. 
this is he of whom it is written, Behold, *I* send my messenger before thy face, who shall prepare thy way before thee. @ Hmâo tơlơi čih kơ pô anŭn tui anai:
‘Anai nê, Kâo pơkiaŏ nao pô pơala Kâo nao hlâo kơ Ih,
Pô či pơkra jơlan hlâo brơi kơ Ih.’
Verily I say to you, that there is not arisen among [the] born of women a greater than John the baptist. But he who is a little one in the kingdom of the heavens is greater than he. @ Kâo laĭ sĭt biă mă kơ ƀing gih, đơ amăng ƀing mơnuih đah kơmơi tơkeng laih, ƀu hmâo hlơi prŏng hloh kơ Yôhan Ƀatem ôh; samơ̆ pô anĕt hloh amăng Dêh Čar Pơtao plei hiam jing prŏng hloh kơ ñu. 
But from the days of John the baptist until now, the kingdom of the heavens is taken by violence, and [the] violent seize on it. @ Dơ̆ng mơ̆ng rơnŭk Yôhan Ƀatem truh pơ ră anai dêh čar pơtao plei hiam hmâo tŭ laih tơlơi kơsung kơpĭ kơtang tĭt, laih anŭn ƀing kơsung kơpĭ kiăng sua mă dêh čar pơtao anŭn hăng tơlơi kơtang gơñu. 
For all the prophets and the law have prophesied unto John. @ Yua kơ abih bang ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo laih anŭn tơlơi juăt hmâo laĭ lui hlâo laih kơ Dêh Čar pơtao Ơi Adai truh pơ rơnŭk Yôhan. 
And if ye will receive it, this is Elias, who is to come. @ Laih anŭn tơdah ƀing gih kiăng tŭ ư, ñu yơh jing Êli pô khŏm rai. 
He that has ears to hear, let him hear. @ Hlơi pô hmâo tơngia, brơi hmư̆ bĕ!
But to whom shall I liken this generation? It is like children sitting in the markets, which, calling to their companions, @ Samơ̆ hăng hơgĕt Kâo či pơhmu ƀing mơnuih rơnŭk anai? Gơñu jing kar hăng ƀing čơđai dŏ ber amăng anih sang sĭ mơdrô iâu ƀing tơdruă gơñu,
say, We have piped to you, and ye have not danced: we have mourned to you, and ye have not wailed. @ ‘Gơmơi ayŭp laih đing klơt, samơ̆ ƀing gih ƀu suang ôh;
gơmơi čŏk hia laih, samơ̆ ƀing gih ƀu ơh ơ̆l ôh.’
For John has come neither eating nor drinking, and they say, He has a demon. @ Yua kơ Yôhan hmâo rai laih ƀu ƀơ̆ng huă kŏn mơñum lơi, laih anŭn gơñu laĭ: ‘Ñu hmâo yang sat ngă.’ 
The Son of man has come eating and drinking, and they say, Behold, a man [that is] eating and wine-drinking, a friend of tax-gatherers, and of sinners: and wisdom has been justified by her children. @ Ană Mơnuih hmâo rai laih, ƀơ̆ng laih anŭn mơñum, laih anŭn gơñu laĭ: ‘Lăng bĕ, sa čô ră ƀơ̆ng laih anŭn ră mơñum, gơyut gơyâo hăng ƀing ring jia laih anŭn ƀing soh.’ Samơ̆ tơlơi kơhnâo dưi pơrơđah ñu jing kơhnâo sĭt yua mơ̆ng bruă tơlơi kơhnâo anŭn ngă.”
Then began he to reproach the cities in which most of his works of power had taken place, because they had not repented. @ Laih anŭn Yêsu čơdơ̆ng ƀuah ƀing ană plei amăng ƀing plei Ñu hmâo ngă laih lu tơlơi mơsêh mơyang, yua kơ gơñu ƀu kơhmal ôh tơlơi soh. 
Woe to thee, Chorazin! woe to thee Bethsaida! for if the works of power which have taken place in you, had taken place in Tyre and Sidon, they had long ago repented in sackcloth and ashes. @ “Răm ƀăm yơh kơ ih, ơ plei Kôrasin! Răm ƀăm yơh kơ ih ơ plei Bêtsaida! Yua kơ tơdah arăng hmâo ngă laih ƀơi plei Tir laih anŭn plei Sidôn tơlơi mơsêh mơyang arăng hmâo ngă laih ƀơi tơ̆ng krah ƀing gih, sĭt biă mă mơ̆ng sui laih gơñu kơhmal tơlơi soh, buh ao kơƀao, laih anŭn klŭm hơbâo pur ƀơi akŏ gơñu. 
But I say to you, that it shall be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon in judgment-day than for you. @ Samơ̆ Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, amăng hrơi phat kơđi tơdơi plei Tir hăng plei Sidôn či tŭ tơlơi pơkơhmal plai ƀiă kơ ƀing gih. 
And *thou*, Capernaum, who hast been raised up to heaven, shalt be brought down even to hades. For if the works of power which have taken place in thee, had taken place in Sodom, it had remained until this day. @ Bơ ih, plei Kapernum, arăng či yŏng đĭ ih truh pơ adai mơ̆? Ư ưh arăng či glŏm hĭ ih amăng plei ƀing djai. Yua kơ tơdah arăng ngă ƀơi plei Sôđôm tơlơi mơsêh mơyang arăng hmâo ngă laih ƀơi tơ̆ng krah ih, sĭt biă mă yơh ñu ăt dŏ truh pơ hrơi anai. 
But I say to you, that it shall be more tolerable for [the] land of Sodom in judgment-day than for thee. @ Samơ̆ Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, amăng hrơi phat kơđi tơdơi plei Sôđôm či tŭ tơlơi pơkơhmal plai ƀiă kơ gih.”
At that time, Jesus answering said, I praise thee, Father, Lord of the heaven and of the earth, that thou hast hid these things from the wise and prudent, and hast revealed them to babes. @ Hlăk anŭn Yêsu laĭ tui anai: “Kâo bơni hơơč kơ Ih, Ơ Ama, Khua Yang kơ adai hăng lŏn tơnah, yua kơ Ih hmâo pơdŏp tơlơi anai kơ ƀing kơhnâo laih anŭn ƀing rơgơi, samơ̆ bơrơđah brơi laih kơ ƀing čơđai anĕt; 
Yea, Father, for thus has it been well-pleasing in thy sight. @ Sĭt yơh, Ơ Ama, yua kơ tơlơi anŭn bơmơak kơ Ih.
All things have been delivered to me by my Father, and no one knows the Son but the Father, nor does any one know the Father, but the Son, and he to whom the Son may be pleased to reveal [him]. @ Abih bang tơlơi Ama Kâo hmâo jao laih kơ Kâo; ƀu hmâo hlơi pô thâo krăn Ană, kơnơ̆ng hơjăn Ama đôč; laih anŭn ƀu hmâo hlơi pô thâo krăn Ama; kơnơ̆ng hơjăn Ană laih anŭn kơ hlơi pô Ană ruah kiăng bơrơđah brơi Ama kơ ñu.
Come to me, all ye who labour and are burdened, and *I* will give you rest. @ Ơ abih bang mơnuih rơmơ̆n hăng gui kơtraŏ, rai bĕ pơ Kâo, Kâo či brơi kơ ƀing gih dŏ pơdơi. 
Take my yoke upon you, and learn from me; for I am meek and lowly in heart; and ye shall find rest to your souls; @ Yua kơ Kâo hmâo pran jua tơdu rơun laih anŭn luă gŭ; brơi ƀing gih glăm bĕ ač Kâo laih anŭn hrăm mơ̆ng Kâo, laih anŭn bơngăt ƀing gih či hmâo tơlơi pơdơi. 
for my yoke is easy, and my burden is light. @ Yua kơ ač Kâo amuñ laih anŭn anong Kâo jing djhul.”
At that time Jesus went on the sabbath through the cornfields; and his disciples were hungry, and began to pluck the ears and to eat. @ Hlăk anŭn Yêsu rơbat găn hmua pơdai tơpŭng ƀơi hrơi saƀat. Ƀing ding kơna Ñu rơpa, laih anŭn gơñu čơdơ̆ng ruač ƀơ̆ng amŭng pơdai. 
But the Pharisees, seeing [it], said to him, Behold, thy disciples are doing what is not lawful to do on sabbath. @ Tơ ƀing Pharisi ƀuh tơlơi anŭn, gơñu laĭ kơ Yêsu: “Lăng bĕ ƀing ding kơna Ih ngă tơlơi ƀu phiăn ngă ôh amăng hrơi saƀat.” 
But he said to them, Have ye not read what David did when he was hungry, and they that were with him? @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Ƀing gih aka ƀu đŏk ôh hă kơ bruă Đawit hmâo ngă tơdang ñu laih anŭn ƀing nao hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ñu rơpa? 
How he entered into the house of God, and ate the shewbread, which it was not lawful for him to eat, nor for those with him, but for the priests only? @ Ñu mŭt amăng sang Ơi Adai laih anŭn ñu hăng ƀing gơ̆p ñu ƀơ̆ng ƀañ tơpŭng pơyơr kơ Ơi Adai, wơ̆t dah ƀañ tơpŭng anŭn ñu ƀu dưi ƀơ̆ng ôh, kơnơ̆ng pioh kơ ƀing khua ngă yang đôč dưi ƀơ̆ng. 
Or have ye not read in the law that on the sabbaths the priests in the temple profane the sabbath, and are blameless? @ Ƀôdah ƀing gih aka lăng ôh hă amăng hơdrôm hră tơlơi juăt Môis, kơ tơlơi ƀing khua ngă yang amăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ ngă gao tơlơi juăt hrơi saƀat, samơ̆ ƀu yap jing soh ôh? 
But I say unto you, that there is here what is greater than the temple. @ Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, pơ anai hmâo sa čô arăng pơpŭ hloh kơ sang kơkuh pơpŭ. 
But if ye had known what is: I will have mercy and not sacrifice, ye would not have condemned the guiltless. @ Laih anŭn tơdah ƀing gih thâo hluh hyư̆m boh pơhiăp anai kiăng pia: ‘Kâo kiăng tơlơi pap drap, ƀu djơ̆ ôh mơnơ̆ng ngă yang,’ ƀing gih ƀu klă kơđi ôh kơ ƀing ƀu hmâo tơlơi soh. 
For the Son of man is Lord of the sabbath. @ Yua kơ Ană Mơnuih jing khua kơ hrơi saƀat.”
And, going away from thence, he came into their synagogue. @ Yêsu đuaĭ mơ̆ng anŭn laih anŭn mŭt amăng sang bơjơnum. 
And behold, there was a man having his hand withered. And they asked him, saying, Is it lawful to heal on the sabbath? that they might accuse him. @ Anai nê, pơ anŭn hmâo sa čô đah rơkơi kro sa ƀĕ tơngan. Hmâo đơđa mơnuih kiăng sem tơlơi kơčut kơ Yêsu, gơñu tơña kơ Yêsu tui anai: “Phiăn mơ̆ pơsuaih amăng hrơi saƀat?”
But he said to them, What man shall there be of you who has one sheep, and if this fall into a pit on the sabbath, will not lay hold of it and raise [it] up? @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Hlơi pô amăng ƀing gih hmâo sa drơi triu laih anŭn triu anŭn lĕ amăng luh dlam amăng hrơi saƀat, ñu ƀu či mă dui đĭ pơ gah rơngiao ôh hă? 
How much better then is a man than a sheep! So that it is lawful to do well on the sabbath. @ Hloh kơ anŭn dơ̆ng sa čô mơnuih yom hloh kơ sa drơi triu! Tui anŭn phiăn yơh ngă hiam amăng hrơi saƀat.” 
Then he says to the man, Stretch out thy hand. And he stretched [it] out, and it was restored sound as the other. @ Laih anŭn Ñu laĭ kơ đah rơkơi anŭn: “Yơr bĕ tơngan ih” Gơ̆ yơr yơh, laih anŭn tơngan gơ̆ suaih jing hiam kar hăng tơngan pơkŏn. 
But the Pharisees, having gone out, took counsel against him, how they might destroy him. @ Samơ̆ ƀing Pharisi tơbiă laih anŭn črŏng sai sem tơlơi dưi pơdjai Yêsu.
But Jesus knowing [it], withdrew thence, and great crowds followed him; and he healed them all: @ Samơ̆ Yêsu thâo tơlơi anŭn, Ñu đuaĭ mơ̆ng anih anŭn. Hmâo lu mơnuih đuaĭ tui Ñu laih anŭn Ñu pơsuaih hĭ abih bang ƀing duăm ruă, 
and charged them strictly that they should not make him publicly known: @ laih anŭn pơtă kơ ƀing gơñu anăm ră ruai brơi arăng hmư̆ hing kơ Ñu ôh. 
that that might be fulfilled which was spoken through Esaias the prophet, saying, @ Tơlơi anŭn kiăng pơsĭt boh pơhiăp pô laĭ lui hlâo Êsai hmâo pơhiăp laih tui anai:
Behold my servant, whom I have chosen, my beloved, in whom my soul has found its delight. I will put my Spirit upon him, and he shall shew forth judgment to the nations. @ “Anai jing ding kơna Kâo hmâo ruah laih,
Pô Kâo khăp hơeng, amăng Ñu Kâo hmâo tơlơi mơak biă mă.
Kâo či brơi Yang Bơngăt Kâo dŏ ƀơi Ñu,
Laih anŭn Ñu či pơhaih tơlơi Kâo phat kơđi kơ ƀing djuai tuai.
He shall not strive or cry out, nor shall any one hear his voice in the streets; @ Ñu ƀu či pơrơjah ƀôdah ur kraih ôh,
Kŏn arăng hmư̆ săp ñu ƀơi jơlan lơi.
a bruised reed shall he not break, and smoking flax shall he not quench, until he bring forth judgment unto victory; @ Ñu ƀu či pơtơĭ hĭ ôh trang bô joh laih,
Kŏn bluh hĭ lơi apui kơđen giăm thăm,
Tơl Ñu ngă brơi tơlơi tơpă dưi hĭ.
and on his name shall [the] nations hope. @ Laih anŭn amăng anăn Ñu abih bang ƀing djuai tuai či čang rơmang.”
Then was brought to him one possessed by a demon, blind and dumb, and he healed him, so that the dumb [man] spake and saw. @ Hlăk anŭn arăng ba nao pơ Yêsu sa čô đah rơkơi yang sat ngă, bum mơta laih anŭn kơmlô. Yêsu pơsuaih gơ̆; tui anŭn đah rơkơi anŭn thâo pơhiăp laih anŭn thâo ƀuh. 
And all the crowds were amazed and said, Is this [man] the Son of David? @ Abih bang ƀing ană plei hling hlang hăng laĭ: “Djơ̆ mơ̆ pô anai jing ană Đawit?”
But the Pharisees, having heard [it], said, This [man] does not cast out demons, but by Beelzebub, prince of demons. @ Samơ̆ tơ ƀing Pharisi hmư̆ tơlơi anŭn, gơñu laĭ: “Mơnuih anŭn puh pơđuaĭ ƀing yang sat hăng anăn Bêlsebul, khua kơ ƀing yang sat.”
But he, knowing their thoughts, said to them, Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation, and every city or house divided against itself will not subsist. @ Yêsu thâo tơlơi pơmĭn gơñu laih anŭn laĭ kơ ƀing gơñu: “Tơdah sa boh dêh čar pơtao pơkah pơpha hĭ gơñu pô, či răm rai yơh, laih anŭn sa boh plei ƀôdah sa boh sang pơkah pơpha hĭ ñu pô, ƀu či dưi dŏ ôh. 
And if Satan casts out Satan, he is divided against himself; how then shall his kingdom subsist? @ Tui anŭn tơdah Satan puh pơđuaĭ hĭ Satan, ñu pơkah pơpha hĭ ñu pô yơh; hyư̆m dêh čar pơtao ñu dưi dŏ lĕ? 
And if *I* cast out demons by Beelzebub, your sons, by whom do they cast [them] out? For this reason *they* shall be your judges. @ Tơdah Kâo puh pơđuaĭ yang sat hăng anăn Bêlsebul, bơ ƀing ană ƀing gih, hăng anăn hlơi gơñu puh pơđuaĭ yang sat? Yua kơ anŭn yơh ƀing gơñu či phat kơđi ƀing gih. 
But if *I* by [the] Spirit of God cast out demons, then indeed the kingdom of God is come upon you. @ Samơ̆ tơdah Kâo puh pơđuaĭ ƀing yang sat hăng Yang Bơngăt Hiam Ơi Adai, tui anŭn dêh čar pơtao Ơi Adai truh laih kơ ƀing gih.
Or how can any one enter into the house of the strong [man] and plunder his goods, unless first he bind the strong [man]? and then he will plunder his house. @ Ƀôdah hyư̆m arăng dưi mŭt amăng sang sa čô mơnuih kơtang laih anŭn sua mă hĭ dram gơnam ñu, tơdah blŭng hlâo ñu ƀu čaŏ hĭ ôh mơnuih kơtang anŭn? Laih čaŏ hĭ kah, ñu dưi sua mă dram gơnam amăng sang ñu.
He that is not with me is against me, and he that gathers not with me scatters. @ Hlơi pô ƀu dŏ gah Kâo, jing pô pơkơdơ̆ng hăng Kâo, laih anŭn hlơi pô ƀu pơgop hăng Kâo, ñu či čơlah hĭ bru bra. 
For this reason I say unto you, Every sin and injurious speaking shall be forgiven to men, but speaking injuriously of the Spirit shall not be forgiven to men. @ Yua kơ anŭn Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, abih bang tơlơi soh laih anŭn abih bang tơlơi pơhiăp pơgao hmiah dưi hmâo tơlơi pap brơi kơ ană mơnuih, samơ̆ tơlơi pơhiăp pơgao kơ Yang Bơngăt Hiam ƀu dưi hmâo tơlơi pap brơi ôh. 
And whosoever shall have spoken a word against the Son of man, it shall be forgiven him; but whosoever shall speak against the Holy Spirit, it shall not be forgiven him, neither in this age nor in the coming [one]. @ Laih anŭn hlơi pô pơhiăp pơkơdơ̆ng hăng Ană Mơnuih dưi hmâo tơlơi pap brơi; samơ̆ hlơi pô pơhiăp pơkơdơ̆ng hăng Yang Bơngăt Hiam ƀu dưi hmâo tơlơi pap brơi kơ ñu ôh, thâo dah amăng rơnŭk anai ƀôdah amăng rơnŭk tơdơi či truh.”
Either make the tree good, and its fruit good; or make the tree corrupt, and its fruit corrupt. For from the fruit the tree is known. @ “Tơdah phŭn kơyâo hiam, boh ñu jing hiam kar kaĭ mơ̆n; ƀôdah tơdah phŭn kơyâo sat, boh ñu jing sat kar kaĭ mơ̆n; yua kơ arăng thâo krăn phŭn kơyâo tui hăng boh ñu. 
Offspring of vipers! how can ye speak good things, being wicked? For of the abundance of the heart the mouth speaks. @ Ơ djuai ala tơpơ̆ng! Hyư̆m ƀing gih dưi pơhiăp tơlơi hiam tơdang ƀing gih jing sat? Yua kơ mơ̆ng tơlơi rơbeh blai amăng pran jua yơh amăng bah tơbiă pơhiăp. 
The good man out of the good treasure brings forth good things; and the wicked man out of the wicked treasure brings forth wicked things. @ Mơnuih hiam yua mơ̆ng pơkom pioh tơlơi hiam hnŭn yơh ñu tơbiă rai tơlơi hiam, samơ̆ mơnuih sat yua mơ̆ng pơkom pioh tơlơi sat hnŭn yơh ñu tơbiă rai tơlơi sat.
But I say unto you, that every idle word which men shall say, they shall render an account of it in judgment-day: @ Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, ƀơi hrơi phat kơđi arăng či pơrơđah abih boh pơhiăp ƀu tŭ yua gơñu hmâo pơhiăp laih. 
for by thy words thou shalt be justified, and by thy words thou shalt be condemned. @ Yua kơ mơ̆ng tơlơi ih pơhiăp ih či hmâo tơlơi yap tơpă, laih anŭn mơ̆ng tơlơi ih pơhiăp mơ̆n ih či tŭ tơlơi klă kơđi.”
Then answered him some of the scribes and Pharisees, saying, Teacher, we desire to see a sign from thee. @ Laih anŭn hmâo đơđa ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt hăng ƀing Pharisi laĭ kơ ñu: “Ơ Nai, gơmơi kiăng ƀuh Ih ngă gru kơnăl mơyang.”
But he, answering, said to them, A wicked and adulterous generation seeks after a sign, and a sign shall not be given to it save the sign of Jonas the prophet. @ Samơ̆ Ñu laĭ glaĭ kơ ƀing anŭn: “Rơnŭk kơnŭng djuai sat ƀai laih anŭn rih răm hơduah sem sa gru kơnăl mơyang; samơ̆ ƀu či brơi gru kơnăl mơyang kơ kơnŭng djuai anai ôh, kơnơ̆ng gru kơnăl mơyang Yônas pô laĭ lui hlâo. 
For even as Jonas was in the belly of the great fish three days and three nights, thus shall the Son of man be in the heart of the earth three days and three nights. @ Yua kơ kar hăng Yônas dŏ amăng hlŭng akan prŏng klâo hrơi klâo mlam, ăt kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n Ană Mơnuih či dŏ amăng lŏn dlam klâo hrơi klâo mlam. 
Ninevites shall stand up in the judgment with this generation, and shall condemn it: for they repented at the preaching of Jonas; and behold, more than Jonas [is] here. @ Ƀơi hrơi phat kơđi ƀing mơnuih ană plei Niniwơ či tơgŭ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing kơnŭng djuai anai laih anŭn klă kơđi kơ ƀing gih; yua kơ ƀing mơnuih ană plei Niniwơ kơhmal tơlơi soh yua kơ gơñu hmư̆ tơlơi Yônas pơtô; laih anŭn anai nê, ƀơi anai hmâo sa čô prŏng hloh kơ Yônas. 
A queen of [the] south shall rise up in the judgment with this generation, and shall condemn it; for she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and behold, more than Solomon [is] here. @ Ƀơi hrơi phat kơđi, pơtao đah kơmơi čar dơnŭng či tơgŭ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing kơnŭng djuai anai laih anŭn či phat kơđi kơ ƀing gih, yua kơ gơ̆ rai mơ̆ng rơnuč lŏn tơnah kiăng hmư̆ tơlơi kơhnâo pơtao Salômôn, laih anŭn anai nê, hmâo sa čô ƀơi anai prŏng hloh kơ pơtao Salômôn.”
But when the unclean spirit has gone out of the man, he goes through dry places, seeking rest, and does not find [it]. @ “Tơ yang bơngăt grĭ hơƀak tơbiă laih mơ̆ng sa čô mơnuih, ñu găn nao lu anih thu hơduah sem anih kiăng pơdơi, samơ̆ ƀu hmâo ôh. 
Then he says, I will return to my house whence I came out; and having come, he finds [it] unoccupied, swept, and adorned. @ Tui anŭn ñu laĭ: ‘Kâo či wơ̆t glaĭ dŏ amăng sang kâo phrâo tơbiă laih.’ Laih anŭn tơ ñu truh ñu ƀuh sang anŭn jing hŏng đôč, kih agaih laih, laih anŭn prăp rơmet hiam djeh djong. 
Then he goes and takes with himself seven other spirits worse than himself, and entering in, they dwell there; and the last condition of that man becomes worse than the first. Thus shall it be to this wicked generation also. @ Laih anŭn ñu nao dơ̆ng jak ba hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ñu tơjuh čô yang sat pơkŏn sat hloh kơ ñu; gơñu mŭt dŏ amăng anŭn. Tui anŭn mơnuih anŭn jing sat kơtang hloh kơ hlâo dơ̆ng. Kơnŭng djuai sat ƀai anai ăt kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n.”
But while he was yet speaking to the crowds, behold, his mother and his brethren stood without, seeking to speak to him. @ Tơdang Yêsu ăt dŏ pơhiăp hăng ƀing mơnuih lu, amĭ Ñu hăng ƀing adơi ayŏng ñu dŏ pơ gah rơngiao kiăng pơhiăp bĭt hăng Ñu. 
Then one said unto him, Behold, thy mother and thy brethren are standing without, seeking to speak to thee. @ Hmâo sa čô laĭ kơ Ñu: “Anai nê, amĭ Ih hăng ƀing adơi ayŏng Ih dŏ pơ gah rơngiao kiăng pơhiăp bĭt hăng Ih.”
But he answering said to him that spoke to him, Who is my mother, and who are my brethren? @ Samơ̆ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ kơ pô laĭ hăng Ñu: “Hlơi jing amĭ Kâo? Laih anŭn hlơi jing ƀing adơi ayŏng Kâo?” 
And, stretching out his hand to his disciples, he said, Behold my mother and my brethren; @ Ñu črâo kơ ƀing ding kơna Ñu laih anŭn laĭ: “Anai yơh amĭ Kâo laih anŭn adơi ayŏng Kâo! 
for whosoever shall do the will of my Father who is in [the] heavens, he is my brother, and sister, and mother. @ Yua kơ hlơi pô ngă tui tơlơi Ama Kâo amăng adai kiăng, ñu anŭn jing adơi ayŏng, amai adơi laih anŭn amĭ Kâo.”
And that [same] day Jesus went out from the house and sat down by the sea. @ Amăng hrơi anŭn mơ̆n, Yêsu tơbiă mơ̆ng sang laih anŭn dŏ ber ƀơi hang ia rơsĭ. 
And great crowds were gathered together to him, so that going on board ship himself he sat down, and the whole crowd stood on the shore. @ Laih anŭn ƀing mơnuih lu rai pơtŭm jum dar Ñu, tui anŭn Ñu đĭ amăng sŏng laih anŭn dŏ ber; laih anŭn abih ƀing mơnuih lu dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơi hang. 
And he spoke to them many things in parables, saying, Behold, the sower went out to sow: @ Ñu pơtô kơ ƀing gơñu lu mơta hăng tơlơi bơhmutu, laĭ: “Hmâo sa čô mơnuih nao sai pơjeh ñu. 
and as he sowed, some [grains] fell along the way, and the birds came and devoured them; @ Tơdang ñu sai hmâo đơđa pơjeh lĕ ƀơi rŏk jơlan laih anŭn čĭm rai čoh ƀơ̆ng hĭ pơjeh anŭn. 
and others fell upon the rocky places where they had not much earth, and immediately they sprang up out of [the ground] because of not having [any] depth of earth, @ Pơjeh pơkŏn lĕ amăng anih lŏn boh pơtâo, hmâo kơnơ̆ng ƀiă lŏn đôč, laih anŭn pơjeh čăt mơtam, yua kơ lŏn ƀu kơpal ôh; 
but when the sun rose they were burned up, and because of not having [any] root were dried up; @ Samơ̆ tơ yang hrơi ƀlĕ, pơjeh anŭn gliu hĭ; laih anŭn yua kơ ƀu hmâo akha ôh, gơñu kro yơh. 
and others fell upon the thorns, and the thorns grew up and choked them; @ Pơjeh pơkŏn lĕ amăng anih drơi. Drơi čăt đĭ glong laih anŭn ket hĭ pơjeh anŭn. 
and others fell upon the good ground, and produced fruit, one a hundred, one sixty, and one thirty. @ Pơjeh pơkŏn lĕ amăng anih lŏn hiam laih anŭn mơboh, hmâo đơđa sa sar jing hĭ sa rơtuh, hmâo đơđa jing hĭ năm pluh, hmâo đơđa jing hĭ klâo pluh. 
He that has ears, let him hear. @ Hlơi pô hmâo tơngia, hmư̆ bĕ!”
And the disciples came up and said to him, Why speakest thou to them in parables? @ Giơ̆ng anŭn ƀing ding kơna nao tơña kơ Yêsu: “Hyư̆m Ih pơhiăp hăng ƀing gơñu hăng tơlơi bơhmutu?”
And he answering said to them, Because to you it is given to know the mysteries of the kingdom of the heavens, but to them it is not given; @ Ñu laĭ glaĭ: “Ƀing gih mă tŭ laih tơlơi thâo hluh tơlơi yom hơgơ̆m kơ dêh čar pơtao plei hiam, samơ̆ gơñu ƀu hmâo ôh. 
for whoever has, to him shall be given, and he shall be caused to be in abundance; but he who has not, even what he has shall be taken away from him. @ Yua kơ Ơi Adai či brơi thim kơ hlơi pô hmâo laih, laih anŭn ñu či hmâo lu rơbeh; samơ̆ hlơi pô ƀu hmâo ôh, arăng či sua mă hĭ wơ̆t kơ hơgĕt mơnơ̆ng ñu hmâo laih. 
For this cause I speak to them in parables, because seeing they do not see, and hearing they do not hear nor understand; @ Yua kơ anŭn yơh Kâo yua tơlơi bơhmutu pơhiăp hăng gơñu, wơ̆t dah gơñu lăng samơ̆ ƀu ƀuh ôh, gơñu pơđing tơngia samơ̆ ƀu hmư̆ ôh, kŏn gơñu thâo hluh lơi. 
and in them is filled up the prophecy of Esaias, which says, Hearing ye shall hear and shall not understand, and beholding ye shall behold and not see; @ Gơñu hmâo ngă pơsĭt tơlơi Êsai hmâo laĭ lui hlâo tui anai:
‘Ƀing gih či pơđing tơngia hmư̆, samơ̆ ƀu thâo hluh ôh;
Ƀing gih či lăng samơ̆ ƀu thâo ƀuh ôh.
for the heart of this people has grown fat, and they have heard heavily with their ears, and they have closed their eyes as asleep, lest they should see with the eyes, and hear with the ears, and understand with the heart, and should be converted, and I should heal them. @ Yua kơ pran jua ƀing ană plei pla anai jing kơpĭl laih,
Laih anŭn tơngia gơñu tơngil hĭ,
Gơñu pĭt hĭ mơta gơñu,
Hwĭ dah mơta gơñu thâo ƀuh,
Tơngia gơñu thâo hmư̆,
Pran jua gơñu thâo hluh,
Laih anŭn gơñu wơ̆t glaĭ pơ Kâo,
Kiăng kơ Kâo pơsuaih gơñu.’
But blessed are *your* eyes because they see, and your ears because they hear; @ Samơ̆ mơyun hiam yơh kơ mơta gih yua kơ dưi thâo ƀuh; mơyun hiam yơh kơ tơngia gih yua kơ dưi thâo hmư̆. 
for verily I say unto you, that many prophets and righteous [men] have desired to see the things which ye behold and did not see [them], and to hear the things which ye hear and did not hear [them]. @ Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih sĭt biă mă, hmâo lu pô laĭ lui hlâo hăng lu mơnuih tơpă kiăng ƀuh hơdôm tơlơi gih ƀuh ră anai samơ̆ gơñu ƀu dưi ƀuh ôh. Gơñu kiăng hmư̆ hơdôm tơlơi ƀing gih hmư̆ ră anai samơ̆ gơñu ƀu dưi hmư̆ ôh.”
*Ye*, therefore, hear the parable of the sower. @ “Tui anŭn hmư̆ bĕ tơlơi pơblang tơlơi bơhmutu kơ pô sai pơjeh anŭn. 
From every one who hears the word of the kingdom and does not understand [it], the wicked one comes and catches away what was sown in his heart: this is he that is sown by the wayside. @ Hlơi pô hmư̆ tơlơi pơhiăp kơ dêh čar pơtao plei hiam laih anŭn ƀu thâo hluh ôh, yang sat rai mă hĭ hơgĕt tơlơi arăng sai laih amăng pran jua ñu; anŭn jing pơjeh sai lĕ ƀơi jơlan. 
But he that is sown on the rocky places this is he who hears the word and immediately receives it with joy, @ Pơjeh arăng sai lĕ ƀơi ngŏ lŏn boh pơtâo, jing pô hmư̆ tơlơi pơhiăp laih anŭn hăng tơlơi hơ̆k mơak mă tŭ mơtam, 
but has no root in himself, but is for a time only; and when tribulation or persecution happens on account of the word, he is immediately offended. @ samơ̆ boh pơhiăp ƀu hmâo akha ôh amăng ñu, ñu dŏ kơjăp kơnơ̆ng ƀiă đôč. Laih anŭn tơdah hmâo tơlơi tơnap ƀôdah tơlơi ngă sat truh yua kơ tơlơi pơhiăp, ñu lui wir mơtam. 
And he that is sown among the thorns this is he who hears the word, and the anxious care of this life, and the deceit of riches choke the word, and he becomes unfruitful. @ Pơjeh sai lĕ ƀơi anih drơi, jing pô hmư̆ tơlơi pơhiăp, samơ̆ tơlơi ƀlơ̆ng bơngơ̆t kơ tơlơi hơdip rơnŭk anai laih anŭn tơlơi plư tơbiă mơ̆ng tơlơi kiăng kơ tơlơi pơdrŏng sah ket hĭ tơlơi pơhiăp, laih anŭn ñu ƀu hmâo mơboh ôh. 
But he that is sown upon the good ground this is he who hears and understands the word, who bears fruit also, and produces, one a hundred, one sixty, and one thirty. @ Bơ kơ pơjeh arăng sai laih ƀơi lŏn hiam, jing pô hmư̆ tơlơi pơhiăp laih anŭn thâo hluh. Sĭt biă mă ñu mơboh tơl sa asar pơjeh jing hĭ sa rơtuh asar dơ̆ng, đơđa jing hĭ năm pluh, đơđa jing hĭ klâo pluh.”
Another parable set he before them, saying, The kingdom of the heavens has become like a man sowing good seed in his field; @ Yêsu pơtô kơ gơñu tơlơi bơhmutu pơkŏn: “Dêh čar pơtao plei hiam dưi pơhmu kar hăng sa čô đah rơkơi sai pơjeh hiam amăng hmua ñu, 
but while men slept, his enemy came and sowed darnel amongst the wheat, and went away. @ samơ̆ tơdang arăng pĭt, pô ayăt ñu rai sai pơjeh rơ̆k sat amăng pơdai tơpŭng laih anŭn đuaĭ hĭ. 
But when the blade shot up and produced fruit, then appeared the darnel also. @ Tơdah pơdai tơpŭng čăt đĭ glong laih anŭn hroh, rơ̆k sat ăt bơrơđah mơ̆n. 
And the bondmen of the householder came up and said to him, Sir, hast thou not sown good seed in thy field? whence then has it darnel? @ Ƀing ding kơna pô hmua anŭn rai laĭ kơ ñu: ‘Ơ Khua, ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă ih sai pơjeh hiam amăng hmua ih? Hyư̆m hmâo hĭ rơ̆k sat lĕ?’ 
And he said to them, A man [that is] an enemy has done this. And the bondmen said to him, Wilt thou then that we should go and gather it [up]? @ Ñu laĭ kơ gơñu: ‘Sa čô ayăt yơh ngă tơlơi anŭn.’ Ƀing ding kơna laĭ kơ ñu: ‘Ih kiăng mơ̆ gơmơi nao buč hĭ rơ̆k anŭn?’ 
But he said, No; lest [in] gathering the darnel ye should root up the wheat with it. @ Samơ̆ ñu laĭ: ‘Anăm ôh, hwĭ kơ tơdang ƀing gih buč rơ̆k sat anŭn ƀing gih buč djơ̆ hĭ wơ̆t pơdai tơpŭng hrŏm hơbĭt mơ̆n. 
Suffer both to grow together unto the harvest, and in time of the harvest I will say to the harvestmen, Gather first the darnel, and bind it into bundles to burn it; but the wheat bring together into my granary. @ Lui abih dua anŭn glong đĭ hrŏm hơbĭt tơl truh bơyan hơpuă; laih anŭn ƀơi bơyan hơpuă kâo či pơtă kơ ƀing hơpuă, buč hĭ rơ̆k sat hlâo, pŏ glaĭ laih anŭn čuh hĭ, samơ̆ pơƀŭt pơdai tơpŭng pioh amăng atông kâo.’”
Another parable set he before them, saying, The kingdom of the heavens is like a grain of mustard [seed] which a man took and sowed in his field; @ Yêsu pơtô kơ gơñu hăng tơlơi bơhmutu pơkŏn dơ̆ng, laĭ: “Dêh čar pơtao plei hiam jing kar hăng sa asar pơjeh añăm bơi, sa čô mơnuih mă laih anŭn sai amăng hmua ñu. 
which is less indeed than all seeds, but when it is grown is greater than herbs, and becomes a tree, so that the birds of heaven come and roost in its branches. @ Ñu jing asar pơjeh anĕt hloh kơ abih bang pơjeh, samơ̆ tơ ñu čăt glong laih, ñu jing prŏng hloh kơ abih bang phŭn añăm pơtăm pơkŏn laih anŭn jing hĭ ania kơyâo, tơl čĭm brĭm rai ngă hruh ƀơi than ñu.”
He spoke another parable to them: The kingdom of the heavens is like leaven, which a woman took and hid in three measures of meal until it had been all leavened. @ Ñu pơtô kơ gơñu hăng tơlơi bơhmutu pơkŏn dơ̆ng: “Dêh čar pơtao plei hiam jing kar hăng tơpơi, sa čô đah kơmơi mă pơlŭk hăng klâo hơnơ̆ng tơpŭng tơl tơpŭng anŭn blang hĭ abih.”
All these things Jesus spoke to the crowds in parables, and without a parable he did not speak to them, @ Yêsu pơtô abih tơlơi anŭn kơ ƀing lu hăng tơlơi bơhmutu soh sel. Ƀu hmâo sa tơlơi pơtô hơgĕt ôh Ñu ƀu yua tơlơi bơhmutu kiăng pơtô kơ ƀing gơñu. 
so that that should be fulfilled which was spoken through the prophet, saying, I will open my mouth in parables; I will utter things hidden from [the] world's foundation. @ Tơlơi anŭn kiăng pơsĭt tơlơi pô laĭ lui hlâo hmâo pơhiăp laih tui anai:
“Kâo či ha pơhiăp hăng tơlơi bơhmutu,
Kâo či pơhaih tơlơi hmâo pơdŏp laih čơdơ̆ng mơ̆ng hrơi hrih pơjing lŏn tơnah.”
Then, having dismissed the crowds, he went into the house; and his disciples came to him, saying, Expound to us the parable of the darnel of the field. @ Giơ̆ng Ñu brơi ƀing mơnuih lu anŭn glaĭ, Khua Yang Yêsu mŭt amăng sang. Ƀing ding kơna Ñu nao pơ Ñu, laĭ: “Rơkâo kơ Ih pơblang brơi kơ gơmơi tơlơi bơhmutu kơ rơ̆k sat amăng hmua.”
But he answering said, He that sows the good seed is the Son of man, @ Ñu laĭ glaĭ: “Pô sai pơjeh hiam jing Ană Mơnuih, 
and the field is the world; and the good seed, these are the sons of the kingdom, but the darnel are the sons of the evil [one]; @ hmua jing lŏn tơnah, pơjeh hiam jing ƀing ană kơ dêh čar pơtao plei hiam, rơ̆k sat jing ƀing ană yang sat, 
and the enemy who has sowed it is the devil; and the harvest is [the] completion of [the] age, and the harvestmen are angels. @ pô ayăt sai pơjeh rơ̆k sat anŭn jing yang sat, bơyan hơpuă jing rơnŭk hnal tuč, laih anŭn ƀing hơpuă jing ƀing ling jang Ơi Adai. 
As then the darnel is gathered and is burned in the fire, thus it shall be in the completion of the age. @ Kar hăng arăng mă rơ̆k sat anŭn, pơƀŭt laih anŭn čuh hĭ amăng apui, arăng či ngă kar hăng tui anŭn mơ̆n ƀơi hrơi hnal tuč rơnŭk. 
The Son of man shall send his angels, and they shall gather out of his kingdom all offences, and those that practise lawlessness; @ Ană Mơnuih či pơkiaŏ nao ƀing ling jang Ñu, laih anŭn gơñu či duñ hĭ abih bang ƀing pơsoh arăng laih anŭn ƀing ngă tơlơi sat mơ̆ng dêh čar pơtao Ñu, 
and they shall cast them into the furnace of fire; there shall be the weeping and the gnashing of teeth. @ laih anŭn glŏm hĭ gơñu amăng tơpur apui prŏng. Ƀơi anih anŭn či hmâo tơlơi čŏk hia hăng tơlơi kĕ tơgơi. 
Then the righteous shall shine forth as the sun in the kingdom of their Father. He that has ears, let him hear. @ Hlăk anŭn ƀing mơnuih tơpă či pơčrang kar hăng yang hrơi amăng dêh čar pơtao Ama gơñu. Hlơi pô hmâo tơngia, brơi ñu hmư̆ bĕ.”
The kingdom of the heavens is like a treasure hid in the field, which a man having found has hid, and for the joy of it goes and sells all whatever he has, and buys that field. @ “Dêh čar pơtao adai jing kar hăng dram gơnam yom arăng pơdŏp hĭ amăng sa blah hmua. Sa čô mơnuih ƀuh dram gơnam yom anŭn ñu pơdŏp hĭ, laih anŭn hăng tơlơi hơ̆k kơdơ̆k ñu nao sĭ hĭ abih bang mơnơ̆ng ñu hmâo kiăng blơi hmua anŭn.”
Again, the kingdom of the heavens is like a merchant seeking beautiful pearls; @ “Kar kaĭ mơ̆n dêh čar pơtao plei hiam jing kar hăng sa čô sĭ mia hyu hơduah boh pơtâo ačung. 
and having found one pearl of great value, he went and sold all whatever he had and bought it. @ Tơ ñu hmâo ƀuh laih sa sar boh pơtâo ačung yom biă mă, ñu nao sĭ hĭ abih mơnơ̆ng ñu hmâo kiăng blơi boh pơtâo ačung anŭn.”
Again, the kingdom of the heavens is like a seine which has been cast into the sea, and which has gathered together of every kind, @ “Kar kaĭ mơ̆n dêh čar pơtao plei hiam jing kar hăng sa blah hơñual arăng trah amăng ia rơsĭ djơ̆ djŏp mơta akan. 
which, when it has been filled, having drawn up on the shore and sat down, they gathered the good into vessels and cast the worthless out. @ Tơ hơñual bă laih, arăng dui đĭ hơñual pơ hang. Gơñu dŏ ber ruah mă akan hiam pioh amăng bai, samơ̆ glŏm hĭ akan sat. 
Thus shall it be in the completion of the age: the angels shall go forth and sever the wicked from the midst of the just, @ Kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n ƀơi hrơi hnal tuč rơnŭk. Ƀing ling jang Ơi Adai či rai laih anŭn pơkah pơpha, mă hĭ ƀing sat mơ̆ng ƀing tơpă, 
and shall cast them into the furnace of fire; there shall be the weeping and the gnashing of teeth. @ laih anŭn glŏm hĭ gơñu amăng tơpur apui prŏng. Ƀơi anŭn gơñu či čŏk hia hăng kĕ tơgơi.”
Jesus says to them, Have ye understood all these things? They say to him, Yea, [Lord]. @ “Ƀing gih thâo hluh laih mơ̆ abih tơlơi anŭn?”
Gơñu laĭ glaĭ: “Ơ, thâo hluh mơ̆n.”
And he said to them, For this reason every scribe discipled to the kingdom of the heavens is like a man [that is] a householder who brings out of his treasure things new and old. @ Laih anŭn Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Yua kơ anŭn, rĭm čô nai pơtô tơlơi juăt arăng hmâo pơhrăm laih gơñu kơ dêh čar pơtao plei hiam, jing kar hăng sa čô pô sang ba tơbiă dram gơnam yom phrâo wơ̆t so mơ̆ng anih kong ngăn ñu.”
And it came to pass when Jesus had finished these parables he withdrew thence. @ Tơ Yêsu pơhiăp tơlơi bơhmutu anŭn giơ̆ng laih, Ñu đuaĭ mơ̆ng anih anŭn. 
And having come into his own country, he taught them in their synagogue, so that they were astonished, and said, Whence has this [man] this wisdom and these works of power? @ Ñu glaĭ pơ plei Ñu pô laih anŭn pơtô amăng sang bơjơnum. Ƀing hmư̆ Ñu hling hlang laih anŭn laĭ: “Mơ̆ng pă pô anai hmâo tơlơi kơhnâo laih anŭn dưi ngă khul bruă mơsêh mơyang anai? 
Is not this the son of the carpenter? Is not his mother called Mary, and his brethren James, and Joseph, and Simon, and Judas? @ Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă Ñu jing ană pô trah kơyâo? Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă anăn amĭ Ñu HʼMari? Laih anŭn ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă ƀing adơi Ñu jing Yakơ, Yôsep, Simôn, laih anŭn Yut? 
And his sisters, are they not all with us? Whence then has this [man] all these things? @ Laih anŭn ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă abih bang ƀing adơi đah kơmơi Ñu dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing ta? Tui anŭn mơ̆ng pă pô anai hmâo abih tơlơi anai?” 
And they were offended in him. And Jesus said to them, A prophet is not without honour, unless in his country and in his house. @ Laih anŭn gơñu tơhnač yua kơ Yêsu. Samơ̆ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Pô laĭ lui hlâo hmâo tơlơi pơpŭ tar ƀar anih, samơ̆ kơnơ̆ng plei pla Ñu laih anŭn sang anŏ Ñu pô đôč ƀu hmâo tơlơi pơpŭ ôh kơ Ñu.” 
And he did not there many works of power, because of their unbelief. @ Laih anŭn Ñu ƀu ngă lu tơlơi mơsêh mơyang ôh ƀơi anŭn, yua kơ gơñu ƀu đaŏ ôh.
At that time Herod the tetrarch heard of the fame of Jesus, @ Hlăk anŭn pơtao Hêrôt, pô wai lăng kwar Galilê, hmư̆ arăng ră ruai tơlơi hing ang Yêsu. 
and said to his servants, This is John the baptist: *he* is risen from the dead, and because of this these works of power display their force in him. @ Ñu laĭ kơ ƀing ding kơna ñu: “Anai jing Yôhan Ƀatem, pô hmâo hơdip glaĭ laih mơ̆ng ƀing djai. Yua kơ anŭn yơh Ñu dưi ngă lu tơlơi mơsêh mơyang anai.”
For Herod had seized John, and had bound him and put him in prison on account of Herodias the wife of Philip his brother. @ Yua kơ pơtao Hêrôt hmâo brơi arăng mă čaŏ laih anŭn krư̆ Yôhan amăng sang mơnă yua kơ bruă HʼHêrôđias, bơnai Philip adơi ñu. 
For John said to him, It is not lawful for thee to have her. @ Yua kơ Yôhan hmâo laĭ kơ ñu: “Ƀu phiăn ôh ih mă đah kơmơi anŭn jing hĭ bơnai ih.” 
And [while] desiring to kill him, he feared the crowd, because they held him for a prophet. @ Pơtao Hêrôt kiăng pơdjai hĭ Yôhan, samơ̆ ñu hwĭ kơ ƀing ană plei, yua kơ gơñu yap Yôhan jing sa čô pô laĭ lui hlâo.
But when Herod's birthday was celebrated, the daughter of Herodias danced before them, and pleased Herod; @ Samơ̆ ƀơi hrơi arăng pơhơdơr hrơi tơkeng kơ pơtao Hêrôt, ană dra HʼHêrôđias suang ƀơi anăp ƀing tuai dŏ ƀơ̆ng huă. Gơ̆ ngă bơmơak kơ pơtao Hêrôt, 
whereupon he promised with oath to give her whatsoever she should ask. @ tơl pơtao Hêrôt hơtŏm ƀuăn či brơi kơ ñu hơgĕt mơnơ̆ng ñu rơkâo.
But she, being set on by her mother, says, Give me here upon a dish the head of John the baptist. @ Hmư̆ amĭ ñu pơtrŭt kơ ñu, dra anŭn laĭ: “Brơi kơ kâo akŏ Yôhan Ƀatem pioh amăng prang ba rai pơ anai mơtam.”
And the king was grieved; but on account of the oaths, and those lying at table with [him], he commanded [it] to be given. @ Pơtao rơngot biă mă, samơ̆ yua kơ ñu ƀuăn rơ̆ng laih ƀơi anăp ƀing ƀơ̆ng huă mơñum hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ñu, ñu pơđar kơ arăng brơi kơ dra anŭn tui hăng tơlơi ñu rơkâo. 
And he sent and beheaded John in the prison; @ Ñu pơkiaŏ nao mơnuih čơ̆ng tơkuai Yôhan amăng sang mơnă, 
and his head was brought upon a dish, and was given to the damsel, and she carried [it] to her mother. @ laih anŭn arăng djă ba akŏ Yôhan amăng sa boh prang brơi kơ dra anŭn, dra anŭn djă ba brơi kơ amĭ ñu. 
And his disciples came and took the body and buried it, and came and brought word to Jesus. @ Ƀing ding kơna Yôhan rai mă drơi jan gơ̆ ba dơr hĭ, laih anŭn gơñu nao laĭ pơthâo tơlơi anŭn kơ Yêsu.
And Jesus, having heard it, went away thence by ship to a desert place apart. And the crowds having heard [of it] followed him on foot from the cities. @ Laih hmư̆ tơlơi anŭn, Yêsu mơ̆ng anih anŭn đĭ sŏng nao pơ anih rơnguă Ñu dưi dŏ hơjăn. Samơ̆ tơ ƀing mơnuih lu hmư̆ tơlơi anŭn, mơ̆ng lu boh plei gơñu rơbat tơkai tui Yêsu. 
And going out he saw a great crowd, and was moved with compassion about them, and healed their infirm. @ Tơdang Yêsu tơbiă đĭ nao pơ hang, Ñu ƀuh mơnuih lu lĭn. Ñu pap drap laih anŭn pơsuaih ƀing duăm ruă.
But when even was come, his disciples came to him saying, The place is desert, and [much of] the [day] time already gone by; dismiss the crowds, that they may go into the villages and buy food for themselves. @ Tơ adai klam laih, ƀing ding kơna nao pơ Ñu laih anŭn laĭ: “Anai jing anih rơnguă rơnguăn, adai mơmŏt laih. Brơi ƀing mơnuih lu nao bĕ pơ plei jĕ giăm blơi mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă kơ gơñu pô.”
But Jesus said to them, They have no need to go: give *ye* them to eat. @ Yêsu laĭ: “Ƀu kiăng ôh kơ gơñu khŏm nao; Ƀing gih yơh brơi kơ gơñu mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă.”
But they say to him, We have not here save five loaves and two fishes. @ Ƀing ding kơna laĭ glaĭ: “Pơ anai gơmơi hmâo kơnơ̆ng rơma klŏ ƀañ tơpŭng laih anŭn dua drơi akan đôč.”
And he said, Bring them here to me. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Ba ƀañ tơpŭng hăng akan anŭn kơ Kâo.” 
And having commanded the crowds to recline upon the grass, having taken the five loaves and the two fishes, he looked up to heaven, and blessed: and having broken the loaves, he gave [them] to the disciples, and the disciples [gave them] to the crowds. @ Ñu pơtă kơ ƀing mơnuih lu anŭn dŏ ber ƀơi rơ̆k. Ñu mă rơma klŏ ƀañ tơpŭng hăng dua drơi akan anŭn, angak mơta pơ adai, bơni hơơč kơ Ơi Adai, wơ̆k ƀañ tơpŭng laih anŭn brơi kơ ƀing ding kơna, laih anŭn ƀing ding kơna pơpha brơi kơ ƀing mơnuih lu anŭn. 
And all ate and were filled, and they took up what was over and above of fragments twelve hand-baskets full. @ Abih bang gơñu ƀơ̆ng trơi soh sel. Laih anŭn gơñu pơƀŭt glaĭ čơđeh meh ƀañ tơpŭng dŏ glaĭ bă pluh dua bai. 
But those that had eaten were about five thousand men, besides women and children. @ Ƀing mơnuih lu ƀơ̆ng ƀañ tơpŭng, akan anŭn giăm hmâo rơma rơbâo čô đah rơkơi, ƀu yap ôh đah kơmơi laih anŭn čơđai.
And immediately he compelled the disciples to go on board ship, and to go on before him to the other side, until he should have dismissed the crowds. @ Giơ̆ng anŭn, Ñu brơi ƀing ding kơna đĭ sŏng laih anŭn găn ia rơsĭ nao hlâo pơ hang gah dih, hlăk anŭn mơ̆n Ñu brơi ƀing mơnuih lu anŭn glaĭ. 
And having dismissed the crowds, he went up into the mountain apart to pray. And when even was come, he was alone there, @ Giơ̆ng kơ Ñu brơi ƀing mơnuih lu glaĭ, Ñu đĭ pơ čư̆ hơjăn Ñu kiăng kơ iâu laĭ. Tơ adai mơmŏt laih, Ñu ăt dŏ pơ anŭn hơjăn Ñu. 
but the ship was already in the middle of the sea tossed by the waves, for the wind was contrary. @ Hlăk anŭn sŏng truh pơ tơ̆ng krah ia rơsĭ laih; ia poh yă kơtang klă sŏng, yua kơ angĭn thut klă gơñu. 
But in the fourth watch of the night he went off to them, walking on the sea. @ Jĕ mơguah Yêsu rơbat ƀơi ngŏ jơlah ia nao pơ ƀing gơñu. 
And the disciples, seeing him walking on the sea, were troubled, saying, It is an apparition. And they cried out through fear. @ Samơ̆ tơ ƀing ding kơna ƀuh Ñu rơbat ƀơi ngŏ jơlah ia, gơñu hwĭ bral biă mă laih anŭn laĭ: “Atâo yơh anŭn!” Laih anŭn gơñu ur kraih hăng tơlơi hwĭ. 
But Jesus immediately spoke to them, saying, Take courage; it is *I*: be not afraid. @ Samơ̆ Yêsu laĭ gơñu mơtam: “Dŏ hơđơ̆ng pran jua bĕ! Kâo gơ̆ yơh, anăm hwĭ ôh.”
And Peter answering him said, Lord, if it be *thou*, command me to come to thee upon the waters. @ Pêtrôs laĭ: “Ơ Khua, tơdah Ih sĭt, brơi kâo rơbat ƀơi hăng ngŏ jơlah ia nao pơ Ih.” 
And he said, Come. And Peter, having descended from the ship, walked upon the waters to go to Jesus. @ Yêsu laĭ: “Rai bĕ!” Tui anŭn Pêtrôs tơbiă mơ̆ng sŏng hăng rơbat ƀơi ngŏ jơlah ia nao pơ Yêsu. 
But seeing the wind strong he was afraid; and beginning to sink he cried out, saying, Lord, save me. @ Samơ̆ tơ ñu ƀuh angĭn kơtang, ñu hwĭ laih anŭn čơdơ̆ng trăm, tui anŭn Ñu ur: “Ơ Khua, pơklaih kâo.” 
And immediately Jesus stretched out his hand and caught hold of him, and says to him, O thou of little faith, why didst thou doubt? @ Tañ mơtam Yêsu yơr tơngan mă ñu, laih anŭn laĭ kơ ñu: “Ơ mơnuih hmâo tơlơi đaŏ anĕt, yua hơgĕt ih đing?” 
And when they had gone up into the ship, the wind fell. @ Tơ gơñu đĭ amăng sŏng laih, angĭn hlŏng hơđơ̆ng mơtam. 
But those in the ship came and did homage to him, saying, Truly thou art God's Son. @ Ƀing dŏ amăng sŏng bon kơkuh kơ Ñu, hăng laĭ: “Sĭt biă mă, Ih jing Ană Ơi Adai.”
And having crossed over they came to the land of Gennesaret. @ Tơ gơñu găn ia rơsĭ laih, gơñu đĭ pơ hang tring Gênêsaret. 
And when the men of that place recognised him, they sent to that whole country around, and they brought to him all that were ill, @ Mơnuih amăng tring anŭn thâo krăn Ñu, gơñu pơkiaŏ arăng nao laĭ pơthâo pơ abih tring laih anŭn ba nao abih bang ƀing duăm ruă pơ Ñu. 
and besought him that they might only touch the hem of his garment; and as many as touched were made thoroughly well. @ Gơñu kơwưh rơkâo kơ Yêsu brơi ƀing duăm ruă kơnơ̆ng ruaih ƀơi jih ao Ñu đôč; laih anŭn abih bang ƀing ruaih ao Ñu leng kơ dưi suaih soh sel.
Then the scribes and Pharisees from Jerusalem come up to Jesus, saying, @ Hlăk anŭn ƀing Pharisi wơ̆t hăng ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt rai mơ̆ng plei Yêrusalem nao pơ Yêsu laih anŭn laĭ, 
Why do thy disciples transgress what has been delivered by the ancients? for they do not wash their hands when they eat bread. @ “Yua hơgĕt ƀing ding kơna Ih gao tơlơi phiăn ơi adon đưm? Ƀing gơñu ƀu rao ôh tơngan gơñu hlâo kơ gơñu ƀơ̆ng huă!”
But he answering said to them, Why do *ye* also transgress the commandment of God on account of your traditional teaching? @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Bơ ƀing gih, yua hơgĕt ƀing gih ngă gao tơlơi Ơi Adai pơtă laih anŭn ngă tui tơlơi phiăn ƀing gih pô lĕ? 
For God commanded saying, Honour father and mother; and, He that speaks ill of father or mother, let him die the death. @ Yua Ơi Adai hmâo pơtă: ‘Pơpŭ bĕ kơ amĭ ama ih,’ laih anŭn ‘Hlơi pô pơhiăp sat kơ ama ƀôdah amĭ, sĭt biă mă ñu khŏm tŭ tơlơi djai.’ 
But *ye* say, Whosoever shall say to his father or mother, It is a gift, whatsoever [it be] by which [received] from me thou wouldest be profited: @ Samơ̆ ƀing gih laĭ: ‘Tơdah sa čô laĭ kơ ama ƀôdah kơ amĭ ñu tui anai: “Mơnơ̆ng hơgĕt kâo dưi djru kơ ƀing gih, kâo hmâo pơyơr laih kơ Ơi Adai”, 
and he shall in no wise honour his father or his mother; and ye have made void the commandment of God on account of your traditional teaching. @ mơnuih anŭn huaĭ djru kơ amĭ ama ñu dơ̆ng tah.’ Tui anŭn, yua kơ tơlơi phiăn ƀing gih pô, ƀing gih lui hĭ boh pơhiăp Ơi Adai. 
Hypocrites! well has Esaias prophesied about you, saying, @ Ơ ƀing plơ̆m ƀlor! Djơ̆ yơh Êsai hmâo laĭ lui hlâo kơ ƀing gih tơ ñu pơhiăp:
This people honour me with the lips, but their heart is far away from me; @ ‘Ƀing anai pơpŭ kơ Kâo hăng amăng bah gơñu đôč;
Samơ̆ pran jua gơñu ataih mơ̆ng Kâo biă mă.
but in vain do they worship me, teaching [as] teachings commandments of men. @ Tơlơi gơñu kơkuh pơpŭ kơ Kâo jing đôč đač đôč,
Yua kơ gơñu pơtô tơlơi phiăn mơnuih pơčeh mă ngă brơi arăng pơmĭn dah anŭn jing tơlơi kâo pơtô.’”
And having called to [him] the crowd, he said to them, Hear and understand: @ Tơdơi kơ anŭn Ñu iâu ƀing ană plei rai pơ Ñu laih anŭn laĭ kơ gơñu: “Hmư̆ bĕ, laih anŭn brơi ƀing gih thâo hluh: 
Not what enters into the mouth defiles the man; but what goes forth out of the mouth, this defiles the man. @ Ƀu djơ̆ ôh mơnơ̆ng hơgĕt mŭt amăng bah ngă pơgrĭ mơnuih, samơ̆ mơnơ̆ng hơgĕt tơbiă mơ̆ng amăng bah, mơnơ̆ng anŭn ngă pơgrĭ mơnuih.”
Then his disciples, coming up, said to him, Dost thou know that the Pharisees, having heard this word, have been offended? @ Tơdơi kơ anŭn ƀing ding kơna rai laĭ kơ Ñu: “Ih thâo mơ̆ ƀing Pharisi hil tơ gơñu hmư̆ tơlơi ih laĭ anŭn?”
But he answering said, Every plant which my heavenly Father has not planted shall be rooted up. @ Ñu laĭ glaĭ: “Abih bang phŭn kơyâo Ama Kâo amăng adai ƀu hmâo pla ôh, Ñu či buč hĭ. 
Leave them alone; they are blind leaders of blind: but if blind lead blind, both will fall into a ditch. @ Lui măk ai gơñu, gơñu jing ƀing bum mơta ba jơlan kơ ƀing bum mơta. Tơdah sa čô bum mơta atăt ba sa čô bum mơta, abih dua gơñu či lĕ amăng luh.”
And Peter answering said to him, Expound to us this parable. @ Samơ̆ Pêtrôs laĭ kơ Ñu: “Pơblang brơi kơ gơmơi tơlơi bơhmutu anŭn.”
But he said, Are *ye* also still without intelligence? @ Yêsu laĭ: “Ƀing gih ăt ƀu thâo hluh ôh hă? 
Do ye not yet apprehend, that everything that enters into the mouth finds its way into the belly, and is cast forth into the draught? @ Ƀing gih ƀu thâo hluh ôh hă mơnơ̆ng hơgĕt mŭt amăng bah nao truh amăng hlŭng laih anŭn hlŏng tơbiă pơ gah rơngiao? 
but the things which go forth out of the mouth come out of the heart, and those defile man. @ Samơ̆ mơnơ̆ng hơgĕt tơbiă mơ̆ng amăng bah rai mơ̆ng pran jua; mơnơ̆ng anŭn pơgrĭ mơnuih. 
For out of the heart come forth evil thoughts, murders, adulteries, fornications, thefts, false witnessings, blasphemies; @ Yua kơ mơ̆ng pran jua yơh tơbiă rai tơlơi pơmĭn sat, tơlơi pơdjai mơnuih, tơlơi klĕ pyu, tơlơi rih răm, tơlơi klĕ dŏp, tơlơi gơ̆ng jơlan ƀlor, laih anŭn pơhiăp pơčeh. 
these are the things which defile man; but the eating with unwashen hands does not defile man. @ Abih tơlơi anai pơgrĭ mơnuih; samơ̆ ƀơ̆ng huă ƀu rao tơngan ƀu pơgrĭ mơnuih ôh.”
And Jesus, going forth from thence, went away into the parts of Tyre and Sidon; @ Yêsu đuaĭ mơ̆ng anŭn nao pơ tring Tir hăng Sidôn. 
and lo, a Canaanitish woman, coming out from those borders, cried [to him] saying, Have pity on me, Lord, Son of David; my daughter is miserably possessed by a demon. @ Anai nê sa čô đah kơmơi Kanaan mơ̆ng tring anŭn truh laih anŭn kơwưh rơkâo kraih, hăng laĭ: “Ơ Khua Yang, Ană Đawit, pap mơñai kơ kâo đa. Ană đah kơmơi kâo yang sat ngă, tơnap tap biă mă.”
But he did not answer her a word. And his disciples came to [him] and asked him, saying, Dismiss her, for she cries after us. @ Samơ̆ Yêsu ƀu laĭ glaĭ sa boh kơ gơ̆ ôh, laih anŭn ƀing ding kơna Ñu nao rơkâo kơwưh kơ Ñu hăng laĭ: “Pơđar đah kơmơi anŭn glaĭ bĕ, yua kơ ñu đuaĭ tui ur ƀơi klon ƀing ta.”
But he answering said, I have not been sent save to the lost sheep of Israel's house. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Arăng pơkiaŏ rai Kâo kơnơ̆ng kơ ƀing triu rơngiă laih amăng sang Israel đôč.”
But she came and did him homage, saying, Lord, help me. @ Samơ̆ gơ̆ rai čon tơŭt ƀơi anăp Ñu hăng laĭ: “Ơ Khua Yang, rơkâo Ih djru kâo đa.”
But he answering said, It is not well to take the bread of the children and cast it to the dogs. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Ƀu gal ôh mă ƀañ tơpŭng ƀing ană laih anŭn glŏm brơi kơ asâo.”
But she said, Yea, Lord; for even the dogs eat of the crumbs which fall from the table of their masters. @ Gơ̆ laĭ: “Sĭt yơh, Ơ Khua Yang, samơ̆ khul asâo ăt ƀơ̆ng mơ̆n djah lĕ mơ̆ng kơƀang khua ƀing gơ̆.”
Then Jesus answering said to her, O woman, thy faith [is] great. Be it to thee as thou desirest. And her daughter was healed from *that* hour. @ Laih anŭn Yêsu laĭ kơ gơ̆: “Ơ đah kơmơi anŭn hơi, tơlơi đaŏ ih prŏng biă mă! Brơi tơlơi anŭn truh tui hăng tơlơi ih kiăng.” Laih anŭn ƀơi mông anŭn mơtam ană đah kơmơi gơ̆ suaih yơh.
And Jesus, going away from thence, came towards the sea of Galilee, and he went up into the mountain and sat down there; @ Yêsu mơ̆ng anih anŭn, hlŏng găn hluai tui hang ia rơsĭ Galilê. Ñu đĭ pơ čư̆ laih anŭn dŏ ber ƀơi anŭn. 
and great crowds came to him, having with them lame, blind, dumb, crippled, and many others, and they cast them at his feet, and he healed them: @ Ƀing mơnuih lu biă mă rai pơ Ñu ba nao ƀing jo tơkai, ƀing bum mơta, ƀing rơwen, ƀing kơmlô, lu ƀing duăm ruă pơkŏn. Arăng pioh ƀing gơ̆ ƀơi tơkai Yêsu, Laih anŭn Ñu pơsuaih brơi ƀing gơ̆. 
so that the crowds wondered, seeing dumb speaking, crippled sound, lame walking, and blind seeing; and they glorified the God of Israel. @ Tui anŭn ƀing mơnuih lu hling hlang tơ gơñu ƀuh ƀing kơmlô dưi pơhiăp, ƀing rơwen dưi rơbat, ƀing jo dưi suaih, ƀing bum mơta dưi ƀuh; laih anŭn gơñu pơpŭ bơni hơơč kơ Ơi Adai ƀing Israel.
But Jesus, having called his disciples to [him], said, I have compassion on the crowd, because they have stayed with me already three days and they have not anything they can eat, and I would not send them away fasting lest they should faint on the way. @ Yêsu iâu ƀing ding kơna Ñu rai pơ Ñu laih anŭn laĭ: “Kâo hmâo tơlơi pap kơ ƀing mơnuih lu anai, yua kơ gơñu dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Kâo klâo hrơi laih, laih anŭn ƀu hmâo mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă ôh. Kâo ƀu kiăng brơi gơñu glaĭ hăng hlŭng rơpa ôh, hwĭ kơ gơñu djai huăt rŏk jơlan.” 
And his disciples say to him, Whence should we have so many loaves in [the] wilderness as to satisfy so great a crowd? @ Ƀing ding kơna laĭ hăng Ñu: “Pơpă ƀing ta dưi hmâo djŏp ƀañ tơpŭng amăng tơdrŏn tač anai, kiăng kơ dưi čem ƀing mơnuih lu kar hăng anai lĕ?” 
And Jesus says to them, How many loaves have ye? But they said, Seven, and a few small fishes. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ ƀing gơñu: “Hơdôm klŏ ƀañ tơpŭng ƀing gih hmâo?” Gơñu laĭ: “Tơjuh klŏ hăng ƀiă drơi akan anĕt đôč.” 
And he commanded the crowds to lie down on the ground; @ Yêsu pơđar kơ ƀing mơnuih lu dŏ ber ƀơi lŏn. 
and having taken the seven loaves and the fishes, having given thanks, he broke [them] and gave [them] to his disciples, and the disciples to the crowd. @ Ñu mă tơjuh klŏ ƀañ tơpŭng laih anŭn akan, giơ̆ng kơ Ñu iâu laĭ bơni hơơč kơ Ơi Adai, Ñu wơ̆k hăng brơi kơ ƀing ding kơna, laih anŭn ƀing ding kơna pơpha brơi ƀing mơnuih lu. 
And all ate and were filled; and they took up what was over and above of the fragments seven baskets full; @ Abih bang gơñu ƀơ̆ng trơi soh sel. Tơdơi kơ anŭn ƀing ding kơna pơƀŭt glaĭ čơđeh meh rơbeh bă tơjuh boh bai. 
but they that ate were four thousand men, besides women and children. @ Ƀing mơnuih ƀơ̆ng hmâo pă rơbâo čô đah rơkơi ƀu yap ôh đah kơmơi laih anŭn čơđai. 
And, having dismissed the crowds, he went on board ship and came to the borders of Magadan. @ Giơ̆ng Ñu brơi ƀing mơnuih lu glaĭ, Ñu đĭ sŏng laih anŭn nao pơ tring Magadan.
And the Pharisees and Sadducees, coming to [him], asked him, tempting [him], to shew them a sign out of heaven. @ Ƀing Pharisi laih anŭn ƀing Sadusi rai kiăng lông lăng Yêsu. Gơñu rơkâo kơ Yêsu ngă brơi kơ gơñu sa tơlơi gru kơnăl mơyang mơ̆ng adai. 
But he answering said to them, When evening is come, ye say, Fine weather, for the sky is red; @ Samơ̆ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ kơ gơñu: “Tơ adai klam laih ƀing gih laĭ: ‘Hrơi pơgi či khong, yua kơ adai mriah.’ 
and in the morning, A storm to-day, for the sky is red [and] lowering; ye know [how] to discern the face of the sky, but ye cannot the signs of the times. @ Laih anŭn mơguah ƀing gih laĭ: ‘Hrơi anai či hmâo hơjan rơbŭ, yua kơ adai hmâo kơnăm laih anŭn mriah.’ Ƀing gih thâo bơkơnăl klă khôr adai, samơ̆ ƀing gih ƀu dưi bơkơnăl ôh kơ khul rơnŭk. 
A wicked and adulterous generation seeks after a sign, and a sign shall not be given to it save the sign of Jonas. And he left them and went away. @ Rơnŭk ƀing sat ƀai laih anŭn rih răm anai sem hơduah sa gru kơnăl mơyang; samơ̆ Ơi Adai ƀu či brơi gru kơnăl mơyang pơkŏn ôh, gah rơngiao kơ gru kơnăl mơyang Yônas.” Laih anŭn Ñu lui ƀing anŭn hăng đuaĭ nao.
And when his disciples were come to the other side, they had forgotten to take bread. @ Tơ ƀing ding kơna truh pơ hang gah dih, gơñu wơr bĭt djă ba ƀañ tơpŭng. 
And Jesus said to them, See and beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and Sadducees. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu “Răng bĕ kơ tơpơi ƀing Pharisi laih anŭn ƀing Sadusi.”
And they reasoned among themselves, saying, Because we have taken no bread. @ Gơñu črŏng sai tơdruă gơñu hăng laĭ: “Yua kơ ƀing ta ƀu djă ba ôh ƀañ tơpŭng.”
And Jesus knowing [it], said, Why reason ye among yourselves, O ye of little faith, because ye have taken no bread? @ Yêsu thâo tơlơi anŭn hăng laĭ: “Ơ ƀing mơnuih hmâo tơlơi đaŏ anĕt, yua hơgĕt ƀing gih črŏng sai yua kơ tơlơi ƀing gih ƀu djă ba ƀañ tơpŭng? 
Do ye not yet understand nor remember the five loaves of the five thousand, and how many hand-baskets ye took [up]? @ Ƀing gih aka thâo hluh ôh hă? Ƀing gih ƀu hơdơr ôh hă kơ rơma klŏ ƀañ tơpŭng čem laih rơma rơbâo čô mơnuih, laih anŭn hơdôm bai ƀañ rơbeh ƀing gih hmâo pơƀŭt glaĭ? 
nor the seven loaves of the four thousand, and how many baskets ye took [up]? @ Kŏn hơdơr lơi kơ tơjuh klŏ ƀañ tơpŭng čem laih pă rơbâo čô, laih anŭn hơdôm bai ƀing gih pơƀŭt laih čơđeh meh ñu rơbeh? 
How do ye not understand that [it was] not concerning bread I said to you, Beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and Sadducees? @ Yua hơgĕt ƀing gih ƀu thâo hluh, Kâo ƀu laĭ kơ ƀañ tơpŭng ôh? Răng bĕ kơ tơpơi ƀing Pharisi laih anŭn ƀing Sadusi.”
Then they comprehended that he did not speak of being beware of the leaven of bread, but of the doctrine of the Pharisees and Sadducees. @ Hlăk anŭn gơñu thâo hluh yơh kơ tơlơi Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu brơi răng ƀu djơ̆ kơ tơpơi ngă ƀañ tơpŭng ôh, samơ̆ kơ tơlơi pơtô ƀing Pharisi laih anŭn ƀing Sadusi.
But when Jesus was come into the parts of Caesarea-Philippi, he demanded of his disciples, saying, Who do men say that I the Son of man am? @ Tơ Yêsu truh pơ tring Sêsarê Philip, Ñu tơña kơ ding kơna Ñu: “Hlơi Ană Mơnuih jing tui hăng arăng laĭ?”
And they said, Some, John the baptist; and others, Elias; and others again, Jeremias or one of the prophets. @ Laih anŭn gơñu laĭ: “Hmâo đơđa laĭ Yôhan Ƀatem, ƀing pơkŏn laĭ Êli, laih anŭn đơđa ƀing pơkŏn laĭ Yêrêmi, ƀôdah sa čô amăng ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo.”
He says to them, But *ye*, who do ye say that I am? @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Bơ ƀing gih, hlơi ƀing gih laĭ Kâo jing?”
And Simon Peter answering said, *Thou* art the Christ, the Son of the living God. @ Simôn Pêtrôs laĭ glaĭ: “Ih jing Yang Krist Ană Ơi Adai hơdip hlŏng lar.”
And Jesus answering said to him, Blessed art thou, Simon Bar-jona, for flesh and blood has not revealed [it] to thee, but my Father who is in the heavens. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ kơ ñu: “Mơyun hiam yơh kơ ih, Ơ Simôn ană Yônas! Yua kơ ƀu djơ̆ asar laih anŭn drah ôh bơrơđah tơlơi anai kơ ih, samơ̆ Ama Kâo amăng adai. 
And *I* also, I say unto thee that *thou* art Peter, and on this rock I will build my assembly, and hades' gates shall not prevail against it. @ Kâo laĭ kơ ih, ih jing Pêtrôs, ƀơi glong boh pơtâo anai Kâo či pơdơ̆ng Phung Sang Ơi Adai Kâo, laih anŭn amăng jang Plei Ƀing Djai ƀu či dưi hăng ñu ôh. 
And I will give to thee the keys of the kingdom of the heavens; and whatsoever thou mayest bind upon the earth shall be bound in the heavens; and whatsoever thou mayest loose on the earth shall be loosed in the heavens. @ Kâo či brơi kơ ih kơmla kăl dêh čar pơtao plei hiam, laih anŭn hơgĕt tơlơi ih či akă ƀơi lŏn tơnah Ơi Adai či akă amăng adai; laih anŭn hơgĕt tơlơi ih či kleh ƀơi lŏn tơnah Ơi Adai či kleh amăng adai mơ̆n.”
Then he enjoined on his disciples that they should say to no man that he was the Christ. @ Laih anŭn Ñu khă ƀing ding kơna anăm ruai ôh kơ arăng thâo kơ tơlơi Ñu jing Yang Krist.
From that time Jesus began to shew to his disciples that he must go away to Jerusalem, and suffer many things from the elders and chief priests and scribes, and be killed, and the third day be raised. @ Mơ̆ng hrơi anŭn Yêsu čơdơ̆ng bơrơđah kơ ƀing ding kơna Ñu kơ tơlơi Ñu khŏm nao pơ plei Yêrusalem, laih anŭn khŏm tŭ lu tơlơi ruă tơnap mơ̆ng ƀing kŏng tha, ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng, laih anŭn ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt. Ƀing anŭn khŏm pơdjai Ñu, samơ̆ ƀơi hrơi tal klâo Ñu khŏm hơdip glaĭ dơ̆ng.
And Peter taking him to [him] began to rebuke him, saying, [God] be favourable to thee, Lord; this shall in no wise be unto thee. @ Pêtrôs ba Ñu pơ anih hơjăn, laih anŭn ƀuah kơ Ñu: “Ơ Khua Yang, rơkâo Ơi Adai khă tơlơi anŭn! Tơlơi anai ƀu či truh kơ Ih ôh.”
But turning round, he said to Peter, Get away behind me, Satan; thou art an offence to me, for thy mind is not on the things that are of God, but on the things that are of men. @ Samơ̆ Yêsu wir lăng laih anŭn laĭ kơ Pêtrôs: “Ơ Satan, đuaĭ bĕ mơ̆ng Kâo! Ih yơh jing pô pơgăn jơlan Kâo; yua kơ ih ƀu pơmĭn kơ bruă Ơi Adai ôh, samơ̆ pơmĭn kơ bruă mơnuih đôč.”
Then Jesus said to his disciples, If any one desires to come after me, let him deny himself and take up his cross and follow me. @ Laih anŭn Yêsu laĭ kơ ƀing ding kơna Ñu: “Tơdah hlơi pô kiăng đuaĭ tui Kâo, ñu khŏm hơngah hĭ tơlơi ñu pô kiăng, glăm kơyâo bơrơkal ñu pô, laih anŭn đuaĭ tui Kâo. 
For whosoever shall desire to save his life shall lose it; but whosoever shall lose his life for my sake shall find it. @ Yua kơ hlơi pô kiăng pơklaih tơlơi hơdip ñu, ñu či rơngiă hĭ, samơ̆ hlơi pô rơngiă tơlơi hơdip ñu yua kơ Kâo, ñu či pơklaih tơlơi hơdip ñu. 
For what does a man profit, if he should gain the whole world and suffer the loss of his soul? or what shall a man give in exchange for his soul? @ Yua kơ, hơgĕt tơlơi tŭ yua kơ sa čô mơnuih tơdah ñu hmâo abih lŏn tơnah, samơ̆ rơngiă hĭ tơlơi hơdip ñu? Ƀôdah hơgĕt mơnơ̆ng ñu či brơi kiăng song mă tơlơi hơdip ñu? 
For the Son of man is about to come in the glory of his Father with his angels, and then he will render to each according to his doings. @ Yua kơ Ană Mơnuih či rai hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing ling jang Ñu amăng tơlơi guh kơang Ama Ñu, laih anŭn hlăk anŭn Ñu či apah rĭm čô tui hăng bruă gơñu hmâo ngă laih. 
Verily I say unto you, There are some of those standing here that shall not taste of death at all until they shall have seen the Son of man coming in his kingdom. @ Sĭt biă mă Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, hmâo đơđa pô dŏ dơ̆ng pơ anai ƀu či djai ôh hlâo kơ gơñu ƀuh Ană Mơnuih rai amăng dêh čar pơtao Ñu.”
And after six days Jesus takes with [him] Peter, and James, and John his brother, and brings them up into a high mountain apart. @ Năm hrơi tơdơi Yêsu jak ba hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Ñu Pêtrôs, Yakơ, laih anŭn Yôhan adơi Yakơ, laih anŭn ba gơñu đĭ pơ čŏng čư̆. 
And he was transfigured before them. And his face shone as the sun, and his garments became white as the light; @ Laih anŭn Yêsu hrih drơi jan Ñu ƀơi anăp ƀing gơ̆: Ƀô̆ mơta Ñu kơmlă kar hăng yang hrơi, laih anŭn ao Ñu kŏ kar hăng tơlơi bơngač, 
and lo, Moses and Elias appeared to them talking with him. @ laih anŭn plŭt Môis hăng Êli bơrơđah rai pơhiăp hrŏm hăng Yêsu. 
And Peter answering said to Jesus, Lord, it is good we should be here. If thou wilt, let us make here three tabernacles: for thee one, and for Moses one, and one for Elias. @ Tui anŭn Pêtrôs pơhiăp hăng Yêsu: “Ơ Khua Yang, hiam biă mă ƀing ta dŏ ƀơi anai, tơdah Ih kiăng kâo či pơdơ̆ng klâo boh sang khăn ƀơi anai, sa boh kơ Ih, sa boh kơ Môis, laih anŭn sa boh kơ Êli.”
While he was still speaking, behold, a bright cloud overshadowed them, and lo, a voice out of the cloud, saying, *This* is my beloved Son, in whom I have found my delight: hear him. @ Tơdang Pêtrôs dŏ pơhiăp, plŭt hmâo kơthul kŏ kơmlă gom gơñu, laih anŭn hmâo asăp mơ̆ng kơthul laĭ: “Anai jing Ană Kâo khăp hơeng, amăng Ñu Kâo hmâo tơlơi mơak biă mă. Brơi ƀing gih hmư̆ Ñu bĕ.”
And the disciples hearing [it] fell upon their faces, and were greatly terrified. @ Tơ ƀing ding kơna hmư̆ tơlơi anai, gơñu rơbuh kŭp ƀô̆ ƀơi lŏn bă hăng tơlơi hwĭ biă mă. 
And Jesus coming to [them] touched them, and said, Rise up, and be not terrified. @ Samơ̆ Yêsu rai ruaih gơñu, laĭ: “Tơgŭ bĕ, anăm hwĭ ôh.” 
And lifting up their eyes, they saw no one but Jesus alone. @ Laih anŭn tơ gơñu angak lăng, gơñu ƀuh kơnơ̆ng hơjăn Yêsu đôč.
And as they descended from the mountain, Jesus charged them, saying, Tell the vision to no one, until the Son of man be risen up from among [the] dead. @ Tơdang gơñu trŭn mơ̆ng čư̆, Yêsu pơtă kơ gơñu: “Anăm ƀing gih ră ruai kơ arăng ôh tơlơi ƀing gih ƀuh anai tơl Ană Mơnuih hơdip glaĭ laih mơ̆ng ƀing djai.”
And [his] disciples demanded of him saying, Why then say the scribes that Elias must first have come? @ Ƀing ding kơna tơña kơ Ñu: “Tui anŭn, yua hơgĕt ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt laĭ Êli khŏm rai hlâo?”
And he answering said to them, Elias indeed comes first and will restore all things. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Sĭt biă mă Êli khŏm rai laih anŭn pơkra abih bang tơlơi; 
But I say unto you that Elias has already come, and they have not known him, but have done unto him whatever they would. Thus also the Son of man is about to suffer from them. @ samơ̆ Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih Êli hmâo rai laih, laih anŭn arăng ƀu thâo krăn gơ̆ ôh, samơ̆ gơñu ngă kơ gơ̆ tui hăng tơlơi gơñu kiăng. Kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n Ană Mơnuih či tŭ tơlơi ruă tơnap mơ̆ng tơngan gơñu.”
Then the disciples understood that he spoke to them of John the baptist. @ Hlăk anŭn ƀing ding kơna thâo hluh yơh Yêsu pơhiăp tơlơi anŭn kơ ƀing gơñu djơ̆ kơ Yôhan Ƀatem.
And when they came to the crowd, a man came to him, falling on his knees before him, and saying, @ Tơ gơñu truh pơ ƀing mơnuih lu, hmâo sa čô đah rơkơi rai čon tơŭt ƀơi anăp Yêsu, hăng laĭ, 
Lord, have mercy on my son, for he is lunatic, and suffers sorely; for often he falls into the fire and often into the water. @ “Ơ Khua Yang, pap mơñai kơ ană đah rơkơi kâo đa, yua kơ ñu hơwing añăk pơjoh drơi jan tơnap tap biă mă, ñu juăt rơbuh amăng apui laih anŭn amăng ia. 
And I brought him to thy disciples, and they were not able to heal him. @ Kâo hmâo ba laih gơ̆ pơ ƀing ding kơna Ih, samơ̆ gơñu ƀu dưi pơsuaih gơ̆ ôh.”
And Jesus answering said, O unbelieving and perverted generation, how long shall I be with you? how long shall I bear with you? Bring him here to me. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Ơ rơnŭk djuai mơnuih ƀu hmâo tơlơi đaŏ laih anŭn kơpĭl, hơdôm sui Kâo či dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing gih? Hơdôm sui Kâo či gir hăng ƀing gih? Ba rai bĕ gơ̆ pơ Kâo.” 
And Jesus rebuked him, and the demon went out from him, and the boy was healed from that hour. @ Yêsu ƀuah pơpuh yang sat, laih anŭn yang sat tơbiă hĭ mơ̆ng čơđai anŭn, ƀơi mông anŭn mơtam, čơđai anŭn suaih hĭ yơh.
Then the disciples, coming to Jesus apart, said [to him], Why were not *we* able to cast him out? @ Tơdơi kơ anŭn ƀing ding kơna nao tơña hơjăn hăng Yêsu laih anŭn laĭ: “Yua hơgĕt ƀing gơmơi ƀu dưi puh pơđuaĭ ôh yang sat anŭn?”
And he says to them, Because of your unbelief; for verily I say unto you, If ye have faith as a grain of mustard [seed], ye shall say to this mountain, Be transported hence there, and it shall transport itself; and nothing shall be impossible to you. @ Yêsu laĭ gơñu: “Yua kơ tơlơi đaŏ ƀing gih anĕt. Sĭt biă mă Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, tơdah ƀing gih hmâo tơlơi đaŏ kar hăng sa asar pơjeh añăm bơi, ƀing gih dưi laĭ kơ čư̆ anai: ‘Đuaĭ bĕ mơ̆ng anai nao pơ adih,’ ñu či nao yơh; laih anŭn ƀu hmâo ôh sa mơta tơlơi hơgĕt ƀing gih ƀu dưi ngă.”
And while they abode in Galilee, Jesus said to them, The Son of man is about to be delivered up into [the] hands of men, @ Tơdang gơñu pơƀŭt glaĭ amăng čar Galilê, Yêsu laĭ kơ ƀing gơñu: “Arăng či jao Ană Mơnuih amăng tơngan mơnuih, 
and they shall kill him; and the third day he shall be raised up. And they were greatly grieved. @ laih anŭn ƀing gơñu či pơdjai Ñu, laih anŭn Ñu či hơdip glaĭ dơ̆ng ƀơi hrơi tal klâo.” Ƀing ding kơna rơngot biă mă.
And when they came to Capernaum, those who received the didrachmas came to Peter and said, Does your teacher not pay the didrachmas? @ Tơ gơñu truh pơ plei Kapernum, ƀing ring jia sang kơkuh pơpŭ nao pơ Pêtrôs laih anŭn laĭ: “Nai ih hmâo duh jia mơ̆?” 
He says, Yes. And when he came into the house, Jesus anticipated him, saying, What dost thou think, Simon? the kings of the earth, from whom do they receive custom or tribute? from their own sons or from strangers? @ Pêtrôs laĭ: “Ơ, Ñu duh jia mơ̆n.” Tơ Pêtrôs glaĭ pơ sang laih, Yêsu pơhiăp hăng ñu hlâo, tơña: “Ơ Simôn, hyư̆m ih pơmĭn? Mơ̆ng hlơi ƀing pơtao lŏn tơnah anai ring jia? Mơ̆ng ƀing ană gơñu pô ƀôdah mơ̆ng pô pơkŏn?”
Peter says to him, From strangers. Jesus said to him, Then are the sons free. @ Pêtrôs laĭ: “Mơ̆ng ƀing pơkŏn.”
Yêsu laĭ kơ ñu: “Tui anŭn yơh ƀing ană gơñu pô huaĭ duh jia ôh. 
But that we may not be an offence to them, go to the sea and cast a hook, and take the first fish that comes up, and when thou hast opened its mouth thou wilt find a stater; take that and give it to them for me and thee. @ Samơ̆ kiăng kơ ƀing ta ƀu ngă brơi gơñu teč tơhnač ôh, nao bĕ pơ ia rơsĭ wah akan, mă akan djơ̆ wah blŭng hlâo. Tơ ih wă amăng bah ñu, ih či ƀuh sa sar prăk. Mă bĕ sar prăk anŭn duh jia brơi kơ Kâo wơ̆t kơ ih mơ̆n!”
In that hour the disciples came to Jesus saying, Who then is greatest in the kingdom of the heavens? @ Ƀơi mông anŭn ƀing ding kơna nao pơ Yêsu laih anŭn tơña: “Hlơi pô jing prŏng hloh amăng dêh čar pơtao plei hiam?”
And Jesus having called a little child to [him], set it in their midst, @ Yêsu iâu sa čô čơđai anĕt, pioh gơ̆ dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơi tơ̆ng krah gơñu, laih anŭn laĭ, 
and said, Verily I say to you, Unless ye are converted and become as little children, ye will not at all enter into the kingdom of the heavens. @ “Sĭt biă mă Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, tơdah ƀing gih ƀu pơplih jing kar hăng čơđai anĕt, ƀing gih ƀu či dưi mŭt amăng dêh čar pơtao plei hiam ôh. 
Whoever therefore shall humble himself as this little child, *he* is the greatest in the kingdom of the heavens; @ Hlơi pô luă gŭ ñu pô kar hăng sa čô čơđai anai, ñu jing pô prŏng hloh amăng dêh čar pơtao plei hiam. 
and whosoever shall receive one such little child in my name, receives me. @ Hlơi pô tŭ jum sa čô čơđai kar hăng anai amăng anăn Kâo jing ñu tŭ jum Kâo yơh;”
But whosoever shall offend one of these little ones who believe in me, it were profitable for him that a great millstone had been hanged upon his neck and he be sunk in the depths of the sea. @ “Tơdah hlơi pô ngă brơi sa čô amăng ƀing čơđai anĕt anai hmâo đaŏ laih kơ Kâo lĕ hĭ amăng tơlơi soh, hiam hloh brơi arăng akă sa boh rơsŭng boh pơtâo ƀơi tơkuai ñu laih anŭn glŏm hĭ amăng ia rơsĭ dlam. 
Woe to the world because of offences! For it must needs be that offences come; yet woe to that man by whom the offence comes! @ Răm ƀăm yơh kơ lŏn tơnah yua kơ hmâo lu tơlơi pơsoh. Yua kơ phiăn yơh khŏm hmâo tơlơi pơsoh, samơ̆ răm ƀăm yơh kơ hlơi pô brơi tơlơi pơsoh truh.
And if thy hand or thy foot offend thee, cut it off and cast [it] from thee; it is good for thee to enter into life lame or maimed, [rather] than having two hands or two feet to be cast into eternal fire. @ Tơdah tơngan ƀôdah tơkai ih pơsoh kơ ih ngă brơi ih lĕ amăng tơlơi soh, čơ̆ng glŏm hĭ ñu mơ̆ng ih; jing hiam hloh kơ ih mŭt amăng tơlơi hơdip hăng tơkai tơngan đŭt, kơ ih hmâo tum dua ƀĕ tơngan ƀôdah dua ƀĕ tơkai samơ̆ arăng glŏm hĭ amăng war apui ƀơ̆ng hlŏng lar. 
And if thine eye offend thee, pluck it out and cast [it] from thee; it is good for thee to enter into life one-eyed, [rather] than having two eyes to be cast into the hell of fire. @ Laih anŭn tơdah mơta ih pơsoh kơ ih ngă brơi ih lĕ amăng tơlơi soh, blač glŏm hĭ ñu mơ̆ng ih; jing hiam hloh kơ ih mŭt amăng tơlơi hơdip hăng sa gah mơta kơ hmâo dua gah mơta samơ̆ arăng glŏm ih amăng war apui.”
See that ye do not despise one of these little ones; for I say unto you that their angels in [the] heavens continually behold the face of my Father who is in [the] heavens. @ “Răng bĕ, anăm lăng jrăp ôh kơ sa čô amăng ƀing čơđai anĕt anai; yua kơ Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, amăng adai ƀing ling jang gơñu ƀuh nanao ƀô̆ mơta Ama Kâo, Pô dŏ amăng adai.
What think ye? If a certain man should have a hundred sheep, and one of them be gone astray, does he not, leaving the ninety and nine on the mountains, go and seek the one that has gone astray? @ Hyư̆m ƀing gih pơmĭn? Tơdah sa čô hmâo sa rơtuh drơi triu, samơ̆ sa drơi amăng ƀing gơñu čơlah hĭ, ƀu djơ̆ hă ñu lui ƀing dua rơpăn pluh dua rơpăn drơi ƀơi ngŏ čư̆ laih anŭn nao sem sa drơi čơlah laih? 
And if it should come to pass that he find it, verily I say unto you, he rejoices more because of it than because of the ninety and nine not gone astray. @ Sĭt biă mă Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, tơdah ñu ƀuh laih triu anŭn, ñu hơ̆k mơak kơ triu anŭn hloh kơ ƀing dua păn pluh dua rơpăn drơi ƀu čơlah ôh. 
So it is not the will of your Father who is in [the] heavens that one of these little ones should perish. @ Kar hăng tui anŭn mơ̆n Ama ƀing gih amăng adai ƀu kiăng ôh sa čô amăng ƀing čơđai anĕt anai răm rơngiă hĭ.”
But if thy brother sin against thee, go, reprove him between thee and him alone. If he hear thee, thou hast gained thy brother. @ “Tơdah adơi ayŏng ih ngă soh hăng ih, nao bĕ pơ ñu laĭ brơi ñu thâo tơlơi anŭn kơnơ̆ng hơjăn ih hăng ñu đôč. Tơdah ñu hmư̆ tơlơi ih laĭ anŭn, ih hmâo tơlơi pơsir laih hăng adơi ayŏng ih. 
But if he do not hear [thee], take with thee one or two besides, that every matter may stand upon the word of two witnesses or of three. @ Samơ̆ tơdah ñu ƀu hmư̆ ôh, jak ba sa ƀôdah dua čô hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ih, kiăng kơ rĭm boh pơhiăp dưi pơsĭt mơ̆ng dua ƀôdah klâo čô pô ngă gơ̆ng jơlan. 
But if he will not listen to them, tell it to the assembly; and if also he will not listen to the assembly, let him be to thee as one of the nations and a tax-gatherer. @ Tơdah ñu hơngah ƀu kiăng hmư̆ gơñu ôh, laĭ pơthâo bĕ tơlơi anŭn kơ Phung Sang Ơi Adai; laih anŭn tơdah ñu hơngah ƀu kiăng hmư̆ ôh wơ̆t kơ Phung Sang Ơi Adai, brơi ih yap ñu jing kar hăng sa čô mơnuih ƀu đaŏ ƀôdah sa čô mơnuih ring jia.”
Verily I say to you, Whatsoever ye shall bind on the earth shall be bound in heaven, and whatsoever ye shall loose on the earth shall be loosed in heaven. @ “Sĭt biă mă Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, hơgĕt tơlơi ƀing gih akă ƀơi lŏn tơnah arăng ăt či akă amăng adai mơ̆n; laih anŭn hơgĕt tơlơi ƀing gih kleh ƀơi lŏn tơnah arăng ăt či kleh amăng adai mơ̆n.
Again I say to you, that if two of you shall agree on the earth concerning any matter, whatsoever it may be that they shall ask, it shall come to them from my Father who is in [the] heavens. @ Sĭt biă mă Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih dơ̆ng, tơdah dua čô amăng ƀing gih ƀơi lŏn tơnah sa pran jua rơkâo hơgĕt mơnơ̆ng ƀing gih kiăng, Ama Kâo amăng adai či ngă brơi kơ ƀing gih. 
For where two or three are gathered together unto my name, there am I in the midst of them. @ Yua kơ pơpă anih hmâo dua ƀôdah klâo čô pơgop glaĭ amăng anăn Kâo, pơ anŭn Kâo dŏ tơ̆ng krah gơñu.”
Then Peter came to him and said, Lord, how often shall my brother sin against me and I forgive him? until seven times? @ Hlăk anŭn Pêtrôs nao pơ Ñu hăng tơña: “Ơ Khua Yang, hơdôm wơ̆t kâo či pap brơi kơ adơi ayŏng kâo tơdah ñu ngă soh hăng kâo? Djơ̆ mơ̆ tơl tơjuh wơ̆t?”
Jesus says to him, I say not to thee until seven times, but until seventy times seven. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ ñu: “Kâo ƀu laĭ kơ ih tơjuh wơ̆t ôh, samơ̆ tơjuh pluh wơ̆t tơjuh. 
For this cause the kingdom of the heavens has become like a king who would reckon with his bondmen. @ Hnŭn yơh, dêh čar pơtao plei hiam dưi pơhmô hăng sa čô pơtao kiăng tĭng hơnưh ƀing ding kơna ñu đom kơ ñu. 
And having begun to reckon, one debtor of ten thousand talents was brought to him. @ Tơ ñu čơdơ̆ng tĭng, arăng ba rai pơ ñu sa čô đom hơnưh sa rơbăn tơlăng. 
But he not having anything to pay, [his] lord commanded him to be sold, and his wife, and his children, and everything that he had, and that payment should be made. @ Samơ̆ yua kơ ding kơna anŭn ƀu dưi kla hơnưh ôh, khua gơ̆ pơtă brơi arăng sĭ hĭ gơ̆ wơ̆t ană bơnai gơ̆ laih anŭn abih bang mơnơ̆ng gơ̆ hmâo kiăng kla hơnưh. 
The bondman therefore falling down did him homage, saying, Lord, have patience with me and I will pay thee all. @ Ding kơna anŭn čon tơŭt kơwưh kơ ñu: ‘Ơ khua, añ dŏ tơguan brơi kâo đa, laih anŭn kâo či kla abih hơnưh ih.’ 
And the lord of that bondman, being moved with compassion, loosed him and forgave him the loan. @ Yua kơ pap kơ ñu, khua ding kơna anŭn pơsir lơ̆m hĭ hơnưh ñu laih anŭn phư brơi ñu glaĭ pơ sang. 
But that bondman having gone out, found one of his fellow-bondmen who owed him a hundred denarii. And having seized him, he throttled him, saying, Pay [me] if thou owest anything. @ Samơ̆ tơ ding kơna anŭn tơbiă nao, ñu bưp sa čô gơyut mă bruă hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ñu; gơ̆ đom hơnưh kơ ñu sa rơtuh đơniê Ñu djă kơ̆ng gơ̆ laih anŭn ket tơkuai gơ̆ hăng laĭ: ‘Kla bĕ hơnưh kơ kâo.’ 
His fellow-bondman therefore, having fallen down [at his feet], besought him, saying, Have patience with me, and I will pay thee. @ Gơyut ñu bon ƀơi anăp ñu hăng kơwưh: ‘Rơkâo kơ ih gir dŏ tơguan brơi kâo đa laih anŭn kâo či kla hĭ hơnưh kâo đom kơ ih.’ 
But he would not, but went away and cast him into prison, until he should pay what was owing. @ Samơ̆ ñu hơngah laih anŭn mă ba krư̆ gơ̆ tơl gơ̆ kla hĭ abih hơnưh. 
But his fellow-bondmen, having seen what had taken place, were greatly grieved, and went and recounted to their lord all that had taken place. @ Tơ ƀing gơ̆p mă bruă hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ñu ƀuh tui anŭn, gơñu rơngot biă mă, laih anŭn laĭ pơthâo kơ khua gơñu abih tơlơi hmâo truh laih. 
Then his lord, having called him to [him], says to him, Wicked bondman! I forgave thee all that debt because thou besoughtest me; @ Tui anŭn khua ñu iâu ñu hăng laĭ kơ ñu: ‘Ơ ding kơna sat ƀai, kâo pap brơi laih abih hơnưh ih yua kơ ih kơwưh rơkâo kơ kâo. 
shouldest not thou also have had compassion on thy fellow-bondman, as *I* also had compassion on thee? @ Yua hơgĕt ih ƀu pap drap ôh kơ gơ̆p ih kar hăng kâo hmâo pap drap laih kơ ih?’ 
And his lord being angry delivered him to the tormentors till he paid all that was owing to him. @ Hăng tơlơi hil biă mă khua ñu jao ñu kơ ƀing wai mơnă tơl ñu kla abih hơnưh ñu. 
Thus also my heavenly Father shall do to you if ye forgive not from your hearts every one his brother. @ Kar hăng tui anŭn mơ̆n Ama Kâo amăng adai či ngă kơ rĭm čô ƀing gih, tơdah ƀing gih ƀu pap brơi ôh kơ adơi ayŏng ƀing gih hăng abih pran jua.”
And it came to pass, when Jesus had finished these words, he withdrew from Galilee, and came to the coasts of Judaea beyond the Jordan; @ Tơ Yêsu pơhiăp giơ̆ng laih hơdôm tơlơi anai, Ñu đuaĭ mơ̆ng tring Galilê mŭt amăng tring Yuđa hang gah adih ia krong Yurdan. 
and great crowds followed him, and he healed them there. @ Phung mơnuih lu đuaĭ tui Ñu laih anŭn pơ anŭn Ñu pơsuaih ƀing mơnuih duăm ruă.
And the Pharisees came to him tempting him, and saying, Is it lawful for a man to put away his wife for every cause? @ Ƀing Pharisi nao pơ Ñu laih anŭn lông lăng Ñu, gơñu tơña: “Phiăn mơ̆ arăng lui hĭ bơnai yua kơ djŏp mơta tơlơi kơlih yua?”
But he answering said [to them], Have ye not read that he who made [them], from the beginning made them male and female, @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Ƀing gih aka ƀu đŏk Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp ôh hă? Mơ̆ng čơdơ̆ng phŭn Pô Hrih Pơjing hmâo pơjing laih mơnuih đah rơkơi laih anŭn đah kơmơi, 
and said, On account of this a man shall leave father and mother, and shall be united to his wife, and the two shall be one flesh? @ laih anŭn laĭ: ‘Yua kơ anŭn yơh, đah rơkơi či lui amĭ ama ñu laih anŭn pơgop hăng bơnai ñu, laih anŭn dua čô gơñu či jing sa asar đeh.’ 
so that they are no longer two, but one flesh. What therefore God has joined together, let not man separate. @ Hnŭn yơh gơñu ƀu jing dua dơ̆ng ôh, samơ̆ kơnơ̆ng sa asar đeh đôč. Tui anŭn, anăm brơi mơnuih pơčơlah hĭ ôh hơgĕt tơlơi Ơi Adai hmâo pơgop laih.”
They say to him, Why then did Moses command to give a letter of divorce and to send [her] away? @ Ƀing Pharisi tơña kơ Ñu: “Tui anŭn yua hơgĕt Môis pơtă brơi ngă hră klaih bơnai, laih anŭn lui hĭ gơ̆?”
He says to them, Moses, in view of your hardheartedness, allowed you to put away your wives; but from the beginning it was not thus. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ kơ gơñu: “Yua kơ pran jua ƀing gih khăng, tui anŭn Môis tŭ ư brơi ƀing gih lui bơnai ƀing gih, samơ̆ mơ̆ng phŭn ƀu djơ̆ tui anŭn ôh. 
But I say unto you, that whosoever shall put away his wife, not for fornication, and shall marry another, commits adultery; and he who marries one put away commits adultery. @ Laih anŭn Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, hlơi pô lui bơnai ñu tơdah ƀu djơ̆ yua kơ bơnai ñu klĕ pyu ôh laih anŭn dŏ đah kơmơi pơkŏn dơ̆ng, ñu anŭn klĕ pyu yơh.”
His disciples say to him, If the case of the man be so with his wife, it is not good to marry. @ Ƀing ding kơna laĭ hăng Ñu: “Tơdah sa čô đah rơkơi dưi lui bơnai ñu kơnơ̆ng yua kơ sa tơlơi tui anŭn đôč, hiam hloh ƀu dŏ bơnai ôh.”
And he said to them, All cannot receive this word, but those to whom it has been given; @ Samơ̆ Yêsu laĭ ƀing gơ̆: “Ƀu djơ̆ ôh abih bang mơnuih dưi tŭ mă boh pơhiăp anai, samơ̆ kơnơ̆ng kơ ƀing mơnuih Ơi Adai pha brơi laih tơlơi anŭn. 
for there are eunuchs which have been born thus from [their] mother's womb; and there are eunuchs who have been made eunuchs of men; and there are eunuchs who have made eunuchs of themselves for the sake of the kingdom of the heavens. He that is able to receive [it], let him receive [it]. @ Yua kơ hmâo mơnuih jing kriao mơ̆ng hrơi arăng tơkeng kơ ñu, laih anŭn hmâo đơđa mơnuih jing kriao yua mơ̆ng tơngan mơnuih, laih anŭn hmâo đơđa ƀing kriao mă gơñu pô yua kơ dêh čar pơtao plei hiam. Hlơi pô dưi mă tŭ boh pơhiăp anai, brơi ñu mă tŭ bĕ.”
