Then there were brought to him little children that he might lay his hands on them and pray; but the disciples rebuked them. @ Hlăk anŭn arăng ba rai ƀing čơđai pơ Ñu kiăng kơ Ñu ah tơngan ƀơi ƀing gơ̆ laih anŭn iâu laĭ. Samơ̆ ƀing ding kơna khă ƀing anŭn. 
But Jesus said, Suffer little children, and do not hinder them from coming to me; for the kingdom of the heavens is of such: @ Samơ̆ Yêsu laĭ: “Brơi ƀing čơđai rai pơ Kâo, anăm khă gơñu ôh; yua kơ dêh čar pơtao plei hiam pioh kơ ƀing jing kar hăng gơñu.”
and having laid his hands upon them, he departed thence. @ Yêsu ah tơngan ƀơi ƀing čơđai, laih anŭn Ñu đuaĭ mơ̆ng anŭn.
And lo, one coming up said to him, Teacher, what good thing shall I do that I may have life eternal? @ Hlăk anŭn, hmâo sa čô mơnuih nao pơ Ñu, hăng tơña: “Ơ Nai, hơgĕt tơlơi hiam kâo khŏm ngă kiăng kơ dưi hmâo tơlơi hơdip hlŏng lar?”
And he said to him, What askest thou me concerning goodness? one is good. But if thou wouldest enter into life, keep the commandments. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơ̆: “Yua hơgĕt ih tơña kơ Kâo hơgĕt jing hiam? Kơnơ̆ng hmâo Sa čô đôč jing hiam. Tơdah ih kiăng mŭt amăng tơlơi hơdip, brơi ih gưt tui tơlơi juăt.”
He says to him, Which? And Jesus said, Thou shalt not kill, Thou shalt not commit adultery, Thou shalt not steal, Thou shalt not bear false witness, @ Gơ̆ tơña kơ Yêsu: “Hơgĕt tơlơi juăt anŭn?” Yêsu laĭ: “Anăm pơdjai mơnuih ôh; anăm klĕ pyu ôh; anăm klĕ dram gơnam arăng ôh; anăm pơčeh ƀlor ôh. 
Honour thy father and thy mother, and Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself. @ Pơpŭ kơ amĭ ama ih, laih anŭn khăp kơ pô jum dar ih kar hăng kơ ih pô.”
The young man says to him, All these have I kept; what lack I yet? @ Pô tơdăm anŭn laĭ glaĭ: “Kâo tui gưt laih abih bang tơlơi juăt anŭn; hơgĕt tơlơi kâo dŏ kơƀah?”
Jesus said to him, If thou wouldest be perfect, go, sell what thou hast and give to [the] poor, and thou shalt have treasure in heaven; and come, follow me. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơ̆: “Tơdah ih kiăng jing klă tum, nao bĕ, sĭ hĭ hơgĕt mơnơ̆ng ih hmâo laih anŭn pha brơi kơ ƀing ƀun rin, laih anŭn ih či hmâo kong ngăn yom amăng adai. Laih anŭn rai bĕ, đuaĭ tui Kâo.”
But the young man, having heard the word, went away grieved, for he had large possessions. @ Tơ pô tơdăm anŭn hmư̆ boh pơhiăp anŭn, ñu đuaĭ hĭ bă hăng tơlơi rơngot yua kơ ñu hmâo kong ngăn lu biă mă.
And Jesus said to his disciples, Verily I say unto you, A rich man shall with difficulty enter into the kingdom of the heavens; @ Yêsu laĭ kơ ƀing ding kơna Ñu: “Sĭt biă mă Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, tơnap biă mă kơ sa čô pơdrŏng mŭt amăng dêh čar pơtao plei hiam. 
and again I say unto you, It is easier for a camel to enter a needle's eye than a rich man into the kingdom of God. @ Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih dơ̆ng, sa drơi aseh samô mŭt bah amăng jrum amuñ hloh kơ sa čô pơdrŏng mŭt amăng dêh čar pơtao Ơi Adai.”
And when the disciples heard [it] they were exceedingly astonished, saying, Who then can be saved? @ Tơ ƀing ding kơna hmư̆ tơlơi anŭn, gơñu hling hlang biă mă hăng laĭ: “Tui anŭn hlơi dưi klaih lĕ?”
But Jesus, looking on [them], said to them, With men this is impossible; but with God all things are possible. @ Samơ̆ Yêsu lăng kơ ƀing gơñu hăng laĭ: “Tơlơi anŭn mơnuih ƀu dưi ngă ôh, samơ̆ Ơi Adai dưi ngă abih bang tơlơi.”
Then Peter answering said to him, Behold, *we* have left all things and have followed thee; what then shall happen to us? @ Pêtrôs laĭ glaĭ kơ Ñu dơ̆ng: “Anai nê, gơmơi lui hĭ laih abih bang mơnơ̆ng hăng đuaĭ tui Ih. Tui anŭn hơgĕt gơmơi či hmâo lĕ?”
And Jesus said to them, Verily I say unto you, That *ye* who have followed me, in the regeneration when the Son of man shall sit down upon his throne of glory, *ye* also shall sit on twelve thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Sĭt biă mă Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, amăng rơnŭk abih bang mơnơ̆ng plih phrâo či truh, tơ Ană Mơnuih či dŏ ber ƀơi gre pơtao guh kơang Ñu, ƀing gih jing ƀing hmâo đuaĭ tui Kâo laih, ăt kar kaĭ mơ̆n či dŏ ber ƀơi pluh dua boh gre pơtao kiăng phat kơđi pluh dua kơnŭng djuai ƀing Israel. 
And every one who has left houses, or brethren, or sisters, or father, or mother, or wife, or children, or lands, for my name's sake, shall receive a hundredfold, and shall inherit life eternal. @ Laih anŭn rĭm čô hlơi pô lui hĭ sang ñu ƀôdah adơi ayŏng, amai adơi, amĭ ama, ƀing ană bă, ƀôdah lŏn hmua ñu yua kơ anăn Kâo, pô anŭn či mă tŭ sa rơtuh wơ̆t lu hloh dơ̆ng laih anŭn hmâo wơ̆t hăng tơlơi hơdip hlŏng lar. 
But many first shall be last, and last first. @ Samơ̆ lu ƀing hlâo či jing tơdơi, laih anŭn ƀing tơdơi či jing hlâo.”
For the kingdom of the heavens is like a householder who went out with the early morn to hire workmen for his vineyard. @ “Dêh čar pơtao adai jing kar hăng sa čô khua sang ưm mơguah tơbiă nao kiăng iâu apah mơnuih mă bruă amăng đang boh kơƀâu ñu. 
And having agreed with the workmen for a denarius the day, he sent them into his vineyard. @ Giơ̆ng hmâo tơlơi tŭ ư laih hăng ƀing mă bruă sa đơniê amăng sa hrơi, ñu pơkiaŏ nao gơñu pơ đang boh kơƀâu ñu. 
And having gone out about [the] third hour, he saw others standing in the market-place idle; @ Ƀơi kơplah dua rơpăn mông mơguah ñu tơbiă nao dơ̆ng laih anŭn ƀuh ƀing mơnuih dŏ đôč đač amăng anih sang sĭ mia. 
and to them he said, Go also ye into the vineyard, and whatsoever may be just I will give you. And they went their way. @ Ñu laĭ kơ ƀing anŭn: ‘Kar kaĭ mơ̆n ƀing gih nao bĕ mă bruă amăng đang boh kơƀâu kâo, laih anŭn kâo či apah ƀing gih djơ̆ nua.’ Tui anŭn gơñu nao mơtam yơh. 
Again, having gone out about the sixth and ninth hour, he did likewise. @ Ƀơi yang hrơi dơ̆ng, laih anŭn ƀơi klâo mông klam pô đang boh kơƀâu tơbiă nao dơ̆ng hăng ngă kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n. 
But about the eleventh [hour], having gone out, he found others standing, and says to them, Why stand ye here all the day idle? @ Ƀơi rơma mông klam ñu tơbiă nao dơ̆ng ƀuh ƀing pơkŏn dŏ đôč đač, laih anŭn ñu laĭ kơ ƀing gơ̆: ‘Yua hơgĕt ƀing gih dŏ pơ anai đôč đač abih sa hrơi?’ 
They say to him, Because no man has hired us. He says to them, Go also ye into the vineyard [and whatsoever may be just ye shall receive]. @ Ƀing anŭn laĭ hăng ñu: ‘Yua kơ ƀu hmâo hlơi kiăng yua gơmơi ôh.’ Pô đang laĭ kơ ƀing gơ̆: ‘Ƀing gih kar kaĭ mơ̆n nao bĕ mă bruă amăng đang boh kơƀâu kâo.’
But when the evening was come, the lord of the vineyard says to his steward, Call the workmen and pay [them] their wages, beginning from the last even to the first. @ Tơ adai klam laih, pô đang boh kơƀâu laĭ kơ pô wai bruă ñu: ‘Iâu bĕ ƀing mă bruă laih anŭn brơi prăk kơ ƀing gơñu čơdơ̆ng mơ̆ng ƀing tơdơi truh kơ ƀing blŭng hlâo.’ 
And when they [who came to work] about the eleventh hour came, they received each a denarius. @ Ƀing mơnuih mă bruă čơdơ̆ng mơ̆ng rơma mông klam rai, rĭm čô gơñu mă prăk apah sa đơniê. 
And when the first came, they supposed that they would receive more, and they received also themselves each a denarius. @ Tơ ƀing mơnuih mă bruă čơdơ̆ng mơ̆ng blŭng hlâo rai, gơñu pơmĭn dah či mă tŭ lu hloh. Samơ̆ rĭm čô gơñu ăt mă tŭ sa đơniê kar kaĭ mơ̆n. 
And on receiving it they murmured against the master of the house, @ Laih anŭn tơ gơñu mă tŭ sa đơniê anŭn gơñu pơhiăp brŏk kơ pô đang, 
saying, These last have worked one hour, and thou hast made them equal to us, who have borne the burden of the day and the heat. @ hăng laĭ: ‘Ƀing rai tơdơi mă bruă kơnơ̆ng sa mông đôč, laih anŭn ih yap gơñu mơdơ̆ hăng gơmơi jing ƀing mă bruă gleh kơtraŏ hăng dang gah yŭ pơ-iă kơtang abih sa hrơi.’ 
But he answering said to one of them, [My] friend, I do not wrong thee. Didst thou not agree with me for a denarius? @ Samơ̆ pô đang laĭ glaĭ kơ sa čô amăng ƀing gơñu: ‘Ơ gơyut, kâo ƀu soh hăng ih ôh; ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă ih tŭ ư laih hăng kâo sa hrơi mă bruă kơnơ̆ng sa đơniê đôč? 
Take what is thine and go. But it is my will to give to this last even as to thee: @ Mă bĕ prăk ih laih anŭn nao bĕ; kâo kiăng brơi kơ pô rai tơdơi anai mơdôm hăng ih. 
is it not lawful for me to do what I will in my own affairs? Is thine eye evil because *I* am good? @ Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă kâo dưi yua gơnam kâo tui hăng kâo kiăng? Ƀôdah yua kơ ih ƀuh kâo čơmah, hnŭn yơh ih moañ?’
Thus shall the last be first, and the first last; for many are called ones, but few chosen ones. @ Tui anŭn ƀing tơdơi či jing hlâo, laih anŭn ƀing hlâo či jing tơdơi.”
And Jesus, going up to Jerusalem, took the twelve disciples with [him] apart in the way, and said to them, @ Tơdang Yêsu đĭ nao pơ plei Yêrusalem, Ñu ba hơjăn ƀing pluh dua čô ding kơna, laih anŭn rŏk jơlan Ñu laĭ kơ gơñu, 
Behold we go up to Jerusalem, and the Son of man will be delivered up to the chief priests and scribes, and they will condemn him to death; @ “Anai nê, ƀing ta nao pơ plei Yêrusalem; arăng či jao Ană Mơnuih kơ ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng laih anŭn ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt, laih anŭn ƀing gơñu či klă kơđi pơdjai hĭ Ñu. 
and they will deliver him up to the nations to mock and to scourge and to crucify, and the third day he shall rise again. @ Gơñu či jao Ñu kơ ƀing djuai tuai kiăng kơ arăng klao mưč, taih Ñu hăng gai hnuăt, laih anŭn pơ̆ng hĭ Ñu ƀơi kơyâo bơrơkal; samơ̆ ƀơi hrơi tal klâo Ñu či hơdip glaĭ dơ̆ng.”
Then came to him the mother of the sons of Zebedee, with her sons, doing homage, and asking something of him. @ Hlăk anŭn amĭ ƀing ană đah rơkơi Sêbêdê nao pơ Yêsu hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing ană đah rơkơi gơ̆. Đah kơmơi anŭn čon tơŭt ƀơi anăp Yêsu kiăng rơkâo sa tơlơi.
And he said to her, What wilt thou? She says to him, Speak [the word] that these my two sons may sit, one on thy right hand and one on thy left in thy kingdom. @ Yêsu tơña kơ ñu: “Hơgĕt ih kiăng?” Đah kơmơi laĭ hăng Ñu: “Brơi dua čô ană đah rơkơi kâo dưi dŏ ber sa čô gah hơnuă, sa čô gah iao Ih amăng dêh čar pơtao Ih.”
And Jesus answering said, Ye know not what ye ask. Can ye drink the cup which *I* am about to drink? They say to him, We are able. @ Samơ̆ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Ƀing gih ƀu thâo hluh ôh hơgĕt ƀing gih rơkâo. Dưi mơ̆ ƀing gih mơñum kơčok Kâo či mơñum?” Gơñu laĭ glaĭ: “Gơmơi dưi mơ̆n.”
[And] he says to them, Ye shall drink indeed my cup, but to sit on my right hand and on [my] left, is not mine to give, but to those for whom it is prepared of my Father. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Ƀing gih či mơñum kơčok Kâo, samơ̆ tơlơi dưi dŏ ber gah hơnuă ƀôdah gah iao Kâo, Kâo ƀu hmâo ôh tơlơi dưi brơi tơlơi anŭn, samơ̆ tơlơi anŭn pioh kơ ƀing hlơi Ama Kâo hmâo prăp pre brơi laih.”
And the ten, having heard [of it], were indignant about the two brothers. @ Tơ ƀing pluh čô ding kơna pơkŏn hmư̆ tơlơi anŭn, gơñu hil kơ dua čô adơi ayŏng anŭn. 
But Jesus having called them to [him], said, Ye know that the rulers of the nations exercise lordship over them, and the great exercise authority over them. @ Samơ̆ Yêsu iâu gơñu hăng laĭ: “Ƀing gih thâo laih ƀing arăng brơi wai lăng ƀing djuai tuai khăp yua tơlơi kơtư̆ juă wai lăng ană plei, laih anŭn ƀing khua prŏng gơñu khăp yua tơlơi dưi kơtang amăng tơlơi gĭt gai ană plei pla. 
It shall not be thus amongst you, but whosoever will be great among you, shall be your servant; @ Samơ̆ tơ̆ng krah ƀing gih ƀu djơ̆ tui anŭn ôh; kơđai glaĭ, hlơi amăng ƀing gih kiăng jing prŏng, brơi ñu khŏm jing ding kơna kơ ƀing gih, 
and whosoever will be first among you, let him be your bondman; @ hlơi amăng ƀing gih kiăng jing mrô sa, brơi ñu jing hlŭn kơ ƀing gih; 
as indeed the Son of man did not come to be served, but to serve, and to give his life a ransom for many. @ kar hăng Ană Mơnuih hmâo rai laih ƀu djơ̆ kiăng kơ arăng mă bruă kơ ñu ôh, samơ̆ kiăng mă bruă kơ arăng, laih anŭn jao tơlơi hơdip ñu pô jing nua song mă kơ lu mơnuih.”
And as they went out from Jericho a great crowd followed him. @ Tơdang gơñu tơbiă mơ̆ng plei Yêrikô, hmâo lu mơnuih đuaĭ tui Yêsu. 
And lo, two blind men, sitting by the wayside, having heard that Jesus was passing by, cried out saying, Have mercy on us, Lord, Son of David. @ Anai nê, hmâo dua čô bum mơta dŏ ƀơi akiăng jơlan. Tơ gơñu hmư̆ kơ Yêsu găn pơ anŭn, gơñu ur kraih: “Ơ Khua Yang, Ană pơtao Đawit, pap mơñai kơ gơmơi đa!”
But the crowd rebuked them, that they might be silent. But they cried out the more, saying, Have mercy on us, Lord, Son of David. @ Ƀing mơnuih lu khă brơi gơñu dŏ rơiăt; samơ̆ gơñu ur kraih kơtang hloh dơ̆ng: “Ơ Khua Yang, Ană pơtao Đawit, pap mơñai kơ gơmơi đa!”
And Jesus, having stopped, called them and said, What will ye that I shall do to you? @ Yêsu dŏ hĭ, iâu gơñu laih anŭn laĭ: “Hơgĕt tơlơi ƀing gih kiăng Kâo ngă brơi kơ ƀing gih?”
They say to him, Lord, that our eyes may be opened. @ Gơñu laĭ hăng Yêsu: “Ơ Khua Yang, brơi mơta gơmơi dưi ƀuh rơđah.”
And Jesus, moved with compassion, touched their eyes; and immediately their eyes had sight restored to them, and they followed him. @ Hăng tơlơi pap Yêsu ruaih mơta gơñu, tui anŭn mơta gơñu ƀuh rơđah mơtam, laih anŭn gơñu đuaĭ tui Yêsu.
And when they drew near to Jerusalem and came to Bethphage, at the mount of Olives, then Jesus sent two disciples, @ Tơdang Yêsu hăng ƀing ding kơna Ñu giăm truh pơ Plei Yêrusalem, truh pơ plei Bêtphajê ƀơi čư̆ Ôliwơ, Yêsu pơkiaŏ nao dua čô ƀing ding kơna, 
saying to them, Go into the village over against you, and immediately ye will find an ass tied, and a colt with it; loose [them] and lead [them] to me. @ laĭ kơ gơñu tui anai: “Nao bĕ pơ plei ƀơi anăp ƀing gih, pơ anŭn ƀing gih či ƀuh arăng akă sa drơi aseh kle ania, ƀơi anŭn hmâo wơ̆t ană ñu. Kleh dua drơi aseh kle anŭn laih anŭn ba rai pơ Kâo. 
And if any one say anything to you, ye shall say, The Lord has need of them, and straightway he will send them. @ Tơdah arăng tơña kơ ƀing gih, brơi ƀing gih laĭ: ‘Khua Yang kiăng kơ gơñu.’ Pô anŭn či brơi kơ ƀing gih dui ba mơtam.”
But all this came to pass, that that might be fulfilled which was spoken through the prophet, saying, @ Tơlơi anai truh kiăng pơsĭt tơlơi pô laĭ lui hlâo pơhiăp laih tui anai:
Say to the daughter of Zion, Behold thy King cometh to thee, meek, and mounted upon an ass, and upon a colt the foal of an ass. @ “Laĭ bĕ kơ ană dra Siôn thâo:
Anai nê, pơtao ih rai pơ ih,
Luă gŭ, đĭ aseh kle,
Laih anŭn đĭ ană aseh kle, jing ană sa drơi ania aseh kle.”
But the disciples, having gone and done as Jesus had ordered them, @ Ƀing ding kơna nao laih anŭn ngă tui kar hăng tơlơi Yêsu hmâo pơtă laih kơ gơñu. 
brought the ass and the colt and put their garments upon them, and he sat on them. @ Gơñu dui ba aseh kle ania laih anŭn ană ñu, gơñu tap ao ƀơi rŏng dua drơi aseh anŭn, laih anŭn Yêsu đĭ. 
But a very great crowd strewed their own garments on the way, and others kept cutting down branches from the trees and strewing them on the way. @ Ƀing mơnuih lu biă mă tap ao gơñu ƀơi jơlan, ƀing pơkŏn dơ̆ng koh than kơyâo laih anŭn tap ƀơi jơlan. 
And the crowds who went before him and who followed cried, saying, Hosanna to the Son of David; blessed [be] he who comes in the name of [the] Lord; hosanna in the highest. @ Ƀing mơnuih lu rơbat ƀơi anăp laih anŭn đuaĭ tui klon Yêsu ur kraih: “Hôsana kơ Ană Đawit! Mơyun hiam yơh kơ Pô rai amăng anăn Khua Yang! Hôsana pơ adai glong hloh kơ abih bang!”
And as he entered into Jerusalem, the whole city was moved, saying, Who is this? @ Tơ Yêsu mŭt amăng plei Yêrusalem, abih bang mơnuih amăng plei rŭng răng laih anŭn tơña: “Hlơi pô anai?”
And the crowds said, This is Jesus the prophet who is from Nazareth of Galilee. @ Ƀing mơnuih lu laĭ glaĭ: “Pô anai jing Yêsu, pô laĭ lui hlâo mơ̆ng plei Nasaret čar Galilê.”
And Jesus entered into the temple [of God], and cast out all that sold and bought in the temple, and overthrew the tables of the money-changers and the seats of those that sold the doves. @ Yêsu mŭt amăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ Ơi Adai laih anŭn puh pơđuaĭ ƀing dŏ sĭ mia wơ̆t blơi mơnơ̆ng amăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ. Ñu klư̆ hĭ kơƀang ƀing mơnuih plih prăk hăng gre ƀing sĭ čĭm kơtrâo. 
And he says to them, It is written, My house shall be called a house of prayer, but *ye* have made it a den of robbers. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ ƀing anŭn: “Hră Ơi Adai pơhiăp čih tui anai:
‘Arăng či iâu sang Kâo jing sang pioh iâu laĭ,’
Samơ̆ ƀing gih pơjing hĭ ñu jing par klĕ dŏp.”
And blind and lame came to him in the temple, and he healed them. @ Ƀing bum mơta hăng ƀing jo tơkai rai pơ Ñu amăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ, laih anŭn Ñu pơsuaih ƀing gơ̆. 
And when the chief priests and the scribes saw the wonders which he wrought, and the children crying in the temple and saying, Hosanna to the Son of David, they were indignant, @ Samơ̆ tơ ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng laih anŭn ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt ƀuh khul tơlơi yom pơphan Yêsu ngă, laih anŭn hmư̆ ƀing čơđai ur kraih amăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ: “Hôsana kơ Ană Đawit” gơñu hil biă mă. 
and said to him, Hearest thou what these say? And Jesus says to them, Yea; have ye never read, Out of the mouth of babes and sucklings thou hast perfected praise? @ Gơñu laĭ hăng Yêsu: “Ih hmư̆ mơ̆ tơlơi ƀing čơđai anai laĭ?” Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Ơ, ƀing gih aka lăng ôh hă hră Ơi Adai pơhiăp hmâo čih laih tui anai:
‘Ih hmâo tơlơi bơni hơơč mơ̆ng amăng bah ƀing čơđai muai laih anŭn ƀing čơđai dŏ mĕm?’”
And leaving them he went forth out of the city to Bethany, and there he passed the night. @ Yêsu lui ƀing anŭn, tơbiă mơ̆ng plei Yêrusalem nao pơ plei Bêthani laih anŭn đơ̆m pơ anŭn.
But early in the morning, as he came back into the city, he hungered. @ Ƀơi mơguah tơdang Ñu wơ̆t glaĭ pơ plei Yêrusalem Ñu rơpa. 
And seeing one fig-tree in the way, he came to it and found on it nothing but leaves only. And he says to it, Let there be never more fruit of thee for ever. And the fig-tree was immediately dried up. @ Ñu ƀuh sa ƀĕ phŭn hra ƀơi akiăng jơlan. Ñu nao jĕ, samơ̆ ƀu ƀuh boh ôh kơnơ̆ng hla đôč. Ñu laĭ kơ phŭn hra: “Mơ̆ng anai pơ anăp ŏng ƀu či mơboh dơ̆ng ôh!” Tañ mơtam phŭn hra anŭn kro hĭ.
And when the disciples saw [it], they wondered, saying, How immediately is the fig-tree dried up! @ Tơ ƀing ding kơna ƀuh tơlơi anŭn gơñu hling hlang biă mă hăng laĭ: “Hyư̆m ngă phŭn hra anai tŏ tơnŏ kro mơtam?”
And Jesus answering said to them, Verily I say unto you, If ye have faith, and do not doubt, not only shall ye do what [is done] to the fig-tree, but even if ye should say to this mountain, Be thou taken away and be thou cast into the sea, it shall come to pass. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ kơ gơñu: “Sĭt biă mă Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, tơdah ƀing gih hmâo tơlơi đaŏ laih anŭn ƀu đing ôh, ƀu djơ̆ ôh kơnơ̆ng ƀing gih dưi ngă tui anŭn kơ phŭn hra, samơ̆ tơdah ƀing gih laĭ kơ čư̆ anai: ‘Đuaĭ bĕ laih anŭn kơdâo amăng ia rơsĭ,’ wơ̆t tơlơi anŭn ăt či truh mơ̆n. 
And all things whatsoever ye shall ask in prayer, believing, ye shall receive. @ Hơgĕt tơlơi ƀing gih rơkâo tơdang iâu laĭ, hăng tơlơi đaŏ ƀing gih či mă tŭ abih bang.”
And when he came into the temple, the chief priests and the elders of the people came to him [as he was] teaching, saying, By what authority doest thou these things? and who gave thee this authority? @ Yêsu mŭt amăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ, ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng laih anŭn ƀing kŏng tha ană plei pla rai laĭ kơ Ñu tơdang Ñu dŏ pơtô: “Mơ̆ng tơlơi dưi pă Ih ngă tơlơi anai? Laih anŭn hlơi pô brơi kơ Ih tơlơi dưi anŭn?”
And Jesus answering said to them, *I* also will ask you one thing, which if ye tell me, *I* also will tell you by what authority I do these things: @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ kơ gơñu: “Kâo ăt kiăng tơña kơ ƀing gih sa tơlơi mơ̆n, tơdah ƀing gih dưi laĭ glaĭ kơ Kâo, tui anŭn Kâo či laĭ glaĭ kơ ƀing gih mơ̆ng pă tơlơi dưi Kâo ngă hơdôm tơlơi anai. 
The baptism of John, whence was it? of heaven or of men? And they reasoned among themselves, saying, If we should say, Of heaven, he will say to us, Why then have ye not believed him? @ Tơlơi ƀatem Yôhan tơbiă rai mơ̆ng pă, mơ̆ng adai ƀôdah mơ̆ng mơnuih?” Gơñu pơ črŏng sai tơdruă gơñu: “Tơdah ƀing ta laĭ: ‘Mơ̆ng adai,’ Ñu či laĭ kơ ƀing ta, tui anŭn yua hơgĕt ƀing gih ƀu đaŏ ôh kơ Yôhan lĕ? 
but if we should say, Of men, we fear the crowd, for all hold John for a prophet. @ Samơ̆ tơdah ƀing ta laĭ: ‘Mơ̆ng mơnuih,’ ƀing ta hwĭ kơ ƀing mơnuih lu, yua kơ abih bang mơnuih đaŏ kơ Yôhan jing sa čô pô laĭ lui hlâo.” 
And answering Jesus they said, We do not know. *He* also said to them, Neither do *I* tell you by what authority I do these things. @ Yua kơ anŭn yơh, gơñu laĭ glaĭ kơ Yêsu: “Gơmơi ƀu thâo ôh.” Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Kâo kŏn či laĭ brơi kơ ƀing gih lơi mơ̆ng pă tơlơi dưi Kâo ngă hơdôm tơlơi anai.”
But what think ye? A man had two children, and coming to the first he said, Child, go to-day, work in [my] vineyard. @ “Hơgĕt ƀing gih pơmĭn lĕ? Sa čô mơnuih hmâo dua čô ană đah rơkơi. Ñu nao laĭ kơ ană tal sa: ‘Ơ dăm, hrơi anai ih nao mă bruă amăng đang boh kơƀâu hŏ.’ 
And he answering said, I will not; but afterwards repenting himself he went. @ Gơ̆ laĭ glaĭ: ‘Kâo ƀu nao ôh,’ samơ̆ ƀiă kơ anŭn ñu pơplih tơlơi pơmĭn laih anŭn ñu nao. 
And coming to the second he said likewise; and he answering said, *I* [go], sir, and went not. @ Pô ama nao pơ ană tal dua laih anŭn ăt laĭ kar kaĭ mơ̆n. Gơ̆ laĭ glaĭ: ‘Ơ, kâo nao,’ samơ̆ ñu ƀu nao ôh. 
Which of the two did the will of the father? They say [to him], The first. Jesus says to them, Verily I say unto you that the tax-gatherers and the harlots go into the kingdom of God before you. @ Hlơi amăng dua čô anŭn ngă tui hăng tơlơi ama ñu kiăng?” Gơñu laĭ glaĭ: “Pô ană tal sa anŭn.” Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Sĭt biă mă Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, ƀing ring jia hăng ƀing đah kơmơi rih răm mŭt amăng dêh čar pơtao Ơi Adai hlâo kơ ƀing gih. 
For John came to you in the way of righteousness, and ye believed him not; but the tax-gatherers and the harlots believed him; but *ye* when ye saw [it] repented not yourselves afterwards to believe him. @ Yua kơ Yôhan rai laih pơ ƀing gih amăng jơlan tơlơi tơpă, laih anŭn ƀing gih ƀu đaŏ kơ ñu ôh, samơ̆ ƀing ring jia laih anŭn ƀing đah kơmơi rih răm đaŏ kơ ñu, laih anŭn wơ̆t kơ laih ƀing gih ƀuh laih tơlơi anŭn, ƀing gih ăt ƀu kơhmal tơlơi soh laih anŭn đaŏ kơ ñu lơi.”
Hear another parable: There was a householder who planted a vineyard, and made a fence round it, and dug a winepress in it, and built a tower, and let it out to husbandmen, and left the country. @ “Hmư̆ bĕ tơlơi bơhmutu pơkŏn. Hmâo sa čô pô lŏn pla sa blah đang boh kơƀâu. Ñu bư̆ rơgong jum dar, klơi sa bĭt luh djet tơpai, laih anŭn pơdơ̆ng đĭ sa boh sang rơñan kiăng kơ gak wai. Ñu brơi arăng čan đang boh kơƀâu anŭn, laih anŭn ñu nao čar pơkŏn. 
But when the time of fruit drew near, he sent his bondmen to the husbandmen to receive his fruits. @ Tơ truh bơyan pĕ boh, ñu pơkiaŏ nao ƀing ding kơna ñu nao pơ ƀing čan, kiăng mă kơmlai boh kơƀâu ñu. 
And the husbandmen took his bondmen, and beat one, killed another, and stoned another. @ Ƀing čan anŭn mă ƀing ding kơna ñu laih anŭn taih pô anai, pơdjai pô dih, laih anŭn glŏm boh pơtâo pô pơkŏn. 
Again he sent other bondmen more than the first, and they did to them in like manner. @ Ñu pơkiaŏ nao ƀing ding kơna pơkŏn lu hloh ƀing hlâo dơ̆ng. Laih anŭn ƀing čan anŭn ăt ngă kơ ƀing gơ̆ kar kaĭ mơ̆n. 
And at last he sent to them his son, saying, They will have respect for my son. @ Hnal tuč ñu pơkiaŏ nao ană đah rơkơi ñu pô pơ ƀing anŭn, hăng laĭ: ‘Gơñu či pơpŭ ană đah rơkơi kâo.’ 
But the husbandmen, seeing the son, said among themselves, This is the heir; come, let us kill him and possess his inheritance. @ Samơ̆ tơ ƀing čan ƀuh ană đah rơkơi ñu, ƀing anŭn bơlaĭ tơdruă gơñu: ‘Anai yơh jing pô tŭ mă kong ngăn; bơ bĕ brơi ƀing ta pơdjai hĭ ñu laih anŭn ƀing ta mă tŭ kong ngăn ñu.’ 
And they took him, and cast him forth out of the vineyard, and killed him. @ Tui anŭn gơñu mă gơ̆, glŏm hĭ gơ̆ pơ gah rơngiao đang boh kơƀâu hăng pơdjai hĭ gơ̆.
When therefore the lord of the vineyard comes, what shall he do to those husbandmen? @ Tui anŭn, tơ pô đang boh kơƀâu anŭn truh, hơgĕt ñu či ngă kơ ƀing čan anŭn?”
They say to him, He will miserably destroy those evil [men], and let out the vineyard to other husbandmen, who shall render him the fruits in their seasons. @ Gơñu laĭ glaĭ kơ Yêsu: “Ñu či pơrai hĭ ƀing sat ƀai anŭn hăng tơlơi pơdjai tơnap tap, laih anŭn brơi ƀing pơkŏn čan đang boh kơƀâu ñu, jing ƀing či brơi kơmlai kơ ñu djơ̆ bơyan.”
Jesus says to them, Have ye never read in the scriptures, The stone which they that builded rejected, this has become the corner-stone: this is of [the] Lord, and it is wonderful in our eyes? @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Ƀing gih aka lăng ôh hă Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp hmâo čih laih tui anai:
‘Boh pơtâo ƀing ngă sang glŏm lui laih,
Jing hĭ laih boh pơtâo phŭn ƀơi akiăng.
Anai jing bruă Khua Yang ngă,
Laih anŭn jing tơlơi yom pơphan ƀơi anăp mơta ƀing ta’?
Therefore I say to you, that the kingdom of God shall be taken from you and shall be given to a nation producing the fruits of it. @ Yua kơ anŭn Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, arăng či mă hĭ dêh čar pơtao Ơi Adai mơ̆ng ƀing gih laih anŭn brơi kơ sa kơnŭng djuai či hmâo boh than kơ dêh čar pơtao anŭn. 
And he that falls on this stone shall be broken, but on whomsoever it shall fall, it shall grind him to powder. @ Hlơi pô rơbuh ƀơi ngŏ boh pơtâo anŭn ñu či pơčah hĭ, samơ̆ tơdah boh pơtâo anŭn lĕ ƀơi hlơi, boh pơtâo anŭn či pơphač hĭ pô anŭn.”
And the chief priests and the Pharisees, having heard his parables, knew that he spoke about them. @ Tơ ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng laih anŭn ƀing Pharisi hmư̆ tơlơi bơhmutu Yêsu pơhiăp anŭn, gơñu thâo hluh Yêsu pơhiăp tơlơi anŭn djơ̆ kơ ƀing gơñu. 
And seeking to lay hold of him, they were afraid of the crowds, because they held him for a prophet. @ Gơñu hơduah jơlan kiăng mă čaŏ Yêsu, samơ̆ gơñu hwĭ kơ ƀing mơnuih lu, yua kơ ƀing gơ̆ đaŏ kơ Yêsu jing sa čô Pô laĭ lui hlâo.
And Jesus answering spoke to them again in parables, saying, @ Yêsu yua tơlơi bơhmutu pơhiăp dơ̆ng hăng gơñu tui anai, 
The kingdom of the heavens has become like a king who made a wedding feast for his son, @ “Dêh čar pơtao adai jing kar hăng sa čô pơtao pơkra tơlơi ƀơ̆ng huă pơdŏ rơkơi bơnai kơ ană đah rơkơi ñu. 
and sent his bondmen to call the persons invited to the wedding feast, and they would not come. @ Ñu pơkiaŏ ƀing ding kơna ñu nao iâu ƀing ñu hmâo jak laih kơ tơlơi ƀơ̆ng huă, samơ̆ ƀing anŭn ƀu kiăng rai ôh. 
Again he sent other bondmen, saying, Say to the persons invited, Behold, I have prepared my dinner; my oxen and my fatted beasts are killed, and all things ready; come to the wedding feast. @ Ñu pơkiaŏ nao ƀing ding kơna pơkŏn dơ̆ng, hăng pơtă tui anai: ‘Laĭ bĕ kơ ƀing kâo hmâo jak laih, anai nê, kâo pơkra laih mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă, čuh laih rơmo laih anŭn ană rơmo rơmŏng, abih bang mơnơ̆ng prăp pre laih soh sel; rai bĕ kơ tơlơi ƀơ̆ng huă pơkol rơkơi bơnai.’ 
But they made light of it, and went, one to his own land, and another to his commerce. @ Samơ̆ ƀing gơñu jak anŭn ƀu bơngơ̆t ôh laih anŭn nao kơ bruă pơkŏn, pô anai nao pơ hmua, pô pơkŏn nao sĭ mia, 
And the rest, laying hold of his bondmen, ill-treated and slew [them]. @ đơđa ƀing pơkŏn mă ƀing ding kơna ñu ngă sat kơ ƀing gơ̆ laih anŭn pơdjai hĭ. 
And [when] the king [heard of it he] was wroth, and having sent his forces, destroyed those murderers and burned their city. @ Pơtao hil biă mă, ñu pơkiaŏ nao ƀing tơhan ñu pơrai ƀing pơdjai mơnuih anŭn hăng čuh hĭ plei pla gơñu. 
Then he says to his bondmen, The wedding feast is ready, but those invited were not worthy; @ Laih anŭn ñu laĭ kơ ƀing ding kơna ñu: ‘Mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă pơdŏ rơkơi bơnai pơkra giơ̆ng laih, samơ̆ ƀing kâo jak ƀu hmâo hlơi năng lăp rai ôh. 
go therefore into the thoroughfares of the highways, and as many as ye shall find invite to the wedding feast. @ Tui anŭn, nao bĕ amăng abih bang jơlan phŭn laih anŭn jak abih bang mơnuih ƀing gih ƀuh brơi rai kơ tơlơi ƀơ̆ng huă tơlơi pơdŏ rơkơi bơnai.’ 
And those bondmen went out into the highways, and brought together all as many as they found, both evil and good; and the wedding feast was furnished with guests. @ Ƀing ding kơna anŭn nao pơ abih bang jơlan, jak ba abih bang ƀing mơnuih gơñu ƀuh, wơ̆t mơnuih sat wơ̆t mơnuih hiam. Tui anŭn, anih ƀơ̆ng huă bă hăng mơnuih.
And the king, having gone in to see the guests, beheld there a man not clothed with a wedding garment. @ Samơ̆ tơ pơtao mŭt lăng ƀing rai, pơ anŭn ñu ƀuh sa čô đah rơkơi ƀu buh ao phiăn ƀơ̆ng huă kơ tơlơi dŏ rơkơi bơnai ôh. 
And he says to him, [My] friend, how camest thou in here not having on a wedding garment? But he was speechless. @ Ñu laĭ kơ pô anŭn: ‘Ơ gơyut, hyư̆m ih dưi mŭt pơ anai ƀu buh ôh ao phiăn ƀơ̆ng huă tơlơi dŏ rơkơi bơnai?’ Mơnuih anŭn ƀu thâo laĭ glaĭ ôh. 
Then said the king to the servants, Bind him feet and hands, and take him away, and cast him out into the outer darkness: there shall be the weeping and the gnashing of teeth. @ Laih anŭn pơtao laĭ kơ ƀing ding kơna ñu: ‘Čaŏ hĭ tơkai tơngan ñu laih anŭn glŏm ñu amăng anih kơnăm mơmŏt pơ gah rơngiao; pơ anŭn či hmâo tơlơi čŏk hia laih anŭn tơlơi kĕ tơgơi.’
For many are called ones, but few chosen ones. @ Yua kơ arăng jak iâu lu mơnuih, samơ̆ kơnơ̆ng ƀiă mơnuih đôč arăng ruah mă.”
Then went the Pharisees and held a council how they might ensnare him in speaking. @ Hlăk anŭn ƀing Pharisi nao pơ črŏng sai ƀơč mơneč kiăng hơduah tơlơi dưi phong Yêsu amăng tơlơi Ñu pơhiăp. 
And they send out to him their disciples with the Herodians, saying, Teacher, we know that thou art true and teachest the way of God in truth, and carest not for any one, for thou regardest not men's person; @ Tui anŭn gơñu pơkiaŏ nao ƀing ding kơna gơñu hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing mơnuih gah kơ Hêrôt, hăng laĭ: “Ơ Nai, gơmơi thâo Ih jing mơnuih tơpă sĭt, pơtô tơlơi Ơi Adai hăng tơlơi tơpă sĭt laih anŭn ih ƀu pơkah lăng mơnuih phara phara ôh; yua kơ Ih ƀu lăng ôh hyư̆m tơlơi arăng jing gah rơngiao. 
tell us therefore what thou thinkest: Is it lawful to give tribute to Caesar, or not? @ Tui anŭn laĭ brơi bĕ kơ gơmơi hơgĕt Ih pơmĭn. Phiăn mơ̆ duh jia kơ Sêsar ƀôdah ƀu phiăn ôh?”
But Jesus, knowing their wickedness, said, Why tempt ye me, hypocrites? @ Samơ̆ Yêsu thâo tơlơi pơmĭn sat gơñu, laih anŭn laĭ glaĭ: “Yua hơgĕt ƀing gih lông lăng Kâo, Ơ ƀing plơ̆m ƀlor? 
Shew me the money of the tribute. And they presented to him a denarius. @ Brơi Kâo lăng prăk duh jia anŭn.”
Gơñu brơi kơ Yêsu sa đơniê. 
And he says to them, Whose [is] this image and superscription? @ Yêsu tơña gơñu “Rup hăng anăn hlơi anai?” 
They say to him, Caesar's. Then he says to them, Pay then what is Caesar's to Caesar, and what is God's to God. @ Gơñu laĭ glaĭ: “Pơtao Sêsar.” Tui anŭn Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Tui anŭn pơglaĭ bĕ kơ Sêsar gơnam lơ̆m kơ Sêsar, laih anŭn pơglaĭ bĕ kơ Ơi Adai hơgĕt gơnam lơ̆m kơ Ơi Adai.” 
And when they heard [him], they wondered, and left him, and went away. @ Tơ gơñu hmư̆ tơlơi anŭn, gơñu kơtuă hling hlang; gơñu lui Yêsu laih anŭn nao.
On that day came to him Sadducees, who say there is no resurrection; and they demanded of him, @ Amăng hrơi anŭn mơ̆n, hmâo ƀing Sadusi rai pơ Yêsu, jing ƀing laĭ ƀu hmâo tơlơi hơdip glaĭ dơ̆ng ôh. Gơñu tơña kơ Yêsu tui anai, 
saying, Teacher, Moses said, If any one die, not having children, his brother shall marry his wife and shall raise up seed to his brother. @ “Ơ Nai, Môis laĭ ‘Tơdah sa čô đah rơkơi djai hĭ ƀu hmâo ană ôh, brơi adơi ñu dŏ bơnai ayŏng ñu kiăng hmâo ană tŏ tui djuai ayŏng ñu.’ 
Now there were with us seven brethren; and the first having married died, and not having seed, left his wife to his brother. @ Tui anŭn hmâo amăng ƀing gơmơi tơjuh adơi ayŏng. Ayŏng tha dŏ bơnai laih anŭn djai hĭ, ƀu hmâo ană ôh, laih anŭn pioh glaĭ bơnai ñu kơ adơi ñu. 
In like manner also the second and the third, unto the seven. @ Kar kaĭ mơ̆n adơi tal dua ñu laih anŭn adơi tal klâo, tơl truh pơ adơi tal tơjuh. 
And last of all the woman also died. @ Tơdơi kơ abih bang, đah kơmơi anŭn djai mơ̆n. 
In the resurrection therefore of which of the seven shall she be wife, for all had her? @ Tui anŭn ƀơi hrơi hơdip glaĭ dơ̆ng, đah kơmơi anŭn či jing bơnai kơ hlơi amăng ƀing tơjuh čô anŭn, yua kơ rĭm čô gơñu leng hmâo dŏ laih đah kơmơi anŭn?”
And Jesus answering said to them, Ye err, not knowing the scriptures nor the power of God. @ Samơ̆ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ kơ ƀing gơñu: “Ƀing gih tơhwơl laih yua kơ ƀing gih ƀu thâo hluh ôh Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp, kŏn thâo hluh lơi tơlơi dưi mơyang Ơi Adai. 
For in the resurrection they neither marry nor are given in marriage, but are as angels of God in heaven. @ Yua kơ amăng hrơi hơdip glaĭ dơ̆ng đah rơkơi ƀu dŏ bơnai dơ̆ng ôh, đah kơmơi kŏn dŏ rơkơi dơ̆ng lơi, samơ̆ gơñu či jing kar hăng ƀing ling jang Ơi Adai amăng adai. 
But concerning the resurrection of the dead, have ye not read what was spoken to you by God, saying, @ Bơ kơ tơlơi ƀing djai hơdip glaĭ dơ̆ng, ƀing gih aka lăng ôh hă Hră Ơi Adai hmâo laĭ laih kơ ƀing gih, 
*I* am the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob? God is not God of [the] dead, but of [the] living. @ ‘Kâo jing Ơi Adai kơ Abraham, Ơi Adai kơ Isak, laih anŭn Ơi Adai kơ Yakôp?’ Ñu ƀu djơ̆ jing Ơi Adai kơ ƀing djai ôh, samơ̆ jing Ơi Adai kơ ƀing hơdip.”
And when the crowds heard [it] they were astonished at his doctrine. @ Tơ ƀing mơnuih lu hmư̆ tơlơi anŭn, gơñu hling hlang biă mă kơ tơlơi Yêsu pơtô.
But the Pharisees, having heard that he had put the Sadducees to silence, were gathered together. @ Tơ ƀing Pharisi hmư̆ Yêsu hmâo ngă kơ ƀing Sadusi kơđĭp hĭ amăng bah, gơñu pơƀŭt glaĭ hrŏm hơbĭt. 
And one of them, a lawyer, demanded, tempting him, and saying, @ Sa čô nai pơtô tơlơi juăt amăng ƀing gơñu tơña tui anai kiăng lông lăng Yêsu, 
Teacher, which is the great commandment in the law? @ “Ơ Nai, amăng tơlơi juăt tơlơi pơtă hơgĕt jing prŏng hloh?”
And he said to him, Thou shalt love [the] Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy understanding. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ ñu: “‘Ih khŏm khăp kơ Khua Yang Ơi Adai ih hăng abih pran jua, hăng abih bơngăt laih anŭn hăng abih tơlơi pơmĭn ih.’ 
This is [the] great and first commandment. @ Tơlơi pơtă anŭn jing prŏng hloh laih anŭn yom hloh. 
And [the] second is like it, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself. @ Laih anŭn tơlơi pơtă tal dua ăt yom kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n: ‘Ih khŏm khăp kơ pô jum dar ih kar hăng kơ ih pô’. 
On these two commandments the whole law and the prophets hang. @ Abih bang tơlơi juăt laih anŭn tơlơi ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo pơtô leng kơ tơbiă rai mơ̆ng dua tơlơi pơtă anŭn soh sel.”
And the Pharisees being gathered together, Jesus demanded of them, @ Tơdang ƀing Pharisi pơƀŭt glaĭ hrŏm hơbĭt, Yêsu tơña kơ gơñu tui anai, 
saying, What think ye concerning the Christ? whose son is he? They say to him, David's. @ “Hơgĕt ƀing gih pơmĭn kơ Krist? Ñu jing ană hlơi?” Ƀing Pharisi laĭ glaĭ: “Ană Đawit.”
He says to them, How then does David in Spirit call him Lord, saying, @ Yêsu laĭ kơ ƀing gơñu: “Tui anŭn, hyư̆m ngă tơdang Đawit hmâo tơlơi kơčut mơ̆ng Yang Bơngăt Hiam, ñu iâu hĭ Gơ̆ jing Khua Yang? laih anŭn laĭ:
The Lord said to my Lord, Sit on my right hand until I put thine enemies under thy feet? @ ‘Khua Yang laĭ kơ Khua Yang kâo:
Ih dŏ ber bĕ gah hơnuă Kâo,
Tơl Kâo pioh ƀing ayăt Ih ƀơi gah yŭ tơkai Ih’?
If therefore David call him Lord, how is he his son? @ Tơdah Đawit iâu Krist jing Khua Yang, hyư̆m Ñu dưi jing hĭ ană Đawit dơ̆ng lĕ?” 
And no one was able to answer him a word, nor did any one dare from that day to question him any more. @ Ƀu hmâo sa čô dưi laĭ glaĭ kơ Ñu dơ̆ng ôh, laih anŭn čơdơ̆ng mơ̆ng hrơi anŭn ƀu hmâo hlơi pô khĭn tơña Ñu sa mơta tơlơi hơgĕt dơ̆ng ôh.
Then Jesus spoke to the crowds and to his disciples, @ Hlăk anŭn Yêsu pơhiăp hăng ƀing mơnuih lu laih anŭn hăng ƀing ding kơna Ñu tui anai, 
saying, The scribes and the Pharisees have set themselves down in Moses' seat: @ “Ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt laih anŭn ƀing Pharisi dŏ ƀơi gre Môis; 
all things therefore, whatever they may tell you, do and keep. But do not after their works, for they say and do not, @ tui anŭn brơi ƀing gih ngă laih anŭn gưt tui tơlơi gơñu pơtă kơ ƀing gih, samơ̆ anăm ngă tui tơlơi gơñu ngă ôh. Yua kơ gơñu ƀu ngă ôh hơgĕt tơlơi ñu pơtô. 
but bind burdens heavy and hard to bear, and lay them on the shoulders of men, but will not move them with their finger. @ Gơñu akă mơnơ̆ng kơtraŏ, tơnap glăm laih anŭn đua brơi ƀơi bra arăng, samơ̆ gơñu pô ƀu kiăng ruaih mơnơ̆ng anŭn hăng sa ƀĕ čơđeng gơñu ôh. 
And all their works they do to be seen of men: for they make broad their phylacteries and enlarge the borders [of their garments], @ Abih bruă gơñu ngă kơnơ̆ng kiăng kơ arăng ƀuh đôč. Lăng bĕ khul hrĕ bơnal čih jơlan Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp ƀơi anŭn gơñu tuang ƀơi athơi laih anŭn akă ƀơi tơngan gơñu jing prŏng dơ̆ pă. Laih anŭn pơtrŭn grua ao phyung gơñu kơ glong. 
and love the chief place in feasts and the first seats in the synagogues, @ Gơñu khăp dŏ ƀơi anih hmâo tơlơi pơpŭ amăng tơlơi ƀơ̆ng huă laih anŭn gre hiam hloh amăng sang bơjơnum, 
and salutations in the market-places, and to be called of men, Rabbi, Rabbi. @ laih anŭn kiăng kơ arăng kơkuh kơ gơñu amăng sang sĭ mơdrô, laih anŭn kiăng kơ arăng iâu kơ gơñu Rabi ‘Nai’. 
But *ye*, be not ye called Rabbi; for one is your instructor, and all *ye* are brethren. @ Samơ̆ anăm brơi arăng iâu kơ ƀing gih Rabi ôh, yua kơ ƀing gih hmâo kơnơ̆ng sa čô Nai đôč. Laih anŭn abih bang ƀing gih leng jing adơi ayŏng. 
And call not [any one] your father upon the earth; for one is your Father, he who is in the heavens. @ Laih anŭn anăm iâu hlơi jing ama amăng lŏn tơnah anai ôh, yua kơ ƀing gih hmâo kơnơ̆ng sa čô Ama đôč, jing Pô dŏ amăng adai. 
Neither be called instructors, for one is your instructor, the Christ. @ Kŏn tŭ lơi arăng iâu ƀing gih khua, yua kơ ƀing gih hmâo kơnơ̆ng sa čô Khua đôč, jing Yang Krist. 
But the greatest of you shall be your servant. @ Pô prŏng hloh amăng ƀing gih či jing ding kơna kơ ƀing gih. 
And whoever shall exalt himself shall be humbled, and whoever shall humble himself shall be exalted. @ Hlơi pô pơđĭ ñu pô, Ơi Adai či pơtrŭn hĭ ñu; laih anŭn hlơi pô pơluă gŭ ñu pô, Ơi Adai či pơđĭ ñu.”
But woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites, for ye shut up the kingdom of the heavens before men; for *ye* do not enter, nor do ye suffer those that are entering to go in. @ “Răm ƀăm yơh kơ ƀing gih, Ơ ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt hăng ƀing Pharisi, jing ƀing plơ̆m ƀlor! Yua kơ ƀing gih krư̆ hĭ dêh čar pơtao plei hiam ƀơi anăp arăng, ƀu djơ̆ ƀing gih pô đôč ôh ƀu mŭt amăng dêh čar pơtao anŭn, samơ̆ ƀing gih ăt pơgăn hĭ mơ̆n ƀing hlơi kiăng mŭt pơ anŭn.
Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites, for ye compass the sea and the dry [land] to make one proselyte, and when he is become [such], ye make him twofold more [the] son of hell than yourselves. @ Răm ƀăm yơh kơ ƀing gih, Ơ ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt hăng ƀing Pharisi, jing ƀing plơ̆m ƀlor! Yua kơ ƀing gih hyu tar ƀar ia rơsĭ laih anŭn lŏn thu kiăng pơjing brơi sa čô mơnuih plih tơlơi đaŏ, laih anŭn tơdah ñu mŭt amăng tơlơi đaŏ ƀing gih laih, ƀing gih pơjing gơ̆ jing sa čô ană war apui sat hloh kơ ƀing gih dua wơ̆t.
Woe to you, blind guides, who say, Whosoever shall swear by the temple, it is nothing; but whosoever shall swear by the gold of the temple, he is a debtor. @ Răm ƀăm yơh kơ ƀing gih, Ơ ƀing ba jơlan bum mơta, ƀing gih laĭ: ‘Tơdah sa čô ƀuăn rơ̆ng hăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ ƀu hmâo tơlơi hơgĕt ôh, samơ̆ tơdah sa čô ƀuăn rơ̆ng hăng mah amăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ, tơlơi anŭn yơh đom.’ 
Fools and blind, for which is greater, the gold, or the temple which sanctifies the gold? @ Ơ ƀing mlŭk bum mơta! Hơgĕt jing yom hloh, mah ƀôdah sang kơkuh pơpŭ ngă kơ mah jing rơgoh hiam? 
And, Whosoever shall swear by the altar, it is nothing; but whosoever shall swear by the gift that is upon it is a debtor. @ Laih anŭn gih laĭ: ‘Tơdah sa čô ƀuăn rơ̆ng hăng kơƀang ngă yang, ƀu hmâo tơlơi hơgĕt ôh, samơ̆ tơdah sa čô ƀuăn rơ̆ng hăng mơnơ̆ng ngă yang ƀơi kơnưl anŭn, tơlơi ƀuăn rơ̆ng anŭn yơh đom.’ 
[Fools and] blind ones, for which is greater, the gift, or the altar which sanctifies the gift? @ Ơ ƀing bum mơta! Hơgĕt jing prŏng hloh, mơnơ̆ng pơyơr ƀôdah kơƀang ngă yang ngă kơ mơnơ̆ng pơyơr anŭn jing rơgoh hiam? 
He therefore that swears by the altar swears by it and by all things that are upon it. @ Tui anŭn hlơi ƀuăn rơ̆ng hăng kơƀang ngă yang jing ñu ƀuăn rơ̆ng hăng kơƀang ngă yang laih anŭn hăng abih mơnơ̆ng dŏ ƀơi kơƀang anŭn; 
And he that swears by the temple swears by it and by him that dwells in it. @ laih anŭn hlơi pô ƀuăn rơ̆ng hăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ jing ñu ƀuăn rơ̆ng hăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ wơ̆t hăng Pô dŏ amăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ anŭn mơ̆n. 
And he that swears by heaven swears by the throne of God and by him that sits upon it. @ Laih anŭn hlơi ƀuăn rơ̆ng hăng adai jing ñu ƀuăn rơ̆ng hăng gre pơtao Ơi Adai laih anŭn hăng Pô dŏ ƀơi gre anŭn mơ̆n.
Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites, for ye pay tithes of mint and anise and cummin, and ye have left aside the weightier matters of the law, judgment and mercy and faith: these ye ought to have done and not have left those aside. @ Răm ƀăm yơh kơ ƀing gih, Ơ ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt hăng ƀing Pharisi, jing ƀing plơ̆m ƀlor! Yua kơ ƀing gih pơyơr sa črăn amăng pluh nua eč, rơya, añăm tăm, samơ̆ ƀing gih ƀu bơngơ̆t ôh kơ tơlơi yom hloh amăng tơlơi juăt, jing tơlơi tơpă, tơlơi pap drap, laih anŭn tơlơi đaŏ. Ƀing gih khŏm ngă abih tơlơi anai, samơ̆ ăt kŏn dưi wơr lơi khul tơlơi anŭn. 
Blind guides, who strain out the gnat, but drink down the camel. @ Ơ ƀing ba jơlan bum mơta, tơdang ƀing gih rưng mă hĭ mơroi samơ̆ lun ƀơ̆ng aseh samô!
Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites, for ye make clean the outside of the cup and of the dish, but within they are full of rapine and intemperance. @ Răm ƀăm yơh kơ ƀing gih, Ơ ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt hăng ƀing Pharisi, jing ƀing plơ̆m ƀlor! Yua kơ ƀing gih pơrơgoh kơčok laih anŭn jam gah rơngiao đôč, samơ̆ amăng lăm bă hăng tơlơi hưp ham laih anŭn hrah hrong. 
Blind Pharisee, make clean first the inside of the cup and of the dish, that their outside also may become clean. @ Ơ ƀing Pharisi bum mơta! Blŭng hlâo, pơrơgoh bĕ amăng lăm kơčok hăng jam anŭn, tui anŭn kah gah rơngiao ăt dưi jing rơgoh kar kaĭ mơ̆n.
Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites, for ye are like whited sepulchres, which appear beautiful outwardly, but within are full of dead men's bones and all uncleanness. @ Răm ƀăm yơh kơ ƀing gih, Ơ ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt hăng ƀing Pharisi, jing ƀing plơ̆m ƀlor! Yua kơ ƀing gih jing kar hăng pơsat arăng pik čur kŏ, gah rơngiao lăng rŏ dah hiam, samơ̆ amăng lăm bă hăng klang mơnuih djai laih anŭn djŏp mơta mơnơ̆ng grĭ grañ. 
Thus also *ye*, outwardly ye appear righteous to men, but within are full of hypocrisy and lawlessness. @ Kar kaĭ mơ̆n gah rơngiao arăng lăng kơ ƀing gih kar hăng mơnuih tơpă, samơ̆ amăng lăm pran jua ƀing gih bă hăng plơ̆m ƀlor laih anŭn sat ƀai.”
Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites, for ye build the sepulchres of the prophets and adorn the tombs of the just, @ “Răm ƀăm yơh kơ ƀing gih, Ơ ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt hăng ƀing Pharisi, jing ƀing plơ̆m ƀlor! Yua kơ ƀing gih man pơsat ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo hăng rơmet pơhrôp hiam pơsat ƀing mơnuih tơpă, 
and ye say, If we had been in the days of our fathers we would not have been partakers with them in the blood of the prophets. @ laih anŭn ƀing gih laĭ: ‘Tơdah ƀing gơmơi dŏ hơdip amăng rơnŭk ƀing ơi gơmơi, gơmơi ƀu ngă hrŏm hơbĭt hăng gơñu ôh amăng bruă tuh drah ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo.’ 
So that ye bear witness of yourselves that ye are sons of those who slew the prophets: @ Tui anŭn, ƀing gih pơhaih pơsĭt ƀing gih pô jing ană tơčo ƀing mơnuih hmâo pơdjai laih ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo. 
and *ye*, fill ye up the measure of your fathers. @ Tui anŭn, brơi ƀing gih pơbă tum hĭ bĕ tơlơi soh ƀing ơi ƀing gih hmâo ngă laih. 
Serpents, offspring of vipers, how should ye escape the judgment of hell? @ Ơ ƀing djuai ala, kơnŭng djuai ala apui, hyư̆m ƀing gih dưi klaih hĭ mơ̆ng tơlơi pơkơhmal amăng war apui? 
Therefore, behold, *I* send unto you prophets, and wise men, and scribes; and [some] of them ye will kill and crucify, and [some] of them ye will scourge in your synagogues, and will persecute from city to city; @ Yua kơ anŭn Kâo pơkiaŏ nao ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo kơ ƀing gih, ƀing kơhnâo, laih anŭn ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt. Đơđa amăng ƀing anŭn ƀing gih či pơdjai laih anŭn pơ̆ng ƀơi kơyâo bơrơkal, đơđa ƀing gih či taih hăng gai amăng sang bơjơnum, laih anŭn kiaŏ mă ngă sat mơ̆ng plei anai truh pơ plei pơkŏn. 
so that all righteous blood shed upon the earth should come upon *you*, from the blood of righteous Abel to the blood of Zacharias son of Barachias, whom ye slew between the temple and the altar. @ Tui anŭn abih bang drah ƀing tơpă arăng tuh laih ƀơi lŏn tơnah či lĕ kơ ƀing gih, čơdơ̆ng mơ̆ng drah Abel pô tơpă hơnơ̆ng truh pơ drah Sakari ană đah rơkơi Baraki, pô ƀing gih pơdjai ƀơi plah wah anih rơgoh hiam hăng kơƀang ngă yang. 
Verily I say unto you, All these things shall come upon this generation. @ Sĭt biă mă Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, tơlơi pơkơhmal kơ abih bang ƀing pơdjai mơnuih či truh kơ djuai mơnuih rơnŭk anai.”
Jerusalem, Jerusalem, [the city] that kills the prophets and stones those that are sent unto her, how often would I have gathered thy children as a hen gathers her chickens under her wings, and ye would not! @ “Ơ Yêrusalem, Yêrusalem, ih pơdjai ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo laih anŭn glŏm boh pơtâo ƀing Ơi Adai hmâo pơkiaŏ nao pơ ih! Lu wơ̆t Kâo kiăng pơƀŭt glaĭ ƀing ană ih kar hăng sa drơi mơnŭ ania kruk pơƀŭt glaĭ ană ñu ƀơi gah yŭ čăng ñu, samơ̆ ih ƀu kiăng ôh! 
Behold, your house is left unto you desolate; @ Lăng bĕ, sang ƀing gih Ơi Adai lui laih jing hĭ rơngol. 
for I say unto you, Ye shall in no wise see me henceforth until ye say, Blessed [be] he that comes in the name of [the] Lord. @ Yua kơ Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, ƀing gih ƀu či ƀuh Kâo dơ̆ng ôh, tơl ƀing gih laĭ: ‘Mơyun hiam yơh kơ Pô rai amăng anăn Khua Yang.’”
And Jesus went forth and went away from the temple, and his disciples came to [him] to point out to him the buildings of the temple. @ Tơ Yêsu tơbiă mơ̆ng sang kơkuh pơpŭ laih anŭn hlăk rơbat nao. Ƀing ding kơna rai pơ Ñu kơčrâo brơi Ñu lăng abih bang bruă pơdơ̆ng pơjing sang kơkuh pơpŭ. 
And he answering said to them, Do ye not see all these things? Verily I say to you, Not a stone shall be left here upon a stone which shall not be thrown down. @ Ñu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Ƀing gih ƀuh mơ̆ abih bang sang anai? Sĭt biă mă Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, ƀu či hmâo ôh sa boh pơtâo anai dŏ ƀơi ngŏ boh pơtâo pơkŏn, abih bang leng kơ glưh trŭn hĭ.”
And as he was sitting upon the mount of Olives the disciples came to him privately, saying, Tell us, when shall these things be, and what is the sign of thy coming and [the] completion of the age? @ Tơdang Yêsu dŏ ber ƀơi ngŏ čư̆ Ôliwơ, ƀing ding kơna rai pơ hơjăn Yêsu hăng laĭ: “Rơkâo kơ Ih laĭ brơi gơmơi hơbin tơlơi anŭn či truh, laih anŭn hơgĕt tơlơi gru kơnăl kơ tơlơi Ih rai dơ̆ng, laih anŭn kơ hrơi hnal tuč rơnŭk?”
And Jesus answering said to them, See that no one mislead you. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ kơ gơñu: “Răng bĕ, anăm brơi arăng plư ƀing gih ôh. 
For many shall come in my name, saying, *I* am the Christ, and they shall mislead many. @ Yua kơ lu mơnuih či rai ƀlor hăng anăn Kâo, laĭ: ‘Kâo jing Krist’, laih anŭn gơñu či plư lu mơnuih. 
But ye will hear of wars and rumours of wars. See that ye be not disturbed; for all [these things] must take place, but it is not yet the end. @ Ƀing gih či hmư̆ dơnai tơlơi pơblah pơ anih giăm laih anŭn hmư̆ hing kơ tơlơi pơblah mơ̆ng anih ataih. Anăm ƀing gih rŭng răng ôh, yua kơ abih tơlơi anŭn khŏm či truh, samơ̆ aka ƀu truh hnal tuč ôh. 
For nation shall rise up against nation, and kingdom against kingdom; and there shall be famines and pestilences, and earthquakes in divers places. @ Yua kơ djuai mơnuih anai či tơgŭ pơkơdơ̆ng hăng djuai mơnuih pơkŏn, laih anŭn dêh čar pơtao anai či pơkơdơ̆ng hăng dêh čar pơtao pơkŏn, laih anŭn či hmâo tơlơi ư̆ rơpa hăng tơlơi pơpư̆ lŏn tơnah amăng lu anih. 
But all these [are the] beginning of throes. @ Abih bang khul tơlơi anŭn kơnơ̆ng jing čơdơ̆ng pơphŭn kơ tơlơi ruă tơkeng đôč.
Then shall they deliver you up to tribulation, and shall kill you; and ye will be hated of all the nations for my name's sake. @ Hlăk anŭn arăng či jao ƀing gih kơ tơlơi arăng ngă sat pơtơnap, laih anŭn brơi arăng pơdjai hĭ ƀing gih; laih anŭn abih bang djuai mơnuih či bơrơmŭt kơ ƀing gih yua anăn Kâo. 
And then will many be offended, and will deliver one another up, and hate one another; @ Hlăk anŭn lu mơnuih či lui wir, pơblư̆ tơdruă, laih anŭn bơrơmŭt tơdruă. 
and many false prophets shall arise and shall mislead many; @ Či hmâo lu pô laĭ lui hlâo ƀlor truh laih anŭn plư lu mơnuih. 
and because lawlessness shall prevail, the love of the most shall grow cold; @ Laih anŭn yua kơ tơlơi sat ƀai lar jai, tơlơi khăp amăng lu mơnuih či rơŏt hĭ. 
but he that has endured to the end, *he* shall be saved. @ Samơ̆ hlơi pô gir tơl hnal tuč či klaih. 
And these glad tidings of the kingdom shall be preached in the whole habitable earth, for a witness to all the nations, and then shall come the end. @ Laih anŭn arăng či pơtô Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam kơ dêh čar pơtao anai tar ƀar lŏn tơnah jing sa tơlơi ngă gơ̆ng jơlan kơ abih bang djuai mơnuih. Hlăk anŭn hrơi hnal tuč či truh.”
When therefore ye shall see the abomination of desolation, which is spoken of through Daniel the prophet, standing in [what is a] holy place, (he that reads let him understand,) @ “Tui anŭn tơ ƀing gih ƀuh tơlơi hơƀak drak krip hmâo truh kơ anih rơgoh hiam tui hăng pô laĭ lui hlâo Đaniel hmâo laĭ laih (hlơi pô đŏk hră anai hluh bĕ), 
then let those who are in Judaea flee to the mountains; @ hlăk anŭn ƀing dŏ amăng kwar Yuđa đuaĭ kơdŏp bĕ pơ čư̆. 
let not him that is on the house come down to take the things out of his house; @ Hlơi dŏ ƀơi ngŏ bơbŭng sang anăm rơngiă mông trŭn mă dram gơnam ñu dơ̆ng ôh, 
and let not him that is in the field turn back to take his garment. @ laih anŭn hlơi pô dŏ pơ hmua anăm glaĭ mă ao phyung ñu lơi. 
But woe to those that are with child, and those that give suck in those days. @ Amăng khul hrơi anŭn tơnap yơh kơ ƀing đah kơmơi pi kian laih anŭn ƀing hmâo ană dŏ mĕm. 
But pray that your flight may not be in winter time nor on sabbath: @ Iâu laĭ bĕ kiăng kơ hrơi ƀing gih đuaĭ kơdŏp ƀu djơ̆ hlăk bơyan puih ƀôdah amăng hrơi saƀat ôh. 
for then shall there be great tribulation, such as has not been from [the] beginning of [the] world until now, nor ever shall be; @ Yua kơ hlăk anŭn či hmâo tơlơi tơnap tap prŏng, tơl aka ƀuh djơ̆ ôh čơdơ̆ng mơ̆ng phŭn hrih lŏn tơnah truh pơ ră anai, laih anŭn mơ̆ng anŭn pơ anăp kŏn či hmâo dơ̆ng lơi kar hăng anŭn. 
and if those days had not been cut short, no flesh had been saved; but on account of the elect those days shall be cut short. @ Tơdah khul hrơi anŭn ƀu pơhrŏ trŭn hĭ ôh, ƀu hmâo ôh sa čô mơnuih dưi klaih. Samơ̆ yua kơ ƀing mơnuih Ơi Adai hmâo ruah mă laih, hnŭn yơh khul hrơi anŭn či pơhrŏ trŭn hĭ mơ̆n.
Then if any one say to you, Behold, here is the Christ, or here, believe [it] not. @ Hlăk anŭn tơdah hmâo hlơi laĭ kơ ƀing gih: ‘Krist dŏ pơ anai,’ ƀôdah ‘Ñu pơ anŭn,’ anăm đaŏ tơlơi anŭn ôh. 
For there shall arise false Christs, and false prophets, and shall give great signs and wonders, so as to mislead, if possible, even the elect. @ Yua kơ či hmâo lu Krist ƀlor laih anŭn lu pô laĭ lui hlâo ƀlor tơbiă rai, gơñu či ngă gru kơnăl prŏng laih anŭn tơlơi yom pơphan kiăng plư plač, tơdah dưi gơñu plư wơ̆t kơ ƀing mơnuih Ơi Adai hmâo ruah laih. 
Behold, I have told you beforehand. @ Hmư̆ bĕ, Kâo hmâo laĭ pơthâo hlâo kơ ƀing gih laih.
If therefore they say to you, Behold, he is in the desert, go not forth; behold, [he is] in the inner chambers, do not believe [it]. @ Tui anŭn tơdah arăng laĭ kơ ƀing gih: ‘Anai nê, Ñu dŏ amăng tơdrŏn tač,’ anăm nao ôh; ƀôdah: ‘Anai nê, Ñu dŏ amăng anih hơgơ̆m,’ kŏn đaŏ kơ tơlơi anŭn lơi. 
For as the lightning goes forth from the east and shines to the west, so shall be the coming of the Son of man. @ Yua kơ kar hăng kơmlă tơbiă mơ̆ng gah ngŏ pơčrang truh pơ gah yŭ, kar hăng tui anŭn mơ̆n tơlơi Ană Mơnuih či rai.
[For] wherever the carcase is, there will be gathered the eagles. @ Pơpă anih hmâo drơi jan mơnuih djai, pơ anŭn klang grư̆ či pơtŭm glaĭ.”
But immediately after the tribulation of those days the sun shall be darkened, and the moon not give her light, and the stars shall fall from heaven, and the powers of the heavens shall be shaken. @ “Tañ mơtam laih giơ̆ng khul hrơi tơnap tap anŭn, yang hrơi či jing kơnăm hĭ, blan ƀu či pơčrang rơđah dơ̆ng ôh, khul pơtŭ mơ̆ng adai či lĕ trŭn laih anŭn abih tơlơi dưi kơtang amăng adai či pơpư̆ pơgơi. 
And then shall appear the sign of the Son of man in heaven; and then shall all the tribes of the land lament, and they shall see the Son of man coming on the clouds of heaven with power and great glory. @ Hlăk anŭn tơlơi gru kơnăl kơ Ană Mơnuih či pơrơđah amăng adai. Abih bang djuai mơnuih amăng lŏn tơnah či čŏk hia, laih anŭn gơñu či ƀuh Ană Mơnuih rai ƀơi kơthul hiăng amăng adai hăng tơlơi dưi mơyang laih anŭn tơlơi guh kơang prŏng. 
And he shall send his angels with a great sound of trumpet, and they shall gather together his elect from the four winds, from [the one] extremity of [the] heavens to [the other] extremity of them. @ Ñu či pơkiaŏ ling jang hiam Ñu ayŭp tơdiăp hăng jua kraih kơtang pơƀŭt ƀing Ơi Adai hmâo ruah laih mơ̆ng pă akiăng lŏn tơnah, čơdơ̆ng mơ̆ng rơnuč adai anai truh pơ rơnuč adai adih.
But learn the parable from the fig-tree: When already its branch becomes tender and produces leaves, ye know that the summer is near. @ Hrăm bĕ hăng tơlơi bơhmutu mơ̆ng phŭn hra: tơ than ñu mơda laih anŭn čơdơ̆ng čơnăt hla, ƀing gih thâo kơ bơyan phang jĕ truh yơh. 
Thus also *ye*, when ye see all these things, know that it is near, at the doors. @ Kar hăng tui anŭn mơ̆n, tơ ƀing gih ƀuh abih bang tơlơi anŭn, ƀing gih thâo kơ Ană Mơnuih jĕ truh laih, Ñu hlăk dŏ ƀơi bah amăng. 
Verily I say to you, This generation will not have passed away until all these things shall have taken place. @ Sĭt biă mă Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, ƀing rơnŭk anai ƀu či rơgao hĭ ôh tơl abih bang tơlơi anŭn či truh. 
The heaven and the earth shall pass away, but my words shall in no wise pass away. @ Adai laih anŭn lŏn tơnah či rơgao hĭ, samơ̆ boh pơhiăp Kâo ƀu či rơgao hĭ ôh.”
But of that day and hour no one knows, not even the angels of the heavens, but [my] Father alone. @ “Samơ̆ kơ hrơi hăng mông anŭn, ƀu hmâo sa čô hlơi thâo ôh, ƀing ling jang amăng adai ƀôdah Ană Mơnuih kŏn thâo lơi, kơnơ̆ng hơjăn Ama đôč thâo. 
But as the days of Noe, so also shall be the coming of the Son of man. @ Kar hăng tơlơi truh laih amăng rơnŭk Nôê, či truh kar kaĭ mơ̆n amăng hrơi Ană Mơnuih rai. 
For as they were in the days which were before the flood, eating and drinking, marrying and giving in marriage, until the day on which Noe entered into the ark, @ Yua kơ kar hăng amăng rơnŭk hlâo kơ ia lip arăng ƀơ̆ng mơñum, pơdŏ rơkơi bơnai, laih anŭn brơi ƀing ană gơñu pơdŏ rơkơi bơnai hlŏng truh pơ hrơi Nôê mŭt amăng kompăn, 
and they knew not till the flood came and took all away; thus also shall be the coming of the Son of man. @ laih anŭn gơñu ƀu thâo hơgĕt ôh tơl ia lip truh pơđung abih bang gơñu. Hrơi Ană Mơnuih rai či truh kar kaĭ mơ̆n. 
Then two shall be in the field, one is taken and one is left; @ Hlăk anŭn, hmâo dua čô đah rơkơi dŏ amăng hmua; sa čô Ơi Adai mă pơđuaĭ hĭ, sa čô dŏ glaĭ. 
two [women] grinding at the mill, one is taken and one is left. @ Hmâo dua čô đah kơmơi tơ̆p pơdai hrŏm hơbĭt; sa čô Ơi Adai mă pơđuaĭ hĭ, sa čô dŏ glaĭ. 
Watch therefore, for ye know not in what hour your Lord comes. @ Tui anŭn răng bĕ, yua kơ ƀing gih ƀu thâo ôh hơbin hrơi Khua Yang gih či rai. 
But know this, that if the master of the house had known in what watch the thief was coming, he would have watched and not have suffered his house to be dug through [into]. @ Samơ̆ brơi ƀing gih thâo tơlơi anai: tơdah pô sang thâo laih mông pă mơnuih klĕ či rai, ñu či răng ƀu brơi mơnuih klĕ ƀoh pơnăng mŭt amăng sang ñu ôh. 
Wherefore *ye* also, be ye ready, for in that hour that ye think not the Son of man comes. @ Tui anŭn kar kaĭ mơ̆n ƀing gih khŏm dŏ prăp pre bĕ; yua kơ Ană Mơnuih či rai amăng mông ƀing gih ƀu ăng rơmăng ôh.”
Who then is the faithful and prudent bondman whom his lord has set over his household, to give them food in season? @ “Hlơi pô jing ding kơna tŏng ten laih anŭn kơhnâo, pô khua hmâo jao brơi wai lăng abih bang mơnuih amăng sang ñu, kiăng brơi mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă kơ ƀing gơ̆ djơ̆ mông? 
Blessed is that bondman whom his lord on coming shall find doing thus. @ Mơyun hiam yơh kơ ding kơna anŭn, tơ khua ñu truh laih anŭn ƀuh ñu dŏ ngă tui anŭn! 
Verily I say unto you, that he will set him over all his substance. @ Sĭt biă mă Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, khua ñu či jao brơi kơ ding kơna anŭn wai lăng abih bang kong ngăn gơ̆ hmâo. 
But if that evil bondman should say in his heart, My lord delays to come, @ Samơ̆ tơdah ding kơna sat anŭn pơmĭn amăng pran jua ñu tui anai: ‘Khua kâo či truh kaih,’ 
and begin to beat his fellow-bondmen, and eat and drink with the drunken; @ ñu čơdơ̆ng taih tơdruă ƀing ding kơna gơ̆p mă bruă hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ñu, laih anŭn ƀơ̆ng mơñum hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing măt tơpai, 
the lord of that bondman shall come in a day when he does not expect it, and in an hour he knows not of, @ khua ding kơna anŭn či truh amăng hrơi ñu ƀu ăng rơmăng, laih anŭn amăng mông ñu ƀu thâo ôh, 
and shall cut him in two and appoint his portion with the hypocrites: there shall be the weeping and the gnashing of teeth. @ laih anŭn khua ñu či taih pơrai hĭ ñu hăng yap ñu hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing plơ̆m ƀlor. Ƀơi anŭn či hmâo tơlơi čŏk hia hăng kĕ tơgơi.”
Then shall the kingdom of the heavens be made like to ten virgins that having taken their torches, went forth to meet the bridegroom. @ “Hlăk anŭn dêh čar pơtao plei hiam či jing kar hăng ƀing pluh čô dra hmŭm djă apui kơđen nao čơkă han tao. 
And five of them were prudent and five foolish. @ Amăng ƀing gơñu anŭn hmâo rơma čô mlŭk laih anŭn rơma čô kơhnâo. 
They that were foolish took their torches and did not take oil with them; @ Ƀing mlŭk djă apui kơđen, gơñu ƀu djă ba ia jâu hrŏm hơbĭt ôh. 
but the prudent took oil in their vessels with their torches. @ Samơ̆ ƀing kơhnâo djă apui kơđen laih anŭn djă wơ̆t get bă ia jâu. 
Now the bridegroom tarrying, they all grew heavy and slept. @ Yua kơ han tao kaih rai, abih bang gơñu leng rơbưi hăng pĭt hĭ yơh.
But in [the] middle of [the] night there was a cry, Behold, the bridegroom; go forth to meet him. @ Samơ̆ ƀơi tơ̆ng krah mlam hmâo asăp ur laĭ: ‘Adi dih, han tao rai yơh! Nao čơkă ñu bĕ!’ 
Then all those virgins arose and trimmed their torches. @ Tui anŭn abih bang ƀing dra hmŭm mơdưh tơgŭ laih anŭn prăp rơmet apui kơđen gơñu. 
And the foolish said to the prudent, Give us of your oil, for our torches are going out. @ Ƀing mlŭk laĭ kơ ƀing kơhnâo: ‘Rơkâo ƀing gih pha ƀiă ia jâu kơ gơmơi đa, yua kơ apui kơđen gơmơi giăm či djai yơh.’ 
But the prudent answered saying, [We cannot,] lest it might not suffice for us and for you. Go rather to those that sell, and buy for yourselves. @ Samơ̆ ƀing kơhnâo laĭ glaĭ: ‘Ƀu dưi ôh, hwĭ kơ ƀu djŏp kơ ƀing gơmơi wơ̆t kơ ƀing gih mơ̆n; hiam hloh nao bĕ pơ ƀing sĭ ia jâu laih anŭn blơi mă kơ gih pô.’ 
But as they went away to buy, the bridegroom came, and the [ones that were] ready went in with him to the wedding feast, and the door was shut. @ Samơ̆ tơdang gơñu nao blơi, han tao truh yơh. Laih anŭn hơdôm ƀing hmâo prăp pre laih, mŭt hơbĭt hăng ñu kơ tơlơi ƀơ̆ng huă dŏ rơkơi bơnai; laih anŭn arăng krư̆ hĭ bah amăng.
Afterwards come also the rest of the virgins, saying, Lord, Lord, open to us; @ Tơdơi ƀiă kơ anŭn ƀing dra hmŭm ăt truh mơ̆n laih anŭn laĭ: ‘Ơ khua, Ơ khua, pŏk brơi bah amăng kơ gơmơi đa.’ 
but he answering said, Verily I say unto you, I do not know you. @ Samơ̆ pô anŭn laĭ glaĭ: ‘Sĭt biă mă kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, kâo ƀu thâo krăn ƀing gih ôh.’
Watch therefore, for ye know not the day nor the hour. @ Tui anŭn, dŏ mơdưh bĕ, yua kơ ƀing gih ƀu thâo ôh hrơi, kŏn thâo mông lơi.”
For [it is] as [if] a man going away out of a country called his own bondmen and delivered to them his substance. @  “Dêh čar pơtao plei hiam jing kar hăng sa čô mơnuih či đuaĭ hyu pơ čar ataih, iâu ƀing ding kơna ñu hăng jao brơi kong ngăn ñu kơ ƀing gơ̆. 
And to one he gave five talents, to another two, and to another one; to each according to his particular ability, and immediately went away out of the country. @ Kơ pô anai ñu brơi rơma tơlăng, kơ pô anŭn dua tơlăng, laih anŭn kơ pô pơkŏn sa tơlăng. Ñu brơi tui hăng tơlơi dưi ngă kơ rĭm čô. Laih anŭn ñu nao yơh. 
And he that had received the five talents went and trafficked with them, and made five other talents. @ Pô hmâo mă tŭ laih rơma tơlăng nao sĭ mia mơtam hăng tơlăng anŭn; laih anŭn ñu ƀơ̆ng kơmlai rơma tơlăng dơ̆ng. 
In like manner also he that [had received] the two, [he also] gained two others. @ Kar kaĭ mơ̆n pô hmâo mă tŭ laih dua tơlăng, ƀơ̆ng kơmlai dua tơlăng dơ̆ng. 
But he that had received the one went and dug in the earth, and hid the money of his lord. @ Samơ̆ pô hmâo mă tŭ laih sa tơlăng nao klơi lŏn hăng dơr pơdŏp hĭ prăk khua ñu.
And after a long time the lord of those bondmen comes and reckons with them. @ Sui hrơi mơ̆ng anŭn, khua kơ ƀing ding kơna anŭn wơ̆t glaĭ hăng yap hră prăk hăng ƀing gơñu. 
And he that had received the five talents came to [him] and brought five other talents, saying, [My] lord, thou deliveredst me five talents; behold, I have gained five other talents besides them. @ Pô mă tŭ rơma tơlăng rai ba rơma tơlăng pơkŏn dơ̆ng hăng laĭ: ‘Ơ Khua, ih jao laih kơ kâo rơma tơlăng. Anai nê, kâo hmâo kơmlai rơma tơlăng pơkŏn dơ̆ng.’ 
His lord said to him, Well, good and faithful bondman, thou wast faithful over a few things, I will set thee over many things: enter into the joy of thy lord. @ Khua ñu laĭ hăng ñu: ‘Hiam biă mă yơh, Ơ ding kơna tơpă hiam hăng tŏng ten ah. Ih tŏng ten laih amăng bruă anĕt, kâo či brơi ih wai lăng lu. Mŭt bĕ tŭ hrŏm hơbĭt tơlơi hơ̆k mơak hăng khua ih.’ 
And he also that had received the two talents came to [him] and said, [My] lord, thou deliveredst me two talents; behold, I have gained two other talents besides them. @ Kar kaĭ mơ̆n pô mă tŭ dua tơlăng rai hăng laĭ: ‘Ơ Khua ih jao laih kơ kâo dua tơlăng. Anai nê, kâo hmâo kơmlai dua tơlăng pơkŏn dơ̆ng.’ 
His lord said to him, Well, good and faithful bondman, thou wast faithful over a few things, I will set thee over many things: enter thou into the joy of thy lord. @ Khua ñu laĭ kơ ñu: ‘Hiam biă mă yơh, Ơ ding kơna tơpă hiam hăng tŏng ten ah. Ih tŏng ten laih amăng bruă anĕt, kâo či brơi ih wai lăng lu. Mŭt bĕ tŭ hrŏm hơbĭt tơlơi hơ̆k mơak hăng khua ih.’ 
And he also that had received the one talent coming to [him] said, [My] lord, I knew thee that thou art a hard man, reaping where thou hadst not sowed, and gathering from where thou hadst not scattered, @ Tơdơi kơ anŭn pô hmâo mă tŭ laih sa tơlăng rai hăng laĭ: ‘Ơ Khua, kâo thâo kơ ih jing sa čô mơnuih khăng khĭp. Ih hơpuă amăng anih ih ƀu tơjŭ, laih anŭn duñ pơƀŭt amăng anih ih ƀu sai ôh. 
and being afraid I went away and hid thy talent in the earth; behold, thou hast that which is thine. @ Tui anŭn yơh kâo hwĭ, laih anŭn kâo pơdŏp hĭ tơlăng ih amăng lŏn. Hĕ anai, mă bĕ gơnam ih pô.’ 
And his lord answering said to him, Wicked and slothful bondman, thou knewest that I reap where I had not sowed, and gather from where I had not scattered; @ Samơ̆ khua ñu laĭ glaĭ: ‘Ơ ding kơna sat ƀai laih anŭn alah! Ih thâo laih kâo hơpuă amăng anih kâo ƀu tơjŭ, laih anŭn duñ pơƀŭt amăng anih kâo ƀu sai ôh. 
thou oughtest then to have put my money to the money-changers, and when I came I should have got what is mine with interest. @ Tui anŭn, djơ̆ biă mă ih khŏm jao prăk kâo kơ ƀing sĭ mia prăk, laih anŭn ƀơi hrơi kâo wơ̆t glaĭ kâo dưi mă glaĭ prăk kâo wơ̆t hăng kơmlai ñu mơ̆n. 
Take therefore the talent from him, and give it to him that has the ten talents: @ Hnŭn yơh, mă hĭ bĕ prăk ñu hăng brơi kơ pô hmâo pluh tơlăng. 
for to every one that has shall be given, and he shall be in abundance; but from him that has not, that even which he has shall be taken from him. @ Yua kơ arăng či thim brơi kơ hlơi pô hmâo laih, laih anŭn ñu či hmâo rơbeh blai; samơ̆ kơ hlơi pô ƀu hmâo ôh, arăng či mă hĭ wơ̆t mơnơ̆ng ñu hmâo laih mơ̆n. 
And cast out the useless bondman into the outer darkness; there shall be the weeping and the gnashing of teeth. @ Bơ kơ ding kơna ƀu tŭ yua anai, glŏm hĭ bĕ ñu amăng anih kơnăm mơmŏt pơ gah rơngiao; ƀơi anŭn či hmâo tơlơi čŏk hia hăng tơlơi kĕ tơgơi.’”
But when the Son of man comes in his glory, and all the angels with him, then shall he sit down upon his throne of glory, @ “Tơ Ană Mơnuih rai amăng tơlơi guh kơang Ñu hrŏm hơbĭt hăng abih bang ƀing ling jang, hlăk anŭn ñu či dŏ ber ƀơi gre pơtao ang yang Ñu. 
and all the nations shall be gathered before him; and he shall separate them from one another, as the shepherd separates the sheep from the goats; @ Abih bang djuai mơnuih či pơƀŭt glaĭ ƀơi anăp Ñu, laih anŭn Ñu či pơkah hĭ gơñu jing dua phung kar hăng pô wai triu pơkah hĭ triu mơ̆ng bơbe. 
and he will set the sheep on his right hand, and the goats on [his] left. @ Laih anŭn Ñu či pioh triu gah hơnuă Ñu, laih anŭn bơbe gah iao. 
Then shall the King say to those on his right hand, Come, blessed of my Father, inherit the kingdom prepared for you from [the] world's foundation: @ Hlăk anŭn Pơtao či laĭ kơ ƀing gah hơnuă ñu: ‘Rai bĕ, Ơ ƀing mơnuih Ama Kâo hmâo hơơč mơyun laih, mă tŭ bĕ dêh čar pơtao Ñu hmâo prăp pre brơi laih kơ ƀing gih mơ̆ng phŭn pơjing lŏn tơnah. 
for I hungered, and ye gave me to eat; I thirsted, and ye gave me to drink; I was a stranger, and ye took me in; @ Yua kơ hlăk Kâo rơpa ƀing gih brơi Kâo mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă; Kâo mơhao ƀing gih brơi Kâo ia mơñum; Kâo jing mơnuih tuai ƀing gih hmâo tŭ jum Kâo; 
naked, and ye clothed me; I was ill, and ye visited me; I was in prison, and ye came to me. @ Kâo dŏ mơhlŭn ƀing gih brơi Kâo sum ao čŭt; Kâo duăm ruă ƀing gih rai čuă wai laih Kâo. Arăng krư̆ kâo, ƀing gih rai čuă ngui kâo.’ 
Then shall the righteous answer him saying, Lord, when saw we thee hungering, and nourished thee; or thirsting, and gave thee to drink? @ Hlăk anŭn ƀing mơnuih tơpă či laĭ glaĭ kơ Ñu: ‘Ơ Khua Yang, hơbin pă gơmơi hmâo ƀuh Ih rơpa laih anŭn brơi kơ Ih mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă, ƀôdah Ih mơhao laih anŭn brơi kơ Ih ia mơñum? 
and when saw we thee a stranger, and took thee in; or naked, and clothed thee? @ Laih anŭn hơbin pă gơmơi hmâo ƀuh Ih jing tuai laih anŭn tŭ jum Ih, ƀôdah Ih dŏ mơhlŭn laih anŭn brơi sum ao kơ Ih buh? 
and when saw we thee ill, or in prison, and came to thee? @ Laih anŭn hơbin pă gơmơi hmâo ƀuh Ih duăm ruă ƀôdah arăng krư̆ laih anŭn nao čuă ngui Ih?’ 
And the King answering shall say to them, Verily, I say to you, Inasmuch as ye have done it to one of the least of these my brethren, ye have done it to me. @ Laih anŭn Pơtao či laĭ glaĭ kơ ƀing gơñu: ‘Sĭt biă mă Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, tơ ƀing gih ngă tơlơi anŭn kơ sa čô amăng ƀing adơi ayŏng Kâo anĕt aneo anai jing tơlơi ƀing gih hmâo ngă laih tơlơi anŭn kơ Kâo.’
Then shall he say also to those on the left, Go from me, cursed, into eternal fire, prepared for the devil and his angels: @ Hlăk anŭn Ñu či laĭ kơ ƀing dŏ gah iao Ñu: ‘Ơ ƀing hơtơ̆m pah laih đuaĭ bĕ mơ̆ng Kâo, nao mŭt amăng apui ƀơ̆ng hlŏng lar pơkra brơi laih kơ yang sat laih anŭn kơ ƀing ling jang sat ñu. 
for I hungered, and ye gave me not to eat; I thirsted, and ye gave me not to drink; @ Yua kơ Kâo rơpa ƀing gih ƀu brơi ôh mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă; Kâo mơhao ƀing gih ƀu brơi ôh ia mơñum; 
I was a stranger, and ye took me not in; naked, and ye did not clothe me; ill, and in prison, and ye did not visit me. @ Kâo jing tuai ƀing gih ƀu tŭ jum Kâo ôh; Kâo dŏ mơhlŭn ƀing gih ƀu brơi sum ao kơ Kâo buh ôh; Kâo duăm ruă laih anŭn arăng krư̆ Kâo ƀing gih ƀu nao čuă ngui Kâo ôh.’ 
Then shall *they* also answer saying, Lord, when saw we thee hungering, or thirsting, or a stranger, or naked, or ill, or in prison, and have not ministered to thee? @ Hlăk anŭn ƀing anai či laĭ glaĭ kơ Ñu: ‘Ơ Khua Yang, hơbin pă gơmơi ƀuh Ih rơpa, mơhao, jing tuai, dŏ mơhlŭn, duăm ruă, ƀôdah arăng krư̆ laih anŭn gơmơi ƀu djru Ih ôh?’ 
Then shall he answer them saying, Verily I say to you, Inasmuch as ye have not done it to one of these least, neither have ye done it to me. @ Ñu či laĭ glaĭ kơ ƀing anŭn: ‘Sĭt biă mă Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, tơdah ƀing gih ƀu ngă ôh tơlơi anŭn kơ sa čô amăng ƀing anĕt aneo anai, jing kar hăng ƀing gih ƀu hmâo ngă kơ Kâo ôh.’ 
And these shall go away into eternal punishment, and the righteous into life eternal. @ Giơ̆ng anŭn ƀing anŭn či mŭt nao amăng tơlơi pơkơhmal hlŏng lar, samơ̆ ƀing tơpă či mŭt nao kơ tơlơi hơdip hlŏng lar.”
And it came to pass when Jesus had finished all these sayings, he said to his disciples, @ Tơ Yêsu pơhiăp giơ̆ng hơdôm tơlơi anŭn, Ñu laĭ kơ ƀing ding kơna Ñu, 
Ye know that after two days the passover takes place, and the Son of man is delivered up to be crucified. @ “Ƀing gih thâo laih dŏ dua hrơi dơ̆ng či truh phĕt Tơlơi Găn. Laih anŭn arăng či jao Ană Mơnuih brơi arăng pơ̆ng hĭ Ñu ƀơi kơyâo bơrơkal.”
Then the chief priests and the elders of the people were gathered together to the palace of the high priest who was called Caiaphas, @ Hlăk anŭn ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng hăng ƀing kŏng tha amăng ƀing ană plei pla pơƀŭt glaĭ amăng sang khua ngă yang prŏng hloh Kaip. 
and took counsel together in order that they might seize Jesus by subtlety and kill him; @ Gơñu črŏng sai mă Yêsu hăng tơlơi hơgơ̆m kiăng pơdjai hĭ Gơ̆. 
but they said, Not in the feast, that there be not a tumult among the people. @ Samơ̆ gơñu laĭ: “Ƀu dưi ôh ngă tơlơi anŭn tơdang phĕt Tơlơi Găn, hwĭ kơ hmâo tơlơi pơrŭng amăng tơ̆ng krah ană plei.”
But Jesus being in Bethany, in Simon the leper's house, @ Hlăk Yêsu dŏ pơ plei Bêthani amăng sang Simôn pô djơ̆ phŭng, 
a woman, having an alabaster flask of very precious ointment, came to him and poured it out upon his head as he lay at table. @ tơdang Ñu dŏ ƀơ̆ng huă hmâo sa čô đah kơmơi djă sa boh get boh pơtâo bă ia klôñ yom biă mă nao pơ Ñu hăng tuh ia klôñ anŭn ƀơi akŏ Ñu. 
But the disciples seeing it became indignant, saying, To what end [was] this waste? @ Samơ̆ tơ ƀing ding kơna ƀuh tơlơi anŭn, gơñu hil biă mă hăng laĭ: “Yua hơgĕt pơrơngiă hĭ đôč đač kar hăng anŭn? 
for this might have been sold for much and been given to the poor. @ Yua kơ ia klôñ anai arăng dưi sĭ hăng nua pơmă biă mă, laih anŭn ba prăk anŭn djru kơ ƀing ƀun rin.”
But Jesus knowing [it] said to them, Why do ye trouble the woman? for she has wrought a good work toward me. @ Samơ̆ Yêsu thâo tơlơi anŭn, tui anŭn Ñu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Yua hơgĕt ƀing gih ngă pơgleh kơ đah kơmơi anai? Gơ̆ hmâo ngă laih sa bruă hiam kơ Kâo. 
For ye have the poor always with you, but me ye have not always. @ Yua kơ ƀing gih hmâo nanao ƀing ƀun rin hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing gih, samơ̆ Kâo ƀu dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt ƀing gih nanao ôh. 
For in pouring out this ointment on my body, she has done it for my burying. @ Tơlơi gơ̆ tuh ia klôñ anai ƀơi drơi jan Kâo jing tơlơi gơ̆ hmâo pơkra pre kơ tơlơi dơr Kâo. 
Verily I say to you, Wheresoever these glad tidings may be preached in the whole world, that also which this [woman] has done shall be spoken of for a memorial of her. @ Sĭt biă mă Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, tar ƀar lŏn tơnah, pơpă anih arăng pơtô Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam anai, arăng či ră ruai kơ bruă đah kơmơi anai hmâo ngă laih kiăng hơdơr kơ ñu.”
Then one of the twelve, he who was called Judas Iscariote, went to the chief priests @ Hlăk anŭn sa čô amăng pluh dua čô, anăn ñu Yudas Iskariôt, nao pơ ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng 
and said, What are ye willing to give me, and *I* will deliver him up to you? And they appointed to him thirty pieces of silver. @ laih anŭn laĭ: “Hơgĕt mơnơ̆ng ƀing gih či brơi kơ kâo tơdah kâo jao Yêsu kơ ƀing gih?” Ƀing anŭn brơi kơ ñu klâo pluh kak prăk. 
And from that time he sought a good opportunity that he might deliver him up. @ Dơ̆ng mơ̆ng mông anŭn ñu hơduah hrơi gal kiăng jao Yêsu kơ gơñu.
Now on the first [day] of [the feast of] unleavened bread, the disciples came to Jesus, saying, Where wilt thou that we prepare for thee to eat the passover? @ Hrơi tal sa amăng hrơi phĕt Ƀañ Tơpŭng Ƀu Hmâo Tơpơi ƀing ding kơna nao pơ Yêsu hăng laĭ: “Pơpă anih Ih kiăng gơmơi prăp rơmet kơ Ih ƀơ̆ng phĕt Tơlơi Găn?”
And he said, Go into the city unto such a one, and say to him, The Teacher says, My time is near, I will keep the passover in thy house with my disciples. @ Ñu laĭ: “Nao bĕ pơ sa čô mơnuih amăng plei prŏng laih anŭn laĭ kơ ñu: ‘Nai laĭ, mông Kâo giăm truh yơh. Kâo či pơhơdơr phĕt Tơlơi Găn amăng sang ih hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing ding kơna kâo.’”
And the disciples did as Jesus had directed them, and they prepared the passover. @ Ƀing ding kơna ngă tui kar hăng Yêsu hmâo pơtă laih kơ gơñu, laih anŭn gơñu prăp rơmet phĕt Tơlơi Găn.
And when the evening was come he lay down at table with the twelve. @ Tơ adai mơmŏt laih, Ñu dŏ ƀơ̆ng huă hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing pluh dua čô ding kơna. 
And as they were eating he said, Verily I say to you, that one of you shall deliver me up. @ Tơdang gơñu dŏ ƀơ̆ng huă Ñu laĭ: “Sĭt biă mă Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, sa čô amăng ƀing gih či pơblư̆ lui Kâo.”
And being exceedingly grieved they began to say to him, each of them, Is it *I*, Lord? @ Ƀing gơñu rơngot biă mă, laih anŭn rĭm čô tŏ tui čơdơ̆ng tơña Yêsu tui anai: “Ơ Khua Yang, djơ̆ mơ̆ kâo?”
But he answering said, He that dips his hand with me in the dish, *he* it is who shall deliver me up. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Hlơi pô añrŭ ƀañ tơpŭng amăng jam hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Kâo pô anŭn yơh pơblư̆ Kâo. 
The Son of man goes indeed, according as it is written concerning him, but woe to that man by whom the Son of man is delivered up; it were good for that man if he had not been born. @ Ană Mơnuih či djai tui hăng Hră Ơi Adai pơhiăp hmâo čih laih kơ Ñu, samơ̆ răm ƀăm yơh kơ pô pơblư̆ lui Ană Mơnuih! Hiam hloh arăng ƀu tơkeng kơ ñu ôh.”
And Judas, who delivered him up, answering said, Is it *I*, Rabbi? He says to him, *Thou* hast said. @ Yudas, pô pơblư̆ lui Ñu, laĭ: “Ơ Nai, djơ̆ mơ̆ kâo?” Yêsu laĭ kơ ñu: “Ih pô hmâo laĭ laih tơlơi anŭn.”
And as they were eating, Jesus, having taken [the] bread and blessed, broke [it] and gave [it] to the disciples, and said, Take, eat: this is my body. @ Tơdang gơñu dŏ ƀơ̆ng huă, Yêsu mă ƀañ tơpŭng, iâu laĭ bơni hơơč, wơ̆k ƀañ tơpŭng hăng pơpha kơ ƀing ding kơna, hăng laĭ: “Mă ƀơ̆ng bĕ; anai jing drơi jan Kâo.” 
And having taken [the] cup and given thanks, he gave [it] to them, saying, Drink ye all of it. @ Laih anŭn Ñu mă kơčok, giơ̆ng iâu laĭ bơni hơơč, Ñu brơi kơčok kơ ƀing gơñu hăng laĭ: “Abih bang ƀing gih mơñum bĕ; 
For this is my blood, that of the [new] covenant, that shed for many for remission of sins. @ yua kơ anai jing drah Kâo, drah kơnol pơgop hmâo tuh brơi laih kiăng kơ lu mơnuih dưi hmâo tơlơi pap brơi tơlơi soh. 
But I say to you, that I will not at all drink henceforth of this fruit of the vine, until that day when I drink it new with you in the kingdom of my Father. @ Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, Kâo ƀu či mơñum tơpai boh kơƀâu anai dơ̆ng tah, tơl hrơi Kâo či mơñum tơpai phrâo hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing gih amăng dêh čar pơtao Ama Kâo.”
And having sung a hymn, they went out to the mount of Olives. @ Giơ̆ng gơñu adoh, tơlơi adoh bơni hơơč, gơñu tơbiă nao pơ Čư̆ Ôliwơ.
Then saith Jesus to them, All *ye* shall be offended in me during this night. For it is written, I will smite the shepherd, and the sheep of the flock shall be scattered abroad. @ Hlăk anŭn Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Mlam anai abih bang ƀing gih či lui raih Kâo. Yua kơ Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp hmâo čih laih tui anai:
‘Kâo či taih pô wai triu,
Laih anŭn khul triu či čơlah bru bra.’
But after that I shall be risen, I will go before you to Galilee. @ Samơ̆ giơ̆ng Kâo hơdip glaĭ, Kâo či nao hlâo kơ ƀing gih pơ kwar Galilê”.
And Peter answering said to him, If all shall be offended in thee, *I* will never be offended. @ Pêtrôs pơhiăp hăng Ñu: “Wơ̆t dah abih bang či čơlah hĭ yua kơ Ih, kâo ƀu či čơlah lui Ih ôh.”
Jesus said to him, Verily I say to thee, that during this night, before [the] cock shall crow, thou shalt deny me thrice. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ ñu: “Sĭt biă mă Kâo laĭ kơ ih, mlam anai yơh hlâo kơ mơnŭ tơdjô̆ ih či hơngah kơ Kâo klâo wơ̆t.”
Peter says to him, If I should needs die with thee, I will in no wise deny thee. Likewise said all the disciples also. @ Pêtrôs laĭ kơ Ñu: “Wơ̆t dah kâo khŏm djai hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Ih tŭ mơ̆n, kâo ƀu či hơngah kơ Ih ôh.” Laih anŭn abih bang ƀing ding kơna laĭ kar hăng tui anŭn mơ̆n.
Then Jesus comes with them to a place called Gethsemane, and says to the disciples, Sit here until I go away and pray yonder. @ Tơdơi kơ anŭn, Yêsu nao hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing ding kơna pơ sa boh anih arăng pơanăn Gêtsêmanê. Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Dŏ ber bĕ ƀơi anai tơdang Kâo nao iâu laĭ pơ adih.” 
And taking with [him] Peter and the two sons of Zebedee, he began to be sorrowful and deeply depressed. @ Ñu jak ba Pêtrôs hăng dua čô ană đah rơkơi Sêbêdê nao hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Ñu. Ñu čơdơ̆ng rơngot ruă pran hăng rŭng răng. 
Then he says to them, My soul is very sorrowful even unto death; remain here and watch with me. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Bơngăt jua Kâo rơngot ruă biă mă tơl giăm djai; dŏ bĕ pơ anai laih anŭn krŏng hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Kâo.”
And going forward a little he fell upon his face, praying and saying, My Father, if it be possible let this cup pass from me; but not as *I* will, but as *thou* [wilt]. @ Yêsu nao ataih ƀiă, bon kŭp ƀô̆ ƀơi lŏn, laih anŭn iâu laĭ: “Ơ Ama Kâo! Tơdah dưi, mă pơđuaĭ hĭ bĕ kơčok anai mơ̆ng Kâo; ƀu djơ̆ tui hăng Kâo kiăng ôh, samơ̆ tui hăng Ih kiăng.”
And he comes to the disciples and finds them sleeping, and says to Peter, Thus ye have not been able to watch one hour with me? @ Tơdơi kơ anŭn Ñu wơ̆t glaĭ pơ ƀing ding kơna laih anŭn ƀuh gơñu dŏ pĭt. Ñu laĭ kơ Pêtrôs: “Ƀing gih ƀu dưi ôh hă dŏ krŏng hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Kâo sa mông? 
Watch and pray, that ye enter not into temptation: the spirit indeed [is] ready, but the flesh weak. @ Dŏ krŏng laih anŭn iâu laĭ bĕ, kiăng kơ ƀing gih ƀu lĕ ôh amăng tơlơi plư. Bơngăt jua kiăng biă mă, samơ̆ asar đeh tơdu”.
Again going away a second time he prayed saying, My Father, if this cannot pass [from me] unless I drink it, thy will be done. @ Ñu nao tal dua dơ̆ng laih anŭn iâu laĭ: “Ơ Ama Kâo! Tơdah kơčok anai ƀu dưi pơđuaĭ hĭ mơ̆ng Kâo ôh, khŏm Kâo mơñum, brơi tơlơi anŭn truh tui hăng Ih kiăng.” 
And coming he found them again sleeping, for their eyes were heavy. @ Yêsu wơ̆t glaĭ dơ̆ng hăng ƀuh ƀing ding kơna ăt dŏ pĭt, yua kơ mơta gơñu ƀu anăm blang ôh.
And leaving them, he went away again and prayed the third time, saying the same thing. @ Tui anŭn, Ñu đuaĭ mơ̆ng ƀing gơñu dơ̆ng hăng nao iâu laĭ tal klâo, ăt rơkâo kar hăng boh pơhiăp hlâo anŭn mơ̆n. 
Then he comes to the disciples and says to them, Sleep on now and take your rest; behold, the hour has drawn nigh, and the Son of man is delivered up into the hands of sinners. @ Giơ̆ng anŭn Ñu wơ̆t glaĭ pơ ƀing ding kơna hăng laĭ kơ gơñu: “Ƀing gih ăt dŏ pĭt hăng dŏ pơdơi hă? Adih dih, mông truh yơh, arăng či jao lui Ană Mơnuih amăng tơngan ƀing soh. 
Arise, let us go; behold, he that delivers me up has drawn nigh. @ Tơgŭ bĕ, brơi ƀing ta nao! Lăng adih, pô pơblư̆ lui Kâo truh laih yơh.”
And while he was yet speaking, behold, Judas, one of the twelve, came, and with him a great crowd with swords and sticks from the chief priests and elders of the people. @ Tơdang Ñu dŏ pơhiăp, Yudas, sa čô amăng ƀing pluh dua čô, rai hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing mơnuih lu djă đao gưm laih anŭn gai mơ̆ng ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng hăng ƀing kŏng tha amăng ƀing ană plei pơkiaŏ rai. 
Now he that delivered him up had given them a sign, saying, Whomsoever I shall kiss, he it is: seize him. @ Pô pơblư̆ brơi laih gru kơnăl kơ ƀing anŭn, laĭ: “Hlơi pô kâo čŭm, Ñu yơh anŭn, mă čaŏ Ñu.”
