And immediately coming up to Jesus he said, Hail, Rabbi, and covered him with kisses. @ Yudas nao pơ Yêsu mơtam hăng laĭ: “Kơkuh kơ Ih, Ơ Nai!” Laih anŭn čŭm Yêsu.
But Jesus said to him, [My] friend, for what purpose art thou come? Then coming up they laid hands upon Jesus and seized him. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ ñu: “Ơ gơyut, ngă bĕ hơgĕt tơlơi kơñăm ih rai pơ anai kiăng ngă!” Tui anŭn, gơñu rai jĕ, mă Yêsu laih anŭn čaŏ hĭ Ñu. 
And behold, one of those with Jesus stretched out his hand and drew his sword, and smiting the bondman of the high priest took off his ear. @ Laih anŭn anai nê, sa čô amăng ƀing dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Yêsu suă đao, koh hlŭn khua ngă yang prŏng hloh djơ̆ ƀơi tơngia ñu tơĭ hĭ.
Then saith Jesus to him, Return thy sword to its place; for all who take the sword shall perish by the sword. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ ñu: “Jek glaĭ bĕ đao ih amăng hrŭm; yua kơ hlơi pô yua đao ñu či djai răm hăng đao mơ̆n. 
Or thinkest thou that I cannot now call upon my Father, and he will furnish me more than twelve legions of angels? @ Ih pơmĭn Kâo ƀu dưi ôh hă rơkâo kơ Ama, laih anŭn Ñu či pơkiaŏ rai mơtam kơ Kâo rơbeh kơ pluh dua phung tơhan ling jang? 
How then should the scriptures be fulfilled that thus it must be? @ Samơ̆ tơdah tui anŭn, hyư̆m dưi pơsĭt Hră Ơi Adai pơhiăp hmâo čih laih kơ tơlơi anai?”
In that hour Jesus said to the crowds, Are ye come out as against a robber with swords and sticks to take me? I sat daily [with you] teaching in the temple, and ye did not seize me. @ Hlăk anŭn Yêsu laĭ kơ ƀing lu: “Yua hơgĕt ƀing gih djă đao laih anŭn gai kiăng mă Kâo kar hăng mă sa čô mơnuih klĕ? Rĭm hrơi Kâo dŏ pơtô amăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ samơ̆ ƀing gih ƀu mă čaŏ Kâo ôh. 
But all this is come to pass that the scriptures of the prophets may be fulfilled. Then all the disciples left him and fled. @ Samơ̆ abih bang tơlơi anai hmâo truh kiăng pơsĭt tơlơi ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo hmâo čih laih.” Hlăk anŭn abih bang ƀing ding kơna lui Ñu laih anŭn đuaĭ kơdŏp.
Now they that had seized Jesus led [him] away to Caiaphas the high priest, where the scribes and the elders were assembled. @ Ƀing mă laih Yêsu ba Ñu nao pơ sang khua ngă yang prŏng hloh Kaip. Pơ anŭn ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt hăng ƀing kŏng tha hmâo pơtŭm glaĭ laih. 
And Peter followed him at a distance, even to the palace of the high priest, and entering in sat with the officers to see the end. @ Pêtrôs đuaĭ tui Yêsu mơ̆ng ataih ataih, truh pơ wăl sang khua ngă yang prŏng hloh. Ñu mŭt dŏ ber hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing tơhan gak wai kiăng lăng hơgĕt tơlơi či truh. 
And the chief priests and the elders and the whole sanhedrim sought false witness against Jesus, so that they might put him to death. @ Hlăk anŭn ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng hăng abih bang ƀing khua phat kơđi hơduah tơlơi gơ̆ng jơlan ƀlor pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ hăng Yêsu kiăng dưi pơdjai hĭ Ñu. 
And they found none, though many false witnesses came forward. But at the last two false witnesses came forward @ Samơ̆ gơñu ƀu ƀuh hơgĕt gĕt ôh, wơ̆t dah hmâo lu mơnuih rai ngă gơ̆ng jơlan ƀlor. Đŭt tơdơi hmâo dua čô rai, 
and said, *He* said, I am able to destroy the temple of God, and in three days build it. @ hăng laĭ: “Pô anai hmâo laĭ: ‘Kâo dưi pơrai hĭ sang kơkuh pơpŭ Ơi Adai hăng pơdơ̆ng glaĭ ñu dơ̆ng amăng klâo hrơi.’”
And the high priest standing up said to him, Answerest thou nothing? What do these witness against thee? @ Khua ngă yang prŏng hloh tơgŭ hăng laĭ: “Ih ƀu hmâo laĭ glaĭ ôh hă kơ tơlơi ƀing anŭn gơ̆ng jơlan pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ hăng Ih?” 
But Jesus was silent. And the high priest answering said to him, I adjure thee by the living God that thou tell us if *thou* art the Christ the Son of God. @ Samơ̆ Yêsu kơnơ̆ng dŏ rơiăt. Khua ngă yang prŏng hloh laĭ kơ Ñu: “Kâo pơđar kơ ih hăng anăn Ơi Adai hơdip, brơi Ih ƀuăn rơ̆ng, laĭ brơi ƀing gơmơi thâo djơ̆ mơ̆ Ih jing Yang Krist, Ană Ơi Adai?”
Jesus says to him, *Thou* hast said. Moreover, I say to you, From henceforth ye shall see the Son of man sitting at the right hand of power, and coming on the clouds of heaven. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ ñu: “Ih pô hmâo laĭ laih tơlơi anŭn. Samơ̆ Kâo laĭ kơ ih, sa hrơi tơdơi ƀing ih či ƀuh Ană Mơnuih dŏ ber gah hơnuă Pô Dưi Kơtang hăng trŭn rai ƀơi hiăng adai.”
Then the high priest rent his clothes, saying, He has blasphemed: what need have we any more of witnesses? behold, now ye have heard the blasphemy. @ Hlăk anŭn khua ngă yang prŏng hloh hek ao ñu hăng laĭ: “Ñu hmâo pơhiăp pơgao hăng Ơi Adai. Hơgĕt ƀing ta kiăng hmâo ƀing mơnuih ngă gơ̆ng jơlan dơ̆ng? Ƀing gih hmư̆ laih tơlơi Ñu pơhiăp pơgao. 
What think ye? And they answering said, He is liable to the penalty of death. @ Hyư̆m ƀing gih pơmĭn?” Ƀing anŭn laĭ glaĭ: “Ñu lăp kơ djai yơh.”
Then they spit in his face, and buffeted him, and some struck him with the palms of their hand, @ Giơ̆ng anŭn gơñu kơčuh ia bah ƀơi ƀô̆ Yêsu hăng taih Ñu; hmâo đơđa pah meng Ñu, 
saying, Prophesy to us, Christ, Who is it who struck thee? @ hăng laĭ: “Ơ Yang Krist, laĭ lui hlâo brơi kơ gơmơi bĕ, hlơi pô hmâo taih Ih laih?”
But Peter sat without in the palace-court; and a maid came to him, saying, And *thou* wast with Jesus the Galilaean. @ Hlăk anŭn tơdang Pêtrôs dŏ ber pơ gah rơngiao wăl sang. Sa čô ding kơna đah kơmơi nao pơ ñu hăng laĭ: “Ih ăt jing mơnuih dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Yêsu, mơnuih Galilê mơ̆n.”
But he denied before all, saying, I do not know what thou sayest. @ Samơ̆ Pêtrôs hơngah mơtam ƀơi anăp abih bang gơñu, laĭ: “Kâo ƀu thâo ôh hơgĕt tơlơi ih laĭ anŭn.” 
And when he had gone out into the entrance, another [maid] saw him, and says to those there, This [man] also was with Jesus the Nazaraean. @ Tơdang ñu nao pơ amăng jang, sa čô ding kơna đah kơmơi pơkŏn ƀuh ñu, laĭ hăng ƀing mơnuih dŏ giăm ƀơi anŭn: “Pô anai hmâo dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Yêsu, mơnuih plei Nasaret.”
And again he denied with an oath: I do not know the man. @ Samơ̆ ñu hơngah dơ̆ng hăng ƀuăn rơ̆ng, laĭ: “Kâo ƀu thâo krăn ôh pô anŭn.”
And after a little, those who stood [there], coming to [him], said to Peter, Truly *thou* too art of them, for also thy speech makes thee manifest. @ Tơdơi kơ anŭn ƀiă ƀing dŏ giăm pơ anŭn rai laĭ kơ Pêtrôs: “Sĭt biă mă ih ăt jing sa čô amăng ƀing anŭn mơ̆n, yua kơ săp ih pơhiăp bơrơđah hlơi ih jing.”
Then he began to curse and to swear, I know not the man. And immediately [the] cock crew. @ Giơ̆ng anŭn ñu čơdơ̆ng hơtơ̆m pah ñu pô hăng tơlơi ƀuăn rơ̆ng: “Kâo ƀu thâo krăn pô anŭn ôh.” Hlăk anŭn mơtam mơnŭ tơdjô̆.
And Peter remembered the word of Jesus, who had said [to him], Before [the] cock crow thou shalt deny me thrice. And he went forth without, and wept bitterly. @ Tui anŭn Pêtrôs hơdơr glaĭ boh pơhiăp Yêsu hmâo laĭ laih: “Hlâo kơ mơnŭ tơdjô̆ ih či hơngah kơ Kâo klâo wơ̆t.” Laih anŭn ñu tơbiă pơ gah rơngiao hia rơngot biă mă.
And when it was morning all the chief priests and the elders of the people took counsel against Jesus so that they might put him to death. @ Truh ưm mơguah abih bang ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng hăng ƀing kŏng tha amăng plei pla črŏng sai ngă kơ Yêsu kiăng pơdjai Ñu. 
And having bound him they led him away, and delivered him up to Pontius Pilate, the governor. @ Gơñu čaŏ hĭ Yêsu, hăng ba Ñu nao pơ Pilat khua čar.
Then Judas, who delivered him up, seeing that he had been condemned, filled with remorse, returned the thirty pieces of silver to the chief priests and the elders, @ Tơ Yudas jing pô pơblư̆ lui Yêsu ƀuh arăng klă kơđi kơ Yêsu, Yudas hơƀlŏk kơ tơlơi soh laih anŭn ba glaĭ hĭ klâo pluh kak prăk anŭn kơ ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng hăng ƀing kŏng tha, hăng laĭ, 
saying, I have sinned [in] having delivered up guiltless blood. But they said, What is that to us? see *thou* [to that]. @ “Kâo hmâo ngă soh yua kơ jao brơi kơ ƀing gih drah Pô hơčih.” Ƀing anŭn laĭ: “Hơgĕt tơlơi anŭn djơ̆ kơ gơmơi? Anŭn jing bruă ih.”
And having cast down the pieces of silver in the temple, he left the place, and went away and hanged himself. @ Ñu glŏm hĭ prăk anŭn amăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ, laih anŭn ñu tơbiă nao hăng rot tơkuai ñu pô.
And the chief priests took the pieces of silver and said, It is not lawful to cast them into the Corban, since it is [the] price of blood. @ Samơ̆ ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng mă prăk anŭn hăng laĭ: “Ƀu phiăn ôh pioh prăk anai amăng hip pioh prăk sang kơkuh pơpŭ, yua kơ anai jing prăk nua drah.” 
And having taken counsel, they bought with them the field of the potter for a burying-ground for strangers. @ Tui anŭn gơñu črŏng sai, yua prăk anŭn blơi hmua pô bruă man lŏn, kiăng pioh dơr ƀing djuai tuai. 
Wherefore that field has been called Blood-field unto this day. @ Yua kơ anŭn arăng pơanăn hmua anŭn jing “Hmua Drah” truh pơ ră anai.
Then was fulfilled that which was spoken through Jeremias the prophet, saying, And I took the thirty pieces of silver, the price of him that was set a price on, whom [they who were] of the sons of Israel had set a price on, @ Tui anŭn pơsĭt laih tơlơi pô laĭ lui hlâo Yêrêmi laĭ: “Gơñu mă klâo pluh kak prăk anŭn, jing nua ƀing ană Israel hmâo pơkă brơi laih kơ Ñu, 
and they gave them for the field of the potter, according as [the] Lord commanded me. @ laih anŭn gơñu yua prăk anŭn blơi hmua pô bruă man lŏn, tui hăng Khua Yang hmâo pơtă brơi kâo.”
But Jesus stood before the governor. And the governor questioned him, saying, Art *thou* the King of the Jews? And Jesus said to him, Thou sayest. @ Yêsu dŏ gah anăp khua čar; laih anŭn khua čar tơña Ñu: “Djơ̆ mơ̆ Ih jing pơtao ană Yuđa?” Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Djơ̆ tui hăng ih laĭ laih.” 
And when he was accused of the chief priests and the elders, he answered nothing. @ Samơ̆ tơ ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng hăng ƀing kŏng tha phong pơčŭt kơ Ñu, Ñu ƀu laĭ glaĭ ôh.
Then says Pilate to him, Hearest thou not how many things they witness against thee? @ Tui anŭn, Pilat laĭ kơ Ñu: “Ih ƀu hmư̆ ôh hă gơñu phong pơčŭt lu tơlơi pơkơdơ̆ng hăng Ih?”
And he answered him not so much as one word, so that the governor wondered exceedingly. @ Samơ̆ Yêsu ƀu laĭ glaĭ ôh, wơ̆t dah kơnơ̆ng sa boh pơhiăp đôč. Yua kơ anŭn khua čar hling hlang biă mă.
Now at [the] feast the governor was accustomed to release one prisoner to the crowd, whom they would. @ Rĭm phĕt Tơlơi Găn khua čar hmâo tơlơi phiăn phư sa čô mơnă tui hăng ƀing ană plei rơkâo. 
And they had then a notable prisoner, named Barabbas. @ Hlăk anŭn hmâo sa čô mơnă anăn ñu Yêsu Barabas, hing ang sat biă mă. 
They therefore being gathered together, Pilate said to them, Whom will ye that I release to you, Barabbas, or Jesus who is called Christ? @ Tui anŭn tơdang ƀing mơnuih lu pơtŭm glaĭ, Pilat tơña ƀing gơñu: “Hlơi pô ƀing gih kiăng kâo phư brơi, Yêsu Barabas ƀôdah Yêsu arăng iâu Krist?” 
For he knew that they had delivered him up through envy. @ Yua kơ ñu thâo arăng jao Yêsu kơ ñu yua kơ tơlơi gơñu moañ.
But, as he was sitting on the judgment-seat, his wife sent to him, saying, Have thou nothing to do with that righteous [man]; for I have suffered to-day many things in a dream because of him. @ Tơdang ñu dŏ ƀơi gre phat kơđi, bơnai ñu pơkiaŏ nao arăng laĭ kơ ñu: “Anăm ngă tơlơi hơgĕt ôh kơ mơnuih hiam tơpă anŭn, yua kơ Ñu yơh ră anai amăng tơlơi rơpơi kâo hmâo lu tơlơi rŭng răng.”
But the chief priests and the elders persuaded the crowds that they should beg for Barabbas, and destroy Jesus. @ Samơ̆ ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng hăng ƀing kŏng tha pơsur ƀing ană plei pla rơkâo pŏk Barabas laih anŭn pơdjai Yêsu. 
And the governor answering said to them, Which of the two will ye that I release unto you? And they said, Barabbas. @ Khua čar tơña kơ ƀing gơñu dơ̆ng: “Hlơi amăng ƀing dua čô anai ƀing gih kiăng kơ kâo pŏk brơi ƀing gih?” Gơñu laĭ glaĭ: “Barabas.” 
Pilate says to them, What then shall I do with Jesus, who is called Christ? They all say, Let him be crucified. @ Pilat laĭ kơ gơñu: “Tui anŭn hơgĕt kâo či ngă hăng Yêsu arăng iâu Krist?” Abih bang gơñu laĭ: “Pơ̆ng hĭ Ñu ƀơi kơyâo bơrơkal!” 
And the governor said, What evil then has he done? But they cried more than ever, saying, Let him be crucified. @ Tui anŭn Pilat tơña: “Yua hơgĕt, hơgĕt tơlơi sat Ñu hmâo ngă?” Samơ̆ abih bang ƀing gơñu ur kơtang hloh dơ̆ng: “Pơ̆ng hĭ Ñu ƀơi kơyâo bơrơkal.”
And Pilate, seeing that it availed nothing, but that rather a tumult was arising, having taken water, washed his hands before the crowd, saying, I am guiltless of the blood of this righteous one: see *ye* [to it]. @ Tui anŭn Pilat thâo ñu ƀu dưi ngă hơgĕt ôh, samơ̆ hmâo dơnai pơrơông pơrơang jai kơtang hloh dơ̆ng, ñu mă ia laih anŭn rao tơngan ñu ƀơi anăp ƀing mơnuih lu anŭn hăng laĭ: “Kâo ƀu soh hăng drah mơnuih anai ôh! Anai jing bruă ƀing gih ngă!” 
And all the people answering said, His blood [be] on us and on our children. @ Abih bang ƀing ană plei pla laĭ glaĭ: “Brơi drah ñu lĕ ƀơi ƀing gơmơi hăng ƀơi ƀing ană gơmơi!” 
Then he released to them Barabbas; but Jesus, having scourged [him], he delivered up that he might be crucified. @ Tui anŭn Pilat pŏk Barabas brơi kơ ƀing gơñu, laih anŭn brơi arăng taih Yêsu hăng gai, ñu jao Yêsu brơi arăng pơ̆ng ƀơi kơyâo bơrơkal.
Then the soldiers of the governor, having taken Jesus with [them] to the praetorium, gathered against him the whole band, @ Hlăk anŭn ƀing tơhan khua čar ba Yêsu amăng sang khua čar, laih anŭn abih bang tơpul tơhan gơñu pơƀŭt glaĭ jum dar Ñu. 
and having taken off his garment, put on him a scarlet cloak; @ Gơñu toh hĭ ao Ñu hăng buh brơi Ñu ao phyung mriah. 
and having woven a crown out of thorns, they put it on his head, and a reed in his right hand; and, bowing the knee before him, they mocked him, saying, Hail, King of the Jews! @ Giơ̆ng anŭn gơñu mơñam sa boh mŭk pơtao hăng drơi, truă ƀơi akŏ Yêsu, laih anŭn dưm sa ƀĕ trang bô kơ tơlơi gĭt gai ƀơi tơngan hơnuă Ñu. Gơñu tŏ tơŭt ƀơi anăp Yêsu hăng djik djak tui anai: “Kơkuh kơ Ih, Ơ Pơtao ană Yuđa!” 
And having spit upon him, they took the reed and beat [him] on his head. @ Gơñu kơčuh ia bah ƀơi Ñu, laih anŭn mă gai trang bô anŭn taih jeñ ƀơi akŏ Ñu. 
And when they had mocked him, they took the cloak off him, and put his own clothes on him, and led him away to crucify. @ Giơ̆ng gơñu djik djak Yêsu laih, gơñu toh hĭ ao phyung mriah laih anŭn buh glaĭ ao Ñu, giơ̆ng anŭn gơñu ba Yêsu nao pơ anih kiăng pơ̆ng hĭ Ñu ƀơi kơyâo bơrơkal.
And as they went forth they found a man of Cyrene, Simon by name; him they compelled to go [with them] that he might bear his cross. @ Tơdang gơñu rơbat nao, gơñu ƀuh sa čô mơnuih mơ̆ng plei Siren, anăn gơ̆ Simôn. Gơñu pơgŏ gơ̆ glăm kơyâo bơrơkal Yêsu. 
And having come to a place called Golgotha, which means Place of a skull, @ Tơ gơñu truh ƀơi anih arăng pơanăn Gôlgôtha (Kiăng pia anih klang akŏ), 
they gave to him to drink vinegar mingled with gall; and having tasted [it], he would not drink. @ gơñu brơi Yêsu mơñum tơpai lŭk hăng ia jrao phĭ; samơ̆ tơ Ñu liah lăng, Ñu hơngah ƀu mơñum ôh.
And having crucified him, they parted his clothes amongst [themselves], casting lots. @ Laih anŭn tơ gơñu pơ̆ng Yêsu ƀơi kơyâo bơrơkal laih, gơñu mă črăm pơpha sum ao Yêsu. 
And sitting down, they kept guard over him there. @ Giơ̆ng anŭn gơñu dŏ ber gak wai Ñu ƀơi anŭn. 
And they set up over his head his accusation written: This is Jesus, the King of the Jews. @ Ƀơi gah ngŏ akŏ Yêsu, gơñu pioh sa pŏk hơnal čih tơlơi phong kơđi pơkơdơ̆ng hăng Ñu tui anai: “ANAI JING YÊSU, PƠTAO ANĂ YUĐA.” 
Then are crucified with him two robbers, one on the right hand and one on the left. @ Hlăk anŭn, hmâo dua čô mơnuih klĕ arăng pơ̆ng hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Yêsu, sa čô gah hơnuă, sa čô gah iao.
But the passers-by reviled him, shaking their heads @ Ƀing mơnuih găn nao ƀơi anŭn djik djak, tơtah akŏ, 
and saying, Thou that destroyest the temple and buildest it in three days, save thyself. If thou art Son of God, descend from the cross. @ hăng laĭ: “Ŏng yơh jing pô kiăng pơrai sang kơkuh pơpŭ laih anŭn pơdơ̆ng glaĭ ñu dơ̆ng amăng klâo hrơi, pơklaih bĕ ŏng pô! Tơdah ŏng jing Ană Ơi Adai, trŭn bĕ mơ̆ng kơyâo bơrơkal!”
[And] in like manner the chief priests also, mocking, with the scribes and elders, said, @ Kar kaĭ mơ̆n wơ̆t ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt laih anŭn ƀing kŏng tha djik djak kơ Yêsu laih anŭn laĭ, 
He saved others, himself he cannot save. He is King of Israel: let him descend now from the cross, and we will believe on him. @ “Ñu hmâo pơklaih laih arăng, samơ̆ Ñu ƀu dưi pơklaih ôh Ñu pô. Ñu jing pơtao ană Israel; brơi Ñu trŭn mơ̆ng kơyâo bơrơkal ră anai ƀing ta či đaŏ Ñu yơh. 
He trusted upon God; let him save him now if he will [have] him. For he said, I am Son of God. @ Ñu đaŏ kơnang kơ Ơi Adai; brơi Ơi Adai pơklaih Ñu ră anai tơdah Ơi Adai khăp kiăng kơ Ñu; yua kơ Ñu laĭ: ‘Kâo jing Ană Ơi Adai!’” 
And the robbers also who had been crucified with him cast the same reproaches on him. @ Wơ̆t ƀing klĕ arăng pơ̆ng ƀơi kơyâo bơrơkal hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Ñu ăt toh djraĭ kơ Ñu kar kaĭ mơ̆n.
Now from [the] sixth hour there was darkness over the whole land until [the] ninth hour; @ Mơ̆ng mông tal năm truh pơ mông tal dua rơpăn hmâo tơlơi kơnăm mơmŏt gom abih čar anŭn. 
but about the ninth hour Jesus cried out with a loud voice, saying, Eli, Eli, lama sabachthani? that is, My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me? @ Kơplah wah mông tal dua rơpăn Yêsu iâu kraih kơtang: “Êli! Êli! Lama sabaktani?” Kiăng laĭ: “Ơ Ơi Adai kâo, Ơ Ơi Adai kâo, yua hơgĕt Ih lui hĭ Kâo?” 
And some of those who stood there, when they heard [it], said, This [man] calls for Elias. @ Hmâo đơđa ƀing mơnuih dŏ jĕ pơ anŭn hmư̆ tơlơi anŭn, gơñu laĭ: “Pô anai iâu Êli.” 
And immediately one of them running and getting a sponge, having filled [it] with vinegar and fixed [it] on a reed, gave him to drink. @ Tañ mơtam sa čô amăng ƀing gơñu nao mă pông diăn añrŭ amăng ia tơpai mơsăm, kă ƀơi jŭng gai trang bô, laih anŭn yơr brơi Yêsu mơñum. 
But the rest said, Let be; let us see if Elias comes to save him. @ Samơ̆ ƀing pơkŏn laĭ: “Tơguan amơĭ! Brơi ƀing ta dŏ krăp lăng thâo dah Êli rai pơklaih Ñu mơ̆n thâo.”
And Jesus, having again cried with a loud voice, gave up the ghost. @ Yêsu ur kraih kơtang sa wơ̆t dơ̆ng laih anŭn tơĭ pran.
And lo, the veil of the temple was rent in two from the top to the bottom, and the earth was shaken, and the rocks were rent, @ Laih anŭn anai nê, khăn păng amăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ tơhek hĭ jing dua mơ̆ng ngŏ truh pơ yŭ; lŏn pơpư̆ pơgơi, lu boh pơtâo čơđang pơčah hĭ; 
and the tombs were opened; and many bodies of the saints fallen asleep arose, @ kar kaĭ mơ̆n lu pơsat čơđang pŏk hĭ, lu drơi jan ƀing rơgoh hiam hmâo djai laih hơdip glaĭ. 
and going out of the tombs after his arising, entered into the holy city and appeared unto many. @ Laih anŭn tơbiă mơ̆ng pơsat. Giơ̆ng kơ Yêsu hơdip glaĭ, ƀing rơgoh hiam anŭn mŭt amăng plei rơgoh hiam hăng bơrơđah brơi kơ lu mơnuih.
But the centurion, and they who were with him on guard over Jesus, seeing the earthquake and the things that took place, feared greatly, saying, Truly this [man] was Son of God. @ Tơ khua tơhan hăng ƀing tơhan gak wai Yêsu, ƀuh tơlơi lŏn tơnah pơpư̆ laih anŭn abih bang tơlơi hmâo truh laih, gơñu hwĭ biă mă hăng laĭ: “Sĭt biă mă Mơnuih anai jing Ană Ơi Adai!”
And there were there many women beholding from afar off, who had followed Jesus from Galilee ministering to him, @ Kar kaĭ mơ̆n pơ anŭn hmâo lu ƀing đah kơmơi dŏ lăng mơ̆ng ataih, ƀing hmâo tui Yêsu mơ̆ng kwar Galilê jing ƀing hmâo mă bruă laih kơ Ñu. 
among whom was Mary of Magdala, and Mary the mother of James and Joses, and the mother of the sons of Zebedee. @ Amăng ƀing anŭn hmâo HʼMari Madala, HʼMari amĭ Yakơ hăng Yôsep, wơ̆t amĭ ƀing ană đah rơkơi Sêbêdê.
Now when even was come there came a rich man of Arimathaea, his name Joseph, who also himself was a disciple to Jesus. @ Tơ adai klam laih, hmâo sa čô đah rơkơi pơdrŏng rai, anăn ñu Yôsep mơ̆ng plei Arimathê; ñu ăt jing sa čô ding kơna Yêsu mơ̆n. 
*He*, going to Pilate, begged the body of Jesus. Then Pilate commanded the body to be given up. @ Ñu nao pơ Pilat hăng rơkâo drơi jan Yêsu. Pilat pơđar kơ arăng brơi drơi jan Yêsu kơ ñu. 
And Joseph having got the body, wrapped it in a clean linen cloth, @ Yôsep mă drơi jan, ñu pŏn lom Ñu hăng khăn kơbuă rơgoh, 
and laid it in his new tomb which he had hewn in the rock; and having rolled a great stone to the door of the tomb, went away. @ laih anŭn pơđih Yêsu amăng pơsat phrâo, Yôsep hmâo phă laih pioh kơ ñu pô. Ñu tơglung sa boh pơtâo prŏng kơđơ̆l hĭ bah amăng pơsat, giơ̆ng anŭn ñu glaĭ yơh. 
But Mary of Magdala was there, and the other Mary, sitting opposite the sepulchre. @ HʼMari Madala hăng HʼMari pơkŏn dŏ ber klă anăp pơsat.
Now on the morrow, which is after the preparation, the chief priests and the Pharisees came together to Pilate, @ Hrơi tŏ tui, hrơi tơdơi kơ hrơi prăp rơmet phĕt Tơlơi Găn, ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng hăng ƀing Pharisi pơƀŭt glaĭ ƀơi anăp Pilat, 
saying, Sir, we have called to mind that that deceiver said when he was still alive, After three days I arise. @ hăng laĭ: “Ơ khua, gơmơi hơdơr tơdang dŏ hơdip mơnuih ƀlor anŭn laĭ tui anai: ‘Kloh klâo hrơi Kâo či hơdip glaĭ dơ̆ng.’ 
Command therefore that the sepulchre be secured until the third day, lest his disciples should come and steal him away, and say to the people, He is risen from the dead; and the last error shall be worse than the first. @ Tui anŭn rơkâo kơ ih pơđar arăng gak wai pơsat ten en tơl truh hrơi tal klâo, hwĭ kơ ƀing ding kơna Ñu nao klĕ mă drơi jan Ñu laih anŭn nao laĭ pơthâo kơ ƀing ană plei: ‘Ñu hơdip glaĭ laih mơ̆ng ƀing djai.’ Tơlơi ƀlor tơdơi anŭn či jing sat hloh kơ hlâo dơ̆ng.” 
And Pilate said to them, Ye have a watch: go, secure it as well as ye know how. @ Pilat laĭ kơ gơñu: “Ƀing gih hmâo laih ƀing tơhan gak; nao bĕ, laih anŭn gak wai pơsat ten en tui hăng tơlơi ƀing gih thâo.” 
And they went and secured the sepulchre, having sealed the stone, with the watch [besides]. @ Tui anŭn gơñu nao kơđŏm hnal boh pơtâo kơđơ̆l bah amăng pơsat, laih anŭn pioh ƀing tơhan gak wai.
Now late on sabbath, as it was the dusk of the next day after sabbath, came Mary of Magdala and the other Mary to look at the sepulchre. @ Tơdơi kơ hrơi saƀat, hlăk sêng brêng ưm mơguah hrơi tal sa amăng hrơi kơ̆m, HʼMari Madala hăng HʼMari pơkŏn nao čuă lăng pơsat. 
And behold, there was a great earthquake; for an angel of [the] Lord, descending out of heaven, came and rolled away the stone and sat upon it. @ Laih anŭn, anai nê blĭp blăp mơtam hmâo tơlơi pơpư̆ lŏn tơnah kơtang, yua kơ hmâo sa čô ling jang Khua Yang trŭn mơ̆ng adai rai tơglung lui hĭ hnal boh pơtâo kơđơ̆l bah amăng pơsat, laih anŭn dŏ ber ƀơi hăng ngŏ boh pơtâo anŭn. 
And his look was as lightning, and his clothing white as snow. @ Rup ñu bơngač bang kar hăng kơmlă, ao ñu kŏ kar hăng pler. 
And for fear of him the guards trembled and became as dead men. @ Ƀing tơhan hwĭ kơ ñu, tơtư̆ tơl jing hĭ kar hăng mơnuih djai.
And the angel answering said to the women, Fear not *ye*, for I know that ye seek Jesus the crucified one. @ Samơ̆ ling jang hiam laĭ kơ ƀing đah kơmơi: “Anăm hwĭ ôh; yua kơ kâo thâo ƀing ih nao sem lăng Yêsu, Pô arăng hmâo pơ̆ng laih ƀơi kơyâo bơrơkal. 
He is not here, for he is risen, as he said. Come, see the place where the Lord lay. @ Ñu ƀu dŏ pơ anai ôh, yua kơ Ñu hơdip glaĭ laih kar hăng Ñu hmâo laĭ laih. Rai lăng bĕ anih Ñu hmâo đih laih. 
And go quickly and say to his disciples that he is risen from the dead; and behold, he goes before you into Galilee, there shall ye see him. Behold, I have told you. @ Tui anŭn nao tañ bĕ laĭ pơthâo kơ ƀing ding kơna Ñu: ‘Ñu hơdip glaĭ laih mơ̆ng tơlơi djai, laih anŭn anai nê, Ñu nao hlâo kơ ƀing gih pơ kwar Galilê. Pơ anŭn ƀing gih či ƀuh Ñu.’ Anai yơh, tơlơi kâo laĭ brơi kơ ƀing gih.”
And going out quickly from the tomb with fear and great joy, they ran to bring his disciples word. @ Tui anŭn tañ mơtam gơñu đuaĭ mơ̆ng pơsat hăng tơlơi hwĭ wơ̆t hăng tơlơi hơ̆k mơak biă mă, laih anŭn nao laĭ pơthâo kơ ƀing ding kơna Ñu.
And as they went to bring his disciples word, behold also, Jesus met them, saying, Hail! And they coming up took him by the feet, and did him homage. @ Plŭt mơtam Yêsu bưp ƀing đah kơmơi anŭn hăng laĭ: “Kơkuh kơ ƀing gih!” Gơñu nao giăm, kuar tơkai Yêsu laih anŭn bon kơkuh kơ Ñu. 
Then Jesus says to them, Fear not; go, bring word to my brethren that they go into Galilee, and there they shall see me. @ Laih anŭn Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Anăm hwĭ ôh; nao laĭ pơthâo kơ ƀing adơi ayŏng Kâo, brơi gơñu nao pơ kwar Galilê, pơ anŭn gơñu či ƀuh Kâo.”
And as they went, behold, some of the watch went into the city, and brought word to the chief priests of all that had taken place. @ Tơdang gơñu nao, hmâo đơđa ƀing tơhan gak wai mŭt amăng plei Yêrusalem pơthâo glaĭ kơ ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng abih tơlơi hmâo truh laih. 
And having assembled with the elders, and having taken counsel, they gave a large sum of money to the soldiers, @ Giơ̆ng kơ ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng bơjơnum črŏng sai hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing kŏng tha; gơñu brơi kơ ƀing tơhan sa nua prăk lu biă mă, 
saying, Say that his disciples coming by night stole him [while] we [were] sleeping. @ hăng pơtă tui anai: “Ƀing gih khŏm laĭ kơ ƀing ană plei pla: ‘Amăng mlam tơdang ƀing gơmơi dŏ pĭt ƀing ding kơna Ñu rai klĕ mă drơi jan Yêsu.’ 
And if this should come to the hearing of the governor, *we* will persuade him, and save *you* from all anxiety. @ Tơdah khua kwar hmư̆ tơlơi anŭn, ƀing gơmơi či alum pơđur ñu, hăng pơgang brơi ƀing gih huaĭ hmâo tơlơi rŭng bơngơ̆t ôh.”
And they took the money and did as they had been taught. And this report is current among the Jews until this day. @ Tui anŭn ƀing tơhan mă prăk anŭn hăng ngă tui kar hăng tơlơi arăng hmâo pơtă laih kơ gơñu; tơlơi anŭn arăng ăt dŏ ruai glaĭ tơ̆ng krah ƀing Yuđa truh pơ hrơi anai.
But the eleven disciples went into Galilee to the mountain which Jesus had appointed them. @ Pluh sa čô ƀing ding kơna nao pơ kwar Galilê, truh pơ čư̆ Yêsu hmâo pơtă laih kơ ƀing gơñu hlâo. 
And when they saw him, they did homage to him: but some doubted. @ Tơ gơñu ƀuh Yêsu, gơñu bon kơkuh kơ Ñu, samơ̆ hmâo đơđa mơnuih dŏ đing. 
And Jesus coming up spoke to them, saying, All power has been given me in heaven and upon earth. @ Yêsu nao giăm gơñu hăng laĭ: “Abih bang tơlơi dưi amăng adai laih anŭn ƀơi lŏn tơnah hmâo jao brơi laih kơ Kâo. 
Go [therefore] and make disciples of all the nations, baptising them to the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit; @ Tui anŭn, nao bĕ laih anŭn pơjing abih bang djuai mơnuih jing hĭ ding kơna Kâo, ngă ƀatem kơ ƀing gơñu hăng anăn Ama, Ană, laih anŭn Yang Bơngăt Hiam; 
teaching them to observe all things whatsoever I have enjoined you. And behold, *I* am with you all the days, until the completion of the age. @ laih anŭn pơhrăm gơñu tui gưt abih bang tơlơi Kâo hmâo pơtă laih kơ ƀing gih. Laih anŭn brơi ƀing gih hơdơr, Kâo dŏ hrŏm hăng ƀing gih nanao tơl đŭt lŏn tơnah.”
Beginning of the glad tidings of Jesus Christ, Son of God; @ Čơdơ̆ng phŭn kơ Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam kơ Yêsu Krist, Ană Ơi Adai. 
as it is written in [Isaiah] the prophet, Behold, *I* send my messenger before thy face, who shall prepare thy way. @ Kar hăng Êsai pô laĭ lui hlâo hmâo čih laih:
“Anai nê, Kâo pơkiaŏ pô pơala Kâo nao hlâo ƀơi anăp Ih,
Ñu či pơkra jơlan kơ Ih.
Voice of one crying in the wilderness, Prepare the way of [the] Lord, make his paths straight. @ Hmâo asăp mơnuih pơhiăp kraih amăng tơdrŏn tač:
Pơkra bĕ jơlan kơ Khua Yang,
Ngă pơtơpă bĕ jơlan Ñu.”
There came John baptising in the wilderness, and preaching [the] baptism of repentance for remission of sins. @ Yôhan hmâo rai laih amăng tơdrŏn tač, ñu pơtô laih anŭn ngă ƀatem kơ tơlơi kơhmal tơlơi soh kiăng hmâo tơlơi Ơi Adai pap brơi tơlơi soh. 
And there went out to him all the district of Judaea, and all they of Jerusalem, and were baptised by him in the river Jordan, confessing their sins. @ Abih bang mơnuih mơ̆ng tring Yuđa hăng abih bang ană plei Yêrusalem leng nao pơ ñu. Gơñu pơhaih tơlơi soh hăng tŭ Yôhan ngă brơi ƀatem kơ gơñu amăng ia krong Yurdan.
And John was clothed in camel's hair, and a leathern girdle about his loins, and ate locusts and wild honey. @  Yôhan buh ao blâu aseh samô, hăng hrăng hơdrăng kơiăng klĭ. Ñu ƀơ̆ng kơtop hăng ia hơni glai. 
And he preached, saying, There comes he that is mightier than I after me, the thong of whose sandals I am not fit to stoop down and unloose. @ Ñu pơtô tui anai: “Pô rai tơdơi kơ kâo, jing mơyang hloh kơ kâo, laih anŭn kâo ƀu lăp ôh tơkui kleh hrĕ klĭ juă Ñu. 
*I* indeed have baptised you with water, but *he* shall baptise you with [the] Holy Spirit. @ Kâo ngă ƀatem kơ ƀing gih hăng ia, samơ̆ Ñu či ngă ƀatem kơ ƀing gih hăng Yang Bơngăt Hiam.”
And it came to pass in those days [that] Jesus came from Nazareth of Galilee, and was baptised by John at the Jordan. @ Amăng khul hrơi anŭn, Yêsu rai mơ̆ng plei Nasaret kwar Galilê, laih anŭn Yôhan ngă ƀatem kơ Ñu amăng ia krong Yurdan. 
And straightway going up from the water, he saw the heavens parting asunder, and the Spirit, as a dove, descending upon him. @ Tơdang Yêsu tơgŭ mơ̆ng ia, Ñu ƀuh khul adai pŏk, laih anŭn Yang Bơngăt Hiam trŭn găm ƀơi Ñu kar hăng sa drơi čĭm bơrơgơ̆m. 
And there came a voice out of the heavens: *Thou* art my beloved Son, in thee I have found my delight. @ Laih anŭn hmâo asăp pơhiăp mơ̆ng adai laĭ: “Ih jing Ană Kâo khăp hơeng, amăng Ih Kâo hmâo tơlơi hơ̆k mơak biă mă.”
And immediately the Spirit drives him out into the wilderness. @ Tañ mơtam Yang Bơngăt Hiam pơtrŭt Ñu nao pơ tơdrŏn tač. 
And he was in the wilderness forty days tempted by Satan, and was with the wild beasts; and the angels ministered to him. @ Ñu dŏ amăng tơdrŏn tač pă pluh hrơi, laih anŭn tŭ tơlơi satan plư Ñu. Ñu dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng hlô glai; laih anŭn ƀing ling jang Ơi Adai djru Ñu.
But after John was delivered up, Jesus came into Galilee preaching the glad tidings of the kingdom of God, @ Giơ̆ng kơ arăng krư̆ hĭ Yôhan, Yêsu nao pơ kwar Galilê pơtô Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam Ơi Adai. 
and saying, The time is fulfilled and the kingdom of God has drawn nigh; repent and believe in the glad tidings. @ Ñu laĭ: “Mông truh laih, laih anŭn dêh čar pơtao Ơi Adai hmâo rai giăm yơh. Kơhmal bĕ tơlơi soh laih anŭn đaŏ kơ Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam.”
And walking by the sea of Galilee, he saw Simon, and Andrew, [Simon's] brother, casting out a net in the sea, for they were fishers. @ Tơdang Yêsu rơbat kơtuai hang ia rơsĭ Galilê, Ñu ƀuh Simôn hăng Andrê adơi Simôn. Gơñu dŏ dăng hơñual amăng ia rơsĭ, yua kơ gơñu jing mơnuih trah akan. 
And Jesus said to them, Come after me, and I will make you become fishers of men; @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Đuaĭ tui Kâo bĕ, laih anŭn Kâo či pơjing ƀing gih mơnuih trah mơnuih.” 
and straightway leaving their trawl-nets they followed him. @ Tañ mơtam gơñu lui hĭ hơñual gơñu hăng đuaĭ tui Yêsu.
And going on thence a little, he saw James the [son] of Zebedee, and John his brother, and these [were] in the ship repairing the trawl-nets; @ Tơ Ñu nao ataih ƀiă, Ñu ƀuh Yakơ ană đah rơkơi Sêbêdê hăng Yôhan adơi ñu, gơñu dŏ pơsir hơñual amăng sŏng. 
and straightway he called them; and leaving their father Zebedee in the ship with the hired servants, they went away after him. @ Tañ mơtam Yêsu iâu gơñu; gơñu lui hĭ ama gơñu Sêbêdê amăng sŏng hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing mơnuih mă bruă apah, laih anŭn đuaĭ tui Yêsu.
And they go into Capernaum. And straightway on the sabbath he entered into the synagogue and taught. @ Gơñu nao pơ plei Kapernum; amăng hrơi saƀat Yêsu mŭt amăng sang bơjơnum Yuđa laih anŭn pơtô pơhrăm. 
And they were astonished at his doctrine, for he taught them as having authority, and not as the scribes. @ Abih mơnuih leng kơ hling hlang kơ tơlơi Ñu pơtô, yua kơ Ñu pơtô kơ ƀing gơ̆ ƀu djơ̆ kar hăng ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt ôh, kơđai glaĭ, Ñu pơtô hăng tơlơi dưi.
And there was in their synagogue a man [possessed] by an unclean spirit, and he cried out @ Hlăk anŭn, amăng sang bơjơnum ƀing gơñu hmâo sa čô mơnuih hmâo yang bơngăt grĭ hơƀak dŏ amăng ñu; 
saying, Eh! what have we to do with thee, Jesus, Nazarene? Art thou come to destroy us? I know thee who thou art, the holy one of God. @ gơ̆ ur: “Ơ Yêsu plei Nasaret, hơgĕt tơlơi Ih hmâo hăng gơmơi? Ih rai kiăng pơrai gơmơi hă? Kâo thâo hlơi Ih jing, Ih jing Pô Rơgoh Hiam mơ̆ng Ơi Adai.”
And Jesus rebuked him, saying, Hold thy peace and come out of him. @ Samơ̆ Yêsu ƀuah ñu, hăng laĭ: “Dŏ rơiăt hăng tơbiă bĕ mơ̆ng mơnuih anai.”
And the unclean spirit, having torn him, and uttered a cry with a loud voice, came out of him. @ Yang bơngăt grĭ hơƀak prăh kơñak drơi jan ñu, ur kraih laih anŭn tơbiă mơ̆ng mơnuih anŭn. 
And all were amazed, so that they questioned together among themselves, saying, What is this? what new doctrine is this? for with authority he commands even the unclean spirits, and they obey him. @ Abih bang gơñu leng kơ hling hlang, hăng tơña tơdruă gơñu: “Hơgĕt tơlơi anai? Sa tơlơi pơhrăm phrâo hă? Hăng tơlơi dưi Ñu pơđar wơ̆t kơ ƀing yang bơngăt grĭ hơƀak, laih anŭn gơñu ăt gưt kơ Ñu mơ̆n!”
And his fame went out straightway into the whole region of Galilee around. @ Laih anŭn tañ mơtam tơlơi hing ang Ñu arăng hmư̆ tar ƀar tring jum dar kwar Galilê.
And straightway going out of the synagogue, they came with James and John into the house of Simon and Andrew. @ Tơbiă mơ̆ng sang bơjơnum, Yêsu hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Yakơ laih anŭn Yôhan nao tơpă pơ sang Simôn hăng Andrê. 
And the mother-in-law of Simon lay in a fever. And straightway they speak to him about her. @ Tơhmua đah kơmơi Simôn duăm dŏ đih ƀơi sưng. Gơñu laĭ pơthâo kơ Yêsu mơtam kơ tơlơi gơ̆ ruă pơgrŭn. 
And he went up to [her] and raised her up, having taken her by the hand, and straightway the fever left her, and she served them. @ Yêsu nao giăm, mă tơngan gơ̆ hăng rŭ tơgŭ, tơlơi pơgrŭn gơ̆ suaih mơtam, laih anŭn gơ̆ čơdơ̆ng buih bruă kơ gơñu.
But evening being come, when the sun had gone down, they brought to him all that were suffering, and those possessed by demons; @ Ƀơi yang hrơi lĕ klam anŭn, arăng ba nao pơ Yêsu abih bang ƀing duăm ruă hăng ƀing hmâo yang sat ngă. 
and the whole city was gathered together at the door. @ Abih bang ƀing mơnuih amăng plei anŭn pơtŭm glaĭ ƀơi anăp bah amăng. 
And he healed many suffering from various diseases; and he cast out many demons, and did not suffer the demons to speak because they knew him. @ Yêsu pơsuaih lu mơnuih hmâo tơlơi ruă phara phara hăng puh pơđuaĭ lu yang sat. Ñu khă ƀu brơi yang sat pơhiăp ôh, yua kơ ƀing gơñu thâo krăn Yêsu.
And rising in the morning long before day, he went out and went away into a desert place, and there prayed. @ Mơ̆ng mơguah ưm, tơdang adai ăt dŏ mơmŏt Yêsu tơgŭ hăng tơbiă nao pơ anih hơđơ̆ng rơiăt, hăng iâu laĭ pơ anŭn. 
And Simon and those with him went after him: @ Simôn hăng ƀing hrŏm hơbĭt hăng gơñu tui sem Yêsu. 
and having found him, they say to him, All seek thee. @ Tơ gơñu ƀuh Yêsu gơñu laĭ hăng Ñu: “Abih bang mơnuih hyu sem Ih.”
And he says to them, Let us go elsewhere into the neighbouring country towns, that I may preach there also, for for this purpose am I come forth. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ ƀing gơñu: “Brơi ƀing ta nao pơ plei jĕ giăm jum dar anai kiăng kơ Kâo dưi pơtô Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam pơ anŭn kar kaĭ mơ̆n; yua kơ tơlơi anŭn yơh Kâo hmâo rai laih.”
And he was preaching in their synagogues in the whole of Galilee, and casting out demons. @  Laih anŭn Yêsu nao tar ƀar kwar Galilê, pơtô amăng sang bơjơnum hăng puh pơđuaĭ ƀing yang sat.
And there comes to him a leper, beseeching him, and falling on his knees to him, and saying to him, If thou wilt thou canst cleanse me. @ Hmâo sa čô mơnuih djơ̆ phŭng nao pơ Yêsu, ñu tŏ tơŭt hăng kơwưh rơkâo: “Tơdah Ih kiăng Ih dưi pơrơgoh kâo.”
But Jesus, moved with compassion, having stretched out his hand, touched him, and says to him, I will, be thou cleansed. @ Yêsu glưh pran jua pap, yơr tơngan ruaih gơ̆, hăng laĭ kơ gơ̆: “Kâo kiăng, rơgoh bĕ.” 
And as he spoke straightway the leprosy left him, and he was cleansed. @ Tañ mơtam phŭng gơ̆ suaih hĭ, laih anŭn gơ̆ jing rơgoh yơh. 
And having sharply charged him, he straightway sent him away, @ Yêsu brơi gơ̆ nao mơtam hăng pơđar kơ gơ̆ hăng tơlơi khĭp kơtang, 
and says to him, See thou say nothing to any one, but go, shew thyself to the priest, and offer for thy cleansing what Moses ordained, for a testimony to them. @ “Răng bĕ, anăm laĭ tơlơi anai kơ arăng ôh, samơ̆ nao pơdah ih pô kơ khua ngă yang, laih anŭn pơyơr mơnơ̆ng ngă yang yua kơ tơlơi ih rơgoh laih kar hăng tơlơi juăt Môis hmâo pơtă laih, jing sa tơlơi gơ̆ng jơlan brơi kơ ană plei pla.”
But he, having gone forth, began to proclaim [it] much, and to spread the matter abroad, so that he could no longer enter openly into the city, but was without in desert places, and they came to him from every side. @ Samơ̆ ñu tơbiă nao hăng čơdơ̆ng ră ruai laih anŭn pơhaih tơlơi anŭn tar ƀar. Yua kơ anŭn yơh, Yêsu ƀu dưi mŭt amăng plei hăng tơlơi rơngai ôh, samơ̆ dŏ amăng anih tơdrŏn tač pơ gah rơngiao plei. Laih anŭn ƀing ană plei mơ̆ng abih bang anih jum dar nao pơ Ñu.
And he entered again into Capernaum after [several] days, and it was reported that he was at [the] house; @ Giơ̆ng kơ ƀiă hrơi mơ̆ng anŭn, Yêsu wơ̆t glaĭ pơ plei Kapernum, laih anŭn arăng thâo Ñu dŏ amăng sang. 
and straightway many were gathered together, so that there was no longer any room, not even at the door; and he spoke the word to them. @ Hnŭn yơh hmâo lu mơnuih pơtŭm glaĭ bă amăng sang tơl ƀu hmâo anih kơ gơñu ôh, wơ̆t ƀơi gah anăp bah amăng sang kŏn hmâo anih rơhông lơi. Laih anŭn Yêsu dŏ pơtô tơlơi Ơi Adai pơhiăp kơ gơñu. 
And there come to him [men] bringing a paralytic, borne by four; @ Hlăk anŭn hmâo pă čô mơnuih čơkung ba sa čô rơwen pơ Ñu. 
and, not being able to get near to him on account of the crowd, they uncovered the roof where he was, and having dug [it] up they let down the couch on which the paralytic lay. @ Yua kơ mơnuih lu, gơñu ƀu dưi ba gơ̆ nao giăm Yêsu ôh, hnŭn yơh gơñu pŏk hĭ bơbŭng sang hăng ngŏ ƀơi anih Yêsu dŏ. Mơ̆ng amăng anŭn gơñu pơañreng trŭn pô rơwen hrŏm hơbĭt hăng kiao gơ̆ đih. 
But Jesus, seeing their faith, says to the paralytic, Child, thy sins are forgiven [thee]. @ Tơ Yêsu ƀuh tơlơi đaŏ gơñu, Ñu laĭ kơ pô rơwen: “Ơ ană, tơlơi soh ih hmâo pap brơi laih.”
But certain of the scribes were there sitting, and reasoning in their hearts, @ Hmâo đơđa nai pơtô tơlơi juăt dŏ ber pơ anŭn tơña amăng pran jua gơñu, 
Why does this [man] thus speak? he blasphemes. Who is able to forgive sins except God alone? @ “Hyư̆m mơnuih anai pơhiăp pơgao tui anŭn? Ñu pơhiăp pơgao hăng Ơi Adai! Hlơi dưi pap brơi tơlơi soh, kơnơ̆ng hơjăn Ơi Adai đôč?”
And straightway Jesus, knowing in his spirit that they are reasoning thus within themselves, said to them, Why reason ye these things in your hearts? @ Amăng tơlơi pơmĭn Yêsu thâo mơtam kơ tơlơi ƀing anŭn tơña amăng tơlơi pơmĭn, laih anŭn Ñu laĭ kơ ƀing gơñu: “Hyư̆m ƀing gih hmâo tơlơi tơña amăng pran jua ƀing gih kar hăng anŭn? 
Which is easier, to say to the paralytic, [Thy] sins are forgiven [thee]; or to say, Arise, and take up thy couch and walk? @ Hơgĕt tơlơi amuñ hloh laĭ kơ pô rơwen: ‘Tơlơi soh ih hmâo pap brơi laih,’ ƀôdah laĭ: ‘Tơgŭ bĕ, mă kiao ih hăng rơbat nao?’ 
But that ye may know that the Son of man has power on earth to forgive sins, he says to the paralytic, @ Samơ̆ kiăng kơ ƀing gih dưi thâo kơ Ană Mơnuih ƀơi lŏn tơnah anai hmâo tơlơi dưi pap brơi tơlơi soh” — Ñu laĭ kơ pô rơwen: — 
To thee I say, Arise, take up thy couch and go to thine house. @ “Kâo laĭ kơ ih, tơgŭ bĕ, mă ba kiao ih hăng glaĭ pơ sang.” 
And he rose up straightway, and, having taken up his couch, went out before [them] all, so that all were amazed, and glorified God, saying, We never saw it thus. @ Pô rơwen tơgŭ, tañ mơtam mă kiao ñu hăng tơbiă nao ƀơi anăp abih bang ƀing gơñu; tui anŭn abih bang gơñu leng kơtuă hling hlang hăng pơpŭ bơni hơơč kơ Ơi Adai, hăng laĭ: “Ƀing ta aka ƀuh djơ̆ ôh tơlơi kar hăng anai.”
And he went out again by the sea, and all the crowd came to him, and he taught them. @ Yêsu tơbiă nao dơ̆ng pơ hang ia rơsĭ, laih anŭn abih bang mơnuih lu pơtŭm jum dar Ñu; laih anŭn Ñu pơtô kơ ƀing gơñu. 
And passing by, he saw Levi the [son] of Alphaeus sitting at the tax-office, and says to him, Follow me. And he rose up and followed him. @ Tơdang Yêsu găn pơ anŭn Ñu ƀuh Lêwi ană Alphê dŏ ber amăng anih ring jia, laih anŭn Ñu laĭ kơ Lêwi: “Đuaĭ tui Kâo bĕ.” Tui anŭn Lêwi tơgŭ hăng đuaĭ tui Ñu.
And it came to pass as he lay at table in his house, that many tax-gatherers and sinners lay at table with Jesus and his disciples; for they were many, and they followed him. @ Tơdang Yêsu dŏ ƀơ̆ng huă amăng sang Lêwi, hmâo lu ƀing ring jia wơ̆t ƀing mơnuih soh dŏ ber ƀơ̆ng huă hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Yêsu laih anŭn hăng ƀing ding kơna Ñu; yua kơ hmâo lu mơnuih hmâo đuaĭ tui Yêsu. 
And the scribes and the Pharisees, seeing him eating with sinners and tax-gatherers, said to his disciples, Why [is it] that he eats and drinks with tax-gatherers and sinners? @ Tơ ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt amăng ƀing Pharisi ƀuh Yêsu dŏ ƀơ̆ng huă hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing soh wơ̆t hăng ƀing ring jia, gơñu laĭ kơ ƀing ding kơna Yêsu: “Yua hơgĕt Ñu dŏ ƀơ̆ng huă hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing ring jia laih anŭn hăng ƀing mơnuih soh?”
And Jesus having heard [it] says to them, They that are strong have not need of a physician, but those who are ill. I have not come to call righteous [men], but sinners. @ Tơ Yêsu hmư̆ tơlơi anŭn, Ñu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Ƀu djơ̆ ƀing mơnuih hiam drơi jan ôh kiăng kơ nai ia jrao, samơ̆ ƀing duăm ruă. Ƀu djơ̆ Kâo rai kiăng kơ iâu ƀing mơnuih tơpă ôh, samơ̆ iâu ƀing mơnuih soh.”
And the disciples of John and the Pharisees were fasting; and they come and say to him, Why do the disciples of John and [the disciples] of the Pharisees fast, but thy disciples fast not? @ Hlăk anŭn ƀing ding kơna Yôhan hăng ƀing Pharisi hmâo tơlơi ư̆ ƀơ̆ng huă. Hmâo mơnuih rai tơña kơ Yêsu: “Yua hơgĕt ƀing ding kơna Yôhan hăng ƀing Pharisi ư̆ ƀơ̆ng huă, samơ̆ ƀing ding kơna Ih ƀu ư̆ ƀơ̆ng huă ôh?”
And Jesus said to them, Can the sons of the bride-chamber fast while the bridegroom is with them? As long as they have the bridegroom with them they cannot fast. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Dưi mơ̆ ƀing arăng iâu kơ tơlơi ƀơ̆ng huă dŏ rơkơi bơnai ư̆ ƀơ̆ng huă tơdang han tao ăt dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng gơñu? Tơdang pô dŏ bơnai ăt dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng gơñu, gơñu ƀu dưi ư̆ ƀơ̆ng huă ôh. 
But days will come when the bridegroom shall have been taken away from them, and then shall they fast in that day. @ Samơ̆ hrơi či truh tơ arăng mă pơđuaĭ hĭ pô dŏ bơnai mơ̆ng ƀing gơñu, hlăk anŭn gơñu či ư̆ ƀơ̆ng huă yơh.
No one sews a patch of new cloth on an old garment: otherwise its new filling-up takes from the old [stuff], and there is a worse rent. @ Ƀu hmâo ôh mơnuih sĭt bơnal phrâo pơklep hăng ao so. Tơdah ngă tui anŭn bơnal phrâo či pơtơĭ hĭ ao so, laih anŭn anih tơĭ či tơhek hĭ prŏng jai. 
And no one puts new wine into old skins; otherwise the wine bursts the skins, and the wine is poured out, and the skins will be destroyed; but new wine is to be put into new skins. @ Laih anŭn ƀu hmâo ôh mơnuih tro ia tơpai phrâo amăng get klĭ so; tơdah ngă tui anŭn tơpai či blôk pơčah hĭ get anŭn, tơpai či hŏk hĭ, wơ̆t get ăt či rơngiă mơ̆n.”
And it came to pass that he went on the sabbath through the cornfields; and his disciples began to walk on, plucking the ears. @  Hmâo sa hrơi saƀat Yêsu găn amăng hmua pơdai tơpŭng. Tơdang gơñu rơbat ƀing ding kơna Ñu ruač amŭng pơdai tơpŭng. 
And the Pharisees said to him, Behold, why do they on the sabbath what is not lawful? @ Ƀing Pharisi laĭ kơ Ñu: “Lăng adih, yua hơgĕt gơñu ngă tơlơi ƀu phiăn dưi ngă ôh amăng hrơi saƀat?”
And *he* said to them, Have ye never read what David did when he had need and hungered, *he* and those with him, @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Ƀing gih aka đŏk djơ̆ ôh hă tơlơi ră ruai kơ tơlơi Đawit hmâo ngă, hlăk ñu laih anŭn ƀing hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ñu rơpa? 
how he entered into the house of God, in [the section of] Abiathar [the] high priest, and ate the shew-bread, which it is not lawful unless for the priests to eat, and gave even to those that were with him? @ Amăng rơnŭk Abiathar ngă khua ngă yang prŏng hloh, ñu mŭt amăng sang Ơi Adai hăng ƀơ̆ng ƀañ tơpŭng pơyơr kơ Ơi Adai, laih anŭn brơi wơ̆t ƀing mơnuih nao hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ñu ăt ƀơ̆ng mơ̆n, wơ̆t dah ƀañ tơpŭng anŭn kơnơ̆ng pioh kơ ƀing khua ngă yang đôč dưi ƀơ̆ng, pô pơkŏn ƀu dưi ƀơ̆ng ôh.”
And he said to them, The sabbath was made on account of man, not man on account of the sabbath; @ Giơ̆ng anŭn Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Ơi Adai pơjing hrơi saƀat yua kơ ană mơnuih, ƀu djơ̆ ôh Ơi Adai pơjing ană mơnuih yua kơ hrơi saƀat. 
so that the Son of man is lord of the sabbath also. @ Tui anŭn Ană Mơnuih ăt jing khua kơ hrơi saƀat mơ̆n.”
And he entered again into the synagogue; and there was there a man having his hand dried up. @ Sa wơ̆t pơkŏn, Yêsu mŭt amăng sang bơjơnum, laih anŭn pơ anŭn hmâo sa čô đah rơkơi jo sa ƀĕ tơngan. 
And they watched him if he would heal him on the sabbath, that they might accuse him. @ Đơđa mơnuih krăp lăng sŭ Yêsu thâo dah Ñu či pơsuaih mơnuih anŭn amăng hrơi saƀat mơ̆n thâo, kiăng kơ dưi pơčŭt Ñu. 
And he says to the man who had his hand dried up, Rise up [and come] into the midst. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ đah rơkơi hmâo tơngan jo anŭn: “Tơgŭ rai dŏ tơ̆ng krah anai.” 
And he says to them, Is it lawful on the sabbath to do good or to do evil, to save life or to kill? But they were silent. @ Laih anŭn Yêsu tơña kơ gơñu: “Amăng hrơi saƀat ƀing ta dưi ngă tơlơi hiam ƀôdah ngă tơlơi sat, pơklaih mơnuih ƀôdah pơdjai mơnuih?” Samơ̆ gơñu leng kơ dŏ rơiăt. 
And looking round upon them with anger, distressed at the hardening of their heart, he says to the man, Stretch out thy hand. And he stretched [it] out, and his hand was restored. @ Ñu lăng jum dar kơ ƀing anŭn hăng tơlơi hil, rơngot kơ pran jua yua kơ gơñu kơpĭl, laih anŭn laĭ kơ đah rơkơi anŭn: “Yơr bĕ tơngan ih” Gơ̆ yơr, laih anŭn tơngan gơ̆ suaih. 
And the Pharisees going out straightway with the Herodians took counsel against him, how they might destroy him. @ Ƀing Pharisi tơbiă laih anŭn tañ mơtam gơñu črŏng sai hơgơ̆m hăng ƀing mơnuih gah kơ Hêrôt pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ Yêsu kiăng hơduah tơlơi dưi pơdjai Ñu.
And Jesus withdrew with his disciples to the sea; and a great multitude from Galilee followed him, and from Judaea, @ Yêsu hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing ding kơna nao pơ ia rơsĭ, hmâo sa phung mơnuih lu biă mă mơ̆ng kwar Galilê, mơ̆ng Yuđa đuaĭ tui Ñu, 
and from Jerusalem, and from Idumaea and beyond the Jordan; and they of around Tyre and Sidon, a great multitude, having heard what things he did, came to him. @ mơ̆ng plei Yêrusalem, mơ̆ng kwar Idumê, mơ̆ng gah dih hang ia krong Yurdan laih anŭn mơ̆ng jum dar plei Tir hăng plei Sidôn. Gơñu hmư̆ hing abih tơlơi Ñu hmâo ngă, tui anŭn gơñu rai pơ Yêsu. 
And he spoke to his disciples, in order that a little ship should wait upon him on account of the crowd, that they might not press upon him. @ Yua kơ ƀing mơnuih lu Ñu pơtă kơ ƀing ding kơna Ñu pre pioh sa boh sŏng anĕt kơ Ñu, hwĭ kơ gơñu bing kơpĭ Ñu. 
For he healed many, so that they beset him that they might touch him, as many as had plagues. @ Ñu hmâo pơsuaih lu mơnuih; yua kơ anŭn, abih bang mơnuih hmâo tơlơi duăm ruă hăt bruh nao giăm kiăng ruaih djơ̆ Yêsu. 
And the unclean spirits, when they beheld him, fell down before him, and cried saying, *Thou* art the Son of God. @ Rĭm wơ̆t ƀing yang bơngăt grĭ hơƀak ƀuh Yêsu, gơñu bon ƀơi anăp Ñu hăng ur kraih: “Ih jing Ană Ơi Adai”.
And he rebuked them much, that they might not make him manifest. @ Samơ̆ Yêsu khă pơtă gơñu anăm pơhaih Ñu kơ hlơi hlơi ôh.
And he goes up into the mountain, and calls whom he himself would, and they went to him. @ Yêsu đĭ pơ čư̆, Ñu iâu ƀing mơnuih Ñu kiăng; laih anŭn gơñu nao pơ Ñu yơh. 
And he appointed twelve that they might be with him, and that he might send them to preach, @ Ñu ruah pluh dua čô, pơanăn gơñu jing khua ding kơna, kiăng dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Ñu, pơkiaŏ gơñu nao hyu pơtô, 
and to have power [to heal diseases, and] to cast out demons. @ laih anŭn brơi kơ gơñu tơlơi dưi puh pơđuaĭ yang sat:
And he gave to Simon the surname of Peter; @ Anai jing pluh dua čô khua ding kơna Ñu hmâo ruah mă: Simôn, Ñu pơanăn Pêtrôs, 
and James the [son] of Zebedee, and John the brother of James, and he gave them the surname of Boanerges, that is, Sons of thunder; @ Yakơ ană Sêbêdê, hăng Yôhan adơi Yakơ, dua čô anai Ñu pơanăn Bôanerjơ (Kiăng pia ană đah rơkơi grơ̆m kơtal). 
and Andrew, and Philip, and Bartholomew, and Matthew, and Thomas, and James the [son] of Alphaeus, and Thaddaeus, and Simon the Cananaean, @ Andrê, Philip, Bartêlômi, Mathiơ, Thômas, Yakơ ană Alphê, Thadê, Simôn mơnuih Kanaan, 
and Judas Iscariote, who also delivered him up. And they come to [the] house. @ laih anŭn Yudas Iskariôt pô pơblư̆ lui Yêsu.
And again a crowd comes together, so that they cannot even eat bread. @ Khua Yang Yêsu glaĭ pơ sang; phung mơnuih lu pơtŭm glaĭ dơ̆ng, yua kơ anŭn yơh Yêsu hăng ƀing ding kơna Ñu ƀu dưi ƀơ̆ng huă ôh. 
And his relatives having heard [of it] went out to lay hold on him, for they said, He is out of his mind. @ Ƀing kơnŭng djuai Ñu hmư̆ tơlơi anŭn, gơñu tơbiă nao kiăng mă kơ̆ng hĭ Yêsu, yua kơ arăng laĭ: “Ñu rơngiă tơlơi pơmĭn laih.”
And the scribes who had come down from Jerusalem said, He has Beelzebub, and, By the prince of the demons he casts out demons. @  Ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt rai mơ̆ng plei Yêrusalem laĭ: “Yang Bêlsebul ngă kơ Ñu, Ñu pơpuh ƀing yang sat hăng tơlơi dưi khua ƀing yang sat.”
And having called them to [him], he said to them in parables, How can Satan cast out Satan? @ Yêsu iâu ƀing anŭn rai pơ Ñu hăng laĭ kơ gơñu hăng tơlơi bơhmutu: “Hyư̆m Satan dưi puh pơđuaĭ Satan lĕ? 
And if a kingdom has become divided against itself, that kingdom cannot subsist. @ Tơdah sa boh dêh čar pơtao pơkah pơpha hĭ ñu pô, dêh čar pơtao anŭn ƀu dưi dŏ kơjăp ôh. 
And if a house has become divided against itself, that house cannot subsist. @ Laih anŭn tơdah sa boh sang pơkah pơpha tơdruă ñu pô sang anŭn ƀu dưi dŏ kơjăp lơi. 
And if Satan rise up against himself, and is divided, he cannot subsist, but has an end. @ Tui anŭn mơ̆n tơdah Satan tơgŭ pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ hăng ñu pô, pơkah pơpha hĭ ñu pô, ñu ƀu dưi dŏ kơjăp ôh, samơ̆ ñu răm rơngiă yơh.
But no one can, having entered into his house, plunder the goods of the strong [man] unless he first bind the strong [man], and then he will plunder his house. @ Kar kaĭ mơ̆n arăng ƀu dưi mŭt ôh amăng sang sa čô mơnuih kơtang kiăng plah sua mă dram gơnam ñu tơdah ƀu čăp hĭ ñu hlâo; khŏm čăp hĭ pô anŭn amơĭ, anŭn kah dưi plah sua mă dram gơnam amăng sang gơ̆.
Verily I say unto you, that all sins shall be forgiven to the sons of men, and all the injurious speeches [with] which they may speak injuriously; @ Sĭt biă mă Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, Ơi Adai či pap brơi abih bang tơlơi soh kơ ƀing ană mơnuih, wơ̆t tơlơi gơñu pơhiăp pơgao hmiah hăng Ơi Adai; 
but whosoever shall speak injuriously against the Holy Spirit, to eternity has no forgiveness; but lies under the guilt of an everlasting sin; @ Samơ̆ hlơi pơhiăp pơgao hmiah hăng Yang Bơngăt Hiam ƀu či hmâo tơlơi pap brơi ôh, samơ̆ jing soh nanao hlŏng lar.” 
because they said, He has an unclean spirit. @ Yêsu laĭ tui anŭn yua kơ gơñu laĭ: “Yang bơngăt grĭ hơƀak ngă Ñu.”
And his brethren and his mother come, and standing without sent to him calling him. @ Laih anŭn amĭ Ñu hăng ƀing adơi ayŏng Ñu rai, dŏ pơ gah rơngiao. Gơñu pơkiaŏ nao arăng iâu Ñu. 
And a crowd sat around him. And they said to him, Behold, thy mother and thy brethren seek thee without. @ Sa phung lu dŏ ber jum dar Ñu, laih anŭn gơñu laĭ hăng Ñu: “Amĭ Ih hăng ƀing adơi ayŏng Ih dŏ pơ gah rơngiao hơduah sem Ih.”
And he answered them, saying, Who is my mother or my brethren? @ Ñu laĭ glaĭ: “Hlơi jing amĭ Kâo? Hlơi jing adơi ayŏng Kâo?” 
And looking around in a circuit at those that were sitting around him, he says, Behold my mother and my brethren: @ Laih anŭn Yêsu lăng kơ ƀing dŏ jum dar Ñu hăng laĭ: “Anai amĭ Kâo hăng ƀing adơi ayŏng Kâo! 
for whosoever shall do the will of God, *he* is my brother, and sister, and mother. @ Hlơi pô ngă tui tơlơi Ơi Adai kiăng anŭn yơh jing adơi ayŏng, amai adơi laih anŭn amĭ Kâo.”
And again he began to teach by the sea. And a great crowd was gathered together to him, so that going on board ship he sat in the sea, and all the crowd were close to the sea on the land. @  Sa wơ̆t dơ̆ng Yêsu čơdơ̆ng pơtô ƀơi hang ia rơsĭ Galilê, laih anŭn hmâo sa phung mơnuih lu biă mă pơtŭm jum dar Ñu. Tui anŭn Ñu đĭ dŏ ber amăng sa boh sŏng amăng ia rơsĭ. Abih bang ƀing mơnuih lu dŏ ƀơi kơdư. 
And he taught them many things in parables. And he said to them in his doctrine, @ Yêsu yua tơlơi bơhmutu pơtô kơ gơñu lu tơlơi, laih anŭn tơdang Ñu pơtô kơ ƀing gơñu, Ñu laĭ:
Hearken: Behold, the sower went forth to sow. @ “Hmư̆ bĕ! Sa čô mơnuih sai pơjeh nao sai. 
And it came to pass as he sowed, one fell by the wayside, and the birds came and devoured it. @ Tơdang ñu sai, hmâo đơđa pơjeh lĕ kơtuai jơlan, laih anŭn čĭm rai čoh ƀơ̆ng hĭ pơjeh anŭn. 
And another fell on the rocky ground, where it had not much earth, and immediately it sprung up out [of the ground] because it had no depth of earth; @ Pơjeh pơkŏn lĕ ƀơi anih lŏn boh pơtâo, ƀơi anŭn hmâo ƀiă lŏn. Ñu čăt tañ mơ̆n yua kơ lŏn ƀu kơpal ôh. 
and when the sun arose it was burnt up, and because of its not having any root, it withered. @ Tơ yang hrơi tơbiă đĭ, pơdai čăt anŭn gliu hĭ, yua kơ ñu ƀu hmâo akha dlam ôh hnŭn yơh ñu djai hĭ. 
And another fell among the thorns, and the thorns grew up and choked it, and it yielded no fruit. @ Pơjeh pơkŏn lĕ amăng tơ̆ng krah anih drơi, laih anŭn drơi anŭn čăt đĭ glong hăng ket hĭ ñu, laih anŭn ñu ƀu hmâo mơboh ôh. 
And another fell into the good ground, and yielded fruit, growing up and increasing; and bore, one thirty, and one sixty, and one a hundred. @ Pơjeh pơkŏn lĕ amăng anih lŏn hiam hnŭn yơh mơboh; ñu prŏng đĭ hăng đah jai, laih anŭn mơboh sa sar hmâo hĭ klâo pluh, năm pluh, laih anŭn sa rơtuh.”
And he said, He that has ears to hear, let him hear. @ Laih anŭn Ñu laĭ: “Hlơi hmâo tơngia pioh hmư̆, brơi ñu hmư̆ bĕ!”
And when he was alone, those about him with the twelve asked him [as to] the parables. @ Tơdang Yêsu dŏ hơjăn, ƀing mơnuih dŏ jum dar Ñu hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing pluh dua čô khua ding kơna Ñu rai tơña kơ tơlơi bơhmutu anŭn. 
And he said to them, To you is given [to know] the mystery of the kingdom of God; but to them who are without, all things are done in parables, @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Kơ ƀing gih arăng brơi laih kơ tơlơi hơgơ̆m kơ dêh čar pơtao Ơi Adai, samơ̆ bơ kơ ƀing gah rơngiao, abih bang hăng tơlơi bơhmutu Kâo pơhiăp kơ gơñu, 
that beholding they may behold and not see, and hearing they may hear and not understand, lest it may be, they should be converted and they should be forgiven. @ kiăng kơ gơñu:
Lăng samơ̆ ƀu thâo ƀuh ôh,
Laih anŭn kiăng kơ gơñu hmư̆ samơ̆ ƀu thâo hluh ôh;
Yua kơ tơdah gơñu thâo ƀuh laih anŭn thâo hluh gơñu dưi kơhmal hăng hmâo hĭ tơlơi pap brơi.”
And he says to them, Do ye not know this parable? and how will ye be acquainted with all the parables? @ Giơ̆ng anŭn Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Ƀing gih ƀu thâo hluh ôh hă tơlơi bơhmutu anai? Tui anŭn hyư̆m ƀing gih thâo hluh abih bang tơlơi bơhmutu pơkŏn lĕ? 
The sower sows the word: @ Mơnuih sai pơjeh anŭn jing sai boh pơhiăp Ơi Adai. 
and these are they by the wayside where the word is sown, and when they hear, immediately Satan comes and takes away the word that was sown in them. @ Dôm pơjeh lĕ ƀơi rŏk jơlan jing ƀing mơnuih hmư̆ boh pơhiăp arăng pơtô kơ gơñu, samơ̆ giơ̆ng kơ gơñu hmư̆, yang sat Satan rai mơtam hăng mă hĭ boh pơhiăp arăng sai laih amăng pran jua gơñu. 
And these are they in like manner who are sown upon the rocky places, who when they hear the word, immediately receive it with joy, @ Kar hăng tui anŭn mơ̆n ƀing mă tŭ pơjeh amăng anih lŏn boh pơtâo: tơ gơñu hmư̆ boh pơhiăp, hăng tơlơi hơ̆k mơak gơñu mă tŭ mơtam, 
and they have no root in themselves, but are for a time: then, tribulation arising, or persecution on account of the word, immediately they are offended. @ Samơ̆ amăng gơñu pô ƀu hmâo akha ôh, kơnơ̆ng dŏ jang jai đôč. Laih anŭn tơ hmâo tơlơi tơnap ƀôdah tơlơi arăng ngă sat yua kơ boh pơhiăp anŭn, gơñu lĕ rơbuh mơtam. 
And others are they who are sown among the thorns: these are they who have heard the word, @ Đơđa pơjeh pơkŏn lĕ ƀơi pum drơi jing kar hăng ƀing mơnuih hmư̆ boh hiăp pơtô, 
and the cares of life, and the deceitfulness of riches, and the lusts of other things, entering in, choke the word, and it becomes unfruitful. @ samơ̆ tơlơi ƀlơ̆ng bơngơ̆t kơ lŏn tơnah, tơlơi khăp đơi kơ tơlơi pơdrŏng sah, laih anŭn tơlơi amoaih kơ mơnơ̆ng pơkŏn mŭt amăng pran jua hăng ket hĭ boh pơhiăp, laih anŭn boh pơhiăp ƀu dưi mơboh ôh. 
And these are they who have been sown on the good ground, such as hear the word and receive it, and bear fruit; one thirty, and one sixty, and one a hundred [fold]. @ Samơ̆ ƀing mơnuih tŭ mă pơjeh amăng lŏn hiam jing ƀing hmư̆ boh pơhiăp laih anŭn mă tŭ gơ̆, hăng hmâo mơboh sa asar lĕ ƀơi lŏn hiam, jing kar hăng ƀing mơnuih hmư̆ hiăp pơtô, tŭ mă hăng mơboh, sa asar hmâo hĭ klâo pluh, năm pluh, laih anŭn sa rơtuh.”
And he said to them, Does the lamp come that it should be put under the bushel or under the couch? [Is it] not that it should be set upon the lamp-stand? @  Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Hmâo mơ̆ arăng ba apui kơđen pioh gah yŭ kơ kơthŭng, ƀôdah gah yŭ kơ sưng pĭt, samơ̆ ƀu pioh ôh ñu ƀơi gơ̆ng apui kơđen? 
For there is nothing hidden which shall not be made manifest; nor does any secret thing take place, but that it should come to light. @ Yua kơ hơgĕt mơnơ̆ng pơdŏp či pơrơđah hĭ, laih anŭn hơgĕt mơnơ̆ng hơgơ̆m či brơi arăng ƀuh amăng tơlơi bơngač. 
If any one have ears to hear, let him hear. @ Hlơi hmâo tơngia pioh hmư̆, brơi ñu hmư̆ bĕ!”
And he said to them, Take heed what ye hear; with what measure ye mete, it shall be meted to you; and there shall be [more] added to you. @  Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Răng bĕ kơ tơlơi hơgĕt ƀing gih hmư̆. Ơi Adai či pơkă brơi kơ ƀing gih tui hăng hơnơ̆ng ƀing gih hmâo pơkă brơi kơ arăng, laih anŭn či thim brơi kơ ƀing gih dơ̆ng. 
For whosoever has, to him shall be given; and he who has not, even what he has shall be taken from him. @ Yua kơ hlơi hmâo laih, Ơi Adai či brơi thim kơ ñu dơ̆ng, samơ̆ hlơi ƀu hmâo ôh, Ơi Adai či mă hĭ wơ̆t mơnơ̆ng ñu hmâo laih.”
And he said, Thus is the kingdom of God, as if a man should cast the seed upon the earth, @ Yêsu laĭ dơ̆ng: “Dêh čar pơtao Ơi Adai jing kar hăng sa čô mơnuih sai pơjeh ƀơi lŏn. 
and should sleep and rise up night and day, and the seed should sprout and grow, he does not know how. @ Ñu pĭt ƀôdah mơdưh, mlam ƀôdah tơhrơi, pơjeh čơnăt laih anŭn čăt glong đĭ, samơ̆ mơnuih anŭn ƀu thâo hluh ôh hyư̆m tơlơi anŭn. 
The earth bears fruit of itself, first [the] blade, then an ear, then full corn in the ear. @ Lŏn pô yơh ngă pơjing mơnơ̆ng, blŭng hlâo jing ană pơdai, giơ̆ng anŭn amŭng pơdai laih anŭn dơ̆ng hmâo asar amăng amung anŭn. 
But when the fruit is produced, immediately he sends the sickle, for the harvest is come. @ Samơ̆ tơ pơdai tơsă laih, tañ mơtam pô sai mă mơnek yuă mă hĭ pơdai, yua kơ bơyan hơpuă truh laih”.
And he said, How should we liken the kingdom of God, or with what comparison should we compare it? @ Yêsu laĭ dơ̆ng: “Hăng hơgĕt ta dưi bơkơnar kơ dêh čar pơtao Ơi Adai? Ƀôdah hăng tơlơi bơhmutu hơgĕt ƀing ta yua kiăng bơrơđah ñu? 
As to a grain of mustard [seed], which, when it is sown upon the earth, is less than all seeds which are upon the earth, @ Ñu jing kar hăng sa asar pơjeh añăm bơi, tơ arăng sai amăng lŏn, ñu jing anĕt hloh kơ abih bang pơjeh ƀơi lŏn tơnah anai. 
and when it has been sown, mounts up and becomes greater than all herbs, and produces great branches, so that the birds of heaven can roost under its shadow. @ Samơ̆ tơ arăng sai ñu laih, ñu čăt laih anŭn jing prŏng hloh kơ abih bang añăm pơtăm pơkŏn, ñu čăt than prŏng, tơl khul čĭm brĭm dưi ngă hruh gah yŭ tơ-u ñu.”
And with many such parables he spoke the word to them, as they were able to hear, @ Yêsu pơtô boh pơhiăp Ơi Adai kơ gơñu hăng lu tơlơi bơhmutu kar hăng anŭn, tui hăng jua gơñu dưi thâo hluh. 
but without a parable spoke he not to them; and in private he explained all things to his disciples. @ Ñu ƀu pơtô ôh kơ gơñu tơdah ƀu pơhiăp hăng tơlơi bơhmutu, samơ̆ tơdang Ñu dŏ hơjăn hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing ding kơna Ñu, Ñu pơblang brơi abih bang kơ ƀing gơ̆.
And on that day, when evening was come, he says to them, Let us go over to the other side: @ Klam hrơi anŭn, Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Brơi ƀing ta găn nao hang gah adih.” 
and having sent away the crowd, they take him with [them], as he was, in the ship. But other ships also were with him. @ Ƀing ding kơna lui ƀing mơnuih lu anŭn, Yêsu ăt dŏ amăng sŏng. Ƀing ding kơna ba Ñu nao, hmâo lu sŏng pơkŏn ăt nao hrŏm hơbĭt mơ̆n. 
And there comes a violent gust of wind, and the waves beat into the ship, so that it already filled. @ Hmâo rơbŭ kơthel prŏng truh thut, laih anŭn jơlah ia poh yă klă amăng sŏng tơl sŏng bă hăng ia. 
And *he* was in the stern sleeping on the cushion. And they awake him up and say to him, Teacher, dost thou not care that we are perishing? @ Samơ̆ Yêsu dŏ ƀơi klon sŏng, đăl akŏ Ñu ƀơi hơnal akŏ laih anŭn pĭt. Ƀing ding kơna râo Yêsu hăng laĭ: “Ơ Nai, Ih ƀu bơngơ̆t ôh hă kơ ƀing ta či djai?”
And awaking up he rebuked the wind, and said to the sea, Silence; be mute. And the wind fell, and there was a great calm. @ Yêsu mơdưh, khă angĭn hăng laĭ kơ ia rơsĭ: “Hơđơ̆ng rơiăt bĕ!” Tui anŭn angĭn dŏ krĕt hĭ, laih anŭn ia rơsĭ hơđơ̆ng rơiăt mơtam. 
And he said to them, Why are ye [thus] fearful? how [is it] ye have not faith? @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Yua hơgĕt ƀing gih hwĭ? Ƀing gih aka hmâo tơlơi đaŏ ôh hă?”
And they feared [with] great fear, and said one to another, Who then is this, that even the wind and the sea obey him? @ Laih anŭn gơñu bă hăng tơlơi hwĭ biă mă laih anŭn bơlaĭ tơdruă gơñu: “Hlơi mơnuih anai jing, tơl wơ̆t angĭn hăng ia rơsĭ ăt gưt kơ Ñu mơ̆n?”
And they came to the other side of the sea, to the country of the Gadarenes. @ Gơñu truh pơ hang gah adih ia rơsĭ amăng kwar Gêrasen. 
And immediately on his going out of the ship there met him out of the tombs a man possessed by an unclean spirit, @ Tơ Yêsu tơbiă mơ̆ng sŏng, plŭt mơtam hmâo sa čô mơnuih yang bơngăt grĭ hơƀak ngă tơbiă mơ̆ng pơsat nao pơ anăp Ñu. 
who had his dwelling in the tombs; and no one was able to bind him, not even with chains; @ Mơnuih anŭn hơdip tơ̆ng krah anih pơsat, laih anŭn arăng ƀu dưi akă ñu ôh, wơ̆t dah hăng hrĕ čuăk arăng kŏn dưi akă kling ñu lơi. 
because he had been often bound with fetters and chains, and the chains had been torn asunder by him, and the fetters were shattered; and no one was able to subdue him. @ Yua kơ lu wơ̆t laih arăng anŭh tơkai hăng čăp tơngan ñu hăng hrĕ čuăk, samơ̆ ñu wơ̆k joh hĭ anŭh hăng dŭng pơtơĭ hĭ hrĕ čuăk. Ƀu hmâo hlơi hmâo tơlơi kơtang dưi kơ̆ng ñu ôh. 
And continually night and day, in the tombs and in the mountains, he was crying and cutting himself with stones. @ Hrơi mlam ñu dŏ amăng anih pơ pơsat hăng ƀơi čư̆ ur tơkeč laih anŭn yua boh pơtâo taih rơka, brơ̆p drơi jan ñu pô.
But seeing Jesus from afar off, he ran and did him homage, @ Tơ ñu ƀuh Yêsu mơ̆ng ataih, ñu nao bon kơkuh ƀơi anăp Ñu. 
and crying with a loud voice he says, What have I to do with thee, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? I adjure thee by God, torment me not. @ Laih anŭn ñu ur kraih hăng laĭ: “Hơgĕt tơlơi Ih hmâo hăng kâo, Ơ Yêsu Ană Ơi Adai Pô Glông Hloh? Kâo kơwưh kơ Ih hăng anăn Ơi Adai, anăm pơtơnap kâo ôh.” 
For he said to him, Come forth, unclean spirit, out of the man. @ Yua kơ Yêsu hmâo laĭ laih kơ ñu: “Ơ yang bơngăt grĭ hơƀak, tơbiă bĕ mơ̆ng mơnuih anai.”
And he asked him, What is thy name? And he says to him, Legion is my name, because we are many. @ Yêsu tơña kơ ñu: “Hlơi anăn ŏng?” Ñu laĭ glaĭ: “Anăn kâo jing ‘Ƀing lu,’ yua kơ gơmơi lu biă mă.” 
And he besought him much that he would not send them away out of the country. @ Laih anŭn hăng abih pran jua ñu kơwưh rơkâo kơ Yêsu anăm puh pơđuaĭ hĭ gơñu mơ̆ng čar anŭn.
Now there was there just at the mountain a great herd of swine feeding; @ Hlăk anŭn ƀơi kriăng čư̆ hmâo bơbui lu biă mă dŏ ƀơ̆ng rơ̆k. 
and they besought him, saying, Send us into the swine that we may enter into them. @ Ƀing bơngăt grĭ rơkâo pơđur kơ Yêsu: “Brơi gơmơi nao mŭt amăng khul bơbui anŭn.” 
And Jesus [immediately] allowed them. And the unclean spirits going out entered into the swine, and the herd rushed down the steep slope, into the sea (about two thousand), and were choked in the sea. @ Tui anŭn Yêsu brơi gơñu mŭt. Ƀing yang bơngăt grĭ hơƀak tơbiă mơ̆ng đah rơkơi anŭn hăng mŭt amăng khul bơbui; Laih anŭn abih bang bơbui anŭn hmâo kơplah wah dua rơbâo drơi, mơ̆ng kriăng čư̆ kơdâo trŭn amăng ia rơsĭ, laih anŭn djai hơngơ̆t amăng ia.
And those that were feeding them fled and reported it in the city and in the country. And they went out to see what it was that had taken place. @ Ƀing wai bơbui đuaĭ kơdŏp hăng ră ruai kơ tơlơi anŭn amăng djŏp plei laih anŭn amăng kwar anŭn. Tui anŭn ƀing ană plei rai lăng hơgĕt tơlơi hmâo truh. 
And they come to Jesus, and they see the possessed of demons sitting [and] clothed and sensible, [him] that had had the legion: and they were afraid. @ Tơ gơñu truh pơ Yêsu, gơñu ƀuh mơnuih hlâo adih yang sat ngă hlăk dŏ ber ƀơi anŭn, buh sum ao laih, tơlơi pơmĭn gơ̆ tơngăl laih; gơñu hwĭ biă mă. 
And they that had seen [it] related to them how it had happened to the [man] possessed by demons, and concerning the swine. @ Hơdôm ƀing ƀuh laih tơlơi truh anŭn ră ruai glaĭ kơ ană plei pla abih tơlơi hmâo truh laih kơ pô yang sat ngă anŭn, wơ̆t tơlơi truh laih kơ khul bơbui. 
And they began to beg him to depart from their coasts. @ Tui anŭn gơñu čơdơ̆ng kơwưh pơđur kơ Yêsu tơbiă mơ̆ng tring gơñu.
And as he went on board ship, the man that had been possessed by demons besought him that he might be with him. @ Tơdang Yêsu čơdơ̆ng đĭ sŏng, mơnuih yang sat ngă anŭn rơkâo pơđur kơ Yêsu kiăng kơ dưi dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Ñu.
And he suffered him not, but says to him, Go to thine home to thine own people, and tell them how great things the Lord has done for thee, and has had mercy on thee. @ Samơ̆ Yêsu hơngah hăng laĭ kơ ñu: “Glaĭ bĕ pơ sang hăng nao bĕ pơ ƀing gơyut gơyâo ih, ră ruai glaĭ kơ gơñu hơdôm tơlơi Khua Yang hmâo ngă brơi laih kơ ih, laih anŭn hyư̆m Ñu hmâo pơrơđah laih tơlơi pap drap kơ ih.”
And he went away and began to proclaim in the Decapolis how great things Jesus had done for him; and all wondered. @ Tui anŭn ñu glaĭ hăng čơdơ̆ng ră ruai amăng tring Dêkapôlis djŏp mơta tơlơi Yêsu hmâo ngă laih kơ ñu. Laih anŭn abih bang mơnuih hmư̆, leng kơ hling hlang yơh.
And Jesus having passed over in the ship again to the other side, a great crowd gathered to him; and he was by the sea. @ Tơ Yêsu đĭ sŏng dơ̆ng hăng găn pơ hang gah adih, hmâo sa phung mơnuih lu biă mă pơtŭm jum dar Ñu. Ñu dŏ ƀơi hang ia rơsĭ. 
And [behold] there comes one of the rulers of the synagogue, by name Jairus, and seeing him, falls down at his feet; @ Hlăk anŭn, hmâo sa čô amăng ƀing khua wai sang bơjơnum rai, anăn ñu Jairus. Tơ ƀuh Yêsu, ñu bon ƀơi tơkai Ñu, 
and he besought him much, saying, My little daughter is at extremity; [I pray] that thou shouldest come and lay thy hands upon her so that she may be healed, and may live. @ laih anŭn kơwưh pơđur kơ Yêsu hăng abih pran jua: “Ană dra anĕt kâo giăm djai yơh, rơkâo kơ Ih rai hăng ah tơngan ƀơi ñu, tui anŭn gơ̆ či suaih hăng hơdip yơh.”
And he went with him, and a large crowd followed him and pressed on him. @ Tui anŭn Yêsu nao hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ñu. Laih anŭn hmâo sa phung mơnuih lu biă mă tui Yêsu, gơñu pơrơsua kơpĭ Ñu.
And a certain woman who had had a flux of blood twelve years, @ Ƀơi anŭn hmâo sa čô đah kơmơi ruă tuh drah hmâo pluh dua thŭn laih. 
and had suffered much under many physicians, and had spent everything she had and had found no advantage from it, but had rather got worse, @ Lu nai ia jrao hmâo pơjrao ñu, laih anŭn ñu hmâo pơrơngiă abih dram gơnam ñu ăt ƀu dưi suaih ôh, samơ̆ tơlơi ruă jai kơtang hloh dơ̆ng. 
having heard concerning Jesus, came in the crowd behind and touched his clothes; @ Ñu hmư̆ hing arăng ră ruai kơ Yêsu, hnŭn yơh ñu rai mŭt amăng phung mơnuih lu hăng tui gah rŏng Yêsu laih anŭn ruaih ao Ñu. 
for she said, If I shall touch but his clothes I shall be healed. @ Yua kơ ñu pơmĭn: “Tơdah kâo kơnơ̆ng ruaih ƀơi ao Ñu đôč kâo či dưi suaih yơh.”
And immediately her fountain of blood was dried up, and she knew in her body that she was cured from the scourge. @ Tañ mơtam drah ñu khơ̆t hĭ; laih anŭn ñu mưn thâo amăng drơi jan ñu suaih laih. 
And immediately Jesus, knowing in himself the power that had gone out of him, turning round in the crowd said, Who has touched my clothes? @ Yêsu thâo mơtam kơ tơlơi dưi mơyang tơbiă laih mơ̆ng Ñu, tui anŭn yơh Ñu wir glaĭ pơ ƀing mơnuih lu hăng laĭ: “Hlơi hmâo ruaih ao Kâo?”
And his disciples said to him, Thou seest the crowd pressing on thee, and sayest thou, Who touched me? @ Ƀing ding kơna Ñu laĭ hăng Ñu: “Ih ƀuh laih ƀing mơnuih lu pơrơsua kơpĭ Ih, hyư̆m Ih dŏ tơña: ‘Hlơi ruaih Kâo?’”
And he looked round about to see her who had done this. @ Yêsu lăng jum dar kiăng ƀuh hlơi hmâo ngă tơlơi anŭn. 
But the woman, frightened and trembling, knowing what had taken place in her, came and fell down before him, and told him all the truth. @ Samơ̆ đah kơmơi thâo laih hơgĕt tơlơi hmâo truh amăng drơi jan ñu, hăng tơlơi hwĭ tơtư̆ ñu rai bon ƀơi tơkai Yêsu, laih anŭn ră ruai abih bang kơ Ñu hăng tơlơi sĭt. 
And he said to her, Daughter, thy faith has healed thee; go in peace, and be well of thy scourge. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơ̆: “Ơ ană đah kơmơi Kâo, tơlơi đaŏ ih hmâo pơsuaih ih laih. Nao bĕ hăng tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua hăng suaih bĕ tơlơi ruă ih.”
While he was yet speaking, they come from the ruler of the synagogue's [house], saying, Thy daughter has died, why troublest thou the teacher any further? @ Tơdang Yêsu ăt dŏ pơhiăp, hmâo hơdôm čô mơnuih mơ̆ng sang Jairus rai laĭ hăng gơ̆: “Ană đah kơmơi ih djai laih, hơgĕt yom ngă pơgleh Nai dơ̆ng?”
But Jesus [immediately], having heard the word spoken, says to the ruler of the synagogue, Fear not; only believe. @ Samơ̆ Yêsu ƀu bơngơ̆t ôh kơ tơlơi gơñu laĭ, laih anŭn Ñu laĭ kơ khua wai sang bơjơnum: “Anăm hwĭ ôh, kơnơ̆ng đaŏ đôč.” 
And he suffered no one to accompany him save Peter and James, and John the brother of James. @ Laih anŭn Ñu ƀu brơi ôh hlơi tui hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Ñu, kơnơ̆ng Pêtrôs, Yakơ, laih anŭn Yôhan adơi Yakơ đôč. 
And he comes to the house of the ruler of the synagogue, and sees the tumult, and people weeping and wailing greatly. @ Tơ gơñu truh pơ sang khua wai sang bơjơnum anŭn, Yêsu ƀuh tơlơi pơrơông pơrơang, laih anŭn ƀing ană plei hia hăng čok ur kraih. 
And entering in he says to them, Why do ye make a tumult and weep? the child has not died, but sleeps. @ Yêsu mŭt amăng sang anŭn Ñu laĭ kơ ƀing gơñu: “Yua hơgĕt ƀing gih ngă pơrơông pơrơang hăng čŏk hia lĕ? Čơđai anĕt anai ƀu djai ôh, samơ̆ gơ̆ dŏ pĭt.”
And they derided him. But he, having put [them] all out, takes with [him] the father of the child, and the mother, and those that were with him, and enters in where the child was lying. @ Laih anŭn ƀing anŭn klao mưč kơ Yêsu. Samơ̆ Yêsu brơi abih bang tơbiă hĭ pơ gah rơngiao, laih anŭn Ñu ba amĭ ama čơđai anĕt hăng ƀing ding kơna Ñu hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Ñu, laih anŭn mŭt amăng anih čơđai anĕt dŏ. 
And having laid hold of the hand of the child, he says to her, Talitha koumi, which is, interpreted, Damsel, I say to thee, Arise. @ Yêsu mă tơngan ñu hăng laĭ kơ gơ̆, “Talitha kum”  kiăng laĭ “Ơ dra anĕt, Kâo pơđar kơ ih, tơgŭ bĕ!”
And immediately the damsel arose and walked, for she was twelve years old. And they were astonished with great astonishment. @ Tañ mơtam đah kơmơi anĕt anŭn tơgŭ hăng rơbat nao; yua kơ gơ̆ hmâo pluh dua thŭn laih. Abih bang mơnuih leng kơtuă biă mă. 
And he charged them much that no one should know this; and he desired that [something] should be given her to eat. @ Yêsu pơhiăp khĭp pơđar kơ gơñu: “Anăm brơi kơ arăng thâo tơlơi anŭn ôh”, laih anŭn Ñu pơtă kơ gơñu brơi mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă kơ dra anŭn.
And he went out thence and came to his own country, and his disciples follow him. @ Yêsu đuaĭ mơ̆ng anih anŭn hăng glaĭ pơ plei Ñu pô, laih anŭn ƀing ding kơna Ñu tui Ñu. 
And when sabbath was come he began to teach in the synagogue, and many hearing were amazed, saying, Whence [has] this [man] these things? and what [is] the wisdom that is given to him, and such works of power are done by his hands? @ Ƀơi hrơi saƀat Ñu čơdơ̆ng pơtô amăng sang bơjơnum, lu ƀing dŏ hmư̆ Ñu kơtuă hling hăng laĭ: “Mơ̆ng pă Pô anai hmâo hơdôm tơlơi anai? Hơgĕt tơlơi kơhnâo arăng hmâo brơi laih kơ Ñu? Yua hơgĕt tơngan Ñu dưi ngă lu bruă mơsêh mơyang kar hăng anŭn? 
Is not this the carpenter, the son of Mary, and brother of James, and Joses, and Judas, and Simon? and are not his sisters here with us? And they were offended in him. @ Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă Ñu yơh jing Pô trah kơyâo, ană đah rơkơi HʼMari laih anŭn ayŏng Yakơ, Yôse, Yut hăng Simôn? Laih anŭn ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă ƀing adơi đah kơmơi Ñu hlăk dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing ta pơ anai?” Laih anŭn ƀing gơñu hơngah hĭ Yêsu.
But Jesus said to them, A prophet is not despised save in his own country, and among [his] kinsmen, and in his own house. @  Laih anŭn Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Arăng pơpŭ kơ ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo pơ djŏp djang anih, kơnơ̆ng plei pla Ñu pô, kơnŭng djuai Ñu pô, sang anŏ Ñu pô đôč ƀu pơpŭ pơyom kơ Ñu.”
And he could not do any work of power there, save that laying his hands on a few infirm persons he healed [them]. @ Yua kơ anŭn yơh Yêsu ƀu dưi ngă sa mơta bruă mơsêh mơyang ôh ƀơi anih anŭn, kơnơ̆ng Ñu ah tơngan kơ đơđa mơnuih ruă duăm hăng pơsuaih gơñu đôč. 
And he wondered because of their unbelief. And he went round the villages in a circuit, teaching. @ Yêsu hling hlang biă mă yua kơ ƀing mơnuih lu anŭn ƀu hmâo tơlơi đaŏ ôh. Laih anŭn Yêsu hyu pơtô amăng lu boh plei jum dar tring anŭn.
And he calls the twelve to [him]; and he began to send them out two [and] two, and gave to them power over the unclean spirits; @ Ñu iâu ƀing pluh dua čô khua ding kơna rai pơ Ñu, laih anŭn čơdơ̆ng pơkiaŏ nao gơñu dua čô, dua čô. Ñu brơi kơ gơñu tơlơi dưi hăng yang bơngăt grĭ hơƀak. 
and he commanded them that they should take nothing for the way, save a staff only; no scrip, no bread, no money in their belt; @ Ñu pơtă kơ gơñu anăm djă ba sa mơta mơnơ̆ng hơgĕt kơ tơlơi gơñu hyu, kơnơ̆ng sa ƀĕ gai jra; ƀu djă ba ƀañ tơpŭng, kơdŭng, prăk amăng hơdrăng kơiăng gơñu ôh; 
but be shod with sandals, and put not on two body-coats. @ kơnơ̆ng čŭt klĭ juă đôč, laih anŭn anăm buh ao dua tal ôh. 
And he said to them, Wheresoever ye shall enter into a house, there remain till ye shall go thence. @ Ñu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Tơ ƀing gih mŭt sang hlơi, brơi ƀing gih dŏ pơ anŭn tơl ƀing gih tơbiă mơ̆ng anih anŭn. 
And whatsoever place shall not receive you nor hear you, departing thence, shake off the dust which is under your feet for a testimony to them. @ Tơdah hmâo anih arăng ƀu tŭ jum ƀing gih kŏn hmư̆ ƀing gih lơi, brơi ƀing gih tơbiă bĕ mơ̆ng anih anŭn, tơtuh hĭ ƀruih lŏn mơ̆ng tơkai ƀing gih kiăng ngă gơ̆ng jơlan pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ hăng gơñu.”
And they went forth and preached that they should repent; @ Hnŭn yơh gơñu tơbiă nao, hyu pơtô kiăng kơ abih bang mơnuih khŏm kơhmal tơlơi soh. 
and they cast out many demons, and anointed with oil many infirm, and healed them. @ Gơñu puh pơđuaĭ lu yang sat, hăng pik ia jâu kơ lu mơnuih ruă duăm laih anŭn pơsuaih gơñu.
And Herod the king heard [of him] (for his name had become public), and said, John the baptist is risen from among [the] dead, and on this account works of power are wrought by him. @  Pơtao Hêrôt hmư̆ hing arăng ruai kơ Yêsu, yua kơ lu mơnuih hmâo hmư̆ hing laih anăn Yêsu. Hmâo đơđa mơnuih laĭ: “Yôhan Ƀatem hơdip glaĭ laih mơ̆ng ƀing djai, hnŭn yơh ñu dưi ngă tơlơi mơsêh mơyang anai.”
And others said, It is Elias; and others said, It is a prophet, as one of the prophets. @ Đơđa ƀing pơkŏn laĭ: “Ñu jing Êli.” Laih anŭn ƀing pơkŏn dơ̆ng laĭ: “Ñu jing sa čô pô laĭ lui hlâo kar hăng sa čô amăng ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo rơnŭk đưm adih.”
But Herod when he heard [it] said, John whom *I* beheaded, he it is; *he* is risen [from among the dead]. @ Samơ̆ tơ Hêrôt hmư̆ tơlơi anŭn, ñu laĭ: “Anai Yôhan yơh, pô kâo čơ̆ng laih tơkuai ñu, ñu hơdip glaĭ dơ̆ng.” 
For the same Herod had sent and seized John, and had bound him in prison on account of Herodias, the wife of Philip his brother, because he had married her. @ Yua kơ Hêrôt pô hmâo pơkiaŏ nao arăng mă čăp Yôhan hăng krư̆ hĭ amăng sang mơnă yua kơ HʼHêrôđias, bơnai Philip adơi Hêrôt; Hêrôt hmâo mă đah kơmơi anŭn jing hĭ bơnai ñu. 
For John said to Herod, It is not lawful for thee to have the wife of thy brother. @ Yua kơ Yôhan hmâo khă Hêrôt: “Ih mă dŏ hĭ bơnai adơi ih, tơlơi anŭn ƀu djơ̆ tui hăng tơlơi juăt ôh.”
But Herodias kept it [in her mind] against him, and wished to kill him, and could not: @ Hnŭn yơh HʼHêrôđias hil rơañ kơ Yôhan laih anŭn kiăng pơdjai hĭ gơ̆. Samơ̆ ñu ƀu dưi pơdjai ôh, 
for Herod feared John knowing that he was a just and holy man, and kept him safe; and having heard him, did many things, and heard him gladly. @ yua kơ Hêrôt hwĭ kơ Yôhan, thâo ñu jing sa čô mơnuih tơpă hăng rơgoh hiam, tui anŭn yơh ñu pơgang gơ̆ ƀu brơi arăng pơdjai ôh. Tơ Hêrôt hmư̆ ñu pơtô ñu rŭng răng biă mă; samơ̆ ñu ăt mơak kiăng hmư̆ gơ̆.
And a holiday being come, when Herod, on his birthday, made a supper to his grandees, and to the chiliarchs, and the chief [men] of Galilee; @ Samơ̆ hmâo mông gal truh ƀơi hrơi pơhơdơr kơ tơlơi tơkeng kơ ñu, Hêrôt pơkra tơlơi ƀơ̆ng huă kơ ƀing khua wai lăng, ƀing khua tơhan hăng ƀing mơnuih khua pơprŏng amăng čar Galilê. 
and the daughter of the same Herodias having come in, and danced, pleased Herod and those that were with [him] at table; and the king said to the damsel, Ask of me whatsoever thou wilt and I will give it thee. @ Yua kơ, tơ ană dra HʼHêrôđias mŭt suang ñu ngă bơmơak kơ Hêrôt hăng kơ ƀing ñu jak. Pơtao laĭ kơ đah kơmơi dra anŭn: “Rơkâo bĕ kơ kâo hơgĕt mơnơ̆ng ih kiăng, kâo či brơi kơ ih yơh.” 
And he swore to her, Whatsoever thou shalt ask me I will give thee, to half of my kingdom. @ Ñu ƀuăn rơ̆ng hăng gơ̆: “Hơgĕt mơnơ̆ng ih rơkâo, kâo či brơi kơ ih, wơ̆t dah sa mơkrah dêh čar pơtao kâo tŭ mơ̆n.”
And she went out, and said to her mother, What should I ask? And she said, The head of John the baptist. @ Đah kơmơi dra anŭn tơbiă nao hăng tơña kơ amĭ ñu: “Hơgĕt mơnơ̆ng kâo či rơkâo?”
Amĭ ñu laĭ glaĭ: “Akŏ Yôhan Ƀatem.”
And immediately going in with haste to the king, she asked saying, I desire that thou give me directly upon a dish the head of John the baptist. @ Tañ mơtam, đah kơmơi dra anŭn mŭt glaĭ hăng tơlơi hăt nao ƀơi anăp pơtao laih anŭn rơkâo tui anai: “Kâo kiăng ih brơi kơ kâo akŏ Yôhan Ƀatem pioh amăng jam ră anai mơtam.”
And the king, [while] made very sorry, on account of the oaths and those lying at table with [him] would not break his word with her. @ Pơtao ruă rơngot biă mă; samơ̆ yua kơ tơlơi ñu ƀuăn rơ̆ng laih, laih anŭn yua kơ ƀing mơnuih ñu jak iâu, ñu ƀu kiăng hơngah hĭ ôh tơlơi ñu hmâo ƀuăn laih kơ dra anŭn. 
And immediately the king, having sent one of the guard, ordered his head to be brought. And he went out and beheaded him in the prison, @ Pơtao pơkiaŏ nao mơtam sa čô tơhan gak hăng pơtă kơ ñu mă ba rai akŏ Yôhan. Tơhan anŭn nao amăng sang mơnă hăng čơ̆ng hĭ tơkuai Yôhan. 
and brought his head upon a dish, and gave it to the damsel, and the damsel gave it to her mother. @ Ba akŏ gơ̆ dưm amăng sa boh jam hăng brơi đah kơmơi dra anŭn; laih anŭn ñu ba brơi kơ amĭ ñu. 
And his disciples having heard [it], came and took up his body, and laid it in a tomb. @ Tơ ƀing ding kơna Yôhan hmư̆ tơlơi anŭn, gơñu nao mă drơi jan gơ̆ ba dơr amăng pơsat.
