And the apostles are gathered together to Jesus. And they related to him all things, [both] what they had done and what they had taught. @ Ƀing khua ding kơna pơƀŭt glaĭ jum dar Yêsu, hăng ruai glaĭ kơ ñu abih bang bruă gơñu hmâo ngă hăng abih tơlơi gơñu hmâo pơtô laih. 
And he said to them, Come ye yourselves apart into a desert place and rest a little. For those coming and those going were many, and they had not leisure even to eat. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Nao bĕ pơ tơdrŏn tač, hăng dŏ pơdơi ƀiă.” Yua kơ hmâo lu mơnuih nao rai tơl gơñu ƀu wăn ƀơ̆ng huă ôh. 
And they went away apart into a desert place by ship. @ Laih anŭn gơñu đĭ sŏng nao pơ tơdrŏn tač dŏ hơjăn ƀing gơñu.
And many saw them going, and recognised them, and ran together there on foot, out of all the cities, and got [there] before them. @ Hlăk anŭn hmâo lu mơnuih ƀuh gơñu nao hăng thâo krăn gơñu, tui anŭn gơñu mơ̆ng abih bang plei nao laih anŭn truh hlâo kơ gơñu. 
And on leaving [the ship] [Jesus] saw a great crowd, and he was moved with compassion for them, because they were as sheep not having a shepherd. And he began to teach them many things. @ Tơ Yêsu đĭ pơ hang Ñu ƀuh sa phung mơnuih lu lĭn, laih anŭn Ñu glưh pran jua pap, yua kơ gơñu jing kar hăng triu ƀu hmâo pô wai ôh; laih anŭn Ñu čơdơ̆ng pơtô kơ ƀing gơ̆ lu mơta tơlơi. 
And when it was already late in the day, his disciples coming to him say, The place is desert, and it is already late in the day; @ Tơ adai klam laih, ƀing ding kơna Ñu nao laĭ hăng Yêsu: “Anai jing anih rơnguă rơnguăn, laih anŭn adai klam laih; 
send them away that they may go into the country and villages around, and buy themselves bread, for they have not anything they can eat. @ brơi gơñu nao bĕ pơ pưk hmua hăng pơ plei jum dar anai kiăng kơ blơi mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă kơ gơñu pô.”
And he answering said to them, Give *ye* them to eat. And they say to him, Shall we go and buy two hundred denarii worth of bread and give them to eat? @ Samơ̆ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ kơ gơñu: “Ƀing gih yơh brơi mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă kơ gơñu.” Gơñu laĭ hăng Yêsu: “Hyư̆m, ƀing gơmơi khŏm nao blơi ƀañ tơpŭng truh kơ dua rơtuh đơniê hăng brơi gơñu ƀơ̆ng hă?”
And he says to them, How many loaves have ye? Go [and] see. And when they knew they say, Five, and two fishes. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Nao lăng bĕ, hơdôm boh ƀañ tơpŭng ƀing gih hmâo?” Tơ gơñu nao lăng laih, gơñu laĭ: “Rơma boh ƀañ tơpŭng hăng dua drơi akan.”
And he ordered them to make them all sit down by companies on the green grass. @ Giơ̆ng anŭn Yêsu pơtă ƀing ding kơna Ñu brơi abih bang ƀing mơnuih lu dŏ ber ƀơi rơ̆k mơda. 
And they sat down in ranks by hundreds and by fifties. @ Tui anŭn gơñu dŏ ber tui khul, hmâo khul sa rơtuh čô, hmâo khul rơma pluh čô. 
And having taken the five loaves and the two fishes, looking up to heaven, he blessed, and broke the loaves, and gave [them] to his disciples that they might set [them] before them. And the two fishes he divided among all. @ Yêsu mă rơma boh ƀañ tơpŭng hăng dua drơi akan, Ñu angak đĭ mơta pơ adai, hăng bơni hơơč kơ Ơi Adai, laih anŭn wơ̆k hĭ ƀañ tơpŭng hăng brơi kơ ƀing ding kơna Ñu pơpha brơi kơ ƀing mơnuih lu. Ñu ăt pha brơi dua drơi akan kơ rĭm čô mơnuih mơ̆n. 
And they all ate and were satisfied. @ Abih bang gơñu ƀơ̆ng leng kơ trơi soh sel. 
And they took up of fragments the fillings of twelve hand-baskets, and of the fishes. @ Laih anŭn gơñu duñ mă ƀañ tơpŭng hăng akan bă pluh dua bai. 
And those that ate of the loaves were five thousand men. @ Mrô ƀing ƀơ̆ng ƀañ tơpŭng anŭn hmâo rơma rơbâo čô đah rơkơi.
And immediately he compelled his disciples to go on board ship, and to go on before to the other side to Bethsaida, while *he* sends the crowd away. @ Laih anŭn mơtam Yêsu brơi ƀing ding kơna Ñu đĭ sŏng găn nao hang gah adih anăp nao pơ plei Bêtsaida hlâo kơ Ñu, tơdang Ñu brơi ƀing mơnuih lu glaĭ. 
And, having dismissed them, he departed into the mountain to pray. @ Giơ̆ng kơ Ñu hmâo laĭ nao hiam kơ ƀing mơnuih lu anŭn, Ñu đĭ pơ čư̆ kiăng iâu laĭ. 
And when evening was come, the ship was in the midst of the sea, and *he* alone upon the land. @ Tơ mơmŏt truh, sŏng anŭn dŏ tơ̆ng krah ia rơsĭ laih, samơ̆ Yêsu ăt dŏ hơjăn Ñu pơ kơdư. 
And seeing them labouring in rowing, for the wind was contrary to them, about the fourth watch of the night he comes to them walking on the sea, and would have passed them by. @ Yêsu ƀuh ƀing ding kơna Ñu waih sŏng hăng tơlơi tơnap gleh, yua kơ angĭn thut klă pă anăp gơñu. Ƀơi giăm mơguah Yêsu nao pơ gơñu, rơbat ƀơi ngŏ jơlah ia, Ñu pơmĭn kiăng blaĭ nao hlâo kơ gơñu. 
But they, seeing him walking on the sea, thought that it was an apparition, and cried out. @ Samơ̆ tơ gơñu ƀuh Yêsu rơbat ƀơi ngŏ jơlah ia, gơñu pơmĭn dah atâo hnŭn yơh gơñu ur kraih; 
For all saw him and were troubled. And immediately he spoke with them, and says to them, Be of good courage: it is *I*; be not afraid. @ yua kơ abih bang gơñu leng kơ ƀuh Ñu, hnŭn yơh gơñu hwĭ bral biă mă. Samơ̆ tañ mơtam Yêsu pơhiăp hăng gơñu: “Kơjăp pran jua bĕ! Kâo yơh anai; anăm hwĭ ôh.” 
And he went up to them into the ship, and the wind fell. And they were exceedingly beyond measure astonished in themselves and wondered; @ Giơ̆ng anŭn Ñu đĭ amăng sŏng hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing gơñu, laih anŭn angĭn rơiăt hĭ. Gơñu kơtuă hling hlang hloh dơ̆ng, 
for they understood not through the loaves: for their heart was hardened. @ yua kơ gơñu ƀu thâo hluh ôh kơ tơlơi hrih ƀañ tơpŭng anŭn, yua kơ pran jua gơñu dŏ khăng.
And having passed over, they came to the land of Gennesaret and made the shore. @ Tơ gơñu găn ia rơsĭ laih, gơñu truh pơ lŏn plei Gênêsaret, laih anŭn akă hĭ sŏng ƀơi hang ia anŭn. 
And on their coming out of the ship, immediately recognising him, @ Tơ gơñu tơbiă mơ̆ng sŏng, ƀing ană plei thâo krăn mơtam Yêsu, 
they ran through that whole country around, and began to carry about those that were ill on couches, where they heard that he was. @ laih anŭn gơñu nao djŏp djang tring; pơpă anih gơñu hmư̆ Yêsu dŏ gơñu čơkung ba ƀing duăm ruă dŏ đih ƀơi sưng nao pơ anŭn. 
And wherever he entered into villages, or cities, or the country, they laid the sick in the market-places, and besought him that they might touch if it were only the hem of his garment; and as many as touched him were healed. @ Pơpă anih Yêsu nao, amăng plei anĕt, plei prŏng, ƀôdah ƀơi gah rơngiao plei, arăng pioh ƀing duăm ruă amăng anih sang sĭ mia, laih anŭn gơñu rơkâo kơwưh kơ Yêsu brơi gơñu ƀiă hloh dưi ruaih kơnơ̆ng ƀơi jih ao Ñu đôč. Laih anŭn abih bang hlơi ruaih bơ̆t djơ̆ ao Ñu leng kơ suaih soh sel.
And the Pharisees and some of the scribes, coming from Jerusalem, are gathered together to him, @ Hlăk anŭn hmâo ƀing Pharisi hrŏm hơbĭt hăng đơđa ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt mơ̆ng plei Yêrusalem nao pơtŭm jum dar Yêsu, 
and seeing some of his disciples eat bread with defiled, that is, unwashed, hands, @ gơñu thâo đơđa ƀing ding kơna Yêsu ƀơ̆ng huă hăng tơngan grĭ, kiăng laĭ ƀu rao tơngan.
(for the Pharisees and all the Jews, unless they wash their hands diligently, do not eat, holding what has been delivered by the ancients; @ (Tui hăng tơlơi phiăn ƀing ơi adon, ƀing Pharisi hăng abih bang ƀing Yuđa ƀu ƀơ̆ng huă ôh tơdah ƀu rao tơngan hlâo, 
and [on coming] from the market-place, unless they are washed, they do not eat; and there are many other things which they have received to hold, the washing of cups and vessels, and brazen utensils, and couches), @ tơ ƀing gơñu glaĭ mơ̆ng sang sĭ mia, ƀing gơñu ƀu ƀơ̆ng huă ôh tơdah ƀing gơñu aka rao tơngan. Laih anŭn gơñu tui lu mơta tơlơi phiăn pơkŏn dơ̆ng, kiăng laĭ tơlơi phiăn rao mŏng, gŏ lŏn, gŏ kong laih anŭn kơƀang ƀơ̆ng huă.)
then the Pharisees and the scribes ask him, Why do thy disciples not walk according to what has been delivered by the ancients, but eat the bread with defiled hands? @ Yua kơ anŭn, ƀing Pharisi hăng ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt tơña kơ Yêsu: “Yua hơgĕt ƀing ding kơna Ih ƀu hơdip tui tơlơi phiăn ƀing ơi adon, laih anŭn gơñu ƀơ̆ng huă hăng tơngan grĭ lĕ?”
But he answering said to them, Well did Esaias prophesy concerning you hypocrites, as it is written, This people honour me with their lips, but their heart is far away from me. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ kơ gơñu: “Êsai laĭ lui hlâo kơ ƀing gih jing ƀing plơ̆m ƀlor djơ̆ biă mă yơh, kar hăng tơlơi hmâo čih laih:
‘Ƀing ană plei pla anai pơpŭ kơ Kâo hăng tơƀuai gơñu,
Samơ̆ pran jua gơñu dŏ ataih mơ̆ng Kâo biă mă.
But in vain do they worship me, teaching [as their] teachings commandments of men. @ Bruă gơñu kơkuh pơpŭ kơ Kâo jing đôč đač,
Mơta tơlơi gơñu pơtô kơnơ̆ng jing khul tơlơi phiăn ană mơnuih đôč.’
[For], leaving the commandment of God, ye hold what is delivered by men [to keep] washings of vessels and cups, and many other such like things ye do. @ Ƀing gih lui laih tơlơi Ơi Adai pơtă, laih anŭn djă pioh kơjăp tơlơi juăt ană mơnuih.”
And he said to them, Well do ye set aside the commandment of God, that ye may observe what is delivered by yourselves [to keep]. @ Tui anŭn Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Hăng tơlơi mơneč ƀing gih lui hĭ tơlơi Ơi Adai pơtă, kiăng djă pioh tơlơi phiăn ƀing gih pô. 
For Moses said, Honour thy father and thy mother; and, he who speaks ill of father or mother, let him surely die. @ Yua kơ Môis laĭ: ‘Pơpŭ bĕ kơ amĭ ama ih,’ laih anŭn ‘Hlơi pô pơhiăp sat kơ ama ƀôdah amĭ ñu, sĭt ñu khŏm djai.’ 
But *ye* say, If a man say to his father or his mother, [It is] corban (that is, gift), whatsoever thou mightest have profit from me by @ Samơ̆ ƀing gih laĭ: ‘Tơdah sa čô laĭ kơ ama ƀôdah amĭ ñu, hơgĕt mơnơ̆ng kâo dưi djru ih jing Kôrban,’ (kiăng laĭ pơyơr laih kơ Ơi Adai), 
And ye no longer suffer him to do anything for his father or his mother; @ ƀing gih ƀu brơi ñu djru amĭ ama gơ̆ dơ̆ng tah. 
making void the word of God by your traditional teaching which ye have delivered; and many such like things ye do. @ Hăng tơlơi juăt ƀing gih pơtô, tui anŭn ƀing gih yap tơlơi Ơi Adai pơhiăp jing đôč đač. Laih anŭn lu tơlơi ƀing gih ngă kar hăng anŭn.”
And having called again the crowd, he said to them, Hear me, all [of you], and understand: @ Giơ̆ng anŭn Yêsu iâu dơ̆ng ƀing mơnuih lu, rai hăng laĭ kơ gơñu: “Brơi abih bang ƀing gih hmư̆ laih anŭn thâo hluh bĕ. 
There is nothing from outside a man entering into him which can defile him; but the things which go out from him, those it is which defile the man. @ Ƀu hmâo ôh sa mơta mơnơ̆ng mơ̆ng gah rơngiao mơnuih dưi mŭt amăng ñu hăng pơgrĭ hĭ ñu, samơ̆ hơgĕt mơnơ̆ng tơbiă mơ̆ng mơnuih, mơnơ̆ng anŭn yơh pơgrĭ ñu.”
And when he went indoors from the crowd, his disciples asked him concerning the parable. @ Tơ Ñu lui laih ƀing mơnuih lu laih anŭn mŭt amăng sang, ƀing ding kơna tơña Ñu kơ tơlơi bơhmutu anŭn. 
And he says to them, Are *ye* also thus unintelligent? Do ye not perceive that all that is outside entering into the man cannot defile him, @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Wơ̆t kơ ƀing gih ăt aka thâo hluh mơ̆n hă? Ƀing gih ƀu thâo ôh hă hơgĕt mơnơ̆ng mơ̆ng gah rơngiao mŭt amăng mơnuih ƀu dưi ngă pơgrĭ mơnuih ôh? 
because it does not enter into his heart but into his belly, and goes out into the draught, purging all meats? @ Yua kơ mơnơ̆ng anŭn ƀu mŭt amăng pran jua ôh, samơ̆ amăng hlŭng laih anŭn hlŏng tơbiă pơ gah rơngiao.” (Tui anŭn Yêsu kiăng laĭ abih bang mơnơ̆ng leng kơ dưi ƀơ̆ng soh sel.)
And he said, That which goes forth out of the man, that defiles the man. @ Laih anŭn Yêsu laĭ: “Hơgĕt mơnơ̆ng tơbiă mơ̆ng mơnuih, mơnơ̆ng anŭn yơh pơgrĭ ñu. 
For from within, out of the heart of men, go forth evil thoughts, adulteries, fornications, murders, @ Yua kơ mơ̆ng amăng lăm, mơ̆ng pran jua mơnuih tơbiă rai tơlơi pơmĭn sat, tơlơi rih răm, tơlơi klĕ, tơlơi pơdjai mơnuih, 
thefts, covetousness, wickednesses, deceit, licentiousness, a wicked eye, injurious language, haughtiness, folly; @ tơlơi klĕ pyu, tơlơi hưp ham, tơlơi ƀrưh hmiah, tơlơi pleč ƀlor, tơlơi hơtoh djraĭ, tơlơi moañ, pơhiăp pơčeh, tơlơi pơgao, laih anŭn tơlơi mlŭk. 
all these wicked things go forth from within and defile the man. @ Abih bang tơlơi sat anŭn leng kơ tơbiă mơ̆ng amăng lăm, laih anŭn ngă pơgrĭ mơnuih.”
And he rose up and went away thence into the borders of Tyre and Sidon; and having entered into a house he would not have any one know [it], and he could not be hid. @ Ñu tơbiă mơ̆ng tring anŭn nao pơ tring plei Tir. Ñu mŭt amăng sa boh sang, Ñu ƀu kiăng arăng thâo Ñu dŏ pơ anŭn ôh, samơ̆ Ñu ƀu thâo hơgơ̆m ôh. 
But immediately a woman, whose little daughter had an unclean spirit, having heard of him, came and fell at his feet @ Hmâo sa čô đah kơmơi hmâo ană đah kơmơi anĕt hmâo yang bơngăt grĭ hơƀak dŏ amăng ñu, hmư̆ hing kơ Yêsu, laih anŭn tañ mơtam nao bon ƀơi tơkai Yêsu. 
(and the woman was a Greek, Syrophenician by race), and asked him that he would cast the demon out of her daughter. @ Đah kơmơi anŭn jing sa čô mơnuih Tuai mơ̆ng tring Phênisi čar Siri; ñu rơkâo kơwưh kơ Yêsu puh pơđuaĭ yang sat mơ̆ng ană đah kơmơi gơ̆. 
But [Jesus] said to her, Suffer the children to be first filled; for it is not right to take the children's bread and cast it to the dogs. @ Ñu laĭ kơ gơ̆: “Brơi kơ ană bă ƀơ̆ng huă trơi hlâo amơĭ, yua kơ ƀu hiam ôh mă ƀañ tơpŭng ƀing ană bă laih anŭn glŏm brơi kơ asâo.”
But she answered and says to him, Yea, Lord; for even the dogs under the table eat of the children's crumbs. @ Samơ̆ đah kơmơi anŭn laĭ glaĭ kơ Ñu: “Djơ̆ yơh, Ơ Khua, samơ̆ ƀing asâo dŏ gah yŭ kơƀang ăt dưi ƀơ̆ng mơ̆n aru ƀañ ƀing ană bă lĕ trŭn.”
And he said to her, Because of this word, go thy way, the demon is gone out of thy daughter. @ Tui anŭn Yêsu laĭ kơ gơ̆: “Ih glaĭ bĕ, yua kơ tơlơi ih pơhiăp tui anŭn, yang sat tơbiă laih mơ̆ng ană đah kơmơi ih.”
And having gone away to her house she found the demon gone out, and her daughter lying on the bed. @ Đah kơmơi anŭn glaĭ pơ sang ƀuh ană ñu dŏ đih ƀơi sưng, laih anŭn yang sat tơbiă laih.
And again having left the borders of Tyre and Sidon, he came to the sea of Galilee, through the midst of the coasts of Decapolis. @ Giơ̆ng kơ Yêsu tơbiă mơ̆ng tring plei Tir, găn plei Sidôn anăp nao ia rơsĭ Galilê, mŭt amăng tring Dêkapôlis. 
And they bring to him a deaf [man] who could not speak right, and they beseech him that he might lay his hand on him. @ Arăng ba nao pơ Yêsu sa čô mơnuih tơngil hăng kơmlô laih anŭn gơñu rơkâo kơwưh kơ Yêsu ah tơngan ƀơi pô anŭn. 
And having taken him away from the crowd apart, he put his fingers to his ears; and having spit, he touched his tongue; @ Yêsu ba pô anŭn tơbiă mơ̆ng ƀing mơnuih lu nao pơ anih hơjăn, laih anŭn Ñu čŭt čơđeng Ñu ƀơi dua gah amăng tơngia ñu. Laih anŭn čuh ia bah pik ƀơi jơlah gơ̆. 
and looking up to heaven he groaned, and says to him, Ephphatha, that is, Be opened. @ Tơdang Ñu angak đĭ mơta pơ adai. Ñu kơhôih jua hăng laĭ kơ gơ̆. “Êphatha” kiăng laĭ “pŏk bĕ.”
And immediately his ears were opened, and the band of his tongue was loosed and he spoke right. @ Tañ mơtam tơngia ñu pŏk hĭ, jơlah ñu klaih, laih anŭn ñu čơdơ̆ng pơhiăp klă rơđah. 
And he charged them that they should speak to no one [of it]. But so much the more *he* charged them, so much the more abundantly *they* proclaimed it; @ Tui anŭn Yêsu pơtă kơ ƀing anŭn anăm ră ruai kơ arăng ôh, samơ̆ jai Yêsu khă jai hloh dơ̆ng gơñu ră ruai tơlơi anŭn. 
and they were astonished above measure, saying, He does all things well; he makes both the deaf to hear, and the speechless to speak. @ Ƀing anŭn dŏ kơtuă hling biă mă hăng laĭ “Ñu ngă abih bang bruă hiam soh sel. Ñu ngă brơi wơ̆t mơnuih tơngil dưi hmư̆ laih anŭn mơnuih kơmlô thâo pơhiăp.”
In those days, there being again a great crowd, and they having nothing that they could eat, having called his disciples to [him], he says to them, @ Amăng hơdôm hrơi anŭn, sa wơ̆t dơ̆ng ƀing mơnuih lu pơtŭm glaĭ, laih anŭn gơñu ƀu hmâo mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă ôh, Yêsu iâu ƀing ding kơna Ñu rai pơ Ñu hăng laĭ kơ gơñu, 
I have compassion on the crowd, because they have stayed with me already three days and they have not anything they can eat, @ “Kâo pap kơ ƀing mơnuih lu anai, yua kơ gơñu hmâo dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Kâo klâo hrơi laih, laih anŭn ƀu hmâo mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă ôh. 
and if I should dismiss them to their home fasting, they will faint on the way; for some of them are come from far. @ Tơdah Kâo brơi gơñu glaĭ hăng tơlơi rơpa, gơñu či rơwet rŏk jơlan; yua kơ hmâo đơđa amăng ƀing gơñu rai mơ̆ng ataih.”
And his disciples answered him, Whence shall one be able to satisfy these with bread here in a desert place? @ Ƀing ding kơna Ñu laĭ glaĭ: “Amăng tơdrŏn tač anai hyư̆m dưi hmâo ƀañ tơpŭng čem ƀing anai lĕ?”
And he asked them, How many loaves have ye? And they said, Seven. @ Yêsu tơña kơ gơñu: “Hơdôm klŏ ƀañ tơpŭng ƀing gih hmâo?” Gơñu laĭ: “Tơjuh klŏ.”
And he commanded the crowd to sit down on the ground. And having taken the seven loaves, he gave thanks, and broke [them] and gave [them] to his disciples, that they might set [them] before [them]; and they set [them] before the crowd. @ Yêsu pơtă brơi ƀing mơnuih lu dŏ ber ƀơi lŏn. Ñu mă tơjuh klŏ ƀañ tơpŭng, laih bơni hơơč kơ Ơi Adai, Ñu wơ̆k ƀañ tơpŭng brơi kơ ƀing ding kơna Ñu pơpha brơi; laih anŭn gơñu pơpha brơi kơ ƀing mơnuih lu. 
And they had a few small fishes, and having blessed them, he desired these also to be set before [them]. @ Gơñu ăt hmâo mơ̆n ƀơƀiă drơi akan anĕt, laih bơni hơơč kơ Ơi Adai, kar kaĭ mơ̆n Ñu pơtă kơ ƀing ding kơna Ñu pơpha brơi akan anŭn kơ ƀing mơnuih lu. 
And they ate and were satisfied. And they took up of fragments that remained seven baskets. @ Abih bang mơnuih ƀơ̆ng trơi soh sel, laih anŭn gơñu duñ djah dŏ glaĭ bă tơjuh bai. 
And they [that had eaten] were about four thousand; and he sent them away. @ Ƀing ƀơ̆ng anŭn hmâo giăm pă rơbâo čô. Giơ̆ng anŭn Yêsu brơi ƀing mơnuih glaĭ, 
And immediately going on board ship with his disciples, he came into the parts of Dalmanutha. @ laih anŭn tañ mơtam Yêsu đĭ sŏng hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing ding kơna Ñu, laih anŭn nao pơ tring Dalmanutha.
And the Pharisees went out and began to dispute against him, seeking from him a sign from heaven, tempting him. @  Ƀing Pharisi rai laih anŭn pơrơjah hăng Yêsu. Gơñu rơkâo Yêsu ngă sa gru kơnăl mơyang mơ̆ng adai kiăng lông lăng Ñu. 
And groaning in his spirit, he says, Why does this generation seek a sign? Verily I say unto you, A sign shall in no wise be given to this generation. @ Yêsu kơhôih amăng bơngăt jua hăng laĭ: “Yua hơgĕt ƀing mơnuih rơnŭk anai hơduah sa gru kơnăl mơyang? Sĭt biă mă Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, ƀu či hmâo sa gru kơnăl mơyang brơi kơ ƀing rơnŭk anai ôh.”
And he left them, and going again on board ship, went away to the other side. @ Giơ̆ng anŭn Yêsu lui gơñu, wơ̆t glaĭ đĭ sŏng hăng găn nao pơ hang gah adih.
And they forgot to take bread, and save one loaf, they had not [any] with them in the ship. @ Ƀing ding kơna wơr bĭt djă ba ƀañ tơpŭng; amăng sŏng gơñu kơnơ̆ng hmâo sa klŏ ƀañ tơpŭng đôč. 
And he charged them, saying, Take heed, beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and [of] the leaven of Herod. @ Yêsu pơtă kơ gơñu hăng laĭ: “Răng bĕ kơ tơpơi ƀing Pharisi hăng tơpơi Hêrôt.”
And they reasoned with one another, [saying], It is because we have no bread. @ Gơñu črŏng sai tơdruă gơñu kơ tơlơi anŭn hăng laĭ: “Ñu pơhiăp tui anŭn yua kơ ƀing ta ƀu hmâo djă ƀañ tơpŭng ôh.”
And Jesus knowing [it], says to them, Why reason ye because ye have no bread? Do ye not yet perceive nor understand? Have ye your heart [yet] hardened? @ Yêsu thâo tơlơi anŭn hăng laĭ kơ gơñu: “Hyư̆m ƀing gih črŏng sai kơ tơlơi ƀing gih ƀu hmâo ƀañ tơpŭng lĕ? Ƀing gih aka thâo hăng aka hluh ôh hă? Pran jua ƀing gih ăt dŏ khăng hă? 
Having eyes, see ye not? and having ears, hear ye not? and do ye not remember? @ Ƀing gih hmâo mơta hyư̆m ƀing gih ƀu ƀuh ôh hă? Ƀing gih hmâo tơngia hyư̆m ƀing gih ƀu hmư̆ hă? Ƀing gih ƀu hơdơr ôh hă? 
When I broke the five loaves for the five thousand, how many hand-baskets full of fragments took ye up? They say to him, Twelve. @ Tơ Kâo wơ̆k rơma klŏ ƀañ tơpŭng brơi kơ rơma rơbâo čô mơnuih, ƀing gih duñ glaĭ hơdôm bai čơđeh meh ƀañ rơbeh?” Gơñu laĭ glaĭ: “Pluh dua bai.”
And when the seven for the four thousand, the filling of how many baskets of fragments took ye up? And they said, Seven. @ “Laih anŭn tơjuh klŏ ƀañ tơpŭng brơi kơ pă rơbâo čô mơnuih, ƀing gih duñ glaĭ hơdôm bai čơđeh meh ƀañ rơbeh?” Gơñu laĭ glaĭ: “Tơjuh bai.”
And he said to them, How do ye not yet understand? @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Ƀing gih ăt aka thâo hluh ôh hă?”
And he comes to Bethsaida; and they bring him a blind man, and beseech him that he might touch him. @ Laih anŭn gơñu truh pơ plei Bêtsaida. Arăng ba rai pơ Yêsu sa čô đah rơkơi bum mơta, hăng rơkâo kơwưh kơ Yêsu ruaih gơ̆. 
And taking hold of the hand of the blind man he led him forth out of the village, and having spit upon his eyes, he laid his hands upon him, and asked him if he beheld anything. @ Yêsu djă tơngan pô bum anŭn, ba gơ̆ pơ gah rơngiao plei. Laih anŭn tơ Ñu kơčuh ia bah ƀơi mơta gơ̆ hăng ah tơngan ƀơi ñu, Ñu tơña gơ̆: “Ih ƀuh mơnơ̆ng hơgĕt mơ̆?”
And having looked up, he said, I behold men, for I see [them], as trees, walking. @ Gơ̆ angak lăng hăng laĭ: “Kâo ƀuh mơnuih, samơ̆ gơñu kar hăng phŭn kơyâo hlăk dŏ rơbat.”
Then he laid his hands again upon his eyes, and he saw distinctly, and was restored and saw all things clearly. @ Sa wơ̆t dơ̆ng Yêsu ah tơngan Ñu ƀơi mơta gơ̆, laih anŭn gơ̆ lăng ƀu kơ ƀleh ôh laih anŭn gơ̆ hlao mơtam hăng ƀuh klă rơđah abih bang mơnơ̆ng. 
And he sent him to his house, saying, Neither enter into the village, nor tell [it] to any one in the village. @ Yêsu brơi gơ̆ glaĭ pơ sang hăng pơtă: “Anăm mŭt glaĭ ôh amăng plei.”
And Jesus went forth and his disciples, into the villages of Caesarea-Philippi. And by the way he asked his disciples, saying unto them, Who do men say that I am? @ Yêsu hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing ding kơna Ñu đuaĭ mơ̆ng anŭn, laih anŭn nao pơ lu boh plei amăng tring Sêsarê Philip. Tơdang rơbat rŏk jơlan Yêsu tơña kơ ƀing ding kơna Ñu: “Hlơi Kâo jing tui hăng arăng laĭ?”
And they answered him, saying, John the baptist; and others, Elias; but others, One of the prophets. @  Gơñu laĭ glaĭ: “Yôhan Ƀatem, laih anŭn ƀing pơkŏn laĭ Êli, ƀing pơkŏn dơ̆ng laĭ sa čô amăng ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo.”
And he asked them, But *ye*, who do ye say that I am? And Peter answering says to him, *Thou* art the Christ. @  Yêsu tơña kơ ƀing gơ̆: “Samơ̆ ƀing gih laĭ hlơi Kâo jing?”
Pêtrôs laĭ glaĭ kơ Ñu: “Ih jing Yang Krist.”
And he charged them straitly, in order that they should tell no man about him. @ Laih anŭn Khua Yang Yêsu khă kơtang tĭt kơ ƀing gơñu, anăm pơhaih kơ arăng ôh hlơi Ñu jing.
And he began to teach them that the Son of man must suffer many things, and be rejected of the elders and of the chief priests and of the scribes, and be killed, and after three days rise [again]. @ Hlăk anŭn Yêsu čơdơ̆ng pơtô kơ gơñu tơlơi Ană Mơnuih khŏm tŭ lu tơlơi ruă nuă, laih anŭn ƀing kŏng tha, ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng, ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt či hơngah lui Ñu, hăng pơdjai hĭ Ñu, laih anŭn klâo hrơi tơdơi Ñu či hơdip glaĭ dơ̆ng. 
And he spoke the thing openly. And Peter, taking him to [him], began to rebuke him. @ Yêsu laĭ tơlơi anŭn klă rơđah biă mă. Pêtrôs ba Yêsu pơ anih pơkŏn hăng khă kơ Ñu anăm laĭ tui anŭn ôh. 
But he, turning round and seeing his disciples, rebuked Peter, saying, Get away behind me, Satan, for thy mind is not on the things that are of God, but on the things that are of men. @ Samơ̆ Yêsu wir lăng kơ ƀing ding kơna Ñu, hăng ƀuah Pêtrôs: “Ơ Satan, kơdŭn bĕ gah klon Kâo. Yua kơ ih ƀu pơmĭn kơ bruă Ơi Adai ôh samơ̆ kơnơ̆ng pơmĭn kơ bruă ană mơnuih đôč.”
And having called the crowd with his disciples, he said to them, Whoever desires to come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross and follow me. @  Giơ̆ng anŭn Yêsu iâu ƀing mơnuih lu hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing ding kơna Ñu laih anŭn laĭ: “Tơdah hlơi pô kiăng đuaĭ tui Kâo brơi ñu khŏm hơngah hĭ tơlơi pô ñu kiăng, glăm kơyâo bơrơkal ñu pô, hăng đuaĭ tui Kâo. 
For whosoever shall desire to save his life shall lose it, but whosoever shall lose his life for my sake and the gospel's shall save it. @ Yua kơ hlơi kiăng pơklaih tơlơi hơdip ñu, ñu či rơngiă hĭ; samơ̆ hlơi rơngiă tơlơi hơdip ñu yua kơ Kâo hăng yua kơ Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam, ñu či pơklaih tơlơi hơdip ñu. 
For what shall it profit a man if he gain the whole world and suffer the loss of his soul? @ Yua kơ, hơgĕt tơlơi tŭ yua kơ sa čô mơnuih tơdah ñu hmâo abih lŏn tơnah, samơ̆ rơngiă hĭ bơngăt ñu? 
for what should a man give in exchange for his soul? @ Hăng mơnơ̆ng hơgĕt ñu dưi brơi kiăng song glaĭ bơngăt ñu? 
For whosoever shall be ashamed of me and of my words in this adulterous and sinful generation, of him shall the Son of man also be ashamed when he shall come in the glory of his Father with the holy angels. @ Yua kơ hlơi pô mlâo kơ Kâo hăng kơ tơlơi Kâo pơhiăp amăng rơnŭk rih răm hăng soh sat anai, kar kaĭ mơ̆n Ană Mơnuih či mlâo kơ pô anŭn hlăk Ñu rai amăng tơlơi ang yang Ama Ñu hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing ling jang rơgoh hiam Ñu.”
And he said to them, Verily I say unto you, There are some of those standing here that shall not taste death until they shall have seen the kingdom of God come in power. @ Laih anŭn Yêsu laĭ hăng gơñu: “Sĭt biă mă Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, hmâo đơđa ƀing dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơi anai ƀu či djai ôh hlâo kơ gơñu ƀuh dêh čar pơtao Ơi Adai rai hăng tơlơi dưi mơyang.”
And after six days Jesus takes with [him] Peter and James and John, and takes them up on a high mountain by themselves apart. And he was transfigured before them: @  Năm hrơi tơdơi Yêsu ba Pêtrôs, Yakơ, hăng Yôhan đĭ pơ glong čŏng čư̆ hơjăn gơñu. Laih anŭn drơi jan Yêsu hrih ƀơi anăp gơñu. 
and his garments became shining, exceeding white [as snow], such as fuller on earth could not whiten [them]. @ Sum ao Ñu rơđah jing kơmlă hăng kŏ biă mă, kŏ hloh kơ arăng dưi ngă ƀơi lŏn tơnah anai. 
And there appeared to them Elias with Moses, and they were talking with Jesus. @ Plŭt Êli hăng Môis pơƀuh rai. Dua čô anŭn dŏ pơhiăp hrŏm hăng Yêsu. 
And Peter answering says to Jesus, Rabbi, it is good that we should be here; and let us make three tabernacles, for thee one, and for Moses one, and for Elias one. @ Pêtrôs laĭ hăng Yêsu. “Ơ Nai hiam yơh ƀing ta dŏ pơ anai, brơi ƀing ta ngă klâo boh sang khăn, sa boh kơ Ih, sa boh kơ Môis, hăng sa boh kơ Êli.” 
For he knew not what he should say, for they were filled with fear. @ Yua kơ Pêtrôs ƀu thâo či pơhiăp hơgĕt ôh, yua kơ gơñu hwĭ biă mă.
And there came a cloud overshadowing them, and there came a voice out of the cloud, *This* is my beloved Son: hear him. @  Giơ̆ng anŭn hmâo sa ƀŭt kơthul gom gơñu, laih anŭn hmâo asăp pơhiăp mơ̆ng kơthul anŭn: “Anai yơh jing Ană Kâo, Pô Kâo khăp hơeng biă mă. Brơi ƀing gih hmư̆ hiăp Ñu bĕ.” 
And suddenly having looked around, they no longer saw any one, but Jesus alone with themselves. @ Tô̆ kơ thĕng, tơ ƀing ding kơna lăng jum dar, gơñu ƀu ƀuh hlơi dơ̆ng ôh hrŏm hơbĭt hăng gơñu, kơnơ̆ng hơjăn Yêsu đôč.
And as they descended from the mountain, he charged them that they should relate to no one what they had seen, unless when the Son of man should be risen from among [the] dead. @ Tơdang gơñu trŭn mơ̆ng čư̆, Yêsu pơtă kơ ƀing gơñu anăm ră ruai kơ arăng ôh kơ tơlơi gơñu hmâo ƀuh laih tơl Ană Mơnuih hơdip glaĭ mơ̆ng ƀing djai.
And they kept that saying, questioning among themselves, what rising from among [the] dead was. @ Tui anŭn gơñu djă pioh tơlơi anŭn laih anŭn tơña tơdruă gơñu: “hơgĕt kiăng laĭ: ‘tơlơi hơdip glaĭ mơ̆ng ƀing djai?’” 
And they asked him saying, Why do the scribes say that Elias must first have come? @ Gơñu tơña kơ Yêsu: “Hyư̆m ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt laĭ, Êli khŏm rai hlâo?”
And he answering said to them, Elias indeed, having first come, restores all things; and how is it written of the Son of man that he must suffer much, and be set at nought: @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Sĭt biă mă Êli khŏm rai hlâo kiăng pơkra glaĭ abih bang bruă. Hyư̆m ngă ăt hmâo mơ̆n Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp čih kơ Ană Mơnuih khŏm tŭ lu tơlơi ruă nuă laih anŭn tơlơi arăng či hơngah lui hĭ Ñu? 
but I say unto you that Elias also is come, and they have done to him whatever they would, as it is written of him. @ Samơ̆ Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih thâo, Êli hmâo rai laih, laih anŭn gơñu hmâo ngă laih kơ gơ̆ tui hăng tơlơi gơñu kiăng, tui hăng Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp hmâo čih djơ̆ laih kơ gơ̆.”
And when he came to the disciples he saw a great crowd around them, and scribes disputing against them. @ Tơ gơñu truh pơ ƀing ding kơna pơkŏn, gơñu ƀuh phung mơnuih lu biă mă dŏ jum dar gơñu, laih anŭn hmâo hơdôm čô nai pơtô tơlơi juăt dŏ pơrơjah hăng gơñu. 
And immediately all the crowd seeing him were amazed, and running to [him], saluted him. @ Tơ phung mơnuih lu ƀuh Ñu, gơñu kơtuă biă mă laih anŭn tañ mơtam gơñu nao čơkă kơkuh kơ Yêsu. 
And he asked them, What do ye question with them about? @ Yêsu tơña kơ gơñu: “Tơlơi hơgĕt ƀing gih pơrơjah hăng gơñu?”
And one out of the crowd answered him, Teacher, I brought to thee my son, who has a dumb spirit; @ Sa čô amăng phung mơnuih lu anŭn laĭ glaĭ kơ Yêsu: “Ơ Nai, kâo ba rai ană đah rơkơi kâo pơ Ih, yua kơ hmâo yang sat ngă kơ ñu jing kơmlô. 
and wheresoever it seizes him it tears him, and he foams and gnashes his teeth, and he is withering away. And I spoke to thy disciples, that they might cast him out, and they could not. @ Rĭm wơ̆t yang ngă ñu, ñu pơrơbuh gơ̆ pơ lŏn, ƀlĕ pơrơboh ia bah, kĕ tơgơi laih anŭn drơi jan gơ̆ khăng arăng hĭ. Kâo hmâo rơkâo kơ ƀing ding kơna Ih puh pơđuaĭ hĭ yang sat anŭn, samơ̆ gơñu ƀu dưi puh pơđuaĭ ôh.”
But he answering them says, O unbelieving generation! how long shall I be with you? how long shall I bear with you? bring him to me. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Ơ kơnŭng djuai ƀu hmâo tơlơi đaŏ, hơdôm sui dơ̆ng Kâo khŏm dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing gih? Dơ̆ pă dơ̆ng Kâo khŏm gir hăng ƀing gih? Ba rai ñu pơ Kâo bĕ.” 
And they brought him to him. And seeing him the spirit immediately tore him; and falling upon the earth he rolled foaming. @ Laih anŭn gơñu ba čơđai anĕt anŭn pơ Yêsu; tơ yang sat ƀuh Yêsu, ñu prăh rơbuh čơđai anŭn ƀơi lŏn mơtam, tơglung blư̆ nao rai, blôk ia bah. 
And he asked his father, How long a time is it that it has been like this with him? And he said, From childhood; @ Yêsu tơña kơ ama ñu: “Hơbin ñu hmâo laih tơlơi anŭn?” Ñu laĭ: “Čơdơ̆ng mơ̆ng gơ̆ hlăk dŏ anĕt.
and often it has cast him both into fire and into waters that it might destroy him: but if thou couldst [do] anything, be moved with pity on us, and help us. @ Lu wơ̆t yang sat glŏm gơ̆ amăng apui ƀôdah amăng ia kiăng pơdjai gơ̆. Samơ̆ tơdah hơgĕt Ih dưi ngă, rơkâo kơ Ih pap hăng djru gơmơi đa.”
And Jesus said to him, The 'if thou couldst' is [if thou couldst] believe: all things are possible to him that believes. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ ñu: “Hyư̆m ih laĭ: ‘Tơdah Ih dưi’ Abih bang tơlơi dưi soh sel kơ hlơi pô đaŏ.”
And immediately the father of the young child crying out said [with tears], I believe, help mine unbelief. @ Tañ mơtam ama čơđai anŭn ur laĭ: “Kâo đaŏ, rơkâo ih djru brơi tơlơi kâo ƀu đaŏ!”
But Jesus, seeing that [the] crowd was running up together, rebuked the unclean spirit, saying to him, Thou dumb and deaf spirit, *I* command thee, come out of him, and enter no more into him. @ Tơ Yêsu ƀuh ƀing mơnuih lu rai, Ñu ƀuah, laĭ kơ yang bơngăt grĭ hơƀak anŭn: “Ơ yang kơmlô hăng tơngil, Kâo pơtă kơ ŏng tơbiă bĕ mơ̆ng čơđai anĕt anai, laih anŭn anăm glaĭ mŭt amăng gơ̆ dơ̆ng ôh.”
And having cried out and torn [him] much, he came out; and he became as if dead, so that the most said, He is dead. @ Giơ̆ng kơ yang sat ur laih anŭn ñu pơañak drơi jan gơ̆ kơtang biă mă hăng tơbiă hĭ. Čơđai anŭn jing kar hăng sa čô djai yơh, tơl hmâo lu mơnuih amăng ƀing anŭn laĭ: “Gơ̆ djai yơh!” 
But Jesus, having taken hold of him by the hand, lifted him up, and he arose. @ Samơ̆ Yêsu mă tơngan ñu hăng rŭ đĭ, laih anŭn gơ̆ tơgŭ.
And when he was entered into the house, his disciples asked him privately, Wherefore could not *we* cast him out? @ Tơ Yêsu mŭt sang, ƀing ding kơna tơña kơ Ñu tơdang Ñu dŏ hơjăn: “Yua hơgĕt ƀing gơmơi ƀu dưi puh pơđuaĭ ôh yang sat anŭn?”
And he said to them, This kind can go out by nothing but by prayer and fasting. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Tơdah ƀu iâu laĭ ƀu hmâo hlơi dưi puh pơđuaĭ mơta yang sat anŭn ôh.”
And going forth from thence they went through Galilee; and he would not that any one knew it; @ Mơ̆ng anih anŭn gơñu hlŏng nao găn kwar Galilê, Yêsu ƀu kiăng arăng thâo tơlơi anŭn ôh, 
for he taught his disciples and said to them, The Son of man is delivered into men's hands, and they shall kill him; and having been killed, after three days he shall rise again. @ yua kơ Ñu hmâo pơtô kơ ƀing ding kơna Ñu tơdang laĭ kơ ƀing gơ̆: “Arăng či jao lui Ană Mơnuih amăng tơngan mơnuih, laih anŭn gơñu či pơdjai hĭ Ñu; laih arăng pơdjai, hrơi tal klâo Ñu či hơdip glaĭ dơ̆ng.”
But they understood not the saying, and feared to ask him. @ Samơ̆ ƀing gơñu ƀu thâo hluh ôh kơ tơlơi Yêsu hmâo pơhiăp anŭn, laih anŭn dơ̆ng gơñu hwĭ ƀu khĭn tơña Yêsu ôh.
And he came to Capernaum, and being in the house, he asked them, Of what were ye reasoning by the way? @ Tui anŭn gơñu truh pơ plei Kapernum. Tơ Ñu mŭt amăng sang laih, Ñu tơña kơ ƀing gơ̆: “Hlăk rơbat ƀơi rŏk jơlan, ƀing gih pơrơjah tơlơi hơgĕt?”
And they remained silent, for by the way they had been reasoning with one another who [was] greatest. @  Samơ̆ ƀing gơñu dŏ rơiăt, yua kơ hlăk rŏk jơlan ƀing gơñu pơrơjah tơdruă gơñu, hlơi amăng ƀing gơñu jing prŏng hloh. 
And sitting down he called the twelve; and he says to them, If any one would be first, he shall be last of all, and minister of all. @ Yêsu dŏ ber, iâu pluh dua čô ƀing khua ding kơna hăng laĭ: “Tơdah hlơi kiăng jing tal sa, brơi ñu khŏm jing pô dŏ pơ rơnuč hloh kơ abih bang laih anŭn jing ding kơna kơ abih bang.” 
And taking a little child he set it in their midst, and having taken it in his arms he said to them, @ Giơ̆ng anŭn Yêsu mă sa čô čơđai anĕt pioh gơ̆ ƀơi tơ̆ng krah ƀing gơñu. Ñu pi gơ̆ tơdang laĭ kơ ƀing gơñu. 
Whosoever shall receive one of such little children in my name, receives me; and whosoever shall receive me, does not receive me, but him who sent me. @ “Hlơi jum sa čô čơđai anĕt kar hăng anai amăng anăn Kâo kar hăng ñu jum Kâo mơ̆n; laih anŭn hlơi jum Kâo, ƀu djơ̆ jum Kâo ôh, samơ̆ jum Pô hmâo pơkiaŏ rai Kâo.”
And John answered him saying, Teacher, we saw some one casting out demons in thy name, who does not follow us, and we forbad him, because he does not follow us. @ Yôhan laĭ hăng Yêsu: “Ơ Nai, gơmơi hmâo ƀuh sa čô mơnuih puh pơđuaĭ yang sat amăng anăn Ih, laih anŭn gơmơi khă ñu yua kơ ñu ƀu tui hăng ƀing ta ôh.”
But Jesus said, Forbid him not; for there is no one who shall do a miracle in my name, and be able soon [after] to speak ill of me; @ Samơ̆ Yêsu laĭ: “Anăm khă ñu ôh, yua kơ ƀu hmâo ôh sa čô mơnuih ngă bruă mơsêh mơyang amăng anăn Kâo mơ̆n laih anŭn pơhiăp sat kơ Kâo mơ̆n. 
for he who is not against us is for us. @ Yua kơ hlơi ƀu pơkơdơ̆ng hăng ƀing ta ñu jing pô lơ̆m kơ ƀing ta. 
For whosoever shall give you a cup of water to drink in [my] name, because ye are Christ's, verily I say unto you, he shall in no wise lose his reward. @ Laih anŭn hlơi pô brơi kơ ƀing gih mơñum sa kơčok ia yua kơ ƀing gih jing ƀing lơ̆m kơ Yang Krist. Sĭt biă mă Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, pô anŭn ƀu či rơngiă ôh tơlơi bơni apah ñu.”
And whosoever shall be a snare to one of the little ones who believe [in me], it were better for him if a millstone were hung about his neck, and he cast into the sea. @ “Tơdah hlơi ngă brơi sa čô amăng ƀing čơđai anĕt anai hmâo đaŏ laih Kâo lĕ amăng tơlơi soh, hiam hloh brơi arăng akă hĭ sa boh rơsŭng boh pơtâo prŏng ƀơi tơkuai pô anŭn hăng glŏm hĭ ñu amăng ia rơsĭ. 
And if thy hand serve as a snare to thee, cut it off: it is better for thee to enter into life maimed, than having thy two hands to go away into hell, into the fire unquenchable; @ Tơdah tơngan ih ngă brơi ih lĕ rơbuh, čơ̆ng hĭ ñu bĕ; hiam hloh kơ ih mŭt amăng tơlơi hơdip hmâo kơnơ̆ng sa ƀĕ tơngan, hăng ih hmâo dua ƀĕ tơngan samơ̆ mŭt amăng war apui, amăng apui ƀu thâo rơngăm ôh. 
And if thy foot serve as a snare to thee, cut it off: it is better for thee to enter into life lame, than having thy two feet to be cast into hell, into the fire unquenchable; @ Tơdah tơkai ih ngă brơi ih lĕ rơbuh, čơ̆ng hĭ ñu bĕ; hiam hloh kơ ih mŭt amăng tơlơi hơdip hmâo kơnơ̆ng sa ƀĕ tơkai, hăng ih hmâo dua ƀĕ tơkai samơ̆ arăng glŏm ih amăng war apui. 
And if thine eye serve as a snare to thee, cast it out: it is better for thee to enter into the kingdom of God with one eye, rather than having two eyes to be cast into the hell of fire, @ Tơdah mơta ih pơsoh ih ngă brơi ih lĕ rơbuh, blač hĭ ñu bĕ; hiam hloh kơ ih mŭt amăng dêh čar pơtao Ơi Adai hăng sa gah mơta, kơ ih hmâo dua gah mơta samơ̆ arăng glŏm hĭ ih amăng war apui. 
where their worm dies not, and the fire is not quenched. @ Pơ anŭn hlăt ƀơ̆ng gơñu ƀu thâo djai, hăng apui ƀơ̆ng gơñu ƀu thâo rơngăm ôh.
For every one shall be salted with fire, and every sacrifice shall be salted with salt. @ Yua kơ arăng či pơđăm rĭm čô hăng apui.
Salt [is] good, but if the salt is become saltless, wherewith will ye season it? Have salt in yourselves, and be at peace with one another. @  Hra jing hiam, samơ̆ tơdah hra rơngiă hĭ mơsĭn, hyư̆m ƀing gih dưi ngă kiăng kơ ñu mơsĭn glaĭ dơ̆ng? Brơi ƀing gih khŏm hmâo hra amăng ƀing gih pô, laih anŭn brơi ƀing gih hơdip rơnŭk rơnua hăng tơdruă ƀing gih.”
And rising up thence he comes into the coasts of Judaea, and the other side of the Jordan. And again crowds come together to him, and, as he was accustomed, again he taught them. @ Yêsu đuaĭ mơ̆ng anŭn nao pơ tring Yuđa laih anŭn pơ hang gah adih ia krong Yurdan. Ƀing mơnuih lu rai pơtŭm jum dar Ñu dơ̆ng, laih anŭn Ñu pơtô ƀing gơ̆ tui hăng tơlơi Ñu juăt ngă laih.
And Pharisees coming to [him] asked him, Is it lawful for a man to put away [his] wife? (tempting him). @ Hmâo ƀing Pharisi nao pơ Yêsu hăng tơña kiăng lông lăng Ñu: “Phiăn mơ̆ sa čô đah rơkơi klaih lui bơnai ñu?”
But he answering said to them, What did Moses command you? @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ gơñu: “Hơgĕt Môis hmâo pơtă laih kơ ƀing gih?”
And they said, Moses allowed to write a bill of divorce, and to put away. @  Gơñu laĭ: “Môis brơi tơlơi dưi đah rơkơi čih hră klaih lui laih anŭn lui hĭ bơnai ñu.”
And Jesus answering said to them, In view of your hard-heartedness he wrote this commandment for you; @ Samơ̆ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Yua kơ pran jua ƀing gih khăng, hnŭn yơh ñu čih tơlơi juăt anŭn brơi kơ ƀing gih. 
but from [the] beginning of [the] creation God made them male and female. @ Samơ̆ mơ̆ng phŭn tơlơi hrih pơjing: ‘Ơi Adai kơnơ̆ng pơjing sa čô đah rơkơi laih anŭn sa čô đah kơmơi đôč.’ 
For this cause a man shall leave his father and mother and shall be united to his wife, @ ‘Yua kơ tơlơi anŭn yơh đah rơkơi či lui amĭ ama ñu laih anŭn pơgop hăng bơnai ñu, 
and the two shall be one flesh: so that they are no longer two but one flesh. @ laih anŭn dua gơñu či jing hĭ sa asar.’ Tui anŭn gơñu ƀu jing dua dơ̆ng ôh, samơ̆ kơnơ̆ng jing sa asar đôč. 
What therefore God has joined together, let not man separate. @ Tui anŭn, anăm brơi mơnuih pơčơlah hĭ ôh ƀing hlơi Ơi Adai hmâo pơgop laih.”
And again in the house the disciples asked him concerning this. @ Tơdang gơñu dŏ amăng sang, ƀing ding kơna tơña kơ Yêsu dơ̆ng kơ tơlơi anŭn. 
And he says to them, Whosoever shall put away his wife and shall marry another, commits adultery against her. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Hlơi lui bơnai ñu hăng dŏ bơnai pơkŏn, jing ñu ngă tơlơi klĕ pyu soh hăng bơnai ñu. 
And if a woman put away her husband and shall marry another, she commits adultery. @ Laih anŭn tơdah đah kơmơi lui rơkơi ñu dŏ rơkơi pơkŏn, ăt ñu jing soh klĕ pyu mơ̆n.”
And they brought little children to him that he might touch them. But the disciples rebuked those that brought [them]. @ Arăng ba ƀing čơđai anĕt nao pơ Yêsu kiăng kơ Ñu ah tơngan hơ-ŭ mơyun kơ ƀing gơ̆; samơ̆ ƀing ding kơna ƀuah kơ ƀing ba čơđai anŭn. 
But Jesus seeing [it], was indignant, and said to them, Suffer the little children to come to me; forbid them not; for of such is the kingdom of God. @ Samơ̆ tơ Yêsu ƀuh tơlơi anŭn Ñu hil hăng laĭ kơ ƀing ding kơna Ñu: “Brơi ƀing čơđai rai pơ Kâo bĕ, anăm khă ƀing gơñu ôh, yua kơ dêh čar pơtao Ơi Adai lơ̆m kơ hlơi pô jing kar hăng ƀing čơđai anŭn. 
Verily I say to you, Whosoever shall not receive the kingdom of God as a little child, shall in no wise enter into it. @ Sĭt biă mă Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, hlơi ƀu tŭ mă ôh dêh čar pơtao Ơi Adai kar hăng sa čô čơđai anĕt, ñu ƀu dưi mŭt pơ anŭn ôh.” 
And having taken them in his arms, having laid his hands on them, he blessed them. @ Giơ̆ng anŭn Yêsu pi mă ƀing čơđai, ah tơngan ƀơi gơñu hăng hơ-ŭ mơyun hiam brơi kơ ƀing gơ̆.
And as he went forth into the way, a person ran up to [him], and kneeling to him asked him, Good Teacher, what shall I do that I may inherit eternal life? @ Tơdang Yêsu čơdơ̆ng rơbat nao, hmâo sa čô mơnuih nao čon tơŭt ƀơi anăp Ñu hăng tơña kơ Ñu: “Ơ Nai hiam klă, hơgĕt tơlơi kâo khŏm ngă kiăng dưi mă tŭ tơlơi hơdip hlŏng lar?”
But Jesus said to him, Why callest thou me good? no one is good but one, [that is] God. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ ñu: “Yua hơgĕt ih iâu Kâo jing Pô hiam klă lĕ? Ƀu hmâo hlơi hiam klă ôh, kơnơ̆ng hơjăn Ơi Adai đôč. 
Thou knowest the commandments: Do not commit adultery, Do not kill, Do not steal, Do not bear false witness, Do not defraud, Honour thy father and mother. @ Ih thâo laih tơlơi juăt: ‘Anăm pơdjai mơnuih ôh; anăm klĕ pyu ôh; anăm klĕ dŏp ôh; anăm ngă gơ̆ng jơlan ƀlor kơ arăng ôh; anăm plư pleč arăng ôh; pơpŭ bĕ kơ amĭ ama ih.’”
And he answering said to him, Teacher, all these things have I kept from my youth. @ Gơ̆ laĭ glaĭ: “Ơ Nai, kâo hmâo tui gưt laih abih bang tơlơi juăt anŭn čơdơ̆ng mơ̆ng kâo dŏ čơđai.”
And Jesus looking upon him loved him, and said to him, One thing lackest thou: go, sell whatever thou hast and give to the poor, and thou shalt have treasure in heaven; and come, follow me, [taking up the cross]. @ Yêsu lăng kơ gơ̆ hăng tơlơi khăp, laih anŭn laĭ: “Ih kơƀah sa tơlơi; nao bĕ, sĭ hĭ hơgĕt mơnơ̆ng ih hmâo hăng pha brơi kơ ƀing ƀun rin, laih anŭn ih či hmâo yơh kong ngăn yom amăng adai. Laih anŭn rai bĕ, đuaĭ tui Kâo.” 
But he, sad at the word, went away grieved, for he had large possessions. @ Tơ ñu hmư̆ tơlơi anŭn ƀô̆ mơta ñu kơtraŏ, laih anŭn ñu rơbat đuaĭ hăng tơlơi rơngot, yua kơ ñu hmâo dram gơnam lu biă mă.
And Jesus looking around says to his disciples, How difficultly shall they that have riches enter into the kingdom of God! @ Tui anŭn Yêsu lăng jum dar hăng laĭ kơ ƀing ding kơna Ñu: “Tơnap biă mă kơ ƀing pơdrŏng sah mŭt amăng dêh čar pơtao Ơi Adai!”
And the disciples were amazed at his words. And Jesus again answering says to them, Children, how difficult it is that those who trust in riches should enter into the kingdom of God! @ Ƀing ding kơna kơtuă kơ tơlơi Ñu pơhiăp anŭn. Samơ̆ Yêsu laĭ kơ ƀing gơñu dơ̆ng: “Ơ ƀing ană Kâo, tơnap biă mă yơh dưi mŭt amăng dêh čar pơtao Ơi Adai. 
It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God. @ Amuñ hloh kơ sa drơi aseh samô mŭt ƀơi amăng jrum hăng sa čô mơnuih pơdrŏng mŭt amăng dêh čar pơtao Ơi Adai.”
And they were exceedingly astonished, saying to one another, And who can be saved? @ Ƀing ding kơna Ñu kơtuă biă mă hăng laĭ tơdruă gơñu: “Tui anŭn hlơi dưi klaih lĕ?”
But Jesus looking on them says, With men it is impossible, but not with God; for all things are possible with God. @ Yêsu lăng kơ ƀing gơñu hăng laĭ: “Tơlơi anŭn mơnuih ƀu dưi ngă ôh, samơ̆ Ơi Adai dưi ngă; yua kơ abih bang tơlơi Ơi Adai dưi ngă soh sel.”
Peter began to say to him, Behold, *we* have left all things and have followed thee. @ Pêtrôs čơdơ̆ng laĭ hăng Yêsu: “Lăng anai, gơmơi hmâo lui laih abih bang tơlơi kiăng đuaĭ tui Ih.”
Jesus answering said, Verily I say to you, There is no one who has left house, or brethren, or sisters, or father, or mother, [or wife], or children, or lands, for my sake and for the sake of the gospel, @ Yêsu laĭ: “Sĭt biă mă Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, abih bang hlơi pô lui laih sang ñu ƀôdah ƀing adơi ayŏng, amai adơi, amĭ ama, ƀing ană bă, ƀôdah lŏn hmua ñu yua kơ Kâo hăng yua kơ Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam, 
that shall not receive a hundredfold now in this time: houses, and brethren, and sisters, and mothers, and children, and lands, with persecutions, and in the coming age life eternal. @ ñu anŭn či mă tŭ amăng rơnŭk anai mơtam sa rơtuh wơ̆t lu hloh pưk sang, adơi ayŏng, amai adơi, amĭ, ƀing ană bă, laih anŭn lŏn hmua hrŏm hơbĭt hăng tơlơi arăng ngă sat mơ̆n, laih anŭn tơlơi hơdip hlŏng lar amăng rơnŭk či truh tơdơi. 
But many first shall be last, and the last first. @ Samơ̆ hmâo lu mơnuih hlâo či jing tơdơi, laih anŭn ƀing tơdơi či jing hlâo.”
And they were in the way going up to Jerusalem, and Jesus was going on before them; and they were amazed, and were afraid as they followed. And taking the twelve again to [him], he began to tell them what was going to happen to him: @ Khua Yang Yêsu hăng ƀing ding kơna hlăk rơbat ƀơi jơlan đĭ nao pơ Yêrusalem, Yêsu rơbat nao hlâo ƀơi anăp gơñu. Ƀing ding kơna hwĭ hyưt laih anŭn ƀing đuaĭ tui Ñu hmâo tơlơi hwĭ bral. Sa wơ̆t dơ̆ng Yêsu iâu mă pluh dua čô khua ding kơna hơjăn gơñu laih anŭn čơdơ̆ng laĭ brơi kơ gơñu tơlơi či truh kơ Ñu. 
Behold, we go up to Jerusalem, and the Son of man shall be delivered up to the chief priests and to the scribes, and they shall condemn him to death, and shall deliver him up to the nations: @ Ñu laĭ: “Hmư̆ bĕ, ƀing ta nao pơ plei Yêrusalem, arăng či jao lui Ană Mơnuih kơ ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng laih anŭn kơ ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt. Gơñu či klă kơđi pơdjai Ñu, laih anŭn jao lui Ñu kơ ƀing djuai tuai. 
and they shall mock him, and shall scourge him, and shall spit upon him, and shall kill him; and after three days he shall rise again. @ Arăng či djik djak kơ Ñu, kơčuh ia bah ƀơi Ñu, taih Ñu hăng hrĕ hnuăt, hăng pơdjai hĭ Ñu. Samơ̆ klâo hrơi tơdơi Ñu či hơdip glaĭ.”
And there come to him James and John, the sons of Zebedee, saying [to him], Teacher, we would that whatsoever we may ask thee, thou wouldst do it for us. @ Yakơ hăng Yôhan, ƀing ană đah rơkơi Sêbêdê, nao pơ anăp Yêsu hăng tơña kơ Ñu: “Ơ Nai, gơmơi kiăng kơ Ih ngă brơi gơmơi hơgĕt tơlơi gơmơi rơkâo.”
And he said to them, What would ye that I should do for you? @ Yêsu tơña: “Hơgĕt tơlơi ƀing gih kiăng kơ Kâo ngă brơi?”
And they said to him, Give to us that we may sit, one on thy right hand, and one on thy left hand, in thy glory. @ Gơñu laĭ glaĭ: “Amăng dêh čar pơtao ang yang Ih, rơkâo kơ Ih brơi gơmơi dŏ ber sa čô gah hơnuă laih anŭn sa čô gah iao Ih.”
And Jesus said to them, Ye do not know what ye ask. Are ye able to drink the cup which *I* drink, or be baptised with the baptism that *I* am baptised with? @ Samơ̆ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Ƀing gih ƀu thâo ôh hơgĕt tơlơi ƀing gih rơkâo. Ƀing gih dưi mơ̆ mơñum kơčok Kâo mơñum, laih anŭn dưi tŭ mơ̆ tơlơi ƀatem Kâo tŭ?”
And they said to him, We are able. And Jesus said to them, The cup that *I* drink ye will drink and with the baptism that *I* am baptised with ye will be baptised, @ Gơñu laĭ: “Gơmơi dưi mơ̆n.”
Tui anŭn Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Ƀing gih či mơñum kơčok Kâo či mơñum, laih anŭn ƀing gih či tŭ tơlơi ƀatem Kâo tŭ. 
but to sit on my right hand or on my left is not mine to give, but for those for whom it is prepared. @ Samơ̆ tơlơi dŏ ber gah hơnuă ƀôdah gah iao Kâo, ƀu djơ̆ Kâo pha brơi ôh. Tơlơi anŭn pioh brơi kơ hlơi Ơi Adai hmâo pơkă pioh laih.”
And the ten having heard [of it], began to be indignant about James and John. @ Tơ ƀing pluh čô hmư̆ tơlơi anŭn, gơñu čơdơ̆ng hil Yakơ hăng Yôhan. 
But Jesus having called them to [him], says to them, Ye know that those who are esteemed to rule over the nations exercise lordship over them; and their great men exercise authority over them; @ Yêsu iâu gơñu rai pơ Ñu hăng laĭ kơ gơñu: “Ƀing gih thâo laih ƀing mơnuih arăng brơi wai lăng ƀing djuai tuai khăp yua tơlơi kơtư̆ juă wai lăng plei pla, laih anŭn ƀing khua prŏng gơñu khăp yua tơlơi dưi kơtang kiăng gĭt gai ană plei. 
but it is not thus among you; but whosoever would be great among you, shall be your minister; @ Samơ̆ tơ̆ng krah ƀing gih ƀu djơ̆ kar hăng anŭn ôh, hlơi pô kiăng jing prŏng amăng ƀing gih, brơi ñu jing ding kơna kơ ƀing gih. 
and whosoever would be first of you shall be bondman of all. @ Laih anŭn hlơi pô kiăng ngă khua amăng ƀing gih, brơi ñu jing hlŭn kơ abih bang. 
For also the Son of man did not come to be ministered to, but to minister, and give his life a ransom for many. @ Yua kơ kar kaĭ mơ̆n Ană Mơnuih hmâo rai laih ƀu djơ̆ kiăng kơ arăng mă bruă kơ Ñu ôh, samơ̆ Ñu kiăng mă bruă kơ arăng, laih anŭn jao brơi tơlơi hơdip Ñu pô jing nua song mă kơ lu mơnuih.”
And they come to Jericho, and as he was going out from Jericho, and his disciples and a large crowd, the son of Timaeus, Bartimaeus, the blind [man], sat by the wayside begging. @ Giơ̆ng anŭn gơñu truh pơ plei Yêrikô. Tơdang Yêsu hăng ƀing ding kơna Ñu tơbiă mơ̆ng plei Yêrikô hrŏm hơbĭt hăng sa phung mơnuih lu, hmâo sa čô mơnuih bum mơta hyu rơkâo dan anăn gơ̆ Ƀartimê ană đah rơkơi Timê, dŏ ber ƀơi akiăng jơlan. 
And having heard that it was Jesus the Nazaraean, he began to cry out and to say, O Son of David, Jesus, have mercy on me. @ Tơ ñu hmư̆ arăng laĭ anai Yêsu plei Nasaret, gơ̆ čơdơ̆ng ur kraih hăng laĭ: “Ơ Yêsu, Ană Đawit, pap mơñai kơ kâo đa.”
And many rebuked him, that he might be silent; but he cried so much the more, Son of David, have mercy on me. @ Lu mơnuih khă gơ̆, brơi gơ̆ dŏ rơiăt, samơ̆ gơ̆ ur kraih hloh dơ̆ng: “Ơ Ană Đawit, pap mơñai kơ kâo đa.”
And Jesus, standing still, desired him to be called. And they call the blind [man], saying to him, Be of good courage, rise up, he calls thee. @ Yêsu dŏ hĭ hăng laĭ: “Iâu gơ̆ rai pơ anai bĕ.” Gơñu iâu mơnuih bum mơta anŭn, hăng laĭ kơ gơ̆: “Kơjăp pran jua, tơgŭ bĕ, Ñu iâu ih.”
And, throwing away his garment, he started up and came to Jesus. @ Gơ̆ toh glŏm lui hĭ ao phyung gơ̆, tơgŭ mơtam, hăng nao pơ Yêsu.
And Jesus answering says to him, What wilt thou that I shall do to thee? And the blind [man] said to him, Rabboni, that I may see. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơ̆: “Hơgĕt tơlơi ih kiăng Kâo ngă brơi kơ ih?”
Mơnuih bum mơta laĭ glaĭ: “Ơ Nai, brơi kâo dưi ƀuh rơđah.”
And Jesus said to him, Go, thy faith has healed thee. And he saw immediately, and followed him in the way. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơ̆: “Nao bĕ, tơlơi đaŏ ih hmâo pơsuaih ih laih.” Tañ mơtam mơta ñu rơđah glaĭ laih anŭn đuaĭ tui Yêsu ƀơi rŏk jơlan.
And when they draw near to Jerusalem, to Bethphage and Bethany, at the mount of Olives, he sends two of his disciples, @ Tơ gơñu nao giăm truh pơ plei Yêrusalem, jĕ plei Bêtphajê hăng plei Bêthani ƀơi čư̆ Ôliwơ, Yêsu pơkiaŏ nao dua čô ding kơna Ñu 
and says to them, Go into the village which is over against you, and immediately on entering into it ye will find a colt tied, upon which no [child] of man has ever sat: loose it and lead it [here]. @ hăng laĭ kơ gơñu: “Nao bĕ pơ plei gah anăp ƀing gih. Tơ ƀing gih man či mŭt pơ anŭn ƀing gih ƀuh sa drơi ană aseh kle arăng hmâo akă laih ƀơi anŭn, aka hmâo mơnuih đĭ djơ̆ ôh. Kleh hăng dui ba pơ anai bĕ. 
And if any one say to you, Why do ye this? say, The Lord has need of it; and straightway he sends it hither. @ Tơdah arăng tơña kơ gih: ‘Yua hơgĕt gih ngă tui anŭn?’ brơi gih laĭ glaĭ: ‘Khua Yang kiăng ñu, laih anŭn Ñu či ba glaĭ tañ mơtam.’”
And they departed, and found a colt bound to the door without at the crossway, and they loose him. @ Ƀing gơñu nao hăng ƀuh sa drơi ană aseh kle arăng hmâo akă laih ƀơi jơlan gah rơngiao ƀơi anăp bah amăng sang; laih anŭn gơñu kleh hĭ. 
And some of those who stood there said to them, What are ye doing, loosing the colt? @ Ƀing dŏ ƀơi anŭn tơña gơñu: “Yua hơgĕt ƀing gih kleh hĭ ană aseh kle anŭn?”
And they said to them as Jesus had commanded. And they let them [do it]. @ Laih anŭn gơñu laĭ glaĭ kơ ƀing anŭn tui hăng Khua Yang Yêsu hmâo pơtă laih. Tui anŭn arăng brơi gơñu nao yơh. 
And they led the colt to Jesus, and cast their clothes upon it, and he sat on it; @ Gơñu dui ba ană aseh kle anŭn pơ Yêsu, tap ao gơñu ƀơi rŏng gơ̆, laih anŭn Yêsu đĭ. 
and many strewed their clothes on the way, and others cut down branches from the trees [and went on strewing them on the way]. @ Lu mơnuih lang ao gơñu ƀơi jơlan, ƀing pơkŏn tap than kơyâo gơñu hmâo koh mơ̆ng glai. 
And those going on before and those following cried out, Hosanna! blessed [be] he that comes in [the] Lord's name. @ Ƀing nao hlâo hăng ƀing tui klon ur kraih:
“Hôsana!
Ơi Adai hơơč mơyun yơh kơ Pô rai amăng anăn Khua Yang!
Blessed [be] the coming kingdom of our father David. Hosanna in the highest! @  Ơi Adai hơơč mơyun kơ dêh čar pơtao Đawit ama ƀing ta či truh!
Hôsana, amăng Anih Hăng Glông Hloh kơ abih bang!”
And he entered into Jerusalem and into the temple; and having looked round on all things, the hour being already late, he went out to Bethany with the twelve. @ Yêsu mŭt amăng plei Yêrusalem hăng nao pơ sang Kơkuh Pơpŭ. Giơ̆ng kơ Ñu lăng abih bang mơnơ̆ng jum dar, yua kơ adai klam laih, Ñu nao pơ plei Bêthani hrŏm hăng pluh dua čô khua ding kơna.
And on the morrow, when they were gone out of Bethany, he hungered. @ Hrơi tơdơi, tơ gơñu tơbiă laih mơ̆ng plei Bêthani, Yêsu rơpa. 
And seeing from afar off a fig-tree which had leaves, he came, if perhaps he might find something on it. And having come up to it he found nothing but leaves, for it was not the time of figs. @ Ataih ƀiă mơ̆ng anŭn Ñu ƀuh sa phŭn hra hmâo lu hla. Ñu nao lăng mĭn dah ñu hmâo boh. Tơ Yêsu truh pơ anŭn, Ñu kơnơ̆ng ƀuh hla đôč, yua kơ hlăk anŭn aka truh bơyan boh hra ôh. 
And answering he said to it, Let no one eat fruit of thee any more for ever. And his disciples heard [it]. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ phŭn hra anŭn: “Ƀu hmâo hlơi či ƀơ̆ng boh ih dơ̆ng tah!” Ƀing ding kơna Ñu leng kơ hmư̆ boh pơhiăp anŭn.
And they come to Jerusalem, and entering into the temple, he began to cast out those who sold and who bought in the temple, and he overthrew the tables of the moneychangers and the seats of the dove-sellers, @ Gơñu truh pơ plei Yêrusalem, Yêsu mŭt amăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ hăng čơdơ̆ng puh pơđuaĭ ƀing sĭ mơdrô mơ̆ng sang anŭn. Ñu klư̆ kơƀang ƀing pơplih prăk hăng gre ƀing sĭ čĭm kơtrâo. 
and suffered not that any one should carry any package through the temple. @ Ñu ƀu brơi arăng ba mơnơ̆ng hơgĕt rơbat găn wăl sang kơkuh pơpŭ ôh. 
And he taught saying to them, Is it not written, My house shall be called a house of prayer for all the nations? but *ye* have made it a den of robbers. @ Laih anŭn Yêsu pơtô laĭ kơ ƀing gơñu: “Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp hmâo čih laih: ‘Arăng či iâu sang Kâo jing sang iâu laĭ kơ abih bang djuai mơnuih’? Samơ̆ ƀing gih hmâo pơjing hĭ ñu jing par kơ ƀing mơnuih klĕ dŏp.”
And the chief priests and the scribes heard [it], and they sought how they might destroy him; for they feared him, because all the crowd were astonished at his doctrine. @ Ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng hăng ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt hmư̆ tơlơi anŭn gơñu čơdơ̆ng hơduah jơlan pơdjai Yêsu. Gơñu hwĭ kơ Yêsu, yua kơ abih bang ƀing mơnuih lu hling hlang kơ tơlơi Ñu pơtô.
And when it was evening he went forth without the city. @ Tơ adai klam laih, Yêsu hăng ƀing ding kơna Ñu tơbiă mơ̆ng plei prŏng.
And passing by early in the morning they saw the fig-tree dried up from the roots. @ Ưm mơguah tơdơi, tơdang gơñu găn ƀơi anŭn, gơñu ƀuh phŭn hra anŭn djai kro laih hlŏng truh pơ akha ñu. 
And Peter, remembering [what Jesus had said], says to him, Rabbi, see, the fig-tree which thou cursedst is dried up. @ Pêtrôs hơdơr glaĭ hăng laĭ kơ Yêsu: “Ơ Nai, lăng adih, phŭn hra Ih hmâo hơtơ̆m pah anŭn kro yơh.”
And Jesus answering says to them, Have faith in God. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ kơ gơñu: “Brơi ƀing gih hmâo tơlơi đaŏ kơ Ơi Adai bĕ. 
Verily I say to you, that whosoever shall say to this mountain, Be thou taken away and cast into the sea, and shall not doubt in his heart, but believe that what he says takes place, whatever he shall say shall come to pass for him. @ Sĭt biă mă Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, hlơi pô laĭ kơ čư̆ anai: ‘Đuaĭ bĕ ih laih anŭn kơdâo amăng ia rơsĭ,’ tơdah amăng pran jua ñu ƀu đing ôh, samơ̆ đaŏ kơ tơlơi ñu laĭ či truh, sĭt tơlơi anŭn či ngă brơi kơ ñu yơh. 
For this reason I say to you, All things whatsoever ye pray for and ask, believe that ye receive it, and it shall come to pass for you. @ Yua kơ tơlơi anŭn Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, hơgĕt tơlơi ƀing gih rơkâo tơdang iâu laĭ, đaŏ bĕ ƀing gih hmâo mă tŭ laih, ƀing gih či hmâo tơlơi anŭn yơh. 
And when ye stand praying, forgive if ye have anything against any one, that your Father also who is in the heavens may forgive you your offences. @ Laih anŭn tơdang gih dŏ dơ̆ng iâu laĭ, pap brơi bĕ hơgĕt tơlơi ƀing gih hmâo hăng arăng, kiăng kơ Ama ƀing gih, Pô dŏ amăng adai dưi pap brơi tơlơi soh ƀing gih kar kaĭ mơ̆n.”
And they come again to Jerusalem. And as he walked about in the temple, the chief priests and the scribes and the elders come to him, @ Ƀing gơñu nao pơ plei Yêrusalem dơ̆ng. Tơdang Yêsu rơbat amăng sang Kơkuh Pơpŭ, ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng, ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt, hăng ƀing kŏng tha nao pơ Ñu. 
and they say to him, By what authority doest thou these things? and who gave thee this authority, that thou shouldest do these things? @ Gơñu tơña kơ Yêsu: “Hăng tơlơi dưi hơgĕt Ih ngă hơdôm tơlơi anai? Hlơi pô brơi kơ Ih tơlơi dưi kiăng ngă hơdôm tơlơi anai?”
And Jesus answering said to them, *I* also will ask you one thing, and answer me, and I will tell you by what authority I do these things: @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Kâo či tơña kơ ƀing gih sa tơlơi; laĭ glaĭ bĕ kơ Kâo, laih anŭn Kâo či laĭ brơi kơ ƀing gih hăng tơlơi dưi hơgĕt Kâo ngă hơdôm tơlơi anai. 
The baptism of John, was it of heaven, or of men? answer me. @ Laĭ brơi Kâo bĕ, tơlơi Yôhan ngă ƀatem tơbiă rai mơ̆ng Ơi Adai ƀôdah mơ̆ng mơnuih?”
And they reasoned with themselves, saying, If we should say, Of heaven, he will say, Why [then] have ye not believed him? @ Gơñu čơdơ̆ng pơrơjah tơdruă gơñu tui anai: “Tơdah ƀing ta laĭ: ‘Mơ̆ng Ơi Adai,’ ñu či laĭ: ‘Tui anŭn yua hơgĕt ƀing gih ƀu đaŏ kơ ñu lĕ?’ 
but should we say, Of men they feared the people; for all held of John that he was truly a prophet. @ Samơ̆ tơdah ƀing ta laĭ: ‘Mơ̆ng mơnuih’?” — Gơñu hwĭ kơ ƀing ană plei, yua kơ abih bang mơnuih đaŏ sĭt kơ Yôhan jing sa čô pô laĭ lui hlâo. — 
And they answering say to Jesus, We do not know. And Jesus [answering] says to them, Neither do *I* tell you by what authority I do these things. @ Tui anŭn gơñu laĭ glaĭ kơ Yêsu: “Gơmơi ƀu thâo ôh.” Yêsu laĭ glaĭ gơñu: “Kâo ăt ƀu či laĭ brơi lơi kơ ƀing gih hăng hơgĕt tơlơi dưi Kâo ngă hơdôm tơlơi anai.”
And he began to say to them in parables, A man planted a vineyard, and made a fence round [it] and dug a wine-vat, and built a tower, and let it out to husbandmen, and left the country. @  Yêsu čơdơ̆ng yua tơlơi bơhmutu kiăng pơtô ƀing gơñu. “Sa čô mơnuih pla sa boh đang boh kơƀâu. Ñu bư̆ rơgong jum dar đang, klơi sa boh amăng luh pioh djet ia boh kơƀâu, pơdơ̆ng đĭ sa boh sang rơñan kiăng kơ gak wai, giơ̆ng anŭn ñu jao brơi ƀing arăng ngă čan đang ñu, laih anŭn ñu nao pơ čar pơkŏn. 
And he sent a bondman to the husbandmen at the season, that he might receive from the husbandmen of the fruit of the vineyard. @ Tơl truh bơyan pĕ boh, ñu pơkiaŏ nao sa čô ding kơna ñu kiăng mă sa črăn boh kơmlai mơ̆ng ƀing ngă čan đang boh kơƀâu anŭn. 
But they took him, and beat [him], and sent [him] away empty. @ Samơ̆ ƀing anŭn mă gơ̆, taih hĭ gơ̆, hăng pơpuh gơ̆ glaĭ tơngan soh. 
And again he sent to them another bondman; and [at] him they [threw stones, and] struck [him] on the head, and sent [him] away with insult. @ Ñu pơkiaŏ nao sa čô ding kơna pơkŏn dơ̆ng pơ ƀing anŭn. Ƀing anŭn taih pơrơka akŏ gơ̆ hăng hơtoh djraĭ gơ̆. 
And [again] he sent another, and him they killed; and many others, beating some and killing some. @ Ñu pơkiaŏ nao sa čô pô pơkŏn dơ̆ng. Ƀing anŭn pơdjai hĭ gơ̆, laih anŭn ngă kar kaĭ kơ lu ƀing pơkŏn, đơđa gơñu taih amang, đơđa ƀing pơkŏn gơñu pơdjai hĭ. 
Having yet therefore one beloved son, he sent also him to them the last, saying, They will have respect for my son. @ Pô đang anŭn kơnơ̆ng dŏ hmâo sa čô ană đah rơkơi pô ñu khăp hơeng. Hnal tuč, ñu pơkiaŏ nao gơ̆ pơ gơñu, hăng laĭ: ‘Sĭt gơñu či pơpŭ kơ ană đah rơkơi kâo.’ 
But those husbandmen said to one another, This is the heir: come, let us kill him and the inheritance will be ours. @ Samơ̆ ƀing ngă čan đang boh anŭn bơlaĭ tơdruă gơñu: ‘Anai yơh jing pô tŭ mă kong ngăn. Bơ bĕ ƀing ta pơdjai hĭ ñu, laih anŭn kong ngăn anŭn či lơ̆m kơ ƀing ta yơh.’ 
And they took him and killed him, and cast him forth out of the vineyard. @ Tui anŭn gơñu mă pơdjai hĭ ană đah rơkơi anŭn, hăng glŏm hĭ drơi jan gơ̆ pơ gah rơngiao đang boh kơƀâu.
What therefore shall the lord of the vineyard do? He will come and destroy the husbandmen, and will give the vineyard to others. @ Hơgĕt pô đang boh kơƀâu anŭn či ngă? Ñu či rai pơdjai hĭ ƀing ngă čan anŭn, hăng jao đang boh kơƀâu anŭn kơ ƀing pơkŏn. 
Have ye not even read this scripture, The stone which they that builded rejected, this has become the corner-stone: @ Ƀing gih ƀu hmâo lăng ôh hă Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp čih:
‘Boh pơtâo ƀing pơdơ̆ng sang hơngah lui laih,
Hmâo jing hĭ laih boh pơtâo phŭn akiăng sang.
this is of [the] Lord, and it is wonderful in our eyes? @ Anai jing tơlơi Khua Yang ngă,
Laih anŭn jing tơlơi yom pơphan ƀơi anăp mơta ƀing ta’?”
And they sought to lay hold of him, and they feared the crowd; for they knew that he had spoken the parable of them. And they left him and went away. @ Ƀing khua wai lăng Yuđa hơduah jơlan mă Yêsu, yua kơ gơñu thâo laih Yêsu pơhiăp tơlơi bơhmutu djơ̆ kơ gơñu, samơ̆ gơñu hwĭ kơ ƀing mơnuih lu, tui anŭn gơñu lui Yêsu hăng đuaĭ hĭ.
And they send to him certain of the Pharisees and of the Herodians, that they might catch him in speaking. @ Ƀing khua wai lăng Yuđa pơkiaŏ nao đơđa ƀing Pharisi hăng ƀing mơnuih gah kơ Hêrôt pơ Yêsu kiăng ƀơč Yêsu amăng tơlơi Ñu pơhiăp. 
And they come and say to him, Teacher, we know that thou art true, and carest not for any one; for thou regardest not men's person, but teachest the way of God with truth: Is it lawful to give tribute to Caesar or not? @ Gơñu rai laĭ kơ Yêsu: “Ơ Nai, gơmơi thâo Ih jing mơnuih sĭt klă, laih anŭn ƀu bơngơ̆t ôh hyư̆m tơlơi arăng pơmĭn, yua kơ ih ƀu lăng ôh kơ hơgĕt tơlơi arăng jing, samơ̆ pơtô jơlan Ơi Adai tui hăng tơlơi tơpă sĭt. Phiăn mơ̆ duh jia kơ Sêsar ƀôdah ƀu phiăn ôh? Ƀing ta či duh jia mơ̆ ƀôdah ƀu duh ôh?” 
Should we give, or should we not give? But he knowing their hypocrisy said unto them, Why tempt ye me? Bring me a denarius that I may see [it]. @ Samơ̆ Yêsu thâo laih tơlơi plơ̆m ƀlor gơñu, tui anŭn Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Yua hơgĕt gih kiăng lông lăng Kâo? Ba rai sa sar prăk đơniê brơi Kâo lăng.”
And they brought [it]. And he says to them, Whose [is] this image and superscription? And they said to him, Caesar's. @ Gơñu ba rai kơ Yêsu sa sar prăk đơniê. Laih anŭn Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Rup hăng anăn hlơi anai?” Gơñu laĭ glaĭ: “Sêsar.” 
And Jesus answering said to them, Pay what is Caesar's to Caesar, and what is God's to God. And they wondered at him. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Ba glaĭ bĕ kơ Sêsar hơgĕt lơ̆m kơ Sêsar, laih anŭn ba glaĭ bĕ kơ Ơi Adai hơgĕt lơ̆m kơ Ơi Adai.” Gơñu dŏ kơtuă hling biă mă kơ tơlơi Yêsu pơhiăp anŭn.
And Sadducees come to him, that say there is no resurrection; and they demanded of him saying, @  Hmâo đơđa ƀing Sadusi rai pơ Yêsu, ƀing anŭn laĭ ƀu hmâo tơlơi hơdip glaĭ ôh. Gơñu tơña kơ Yêsu tui anai: 
Teacher, Moses wrote to us that if any one's brother die, and leave a wife behind, and leave no children, that his brother shall take his wife, and raise up seed to his brother. @ “Ơ Nai, Môis hmâo čih brơi kơ gơmơi, tơdah sa čô mơnuih hmâo ayŏng dŏ bơnai, ñu djai hĭ pioh glaĭ bơnai ñu samơ̆ ƀu hmâo ană ôh, adơi ñu khŏm dŏ bơnai ñu kiăng hmâo ană djă pioh djuai kơ ayŏng ñu. 
There were seven brethren; and the first took a wife, and dying did not leave seed; @ Hmâo tơjuh čô adơi ayŏng. Ayŏng tha dŏ bơnai, samơ̆ ñu djai hĭ ƀu hmâo ană ôh. 
and the second took her and died, and neither did he leave seed; and the third likewise. @ Pô tal dua dŏ đah kơmơi anŭn, laih anŭn djai hĭ ƀu hmâo ană mơ̆n, wơ̆t adơi tal klâo ăt kar kaĭ mơ̆n. 
And the seven [took her and] did not leave seed. Last of all the woman also died. @ Tui anŭn abih tơjuh čô adơi ayŏng anŭn ƀu hmâo ană ôh. Hnal tuč đah kơmơi anŭn ăt djai mơ̆n. 
In the resurrection, when they shall rise again, of which of them shall she be wife, for the seven had her as wife? @ Tơ gơñu hơdip amăng hrơi hơdip glaĭ, ñu či jing bơnai kơ pô hlơi, yua kơ abih tơjuh čô anŭn leng kơ hmâo dŏ gơ̆ soh sel?”
And Jesus answering said to them, Do not ye therefore err, not knowing the scriptures, nor the power of God? @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă ƀing gih soh tơhwơl laih yua kơ ƀing gih ƀu thâo hluh ôh Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp, kŏn thâo hluh lơi tơlơi dưi mơyang Ơi Adai? 
For when they rise from among [the] dead they neither marry, nor are given in marriage, but are as angels [who are] in the heavens. @ Yua kơ tơ arăng hơdip glaĭ mơ̆ng ƀing djai, ƀing đah rơkơi ƀu či dŏ bơnai dơ̆ng ôh, ƀing đah kơmơi ăt ƀu či dŏ rơkơi dơ̆ng lơi; samơ̆ gơñu či jing kar hăng ƀing ling jang amăng adai. 
But concerning the dead that they rise, have ye not read in the book of Moses, in [the section of] the bush, how God spoke to him, saying, *I* [am] the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob? @ Bơ kơ tơlơi ƀing djai hơdip glaĭ, ƀing gih ƀu hmâo lăng ôh hă amăng hơdrôm hră Môis, anih pơhiăp djơ̆ kơ apui dŏ ƀơ̆ng pum drơi hyư̆m Tơlơi Ơi Adai laĭ kơ ñu: ‘Kâo jing Ơi Adai kơ Abraham, Ơi Adai kơ Isak laih anŭn Ơi Adai kơ Yakôp?’ 
He is not the God of [the] dead, but of [the] living. *Ye* therefore greatly err. @ Ñu ƀu djơ̆ jing Ơi Adai kơ ƀing djai ôh, samơ̆ Ơi Adai kơ ƀing hơdip. Ƀing gih soh tơhwơl biă mă.”
And one of the scribes who had come up, and had heard them reasoning together, perceiving that he had answered them well, demanded of him, Which is [the] first commandment of all? @  Hmâo sa čô amăng ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt rai hăng hmư̆ tơlơi gơñu pơrơjah hăng Yêsu, hăng hmư̆ tơlơi Yêsu laĭ glaĭ kơ ƀing Sadusi thâo djơ̆ biă mă, ñu tơña kơ Yêsu: “Tơlơi pơtă pă yom hloh kơ abih bang?”
And Jesus answered him, [The] first commandment of all [is], Hear, Israel: the Lord our God is one Lord; @  Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Tơlơi pơtă yom hloh kơ abih bang anŭn jing: ‘Hmư̆ bĕ, Ơ ƀing Israel! Khua Yang Ơi Adai ƀing ta jing Khua Yang hmâo kơnơ̆ng hasa đôč. 
and thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thine understanding, and with all thy strength. This is [the] first commandment. @ Ih khŏm khăp kơ Khua yang Ơi Adai ih hăng abih pran jua, hăng abih bơngăt, hăng abih tơlơi pơmĭn, laih anŭn hăng abih tơlơi kơtang ih.’ 
And a second like it [is] this: Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself. There is not another commandment greater than these. @ Anai jing Tơlơi Pơtă tal dua: ‘Ih khŏm khăp kơ mơnuih jum dar ih kar hăng ih khăp kơ ih pô.’ Ƀu hmâo dơ̆ng tah tơlơi pơtă pơkŏn prŏng hloh kơ dua mơta tơlơi anai.”
And the scribe said to him, Right, teacher; thou hast spoken according to [the] truth. For he is one, and there is none other besides him; @  Nai pơtô tơlơi juăt anŭn laĭ hăng Yêsu: “Ơ Nai, djơ̆ yơh, ih laĭ djơ̆ biă mă Ơi Adai kơnơ̆ng jing hasa đôč, laih anŭn ƀu hmâo Pô pơkŏn dơ̆ng ôh. 
and to love him with all the heart, and with all the intelligence, and with all the soul, and with all the strength, and to love one's neighbour as one's self, is more than all the burnt-offerings and sacrifices. @ Sĭt yơh, tơlơi khăp kơ Ñu hăng abih pran jua, hăng abih tơlơi thâo hluh, hăng abih tơlơi kơtang, laih anŭn khăp kơ mơnuih jum dar kar hăng ih khăp kơ ih pô, jing yom hloh kơ abih bang mơnơ̆ng ngă yang čuh hăng mơnơ̆ng ngă yang pơkŏn.”
And Jesus, seeing that he had answered intelligently, said to him, Thou art not far from the kingdom of God. And no one dared question him any more. @ Tơ Yêsu ƀuh mơnuih anŭn laĭ glaĭ hăng tơlơi kơhnâo, Yêsu laĭ kơ ñu: “Ih ƀu ataih ôh hăng dêh čar pơtao Ơi Adai.” Giơ̆ng tơlơi anŭn ƀu hmâo dơ̆ng tah sa čô khĭn tơña kơ Ñu sa tơlơi.
And Jesus answering said [as he was] teaching in the temple, How do the scribes say that the Christ is son of David? @ Tơdang Yêsu dŏ pơtô amăng sang Kơkuh Pơpŭ, Ñu laĭ: “Hyư̆m ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt dưi laĭ Krist jing ană pơtao Đawit lĕ? 
[for] David himself said [speaking] in the Holy Spirit, The Lord said to my Lord, Sit on my right hand until I put thine enemies [as] footstool of thy feet. @ Đawit pô hmâo tơlơi pơtrŭt mơ̆ng Yang Bơngăt Hiam laĭ tui anai:
‘Khua Yang laĭ kơ Khua Yang kâo,
Dŏ ber bĕ gah hơnuă Kâo,
Tơl Kâo dưm ƀing ayăt Ih ƀơi gah yŭ tơkai Ih.’
David himself [therefore] calls him Lord, and whence is he his son? And the mass of the people heard him gladly. @ Đawit pô iâu Ñu Khua Yang. Tui anŭn hyư̆m Ñu dưi jing ană đah rơkơi Đawit lĕ?” Ƀing mơnuih lu dŏ hmư̆ Yêsu hăng tơlơi hơ̆k mơak.
And he said to them in his doctrine, Beware of the scribes, who like to walk about in long robes, and salutations in the marketplaces, @ Tơdang Yêsu dŏ pơtô, Ñu laĭ tui anai: “Răng bĕ kơ ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt, jing ƀing khăp buh ao phyung rơbat hyu, hăng kiăng kơ arăng kơkuh kơ gơñu amăng sang sĭ mơdrô. 
and first seats in the synagogues, and first places at suppers; @ Gơñu ruah anih yom hloh amăng sang bơjơnum hăng anih pơpŭ pơyom amăng tơlơi ƀơ̆ng huă. 
who devour the houses of widows, and as a pretext make long prayers. These shall receive a severer judgment. @ Gơñu plah sua mă sang ƀing đah kơmơi blao, hăng ngă mă iâu laĭ sui. Gơñu či tŭ tơlơi pơkơhmal kơtang hloh.”
And Jesus, having sat down opposite the treasury, saw how the crowd was casting money into the treasury; and many rich cast in much. @ Yêsu dŏ ber pơklă anăp hăng hip pơyơr prăk amăng sang Kơkuh Pơpŭ, lăng ƀing mơnuih lu pơyơr prăk amăng hip anŭn. Ƀing pơdrŏng pơyơr lu prăk. 
And a poor widow came and cast in two mites, which is a farthing. @ Hlăk anŭn hmâo sa čô đah kơmơi blao rai pơyơr dua su prăk anĕt, jing sa kak. 
And having called his disciples to [him] he said to them, Verily I say unto you, This poor widow has cast in more than all who have cast into the treasury: @ Yêsu iâu ƀing ding kơna Ñu hăng laĭ kơ ƀing gơñu: “Sĭt biă mă Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, đah kơmơi blao ƀun rin anai hmâo pơyơr laih amăng hip pơyơr prăk lu hloh kơ ƀing pơkŏn. 
for all have cast in of that which they had in abundance, but she of her destitution has cast in all that she had, the whole of her living. @ Yua kơ abih bang gơñu pơyơr mơ̆ng prăk rơbeh gơñu đôč, samơ̆ đah kơmơi anŭn ƀun rin biă mă, hmâo pơyơr abih mơnơ̆ng ñu hmâo, jing mơnơ̆ng kiăng čem tơlơi hơdip ñu.”
And as he was going out of the temple, one of his disciples says to him, Teacher, see what stones and what buildings! @ Tơ Yêsu tơbiă mơ̆ng Sang Kơkuh Pơpŭ, sa čô amăng ƀing ding kơna Ñu laĭ: “Ơ Nai, lăng bĕ, khul boh pơtâo prŏng hăng abih bang sang prŏng anai hiam kloh noh biă mă.”
And Jesus answering said to him, Seest thou these great buildings? not a stone shall be left upon a stone, which shall not be thrown down. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Ih ƀuh mơ̆ abih bang sang prŏng anai? Ƀu hmâo ôh sa klŏ boh pơtâo či dŏ ƀơi hăng ngŏ boh pơtâo pơkŏn, samơ̆ abih bang či tơglưh hĭ abih.”
And as he sat on the mount of Olives opposite the temple, Peter and James and John and Andrew asked him privately, @ Tơdang Yêsu dŏ ber ƀơi čư̆ Ôliwơ pơklă anăp hăng Sang Kơkuh Pơpŭ, Pêtrôs, Yakơ, Yôhan, hăng Andrê nao tơña hơjăn hăng Yêsu, 
Tell us, when shall these things be, and what is the sign when all these things are going to be fulfilled? @ “Rơkâo Ih laĭ brơi kơ gơmơi thâo hơbin tơlơi anŭn či truh? Laih anŭn hơgĕt či jing gru kơnăl laĭ pơthâo mông kơ abih bang tơlơi anŭn či đŭt.”
And Jesus answering them began to say, Take heed lest any one mislead you. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Răng bĕ, anăm brơi arăng plư ƀing gih ôh. 
For many shall come in my name, saying, It is *I*, and shall mislead many. @ Hmâo lu mơnuih či rai ƀlor mă hăng anăn Kâo laih anŭn laĭ: ‘Kâo yơh jing Krist,’ laih anŭn gơñu či plư lu mơnuih. 
But when ye shall hear of wars and rumours of wars, be not disturbed, for [this] must happen, but the end is not yet. @ Tơ ƀing gih hmư̆ arăng ruai kơ tơlơi pơblah jĕ giăm hăng hmư̆ hing tơlơi pơblah pơ ataih, anăm rŭng răng ôh. Tơlơi anŭn khŏm truh, samơ̆ aka ƀu truh hrơi hnal tuč ôh. 
For nation shall rise up against nation, and kingdom against kingdom; and there shall be earthquakes in [different] places, and there shall be famines and troubles: these things [are the] beginnings of throes. @ Djuai mơnuih anai či pơkơdơ̆ng hăng djuai mơnuih pơkŏn, laih anŭn dêh čar pơtao anai či pơkơdơ̆ng hăng dêh čar pơtao pơkŏn. Či hmâo tơlơi pơpư̆ lŏn tơnah amăng lu anih, hăng či hmâo lu tơlơi ư̆ rơpa. Abih tơlơi anŭn kơnơ̆ng jing tơlơi pơphŭn kơ tơlơi ruă tơkeng đôč.”
But *ye*, take heed to yourselves, for they shall deliver you up to sanhedrims and to synagogues: ye shall be beaten and brought before rulers and kings for my sake, for a testimony to them; @  “Răng bĕ kơ ƀing gih pô, yua kơ arăng či jao hĭ ƀing gih kơ ƀing khua phat kơđi, arăng či taih čŏm ƀing gih amăng sang jơnum. Ƀing gih či dŏ ƀơi anăp ƀing khua čar hăng ƀơi anăp ƀing pơtao yua anăn Kâo, kiăng ngă gơ̆ng jơlan kơ ƀing gơñu. 
and the gospel must first be preached to all the nations. @ Samơ̆ hlâo kơ hrơi hnal tuč či truh, Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam anai arăng khŏm pơtô ră ruai kơ abih bang djuai mơnuih. 
But when they shall lead you away to deliver you up, be not careful beforehand as to what ye shall say, [nor prepare your discourse]: but whatsoever shall be given you in that hour, that speak; for *ye* are not the speakers, but the Holy Spirit. @ Tơ arăng mă jao ƀing gih kơ tơlơi phat kơđi, anăm ƀing gih bơngơ̆t ôh kơ hơgĕt tơlơi ƀing gih či pơhiăp; samơ̆ pơhiăp bĕ hơgĕt tơlơi Ơi Adai pha brơi kơ ƀing gih ƀơi mông anŭn. Yua kơ ƀu djơ̆ ôh pô ƀing gih pơhiăp, samơ̆ Yang Bơngăt Hiam yơh pơhiăp. 
But brother shall deliver up brother to death, and father child; and children shall rise up against parents, and cause them to be put to death. @ Ayŏng či jao lui adơi ñu pô brơi kơ arăng pơdjai hĭ, laih anŭn ama či jao lui hĭ ană ñu pô. Ƀing ană či pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ hăng amĭ ama gơñu, hăng brơi arăng pơdjai hĭ ƀing gơ̆. 
And ye will be hated of all on account of my name; but he that has endured to the end, *he* shall be saved. @ Abih bang mơnuih či bơrơmŭt kơ ƀing gih yua kơ anăn Kâo. Samơ̆ hlơi pô gir tơl hnal tuč, ñu anŭn či dưi klaih yơh.”
But when ye shall see the abomination of desolation standing where it should not, (he that reads let him consider [it],) then let those in Judaea flee to the mountains; @  “Samơ̆ tơ ƀing gih ƀuh ‘tơlơi hơƀak drak krip’ arăng pơdơ̆ng đĭ ƀơi anih ƀu dưi pơdơ̆ng ôh,” (hlơi pô đŏk khŏm thâo hluh) “hlăk anŭn hlơi pô dŏ amăng tring Yuđa đuaĭ kơdŏp bĕ pơ čư̆. 
and him that is upon the housetop not come down into the house, nor enter [into it] to take away anything out of his house; @ Hlơi pô dŏ ƀơi bơbŭng sang anăm rơngiă mông trŭn mŭt amăng sang kiăng mă dram gơnam ñu ôh. 
and him that is in the field not return back to take his garment. @ Pô dŏ amăng hmua anăm wơ̆t glaĭ pơ sang mă ao phyung ñu ôh. 
But woe to those that are with child and to those that give suck in those days! @ Amăng khul hrơi anŭn, tơnap tap yơh kơ ƀing đah kơmơi pi kian hăng ƀing đah kơmơi hmâo ană dŏ mĕm! 
And pray that it may not be in winter time; @ Iâu laĭ bĕ, kiăng kơ abih tơlơi anŭn ƀu truh ôh amăng bơyan puih. 
for those days shall be distress such as there has not been the like since [the] beginning of creation which God created, until now, and never shall be; @ Yua kơ amăng khul hrơi anŭn či hmâo tơlơi tơnap tap tơl čơdơ̆ng mơ̆ng rơnŭk Ơi Adai hrih pơjing abih bang mơnơ̆ng hlŏng truh pơ hrơi anai aka hmâo djơ̆ ôh kar hăng anŭn, laih anŭn tơdơi anai kŏn či hmâo lơi. 
and if [the] Lord had not cut short those days, no flesh should have been saved; but on account of the elect whom he has chosen, he has cut short those days. @ Tơdah Khua Yang ƀu pơhrŏ ôh khul hrơi anŭn ƀu hmâo sa čô mơnuih dưi klaih ôh. Samơ̆ Ñu hmâo pơhrŏ hrơi anŭn yua kơ ƀing mơnuih Ñu hmâo ruah mă laih. 
And then if any one say to you, Lo, here [is] the Christ, or Lo, there, believe [it] not. @ Hlăk anŭn, tơdah arăng laĭ kơ ƀing gih: ‘Hơi, Krist pơ anai,’ ƀôdah: ‘Adih, Ñu pơ anŭn,’ anăm đaŏ ôh kơ tơlơi anŭn. 
For false Christs and false prophets will arise, and give signs and wonders to deceive, if possible, even the elect. @ Či hmâo lu Krist ƀlor hăng ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo ƀlor či tơgŭ đĭ. Gơñu či ngă lu tơlơi gru kơnăl yom pơphan hăng tơlơi mơsêh mơyang, tơdah dưi ñu kiăng plư wơ̆t ƀing Ơi Adai hmâo ruah mă laih mơ̆n. 
But do *ye* take heed: behold, I have told you all things beforehand. @ Tui anŭn răng bĕ. Kâo hmâo laĭ pơthâo hlâo abih bang tơlơi anŭn brơi kơ ƀing gih laih.”
But in those days, after that distress, the sun shall be darkened and the moon shall not give its light; @  “Amăng khul hrơi anŭn tơdơi kơ tơlơi tơnap tap,
Yang hrơi či jing kơnăm mơmŏt,
Laih anŭn blan ƀu pơčrang rơđah dơ̆ng ôh.
and the stars of heaven shall be falling down, and the powers which are in the heavens shall be shaken; @ Khul pơtŭ či lĕ trŭn mơ̆ng adai,
Laih anŭn khul tơlơi dưi kơtang amăng adai rơngit či pơpư̆ pơgơi.
and then shall they see the Son of man coming in clouds with great power and glory; @  Hlăk anŭn arăng či ƀuh Ană Mơnuih rai ƀơi hiăng kơthul hrŏm hăng tơlơi dưi mơyang prŏng, hăng tơlơi ang yang. 
and then shall he send his angels and shall gather together his elect from the four winds, from end of earth to end of heaven. @ Ñu či pơkiaŏ nao ƀing ling jang hiam Ñu, pơƀŭt ƀing Ơi Adai hmâo ruah laih mơ̆ng pă akiăng lŏn tơnah, mơ̆ng rơnuč lŏn tơnah anai truh pơ rơnuč tal adai adih.”
But learn the parable from the fig-tree: when its branch already becomes tender and puts forth the leaves, ye know that the summer is near. @ “Brơi kơ ƀing gih hrăm mă bĕ tơlơi bơhmutu mơ̆ng phŭn hra: tơ than ñu mơda hla ñu čơdơ̆ng čơnăt ƀing gih thâo bơyan phang giăm truh laih yơh. 
Thus also *ye*, when ye see these things happening, know that it is near, at the doors. @ Ăt kar kaĭ mơ̆n, tơ ƀing gih ƀuh abih bang tơlơi anŭn truh, ƀing gih thâo Ană Mơnuih giăm truh laih yơh, Ñu dŏ ƀơi bah amăng laih. 
Verily I say unto you, This generation shall in no wise pass away, till all these things take place. @ Sĭt biă mă Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, ƀing mơnuih rơnŭk anai ƀu či rơgao hĭ ôh hlâo kơ abih bang tơlơi anŭn truh hĭ laih. 
The heaven and the earth shall pass away, but my words shall in no wise pass away. @ Adai hăng lŏn tơnah či rơgao hĭ, samơ̆ tơlơi Kâo pơhiăp ƀu či rơgao hĭ ôh.”
But of that day or of that hour no one knows, neither the angels who are in heaven, nor the Son, but the Father. @  “Samơ̆ kơ hrơi hăng mông anŭn ƀu hmâo hlơi thâo ôh. Wơ̆t ƀing ling jang hiam amăng adai, wơ̆t Ană kŏn thâo lơi, kơnơ̆ng hơjăn Ama đôč thâo. 
Take heed, watch and pray, for ye do not know when the time is: @ Brơi kơđiăng hăng dŏ krŏng bĕ yua kơ ƀing gih ƀu thâo ôh hơbin mông anŭn či truh. 
[it is] as a man gone out of the country, having left his house and given to his bondmen the authority, and to each one his work, and commanded the doorkeeper that he should watch. @ Tơlơi anŭn jing kar hăng sa čô mơnuih hyu pơ čar ataih. Tơ ñu tơbiă mơ̆ng sang, jao tơlơi dưi kơ ƀing ding kơna ñu, rĭm čô bruă phara phara, hăng pơtă kơ pô gak wai bah amăng dŏ răng nanao. 
Watch therefore, for ye do not know when the master of the house comes: evening, or midnight, or cock-crow, or morning; @ Tui anŭn, dŏ krŏng bĕ yua kơ ƀing gih ƀu thâo ôh hơbin khua sang či truh, thâo dah ƀơi klam mơmŏt ƀôdah tơ̆ng krah mlam, ƀôdah hlăk mơnŭ tơdjô̆, ƀôdah ƀơi ưm mơguah, 
lest coming suddenly he find you sleeping. @ Hwĭ kơ Ñu plŭt rai, laih anŭn ƀuh ƀing gih dŏ pĭt.
