But what I say to you, I say to all, Watch. @ Hơgĕt tơlơi Kâo laĭ laih kơ ƀing gih, Kâo ăt laĭ kơ abih bang mơnuih mơ̆n. Dŏ krŏng bĕ!”
Now the passover and the [feast of] unleavened bread was after two days. And the chief priests and the scribes were seeking how they might seize him by subtlety and kill him. @  Dŏ dua hrơi hlâo kơ phĕt Tơlơi Găn hăng phĕt Ƀañ Tơpŭng Ƀu Hmâo Tơpơi, ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng hăng ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt hơduah jơlan kiăng mă Yêsu hăng tơlơi hơgơ̆m laih anŭn pơdjai hĭ Gơ̆. 
For they said, Not in the feast, lest perhaps there be a tumult of the people. @ Yua kơ gơñu laĭ: “Ta ƀu dưi ngă ôh hlăk hrơi phĕt, hwĭ kơ ƀing ană plei pla rŭng răng.”
And when he was in Bethany, in the house of Simon the leper, as he lay at table, there came a woman having an alabaster flask of ointment of pure nard, very costly; and having broken the alabaster flask, she poured it out upon his head. @  Hlăk Yêsu dŏ pơ Plei Bêthani amăng sang Simôn pô djơ̆ phŭng. Tơdang Ñu dŏ ƀơ̆ng huă hmâo sa čô đah kơmơi djă sa boh get boh pơtâo yom pioh ia ƀâu mơngưi ngă hăng kơyâo nard sĭt, yom biă mă. Đah kơmơi anŭn taih pơčah hĭ get hăng tuh ia klôñ ƀơi akŏ Yêsu. 
And there were some indignant in themselves, and saying, Why has this waste been made of the ointment? @ Samơ̆ hmâo đơđa hil laĭ tơdruă gơñu: “Yua hơgĕt plai hĭ đôč đač ia ƀâu mơngưi kar hăng anŭn? 
for this ointment could have been sold for more than three hundred denarii and given to the poor. And they spoke very angrily at her. @ Yua kơ arăng dưi sĭ ia mơngưi anai rơbeh klâo rơtuh đơniê kiăng kơ pha hĭ brơi ƀing mơnuih ƀun rin.” Tui anŭn gơñu ƀuah kơ đah kơmơi anŭn kơtang biă mă.
But Jesus said, Let her alone; why do ye trouble her? she has wrought a good work as to me; @ Samơ̆ Yêsu laĭ: “Lui măk ai ñu. Yua hơgĕt ƀing gih pơrŭng gơ̆? Ñu ngă tơlơi hiam kơ Kâo. 
for ye have the poor always with you, and whenever ye would ye can do them good; but me ye have not always. @ Ƀing gih hmâo ƀing mơnuih ƀun rin hrŏm hăng ƀing gih nanao, mông pă ƀing gih kiăng, ƀing gih dưi ngă hiam kơ gơñu yơh. Samơ̆ ƀing gih ƀu hmâo Kâo nanao ôh. 
What *she* could she has done. She has beforehand anointed my body for the burial. @ Đah kơmơi anai ngă tui hăng tơlơi ñu dưi ngă. Ñu tuh ia klôñ ƀơi drơi jan kâo prăp rơmet hlâo kơ tơlơi arăng dơr kâo. 
And verily I say unto you, Wheresoever these glad tidings may be preached in the whole world, what this [woman] has done shall be also spoken of for a memorial of her. @ Kâo laĭ sĭt biă mă kơ ƀing gih, amăng djŏp djang lŏn tơnah, pơpă anih arăng pơtô Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam, arăng či ră ruai glaĭ bruă đah kơmơi anai hmâo ngă kiăng pơhơdơr kơ ñu.”
And Judas Iscariote, one of the twelve, went away to the chief priests that he might deliver him up to them; @ Giơ̆ng anŭn Yudas Iskariôt, sa čô amăng pluh dua čô ƀing khua ding kơna nao pơ ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng kiăng pơblư̆ hăng jao hĭ Yêsu kơ gơñu. 
and they, when they heard it, rejoiced, and promised him to give money. And he sought how he could opportunely deliver him up. @ Tơ hmư̆ tơlơi anŭn gơñu hơ̆k mơak biă mă, laih anŭn ƀuăn či brơi prăk kơ Yudas. Tui anŭn Yudas hơduah mông gal kiăng kơ pơblư̆ hĭ Yêsu.
And the first day of unleavened bread, when they slew the passover, his disciples say to him, Where wilt thou that we go and prepare, that thou mayest eat the passover? @ Hrơi tal sa amăng phĕt Ƀañ Tơpŭng Ƀu Hmâo Tơpơi, hrơi arăng pơdjai ană triu phĕt Tơlơi Găn, ƀing ding kơna tơña kơ Yêsu: “Pơpă anih Ih kiăng gơmơi nao pơkra brơi kơ Ih ƀơ̆ng phĕt Tơlơi Găn?”
And he sends two of his disciples, and says to them, Go into the city, and a man shall meet you carrying a pitcher of water; follow him. @ Ñu pơkiaŏ nao dua čô ƀing ding kơna Ñu hăng laĭ kơ gơñu: “Nao bĕ mŭt amăng plei, či hmâo sa čô đah rơkơi đua sa boh čeh ia či bưp ƀing gih. Đuaĭ tui ñu bĕ. 
And wheresoever he enters, say to the master of the house, The Teacher says, Where is my guest-chamber where I may eat the passover with my disciples? @ Sang pă ñu mŭt, brơi ƀing gih laĭ kơ pô sang anŭn: ‘Nai laĭ, pơpă anih kâo či ƀơ̆ng phĕt Tơlơi Găn hrŏm hăng ƀing ding kơna Kâo?’ 
and *he* will shew you a large upper room furnished ready. There make ready for us. @ Mơnuih anŭn či črâo brơi kơ ƀing gih sa boh anih prŏng amăng adŭ tal glong arăng hmâo prăp pơkra brơi laih. Ƀơi anih anŭn ƀing gih prăp rơmet bĕ kơ ƀing ta.”
And his disciples went away and came into the city, and found as he had said to them; and they made ready the passover. @ Ƀing ding kơna anŭn nao mŭt amăng plei hăng ƀuh abih bang tơlơi tui hăng Yêsu hmâo laĭ laih kơ gơñu. Laih anŭn gơñu pơkra phĕt Tơlơi Găn.
And when evening was come, he comes with the twelve. @ Tơ adai mơmŏt laih, Yêsu nao hrŏm hăng pluh dua čô khua ding kơna. 
And as they lay at table and were eating, Jesus said, Verily I say to you, One of you shall deliver me up; he who is eating with me. @ Tơdang gơñu dŏ ƀơ̆ng huă ƀơi kơƀang, Yêsu laĭ: “Sĭt biă mă Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, sa čô amăng ƀing gih dŏ ƀơ̆ng huă hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Kâo, či pơblư̆ lui Kâo.”
And they began to be grieved, and to say to him, one by one, Is it *I*? [and another, Is it *I*?] @ Ƀing gơñu rơngot biă mă, rĭm čô gơñu čơdơ̆ng tơña kơ Yêsu: “Ƀu djơ̆ kâo ôh, djơ̆ mơ̆?”
But he answered and said to them, One of the twelve, he who dips with me in the dish. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Pô anŭn jing sa čô amăng pluh dua čô, jing pô hlăk añrŭ ƀañ tơpŭng ñu amăng jam hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Kâo. 
The Son of man goes indeed as it is written concerning him, but woe to that man by whom the Son of man is delivered up; [it were] good for that man if he had not been born. @ Ană Mơnuih či djai tui hăng Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp hmâo čih djơ̆ kơ Ñu, samơ̆ răm ƀăm yơh kơ pô pơblư̆ lui Ană Mơnuih! Hiam hloh arăng ƀu tơkeng ôh pô anŭn.”
And as they were eating, Jesus, having taken bread, when he had blessed, broke [it], and gave [it] to them, and said, Take [this]: this is my body. @ Tơdang gơñu dŏ ƀơ̆ng huă, Yêsu mă ƀañ tơpŭng, iâu laĭ bơni hơơč, Ñu wơ̆k ƀañ tơpŭng brơi kơ ƀing gơñu hăng laĭ: “Mă bĕ; anai jing drơi jan Kâo.”
And having taken [the] cup, when he had given thanks, he gave [it] to them, and they all drank out of it. @ Ñu mă kơčok, iâu laĭ bơni hơơč, giơ̆ng anŭn Ñu brơi kơ ƀing gơñu, laih anŭn abih bang gơñu mơñum. 
And he said to them, This is my blood, that of the [new] covenant, that shed for many. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Anai jing drah Kâo, drah kơ tơlơi kơnol pơgop hmâo tuh brơi kơ lu mơnuih. 
Verily I say to you, I will no more drink at all of the fruit of the vine, until that day when I drink it new in the kingdom of God. @ Sĭt biă mă Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, Kâo ƀu či mơñum tơpai boh kơƀâu anai dơ̆ng ôh tơl hrơi Kâo či mơñum tơpai boh kơƀâu phrâo amăng Dêh Čar Pơtao Ơi Adai.”
And having sung a hymn, they went out to the mount of Olives. @ Giơ̆ng gơñu adoh sa tơlơi adoh bơni hơơč, gơñu tơbiă nao pơ čư̆ Ôliwơ.
And Jesus says to them, All ye shall be offended, for it is written, I will smite the shepherd, and the sheep shall be scattered abroad. @ Yêsu laĭ hăng ƀing ding kơna Ñu: “Abih bang ƀing gih či đuaĭ lui Kâo; yua kơ Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp hmâo čih:
‘Kâo či taih pô wai triu,
Laih anŭn abih bang triu či čơlah bru bra.’
But after I am risen, I will go before you into Galilee. @  Samơ̆ giơ̆ng Kâo hơdip glaĭ, Kâo či nao hlâo kơ ƀing gih pơ kwar Galilê”.
But Peter said to him, Even if all should be offended, yet not *I*. @ Pêtrôs laĭ hăng Ñu: “Wơ̆t dah abih bang či lui hĭ Ih, kâo ƀu či lui Ih ôh.”
And Jesus says to him, Verily I say to thee, that thou to-day, in this night, before [the] cock shall crow twice, thou shalt thrice deny me. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ ñu: “Sĭt biă mă Kâo laĭ kơ ih, mlam anai yơh, hlâo kơ mơnŭ tơdjô̆ dua wơ̆t, ih či hơngah Kâo klâo wơ̆t.”
But he said [so much] exceedingly the more, If I should have to die with thee, I will in no wise deny thee. And likewise said they all too. @ Samơ̆ Pêtrôs laĭ hăng tơlơi khŭt khăt hloh dơ̆ng: “Wơ̆t dah kâo djai hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Ih tŭ mơ̆n, kâo ƀu či hơngah Ih ôh.” Laih anŭn abih bang gơñu ăt laĭ hrup hăng anŭn.
And they come to a place of which the name [is] Gethsemane, and he says to his disciples, Sit here while I shall pray. @ Gơñu nao pơ anih arăng pia Gêtsêmanê, laih anŭn Yêsu laĭ kơ ƀing ding kơna Ñu: “Dŏ ber bĕ ƀơi anai tơdang Kâo nao iâu laĭ.” 
And he takes with him Peter and James and John, and he began to be amazed and oppressed in spirit. @ Yêsu jak ba Pêtrôs, Yakơ hăng Yôhan nao hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Ñu, Ñu čơdơ̆ng hmâo tơlơi rơngot hăng rŭng răng kơtang biă mă. 
And he says to them, My soul is full of grief even unto death; abide here and watch. @ Ñu laĭ hăng gơñu: “Pran jua Kâo rơngot biă mă tơl či djai, dŏ pơ anai laih anŭn dŏ krŏng bĕ.” 
And, going forward a little, he fell upon the earth; and he prayed that, if it were possible, the hour might pass away from him. @ Ñu nao ataih ƀiă, Ñu bon ƀơi lŏn laih anŭn iâu laĭ, kiăng kơ tơdah dưi rơkâo mông anŭn anăm truh kơ Ñu ôh. 
And he said, Abba, Father, all things are possible to thee: take away this cup from me; but not what *I* will, but what *thou* [wilt]. @ Ñu laĭ: “Aba, Ơ Ama, abih bang tơlơi Ih dưi ngă soh sel. Rơkâo kơ Ih mă pơđuaĭ hĭ kơčok anai mơ̆ng Kâo. Ƀu djơ̆ tui hăng tơlơi Kâo kiăng ôh samơ̆ tui hăng tơlơi Ih kiăng.” 
And he comes and finds them sleeping. And he says to Peter, Simon, dost thou sleep? Hast thou not been able to watch one hour? @ Giơ̆ng anŭn, Ñu wơ̆t glaĭ hăng ƀuh gơñu dŏ pĭt; Ñu laĭ kơ Pêtrôs: “Ơ Simôn, ih dŏ pĭt hă? Ih ƀu dưi dŏ krŏng amăng sa mông ôh hă? 
Watch and pray, that ye enter not into temptation. The spirit indeed [is] willing, but the flesh weak. @ Dŏ krŏng hăng iâu laĭ bĕ, kiăng kơ ƀing gih ƀu lĕ amăng tơlơi plư ôh. Bơngăt jua kiăng biă mă, samơ̆ asar đeh tơdu.” 
And going away, he prayed again, saying the same thing. @ Yêsu nao sa wơ̆t dơ̆ng hăng iâu laĭ kar hăng hlâo mơ̆n. 
And returning, he found them again sleeping, for their eyes were heavy; and they knew not what they should answer him. @ Yêsu wơ̆t glaĭ dơ̆ng hăng ƀuh ƀing ding kơna Ñu ăt dŏ pĭt, yua kơ mơta gơñu ƀu dưi blang ôh. Gơñu ƀu thâo hyư̆m či laĭ glaĭ kơ Yêsu ôh. 
And he comes the third time and says to them, Sleep on now, and take your rest. It is enough; the hour is come; behold, the Son of man is delivered up into the hands of sinners. @ Tơ Yêsu wơ̆t glaĭ tal klâo hăng laĭ kơ gơñu: “Ƀing gih ăt dŏ pĭt hăng dŏ pơdơi hă? Dôm anŭn djŏp yơh, mông truh yơh. Arăng čơdơ̆ng jao lui Ană Mơnuih amăng tơngan ƀing soh. 
Arise, let us go; behold, he that delivers me up has drawn nigh. @ Ƀing ta tơgŭ nao bĕ. Lăng adih, pô pơblư̆ lui Kâo truh yơh.”
And immediately, while he was yet speaking, Judas comes up, [being] one of the twelve, and with him a great crowd, with swords and sticks, from the chief priests and the scribes and the elders. @ Ƀơi mông Yêsu hlăk dŏ pơhiăp, Yudas, sa čô amăng ƀing pluh dua čô khua ding kơna, truh mơtam hrŏm hơbĭt hăng sa phung lu djă đao gưm, djă gai, mơ̆ng ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng, ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt hăng ƀing kŏng tha pơkiaŏ rai. 
Now he that delivered him up had given them a sign between them, saying, Whomsoever I shall kiss, that is he; seize him, and lead [him] away safely. @ Pô pơblư̆ hmâo brơi sa gru kơnăl kơ ƀing phung lu, laĭ: “Hlơi pô kâo čŭm, ñu yơh anŭn. Čaŏ hĭ ñu hăng atăt ba răng wai kơjăp bĕ.” 
And being come, straightway coming up to him, he says, Rabbi, Rabbi; and he covered him with kisses. @ Tơ Yudas truh, ñu nao pơ Yêsu mơtam hăng laĭ: “Ơ Nai” Ñu čŭm Yêsu. 
And they laid their hands upon him and seized him. @ Ƀing anŭn mă čaŏ Yêsu. 
But a certain one of those who stood by, having drawn his sword, struck the bondman of the high priest, and took off his ear. @ Samơ̆ sa čô dŏ giăm suă đao ñu hăng koh tơĭ tơngia sa čô hlŭn khua ngă yang prŏng hloh. 
And Jesus answering said to them, Are ye come out as against a robber, with swords and sticks to take me? @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Yua hơgĕt ƀing gih djă đao gưm hăng gai kiăng mă čaŏ kâo hrup hăng sa čô mơnuih klĕ? 
I was daily with you teaching in the temple, and ye did not seize me; but [it is] that the scriptures may be fulfilled. @ Rĭm hrơi kâo dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing gih, pơtô amăng Sang Kơkuh Pơpŭ, samơ̆ ƀing gih ƀu mă čaŏ kâo ôh. Samơ̆ anai jing tơlơi khŏm pơsĭt kơ Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp hmâo čih laih.” 
And all left him and fled. @ Hlăk anŭn abih bang ƀing ding kơna lui hĭ Yêsu hăng đuaĭ kơdŏp.
And a certain young man followed him with a linen cloth cast about his naked [body]; and [the young men] seize him; @ Hmâo sa čô tơdăm kơnơ̆ng sŏm sa blah khăn kơbuă đuaĭ tui Yêsu. 
but he, leaving the linen cloth behind [him], fled from them naked. @ Gơñu mă tơdăm anŭn, samơ̆ ñu blač hĭ mơ̆ng khăn kơbuă anŭn hăng đuaĭ drơi mơhlŭn.
And they led away Jesus to the high priest. And there come together to him all the chief priests and the elders and the scribes. @ Gơñu ba Yêsu pơ sang khua ngă yang prŏng hloh. Abih bang ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng, ƀing kŏng tha, laih anŭn ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt hmâo pơƀŭt glaĭ laih pơ anŭn. 
And Peter followed him at a distance, till [he was] within the court of the high priest's palace; and he was sitting with the officers and warming himself in the light [of the fire]. @ Pêtrôs đuaĭ tui Yêsu mơ̆ng ataih ataih, mŭt amăng wăl sang khua ngă yang prŏng hloh. Ñu dŏ ber hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing tơhan gak dŏ mơdang apui pơ anŭn. 
And the chief priests and the whole sanhedrim sought testimony against Jesus to cause him to be put to death, and did not find [any]. @ Ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng hăng abih bang tơpul khua gĭt gai ană plei pla hơduah tơhnal tơlơi pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ hăng Yêsu kiăng pơdjai hĭ Ñu, samơ̆ gơñu ƀu dưi sem ƀuh tơlơi hơgĕt ôh. 
For many bore false witness against him, and their testimony did not agree. @ Yua kơ hmâo lu mơnuih ngă gơ̆ng jơlan pơkơdơ̆ng hăng Yêsu, samơ̆ abih tơlơi gơñu pơčŭt ƀu hmâo sa hơnơ̆ng ôh. 
And certain persons rose up and bore false witness against him, saying, @ Hmâo đơđa mơnuih tơgŭ dơ̆ng pơčeh pơkơdơ̆ng hăng Yêsu, laĭ, 
*We* heard him saying, *I* will destroy this temple which is made with hands, and in the course of three days I will build another not made with hands. @ “Gơmơi hmâo hmư̆ Ñu laĭ: ‘Kâo či pơrai hĭ Sang Kơkuh Pơpŭ tơngan ană mơnuih ngă anai, laih anŭn amăng klâo hrơi Kâo či pơdơ̆ng glaĭ sa boh sang kơkuh pơpŭ pơkŏn dơ̆ng, ƀu djơ̆ hăng tơngan ană mơnuih ôh.’” 
And neither thus did their testimony agree. @ Samơ̆ wơ̆t amăng tơlơi anai, tơlơi gơñu ngă gơ̆ng jơlan anŭn ăt ƀu hơnơ̆ng ôh.
And the high priest, rising up before them all, asked Jesus, saying, Answerest thou nothing? What do these testify against thee? @ Khua ngă yang prŏng hloh tơgŭ dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơi anăp gơñu hăng tơña kơ Yêsu: “Ih ƀu hmâo tơlơi laĭ glaĭ ôh hă kơ abih tơlơi ƀing anai pơčŭt kơ Ih?” 
But he was silent, and answered nothing. Again the high priest asked him, and says to him, *Thou* art the Christ, the Son of the Blessed? @ Samơ̆ Yêsu ăt dŏ rơiăt, ƀu pơhiăp sa boh ôh. Sa wơ̆t dơ̆ng khua ngă yang prŏng hloh tơña Yêsu: “Djơ̆ mơ̆ Ih jing Yang Krist Ană Ơi Adai Pô arăng hơơč bơni?” 
And Jesus said, *I* am, and ye shall see the Son of man sitting at the right hand of power, and coming with the clouds of heaven. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Sĭt Kâo gơ̆ yơh,
Laih anŭn ƀing gih či ƀuh Ană Mơnuih
Dŏ ber gah hơnuă Pô Dưi Kơtang,
Laih anŭn trŭn rai dơ̆ng ƀơi hiăng amăng adai.”
And the high priest, having rent his clothes, says, What need have we any more of witnesses? @ Khua ngă yang prŏng hloh hek hĭ ao ñu pô hăng laĭ: “Hơgĕt ƀing ta dŏ kiăng kơ tơlơi ƀing arăng ngă gơ̆ng jơlan dơ̆ng? 
Ye have heard the blasphemy; what think ye? And they all condemned him to be guilty of death. @ Ƀing gih hmư̆ laih tơlơi Ñu pơhiăp pơgao hmiah hăng Ơi Adai. Hyư̆m tơlơi ƀing gih khư̆p ư lĕ?” Abih bang gơñu leng klă kơđi Yêsu jing lăp kơ tơlơi djai. 
And some began to spit upon him, and cover up his face, and buffet him, and say to him, Prophesy; and the officers struck him with the palms of their hands. @ Hmâo đơđa amăng gơñu čơdơ̆ng kơčuh ia bah kơ Yêsu, gom ƀô̆ mơta Ñu, čok Ñu hăng laĭ: “Ih đaŏ lăng hlơi pô taih Ih!” Ƀing tơhan gak mă hăng pah meng Gơ̆.
And Peter being below in the palace-court, there comes one of the maids of the high priest, @ Hlăk Pêtrôs dŏ ƀơi gah yŭ amăng wăl sang, sa čô ding kơna đah kơmơi khua ngă yang prŏng hloh rai giăm. 
and seeing Peter warming himself, having looked at him, says, And *thou* wast with the Nazarene, Jesus. @ Ñu ƀuh Pêtrôs dŏ mơdang apui, ñu lăng kơ Pêtrôs hăng laĭ: “Ih ăt jing pô dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Yêsu plei Nasaret.” 
But he denied, saying, I know not nor understand what thou sayest. And he went out into the vestibule; and a cock crew. @ Samơ̆ Pêtrôs hơngah hăng laĭ: “Kâo ƀu thâo ôh kŏn thâo hluh lơi hơgĕt ih laĭ anŭn.” Pêtrôs tơbiă nao pơ bah amăng wăl sang. Hlăk anŭn mơnŭ tơdjô̆. 
And the maid, seeing him, again began to say to those that stood by, This is [one] of them. @ Ding kơna đah kơmơi anŭn ƀuh ñu dơ̆ng, hăng laĭ kơ ƀing dŏ giăm anŭn: “Pô anai jing sa čô amăng ƀing anŭn mơ̆n.” 
And he again denied. And again, after a little, those that stood by said to Peter, Truly thou art [one] of them, for also thou art a Galilean. @ Samơ̆ sa wơ̆t dơ̆ng Pêtrôs hơngah. Tơdơi ƀiă kơ anŭn ƀing dŏ giăm laĭ kơ Pêtrôs: “Sĭt biă mă ih jing sa čô amăng ƀing anŭn, yua kơ ih jing mơnuih Galilê.” 
But he began to curse and to swear, I know not this man of whom ye speak. @ Samơ̆ Pêtrôs čơdơ̆ng hơtơ̆m tơĭ hăng ƀuăn rơ̆ng ñu pô: “Kâo ƀu thâo krăn ôh mơnuih ƀing gih laĭ anŭn!”
And the second time a cock crew. And Peter remembered the word that Jesus said to him, Before [the] cock crow twice, thou shalt deny me thrice; and when he thought thereon he wept. @ Hlăk anŭn mơtam, mơnŭ tơdjô̆ tal dua. Pêtrôs hơdơr glaĭ kơ tơlơi Yêsu hmâo laĭ kơ ñu: “Hlâo kơ mơnŭ tơdjô̆ tal dua ih či hơngah Kâo klâo wơ̆t.” Ñu rơngot biă mă hăng hia.
And immediately in the morning the chief priests, having taken counsel with the elders and scribes and the whole sanhedrim, bound Jesus and carried [him] away, and delivered [him] up to Pilate. @ Man ưm mơguah, ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng, ƀing kŏng tha, ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt, abih bang ƀing khua phat kơđi črŏng sai; gơñu čaŏ Yêsu laih anŭn ba jao kơ Pilat. 
And Pilate asked him, Art *thou* the King of the Jews? And he answered and said to him, *Thou* sayest. @ Pilat tơña kơ Yêsu: “Djơ̆ mơ̆ Ih jing pơtao ană Yuđa?” Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Sĭt, djơ̆ tui hăng ih laĭ yơh.” 
And the chief priests accused him urgently. @ Ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng pơčŭt kơ Yêsu lu tơlơi. 
And Pilate asked him again, saying, Answerest thou nothing? See of how many things they bear witness against thee. @ Pilat tơña kơ Yêsu: “Ih ƀu laĭ glaĭ ôh hă? Hmư̆ bĕ tơlơi gơñu pơčŭt kơ Ih lu biă mă.” 
But Jesus still answered nothing, so that Pilate marvelled. @ Samơ̆ Yêsu ƀu laĭ glaĭ ôh, tui anŭn Pilat kơtuă hling biă mă.
But at [the] feast he released to them one prisoner, whomsoever they begged [of him]. @ Rĭm wơ̆t phĕt Tơlơi Găn Pilat juăt phư brơi sa čô mơnă, tui hăng hlơi ană plei pla rơkâo. 
Now there was the [person] named Barabbas bound with those who had made insurrection with [him], [and] that had committed murder in the insurrection. @ Hlăk anŭn hmâo sa čô mơnuih anăn ñu Barabas arăng krư̆ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing ngă pơrŭng, jing ƀing mơnuih soh yua kơ tơlơi pơdjai mơnuih amăng tơlơi ngă pơrŭng pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ. 
And the crowd crying out began to beg [that he would do] to them as he had always done. @ Ƀing mơnuih lu rai rơkâo kơ Pilat ngă tui hăng tơlơi juăt ñu hmâo ngă laih kơ ană plei pla. 
But Pilate answered them saying, Will ye that I release to you the King of the Jews? @ Pilat tơña kơ gơñu: “Ƀing gih kiăng mơ̆ kâo phư brơi kơ ƀing gih pơtao ană Yuđa?” 
for he knew that the chief priests had delivered him up through envy. @ Yua kơ ñu thâo rơđah ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng hmâo jao Yêsu kơ ñu yua kơ gơñu rơañ. 
But the chief priests stirred up the crowd that he might rather release Barabbas to them. @ Samơ̆ ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng pơsur ană plei pla rơkâo kơ Pilat phư brơi Barabas. 
And Pilate answering said to them again, What will ye then that I do [to him] whom ye call King of the Jews? @ Pilat tơña dơ̆ng kơ ƀing ană plei pla: “Tui anŭn hơgĕt kâo či ngă hăng mơnuih pô ƀing gih iâu Pơtao ană Yuđa?” 
And they cried out again, Crucify him. @ Gơñu ur dơ̆ng: “Pơ̆ng hĭ Ñu pơ kơyâo bơrơkal!” 
And Pilate said to them, What evil then has he done? But they cried out the more urgently, Crucify him. @ Pilat tơña: “Hyư̆m, hơgĕt tơlơi soh Ñu hmâo ngă?” Ƀing gơñu ur jai kơtang hloh dơ̆ng: “Pơ̆ng hĭ Ñu pơ kơyâo bơrơkal!” 
And Pilate, desirous of contenting the crowd, released to them Barabbas, and delivered up Jesus, when he had scourged him, that he might be crucified. @ Yua kơ Pilat kiăng ngă bơmơak kơ ană plei pla, tui anŭn ñu phư Barabas brơi kơ gơñu. Giơ̆ng ñu brơi arăng taih Yêsu hăng gai, ñu jao Yêsu brơi kơ ƀing tơhan ba nao pơ̆ng ƀơi kơyâo bơrơkal.
And the soldiers led him away into the court which is [called the] praetorium, and they call together the whole band. @ Ƀing tơhan ba Yêsu mŭt amăng wăl sang khua čar (kiăng laĭ sang phat kơđi), gơñu iâu pơƀŭt abih bang tơpul tơhan hrŏm hơbĭt. 
And they clothe him with purple, and bind round on him a crown of thorns which they had plaited. @ Gơñu buh brơi Yêsu sa blah ao phyung mriah, laih anŭn gơñu mơñam sa boh mŭk pơtao hăng drơi laih anŭn đua brơi ƀơi akŏ Yêsu. 
And they began to salute him, Hail, King of the Jews! @ Gơñu čơdơ̆ng kơkuh kơ Yêsu: “Kơkuh kơ Ih, Ơ pơtao ƀing ană Yuđa ah!” 
And they struck his head with a reed, and spat on him, and, bending the knee, did him homage. @ Gơñu taih akŏ Yêsu hăng gai trang bô, kơčuh ia bah ƀơi Yêsu, hăng čon tơŭt kơkuh kơ Yêsu. 
And when they had mocked him, they took the purple off him, and put his own clothes on him; and they lead him out that they may crucify him. @ Giơ̆ng gơñu mưč kơ Yêsu, gơñu toh hĭ ao phyung mriah, gơñu buh brơi ao Yêsu Pô dơ̆ng. Laih anŭn gơñu ba nao pơ̆ng Yêsu pơ kơyâo bơrơkal.
And they compel to go [with them] a certain passer-by, Simon, a Cyrenian, coming from the field, the father of Alexander and Rufus, that he might carry his cross. @  Ƀơi jơlan, gơñu bưp sa čô mơnuih anăn Simôn mơ̆ng čar Siren, ama Aleksandơ hăng Ruphus, rai mơ̆ng gah rơngiao plei găn nao ƀơi anŭn. Gơñu pơgŏ gơ̆ glăm kơyâo bơrơkal Yêsu. 
And they bring him to the place [called] Golgotha, which, being interpreted, is Place of a skull. @ Gơñu ba Yêsu pơ anih arăng pơanăn Gôlgôtha, (kiăng laĭ anih klang akŏ). 
And they offered him wine [to drink] medicated with myrrh; but he did not take [it]. @ Gơñu pơgŏ Yêsu mơñum tơpai klai hăng ia jrao krŏn phĭ ƀâu mơngưi, samơ̆ Yêsu ƀu mơñum ôh. 
And having crucified him, they part his clothes amongst [themselves], casting lots on them, what each one should take. @ Giơ̆ng kơ gơñu pơ̆ng Yêsu pơ kơyâo bơrơkal laih, gơñu pơpha tơdruă gơñu bơnal ao Yêsu hăng tơlơi mă črăm, kiăng kơ thâo hơgĕt rĭm čô gơñu či mă tŭ. 
And it was the third hour, and they crucified him. @ Ƀơi dua rơpăn mông mơguah gơñu pơ̆ng Yêsu ƀơi kơyâo bơrơkal. 
And the superscription of what he was accused of was written up: The King of the Jews. @ Arăng čih tơlơi klă kơđi kơ Yêsu tui anai: “PƠTAO KƠ ɃING YUĐA” 
And with him they crucify two robbers, one on his right hand, and one on his left. @ Gơñu ăt pơ̆ng mơ̆n dua čô mơnuih klĕ dŏp hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Yêsu, sa čô gah hơnuă, sa čô gah iao.
And they that passed by reviled him, shaking their heads, and saying, Aha, thou that destroyest the temple and buildest it in three days, @  Ƀing găn ƀơi anŭn mưč mač kơ Yêsu, tơtah akŏ hăng laĭ: “Ah hah! Ơ pô kiăng pơrai hĭ Sang Kơkuh Pơpŭ hăng pơdơ̆ng glaĭ dơ̆ng amăng klâo hrơi, 
save thyself, and descend from the cross. @ pơklaih bĕ pô ih, hăng trŭn mơ̆ng kơyâo bơrơkal.” 
In like manner the chief priests also, with the scribes, mocking with one another, said, He saved others; himself he cannot save. @ Ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt mưč kơ Yêsu kar kaĭ mơ̆n, tơdang bơlaĭ tơdruă gơñu tui anai: “Ñu hmâo pơklaih ƀing pơkŏn, samơ̆ Ñu ƀu dưi pơklaih pô Ñu ôh. 
Let the Christ the King of Israel descend now from the cross, that we may see and may believe. And they that were crucified with him reproached him. @ Ơ Yang Krist, Pơtao ƀing Israel, trŭn bĕ mơ̆ng kơyâo bơrơkal ră anai, kiăng kơ ƀing gơmơi ƀuh hăng đaŏ!”
Dua čô mơnuih arăng pơ̆ng ƀơi kơyâo bơrơkal hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Yêsu ăt hơtoh djraĭ kơ Yêsu mơ̆n.
And when [the] sixth hour was come, there came darkness over the whole land until [the] ninth hour; @ Ƀơi yang hrơi dơ̆ng hmâo tơlơi kơnăm mơmŏt djŏp djang čar tơl truh klâo mông klam. 
and at the ninth hour, Jesus cried with a loud voice, [saying], Eloi, Eloi, lama sabachthani? which is, being interpreted, My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me? @ Ƀơi klâo mông klam Yêsu ur kraih kơtang, “Êloi, Êloi, Lama sabaktani?” kiăng laĭ: “Ơ Ơi Adai kâo, Ơ Ơi Adai Kâo, yua hơgĕt Ih lui hĭ kâo?” 
And some of those who stood by, when they heard [it], said, Behold, he calls for Elias. @ Hmâo đơđa amăng ƀing dŏ giăm ƀơi anŭn hmư̆ tơlơi anŭn hăng laĭ: “Hmư̆ bĕ, Ñu iâu Êli.” 
And one, running and filling a sponge with vinegar, fixed it on a reed, and gave him to drink, saying, Let alone, let us see if Elias comes to take him down. @ Hmâo sa čô mơnuih nao mă pông diăn, añrŭ amăng ia tơpai mơsăm, kă ƀơi jŭng sa ƀĕ gai trang bô, yơr đĭ ƀơi amăng bah Yêsu hăng laĭ: “Tơguan bĕ, brơi ƀing ta krăp lăng thâo dah Êli či rai ba trŭn Ñu.” 
And Jesus, having uttered a loud cry, expired. @ Yêsu ur kraih kơtang, giơ̆ng anŭn Ñu tơĭ pran.
And the veil of the temple was rent in two from the top to the bottom. @  Hlăk anŭn khăn păng amăng Sang Kơkuh Pơpŭ tơhek hĭ dua mơ̆ng ngŏ truh pơ yŭ. 
And the centurion who stood by over against him, when he saw that he had expired having thus cried out, said, Truly this man was Son of God. @ Pô khua tơhan dŏ klă anăp Yêsu ƀuh hyư̆m Ñu tơĭ pran, ñu laĭ: “Sĭt biă mă pô anai jing Ană Ơi Adai!” 
And there were women also looking on from afar off, among whom were both Mary of Magdala, and Mary the mother of James the less and of Joses, and Salome; @ Hmâo mơ̆n đơđa ƀing đah kơmơi dŏ lăng mơ̆ng ataih. Amăng ƀing anŭn hmâo HʼMari Madala, HʼMari amĭ Yakơ anĕt hăng Yôse, hrŏm hơbĭt hăng HʼSalômê. 
who also, when he was in Galilee, followed him and ministered to him; and many others who came up with him to Jerusalem. @ Klâo čô anai hmâo đuaĭ tui hăng mă bruă kơ Yêsu hlăk Ñu dŏ pơ Galilê. Ăt hmâo mơ̆n lu ƀing đah kơmơi pơkŏn dơ̆ng, jing ƀing mơnuih hmâo tui Yêsu nao pơ Plei Yêrusalem.
And when it was already evening, since it was [the] preparation, that is, [the day] before a sabbath, @ Adai giăm mơmŏt yơh, hrơi anŭn jing hrơi prăp pre kơ phĕt Tơlơi Găn, kiăng laĭ hrơi hlâo kơ hrơi saƀat, 
Joseph of Arimathaea, an honourable councillor, who also himself was awaiting the kingdom of God, coming, emboldened himself and went in to Pilate and begged the body of Jesus. @ hnŭn yơh Yôsep, mơnuih plei Arimathê, jing sa čô amăng ƀing khua phat kơđi arăng pơpŭ, Ñu pô mơ̆n jing pô dŏ čang tơguan kơ dêh čar pơtao Ơi Adai, hăng tơlơi khĭn ñu nao pơ Pilat rơkâo drơi jan Yêsu. 
And Pilate wondered if he were already dead; and having called to [him] the centurion, he inquired of him if he had long died. @ Pilat kơtuă biă mă yua kơ Yêsu djai laih. Ñu iâu khua tơhan hăng tơña kơ gơ̆ kiăng thâo klă Yêsu djai sui laih ƀôdah phrâo. 
And when he knew from the centurion, he granted the body to Joseph. @ Giơ̆ng ñu thâo sĭt tui hăng khua tơhan hmâo laĭ pơthâo, ñu brơi drơi jan Yêsu kơ Yôsep. 
And having bought fine linen, [and] having taken him down, he swathed him in the fine linen, and laid him in a sepulchre which was cut out of rock, and rolled a stone to the door of the sepulchre. @ Yôsep blơi sa blah khăn kơbuă, mă pơtrŭn drơi jan Yêsu, ñu pŏn hrôm Ñu hăng khăn kơbuă anŭn hăng pơđih Ñu amăng pơsat arăng hmâo ƀoh amăng boh pơtâo. Giơ̆ng anŭn ñu glung boh pơtâo kơđơ̆l hĭ ƀơi bah amăng pơsat. 
And Mary of Magdala and Mary the [mother] of Joses saw where he was put. @ HʼMari Madala hăng HʼMari amĭ Yôse leng kơ ƀuh anih arăng dơr drơi jan Yêsu.
And the sabbath being [now] past, Mary of Magdala, and Mary the [mother] of James, and Salome, bought aromatic spices that they might come and embalm him. @ Tơdơi kơ hrơi Saƀat, HʼMari Madala, HʼMari amĭ Yakơ, hăng HʼSalômê blơi ia ƀâu mơngưi kiăng nao pik drơi jan Yêsu. 
And very early on the first [day] of the week they come to the sepulchre, the sun having risen. @ Hrơi tal sa amăng hrơi kơ̆m, sêng brêng ưm mơguah, hlăk yang hrơi phrâo tơbiă gơñu nao pơ pơsat. 
And they said to one another, Who shall roll us away the stone out of the door of the sepulchre? @ Rŏk jơlan gơñu bơlaĭ tơdruă: “Hlơi či tơglung hĭ boh pơtâo kơđơ̆l bah amăng pơsat brơi kơ ƀing ta?” 
And when they looked, they see that the stone has been rolled [away], for it was very great. @ Samơ̆ tơ gơñu angak lăng, gơñu ƀuh boh pơtâo prŏng biă mă anŭn arăng tơglung hĭ laih mơ̆ng bah amăng pơsat. 
And entering into the sepulchre, they saw a young man sitting on the right, clothed in a white robe, and they were amazed and alarmed; @ Tui anŭn yơh gơñu mŭt amăng pơsat, gơñu ƀuh sa čô tơdăm buh ao phyung kŏ dŏ ber gah hơnuă, gơñu hwĭ biă mă. 
but he says to them, Be not alarmed. Ye seek Jesus, the Nazarene, the crucified one. He is risen, he is not here; behold the place where they had put him. @ Ñu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Anăm hwĭ ôh. Kâo thâo ƀing gih sem Yêsu plei Nasaret, Pô arăng pơ̆ng laih ƀơi kơyâo bơrơkal. Ñu hơdip glaĭ laih. Ñu ƀu dŏ pơ anai dơ̆ng tah. Lăng bĕ, anai jing anih arăng pơđih Ñu. 
But go, tell his disciples and Peter, he goes before you into Galilee; there shall ye see him, as he said to you. @ Ră anai nao laĭ pơthâo bĕ kơ ƀing ding kơna Ñu hăng Pêtrôs: ‘Yêsu nao hlâo kơ ƀing gih pơ kwar Galilê. Pơ anŭn ƀing gih či ƀuh Ñu, tui hăng ñu hmâo laĭ laih kơ ƀing gih.’” 
And they went out, and fled from the sepulchre. And trembling and excessive amazement possessed them, and they said nothing to any one, for they were afraid. @ Tui anŭn gơñu tơbiă mơ̆ng pơsat laih anŭn đuaĭ kơdŏp hĭ, yua kơ gơñu hwĭ bral tơtư̆ drơi jan hăng kơtuă hling hlang đơi. Gơñu ƀu khĭn pơhaih kơ hlơi hlơi ôh.
[ 
Now when he had risen very early, the first [day] of the week, he appeared first to Mary of Magdala, out of whom he had cast seven demons. @ Giơ̆ng Yêsu hơdip glaĭ laih, hlăk ưm mơguah hrơi tal sa amăng hrơi kơ̆m anŭn, Ñu pơƀuh Ñu pô blŭng hlâo kơ HʼMari Madala, jing pô Yêsu hmâo puh pơđuaĭ tơjuh čô yang sat mơ̆ng gơ̆. 
*She* went and brought word to those that had been with him, [who were] grieving and weeping. @ HʼMari Madala nao laĭ pơthâo tơlơi anŭn kơ ƀing hmâo dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt laih hăng Yêsu. Ƀing anai hlăk dŏ čŏk hia rơngot hơning. 
And when these heard that he was alive and had been seen of her, they disbelieved [it]. @ Samơ̆ tơ gơñu hmư̆ laih tơlơi đah kơmơi anŭn laĭ pơthâo kơ tơlơi Yêsu hmâo hơdip glaĭ laih anŭn gơ̆ hmâo ƀuh laih Yêsu, gơñu ƀu đaŏ ôh kơ tơlơi anŭn.
And after these things he was manifested in another form to two of them as they walked, going into the country; @ Giơ̆ng tơlơi anŭn Yêsu pơƀuh Ñu pô hăng rup pơkŏn kơ dua čô ƀing ding kơna tơdang gơñu rơbat rŏk jơlan glaĭ pơ plei. 
and *they* went and brought word to the rest; neither did they believe them. @ Gơñu wơ̆t glaĭ laĭ pơthâo tơlơi anŭn kơ ƀing ding kơna pơkŏn, samơ̆ ƀing ding kơna anŭn ƀu đaŏ kơ tơlơi gơñu laĭ pơthâo ôh.
Afterwards as they lay at table he was manifested to the eleven, and reproached [them with] their unbelief and hardness of heart, because they had not believed those who had seen him risen. @ Tơdơi kơ abih bang, Yêsu pơƀuh Ñu pô dơ̆ng kơ pluh sa čô ƀing ding kơna tơdang gơñu dŏ ƀơ̆ng huă. Yêsu ƀuah gơñu yua kơ tơlơi gơñu ƀu đaŏ hăng pran jua khăng gơñu; yua kơ gơñu ƀu đaŏ ôh kơ ƀing hmâo ƀuh Ñu hmâo hơdip glaĭ laih. 
And he said to them, Go into all the world, and preach the glad tidings to all the creation. @ Ñu laĭ hăng ƀing gơ̆: “Nao bĕ pơ djŏp djang lŏn tơnah, pơtô Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam kơ abih bang mơnuih. 
He that believes and is baptised shall be saved, and he that disbelieves shall be condemned. @ Hlơi pô đaŏ laih anŭn tŭ ƀatem či klaih, samơ̆ hlơi pô ƀu đaŏ ôh či tŭ tơlơi klă kơđi. 
And these signs shall follow those that have believed: in my name they shall cast out demons; they shall speak with new tongues; @ Ơi Adai či brơi ƀing đaŏ hơdôm gru kơnăl tui anai: Hăng anăn Kâo gơñu či puh pơđuaĭ ƀing yang sat, gơñu či pơhiăp tơlơi tuai, 
they shall take up serpents; and if they should drink any deadly thing it shall not injure them; they shall lay hands upon the infirm, and they shall be well. @ tơdah gơñu mă djơ̆ ala, ƀôdah mơñum djơ̆ ia kăm, gơñu ƀu či ruă ôh, gơñu či ah tơngan ƀơi mơnuih duăm ruă, mơnuih duăm ruă či suaih.”
The Lord therefore, after he had spoken to them, was taken up into heaven, and sat at the right hand of God. @  Giơ̆ng kơ Khua Yang Yêsu hmâo pơhiăp laih hăng gơñu, Ơi Adai pŭ ba Ñu pơ adai, laih anŭn Ñu dŏ ber gah hơnuă kơ Ơi Adai. 
And they, going forth, preached everywhere, the Lord working with [them], and confirming the word by the signs following upon [it]. @ Ƀing ding kơna hyu pơtô djŏp djang anih, Khua Yang mă bruă hrŏm hơbĭt hăng gơñu laih anŭn yua khul tơlơi gru kơnăl mơsêh mơyang nao hrŏm hơbĭt kiăng pơsĭt tơlơi gơñu pơtô.]
Forasmuch as many have undertaken to draw up a relation concerning the matters fully believed among us, @ Hmâo lu mơnuih mă bruă hăng abih pran jua čih ruai glaĭ kơ tơlơi hmâo truh laih ƀơi tơ̆ng krah ƀing ta. 
as those who from the beginning were eye-witnesses of and attendants on the Word have delivered them to us, @ Gơñu čih tơlơi anŭn djơ̆ tui hăng ƀing hmâo ƀuh laih mơ̆ng phŭn laih anŭn jing ƀing pô pơtô pơhaih tơlơi Ơi Adai pơhiăp anŭn kơ ƀing ta. 
it has seemed good to *me* also, accurately acquainted from the origin with all things, to write to thee with method, most excellent Theophilus, @ Yua kơ anŭn yơh kâo kar kaĭ mơ̆n pơmĭn jing hiam, laih kâo kơsem pơklă abih bang tơlơi anŭn mơ̆ng phŭn, kiăng čih djơ̆ tui hăng pruăi tơlơi anŭn kơ ih, Ơ Ơi Thêôphil, 
that thou mightest know the certainty of those things in which thou hast been instructed. @ Kiăng kơ ih dưi thâo khul tơlơi ih hmâo hrăm anŭn jing sĭt biă mă.
There was in the days of Herod, the king of Judaea, a certain priest, by name Zacharias, of the course of Abia, and his wife of the daughters of Aaron, and her name Elizabeth. @  Rơnŭk Hêrôt ngă pơtao čar Yuđa, hmâo sa čô khua ngă yang anăn ñu Sakari mơ̆ng tơpul Abija. Bơnai ñu mơ̆ng kơnŭng djuai Arôn anăn gơ̆ HʼÊlisabet. 
And they were both just before God, walking in all the commandments and ordinances of the Lord blameless. @ Abih dua gơñu hơdip tơpă hơnơ̆ng ƀơi anăp Ơi Adai, tui gưt abih bang tơlơi juăt laih anŭn tơlơi Khua Yang pơtă tơl arăng ƀu dưi ƀuah kơ gơñu ôh. 
And they had no child, because Elizabeth was barren, and they were both advanced in years. @ Gơñu ƀu hmâo ană ôh, yua kơ HʼÊlisabet jing đah kơmơi plao, laih anŭn abih dua gơñu leng kơ tha laih.
And it came to pass, as he fulfilled his priestly service before God in the order of his course, @ Djơ̆ tal tơpul ñu, Sakari ngă bruă khua ngă yang ƀơi anăp Ơi Adai. 
it fell to him by lot, according to the custom of the priesthood, to enter into the temple of the Lord to burn incense. @ Tơ mă črăm tui hăng tơlơi juăt kơ ƀing khua ngă yang, ñu mă djơ̆ črăm dưi mŭt čuh mơnơ̆ng ƀâu mơngưi amăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ Khua Yang. 
And all the multitude of the people were praying without at the hour of incense. @ Amăng mông čuh mơnơ̆ng ƀâu mơngưi, abih bang mơnuih lu dŏ iâu laĭ pơ gah rơngiao. 
And an angel of [the] Lord appeared to him, standing on the right of the altar of incense. @ Hlăk anŭn hmâo sa čô ling jang Khua Yang pơƀuh brơi kơ Sakari, ñu dŏ dơ̆ng gah hơnuă kơƀang ngă yang čuh mơnơ̆ng ƀâu mơngưi. 
And Zacharias was troubled, seeing [him], and fear fell upon him. @ Tơ Sakari ƀuh ling jang anŭn, ñu rŭng răng laih anŭn hwĭ bral. 
But the angel said to him, Fear not, Zacharias, because thy supplication has been heard, and thy wife Elizabeth shall bear thee a son, and thou shalt call his name John. @ Samơ̆ ling jang laĭ kơ ñu: “Ơ Sakari! Anăm hwĭ ôh, yua kơ Ơi Adai hmâo hmư̆ laih tơlơi ih iâu laĭ. Bơnai ih HʼÊlisabet či tơkeng kơ ih sa čô ană đah rơkơi, laih anŭn ih či pơanăn ñu Yôhan. 
And he shall be to thee joy and rejoicing, and many shall rejoice at his birth. @ Ih či hmâo tơlơi hơ̆k kơdơ̆k, mơak mơai, laih anŭn lu mơnuih či mơak yua kơ tơlơi tơkeng ñu. 
For he shall be great before [the] Lord, and he shall drink no wine nor strong drink; and he shall be filled with [the] Holy Spirit, even from his mother's womb. @ Yua kơ ñu či jing prŏng ƀơi anăp Khua Yang, ñu ƀu či mơñum tơpai boh kơƀâu ƀôdah mơnơ̆ng mơñum hmâo tơpơi ôh, laih anŭn ñu či bă blai hăng Yang Bơngăt Hiam čơdơ̆ng mơ̆ng ñu hlăk dŏ amăng kian amĭ ñu. 
And many of the sons of Israel shall he turn to [the] Lord their God. @ Ñu či ba lu ƀing ană plei Israel wơ̆t glaĭ kơ Khua Yang jing Ơi Adai ƀing gơñu. 
And *he* shall go before him in [the] spirit and power of Elias, to turn hearts of fathers to children, and disobedient ones to [the] thoughts of just [men], to make ready for [the] Lord a prepared people. @ Ñu či nao ƀơi anăp Khua Yang hăng jua pơmĭn laih anŭn tơlơi dưi mơyang Êli, kiăng pơsir pran jua ƀing ama hăng ană gơñu, laih anŭn ba ƀing mơnuih ƀu thâo gưt hiăp wơ̆t glaĭ kơ tơlơi kơhnâo kơ ƀing mơnuih tơpă, laih anŭn kiăng kơ prăp rơmet sa phung kơnŭng djuai hmâo pran jua hiam brơi kơ Khua Yang.”
And Zacharias said to the angel, How shall I know this, for *I* am an old man, and my wife advanced in years? @ Sakari laĭ kơ ling jang: “Hyư̆m kâo dưi thâo tơlơi anŭn či truh sĭt lĕ? Yua kơ kâo tha laih, laih anŭn bơnai kâo ăt tha laih mơ̆n.”
And the angel answering, said to him, *I* am Gabriel, who stand before God, and I have been sent to speak to thee, and to bring these glad tidings to thee; @  Ling jang laĭ glaĭ: “Kâo Gabriel, pô dŏ ƀơi anăp Ơi Adai. Ơi Adai pơkiaŏ rai kâo pơhiăp hrŏm hăng ih laih anŭn pơthâo kơ ih tơlơi phrâo hiam anai. 
and behold, thou shalt be silent and not able to speak, till the day in which these things shall take place, because thou hast not believed my words, the which shall be fulfilled in their time. @ Anai nê, ih či kơmlô hĭ, ƀu dưi pơhiăp ôh tơl hrơi tơlơi anŭn hmâo truh hĭ, yua kơ ih ƀu đaŏ ôh kơ tơlơi kâo pơhiăp. Tơlơi pơhiăp anŭn či krĕp djơ̆ ƀơi hrơi Ơi Adai hmâo pơkă laih.”
And the people were awaiting Zacharias, and they wondered at his delaying in the temple. @ Hlăk anŭn, ƀing ană plei dŏ tơguan kơ Sakari, gơñu hling hlang yua kơ ñu dŏ sui amăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ. 
But when he came out he could not speak to them, and they recognised that he had seen a vision in the temple. And he was making signs to them, and continued dumb. @ Tơ Sakari tơbiă, ñu ƀu dưi pơhiăp hăng ƀing gơñu ôh, laih anŭn gơñu thâo kơ ñu hmâo laih tơlơi pơƀuh amăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ anŭn. Yua kơ ñu ƀu dưi pơhiăp ôh, tui anŭn ñu ngă gru hăng tơngan kiăng pơhiăp hăng ƀing gơñu.
And it came to pass, when the days of his service were completed, he departed to his house. @ Tơ khul hrơi ñu mă bruă abih laih, ñu glaĭ pơ sang. 
Now after these days, Elizabeth his wife conceived, and hid herself five months, saying, @ Sui ƀiă mơ̆ng anŭn, bơnai ñu HʼÊlisabet pi kian, laih anŭn pơdŏp ñu pô amăng rơma blan. Ñu laĭ tui anai: 
Thus has [the] Lord done to me in [these] days in which he looked upon [me] to take away my reproach among men. @ “Anai jing tơlơi Khua Yang hmâo ngă brơi laih kơ kâo. Amăng khul hrơi anai yơh, Ñu pap drap kơ kâo laih anŭn mă lui hĭ mơ̆ng kâo tơlơi mlâo hañ ƀơi anăp ƀing ană plei pla.”
But in the sixth month, the angel Gabriel was sent of God to a city of Galilee, of which [the] name [was] Nazareth, @ Năm blan tơdơi, Ơi Adai pơkiaŏ ling jang Ñu Gabriel nao pơ sa boh plei amăng čar Galilê anăn plei anŭn Nasaret, 
to a virgin betrothed to a man whose name [was] Joseph, of the house of David; and the virgin's name [was] Mary. @ bưp sa čô đah kơmơi dra hmŭm hmâo djă kong laih hăng sa čô đah rơkơi, anăn gơ̆ Yôsep, amăng kơnŭng djuai Đawit. Dra hmŭm anŭn anăn gơ̆ HʼMari. 
And the angel came in to her, and said, Hail, [thou] favoured one! the Lord [is] with thee: [blessed art *thou* amongst women]. @ Ling jang truh pơ HʼMari laih anŭn laĭ: “Kơkuh kơ ih, ơ pô Ơi Adai pap. Khua Yang dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ih!” 
But she, [seeing] [the angel], was troubled at his word, and reasoned in her mind what this salutation might be. @ Hmư̆ tơlơi pơhiăp anŭn, HʼMari rŭng răng biă mă, laih anŭn pơmĭn amăng pran jua ñu, hơgĕt tơlơi kơkuh anŭn jing. 
And the angel said to her, Fear not, Mary, for thou hast found favour with God; @ Ling jang laĭ kơ ñu: “Ơ HʼMari, anăm hwĭ ôh, yua kơ ih hmâo laih tơlơi pap ƀơi anăp Ơi Adai. 
and behold, thou shalt conceive in the womb and bear a son, and thou shalt call his name Jesus. @ Anai nê, ih či pi kian laih anŭn tơkeng sa čô ană đah rơkơi, ih či pơanăn Ñu Yêsu. 
*He* shall be great, and shall be called Son of [the] Highest; and [the] Lord God shall give him the throne of David his father; @ Ñu či jing prŏng, laih anŭn arăng či iâu Ñu Ană Pô Glông Hloh, laih anŭn Khua Yang Ơi Adai či brơi kơ Ñu gre pơtao ơi Ñu Đawit. 
and he shall reign over the house of Jacob for the ages, and of his kingdom there shall not be an end. @ Ñu či wai lăng kơnŭng djuai Yakôp nanao hlŏng lar, laih anŭn Dêh Čar pơtao Ñu ƀu či thâo đŭt ôh.”
But Mary said to the angel, How shall this be, since I know not a man? @ HʼMari laĭ kơ ling jang: “Hyư̆m tơlơi anŭn dưi truh lĕ yua kơ kâo jing đah kơmơi dra aka dŏ hrŏm hăng đah rơkơi ôh?”
And the angel answering said to her, [The] Holy Spirit shall come upon thee, and power of [the] Highest overshadow thee, wherefore the holy thing also which shall be born shall be called Son of God. @ Ling jang laĭ kơ ñu: “Yang Bơngăt Hiam či rai pơ ih, laih anŭn tơlơi dưi mơyang Pô Glông Hloh či gom ih; yua kơ anŭn yơh ană rơgoh hiam ih či tơkeng rai anŭn arăng či iâu Ñu jing Ană Ơi Adai. 
And behold, Elizabeth, thy kinswoman, she also has conceived a son in her old age, and this is the sixth month to her that was called barren: @ Anai nê, sa čô đah kơmơi kơnŭng djuai ih, HʼÊlisabet, hmâo pi kian laih sa čô ană đah rơkơi tơdang gơ̆ tha laih. Pô arăng iâu đah kơmơi plao, ñu pi kian hmâo năm blan laih. 
for nothing shall be impossible with God. @ Yua kơ ƀu hmâo ôh sa mơta bruă hơgĕt Ơi Adai ƀu dưi ngă.”
And Mary said, Behold the bondmaid of [the] Lord; be it to me according to thy word. And the angel departed from her. @ HʼMari laĭ: “Anai nê kâo jing ding kơna đah kơmơi kơ Khua Yang. Brơi tơlơi anŭn truh kơ kâo tui hăng tơlơi ih hmâo pơhiăp laih.” Laih anŭn ling jang tơbiă đuaĭ hĭ.
And Mary, rising up in those days, went into the hill country with haste, to a city of Judah, @ Hlăk anŭn HʼMari tơgŭ hăng tơlơi hăt hot nao pơ sa boh plei amăng čar kơdư Yuđa. 
and entered into the house of Zacharias, and saluted Elizabeth. @ Ñu mŭt amăng sang Sakari laih anŭn kơkuh kơ HʼÊlisabet. 
And it came to pass, as Elizabeth heard the salutation of Mary, the babe leaped in her womb; and Elizabeth was filled with [the] Holy Spirit, @ Tơ HʼÊlisabet hmư̆ tơlơi HʼMari kơkuh, ană amăng kian ñu pơpư̆ mơtam, laih anŭn HʼÊlisabet bă blai Yang Bơngăt Hiam. 
and cried out with a loud voice and said, Blessed [art] *thou* amongst women, and blessed the fruit of thy womb. @ HʼÊlisabet pơhiăp kraih krin tui anai: “Ih hmâo tơlơi mơyun hiam hloh kơ ƀing đah kơmơi pơkŏn, laih anŭn mơyun hiam yơh kơ ană mơ̆ng kian pruăi ih! 
And whence [is] this to me, that the mother of my Lord should come to me? @ Hyư̆m tơlơi yom anai dưi truh kơ kâo, tơl amĭ Khua Yang kâo rai čuă ngui kâo? 
For behold, as the voice of thy salutation sounded in my ears, the babe leaped with joy in my womb. @ Yua kơ tơdang kâo hmư̆ tơlơi ih kơkuh kơ kâo, ană amăng kian kâo pơpư̆ hơ̆k kơdơ̆k. 
And blessed [is] she that has believed, for there shall be a fulfilment of the things spoken to her from [the] Lord. @ Mơyun hiam yơh kơ đah kơmơi hmâo đaŏ laih, yua kơ abih tơlơi Khua Yang laĭ kơ ñu či truh sĭt.”
And Mary said, My soul magnifies the Lord, @  HʼMari laĭ:
“Bơngăt kâo bơni hơơč kơ Khua Yang,
and my spirit has rejoiced in God my Saviour. @ Bơngăt jua kâo hmâo tơlơi mơak amăng Ơi Adai Pô Pơklaih kâo.
For he has looked upon the low estate of his bondmaid; for behold, from henceforth all generations shall call me blessed. @  Yua kơ Ñu hmâo lăng laih kơ tơlơi luă gŭ ding kơna đah kơmơi Ñu.
Anai nê, mơ̆ng ră anai truh pơ anăp, mơnuih abih bang rơnŭk či yap kơ kâo jing mơnuih hmâo tơlơi mơyun hiam.
For the Mighty One has done to me great things, and holy [is] his name; @ Yua kơ Pô Mơyang biă mă hmâo ngă laih tơlơi yom pơphan kơ kâo.
Anăn Ñu jing rơgoh hiam.
and his mercy [is] to generations and generations to them that fear him. @ Ñu pap drap kơ ƀing hwĭ pơpŭ kơ Ñu,
Amăng abih bang rơnŭk.
He has wrought strength with his arm; he has scattered haughty [ones] in the thought of their heart. @ Ñu hmâo bơrơđah laih tơlơi kơtang hăng tơngan Ñu,
Ñu ngă čơlah čơlap hĭ ƀing hmâo pran jua tơlơi pơmĭn pơgao ang.
He has put down rulers from thrones, and exalted the lowly. @  Ñu hmâo pơglưh trŭn hĭ laih ƀing khua gĭt gai mơ̆ng gre pơtao gơñu,
Laih anŭn yŏng đĭ ƀing thâo luă gŭ.
He has filled the hungry with good things, and sent away the rich empty. @ Ñu brơi ƀing rơpa dưi trơi hăng mơnơ̆ng hiam jơman,
Laih anŭn Ñu puh pơđuaĭ hĭ ƀing pơdrŏng sah glaĭ hăng tơngan đôč đač.
He has helped Israel his servant, in order to remember mercy, @ Ñu hmâo djru laih ƀing Israel, ding kơna Ñu,
Ñu hơdơr glaĭ tơlơi Ñu pap drap,
(as he spoke to our fathers,) to Abraham and to his seed for ever. @  Tui hăng Ñu hmâo pơhiăp laih hăng ƀing ơi adon ta,
Hăng Abraham laih anŭn hăng ƀing ană tơčo ñu hlŏng lar.”
And Mary abode with her about three months, and returned to her house. @ HʼMari dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng HʼÊlisabet năng ai klâo blan, laih anŭn ñu wơ̆t glaĭ pơ sang ñu pô.
But the time was fulfilled for Elizabeth that she should bring forth, and she gave birth to a son. @ Hrơi HʼÊlisabet đih apui truh yơh. Ñu tơkeng sa čô ană đah rơkơi. 
And her neighbours and kinsfolk heard that [the] Lord had magnified his mercy with her, and they rejoiced with her. @ Ƀing ană plei pla jum dar ñu hăng ƀing kơnŭng djuai ñu hmư̆ tơlơi Khua Yang hmâo bơrơđah laih kơ ñu tơlơi pap drap prŏng, laih anŭn gơñu hơ̆k mơak hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ñu.
And it came to pass on the eighth day they came to circumcise the child, and they called it after the name of his father, Zacharias. @  Ƀơi hrơi tal sapăn gơñu rai kiăng khăt klĭ ană nge anŭn hăng pơanăn ñu jing Sakari tui hăng anăn ama gơ̆. 
And his mother answering said, No; but he shall be called John. @ Samơ̆ amĭ ñu laĭ: “Ư ưh! Či pơanăn ñu Yôhan.”
And they said to her, There is no one among thy kinsfolk who is called by this name. @ Gơñu laĭ kơ HʼÊlisabet: “Ƀu hmâo ôh sa čô amăng kơnŭng djuai ih hmâo anăn kar hăng anŭn.” 
And they made signs to his father as to what he might wish it to be called. @ Tui anŭn gơñu ngă gru hăng tơngan kiăng pơhiăp hăng ama ñu kiăng thâo hlơi ñu kiăng pơanăn kơ gơ̆.
And having asked for a writing-table, he wrote saying, John is his name. And they all wondered. @ Sakari rơkâo sa pŏk hơnal, laih anŭn čih tui anai: “Anăn ñu Yôhan”. Abih bang gơñu dŏ kơtuă hling hlang. 
And his mouth was opened immediately, and his tongue, and he spake, blessing God. @ Mông anŭn mơtam, Sakari ha amăng bah, jơlah ñu klaih, ñu pơhiăp laih anŭn pơpŭ bơni hơơč kơ Ơi Adai. 
And fear came upon all who dwelt round about them; and in the whole hill-country of Judaea all these things were the subject of conversation. @ Abih bang ƀing mơnuih jum dar gơñu hwĭ biă mă. Arăng ruai abih tơlơi anŭn djŏp djang čar kơdư Yuđa. 
And all who heard them laid them up in their heart, saying, What then will this child be? And [the] Lord's hand was with him. @ Abih bang ƀing hmư̆ tơlơi anŭn djă pioh amăng pran jua gơñu hăng laĭ: “Hyư̆m ană anŭn či jing lĕ?” Yua kơ sĭt biă mă tơngan Khua Yang hmâo dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt laih hăng ñu.
And Zacharias his father was filled with [the] Holy Spirit, and prophesied, saying, @ Sakari, ama ñu, bă blai Yang Bơngăt Hiam laih anŭn laĭ lui hlâo tui anai:
Blessed be [the] Lord the God of Israel, because he has visited and wrought redemption for his people, @ “Pơpŭ bơni kơ Khua Yang, Ơi Adai Israel,
Yua kơ Ñu hmâo čuă ngui laih anŭn song mă ƀing ană plei pla Ñu,
and raised up a horn of deliverance for us in the house of David his servant; @ Ñu hmâo pơjing brơi laih kơ ƀing ta sa čô Pô Pơklaih bă hăng tơlơi dưi mơyang,
Amăng sang Đawit, ding kơna Ñu.
as he spoke by [the] mouth of his holy prophets, who have been since the world began; @ Kar hăng Ñu hmâo laĭ laih mơ̆ng rơnŭk đưm adih
Găn mơ̆ng amăng bah ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo rơgoh hiam Ñu,
deliverance from our enemies and out of the hand of all who hate us; @ Kiăng kơ ƀing ta dưi klaih mơ̆ng ƀing ayăt ƀing ta,
Laih anŭn mơ̆ng tơngan abih bang ƀing bơrơmŭt kơ ƀing ta.
to fulfil mercy with our fathers and remember his holy covenant, @ Kiăng pơsĭt tơlơi pap drap Ñu hmâo ƀuăn laih kơ ƀing ơi adon ƀing ta,
Laih anŭn hơdơr glaĭ tơlơi kơnol pơgop hiam rơgoh Ñu.
[the] oath which he swore to Abraham our father, @ Tui hăng tơlơi Ñu hmâo ƀuăn rơ̆ng laih hăng Abraham,
Ơi adon ƀing ta,
to give us, that, saved out of the hand of our enemies, we should serve him without fear @ Giơ̆ng kơ Ñu pơrơngai ƀing ta mơ̆ng tơngan ƀing ayăt,
Ñu či brơi kơ ƀing ta dưi buih bruă Ñu ƀu hmâo tơlơi hwĭ hơgĕt ôh.
in piety and righteousness before him all our days. @ Hăng tơlơi rơgoh hơčih laih anŭn tơlơi tơpă klă
Ƀơi anăp Ñu abih hrơi ƀing ta dŏ hơdip.
And *thou*, child, shalt be called [the] prophet of [the] Highest; for thou shalt go before the face of [the] Lord to make ready his ways; @  Bơ ih, ơ ană, arăng či iâu ih jing pô laĭ lui hlâo kơ Pô Glông Hloh,
Yua kơ ih či rơbat ƀơi anăp Khua Yang kiăng pơkra rơmet jơlan Ñu,
to give knowledge of deliverance to his people by [the] remission of their sins @ Kiăng kơ ƀing ană plei pla Ñu thâo hluh kơ tơlơi pơklaih,
Mơ̆ng tơlơi pap brơi tơlơi soh ƀing gơñu.
on account of [the] bowels of mercy of our God; wherein [the] dayspring from on high has visited us, @ Yua kơ tơlơi pap drap Ơi Adai ƀing ta,
Tơlơi bơngač Yang Hrơi či pơčrang brơi kơ ƀing ta mơ̆ng adai glong,
to shine upon them who were sitting in darkness and in [the] shadow of death, to guide our feet into [the] way of peace. @  Kiăng pơčrang rơđah ƀing dŏ amăng tơlơi kơnăm mơmŏt laih anŭn amăng tơ-u tơlơi djai,
Kiăng atăt ba ƀing ta rơbat amăng jơlan tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua.”
And the child grew and was strengthened in spirit; and he was in the deserts until the day of his shewing to Israel. @ Čơđai anĕt anŭn prŏng tui, bơngăt jua ñu jing kơtang. Ñu dŏ amăng tơdrŏn tač, tơl truh hrơi ñu pơrơđah ñu pô kơ ƀing Israel.
But it came to pass in those days that a decree went out from Caesar Augustus, that a census should be made of all the habitable world. @ Rơnŭk anŭn Sêsar Ôgust pơtrŭn asăp brơi abih bang mơnuih amăng lŏn tơnah čih anăn amăng hơdrôm hră yap ană plei pla. 
The census itself first took place when Cyrenius had the government of Syria. @ Anai jing tơlơi yap akŏ mơnuih tal blŭng hlâo, tơdang Kirinius jing khua wai lăng čar Siri. 
And all went to be inscribed in the census roll, each to his own city: @ Rĭm čô khŏm glaĭ pơ plei phŭn gơñu pô kiăng brơi arăng čih pơmŭt anăn gơñu.
and Joseph also went up from Galilee out of the city Nazareth to Judaea, to David's city, the which is called Bethlehem, because he was of the house and family of David, @ Yôsep ăt kar kaĭ mơ̆n, mơ̆ng čar Galilê plei Nasaret, ñu đĭ nao pơ čar Yuđa plei Đawit, arăng pơanăn dơ̆ng jing plei Betlêhem, yua kơ ñu jing kơnŭng djuai laih anŭn ană tơčo Đawit, 
to be inscribed in the census roll with Mary who was betrothed to him [as his] wife, she being great with child. @ kiăng brơi arăng čih pơmŭt anăn ñu hrŏm hơbĭt hăng HʼMari, pô hmâo djă kong laih hăng ñu. Hlăk anŭn HʼMari dŏ pi kian. 
And it came to pass, while they were there, the days of her giving birth [to her child] were fulfilled, @ Tơdang gơñu dŏ pơ anŭn, hrơi HʼMari đih apui truh. 
and she brought forth her first-born son, and wrapped him up in swaddling-clothes and laid him in the manger, because there was no room for them in the inn. @ Ñu tơkeng sa čô ană kơčoa đah rơkơi. Ñu sŏm ană ñu hăng khăn laih anŭn pơđih gơ̆ amăng atŏng rơ̆k, yua kơ ƀu hmâo anih ôh kơ gơñu dŏ amăng sang jưh.
And there were shepherds in that country abiding without, and keeping watch by night over their flock. @ Amăng tring anŭn hmâo ƀing wai triu dŏ krŏng amăng mlam pơ hmua, kiăng wai phung triu gơñu. 
And lo, an angel of [the] Lord was there by them, and [the] glory of [the] Lord shone around them, and they feared [with] great fear. @ Hmâo sa čô ling jang Khua Yang pơƀuh brơi kơ gơñu, tơlơi ang yang Khua Yang pơčrang jum dar gơñu, hnŭn yơh gơñu hwĭ biă mă. 
And the angel said to them, Fear not, for behold, I announce to you glad tidings of great joy, which shall be to all the people; @ Samơ̆ ling jang laĭ kơ gơñu: “Anăm hwĭ ôh! Anai nê, kâo rai pơthâo brơi kơ ƀing gih sa Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam, jing tơlơi hơ̆k mơak prŏng brơi kơ abih bang mơnuih mơnam. 
for to-day a Saviour has been born to you in David's city, who is Christ [the] Lord. @ Yua kơ hrơi anai amăng plei Đawit, arăng tơkeng laih kơ ƀing gih sa čô Pô Pơklaih, Ñu jing Krist, Khua Yang. 
And this is the sign to you: ye shall find a babe wrapped in swaddling-clothes, and lying in a manger. @ Tơlơi anai jing gru kơnăl brơi kơ ƀing gih thâo krăn Ñu: Ƀing gih či ƀuh sa čô ană nge sŏm hăng khăn laih anŭn đih amăng atŏng rơ̆k.” 
And suddenly there was with the angel a multitude of the heavenly host, praising God and saying, @ Blĭp blăp mơtam, hmâo klăk klai ƀing ling jang hiam pơkŏn hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ling jang hiam anŭn adoh pơpŭ bơni kơ Ơi Adai tui anai:
Glory to God in the highest, and on earth peace, good pleasure in men. @ “Tơlơi guh kơang kơ Ơi Adai amăng anih glong hloh,
Laih anŭn tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua ƀơi lŏn tơnah, tơlơi pap kơ ƀing mơnuih Ñu khăp!”
And it came to pass, as the angels departed from them into heaven, that the shepherds said to one another, Let us make our way then now as far as Bethlehem, and let us see this thing that is come to pass, which the Lord has made known to us. @ Giơ̆ng kơ phung ling jang đuaĭ mơ̆ng gơñu wơ̆t glaĭ pơ adai, ƀing wai triu bơlaĭ hăng tơdruă gơñu: “Nao bĕ ƀing ta pơ Plei Betlêhem kiăng lăng tơlơi hmâo truh laih jing tơlơi Khua Yang hmâo laĭ pơthâo laih kơ ƀing ta.”
And they came with haste, and found both Mary and Joseph, and the babe lying in the manger; @ Tui anŭn, gơñu nao ječ mơtam, gơñu ƀuh HʼMari, Yôsep laih anŭn ană nge dŏ đih amăng atŏng rơ̆k. 
and having seen [it] they made known about the country the thing which had been said to them concerning this child. @ Tơ gơñu ƀuh ană nge anŭn, gơñu ruai glaĭ hơdôm tơlơi ling jang hiam laĭ kơ ană nge anŭn. 
And all who heard [it] wondered at the things said to them by the shepherds. @ Abih bang hlơi pô hmư̆ tơlơi ƀing wai triu ră ruai kơ tơlơi anŭn leng kơ hling hlang yơh. 
But Mary kept all these things [in her mind], pondering [them] in her heart. @ Samơ̆ HʼMari djă pioh laih anŭn pơmĭn kơ abih tơlơi anŭn amăng pran jua ñu. 
And the shepherds returned, glorifying and praising God for all things which they had heard and seen, as it had been said to them. @ Ƀing wai triu wơ̆t glaĭ hĭ, gơñu adoh bơni laih anŭn pơ-ư ang kơ Ơi Adai yua kơ abih tơlơi gơñu hmâo hmư̆ hăng hmâo ƀuh laih, djơ̆ tui hăng tơlơi ƀing ling jang hiam hmâo pơthâo laih kơ gơñu.
And when eight days were fulfilled for circumcising him, his name was called Jesus, which was the name given by the angel before he had been conceived in the womb. @  Sapăn hrơi mơ̆ng hrơi arăng tơkeng kơ Ñu, jing hrơi arăng khŏm khăt klĭ ană nge anŭn, arăng pơanăn Ñu jing Yêsu, tui hăng anăn ling jang hiam hmâo pơanăn hlâo kơ amĭ Ñu pi kian.
And when the days were fulfilled for their purifying according to the law of Moses, they brought him to Jerusalem to present [him] to the Lord @ Tơ khul hrơi ngă tơlơi pơrơgoh tui hăng Tơlơi Juăt Môis giơ̆ng hĭ laih, Yôsep hăng HʼMari ba nao Ñu pơ plei Yêrusalem kiăng pơyơr Ñu kơ Khua Yang, 
(as it is written in the law of [the] Lord: Every male that opens the womb shall be called holy to the Lord), @ tui hăng Môis hmâo čih laih amăng Tơlơi Juăt Khua Yang: “Rĭm čô ană kơčoa đah rơkơi arăng khŏm pioh brơi jing rơgoh hiam kơ Khua Yang,” 
and to offer a sacrifice according to what is said in the law of [the] Lord: A pair of turtle doves, or two young pigeons. @ laih anŭn pơyơr mơnơ̆ng ngă yang tui hăng tơlơi hmâo čih laih amăng tơlơi Juăt Khua Yang: “Dua drơi čĭm bơrơgơ̆m ƀôdah dua drơi ană čĭm kơtrâo.”
And behold, there was a man in Jerusalem whose name was Simeon; and this man was just and pious, awaiting the consolation of Israel, and [the] Holy Spirit was upon him. @ Hlăk anŭn, pơ Plei Yêrusalem hmâo sa čô đah rơkơi, anăn ñu Simêôn. Ñu jing mơnuih tơpă laih anŭn rơgoh hiam. Ñu dŏ čang rơmang tơlơi pơalum kơ ƀing ană Israel, laih anŭn Yang Bơngăt Hiam dŏ ƀơi ñu. 
And it was divinely communicated to him by the Holy Spirit, that he should not see death before he should see [the] Lord's Christ. @ Yang Bơngăt Hiam hmâo laĭ brơi kơ ñu thâo, ñu ƀu či djai ôh tơl ñu ƀuh Yang Krist Pô rai mơ̆ng Khua Yang. 
And he came in the Spirit into the temple; and as the parents brought in the child Jesus that they might do for him according to the custom of the law, @ Hmâo tơlơi pơtrŭt mơ̆ng Yang Bơngăt Hiam, Simêôn nao pơ sang kơkuh pơpŭ djơ̆ ƀơi mông amĭ ama Yêsu ba rai ană nge Yêsu, kiăng ngă brơi kơ Ñu tui hăng tơlơi juăt hmâo pơtă. 
*he* received him into his arms, and blessed God, and said, @ Simêôn pi mă ană nge anŭn hăng bơni hơơč kơ Ơi Adai tui anai:
Lord, now thou lettest thy bondman go, according to thy word, in peace; @ “Ơ Khua Yang, ră anai rơkâo kơ Ih brơi ding kơna Ih djai hăng tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua,
Tui hăng tơlơi Ih hmâo pơhiăp laih;
for mine eyes have seen thy salvation, @ Yua kơ mơta kâo hmâo ƀuh laih tơlơi pơklaih Ih,
which thou hast prepared before the face of all peoples; @ Ih hmâo pơkra laih ƀơi anăp abih bang kơnŭng djuai mơnuih,
a light for revelation of [the] Gentiles and [the] glory of thy people Israel. @  Jing tơlơi bơngač pơčrang jơlan kơ ƀing djuai tuai,
Laih anŭn jing tơlơi guh kơang kơ Israel, ană plei pla Ih.”
And his father and mother wondered at the things which were said concerning him. @ Amĭ ama Ñu hling hlang yua kơ tơlơi arăng laĭ kơ ană nge anŭn. 
And Simeon blessed them, and said to Mary his mother, Lo, this [child] is set for the fall and rising up of many in Israel, and for a sign spoken against; @ Simêôn hơơč mơyun tơlơi hiam klă kơ gơñu laih anŭn laĭ kơ HʼMari amĭ Ñu: “Anai nê, Ơi Adai hmâo ruah laih ană anai kơ bruă pơrai laih anŭn pơklaih lu mơnuih amăng ƀing Israel, laih anŭn jing gru kơnăl arăng či pơhiăp pơkơdơ̆ng. 
(and even a sword shall go through thine own soul;) so that [the] thoughts may be revealed from many hearts. @ (Bơ kơ ih pô, sa ƀĕ đao či klaŏ bơngăt jua ih), kiăng kơ tơlơi pơmĭn amăng lu hơtai pran mơnuih dưi pơrơđah.”
And there was a prophetess, Anna, daughter of Phanuel, of [the] tribe of Asher, who was far advanced in years, having lived with [her] husband seven years from her virginity, @ Ăt hmâo mơ̆n sa čô pô laĭ lui hlâo đah kơmơi, anăn ñu HʼAn, ană đah kơmơi Panuel, mơ̆ng kơnŭng djuai Aser. Ñu tha laih, ñu hmâo hơdip laih hăng rơkơi ñu tơjuh thŭn, 
and herself a widow up to eighty-four years; who did not depart from the temple, serving night and day with fastings and prayers; @ giơ̆ng anŭn ñu jing hĭ đah kơmơi djai rơkơi, truh kơ ră anai hmâo sapăn pluh pă thŭn laih. Ñu ƀu tơbiă ôh mơ̆ng sang kơkuh pơpŭ, hrơi mlam ñu kơkuh pơpŭ kơ Ơi Adai, ư̆ ƀơ̆ng huă laih anŭn iâu laĭ. 
and she coming up the same hour gave praise to the Lord, and spoke of him to all those who waited for redemption in Jerusalem. @ Ƀơi mông anŭn ñu truh, ñu bơni hơơč kơ Ơi Adai, laih anŭn pơhiăp tơlơi djơ̆ kơ Yêsu kơ abih bang ƀing dŏ čang rơmang kơ tơlơi pơrơngai plei Yêrusalem.
And when they had completed all things according to the law of [the] Lord, they returned to Galilee to their own city Nazareth. @  Tơ gơñu ngă abih bang bruă tui hăng tơlơi juăt Khua Yang, gơñu wơ̆t glaĭ pơ plei Nasaret plei gơñu pô amăng čar Galilê. 
And the child grew and waxed strong [in spirit], filled with wisdom, and God's grace was upon him. @ Čơđai Anĕt anŭn prŏng tui, kơjăp kơtang, bă blai tơlơi kơhnâo; laih anŭn tơlơi pap Ơi Adai dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Ñu.
And his parents went yearly to Jerusalem at the feast of the passover. @  Rĭm thŭn djơ̆ hrơi phĕt Tơlơi Găn, amĭ ama Yêsu đĭ nao pơ plei Yêrusalem. 
And when he was twelve years old, and they went up [to Jerusalem] according to the custom of the feast @ Hlăk Yêsu pluh dua thŭn, Ñu hrŏm hơbĭt hăng amĭ ama Ñu đĭ nao pơ plei Yêrusalem kiăng pơhơdơr phĕt Tơlơi Găn tui hăng tơlơi gơñu juăt ngă. 
and had completed the days, as they returned, the boy Jesus remained behind in Jerusalem, and his parents knew not [of it]; @ Tơ khul hrơi phĕt Tơlơi Găn abih hĭ laih, gơñu čơdơ̆ng wơ̆t glaĭ pơ plei gơñu, samơ̆ čơđai anĕt Yêsu dŏ glaĭ pơ plei Yêrusalem. Amĭ ama Ñu ƀu thâo ôh tơlơi anŭn. 
but, supposing him to be in the company that journeyed together, they went a day's journey, and sought him among their relations and acquaintances: @ Gơñu pơmĭn dah Yêsu nao hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing mơnuih lu rŏk jơlan, gơñu rơbat abih sa hrơi, giơ̆ng anŭn kah gơñu sem hơduah Yêsu amăng ƀing kơnŭng djuai laih anŭn ƀing gơyut Ñu. 
and not having found him they returned to Jerusalem seeking him. @ Tơ gơñu ƀu ƀuh Ñu ôh, gơñu wơ̆t glaĭ pơ plei Yêrusalem dơ̆ng kiăng kơ hơduah Ñu. 
And it came to pass, after three days they found him in the temple, sitting in the midst of the teachers and hearing them and asking them questions. @ Rơgao klâo hrơi, gơñu ƀuh Yêsu amăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ dŏ ber tơ̆ng krah ƀing khua pô pơtô. Ñu dŏ hmư̆ ƀing anŭn laih anŭn Ñu tơña kơ ƀing anŭn. 
And all who heard him were astonished at his understanding and answers. @ Abih bang ƀing dŏ hmư̆ Ñu leng kơ dŏ kơtuă hling hlang kơ tơlơi rơgơi laih anŭn kơ tơlơi Ñu laĭ glaĭ. 
And when they saw him they were amazed: and his mother said to him, Child, why hast thou dealt thus with us? behold, thy father and I have sought thee distressed. @ Tơ ƀuh Yêsu, amĭ ama Ñu dŏ hling hlang laih anŭn amĭ Ñu laĭ tui anai: “Ơ dăm, hyư̆m ih ngă kơ gơmơi tui anai lĕ? Anai nê, ama ih hăng kâo hyu sem hơduah ih hăng tơlơi hyơ̆k bơngơ̆t biă mă.”
And he said to them, Why [is it] that ye have sought me? did ye not know that I ought to be [occupied] in my Father's business? @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Yua hơgĕt ƀing ih sem hơduah kâo? Ƀing ih ƀu thâo ôh hă kâo khŏm mă bruă kơ Ama kâo?” 
And they understood not the thing that he said to them. @ Samơ̆ amĭ ama Ñu ƀu thâo hluh ôh kơ tơlơi Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu.
And he went down with them and came to Nazareth, and he was in subjection to them. And his mother kept all these things in her heart. @ Giơ̆ng anŭn Yêsu glaĭ pơ plei Nasaret hrŏm hơbĭt hăng amĭ ama Ñu laih anŭn tui gưt kơ ƀing gơñu. Amĭ Ñu djă pioh abih tơlơi anŭn amăng pran jua ñu. 
And Jesus advanced in wisdom and stature, and in favour with God and men. @ Yêsu prŏng tui amăng tơlơi kơhnâo, amăng drơi jan, laih anŭn amăng tơlơi ngă bơmơak kơ Ơi Adai hăng ană mơnuih.
Now in the fifteenth year of the government of Tiberius Caesar, Pontius Pilate being governor of Judaea, and Herod tetrarch of Galilee, and Philip his brother tetrarch of Ituraea and the region of Trachonitis, and Lysanias tetrarch of Abilene, @ Amăng thŭn tal pluh rơma Sêsar Tiber wai lăng, Pôntơ Pilat jing khua wai lăng čar Yuđa, Hêrôt wai lăng čar Galilê, laih anŭn adơi ñu Philip wai lăng čar Iturê hăng Trakônit, Lisanias wai lăng čar Abilen, 
in the high priesthood of Annas and Caiaphas, [the] word of God came upon John, the son of Zacharias, in the wilderness. @ amăng rơnŭk Anas hăng Kaip jing khua ngă yang prŏng hloh, hmâo boh pơhiăp Ơi Adai pơtrŭn kơ Yôhan ană đah rơkơi Sakari amăng tơdrŏn har. 
And he came into all the district round the Jordan, preaching [the] baptism of repentance for [the] remission of sins, @ Tui anŭn ñu nao tar ƀar tring jum dar ia krong Yurdan pơtô tơlơi ƀatem kơ tơlơi kơhmal tơlơi soh, kiăng hmâo tơlơi pap brơi. 
as it is written in [the] book of [the] words of Esaias the prophet: Voice of one crying in the wilderness: Prepare ye the way of [the] Lord, make straight his paths. @ Tui hăng tơlơi hmâo čih laih amăng hơdrôm hră pô laĭ lui hlâo Êsai:
“Hmâo asăp mơnuih ur kraih amăng tơdrŏn har,
Rơmet bĕ jơlan kơ Khua Yang, pơtơpă bĕ jơlan Ñu.
Every gorge shall be filled up, and every mountain and hill shall be brought low, and the crooked [places] shall become a straight [path], and the rough places smooth ways, @ Abih bang đŭng klŭng khŏm pơbă hĭ,
Abih bang čư̆ hăng bol čư̆ khŏm ngă mơdơ̆ hĭ,
Jơlan wĕ wŏ khŏm ngă tơpă glaĭ,
Jơlan klŭng hŭp khŏm jing lŏn daŏ;
and all flesh shall see the salvation of God. @ Laih anŭn abih bang kơnŭng djuai mơnuih či ƀuh tơlơi pơklaih Ơi Adai.”
He said therefore to the crowds which went out to be baptised by him, Offspring of vipers, who has forewarned you to flee from the coming wrath? @  Tui anŭn Yôhan laĭ kơ ƀing mơnuih lu rai kiăng tŭ tơlơi ñu ngă ƀatem: “Ơ ƀing djuai ala tơpơ̆ng, hlơi laĭ brơi kơ ƀing gih thâo đuaĭ mơ̆ng tơlơi Ơi Adai hil či truh? 
Produce therefore fruits worthy of repentance; and begin not to say in yourselves, We have Abraham for [our] father, for I say unto you that God is able of these stones to raise up children to Abraham. @ Brơi ƀing gih mơboh năng lăp hăng tơlơi ƀing gih kơhmal tơlơi soh, laih anŭn anăm čơdơ̆ng laĭ ôh kơ ƀing gih pô: ‘Gơmơi hmâo Abraham jing ơi adon gơmơi,’ yua kơ kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, Ơi Adai dưi ngă brơi khul boh pơtâo anai jing hĭ ană tơčo Abraham. 
And already also the axe is applied to the root of the trees; every tree therefore not producing good fruit is cut down and cast into [the] fire. @ Ră anai jong Ơi Adai hmâo dưm laih ƀơi akha kơyâo; abih bang kơyâo ƀu mơboh boh hiam ôh Ơi Adai či drom hĭ hăng glŏm amăng apui.”
And the crowds asked him saying, What should we do then? @ Ƀing ană plei tơña kơ ñu: “Tui anŭn hơgĕt gơmơi khŏm ngă lĕ?”
And he answering says to them, He that has two body-coats, let him give to him that has none; and he that has food, let him do likewise. @ Ñu laĭ glaĭ: “Hlơi pô hmâo dua blah ao, brơi ñu pha brơi kơ pô ƀu hmâo ôh; laih anŭn hlơi pô hmâo mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă, brơi ñu ngă kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n.”
And tax-gatherers came also to be baptised, and they said to him, Teacher, what should we do? @  Ăt hmâo mơ̆n ƀing ring jia rai kiăng tŭ ƀatem, laih anŭn gơñu tơña kơ Yôhan: “Ơ nai, hơgĕt gơmơi khŏm ngă lĕ?”
And he said to them, Take no more [money] than what is appointed to you. @ Ñu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Anăm ring ôh rơgao hloh kơ nua arăng pơkơčah laih kơ ƀing gih.”
And persons engaged in military service also asked him saying, And we, what should we do? And he said to them, Oppress no one, nor accuse falsely, and be satisfied with your pay. @ Ƀing tơhan ăt tơña kar kaĭ mơ̆n: “Bơ gơmơi, hơgĕt gơmơi khŏm ngă lĕ?”
Ñu laĭ glaĭ: “Anăm pơhwĭ arăng, ƀôdah pơčeh ƀlor kiăng plah mă prăk arăng ôh, samơ̆ brơi ƀing gih mơak bĕ hăng prăk blan ƀing gih hmâo.”
But as the people were in expectation, and all were reasoning in their hearts concerning John whether *he* might be the Christ, @ Tơdang ƀing ană plei dŏ kơčăng tơguan laih anŭn tơña amăng pran jua gơñu: “Djơ̆ mơ̆ Yôhan jing Yang Krist?” 
John answered all, saying, *I* indeed baptise you with water, but the mightier than I is coming, the thong of whose sandals I am not fit to unloose; *he* shall baptise you with [the] Holy Spirit and fire; @ Hnŭn yơh, Yôhan laĭ glaĭ kơ abih bang gơñu: “Kâo ngă ƀatem kơ ƀing gih hăng ia, samơ̆ Pô mơyang hloh kơ kâo či rai, laih anŭn kâo ƀu lăp ôh kleh hrĕ klĭ juă Ñu. Ñu či ngă ƀatem kơ ƀing gih hăng Yang Bơngăt Hiam laih anŭn hăng apui. 
whose winnowing-fan is in his hand, and he will thoroughly purge his threshing-floor, and will gather the wheat into his garner, but the chaff he will burn with fire unquenchable. @ Ñu djă čơngua kiăng pơi pơrơgoh anih prăh pơdai ñu, laih anŭn pơƀŭt pơdai amăng atông, samơ̆ Ñu či čuh hĭ hơkam amăng apui ƀu thâo thăm ôh.”
Exhorting then many other things also he announced [his] glad tidings to the people. @ Hăng lu mơta tơlơi pơtô pơđur pơkŏn, Yôhan pơtô Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam kơ ƀing ană plei pla. 
But Herod the tetrarch, being reproved by him as to Herodias, the wife of his brother, and as to all the wicked things which Herod had done, @ Samơ̆ Yôhan ƀuah kơ Hêrôt, pơtao wai lăng, yua kơ tơlơi ñu mă dŏ HʼHêrôđias bơnai adơi ñu, laih anŭn yua kơ abih bang tơlơi sat ñu hmâo ngă laih, 
added this also to all [the rest], that he shut up John in prison. @ thim kơ khul tơlơi soh anŭn dơ̆ng, ñu mă krư̆ Yôhan amăng sang mơnă.
And it came to pass, all the people having been baptised, and Jesus having been baptised and praying, that the heaven was opened, @ Tơ giơ̆ng abih bang mơnuih tŭ ƀatem laih, Yêsu ăt tŭ ƀatem mơ̆n. Hlăk Yêsu dŏ iâu laĭ, adai pŏk hĭ, 
and the Holy Spirit descended in a bodily form as a dove upon him; and a voice came out of heaven, *Thou* art my beloved Son, in thee I have found my delight. @ laih anŭn Yang Bơngăt Hiam trŭn rai amăng rup hrup hăng čĭm bơrơgơ̆m găm ƀơi Ñu; laih anŭn hmâo asăp pơhiăp mơ̆ng adai laĭ: “Ih jing Ană Kâo khăp hơeng biă mă; amăng Ih Kâo hmâo tơlơi mơak biă mă.”
And Jesus himself was beginning to be about thirty years old; being as was supposed son of Joseph; of Eli, @ Năng ai Yêsu hmâo klâo pluh thŭn hlăk Ñu čơdơ̆ng mă bruă. Tui arăng pơmĭn, Ñu jing ană đah rơkơi Yôsep; Yôsep jing ană đah rơkơi Hêli. 
of Matthat, of Levi, of Melchi, of Janna, of Joseph, @ Hêli jing ană đah rơkơi Mathat, Mathat jing ană đah rơkơi Lêwi, Lêwi jing ană đah rơkơi Melki, Melki jing ană đah rơkơi Yanai, Yanai jing ană đah rơkơi Yôsep. 
of Mattathias, of Amos, of Naoum, of Esli, of Naggai, @ Yôsep jing ană đah rơkơi Matathias, Matathias jing ană đah rơkơi Amôs, Amôs jing ană đah rơkơi Nahum, Nahum jing ană đah rơkơi Êsli, Êsli jing ană đah rơkơi Nagai; 
of Maath, of Mattathias, of Semei, of Joseph, of Juda, @ Nagai jing ană đah rơkơi Math, Math jing ană đah rơkơi Matathias, Matathias jing ană đah rơkơi Sêmêin, Sêmêin jing ană đah rơkơi Yôsek, Yôsek jing ană đah rơkơi Yôda. 
of Joannes, of Resa, of Zorobabel, of Salathiel, of Neri, @ Yôda jing ană đah rơkơi Yôanan, Yôanan jing ană đah rơkơi Rêsa, Rêsa jing ană đah rơkơi Sôrôbabel, Sôrôbabel jing ană đah rơkơi Sêaltiêl, Sêaltiêl jing ană đah rơkơi Nêri. 
of Melchi, of Addi, of Cosam, of Elmodam, of Er, @ Nêri jing ană đah rơkơi Melki, Melki jing ană đah rơkơi Adi, Adi jing ană đah rơkơi Kôsam, Kôsam jing ană đah rơkơi Êlmadam, Êlmadam jing ană đah rơkơi Er. 
of Joses, of Eliezer, of Joreim, of Matthat, of Levi, @ Er jing ană đah rơkơi Yôsuê, Yôsuê jing ană đah rơkơi Êliêser, Êliêser jing ană đah rơkơi Yôrim, Yôrim jing ană đah rơkơi Mathat, Mathat jing ană đah rơkơi Lêwi. 
of Simeon, of Juda, of Joseph, of Jonan, of Eliakim, @ Lêwi jing ană đah rơkơi Simêôn, Simêôn jing ană đah rơkơi Yuđa, Yuđa jing ană đah rơkơi Yôsep, Yôsep jing ană đah rơkơi Yônam, Yônam jing ană đah rơkơi Êliakim. Êliakim jing ană đah rơkơi Mêlêa. 
of Meleas, of Menan, of Mattatha, of Nathan, of David, @ Mêlêa jing ană đah rơkơi Mêna, Mêna jing ană đah rơkơi Matatha, Matatha jing ană đah rơkơi Nathan, Nathan jing ană đah rơkơi Đawit. 
of Jesse, of Obed, of Booz, of Salmon, of Naasson, @ Đawit jing ană đah rơkơi Yêsê, Yêsê jing ană đah rơkơi Ôbet, Ôbet jing ană đah rơkơi Bôas, Bôas jing ană đah rơkơi Salmôn, Salmôn jing ană đah rơkơi Nahsôn. 
of Aminadab, of Aram, of Esrom, of Phares, of Juda, @ Nahsôn jing ană đah rơkơi Aminadap, Aminadap jing ană đah rơkơi Atmin, Atmin jing ană đah rơkơi Arni, Arni jing ană đah rơkơi Hêsrôn, Hêsrôn jing ană đah rơkơi Parês, Parês jing ană đah rơkơi Yuđa, 
of Jacob, of Isaac, of Abraham, of Terah, of Nachor, @ Yuđa jing ană đah rơkơi Yakôp, Yakôp jing ană đah rơkơi Isak, Isak jing ană đah rơkơi Abraham, Abraham jing ană đah rơkơi Têra, Têra jing ană đah rơkơi Nakôr, 
of Seruch, of Ragau, of Phalek, of Eber, of Sala, @ Nakôr jing ană đah rơkơi Sêruk, Sêruk jing ană đah rơkơi Rêu, Rêu jing ană đah rơkơi Pêlek, Pêlek jing ană đah rơkơi Êber, Êber jing ană đah rơkơi Sêlah. 
of Cainan, of Arphaxad, of Sem, of Noe, of Lamech, @ Sêlah jing ană đah rơkơi Kainan, Kainan jing ană đah rơkơi Arpaksat, Arpaksat jing ană đah rơkơi Sem, Sem jing ană đah rơkơi Nôê, Nôê jing ană đah rơkơi Lamek, 
of Methusala, of Enoch, of Jared, of Maleleel, of Cainan, @ Lamek jing ană đah rơkơi Mêthusêla, Mêthusêla jing ană đah rơkơi Ênok, Ênok jing ană đah rơkơi Yared, Yared jing ană đah rơkơi Mahalalel, Mahalalel jing ană đah rơkơi Kainan. 
of Enos, of Seth, of Adam, of God. @ Kainan jing ană đah rơkơi Enôs, Enôs jing ană đah rơkơi Seth, Seth jing ană đah rơkơi Ađam, Ađam jing ană đah rơkơi Ơi Adai.
But Jesus, full of [the] Holy Spirit, returned from the Jordan, and was led by the Spirit in the wilderness @ Yêsu bă blai Yang Bơngăt Hiam, mơ̆ng ia krong Yurdan Ñu wơ̆t glaĭ, laih anŭn Yang Bơngăt Hiam atăt ba Ñu amăng tơdrŏn har. 
forty days, tempted of the devil; and in those days he did not eat anything, and when they were finished he hungered. @ Pơ anŭn Ñu tŭ tơlơi yang sat plư amăng pă pluh hrơi. Ñu ƀu ƀơ̆ng huă ôh amăng pă pluh hrơi anŭn, laih anŭn tơ khul hrơi anŭn rơgao laih Ñu rơpa.
And the devil said to him, If thou be Son of God, speak to this stone, that it become bread. @ Yang sat laĭ Ñu: “Tơdah Ih jing Ană Ơi Adai pơđar bĕ boh pơtâo anai blih jing hĭ ƀañ tơpŭng!”
And Jesus answered unto him saying, It is written, Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word of God. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Hră Ơi Adai hmâo čih laih tui anai: ‘Mơnuih hơdip ƀu djơ̆ kơnơ̆ng yua kơ ƀơ̆ng ƀañ tơpŭng đôč ôh.’”
And [the devil], leading him up into a high mountain, shewed him all the kingdoms of the habitable world in a moment of time. @ Yang sat atăt ba Ñu pơ anih hăng glong, kơčrâo brơi Ñu ƀiă mơnĭt abih bang dêh čar pơtao ƀơi lŏn tơnah, 
And the devil said to him, I will give thee all this power, and their glory; for it is given up to me, and to whomsoever I will I give it. @ laih anŭn yang sat laĭ kơ Ñu: “Kâo či brơi kơ ih abih bang tơlơi dưi laih anŭn tơlơi guh kơang abih bang lŏn čar pơtao anai, yua kơ arăng hmâo jao brơi laih kơ kâo, laih anŭn kâo brơi kơ hlơi pô kâo kiăng. 
If therefore *thou* wilt do homage before me, all [of it] shall be thine. @ Tui anŭn tơdah ih bon kơkuh pơpŭ kơ kâo, abih mơnơ̆ng anŭn či lơ̆m kơ ih yơh.”
And Jesus answering him said, It is written, Thou shalt do homage to [the] Lord thy God, and him alone shalt thou serve. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp hmâo čih laih tui anai: ‘Brơi Ih khŏm kơkuh pơpŭ kơ Khua Yang Ơi Adai ih, laih anŭn kơnơ̆ng mă bruă kơ hơjăn Ñu đôč.’”
And he led him to Jerusalem, and set him on the edge of the temple, and said to him, If thou be Son of God, cast thyself down hence; @ Yang sat atăt ba Ñu pơ plei Yêrusalem dơ̆ng, brơi Ñu dŏ ƀơi hăng ngŏ gor bơbŭng sang kơkuh pơpŭ, laih anŭn laĭ kơ Ñu: “Tơdah Ih jing Ană Ơi Adai, kơdâo trŭn bĕ mơ̆ng anih anai; 
for it is written, He shall give charge to his angels concerning thee to keep thee; @ Yua kơ Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp hmâo čih laih tui anai:
‘Ơi Adai či brơi ƀing ling jang Ñu wai lăng ih,’
and on [their] hands shall they bear thee, lest in any wise thou strike thy foot against a stone. @ laih anŭn ‘Gơñu či pŭ mă ih amăng tơngan gơñu, hwĭ dah tơkai ih tơhnač djơ̆ boh pơtâo!’”
And Jesus answering said to him, It is said, Thou shalt not tempt [the] Lord thy God. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp hmâo čih mơ̆n: ‘Ih anăm lông lăng Khua Yang Ơi Adai ih ôh.’”
And the devil, having completed every temptation, departed from him for a time. @ Giơ̆ng ñu plư hăng abih tơlơi anŭn, yang sat đuaĭ hĭ mơ̆ng Yêsu, dŏ tơguan mông gal pơkŏn dơ̆ng.
And Jesus returned in the power of the Spirit to Galilee; and a rumour went out into the whole surrounding country about him; @ Yêsu bă hăng tơlơi dưi mơyang Yang Bơngăt Hiam, wơ̆t glaĭ pơ čar Galilê, laih anŭn arăng hmư̆ hing Ñu tar ƀar tring jum dar. 
and *he* taught in their synagogues, being glorified of all. @ Ñu pơtô lu amăng sang bơjơnum, laih anŭn abih bang mơnuih pơpŭ bơni kơ Ñu.
And he came to Nazareth, where he was brought up; and he entered, according to his custom, into the synagogue on the sabbath day, and stood up to read. @ Yêsu truh pơ Plei Nasaret, anih arăng răk rong Ñu, laih anŭn tui hăng tơlơi Ñu juăt ngă, hrơi Saƀat Ñu mŭt amăng sang bơjơnum. Ñu tơgŭ kiăng đŏk hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp. 
And [the] book of the prophet Esaias was given to him; and having unrolled the book he found the place where it was written, @ Arăng brơi kơ Ñu hơdrôm hră pô laĭ lui hlâo Êsai. Ñu pŏk hơdrôm hră anŭn, ƀuh anih hmâo tơlơi čih tui anai:
[The] Spirit of [the] Lord is upon me, because he has anointed me to preach glad tidings to [the] poor; he has sent me to preach to captives deliverance, and to [the] blind sight, to send forth [the] crushed delivered, @ “Yang Bơngăt Hiam Khua Yang dŏ ƀơi Kâo,
Yua kơ Ñu hmâo truač laih ia jâu kơ Kâo, Kiăng Kâo pơhaih Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam kơ ƀing ƀun rin.
to preach [the] acceptable year of [the] Lord. @ Ñu pơkiaŏ Kâo nao pơhaih tơlơi pŏk rơngai brơi kơ ƀing mơnă,
Ƀing bum mơta dưi ƀuh rơđah,
Ƀing arăng kơtư̆ juă dưi hmâo tơlơi rơngai.
Laih anŭn pơhaih thŭn Khua Yang či pơklaih ƀing ană plei pla Ñu.”
And having rolled up the book, when he had delivered it up to the attendant, he sat down; and the eyes of all in the synagogue were fixed upon him. @ Giơ̆ng tơlơi anŭn, Yêsu lom hĭ hơdrôm hră, brơi glaĭ kơ pô wai laih anŭn dŏ ber. Abih bang ƀing dŏ amăng sang bơjơnum dŏ lăng kơ Ñu soh sel. 
And he began to say to them, To-day this scripture is fulfilled in your ears. @ Laih anŭn Ñu čơdơ̆ng laĭ hăng ƀing anŭn: “Hrơi anai Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp ƀing gih hmư̆ anai hmâo krĕp djơ̆ laih.”
And all bore witness to him, and wondered at the words of grace which were coming out of his mouth. And they said, Is not this the son of Joseph? @ Abih bang pơhaih Ñu jing hiam, laih anŭn hling hlang kơ tơlơi boh pơhiăp bă hăng tơlơi khăp pap tơbiă mơ̆ng amăng bah Ñu; laih anŭn ƀing gơñu laĭ: “Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă Ñu jing ană đah rơkơi Yôsep?”
And he said to them, Ye will surely say to me this parable, Physician, heal thyself; whatsoever we have heard has taken place in Capernaum do here also in thine own country. @ Yêsu laĭ: “Sĭt yơh ƀing gih či laĭ kơ Kâo tơlơi raŏ anai: ‘Ơ ơi ia jrao, pơsuaih bĕ ih pô; kar kaĭ mơ̆n ngă ƀơi anai amăng plei ih pô abih tơlơi gơmơi hmư̆ ih hmâo ngă laih pơ plei Kapernum.’” 
And he said, Verily I say to you, that no prophet is acceptable in his [own] country. @ Ñu laĭ dơ̆ng: “Sĭt biă mă Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih ƀu hmâo ôh sa čô pô laĭ lui hlâo hmâo tơlơi tŭ jum hiam amăng plei ñu pô. 
But of a truth I say to you, There were many widows in Israel in the days of Elias, when the heaven was shut up for three years and six months, so that a great famine came upon all the land, @ Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih sĭt biă mă, rơnŭk Êli amăng čar Israel hmâo lu ƀing đah kơmơi djai rơkơi, tơdang adai khong klâo thŭn ha mơkrah, hmâo tơlơi ư̆ rơpa prŏng truh kơ abih tring. 
and to none of them was Elias sent but to Sarepta of Sidonia, to a woman [that was] a widow. @ Samơ̆ Ơi Adai ƀu pơkiaŏ nao ôh Êli kơ sa čô amăng ƀing gơñu, kơnơ̆ng kơ sa čô đah kơmơi djai rơkơi pơ plei Sarepta amăng čar Sidôn đôč. 
And there were many lepers in Israel in the time of Elisha the prophet, and none of them was cleansed but Naaman the Syrian. @ Amăng rơnŭk pô laĭ lui hlâo Êlisê amăng čar Israel ăt hmâo lu mơnuih djơ̆ phŭng mơ̆n, samơ̆ ƀu hmâo ôh sa čô amăng ƀing gơñu dưi hmâo tơlơi rơgoh, kơnơ̆ng hơjan Naman čar Siri đôč.”
