And they were all filled with rage in the synagogue, hearing these things; @ Giơ̆ng kơ hmư̆ tơlơi anŭn, abih bang ƀing amăng sang bơjơnum bă hăng tơlơi hil biă mă. 
and rising up they cast him forth out of the city, and led him up to the brow of the mountain upon which their city was built, so that they might throw him down the precipice; @ Gơñu tơgŭ, dui tơbiă Yêsu pơ gah rơngiao plei, ba Ñu pơ akŏ čư̆ ƀơi anih arăng pơdơ̆ng plei, kiăng glŏm trŭn Ñu. 
but *he*, passing through the midst of them, went his way, @ Samơ̆ Yêsu găn tơ̆ng krah gơñu hăng đuaĭ nao.
and descended to Capernaum, a city of Galilee, and taught them on the sabbaths. @ Yêsu trŭn nao pơ Plei Kapernum, amăng tring Galilê, laih anŭn Ñu pơtô kơ ƀing gơñu amăng hrơi Saƀat. 
And they were astonished at his doctrine, for his word was with authority. @ Gơñu hling hlang kơ tơlơi Yêsu pơtô, yua kơ boh pơhiăp Ñu bă hăng tơlơi dưi kơhưm. 
And there was in the synagogue a man having a spirit of an unclean demon, and he cried with a loud voice, @ Amăng sang bơjơnum hmâo sa čô đah rơkơi yang bơngăt grĭ hơƀak dŏ amăng ñu; laih anŭn ñu ur kraih kơtang, 
saying, Eh! what have we to do with thee, Jesus, Nazarene? hast thou come to destroy us? I know thee who thou art, the Holy [One] of God. @ “Hơi! Hơgĕt tơlơi hmâo gơmơi hăng Ih, Ơ Yêsu plei Nasaret? Ih rai kiăng pơrai gơmơi hă? Kâo thâo hlơi Ih jing, Ih Pô rơgoh hiam mơ̆ng Ơi Adai!”
And Jesus rebuked him, saying, Hold thy peace, and come out from him. And the demon, having thrown him down into the midst, came out from him without doing him any injury. @ Samơ̆ Yêsu khă ƀuah yang sat anŭn hăng laĭ: “Dŏ rơiăt laih anŭn tơbiă bĕ mơ̆ng mơnuih anai!” Giơ̆ng yang sat pơrơbuh ñu tơ̆ng krah mơnuih lu, laih anŭn yang sat tơbiă đuaĭ mơ̆ng ñu samơ̆ ƀu hmâo sa mơta ngă răm kơ ñu ôh.
And astonishment came upon all, and they spoke to one another, saying, What word [is] this? for with authority and power he commands the unclean spirits, and they come out. @ Abih bang gơñu hling hlang laih anŭn hăng bơlaĭ tơdruă gơñu: “Hơgĕt Boh Pơhiăp anai? Yua kơ hăng tơlơi dưi kơhưm laih anŭn tơlơi mơyang pơtă kơ ƀing yang bơngăt grĭ hơƀak, laih anŭn gơñu khŏm tơbiă mơ̆n.” 
And a rumour went out into every place of the country round concerning him. @ Arăng hmư̆ hing kơ Ñu tar ƀar anih jum dar.
And rising up out of the synagogue, he entered into the house of Simon. But Simon's mother-in-law was suffering under a bad fever; and they asked him for her. @ Yêsu tơbiă mơ̆ng sang bơjơnum laih anŭn mŭt amăng sang Simôn. Tơhmua đah kơmơi Simôn hmâo tơlơi duăm pơgrŭn kraih, laih anŭn gơñu rơkâo kơ Yêsu pơsuaih brơi kơ ñu. 
And standing over her, he rebuked the fever, and it left her; and forthwith standing up she served them. @ Yêsu dŏ dơ̆ng jĕ ñu, pơđar tơlơi duăm pơgrŭn laih anŭn tơlơi duăm pơgrŭn đuaĭ mơ̆ng ñu. Tañ mơtam ñu tơgŭ laih anŭn buih bruă kơ gơñu.
And when the sun went down, all, as many as had persons sick with divers diseases, brought them to him, and having laid his hands on every one of them, he healed them; @ Tơ yang hrơi lĕ laih, arăng ba abih bang ƀing mơnuih hmâo tơlơi ruă phara phara nao pơ Yêsu. Yêsu ah tơngan ƀơi rĭm čô laih anŭn pơsuaih gơñu. 
and demons also went out from many, crying out and saying, *Thou* art the Son of God. And rebuking them, he suffered them not to speak, because they knew him to be the Christ. @ Ƀing yang sat ăt tơbiă mơ̆ng lu mơnuih laih anŭn ur kraih: “Ih jing Ană Ơi Adai!” Samơ̆ Yêsu khă ƀuah ƀing yang sat, laih anŭn ƀu brơi gơñu pơhiăp ôh, yua kơ gơñu thâo krăn Yêsu jing Yang Krist.
And when it was day he went out, and went into a desert place, and the crowds sought after him, and came up to him, and [would have] kept him back that he should not go from them. @ Tơ yang hrơi tơbiă, Yêsu nao pơ anih hơđơ̆ng rơiăt. Ƀing ană plei pla hơduah Yêsu laih anŭn tơ gơñu truh pơ Ñu, gơñu kiăng kơ̆ng Yêsu ƀu brơi Ñu đuaĭ mơ̆ng gơñu ôh. 
But he said to them, I must needs announce the glad tidings of the kingdom of God to the other cities also, for for this I have been sent forth. @ Samơ̆ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Kâo khŏm pơhaih Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam kơ Dêh Čar Pơtao Ơi Adai kơ lu boh plei pơkŏn dơ̆ng, yua kơ tơlơi anŭn yơh Ơi Adai hmâo pơkiaŏ rai Kâo.”
And he was preaching in the synagogues of Galilee. @ Tui anŭn Ñu dŏ pơtô amăng sang bơjơnum amăng tring Yuđa.
And it came to pass, as the crowd pressed on him to hear the word of God, that he was standing by the lake of Gennesaret: @ Tơdang Yêsu dŏ ƀơi hang ia dơnao Gênêsaret, ƀing ană plei pla pơčer pơrơsua nao giăm Yêsu kiăng hmư̆ tơlơi Ơi Adai pơhiăp. 
and he saw two ships standing by the lake, but the fishermen, having come down from them, were washing their nets. @ Yêsu ƀuh dua boh sŏng dŏ jĕ ƀơi hang ia, ƀing trah akan tơbiă laih mơ̆ng sŏng laih anŭn hlăk dŏ boh hơñual gơñu. 
And getting into one of the ships, which was Simon's, he asked him to draw out a little from the land; and he sat down and taught the crowds out of the ship. @ Yêsu đĭ sa amăng dua boh sŏng, jing sŏng Simôn, laih anŭn rơkâo kơ ñu nao ataih ƀiă mơ̆ng hang. Yêsu dŏ ber amăng sŏng laih anŭn pơtô kơ ƀing ană plei pla.
But when he ceased speaking, he said to Simon, Draw out into the deep [water] and let down your nets for a haul. @ Giơ̆ng Ñu pơtô laih, Ñu laĭ kơ Simôn: “Nao bĕ pơ anih ia dlam hăng dăng bĕ hơñual ih.”
And Simon answering said to him, Master, having laboured through the whole night we have taken nothing, but at thy word I will let down the net. @ Simôn laĭ glaĭ: “Ơ Nai, gơmơi dăng laih abih mlam samơ̆ ƀu hmâo akan ôh! Samơ̆ kiăng gưt hiăp Ih, kâo či dăng hơñual dơ̆ng.” 
And having done this, they enclosed a great multitude of fishes. And their net broke. @ Laih gơñu dăng, hơñual gơñu djơ̆ akan lu biă mă tơl hơñual gơñu tơĭ. 
And they beckoned to their partners who were in the other ship to come and help them, and they came, and filled both the ships, so that they were sinking. @ Gơñu wơ̆t tơngan kơ ƀing gơ̆p gơñu đĭ amăng sŏng pơkŏn rai djru gơñu. Ƀing anŭn rai laih anŭn akan bă abih dua boh sŏng, tơl giăm či trăm amăng ia. 
But Simon Peter, seeing it, fell at Jesus' knees, saying, Depart from me, for I am a sinful man, Lord. @ Tơ Simôn Pêtrôs ƀuh tơlơi anŭn ñu bon ƀơi tơkai Yêsu laih anŭn laĭ: “Ơ Khua Yang, đuaĭ bĕ mơ̆ng kâo, yua kơ kâo jing sa čô mơnuih soh.”
For astonishment had laid hold on him, and on all those who were with him, at the haul of fishes which they had taken; @ Yua kơ Simôn wơ̆t hăng abih bang ƀing hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ñu hling hlang kơ tơlơi gơñu hmâo akan lu anŭn. 
and in like manner also on James and John, sons of Zebedee, who were partners with Simon. And Jesus said to Simon, Fear not; henceforth thou shalt be catching men. @ Wơ̆t Yakơ laih anŭn Yôhan, ƀing ană đah rơkơi Sêbêdê gơ̆p mă bruă hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Simôn hling hlang kar kaĭ mơ̆n. Yêsu laĭ kơ Simôn: “Anăm hwĭ ôh; mơ̆ng anai pơ anăp ih či jing mơnuih trah mơnuih.”
And having run the ships on shore, leaving all they followed him. @ Tơ gơñu waih sŏng truh pơ hang, gơñu lui hĭ abih bang mơnơ̆ng laih anŭn đuaĭ tui Yêsu.
And it came to pass as he was in one of the cities, that behold, there was a man full of leprosy, and seeing Jesus, falling upon his face, he besought him saying, Lord, if thou wilt, thou art able to cleanse me. @ Tơdang Yêsu dŏ amăng sa boh plei, hmâo sa čô mơnuih djơ̆ phŭng rơka bă drơi jan. Tơ ñu ƀuh Yêsu, ñu kŭp ƀô̆ ƀơi lŏn laih anŭn kơwưh kơ Ñu: “Ơ Khua Yang, tơdah Ih kiăng, Ih dưi pơrơgoh kâo!”
And stretching forth his hand he touched him, saying, I will; be thou cleansed: and immediately the leprosy departed from him. @ Yêsu yơr tơngan ruaih gơ̆ laih anŭn laĭ: “Kâo kiăng yơh, rơgoh bĕ!” Tañ mơtam phŭng ñu rơngiă hĭ. 
And he enjoined him to tell no one; but go, shew thyself to the priest, and offer for thy cleansing as Moses ordained, for a testimony to them. @ Laih anŭn Yêsu pơtă kơ ñu anăm ră ruai kơ arăng ôh, samơ̆ “Nao pơdah ih pô kơ khua ngă yang bĕ laih anŭn pơyơr mơnơ̆ng ngă yang kơ tơlơi pơrơgoh tui hăng Môis pơtă laih, jing tơlơi gơ̆ng jơlan pơsĭt kơ ƀing ană plei pla.”
But the report concerning him was spread abroad still more, and great crowds came together to hear, and to be healed from their infirmities. @ Arăng hmư̆ hing kơ Yêsu jai lu hloh dơ̆ng, laih anŭn hmâo lu mơnuih pơƀŭt glaĭ kiăng hmư̆ Ñu pơtô laih anŭn kiăng dưi suaih mơ̆ng tơlơi ruă duăm. 
And *he* withdrew himself, and was about in the desert [places] and praying. @ Samơ̆ Yêsu đuaĭ pơ anih hơđơ̆ng rơiăt kiăng iâu laĭ.
And it came to pass on one of the days, that *he* was teaching, and there were Pharisees and doctors of the law sitting by, who were come out of every village of Galilee and Judaea and [out of] Jerusalem; and [the] Lord's power was [there] to heal them. @ Sa hrơi anŭn, tơdang Yêsu dŏ pơtô hmâo ƀing Pharisi hăng ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt dŏ ber giăm Ñu. Gơñu rai mơ̆ng rĭm boh plei amăng čar Galilê, čar Yuđa, laih anŭn mơ̆ng plei Yêrusalem. Tơlơi dưi mơyang Khua Yang dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Ñu kiăng pơsuaih tơlơi duăm ruă. 
And lo, men bringing upon a couch a man who was paralysed; and they sought to bring him in, and put [him] before him. @ Anai nê, hmâo ƀing mơnuih čơkung ba sa čô mơnuih đah rơkơi rơwen hăng sưng pĭt; gơñu hơduah jơlan kiăng ba ñu amăng sang laih anŭn dưm gơ̆ ƀơi anăp Yêsu. 
And not finding what way to bring him in, on account of the crowd, going up on the housetop they let him down through the tiles, with his little couch, into the midst before Jesus. @ Samơ̆ ƀing gơñu ƀu hmâo jơlan dưi ba mŭt ñu ôh yua kơ mơnuih lu đơi. Tui anŭn gơñu đĭ ƀơi bơbŭng sang laih anŭn pŏk hĭ goč, gơñu pơañreng trŭn gơ̆ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng sưng ñu djơ̆ ƀơi anăp Yêsu tơ̆ng krah ƀing mơnuih lu. 
And seeing their faith, he said, Man, thy sins are forgiven thee. @ Tơ Yêsu ƀuh tơlơi đaŏ gơñu, Yêsu laĭ: “Ơ gơyut, tơlơi soh ih hmâo tơlơi pap brơi laih.”
And the scribes and the Pharisees began to reason [in their minds], saying, Who is this who speaks blasphemies? Who is able to forgive sins but God alone? @ Ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt hăng ƀing Pharisi čơdơ̆ng pơhiăp tơdruă gơñu: “Hlơi pô anai, khĭn pơhiăp pơgao hmiah hăng Ơi Adai? Hlơi pô dưi pap brơi tơlơi soh, kơnơ̆ng hơjăn Ơi Adai đôč?”
But Jesus, knowing their reasonings, answering said to them, Why reason ye in your hearts? @ Samơ̆ Yêsu thâo laih tơlơi gơñu pơmĭn, Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Yua hơgĕt ƀing gih tơña amăng pran jua ƀing gih? 
which is easier, to say, Thy sins are forgiven thee; or to say, Rise up and walk? @ Hơgĕt tơlơi laĭ amuñ hloh: ‘Tơlơi soh ih hmâo pap brơi laih,’ ƀôdah laĭ: ‘Tơgŭ laih anŭn rơbat bĕ?’ 
But that ye may know that the Son of man has power on earth to forgive sins, he said to the paralysed man, I say to thee, Arise, and take up thy little couch and go to thine house. @ Samơ̆ kiăng kơ ƀing gih thâo ƀơi lŏn tơnah Ană Mơnuih hmâo tơlơi dưi pap brơi tơlơi soh” — Ñu laĭ kơ mơnuih rơwen — “Kâo laĭ kơ ih, tơgŭ bĕ, mă sưng pĭt ih laih anŭn glaĭ pơ sang!”
And immediately standing up before them, having taken up that whereon he was laid, he departed to his house, glorifying God. @ Tañ mơtam ñu tơgŭ ƀơi anăp ƀing anŭn, mă sưng ñu hmâo đih laih, laih anŭn glaĭ pơ sang, pơpŭ bơni kơ Ơi Adai. 
And astonishment seized all, and they glorified God, and were filled with fear, saying, We have seen strange things to-day. @ Abih bang leng kơ hling hlang laih anŭn pơpŭ bơni hơơč kơ Ơi Adai. Gơñu bă hăng hwĭ laih anŭn laĭ: “Hrơi anai gơmơi hmâo ƀuh laih lu tơlơi hling hlang!”
And after these things he went forth and saw a tax-gatherer, Levi by name, sitting at the receipt of taxes, and said to him, Follow me. @ Giơ̆ng tơlơi anŭn Yêsu tơbiă laih anŭn ƀuh sa čô mơnuih ring jia, anăn gơ̆ Lêwi, dŏ ber ƀơi anih ring jia. Yêsu laĭ kơ ñu: “Đuaĭ tui Kâo bĕ!” 
And having left all, rising up, he followed him. @ Gơ̆ lui hĭ abih bang, tơgŭ laih anŭn đuaĭ tui Yêsu.
And Levi made a great entertainment for him in his house, and there was a great crowd of tax-gatherers and others who were at table with them. @ Lêwi pơkra tơlơi ƀơ̆ng huă prŏng jum Yêsu amăng sang ñu, laih anŭn hmâo lu ƀing ring jia laih anŭn ƀing mơnuih pơkŏn ƀơ̆ng huă hrŏm hơbĭt hăng gơñu. 
And their scribes and the Pharisees murmured at his disciples, saying, Why do ye eat and drink with tax-gatherers and sinners? @ Ƀing Pharisi laih anŭn ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt pơhiăp brŏk hăng ƀing ding kơna Yêsu hăng laĭ: “Hyư̆m ƀing gih dŏ ƀơ̆ng huă laih anŭn mơñum hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing ring jia laih anŭn ƀing mơnuih soh?”
And Jesus answering said to them, They that are in sound health have not need of a physician, but those that are ill. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ gơñu: “Ƀu djơ̆ ƀing mơnuih suaih prăl ôh kiăng kơ ơi ia jrao, samơ̆ ƀing mơnuih duăm ruă yơh. 
I am not come to call righteous [persons], but sinful [ones] to repentance. @ Kâo ƀu rai iâu ƀing mơnuih tơpă ôh, samơ̆ iâu ƀing mơnuih soh kơhmal tơlơi soh.”
And they said to him, Why do the disciples of John fast often and make supplications, in like manner those also of the Pharisees, but thine eat and drink? @ Ƀing anŭn laĭ kơ Ñu: “Ƀing ding kơna Yôhan nanao ư̆ ƀơ̆ng huă laih anŭn iâu laĭ, wơ̆t ƀing ding kơna ƀing Pharisi ngă tui anŭn mơ̆n, samơ̆ ƀing ding kơna ih ƀơ̆ng huă laih anŭn mơñum.”
And he said to them, Can ye make the sons of the bridechamber fast when the bridegroom is with them? @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Dưi mơ̆ ƀing gih ngă brơi ƀing arăng jak kơ tơlơi ƀơ̆ng huă dŏ rơkơi bơnai ư̆ ƀơ̆ng huă tơdang han tao ăt dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng gơñu? 
But days will come when also the bridegroom will have been taken away from them; then shall they fast in those days. @ Samơ̆ truh hrơi arăng ba pơđuaĭ hĭ han tao mơ̆ng ƀing gơñu, hlăk anŭn gơñu či ư̆ ƀơ̆ng huă.”
And he spoke also a parable to them: No one puts a piece of a new garment upon an old garment, otherwise he will both rend the new, and the piece which is from the new will not suit with the old. @ Yêsu ăt pơhiăp tơlơi bơhmutu kơ ƀing gơñu: “Arăng ƀu hek ôh sa pŏk bơnal mơ̆ng ao phrâo kiăng sĭt tĕp hăng ao so. Tơdah ngă tui anŭn, ao phrâo či tơĭ hĭ, laih anŭn bơnal phrâo ăt ƀu gal lăp hăng ao so ôh. 
And no one puts new wine into old skins, otherwise the new wine will burst the skins, and it will be poured out, and the skins will be destroyed; @ Laih anŭn arăng ƀu pioh ôh tơpai phrâo amăng get klĭ so, tơdah ngă tui anŭn tơpai phrâo či blôk pơčah klĭ so anŭn, tơpai či hŏk hĭ laih anŭn kơdŭng klĭ či răm mơ̆n. 
but new wine is to be put into new skins, and both are preserved. @ Samơ̆ arăng pioh tơpai phrâo amăng get klĭ phrâo. 
And no one having drunk old wine [straightway] wishes for new, for he says, The old is better. @ Laih anŭn arăng ƀu kiăng dơ̆ng ôh tơpai phrâo tơ laih arăng mơñum tơpai so, yua kơ ñu laĭ: ‘tơpai so hiam hloh.’”
And it came to pass on [the] second-first sabbath, that he went through cornfields, and his disciples were plucking the ears and eating [them], rubbing [them] in their hands. @ Sa hrơi Saƀat Yêsu găn hmua pơdai blê. Ƀing ding kơna Ñu ruač amŭng pơdai, pơpao hăng tơngan gơñu laih anŭn ƀơ̆ng. 
But some of the Pharisees said to them, Why do ye what is not lawful to do on the sabbath? @ Hmâo đơđa ƀing Pharisi laĭ: “Hyư̆m ƀing gih ngă tơlơi arăng ƀu dưi ngă ôh amăng hrơi Saƀat?”
And Jesus answering said to them, Have ye not read so much as this, what David did when he hungered, he and those who were with him, @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Ƀing gih aka đŏk ôh hă hơgĕt tơlơi Đawit hmâo ngă laih tơdang ñu hăng ƀing đuaĭ tui ñu rơpa? 
how he entered into the house of God and took the shewbread and ate, and gave to those also who were with him, which it is not lawful that [any] eat, unless the priests alone? @ Ñu mŭt amăng sang Ơi Adai, mă ƀơ̆ng ƀañ tơpŭng pơyơr kơ Ơi Adai, laih anŭn brơi kơ ƀing nao hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ñu ƀơ̆ng mơ̆n. Wơ̆t dah ƀañ tơpŭng anŭn kơnơ̆ng pioh brơi kơ ƀing khua ngă yang đôč dưi ƀơ̆ng.”
And he said to them, The Son of man is Lord of the sabbath also. @ Laih anŭn Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Ană Mơnuih jing Khua kơ hrơi Saƀat.”
And it came to pass on another sabbath also that he entered into the synagogue and taught; and there was a man there, and his right hand was withered. @ Sa hrơi Saƀat pơkŏn, Yêsu mŭt amăng sang bơjơnum laih anŭn pơtô laĭ. Pơ anŭn hmâo sa čô mơnuih tơngan gah hơnuă ñu jo. 
And the scribes and the Pharisees were watching if he would heal on the sabbath, that they might find something of which to accuse him. @ Ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt laih anŭn ƀing Pharisi krăp lăng sŭ Yêsu thâo dah Ñu či pơsuaih mơ̆ amăng hrơi Saƀat, kiăng kơ hmâo tơlơi phong kơ Ñu. 
But *he* knew their thoughts, and said to the man who had the withered hand, Get up, and stand in the midst. And having risen up he stood [there]. @ Samơ̆ Yêsu thâo tơlơi pơmĭn gơñu laih anŭn laĭ kơ mơnuih jo tơngan: “Rai dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơi anai.” Ñu tơgŭ hăng dŏ dơ̆ng pơ anŭn. 
Jesus therefore said to them, I will ask you if it is lawful on the sabbath to do good, or to do evil? to save life, or to destroy [it]? @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Kâo tơña ƀing gih: Hơgĕt tơlơi juăt tŭ ư brơi ƀing ta dưi ngă amăng hrơi Saƀat, ngă bruă hiam ƀôdah ngă bruă sat, pơklaih mơnuih ƀôdah pơdjai mơnuih?” 
And having looked around on them all, he said to him, Stretch out thy hand. And he did [so] and his hand was restored as the other. @ Yêsu lăng kơ abih bang ƀing jum dar laih anŭn laĭ kơ gơ̆: “Yơr tơngan ih bĕ.” Gơ̆ yơr, laih anŭn tơngan ñu suaih mơtam.
But *they* were filled with madness, and they spoke together among themselves what they should do to Jesus. @ Gơñu bă hăng tơlơi hil laih anŭn črŏng sai tơdruă gơñu kiăng sem hơgĕt tơlơi gơñu dưi ngă kơ Yêsu.
And it came to pass in those days that he went out into the mountain to pray, and he spent the night in prayer to God. @ Hlăk anŭn Yêsu tơbiă nao đĭ pơ čư̆ kiăng iâu laĭ, laih anŭn ñu dŏ iâu laĭ hăng Ơi Adai abih sa mlam. 
And when it was day he called his disciples, and having chosen out twelve from them, whom also he named apostles: @ Tơ mơguah hrơi tơdơi, Yêsu iâu ƀing ding kơna Ñu laih anŭn ruah mă pluh dua čô mơ̆ng ƀing gơñu. Kơ ƀing anŭn Ñu pia jing khua ding kơna: 
Simon, to whom also he gave the name of Peter, and Andrew his brother, [and] James and John, [and] Philip and Bartholomew, @ Simôn pô Ñu pơanăn dơ̆ng Pêtrôs, Andrê adơi Pêtrôs, Yakơ, Yôhan, Philip, Bartêlômi. 
[and] Matthew and Thomas, James the [son] of Alphaeus and Simon who was called Zealot, @ Mathiơ, Thômas, Yakơ ană đah rơkơi Alphê, Simôn arăng iâu dơ̆ng Sêlôt, 
[and] Judas [brother] of James, and Judas Iscariote, who was also [his] betrayer; @ Yudas ană Yakơ, laih anŭn Yudas Iskariôt jing pô pơblư̆ lui Yêsu.
and having descended with them, he stood on a level place, and a crowd of his disciples, and a great multitude of the people from all Judaea and Jerusalem, and the sea coast of Tyre and Sidon, who came to hear him, and to be healed of their diseases; @ Yêsu trŭn hrŏm hăng ƀing ding kơna Ñu laih anŭn dŏ ƀơi sa anih lŏn daŏ. Hmâo lu ƀing ding kơna Ñu laih anŭn ƀing ană plei pla mơ̆ng tar ƀar čar Yuđa, mơ̆ng plei Yêrusalem, laih anŭn mơ̆ng čar hang ia rơsĭ plei Tir hăng plei Sidôn. 
and those that were beset by unclean spirits were healed. @ Ƀing mơnuih yang bơngăt grĭ hơƀak ngă ăt dưi suaih mơ̆n. 
And all the crowd sought to touch him, for power went out from him and healed all. @ Abih bang mơnuih lu hơduah jơlan kiăng ruaih Ñu, yua kơ tơlơi dưi mơyang tơbiă mơ̆ng Ñu laih anŭn pơsuaih abih ƀing gơñu.
And *he*, lifting up his eyes upon his disciples, said, Blessed [are] ye poor, for yours is the kingdom of God. @ Yêsu lăng kơ ƀing ding kơna hăng laĭ:
“Mơyun hiam yơh kơ ƀing gih jing ƀing mơnuih ƀun rin,
Yua kơ Dêh Čar Pơtao Ơi Adai lơ̆m kơ ƀing gih.
Blessed ye that hunger now, for ye shall be filled. Blessed ye that weep now, for ye shall laugh. @ Mơyun hiam yơh kơ ƀing gih jing ƀing dŏ rơpa ră anai,
Yua kơ ƀing gih či trơi.
Mơyun hiam kơ ƀing gih jing ƀing dŏ čŏk hia ră anai,
Yua kơ ƀing gih či klao hơ̆k.
Blessed are ye when men shall hate you, and when they shall separate you [from them], and shall reproach [you], and cast out your name as wicked, for the Son of man's sake: @ Mơyun hiam yơh kơ ƀing gih tơdah yua kơ Ană Mơnuih; arăng bơrơmŭt kơ ƀing gih, arăng ƀu jum ƀing gih, hơtoh djraĭ ƀing gih, laih anŭn hơngah anăn ƀing gih kar hăng pô sat! 
rejoice in that day and leap for joy, for behold, your reward is great in the heaven, for after this manner did their fathers act toward the prophets. @ Amăng hrơi anŭn ƀing gih hơ̆k mơak bĕ hăng plŏng kơdăt, yua kơ pri apah kơ ƀing gih amăng adai prŏng biă mă; yua kơ ƀing ơi adon gơñu ăt ngă laih kơ ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n.
But woe to you rich, for ye have received your consolation. @ Samơ̆ tơnap tap yơh kơ ƀing gih jing ƀing pơdrŏng,
Yua kơ ƀing gih hmâo laih tơlơi pơalum.
Woe to you that are filled, for ye shall hunger. Woe to you who laugh now, for ye shall mourn and weep. @ Tơnap tap yơh kơ ƀing gih jing ƀing dŏ trơi ră anai,
Yua kơ ƀing gih či rơpa!
Tơnap tap yơh ƀing gih jing ƀing dŏ klao ră anai,
Yua kơ ƀing gih či kơ-ŭ rơngot laih anŭn čŏk hia!
Woe, when all men speak well of you, for after this manner did their fathers to the false prophets. @ Tơnap tap yơh kơ ƀing gih, tơ abih bang mơnuih pơhiăp bơni hiam kơ ƀing gih,
Yua kơ kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n ƀing ơi adon gơñu ngă kơ ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo ƀlor!”
But to you that hear I say, Love your enemies; do good to those that hate you; @ “Samơ̆ Kâo laĭ ƀing gih ƀing dŏ hmư̆, khăp bĕ ƀing ayăt kơ ƀing gih, ngă hiam bĕ kơ ƀing bơrơmŭt kơ ƀing gih. 
bless those that curse you; pray for those who use you despitefully. @ Hơơč mơyun bĕ tơlơi hiam kơ ƀing hơtơ̆m pah ƀing gih, laih anŭn iâu laĭ brơi bĕ kơ ƀing ngă sat kơ ƀing gih. 
To him that smites thee on the cheek, offer also the other; and from him that would take away thy garment, forbid not thy body-coat also. @ Tơdah arăng pah meng ƀing gih gah anai, brơi bĕ gơñu pah meng gah adih mơ̆n. Tơdah arăng mă ao phyung ih, brơi ñu mă wơ̆t ao amăng lăm mơ̆n. 
To every one that asks of thee, give; and from him that takes away what is thine, ask it not back. @ Pha brơi bĕ kơ hlơi pô rơkâo gơnam ih, laih anŭn anăm rơkâo glaĭ ôh gơnam ih mơ̆ng pô sua mă laih. 
And as ye wish that men should do to you, do *ye* also to them in like manner. @ Ƀing gih kiăng kơ arăng ngă brơi kơ ƀing gih hyư̆m pă, brơi ƀing gih ngă brơi kơ arăng kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n.
And if ye love those that love you, what thank is it to you? for even sinners love those that love them. @ Tơdah ƀing gih khăp kơ ƀing mơnuih khăp kơ ƀing gih, hơgĕt tơlơi mơyun hiam ƀing gih hmâo? Yua kơ ƀing soh ăt khăp kơ ƀing mơnuih khăp kơ gơñu mơ̆n. 
And if ye do good to those that do good to you, what thank is it to you? for even sinners do the same. @ Tơdah ƀing gih ngă hiam kơ ƀing ngă hiam kơ ƀing gih, hơgĕt tơlơi mơyun hiam ƀing gih hmâo? Yua kơ ƀing soh ăt ngă kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n. 
And if ye lend to those from whom ye hope to receive, what thank is it to you? [for] even sinners lend to sinners that they may receive the like. @ Tơdah ƀing gih kơnơ̆ng brơi čan kơ ƀing mơnuih ƀing gih čang rơmang gơñu brơi glaĭ, hơgĕt tơlơi mơyun hiam ƀing gih hmâo? Wơ̆t kơ ƀing soh ăt brơi mơ̆n kơ ƀing soh čan, kiăng kơ dưi tŭ glaĭ djŏp mrô hơđăp. 
But love your enemies, and do good, and lend, hoping for nothing in return, and your reward shall be great, and ye shall be sons of [the] Highest; for *he* is good to the unthankful and wicked. @ Samơ̆ khăp bĕ kơ ƀing ayăt ƀing gih. Ngă hiam laih anŭn brơi arăng čan bĕ, anăm čang rơmang kơ tơlơi ba glaĭ dơ̆ng ôh. Tui anŭn pri apah ƀing gih či prŏng biă mă, laih anŭn ƀing gih či jing ƀing ană Pô Glông Hloh; yua kơ Ñu ngă hiam kơ ƀing ƀu thâo hơdơr tơngia laih anŭn kơ ƀing sat ƀai. 
Be ye therefore merciful, even as your Father also is merciful. @ Brơi ƀing gih thâo pap kar hăng Ama ƀing gih thâo pap.”
And judge not, and ye shall not be judged; condemn not, and ye shall not be condemned. Remit, and it shall be remitted to you. @ “Anăm phat kơđi arăng, tui anŭn Ơi Adai ƀu či phat kơđi kơ ƀing gih ôh. Anăm klă kơđi kơ arăng kiăng kơ Ơi Adai ƀu klă kơđi kơ ih. Pap brơi kơ arăng bĕ, tui anŭn Ơi Adai či pap brơi kơ ƀing gih. 
Give, and it shall be given to you; good measure, pressed down, and shaken together, and running over, shall be given into your bosom: for with the same measure with which ye mete it shall be measured to you again. @ Pha brơi bĕ kơ arăng, tui anŭn Ơi Adai či pha brơi glaĭ kơ ƀing gih. Ơi Adai či tuh brơi kơ ƀing gih hăng hơnơ̆ng pơkă hiam, Ñu rơyuh hăng gư̆ tơl bă blai. Yua kơ Ơi Adai či pơkă tui hăng hơnơ̆ng ƀing gih hmâo pơkă brơi laih kơ arăng.”
And he spoke also a parable to them: Can a blind [man] lead a blind [man]? shall not both fall into [the] ditch? @ Laih anŭn Yêsu pơhiăp sa tơlơi bơhmutu kơ gơñu: “Dưi mơ̆ mơnuih bum mơta atăt ba mơnuih bum mơta? Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă abih dua gơñu či lĕ amăng luh? 
The disciple is not above his teacher, but every one that is perfected shall be as his teacher. @ Ding kơna ƀu prŏng hloh kơ nai pơtô ñu ôh, samơ̆ tơdah rĭm čô ding kơna hmâo hrăm tum laih, gơñu či jing hrup hăng nai pơtô gơñu.
But why lookest thou on the mote which is in the eye of thy brother, but perceivest not the beam which is in thine own eye? @ Hyư̆m ih ƀuh ƀruih amăng mơta adơi ayŏng ih, samơ̆ ƀu ƀuh ôh tơda amăng mơta ih pô? 
or how canst thou say to thy brother, Brother, allow [me], I will cast out the mote that is in thine eye, thyself not seeing the beam that is in thine eye? Hypocrite, cast out first the beam out of thine eye, and then thou shalt see clear to cast out the mote which is in the eye of thy brother. @ Ƀôdah hyư̆m ih dưi laĭ kơ adơi ayŏng ih: ‘Ơ ayŏng brơi kâo mă hĭ ƀruih mơ̆ng mơta ih,’ tơdang anŭn ih ƀu ƀuh ôh tơda amăng mơta ih pô? Ơ mơnuih pơrup mă, blŭng hlâo mă hĭ tơda mơ̆ng mơta ih pô, laih anŭn kah ih či ƀuh rơđah dưi mă hĭ ƀruih mơ̆ng mơta adơi ayŏng ih.”
For there is no good tree which produces corrupt fruit, nor a corrupt tree which produces good fruit; @ “Yua kơ phŭn kơyâo hiam ƀu dưi mơboh kơ boh sat ôh, phŭn kơyâo sat ƀu dưi mơboh kơ boh hiam lơi. 
for every tree is known by its own fruit, for figs are not gathered from thorns, nor grapes vintaged from a bramble. @ Yua kơ arăng thâo krăn rĭm phŭn kơyâo tui hăng boh ñu. Arăng ƀu pĕ ôh boh hra mơ̆ng hrĕ drơi, arăng kŏn pĕ lơi boh kơƀâu mơ̆ng pum drơi. 
The good man, out of the good treasure of his heart, brings forth good; and the wicked [man] out of the wicked, brings forth what is wicked: for out of the abundance of the heart his mouth speaks. @ Mơnuih hiam yua mơ̆ng pran jua hiam, ñu tơbiă rai tơlơi hiam; laih anŭn mơnuih sat yua mơ̆ng pran jua sat, ñu tơbiă rai tơlơi sat; yua mơ̆ng tơlơi bă blai amăng lăm pran jua hnŭn yơh amăng bah tơbiă rai tơlơi pơhiăp.”
And why call ye me, Lord, Lord, and do not the things that I say? @ “Hyư̆m ƀing gih iâu Kâo: ‘Ơ Khua Yang, Khua Yang,’ samơ̆ ƀu ngă ôh tui hăng tơlơi Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih? 
Every one that comes to me, and hears my words and does them, I will shew you to whom he is like. @ Kơ rĭm čô hlơi pô rai pơ Kâo hmư̆ hiăp Kâo laih anŭn gưt tui Kâo, Kâo či pơrơđah brơi kơ ƀing gih hyư̆m pô anŭn jing, 
He is like a man building a house, who dug and went deep, and laid a foundation on the rock; but a great rain coming, the stream broke upon that house, and could not shake it, for it had been founded on the rock. @ Ñu anŭn jing kar hăng sa čô mơnuih pơdơ̆ng sang, ñu klơi luh dlam, laih anŭn pơdơ̆ng atur ƀơi ngŏ boh pơtâo. Tơ ia lip truh, ia ro kơtang klă sang anŭn samơ̆ ñu ƀu pơgơi ôh, yua kơ arăng pơdơ̆ng ñu kơjăp biă mă. 
And he that has heard and not done, is like a man who has built a house on the ground without [a] foundation, on which the stream broke, and immediately it fell, and the breach of that house was great. @ Samơ̆ hlơi pô hmư̆ laih anŭn ƀu gưt tui ôh tơlơi Kâo pơhiăp, pô anŭn jing kar hăng sa čô mơnuih pơdơ̆ng sang ƀơi lŏn, ƀu hmâo atur ôh. Ia juar klă sang anŭn, sang anŭn tơglưh mơtam laih anŭn răm rai prŏng biă mă.”
And when he had completed all his words in the hearing of the people, he entered into Capernaum. @ Giơ̆ng kơ Yêsu pơđŭt abih tơlơi Ñu pơhiăp anŭn kơ ƀing ană plei pla, Ñu mŭt amăng plei Kapernum. 
And a certain centurion's bondman who was dear to him was ill and about to die; @ Sa čô khua tơhan kơ sa rơtuh čô hmâo sa čô ding kơna ñu khăp biă mă, dŏ ruă, giăm djai. 
and having heard of Jesus, he sent to him elders of the Jews, begging him that he might come and save his bondman. @ Tơ ñu hmư̆ hing kơ Yêsu, ñu pơkiaŏ nao ƀing kŏng tha ƀing Yuđa rơkâo kơ Yêsu rai pơsuaih ding kơna ñu. 
But they, being come to Jesus, besought him diligently, saying, He is worthy to whom thou shouldest grant this, @ Tơ ƀing anŭn truh pơ Yêsu, gơñu kơwưh kơ Yêsu hăng abih pran jua hăng laĭ: “ñu năng lăp kơ Ih ngă tơlơi anŭn kơ ñu, 
for he loves our nation, and himself has built the synagogue for us. @ Yua kơ ñu khăp kơ kơnŭng djuai ƀing ta, laih anŭn ñu pơdơ̆ng brơi laih kơ ƀing ta sa boh sang bơjơnum.”
And Jesus went with them. But already, when he was not far from the house, the centurion sent to him friends, saying to him, Lord, do not trouble thyself, for I am not worthy that thou shouldest enter under my roof. @ Yêsu nao hrŏm hăng ƀing gơñu. Tơ Yêsu giăm truh pơ sang, khua tơhan pơkiaŏ gơyut ñu nao pơ Yêsu, hăng laĭ: “Ơ Khua Yang, anăm pơgleh ih pô ôh, yua kơ kâo ƀu lăp ôh jum ih mŭt amăng sang kâo. 
Wherefore neither did I count myself worthy to come to thee. But say by a word and my servant shall be healed. @ Yua kơ anŭn yơh kâo pơmĭn kâo pô kŏn lăp lơi nao pơ Ih. Samơ̆ kơnơ̆ng rơkâo Ih pơhiăp sa boh đôč, laih anŭn ding kơna kâo či suaih yơh. 
For *I* also am a man placed under authority, having under myself soldiers, and I say to this [one], Go, and he goes; and to another, Come, and he comes; and to my bondman, Do this, and he does [it]. @ Yua kơ kâo ăt jing sa čô dŏ gah yŭ tơlơi dưi arăng, laih anŭn kâo ăt hmâo ƀing tơhan dŏ gah yŭ tơlơi dưi kâo. Kâo laĭ kơ sa čô: ‘Nao bĕ,’ laih anŭn ñu nao; kơ sa čô pơkŏn: ‘Rai bĕ,’ laih anŭn ñu rai, laih anŭn kơ ding kơna kâo: ‘Ngă tui anai,’ laih anŭn ñu ngă yơh.”
And Jesus hearing this wondered at him, and turning to the crowd following him said, I say to you, Not even in Israel have I found so great faith. @ Tơ Yêsu hmư̆ tơlơi anŭn, Ñu hling hlang kơ khua tơhan anŭn, laih anŭn wir lăng hăng laĭ kơ ƀing lu đuaĭ tui Ñu: “Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, wơ̆t amăng Israel Kâo aka ƀuh ôh tơlơi đaŏ prŏng kar hăng anŭn.”
And they who had been sent returning to the house found the bondman, who was ill, in good health. @ Tơ ƀing mơnuih khua tơhan pơkiaŏ nao anŭn wơ̆t glaĭ pơ sang, gơñu ƀuh ding kơna anŭn suaih laih.
And it came to pass afterwards he went into a city called Nain, and many of his disciples and a great crowd went with him. @ Hrơi tơdơi, Yêsu nao pơ sa boh plei anăn Nain. Ƀing ding kơna Ñu laih anŭn khul mơnuih lu nao hrŏm hăng Ñu. 
And as he drew near to the gate of the city, behold, a dead man was carried out, the only son of his mother, and she a widow, and a very considerable crowd of the city [was] with her. @ Tơ Ñu giăm truh ƀơi amăng jang plei, anai nê arăng čơkung sa čô mơnuih djai, ană đah rơkơi sa čô đah kơmơi blao, ñu hmâo kơnơ̆ng sa čô ană anŭn đôč. Laih anŭn hmâo lu mơnuih mơ̆ng plei nao hrŏm hăng đah kơmơi anŭn. 
And the Lord, seeing her, was moved with compassion for her, and said to her, Weep not; @ Tơ Khua Yang ƀuh đah kơmơi anŭn, Ñu hmâo tơlơi glưh pran jua hăng pap drap kơ gơ̆, hnŭn yơh Ñu laĭ: “Anăm hia ôh.” 
and coming up he touched the bier, and the bearers stopped. And he said, Youth, I say to thee, Wake up. @ Ñu nao giăm, ruaih bong, laih anŭn ƀing mơnuih čơkung dơ̆ng glaĭ hĭ. Ñu laĭ: “Ơ dăm, Kâo laĭ kơ ih tơgŭ bĕ!” 
And the dead sat up and began to speak; and he gave him to his mother. @ Pô djai anŭn pyut tơgŭ dŏ laih anŭn čơdơ̆ng pơhiăp. Yêsu jao gơ̆ kơ amĭ ñu. 
And fear seized on all, and they glorified God, saying, A great prophet has been raised up amongst us; and God has visited his people. @ Abih bang mơnuih hwĭ biă mă, laih anŭn gơñu pơpŭ bơni hơơč kơ Ơi Adai, hăng laĭ: “Sa čô pô laĭ lui hlâo prŏng truh laih tơ̆ng krah ƀing ta,” laih anŭn “Ơi Adai hmâo rai čuă laih ƀing ană plei pla Ñu.” 
And this report went out in all Judaea concerning him, and in all the surrounding country. @ Arăng ră ruai tơlơi Yêsu ngă anai tar ƀar čar Yuđa laih anŭn abih tring jum dar.
And the disciples of John brought him word concerning all these things: @ Ƀing ding kơna Yôhan ruai glaĭ kơ Yôhan abih tơlơi anŭn. Yôhan iâu dua čô ding kơna ñu, 
and John, having called two of his disciples, sent to Jesus, saying, Art *thou* he that is coming, or are we to wait for another? @ laih anŭn pơkiaŏ gơñu nao tơña Khua Yang: “Djơ̆ mơ̆ Ih jing Pô khŏm rai, ƀôdah gơmơi či dŏ tơguan pô pơkŏn?” 
But the men having come to him said, John the baptist has sent us to thee, saying, Art *thou* he that is coming, or are we to wait for another? @ Tơ ƀing anŭn truh pơ Yêsu, gơñu laĭ: “Yôhan Ƀatem pơkiaŏ rai gơmơi tơña kơ Ih: ‘Djơ̆ mơ̆ Ih jing Pô khŏm rai, ƀôdah gơmơi či dŏ tơguan pô pơkŏn?’”
In that hour he healed many of diseases and plagues and evil spirits, and to many blind he granted sight. @ Ƀơi mông anŭn Yêsu pơsuaih lu mơnuih ruă duăm, mơnuih yang sat ngă, laih anŭn Ñu ngă brơi lu mơnuih bum mơta dưi ƀuh rơđah. 
And Jesus answering said to them, Go, bring back word to John of what ye have seen and heard: that blind see, lame walk, lepers are cleansed, deaf hear, dead are raised, poor are evangelized; @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ kơ gơñu: “Nao ruai glaĭ bĕ kơ Yôhan hơgĕt tơlơi ƀing gih hmâo ƀuh laih anŭn hmư̆ laih: ƀing bum mơta dưi ƀuh rơđah dơ̆ng, ƀing rơwen tơkai thâo rơbat, ƀing djơ̆ phŭng dưi rơgoh, ƀing tơngil dưi hmư̆, ƀing djai hơdip glaĭ dơ̆ng, laih anŭn ƀing ƀun rin dưi hmư̆ Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam. 
and blessed is whosoever shall not be offended in me. @ Mơyun hiam yơh kơ hlơi pô ƀu tơhnač rơbuh yua kơ Kâo!”
And the messengers of John having departed, he began to speak to the crowds concerning John: What went ye out into the wilderness to behold? a reed shaken by the wind? @ Tơ ƀing Yôhan pơkiaŏ nao glaĭ laih, Yêsu čơdơ̆ng pơhiăp kơ ƀing lu tơlơi djơ̆ kơ Yôhan: “Ƀing gih nao lăng tơlơi hơgĕt amăng tơdrŏn tač? Sa ƀĕ gai trang bô angĭn pưh rơyuh hă? 
But what went ye out to see? a man clothed in delicate garments? Behold, those who are in splendid clothing and live luxuriously are in the courts of kings. @ Tui anŭn hơgĕt tơlơi ƀing gih nao lăng lĕ? Sa čô đah rơkơi buh ao yom kơdrưh hă? Anai nê, ƀing buh ao yom kơdrưh laih anŭn hơdip pơdrŏng sah dŏ amăng sang pơtao. 
But what went ye out to see? a prophet? Yea, I say to you, and [what is] more excellent than a prophet. @ Tui anŭn hơgĕt tơlơi ƀing gih nao lăng lĕ? Sa čô pô laĭ lui hlâo hă? Djơ̆ laih, kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, hmâo pô yom hloh kơ pô laĭ lui hlâo dơ̆ng. 
This is he concerning whom it is written, Behold, *I* send my messenger before thy face, who shall prepare thy way before thee; @ Kơ pô anŭn yơh Hră Ơi Adai pơhiăp hmâo čih laih tui anai:
‘Anai nê, Kâo pơkiaŏ nao pô pơala Kâo nao hlâo kơ Ih,
Ñu či rơmet jơlan Ih hlâo kơ Ih truh.’
for I say unto you, Among them that are born of women a greater [prophet] is no one than John [the baptist]; but he who is a little one in the kingdom of God is greater than he. @ Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, đơ ƀing mơnuih đah kơmơi tơkeng rai laih, ƀu hmâo pô prŏng hloh kơ Yôhan ôh; samơ̆ pô anĕt hloh amăng dêh čar pơtao Ơi Adai jing pô prŏng hloh kơ Yôhan.” 
(And all the people who heard [it], and the tax-gatherers, justified God, having been baptised with the baptism of John; @ Abih bang ƀing ană plei pla wơ̆t ƀing ring jia hmư̆ Yôhan pơtô, hmâo tŭ laih tơlơi ƀatem Yôhan, gơñu leng tŭ ư kơ Ơi Adai jing tơpă. 
but the Pharisees and the lawyers rendered null as to themselves the counsel of God, not having been baptised by him.) @ Samơ̆ ƀing Pharisi hăng ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt hơngah tơlơi Ơi Adai ruah pioh brơi kơ gơñu, yua kơ gơñu ƀu tŭ ôh tơlơi ƀatem Yôhan.
To whom therefore shall I liken the men of this generation, and to whom are they like? @ “Hăng tơlơi hơgĕt Kâo či pơhmu ƀing mơnuih rơnŭk anai lĕ, laih anŭn gơñu hrup hăng hlơi? 
They are like children sitting in the market-place, and calling one to another and saying, We have piped to you, and ye have not danced; we have mourned to you, and ye have not wept. @ Gơñu jing hrup hăng ƀing čơđai dŏ ber amăng anih sĭ mơdrô, laih anŭn gơñu pơ iâu tơdruă gơñu tui anai: ‘Gơmơi ayŭp laih đing dĕk kơ ƀing gih, samơ̆ ƀing gih ƀu yŭn suang ôh; gơmơi hri čok laih, samơ̆ ƀing gih ƀu hia ôh.’ 
For John the baptist has come neither eating bread nor drinking wine, and ye say, He has a demon. @ Yua kơ Yôhan Ƀatem rai laih, ƀu ƀơ̆ng huă, laih anŭn ƀu mơñum tơpai ôh, anŭn yơh ƀing gih laĭ: ‘Ñu yang sat ngă.’ 
The Son of man has come eating and drinking, and ye say, Behold an eater and wine-drinker, a friend of tax-gatherers and sinners; @ Ană Mơnuih hmâo rai laih ƀơ̆ng huă hăng mơñum, laih anŭn gơñu laĭ: ‘Anai nê, sa čô ră ƀơ̆ng, ră mơñum, gơyut gơyâo hăng ƀing ring jia laih anŭn ƀing mơnuih soh!’ 
and wisdom has been justified of all her children. @ Samơ̆ tơlơi kơhnâo pơsĭt ñu pô jing djơ̆ yua mơ̆ng boh than ñu.”
But one of the Pharisees begged him that he would eat with him. And entering into the house of the Pharisee he took his place at table; @ Sa čô Pharisi jak Yêsu ƀơ̆ng huă hrŏm hăng ñu, Yêsu mŭt amăng sang pô anŭn laih anŭn dŏ ber ƀơ̆ng huă hrŏm hăng ñu. 
and behold, a woman in the city, who was a sinner, and knew that he was sitting at meat in the house of the Pharisee, having taken an alabaster box of myrrh, @ Laih anŭn anai nê, hmâo sa čô đah kơmơi soh sat amăng plei anŭn, tơ ñu thâo Yêsu dŏ ƀơ̆ng huă amăng sang sa čô mơnuih Pharisi, ñu djă ba sa boh get boh pơtâo hiam pioh bă hăng ia klôñ ƀâu mơngưi. 
and standing at his feet behind [him] weeping, began to wash his feet with tears; and she wiped them with the hairs of her head, and kissed his feet, and anointed [them] with the myrrh. @ Ñu dŏ gah klon ƀơi tơkai Yêsu, ñu hia, ia mơta ñu ngă pơsah tơkai Yêsu; giơ̆ng anŭn ñu sut tơkai Yêsu hăng ƀuk ñu. Ñu čŭm tơkai Yêsu hăng truač ia ƀâu hiam ƀơi tơkai Yêsu. 
And the Pharisee who had invited him, seeing it, spoke with himself saying, This [person] if he were a prophet would have known who and what the woman is who touches him, for she is a sinner. @ Mơnuih Pharisi, pô jak Yêsu ƀuh tơlơi anŭn, ñu pơmĭn tui anai: “Tơdah pô anai jing sa čô pô laĭ lui hlâo sĭt, Ñu thâo krăn yơh hlơi đah kơmơi pô ruaih Ñu anai laih anŭn hyư̆m gơ̆ jing, yua kơ gơ̆ jing sa čô mơnuih soh.”
And Jesus answering said to him, Simon, I have somewhat to say to thee. And he says, Teacher, say [it]. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ ñu: “Ơ Simôn, Kâo hmâo tơlơi kiăng pơhiăp hăng ih.” Ñu laĭ: “Ơ nai, pơhiăp bĕ!”
There were two debtors of a certain creditor: one owed five hundred denarii and the other fifty; @ “Sa čô mơnuih hmâo dua čô đom hơnưh ñu. Sa čô đom hơnưh rơma rơtuh đơniê laih anŭn sa čô pơkŏn rơma pluh đơniê. 
but as they had nothing to pay, he forgave both of them [their debt]: [say,] which of them therefore will love him most? @ Yua kơ dua gơñu ƀu dưi kla ôh, pô hơnưh pơrơngai hĭ hơnưh gơñu. Tui anŭn hlơi amăng dua gơñu či khăp kơ pô hơnưh lu hloh?”
And Simon answering said, I suppose he to whom he forgave the most. And he said to him, Thou hast rightly judged. @ Simôn laĭ glaĭ: “Kâo pơmĭn pô ñu pơrơngai hơnưh lu hloh anŭn.” Yêsu laĭ kơ ñu: “Ih pơmĭn djơ̆ yơh.”
And turning to the woman he said to Simon, Seest thou this woman? I entered into thy house; thou gavest me not water on my feet, but *she* has washed my feet with tears, and wiped them with her hair. @ Laih anŭn Ñu wir lăng đah kơmơi anŭn hăng laĭ kơ Simôn: “Ih ƀuh mơ̆ đah kơmơi anai? Kâo mŭt laih amăng sang ih, ih ƀu brơi ia kơ Kâo rao tơkai ôh. Samơ̆ bơ đah kơmơi anai, gơ̆ hmâo pơsah laih tơkai Kâo hăng ia mơta laih anŭn sut hăng ƀuk gơ̆. 
Thou gavest me not a kiss, but *she* from the time I came in has not ceased kissing my feet. @ Ih ƀu čŭm Kâo ôh, samơ̆ dơ̆ng mơ̆ng kâo mŭt amăng sang ih, gơ̆ ƀu pơdơi čŭm tơkai Kâo ôh. 
My head with oil thou didst not anoint, but *she* has anointed my feet with myrrh. @ Ih ƀu truač ia jâu ƀơi akŏ Kâo ôh, samơ̆ ñu hmâo pik laih ia jâu ƀâu mơngưi ƀơi tơkai Kâo. 
For which cause I say to thee, Her many sins are forgiven; for she loved much; but he to whom little is forgiven loves little. @ Hnŭn yơh Kâo laĭ kơ ih tơlơi soh gơ̆ lu biă mă samơ̆ hmâo tơlơi pap brơi laih, yua kơ anŭn yơh gơ̆ khăp lu. Samơ̆ kơ pô hmâo tơlơi pap brơi ƀiă, ñu khăp ƀiă.”
And he said to her, Thy sins are forgiven. @ Laih anŭn Ñu laĭ kơ đah kơmơi anŭn: “Tơlơi soh ih Kâo pap brơi laih.”
And they that were with [them] at table began to say within themselves, Who is this who forgives also sins? @ Tui anŭn ƀing dŏ ƀơ̆ng huă hrŏm hăng Ñu čơdơ̆ng bơlaĭ tơdruă gơñu pô: “Hlơi pô anai, tơl Ñu dưi pap brơi tơlơi soh arăng?”
And he said to the woman, Thy faith has saved thee; go in peace. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ đah kơmơi anŭn: “Tơlơi đaŏ ih pơklaih ih laih; nao rơnŭk rơnua bĕ.”
And it came to pass afterwards that *he* went through [the country] city by city, and village by village, preaching and announcing the glad tidings of the kingdom of God; and the twelve [were] with him, @ Giơ̆ng anŭn, Yêsu găn nao plei prŏng laih anŭn plei anĕt, pơhaih hăng pơtô Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam Dêh Čar Pơtao Ơi Adai. Pluh dua čô khua ding kơna nao hrŏm hăng Ñu. 
and certain women who had been healed of wicked spirits and infirmities, Mary who was called Magdalene, from whom seven demons had gone out, @ Laih anŭn ăt hmâo mơ̆n ƀing đah kơmơi nao hrŏm hăng Ñu, jing ƀing mơnuih Yêsu hmâo suaih laih mơ̆ng tơlơi yang sat ngă laih anŭn tơlơi duăm ruă: HʼMari Madala, mơ̆ng ñu yơh tơjuh čô yang sat tơbiă laih, 
and Joanna, wife of Chuza, Herod's steward, and Susanna, and many others, who ministered to him of their substance. @ HʼYôana bơnai Kusa, ding kơna wai lăng sang Hêrôt, HʼSusana, laih anŭn lu ƀing pơkŏn dơ̆ng; ƀing đah kơmơi anŭn hmâo yua laih dram gơnam gơñu kiăng djru Yêsu laih anŭn ƀing ding kơna Ñu.
And a great crowd coming together, and those who were coming to him out of each city, he spoke by parable: @ Tơ ƀing mơnuih lu pơtŭm glaĭ, laih anŭn ƀing ană plei mơ̆ng lu boh plei phara rai pơ Ñu, Yêsu pơhiăp hăng tơlơi bơhmutu, 
The sower went out to sow his seed; and as he sowed, some fell along the way, and it was trodden under foot, and the birds of the heaven devoured it up; @ “Sa čô mơnuih sai pơjeh nao sai pơjeh ñu. Tơdang ñu sai đơđa pơjeh lĕ kơtuai jơlan. Arăng juă laih anŭn čĭm čoh ƀơ̆ng hĭ pơjeh anŭn. 
and other fell upon the rock, and having sprung up, it was dried up because it had not moisture; @ Đơđa lĕ ƀơi ngŏ boh pơtâo. Pơjeh anŭn man čăt, ñu gliu hĭ yua kơ ƀu hmâo hyuh ia ôh. 
and other fell in the midst of the thorns, and the thorns having sprung up with [it] choked it; @ Đơđa lĕ amăng anih drơi, drơi čăt hrŏm laih anŭn ket hĭ pơdai anŭn. 
and other fell into the good ground, and having sprung up bore fruit a hundredfold. As he said these things he cried, He that has ears to hear, let him hear. @ Hmâo đơđa pơjeh pơkŏn dơ̆ng lĕ amăng anih lŏn hiam, ñu čăt đĭ hăng mơboh sa asar jing sa rơtuh.” Giơ̆ng Ñu pơhiăp tui anŭn, Ñu laĭ kraih: “Hlơi pô hmâo tơngia thâo hmư̆, brơi ñu hmư̆ bĕ!”
And his disciples asked him [saying], What may this parable be? @ Tơ ƀing ding kơna Ñu tơña Ñu hơgĕt tơlơi kiăng pia kơ tơlơi bơhmutu anŭn, 
And he said, To you it is given to know the mysteries of the kingdom of God, but to the rest in parables, in order that seeing they may not see, and hearing they may not understand. @ Ñu laĭ: “Ơi Adai pha brơi kơ ƀing gih dưi thâo hluh tơlơi yom hơgơ̆m kơ Dêh Čar Pơtao Ơi Adai; Samơ̆ kơ ƀing pơkŏn Kâo pơhiăp kơ gơñu hăng tơlơi bơhmutu, kiăng kơ
Gơñu lăng samơ̆ gơñu ƀu thâo ƀuh ôh,
Laih anŭn gơñu hmư̆ samơ̆ ƀu thâo hluh ôh.”
But the parable is this: The seed is the word of God. @ “Anai tơlơi bơhmutu anŭn kiăng pia: pơjeh jing boh pơhiăp Ơi Adai. 
But those by the wayside are those who hear; then comes the devil and takes away the word from their heart that they may not believe and be saved. @ Pơjeh lĕ kơtuai jơlan jing ƀing hmư̆ boh pơhiăp, samơ̆ yang sat rai hăng mă hĭ pơjeh mơ̆ng pran jua gơñu, hwĭ kơ gơñu đaŏ laih anŭn hmâo hĭ tơlơi pơklaih. 
But those upon the rock, those who when they hear receive the word with joy; and these have no root, who believe for a time, and in time of trial fall away. @ Pơjeh lĕ ƀơi boh pơtâo jing ƀing hmư̆ boh pơhiăp laih anŭn mă tŭ mơtam hăng tơlơi mơak, samơ̆ gơñu ƀu hmâo akha ôh. Gơñu đaŏ kơnơ̆ng jang jai đôč; laih anŭn tơ hmâo tơlơi lông lăng, gơñu lui wir hĭ. 
But that that fell where the thorns were, these are they who having heard go away and are choked under cares and riches and pleasures of life, and bring no fruit to perfection. @ Bơ pơjeh lĕ amăng anih pum drơi, jing ƀing hmâo hmư̆ laih boh pơhiăp, samơ̆ tơdang gơñu rơbat nao amăng jơlan tơlơi hơdip gơñu, tơlơi ƀlơ̆ng bơngơ̆t, tơlơi pơdrŏng sah, laih anŭn tơlơi hơ̆k mơak kơ tơlơi hơdip lŏn tơnah anai kơpĭ ket hĭ gơñu, laih anŭn boh gơñu ƀu thâo tơsă ôh. 
But that in the good ground, these are they who in an honest and good heart, having heard the word keep it, and bring forth fruit with patience. @ Samơ̆ pơjeh lĕ amăng lŏn hiam jing ƀing hmư̆ boh pơhiăp, djă pioh boh pơhiăp anŭn amăng pran jua hăng tơlơi tơpă sĭt laih anŭn hiam, laih anŭn gơñu gir run tơl gơñu dưi mơboh.”
And no one having lighted a lamp covers it with a vessel or puts it under a couch, but sets it on a lamp-stand, that they who enter in may see the light. @ “Ƀu hmâo ôh hlơi čuh apui kơđen laih anŭn gom hĭ ñu hăng kơthŭng ƀôdah pioh ñu gah yŭ sưng pĭt, samơ̆ pioh ñu ƀơi gơ̆ng apui kơđen, kiăng kơ hlơi pô mŭt amăng sang dưi ƀuh tơlơi bơngač.
For there is nothing hid which shall not become manifest, nor secret which shall not be known and come to light. @ Yua kơ ƀu hmâo ôh tơlơi hơgĕt hơgơ̆m tơl ƀu či bơrơđah hĭ, kŏn hmâo lơi tơlơi hơgĕt pơdŏp tơl arăng ƀu dưi thâo laih anŭn ba tơbiă pơ tơlơi bơngač.
Take heed therefore how ye hear; for whosoever has, to him shall be given, and whosoever has not, even what he seems to have shall be taken from him. @ Tui anŭn, răng bĕ kơ tơlơi ƀing gih hmư̆; yua kơ hlơi pô hmâo laih Ơi Adai či brơi thim dơ̆ng; samơ̆ kơ hlơi pô ƀu hmâo ôh, wơ̆t kơ mơnơ̆ng ñu pơmĭn ñu hmâo laih Ơi Adai či mă lui hĭ mơ̆n.”
And his mother and his brethren came to him, and could not get to him because of the crowd. @ Hlăk anŭn amĭ hăng adơi Yêsu rai sem Ñu, samơ̆ yua kơ ƀing mơnuih lu gơñu ƀu dưi nao giăm pơ Ñu ôh. 
And it was told him [saying], Thy mother and thy brethren stand without, wishing to see thee. @ Hmâo mơnuih laĭ pơthâo Ñu: “Amĭ hăng adơi Ih dŏ pơ rơngiao kiăng bưp ih.”
But he answering said to them, My mother and my brethren are those who hear the word of God and do [it]. @ Samơ̆ Ñu laĭ glaĭ kơ gơñu: “Hlơi pô hmư̆ tơlơi Ơi Adai pơhiăp laih anŭn ngă tui, ƀing anŭn jing amĭ Kâo laih anŭn ƀing adơi ayŏng Kâo.”
And it came to pass on one of the days, that *he* entered into a ship, himself and his disciples; and he said to them, Let us pass over to the other side of the lake; and they set off from shore. @ Sa hrơi anŭn, Yêsu đĭ amăng sa boh sŏng hrŏm hăng ƀing ding kơna Ñu. Ñu laĭ kơ ƀing gơ̆: “Brơi ƀing ta găn nao pơ hang gah adih ia dơnao.” Tui anŭn gơñu nao. 
And as they sailed, he fell asleep; and a sudden squall of wind came down on the lake, and they were filled [with water], and were in danger; @ Tơdang sŏng gơñu nao, Yêsu pĭt hĭ. Hmâo rơbŭ kơthel truh ƀơi ia dơnao, laih anŭn ia mŭt bă sŏng, laih anŭn gơñu hlăk bưp tơlơi hyưt pưt. 
and coming to [him] they woke him up, saying, Master, master, we perish. But he, rising up, rebuked the wind and the raging of the water; and they ceased, and there was a calm. @ Gơñu nao râo Yêsu hăng laĭ: “Ơ Nai, Ơ Nai, ƀing ta djai yơh!” Yêsu mơdưh, khă angĭn hăng ia pah pŭng. Tui anŭn angĭn wơ̆t ia pah pŭng dŏ hơđơ̆ng hĭ laih anŭn rơiăt lơleh. 
And he said to them, Where is your faith? And, being afraid, they were astonished, saying to one another, Who then is this, that he commands even the winds and the water, and they obey him? @ Yêsu laĭ kơ ƀing gơñu “Pơpă tơlơi đaŏ ƀing gih lĕ?” Gơñu hwĭ, hling hlang laih anŭn bơlaĭ tơdruă gơñu: “Hlơi pô anai, tơl wơ̆t angĭn laih anŭn ia pah pŭng ăt gưt kơ Ñu mơ̆n?”
And they arrived in the country of the Gadarenes, which is over against Galilee. @ Gơñu truh pơ tring Gêrasen klă anăp tring Galilê. 
And as he got out [of the ship] on the land, a certain man out of the city met him, who had demons a long time, and put on no clothes, and did not abide in a house, but in the tombs. @ Tơdang Yêsu man tơbiă trŭn ƀơi hang, hmâo sa čô mơnuih mơ̆ng plei hmâo lu yang sat ngă nao bưp Ñu. Mơ̆ng sui laih ñu ƀu buh sum ao ôh, laih anŭn ñu ƀu dŏ amăng sang ôh, samơ̆ dŏ amăng par pơsat. 
But seeing Jesus, he cried out, and fell down before him, and with a loud voice said, What have I to do with thee, Jesus Son of the Most High God? I beseech thee torment me not. @ Tơ ñu ƀuh Yêsu, ñu ur kraih, bon kŭp ƀơi anăp Yêsu laih anŭn laĭ: “Hơgĕt tơlơi Ih hmâo hăng kâo, Ơ Yêsu, Ană Ơi Adai Pô Pơ Glông Hloh? Kâo kơwưh kơ Ih, anăm pơtơnap kâo ôh.” 
For he had commanded the unclean spirit to go out from the man. For very often it had seized him; and he had been bound, kept with chains and fetters; and breaking the bonds he was driven by the demon into the deserts. @ Yua kơ Yêsu hmâo pơđar laih yang bơngăt grĭ hơƀak brơi ñu tơbiă mơ̆ng mơnuih anŭn. Yua kơ lu wơ̆t yang sat ngă kơ ñu; wơ̆t dah arăng gak wai laih anŭn čaŏ tơkai, akă tơngan ñu hăng hrĕ čuăk laih anŭn anŭh, samơ̆ ñu kơtŭng tơĭ hĭ hrĕ anŭn, laih anŭn yang sat ba pơđuaĭ ñu nao pơ tơdrŏn tač.
And Jesus asked him saying, What is thy name? And he said, Legion: for many demons had entered into him. @ Yêsu tơña kơ gơ̆: “Hlơi anăn ih?” Gơ̆ laĭ: “Phung lu,” yua kơ hmâo lu yang sat mŭt laih amăng ñu. 
And they besought him that he would not command them to go away into the bottomless pit. @ Laih anŭn ƀing yang sat kơwưh kơ Yêsu anăm pơđar gơñu nao mŭt amăng hlŭng dlam ôh!
And there was there a herd of many swine feeding on the mountain, and they besought him that he would suffer them to enter into those; and he suffered them. @ Ƀơi kriăng čư̆ anŭn hmâo lu bơbui hyu ƀơ̆ng; laih anŭn ƀing yang sat kơwưh kơ Yêsu brơi gơñu mŭt amăng khul bơbui anŭn, laih anŭn Yêsu brơi yơh. 
And the demons, going out from the man, entered into the swine, and the herd rushed down the precipice into the lake, and were choked. @ Giơ̆ng anŭn ƀing yang sat tơbiă mơ̆ng mơnuih anŭn hăng mŭt amăng khul bơbui. Abih bang khul bơbui mơ̆ng kriăng čư̆ dơ̆ng lơ̆ng, kơdâo trŭn amăng ia dơnao, laih anŭn djai trăm abih.
But they that fed [them], seeing what had happened, fled, and told [it] to the city and to the country. @ Tơ ƀing wai bơbui ƀuh tơlơi truh, gơñu đuaĭ kơdŏp hăng ră tơlơi anŭn djŏp plei pla amăng tring anŭn. 
And they went out to see what had happened, and came to Jesus, and found the man from whom the demons had gone out, sitting, clothed and sensible, at the feet of Jesus. And they were afraid. @ Tui anŭn ƀing ană plei pla tơbiă nao kiăng lăng tơlơi truh anŭn. Gơñu truh pơ Yêsu, laih anŭn ƀuh mơnuih ƀing yang sat hmâo tơbiă đuaĭ laih. Gơ̆ dŏ ber ƀơi tơkai Yêsu, čŭt hơô sum ao, tơlơi pơmĭn tơngăl laih; laih anŭn gơñu hwĭ biă mă. 
And they also who had seen it told them how the possessed man had been healed. @ Ƀing mơnuih hmâo ƀuh laih tơlơi truh anŭn ră ruai glaĭ kơ ƀing mơnuih pơkŏn kơ tơlơi mơnuih yang sat ngă anŭn hyư̆m ñu suaih laih. 
And all the multitude of the surrounding country of the Gadarenes asked him to depart from them, for they were possessed with great fear; and *he*, entering into the ship, returned. @ Tui anŭn abih bang ƀing ană plei pla jum dar tring Gêrasen rơkâo kơ Yêsu đuaĭ hĭ mơ̆ng gơñu, yua kơ gơñu hwĭ biă mă. Hnŭn yơh, Yêsu đĭ sŏng laih anŭn wơ̆t glaĭ. 
But the man out of whom the demons had gone besought him that he might be with him. But he sent him away, saying, @ Mơnuih hmâo ƀing yang sat phrâo tơbiă anŭn kơwưh kiăng dưi dŏ hrŏm hăng Yêsu. Samơ̆ Yêsu brơi ñu glaĭ hăng laĭ, 
Return to thine house and relate how great things God has done for thee. And he went away through the whole city, publishing how great things Jesus had done for him. @ “Glaĭ bĕ pơ sang ih, laih anŭn ruai glaĭ abih tơlơi Ơi Adai hmâo ngă brơi laih kơ ih.” Tui anŭn gơ̆ nao laih anŭn ră ruai djŏp plei khul tơlơi Yêsu hmâo ngă brơi laih kơ ñu.
And it came to pass when Jesus returned, the crowd received him gladly, for they were all expecting him. @ Tơ Yêsu wơ̆t glaĭ, ƀing mơnuih lu čơkă drông Ñu, yua kơ abih bang ƀing gơñu leng kơ dŏ čang tơguan Ñu. 
And behold, a man came, whose name was Jairus, and he was [a] ruler of the synagogue, and falling at the feet of Jesus besought him to come to his house, @ Hmâo sa čô mơnuih rai, anăn ñu Jairus. Ñu jing khua wai sang bơjơnum. Ñu glung nao bon kŭp ƀơi tơkai Yêsu laih anŭn kơwưh rơkâo Yêsu nao pơ sang ñu, 
because he had an only daughter, about twelve years old, and she was dying. And as he went the crowds thronged him. @ yua kơ ñu hmâo kơnơ̆ng sa čô ană đah kơmơi pluh dua thŭn giăm djai.
Tơdang Yêsu hlăk nao, ƀing mơnuih lu pơ kơpĭ Ñu. 
And a woman who had a flux of blood since twelve years, who, having spent all her living on physicians, could not be cured by any one, @ Hmâo sa čô đah kơmơi ruă tuh drah hmâo pluh dua thŭn laih. Ñu hmâo pơrơngiă laih abih dram gơnam kơ ƀing ơi ia jrao, samơ̆ ƀu hmâo hlơi dưi pơsuaih ñu ôh. 
coming up behind, touched the hem of his garment, and immediately her flux of blood stopped. @ Gơ̆ nao pơ gah klon Yêsu laih anŭn ruaih ƀơi jih ao Yêsu, tañ mơtam drah gơ̆ khơ̆t hĭ. 
And Jesus said, Who has touched me? But all denying, Peter and those with him said, Master, the crowds close thee in and press upon thee, and sayest thou, Who has touched me? @ Laih anŭn Yêsu tơña: “Hlơi ruaih Kâo?” Tơdang abih bang mơnuih hơngah, Pêtrôs laih anŭn ƀing hrŏm hăng ñu laĭ: “Ơ Nai, ƀing mơnuih lu jum dar Ih, gơñu kơpĭ Ih.”
And Jesus said, Some one has touched me, for *I* have known that power has gone out from me. @ Samơ̆ Yêsu laĭ: “Hmâo sa čô mơnuih ruaih laih Kâo, yua kơ Kâo thâo tơlơi dưi mơyang tơbiă laih mơ̆ng Kâo.” 
And the woman, seeing that she was not hid, came trembling, and falling down before him declared before all the people for what cause she had touched him, and how she was immediately healed. @ Tơ đah kơmơi anŭn thâo kơ ñu ƀu dưi pơdŏp ôh, ñu tơtư̆ drơi jan glung nao bon ƀơi tơkai Yêsu, laih anŭn pơhaih ƀơi anăp abih bang mơnuih yua hơgĕt gơ̆ hmâo ruaih laih ao Yêsu laih anŭn hyư̆m gơ̆ suaih mơtam. 
And he said to her, [Be of good courage,] daughter; thy faith has healed thee; go in peace. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơ̆: “Ơ mŏ, tơlơi đaŏ ih hmâo pơsuaih ih laih. Nao rơnŭk rơnua bĕ!”
While he was yet speaking, comes some one from the ruler of the synagogue, saying to him, Thy daughter is dead; do not trouble the teacher. @ Tơdang Ñu ăt dŏ pơhiăp, hmâo sa čô rai mơ̆ng sang khua wai sang bơjơnum laih anŭn laĭ: “Ană đah kơmơi ih djai laih, anăm pơgŭn Nai dơ̆ng ôh.”
But Jesus, hearing it, answered him saying, Fear not: only believe, and she shall be made well. @ Samơ̆ tơ Yêsu hmư̆ tơlơi anŭn, Ñu laĭ kơ khua wai sang bơjơnum anŭn: “Anăm hwĭ ôh, kơnơ̆ng đaŏ đôč, ană dra ih či hơdip.”
And when he came to the house he suffered no one to go in but Peter and John and James and the father of the child and the mother. @ Tơ Yêsu truh pơ sang, Ñu ƀu brơi sa čô mŭt hrŏm hăng Ñu ôh, kơnơ̆ng Pêtrôs, Yôhan, Yakơ, laih anŭn amĭ ama čơđai anŭn. 
And all were weeping and lamenting her. But he said, Do not weep, for she has not died, but sleeps. @ Abih bang hlăk dŏ čŏk hia rơngot kơ đah kơmơi anŭn; samơ̆ Yêsu laĭ: “Anăm čŏk hia ôh, yua kơ gơ̆ ƀu djai ôh, samơ̆ gơ̆ dŏ pĭt đôč.”
And they derided him, knowing that she had died. @ Ƀing anŭn klao mưč kơ Yêsu, yua kơ gơñu thâo čơđai anŭn djai laih. 
But *he*, having turned them all out and taking hold of her hand, cried saying, Child, arise. @ Samơ̆ Yêsu djă tơngan gơ̆ hăng laĭ: “Ơ mŏ, tơgŭ bĕ.” 
And her spirit returned, and immediately she rose up; and he commanded [something] to eat to be given to her. @ Bơngăt gơ̆ wơ̆t glaĭ pơ gơ̆ dơ̆ng laih anŭn gơ̆ tơgŭ mơtam. Yêsu pơđar arăng ba mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă kơ gơ̆. 
And her parents were amazed; but he enjoined them to tell no one what had happened. @ Amĭ ama gơ̆ hling hlang biă mă; samơ̆ Yêsu pơtă kơ gơñu anăm ruai kơ hlơi hlơi ôh hơgĕt tơlơi hmâo truh laih.
And having called together the twelve, he gave them power and authority over all demons, and to heal diseases, @ Yêsu iâu pơƀŭt glaĭ pluh dua čô khua ding kơna, pha brơi kơ gơñu tơlơi dưi mơyang laih anŭn tơlơi dưi kiăng puh pơđuaĭ abih bang yang sat, laih anŭn tơlơi dưi pơsuaih tơlơi duăm ruă. 
and sent them to proclaim the kingdom of God and to heal the sick. @ Yêsu pơkiaŏ nao gơñu pơtô tơlơi Dêh Čar Pơtao Ơi Adai laih anŭn pơsuaih ƀing mơnuih duăm ruă. 
And he said to them, Take nothing for the way, neither staff, nor scrip, nor bread, nor money; nor to have two body-coats apiece. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Anăm djă ba sa mơta gơnam hơgĕt ôh kơ tơlơi ƀing gih hyu. Anăm djă ba gai jra, kơdŭng, ƀañ tơpŭng, ƀôdah prăk ôh; laih anŭn anăm ba dua blah ao ôh. 
And into whatsoever house ye enter, there abide and thence go forth. @ Sang hlơi ƀing gih mŭt, dŏ bĕ pơ anŭn tơl ƀing gih đuaĭ. 
And as many as may not receive you, going forth from that city, shake off even the dust from your feet for a witness against them. @ Laih anŭn anih pă arăng ƀu jum ƀing gih ôh, tơbiă bĕ mơ̆ng plei anŭn, tơtuh hĭ ƀruih lŏn mơ̆ng tơkai ƀing gih jing tơlơi ngă gơ̆ng jơlan pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ hăng gơñu.”
And going forth they passed through the villages, announcing the glad tidings and healing everywhere. @ Ƀing gơñu nao laih anŭn găn lu boh plei, pơtô Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam tar ƀar anih laih anŭn pơsuaih ƀing duăm ruă.
And Herod the tetrarch heard of all the things which were done [by him], and was in perplexity, because it was said by some that John was risen from among [the] dead, @ Hlăk anŭn pơtao Hêrôt, pô wai lăng tring Galilê hmư̆ abih tơlơi truh laih, laih anŭn ñu rŭng răng, yua kơ ƀing anai laĭ Yôhan hơdip glaĭ laih mơ̆ng ƀing djai. 
and by some that Elias had appeared, and by others that one of the old prophets had risen again. @ Ƀing pơkŏn laĭ Êli hmâo pơrơđah rai, laih anŭn ƀing pơkŏn dơ̆ng laĭ sa čô amăng ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo rơnŭk đưm hmâo hơdip glaĭ. 
And Herod said, John *I* have beheaded, but who is this of whom I hear such things? and he sought to see him. @ Hêrôt laĭ: “Kâo čơ̆ng laih tơkuai Yôhan, samơ̆ hlơi pô anai kâo hmư̆ lu tơlơi ră ruai kơ ñu?” Laih anŭn Hêrôt hơduah jơlan kiăng ƀuh Yêsu.
And the apostles having returned related to him whatever they had done. And he took them and withdrew apart into [a desert place of] a city called Bethsaida. @ Tơ ƀing khua ding kơna wơ̆t glaĭ, gơñu ră ruai kơ Yêsu abih tơlơi gơñu hmâo ngă laih. Yêsu ba gơñu nao hơjăn pơ sa boh plei anăn plei Bêtsaida. 
But the crowds knowing [it] followed him; and he received them and spake to them of the kingdom of God, and cured those that had need of healing. @ Tơ ƀing mơnuih lu thâo tơlơi anŭn, gơñu đuaĭ tui Yêsu. Yêsu jum ƀing gơ̆ laih anŭn pơtô tơlơi dêh čar pơtao Ơi Adai kơ ƀing gơñu, laih anŭn pơsuaih brơi tơlơi duăm ruă kơ ƀing hlơi kiăng suaih.
But the day began to decline, and the twelve came and said to him, Send away the crowd that they may go into the villages around, and [into] the fields, and lodge and find victuals, for here we are in a desert place. @ Adai čơdơ̆ng klam yơh, laih anŭn ƀing pluh dua čô khua ding kơna rai laĭ kơ Yêsu: “Brơi ƀing ană plei pla glaĭ bĕ kiăng kơ gơñu nao amăng khul plei jum dar, kiăng kơ hơduah mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă laih anŭn anih pĭt đih. Yua kơ ƀing ta hlăk dŏ anai jing anih tơdrŏn tač.”
And he said to them, Give *ye them to eat. And they said, We have not more than five loaves and two fishes, unless *we* should go and buy food for all this people; @ Samơ̆ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Ƀing gih yơh brơi mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă kơ gơñu.”
Gơñu laĭ: “Gơmơi hmâo kơnơ̆ng rơma klŏ ƀañ tơpŭng hăng dua drơi akan đôč, kơnơ̆ng gơmơi khŏm nao blơi mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă kơ abih bang ƀing mơnuih lu anai.” 
for they were about five thousand men. And he said to his disciples, Make them sit down in companies by fifties. @ Yua kơ pơ anai hmâo giăm rơma rơbâo čô đah rơkơi. Yêsu laĭ kơ ƀing ding kơna Ñu: “Brơi gơñu dŏ ber bĕ tui hăng bôr, rĭm bôr rơma pluh čô.”
And they did so, and made them all sit down. @ Ƀing ding kơna ngă tui anŭn yơh, laih anŭn brơi abih bang ƀing gơñu dŏ ber. 
And taking the five loaves and the two fishes, looking up to heaven he blessed them, and broke and gave to the disciples to set before the crowd. @ Yêsu mă rơma klŏ ƀañ tơpŭng hăng dua drơi akan anŭn, Ñu angak mơta pơ adai, bơni hơơč kơ Ơi Adai laih anŭn wơ̆k ƀañ tơpŭng, brơi kơ ƀing ding kơna pơpha brơi kơ ƀing mơnuih lu. 
And they all ate and were filled; and there was taken up of what had remained over and above to them in fragments twelve hand-baskets. @ Abih bang ƀơ̆ng laih anŭn trơi soh sel, laih anŭn gơñu duñ pơƀŭt čơđeh meh ƀañ tơpŭng, akan rơbeh anŭn bă pluh dua bai.
And it came to pass as he was praying alone, his disciples were with him, and he asked them saying, Who do the crowds say that I am? @ Sa hrơi tơdang Yêsu dŏ iâu laĭ hơjăn Ñu, ƀing ding kơna nao dŏ jum dar Ñu, Yêsu tơña kơ ƀing gơñu: “Hlơi Kâo jing tui hăng ƀing ană plei pla laĭ?”
But they answering said, John the baptist; but others, Elias; and others, that one of the old prophets has risen again. @ Gơñu laĭ glaĭ: “Yôhan ngă ƀatem, samơ̆ hmâo đơđa pơkŏn laĭ Êli, đơđa pơkŏn dơ̆ng laĭ sa čô amăng ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo rơnŭk đưm hơdip glaĭ.”
And he said to them, But *ye*, who do ye say that I am? And Peter answering said, The Christ of God. @ Yêsu tơña kơ gơñu dơ̆ng: “Samơ̆ ƀing gih laĭ hlơi Kâo jing?”
Pêtrôs laĭ glaĭ: “Ih jing Yang Krist mơ̆ng Ơi Adai.”
But, earnestly charging them, he enjoined [them] to say this to no man, @ Yêsu khă laih anŭn pơđar kơ ƀing gơñu anăm pơhaih tơlơi anŭn kơ arăng ôh, 
saying, The Son of man must suffer many things, and be rejected of the elders and chief priests and scribes, and be killed, and the third day be raised up. @ Ñu laĭ: “Ană Mơnuih khŏm tŭ lu tơlơi tơnap tap, mơ̆ng ƀing kŏng tha, ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng laih anŭn ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt hơngah lui, Ñu khŏm tŭ tơlơi arăng pơdjai, truh hrơi tal klâo Ñu khŏm hơdip glaĭ.”
And he said to [them] all, If any one will come after me, let him deny himself and take up his cross daily and follow me; @ Laih anŭn Yêsu laĭ kơ abih bang gơñu: “Tơdah hlơi pô kiăng đuaĭ tui Kâo, brơi ñu khŏm hơngah hĭ ñu pô, rĭm hrơi glăm kơyâo bơrơkal ñu pô hăng đuaĭ tui Kâo. 
for whosoever shall desire to save his life shall lose it, but whosoever shall lose his life for my sake, *he* shall save it. @ Yua kơ hlơi kiăng pơklaih tơlơi hơdip ñu, ñu či rơngiă, samơ̆ hlơi pô rơngiă tơlơi hơdip ñu yua kơ Kâo ñu či hmâo glaĭ tơlơi hơdip ñu. 
For what shall a man profit if he shall have gained the whole world, and have destroyed, or come under the penalty of the loss of himself? @ Hơgĕt tơlơi tŭ yua kơ sa čô mơnuih tơdah ñu hmâo abih lŏn tơnah samơ̆ ñu pô răm rai laih anŭn rơngiă hĭ? 
For whosoever shall have been ashamed of me and of my words, of him will the Son of man be ashamed when he shall come in his glory, and [in that] of the Father, and of the holy angels. @ Yua kơ hlơi pô mlâo kơ Kâo laih anŭn kơ boh pơhiăp Kâo, Ană Mơnuih či mlâo kơ pô anŭn hlăk hrơi Ñu rai dơ̆ng amăng tơlơi guh kơang Ñu, tơlơi guh kơang ama Ñu, laih anŭn tơlơi guh kơang ƀing ling jang rơgoh hiam Ñu. 
But I say unto you of a truth, There are some of those standing here who shall not taste death until they shall have seen the kingdom of God. @ Samơ̆ sĭt biă mă Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, hmâo đơđa ƀing dŏ pơ anai ƀu či djai ôh hlâo kơ gơñu ƀuh Dêh Čar Pơtao Ơi Adai.”
And it came to pass after these words, about eight days, that taking Peter and John and James he went up into a mountain to pray. @ Amăng sapăn hrơi tơdơi giơ̆ng Ñu pơhiăp khul tơlơi anŭn, Yêsu jak ba hrŏm hăng Ñu Pêtrôs, Yôhan laih anŭn Yakơ, đĭ pơ čư̆ kiăng kơ iâu laĭ. 
And as he prayed the fashion of his countenance became different and his raiment white [and] effulgent. @ Tơdang Ñu iâu laĭ ƀô̆ mơta Ñu pơplih hĭ, ao Ñu jing kŏ laih anŭn bơngač kơmlă biă mă. 
And lo, two men talked with him, who were Moses and Elias, @ Laih anŭn plŭt hmâo dua čô đah rơkơi, Môis hăng Êli dŏ pơhiăp hăng Ñu. 
who, appearing in glory, spoke of his departure which he was about to accomplish in Jerusalem. @ Gơñu pơƀuh rai amăng tơlơi guh kơang laih anŭn pơhiăp kơ tơlơi Yêsu či djai, jing bruă Ñu či ngă pơsĭt pơ plei Yêrusalem. 
But Peter and those with him were oppressed with sleep: but having fully awoke up they saw his glory, and the two men who stood with him. @ Pêtrôs hăng ƀing hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ñu mơhao pĭt biă mă, samơ̆ tơ gơñu amlư̆ mơdưh, gơñu ƀuh tơlơi guh kơang Yêsu hăng dua čô đah rơkơi dŏ dơ̆ng hăng Ñu. 
And it came to pass as they departed from him, Peter said to Jesus, Master, it is good for us to be here; and let us make three tabernacles, one for thee, and one for Moses, and one for Elias: not knowing what he said. @ Hlăk dua čô đah rơkơi anŭn đuaĭ mơ̆ng Yêsu, Pêtrôs laĭ hăng Ñu: “Ơ Nai, hiam yơh ƀing ta dŏ ƀơi anai; brơi gơmơi ngă klâo boh sang khăn: sa boh kơ Ih, sa kơ Môis laih anŭn sa boh kơ Êli.” Pêtrôs pơhiăp samơ̆ ƀu thâo ôh hơgĕt tơlơi ñu hlăk pơhiăp. 
But as he was saying these things, there came a cloud and overshadowed them, and they feared as they entered into the cloud: @ Tơdang Pêtrôs hlăk pơhiăp tơlơi anŭn, hmâo kơthul rai gom hĭ ƀing gơñu, laih anŭn ƀing gơñu hwĭ biă mă tơdang ƀuh kơthul gom gơñu. 
and there was a voice out of the cloud saying, *This* is my beloved Son: hear him. @ Laih anŭn hmâo asăp pơhiăp mơ̆ng kơthul laĭ: “Pô anai jing ană Kâo, pô Kâo hmâo ruah laih, brơi ƀing gih dŏ hmư̆ Ñu bĕ.” 
And as the voice was [heard] Jesus was found alone: and *they* kept silence, and told no one in those days any of the things they had seen. @ Tơ asăp pơhiăp anŭn abih laih, kơnơ̆ng hơjăn Yêsu đôč dŏ ƀơi anŭn. Amăng khul hrơi anŭn, ƀing ding kơna Ñu dŏ rơiăt, ƀu hmâo ră ruai kơ arăng ôh hơdôm tơlơi hơgĕt gơñu hmâo ƀuh laih.
And it came to pass on the following day, when they came down from the mountain, a great crowd met him. @ Ƀơi hrơi tơdơi anŭn tơdang gơñu trŭn laih mơ̆ng čư̆, sa phung mơnuih lu bưp Yêsu. 
And lo, a man from the crowd cried out saying, Teacher, I beseech thee look upon my son, for he is mine only child: @ Laih anŭn anai nê, mơ̆ng tơ̆ng krah phung mơnuih lu sa čô đah rơkơi ur laĭ: “Ơ Nai, kâo kơwưh kơ Ih, rơkâo kơ Ih pap drap kơ ană đah rơkơi kâo đa, yua kơ kâo hmâo kơnơ̆ng sa čô anai đôč. 
and behold, a spirit takes him, and suddenly he cries out, and it tears him with foaming, and with difficulty departs from him after crushing him. @ Tơ yang sat ngă kơ ñu, tŏ tơnŏ ñu ur kraih laih anŭn yang sat hơprah añăk ñu tơl blôk ia bah, ngă pơruă gơ̆ laih anŭn gleh biă mă ñu tơbiă mơ̆ng gơ̆. 
And I besought thy disciples that they might cast him out, and they could not. @ Kâo hmâo kơwưh laih kơ ƀing ding kơna Ih puh pơđuaĭ yang sat anai, samơ̆ gơñu ƀu dưi puh pơđuaĭ ôh.”
And Jesus answering said, O unbelieving and perverted generation, how long shall I be with you and suffer you? Bring hither thy son. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Ơ kơnŭng djuai ƀu hmâo tơlơi đaŏ laih anŭn kơpĭl, hơdôm sui dơ̆ng Kâo či dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt laih anŭn gir hăng ƀing gih? Ba ană đah rơkơi ih pơ anai bĕ.”
But as he was yet coming, the demon tore him and dragged him all together. And Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit, and healed the child and gave him back to his father. @ Tơdang gơ̆ rai, yang sat hơprah gơ̆ ƀơi lŏn, laih anŭn pơkơñak gơ̆. Samơ̆ Yêsu ƀuah yang bơngăt grĭ hơƀak anŭn, pơsuaih čơđai anŭn laih anŭn jao glaĭ kơ ama ñu.
And all were astonished at the glorious greatness of God. And as all wondered at all the things which [Jesus] did, he said to his disciples, @ Abih bang mơnuih hling hlang kơ tơlơi dưi mơyang Ơi Adai. Tơdang abih bang dŏ hling hlang kơ abih tơlơi Yêsu hmâo ngă laih, Ñu laĭ kơ ƀing ding kơna Ñu tui anai: 
Do *ye* let these words sink into your ears. For the Son of man is about to be delivered into men's hands. @ “Brơi ƀing gih hmư̆ pơñen bĕ khul tơlơi anai: Arăng či jao hĭ Ană Mơnuih amăng tơngan ƀing mơnuih.” 
But they understood not this saying, and it was hid from them that they should not perceive it. And they feared to ask him concerning this saying. @ Samơ̆ ƀing ding kơna ƀu thâo hluh ôh boh pơhiăp anŭn. Tơlơi anŭn jing hơgơ̆m kơ gơñu, gơñu ƀu dưi thâo hluh ôh tơlơi anŭn, samơ̆ gơñu hwĭ ƀu khĭn tơña ôh kơ Yêsu khul tơlơi pơhiăp anŭn.
And a reasoning came in amongst them, who should be [the] greatest of them. @ Ƀing ding kơna pơrơjah tơdruă gơñu kơ tơlơi hlơi pô jing prŏng hloh amăng ƀing gơñu. 
And Jesus, seeing the reasoning of their heart, having taken a little child set it by him, @ Samơ̆ Yêsu thâo tơlơi pơmĭn amăng pran jua gơñu, hnŭn yơh Yêsu mă sa čô čơđai anĕt laih anŭn pioh gơ̆ ƀơi djeo Ñu, 
and said to them, Whosoever shall receive this little child in my name receives me, and whosoever shall receive me receives him that sent me. For he who is the least among you all, *he* is great. @ laih anŭn laĭ kơ gơñu: “Hlơi pô jum čơđai anĕt anai yua kơ anăn Kâo kar hăng jum Kâo mơ̆n; laih anŭn hlơi pô jum Kâo kar hăng jum Pô hmâo pơkiaŏ rai Kâo laih. Yua kơ hlơi pô jing anĕt hloh kơ abih bang amăng ƀing gih, pô anŭn yơh jing prŏng hloh.”
And John answering said, Master, we saw some one casting out demons in thy name, and we forbad him, because he follows not with us. @ Yôhan laĭ: “Ơ Nai, gơmơi hmâo ƀuh laih sa čô mơnuih puh pơđuaĭ yang sat amăng anăn Ih, laih anŭn gơmơi khă ñu, yua kơ ñu ƀu tui ƀing ta ôh.” 
And Jesus said to him, Forbid [him] not, for he that is not against you is for you. @ Samơ̆ Yêsu laĭ kơ Yôhan: “Anăm khă ñu ôh, yua kơ hlơi pô ƀu pơkơdơ̆ng hăng ƀing gih jing pô anŭn gah kơ ƀing gih.”
And it came to pass when the days of his receiving up were fulfilled, that *he* stedfastly set his face to go to Jerusalem. @ Tơ giăm truh hrơi arăng či pŭ ba Yêsu pơ adai, Ñu khư̆p ư nao pơ plei Yêrusalem. 
And he sent messengers before his face. And having gone they entered into a village of the Samaritans that they might make ready for him. @ Yêsu pơkiaŏ ƀing pô pơala nao hlâo kơ Ñu. Gơñu nao laih anŭn mŭt amăng sa boh plei ƀing Samari kiăng prăp rơmet anih kơ Yêsu. 
And they did not receive him, because his face was [turned as] going to Jerusalem. @ Samơ̆ ƀing ană plei ƀu jum Ñu ôh yua kơ gơñu thâo Yêsu anăp nao tơpă plei Yêrusalem. 
And his disciples James and John seeing [it] said, Lord, wilt thou that we speak [that] fire come down from heaven and consume them, as also Elias did? @ Tơ ƀing ding kơna Ñu Yakơ hăng Yôhan ƀuh tơlơi anŭn, gơñu laĭ: “Ơ Khua Yang, Ih kiăng mơ̆ gơmơi pơđar kơ apui trŭn mơ̆ng adai čuh hĭ gơñu?” 
But turning he rebuked them [and said, Ye know not of what spirit ye are]. @ Samơ̆ Yêsu wir lăng laih anŭn ƀuah kơ gơñu. 
And they went to another village. @ Giơ̆ng anŭn gơñu hlŏng nao pơ sa boh plei pơkŏn.
And it came to pass as they went in the way, one said to him, I will follow thee wheresoever thou goest, Lord. @ Tơdang gơñu rơbat rŏk jơlan, hmâo sa čô mơnuih laĭ hăng Yêsu: “Kâo či đuaĭ tui Ih pơpă anih Ih nao.”
And Jesus said to him, The foxes have holes and the birds of the heaven roosting-places, but the Son of man has not where he may lay his head. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Pơja hmâo amăng, čĭm amăng adai hmâo hruh, samơ̆ Ană Mơnuih ƀu hmâo anih đăl akŏ ôh.”
And he said to another, Follow me. But he said, Lord, allow me to go first and bury my father. @ Yêsu laĭ hăng sa čô pô pơkŏn: “Đuaĭ tui Kâo bĕ.” Samơ̆ ñu laĭ: “Ơ Khua Yang, brơi kâo glaĭ dơr hĭ ama kâo hlâo amơĭ.”
But Jesus said to him, Suffer the dead to bury their own dead, but do *thou* go and announce the kingdom of God. @ Samơ̆ Yêsu laĭ kơ ñu: “Lui ƀing djai dơr mă ƀing djai gơñu pô; bơ ih nao bĕ pơhaih Dêh Čar Pơtao Ơi Adai.”
And another also said, I will follow thee, Lord, but first allow me to bid adieu to those at my house. @ Sa čô pơkŏn laĭ: “Ơ Khua Yang, kâo či đuaĭ tui Ih, samơ̆ blŭng hlâo brơi kâo nao laĭ pơthâo hăng kơnŭng djuai kâo amơĭ.”
But Jesus said to him, No one having laid his hand on [the] plough and looking back is fit for the kingdom of God. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ ñu: “Hlơi pô djă wăng čuar samơ̆ ăt dŏ lăng glaĭ pơ klon ƀu năng lăp kơ Dêh Čar Pơtao Ơi Adai ôh.”
Now after these things the Lord appointed seventy others also, and sent them two and two before his face into every city and place where he himself was about to come. @ Tơdơi kơ anŭn Khua Yang ruah tơjuh pluh čô ding kơna pơkŏn laih anŭn pơkiaŏ ƀing gơñu tơdua čô nao hlâo kơ Ñu amăng abih bang plei laih anŭn anih Ñu pô či nao. 
And he said to them, The harvest indeed [is] great, but the workmen few; supplicate therefore the Lord of the harvest that he may send out workmen into his harvest. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Lu biă mă pơdai tơsă, samơ̆ mơnuih hơpuă ƀiă đôč. Tui anŭn, rơkâo bĕ kơ Khua pô hmua pơkiaŏ nao ƀing mă bruă nao hơpuă pơdai Ñu. 
Go: behold *I* send you forth as lambs in the midst of wolves. @ Nao bĕ, anai nê Kâo pơkiaŏ nao ƀing gih kar hăng ană triu tŏng krah khul asâo tan. 
Carry neither purse nor scrip nor sandals, and salute no one on the way. @ Anăm djă ba kơdŭng prăk, kơƀao, klĭ juă, laih anŭn anăm kơkuh kơ arăng rŏk jơlan ôh. 
And into whatsoever house ye enter, first say, Peace to this house. @ Hlơi sang ƀing gih mŭt, blŭng hlâo laĭ bĕ: ‘Rơkâo tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua dŏ amăng sang anai!’ 
And if a son of peace be there, your peace shall rest upon it; but if not it shall turn to you again. @ Tơdah pơ anŭn hmâo mơnuih lăp tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua, tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua ƀing gih či dŏ ƀơi ñu. Samơ̆ tơdah ƀu hmâo tui anŭn ôh tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua či glaĭ kơ ƀing gih pô. 
And in the same house abide, eating and drinking such things as they have; for the workman is worthy of his hire. Remove not from house to house. @ Dŏ bĕ amăng sang anŭn, ƀơ̆ng huă laih anŭn mơñum hơgĕt mơnơ̆ng arăng či brơi kơ ƀing gih, yua kơ mơnuih mă bruă năng lăp kơ tơlơi apah. Anăm đuaĭ mơ̆ng sang anai nao pơ sang pơkŏn ôh. 
And into whatsoever city ye may enter and they receive you, eat what is set before you, @ Tơdah ƀing gih mŭt amăng sa boh plei pă arăng tŭ jum ƀing gih, brơi ƀing gih ƀơ̆ng huă hơgĕt mơnơ̆ng arăng pŭ brơi kơ ƀing gih. 
and heal the sick in it, and say to them, The kingdom of God is come nigh to you. @ Pơsuaih bĕ ƀing duăm ruă amăng plei anŭn laih anŭn laĭ kơ gơñu: ‘Dêh Čar Pơtao Ơi Adai truh giăm kơ ƀing gih laih.’ 
But into whatsoever city ye may have entered and they do not receive you, go out into its streets and say, @ Samơ̆ tơdah ƀing gih mŭt amăng sa boh plei pă arăng ƀu tŭ jum ƀing gih ôh, nao bĕ pơ jơlan laih anŭn laĭ, 
Even the dust of your city, which cleaves to us on the feet, do we shake off against you; but know this, that the kingdom of God is come nigh. @ ‘Wơ̆t ƀruih lŏn plei ƀing gih đom ƀơi tơkai gơmơi, gơmơi ăt tơtuh hĭ mơ̆n kiăng pơkơdơ̆ng hăng ƀing gih. Samơ̆ brơi ƀing gih thâo kơ Dêh Čar Pơtao Ơi Adai giăm truh laih.’ 
I say to you that it shall be more tolerable for Sodom in that day than for that city. @ Kâo laĭ hăng ƀing gih, amăng hrơi phat kơđi plei Sôđôm či hmâo tơlơi phat kơđi plai ƀiă hăng plei anŭn.”
Woe to thee, Chorazin! woe to thee, Bethsaida! for if the works of power which have taken place in you had taken place in Tyre and Sidon, they had long ago repented, sitting in sackcloth and ashes. @ “Răm ƀăm yơh kơ ih, Ơ Plei Kôrasin! Răm ƀăm yơh kơ ih, Ơ Plei Bêtsaida! Yua kơ tơdah tơlơi mơsêh mơyang hmâo ngă tơ̆ng krah ƀing gih, hmâo ngă hĭ laih amăng plei Tir hăng plei Sidôn, ƀing gơñu kơhmal tơlơi soh ƀing gơñu mơ̆ng sui laih, buh ao kơƀao laih anŭn pruai pur ƀơi drơi jan gơñu. 
But it shall be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon in the judgment than for you. @ Samơ̆ ƀơi hrơi phat kơđi, plei Tir hăng plei Sidôn či hmâo tơlơi pơkơhmal plai ƀiă hăng ƀing gih. 
And *thou*, Capernaum, who hast been raised up to heaven, shalt be brought down even to hades. @ Laih anŭn bơ ih, ơ plei Kapernum, Ơi Adai či yŏng pơđĭ ih truh pơ adai mơ̆? Ư ưh, Ơi Adai či plĕ trŭn ih truh pơ plei ƀing djai!
He that hears you hears me; and he that rejects you rejects me; and he that rejects me rejects him that sent me. @ Hlơi pô dŏ hmư̆ ƀing gih ñu dŏ hmư̆ Kâo yơh; laih anŭn hlơi pô hơngah ƀing gih ñu hơngah Kâo mơ̆n; laih anŭn hlơi pô hơngah Kâo ñu hơngah kơ Pô pơkiaŏ rai Kâo mơ̆n.”
And the seventy returned with joy, saying, Lord, even the demons are subject to us through thy name. @ Tơjuh pluh čô ƀing ding kơna wơ̆t glaĭ hăng tơlơi hơ̆k mơak gơñu laĭ: “Ơ Khua Yang, amăng anăn Ih wơ̆t kơ ƀing yang sat ăt gưt kơ gơmơi mơ̆n!”
And he said to them, I beheld Satan as lightning falling out of heaven. @ Yêsu laĭ gơñu: “Kâo ƀuh laih satan lĕ trŭn mơ̆ng adai kar hăng kơmlă. 
Behold, I give you the power of treading upon serpents and scorpions and over all the power of the enemy, and nothing shall in anywise injure you. @ Anai nê, Kâo hmâo pha brơi laih kơ ƀing gih tơlơi dưi kiăng kơ juă hĭ ala, aguăt, laih anŭn abih tơlơi dưi kơtang pô ayăt gah yŭ tơkai ƀing gih; ƀu hmâo sa tơlơi hơgĕt dưi ngă sat kơ ƀing gih ôh. 
Yet in this rejoice not, that the spirits are subjected to you, but rejoice that your names are written in the heavens. @ Wơ̆t tui anŭn, anăm hơ̆k mơak ôh yua kơ ƀing yang sat gưt kơ ƀing gih, samơ̆ hơ̆k mơak bĕ yua kơ anăn ƀing gih hmâo čih laih amăng adai.”
In the same hour Jesus rejoiced in spirit and said, I praise thee, Father, Lord of the heaven and of the earth, that thou hast hid these things from wise and prudent, and hast revealed them to babes: yea, Father, for thus has it been well-pleasing in thy sight. @ Hlăk mông anŭn, Yêsu hmâo tơlơi hơ̆k mơak mơ̆ng Yang Bơngăt Hiam laih anŭn laĭ: “Ơ Ama, Khua kơ adai laih anŭn lŏn tơnah, kâo bơni hơơč kơ Ih yua kơ Ih hmâo pơdŏp laih khul tơlơi anai kơ ƀing mơnuih kơhnâo, ƀing mơnuih rơgơi, samơ̆ Ih hmâo bơrơđah laih tơlơi anai kơ ƀing čơđai anĕt. Sĭt yơh, Ơ Ama yua kơ tơlơi anŭn bơmơak kơ Ih.
All things have been delivered to me by my Father, and no one knows who the Son is but the Father, and who the Father is but the Son, and he to whomsoever the Son is pleased to reveal [him]. @ Abih bang mơnơ̆ng Ama hmâo jao laih kơ Kâo. Ƀu hmâo hlơi thâo krăn Ană ôh, kơnơ̆ng hơjăn Ama thâo; kŏn hmâo hlơi thâo krăn Ama lơi, kơnơ̆ng hơjăn Ană thâo laih anŭn kơ hlơi pô Ană kiăng bơrơđah Ama kơ ñu.”
And having turned to the disciples privately he said, Blessed are the eyes which see the things that ye see. @ Laih anŭn Ñu wir lăng ƀing ding kơna hăng laĭ kơ hơjăn gơñu: “Mơyun hiam yơh kơ mơta dưi ƀuh tơlơi ƀing gih ƀuh ră anai! 
For I say to you that many prophets and kings have desired to see the things which ye behold, and did not see [them]; and to hear the things which ye hear, and did not hear [them]. @ Yua kơ Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, hmâo lu ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo laih anŭn ƀing pơtao kiăng lăng tơlơi ƀing gih ƀuh, samơ̆ ƀu ƀuh ôh, laih anŭn kiăng hmư̆ tơlơi ƀing gih hmư̆, samơ̆ ƀu hmư̆ ôh.”
And behold, a certain lawyer stood up tempting him, and saying, Teacher, having done what, shall I inherit life eternal? @ Hlăk anŭn, hmâo sa čô nai tơlơi juăt tơgŭ tơña kiăng lông lăng Yêsu hăng laĭ: “Ơ Nai, hơgĕt kâo khŏm ngă kiăng kơ dưi hmâo tơlơi hơdip hlŏng lar?” 
And he said to him, What is written in the law? how readest thou? @ Yêsu laĭ kơ ñu: “Hơgĕt arăng čih laih amăng tơlơi juăt? Hơgĕt tơlơi ih ƀuh amăng anŭn?” 
But he answering said, Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy strength, and with all thine understanding; and thy neighbour as thyself. @ Ñu laĭ glaĭ: “Ih khŏm khăp kơ Khua Yang Ơi Adai ih hăng abih pran jua, hăng abih bơngăt, hăng abih tơlơi kơtang, laih anŭn hăng abih tơlơi pơmĭn laih anŭn khăp kơ pô jum dar ih kar hăng kơ ih pô.”
