And he said to him, Thou hast answered right: this do and thou shalt live. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ ñu: “Ih laĭ glaĭ djơ̆ biă mă; ngă bĕ tui anŭn laih anŭn ih či hơdip.”
But he, desirous of justifying himself, said to Jesus, And who is my neighbour? @ Samơ̆ ñu kiăng pơrơđah pô ñu jing pô tơpă hơnơ̆ng, tui anŭn ñu laĭ kơ Yêsu: “Hlơi jing pô jum dar kâo?”
And Jesus replying said, A certain man descended from Jerusalem to Jericho and fell into [the hands of] robbers, who also, having stripped him and inflicted wounds, went away leaving him in a half-dead state. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Sa čô mơnuih đah rơkơi trŭn mơ̆ng plei Yêrusalem nao pơ plei Yêrikô, gơ̆ bưp ƀing klĕ dŏp. Ƀing anŭn toh mă hĭ sum ao gơ̆, taih gơ̆ tơl djai mol laih anŭn lui hĭ gơ̆. 
And a certain priest happened to go down that way, and seeing him, passed on on the opposite side; @ Hmâo sa čô khua ngă yang rơbat ƀơi jơlan anŭn. Tơ ñu ƀuh gơ̆, ñu weh đuaĭ hĭ. 
and in like manner also a Levite, being at the spot, came and looked [at him] and passed on on the opposite side. @ Kar kaĭ mơ̆n hmâo sa čô mơnuih Lêwi, tơ ñu truh ƀơi anih anŭn, ƀuh gơ̆ ñu ăt weh đuaĭ laih anŭn rơbat nao. 
But a certain Samaritan journeying came to him, and seeing [him], was moved with compassion, @ Samơ̆ hmâo sa čô mơnuih Samari rơbat ƀơi jơlan anŭn, truh giăm anih pô rơka dŏ anŭn. Tơ ñu ƀuh gơ̆, ñu hmâo tơlơi pap biă mă. 
and came up [to him] and bound up his wounds, pouring in oil and wine; and having put him on his own beast, took him to [the] inn and took care of him. @ Ñu nao pơ gơ̆, ñu mă ia ôliwơ hăng ia tơpai pơjrao laih anŭn pŏn hĭ anih rơka gơ̆; giơ̆ng anŭn ñu brơi gơ̆ đĭ aseh ñu pô, hăng ba nao gơ̆ pơ sang jưh, kiăng kơ wai lăng gơ̆, 
And on the morrow [as he left], taking out two denarii he gave them to the innkeeper, and said to him, Take care of him, and whatsoever thou shalt expend more, *I* will render to thee on my coming back. @ Hrơi tơdơi, ñu mă dua đơniê brơi kơ pô sang jưh hăng laĭ ‘Brơi ih wai lăng ñu, laih anŭn hơgĕt ih či pơhuač rơgao hloh dơ̆ng, tơ kâo wơ̆t glaĭ kâo či kla kơ ih dơ̆ng.’
Which [now] of these three seems to thee to have been neighbour of him who fell into [the hands of] the robbers? @ Hlơi amăng klâo čô anŭn tui hăng ih pơmĭn jing pô jum dar kơ pô bưp hăng ƀing mơnuih klĕ dŏp anŭn?”
And he said, He that shewed him mercy. And Jesus said to him, Go, and do *thou* likewise. @ Nai tơlơi juăt laĭ glaĭ: “Pô hmâo bơrơđah laih tơlơi pap drap kơ pô bưp ƀing klĕ dŏp yơh.”
Yêsu laĭ kơ ñu: “Nao bĕ laih anŭn ngă kar hăng anŭn.”
And it came to pass as they went that *he* entered into a certain village; and a certain woman, Martha by name, received him into her house. @ Tơdang Yêsu hăng ƀing ding kơna Ñu hyu pơtô. Gơñu truh pơ sa boh plei; hmâo sa čô đah kơmơi anăn gơ̆ HʼMart jak jum Ñu amăng sang gơ̆. 
And she had a sister called Mary, who also, having sat down at the feet of Jesus was listening to his word. @ Ñu hmâo sa čô adơi đah kơmơi anăn HʼMari. HʼMari dŏ ber ƀơi tơkai Khua Yang kiăng kơ hmư̆ tơlơi Ñu pơtô. 
Now Martha was distracted with much serving, and coming up she said, Lord, dost thou not care that my sister has left me to serve alone? Speak to her therefore that she may help me. @ Samơ̆ HʼMart gŭn yua kơ hăt buih bruă. Tui anŭn ñu nao pơ Yêsu laih anŭn laĭ: “Ơ Khua, Ih ƀu bơngơ̆t ôh hă adơi kâo lui hơjăn kâo pơkra mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă? Tui anŭn rơkâo kơ Ih laĭ kơ ñu gŭm djru kâo đa.”
But Jesus answering said to her, Martha, Martha, thou art careful and troubled about many things; @ Khua Yang laĭ kơ gơ̆: “Ơ HʼMart, HʼMart, ih ƀlơ̆ng bơngơ̆t laih anŭn rŭng răng yua kơ lu bruă; 
but there is need of one, and Mary has chosen the good part, the which shall not be taken from her. @ samơ̆ kơnơ̆ng hmâo sa mơta bruă kiăng đôč. HʼMari hmâo ruah mă laih gah hiam anŭn, jing tơlơi arăng ƀu či dưi sua mă mơ̆ng ñu ôh.”
And it came to pass as he was in a certain place praying, when he ceased, one of his disciples said to him, Lord, teach us to pray, even as John also taught his disciples. @ Sa hrơi Yêsu dŏ iâu laĭ ƀơi sa anih. Tơ iâu laĭ giơ̆ng hmâo sa čô amăng ding kơna Ñu rơkâo kơ Ñu: “Ơ Khua Yang, rơkâo kơ Ih pơtô gơmơi iâu laĭ kar hăng Yôhan hmâo pơtô laih ƀing ding kơna ñu.” 
And he said to them, When ye pray, say, Father, thy name be hallowed; thy kingdom come; @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Tơdang ƀing gih iâu laĭ, laĭ bĕ tui anai:
‘Ơ Ama, brơi kơ Anăn Ih hmâo tơlơi pơpŭ rơgoh hiam.
Brơi kơ dêh čar pơtao Ih dưi truh.
give us our needed bread for each day; @ Brơi kơ gơmơi mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă djŏp kơ rĭm hrơi.
and remit us our sins, for we also remit to every one indebted to us; and lead us not into temptation. @ Pap brơi tơlơi soh gơmơi,
Yua kơ gơmơi pô ăt pap brơi mơ̆n kơ rĭm čô hmâo ngă soh kơ gơmơi laih;
Laih anŭn anăm atăt ba gơmơi amăng tơlơi plư ôh.’”
And he said to them, Who among you shall have a friend, and shall go to him at midnight and say to him, Friend, let me have three loaves, @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Hlơi pô amăng ƀing gih nao pơ sang gơyut ñu krah mlam hăng rơkâo kơ ñu, hăng laĭ: ‘Ơ gơyut, brơi kâo čan klâo klŏ ƀañ tơpŭng ih, 
since a friend of mine on a journey is come to me, and I have nothing to set before him; @ yua kơ sa čô gơyut kâo hyu truh laih pơ sang kâo, kâo ƀu hmâo mơnơ̆ng hơgĕt brơi kơ ñu ƀơ̆ng huă ôh.’ 
and he within answering should say, Do not disturb me; the door is already shut, and my children are with me in bed; I cannot rise up to give [it] thee? @ Laih anŭn ñu laĭ glaĭ mơ̆ng lăm sang: ‘Anăm pơrŭng kâo ôh, bah amăng kơđơ̆l laih, ƀing ană bă kâo hăng kâo dŏ đih pĭt laih. Kâo ƀu dưi tơgŭ brơi mơnơ̆ng kơ ih ôh.’ 
I say to you, Although he will not get up and give [them] to him because he is his friend, because of his shamelessness, at any rate, he will rise and give him as many as he wants. @ Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, wơ̆t dah ñu ƀu či tơgŭ brơi mơnơ̆ng kơ gơ̆ ôh yua kơ gơ̆ jing gơyut ñu, samơ̆ yua kơ gơ̆ ƀu mlâo ôh ăt dŏ ƀel rơkâo nanao, ñu či tơgŭ laih anŭn brơi kơ gơ̆ abih mơnơ̆ng gơ̆ kiăng.
And *I* say to you, Ask, and it shall be given to you; seek, and ye shall find; knock, and it shall be opened to you. @ Tui anŭn Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, rơkâo bĕ, laih anŭn Ơi Adai či brơi kơ ƀing gih; sem bĕ, laih anŭn ƀing gih či ƀuh; khŏk bĕ laih anŭn Ơi Adai či pŏk brơi kơ ƀing gih. 
For every one that asks receives; and he that seeks finds; and to him that knocks it will be opened. @ Yua kơ rĭm čô hlơi pô rơkâo či hmâo; hlơi pô sem či ƀuh laih anŭn Ơi Adai či pŏk brơi kơ hlơi pô khŏk. 
But of whom of you that is a father shall a son ask bread, and [the father] shall give him a stone? or also a fish, and instead of a fish shall give him a serpent? @ Hlơi amăng ƀing gih jing ama, tơdah ană ñu rơkâo ƀañ tơpŭng ñu brơi boh pơtâo kơ gơ̆ mơ̆? Ƀôdah gơ̆ rơkâo akan, ñu či brơi kơ gơ̆ ala pơala kơ akan mơ̆? 
or if also he shall ask an egg, shall give him a scorpion? @ Ƀôdah gơ̆ rơkâo boh mơnŭ, ñu brơi aguăt mơ̆? 
If therefore *ye*, being evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much rather shall the Father who is of heaven give [the] Holy Spirit to them that ask him? @ Tui anŭn, tơdah ƀing gih jing ƀing sat thâo brơi mơnơ̆ng hiam kơ ană ƀing gih, hloh kơ anŭn dơ̆ng Ama amăng adai ƀu či brơi Yang Bơngăt Hiam kơ hlơi pô rơkâo kơ Ñu ôh hă!”
And he was casting out a demon, and it was dumb; and it came to pass, the demon being gone out, the dumb [man] spoke. And the crowds wondered. @ Yêsu pơpuh đuaĭ sa čô yang sat kơmlô. Tơ yang sat tơbiă đuaĭ laih mơnuih kơmlô thâo pơhiăp mơtam, laih anŭn ƀing ană plei hling hlang. 
But some from among them said, By Beelzebub the prince of the demons casts he out demons. @ Samơ̆ đơđa laĭ: “Ñu puh pơđuaĭ yang sat hăng Bêlsebul, khua kơ ƀing yang sat.”
And others tempting [him] sought from him a sign out of heaven. @ Hmâo ƀing pơkŏn kiăng lông lăng Ñu, rơkâo kơ Ñu ngă sa gru kơnăl mơ̆ng adai. 
But *he*, knowing their thoughts, said to them, Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation: and a house set against a house falls; @ Samơ̆ Yêsu thâo tơlơi pơmĭn ƀing anŭn, laih anŭn laĭ kơ gơñu: “Dêh čar pơtao pă pơkah pơpha pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ tơdruă gơñu pô či pơrai ñu pô, laih anŭn sang anŏ hlơi pơkah pơpha ñu pô či pơrai ñu pô. 
and if also Satan is divided against himself, how shall his kingdom subsist? because ye say that I cast out demons by Beelzebub. @ Kar kaĭ mơ̆n tơdah satan pơkah pơpha ñu pô, hyư̆m dêh čar pơtao ñu dưi dŏ kơjăp? Yua kơ ƀing gih laĭ Kâo pơpuh đuaĭ ƀing yang sat hăng Bêlsebul. 
But if *I* by Beelzebub cast out demons, your sons by whom do they cast [them] out? For this reason *they* shall be your judges. @ Tơdah Kâo puh pơđuaĭ ƀing yang sat hăng Bêlsebul, bơ ană bă ƀing gih kơnang kơ hlơi gơñu puh pơđuaĭ yang sat lĕ? Yua kơ anŭn yơh, ƀing ană bă ƀing gih pô či jing pô phat kơđi kơ ƀing gih. 
But if by the finger of God I cast out demons, then the kingdom of God is come upon you. @ Samơ̆ tơdah hăng čơđeng Ơi Adai Kâo puh pơđuaĭ ƀing yang sat, tui anŭn dêh čar pơtao Ơi Adai truh laih yơh kơ ƀing gih.
When the strong [man] armed keeps his own house, his goods are in peace; @ Tơ sa čô mơnuih kơtang, hmâo djŏp gơnam pơblah, wai lăng sang gơñu pô, dram gơnam ñu dŏ rơnŭk hơ-ĭn yơh. 
but when the stronger than he coming upon [him] overcomes him, he takes away his panoply in which he trusted, and he will divide the spoil [he has taken] from him. @ Samơ̆ tơ hmâo mơnuih kơtang hloh kơ ñu rai kơsung blah laih anŭn dưi hĭ hăng ñu, pô anŭn mă hĭ gơnam pơblah ñu kơnang, laih anŭn pơpha hĭ dram gơnam ñu plah sua.
He that is not with me is against me, and he that gathers not with me scatters. @ Hlơi pô ƀu dŏ hrŏm hăng Kâo, ñu pơkơdơ̆ng hăng Kâo, laih anŭn hlơi pô ƀu pơgop hăng Kâo, ñu čơlah đuaĭ čơlah čơlap.”
When the unclean spirit has gone out of the man, he goes through dry places seeking rest; and not finding [any] he says, I will return to my house whence I came out. @ “Tơ yang bơngăt grĭ hơƀak tơbiă laih mơ̆ng sa čô mơnuih, ñu găn nao amăng anih thu kro sem anih pơdơi; samơ̆ ƀu ƀuh anih ôh, ñu laĭ: ‘Kâo či wơ̆t glaĭ pơ sang kâo, jing anih kâo hmâo tơbiă đuaĭ laih.’ 
And having come, he finds it swept and adorned. @ Tơ ñu truh, ñu ƀuh sang anŭn arăng kih laih anŭn prăp rơmet dưm dăp hiam laih. 
Then he goes and takes seven other spirits worse than himself, and entering in, they dwell there; and the last condition of that man becomes worse than the first. @ Tui anŭn ñu nao laih anŭn jak ba tơjuh čô yang sat pơkŏn sat hloh kơ ñu. Gơñu mŭt dŏ amăng sang anŭn. Hnŭn yơh, tơlơi hơdip pô anŭn jing sat hloh kơ hlâo.”
And it came to pass as he spake these things, a certain woman, lifting up her voice out of the crowd, said to him, Blessed is the womb that has borne thee, and the paps which thou hast sucked. @ Tơdang Yêsu pơhiăp tơlơi anŭn, hmâo sa čô đah kơmơi mơ̆ng tơ̆ng krah mơnuih lu ur laĭ kơ Yêsu: “Mơyun hiam yơh kơ kian hmâo pi laih Ih, laih anŭn tơsâo hmâo pơmĕm Ih laih!”
But *he* said, Yea rather, blessed are they who hear the word of God and keep [it]. @ Samơ̆ Yêsu laĭ: “Ƀing hlơi hmư̆ hăng gưt boh pơhiăp Ơi Adai hmâo tơlơi mơyun hiam hloh dơ̆ng!”
But as the crowds thronged together, he began to say, This generation is a wicked generation: it seeks a sign, and a sign shall not be given to it but the sign of Jonas. @ Tơ hmâo mơnuih lu pơƀŭt glaĭ jai lu hloh dơ̆ng, Yêsu čơdơ̆ng laĭ: “Rơnŭk anai jing rơnŭk sat ƀai; gơñu hơduah sem sa gru kơnăl mơyang, samơ̆ Ơi Adai ƀu či brơi kơ gơñu sa gru kơnăl mơyang ôh, rơngiao kơ gru kơnăl mơyang Yônas. 
For as Jonas was a sign to the Ninevites, thus shall also the Son of man be to this generation. @ Yua kơ kar hăng Yônas jing sa gru kơnăl mơyang kơ ƀing mơnuih Niniwơ, kar hăng tui anŭn mơ̆n Ană Mơnuih či jing sa gru kơnăl mơyang kơ ƀing rơnŭk anai. 
A queen of the south shall rise up in the judgment with the men of this generation, and shall condemn them: for she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and behold, more than Solomon is here. @ Pơtao đah kơmơi čar dơnŭng či tơgŭ ƀơi hrơi phat kơđi, hrŏm hăng ƀing mơnuih rơnŭk anai laih anŭn klă kơđi kơ gơñu, yua kơ ñu rai mơ̆ng rơnuč lŏn tơnah kiăng hmư̆ tơlơi kơhnâo Salômôn. Laih anŭn anai nê, pơ anai hmâo Pô prŏng hloh kơ Salômôn. 
Men of Nineveh shall stand up in the judgment with this generation, and shall condemn it: for they repented at the preaching of Jonas; and behold, more than Jonas is here. @ Amăng hrơi phat kơđi ƀing ană plei Niniwơ či tơgŭ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing rơnŭk anai laih anŭn klă kơđi kơ gơñu, yua kơ ƀing gơñu kơhmal tơlơi soh laih hmư̆ tơlơi Yônas pơtô. Laih anŭn anai nê pơ anai hmâo Pô prŏng hloh kơ Yônas.”
But no one having lit a lamp sets it in secret, nor under the corn-measure, but on the lamp-stand, that they who enter in may see the light. @ “Ƀu hmâo ôh hlơi tuč apui kơđen pioh hĭ ƀơi anih hơgơ̆m ƀôdah pioh gah yŭ kơthŭng, samơ̆ arăng pioh ñu ƀơi gơ̆ng apui kơđen kiăng kơ hlơi pô mŭt dưi ƀuh tơlơi bơngač. 
The lamp of the body is thine eye: when thine eye is simple, thy whole body also is light; but when it is wicked, thy body also is dark. @ Mơta ih jing apui kơđen kơ drơi jan; tơdah mơta ih hiam, abih drơi jan ih bă hăng tơlơi bơngač. Samơ̆ tơdah mơta ih răm, abih drơi jan ih bă hăng tơlơi kơnăm mơmŏt. 
See therefore that the light which is in thee be not darkness. @ Tui anŭn răng bĕ hwĭ kơ tơlơi bơngač amăng ƀing gih jing hĭ kơnăm mơmŏt. 
If therefore thy whole body [is] light, not having any part dark, it shall be all light as when the lamp lights thee with its brightness. @ Tơdah abih drơi jan ih bă hăng tơlơi bơngač, ƀu hmâo sa črăn tơlơi kơnăm mơmŏt ôh, ñu či hmâo tơlơi bơngač abih bang kar hăng apui kơđen pơčrang tơlơi bơngač kơ ih.”
But as he spoke, a certain Pharisee asked him that he would dine with him; and entering in he placed himself at table. @ Tơ Yêsu pơhiăp giơ̆ng laih, hmâo sa čô Pharisi jak Ñu ƀơ̆ng huă hrŏm hăng ñu; Ñu mŭt laih anŭn dŏ ber ƀơ̆ng huă. 
But the Pharisee seeing [it] wondered that he had not first washed before dinner. @ Pô Pharisi anŭn hling hlang kơ Ñu ƀu rao tơngan ôh hlâo kơ huă. 
But the Lord said to him, Now do ye Pharisees cleanse the outside of the cup and of the dish, but your inward [parts] are full of plunder and wickedness. @ Hnŭn yơh, Khua Yang laĭ kơ ñu: “Ƀing Pharisi gih, pơrơgoh gah rơngiao kơčok laih anŭn jam, samơ̆ amăng lăm ƀing gih bă hăng tơlơi hưp ham laih anŭn tơlơi sat ƀai. 
Fools, has not he who has made the outside made the inside also? @ Ơ ƀing mlŭk! Pô hmâo pơjing laih mơnơ̆ng gah rơngiao, Ñu ƀu pơjing ôh hă mơnơ̆ng amăng lăm? 
But rather give alms of what ye have, and behold, all things are clean to you. @ Samơ̆ ƀing gih brơi bĕ mơnơ̆ng pap kơ ƀing ƀun rin hăng pran jua čơmah hơgĕt mơnơ̆ng gih hmâo, tui anŭn abih bang mơnơ̆ng či rơgoh kơ ƀing gih yơh.
But woe unto you, Pharisees, for ye pay tithes of mint and rue and every herb, and pass by the judgment and the love of God: these ye ought to have done, and not have left those aside. @ Samơ̆ răm ƀăm yơh kơ ƀing gih, Ơ ƀing Pharisi! Yua kơ ƀing gih pơyơr sa črăn amăng pluh eč, gruač laih anŭn djŏp mơta añăm pơtăm, samơ̆ lui hĭ tơlơi tơpă laih anŭn tơlơi thâo khăp kơ Ơi Adai. Ƀing gih khŏm ngă khul tơlơi anai, samơ̆ ăt kŏn wơr lơi khul tơlơi anŭn.
Woe unto you, Pharisees, for ye love the first seat in the synagogues and salutations in the market-places. @ Răm ƀăm yơh kơ ƀing gih, Ơ ƀing Pharisi! Yua kơ ƀing gih khăp kơ anih dŏ hiam hloh amăng sang bơjơnum laih anŭn tơlơi arăng kơkuh kơ ƀing gih amăng sang sĭ mia. 
Woe unto you, for ye are as the sepulchres which appear not, and the men walking over them do not know [it]. @ Răm ƀăm yơh kơ ƀing gih! Yua kơ ƀing gih kar hăng pơsat ƀu hmâo gru ôh, laih anŭn arăng rơbat ƀơi ngŏ pơsat anŭn, samơ̆ ƀu thâo ôh.”
And one of the doctors of the law answering says to him, Teacher, in saying these things thou insultest us also. @ Sa čô amăng ƀing nai tơlơi juăt laĭ kơ Ñu: “Ơ nai, tơdang Ih pơhiăp tui anŭn Ih ƀuah wơ̆t kơ gơmơi yơh.”
And he said, To you also woe, doctors of the law, for ye lay upon men burdens heavy to bear, and yourselves do not touch the burdens with one of your fingers. @ Laih anŭn Yêsu laĭ: “Răm ƀăm yơh wơ̆t kơ ƀing gih mơ̆n, ơ ƀing nai tơlơi juăt! Yua kơ ƀing gih brơi arăng mơnơ̆ng kơtraŏ tơnap glăm, samơ̆ ƀing gih pô hăng sa ƀĕ čơđeng ƀu ruaih djơ̆ amơĭ. 
Woe unto you, for ye build the sepulchres of the prophets, but your fathers killed them. @ Răm ƀăm yơh kơ ƀing gih, yua kơ ƀing gih man pơsat ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo ƀing ơi adon ƀing gih hmâo pơdjai laih. 
Ye bear witness then, and consent to the works of your fathers; for *they* killed them, and *ye* build [their sepulchres]. @ Tui anŭn, ƀing gih jing mơnuih ngă gơ̆ng jơlan kơ bruă ƀing ơi adon ƀing gih laih anŭn tŭ ư tơlơi gơñu ngă; yua kơ gơñu hmâo pơdjai laih ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo laih anŭn ƀing gih man pơsat ƀing gơ̆. 
For this reason also the wisdom of God has said, I will send to them prophets and apostles, and of these shall they kill and drive out by persecution, @ Yua anŭn mơ̆n tơlơi kơhnâo Ơi Adai hmâo laĭ laih: ‘Kâo či pơkiaŏ ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo laih anŭn ƀing khua ding kơna nao pơ gơñu. Đơđa amăng ƀing anŭn gơñu či pơdjai laih anŭn ngă sat,’ 
that the blood of all the prophets which has been poured out from the foundation of the world may be required of this generation, @ hnŭn yơh, nua drah ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo arăng hmâo pơdjai laih mơ̆ng phŭn hrih lŏn tơnah či tuh ƀơi rơnŭk anai, 
from the blood of Abel to the blood of Zacharias, who perished between the altar and the house; yea, I say to you, it shall be required of this generation. @ čơdơ̆ng mơ̆ng drah Abel truh pơ drah Sakari, pô arăng hmâo pơdjai laih kơplah wah kơƀang ngă yang laih anŭn anih rơgoh hiam. Sĭt yơh, Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, arăng či tuh drah anŭn kơ ƀing rơnŭk anai.
Woe unto you, the doctors of the law, for ye have taken away the key of knowledge; yourselves have not entered in, and those who were entering in ye have hindered. @ Răm ƀăm yơh kơ ƀing gih, ơ ƀing nai tơlơi juăt! Yua kơ ƀing gih djă pioh laih kơmla kăl tơlơi thâo mĭn; ƀing gih pô ƀu mŭt ôh, laih anŭn ƀing gih khă ƀing kiăng mŭt.”
And as he said these things to them, the scribes and the Pharisees began to press him urgently, and to make him speak of many things; @ Tơ Yêsu đuaĭ mơ̆ng anih anŭn, ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt hăng ƀing Pharisi čơdơ̆ng pơkơdơ̆ng hăng Ñu kơtang tĭt laih anŭn tơña Ñu lu mơta tơlơi, 
watching him, [and seeking] to catch something out of his mouth, [that they might accuse him]. @ gơñu dưm mơneč kiăng mă tơlơi soh rĭm boh pơhiăp tơbiă mơ̆ng amăng bah Ñu.
Now at the same time there were present some who told him of the Galileans whose blood Pilate mingled with [that of] their sacrifices. @ Ăt hlăk anŭn mơ̆n, hmâo đơđa mơnuih pơ anŭn ră ruai kơ Yêsu tơlơi truh laih kơ ƀing mơnuih Galilê, kơ tơlơi Pilat pơdjai ƀing gơ̆, laih anŭn gơñu pơlŭk hăng drah hlô mơnơ̆ng ngă yang ƀing gơ̆ hlăk dŏ pơyơr. 
And he answering said to them, Think ye that these Galileans were sinners beyond all the Galileans because they suffered such things? @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ kơ gơñu: “Ƀing gih pơmĭn mơ̆ ƀing mơnuih Galilê anŭn jing ƀing soh sat hloh kơ abih bang ƀing Galilê pơkŏn, yua kơ gơñu tŭ tơlơi tơnap tap kar hăng anŭn? 
No, I say to you, but if ye repent not, ye shall all perish in the same manner. @ Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, ư ưh, samơ̆ tơdah ƀing gih ƀu kơhmal ôh kơ tơlơi soh ƀing gih, abih bang ƀing gih či răm rai kar kaĭ mơ̆n. 
Or those eighteen on whom the tower in Siloam fell and killed them, think ye that *they* were debtors beyond all the men who dwell in Jerusalem? @ Ƀôdah bơ ƀing pluh sapăn čô sang rơñan Silôê glưh kơtĭt djai hĭ ƀing gơ̆, ƀing gih pơmĭn mơ̆ ƀing gơ̆ jing ƀing soh sat hloh kơ abih bang ƀing pơkŏn dŏ amăng plei Yêrusalem? 
No, I say to you, but if ye repent not, ye shall all perish in like manner. @ Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, ư ưh, samơ̆ tơdah ƀing gih ƀu kơhmal ôh tơlơi soh ƀing gih, abih bang ƀing gih či răm rai kar kaĭ mơ̆n.”
And he spoke this parable: A certain [man] had a fig-tree planted in his vineyard, and he came seeking fruit upon it and did not find [any]. @ Giơ̆ng anŭn Ñu pơhiăp tơlơi bơhmutu anai: “Sa čô mơnuih pla sa phŭn hra amăng đang boh kơƀâu ñu. Ñu nao hơduah boh pơ anŭn, samơ̆ ƀu ƀuh ôh. 
And he said to the vinedresser, Behold, [these] three years I come seeking fruit on this fig-tree and find none: cut it down; why does it also render the ground useless? @ Ñu laĭ kơ pô pla phŭn boh kơƀâu: ‘Lăng bĕ, klâo thŭn laih Kâo rai hơduah boh mơ̆ng phŭn hra anai, samơ̆ Kâo ƀu ƀuh boh ôh. Drom hĭ ñu bĕ, yua hơgĕt pioh lui ñu ngă gơniă lŏn đôč đač?’ 
But he answering says to him, Sir, let it alone for this year also, until I shall dig about it and put dung, @ Pô wai đang laĭ glaĭ: ‘Ơ khua, pioh ñu sa thŭn dơ̆ng, kâo či klơi jum dar phŭn ñu laih anŭn pioh djah. 
and if it shall bear fruit but if not, after that thou shalt cut it down. @ Tơdah thŭn tơdơi ñu mơboh, hiam yơh. Samơ̆ tơdah ñu ƀu mơboh ôh, ih či drom hĭ ñu.’”
And he was teaching in one of the synagogues on the sabbath. @ Amăng hrơi saƀat Yêsu dŏ pơtô amăng sang bơjơnum. 
And lo, [there was] a woman having a spirit of infirmity eighteen years, and she was bent together and wholly unable to lift her head up. @ Pơ anŭn hmâo sa čô đah kơmơi yang sat ngă kơ gơ̆ rơwen amăng pluh sapăn thŭn laih. Rŏng gơ̆ gô trŭn, laih anŭn drơi jan ƀu dưi dŏ dơ̆ng tơpă dơ̆ng ôh. 
And Jesus, seeing her, called to [her], and said to her, Woman, thou art loosed from thine infirmity. @ Tơ Yêsu ƀuh ñu, Ñu iâu laih anŭn laĭ kơ gơ̆: “Ơ đah kơmơi, ih klaih laih mơ̆ng ruă ih.” 
And he laid his hands upon her; and immediately she was made straight, and glorified God. @ Tơ Yêsu ah tơngan ƀơi gơ̆. Tañ mơtam gơ̆ dơ̆ng tơpă glaĭ laih anŭn pơpŭ bơni hơơč kơ Ơi Adai.
But the ruler of the synagogue, indignant because Jesus healed on the sabbath, answering said to the crowd, There are six days in which [people] ought to work; in these therefore come and be healed, and not on the sabbath day. @ Samơ̆ khua wai sang bơjơnum hil yua kơ Yêsu pơsuaih amăng hrơi saƀat, laih anŭn ñu laĭ kơ ƀing ană plei: “Hmâo năm hrơi pioh mă bruă; rai bĕ amăng khul hrơi anŭn kiăng hmâo tơlơi pơsuaih, samơ̆ anăm rai ôh amăng hrơi saƀat.”
The Lord therefore answered him and said, Hypocrites! does not each one of you on the sabbath loose his ox or his ass from the manger and leading [it] away, water [it]? @ Khua Yang laĭ glaĭ kơ ñu: “Ơ ƀing plơ̆m ƀlor, amăng hrơi saƀat, ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă rĭm čô amăng ƀing gih leng kơ kleh rơmo ƀôdah aseh kle ƀing gih mơ̆ng war laih anŭn ba ñu nao mơñum ia? 
And this [woman], who is a daughter of Abraham, whom Satan has bound, lo, [these] eighteen years, ought she not to be loosed from this bond on the sabbath day? @ Đah kơmơi anai jing ană Abraham, yang sat hmâo čaŏ ñu pluh sapăn thŭn laih, hyư̆m ngă ƀu dưi ôh hă yaih brơi ñu amăng hrơi Saƀat?” 
And as he said these things, all who were opposed to him were ashamed; and all the crowd rejoiced at all the glorious things which were being done by him. @ Tơ Yêsu pơhiăp tơlơi anŭn, abih bang ƀing ayăt Ñu mlâo hañ soh sel; laih anŭn abih bang ƀing ană plei pla hơ̆k mơak yua kơ abih bruă yom pơphan guh kơang Ñu hmâo ngă laih.
And he said, To what is the kingdom of God like? and to what shall I liken it? @ Yua kơ anŭn Yêsu laĭ: “Dêh čar pơtao Ơi Adai jing kar hăng hơgĕt? Laih anŭn hăng hơgĕt Kâo či bơkơnar ñu? 
It is like a grain of mustard [seed] which a man took and cast into his garden; and it grew and became a great tree, and the birds of heaven lodged in its branches. @ Dêh čar pơtao anŭn jing kar hăng sa asar pơjeh añăm bơi sa čô mơnuih sai amăng đang. Ñu čăt laih anŭn jing sa ƀĕ phŭn kơyâo laih anŭn čĭm amăng adai ngă hruh amăng than ñu.”
And again he said, To what shall I liken the kingdom of God? @ Laih anŭn Yêsu laĭ dơ̆ng: “Hăng hơgĕt kâo či bơkơnar kơ dêh čar pơtao Ơi Adai? 
It is like leaven, which a woman took and hid in three measures of meal until the whole was leavened. @ Dêh čar pơtao anŭn jing kar hăng tơpơi sa čô đah kơmơi pơlŭk hăng klâo hơnơ̆ng tơpŭng tơl abih tơpŭng anŭn bô̆ đĭ.”
And he went through one city and village after another, teaching, and journeying to Jerusalem. @ Yêsu găn nao plei prŏng laih anŭn plei anĕt tơdang Ñu nao Ñu pơtô rah hlŏng truh pơ plei Yêrusalem. 
And one said to him, Sir, [are] such as are to be saved few in number? But he said unto them, @ Hmâo sa čô tơña kơ Ñu: “Ơ Khua Yang, djơ̆ mơ̆ kơnơ̆ng ƀiă mơnuih dưi klaih?”
Strive with earnestness to enter in through the narrow door, for many, I say to you, will seek to enter in and will not be able. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Brơi ƀing gih gir kơtir mŭt bah amăng gơniă; yua kơ Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, lu mơnuih hơduah kiăng mŭt, samơ̆ ƀu dưi ôh. 
From the time that the master of the house shall have risen up and shall have shut the door, and ye shall begin to stand without and to knock at the door, saying, Lord, open to us; and he answering shall say to you, I know you not whence ye are: @ Tơ pô sang tơgŭ laih anŭn krư̆ hĭ bah amăng, ƀing gih či dŏ pơ gah rơngiao laih anŭn khŏk bah amăng hăng laĭ: ‘Ơ Khua, pŏk brơi bah amăng kơ gơmơi đa.’ Ñu či laĭ glaĭ kơ ƀing gih: ‘Kâo ƀu thâo ôh mơ̆ng pă ƀing gih rai.’ 
then shall ye begin to say, We have eaten in thy presence and drunk, and thou hast taught in our streets; @ Hlăk anŭn ƀing gih či laĭ: ‘Gơmơi hmâo ƀơ̆ng huă mơñum laih ƀơi anăp Ih, laih anŭn Ih hmâo pơtô laih amăng plei pla gơmơi.’ 
and he shall say, I tell you, I do not know you whence ye are; depart from me, all [ye] workers of iniquity. @ Samơ̆ ñu či laĭ: ‘Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, kâo ƀu thâo ôh mơ̆ng pă ƀing gih rai; đuaĭ bĕ mơ̆ng kâo, ơ abih bang ƀing ngă bruă soh sat!’ 
There shall be the weeping and the gnashing of teeth, when ye shall see Abraham and Isaac and Jacob and all the prophets in the kingdom of God, but yourselves cast out. @ Hlăk anŭn ƀing gih či ƀuh Abraham, Isak, Yakôp, laih anŭn abih bang ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo amăng dêh čar pơtao Ơi Adai, bơ ƀing gih pô arăng či glŏm hĭ pơ gah rơngiao, anih hmâo tơlơi čŏk hia laih anŭn kĕ tơgơi. 
And they shall come from east and west, and from north and south, and shall lie down at table in the kingdom of God. @ Laih anŭn či hmâo ƀing rai mơ̆ng ngŏ, mơ̆ng yŭ, mơ̆ng kơdư laih anŭn mơ̆ng dơnŭng, dŏ ber ƀơ̆ng huă amăng dêh čar pơtao Ơi Adai. 
And behold, there are last who shall be first, and there are first who shall be last. @ Sĭt yơh, ƀing tơdơi či jing hlâo, laih anŭn ƀing hlâo či jing tơdơi.”
The same hour certain Pharisees came up, saying to him, Get out, and go hence, for Herod is desirous to kill thee. @ Ƀơi mông anŭn hmâo ƀing Pharisi rai laĭ kơ Ñu: “Đuaĭ bĕ mơ̆ng anih anai, yua kơ Hêrôt kiăng pơdjai Ih.”
And he said to them, Go, tell that fox, Behold, I cast out demons and accomplish cures to-day and to-morrow, and the third [day] I am perfected; @ Ñu laĭ kơ ƀing anŭn: “Nao laĭ bĕ kơ asâo tan anŭn: ‘Hrơi anai, hrơi pơgi, Kâo puh pơđuaĭ yang sat laih anŭn pơsuaih tơlơi duăm ruă, truh hrơi tal klâo Kâo či pơgiơ̆ng hĭ bruă Kâo. 
but I must needs walk to-day and to-morrow and the [day] following, for it must not be that a prophet perish out of Jerusalem. @ Wơ̆t dah tui anŭn hrơi anai, hrơi pơgi, hrơi kơdih Kâo ăt khŏm či rơbat nao; yua kơ sa čô pô laĭ lui hlâo ƀu dưi djai gah rơngiao kơ plei Yêrusalem ôh.’
Jerusalem, Jerusalem, the [city] that kills the prophets and stones those that are sent unto her, how often would I have gathered thy children together, as a hen her brood under her wings, and ye would not. @ Ơ Yêrusalem, Yêrusalem! Ih hmâo pơdjai laih ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo laih anŭn glŏm boh pơtâo kơ ƀing mơnuih Ơi Adai hmâo pơkiaŏ rai pơ ih. Hmâo lu wơ̆t laih Kâo kiăng pơƀŭt glaĭ ƀing ană bă ih kar hăng mơnŭ ania kruk ană ñu kiăng kơ krôp gah yŭ čăng, samơ̆ ih ƀu kiăng ôh! 
Behold, your house is left unto you; and I say unto you, that ye shall not see me until it come that ye say, Blessed [is] he that comes in the name of [the] Lord. @ Anai nê, sang ƀing gih či jing hĭ rơngol. Laih anŭn Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, ƀing gih ƀu či ƀuh Kâo dơ̆ng ôh tơl ƀing gih či laĭ: ‘Mơyun hiam yơh kơ Pô rai amăng anăn Khua Yang!’”
And it came to pass, as he went into the house of one of the rulers, [who was] of the Pharisees, to eat bread on [the] sabbath, that *they* were watching him. @ Sa hrơi saƀat Yêsu nao ƀơ̆ng huă pơ sang sa čô khua ƀing Pharisi, laih anŭn arăng krăp lăng sŭ Ñu. 
And behold, there was a certain dropsical [man] before him. @ Hlăk anŭn hmâo sa čô mơnuih ruă pơôr dŏ ƀơi anăp Ñu. 
And Jesus answering spoke unto the doctors of the law and Pharisees, saying, Is it lawful to heal on the sabbath? @ Yêsu tơña ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt laih anŭn ƀing Pharisi, laĭ: “Phiăn mơ̆ pơsuaih tơlơi ruă amăng hrơi saƀat?”
But they were silent. And taking him he healed him and let him go. @ Samơ̆ gơñu dŏ rơiăt. Yêsu rŭ pô ruă hăng pơsuaih gơ̆, laih anŭn brơi gơ̆ glaĭ. 
And answering he said to them, Of which of you shall an ass or ox fall into a well, that he does not straightway pull him up on the sabbath day? @ Giơ̆ng anŭn Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Hlơi amăng ƀing gih hmâo sa čô ană đah rơkơi ƀôdah sa drơi rơmo lĕ amăng ia dơmun amăng hrơi saƀat ñu ƀu tañ dui đĭ mơtam ôh hă?”
And they were not able to answer him to these things. @ Gơñu ƀu dui laĭ glaĭ dơ̆ng ôh kơ tơlơi anŭn.
And he spoke a parable to those that were invited, remarking how they chose out the first places, saying to them, @ Tơ Yêsu ƀuh ƀing mơnuih arăng jak ƀơ̆ng huă hrŏm hơbĭt leng kơ ruah mă anih dŏ pơpŭ yom, Ñu pơhiăp sa tơlơi bơhmutu, hăng laĭ kơ ƀing gơ̆, 
When thou art invited by any one to a wedding, do not lay thyself down in the first place at table, lest perhaps a more honourable than thou be invited by him, @ “Tơdah arăng jak ih kơ tơlơi ƀơ̆ng huă dŏ rơkơi bơnai, anăm dŏ ber ôh ƀơi anih arăng pơpŭ yom, hwĭ kơ amăng ƀing ñu jak anŭn hmâo sa čô pơpŭ yom hloh kơ ih. 
and he who invited thee and him come and say to thee, Give place to this [man], and then thou begin with shame to take the last place. @ Laih anŭn pô jak dua gih či laĭ kơ ih: ‘Brơi anih anai kơ pô anai bĕ,’ hlăk anŭn ih či mlâo hañ yua kơ ih khŏm nao dŏ pơ anih rơnuč hloh. 
But when thou hast been invited, go and put thyself down in the last place, that when he who has invited thee comes, he may say to thee, Friend, go up higher: then shalt thou have honour before all that are lying at table with thee; @ Samơ̆ tơdah arăng jak ih, nao dŏ bĕ pơ anih rơnuč hloh. Tui anŭn kah tơdah pô jak ih truh, ñu dưi laĭ kơ ih: ‘Ơ giăng, đĭ nao dŏ pơ anih pơpŭ hloh.’ Tui anŭn ih či hmâo tơlơi pơpŭ ƀơi anăp abih bang ƀing dŏ ber ƀơ̆ng huă hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ih. 
for every one that exalts himself shall be abased, and he that abases himself shall be exalted. @ Yua kơ hlơi pô pơđĭ ñu pô, arăng či pơtrŭn ñu, laih anŭn hlơi pô pơtrŭn ñu pô arăng či pŭ đĭ ñu.”
And he said also to him that had invited him, When thou makest a dinner or a supper, call not thy friends, nor thy brethren, nor thy kinsfolk, nor rich neighbours, lest it may be they also should invite thee in return, and a recompense be made thee. @ Yêsu ăt laĭ hăng pô jak Ñu: “Tơ ih pơkra tơlơi ƀơ̆ng huă yang hrơi dơ̆ng ƀôdah klam, anăm jak ôh ƀing gơyut gơyâo ih, ƀing adơi ayŏng, ƀing kơnŭng djuai ih, ƀôdah ƀing jum dar ih pơdrŏng sah, hwĭ kơ gơñu či jak glaĭ ih dơ̆ng laih anŭn ba glaĭ kơ ih kar kaĭ mơ̆n. 
But when thou makest a feast, call poor, crippled, lame, blind: @ Samơ̆ tơ ih pơkra tơlơi ƀơ̆ng mơñum jak bĕ ƀing ƀun rin, ƀing rơwen, ƀing đŭt tơkai tơngan laih anŭn ƀing bum mơta. 
and thou shalt be blessed; for they have not [the means] to recompense thee; for it shall be recompensed thee in the resurrection of the just. @ Tui anŭn kah ih či hmâo tơlơi mơyun hiam, yua kơ gơñu ƀu dưi kla glaĭ kơ ih dơ̆ng ôh. Ih či hmâo tơlơi apah ƀơi hrơi ƀing tơpă klă hơdip glaĭ dơ̆ng.”
And one of those that were lying at table with [them], hearing these things, said to him, Blessed [is] he who shall eat bread in the kingdom of God. @ Sa čô amăng ƀing dŏ ber ƀơ̆ng huă hrŏm hăng Yêsu hmư̆ tơlơi anai, ñu laĭ kơ Yêsu: “Mơyun hiam yơh kơ hlơi pô či dưi ƀơ̆ng huă amăng dêh čar pơtao Ơi Adai!”
And he said to him, A certain man made a great supper and invited many. @ Samơ̆ Yêsu laĭ kơ ñu: “Hmâo sa čô mơnuih pơkra tơlơi ƀơ̆ng huă mơñum prŏng laih anŭn jak lu mơnuih. 
And he sent his bondman at the hour of supper to say to those who were invited, Come, for already all things are ready. @ Truh mông ƀơ̆ng huă, ñu pơkiaŏ nao ƀing ding kơna ñu laĭ kơ ƀing ñu jak laih: ‘Rai bĕ, yua kơ abih bang mơnơ̆ng pơkra laih.’ 
And all began, without exception, to excuse themselves. The first said to him, I have bought land, and I must go out and see it; I pray thee hold me for excused. @ Samơ̆ abih bang ƀing gơñu leng kơ hơngah soh sel. Pô tal hlâo laĭ: ‘Kâo hmâo blơi sa blah hmua laih anŭn kâo kiăng nao lăng ñu. Kâo rơkâo tơlơi pap mơñai.’ 
And another said, I have bought five yoke of oxen, and I go to prove them; I pray thee hold me for excused. @ Sa čô pơkŏn laĭ: ‘Kâo hmâo blơi rơma grop rơmo, laih anŭn kâo kiăng nao lăng gơñu. Kâo rơkâo tơlơi pap mơñai.’ 
And another said, I have married a wife, and on this account I cannot come. @ Laih anŭn pô pơkŏn dơ̆ng laĭ: ‘Kâo phrâo pơdŏ bơnai, tui anŭn kâo ƀu dưi nao ôh.’ 
And the bondman came up and brought back word of these things to his lord. Then the master of the house, in anger, said to his bondman, Go out quickly into the streets and lanes of the city, and bring here the poor and crippled and lame and blind. @ Ding kơna anŭn wơ̆t glaĭ laih anŭn laĭ kơ khua ñu. Pô sang anŭn hil laih anŭn laĭ kơ ding kơna ñu: ‘Nao tañ bĕ amăng jơlan prŏng laih anŭn jơlan anĕt amăng plei anai laih anŭn jak ba ƀing ƀun rin, ƀing rơwen, ƀing bum mơta, laih anŭn ƀing đŭt tơkai tơngan.’ 
And the bondman said, Sir, it is done as thou hast commanded, and there is still room. @ Ding kơna laĭ: ‘Ơ khua kâo hmâo ngă laih tơlơi ih pơtă, samơ̆ ăt dŏ hmâo anih rơhông.’ 
And the lord said to the bondman, Go out into the ways and fences and compel to come in, that my house may be filled; @ Khua sang laĭ kơ ding kơna ñu: ‘Nao bĕ pơ jơlan prŏng laih anŭn jơlan anĕt gah rơngiao plei, laih anŭn pơgŏ ƀing ană plei rai mŭt kiăng kơ bă sang kâo. 
for I say to you, that not one of those men who were invited shall taste of my supper. @ Yua kơ kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, ƀu hmâo ôh sa čô amăng ƀing mơnuih kâo jak hlâo anŭn či ƀơ̆ng mơnơ̆ng kâo.’”
And great crowds went with him; and, turning round, he said to them, @ Ƀing mơnuih lu nao hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Yêsu. Ñu wir glaĭ lăng hăng laĭ kơ ƀing gơñu: 
If any man come to me, and shall not hate his own father and mother, and wife, and children, and brothers, and sisters, yea, and his own life too, he cannot be my disciple; @ “Tơdah hlơi pô đuaĭ tui Kâo samơ̆ ƀu bơrơmŭt ôh kơ amĭ ama, kơ ană bơnai, kơ ƀing ayŏng amai adơi, laih anŭn wơ̆t kơ tơlơi hơdip ñu pô, ñu ƀu dưi jing ding kơna Kâo ôh. 
and whoever does not carry his cross and come after me cannot be my disciple. @ Hlơi pô ƀu glăm kơyâo bơrơkal ñu pô laih anŭn đuaĭ tui Kâo, ăt ƀu dưi jing ding kơna Kâo ôh.
For which of you, desirous of building a tower, does not first sit down and count the cost, if he have what [is needed] to complete it; @ Tơdah hlơi pô amăng ƀing gih kiăng ngă sang rơñan, blŭng hlâo ƀu dŏ ber kiăng tĭng lăng nua ñu kiăng kơ thâo ñu dưi ngă pơgiơ̆ng mơ̆ sang rơñan anŭn? 
in order that, having laid the foundation of it, and not being able to finish it, all who see it do not begin to mock at him, @ Hwĭ kơ giơ̆ng kơ ñu pơkra atur laih, samơ̆ ñu ƀu dưi ngă pơgiơ̆ng hĭ ôh, laih anŭn abih bang ƀing ƀuh tơlơi anŭn čơdơ̆ng mưč kơ ñu hăng laĭ, 
saying, This man began to build and was not able to finish? @ ‘Mơnuih anai čơdơ̆ng ngă sang, samơ̆ ñu ƀu dưi ngă pơgiơ̆ng ôh.’ 
Or what king, going on his way to engage in war with another king, does not, sitting down first, take counsel whether he is able with ten thousand to meet him coming against him with twenty thousand? @ Ƀôdah hmâo mơ̆ pơtao tơdang ñu nao pơblah hăng sa čô pơtao pơkŏn, samơ̆ ƀu dŏ ber črŏng sai hlâo ôh kiăng thâo ñu djă ba pluh rơbâo tơhan dưi mơ̆ pơblah hăng pơtao hmâo dua pluh rơbâo tơhan? 
and if not, while he is yet far off, having sent an embassy, he asks for terms of peace. @ Tơdah ƀu dưi ôh, tơdang pô ayăt ăt dŏ pơ ataih, ñu či pơkiaŏ nao sa tơpul ƀing pơala kiăng rơkâo tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua. 
Thus then every one of you who forsakes not all that is his own cannot be my disciple. @ Tui anŭn mơ̆n hlơi pô amăng ƀing gih ƀu lui hĭ ôh abih bang tơlơi ñu hmâo, ñu ƀu dưi jing ding kơna Kâo ôh.”
Salt [then] [is] good, but if the salt also has become savourless, wherewith shall it be seasoned? @ “Hra jing mơnơ̆ng hiam, samơ̆ tơdah ñu rơngiă hĭ mơnâo mơsĭn ñu, hăng hơgĕt arăng či ngă ñu mơsĭn glaĭ dơ̆ng? 
It is proper neither for land nor for dung; it is cast out. He that hath ears to hear, let him hear. @ Hra anŭn ƀu tŭ yua kơ lŏn hmua dơ̆ng ôh, kŏn tŭ yua kơ pơlŭk hăng kơmơ̆k lơi. Arăng tuh hĭ ñu pơ gah rơngiao. Hlơi pô hmâo tơngia dưi hmư̆, brơi ñu hmư̆ bĕ.”
And all the tax-gatherers and the sinners were coming near to him to hear him; @ Hlăk anŭn abih bang ƀing ring jia laih anŭn ƀing mơnuih soh nao giăm Yêsu kiăng hmư̆ tơlơi Ñu pơtô. 
and the Pharisees and the scribes murmured, saying, This [man] receives sinners and eats with them. @ Ƀing Pharisi laih anŭn ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt pơhiăp brŏk hăng laĭ: “Pô anai tŭ jum ƀing mơnuih soh laih anŭn ƀơ̆ng huă hrŏm hơbĭt hăng gơñu!”
And he spoke to them this parable, saying, @ Yua kơ anŭn, Yêsu pơhiăp tơlơi bơhmutu anai kơ gơñu: 
What man of you having a hundred sheep, and having lost one of them, does not leave the ninety and nine in the wilderness and go after that which is lost, until he find it? @ “Hmâo hlơi mơ̆ amăng ƀing gih hmâo sa rơtuh drơi triu, tơdah rơngiă hĭ sa drơi, ñu ƀu lui hĭ ôh dua rơpăn pluh dua rơpăn drơi pơkŏn amăng tơdrŏn tač kiăng kơ nao sem sa drơi rơngiă laih tơl ƀuh ñu? 
and having found it, he lays it upon his own shoulders, rejoicing; @ Tơ gơ̆ ƀuh ñu laih, gơ̆ glăm ñu ƀơi bra hăng tơlơi hơ̆k mơak. 
and being come to the house, calls together the friends and the neighbours, saying to them, Rejoice with me, for I have found my lost sheep. @ Laih anŭn tơ ñu truh pơ sang, ñu iâu pơƀŭt ƀing giăng mah laih anŭn ƀing jum dar ñu hăng laĭ kơ gơñu: ‘Hơ̆k mơak bĕ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng kâo yua kơ kâo ƀuh glaĭ laih triu rơngiă anŭn.’ 
I say unto you, that thus there shall be joy in heaven for one repenting sinner, [more] than for ninety and nine righteous who have no need of repentance. @ Ăt tui anŭn mơ̆n, Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih amăng adai či hmâo tơlơi hơ̆k mơak kơ sa čô mơnuih soh kơhmal tơlơi soh hloh kơ dua rơpăn pluh dua rơpăn čô mơnuih tơpă ƀu kiăng khŏm kơhmal tơlơi soh ôh.”
Or, what woman having ten drachmas, if she lose one drachma, does not light a lamp and sweep the house and seek carefully till she find it? @ “Ƀôdah hmâo mơ̆ sa čô đah kơmơi hmâo pluh sar prăk kak, tơdah rơngiă hĭ sa asar, ñu ƀu čuh apui kơđen, kih sang laih anŭn sem hăng abih pran jua tơl ñu ƀuh? 
and having found it she calls together the friends and neighbours, saying, Rejoice with me, for I have found the drachma which I had lost. @ Laih anŭn tơ ñu ƀuh glaĭ prăk anŭn, ñu iâu pơƀŭt ƀing giăng mah laih anŭn ƀing jum dar hăng laĭ: ‘Hơ̆k mơak bĕ hrŏm hăng kâo, yua kơ kâo ƀuh glaĭ laih prăk kak rơngiă anŭn.’ 
Thus, I say unto you, there is joy before the angels of God for one repenting sinner. @ Kar kaĭ mơ̆n, Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih thâo, ƀing ling jang hiam Ơi Adai mơak biă mă yua kơ sa čô mơnuih soh kơhmal tơlơi soh ñu.”
And he said, A certain man had two sons; @ Giơ̆ng anŭn Yêsu ruai dơ̆ng: “Sa čô mơnuih hmâo dua čô ană đah rơkơi. 
and the younger of them said to his father, Father, give to me the share of the property that falls [to me]. And he divided to them what he was possessed of. @ Pô adơi laĭ hăng ama ñu: ‘Ơ ama, rơkâo ih pơpha brơi kâo črăn kong ngăn lơ̆m kơ kâo.’ Laih anŭn ama gơñu pơpha brơi kong ngăn kơ dua gơñu. 
And after not many days the younger son gathering all together went away into a country a long way off, and there dissipated his property, living in debauchery. @ Ƀu sui ôh mơ̆ng anŭn, adơi ñu mă abih gơnam ñu hmâo laih anŭn nao pơ sa boh čar ataih. Pơ anŭn ñu pơprŏt pơrai kong ngăn ñu hăng tơlơi hơdip ngui ngơr tă tăn. 
But when he had spent all there arose a violent famine throughout that country, and he began to be in want. @ Tơ ñu pơplai hĭ abih gơnam laih, tơlơi ư̆ rơpa prŏng truh amăng čar anŭn, laih anŭn ñu čơdơ̆ng kơƀah kơƀap. 
And he went and joined himself to one of the citizens of that country, and he sent him into his fields to feed swine. @ Tui anŭn ñu khŏm nao mă bruă kơ sa čô mơnuih amăng čar anŭn. Pô anŭn pơkiaŏ ñu nao wai bơbui pơ tơdrŏn glai. 
And he longed to fill his belly with the husks which the swine were eating; and no one gave to him. @ Ñu kiăng biă mă ƀơ̆ng kơđuh rơtak arăng čem bơbui, samơ̆ arăng ƀu brơi ñu ƀơ̆ng sa mơta mơnơ̆ng hơgĕt ôh. 
And coming to himself, he said, How many hired servants of my father's have abundance of bread, and *I* perish here by famine. @ Hlăk anŭn ñu hơdơr glaĭ, ñu laĭ amăng pran jua ñu: ‘Hmâo lu ƀing mơnuih mă bruă apah amăng sang ama kâo, gơñu hmâo djŏp ƀañ tơpŭng ƀơ̆ng laih anŭn rơbeh rơbai, samơ̆ kâo pơ anai či djai rơwet. 
I will rise up and go to my father, and I will say to him, Father, I have sinned against heaven and before thee; @ Kâo či tơgŭ hăng glaĭ pơ ama kâo, laih anŭn kâo či laĭ hăng ñu: “Ơ Ama, kâo hmâo ngă soh laih hăng adai laih anŭn hăng ih. 
I am no longer worthy to be called thy son: make me as one of thy hired servants. @ Kâo ƀu lăp ôh ih iâu kâo ană ih dơ̆ng. Yap bĕ kâo kar hăng mơnuih mă bruă apah amăng sang ih.”’
And he rose up and went to his own father. But while he was yet a long way off, his father saw him, and was moved with compassion, and ran, and fell upon his neck, and covered him with kisses. @ Hnŭn yơh ñu tơgŭ mơtam glaĭ pơ ama ñu. Samơ̆ tơdang ñu ăt dŏ pơ ataih, ama ñu ƀuh ñu, glưh pran jua pap drap, đuaĭ nao kuar mă hăng čŭm ñu. 
And the son said to him, Father, I have sinned against heaven and before thee; I am no longer worthy to be called thy son. @ Laih anŭn ană đah rơkơi ñu laĭ hăng ñu: ‘Ơ Ama, kâo hmâo ngă soh glaĭ laih hăng adai laih anŭn hăng ih. Kâo ƀu lăp ôh ih iâu kâo ană ih dơ̆ng.’ 
But the father said to his bondmen, Bring out the best robe and clothe him in [it], and put a ring on his hand and sandals on his feet; @ Samơ̆ ama ñu laĭ kơ ƀing ding kơna ñu: ‘Mă rai tañ bĕ ao phyung hiam hloh buh brơi ñu, čŭt rơbưn ƀơi čơđeng ñu, laih anŭn čŭt brơi čơkhŏ ƀơi tơkai ñu. 
and bring the fatted calf and kill it, and let us eat and make merry: @ Mă bĕ ană rơmo rơmŏng laih anŭn čuh. Brơi ƀing ta ƀơ̆ng huă laih anŭn hơ̆k mơak, 
for this my son was dead and has come to life, was lost and has been found. And they began to make merry. @ Yua kơ ană kâo anai djai laih, samơ̆ ră anai ñu hơdip glaĭ laih. Ñu rơngiă laih, samơ̆ ră anai kâo ƀuh glaĭ dơ̆ng.’ Laih anŭn gơñu čơdơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă hơ̆k mơak.”
And his elder son was in the field; and as, coming [up], he drew nigh to the house, he heard music and dancing. @ “Hlăk anŭn ană kơčoa ñu dŏ pơ hmua. Tơ ñu glaĭ giăm truh pơ sang, ñu hmư̆ asăp gong, adoh laih anŭn tơlơi yŭn suang. 
And having called one of the servants, he inquired what these things might be. @ Ñu iâu sa čô amăng ding kơna laih anŭn tơña hơgĕt tơlơi anŭn. 
And he said to him, Thy brother is come, and thy father has killed the fatted calf because he has received him safe and well. @ Ding kơna anŭn laĭ kơ ñu: ‘Adơi ih hmâo glaĭ laih, laih anŭn ama ih hmâo čuh ană rơmo rơmŏng, yua kơ ƀuh gơ̆ glaĭ hiam drơi jan suaih prăl.’ 
But he became angry and would not go in. And his father went out and besought him. @ Ană kơčoa ñu hil mơtam laih anŭn hơngah ƀu kiăng mŭt amăng sang ôh. Ama ñu tơbiă nao hăng pơđur alum ñu. 
But he answering said to his father, Behold, so many years I serve thee, and never have I transgressed a commandment of thine; and to me hast thou never given a kid that I might make merry with my friends: @ Samơ̆ ñu laĭ hăng ama ñu: ‘Ơ ama lăng bĕ, sui thŭn laih kâo mă bruă kơ ih, kâo aka rơgao djơ̆ ôh asăp ih pơđar, samơ̆ ih ƀu brơi amơĭ kơ kâo sa drơi ană bơbe kiăng kơ kâo ngă tơlơi hơ̆k mơak hăng ƀing giăng mah kâo. 
but when this thy son, who has devoured thy substance with harlots, is come, thou hast killed for him the fatted calf. @ Samơ̆ tơ ană ih anŭn, jing pô hmâo pơprŏt pơrai abih kong ngăn ih hăng ƀing đah kơmơi rih răm laih anŭn wơ̆t glaĭ, samơ̆ ih čuh kơ ñu ană rơmo rơmŏng ƀơ̆ng huă hơ̆k mơak.’ 
But he said to him, Child, *thou* art ever with me, and all that is mine is thine. @ Ama ñu laĭ kơ ñu: ‘Ơ dăm, ih dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng kâo nanao, laih anŭn abih bang gơnam kâo hmâo jing gơnam ih. 
But it was right to make merry and rejoice, because this thy brother was dead and has come to life again, and was lost and has been found. @ Samơ̆ lăp yơh ngă tơlơi ƀơ̆ng huă laih anŭn hơ̆k mơak, yua kơ adơi ih anai djai laih, samơ̆ ră anai ñu hơdip glaĭ dơ̆ng; ñu rơngiă laih, samơ̆ ră anai ƀuh glaĭ dơ̆ng.’”
And he said also to [his] disciples, There was a certain rich man who had a steward, and *he* was accused to him as wasting his goods. @ Yêsu laĭ dơ̆ng kơ ƀing ding kơna Ñu: “Sa čô mơnuih pơdrŏng anŭn hmâo sa čô pô wai lăng sang ñu, arăng phong kơ ñu hmâo pơprŏt pơrai hĭ kong ngăn khua ñu. 
And having called him, he said to him, What [is] this that I hear of thee? give the reckoning of thy stewardship, for thou canst be no longer steward. @ Tui anŭn, khua anŭn iâu ñu laih anŭn laĭ kơ ñu: ‘Hơgĕt tơlơi ih hmâo ngă laih, kâo hmư̆ arăng phong kơ ih? Ruai pơdah bĕ abih bruă ih wai lăng sang kâo, yua kơ mơ̆ng ră anai ih ƀu dưi wai lăng sang kâo dơ̆ng tah.’ 
And the steward said within himself, What shall I do; for my lord is taking the stewardship from me? I am not able to dig; I am ashamed to beg. @ Pô wai lăng sang anŭn laĭ amăng pran jua: ‘Khua kâo khăt bruă kâo wai lăng sang ñu, hơgĕt kâo či ngă? Nao ngă hmua kâo ƀu ai ôh, nao rơkâo dan kâo mlâo hañ. 
I know what I will do, that when I shall have been removed from the stewardship I may be received into their houses. @ Kâo thâo laih hơgĕt kâo khŏm ngă kiăng kơ hmâo mơnuih jum kâo mŭt amăng sang gơñu, tơ khua kâo khăt bruă kâo.’ 
And having called to [him] each one of the debtors of his own lord, he said to the first, How much owest thou to my lord? @ Tui anŭn, ñu iâu mă hơjăn rĭm čô ƀing đom hơnưh kơ khua ñu, laih anŭn tơña kơ pô blŭng hlâo: ‘Hơdôm ih đom hơnưh kơ khua kâo?’ 
And he said, A hundred baths of oil. And he said to him, Take thy writing and sit down quickly and write fifty. @ Gơ̆ laĭ: ‘Sa rơtuh kơthŭng ia luil ôliwơ.’ Ñu laĭ kơ gơ̆: ‘Mă hră hơnưh ih, dŏ ber tañ laih anŭn čih glaĭ rơma pluh.’ 
Then he said to another, And thou, how much dost thou owe? And he said, A hundred cors of wheat. And he says to him, Take thy writing and write eighty. @ Giơ̆ng anŭn ñu tơña kơ sa čô pơkŏn: ‘Bơ ih, hơdôm ih đom hơnưh?’ Gơ̆ laĭ glaĭ: ‘Sa rơtuh reo pơdai.’ Ñu laĭ kơ gơ̆: ‘Mă hră hơnưh ih laih anŭn čih glaĭ sapăn pluh.’ 
And the lord praised the unrighteous steward because he had done prudently. For the sons of this world are, for their own generation, more prudent than the sons of light. @ Khua kơ pô wai lăng sang ƀu tŏng ten anŭn bơni kơ ñu, yua kơ ñu ngă laih hăng tơlơi kơhnâo; yua kơ ƀing mơnuih rơnŭk anai kơhnâo hloh kơ ƀing ană bă tơlơi bơngač amăng tơlơi gơñu hơdip hăng tơdruă.
And *I* say to you, Make to yourselves friends with the mammon of unrighteousness, that when it fails ye may be received into the eternal tabernacles. @ Laih anŭn kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, brơi ƀing gih yua dram gơnam ƀu hiam klă kiăng ngă gơyut gơyâo, kiăng kơ tơ mơnơ̆ng anŭn abih hĭ laih, gơñu či tŭ jum ƀing gih amăng sang hlŏng lar. 
He that is faithful in the least is faithful also in much; and he that is unrighteous in the least is unrighteous also in much. @ Hlơi pô tŏng ten amăng bruă anĕt aneo ăt ñu tŏng ten amăng bruă prŏng mơ̆n; laih anŭn hlơi pô ƀu tơpă amăng bruă anĕt aneo, ăt ƀu tơpă amăng bruă prŏng mơ̆n. 
If therefore ye have not been faithful in the unrighteous mammon, who shall entrust to you the true? @ Tui anŭn tơdah ƀing gih ƀu tŏng ten ôh amăng dram gơnam ƀu hiam klă, hlơi či jao kơ ƀing gih dram gơnam sĭt lĕ? 
and if ye have not been faithful in that which is another's, who shall give to you your own? @ Laih anŭn tơdah ƀing gih ƀu tŏng ten ôh hăng dram gơnam pô pơkŏn, hlơi či jao brơi kơ ƀing gih dram gơnam kơ gih pô lĕ?
No servant can serve two masters, for either he will hate the one and will love the other, or he will cleave to the one and despise the other. Ye cannot serve God and mammon. @  Sa čô ding kơna ƀu dưi mă bruă kơ dua čô khua ôh, yua kơ ñu či bơrơmŭt kơ khua anai laih anŭn khăp kơ khua pơkŏn, ƀôdah ñu či pơpŭ kơ khua anai laih anŭn mưč kơ khua pơkŏn. Ƀing gih ƀu dưi mă bruă kơ Ơi Adai laih anŭn kơ prăk kak hrŏm hơbĭt ôh.”
And the Pharisees also, who were covetous, heard all these things, and mocked him. @ Ƀing Pharisi, jing ƀing hưp ham kơ prăk, hmư̆ abih tơlơi anŭn laih anŭn gơñu djik kơ Yêsu. 
And he said to them, *Ye* are they who justify themselves before men, but God knows your hearts; for what amongst men is highly thought of is an abomination before God. @ Samơ̆ Yêsu laĭ gơñu: “Ƀing gih jing ƀing mơnuih ngă mă tơpă hơnơ̆ng ƀơi anăp ană mơnuih, samơ̆ Ơi Adai thâo pran jua ƀing gih; yua kơ hơgĕt tơlơi ƀing ană mơnuih pơpŭ, Ơi Adai bơrơmŭt khĕl kơ tơlơi anŭn.
The law and the prophets [were] until John: from that time the glad tidings of the kingdom of God are announced, and every one forces his way into it. @ Tơlơi juăt laih anŭn boh pơhiăp laĭ lui hlâo hmâo truh pơ rơnŭk Yôhan đôč; čơdơ̆ng mơ̆ng rơnŭk anŭn arăng pơtô Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam kơ dêh čar pơtao Ơi Adai, laih anŭn abih bang mơnuih yua tơlơi kơtang pơrơsua kiăng kơ mŭt ƀơi anŭn. 
But it is easier that the heaven and the earth should pass away than that one tittle of the law should fail. @ Lŏn rai adai rơgao hĭ amuñ hloh kơ sut hĭ sa tŭt sa gat boh hră amăng tơlơi juăt.
Every one who puts away his wife and marries another commits adultery; and every one that marries one put away from a husband commits adultery. @ Hlơi pô klaih lui bơnai ñu laih anŭn dŏ bơnai pơkŏn ñu soh klĕ pyu yơh; laih anŭn hlơi pô dŏ sa čô đah kơmơi rơkơi ñu klaih lui laih ăt jing soh klĕ pyu mơ̆n.”
Now there was a rich man and he was clothed in purple and fine linen, making good cheer in splendour every day. @ “Hmâo sa čô mơnuih pơdrŏng buh ao mriah ngă hăng bơnal kơbuă añĕ ară, rĭm hrơi ƀơ̆ng mơñum mơnơ̆ng hiam jơman. 
And [there was] a poor man, by name Lazarus, [who] was laid at his gateway full of sores, @ Hmâo sa čô mơnuih ƀun rin, anăn gơ̆ Lasar, dŏ đih ƀơi amăng jang ñu, drơi jan gơ̆ bă hăng mruih kơčung. 
and desiring to be filled with the crumbs which fell from the table of the rich man; but the dogs also coming licked his sores. @ Gơ̆ kiăng ƀơ̆ng biă mă aru djah lĕ mơ̆ng kơƀang pô pơdrŏng. Hmâo ƀing asâo rai liah rơka mruih kơčung ñu. 
And it came to pass that the poor man died, and that he was carried away by the angels into the bosom of Abraham. And the rich man also died and was buried. @ Mơnuih ƀun rin anŭn djai hĭ, laih anŭn ƀing ling jang hiam pŭ ba pioh gơ̆ ƀơi tơda Abraham. Mơnuih pơdrŏng ăt djai kar kaĭ mơ̆n, laih anŭn arăng ba dơr ñu. 
And in hades lifting up his eyes, being in torments, he sees Abraham afar off, and Lazarus in his bosom. @ Amăng plei ƀing djai tơdang ñu dŏ ruă nuă tơnap tap, ñu angak mơta lăng đĭ laih anŭn ƀuh Abraham pơ ataih laih anŭn Lasar dŏ ƀơi tơda ñu. 
And he crying out said, Father Abraham, have compassion on me, and send Lazarus that he may dip the tip of his finger in water and cool my tongue, for I am suffering in this flame. @ Ñu ur kraih: ‘Ơ ama Abraham, pap drap kơ kâo đa, pơkiaŏ rai bĕ Lasar añrŭ jŭng čơđeng amăng ia laih anŭn ngă rơơ̆ brơi jơlah kâo, yua kơ amăng jơlah apui anai kâo ruă nuă tơnap tap biă mă.’ 
But Abraham said, Child, recollect that *thou* hast fully received thy good things in thy lifetime, and likewise Lazarus evil things. But now he is comforted here, and *thou* art in suffering. @ Samơ̆ Abraham laĭ: ‘Ơ dăm, hơdơr glaĭ bĕ hlăk ih dŏ hơdip ih hmâo mă tŭ laih lu tơlơi hiam mơak, bơ Lasar tŭ mă lu tơlơi sat. Ră anai pơ anai Lasar hmâo tơlơi pơalum laih anŭn ih hmâo tơlơi ruă tơnap. 
And besides all this, between us and you a great chasm is fixed, so that those who desire to pass hence to you cannot, nor do they who [desire to cross] from there pass over unto us. @ Hloh kơ anŭn dơ̆ng, kơplah wah gơmơi hăng ih hmâo sa amăng luh prŏng dlam, tơl kơ hlơi mơ̆ng anai kiăng nao pơ anŭn ƀu dưi ôh, laih anŭn hlơi mơ̆ng anŭn kiăng rai pơ anai ăt kŏn dưi lơi.’ 
And he said, I beseech thee then, father, that thou wouldest send him to the house of my father, @ Mơnuih pơdrŏng laĭ: ‘Tơdah tui anŭn kâo rơkâo kơwưh kơ ih, ơ ama, pơkiaŏ nao bĕ Lasar nao pơ sang ama kâo, 
for I have five brothers, so that he may earnestly testify to them, that they also may not come to this place of torment. @ yua kơ kâo hmâo rơma čô adơi ayŏng, kiăng kơ ñu nao pơthâo pơgăn gơñu hwĭ kơ gơñu ăt lĕ amăng anih ruă tơnap tap anai mơ̆n.’ 
But Abraham says to him, They have Moses and the prophets: let them hear them. @ Samơ̆ Abraham laĭ: ‘Gơñu hmâo laih Môis hăng ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo. Brơi gơñu dŏ hmư̆ ƀing anŭn bĕ.’ 
But he said, Nay, father Abraham, but if one from the dead should go to them, they will repent. @ Pô pơdrŏng laĭ glaĭ ‘Ư ưh, ơ ama Abraham, samơ̆ tơdah hmâo mơnuih djai hơdip glaĭ nao pơ gơñu, sĭt gơñu či kơhmal tơlơi soh gơñu.’ 
And he said to him, If they hear not Moses and the prophets, not even if one rise from among [the] dead will they be persuaded. @ Abraham laĭ kơ ñu: ‘Tơdah gơñu ƀu gưt hmư̆ ôh Môis hăng ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo, wơ̆t dah hmâo mơnuih djai hơdip glaĭ dơ̆ng kŏn hmâo tơlơi hơgĕt dưi ngă brơi kơ ƀing gơñu đaŏ lơi.’”
And he said to his disciples, It cannot be but that offences come, but woe [to him] by whom they come! @ Yêsu laĭ kơ ƀing ding kơna Ñu: “Tơlơi pơteč tơhnač khŏm truh sĭt, samơ̆ răm ƀăm yơh kơ hlơi pô ngă tơlơi teč tơhnač anŭn! 
It would be [more] profitable for him if a millstone were hanged about his neck and he cast into the sea, than that he should be a snare to one of these little ones. @ Hiam hloh akă ƀơi tơkuai pô anŭn sa boh rơsŭng boh pơtâo laih anŭn glŏm hĭ ñu amăng ia rơsĭ, hloh kơ lui ñu ngă brơi sa čô amăng ƀing anĕt anai ngă soh.
Take heed to yourselves: if thy brother should sin, rebuke him; and if he should repent, forgive him. @ Brơi ƀing gih thâo răng bĕ. Tơdah adơi ayŏng ih ngă soh, ƀuah ñu bĕ; laih anŭn tơdah gơñu kơhmal tơlơi soh gơñu, pap brơi gơñu bĕ. 
And if he should sin against thee seven times in the day, and seven times should return to thee, saying, I repent, thou shalt forgive him. @ Laih anŭn tơdah ñu ngă soh hăng ih tơjuh wơ̆t amăng sa hrơi, laih anŭn tơjuh wơ̆t mơ̆n ñu rai laĭ hăng ih: ‘Kâo kơhmal tơlơi soh kâo,’ brơi ih khŏm pap brơi kơ ñu.”
And the apostles said to the Lord, Give more faith to us. @ Ƀing khua ding kơna laĭ hăng Khua Yang: “Rơkâo kơ Ih thim brơi tơlơi đaŏ ƀing gơmơi!”
But the Lord said, If ye have faith as a grain of mustard [seed], ye had said to this sycamine tree, Be thou rooted up, and be thou planted in the sea, and it would have obeyed you. @ Khua Yang laĭ: “Tơdah ƀing gih hmâo tơlơi đaŏ đơr sa asar pơjeh añăm bơi, ƀing gih dưi laĭ kơ phŭn kơyâo sikamôr anai: ‘Tơbuč bĕ ih laih anŭn nao čăt amăng ia rơsĭ,’ laih anŭn ñu či gưt kơ ƀing gih mơ̆n.”
But which of you [is there] who, having a bondman ploughing or shepherding, when he comes in out of the field, will say, Come and lie down immediately to table? @ “Hmâo mơ̆ hlơi amăng ƀing gih hmâo sa čô ding kơna nao čuar hmua ƀôdah wai triu, tơdah ñu phrâo glaĭ mơ̆ng hmua gih či laĭ kơ ñu: ‘Rai tañ bĕ dŏ ber ƀơ̆ng huă mơtam’? 
But will he not say to him, Prepare what I shall sup on, and gird thyself and serve me that I may eat and drink; and after that *thou* shalt eat and drink? @ Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă ñu či laĭ kơ gơ̆: ‘Rơmet mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă kơ kâo bĕ, hruă hơdrăng kơiăng ih laih anŭn buih bruă kơ kâo tơl kâo ƀơ̆ng huă giơ̆ng kah ih ƀơ̆ng huă’? 
Is he thankful to the bondman because he has done what was ordered? I judge not. @ Ñu či bơni mơ̆ kơ ƀing ding kơna anŭn yua kơ gơ̆ ngă laih tơlơi ñu pơtă? 
Thus *ye* also, when ye shall have done all things that have been ordered you, say, We are unprofitable bondmen; we have done what it was our duty to do. @ Ƀing gih kar kaĭ mơ̆n, tơ ƀing gih ngă giơ̆ng laih abih tơlơi arăng pơđar kơ ƀing gih khŏm ngă, laĭ bĕ: ‘Gơmơi jing ƀing ding kơna ƀu lăp ôh, tơlơi ƀing gơmơi hmâo ngă laih kơnơ̆ng jing bruă jao laih kơ ƀing gơmơi khŏm ngă.’”
And it came to pass as he was going up to Jerusalem, that he passed through the midst of Samaria and Galilee. @ Tơdang Yêsu nao pơ Yêrusalem, Ñu găn nao kơplah wah guai tring Samari hăng tring Galilê. 
And as he entered into a certain village ten leprous men met him, who stood afar off. @ Tơ Ñu mŭt amăng sa boh plei anŭn, hmâo pluh čô mơnuih djơ̆ phŭng rai čơkă Ñu. Gơñu dŏ pơ ataih 
And they lifted up [their] voice saying, Jesus, Master, have compassion on us. @ laih anŭn iâu kraih: “Ơ Yêsu, Ơ Nai, pap mơñai kơ gơmơi đa!”
And seeing [them] he said to them, Go, shew yourselves to the priests. And it came to pass as they were going they were cleansed. @ Tơ Yêsu ƀuh gơñu, Ñu laĭ: “Nao pơrơđah bĕ ƀing gih pô kơ ƀing khua ngă yang.” Laih anŭn tơdang gơñu nao, gơñu hmâo tơlơi rơgoh. 
And one of them, seeing that he was cured, turned back, glorifying God with a loud voice, @ Sa čô amăng ƀing gơñu, ƀuh ñu hlao laih, ñu wơ̆t glaĭ pơpŭ bơni hơơč kơ Ơi Adai hăng săp kraih kơtang. 
and fell on [his] face at his feet giving him thanks: and *he* was a Samaritan. @ Gơ̆ bon kŭp ƀơi tơkai Yêsu, laih anŭn bơni hơơč kơ Ñu. Pô anŭn jing sa čô mơnuih Samari. 
And Jesus answering said, Were not the ten cleansed? but the nine, where [are they]? @ Tui anŭn Yêsu laĭ: “Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă pluh čô hmâo tơlơi rơgoh? Pơpă dua rơpăn čô anŭn lĕ? 
There have not been found to return and give glory to God save this stranger. @ Kơnơ̆ng sa čô tuai anai đôč hă wơ̆t glaĭ pơpŭ bơni kơ Ơi Adai?” 
And he said to him, Rise up and go thy way: thy faith has made thee well. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơ̆: “Tơgŭ nao bĕ, tơlơi đaŏ ih hmâo pơklaih ih laih.”
And having been asked by the Pharisees, When is the kingdom of God coming? he answered them and said, The kingdom of God does not come with observation; @ Ƀing Pharisi tơña kơ Yêsu hơbin dêh čar pơtao Ơi Adai či truh, laih anŭn Ñu laĭ glaĭ: “Dêh čar pơtao Ơi Adai ƀu rai hăng tơlơi klă rơđah tơl arăng dưi ƀuh ôh. 
nor shall they say, Lo here, or, Lo there; for behold, the kingdom of God is in the midst of you. @ Arăng kŏn dưi laĭ lơi: ‘Lăng adih, ñu pơ anai!’ Ƀôdah: ‘Ñu pơ anŭn!’ Yua kơ, dêh čar pơtao Ơi Adai dŏ amăng pran jua ƀing gih.”
And he said to the disciples, Days are coming, when ye shall desire to see one of the days of the Son of man, and shall not see [it]. @ Ñu laĭ dơ̆ng kơ ƀing ding kơna Ñu: “Či hmâo sa hrơi ƀing gih čang kiăng dưi ƀuh sa hrơi Ană Mơnuih, samơ̆ ƀing gih ƀu dưi ƀuh ôh. 
And they will say to you, Lo here, or Lo there; go not, nor follow [them]. @ Arăng či laĭ kơ ƀing gih: ‘Ñu pơ anŭn’ ƀôdah ‘Ñu pơ anai!’ Anăm nao ôh; anăm đuaĭ tui gơñu ôh. 
For as the lightning shines which lightens from [one end] under heaven to [the other end] under heaven, thus shall the Son of man be in his day. @ Yua kơ kar hăng kơmlă blĭp črang mơ̆ng rơnuč adai anai truh pơ rơnuč adai adih, Ană Mơnuih amăng hrơi Ñu či jing ăt kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n. 
But first he must suffer many things and be rejected of this generation. @ Samơ̆ blŭng hlâo, Ñu khŏm tŭ lu tơlơi ruă nuă laih anŭn ƀing mơnuih rơnŭk anai či hơngah lui Ñu. 
And as it took place in the days of Noe, thus also shall it be in the days of the Son of man: @ Amăng rơnŭk Nôê hyư̆m pă, amăng hrơi Ană Mơnuih ăt kar kaĭ mơ̆n. 
they ate, they drank, they married, they were given in marriage, until the day that Noe entered into the ark, and the flood came and destroyed all [of them]; @ Arăng ƀơ̆ng mơñum, pơdŏ rơkơi bơnai, gơñu brơi ană bă pơdŏ rơkơi bơnai, tơl truh hrơi Nôê mŭt amăng kompăn, laih anŭn ia lip truh pơrai hĭ gơñu. 
and in like manner as took place in the days of Lot: they ate, they drank, they bought, they sold, they planted, they builded; @ Tơlơi hmâo truh amăng rơnŭk Lot ăt kar kaĭ mơ̆n: Arăng ƀơ̆ng mơñum, sĭ mia pơdrô čan, jŭ pla, ngă sang. 
but on the day that Lot went out from Sodom, it rained fire and sulphur from heaven, and destroyed all [of them]: @ Samơ̆ ƀơi hrơi Lot tơbiă mơ̆ng plei Sôđôm hmâo apui laih anŭn boh pơtâo apui lĕ mơ̆ng adai pơrai hĭ abih gơñu. 
after this [manner] shall it be in the day that the Son of man is revealed. @ Hrơi Ană Mơnuih bơrơđah rai ăt kar kaĭ mơ̆n.
In that day, he who shall be on the housetop, and his stuff in the house, let him not go down to take it away; and he that is in the field, let him likewise not return back. @ Amăng hrơi anŭn, hlơi pô dŏ ƀơi bơbŭng sang, anăm trŭn mă dram gơnam ñu amăng sang ôh. Ăt kar kaĭ mơ̆n hlơi pô dŏ pơ hmua anăm wơ̆t glaĭ pơ sang ñu lơi. 
Remember the wife of Lot. @ Hơdơr glaĭ bĕ kơ bơnai Lot. 
Whosoever shall seek to save his life shall lose it, and whosoever shall lose it shall preserve it. @ Hlơi pô hơduah jơlan kiăng pơklaih tơlơi hơdip ñu, ñu či rơngiă hĭ gơ̆; samơ̆ hlơi pô rơngiă tơlơi hơdip ñu, ñu či hmâo glaĭ gơ̆. 
I say to you, In that night there shall be two [men] upon one bed; one shall be seized and the other shall be let go. @ Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, amăng mlam anŭn či hmâo dua čô mơnuih đih hrŏm sa boh sưng, sa čô arăng mă đuaĭ, sa čô arăng lui. 
Two [women] shall be grinding together; the one shall be seized and the other shall be let go. @ Či hmâo dua čô đah kơmơi dŏ tơ̆p pơdai hrŏm hơbĭt, sa čô arăng či mă đĭ laih anŭn sa čô arăng pioh glaĭ.” 
And answering they say to him, Where, Lord? And he said to them, Where the body [is], there the eagles will be gathered together. @ Ƀing ding kơna tơña kơ Yêsu: “Ơ Khua, pơpă tơlơi anŭn či truh?” Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Pơpă hmâo kơmăp drơi jan djai, pơ anŭn klang grư̆ či pơƀŭt glaĭ.”
And he spoke also a parable to them to the purport that they should always pray and not faint, @ Yêsu pơhiăp sa tơlơi bơhmutu kơ gơñu kiăng gơñu thâo khŏm iâu laĭ nanao, anăm hơtah hơtai ôh. 
saying, There was a judge in a city, not fearing God and not respecting man: @ Ñu laĭ: “Amăng sa boh plei anŭn hmâo sa čô khua phat kơđi ƀu hwĭ pơpŭ kơ Ơi Adai ôh, kŏn pơpŭ kơ mơnuih lơi. 
and there was a widow in that city, and she came to him, saying, Avenge me of mine adverse party. @ Amăng plei anŭn hmâo sa čô đah kơmơi blao rai pơ ñu nanao laih anŭn laĭ: ‘Phat brơi bĕ hăng tơlơi tơpă kơđi kâo hăng pô ayăt kâo.’ 
And he would not for a time; but afterwards he said within himself, If even I fear not God and respect not man, @ Pô khua anŭn hơngah sui laih, samơ̆ tơdơi kơ anŭn ñu pơmĭn glaĭ amăng pran jua ñu: ‘Wơ̆t dah kâo ƀu hwĭ pơpŭ kơ Ơi Adai ôh, kŏn pơpŭ kơ mơnuih lơi, 
at any rate because this widow annoys me I will avenge her, that she may not by perpetually coming completely harass me. @ samơ̆ yua kơ đah kơmơi blao anai ngă pơrŭng kâo, hnŭn yơh kâo či phat brơi kơđi ñu hăng tơlơi tơpă, kiăng kơ ñu ƀu rai ngă bơngơ̆t bơngañ kâo dơ̆ng ôh.’ ”
And the Lord said, Hear what the unjust judge says. @ Giơ̆ng anŭn Khua Yang laĭ: “Hmư̆ bĕ hơgĕt tơlơi khua phat kơđi ƀu tơpă laĭ. 
And shall not God at all avenge his elect, who cry to him day and night, and he bears long as to them? @ Hyư̆m, Ơi Adai ƀu phat brơi kơđi hăng tơlơi tơpă kơ ƀing mơnuih Ñu hmâo ruah mă laih, jing ƀing mơnuih hrơi mlam ur kơwưh kơ Ñu ôh hă? Ñu či pơhrưĭ amăng tơlơi djru kơ gơñu mơ̆? 
I say unto you that he will avenge them speedily. But when the Son of man comes, shall he indeed find faith on the earth? @ Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, Ñu či tañ mơtam phat brơi kơđi kơ ƀing gơñu hăng tơlơi tơpă. Samơ̆ tơ Ană Mơnuih rai, Ñu či ƀuh mơ̆ tơlơi đaŏ ƀơi lŏn tơnah?”
And he spoke also to some, who trusted in themselves that they were righteous and made nothing of all the rest [of men], this parable: @ Yêsu pơhiăp tơlơi bơhmutu anai dơ̆ng kơ đơđa ƀing mơnuih yap gơñu pô jing mơnuih tơpă laih anŭn mưč mač kơ ƀing mơnuih pơkŏn. 
Two men went up into the temple to pray; the one a Pharisee, and the other a tax-gatherer. @ “Hmâo dua čô mơnuih đĭ nao pơ sang kơkuh pơpŭ kiăng iâu laĭ: sa čô jing Pharisi laih anŭn sa čô pơkŏn jing mơnuih ring jia. 
The Pharisee, standing, prayed thus to himself: God, I thank thee that I am not as the rest of men, rapacious, unjust, adulterers, or even as this tax-gatherer. @ Pô Pharisi tơgŭ dơ̆ng hơjăn laih anŭn iâu laĭ kơ ñu pô tui anai: ‘Ơ Ơi Adai, kâo bơni kơ Ih yua kơ kâo ƀu djơ̆ kar hăng ƀing mơnuih pơkŏn ôh. Gơñu jing ƀing mơnuih hưp ham, ƀing ƀu tơpă klă, ƀing klĕ pyu, kŏn hrup hăng mơnuih ring jia anai lơi. 
I fast twice in the week, I tithe everything I gain. @ Kâo ư̆ ƀơ̆ng huă sa hrơi kơ̆m dua wơ̆t. Kâo pơyơr sa črăn amăng pluh mơ̆ng abih gơnam kâo hmâo.’ 
And the tax-gatherer, standing afar off, would not lift up even his eyes to heaven, but smote upon his breast, saying, O God, have compassion on me, the sinner. @ Samơ̆ mơnuih ring jia dŏ pơ ataih ƀu khĭn angak mơta ñu pơ adai ôh, samơ̆ ñu tŭk tơda ñu hăng laĭ: ‘Ơ Ơi Adai, pap mơñai kơ kâo đa, yua kơ kâo jing sa čô mơnuih soh!’ 
I say unto you, This [man] went down to his house justified rather than that [other]. For every one who exalts himself shall be humbled, and he that humbles himself shall be exalted. @ Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, pô ring jia anai glaĭ pơ sang hmâo laih tơlơi yap tơpă hloh kơ pô Pharisi anŭn. Yua kơ hlơi pô pŭ đĭ ñu pô, Ơi Adai či pơtrŭn hĭ ñu; samơ̆ hlơi pô pơtrŭn ñu pô Ơi Adai či pŭ đĭ ñu.”
And they brought to him also infants that he might touch them, but the disciples when they saw [it] rebuked them. @ Arăng ăt ba nao ƀing čơđai anĕt nao pơ Yêsu, kiăng kơ Ñu dưi ah tơngan ƀơi ƀing gơñu; tơ ƀing ding kơna ƀuh tơlơi anŭn, gơñu khă ƀing ba nao ƀing čơđai. 
But Jesus calling them to [him] said, Suffer little children to come to me, and do not forbid them, for of such is the kingdom of God. @ Samơ̆ Yêsu iâu gơñu hăng laĭ: “Brơi ƀing čơđai rai pơ Kâo bĕ, anăm khă gơñu ôh, yua kơ dêh čar pơtao Ơi Adai lơ̆m kơ ƀing jing kar hăng ƀing čơđai anŭn. 
Verily I say to you, Whosoever shall not receive the kingdom of God as a little child shall in no wise enter therein. @ Sĭt biă mă Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, hlơi pô ƀu tŭ mă dêh čar pơtao Ơi Adai kar hăng sa čô čơđai ñu ƀu dưi mŭt pơ anŭn ôh.”
And a certain ruler asked him saying, Good teacher, having done what, shall I inherit eternal life? @ Sa čô khua wai lăng tơña kơ Yêsu: “Ơ nai, pô hiam klă, hơgĕt kâo khŏm ngă kiăng kơ dưi tŭ mă tơlơi hơdip hlŏng lar?” 
But Jesus said to him, Why callest thou me good? There is none good but one, God. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ ñu: “Yua hơgĕt ih iâu Kâo jing hiam klă? Ƀu hmâo hlơi jing pô hiam klă ôh, kơnơ̆ng hơjăn Ơi Adai đôč. 
Thou knowest the commandments: Do not commit adultery, Do not kill, Do not steal, Do not bear false witness, Honour thy father and thy mother. @ Ih thâo laih tơlơi juăt: ‘Anăm klĕ pyu; anăm pơdjai mơnuih; anăm klĕ dŏp; anăm ngă gơ̆ng jơlan ƀlor; pơpŭ bĕ kơ amĭ ama ih.’”
And he said, All these things have I kept from my youth. @ Pô anŭn laĭ glaĭ: “Kâo gưt laih abih tơlơi anŭn dơ̆ng mơ̆ng kâo dŏ čơđai.”
And when Jesus had heard this, he said to him, One thing is lacking to thee yet: Sell all that thou hast and distribute to the poor, and thou shalt have treasure in the heavens, and come, follow me. @ Tơ Yêsu hmư̆ tơlơi anŭn, Ñu laĭ kơ gơ̆: “Ih ăt dŏ kơƀah sa tơlơi. Sĭ hĭ bĕ abih bang gơnam ih hmâo laih anŭn pơpha brơi ƀing ƀun rin, laih anŭn ih či hmâo dram gơnam yom amăng adai, giơ̆ng anŭn đuaĭ tui kâo bĕ.” 
But when he heard this he became very sorrowful, for he was very rich. @ Samơ̆ tơ ñu hmư̆ tơlơi anŭn ñu rơngot biă mă, yua kơ ñu pơdrŏng biă mă. 
But when Jesus saw that he became very sorrowful, he said, How difficultly shall those who have riches enter into the kingdom of God; @ Yêsu lăng ñu laih anŭn laĭ: “Tơnap tap đơi kơ mơnuih pơdrŏng sah mŭt amăng dêh čar pơtao Ơi Adai! 
for it is easier for a camel to enter through a needle's eye than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God. @ Yua kơ sa drơi aseh samô čur mŭt ƀơi amăng jrum amuñ hloh hăng sa čô pơdrŏng mŭt amăng dêh čar pơtao Ơi Adai!”
And those who heard it said, And who can be saved? @ Ƀing hmư̆ tơlơi anŭn laĭ: “Tui anŭn hlơi dưi klaih lĕ?”
But he said, The things that are impossible with men are possible with God. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Hơgĕt tơlơi ană mơnuih ƀu dưi ngă ôh, Ơi Adai yơh dưi ngă.”
And Peter said, Behold, *we* have left all things and have followed thee. @ Pêtrôs laĭ: “Lăng anai, gơmơi lui hĭ laih sang gơmơi laih anŭn đuaĭ tui Ih.” 
And he said to them, Verily I say to you, There is no one who has left home, or parents, or brethren, or wife, or children, for the kingdom of God's sake, @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Sĭt biă mă Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, hlơi pô lui laih pưk sang, ană bơnai, adơi ayŏng, amĭ ama, yua kơ dêh čar pơtao Ơi Adai, 
who shall not receive manifold more at this time, and in the coming age life eternal. @ ñu či tŭ mă lu hloh amăng rơnŭk anai, laih anŭn amăng rơnŭk tơdơi či tŭ mă tơlơi hơdip hlŏng lar.”
And he took the twelve to [him] and said to them, Behold, we go up to Jerusalem, and all things that are written of the Son of man by the prophets shall be accomplished; @ Giơ̆ng anŭn, Yêsu ba pluh dua čô khua ding kơna nao hơjăn hăng laĭ kơ gơñu: “Anai nê, ƀing ta đĭ nao pơ Yêrusalem. Abih tơlơi ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo hmâo čih laih kơ Ană Mơnuih či krĕp djơ̆. 
for he shall be delivered up to the nations, and shall be mocked, and insulted, and spit upon. @ Yua kơ arăng či jao hĭ Ñu kơ ƀing djuai tuai, arăng či djik djak kơ Ñu, ngă pơmlâo Ñu, laih anŭn kơčuh ia bah ƀơi Ñu. 
And when they have scourged [him] they will kill him; and on the third day he will rise again. @ Arăng či taih Ñu hăng hrĕ hnuăt laih anŭn pơdjai Ñu, samơ̆ ƀơi hrơi tal klâo Ñu či hơdip glaĭ dơ̆ng.”
And they understood nothing of these things. And this word was hidden from them, and they did not know what was said. @ Samơ̆ ƀing ding kơna ƀu thâo hluh ôh tơlơi anŭn, yua kơ khul boh pơhiăp anŭn jing hơgơ̆m kơ gơñu, laih anŭn gơñu ƀu thâo hluh ôh hơgĕt tơlơi Yêsu kiăng laĭ.
And it came to pass when he came into the neighbourhood of Jericho, a certain blind man sat by the wayside begging. @ Tơ Yêsu giăm truh pơ Yêrikô, hmâo sa čô mơnuih bum mơta dŏ ber rơkâo dan ƀơi akiăng jơlan. 
And when he heard the crowd passing, he inquired what this might be. @ Gơ̆ hmư̆ phung lu găn ƀơi anŭn, gơ̆ tơña hơgĕt tơlơi anŭn. 
And they told him that Jesus the Nazaraean was passing by. @ Arăng laĭ glaĭ: “Yêsu plei Nasaret hlăk găn nao.” 
And he called out saying, Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me. @ Pô bum anŭn ur kraih mơtam: “Ơ Yêsu, Ană Pơtao Đawit, rơkâo Ih pap mơñai kơ kâo đa!” 
And those [who were] going before rebuked him that he might be silent; but *he* cried out so much the more, Son of David, have mercy on me. @ Ƀing mơnuih nao hlâo khă brơi ñu dŏ rơiăt. Samơ̆ gơ̆ ur kơtang hloh dơ̆ng: “Ơ Ană Pơtao Đawit, rơkâo Ih pap mơñai kơ kâo đa!” 
And Jesus stood still, and commanded him to be led to him. And when he drew nigh he asked him [saying], @ Yêsu dŏ hĭ, brơi arăng ba gơ̆ nao pơ Ñu; laih anŭn tơ ñu nao giăm, Yêsu tơña kơ gơ̆, 
What wilt thou that I shall do to thee? And he said, Lord, that I may see. @ “Hơgĕt ih kiăng Kâo ngă brơi kơ ih?” Gơ̆ laĭ: “Ơ khua Yang, brơi kâo thâo ƀuh glaĭ dơ̆ng.”
And Jesus said to him, See: thy faith has healed thee. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ ñu: “Ƀuh rơđah bĕ! Tơlơi đaŏ ih hmâo pơsuaih ih laih.”
And immediately he saw, and followed him, glorifying God. And all the people when they saw [it] gave praise to God. @ Tañ mơtam gơ̆ ƀuh glaĭ rơđah dơ̆ng laih anŭn đuaĭ tui Yêsu, pơpŭ bơni kơ Ơi Adai. Abih bang ƀing ană plei ƀuh tơlơi anŭn, gơñu bơni hơơč kơ Ơi Adai.
And he entered and passed through Jericho. @ Yêsu mŭt amăng Plei Yêrikô laih anŭn găn plei anŭn. 
And behold, [there was] a man by name called Zacchaeus, and he was chief tax-gatherer, and he was rich. @ Pơ anŭn hmâo sa čô mơnuih pơdrŏng anăn ñu Sačê, ñu jing sa čô khua ƀing ring jia. 
And he sought to see Jesus who he was: and he could not for the crowd, because he was little in stature. @ Ñu hơduah kiăng lăng hlơi Yêsu jing, samơ̆ ƀu dưi ƀuh ôh yua kơ ƀing mơnuih lu, laih anŭn ñu jing mơnuih ber. 
And running on before, he got up into a sycamore that he might see him, for he was going to pass that [way]. @ Tui anŭn ñu nao hlâo laih anŭn đĭ ƀơi phŭn kơyâo Sikamôr kiăng lăng Yêsu, yua kơ Yêsu či găn nao pơ anŭn. 
And when he came up to the place, Jesus looked up and saw him, and said to him, Zacchaeus, make haste and come down, for to-day I must remain in thy house. @ Tơ Yêsu truh pơ anih anŭn, Yêsu angak lăng đĭ hăng laĭ: “Ơ Sačê trŭn tañ bĕ, yua kơ hrơi anai Kâo khŏm dŏ glaĭ amăng sang ih.”
And he made haste and came down, and received him with joy. @ Tui anŭn Sačê trŭn ječ meč mơtam hăng hơ̆k kơdơ̆k jum Yêsu. 
And all murmured when they saw [it], saying, He has turned in to lodge with a sinful man. @ Ƀing mơnuih lu ƀuh tui anŭn, leng kơ pơhiăp brŏk hăng laĭ: “Mơnuih anai mŭt dŏ amăng sang mơnuih soh.”
But Zacchaeus stood and said to the Lord, Behold, Lord, the half of my goods I give to the poor, and if I have taken anything from any man by false accusation, I return [him] fourfold. @ Samơ̆ Sačê tơgŭ dơ̆ng ƀơi anăp Khua Yang hăng laĭ: “Ơ Khua Yang, anai nê kâo či mă ha mơkrah dram gơnam kâo laih anŭn pơpha brơi hĭ kơ ƀing mơnuih ƀun rin laih anŭn tơdah kâo hmâo plư ƀơ̆ng gơnam arăng, kâo či kla glaĭ pă wơ̆t lu hloh.”
And Jesus said to him, To-day salvation is come to this house, inasmuch as he also is a son of Abraham; @ Yêsu laĭ kơ ñu: “Hrơi anai tơlơi pơklaih hmâo mŭt laih amăng sang anai, yua kơ pô anai ăt jing sa čô ană tơčo Abraham mơ̆n. 
for the Son of man has come to seek and to save that which is lost. @ Yua kơ Ană Mơnuih rai laih kiăng hơduah laih anŭn pơklaih ƀing răm rơngiă.”
But as they were listening to these things, he added and spake a parable, because he was near to Jerusalem and they thought that the kingdom of God was about to be immediately manifested. @ Tơdang gơñu dŏ hmư̆ tơlơi anŭn, Yêsu pơhiăp sa tơlơi bơhmutu dơ̆ng, yua kơ Ñu giăm truh pơ plei Yêrusalem, laih anŭn yua kơ arăng pơmĭn dêh čar pơtao Ơi Adai či pơrơđah mơtam yơh. 
He said therefore, A certain high-born man went to a distant country to receive for himself a kingdom and return. @ Tui anŭn Yêsu laĭ: “Sa čô mơnuih arăng pơpŭ nao pơ čar ataih kiăng kơ mă tŭ tơlơi dưi jing pơtao giơ̆ng anŭn ñu či wơ̆t glaĭ. 
And having called his own ten bondmen, he gave to them ten minas, and said to them, Trade while I am coming. @ Ñu iâu pluh čô amăng ƀing ding kơna Ñu. Ñu brơi kơ ƀing gơ̆ pluh sar prăk hăng laĭ: ‘Brơi ƀing ih nao sĭ mia hăng sar prăk anai tơl kâo wơ̆t glaĭ dơ̆ng.’ 
But his citizens hated him, and sent an embassy after him, saying, We will not that this [man] should reign over us. @ Samơ̆ ƀing ană plei ñu bơrơmŭt kơ gơ̆ laih anŭn pơkiaŏ nao pô pơala kiaŏ tui ñu hăng laĭ: ‘Gơmơi ƀu kiăng ôh mơnuih anai wai lăng gơmơi’.
And it came to pass on his arrival back again, having received the kingdom, that he desired these bondmen to whom he gave the money to be called to him, in order that he might know what every one had gained by trading. @ Giơ̆ng kơ ñu mă tŭ tơlơi dưi jing pơtao ñu wơ̆t glaĭ dơ̆ng, ñu iâu ƀing ding kơna rai pơ ñu, jing ƀing ñu hmâo brơi laih sar prăk, kiăng kơ thâo hyư̆m ƀing gơ̆ ƀơ̆ng kơmlai laih hăng tơlơi sĭ mia anŭn. 
And the first came up, saying, [My] Lord, thy mina has produced ten minas. @ Ding kơna tal sa truh ƀơi anăp ñu hăng laĭ: ‘Ơ Khua, sar prăk ih ƀơ̆ng kơmlai dơ̆ng jing pluh sar.’ 
And he said to him, Well [done], thou good bondman; because thou hast been faithful in that which is least, be thou in authority over ten cities. @ Khua laĭ kơ ñu: ‘Hiam yơh, ơ ding kơna tơpă hiam; yua kơ ih hmâo tŏng ten laih amăng bruă anĕt, ih či hmâo tơlơi dưi wai lăng pluh boh plei.’ 
And the second came, saying, [My] Lord, thy mina has made five minas. @ Ding kơna tal dua rai hăng laĭ: ‘Ơ Khua, sar prăk ih ƀơ̆ng kơmlai rơma sar dơ̆ng.’ 
And he said also to this one, And *thou*, be over five cities. @ Ñu laĭ kơ gơ̆: ‘Ih či wai lăng rơma boh plei.’ 
And another came, saying, [My] Lord, lo, [there is] thy mina, which I have kept laid up in a towel. @ Ding kơna pơkŏn rai laih anŭn laĭ: ‘Ơ Khua, anai sar prăk ih, kâo hmâo pơdŏp laih ñu amăng khăn, 
For I feared thee because thou art a harsh man: thou takest up what thou hast not laid down, and thou reapest what thou hast not sowed. @ Yua kơ kâo hwĭ kơ ih, yua kơ ih jing mơnuih khăng khĭp. Ih mă mơnơ̆ng ƀu djơ̆ jing gơnam ih ôh, laih anŭn hơpuă mơnơ̆ng ih ƀu hmâo sai ôh.’ 
He says to him, Out of thy mouth will I judge thee, wicked bondman: thou knewest that *I* am a harsh man, taking up what I have not laid down and reaping what I have not sowed. @ Khua anŭn laĭ kơ ñu: ‘Ơ ding kơna sat ƀai! Kâo či phat kơđi ih tui hăng tơlơi ih pô pơhiăp! Ih thâo laih kâo jing sa čô khăng khĭp, mă mơnơ̆ng ƀu jing gơnam kâo ôh, laih anŭn hơpuă mơnơ̆ng kâo ƀu hmâo sai ôh. 
And why didst thou not give my money to [the] bank; and *I* should have received it, at my coming, with interest? @ Tui anŭn yua hơgĕt ih ƀu pioh ôh prăk kâo amăng sang wai prăk, kiăng kơ tơ kâo wơ̆t glaĭ, kâo či mă glaĭ prăk anŭn wơ̆t hăng kơmlai ñu mơ̆n?’ 
And he said to those that stood by, Take from him the mina and give [it] to him who has the ten minas. @ Laih anŭn ñu laĭ kơ ƀing dŏ giăm: ‘Mă hĭ bĕ prăk mơ̆ng ñu, hăng brơi hĭ pô hmâo laih pluh sar prăk.’ 
And they said to him, Lord, he has ten minas. @ Gơñu laĭ kơ gơ̆: ‘Ơ khua, ñu hmâo laih pluh sar prăk!’ 
For I say unto you, that to every one that has shall be given; but from him that has not, that even which he has shall be taken from him. @ Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, hlơi pô hmâo, Ơi Adai či brơi thim dơ̆ng, samơ̆ hlơi pô ƀu hmâo, Ơi Adai či mă hĭ wơ̆t hăng mơnơ̆ng ñu hmâo laih. 
Moreover those mine enemies, who would not [have] me to reign over them, bring them here and slay [them] before me. @ Samơ̆ bơ kơ ƀing ayăt kâo, ƀing ƀu kiăng ôh kâo wai lăng gơñu, ba rai bĕ gơñu pơ anai laih anŭn pơdjai hĭ gơñu ƀơi anăp kâo.”
And having said these things, he went on before, going up to Jerusalem. @ Giơ̆ng kơ Yêsu pơhiăp tơlơi anŭn, Ñu rơbat nao hlâo, đĭ nao pơ plei Yêrusalem. 
And it came to pass as he drew near to Bethphage and Bethany at the mountain called [the mount] of Olives, he sent two of his disciples, @ Tơ Ñu giăm truh pơ plei Bêtphajê hăng plei Bêthani, ƀơi čư̆ arăng pơanăn jing čư̆ Ôliwơ, Ñu pơkiaŏ nao dua čô ƀing ding kơna Ñu 
saying, Go into the village over against [you], in which ye will find, on entering it, a colt tied up, on which no [child] of man ever sat at any time: loose it and lead it [here]. @ hăng laĭ: “Nao bĕ pơ plei ƀơi anăp ƀing gih. Tơ ƀing gih mŭt amăng plei, ƀing gih či ƀuh sa drơi ană aseh kle arăng akă pơ anŭn, arăng aka đĭ djơ̆ ôh. Kleh ñu hăng dui rai pơ anai. 
And if any one ask you, Why do ye loose [it]? thus shall ye say to him, Because the Lord has need of it. @ Tơdah arăng tơña kơ ƀing gih: ‘Yua hơgĕt ƀing gih kleh ñu lĕ?’ brơi ƀing gih laĭ tui anai: ‘Khua Yang kiăng ñu.’”
And they that were sent, having gone their way, found as he had said to them. @ Tui anŭn ƀing gơñu nao hăng ƀuh abih bang tơlơi djơ̆ tui hăng tơlơi Yêsu hmâo laĭ laih. 
And as they were loosing the colt, its masters said to them, Why loose ye the colt? @ Tơdang gơñu kleh ană aseh kle anŭn, pô aseh anŭn tơña kơ gơñu: “Yua hơgĕt ƀing gih kleh ană aseh kle anai lĕ?”
And they said, Because the Lord has need of it. @ Gơñu laĭ: “Khua Yang kiăng ñu.” 
And they led it to Jesus; and having cast their own garments on the colt, they put Jesus on [it]. @ Laih anŭn gơñu dui ba aseh pơ Yêsu; gơñu tap khăn ao gơñu ƀơi rŏng ană aseh kle laih anŭn pŭ Yêsu đĭ.
