And as he went, they strewed their clothes in the way. @ Tơ Yêsu đĭ aseh kle rơbat nao, gơñu lang khăn ao gơñu ƀơi jơlan.
And as he drew near, already at the descent of the mount of Olives, all the multitude of the disciples began, rejoicing, to praise God with a loud voice for all the works of power which they had seen, @ Hlăk Yêsu giăm truh pơ plei Yêrusalem ƀơi anih trŭn đŭng čư̆ Ôliwơ, abih bang ƀing ding kơna čơdơ̆ng hơ̆k mơak laih anŭn pơpŭ bơni kơ Ơi Adai hăng asăp kraih yua kơ abih bang khul bruă mơsêh mơyang gơñu hmâo ƀuh laih.
saying, Blessed the King that comes in the name of [the] Lord: peace in heaven, and glory in the highest. @ Gơñu laĭ: “Ơi Adai hơơč mơyun kơ Pơtao rai amăng anăn Khua Yang!
Rơnŭk rơnua amăng adai, laih anŭn tơlơi guh kơang amăng anih Glông Hloh!”
And some of the Pharisees from the crowd said to him, Teacher, rebuke thy disciples. @ Amăng tơ̆ng krah ƀing mơnuih lu hmâo đơđa ƀing Pharisi laĭ kơ Yêsu: “Ơ Nai, khă bĕ ƀing ding kơna Ih.” 
And he answering said to them, I say unto you, If these shall be silent, the stones will cry out. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, tơdah gơñu dŏ rơiăt, boh pơtâo yơh či ur driao.”
And as he drew near, seeing the city, he wept over it, @ Tơ Yêsu nao giăm, Ñu ƀuh plei Yêrusalem, Ñu hia yua kơ plei anŭn hăng laĭ, 
saying, If thou hadst known, even thou, even at least in this thy day, the things that are for thy peace: but now they are hid from thine eyes; @ “Kâo kiăng biă mă yơh tơdah hrơi anai ih dưi thâo tơlơi dưi brơi tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua kơ ih! Samơ̆ ră anai tơlơi anŭn pơdŏp hĭ laih kơ mơta ih. 
for days shall come upon thee, that thine enemies shall make a palisaded mound about thee, and shall close thee around, and keep thee in on every side, @ Yua kơ hrơi či truh, ƀing ayăt ih či bôr lŏn jum dar ih hăng wang dar ih, laih anŭn krư̆ hret ih jum dar, 
and shall lay thee even with the ground, and thy children in thee; and shall not leave in thee a stone upon a stone: because thou knewest not the season of thy visitation. @ gơñu či pơrai hĭ ih wơ̆t ƀing ană bă ih ƀơi tơ̆ng krah ih. Gơñu ƀu lui brơi ôh amăng ih sa boh pơtâo anai dŏ đom ƀơi hăng ngŏ kơ boh pơtâo pơkŏn, yua kơ ih ƀu thâo ôh hrơi Ơi Adai hmâo čuă ngui ih laih.”
And entering into the temple, he began to cast out those that sold and bought in it, @ Yêsu mŭt amăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ laih anŭn čơdơ̆ng pơpuh ƀing sĭ mia ƀơi anŭn, 
saying to them, It is written, My house is a house of prayer, but *ye* have made it a den of robbers. @ Ñu laĭ kơ ƀing anŭn: “Hmâo boh pơhiăp čih tui anai: ‘Sang Kâo či jing sang iâu laĭ’; samơ̆ ƀing gih pơjing ñu jing hĭ par kơ ƀing klĕ dŏp.”
And he was teaching day by day in the temple: and the chief priests and the scribes and the chief of the people sought to destroy him, @ Rĭm hrơi Yêsu pơtô amăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ. Ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng, ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt, laih anŭn ƀing akŏ wai lăng ană plei pla hơduah jơlan kiăng pơdjai Ñu, 
and did not find what they could do, for all the people hung on him to hear. @ samơ̆ gơñu ƀu dưi ngă hơgĕt gĕt ôh, yua kơ abih bang ană plei khăp hmư̆ đơi kơ tơlơi Yêsu pơhiăp.
And it came to pass on one of the days, as he was teaching the people in the temple, and announcing the glad tidings, the chief priests and the scribes with the elders came up, @ Hmâo sa hrơi, tơdang Yêsu pơhrăm ƀing ană plei amăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ laih anŭn pơtô Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam, ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng hăng ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing kŏng tha rai 
and spoke to him saying, Tell us by what authority thou doest these things, or who is it who has given thee this authority? @ laih anŭn tơña kơ Ñu: “Laĭ brơi gơmơi thâo mơ̆ng tơlơi dưi pă Ih ngă tơlơi anai, ƀôdah hlơi pô brơi tơlơi dưi anai kơ Ih?”
And he answering said to them, *I* also will ask you [one] thing, and tell me: @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ kơ ƀing anŭn dơ̆ng: “Kâo ăt kiăng tơña kơ ƀing gih sa tơlơi mơ̆n. Laĭ brơi Kâo bĕ: 
The baptism of John, was it of heaven or of men? @ Tơlơi ƀatem Yôhan tơbiă rai mơ̆ng adai ƀôdah mơ̆ng mơnuih?”
And they reasoned among themselves, saying, If we should say, Of heaven, he will say, Why have ye not believed him? @ Ƀing anŭn črŏng sai tơdruă gơñu hăng laĭ: “Tơdah ƀing ta laĭ: ‘Mơ̆ng Ơi Adai,’ Ñu či laĭ: ‘Yua hơgĕt ƀing gih ƀu đaŏ ôh kơ ñu?’ 
but if we should say, Of men, the whole people will stone us, for they are persuaded that John was a prophet. @ Samơ̆ tơdah ƀing ta laĭ: ‘Mơ̆ng mơnuih,’ abih bang ană plei či glŏm boh pơtâo kơ ƀing ta, yua kơ gơñu đaŏ kơ Yôhan jing sa čô pô laĭ lui hlâo.” 
And they answered, they did not know whence. @ Tui anŭn gơñu laĭ glaĭ gơñu ƀu thâo ôh mơ̆ng pă tơlơi ƀatem anŭn tơbiă rai.
And Jesus said to them, Neither do *I* tell you by what authority I do these things. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ kơ gơñu: “Kâo kŏn či laĭ brơi kơ ƀing gih lơi mơ̆ng tơlơi dưi pă Kâo ngă tơlơi anai.”
And he began to speak to the people this parable: A man planted a vineyard and let it out to husbandmen, and left the country for a long time. @ Yêsu čơdơ̆ng pơhiăp tơlơi bơhmutu anai kơ ƀing ană plei pla: “Sa čô mơnuih ngă sa boh đang boh kơƀâu laih anŭn brơi kơ arăng čan, laih anŭn ñu nao pơ tring pơkŏn sui hrơi. 
And in the season he sent to the husbandmen a bondman, that they might give to him of the fruit of the vineyard; but the husbandmen, having beaten him, sent [him] away empty. @ Tơ truh bơyan pĕ boh, pô đang pơkiaŏ nao sa čô ding kơna ñu pơ ƀing čan anŭn kiăng kơ ƀing čan brơi kơ ñu sa črăn boh kơmlai mơ̆ng đang boh kơƀâu anŭn. Samơ̆ ƀing čan taih gơ̆, laih anŭn pơkiaŏ hĭ gơ̆ glaĭ tơngan soh. 
And again he sent another bondman; but they, having beaten him also, and cast insult upon him, sent [him] away empty. @ Tơdơi kơ anŭn pô đang pơkiaŏ nao dơ̆ng sa čô ding kơna pơkŏn. Samơ̆ ƀing mơnuih apah ăt taih gơ̆, laih anŭn ngă sat kơ gơ̆, hăng brơi gơ̆ glaĭ hăng tơngan soh. 
And again he sent a third; and they, having wounded him also, cast [him] out. @ Pô đang pơkiaŏ nao ding kơna tal klâo dơ̆ng, samơ̆ gơñu ăt taih pơrơka gơ̆ hăng puh pơđuaĭ hĭ gơ̆. 
And the lord of the vineyard said, What shall I do? I will send my beloved son: perhaps when they see him they will respect [him]. @ Hlăk anŭn pô đang boh kơƀâu laĭ: ‘Hơgĕt kâo či ngă? Kâo či pơkiaŏ nao ană đah rơkơi pô kâo khăp hơeng; Năng ai gơñu či pơpŭ kơ gơ̆.’ 
But when the husbandmen saw him, they reasoned among themselves, saying, This is the heir; [come,] let us kill him, that the inheritance may become ours. @ Samơ̆ tơ ƀing čan ƀuh gơ̆, gơñu bơlaĭ tơdruă gơñu: ‘Anai jing pô mă tŭ kong ngăn; brơi ƀing ta pơdjai hĭ ñu, kiăng kơ kong ngăn anŭn či lơ̆m kơ ƀing ta.’ 
And having cast him forth out of the vineyard, they killed [him]. What therefore shall the lord of the vineyard do to them? @ Gơñu glŏm hĭ gơ̆ pơ gah rơngiao đang boh kơƀâu hăng pơdjai hĭ gơ̆. Tui anŭn hơgĕt pô đang boh kơƀâu či ngă kơ ƀing gơñu? 
He will come and destroy those husbandmen, and will give the vineyard to others. And when they heard it they said, May it never be! @ Pô anŭn či rai pơdjai hĭ ƀing čan anŭn, laih anŭn jao đang boh kơƀâu kơ ƀing pơkŏn.” Tơdah ƀing ană plei hmư̆ tơlơi anŭn, gơñu laĭ: “Ư ưh, brơi Ơi Adai khă tơlơi anŭn!”
But he looking at them said, What then is this that is written, The stone which they that builded rejected, this has become the corner-stone? @ Samơ̆ Yêsu lăng kơ gơñu laih anŭn laĭ: “Tui anŭn, hơgĕt tơlơi Ơi Adai Pơhiăp čih anai kiăng laĭ:
‘Boh pơtâo ƀing ngă sang hơngah lui laih,
Hmâo jing hĭ laih boh pơtâo phŭn akiăng sang’
Every one falling on this stone shall be broken, but on whomsoever it shall fall, it shall grind him to powder. @ Hlơi pô lĕ rơbuh ƀơi boh pơtâo anŭn, pô anŭn či pơčah brăk brai hĭ; laih anŭn tơdah boh pơtâo anŭn lĕ djơ̆ ƀơi hlơi, boh pơtâo anŭn či glit pơphač hĭ pô anŭn yơh.”
And the chief priests and the scribes sought the same hour to lay hands on him, and they feared the people; for they knew that he had spoken this parable of them. @ Ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng hăng ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt hơduah jơlan kiăng mă Yêsu ƀơi mông anŭn mơtam, yua kơ gơñu thâo Yêsu pơhiăp tơlơi bơhmutu anŭn djơ̆ kơ gơñu; samơ̆ gơñu hwĭ kơ ƀing ană plei pla. 
And having watched [him], they sent out suborned persons, pretending to be just men, that they might take hold of him in [his] language, so that they might deliver him up to the power and authority of the governor. @ Tui anŭn gơñu krăp lăng sŭ Yêsu, laih anŭn pơkiaŏ nao ƀing kơnuă pơƀlor mă jing kar hăng ƀing mơnuih tơpă hiam, kiăng hmâo tơlơi dưi pơčŭt kơ tơlơi Yêsu pơhiăp, kiăng kơ gơñu dưi jao gơ̆ kơ kơnuk kơna laih anŭn kơ khua prŏng Rôm. 
And they asked him saying, Teacher, we know that thou sayest and teachest rightly, and acceptest no [man's] person, but teachest with truth the way of God: @ Ƀing anŭn tơña kơ Yêsu: “Ơ nai, gơmơi thâo ih pơhiăp laih anŭn pơtô hăng tơlơi tơpă. Ih ƀu dŏ gah sa bơnah ôh, samơ̆ pơtô jơlan Ơi Adai hăng tơlơi sĭt tơpă. 
Is it lawful for us to give tribute to Caesar, or not? @ Phiăn mơ̆ ƀing ta duh jia kơ Sêsar?”
But perceiving their deceit he said to them, Why do ye tempt me? @ Samơ̆ Yêsu thâo tơlơi mơneč gơñu laih anŭn laĭ kơ gơñu, 
Shew me a denarius. Whose image and superscription has it? And answering they said, Caesar's. @ “Brơi Kâo lăng sa kak đơniê. Kak đơniê anai hmâo rup hăng anăn hlơi?” Gơñu laĭ glaĭ: “Sêsar.”
And he said to them, Pay therefore what is Caesar's to Caesar, and what is God's to God. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Tui anŭn ba glaĭ bĕ kơ Sêsar gơnam kơ Sêsar, laih anŭn ba glaĭ bĕ gơnam Ơi Adai kơ Ơi Adai.”
And they were not able to take hold of him in [his] expressions before the people, and, wondering at his answer, they were silent. @ Ƀơi anăp ană plei pla, gơñu ƀu hmâo tơlơi dưi pơčŭt kơ Yêsu kơ sa mơta tơlơi hơgĕt ôh. Gơñu hling hlang kơ tơlơi Yêsu laĭ glaĭ, laih anŭn gơñu dŏ rơiăt.
And some of the Sadducees, who deny that there is any resurrection, coming up [to him], @ Hmâo đơđa ƀing Sadusi rai pơ Yêsu, jing ƀing laĭ ƀu hmâo tơlơi hơdip glaĭ dơ̆ng ôh. 
demanded of him saying, Teacher, Moses wrote to us, If any one's brother, who has a wife, die, and he die childless, his brother shall take the wife and raise up seed to his brother. @ Gơñu tơña Yêsu tui anai: “Ơ Nai, Môis čih laih tơlơi juăt kơ ƀing gơmơi tơdah sa čô ayŏng djai, hmâo bơnai samơ̆ ƀu hmâo ană ôh, brơi adơi gơ̆ mă dŏ bơnai ayŏng ñu, kiăng hmâo ană djă pioh djuai ayŏng ñu. 
There were then seven brethren: and the first, having taken a wife, died childless; @ Anai nê, hmâo laih tơjuh čô adơi ayŏng. Ayŏng tha dŏ bơnai laih anŭn djai, ƀu hmâo ană ôh. 
and the second [took the woman, and *he* died childless]; @ Adơi tal dua dŏ đah kơmơi anŭn mơ̆n, 
and the third took her: and in like manner also the seven left no children and died; @ tal klâo dŏ đah kơmơi anŭn mơ̆n, tơl abih bang tơjuh čô adơi ayŏng dŏ đah kơmơi anŭn, djai ƀu hmâo ană ôh. 
and last of all the woman also died. @ Đŭt tơdơi, đah kơmơi anŭn ăt djai mơ̆n. 
In the resurrection therefore of which of them does she become wife, for the seven had her as wife? @ Tui anŭn, ƀơi hrơi hơdip glaĭ, đah kơmơi anŭn či jing bơnai kơ hlơi lĕ? yua kơ abih tơjuh čô anŭn leng kơ hmâo dŏ laih ñu.”
And Jesus said to them, The sons of this world marry and are given in marriage, @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Ƀing ană rơnŭk anai dŏ rơkơi dŏ bơnai, 
but they who are counted worthy to have part in that world, and the resurrection from among [the] dead, neither marry nor are given in marriage; @ samơ̆ ƀing arăng yap năng lăp mŭt amăng rơnŭk tơdơi laih anŭn kơ tơlơi hơdip glaĭ mơ̆ng ƀing djai ƀu či dŏ rơkơi dŏ bơnai dơ̆ng ôh, 
for neither can they die any more, for they are equal to angels, and are sons of God, being sons of the resurrection. @ gơñu ƀu dưi djai dơ̆ng ôh, yua kơ gơñu jing kar hăng ƀing ling jang hiam Ơi Adai laih anŭn jing ƀing ană Ơi Adai, jing ană kơ tơlơi hơdip glaĭ. 
But that the dead rise, even Moses shewed in [the section of] the bush, when he called [the] Lord the God of Abraham and the God of Isaac and the God of Jacob; @ Bơ kơ tơlơi ƀing djai hơdip glaĭ, wơ̆t kơ Môis bơrơđah laih amăng tơlơi čih ră ruai kơ apui ƀơ̆ng pum drơi dŏ jă, hlăk ñu iâu Khua Yang jing Ơi Adai kơ Abraham, Ơi Adai kơ Isak, laih anŭn Ơi Adai kơ Yakôp. 
but he is not God of [the] dead but of [the] living; for all live for him. @ Tui anŭn, Khua Yang ƀu djơ̆ jing Ơi Adai kơ ƀing djai ôh, samơ̆ kơ ƀing hơdip, yua kơ gah kơ Ơi Adai abih bang gơñu leng dŏ hơdip.”
And some of the scribes answering said, Teacher, thou hast well spoken. @ Hmâo đơđa ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt laĭ glaĭ dơ̆ng: “Ơ Nai, Ih pơhiăp djơ̆ yơh.” 
For they did not dare any more to ask him anything. @ Tui anŭn gơñu ƀu khĭn tơña kơ Yêsu sa mơta tơlơi hơgĕt dơ̆ng ôh.
And he said to them, How do they say that the Christ is David's son, @ Yêsu tơña kơ gơñu: “Hyư̆m arăng dưi laĭ Yang Krist jing ană pơtao Đawit lĕ? 
and David himself says in the book of Psalms, The Lord said to my Lord, Sit at my right hand @ Yua kơ Đawit pô laĭ amăng hơdrôm hră Tơlơi Adoh Hơđăp:
‘Khua Yang laĭ hăng Khua Yang kâo: Dŏ ber bĕ gah hơnuă Kâo,
until I put thine enemies [as] footstool of thy feet? @ Tơl Kâo ngă kơ ƀing ayăt ih jing hnăl tơkai ih juă.’
David therefore calls him Lord, and how is he his son? @ Đawit iâu Krist jing ‘Khua Yang’; Tui anŭn hyư̆m Krist dưi jing ană đah rơkơi Đawit lĕ?”
And, as all the people were listening, he said to his disciples, @ Tơdang abih bang ƀing ană plei pla dŏ hmư̆, Ñu laĭ kơ ƀing ding kơna Ñu, 
Beware of the scribes, who like to walk about in long robes, and who love salutations in the market-places, and first seats in the synagogues, and first places at suppers; @ “Răng bĕ kơ ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt. Gơñu khăp čŭt ao phyung rơbat hyu, laih anŭn khăp kơ tơlơi arăng kơkuh kơ gơñu amăng sang sĭ mia, hăng ruah anih hiam hloh amăng sang bơjơnum laih anŭn anih hmâo tơlơi pơpŭ hloh amăng tơlơi ƀơ̆ng huă. 
who devour the houses of widows, and as a pretext make long prayers. These shall receive a severer judgment. @ Gơñu plah sua mă sang ƀing đah kơmơi djai rơkơi laih anŭn ngă mă iâu laĭ sui. Gơñu či tŭ tơlơi pơkơhmal kơtang hloh.”
And he looked up and saw the rich casting their gifts into the treasury; @ Yêsu angak mơta lăng laih anŭn ƀuh ƀing pơdrŏng plĕ prăk gơñu pơyơr amăng hip prăk sang kơkuh pơpŭ. 
but he saw also a certain poor widow casting therein two mites. @ Yêsu ăt ƀuh mơ̆n sa čô đah kơmơi blao ƀun rin pơyơr dua su. 
And he said, Verily I say unto you, that this poor widow has cast in more than all; @ Ñu laĭ: “Sĭt biă mă Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, đah kơmơi blao ƀun rin anai pơyơr lu hloh kơ abih bang ƀing pơkŏn. 
for all these out of their abundance have cast into the gifts [of God]; but she out of her need has cast in all the living which she had. @ Yua kơ abih bang ƀing anŭn mă prăk rơbeh gơñu pơyơr kơ Ơi Adai, bơ kơ đah kơmơi anai ƀun rin biă mă samơ̆ ñu mă abih dram gơnam ñu hmâo kiăng dŏ hơdip pơyơr hĭ kơ Ơi Adai.”
And as some spoke of the temple, that it was adorned with goodly stones and consecrated offerings, he said, @ Tơdang hmâo đơđa mơnuih laĭ djơ̆ kơ sang kơkuh pơpŭ, tơlơi arăng pơhrôp pơhiam ñu hăng boh pơtâo yom, laih anŭn gơnam arăng pơyơr, Yêsu laĭ, 
[As to] these things which ye are beholding, days are coming in which there shall not be left stone upon stone which shall not be thrown down. @ “Kơ gơnam ƀing gih ƀuh anai, hrơi či truh, hlăk anŭn ƀu či hmâo sa boh pơtâo dŏ ƀơi hăng ngŏ boh pơtâo pơkŏn ôh, samơ̆ abih bang či glưh hĭ.”
And they asked him saying, Teacher, when then shall these things be; and what [is] the sign when these things are going to take place? @ Gơñu tơña kơ Yêsu: “Ơ Nai, hơbin tơlơi anŭn či truh, laih anŭn hơgĕt gru kơnăl kơ tơlơi anŭn giăm truh?”
And he said, See that ye be not led astray, for many shall come in my name, saying, *I* am [he], and the time is drawn nigh: go ye not [therefore] after them. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Răng bĕ, anăm brơi arăng plư kơ ƀing gih ôh, yua kơ lu mơnuih či rai ƀlor amăng anăn Kâo laih anŭn laĭ: ‘Kâo yơh Krist’ laih anŭn ‘Hrơi anŭn giăm truh yơh!’ Anăm đuaĭ tui gơñu ôh. 
And when ye shall hear of wars and tumults, be not terrified, for these things must first take place, but the end is not immediately. @ Laih anŭn tơ ƀing gih hmư̆ hing kơ tơlơi pơblah hăng tơlơi krŭ pơkơdơ̆ng, anăm hwĭ ôh; yua kơ tơlơi anŭn khŏm truh hlâo, samơ̆ aka ƀu truh hrơi hnal tuč ôh.”
Then he said to them, Nation shall rise up against nation, and kingdom against kingdom; @ Yêsu laĭ kơ ƀing anŭn dơ̆ng: “Djuai mơnuih anai či pơkơdơ̆ng hăng djuai mơnuih pơkŏn, laih anŭn dêh čar pơtao anai či pơblah hăng dêh čar pơtao pơkŏn. 
there shall be both great earthquakes in different places, and famines and pestilences; and there shall be fearful sights and great signs from heaven. @ Či hmâo tơlơi pơpư̆ lŏn tơnah kơtang, laih anŭn amăng lu anih či hmâo tơlơi ư̆ rơpa, tơlơi ruă djai, laih anŭn či hmâo tơlơi hwĭ hyưt biă mă hăng tơlơi gru kơnăl mơyang prŏng mơ̆ng adai. 
But before all these things they shall lay their hands upon you and persecute you, delivering [you] up to synagogues and prisons, bringing [you] before kings and governors on account of my name; @ Samơ̆ hlâo kơ abih bang tơlơi anŭn truh, arăng či mă ƀing gih, ngă sat kơ ƀing gih, jao ƀing gih kơ khua sang bơjơnum, krư̆ ƀing gih, laih anŭn arăng či dui ba ƀing gih ƀơi anăp ƀing pơtao laih anŭn ƀing khua wai lăng lŏn čar yua kơ anăn Kâo. 
but it shall turn out to you for a testimony. @ Anŭn či jing mông gal brơi kơ ƀing gih pơhaih tơlơi ƀing gih đaŏ. 
Settle therefore in your hearts not to meditate beforehand [your] defence, @ Brơi ƀing gih kơđŏm pioh tơlơi anŭn amăng pran jua, anăm pơmĭn hlâo ôh hyư̆m tơlơi ƀing gih či laĭ glaĭ; 
for *I* will give you a mouth and wisdom which all your opposers shall not be able to reply to or resist. @ yua kơ, Kâo či pha brơi kơ ƀing gih tơlơi pơhiăp laih anŭn tơlơi kơhnâo tơl abih bang ƀing ayăt roh ƀing gih ƀu dưi pơkơdơ̆ng ƀôdah pơgăl hăng ƀing gih ôh. 
But ye will be delivered up even by parents and brethren and relations and friends, and they shall put to death [some] from among you, @ Wơ̆t kơ amĭ ama adơi ayŏng, kơnŭng djuai ƀing gih pô, laih anŭn gơyut gơyâo ƀing gih či pleč jao lui ƀing gih, laih anŭn gơñu či pơdjai wơ̆t đơđa ƀing gih mơ̆n. 
and ye will be hated of all for my name's sake. @ Abih bang mơnuih či bơrơmŭt kơ ƀing gih yua kơ anăn Kâo. 
And a hair of your head shall in no wise perish. @ Samơ̆ ƀu hmâo ôh sa ară ƀuk ƀơi akŏ ƀing gih či rơngiă hĭ. 
By your patient endurance gain your souls. @ Yua mơ̆ng tơlơi gir run, ƀing gih či pơklaih bơngăt ƀing gih.”
But when ye see Jerusalem encompassed with armies, then know that its desolation is drawn nigh. @ “Tơ ƀing gih ƀuh ƀing tơhan wang jum dar plei Yêrusalem laih, tui anŭn brơi ƀing gih thâo tơlơi pơrai plei anŭn giăm truh yơh. 
Then let those who are in Judaea flee to the mountains, and those who are in the midst of it depart out, and those who are in the country not enter into it; @ Hlăk anŭn hlơi pô dŏ amăng čar Yuđa brơi đuaĭ kơdŏp bĕ pơ čư̆. Laih anŭn hlơi pô dŏ amăng plei Yêrusalem brơi ñu tơbiă bĕ pơ rơngiao; hlơi pô dŏ pơ hmua anăm mŭt glaĭ amăng plei ôh. 
for these are days of avenging, that all the things that are written may be accomplished. @ Yua kơ anŭn jing khul hrơi rŭ nua, kiăng pơsĭt abih tơlơi arăng hmâo čih laih. 
But woe to them that are with child and to them who give suck in those days, for there shall be great distress upon the land and wrath upon this people. @ Amăng khul hrơi anŭn tơnap tap yơh kơ ƀing đah kơmơi pi kian hăng ƀing pơmĕm ană! Yua kơ či hmâo tơlơi tơnap tap prŏng ƀơi lŏn tơnah laih anŭn tơlơi kreñ pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ truh kơ ană plei pla anai. 
And they shall fall by the edge of the sword, and be led captive into all the nations; and Jerusalem shall be trodden down of [the] nations until [the] times of [the] nations be fulfilled. @ Gơñu či djai hăng đao gưm, laih anŭn arăng či dui ba gơñu jing mơnă ƀơi tơ̆ng krah abih bang ƀing djuai mơnuih. Laih anŭn ƀing djuai tuai či juă lin plei Yêrusalem tơl rơnŭk ƀing djuai tuai abih hĭ.”
And there shall be signs in sun and moon and stars, and upon the earth distress of nations in perplexity [at] the roar of the sea and rolling waves, @ “Či hmâo gru kơnăl hling hlang amăng yang hrơi, amăng blan, laih anŭn amăng khul pơtŭ, laih anŭn ƀơi lŏn tơnah či hmâo tơlơi rŭng răng amăng ƀing djuai mơnuih, yua kơ gơñu ƀu thâo hơgĕt ngă ôh tơ hmư̆ dơnai ia rơsĭ laih anŭn ia pah pŭng ur grao. 
men ready to die through fear and expectation of what is coming on the habitable earth, for the powers of the heavens shall be shaken. @ Lu mơnuih či djai huăt hĭ yua kơ hwĭ bral tơdang dŏ tơguan kơ tơlơi či truh ƀơi lŏn tơnah; yua kơ tơlơi dưi kơtang amăng adai či pơpư̆ pơgơi. 
And then shall they see the Son of man coming in a cloud with power and great glory. @ Hlăk anŭn gơñu či ƀuh Ană Mơnuih rai amăng kơthul hiăng hăng tơlơi dưi mơyang laih anŭn tơlơi guh kơang prŏng. 
But when these things begin to come to pass, look up and lift up your heads, because your redemption draws nigh. @ Tơ tơlơi anŭn čơdơ̆ng truh, tơgŭ bĕ, angak đĭ akŏ ƀing gih, yua kơ tơlơi pơklaih ƀing gih giăm truh laih.”
And he spoke a parable to them: Behold the fig-tree and all the trees; @ Yêsu pơhiăp hăng ƀing gơñu sa tơlơi bơhmutu: “Lăng bĕ kơ phŭn hra laih anŭn abih bang phŭn kơyâo pơkŏn. 
when they already sprout, ye know of your own selves, [on] looking [at them], that already the summer is near. @ Tơ ƀing gih ƀuh gơñu čơdơ̆ng čơnăt hla, ƀing gih thâo bơyan phang giăm truh yơh. 
So also *ye*, when ye see these things take place, know that the kingdom of God is near. @ Kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n, tơ ƀing gih ƀuh abih tơlơi anŭn truh rai, brơi ƀing gih thâo kơ dêh čar pơtao Ơi Adai giăm truh laih.”
Verily I say unto you, that this generation shall in no wise pass away until all come to pass. @ “Sĭt biă mă Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, ƀing mơnuih rơnŭk anai ƀu či rơgao hĭ ôh tơl abih tơlơi anŭn truh. 
The heaven and the earth shall pass away, but my words shall in no wise pass away. @ Adai laih anŭn lŏn tơnah či rơgao hĭ, samơ̆ tơlơi Kâo pơhiăp ƀu či rơgao hĭ ôh.”
But take heed to yourselves lest possibly your hearts be laden with surfeiting and drinking and cares of life, and that day come upon you suddenly unawares; @ “Samơ̆ răng bĕ kơ gih pô, hwĭ kơ pran jua ƀing gih jing kơtraŏ hăng tơlơi ƀơ̆ng huă gao hơnơ̆ng, măt tơpai laih anŭn tơlơi ƀlơ̆ng bơngơ̆t kơ tơlơi hơdip rơnŭk anai laih anŭn Hrơi anŭn blĭp truh kơ ƀing gih kar hăng jal klŭp. 
for as a snare shall it come upon all them that dwell upon the face of the whole earth. @ Yua kơ tơlơi anŭn či truh kơ abih bang mơnuih dŏ tar ƀar rŏng lŏn tơnah. 
Watch therefore, praying at every season, that ye may be accounted worthy to escape all these things which are about to come to pass, and to stand before the Son of man. @ Tui anŭn, brơi ƀing gih dŏ răng nanao, laih anŭn iâu laĭ kiăng kơ ƀing gih hmâo tơlơi kơtang dưi klaih mơ̆ng abih tơlơi či truh, laih anŭn dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơi anăp Ană Mơnuih.”
And by day he was teaching in the temple, and by night, going out, he remained abroad on the mountain called [the mount] of Olives; @ Rĭm hrơi Yêsu dŏ pơtô amăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ, samơ̆ mlam Ñu nao đơ̆m pơ čư̆ arăng pơanăn čư̆ Ôliwơ. 
and all the people came early in the morning to him in the temple to hear him. @ Ưm mơguah abih bang ană plei rai pơ Ñu kiăng hmư̆ tơlơi Ñu pơtô amăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ.
Now the feast of unleavened bread, which [is] called the passover, drew nigh, @ Phĕt Ƀañ Tơpŭng Ƀu Hmâo Tơpơi arăng pơanăn phĕt Tơlơi Găn, giăm truh laih. 
and the chief priests and the scribes sought how they might kill him; for they feared the people. @ Ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng hăng ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt hơduah jơlan kiăng pơdjai Yêsu; yua kơ gơñu hwĭ ană plei pla.
And Satan entered into Judas, who was surnamed Iscariote, being of the number of the twelve. @ Hlăk anŭn satan mŭt amăng Yudas arăng pơanăn Iskariôt, sa čô amăng pluh dua čô khua ding kơna. 
And he went away and spoke with the chief priests and captains as to how he should deliver him up to them. @ Yudas nao črŏng sai hăng ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng laih anŭn hăng ƀing khua tơhan sang kơkuh pơpŭ hơduah jơlan kiăng dưi jao brơi Yêsu kơ gơñu. 
And they were rejoiced, and agreed to give him money. @ Ƀing gơñu hơ̆k mơak biă mă, laih anŭn ƀuăn či brơi prăk kơ ñu. 
And he came to an agreement to do it, and sought an opportunity to deliver him up to them away from the crowd. @ Tui anŭn ñu tŭ ư, laih anŭn hơduah hrơi gal dưi jao Yêsu kơ ƀing gơñu tơdang mơnuih lu ƀu thâo ôh.
And the day of unleavened bread came, in which the passover was to be killed. @ Truh hrơi phĕt Ƀañ Ƀu Hmâo Tơpơi, jing hrơi arăng khŏm pơdjai ană triu phĕt Tơlơi Găn, 
And he sent Peter and John, saying, Go and prepare the passover for us, that we may eat [it]. @ Yêsu pơkiaŏ nao Pêtrôs hăng Yôhan laih anŭn laĭ: “Nao bĕ prăp rơmet phĕt Tơlơi Găn, kiăng ƀing ta dưi ƀơ̆ng.”
But they said to him, Where wilt thou that we prepare [it]? @ Gơñu tơña kơ Yêsu: “Pơpă anih ih kiăng gơmơi prăp rơmet phĕt Tơlơi Găn?”
And he said to them, Behold, as ye enter into the city a man will meet you, carrying an earthen pitcher of water; follow him into the house where he goes in; @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Anai nê, tơ ƀing gih mŭt amăng plei laih, hmâo sa čô mơnuih đua čeh ia či bưp ƀing gih; đuaĭ tui ñu bĕ mŭt amăng sang ñu mŭt, 
and ye shall say to the master of the house, The Teacher says to thee, Where is the guest-chamber where I may eat the passover with my disciples? @ laih anŭn laĭ kơ pô sang: ‘Nai tơña kơ ih: “Pơpă anih Kâo či ƀơ̆ng phĕt Tơlơi Găn hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing ding kơna Kâo?”’ 
And *he* will shew you a large upper room furnished: there make ready. @ Pô sang či črâo brơi kơ ƀing gih sa boh anih prŏng amăng adŭ, mơnơ̆ng mơnuă prăp rơmet laih. Ƀơi anŭn yơh ƀing gih prăp rơmet.”
And having gone they found it as he had said to them; and they prepared the passover. @ Gơñu nao laih anŭn ƀuh tơlơi anŭn djơ̆ tui hăng tơlơi Yêsu hmâo laĭ laih kơ gơñu; laih anŭn gơñu pơkra rơmet phĕt Tơlơi Găn.
And when the hour was come, he placed himself at table, and the [twelve] apostles with him. @ Tơl truh mông laih, Ñu dŏ ber ƀơi kơƀang ƀơ̆ng huă, laih anŭn ƀing khua ding kơna dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Ñu. 
And he said to them, With desire I have desired to eat this passover with you before I suffer. @ Ñu laĭ kơ ƀing gơ̆: “Kâo kiăng biă mă ƀơ̆ng phĕt Tơlơi Găn anai hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing gih hlâo kơ Kâo tŭ tơlơi ruă nuă. 
For I say unto you, that I will not eat any more at all of it until it be fulfilled in the kingdom of God. @ Yua kơ Kâo laĭ hăng ƀing gih, Kâo ƀu či ƀơ̆ng phĕt Tơlơi Găn anai dơ̆ng ôh tơl phĕt anŭn pơgiơ̆ng sĭt hĭ amăng dêh čar pơtao Ơi Adai.”
And having received a cup, when he had given thanks he said, Take this and divide it among yourselves. @ Ñu mă sa boh kơčok, giơ̆ng kơ iâu laĭ bơni hơơč, Ñu laĭ: “Mă bĕ kơčok anai laih anŭn pơpha brơi tơdruă ƀing gih. 
For I say unto you, that I will not drink at all of the fruit of the vine until the kingdom of God come. @ Yua kơ Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, mơ̆ng anai pơ anăp Kâo ƀu či mơñum dơ̆ng ôh tơpai boh kơƀâu anai tơl dêh čar pơtao Ơi Adai truh.”
And having taken a loaf, when he had given thanks, he broke [it], and gave [it] to them, saying, This is my body which is given for you: this do in remembrance of me. @ Laih anŭn Ñu mă ƀañ tơpŭng, giơ̆ng iâu laĭ bơni hơơč, Ñu wơ̆k ƀañ tơpŭng laih anŭn brơi kơ ƀing gơ̆ hăng laĭ: “Anai jing drơi jan Kâo, hmâo pơsăn brơi laih yua kơ ƀing gih. Ngă bĕ tơlơi anai kiăng hơdơr kơ Kâo.” 
In like manner also the cup, after having supped, saying, This cup [is] the new covenant in my blood, which is poured out for you. @ Tơ ƀơ̆ng giơ̆ng laih, Ñu ăt ngă kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n laih anŭn laĭ: “Kơčok anai jing kơnol pơgop phrâo amăng drah Kâo, tuh brơi laih yua kơ ƀing gih.”
Moreover, behold, the hand of him that delivers me up [is] with me on the table; @ “Samơ̆ anai, tơngan pô pơblư̆ lui Kâo hlăk dŏ ƀơi kơƀang hrŏm hăng Kâo. 
and the Son of man indeed goes as it is determined, but woe unto that man by whom he is delivered up. @ Yua kơ Ană Mơnuih či nao tui hăng tơlơi Ơi Adai hmâo dưm laih kơ Ñu; samơ̆ răm ƀăm yơh kơ pô pơblư̆ lui Ñu.”
And *they* began to question together among themselves who then it could be of them who was about to do this. @ Ƀing ding kơna čơdơ̆ng tơña tơdruă gơñu kiăng thâo hlơi amăng ƀing gơñu či ngă tơlơi anŭn.
And there was also a strife among them which of them should be held to be [the] greatest. @ Hmâo tơlơi pơrơjah amăng tơdruă ƀing ding kơna kiăng thâo hlơi či jing prŏng hloh amăng ƀing gơñu. 
And he said to them, The kings of the nations rule over them, and they that exercise authority over them are called benefactors. @ Samơ̆ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Ƀing pơtao djuai tuai yua tơlơi dưi kiăng wai lăng ƀing gơñu; laih anŭn ƀing khua gĭt gai, arăng iâu gơñu jing ƀing mơnuih ngă bruă hiam. 
But *ye* [shall] not [be] thus; but let the greater among you be as the younger, and the leader as he that serves. @ Samơ̆ gah kơ ƀing gih ƀu djơ̆ tui anŭn ôh. Hlơi pô prŏng hloh amăng ƀing gih khŏm ñu jing kar hăng anĕt hloh, laih anŭn hlơi jing pô wai lăng khŏm ñu jing kar hăng ding kơna. 
For which [is] greater, he that is at table or he that serves? [Is] not he that is at table? But *I* am in the midst of you as the one that serves. @ Yua kơ hlơi jing prŏng hloh, pô dŏ ber ƀơ̆ng huă ƀôdah pô buih bruă? Djơ̆ mơ̆ jing pô dŏ ber ƀơ̆ng huă? Samơ̆ Kâo dŏ tơ̆ng krah ƀing gih kar hăng sa čô mơnuih buih bruă.”
But *ye* are they who have persevered with me in my temptations. @ “Ƀing gih jing ƀing dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt laih hăng Kâo amăng tơlơi lông lăng truh kơ Kâo, 
And *I* appoint unto you, as my Father has appointed unto me, a kingdom, @ hnŭn yơh Kâo pha brơi dêh čar pơtao kơ ƀing gih kar hăng Ama Kâo hmâo pha brơi kơ Kâo mơ̆n, 
that ye may eat and drink at my table in my kingdom, and sit on thrones judging the twelve tribes of Israel. @ kiăng kơ ƀing gih dưi ƀơ̆ng mơñum hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Kâo ƀơi kơƀang amăng dêh čar pơtao Kâo, laih anŭn dŏ ber ƀơi gre pơtao phat kơđi kơ pluh dua kơnŭng djuai Israel.”
And the Lord said, Simon, Simon, behold, Satan has demanded to have you, to sift [you] as wheat; @ “Ơ Simôn, Simôn ih lăng anai, Satan kiăng pơi ƀing gih kar hăng pơdai. 
but *I* have besought for thee that thy faith fail not; and *thou*, when once thou hast been restored, confirm thy brethren. @ Samơ̆ Kâo iâu laĭ laih kơ ih, kiăng kơ tơlơi đaŏ ih ƀu tơdu ôh. Laih anŭn tơ ih wơ̆t glaĭ pơ Kâo dơ̆ng, brơi ih pơkơjăp ƀing adơi ayŏng ih bĕ.”
And he said to him, Lord, with thee I am ready to go both to prison and to death. @ Pêtrôs laĭ: “Ơ Khua Yang, kâo pre rơmet laih kiăng nao hrŏm hăng Ih wơ̆t amăng sang mơnă ƀôdah amăng tơlơi djai.”
And he said, I tell thee, Peter, [the] cock shall not crow to-day before that thou shalt thrice deny that thou knowest me. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Ơ Pêtrôs, Kâo laĭ kơ ih, hrơi anai tơdang mơnŭ aka tơdjô̆ ôh, ih či hơngah ƀu thâo krăn Kâo klâo wơ̆t.”
And he said to them, When I sent you without purse and scrip and sandals, did ye lack anything? And they said, Nothing. @ Yêsu laĭ dơ̆ng: “Tơ Kâo pơkiaŏ ƀing gih nao, ƀu hmâo kơdŭng prăk ƀôdah kơƀao, ƀôdah klĭ juă, ƀing gih hmâo kơƀah hơgĕt mơ̆?” Gơñu laĭ: “Ƀu kơƀah hơgĕt ôh.”
He said therefore to them, But now he that has a purse let him take [it], in like manner also a scrip, and he that has none let him sell his garment and buy a sword; @ Yêsu laĭ kơ ƀing gơ̆: “Samơ̆ ră anai, hlơi hmâo kơdŭng prăk djă ba bĕ, hlơi hmâo kơƀao, ăt kar kaĭ mơ̆n; laih anŭn hlơi ƀu hmâo đao ôh, brơi ñu sĭ ao phyung ñu laih anŭn blơi sa ƀĕ đao. 
for I say unto you, that this that is written must yet be accomplished in me, And he was reckoned with [the] lawless: for also the things concerning me have an end. @ Yua kơ Kâo laĭ hăng ƀing gih, Tơlơi Ơi Adai Pơhiăp anai čih laih khŏm krĕp djơ̆ amăng Kâo yơh: ‘Arăng hmâo yap laih Ñu jing hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing mơnuih soh’. Sĭt yơh, tơlơi čih laih djơ̆ kơ Kâo hlăk hmâo tơlơi krĕp djơ̆ yơh.” 
And they said, Lord, behold here are two swords. And he said to them, It is enough. @ Gơñu laĭ: “Ơ Khua Yang, hmâo dua ƀĕ đao pơ anai.” Yêsu laĭ: “Djŏp yơh.”
And going forth he went according to his custom to the mount of Olives, and the disciples also followed him. @ Giơ̆ng anŭn, Yêsu tơbiă laih anŭn rơbat nao pơ čư̆ Ôliwơ tui hăng tơlơi Ñu juăt ngă; Ƀing ding kơna Ñu nao hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Ñu. 
And when he was at the place he said to them, Pray that ye enter not into temptation. @ Tơ Yêsu truh laih pơ anih anŭn, Yêsu laĭ kơ ƀing ding kơna Ñu: “Iâu laĭ bĕ kiăng kơ ƀing gih ƀu lĕ ôh amăng tơlơi plư.”
And he was withdrawn from them about a stone's throw, and having knelt down he prayed, @ Yêsu nao ataih mơ̆ng ƀing gơñu kơplah wah sa wang arăng glŏm boh pơtâo, Ñu tŏ tơŭt iâu laĭ tui anai, 
saying, Father, if thou wilt remove this cup from me: but then, not my will, but thine be done. @ “Ơ Ama, tơdah Ih kiăng, rơkâo Ih mă pơđuaĭ hĭ bĕ kơčok tơlơi ruă nuă anai mơ̆ng Kâo; samơ̆ tui hăng Ih kiăng, ƀu djơ̆ tui hăng Kâo kiăng ôh.” 
And an angel appeared to him from heaven strengthening him. @ Hmâo sa čô ling jang mơ̆ng adai pơrơđah rai kơ Ñu laih anŭn pơkơtang brơi Ñu. 
And being in conflict he prayed more intently. And his sweat became as great drops of blood, falling down upon the earth. @ Amăng tơlơi ruă nuă, Ñu iâu laĭ jai kơtang hloh dơ̆ng, ia hô̆ Ñu jing hĭ kar hăng tơdjoh drah prŏng lĕ ƀơi lŏn. 
And rising up from his prayer, coming to the disciples, he found them sleeping from grief. @ Giơ̆ng kơ iâu laĭ, Yêsu tơgŭ nao pơ ƀing ding kơna Ñu. Ñu ƀuh ƀing gơñu hlăk dŏ pĭt yua kơ tơlơi rơngot. 
And he said to them, Why sleep ye? rise up and pray that ye enter not into temptation. @ Ñu laĭ kơ ƀing gơñu: “Hyư̆m ƀing gih dŏ pĭt lĕ? Tơgŭ laih anŭn iâu laĭ bĕ, kiăng kơ ƀing gih ƀu lĕ ôh amăng tơlơi plư.”
As he was yet speaking, behold, a crowd, and he that was called Judas, one of the twelve, went on before them, and drew near to Jesus to kiss him. @ Tơdang Yêsu dŏ pơhiăp, hmâo sa phung mơnuih lu rai; pô arăng pơanăn Yudas, sa čô amăng pluh dua čô ƀing khua ding kơna, ba jơlan ƀing anŭn. Ñu nao jĕ Yêsu kiăng čŭm Yêsu. 
And Jesus said to him, Judas, deliverest thou up the Son of man with a kiss? @ Samơ̆ Yêsu laĭ kơ ñu: “Ơ Yudas, ih yua tơlơi čŭm kiăng pơblư̆ lui Ană Mơnuih hă?”
And they who were around him, seeing what was going to follow, said [to him], Lord, shall we smite with [the] sword? @ Tơ ƀing mơnuih dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Yêsu ƀuh tơlơi čơdơ̆ng truh, gơñu laĭ: “Ơ Khua Yang, gơmơi dưi yua đao kiăng koh mơ̆?” 
And a certain one from among them smote the bondman of the high priest and took off his right ear. @ Sa čô amăng ƀing gơñu koh hĭ ding kơna khua ngă yang prŏng hloh laih anŭn tơĭ hĭ tơngia gah hơnuă ñu.
And Jesus answering said, Suffer thus far; and having touched his ear, he healed him. @ Samơ̆ Yêsu laĭ: “Lui bĕ! Anăm koh dơ̆ng ôh!” Giơ̆ng anŭn Yêsu ruaih ƀơi tơngia pô ding kơna anŭn hăng pơhlao brơi gơ̆.
And Jesus said to the chief priests and captains of the temple and elders, who were come against him, Have ye come out as against a robber with swords and sticks? @ Khua Yang Yêsu laĭ tui anai hăng ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng, ƀing tơhan gak wai sang kơkuh pơpŭ, laih anŭn ƀing kŏng tha rai mă Ñu: “Ƀing gih djă đao hăng gai rai mă Kâo kar hăng kiăng mă sa čô mơnuih klĕ dŏp hă? 
When I was day by day with you in the temple ye did not stretch out your hands against me; but this is your hour and the power of darkness. @ Tơdang rĭm hrơi Kâo dŏ hrŏm hăng ƀing gih amăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ, ƀing gih ƀu mă Kâo ôh. Samơ̆ ră anai jing mông kơ ƀing gih laih anŭn kơ tơlơi dưi mơyang kơnăm mơmŏt yơh.”
And having laid hold on him, they led him [away], and they led [him] into the house of the high priest. And Peter followed afar off. @ Gơñu mă čăp Yêsu laih anŭn ba pơđuaĭ, gơñu ba Yêsu nao pơ sang khua ngă yang prŏng hloh. Pêtrôs đuaĭ tui mơ̆ng ataih ataih. 
And they having lit a fire in the midst of the court and sat down together, Peter sat among them. @ Gơñu pơtŏ apui tơ̆ng krah wăl sang laih anŭn dŏ ber hrŏm hơbĭt, Pêtrôs ăt dŏ ber tơ̆ng krah ƀing gơñu mơ̆n. 
And a certain maid, having seen him sitting by the light, and having fixed her eyes upon him, said, And this [man] was with him. @ Tơdang Pêtrôs dŏ ber giăm apui, sa čô ding kơna đah kơmơi dŏ lăng kơ ñu ƀu ƀleh mơta ôh, laih anŭn laĭ: “Pô anai ăt dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Ñu mơ̆n.”
But he denied [him], saying, Woman, I do not know him. @ Samơ̆ Pêtrôs hơngah laih anŭn laĭ: “Ơ yă anŭn hơi, kâo ƀu thâo krăn Ñu ôh.”
And after a short time another seeing him said, And *thou* art of them. But Peter said, Man, I am not. @ Ƀiă kơ anŭn, hmâo sa čô mơnuih pơkŏn ƀuh Pêtrôs laih anŭn laĭ: “Ih ăt jing sa čô amăng ƀing anŭn mơ̆n!”
Samơ̆ Pêtrôs laĭ: “Ơ čơkơi anŭn, kâo ƀu jing ƀing anŭn ôh.”
And after the lapse of about one hour another stoutly maintained it, saying, In truth this [man] also was with him, for also he is a Galilaean. @ Năng ai sa mông tơdơi kơ anŭn, hmâo sa čô pô pơkŏn laĭ khŭt khăt tui anai: “Sĭt biă mă pô anai ăt dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Yêsu mơ̆n, yua kơ ñu jing mơnuih Galilê mơ̆n.”
And Peter said, Man, I know not what thou sayest. And immediately, while he was yet speaking, [the] cock crew. @ Samơ̆ Pêtrôs laĭ: “Ơ čơkơi anŭn, kâo ƀu thâo ôh hơgĕt tơlơi ih laĭ!”
Hlăk anŭn mơtam tơdang Pêtrôs ăt dŏ pơhiăp, mơnŭ tơdjô̆ hĭ. 
And the Lord, turning round, looked at Peter; and Peter remembered the word of the Lord, how he said to him, Before [the] cock crow thou shalt deny me thrice. @ Khua Yang wir lăng pơ Pêtrôs. Pêtrôs hơdơr glaĭ tơlơi Khua Yang hmâo laĭ laih kơ ñu: “Hrơi anai, hlâo kơ mơnŭ tơdjô̆, ih či hơngah Kâo klâo wơ̆t.” 
And Peter, going forth without, wept bitterly. @ Pêtrôs tơbiă pơ rơngiao laih anŭn hia rơngot biă mă.
And the men who held him mocked him, beating [him]; @ Ƀing mơnuih gak wai Yêsu djik djak kơ Yêsu laih anŭn taih Ñu. 
and covering him up, asked him saying, Prophesy, who is it that struck thee? @ Gơñu gom mơta Yêsu laih anŭn tơña kơ Gơ̆: “Đao lăng bĕ, hlơi hmâo taih Ih?” 
And they said many other injurious things to him. @ Laih anŭn gơñu pơhiăp lu tơlơi ƀrưh hmiah pơkŏn dơ̆ng kơ Yêsu.
And when it was day, the elderhood of the people, both [the] chief priests and scribes, were gathered together, and led him into their council, saying, @ Truh mơguah, ƀing kŏng tha amăng ană plei pla, ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng, laih anŭn ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt bơjơnum hrŏm hơbĭt; laih anŭn gơñu ba Yêsu nao pơ anăp ƀing khua phat kơđi. 
If *thou* art the Christ, tell us. And he said to them, If I tell you, ye will not at all believe; @ Gơñu laĭ: “Tơdah Ih jing Yang Krist, pơhaih bĕ kơ gơmơi thâo.”
Yêsu laĭ glaĭ kơ gơñu: “Tơdah Kâo laĭ tơlơi anŭn kơ ƀing gih, ƀing gih ƀu či đaŏ ôh; 
and if I should ask [you], ye would not answer me at all, nor let me go; @ tơdah Kâo tơña kơ ƀing gih, ƀing gih ƀu či laĭ glaĭ ôh. 
but henceforth shall the Son of man be sitting on the right hand of the power of God. @ Samơ̆ mơ̆ng ră anai truh pơ anăp Ană Mơnuih či dŏ ber gah hơnuă kơ Ơi Adai Pô Dưi Kơtang.”
And they all said, *Thou* then art the Son of God? And he said to them, *Ye* say that I am. @ Abih bang gơñu laĭ: “Tui anŭn Ih jing Ană Ơi Adai hă?” Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Ƀing gih laĭ laih hlơi Kâo jing.”
And they said, What need have we any more of witness, for we have heard ourselves out of his mouth? @ Tui anŭn gơñu laĭ: “Ƀing ta ƀu kiăng hmâo thim tơlơi gơ̆ng jơlan pơkŏn dơ̆ng tah? Ƀing ta hmâo hmư̆ laih tơlơi anŭn mơ̆ng amăng bah Ñu pô.”
And the whole multitude of them, rising up, led him to Pilate. @ Abih bang ƀing anŭn tơgŭ laih anŭn ba Yêsu pơ anăp Pilat. 
And they began to accuse him, saying, We have found this [man] perverting our nation, and forbidding to give tribute to Caesar, saying that he himself is Christ, a king. @ Gơñu čơdơ̆ng pơčŭt kơ Yêsu, laĭ: “Gơmơi ƀuh mơnuih anai pơsur kơnŭng djuai ƀing gơmơi pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ laih anŭn khă gơmơi duh jia kơ Sêsar laih anŭn laĭ kơ ñu Pô jing Yang Krist, jing Pơtao.”
And Pilate demanded of him saying, Art *thou* the king of the Jews? And he answering him said, Thou sayest. @ Pilat tơña kơ Yêsu: “Djơ̆ mơ̆ Ih jing pơtao ană Yuđa?”
Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Ih yơh hmâo laĭ laih tơlơi anŭn.”
And Pilate said to the chief priests and the crowds, I find no guilt in this man. @ Pilat laĭ kơ ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng laih anŭn kơ ƀing ană plei pla: “Kâo ƀu ƀuh ôh tơlơi soh amăng mơnuih anai.”
But they insisted, saying, He stirs up the people, teaching throughout all Judaea, beginning from Galilee even on to here. @ Samơ̆ gơñu tŭt kơ pơtrŭt Pilat hăng tơlơi laĭ tui anai: “Ñu pơsur ƀing ană plei pla krŭ pơkơdơ̆ng, tơdang pơtô tar ƀar tring Yuđa čơdơ̆ng mơ̆ng tring Galilê truh pơ anih anai.”
But Pilate, having heard Galilee [named], demanded if the man were a Galilaean; @ Tơ Pilat hmư̆ tơlơi anŭn, ñu tơña kiăng thâo pô anai jing mơnuih Galilê sĭt mơ̆? 
and having learned that he was of Herod's jurisdiction, remitted him to Herod, who himself also was at Jerusalem in those days. @ Tơ ñu thâo Yêsu jing ană plei pla tring dŏ gah yŭ kơ pơtao Hêrôt wai lăng, ñu brơi arăng ba gơ̆ pơ pơtao Hêrôt. Hlăk anŭn Hêrôt hmâo ƀô̆ mơta pơ plei Yêrusalem mơ̆n. 
And when Herod saw Jesus he greatly rejoiced, for he had been a long while desirous of seeing him, because of hearing many things concerning him, and he hoped to see some sign done by him; @ Tơ pơtao Hêrôt ƀuh Yêsu ñu mơak biă mă, yua kơ mơ̆ng sui laih ñu kiăng ƀuh Yêsu. Yua kơ ñu hmư̆ laih tơlơi arăng ră ruai kơ Yêsu, laih anŭn ñu čang rơmang či ƀuh Yêsu ngă tơlơi mơsêh mơyang. 
and he questioned him in many words, but *he* answered him nothing. @ Tui anŭn ñu tơña kơ Yêsu lu tơlơi; samơ̆ Yêsu ƀu laĭ glaĭ ôh. 
And the chief priests and the scribes stood and accused him violently. @ Ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng laih anŭn ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt dŏ giăm pơčŭt kơ Yêsu kơtang biă mă. 
And Herod with his troops having set him at nought and mocked him, having put a splendid robe upon him, sent him back to Pilate. @ Hêrôt hăng ƀing tơhan ñu ƀrưh hmiah hăng djik djak kơ Yêsu; gơñu buh brơi Yêsu sa blah ao phyung hiam rŏ laih anŭn Hêrôt brơi arăng ba Yêsu glaĭ pơ Pilat dơ̆ng. 
And Pilate and Herod became friends with one another the same day, for they had been at enmity before between themselves. @ Hlâo adih Hêrôt hăng Pilat jing ayăt tơdruă, samơ̆ amăng hrơi anŭn gơñu čơdơ̆ng jing hĭ gơyut gơyâo.
And Pilate, having called together the chief priests and the rulers and the people, @ Laih anŭn Pilat iâu pơƀŭt ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng, ƀing khua wai lăng, laih anŭn ƀing ană plei pla, 
said to them, Ye have brought to me this man as turning away the people [to rebellion], and behold, I, having examined him before you, have found nothing criminal in this man as to the things of which ye accuse him; @ hăng laĭ: “Ƀing gih ba mơnuih anai pơ kâo laih anŭn pơčŭt kơ gơ̆ jing pô pơsur ană plei pla ngă pơrŭng; samơ̆ giơ̆ng kâo hmâo tơña kơsem gơ̆ laih ƀơi anăp ƀing gih, kâo ƀu ƀuh ôh amăng mơnuih anai tơlơi soh kar hăng ƀing gih hmâo pơčŭt. 
nor Herod either, for I remitted you to him, and behold, nothing worthy of death is done by him. @ Hêrôt ăt kŏn ƀuh lơi tơlơi soh Ñu, yua kơ ñu ba glaĭ laih Ñu pơ ƀing ta dơ̆ng. Hnŭn yơh, mơnuih anai ƀu ngă tơlơi soh hơgĕt lăp kơ djai ôh. 
Having chastised him therefore, I will release him. @ Tui anŭn kâo či taih Ñu hăng gai laih anŭn phư hĭ Ñu.”
But they cried out in a mass saying, Away with this [man] and release Barabbas to us; @ Samơ̆ abih bang gơñu ur hơdrăm bĭt: “Pơdjai hĭ pô anai, laih anŭn phư brơi Barabas kơ gơmơi.” 
who was one who, for a certain tumult which had taken place in the city, and [for] murder, had been cast into prison. @ Arăng krư̆ Barabas yua kơ tơlơi ñu tơgŭ pơkơdơ̆ng amăng plei anŭn, laih anŭn yua kơ ñu pơdjai mơnuih.
Pilate therefore, desirous to release Jesus, again addressed [them]. @ Pilat kiăng phư Yêsu, hnŭn yơh ñu pơđur ƀing ană plei pla dơ̆ng. 
But they cried out in reply saying, Crucify, crucify him. @ Samơ̆ gơñu ur: “Pơ̆ng hĭ Ñu ƀơi kơyâo bơrơkal! Pơ̆ng hĭ Ñu ƀơi kơyâo bơrơkal!”
And he said the third time to them, What evil then has this [man] done? I have found no cause of death in him: I will chastise him therefore and release him. @ Pilat laĭ hăng ƀing gơñu tal klâo: “Hơgĕt tơlơi sat mơnuih anai hmâo ngă laih? Kâo ƀu ƀuh ôh amăng Ñu tơlơi soh prŏng lăp kơ djai. Tui anŭn kâo či brơi arăng taih Ñu hăng gai laih anŭn phư hĭ.”
But they were urgent with loud voices, begging that he might be crucified. And their voices [and those of the chief priests] prevailed. @ Samơ̆ gơñu jai ur kraih hloh dơ̆ng, brơi arăng khŏm pơ̆ng Yêsu ƀơi kơyâo bơrơkal; laih anŭn tơlơi gơñu ur kraih dưi hĭ. 
And Pilate adjudged that what they begged should take place. @ Tui anŭn Pilat phat brơi kơđi tui hăng tơlơi gơñu rơkâo. 
And he released him who, for tumult and murder, had been cast into prison, whom they begged for, and Jesus he delivered up to their will. @ Pilat pŏk brơi pô arăng hmâo krư̆ laih, jing pô gŭ pơkơdơ̆ng laih anŭn tơlơi pơdjai mơnuih, tui hăng ƀing gơñu rơkâo; samơ̆ jao Yêsu kơ ƀing anŭn tui hăng tơlơi gơñu kiăng.
And as they led him away, they laid hold on a certain Simon, a Cyrenian, coming from the field, and put the cross upon him to bear it behind Jesus. @ Tơdang gơñu ba Yêsu, gơñu bưp sa čô mơnuih anăn gơ̆ Simôn mơnuih Siren tơdang gơ̆ glaĭ mơ̆ng hmua, laih anŭn pơgŏ gơ̆ glăm kơyâo bơrơkal tui klon Yêsu. 
And a great multitude of the people, and of women who wailed and lamented him, followed him. @ Hmâo phung mơnuih lu đuaĭ tui Yêsu, amăng anŭn hmâo ƀing đah kơmơi tŭk tơda čŏk hia kơ Yêsu. 
And Jesus turning round to them said, Daughters of Jerusalem, do not weep over me, but weep over yourselves and over your children; @ Yêsu wir glaĭ lăng kơ gơñu laih anŭn laĭ “Ơ ƀing ană đah kơmơi plei Yêrusalem, anăm hia kơ Kâo ôh, samơ̆ hia bĕ kơ gih pô laih anŭn kơ ƀing ană bă ƀing gih. 
for behold, days are coming in which they will say, Blessed [are] the barren, and wombs that have not borne, and breasts that have not given suck. @ Yua kơ khul hrơi či truh, arăng či laĭ: ‘Mơyun hiam yơh kơ ƀing đah kơmơi plao, laih anŭn kơ kian ƀu hmâo tơkeng, hăng ƀing đah kơmơi ƀu hmâo ană mĕm!’ 
Then shall they begin to say to the mountains, Fall upon us; and to the hills, Cover us: @ Hlăk anŭn gơñu či laĭ kơ čư̆: ‘Glưh trŭn bĕ ƀơi gơmơi’ laih anŭn laĭ kơ bul čư̆: ‘Gom hĭ gơmơi bĕ!’ 
for if these things are done in the green tree, what shall take place in the dry? @ Yua kơ tơdah kơyâo dŏ mơtah arăng hmâo ngă kar hăng anŭn, bơ kơ kơyâo kro hyư̆m ñu či jing lĕ?”
Now two others also, malefactors, were led with him to be put to death. @ Kar kaĭ mơ̆n arăng ăt ba dua čô mơnuih soh prŏng kiăng pơdjai gơñu hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Yêsu. 
And when they came to the place which is called Skull, there they crucified him, and the malefactors, one on the right hand, the other on the left. @ Tơ gơñu truh pơ anih arăng pơanăn anih Klang Akŏ, pơ anŭn gơñu pơ̆ng Yêsu ƀơi kơyâo bơrơkal, wơ̆t ƀing soh prŏng anŭn, sa čô gah hơnuă, sa čô gah iao. 
And Jesus said, Father, forgive them, for they know not what they do. And, parting out his garments, they cast lots. @ Yêsu iâu laĭ: “Ơ Ama, pap brơi kơ gơñu, yua kơ gơñu ƀu thâo ôh hơgĕt tơlơi gơñu ngă.”
Laih anŭn gơñu pơpha ao phyung Yêsu hăng tơlơi mă črăm. 
And the people stood beholding, and the rulers also [with them] sneered, saying, He has saved others; let him save himself if this is the Christ, the chosen one of God. @ Ƀing ană plei pla dŏ pơ anŭn dŏ krăp lăng; samơ̆ ƀing khua wai lăng djik djak Yêsu hăng laĭ: “Ñu hmâo pơklaih laih ƀing pơkŏn. Tơdah Ñu jing Yang Krist mơ̆ng Ơi Adai, Pô Ơi Adai hmâo ruah laih, brơi Ñu pơklaih bĕ pô Ñu,”
And the soldiers also made game of him, coming up offering him vinegar, @ Wơ̆t ƀing tơhan ăt ƀrưh mưč mơ̆n, nao giăm yơr đĭ ia tơpai mơsăm kơ Yêsu, 
and saying, If *thou* be the king of the Jews, save thyself. @ hăng laĭ: “Tơdah Ih jing Pơtao ană Yuđa, pơklaih bĕ Ih pô!”
And there was also an inscription [written] over him in Greek, and Roman, and Hebrew letters: This is the King of the Jews. @ Gah ngŏ akŏ Yêsu arăng hmâo čih tui anai: “mơnuih anai jing pơtao ană yuđa.”
Now one of the malefactors who had been hanged spoke insultingly to him, saying, Art not thou the Christ? save thyself and us. @ Sa čô amăng ƀing soh prŏng arăng yol ƀơi kơyâo bơrơkal ăt hơtoh djraĭ Yêsu hăng laĭ: “Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă Ih jing Yang Krist? Pơklaih bĕ pô Ih laih anŭn wơ̆t gơmơi mơ̆n!”
But the other answering rebuked him, saying, Dost *thou* too not fear God, thou that art under the same judgment? @ Samơ̆ pô soh pơkŏn ƀuah gơ̆ hăng laĭ: “Ih ƀu hwĭ kơ Ơi Adai ôh hă? Yua kơ ih ăt tŭ tơlơi phak kar kaĭ mơ̆n. 
and *we* indeed justly, for we receive the just recompense of what we have done; but this [man] has done nothing amiss. @ Bơ kơ ƀing ta djơ̆ yơh; yua kơ ƀing ta mă tŭ tơlơi phak năng lăp hăng bruă ƀing ta ngă, samơ̆ pô anai ƀu hmâo ngă tơlơi soh glaĭ hơgĕt ôh.” 
And he said to Jesus, Remember me, [Lord,] when thou comest in thy kingdom. @ Laih anŭn gơ̆ laĭ: “Ơ Yêsu, rơkâo kơ Ih hơdơr kơ kâo tơ Ih rai amăng dêh čar pơtao Ih.”
And Jesus said to him, Verily I say to thee, To-day shalt thou be with me in paradise. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Sĭt biă mă Kâo laĭ kơ ih, hrơi anai ih či dŏ hrŏm hăng Kâo amăng Parađi.”
And it was about [the] sixth hour, and there came darkness over the whole land until [the] ninth hour. @ Hlăk anŭn kơplah yang hrơi dơ̆ng, abih bang tring hmâo tơlơi kơnăm mơmŏt tơl truh klâo mông klam. 
And the sun was darkened, and the veil of the temple rent in the midst. @ Tơdang yang hrơi jing kơnăm mơmŏt, khăn păng amăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ tơhek hĭ tơ̆ng krah jing dua. 
And Jesus, having cried with a loud voice, said, Father, into thy hands I commit my spirit. And having said this, he expired. @ Hlăk anŭn Yêsu ur kraih kơtang, laĭ: “Ơ Ama, Kâo jao bơngăt Kâo amăng tơngan Ih!” Laih pơhiăp giơ̆ng Ñu tơĭ pran.
Now the centurion, seeing what took place, glorified God, saying, In very deed this man was just. @ Tơ khua tơhan ƀuh tơlơi hmâo truh laih, ñu pơpŭ bơni hơơč kơ Ơi Adai hăng laĭ: “Sĭt biă mă pô anai jing mơnuih tơpă!”
And all the crowds who had come together to that sight, having seen the things that took place, returned, beating [their] breasts. @ Abih bang ƀing mơnuih lu pơtŭm glaĭ kiăng lăng tơlơi truh anai; tơ gơñu ƀuh khul tơlơi hmâo truh laih, gơñu đuaĭ glaĭ hăng tŭk tơda. 
And all those who knew him stood afar off, the women also who had followed him from Galilee, beholding these things. @ Abih bang ƀing thâo krăn Yêsu, wơ̆t ƀing đah kơmơi hmâo đuaĭ tui laih Ñu mơ̆ng tring Galilê, dŏ dơ̆ng mơ̆ng ataih ƀuh abih tơlơi anŭn.
And behold, a man named Joseph, who was a councillor, a good man and a just @ Hmâo sa čô mơnuih, anăn ñu Yôsep mơ̆ng plei Arimathê amăng tring Yuđa. Ñu jing sa čô amăng ƀing khua phat kơđi, sa čô mơnuih hiam laih anŭn tơpă, 
(this [man] had not assented to their counsel and deed), of Arimathaea, a city of the Jews, who also waited, [himself also,] for the kingdom of God @ ñu jing mơnuih dŏ čang rơmang dêh čar pơtao Ơi Adai. Ñu ƀu tŭ ư ôh kơ tơlơi ƀing anŭn črŏng sai hăng bruă gơñu ngă anŭn. 
he having gone to Pilate begged the body of Jesus; @ Ñu nao pơ Pilat hăng rơkâo drơi jan Yêsu. 
and having taken it down, wrapped it in fine linen and placed him in a tomb hewn in the rock, where no one had ever been laid. @ Ñu pơtrŭn drơi jan Yêsu, pŏn lom hăng khăn kơbuă ƀlĭ, laih anŭn pơđih gơ̆ amăng pơsat hmâo ƀoh laih amăng boh pơtâo, ƀơi anih anŭn arăng aka ƀu dơr hlơi ôh. 
And it was preparation day, and [the] sabbath twilight was coming on. @ Hrơi anŭn jing hrơi Prăp Rơmet laih anŭn hrơi saƀat jĕ truh.
And women, who had come along with him out of Galilee, having followed, saw the sepulchre and how his body was placed. @ Ƀing đah kơmơi hmâo đuaĭ tui laih Yêsu mơ̆ng tring Galilê, ăt nao hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Yôsep kiăng lăng pơsat laih anŭn hyư̆m tơlơi arăng pioh drơi jan Yêsu. 
And having returned they prepared aromatic spices and ointments, and remained quiet on the sabbath, according to the commandment. @ Giơ̆ng anŭn gơñu glaĭ prăp rơmet mơnơ̆ng ƀâu mơngưi laih anŭn ia klôñ. Hrơi saƀat gơñu pơdơi tui hăng tơlơi juăt pơkă.
But on the morrow of the sabbath, very early indeed in the morning, they came to the tomb, bringing the aromatic spices which they had prepared. @ Hrơi tal sa amăng hrơi kơ̆m, hlăk ưm mơguah gơñu nao pơ pơsat, djă ba mơnơ̆ng ƀâu mơngưi gơñu hmâo prăp rơmet laih. 
And they found the stone rolled away from the sepulchre. @ Gơñu ƀuh boh pơtâo hmâo tơglung laih mơ̆ng bah amăng pơsat, 
And when they had entered they found not the body of the Lord Jesus. @ samơ̆ tơ gơñu mŭt amăng pơsat, gơñu ƀu ƀuh ôh drơi jan Khua Yang Yêsu. 
And it came to pass as they were in perplexity about it, that behold, two men suddenly stood by them in shining raiment. @ Tơdang gơñu dŏ sư̆ rơbư̆ rŭng răng kơ tơlơi anŭn, plŭt hmâo dua čô đah rơkơi dŏ giăm gơñu buh ao kŏ kơmlă biă mă. 
And as they were filled with fear and bowed their faces to the ground, they said to them, Why seek ye the living one among the dead? @ Tơdang gơñu hwĭ biă mă hăng kŭp ƀô̆ ƀơi lŏn, ƀing đah rơkơi anŭn laĭ kơ gơñu: “Hyư̆m ƀing gih sem pô hơdip ƀơi tơ̆ng krah ƀing djai? 
He is not here, but is risen: remember how he spoke to you, being yet in Galilee, @ Ñu ƀu dŏ pơ anai ôh, Ñu hơdip glaĭ laih! Hơdơr glaĭ bĕ kơ tơlơi Ñu hmâo laĭ laih kơ ƀing gih tơdang Ñu ăt dŏ amăng tring Galilê. 
saying, The Son of man must be delivered up into the hands of sinners, and be crucified, and rise the third day. @ ‘Arăng khŏm jao hĭ Ană Mơnuih amăng tơngan ƀing mơnuih soh, khŏm pơ̆ng hĭ Ñu ƀơi kơyâo bơrơkal, laih anŭn ƀơi hrơi tal klâo Ñu khŏm hơdip glaĭ.’”
And they remembered his words; @ Tui anŭn gơñu hơdơr glaĭ kơ tơlơi Yêsu hmâo pơhiăp laih. 
and, returning from the sepulchre, related all these things to the eleven and to all the rest. @ Gơñu glaĭ mơ̆ng pơsat, laĭ pơthâo abih tơlơi anŭn kơ ƀing pluh sa čô laih anŭn kơ abih bang ƀing ding kơna pơkŏn. 
Now it was Mary of Magdala, and Johanna, and Mary the [mother] of James, and the others with them, who told these things to the apostles. @ Ƀing anŭn jing HʼMari Madala, HʼYôana, hăng HʼMari amĭ Yakơ, laih anŭn ƀing đah kơmơi pơkŏn hrŏm hơbĭt hăng gơñu ruai glaĭ tơlơi anŭn kơ ƀing khua ding kơna. 
And their words appeared in their eyes as an idle tale, and they disbelieved them. @ Samơ̆ ƀing khua ding kơna ƀu đaŏ ôh, gơñu pơmĭn khul boh pơhiăp anŭn jing tơlơi ruai ngơr đôč. 
But Peter, rising up, ran to the sepulchre, and stooping down he sees the linen clothes lying there alone, and went away home, wondering at what had happened. @ Samơ̆ Pêtrôs tơgŭ laih anŭn nao pơ pơsat. Ñu tơkui ep lăng amăng pơsat laih anŭn kơnơ̆ng ƀuh khăn kơbuă ƀlĭ đôč. Laih anŭn ñu glaĭ pơ sang hăng dŏ hling hlang kơ tơlơi hmâo truh laih.
And behold, two of them were going on the same day to a village distant sixty stadia from Jerusalem, called Emmaus; @ Ăt amăng hrơi anŭn mơ̆n hmâo dua čô ding kơna nao pơ sa boh plei pơanăn Êmaus, ataih mơ̆ng plei Yêrusalem kơplah wah pluh sa wang kilômet. 
and they conversed with one another about all these things which had taken place. @ Gơñu ră ruai tơdruă gơñu kơ abih tơlơi hmâo truh laih. 
And it came to pass as they conversed and reasoned, that Jesus himself drawing nigh, went with them; @ Tơdang gơñu dŏ ră ruai tơdruă gơñu laih anŭn pơrơjah nao rai, Yêsu pô nao giăm gơñu laih anŭn rơbat hrŏm hơbĭt hăng gơñu. 
but their eyes were holden so as not to know him. @ Gơñu ƀuh Yêsu samơ̆ ƀu thâo krăn Ñu ôh. 
And he said to them, What discourses are these which pass between you as ye walk, and are downcast? @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Hơgĕt tơlơi ƀing gih pơrơjah tơdruă tơdang ƀing gih rơbat rŏk jơlan?”
Gơñu dŏ hĭ hăng tơlơi rơngot. 
And one [of them], named Cleopas, answering said to him, Thou sojournest alone in Jerusalem, and dost not know what has taken place in it in these days? @ Sa čô amăng ƀing gơñu, anăn ñu Klêôpas, laĭ glaĭ: “Djơ̆ mơ̆ kơnơ̆ng hơjăn ih hă jing tuai amăng plei Yêrusalem ƀu thâo ôh khul tơlơi hmâo truh laih phrâo ƀiă hơdôm hrơi anai?”
And he said to them, What things? And they said to him, The things concerning Jesus the Nazaraean, who was a prophet mighty in deed and word before God and all the people; @ Yêsu tơña gơñu: “Hơgĕt tơlơi anŭn?”
Gơñu laĭ kơ Yêsu: “Tơlơi hmâo truh laih kơ Yêsu Nasaret; Ñu jing sa čô pô laĭ lui hlâo mơyang biă mă amăng bruă ngă laih anŭn amăng tơlơi pơhiăp ƀơi anăp Ơi Adai hăng ƀơi anăp abih bang ană plei pla, 
and how the chief priests and our rulers delivered him up to [the] judgment of death and crucified him. @ samơ̆ ƀu thâo hluh ôh yua hơgĕt ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng laih anŭn ƀing khua wai lăng ƀing ta pŭng kơ jao lui Ñu brơi kơ arăng klă kơđi pơdjai hĭ hăng pơ̆ng Ñu ƀơi kơyâo bơrơkal. 
But *we* had hoped that *he* was [the one] who is about to redeem Israel. But then, besides all these things, it is now, to-day, the third day since these things took place. @ Samơ̆ gơmơi hmâo čang rơmang laih kơ Ñu yơh jing Pô song mă ƀing Israel; wơ̆t hnŭn, hmâo klâo hrơi rơgao laih mơ̆ng tơlơi anŭn truh. 
And withal, certain women from amongst us astonished us, having been very early at the sepulchre, @ Hloh anŭn dơ̆ng, hmâo đơđa đah kơmơi amăng ƀing gơmơi hmâo ngă brơi ƀing gơmơi hling hlang biă mă: Hlăk ưm mơguah gơñu nao pơ pơsat, 
and, not having found his body, came, saying that they also had seen a vision of angels, who say that he is living. @ samơ̆ gơñu ƀu ƀuh ôh drơi jan Yêsu, gơñu wơ̆t glaĭ hăng laĭ hmâo ling jang pơƀuh rai laĭ pơthâo kơ Yêsu hlăk dŏ hơdip. 
And some of those with us went to the sepulchre, and found it so, as the women also had said, but him they saw not. @ Đơđa amăng ƀing gơmơi nao pơ pơsat, laih anŭn ăt ƀuh djơ̆ kar hăng ƀing đah kơmơi hmâo ruai laih; samơ̆ gơñu ƀu ƀuh Yêsu ôh.”
And *he* said to them, O senseless and slow of heart to believe in all that the prophets have spoken! @ Hlăk anŭn Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Ơ ƀing mơnuih mlŭk laih anŭn pran jua kaih đaŏ abih tơlơi ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo hmâo pơhiăp laih! 
Ought not the Christ to have suffered these things and to enter into his glory? @ Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă Yang Krist khŏm tŭ abih tơlơi ruă nuă kar hăng anŭn hnŭn kah dưi mŭt amăng tơlơi guh kơang Ñu?” 
And having begun from Moses and from all the prophets, he interpreted to them in all the scriptures the things concerning himself. @ Giơ̆ng anŭn Ñu pơblang kơ gơñu khul boh pơhiăp hmâo čih laih djơ̆ kơ Ñu amăng abih Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp, čơdơ̆ng mơ̆ng Môis truh kơ abih ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo.
And they drew near to the village where they were going, and *he* made as though he would go farther. @ Tơ gơñu giăm truh pơ plei gơñu kiăng nao; Yêsu ngă kar hăng Ñu kiăng nao ataih hloh dơ̆ng. 
And they constrained him, saying, Stay with us, for it is toward evening and the day is declining. And he entered in to stay with them. @ Samơ̆ gơñu pơđur Yêsu hăng laĭ: “Dŏ glaĭ hăng ƀing gơmơi bĕ, yua kơ adai klam laih, mlam giăm truh yơh.” Tui anŭn Ñu mŭt dŏ glaĭ hăng ƀing gơñu. 
And it came to pass as he was at table with them, having taken the bread, he blessed, and having broken it, gave it to them. @ Tơdang Yêsu dŏ ƀơ̆ng huă hrŏm hơbĭt hăng gơñu, Ñu mă ƀañ tơpŭng laih anŭn iâu laĭ bơni hơơč, Ñu wơ̆k ƀañ tơpŭng laih anŭn brơi kơ gơñu. 
And their eyes were opened, and they recognised him. And he disappeared from them. @ Hlăk anŭn mơta gơñu pŏk hĭ, laih anŭn gơñu thâo krăn Yêsu. Samơ̆ Yêsu đuaĭ thĕng mơ̆ng mơta gơñu ƀuh. 
And they said to one another, Was not our heart burning in us as he spoke to us on the way, [and] as he opened the scriptures to us? @ Gơñu bơlaĭ tơdruă: “Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă pran jua ƀing ta hmâo tơlơi pơ-iă tơdang Ñu pơhiăp hăng ƀing ta laih anŭn pơblang Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp kơ ƀing ta ƀơi rŏk jơlan.”
And rising up the same hour, they returned to Jerusalem. And they found the eleven, and those with them, gathered together, @ Mông anŭn mơtam gơñu tơgŭ wơ̆t glaĭ pơ plei Yêrusalem; gơñu bưp hăng ƀing pluh sa čô khua ding kơna hăng ƀing ding kơna pơkŏn hlăk bơjơnum hrŏm hơbĭt. Ƀing anŭn laĭ, 
saying, The Lord is indeed risen and has appeared to Simon. @ “Khua Yang hmâo hơdip glaĭ sĭt yơh, laih anŭn pơƀuh laih Ñu pô kơ Simôn.”
And they related what [had happened] on the way, and how he was made known to them in the breaking of bread. @ Laih anŭn dua čô ding kơna anŭn kar kaĭ mơ̆n ră ruai hơgĕt tơlơi truh laih kơ gơñu rŏk jơlan, laih anŭn hyư̆m gơñu thâo krăn Yêsu tơdang Ñu wơ̆k ƀañ tơpŭng.
And as they were saying these things, he himself stood in their midst, and says to them, Peace [be] unto you. @ Tơdang gơñu dŏ pơhiăp khul tơlơi anŭn, plŭt Yêsu pô dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơi tơ̆ng krah gơñu hăng laĭ: “Rơnŭk rơnua kơ ƀing gih.”
But they, being confounded and being frightened, supposed they beheld a spirit. @ Samơ̆ gơñu hñơ̆t kơtuă hăng hwĭ bral, pơmĭn dah ƀuh atâo. 
And he said to them, Why are ye troubled? and why are thoughts rising in your hearts? @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Yua hơgĕt ƀing gih rŭng răng, laih anŭn yua hơgĕt ƀing gih ăt dŏ đing amăng pran jua kar hăng anŭn? 
behold my hands and my feet, that it is *I* myself. Handle me and see, for a spirit has not flesh and bones as ye see me having. @ Lăng bĕ tơngan hăng tơkai Kâo; Kâo gơ̆ yơh. Ruaih laih anŭn sem bĕ, yua kơ atâo ƀu hmâo asar klang ôh, samơ̆ ƀing gih ƀuh Kâo hmâo.”
And having said this he shewed them his hands and his feet. @ Giơ̆ng Yêsu pơhiăp tui anŭn, Ñu pơdah tơngan hăng tơkai Ñu brơi kơ gơñu lăng. 
But while they yet did not believe for joy, and were wondering, he said to them, Have ye anything here to eat? @ Tơdang ƀing ding kơna aka đaŏ ôh, yua kơ gơñu hơ̆k mơak hăng dŏ kơtuă hling hlang đơi, tui anŭn Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Pơ anai ƀing gih hmâo mơnơ̆ng hơgĕt ƀơ̆ng mơ̆?” 
And they gave him part of a broiled fish and of a honeycomb; @ Gơñu brơi kơ Yêsu sa čơđeh akan ŏm. 
and he took it and ate before them. @ Yêsu mă akan anŭn hăng ƀơ̆ng ƀơi anăp gơñu.
And he said to them, These [are] the words which I spoke to you while I was yet with you, that all that is written concerning me in the law of Moses and prophets and psalms must be fulfilled. @ Laih anŭn Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Abih tơlơi Kâo hmâo pơhiăp laih kơ ƀing gih tơdang Kâo ăt dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing gih, kiăng kơ abih bang tơlơi arăng hmâo čih laih djơ̆ kơ Kâo amăng tơlơi juăt Môis, amăng hră ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo, laih anŭn amăng hră Adoh Hơđăp khŏm krĕp djơ̆ soh sel.”
Then he opened their understanding to understand the scriptures, @ Hlăk anŭn Yêsu pŏk tơlơi pơmĭn gơñu, kiăng gơñu thâo hluh Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp. 
and said to them, Thus it is written, and thus it behoved the Christ to suffer, and to rise from among the dead the third day; @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Hmâo boh pơhiăp čih laih Yang Krist khŏm tŭ tơlơi ruă nuă, truh hrơi tal klâo Ñu či hơdip glaĭ mơ̆ng ƀing djai; 
and that repentance and remission of sins should be preached in his name to all the nations beginning at Jerusalem. @ laih anŭn hăng anăn Ñu arăng či pơtô kơ abih bang kơnŭng djuai mơnuih kơ tơlơi kơhmal kiăng kơ dưi pap brơi tơlơi soh, čơdơ̆ng mơ̆ng plei Yêrusalem. 
And *ye* are witnesses of these things. @ Ƀing gih jing ƀing mơnuih ngă gơ̆ng jơlan pơsĭt kơ abih tơlơi anŭn. Anai nê, Kâo či pha brơi kơ ƀing gih tơlơi Ama Kâo hmâo ƀuăn laih; 
And behold, I send the promise of my Father upon you; but do ye remain in the city till ye be clothed with power from on high. @ samơ̆ brơi ƀing gih khŏm dŏ tơguan bĕ amăng plei Yêrusalem tơl ƀing gih dưi buh mă tơlơi dưi mơyang mơ̆ng ngŏ.”
And he led them out as far as Bethany, and having lifted up his hands, he blessed them. @ Giơ̆ng tơlơi anŭn Yêsu atăt ba gơñu giăm pơ plei Bêthani, laih anŭn Ñu yơr tơngan tuh mơyun hiam kơ gơñu. 
And it came to pass as he was blessing them, he was separated from them and was carried up into heaven. @ Tơdang Ñu tuh mơyun hiam kơ gơñu, Yêsu đuaĭ mơ̆ng gơñu, laih anŭn Ơi Adai pŭ đĭ Ñu pơ adai. 
And *they*, having done him homage, returned to Jerusalem with great joy, @ Gơñu kơkuh pơpŭ kơ Ñu laih anŭn wơ̆t glaĭ pơ plei Yêrusalem dơ̆ng hăng tơlơi hơ̆k mơak bă blai. 
and were continually in the temple praising and blessing God. @ Laih anŭn gơñu dŏ nanao amăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ, pơpŭ bơni hơơč kơ Ơi Adai.
In [the] beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God. @ Blŭng hlâo hmâo Boh Pơhiăp, Boh Pơhiăp dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Ơi Adai, laih anŭn Boh Pơhiăp jing Ơi Adai. 
*He* was in the beginning with God. @ Mơ̆ng blŭng hlâo, Boh Pơhiăp dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Ơi Adai. 
All things received being through him, and without him not one [thing] received being which has received being. @ Mơ̆ng Ñu Ơi Adai hrih abih bang mơnơ̆ng, laih anŭn ƀu hmâo ôh sa mơta mơnơ̆ng amăng abih bang mơnơ̆ng hmâo hrih pơjing laih ƀu hmâo mơ̆ng Ñu. 
In him was life, and the life was the light of men. @ Boh Pơhiăp jing phŭn kơ tơlơi hơdip, laih anŭn tơlơi hơdip anŭn jing tơlơi bơngač kơ mơnuih mơnam. 
And the light appears in darkness, and the darkness apprehended it not. @ Tơlơi bơngač pơčrang amăng tơlơi kơnăm mơmŏt, laih anŭn tơlơi kơnăm mơmŏt ƀu hmâo tơlơi dưi hăng tơlơi bơngač ôh.
There was a man sent from God, his name John. @ Hmâo sa čô mơnuih Ơi Adai pơkiaŏ rai, anăn gơ̆ Yôhan. 
He came for witness, that he might witness concerning the light, that all might believe through him. @ Ñu rai jing pô ngă gơ̆ng jơlan pơsĭt brơi arăng thâo kơ tơlơi bơngač, kiăng kơ abih bang mơnuih dưi đaŏ. 
*He* was not the light, but that he might witness concerning the light. @ Ñu pô ƀu jing tơlơi bơngač ôh, samơ̆ ñu rai kiăng ngă gơ̆ng jơlan pơsĭt kơ tơlơi bơngač. 
The true light was that which, coming into the world, lightens every man. @ Tơlơi bơngač anŭn jing tơlơi bơngač sĭt, truh laih pơ lŏn tơnah, kiăng pơčrang rĭm čô mơnuih.
He was in the world, and the world had [its] being through him, and the world knew him not. @ Boh Pơhiăp dŏ laih amăng lŏn tơnah, laih anŭn hăng Ñu mơ̆n Ơi Adai hmâo hrih laih lŏn tơnah, samơ̆ lŏn tơnah ƀu thâo krăn Ñu ôh. 
He came to his own, and his own received him not; @ Ñu rai laih amăng lŏn čar Ñu pô, samơ̆ ƀing ană plei Ñu ƀu tŭ jum Ñu ôh. 
but as many as received him, to them gave he [the] right to be children of God, to those that believe on his name; @ Samơ̆ hlơi pô tŭ jum Ñu, kiăng laĭ hlơi pô đaŏ kơ anăn Ñu, Ñu brơi kơ mơnuih anŭn tơlơi dưi jing ană bă Ơi Adai, 
who have been born, not of blood, nor of flesh's will, nor of man's will, but of God. @ jing ƀing mơnuih hmâo tơkeng rai ƀu djơ̆ hăng drah kŏn djơ̆ tui hăng asar đeh kiăng, ƀôdah tui hăng tơlơi mơnuih kiăng lơi, samơ̆ tơkeng rai mơ̆ng Ơi Adai.
And the Word became flesh, and dwelt among us (and we have contemplated his glory, a glory as of an only-begotten with a father), full of grace and truth; @ Boh Pơhiăp hmâo jing hĭ laih mơnuih, dŏ hơdip tơ̆ng krah ƀing ta, bă hăng tơlơi pap laih anŭn tơlơi sĭt. Ƀing ta hmâo ƀuh laih tơlơi ang yang Ñu, sĭt jing tơlơi ang yang mơ̆ng Ama hmâo brơi kơ Ană Ha Čô Ñu. 
(John bears witness of him, and he has cried, saying, This was he of whom I said, He that comes after me is preferred before me, for he was before me;) @ Yôhan ngă gơ̆ng jơlan kơ Ñu hăng ur kraih tui anai: “Anai jing Pô kâo hmâo laĭ laih: ‘Pô rai tơdơi kơ kâo jing prŏng hloh kơ kâo yua kơ Ñu hmâo hlâo kơ kâo.’”
for of his fulness we all have received, and grace upon grace. @ Laih anŭn mơ̆ng tơlơi pap rơbeh blai Ñu, abih bang ƀing ta hmâo mă tŭ laih tơlơi pap thim kơ tơlơi pap. 
For the law was given by Moses: grace and truth subsists through Jesus Christ. @ Yua kơ Ơi Adai hmâo brơi laih tơlơi juăt găn mơ̆ng Môis; samơ̆ tơlơi pap hăng tơlơi sĭt hmâo mơ̆ng Yêsu Krist. 
No one has seen God at any time; the only-begotten Son, who is in the bosom of the Father, *he* hath declared [him]. @ Aka hmâo hlơi ƀuh djơ̆ Ơi Adai ôh; kơnơ̆ng Ană Ha Čô pô dŏ amăng Ama, Ñu jing Ơi Adai pô. Ñu yơh hmâo pơrơđah Ama kơ ƀing ta thâo.
And this is the witness of John, when the Jews sent from Jerusalem priests and Levites that they might ask him, Thou, who art thou? @ Anai jing tơlơi Yôhan ngă gơ̆ng jơlan, tơ ƀing Yuđa pơkiaŏ ƀing khua ngă yang hăng ƀing mơnuih Lêwi mơ̆ng plei Yêrusalem nao tơña kơ ñu: “Hlơi ih jing?” 
And he acknowledged and denied not, and acknowledged, I am not the Christ. @ Yôhan pơhaih mơtam, ƀu hơngah ôh. Ñu laĭ: “Kâo ƀu djơ̆ Yang Krist ôh.” 
And they asked him, What then? Art thou Elias? And he says, I am not. Art thou the prophet? And he answered, No. @ Gơñu tơña dơ̆ng: “Tui anŭn hlơi ih jing? Djơ̆ mơ̆ ih jing Êli?” Ñu laĭ glaĭ: “Kâo ƀu djơ̆ Êli ôh.” Gơñu tơña dơ̆ng: “Ih jing pô laĭ lui hlâo hă?” Yôhan laĭ glaĭ: “Ư ưh.” 
They said therefore to him, Who art thou? that we may give an answer to those who sent us. What sayest thou of thyself? @ Gơñu laĭ kơ ñu: “Tui anŭn hlơi ih jing lĕ? Kiăng kơ gơmơi dưi laĭ glaĭ kơ ƀing hmâo pơkiaŏ rai gơmơi. Hlơi ih laĭ ih jing?” 
He said, I [am] [the] voice of one crying in the wilderness, Make straight the path of [the] Lord, as said Esaias the prophet. @ Ñu laĭ glaĭ:
“Kâo jing asăp sa čô mơnuih ur kraih amăng tơdrŏn har:
‘Pơkra pơdaŏ jơlan Khua Yang bĕ,’
kar hăng pô laĭ lui hlâo Êsai hmâo laĭ laih,” 
And they were sent from among the Pharisees. @ Ƀing mơnuih arăng hmâo pơkiaŏ rai, jing tơpul ƀing Pharisi, 
And they asked him and said to him, Why baptisest thou then, if thou art not the Christ, nor Elias, nor the prophet? @ gơñu tơña kơ Yôhan: “Tơdah ih ƀu jing Yang Krist ôh, kŏn djơ̆ Êli, ăt kŏn djơ̆ pô laĭ lui hlâo lơi, tui anŭn hyư̆m ih dưi ngă ƀatem lĕ?” 
John answered them saying, I baptise with water. In the midst of you stands, whom ye do not know, @ Yôhan laĭ glaĭ: “Kâo ngă ƀatem hăng ia, samơ̆ hmâo sa čô dŏ tơ̆ng krah ƀing gih, Pô anŭn ƀing gih ƀu thâo krăn ôh, 
he who comes after me, the thong of whose sandal I am not worthy to unloose. @ Ñu rai tơdơi kơ kâo, kâo ƀu năng lăp ôh kleh hrĕ klĭ juă Ñu.” 
These things took place in Bethany, across the Jordan, where John was baptising. @ Abih tơlơi anŭn hmâo truh laih amăng plei Bêthani ƀơi hang gah adih ia krong Yurdan, anih Yôhan dŏ ngă ƀatem.
On the morrow he sees Jesus coming to him, and says, Behold the Lamb of God, who takes away the sin of the world. @ Hrơi tơdơi Yôhan ƀuh Yêsu rai pơ ñu, hăng laĭ: “Lăng adih, anŭn jing Ană Triu Ơi Adai, jing Pô mă pơđuaĭ hĭ tơlơi soh lŏn tơnah! 
He it is of whom I said, A man comes after me who takes a place before me, because he *was* before me; @ Ñu yơh jing Pô kâo hmâo laĭ laih: ‘Hmâo sa čô mơnuih rai tơdơi kơ kâo, Ñu jing Pô prŏng hloh kơ kâo, yua kơ Ñu hmâo laih hlâo kơ kâo.’ 
and I knew him not; but that he might be manifested to Israel, therefore have I come baptising with water. @ Kâo pô ƀu thâo krăn Ñu ôh, samơ̆ kâo rai ngă ƀatem hăng ia, kiăng kơ pơrơđah Ñu kơ ƀing ană Israel.” 
And John bore witness, saying, I beheld the Spirit descending as a dove from heaven, and it abode upon him. @ Giơ̆ng anŭn Yôhan ngă gơ̆ng jơlan dơ̆ng tui anai: “Kâo hmâo ƀuh laih Yang Bơngăt Hiam trŭn mơ̆ng adai kar hăng sa drơi čĭm bơrơgơ̆m găm ƀơi hăng ngŏ Ñu. 
And I knew him not; but he who sent me to baptise with water, *he* said to me, Upon whom thou shalt see the Spirit descending and abiding on him, he it is who baptises with [the] Holy Spirit. @ Kâo pô ƀu thâo krăn Ñu ôh, samơ̆ Pô pơkiaŏ rai kâo ngă ƀatem hăng ia hmâo laĭ laih kơ kâo tui anai: ‘Pô ih ƀuh Yang Bơngăt Hiam trŭn rai hăng dŏ amăng Ñu, Ñu yơh jing Pô ngă ƀatem hăng Yang Bơngăt Hiam.’ 
And I have seen and borne witness that this is the Son of God. @ Kâo hmâo ƀuh laih, hăng ngă gơ̆ng jơlan Ñu anai yơh jing Ană Ơi Adai.”
Again, on the morrow, there stood John and two of his disciples. @ Hrơi tơdơi Yôhan dŏ ƀơi anŭn dơ̆ng hrŏm hơbĭt hăng dua čô amăng ƀing ding kơna ñu; 
And, looking at Jesus as he walked, he says, Behold the Lamb of God. @ Tơdang ñu ƀuh Yêsu rơbat găn ñu laĭ: “Lăng adih, Ană Triu Ơi Adai!” 
And the two disciples heard him speaking, and followed Jesus. @ Dua čô ding kơna anŭn hmư̆ tơlơi ñu laĭ, gơñu đuaĭ tui Yêsu mơtam. 
But Jesus having turned, and seeing them following, says to them, What seek ye? And *they* said to him, Rabbi (which, being interpreted, signifies Teacher), where abidest thou? @ Yêsu wir glaĭ, ƀuh gơñu đuaĭ tui, Yêsu tơña: “Hơgĕt ƀing gih sem?”
Gơñu laĭ glaĭ: “Rabi ‘kiăng laĭ Nai’, pơpă anih Ih dŏ?” 
He says to them, Come and see. They went therefore, and saw where he abode; and they abode with him that day. It was about the tenth hour. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Rai lăng bĕ.” Gơñu nao hăng ƀuh anih Ñu dŏ; laih anŭn gơñu dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Ñu amăng hrơi anŭn. Hlăk anŭn năng ai pă mông klam laih. 
Andrew, the brother of Simon Peter, was one of the two who heard [this] from John and followed him. @ Andrê adơi Simôn Pêtrôs jing sa čô amăng dua čô hmư̆ tơlơi Yôhan pơhiăp anŭn hăng đuaĭ tui Yêsu. 
He first finds his own brother Simon, and says to him, We have found the Messias (which being interpreted is Christ). @ Hlâo kơ abih bang, ñu sem ayŏng ñu Simôn hăng laĭ kơ gơ̆: “Gơmơi hmâo ƀuh laih Yang Mêsi” (kiăng laĭ Yang Krist). 
And he led him to Jesus. Jesus looking at him said, Thou art Simon, the son of Jonas; thou shalt be called Cephas (which interpreted is stone). @ Ñu ba Simôn nao pơ Yêsu. Yêsu lăng Simôn hăng laĭ: “Ih jing Simôn ană Yôhan. Arăng či iâu ih Sêphas” (kiăng laĭ Pêtrôs).
On the morrow he would go forth into Galilee, and Jesus finds Philip, and says to him, Follow me. @ Hrơi tơdơi, Yêsu kiăng nao pơ kwar Galilê. Ñu sem Philip hăng laĭ kơ gơ̆: “Đuaĭ tui kâo bĕ.” 
And Philip was from Bethsaida, of the city of Andrew and Peter. @ Philip jing sa čô mơnuih Plei Bêtsaida, plei hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Andrê, Pêtrôs. 
Philip finds Nathanael, and says to him, We have found him of whom Moses wrote in the law, and the prophets, Jesus, the son of Joseph, who is from Nazareth. @ Philip sem Natanel hăng laĭ kơ gơ̆: “Gơmơi hmâo ƀuh laih Pô Môis hmâo čih amăng Hră Tơlơi Juăt, laih anŭn ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo hmâo čih laih mơ̆n; anŭn jing Yêsu Plei Nasaret, ană Yôsep.” 
And Nathanael said to him, Can anything good come out of Nazareth? Philip says to him, Come and see. @ Natanel laĭ: “Hmâo tơlơi hơgĕt hiam tơbiă rai mơ̆ng plei Nasaret?” Philip laĭ: “Rai lăng bĕ!” 
Jesus saw Nathanael coming to him, and says of him, Behold [one] truly an Israelite, in whom there is no guile. @ Yêsu ƀuh Natanel rai pơ Ñu, laih anŭn Ñu laĭ kơ gơ̆: “Anai jing sa čô mơnuih Israel sĭt, amăng ñu ƀu hmâo tơlơi wĕ wŏ ôh!” 
Nathanael says to him, Whence knowest thou me? Jesus answered and said to him, Before that Philip called thee, when thou wast under the fig-tree, I saw thee. @ Natanel tơña kơ Yêsu: “Hyư̆m ih thâo krăn kâo?” Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Hlâo kơ Philip iâu ih, hlăk ih dŏ gah yŭ phŭn hra Kâo ƀuh ih laih.” 
Nathanael answered and said to him, Rabbi, thou art the Son of God, thou art the King of Israel. @ Natanel laĭ glaĭ: “Ơ Nai, Ih jing Ană Ơi Adai! Ih jing Pơtao ană Israel!” 
Jesus answered and said to him, Because I said to thee, I saw thee under the fig-tree, believest thou? Thou shalt see greater things than these. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơ̆: “Djơ̆ mơ̆ yua kơ kâo laĭ kâo ƀuh ih dŏ gah yŭ phŭn hra hnŭn yơh ih đaŏ? Ih či ƀuh lu tơlơi prŏng hloh kơ tơlơi anŭn dơ̆ng.” 
And he says to him, Verily, verily, I say to you, Henceforth ye shall see the heaven opened, and the angels of God ascending and descending on the Son of man. @ Laih anŭn Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih sĭt biă mă, ƀing gih či ƀuh adai pŏk, laih anŭn ling jang Ơi Adai đĭ trŭn ƀơi Ană Mơnuih.”
And on the third day a marriage took place in Cana of Galilee, and the mother of Jesus was there. @ Klâo hrơi mơ̆ng anŭn, hmâo tơlơi pơkol rơkơi bơnai pơ Plei Kana amăng kwar Galilê. Amĭ Yêsu pơ anŭn mơ̆n. 
And Jesus also, and his disciples, were invited to the marriage. @ Arăng ăt jak Yêsu hăng ƀing ding kơna Ñu nao kơ tơlơi pơkol rơkơi bơnai anŭn mơ̆n. 
And wine being deficient, the mother of Jesus says to him, They have no wine. @ Tơ abih tơpai laih, amĭ Yêsu laĭ hăng Yêsu: “Gơñu ƀu hmâo ia tơpai dơ̆ng tah.” 
Jesus says to her, What have I to do with thee, woman? mine hour has not yet come. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Ơ amĭ, hơgĕt tơlơi anai djơ̆ kơ ih hăng kâo? Mông kâo aka truh ôh.” 
His mother says to the servants, Whatever he may say to you, do. @ Amĭ Yêsu laĭ kơ ƀing buih bruă: “Hơgĕt tơlơi Ñu pơđar kơ ƀing gih brơi ƀing gih ngă mơtam hŏ!” 
Now there were standing there six stone water-vessels, according to the purification of the Jews, holding two or three measures each. @ Pơ anŭn hmâo năm boh čeh boh pơtâo, pioh yua kơ tơlơi pơrơgoh tui hăng tơlơi juăt ƀing Yuđa. Rĭm boh čeh dưi pioh giăm kơ sa rơtuh lit ia. 
Jesus says to them, Fill the water-vessels with water. And they filled them up to the brim. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Tuh ia pơbă abih čeh anai.” Gơñu tuh ia pơbă truh pơ tơƀuai abih čeh anŭn. 
And he says to them, Draw out now, and carry [it] to the feast-master. And they carried [it]. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Tuah ba ia anai kơ pô wai tơlơi ƀơ̆ng huă.” Tui anŭn gơñu tuah ba yơh. 
But when the feast-master had tasted the water which had been made wine (and knew not whence it was, but the servants knew who drew the water), the feast-master calls the bridegroom, @ Tơ pô wai tơlơi ƀơ̆ng huă liah ia hmâo jing laih tơpai anŭn, samơ̆ ñu ƀu thâo ôh mơ̆ng pơpă tơbiă rai tơpai anŭn (samơ̆ ƀing ding kơna tuah ia anŭn thâo yơh), pô wai tơlơi ƀơ̆ng huă iâu han tao 
and says to him, Every man sets on first the good wine, and when [men] have well drunk, then the inferior; thou hast kept the good wine till now. @ hăng laĭ kơ gơ̆: “Rĭm čô mơnuih pơdơ̆ng brơi arăng mơñum ia tơpai hiam blŭng hlâo; laih anŭn tơ arăng mơñum lu laih, ñu brơi mơñum ia tơpai tơba ƀiă. Samơ̆ ih djă pioh ia tơpai hiam tơl truh ră anai.” 
This beginning of signs did Jesus in Cana of Galilee, and manifested his glory; and his disciples believed on him. @ Anai yơh jing gru tơlơi mơsêh mơyang tal blŭng hlâo Yêsu ngă pơ plei Kana amăng kwar Galilê, pơrơđah tơlơi ang yang Ñu. Hnŭn yơh ƀing ding kơna Ñu đaŏ kơ Ñu. 
After this he descended to Capernaum, he and his mother and his brethren and his disciples; and there they abode not many days. @ Giơ̆ng anŭn, Yêsu hăng amĭ Ñu, ƀing adơi Ñu hăng ƀing ding kơna Ñu trŭn nao pơ Plei Kapernum; gơñu dŏ pơ anŭn ƀiă hrơi.
And the passover of the Jews was near, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem. @ Phĕt Tơlơi Găn ƀing Yuđa giăm truh, tui anŭn Yêsu đĭ nao pơ plei Yêrusalem. 
And he found in the temple the sellers of oxen and sheep and doves, and the money-changers sitting; @ Amăng Sang Kơkuh Pơpŭ Ñu ƀuh ƀing sĭ rơmo, triu, čĭm bơrơgơ̆m laih anŭn ƀing pơplih prăk dŏ ber ƀơi kơƀang gơñu. 
and, having made a scourge of cords, he cast [them] all out of the temple, both the sheep and the oxen; and he poured out the change of the money-changers, and overturned the tables, @ Yêsu kuĭ hrĕ ngă gai hnuăt, laih anŭn puh pơđuaĭ ƀing anŭn mơ̆ng Sang Kơkuh Pơpŭ, wơ̆t triu hăng rơmo. Ñu tuh hĭ asar prăk ƀing pơplih prăk hăng tơlư̆ hĭ kơƀang gơñu. 
and said to the sellers of doves, Take these things hence; make not my Father's house a house of merchandise. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ ƀing sĭ čĭm kơtrâo: “Mă pơđuaĭ bĕ abih gơnam anŭn mơ̆ng anai; Anăm pơjing sang Ama kâo jing hĭ sang sĭ mơdrô ôh.” 
[And] his disciples remembered that it is written, The zeal of thy house devours me. @ Ƀing ding kơna Ñu hơdơr Tơlơi Ơi Adai pơhiăp hmâo čih: “Ơ Ơi Adai, tơlơi hur har kơ sang Ih, kar hăng apui čuh amăng lăm kâo.”
The Jews therefore answered and said to him, What sign shewest thou to us, that thou doest these things? @ Ƀing Yuđa tơña kơ Ñu: “Hơgĕt gru kơnăl mơyang Ih pơrơđah kơ gơmơi ƀuh kiăng pơklă kơ tơlơi dưi Ih dưi ngă bruă anai?”
Jesus answered and said to them, Destroy this temple, and in three days I will raise it up. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Pơrai hĭ bĕ sang kơkuh pơpŭ anai, laih anŭn Kâo či pơdơ̆ng glaĭ ñu amăng klâo hrơi.”
The Jews therefore said, Forty and six years was this temple building, and thou wilt raise it up in three days? @ Tui anŭn ƀing Yuđa laĭ: “Arăng pơdơ̆ng sang kơkuh pơpŭ anai pă pluh năm thŭn, samơ̆ Ih či pơdơ̆ng glaĭ ñu kơnơ̆ng amăng klâo hrơi đôč hă?”
But *he* spoke of the temple of his body. @ Samơ̆ sang kơkuh pơpŭ Ñu laĭ anŭn jing drơi jan Ñu pô.
