When therefore he was raised from among [the] dead, his disciples remembered that he had said this, and believed the scripture and the word which Jesus had spoken. @ Hnŭn yơh, giơ̆ng Yêsu hơdip glaĭ mơ̆ng tơlơi djai, ƀing ding kơna Ñu hơdơr glaĭ Yêsu hmâo laĭ tơlơi anŭn; hnŭn yơh gơñu đaŏ kơ Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp hăng tơlơi Yêsu hmâo pơhiăp laih.
And when he was in Jerusalem, at the passover, at the feast, many believed on his name, beholding his signs which he wrought. @ Tơdang Yêsu dŏ amăng Plei Yêrusalem hlăk hrơi phĕt Tơlơi Găn, lu mơnuih ƀuh gru kơnăl mơyang Yêsu ngă, gơñu đaŏ kơ Yêsu yơh. 
But Jesus himself did not trust himself to them, because he knew all [men], @ Samơ̆ Yêsu ƀu jao Ñu pô kơ gơñu ôh, yua kơ Ñu thâo krăn laih abih bang mơnuih, 
and that he had not need that any should testify of man, for himself knew what was in man. @ laih anŭn Ñu ƀu tơguan kơ tơlơi arăng ngă gơ̆ng jơlan kơ hlơi hlơi ôh, yua kơ Ñu thâo laih hyư̆m amăng pran jua mơnuih jing.
But there was a man from among the Pharisees, his name Nicodemus, a ruler of the Jews; @ Hmâo sa čô amăng ƀing Pharisi anăn ñu Nikôđem. Ñu jing sa čô amăng ƀing khua gĭt gai ană Yuđa. 
he came to him by night, and said to him, Rabbi, we know that thou art come a teacher from God, for none can do these signs that thou doest unless God be with him. @ Hlăk mlam, ñu nao pơ Yêsu hăng laĭ: “Rabi, gơmơi thâo Ih jing sa čô nai tơbiă rai mơ̆ng Ơi Adai; ƀu hmâo ôh hlơi dưi ngă tơlơi mơsêh mơyang Ih hmâo ngă laih tơdah ƀu hmâo Ơi Adai dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ñu.”
Jesus answered and said to him, Verily, verily, I say unto thee, Except any one be born anew he cannot see the kingdom of God. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Kâo laĭ kơ ih sĭt biă mă, tơdah sa čô mơnuih ƀu tơkeng glaĭ dơ̆ng, ñu ƀu dưi ƀuh Dêh Čar Pơtao Ơi Adai ôh.”
Nicodemus says to him, How can a man be born being old? can he enter a second time into the womb of his mother and be born? @ Nikôđem laĭ glaĭ: “Hyư̆m sa čô mơnuih tha laih dưi tơkeng glaĭ dơ̆ng lĕ? Dưi mơ̆ ñu mŭt glaĭ amăng kian amĭ ñu hăng tơkeng tal dua dơ̆ng?”
Jesus answered, Verily, verily, I say unto thee, Except any one be born of water and of Spirit, he cannot enter into the kingdom of God. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Kâo laĭ kơ ih sĭt biă mă, tơdah sa čô mơnuih ƀu kơnang kơ ia laih anŭn hăng Yang Bơngăt Hiam kiăng kơ tơkeng glaĭ dơ̆ng, ñu anŭn ƀu dưi mŭt amăng Dêh Čar Pơtao Ơi Adai ôh. 
That which is born of the flesh is flesh; and that which is born of the Spirit is spirit. @ Tơlơi hơgĕt tơkeng rai mơ̆ng asar đeh ñu jing asar đeh, tơlơi hơgĕt tơkeng rai mơ̆ng Yang Bơngăt Hiam ñu jing bơngăt mơyang. 
Do not wonder that I said to thee, It is needful that *ye* should be born anew. @ Anăm kơtuă hling ôh kơ tơlơi kâo hmâo laĭ laih kơ ih: ‘Ƀing gih khŏm tơkeng glaĭ dơ̆ng.’ 
The wind blows where it will, and thou hearest its voice, but knowest not whence it comes and where it goes: thus is every one that is born of the Spirit. @ Pơpă angĭn kiăng thut ñu thut yơh, ih hmư̆ dơnai ñu, samơ̆ ih ƀu thâo ôh mơ̆ng pơpă ñu tơbiă rai, ăt kŏn thâo lơi pơpă ñu nao. Hlơi pô tơkeng rai mơ̆ng Yang Bơngăt Hiam ăt ñu jing kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n.”
Nicodemus answered and said to him, How can these things be? @ Nikôđem tơña: “Hyư̆m tơlơi anai dưi jing lĕ?” 
Jesus answered and said to him, Thou art the teacher of Israel and knowest not these things! @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Ih jing nai pơtô kơ ƀing Israel, samơ̆ ih ƀu thâo hluh tơlơi anai ôh hă? 
Verily, verily, I say unto thee, We speak that which we know, and we bear witness of that which we have seen, and ye receive not our witness. @ Kâo laĭ kơ ih sĭt biă mă: Gơmơi pơhiăp hơgĕt tơlơi gơmơi thâo, pơhaih hơgĕt tơlơi gơmơi hmâo ƀuh laih, samơ̆ ƀing gih ƀu tŭ ôh tơlơi ƀing gơmơi pơhaih. 
If I have said the earthly things to you, and ye believe not, how, if I say the heavenly things to you, will ye believe? @ Tơdah kâo pơhaih kơ ƀing gih khul tơlơi amăng lŏn tơnah, ƀing gih ăt kŏn đaŏ mơ̆n. Hloh kơ anŭn dơ̆ng hyư̆m ƀing gih dưi đaŏ tơdah Kâo pơhaih kơ ƀing gih khul tơlơi amăng adai? 
And no one has gone up into heaven, save he who came down out of heaven, the Son of man who is in heaven. @ Aka hmâo djơ̆ ôh mơnuih đĭ nao pơ adai, kơnơ̆ng hmâo Pô trŭn rai mơ̆ng adai, jing Ană Mơnuih.”
And as Moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness, thus must the Son of man be lifted up, @ Kar hăng Môis yol đĭ laih ala ngă hăng kong amăng tơdrŏn tač, ăt kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n arăng či yol đĭ Ană Mơnuih. 
that every one who believes on him may [not perish, but] have life eternal. @ Kiăng kơ hlơi pô đaŏ kơ Ñu dưi hmâo tơlơi hơdip hlŏng lar.
For God so loved the world, that he gave his only-begotten Son, that whosoever believes on him may not perish, but have life eternal. @ Yua kơ Ơi Adai khăp biă mă kơ lŏn tơnah, tơl Ñu brơi Ană Ñu hmâo kơnơ̆ng sa čô, kiăng kơ hlơi pô đaŏ kơ Ană anŭn ñu ƀu răm rơngiă hĭ ôh samơ̆ ñu hmâo tơlơi hơdip hlŏng lar. 
For God has not sent his Son into the world that he may judge the world, but that the world may be saved through him. @ Yua kơ Ơi Adai hmâo pơkiaŏ rai laih Ană Ñu amăng lŏn tơnah, ƀu djơ̆ kiăng phat kơđi kơ lŏn tơnah ôh, samơ̆ kiăng kơ lŏn tơnah yua mơ̆ng Ană anŭn dưi hmâo tơlơi pơklaih.
He that believes on him is not judged: but he that believes not has been already judged, because he has not believed on the name of the only-begotten Son of God. @ Hlơi pô đaŏ kơ Ană anŭn Ơi Adai ƀu klă kơđi ôh; samơ̆ hlơi pô ƀu đaŏ ôh Ơi Adai klă kơđi kơ ñu laih yơh, yua kơ ñu ƀu đaŏ ôh kơ anăn Ană Ơi Adai hmâo kơnơ̆ng sa čô. 
And this is the judgment, that light is come into the world, and men have loved darkness rather than light; for their works were evil. @ Tơlơi klă kơđi anŭn jing tui anai: Tơlơi bơngač hmâo truh laih amăng lŏn tơnah, samơ̆ ană mơnuih khăp kơ tơlơi kơnăm mơmŏt lu hloh kơ tơlơi bơngač, yua kơ bruă gơñu ngă jing soh sat. 
For every one that does evil hates the light, and does not come to the light that his works may not be shewn as they are; @ Yua kơ hlơi pô ngă tơlơi sat ñu bơrơmŭt kơ tơlơi bơngač, laih anŭn ƀu nao ôh pơ tơlơi bơngač, hwĭ kơ rơđah hĭ bruă ñu ngă. 
but he that practises the truth comes to the light, that his works may be manifested that they have been wrought in God. @ Samơ̆ hlơi pô ngă tui tơlơi sĭt, ñu nao pơ tơlơi bơngač yơh, kiăng kơ khul bruă ñu ngă dưi rơđah klă, yua kơ ñu ngă tui hăng tơlơi Ơi Adai kiăng.
After these things came Jesus and his disciples into the land of Judaea; and there he abode with them and baptised. @ Giơ̆ng anŭn, Yêsu hăng ƀing ding kơna Ñu nao pơ tring Yuđa. Ñu dŏ hăng gơñu pơ anŭn laih anŭn ngă ƀatem. 
And John also was baptising in Aenon, near Salim, because there was a great deal of water there; and they came to [him] and were baptised: @ Yôhan ăt ngă ƀatem mơ̆n ƀơi plei Ênon, giăm plei Salim, yua kơ pơ anŭn hmâo lu ia, laih anŭn ƀing ană plei rai kiăng tŭ ƀatem. 
for John was not yet cast into prison. @ Hlăk anŭn arăng aka krư̆ Yôhan amăng sang mơnă ôh.
There was therefore a reasoning of the disciples of John with a Jew about purification. @ Hlăk anŭn, hmâo tơlơi pơrơjah tơ̆ng krah ƀing ding kơna Yôhan hăng sa čô mơnuih Yuđa kơ phĕt tơlơi rao pơrơgoh. 
And they came to John and said to him, Rabbi, he who was with thee beyond the Jordan, to whom thou barest witness, behold, he baptises, and all come to him. @ Gơñu nao pơ Yôhan hăng laĭ: “Ơ Nai, pô hmâo dŏ laih hăng ih ƀơi gah adih hang ia krong Yurdan, kơ pô anŭn yơh ih hmâo ngă gơ̆ng jơlan laih, ră anai Ñu dŏ ngă ƀatem, abih bang mơnuih leng kơ nao pơ Ñu soh sel.”
John answered and said, A man can receive nothing unless it be given him out of heaven. @ Yôhan laĭ glaĭ: “Tơdah Ơi Adai ƀu pha brơi, ƀu hmâo hlơi dưi mă tŭ hơgĕt gĕt ôh. 
Ye yourselves bear me witness that I said, I am not the Christ, but, that I am sent before him. @ Ƀing gih yơh jing pô ngă gơ̆ng jơlan kơ tơlơi kâo hmâo laĭ laih, kâo pô ƀu djơ̆ jing Yang Krist ôh, samơ̆ Ơi Adai pơkiaŏ kâo rai hlâo kơ Ñu. 
He that has the bride is the bridegroom; but the friend of the bridegroom, who stands and hears him, rejoices in heart because of the voice of the bridegroom: this my joy then is fulfilled. @ Hlơi pô dŏ kơ dra pơkô̆, ñu anŭn jing tơdăm pơkô̆; samơ̆ ƀing gơyut kơ pô tơdăm pơkô̆ dŏ giăm hmư̆ hiăp tơdăm pơkô̆ anŭn gơñu bă hăng tơlơi hơ̆k mơak biă mă. Anŭn jing tơlơi hơ̆k mơak klă tum kơ kâo yơh. 
He must increase, but I must decrease. @ Ñu khŏm đĭ tui, kâo khŏm trŭn tui.”
He who comes from above is above all. He who has his origin in the earth is of the earth, and speaks [as] of the earth. He who comes out of heaven is above all, @ Pô rai mơ̆ng glong Ñu jing prŏng hloh kơ abih bang. Pô tơbiă mơ̆ng lŏn tơnah jing pô lơ̆m kơ lŏn tơnah, ñu pơhiăp khul tơlơi lơ̆m kơ lŏn tơnah; samơ̆ pô rai mơ̆ng adai jing pô glong hloh kơ abih bang. 
[and] what he has seen and has heard, this he testifies; and no one receives his testimony. @ Ñu ngă gơ̆ng jơlan hơgĕt tơlơi Ñu hmâo ƀuh hăng hmư̆ laih, samơ̆ ƀu hmâo hlơi tŭ mă tơlơi Ñu ngă gơ̆ng jơlan ôh. 
He that has received his testimony has set to his seal that God is true; @ Hlơi pô tŭ mă tơlơi Ñu ngă gơ̆ng jơlan, pô anŭn pơhaih Ơi Adai jing sĭt. 
for he whom God has sent speaks the words of God, for God gives not the Spirit by measure. @ Pô Ơi Adai hmâo pơkiaŏ rai, Ñu pơhaih boh pơhiăp Ơi Adai, yua kơ Ơi Adai pha brơi Yang Bơngăt Hiam kơ Ñu tơl ƀu hmâo hơnơ̆ng pơkă ôh. 
The Father loves the Son, and has given all things [to be] in his hand. @ Ama khăp kơ Ană laih anŭn hmâo jao laih abih bang tơlơi dưi amăng tơngan Ană. 
He that believes on the Son has life eternal, and he that is not subject to the Son shall not see life, but the wrath of God abides upon him. @ Hlơi pô đaŏ kơ Ană, ñu hmâo tơlơi hơdip hlŏng lar; hlơi pô ƀu đaŏ ôh kơ Ană, ñu ƀu dưi ƀuh ôh tơlơi hơdip, samơ̆ tơlơi Ơi Adai hil ăt dŏ ƀơi ñu nanao.
When therefore the Lord knew that the Pharisees had heard that Jesus makes and baptises more disciples than John @ Tơ Yêsu thâo ƀing Pharisi hmư̆ hing kơ Ñu hmâo pơjing laih anŭn ngă ƀatem kơ ƀing ding kơna lu hloh kơ Yôhan, 
(however, Jesus himself did not baptise, but his disciples), @ (biă mă ƀu djơ̆ Yêsu pô ôh ngă ƀatem kơ arăng, kơnơ̆ng ƀing ding kơna Ñu đôč ngă.) 
he left Judaea and went away again unto Galilee. @ Yêsu tơbiă mơ̆ng kwar Yuđa wơ̆t glaĭ pơ kwar Galilê. 
And he must needs pass through Samaria. @ Samơ̆ Yêsu khŏm găn nao kwar Samari, 
He comes therefore to a city of Samaria called Sychar, near to the land which Jacob gave to his son Joseph. @ Tui anŭn Ñu truh pơ sa boh plei amăng kwar Samari, anăn Sikar jĕ pơ hmua Yakôp brơi kơ ană ñu Yôsep. 
Now a fountain of Jacob's was there; Jesus therefore, being wearied with the way he had come, sat just as he was at the fountain. It was about the sixth hour. @ Pơ anŭn hmâo ia dơmun Yakôp. Yêsu gleh rơbưi yua kơ rơbat, tui anŭn Ñu dŏ ber ƀơi ia dơmun. Hlăk anŭn năng ai pluh dua mông yang hrơi dơ̆ng.
A woman comes out of Samaria to draw water. Jesus says to her, Give me to drink @ Hmâo sa čô đah kơmơi Samari rai sŏ ia. Yêsu laĭ hăng gơ̆: “Pha kâo mơñum ia ih đa.” 
(for his disciples had gone away into the city that they might buy provisions). @ (Hlăk anŭn ƀing ding kơna Ñu nao laih pơ plei kiăng blơi mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă.)
The Samaritan woman therefore says to him, How dost thou, being a Jew, ask to drink of me who am a Samaritan woman? for Jews have no intercourse with Samaritans. @ Đah kơmơi Samari laĭ kơ Ñu: “Hyư̆m, Ih jing mơnuih Yuđa pŭng kơ rơkâo mơñum ia mơ̆ng kâo jing đah kơmơi Samari lĕ?” (Yua kơ mơnuih Yuđa ƀu pơgop pơlir hăng mơnuih Samari ôh.)
Jesus answered and said to her, If thou knewest the gift of God, and who it is that says to thee, Give me to drink, thou wouldest have asked of him, and he would have given thee living water. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Tơdah ih thâo mơnơ̆ng Ơi Adai pha brơi, laih anŭn tơdah ih thâo krăn hlơi pô dŏ pơhiăp hơbĭt hăng ih: ‘Pha kâo mơñum ia ih đa,’ tui anŭn ih pô či rơkâo kơ Ñu, laih anŭn Ñu či brơi ia hơdip kơ ih.”
The woman says to him, Sir, thou hast nothing to draw with, and the well is deep: whence then hast thou the living water? @ Đah kơmơi laĭ kơ Ñu: “Ơ Khua, ih ƀu hmâo kơthŭng sŏ ia ôh, hloh kơ anŭn ia dơmun anai dlam dơ̆ng; tui anŭn mơ̆ng pơpă ih hmâo ia hơdip anŭn lĕ? 
Art thou greater than our father Jacob, who gave us the well, and drank of it himself, and his sons, and his cattle? @ Djơ̆ mơ̆ ih prŏng hloh kơ Yakôp ơi adon gơmơi đưm, pô hmâo brơi kơ gơmơi ia dơmun anai, laih anŭn ñu pô wơ̆t hăng ƀing ană đah rơkơi ñu, hlô mơnơ̆ng ñu rong, leng kơ mơñum ia anai soh sel?” 
Jesus answered and said to her, Every one who drinks of this water shall thirst again; @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Hlơi pô mơñum ia anai ăt či mơhao dơ̆ng, 
but whosoever drinks of the water which I shall give him shall never thirst for ever, but the water which I shall give him shall become in him a fountain of water, springing up into eternal life. @ samơ̆ hlơi pô mơñum ia Kâo či pha brơi, ƀu či mơhao dơ̆ng tah; ia Kâo pha brơi či jing hĭ amăng ñu sa bĭt akŏ ia ƀlĕ bluh hlŏng truh pơ tơlơi hơdip hlŏng lar.” 
The woman says to him, Sir, give me this water, that I may not thirst nor come here to draw. @ Đah kơmơi anŭn laĭ hăng Ñu: “Ơ Khua, rơkâo kơ ih brơi ia anŭn kơ kâo bĕ, kiăng kơ kâo ƀu mơhao dơ̆ng ôh, kŏn rai sŏ ia anai dơ̆ng lơi.”
Jesus says to her, Go, call thy husband, and come here. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơ̆: “Nao iâu rơkơi ih bĕ, hăng wơ̆t glaĭ pơ anai.” 
The woman answered and said, I have not a husband. Jesus says to her, Thou hast well said, I have not a husband; @ Đah kơmơi laĭ glaĭ: “Kâo ƀu hmâo rơkơi ôh.” Yêsu laĭ kơ gơ̆: “Djơ̆ yơh ih laĭ: ‘kâo ƀu hmâo rơkơi ôh’, 
for thou hast had five husbands, and he whom now thou hast is not thy husband: this thou hast spoken truly. @ yua kơ ih hmâo rơma čô rơkơi laih, laih anŭn mơnuih ih dŏ ră anai ñu ƀu djơ̆ rơkơi ih mơ̆n. Djơ̆ yơh ih laĭ tui anŭn.” 
The woman says to him, Sir, I see that thou art a prophet. @ Đah kơmơi anŭn laĭ kơ Ñu: “Ơ Khua, kâo thâo Ih jing sa čô pô laĭ lui hlâo. 
Our fathers worshipped in this mountain, and ye say that in Jerusalem is the place where one must worship. @ Ƀing ơi adon gơmơi kơkuh pơpŭ ƀơi hăng ngŏ čư̆ anai; samơ̆ ƀing ih laĭ amăng plei Yêrusalem yơh jing anih lăp arăng kơkuh pơpŭ.” 
Jesus says to her, Woman, believe me, [the] hour is coming when ye shall neither in this mountain nor in Jerusalem worship the Father. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơ̆: “Ơ đah kơmơi, đaŏ bĕ kơ Kâo, mông giăm truh, ƀing gih ƀu kơkuh pơpŭ kơ Ama ƀơi hăng ngŏ čư̆ anai, kŏn djơ̆ pơ plei Yêrusalem lơi. 
Ye worship ye know not what; we worship what we know, for salvation is of the Jews. @ Ƀing gih kơkuh pơpŭ kơ pô ƀing gih ƀu thâo krăn ôh; samơ̆ gơmơi jing ƀing Yuđa kơkuh pơpŭ kơ pô gơmơi thâo krăn, yua kơ tơlơi pơklaih tơbiă rai mơ̆ng ƀing mơnuih Yuđa. 
But [the] hour is coming and now is, when the true worshippers shall worship the Father in spirit and truth; for also the Father seeks such as his worshippers. @ Samơ̆ mông giăm truh, laih anŭn ñu truh laih, tơ ƀing mơnuih kơkuh pơpŭ hăng tơlơi sĭt, či kơkuh pơpŭ kơ Ama hăng bơngăt jua laih anŭn hăng tơlơi sĭt; ƀing kơkuh pơpŭ kar hăng anŭn yơh Ama kiăng. 
God [is] a spirit; and they who worship him must worship [him] in spirit and truth. @ Ơi Adai jing bơngăt mơyang, hnŭn yơh ƀing kơkuh pơpŭ kơ Ñu, khŏm kơkuh pơpŭ hăng bơngăt jua laih anŭn hăng tơlơi sĭt.” 
The woman says to him, I know that Messias is coming, who is called Christ; when *he* comes he will tell us all things. @ Đah kơmơi anŭn laĭ kơ Yêsu: “Kâo thâo Yang Mêsi či rai ‘Pô anŭn arăng iâu Yang Krist’; Tơ Ñu rai, Ñu či bơrơđah brơi kơ ƀing ta abih bang tơlơi.” 
Jesus says to her, I who speak to thee am [he]. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ ñu: “Kâo, pô dŏ pơhiăp hăng ih, jing Pô anŭn yơh.”
And upon this came his disciples, and wondered that he spoke with a woman; yet no one said, What seekest thou? or, Why speakest thou with her? @ Hlăk anŭn ƀing ding kơna Ñu truh. Gơñu kơtuă hling ƀuh Ñu dŏ pơhiăp hăng sa čô đah kơmơi, samơ̆ ƀu hmâo ôh sa čô tơña kơ Ñu: “Hơgĕt Ih kiăng?” Ƀôdah “Hyư̆m Ih dŏ pơhiăp hăng ñu?”
The woman then left her waterpot and went away into the city, and says to the men, @ Tui anŭn đah kơmơi anŭn lui hĭ čeh ia ñu, hăng nao pơ plei laĭ kơ ƀing ană plei pla. 
Come, see a man who told me all things I had ever done: is not he the Christ? @ “Rai bĕ, lăng sa čô đah rơkơi hmâo laĭ djơ̆ abih bang tơlơi kâo hmâo ngă laih. Pô anŭn ƀu djơ̆ Yang Krist ôh hă?” 
They went out of the city and came to him. @ Gơñu tơbiă mơ̆ng plei hăng nao pơ Yêsu.
But meanwhile the disciples asked him saying, Rabbi, eat. @ Tơdang anŭn, ƀing ding kơna pơđur kơ Yêsu: “Ơ Nai, ƀơ̆ng huă bĕ.”
But he said to them, I have food to eat which ye do not know. @ Samơ̆ Ñu laĭ glaĭ: “Kâo hmâo gơnam ƀơ̆ng huă samơ̆ ƀing gih ƀu thâo ôh.”
The disciples therefore said to one another, Has any one brought him [anything] to eat? @ Tui anŭn ƀing ding kơna bơlaĭ tơdruă gơñu pô: “Hmâo hlơi ba mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă kơ Ñu hă?”
Jesus says to them, My food is that I should do the will of him that has sent me, and that I should finish his work. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ ƀing gơ̆: “Mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă Kâo jing ngă tui hăng tơlơi kiăng Pô hmâo pơkiaŏ rai Kâo, hăng ngă pơgiơ̆ng hĭ bruă Ñu. 
Do not ye say, that there are yet four months and the harvest comes? Behold, I say to you, Lift up your eyes and behold the fields, for they are already white to harvest. @ Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă ƀing gih laĭ: ‘Dŏ pă blan dơ̆ng truh bơyan hơpuă’? Samơ̆ Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, angak mơta lăng bĕ, hăng lăng khul hmua hmâo pơdai tơsă, laih anŭn bơyan hơpuă truh laih yơh. 
He that reaps receives wages and gathers fruit unto life eternal, that both he that sows and he that reaps may rejoice together. @ Pô hơpuă hmâo mă tŭ laih prăk apah hăng hrui pơƀŭt boh than pioh kơ tơlơi hơdip hlŏng lar; tui anŭn kiăng kơ pô sai hăng pô hơpuă dưi hơ̆k mơak hrŏm hơbĭt. 
For in this is [verified] the true saying, It is one who sows and another who reaps. @ Yua kơ tui anai tơlơi arăng juăt laĭ: ‘Pô anai sai, pô pơkŏn hơpuă’ jing djơ̆ biă mă yơh. 
I have sent you to reap that on which ye have not laboured; others have laboured, and ye have entered into their labours. @ Kâo hmâo pơkiaŏ ƀing gih nao hơpuă pơ anih ƀing gih ƀu mă bruă ôh. Ƀing pơkŏn mă bruă laih, laih anŭn ƀing gih kơnơ̆ng hơpuă mă boh than mơ̆ng bruă gơñu đôč.”
But many of the Samaritans of that city believed on him because of the word of the woman who bore witness, He told me all things that I had ever done. @ Hmâo lu ƀing Samari amăng plei anŭn đaŏ kơ Yêsu, yua kơ tơlơi đah kơmơi anŭn hmâo ngă gơ̆ng jơlan: “Ñu hmâo laĭ djơ̆ abih bang tơlơi kâo hmâo ngă.” 
When therefore the Samaritans came to him they asked him to abide with them, and he abode there two days. @ Tui anŭn tơ ƀing Samari nao pơ Yêsu, gơñu rơkâo kơ Yêsu dŏ glaĭ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng gơñu, laih anŭn Yêsu dŏ glaĭ pơ anŭn dua hrơi.
And more a great deal believed on account of his word; @ Hmâo mơnuih đaŏ lu hloh dơ̆ng yua kơ tơlơi Yêsu pơtô. 
and they said to the woman, [It is] no longer on account of thy saying that we believe, for we have heard him ourselves, and we know that this is indeed the Saviour of the world. @ Gơñu laĭ kơ đah kơmơi anŭn: “Ră anai gơmơi đaŏ ƀu djơ̆ yua kơ tơlơi ih ngă gơ̆ng jơlan ôh, samơ̆ yua kơ gơmơi pô hmâo hmư̆ laih, hăng thâo sĭt Ñu yơh jing Pô Pơklaih lŏn tơnah.”
But after the two days he went forth thence and went away into Galilee, @ Dua hrơi mơ̆ng anŭn, Yêsu lui anih anŭn nao pơ kwar Galilê; 
for Jesus himself bore witness that a prophet has no honour in his own country. @ yua kơ Yêsu pô hmâo laĭ pơsĭt, arăng ƀu pơpŭ pơyom ôh sa čô pô laĭ lui hlâo amăng plei ñu pô. 
When therefore he came into Galilee, the Galileans received him, having seen all that he had done in Jerusalem during the feast, for they also went to the feast. @ Tơ Ñu truh pơ kwar Galilê, ƀing mơnuih Galilê mơak čơkă jum Ñu, yua kơ gơñu hmâo ƀuh abih bang tơlơi Ñu hmâo ngă amăng plei Yêrusalem ƀơi hrơi phĕt Tơlơi Găn, yua kơ wơ̆t gơñu mơ̆n hmâo nao kơ tơlơi phĕt anŭn.
He came therefore again to Cana of Galilee, where he made the water wine. And there was a certain courtier in Capernaum whose son was sick. @ Tui anŭn Yêsu wơ̆t glaĭ dơ̆ng pơ plei Kana amăng kwar Galilê, anih Ñu hmâo hrih ia ƀlăng jing tơpai. Pơ plei Kapernum hmâo sa čô ană đah rơkơi khua prŏng dŏ ruă. 
He, having heard that Jesus had come out of Judaea into Galilee, went to him and asked [him] that he would come down and heal his son, for he was about to die. @ Tơ khua anŭn hmư̆ Yêsu tơbiă rai mơ̆ng kwar Yuđa nao pơ kwar Galilê, ñu nao pơ Yêsu hăng rơkâo kơ Gơ̆ nao pơ plei Kapernum pơsuaih ană đah rơkơi ñu, yua kơ gơ̆ ruă giăm či djai. 
Jesus therefore said to him, Unless ye see signs and wonders ye will not believe. @ Tui anŭn Yêsu laĭ kơ ñu: “Tơdah ƀing gih ƀu ƀuh ôh gru kơnăl mơyang hăng tơlơi mơsêh mơyang, ƀing gih ƀu či đaŏ ôh.”
The courtier says to him, Sir, come down ere my child die. @ Khua anŭn laĭ glaĭ: “Ơ Khua, rơkâo kơ Ih rai bĕ hlâo kơ ană kâo djai.”
Jesus says to him, Go, thy son lives. And the man believed the word which Jesus said to him, and went his way. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ ñu: “Nao bĕ, ană đah rơkơi ih či hơdip.” Pô anŭn đaŏ kơ tơlơi Yêsu hmâo laĭ kơ ñu, gơ̆ glaĭ yơh. 
But already, as he was going down, his servants met him and brought [him] word saying, Thy child lives. @ Tơdang ñu dŏ rơbat ƀơi jơlan, ƀing ding kơna ñu nao čơkă ñu hăng laĭ: “Ană đah rơkơi ih ăt dŏ hơdip.”
He inquired therefore from them the hour at which he got better. And they said to him, Yesterday at the seventh hour the fever left him. @ Tui anŭn pô khua tơña kơ gơñu hlăk hơdôm mông ană ñu suaih. Gơñu laĭ: “Tơ̆m brơi hlăk sa mông klam tơlơi duăm rơŏt ñu abih.” 
The father therefore knew that [it was] in that hour in which Jesus said to him, Thy son lives; and he believed, himself and his whole house. @ Pô ama anŭn thâo djơ̆ ƀơi mông anŭn yơh Yêsu hmâo laĭ kơ ñu: “Ană đah rơkơi ih či hơdip” Tui anŭn ñu hăng abih bang sang anŏ ñu đaŏ yơh.
This second sign again did Jesus, being come out of Judaea into Galilee. @ Anai jing tơlơi mơsêh mơyang tal dua Yêsu hmâo ngă tơdơi kơ Ñu tơbiă mơ̆ng kwar Yuđa glaĭ pơ kwar Galilê.
After these things was a feast of the Jews, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem. @ Tơdơi kơ anŭn hmâo hrơi phĕt ƀing ană Yuđa, Yêsu đĭ nao pơ plei Yêrusalem. 
Now there is in Jerusalem, at the sheepgate, a pool, which is called in Hebrew, Bethesda, having five porches. @ Amăng plei Yêrusalem jĕ amăng jang Triu hmâo sa dơnao ia hmâo rơma boh adring, amăng tơlơi Hêbrơ arăng iâu Bêtesda. 
In these lay a multitude of sick, blind, lame, withered, [awaiting the moving of the water. @ Ƀơi khul adring anŭn hmâo lu mơnuih duăm ruă dŏ đih, hmâo mơnuih bum mơta, đŭt tơkai, rơwen rơwo. 
But there was a certain man there who had been suffering under his infirmity thirty and eight years. @ Ƀơi anŭn hmâo sa čô đah rơkơi ruă klâo pluh sapăn thŭn laih. 
Jesus seeing this [man] lying [there], and knowing that he was [in that state] now a great length of time, says to him, Wouldest thou become well? @ Yêsu ƀuh ñu hăng thâo kơ ñu dŏ đih pơ anŭn sui thŭn laih, hnŭn yơh Yêsu tơña kơ ñu: “Ih kiăng suaih mơ̆?”
The infirm [man] answered him, Sir, I have not a man, in order, when the water has been troubled, to cast me into the pool; but while I am coming another descends before me. @ Mơnuih ruă anŭn laĭ glaĭ: “Ơ Khua, hlăk ia tơglăk kâo ƀu hmâo ôh mơnuih djru glŏm kâo amăng dơnao ia; tơdang kâo gir trŭn hmâo laih mơnuih pơkŏn trŭn hlâo kơ kâo.”
Jesus says to him, Arise, take up thy couch and walk. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ ñu: “Tơgŭ bĕ, mă kiao ih hăng rơbat nao.” 
And immediately the man became well, and took up his couch and walked: and on that day was sabbath. @ Mơnuih anŭn suaih mơtam yơh. Ñu mă kiao hăng rơbat nao.
Hlăk anŭn jing hrơi Saƀat. 
The Jews therefore said to the healed [man], It is sabbath, it is not permitted thee to take up thy couch. @ Tui anŭn ƀing Yuđa laĭ kơ mơnuih phrâo suaih anŭn: “Hrơi anai jing hrơi Saƀat, ih ƀu dưi glăm ba kiao ih ôh.”
He answered them, He that made me well, *he* said to me, Take up thy couch and walk. @ Samơ̆ pô anŭn laĭ glaĭ: “Pô pơsuaih kâo laĭ kơ kâo: ‘Mă ba kiao ih hăng rơbat nao bĕ.’”
They asked him [therefore], Who is the man who said to thee, Take up thy couch and walk? @ Gơñu tơña kơ gơ̆: “Hlơi laĭ kơ ih ‘glăm ba kiao ih hăng rơbat nao?’”
But he that had been healed knew not who it was, for Jesus had slidden away, there being a crowd in the place. @ Mơnuih phrâo suaih anŭn ƀu thâo krăn ôh hlơi pô hmâo pơsuaih ñu, yua kơ Yêsu hmâo sek mŭt amăng mơnuih lu pơ anŭn.
After these things Jesus finds him in the temple, and said to him, Behold, thou art become well: sin no more, that something worse do not happen to thee. @ Sui ƀiă kơ anŭn Yêsu bưp pô anŭn amăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ, hăng laĭ kơ ñu: “Hơi, ih hmâo suaih laih. Anăm ngă soh dơ̆ng ôh, hwĭ kơ hmâo tơlơi răm hloh dơ̆ng truh kơ ih.”
The man went away and told the Jews that it was Jesus who had made him well. @ Pô anŭn nao laĭ pơthâo kơ ƀing Yuđa, Yêsu yơh hmâo pơsuaih ñu. 
And for this the Jews persecuted Jesus [and sought to kill him], because he had done these things on sabbath. @ Ƀing Yuđa čơdơ̆ng ngă sat kơ Yêsu yua kơ Ñu hmâo pơsuaih mơnuih amăng hrơi saƀat. 
But Jesus answered them, My Father worketh hitherto and I work. @ Samơ̆ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ kơ gơñu: “Ama Kâo ăt mă bruă truh pơ ră anai, Kâo ăt mă bruă tui anŭn mơ̆n.”
For this therefore the Jews sought the more to kill him, because he had not only violated the sabbath, but also said that God was his own Father, making himself equal with God. @ Yua kơ tơlơi anŭn yơh, ƀing Yuđa jai kơtang hloh hơduah jơlan kiăng pơdjai Ñu, yua kơ ƀu djơ̆ kơnơ̆ng Ñu gao hrơi saƀat đôč ôh samơ̆ wơ̆t yua kơ Ñu iâu Ơi Adai jing Ama Ñu, Ñu yap Ñu pô bơmơđơr hăng Ơi Adai.
Jesus therefore answered and said to them, Verily, verily, I say to you, The Son can do nothing of himself save whatever he sees the Father doing: for whatever things *he* does, these things also the Son does in like manner. @ Tui anŭn Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih sĭt biă mă, Ană ƀu dưi ngă sa mơta bruă tui hăng Ñu pô kiăng ôh, samơ̆ kơnơ̆ng ngă tơlơi Ñu ƀuh Ama ngă. Yua kơ bruă hơgĕt Ama ngă, Ană ăt ngă kar kaĭ mơ̆n. 
For the Father loves the Son and shews him all things which he himself does; and he will shew him greater works than these, that ye may wonder. @ Yua kơ Ama khăp kơ Ană hăng pơrơđah brơi Ană abih bang bruă Ñu ngă. Laih anŭn Ñu či pơrơđah kơ Ană bruă prŏng hloh kơ khul bruă anai dơ̆ng, kiăng kơ ƀing gih kơtuă hling. 
For even as the Father raises the dead and quickens [them], thus the Son also quickens whom he will: @ Kar hăng Ama hmâo pơhơdip glaĭ ƀing mơnuih djai hăng brơi tơlơi hơdip kơ gơñu, ăt kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n Ană brơi tơlơi hơdip kơ hlơi pô Ñu kiăng. 
for neither does the Father judge any one, but has given all judgment to the Son; @ Ama ƀu phat kơđi kơ hlơi hlơi ôh, samơ̆ Ñu hmâo jao abih tơlơi phat kơđi anŭn kơ Ană Ñu, 
that all may honour the Son, even as they honour the Father. He who honours not the Son, honours not the Father who has sent him. @ kiăng kơ abih bang mơnuih leng kơ pơpŭ kơ Ană, kar hăng gơñu pơpŭ kơ Ama mơ̆n. Hlơi pô ƀu pơpŭ kơ Ană, kŏn pơpŭ kơ Ama lơi, jing Pô hmâo pơkiaŏ rai Ñu.”
Verily, verily, I say unto you, that he that hears my word, and believes him that has sent me, has life eternal, and does not come into judgment, but is passed out of death into life. @ “Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih sĭt biă mă, hlơi pô hmư̆ boh pơhiăp Kâo hăng đaŏ kơ pô pơkiaŏ rai Kâo, ñu anŭn hmâo tơlơi hơdip hlŏng lar; ñu ƀu či tŭ tơlơi phat kơđi ôh, samơ̆ ñu găn tơlơi djai laih anŭn mŭt amăng tơlơi hơdip. 
Verily, verily, I say unto you, that an hour is coming, and now is, when the dead shall hear the voice of the Son of God, and they that have heard shall live. @ Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih sĭt biă mă, mông jĕ truh, laih anŭn hmâo truh laih, tơ ƀing djai či hmư̆ hiăp Ană Ơi Adai; laih anŭn ƀing hmư̆ hiăp Ñu či hơdip. 
For even as the Father has life in himself, so he has given to the Son also to have life in himself, @ Yua kơ kar hăng Ama hmâo tơlơi hơdip amăng Ñu Pô, kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n Ñu brơi kơ Ană hmâo tơlơi hơdip amăng Ñu Pô. 
and has given him authority to execute judgment [also], because he is Son of man. @ Laih anŭn Ama hmâo brơi kơ Ană tơlơi dưi phat kơđi, yua kơ Gơ̆ jing Ană Mơnuih. 
Wonder not at this, for an hour is coming in which all who are in the tombs shall hear his voice, @ Anăm kơtuă hling ôh kơ tơlơi anŭn; yua kơ mông či truh tơ abih bang ƀing dŏ amăng pơsat či hmư̆ hiăp Ñu 
and shall go forth; those that have practised good, to resurrection of life, and those that have done evil, to resurrection of judgment. @ laih anŭn tơbiă. Hlơi pô ngă hiam či hơdip glaĭ pioh kơ hơdip, samơ̆ hlơi pô ngă sat či hơdip glaĭ pioh kơ tơlơi phat kơđi.”
I cannot do anything of myself; as I hear, I judge, and my judgment is righteous, because I do not seek my will, but the will of him that has sent me. @ “Kâo ƀu dưi ngă hơgĕt bruă mơ̆ng Kâo pô ôh. Kâo phat kơđi tui hăng tơlơi Kâo hmư̆; laih anŭn tơlơi Kâo phat kơđi jing tơpă hơnơ̆ng, yua kơ Kâo ƀu hơduah tơlơi Kâo pô kiăng ôh, samơ̆ tui hăng tơlơi kiăng pô pơkiaŏ rai Kâo.”
If I bear witness concerning myself, my witness is not true. @ “Tơdah Kâo ngă gơ̆ng jơlan pơsĭt kơ Kâo pô, tơlơi Kâo ngă gơ̆ng jơlan anŭn ƀu sĭt ôh. 
It is another who bears witness concerning me, and I know that the witness which he bears concerning me is true. @ Hmâo pô pơkŏn ngă gơ̆ng jơlan pơsĭt kơ Kâo, laih anŭn Kâo thâo tơlơi ñu ngă gơ̆ng jơlan pơsĭt kơ Kâo jing sĭt yơh. 
Ye have sent unto John, and he has borne witness to the truth. @ Ƀing gih hmâo pơkiaŏ pô pơala gih nao tơña Yôhan, laih anŭn ñu ngă gơ̆ng jơlan pơsĭt kơ tơlơi sĭt. 
But I do not receive witness from man, but I say this that *ye* might be saved. @ Ƀu djơ̆ ôh Kâo kiăng kơnang tơlơi gơ̆ng jơlan mơ̆ng mơnuih. Samơ̆ Kâo laĭ tơlơi anŭn kiăng kơ ƀing gih dưi klaih. 
*He* was the burning and shining lamp, and ye were willing for a season to rejoice in his light. @ Yôhan jing apui kơđen dŏ jă hăng pơčrang rơđah, laih anŭn ƀing gih tŭ mơak jang jai amăng tơlơi rơđah ñu. 
But I have the witness [that is] greater than [that] of John; for the works which the Father has given me that I should complete them, the works themselves which I do, bear witness concerning me that the Father has sent me. @ Samơ̆ Kâo hmâo tơlơi ngă gơ̆ng jơlan prŏng hloh kơ tơlơi Yôhan gơ̆ng jơlan; yua kơ khul bruă Ama jao brơi Kâo khŏm ngă pơgiơ̆ng, khul bruă anŭn Kâo hlăk ngă ră anai, ngă gơ̆ng jơlan kơ Kâo kơ tơlơi Ama hmâo pơkiaŏ rai Kâo. 
And the Father who has sent me himself has borne witness concerning me. Ye have neither heard his voice at any time, nor have seen his shape, @ Laih anŭn Ama, Pô hmâo pơkiaŏ rai Kâo, ăt ngă gơ̆ng jơlan kơ Kâo. Ƀing gih aka hmư̆ djơ̆ ôh hiăp Ñu, kŏn ƀuh djơ̆ rup drơi jan Ñu lơi, 
and ye have not his word abiding in you; for whom *he* hath sent, him ye do not believe. @ laih anŭn boh pơhiăp Ñu ƀu dŏ amăng ƀing gih ôh, yua kơ ƀing gih ƀu đaŏ ôh kơ pô Ñu hmâo pơkiaŏ rai. 
Ye search the scriptures, for ye think that in them ye have life eternal, and they it is which bear witness concerning me; @ Ƀing gih kơtuai sem Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp, yua kơ ƀing gih pơmĭn amăng anŭn hmâo tơlơi hơdip hlŏng lar. Tơlơi Ơi Adai Pơhiăp anŭn yơh ngă gơ̆ng jơlan kơ Kâo. 
and ye will not come to me that ye might have life. @ Samơ̆ ƀing gih hơngah ƀu kiăng rai pơ Kâo ôh kiăng hmâo tơlơi hơdip.
I do not receive glory from men, @ Kâo ƀu sem hơduah tơlơi guh kơang mơ̆ng mơnuih mơnam ôh. 
but I know you, that ye have not the love of God in you. @ Samơ̆ Kâo thâo ƀing gih ƀu hmâo tơlơi khăp Ơi Adai dŏ amăng ƀing gih ôh. 
I am come in my Father's name, and ye receive me not; if another come in his own name, him ye will receive. @ Kâo hmâo rai laih amăng anăn Ama Kâo, samơ̆ ƀing gih ƀu tŭ jum Kâo ôh; tơdah pô pơkŏn rai amăng anăn ñu pô ƀing gih či tŭ jum ñu yơh. 
How can ye believe, who receive glory one of another, and seek not the glory which [comes] from God alone? @ Ƀing gih khăp mă tŭ tơlơi guh kơang mơ̆ng tơdruă samơ̆ gih ƀu hơduah ôh tơlơi ư-ang rai mơ̆ng hơjăn Ơi Adai. Tui anŭn hyư̆m ƀing gih dưi đaŏ lĕ? 
Think not that I will accuse you to the Father: there is [one] who accuses you, Moses, on whom ye trust; @ Anăm pơmĭn ôh Kâo či phong ƀing gih ƀơi anăp Ama. Môis yơh jing pô či phong kơ ƀing gih, ƀơi ñu yơh ƀing gih čang rơmang. 
for if ye had believed Moses, ye would have believed me, for he wrote of me. @ Tơdah ƀing gih hmâo đaŏ kơ Môis, ăt ƀing gih či đaŏ kơ Kâo mơ̆n, yua kơ ñu hmâo čih djơ̆ kơ Kâo. 
But if ye do not believe his writings, how shall ye believe my words? @ Samơ̆ tơdah ƀing gih ƀu đaŏ ôh kơ tơlơi ñu čih, hyư̆m ƀing gih dưi đaŏ kơ tơlơi Kâo pơhiăp?”
After these things Jesus went away beyond the sea of Galilee, [or] of Tiberias, @ Giơ̆ng anŭn Yêsu găn nao pơ hang gah dih ia rơsĭ Galilê, anăn pơkŏn dơ̆ng ia rơsĭ Tibêrias. 
and a great crowd followed him, because they saw the signs which he wrought upon the sick. @ Sa phung mơnuih lu đuaĭ tui Ñu, yua kơ gơñu hmâo ƀuh gru tơlơi mơsêh mơyang Yêsu pơsuaih ƀing mơnuih duăm ruă. 
And Jesus went up into the mountain, and there sat with his disciples: @ Yêsu đĭ pơ čư̆ laih anŭn dŏ ber pơ anŭn hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing ding kơna Ñu. 
but the passover, the feast of the Jews, was near. @ Hrơi phĕt Tơlơi Găn ƀing ană Yuđa jĕ truh yơh. 
Jesus then, lifting up his eyes and seeing that a great crowd is coming to him, says to Philip, Whence shall we buy loaves that these may eat? @ Tơdang Yêsu angak mơta Ñu ƀuh phung mơnuih lu rai pơ Ñu, Ñu laĭ kơ Philip: “Pơpă ƀing ta či blơi ƀañ tơpŭng, kiăng brơi ƀing mơnuih anai ƀơ̆ng?” 
But this he said trying him, for he knew what he was going to do. @ Yêsu laĭ tui anŭn kiăng lông lăng Philip, yua kơ Ñu thâo laih hơgĕt Ñu či ngă.
Philip answered him, Loaves for two hundred denarii are not sufficient for them, that each may have some little [portion]. @ Philip laĭ glaĭ: “Dua rơtuh đơniê blơi ƀañ tơpŭng wơ̆t dah pha brơi rĭm čô ƀơƀiă đôč ăt ƀu djŏp mơ̆n.”
One of his disciples, Andrew, Simon Peter's brother, says to him, @ Sa čô amăng ƀing ding kơna Ñu, Andrê adơi Simôn Pêtrôs, laĭ kơ Yêsu, 
There is a little boy here who has five barley loaves and two small fishes; but this, what is it for so many? @ “Hmâo sa čô čơđai đah rơkơi hmâo rơma klŏ ƀañ tơpŭng pơdai ôrgơ hăng dua drơi akan; samơ̆ hyư̆m dưi djŏp kơ mơnuih lu lĭn anai?”
[And] Jesus said, Make the men sit down. Now there was much grass in the place: the men therefore sat down, in number about five thousand. @ Yêsu laĭ: “Brơi ƀing ană plei dŏ ber bĕ.” Ƀơi anŭn hmâo lu rơ̆k. Tui anŭn ƀing gơñu dŏ ber. Hmâo năng ai rơma rơbâo čô đah rơkơi. 
And Jesus took the loaves, and having given thanks, distributed [them] to those that were set down; and in like manner of the small fishes as much as they would. @ Yêsu mă ƀañ tơpŭng, giơ̆ng Ñu bơni hơơč kơ Ơi Adai, Ñu pơpha brơi ƀing dŏ ber ƀơi anŭn. Ñu pơpha wơ̆t akan mơ̆n tui hăng hơdôm gơñu kiăng. 
And when they had been filled, he says to his disciples, Gather together the fragments which are over and above, that nothing may be lost. @ Giơ̆ng gơñu ƀơ̆ng trơi laih, Yêsu laĭ kơ ƀing ding kơna Ñu: “Duñ bĕ čơđeh meh ƀañ tơpŭng, akan rơbeh, anăm pơrơngiă hĭ đôč đač ôh.” 
They gathered [them] therefore together, and filled twelve hand-baskets full of fragments of the five barley loaves, which were over and above to those that had eaten. @ Hnŭn yơh gơñu duñ abih čơđeh meh anŭn hmâo bă pluh dua bai čơđeh meh mơ̆ng rơma klŏ ƀañ tơpŭng pơdai ôrgơ anŏ arăng hmâo ƀơ̆ng laih.
The men therefore, having seen the sign which Jesus had done, said, This is truly the prophet which is coming into the world. @ Tơ ƀing ană plei ƀuh tơlơi mơsêh mơyang Yêsu hmâo ngă, gơñu laĭ: “Sĭt yơh Pô anai jing Pô laĭ lui hlâo, jing Pô khŏm rai amăng lŏn tơnah!” 
Jesus therefore knowing that they were going to come and seize him, that they might make [him] king, departed again to the mountain himself alone. @ Hlăk anŭn Yêsu thâo gơñu či pơgŏ Ñu ngă pơtao, tui anŭn Ñu hơdeč đuaĭ pơ čư̆ dŏ hơjăn Ñu.
But when evening was come, his disciples went down to the sea, @ Tơ klam truh, ƀing ding kơna Yêsu trŭn nao pơ ia rơsĭ, 
and having gone on board ship, they went over the sea to Capernaum. And it had already become dark, and Jesus had not come to them, @ đĭ amăng sa boh sŏng hăng čơdơ̆ng găn ia rơsĭ kiăng nao pơ plei Kapernum. Adai mơmŏt laih, samơ̆ Yêsu ăt aka nao truh pơ gơñu ôh. 
and the sea was agitated by a strong wind blowing. @ Ia rơsĭ čơdơ̆ng poh yă yua kơ hmâo angĭn thut kơtang. 
Having rowed then about twenty-five or thirty stadia, they see Jesus walking on the sea and coming near the ship; and they were frightened. @ Tơ gơñu waih sŏng nao năng ai rơma ƀôdah năm kilômet, gơñu ƀuh Yêsu rơbat ƀơi jơlah ia hăng rai jĕ pơ sŏng. Gơñu hwĭ. 
But he says to them, It is I: be not afraid. @ Samơ̆ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Anăm hwĭ ôh; Kâo gơ̆ yơh.” 
They were willing therefore to receive him into the ship; and immediately the ship was at the land to which they went. @ Laih anŭn gơñu mơak jum Yêsu đĭ amăng sŏng. Tañ mơtam sŏng truh pơ hang pơ anih gơñu kiăng nao.
On the morrow the crowd which stood on the other side of the sea, having seen that there was no other little ship there except that into which his disciples had got, and that Jesus had not gone with his disciples into the ship, but [that] his disciples had gone away alone; @ Hrơi tơdơi ƀing ană plei ăt dŏ ƀơi hang gah adih ia rơsĭ kơnơ̆ng ƀuh sa boh sŏng pơ anŭn, laih anŭn gơñu thâo Yêsu ƀu đĭ amăng sŏng hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing ding kơna Ñu ôh kơnơ̆ng hơjăn ƀing ding kơna Ñu đôč nao. 
(but other little ships out of Tiberias came near to the place where they ate bread after the Lord had given thanks;) @ Hmâo lu boh sŏng mơ̆ng plei Tibêrias rai dŏ jĕ ƀơi anih gơñu hmâo ƀơ̆ng ƀañ tơpŭng, giơ̆ng kơ Khua Yang bơni hơơč kơ Ơi Adai. 
when therefore the crowd saw that Jesus was not there, nor his disciples, *they* got into the ships, and came to Capernaum, seeking Jesus. @ Tơ ƀing ană plei thâo Yêsu ƀu dŏ pơ anŭn dơ̆ng ôh, ƀing ding kơna Ñu kŏn dŏ pơ anŭn lơi, tui anŭn ƀing ană plei đĭ sŏng nao pơ plei Kapernum kiăng sem Yêsu.
And having found him the other side of the sea, they said to him, Rabbi, when art thou arrived here? @ Tơ gơñu ƀuh Yêsu ƀơi hang gah adih ia rơsĭ, gơñu laĭ kơ Ñu: “Ơ Nai, hơbin Ih truh pơ anai?”
Jesus answered them and said, Verily, verily, I say to you, Ye seek me not because ye have seen signs, but because ye have eaten of the loaves and been filled. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih sĭt biă mă, ƀing gih hyu sem Kâo, ƀu djơ̆ yua kơ ƀing gih hmâo ƀuh tơlơi mơsêh mơyang ôh, samơ̆ yua ƀing gih hmâo ƀơ̆ng ƀañ tơpŭng trơi laih. 
Work not [for] the food which perishes, but [for] the food which abides unto life eternal, which the Son of man shall give to you; for him has the Father sealed, [even] God. @ Anăm mă bruă kơ mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă thâo răm rai ôh, samơ̆ mă bruă bĕ kơ mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă ăt dŏ tơl truh kơ tơlơi hơdip hlŏng lar. Mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă anŭn Ană Mơnuih či pha brơi kơ ƀing gih; yua kơ Ñu yơh jing Pô Ơi Adai Ama hmâo kơđŏm gru pơsĭt tŭ ư Ñu laih.”
They said therefore to him, What should we do that we may work the works of God? @ Gơñu laĭ kơ Yêsu: “Hơgĕt gơmơi khŏm ngă, kiăng mă bruă kơ Ơi Adai?”
Jesus answered and said to them, This is the work of God, that ye believe on him whom *he* has sent. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Bruă Ơi Adai anŭn jing brơi ƀing gih đaŏ bĕ kơ Pô Ñu hmâo pơkiaŏ rai laih.”
They said therefore to him, What sign then doest thou that we may see and believe thee? what dost thou work? @ Gơñu laĭ kơ Yêsu: “Tui anŭn hơgĕt gru kơnăl mơyang Ih ngă kiăng kơ gơmơi ƀuh laih anŭn đaŏ kơ Ih? Hơgĕt bruă Ih ngă lĕ? 
Our fathers ate the manna in the wilderness, as it is written, He gave them bread out of heaven to eat. @ Ƀing ơi adon gơmơi hmâo ƀơ̆ng laih ƀañ tơpŭng mana amăng tơdrŏn har, tui hăng tơlơi hmâo čih laih: ‘Ñu brơi kơ ƀing gơñu ƀơ̆ng ƀañ tơpŭng mơ̆ng adai.’”
Jesus therefore said to them, Verily, verily, I say to you, [It is] not Moses that has given you the bread out of heaven; but my Father gives you the true bread out of heaven. @ Laih anŭn Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih sĭt biă mă, ƀu djơ̆ Môis ôh hmâo brơi laih kơ ƀing gih ƀañ tơpŭng mơ̆ng adai; samơ̆ Ama Kâo hmâo brơi laih kơ ƀing gih ƀañ tơpŭng mơ̆ng adai. 
For the bread of God is he who comes down out of heaven and gives life to the world. @ Yua kơ ƀañ tơpŭng Ơi Adai jing ƀañ mơ̆ng adai trŭn rai pha brơi tơlơi hơdip kơ lŏn tơnah.”
They said therefore to him, Lord, ever give to us this bread. @ Gơñu laĭ: “Ơ Khua, rơkâo kơ Ih brơi kơ gơmơi ƀañ tơpŭng anŭn nanao.”
[And] Jesus said to them, I am the bread of life: he that comes to me shall never hunger, and he that believes on me shall never thirst at any time. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Kâo jing ƀañ tơpŭng kơ tơlơi hơdip, hlơi pô rai pơ Kâo ñu ƀu či rơpa ôh, laih anŭn hlơi pô đaŏ kơ Kâo ñu ƀu či mơhao ôh. 
But I have said to you, that ye have also seen me and do not believe. @ Samơ̆ Kâo hmâo laĭ laih kơ ƀing gih, ƀing gih hmâo ƀuh laih Kâo, samơ̆ ƀing gih ăt ƀu đaŏ ôh. 
All that the Father gives me shall come to me, and him that comes to me I will not at all cast out. @ Abih bang ƀing mơnuih Ama brơi kơ Kâo, či rai pơ Kâo; laih anŭn hlơi pô rai pơ Kâo, Kâo ƀu či puh pơđuaĭ ñu ôh. 
For I am come down from heaven, not that I should do *my* will, but the will of him that has sent me. @ Yua kơ Kâo trŭn rai laih mơ̆ng adai, ƀu djơ̆ ngă tơlơi Kâo pô kiăng ôh, samơ̆ ngă tui hăng tơlơi Pô pơkiaŏ rai Kâo kiăng. 
And this is the will of him that has sent me, that of all that he has given me I should lose nothing, but should raise it up in the last day. @ Anai jing tơlơi kiăng kơ Pô pơkiaŏ rai Kâo: Kâo ƀu dưi pơrơngiă hĭ ôh sa čô amăng abih bang mơnuih Ñu hmâo brơi laih kơ Kâo, samơ̆ Kâo khŏm ngă pơhơdip glaĭ ƀing gơñu ƀơi hrơi đŭt tơdơi. 
For this is the will of my Father, that every one who sees the Son, and believes on him, should have life eternal; and I will raise him up at the last day. @ Yua kơ anai jing tơlơi Ama kâo kiăng: Hlơi pô ƀuh Ană laih anŭn đaŏ kơ Ană, ñu anŭn či hmâo tơlơi hơdip hlŏng lar, Kâo či brơi kơ pô anŭn hơdip glaĭ amăng hrơi đŭt tơdơi.”
The Jews therefore murmured about him, because he said, I am the bread which has come down out of heaven. @ Ƀing Ană Yuđa pơhiăp brŏk kơ Yêsu yua kơ Yêsu laĭ: “Kâo jing ƀañ tơpŭng trŭn rai mơ̆ng adai.” 
And they said, Is not this Jesus the son of Joseph, whose father and mother we have known? how then does *he* say, I am come down out of heaven? @ Gơñu laĭ: “Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă anai jing Yêsu ană Yôsep, amĭ ama Ñu ƀing ta thâo soh sel? Tui anŭn hyư̆m ră anai Ñu laĭ: ‘Kâo trŭn rai mơ̆ng adai?’”
Jesus therefore answered and said to them, Murmur not among yourselves. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Anăm pơhiăp brŏk tơdruă ƀing gih ôh. 
No one can come to me except the Father who has sent me draw him, and I will raise him up in the last day. @ Ƀu hmâo hlơi dưi rai pơ Kâo ôh, tơdah Ama, Pô hmâo pơkiaŏ rai Kâo ƀu dui pô anŭn rai pơ Kâo, laih anŭn Kâo či pơhơdip glaĭ ñu ƀơi hrơi đŭt tơdơi. 
It is written in the prophets, And they shall be all taught of God. Every one that has heard from the Father [himself], and has learned [of him], comes to me; @ Amăng hơdrôm hră ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo hmâo čih: ‘Ơi Adai či pơhrăm abih bang gơñu,’ Rĭm čô hlơi pô hmâo hmư̆ hăng hrăm laih mơ̆ng Ama, gơñu rai pơ Kâo. 
not that any one has seen the Father, except he who is of God, he has seen the Father. @ Aka hmâo hlơi ƀuh djơ̆ Ama ôh, kơnơ̆ng pô hmâo rai laih mơ̆ng Ơi Adai, Ñu yơh ƀuh laih Ama. 
Verily, verily, I say to you, He that believes [on me] has life eternal. @ Kâo laĭ sĭt biă mă kơ ƀing gih, hlơi pô đaŏ hmâo tơlơi hơdip hlŏng lar. 
I am the bread of life. @ Kâo jing ƀañ tơpŭng tơlơi hơdip. 
Your fathers ate the manna in the wilderness and died. @ Ƀing ơi adon ƀing gih hmâo ƀơ̆ng laih ƀañ tơpŭng mana amăng tơdrŏn har, giơ̆ng anŭn gơñu ăt djai mơ̆n. 
This is the bread which comes down out of heaven, that one may eat of it and not die. @ Anai jing ƀañ tơpŭng trŭn rai mơ̆ng adai, kiăng kơ hlơi pô ƀơ̆ng ñu ƀu djai ôh. 
I am the living bread which has come down out of heaven: if any one shall have eaten of this bread he shall live for ever; but the bread withal which I shall give is my flesh, which I will give for the life of the world. @ Kâo jing ƀañ tơpŭng tơlơi hơdip trŭn rai mơ̆ng adai. Tơdah hlơi pô ƀơ̆ng ƀañ anai, ñu či hơdip hlŏng lar; ƀañ tơpŭng Kâo či pha brơi yua kơ tơlơi hơdip kơ lŏn tơnah, anŭn jing asar Kâo pô.”
The Jews therefore contended among themselves, saying, How can he give us this flesh to eat? @ Yua kơ tơlơi anŭn ƀing ană Yuđa pơrơjah tơdruă gơñu hăng laĭ: “Hyư̆m mơnuih anai dưi brơi ƀing ta ƀơ̆ng asar ñu lĕ?”
Jesus therefore said to them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Unless ye shall have eaten the flesh of the Son of man, and drunk his blood, ye have no life in yourselves. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih sĭt biă mă, tơdah ƀing gih ƀu ƀơ̆ng ôh asar Ană Mơnuih hăng mơñum drah Ñu, ƀing gih ƀu hmâo tơlơi hơdip hlŏng lar amăng ƀing gih ôh. 
He that eats my flesh and drinks my blood has life eternal, and I will raise him up at the last day: @ Hlơi pô ƀơ̆ng asar hăng mơñum drah Kâo, hmâo tơlơi hơdip hlŏng lar, laih anŭn Kâo či pơhơdip glaĭ ñu ƀơi hrơi đŭt tơdơi. 
for my flesh is truly food and my blood is truly drink. @ Yua kơ asar Kâo jing mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă sĭt, laih anŭn drah Kâo jing mơnơ̆ng mơñum sĭt. 
He that eats my flesh and drinks my blood dwells in me and I in him. @ Hlơi pô ƀơ̆ng asar Kâo hăng mơñum drah Kâo, ñu anŭn dŏ amăng Kâo laih anŭn Kâo dŏ amăng ñu, 
As the living Father has sent me and I live on account of the Father, *he* also who eats me shall live also on account of me. @ Kar hăng Ama, Pô hơdip, hmâo pơkiaŏ rai Kâo laih anŭn Kâo hơdip yua kơ Ama, ăt kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n hlơi pô ƀơ̆ng asar Kâo ñu či hơdip yua mơ̆ng Kâo. 
This is the bread which has come down out of heaven. Not as the fathers ate and died: he that eats this bread shall live for ever. @ Anai jing ƀañ tơpŭng trŭn rai mơ̆ng adai, ƀu djơ̆ hrup hăng ƀañ tơpŭng mana ƀing ơi adon ƀing gih ƀơ̆ng laih anŭn ăt djai mơ̆n; hlơi pô ƀơ̆ng ƀañ tơpŭng anai ñu či hơdip hlŏng lar.”
These things he said in [the] synagogue, teaching in Capernaum. @ Yêsu pơhiăp hơdôm tơlơi anai tơdang Ñu pơtô amăng sang bơjơnum pơ Plei Kapernum.
Many therefore of his disciples having heard [it] said, This word is hard; who can hear it? @ Lu ƀing ding kơna Ñu hmư̆ tơlơi anai, gơñu laĭ “Boh pơhiăp anai tơnap đơi thâo hluh. Hlơi pô dưi hmư̆ tơlơi anŭn?”
But Jesus, knowing in himself that his disciples murmur concerning this, said to them, Does this offend you? @ Samơ̆ Yêsu thâo yơh amăng pran jua Ñu kơ ƀing ding kơna Ñu pơhiăp brŏk kơ tơlơi anŭn, hnŭn yơh Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Djơ̆ mơ̆ tơlơi anai ngă tơhnač ƀing gih? 
If then ye see the Son of man ascending up where he was before? @ Tui anŭn, hơgĕt tơlơi ƀing gih pơmĭn tơdah ƀing gih ƀuh Ană Mơnuih đĭ nao pơ anih Ñu dŏ laih mơ̆ng hlâo? 
It is the Spirit which quickens, the flesh profits nothing: the words which I have spoken unto you are spirit and are life. @ Yang Bơngăt Ơi Adai yơh jing pô brơi tơlơi hơdip, asar ƀu yom ôh; khul boh pơhiăp Kâo hmâo pơhiăp hăng ƀing gih jing Yang Bơngăt laih anŭn tơlơi hơdip. 
But there are some of you who do not believe. For Jesus knew from the beginning who they were who did not believe, and who would deliver him up. @ Samơ̆ hmâo đơđa mơnuih amăng ƀing gih ƀu đaŏ ôh.” Yua kơ Yêsu thâo laih mơ̆ng blŭng hlâo hlơi jing ƀing mơnuih ƀu đaŏ, laih anŭn hlơi jing pô či pơblư̆ lui Ñu. 
And he said, Therefore said I unto you, that no one can come to me unless it be given to him from the Father. @ Laih anŭn Ñu laĭ: “Yua kơ anŭn kâo hmâo laĭ laih kơ ƀing gih, ƀu hmâo ôh hlơi dưi rai pơ Kâo tơdah Ama ƀu brơi tơlơi dưi kơ ñu.”
From that [time] many of his disciples went away back and walked no more with him. @ Mă mơ̆ng anŭn, lu ƀing ding kơna Ñu đuaĭ glaĭ ƀu nao hrŏm hăng Yêsu dơ̆ng ôh. 
Jesus therefore said to the twelve, Will ye also go away? @ Yêsu laĭ hăng pluh dua čô ding kơna: “Bơ ƀing gih, ƀing gih či lui kâo mơ̆n hă?”
Simon Peter answered him, Lord, to whom shall we go? thou hast words of life eternal; @ Simôn Pêtrôs laĭ glaĭ: “Ơ Khua, kơ hlơi ƀing gơmơi či đuaĭ tui? Ih yơh hmâo boh pơhiăp kơ tơlơi hơdip hlŏng lar. 
and we have believed and known that thou art the holy one of God. @ Ƀing gơmơi hmâo đaŏ laih hăng thâo krăn Ih jing Pô Rơgoh Hiam mơ̆ng Ơi Adai.”
Jesus answered them, Have not I chosen you the twelve? and of you one is a devil. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă Kâo hmâo ruah laih ƀing gih jing pluh dua čô ding kơna, samơ̆ sa čô amăng ƀing gih jing yang sat?” 
Now he spoke of Judas [the son] of Simon, Iscariote, for he [it was who] should deliver him up, being one of the twelve. @ Ñu pơhiăp djơ̆ kơ Yudas ană đah rơkơi Simôn Iskariôt, yua kơ ñu jing sa čô amăng ƀing pluh dua čô ding kơna, pô či pơblư̆ lui Yêsu.
And after these things Jesus walked in Galilee, for he would not walk in Judaea, because the Jews sought to kill him. @ Tơdơi kơ tơlơi anŭn, Yêsu hyu amăng tring Galilê. Ñu ƀu hyu ôh amăng kwar Yuđa yua kơ ƀing ană Yuđa hơduah kiăng pơdjai Ñu. 
Now the tabernacles, the feast of the Jews, was near. @ Phĕt Sang Khăn ƀing ană Yuđa jĕ truh. 
His brethren therefore said to him, Remove hence and go into Judaea, that thy disciples also may see thy works which thou doest; @ Tui anŭn ƀing adơi Yêsu laĭ kơ Ñu: “Tơbiă bĕ mơ̆ng anih anai hăng nao pơ tring Yuđa, kiăng kơ ƀing ding kơna ih dưi ƀuh bruă ih ngă. 
for no one does anything in secret and himself seeks to be [known] in public. If thou doest these things, manifest thyself to the world: @ Yua kơ ƀu hmâo ôh sa čô mă bruă hơgơ̆m tơdah ñu kiăng kơ arăng thâo krăn ñu. Tơdah ih ngă hơdôm bruă anŭn, pơrơđah bĕ ih pô kơ mơnuih lŏn tơnah thâo.” 
for neither did his brethren believe on him. @ Yua kơ wơ̆t ƀing adơi Ñu kŏn đaŏ kơ Ñu lơi.
Jesus therefore says to them, My time is not yet come, but your time is always ready. @ Yêsu laĭ hăng gơñu: “Mông kâo aka truh ôh, samơ̆ ƀing gih hmâo mông gal nanao. 
The world cannot hate you, but me it hates, because I bear witness concerning it that its works are evil. @ Lŏn tơnah ƀu bơrơmŭt kơ ƀing gih ôh, samơ̆ lŏn tơnah bơrơmŭt kơ kâo, yua kơ kâo pơhaih bruă gơñu ngă jing soh sat. 
Ye, go ye up to this feast. I go not up to this feast, for *my* time is not yet fulfilled. @ Ƀing gih nao bĕ kơ hrơi phĕt anai. Kâo aka nao ôh yua kơ mông kâo aka truh.” 
Having said these things to them he abode in Galilee. @ Pơhiăp giơ̆ng, Ñu ăt dŏ glaĭ amăng tring Galilê.
But when his brethren had gone up, then he himself also went up to the feast, not openly, but as in secret. @ Samơ̆ tơ ƀing adơi Ñu nao laih kơ hrơi phĕt, tơdơi kơ anŭn Ñu pô ăt nao mơ̆n, samơ̆ Ñu nao hăng tơlơi hơgơ̆m ƀu brơi ƀing mơnuih lu thâo ôh. 
The Jews therefore sought him at the feast, and said, Where is he? @ Ƀing Yuđa hyu sem Yêsu amăng anih tơlơi phĕt anŭn hăng laĭ: “Pơpă Ñu?”
And there was much murmuring concerning him among the crowds. Some said, He is [a] good [man]; others said, No; but he deceives the crowd. @ Lu ƀing ană plei pơhiăp phač djơ̆ kơ Ñu tơdang hmâo đơđa mơnuih laĭ: “Ñu jing sa čô mơnuih hiam,” ƀing pơkŏn laĭ: “Ư ưh, Ñu jing mơnuih plư pleč ană plei.” 
However, no one spoke openly concerning him on account of [their] fear of the Jews. @ Samơ̆ ƀu hmâo hlơi khĭn pơhiăp rơđah ôh yua kơ hwĭ kơ ƀing khua ană Yuđa.
But when it was now the middle of the feast, Jesus went up into the temple and taught. @ Hlăk tơ̆ng krah hrơi phĕt, Yêsu nao pơ sang kơkuh pơpŭ laih anŭn pơtô laĭ. 
The Jews therefore wondered, saying, How knows this [man] letters, having never learned? @ Ƀing Yuđa kơtuă hling kơ tơlơi anŭn hăng laĭ: “Hyư̆m mơnuih anai dưi thâo Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp lu tui anŭn, Ñu aka hrăm djơ̆ ôh?”
Jesus therefore answered them and said, My doctrine is not mine, but [that] of him that has sent me. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Tơlơi Kâo pơtô ƀu djơ̆ mơ̆ng Kâo pô ôh samơ̆ mơ̆ng Pô pơkiaŏ rai Kâo. 
If any one desire to practise his will, he shall know concerning the doctrine, whether it is of God, or [that] I speak from myself. @ Tơdah sa čô mơnuih mơak pran jua kiăng ngă tui hăng tơlơi Ơi Adai kiăng, ñu či thâo yơh tơlơi Kâo pơtô tơbiă rai mơ̆ng Ơi Adai ƀôdah mơ̆ng Kâo pô. 
He that speaks from himself seeks his own glory; but he that seeks the glory of him that has sent him, he is true, and unrighteousness is not in him. @ Hlơi pô pơhiăp tui hăng tơlơi dưi ñu pô, sem hơduah tơlơi ư-ang kơ ñu pô; samơ̆ hlơi pô sem hơduah tơlơi ư-ang kơ pô pơkiaŏ rai ñu, ñu jing pô tơpă sĭt, laih anŭn amăng ñu ƀu hmâo tơlơi plơ̆m ƀlor ôh. 
Has not Moses given you the law, and no one of you practises the law? Why do ye seek to kill me? @ Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă Môis hmâo brơi laih tơlơi juăt kơ ƀing gih? Samơ̆ ƀu hmâo ôh sa čô amăng ƀing gih gưt ngă tui tơlơi juăt. Hyư̆m ƀing gih sem hơduah kiăng pơdjai Kâo lĕ?”
The crowd answered [and said], Thou hast a demon: who seeks to kill thee? @ Ƀing ană plei laĭ glaĭ: “Amăng ih hmâo yang sat! Hlơi hơduah sem kiăng pơdjai ih?”
Jesus answered and said to them, I have done one work, and ye all wonder. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Kâo hmâo ngă laih sa mơta bruă, laih anŭn abih bang ƀing gih dŏ kơtuă hling yua kơ bruă anŭn. 
Therefore Moses gave you circumcision (not that it is of Moses, but of the fathers), and ye circumcise a man on sabbath. @ Môis brơi kơ ƀing gih tơlơi juăt khăt klĭ. (Tơlơi anŭn ƀu djơ̆ tơbiă rai mơ̆ng Môis ôh, samơ̆ mơ̆ng ơi adon ƀing gih), laih anŭn ƀing gih khăt klĭ kơ ƀing đah rơkơi amăng hrơi saƀat. 
If a man receives circumcision on sabbath, that the law of Moses may not be violated, are ye angry with me because I have made a man entirely sound on sabbath? @ Tơdah sa čô đah rơkơi khŏm tŭ tơlơi khăt klĭ amăng hrơi saƀat kiăng kơ ƀu hmâo gao ôh tơlơi juăt Môis, hyư̆m ƀing gih hil kơ Kâo yua kơ Kâo hmâo pơsuaih abih drơi jan sa čô mơnuih amăng hrơi saƀat lĕ? 
Judge not according to sight, but judge righteous judgment. @ Anăm phat kơđi tui hăng tơlơi thâo ƀuh gah rơngiao ôh, samơ̆ brơi ƀing gih phat kơđi tui hăng tơlơi tơpă hơnơ̆ng.”
Some therefore of those of Jerusalem said, Is not this he whom they seek to kill? @ Hmâo đơđa mơnuih amăng plei Yêrusalem laĭ: “Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă pô anai yơh arăng hơduah kiăng pơdjai? 
and behold, he speaks openly, and they say nothing to him. Have the rulers then indeed recognised that this is the Christ? @ Lăng adih, Ñu dŏ pơtô hăng tơlơi rơngai ƀơi anăp abih bang mơnuih, laih anŭn arăng ƀu laĭ tơlơi hơgĕt kơ Ñu ôh. Djơ̆ mơ̆ ƀing khua wai lăng thâo klă sĭt laih mơnuih anai jing Yang Krist? 
But [as to] this [man] we know whence he is. Now [as to] the Christ, when he comes, no one knows whence he is. @ Samơ̆ tơ Yang Krist či rai ƀu hmâo hlơi pô thâo mơ̆ng pơpă Ñu rai ôh. Bơ mơnuih anai ƀing ta thâo laih mơ̆ng pơpă ñu tơbiă rai.”
Jesus therefore cried out in the temple, teaching and saying, Ye both know me and ye know whence I am; and I am not come of myself, but he that sent me is true, whom ye do not know. @ Hlăk Yêsu dŏ pơtô amăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ, Ñu pơhiăp kraih: “Ƀing gih thâo krăn laih Kâo, laih anŭn ƀing gih ăt thâo mơ̆n mơ̆ng pơpă Kâo rai. Kâo ƀu rai ôh tui hăng pô Kâo kiăng; samơ̆ Pô hmâo pơkiaŏ rai Kâo jing pô sĭt laih anŭn ƀing gih ƀu thâo krăn Ñu ôh. 
I know him, because I am from him, and *he* has sent me. @ Samơ̆ Kâo thâo krăn Ñu, yua kơ Kâo rai mơ̆ng Ñu, laih anŭn Ñu jing Pô pơkiaŏ rai Kâo.”
They sought therefore to take him; and no one laid his hand upon him, because his hour had not yet come. @ Tui anŭn, gơñu hơduah jơlan kiăng mă Yêsu, samơ̆ ƀu hmâo hlơi pô dưi yơr tơngan ruaih Ñu ôh, yua kơ mông Ñu aka truh. 
But many of the crowd believed on him, and said, Will the Christ, when he comes, do more signs than those which this [man] has done? @ Samơ̆ hmâo lu mơnuih đaŏ kơ Ñu laih anŭn gơñu laĭ: “Tơ Yang Krist truh, Ñu či ngă lu gru kơnăl mơyang hloh kơ pô anai hmâo ngă laih mơ̆?”
The Pharisees heard the crowd murmuring these things concerning him, and the Pharisees and the chief priests sent officers that they might take him. @ Ƀing Pharisi hmư̆ ƀing mơnuih lu pơhiăp phač djơ̆ kơ Yêsu. Tui anŭn gơñu hăng ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng pơkiaŏ ƀing tơhan gak wai sang kơkuh pơpŭ nao mă Yêsu. 
Jesus therefore said, Yet a little while I am with you, and I go to him that has sent me. @ Yua kơ anŭn yơh Yêsu laĭ: “Kâo či dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing gih sui ƀiă dơ̆ng, giơ̆ng anŭn Kâo či glaĭ pơ Pô hmâo pơkiaŏ rai Kâo. 
Ye shall seek me and shall not find [me], and where I am ye cannot come. @ Ƀing gih či sem hơduah Kâo samơ̆ ƀing gih ƀu ƀuh Kâo ôh; ƀơi anih Kâo dŏ ƀing gih ƀu dưi nao ôh.”
The Jews therefore said to one another, Where is he about to go that we shall not find him? Is he about to go to the dispersion among the Greeks, and teach the Greeks? @ Ƀing Yuđa bơlaĭ tơdruă gơñu: “Pơpă pô anai pơmĭn kiăng nao tơl ƀing ta ƀu či ƀuh Ñu ôh? Djơ̆ mơ̆ Ñu či nao pơ ƀing bra hyu tơ̆ng krah ƀing Grek hăng pơtô kơ ƀing Grek mơ̆? 
What word is this which he said, Ye shall seek me and shall not find [me]; and where I am ye cannot come? @ Hơgĕt Ñu kiăng laĭ: ‘Ƀing gih či sem hơduah Kâo, samơ̆ ƀing gih ƀu či ƀuh ôh’, laih anŭn ‘ƀơi anih Kâo dŏ ƀing gih ƀu dưi nao ôh?’”
In the last, the great day of the feast, Jesus stood and cried saying, If any one thirst, let him come to me and drink. @ Ƀơi hrơi hnal tuč jing hrơi yom hloh amăng hrơi phĕt anŭn, Yêsu dŏ dơ̆ng hăng pơhiăp kraih tui anai: “Hlơi pô mơhao, brơi ñu rai bĕ pơ Kâo laih anŭn mơñum. 
He that believes on me, as the scripture has said, out of his belly shall flow rivers of living water. @ Hlơi pô đaŏ kơ Kâo, tui hăng Hră Ơi Adai pơhiăp hmâo laĭ: ‘Či hmâo ia tơlơi hơdip ro mơ̆ng pran jua ñu.’” 
But this he said concerning the Spirit, which they that believed on him were about to receive; for [the] Spirit was not yet, because Jesus had not yet been glorified. @ Yêsu laĭ tơlơi anŭn kiăng laĭ nao kơ Yang Bơngăt Hiam, kơ hlơi pô đaŏ kơ Ñu či tŭ mă. Hrơi anŭn Ơi Adai aka brơi trŭn Yang Bơngăt Hiam ôh, yua kơ Yêsu aka hmâo tơlơi guh kơang.
[Some] out of the crowd therefore, having heard this word, said, This is truly the prophet. @ Tơ ƀing mơnuih lu hmư̆ hơdôm tơlơi anai, hmâo đơđa laĭ: “Sĭt mơnuih anai jing pô Laĭ Lui Hlâo.”
Others said, This is the Christ. Others said, Does then the Christ come out of Galilee? @ Ƀing pơkŏn laĭ: “Anai yơh Yang Krist.” Samơ̆ đơđa laĭ: “Yang Krist ƀu tơbiă rai mơ̆ng tring Galilê ôh. 
Has not the scripture said that the Christ comes of the seed of David, and from the village of Bethlehem, where David was? @ Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp hmâo laĭ laih Yang Krist jing ană tơčo Đawit, laih anŭn tơbiă rai mơ̆ng Betlêhem, jing plei Đawit?” 
There was a division therefore in the crowd on account of him. @ Tui anŭn hmâo tơlơi pơkah pha phung tơ̆ng krah ƀing ană plei yua kơ Yêsu. 
But some of them desired to take him, but no one laid hands upon him. @ Đơđa ƀing gơñu kiăng mă čaŏ Yêsu, samơ̆ ƀu hmâo hlơi ruaih djơ̆ Ñu ôh.
The officers therefore came to the chief priests and Pharisees, and they said to them, Why have ye not brought him? @ Tui anŭn, ƀing khua tơhan gak wai sang kơkuh pơpŭ wơ̆t glaĭ pơ ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng hăng ƀing Pharisi, laih anŭn gơñu tơña: “Hyư̆m ƀing gih ƀu mă Yêsu ba rai pơ anai?”
The officers answered, Never man spoke thus, as this man [speaks]. @ Ƀing khua tơhan laĭ glaĭ: “Aka hmâo djơ̆ ôh mơnuih pơhiăp kar hăng pô anai!”
The Pharisees therefore answered them, Are ye also deceived? @ Ƀing Pharisi laĭ glaĭ kơ gơñu: “Wơ̆t kơ ƀing gih ăt lĕ tơlơi Ñu plư mơ̆n hă? 
Has any one of the rulers believed on him, or of the Pharisees? @ Hmâo mơ̆ hlơi amăng ƀing khua ană Yuđa ƀôdah ƀing mơnuih Pharisi đaŏ kơ Ñu? 
But this crowd, which does not know the law, are accursed. @ Ƀing mơnuih lu anai ƀu thâo tơlơi juăt Môis ôh, gơñu năng lăp kơ hơtơ̆m pah yơh!”
Nicodemus says to them (being one of themselves), @ Nikôđem, jing sa čô mơnuih amăng ƀing Pharisi, pô hmâo nao laih pơ Yêsu hlâo adih, laĭ kơ gơñu, 
Does our law judge a man before it have first heard from himself, and know what he does? @ “Tui tơlơi juăt ƀing ta ƀu dưi mă phat kơđi ôh kơ sa čô mơnuih tơdah aka ƀu hmâo tơña sem laih hơgĕt tơlơi ñu hmâo ngă.”
They answered and said to him, Art thou also of Galilee? Search and look, that no prophet arises out of Galilee. @ Gơñu laĭ glaĭ: “Hyư̆m ih ăt jing mơnuih Galilê mơ̆n hă? Brơi ih kơsem lăng bĕ Hră Ơi Adai, ih či ƀuh ƀu hmâo sa čô pô laĭ lui hlâo tơbiă rai mơ̆ng tring Galilê ôh.” [
And every one went to his home. @ Giơ̆ng anŭn abih bang gơñu glaĭ pơ sang gơñu pô.
But Jesus went to the mount of Olives. @ Yêsu đĭ nao pơ Čư̆ Ôliwơ. 
And early in the morning he came again into the temple, and all the people came to him; and he sat down and taught them. @ Ưm mơguah, Yêsu wơ̆t glaĭ pơ sang kơkuh pơpŭ dơ̆ng. Abih bang ƀing ană plei leng kơ nao pơ Ñu. Laih anŭn Ñu dŏ ber pơtô ƀing gơ̆. 
And the scribes and the Pharisees bring [to him] a woman taken in adultery, and having set her in the midst, @ Ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt hăng ƀing Pharisi ba rai sa čô đah kơmơi arăng hmâo mă tơdang gơ̆ klĕ pyu hăng pioh ñu dŏ ƀơi tơ̆ng krah mơnuih lu, 
they say to him, Teacher, this woman has been taken in the very act, committing adultery. @ hăng laĭ kơ Yêsu: “Ơ Nai, đah kơmơi anai arăng hmâo mă ñu tơdang ñu dŏ klĕ pyu. 
Now in the law Moses has commanded us to stone such; thou therefore, what sayest thou? @ Amăng tơlơi juăt Môis pơtă brơi ƀing ta khŏm glŏm boh pơtâo pơdjai hĭ pô ngă kar hăng tui anŭn. Bơ Ih hyư̆m Ih laĭ kơ tơlơi anŭn?” 
But this they said proving him, that they might have [something] to accuse him [of]. But Jesus, having stooped down, wrote with his finger on the ground. @ Gơñu laĭ tui anŭn kiăng lông lăng Yêsu kiăng kơ hmâo tơlơi dưi phong kơ Ñu. Yêsu tơkui čih hăng čơđeng Ñu ƀơi lŏn. 
But when they continued asking him, he lifted himself up and said to them, Let him that is without sin among you first cast the stone at her. @ Yua kơ ƀing anŭn tơña nanao kơ Ñu dơ̆ng, dŏ tơña lu tơlơi, Ñu angak mơta hăng laĭ: “Hlơi amăng ƀing gih jing mơnuih ƀu hmâo tơlơi soh ôh, brơi ñu blŭng hlâo mă boh pơtâo glŏm đah kơmơi anai.” 
And again stooping down he wrote on the ground. @ Giơ̆ng anŭn Yêsu tơkui čih ƀơi lŏn dơ̆ng. 
But they, having heard [that], went out one by one beginning from the elder ones until the last; and Jesus was left alone and the woman standing there. @ Tơ gơñu hmư̆ tơlơi anŭn, gơñu ƀrư̆ ƀrư̆ pha drơi pha đuaĭ, ƀing tha đuaĭ hlâo. Yêsu dŏ glaĭ hơjăn Ñu hăng đah kơmơi hlăk dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơi anăp Ñu anŭn. 
And Jesus, lifting himself up and seeing no one but the woman, said to her, Woman, where are those thine accusers? Has no one condemned thee? @ Yêsu angak mơta hăng laĭ kơ đah kơmơi anŭn: “Pơpă ƀing pơčŭt kơ ih lĕ? Ƀu hmâo hlơi klă kơđi kơ ih ôh hă?”
And she said, No one, sir. And Jesus said to her, Neither do I condemn thee: go, and sin no more. @ Đah kơmơi anŭn laĭ: “Ơ Khua, ƀu hmâo ôh.”
Yêsu laĭ: “Kâo kŏn klă kơđi ih lơi. Nao bĕ, anăm ngă soh dơ̆ng ôh.”]
Again therefore Jesus spoke to them, saying, I am the light of the world; he that follows me shall not walk in darkness, but shall have the light of life. @ Yêsu pơhiăp dơ̆ng hăng ƀing gơñu: “Kâo jing tơlơi bơngač kơ lŏn tơnah, hlơi pô đuaĭ tui kâo ñu ƀu či rơbat amăng tơlơi kơnăm mơmŏt ôh, samơ̆ či hmâo tơlơi bơngač kơ tơlơi hơdip.”
The Pharisees therefore said to him, Thou bearest witness concerning thyself; thy witness is not true. @ Ƀing Pharisi laĭ kơ Ñu: “Ih ngă gơ̆ng jơlan kơ Ih pô, tơlơi Ih ngă gơ̆ng jơlan anŭn ƀu jing sĭt ôh.”
Jesus answered and said to them, Even if I bear witness concerning myself, my witness is true, because I know whence I came and whither I go: but ye know not whence I come and whither I go. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Wơ̆t dah Kâo ngă gơ̆ng jơlan mă Kâo pô, tơlơi Kâo ngă gơ̆ng jơlan jing sĭt, yua kơ Kâo thâo mơ̆ng pơpă Kâo rai hăng pơpă anih Kâo nao; samơ̆ ƀing gih ƀu thâo ôh mơ̆ng pă Kâo rai ƀôdah pơpă anih Kâo nao. 
Ye judge according to the flesh, I judge no one. @ Ƀing gih phat kơđi tui hăng mơnuih đôč, bơ Kâo ƀu hmâo phat kơđi kơ hlơi hlơi ôh. 
And if also I judge, my judgment is true, because I am not alone, but I and the Father who has sent me. @ Samơ̆ wơ̆t dah Kâo phat kơđi, tơlơi Kâo phat kơđi jing sĭt, yua kơ Kâo ƀu phat kơđi hơjăn Kâo đôč ôh, samơ̆ Kâo hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Ama Pô hmâo pơkiaŏ rai laih Kâo. 
And in your law too it is written that the testimony of two men is true: @ Amăng tơlơi juăt ƀing gih hmâo čih laih, dua čô ngă gơ̆ng jơlan kah jing sĭt. 
I am [one] who bear witness concerning myself, and the Father who has sent me bears witness concerning me. @ Kâo ngă gơ̆ng jơlan pơsĭt kơ Kâo pô laih anŭn Ama jing Pô hmâo pơkiaŏ rai Kâo ăt ngă gơ̆ng jơlan pơsĭt kơ Kâo mơ̆n.”
They said to him therefore, Where is thy Father? Jesus answered, Ye know neither me nor my Father. If ye had known me, ye would have known also my Father. @ Tui anŭn gơñu tơña kơ Yêsu: “Pơpă Ama Ih?”
Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Ƀing gih ƀu thâo krăn Kâo ôh, ăt ƀing gih ƀu thâo krăn Ama Kâo lơi. Tơdah ƀing gih thâo krăn Kâo, ƀing gih ăt thâo krăn Ama Kâo mơ̆n.”
These words spoke he in the treasury, teaching in the temple; and no one took him, for his hour was not yet come. @ Yêsu pơhiăp khul tơlơi anai amăng anih pioh hip pơyơr prăk, tơdang Ñu pơtô amăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ. Samơ̆ ƀu hmâo hlơi pô mă čaŏ Ñu, yua kơ mông Ñu aka truh ôh.
He said therefore again to them, I go away, and ye shall seek me, and shall die in your sin; where I go ye cannot come. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu dơ̆ng: “Kâo či nao, ƀing gih či sem Kâo, samơ̆ ƀing gih či djai amăng tơlơi soh ƀing gih. Anih Kâo nao, ƀing gih ƀu dưi nao ôh.”
The Jews therefore said, Will he kill himself, that he says, Where I go ye cannot come? @ Yua kơ anŭn yơh ƀing khua ană Yuđa laĭ: “Hyư̆m, Ñu či pơdjai Ñu pô hă, yua kơ Ñu laĭ: ‘Anih Kâo nao ƀing gih ƀu dưi nao ôh?’”
And he said to them, Ye are from beneath; I am from above. Ye are of this world; I am not of this world. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Ƀing gih tơbiă rai mơ̆ng gah yŭ, bơ Kâo trŭn rai mơ̆ng glong. Ƀing gih tơbiă mơ̆ng lŏn tơnah anai, bơ Kâo ƀu tơbiă rai mơ̆ng lŏn tơnah anai ôh. 
I said therefore to you, that ye shall die in your sins; for unless ye shall believe that I am [he], ye shall die in your sins. @ Anŭn yơh, yua hơgĕt Kâo hmâo laĭ laih kơ ƀing gih, ƀing gih či djai amăng tơlơi soh ƀing gih; yua kơ tơdah ƀing gih ƀu đaŏ ôh Kâo jing Pô Kâo Jing, ƀing gih či djai amăng tơlơi soh ƀing gih pô.”
They said therefore to him, Who art thou? [And] Jesus said to them, Altogether that which I also say to you. @ Gơñu tơña kơ Yêsu: “Hlơi Ih jing?”
Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Hrup hăng Kâo hmâo laĭ laih hăng ƀing gih mơ̆ng phŭn blŭng. 
I have many things to say and to judge concerning you, but he that has sent me is true, and I, what I have heard from him, these things I say to the world. @ Kâo hmâo lu tơlơi kiăng laĭ djơ̆ kơ ƀing gih laih anŭn lu tơlơi kiăng phat kơđi kơ ƀing gih; samơ̆ Pô hmâo Pơkiaŏ rai laih Kâo jing sĭt, laih anŭn Kâo pơhaih brơi kơ lŏn tơnah hơgĕt tơlơi Kâo hmâo hmư̆ laih mơ̆ng Ñu.”
They knew not that he spoke to them of the Father. @ Gơñu ƀu thâo hluh ôh Yêsu pơhiăp tơlơi anŭn laĭ nao kơ Ama brơi kơ gơñu. 
Jesus therefore said to them, When ye shall have lifted up the Son of man, then ye shall know that I am [he], and [that] I do nothing of myself, but as the Father has taught me I speak these things. @ Yua kơ anŭn, Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Tơ ƀing gih yol đĭ Ană Mơnuih hăng glong, hlăk anŭn ƀing gih či thâo yơh Kâo Jing Pô Kâo Jing, hăng thâo Kâo ƀu ngă hơgĕt tơlơi mơ̆ng tơlơi dưi Kâo pô ôh, samơ̆ Kâo kơnơ̆ng pơhiăp tui hăng hơgĕt tơlơi Ama hmâo pơtô brơi. 
And he that has sent me is with me; he has not left me alone, because I do always the things that are pleasing to him. @ Pô hmâo pơkiaŏ rai Kâo ăt dŏ hrŏm hăng Kâo. Ñu ƀu lui Kâo dŏ hơjăn ôh, yua kơ Kâo nanao ngă khul tơlơi bơmơak kơ Ñu.”
As he spoke these things many believed on him. @ Yua kơ Yêsu pơhiăp hơdôm tơlơi anŭn, hmâo lu mơnuih đaŏ kơ Ñu.
Jesus therefore said to the Jews who believed him, If ye abide in my word, ye are truly my disciples; @ Hnŭn yơh Yêsu laĭ hăng ƀing ană Yuđa đaŏ laih kơ Ñu: “Tơdah ƀing gih dŏ kơjăp nanao amăng boh pơhiăp Kâo, sĭt ƀing gih jing ding kơna Kâo. 
and ye shall know the truth, and the truth shall set you free. @ Ƀing gih či thâo tơlơi sĭt laih anŭn tơlơi sĭt či pơrơngai ƀing gih.”
They answered him, We are Abraham's seed, and have never been under bondage to any one; how sayest thou, Ye shall become free? @ Ƀing ană Yuđa laĭ glaĭ: “Gơmơi jing ană tơčo Abraham, laih anŭn gơmơi aka ngă djơ̆ hlŭn kơ arăng ôh. Hyư̆m tơlơi Ih laĭ: ‘Ƀing gih či dưi jing rơngai’?”
Jesus answered them, Verily, verily, I say to you, Every one that practises sin is the bondman of sin. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Kâo laĭ sĭt biă mă kơ ƀing gih, hlơi pô ngă soh ñu jing hlŭn kơ tơlơi soh. 
Now the bondman abides not in the house for ever: the son abides for ever. @ Hlŭn ƀu dŏ nanao amăng sang ôh samơ̆ ană dŏ nanao amăng sang. 
If therefore the Son shall set you free, ye shall be really free. @ Tui anŭn tơdah Ană pơrơngai ƀing gih, ƀing gih či jing rơngai sĭt yơh. 
I know that ye are Abraham's seed; but ye seek to kill me, because my word has no entrance in you. @ Kâo thâo ƀing gih jing ană tơčo Abraham; samơ̆ ƀing gih sem hơduah kiăng pơdjai hĭ Kâo, yua kơ boh pơhiăp Kâo ƀu hmâo ôh anih amăng pran jua ƀing gih. 
I speak what I have seen with my Father, and ye then do what ye have seen with your father. @ Kâo pơhiăp khul tơlơi Kâo ƀuh mơ̆ng Ama Kâo, samơ̆ ƀing gih ngă tui hơgĕt tơlơi ƀing gih hmư̆ mơ̆ng ama ƀing gih.”
They answered and said to him, Abraham is our father. Jesus says to them, If ye were Abraham's children, ye would do the works of Abraham; @ Gơñu laĭ glaĭ: “Abraham jing ama ƀing gơmơi.”
Yêsu laĭ: “Tơdah ƀing gih jing ană Abraham, ƀing gih či ngă tơlơi Abraham hmâo ngă laih. 
but now ye seek to kill me, a man who has spoken the truth to you, which I have heard from God: this did not Abraham. @ Samơ̆ ră anai ƀing gih sem hơduah kiăng pơdjai hĭ Kâo, pô hmâo pơhiăp laih tơlơi sĭt kơ ƀing gih, anŭn jing tơlơi Kâo hmâo hmư̆ laih mơ̆ng Ơi Adai. Abraham ƀu hmâo ngă khul bruă tui anŭn ôh. 
Ye do the works of your father. They said [therefore] to him, We are not born of fornication; we have one father, God. @ Ƀing gih hlăk dŏ ngă khul tơlơi ama ƀing gih ngă.” Gơñu laĭ: “Ƀing gơmơi ƀu djơ̆ ană ƀă pôm ôh. Gơmơi kơnơ̆ng hmâo sa čô Ama đôč, jing Ơi Adai.” 
Jesus said to them, If God were your father ye would have loved me, for I came forth from God and am come [from him]; for neither am I come of myself, but *he* has sent me. @ Yêsu laĭ: “Tơdah Ơi Adai jing Ama ƀing gih, ƀing gih či khăp yơh kơ Kâo, yua kơ Kâo rai mơ̆ng Ơi Adai, laih anŭn ră anai Kâo dŏ pơ anai. Kâo ƀu rai mơ̆ng tơlơi dưi Kâo pô ôh, samơ̆ Ơi Adai hmâo pơkiaŏ rai Kâo. 
Why do ye not know my speech? Because ye cannot hear my word. @ Yua hơgĕt ƀing gih ƀu thâo hluh ôh tơlơi Kâo pơhiăp? Yua kơ ƀing gih ƀu anăm hmư̆ ôh boh pơhiăp Kâo. 
Ye are of the devil, as [your] father, and ye desire to do the lusts of your father. He was a murderer from the beginning, and has not stood in the truth, because there is no truth in him. When he speaks falsehood, he speaks of what is his own; for he is a liar and its father: @ Ƀing gih tơbiă rai mơ̆ng ama ƀing gih jing Yang Sat, laih anŭn ƀing gih kiăng ngă tui hăng tơlơi ama ƀing gih kiăng. Mơ̆ng blŭng hlâo ñu jing laih pô pơdjai mơnuih, ñu ƀu dŏ amăng tơlơi sĭt ôh yua kơ tơlơi sĭt ƀu dŏ amăng ñu ôh. Tơdah ñu pơhiăp ƀlor jing ñu pơhiăp tui hăng kơnuih ñu, yua kơ ñu jing pô ƀlor hơđăp amơĭ laih anŭn ñu jing ama kơ tơlơi ƀlor. 
and because I speak the truth, ye do not believe me. @ Samơ̆ yua kơ Kâo pơhiăp tơlơi sĭt, hnŭn yơh ƀing gih ƀu đaŏ kơ Kâo ôh. 
Which of you convinces me of sin? If I speak truth, why do ye not believe me? @ Hlơi pô amăng ƀing gih dưi črâo tơlơi soh Kâo ngă? Tơdah Kâo pơhiăp tơlơi sĭt, yua hơgĕt ƀing gih ƀu đaŏ kơ Kâo? 
He that is of God hears the words of God: therefore ye hear [them] not, because ye are not of God. @ Hlơi pô tơbiă rai mơ̆ng Ơi Adai, ñu hmư̆ boh pơhiăp Ơi Adai. Ƀing gih ƀu hmư̆ ôh tơlơi pơhiăp anŭn, yua kơ ƀing gih ƀu tơbiă rai mơ̆ng Ơi Adai ôh.”
The Jews answered and said to him, Say we not well that thou art a Samaritan and hast a demon? @ Ƀing ană Yuđa laĭ kơ Yêsu: “Gơmơi laĭ Ih jing mơnuih Samari hăng pô hmâo yang sat ngă, anŭn ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă?”
Jesus answered, I have not a demon; but I honour my Father, and ye dishonour me. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Kâo ƀu djơ̆ yang sat ngă ôh; Samơ̆ Kâo pơpŭ kơ Ama Kâo, laih anŭn ƀing gih ƀu pơpŭ kơ Kâo ôh. 
But I do not seek my own glory: there is he that seeks and judges. @ Kâo ƀu sem hơduah tơlơi ư-ang kơ Kâo pô ôh. Hmâo laih Pô sem hơduah kơ tơlơi anŭn laih anŭn jing Pô phat kơđi. 
Verily, verily, I say unto you, If any one shall keep my word, he shall never see death. @ Sĭt biă mă Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, tơdah hlơi pô gưt boh pơhiăp Kâo ñu ƀu či djai ôh.”
The Jews therefore said to him, Now we know that thou hast a demon. Abraham has died, and the prophets, and thou sayest, If any one keep my word, he shall never taste death. @ Ƀing ană Yuđa laĭ: “Ră anai gơmơi thâo kơ Ih jing sa čô yang sat ngă. Abraham djai laih, ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo ăt djai laih mơ̆n, samơ̆ Ih laĭ: ‘Tơdah hlơi pô gưt kơ boh pơhiăp Kâo ñu ƀu či djai ôh!’ 
Art thou greater than our father Abraham, who has died? and the prophets have died: whom makest thou thyself? @ Ih jing Pô prŏng hloh kơ Abraham, ama gơmơi pô hmâo djai laih mơ̆? Laih anŭn ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo ăt djai laih mơ̆n. Hlơi Ih pơmĭn Ih jing?”
Jesus answered, If I glorify myself, my glory is nothing: it is my Father who glorifies me, [of] whom ye say, He is our God. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Tơdah Kâo pơ-ư pơang kơ Kâo pô, tơlơi ư-ang kơ Kâo pô anŭn jing đôč đač. Ama Kâo yơh jing pô pơ-ư pơang Kâo. Kơ Pô anŭn ƀing gih hmâo laĭ laih jing Ơi Adai kơ ƀing gih. 
And ye know him not; but I know him; and if I said, I know him not, I should be like you, a liar. But I know him, and I keep his word. @ Ƀing gih ƀu thâo krăn Ñu ôh, samơ̆ Kâo thâo krăn Ñu. Tơdah Kâo laĭ Kâo ƀu thâo krăn Ñu ôh, Kâo ăt pơhiăp ƀlor kar hăng ƀing gih mơ̆n; samơ̆ Kâo thâo krăn Ñu sĭt, hăng djă pioh boh pơhiăp Ñu. 
Your father Abraham exulted in that he should see my day, and he saw and rejoiced. @ Abraham ama ƀing gih hơ̆k mơak biă mă čang rơmang dưi ƀuh rơnŭk Kâo. Ñu hmâo ƀuh laih hăng hơ̆k kơdơ̆k biă mă.”
The Jews therefore said to him, Thou hast not yet fifty years, and hast thou seen Abraham? @ Ƀing Yuđa laĭ kơ Ñu: “Ih aka hmâo rơma pluh thŭn ôh, hyư̆m Ih ƀuh Abraham laih hă?”
Jesus said to them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Before Abraham was, I am. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Sĭt biă mă Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, hlâo kơ hmâo Abraham, hmâo Kâo laih.”
They took up therefore stones that they might cast [them] at him; but Jesus hid himself and went out of the temple, [going through the midst of them, and thus passed on.] @ Hnŭn yơh gơñu mă boh pơtâo kiăng glŏm Yêsu; samơ̆ Yêsu sek đuaĭ hăng tơbiă hĭ mơ̆ng sang kơkuh pơpŭ.
And as he passed on, he saw a man blind from birth. @ Tơdang Yêsu rơbat nao, Ñu ƀuh sa čô mơnuih bum mơta mơ̆ng hrơi amĭ tơkeng. 
And his disciples asked him, saying, Rabbi, who sinned, this [man] or his parents, that he should be born blind? @ Ƀing ding kơna tơña kơ Yêsu: “Ơ Nai, tơlơi soh hlơi ngă kơ ñu bum mơta anai; tơlơi soh ñu, ƀôdah tơlơi soh amĭ ama ñu?”
Jesus answered, Neither has this [man] sinned nor his parents, but that the works of God should be manifested in him. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Ƀu djơ̆ yua kơ tơlơi ñu ƀôdah tơlơi soh amĭ ama ñu ôh, samơ̆ kiăng kơ bruă Ơi Adai dưi pơrơđah amăng ñu. 
I must work the works of him that has sent me while it is day. [The] night is coming, when no one can work. @ Tơdang dŏ tơhrơi khŏm ƀing ta mă bruă bĕ kơ Pô pơkiaŏ rai Kâo; tơ mlam truh hlăk anŭn ƀu hmâo hlơi dưi mă bruă ôh. 
As long as I am in the world, I am [the] light of the world. @ Tơdang Kâo dŏ amăng lŏn tơnah, Kâo jing tơlơi bơngač kơ lŏn tơnah.”
Having said these things, he spat on the ground and made mud of the spittle, and put the mud, as ointment, on his eyes. @ Pơhiăp giơ̆ng, Yêsu kơčuh ia bah ƀơi lŏn, lŭk lŏn hăng ia bah Ñu jing hlŭ, laih anŭn pik ƀơi mơta pô bum anŭn. 
And he said to him, Go, wash in the pool of Siloam, which is interpreted, Sent. He went therefore and washed, and came seeing. @ Laih anŭn laĭ kơ gơ̆: “Nao rao bĕ pơ dơnao ia Silôê.” (Silôê kiăng pia “Arăng Pơkiaŏ Nao”). Tui anŭn gơ̆ nao rao laih anŭn wơ̆t glaĭ thâo ƀuh mơtam yơh.
The neighbours therefore, and those who used to see him before, that he was a beggar, said, Is not this he that was sitting and begging? @ Ƀing jum dar hăng ƀing hmâo ƀuh gơ̆ hlâo anŭn jing mơnuih rơkâo dan, laĭ: “Djơ̆ mơ̆ mơnuih anai jing pô juăt dŏ ber rơkâo gơnam arăng?”
Some said, It is he; others said, No, but he is like him: *he* said, It is I. @ Hmâo mơnuih laĭ: “Ơ, ñu yơh;” ƀing pơkŏn laĭ: “Ƀu djơ̆ ôh, samơ̆ lăng ñu hrup hăng pô anŭn.” Pô bum laĭ: “Kâo gơ̆ yơh.” 
They said therefore to him, How have thine eyes been opened? @ Gơñu tơña kơ gơ̆: “Tui anŭn hyư̆m mơta ih dưi ƀuh?” 
He answered [and said], A man called Jesus made mud and anointed mine eyes, and said to me, Go to Siloam and wash: and having gone and washed, I saw. @ Gơ̆ laĭ glaĭ: “Sa čô mơnuih anăn ñu Yêsu, hmâo lŭk hlŭ pik ƀơi mơta kâo hăng pơđar kâo: ‘Nao rao bĕ pơ ia dơnao Silôê.’ Tui anŭn kâo nao rao laih anŭn thâo ƀuh yơh.” 
They said therefore to him, Where is he? He says, I do not know. @ Gơñu tơña: “Pơpă ñu lĕ?” Ñu laĭ glaĭ: “Kâo ƀu thâo ôh.”
They bring him who was before blind to the Pharisees. @ Gơñu ba pô bum mơta hlâo dih nao pơ ƀing Pharisi. 
Now it was sabbath when Jesus made the mud and opened his eyes. @ Hrơi Yêsu lŭk hlŭ hăng pơsuaih mơta pô bum anŭn jing hrơi saƀat. 
The Pharisees therefore also again asked him how he received his sight. And he said to them, He put mud upon mine eyes, and I washed, and I see. @ Tui anŭn ƀing Pharisi tơña dơ̆ng kơ pô bum anŭn hyư̆m mơta ñu dưi thâo ƀuh. Pô bum laĭ glaĭ: “Ñu pik hlŭ ƀơi mơta kâo, kâo rao laih anŭn kâo thâo ƀuh yơh.”
Some of the Pharisees therefore said, This man is not of God, for he does not keep the sabbath. Others said, How can a sinful man perform such signs? And there was a division among them. @ Hmâo mơnuih amăng ƀing Pharisi laĭ: “Mơnuih anai ƀu djơ̆ rai mơ̆ng Ơi Adai ôh, yua kơ ñu ƀu gưt tui tơlơi juăt hrơi saƀat ôh.”
Samơ̆ ƀing pơkŏn laĭ: “Hyư̆m sa čô mơnuih soh dưi ngă tơlơi mơsêh mơyang kar hăng anŭn lĕ?” Laih anŭn hmâo tơlơi kah pơpha tơdruă gơñu.
They say therefore again to the blind [man], What dost thou say of him, that he has opened thine eyes? And he said, He is a prophet. @ Tui anŭn gơñu tơña kơ pô bum anŭn dơ̆ng: “Bơ ih, hyư̆m ih laĭ kơ ñu jing, yua kơ ñu hmâo pơsuaih mơta ih.”
Ñu laĭ glaĭ: “Ñu jing sa čô pô laĭ lui hlâo.”
The Jews therefore did not believe concerning him that he was blind and had received sight, until they had called the parents of him that had received sight. @ Samơ̆ ƀing khua ană Yuđa ƀu đaŏ ôh pô anŭn hlâo adih bum mơta, samơ̆ ră anai thâo ƀuh glaĭ, tơl gơñu iâu amĭ ama gơ̆ rai, 
And they asked them saying, This is your son, of whom ye say that he was born blind: how then does he now see? @ gơñu tơña kơ amĭ ama gơ̆: “Djơ̆ mơ̆ anai jing ană đah rơkơi ƀing gih, jing pô bum mơta mơ̆ng hrơi amĭ tơkeng? Tui anŭn hyư̆m ră anai ñu thâo ƀuh lĕ?”
His parents answered [them] and said, We know that this is our son, and that he was born blind; @ Amĭ ama ñu laĭ glaĭ: “Gơmơi thâo anai jing ană đah rơkơi gơmơi, ñu bum mơta mơ̆ng hrơi tơkeng. 
but how he now sees we do not know, or who has opened his eyes we do not know. *He* is of age: ask *him*; *he* will speak concerning himself. @ Samơ̆ gơmơi ƀu thâo ôh hyư̆m ră anai ñu thâo ƀuh. Kŏn gơmơi thâo lơi hlơi pô hmâo pơsuaih brơi ñu. Tơña kơ ñu pô bĕ; ñu tha laih, ñu pô dưi ră ruai kơ ƀing gih.”
