His parents said these things because they feared the Jews, for the Jews had already agreed that if any one confessed him [to be the] Christ, he should be excommunicated from the synagogue. @ Amĭ ama ñu laĭ tui anŭn yua kơ gơñu hwĭ kơ ƀing khua ană Yuđa; yua kơ ƀing khua Yuđa hmâo tŭ ư hrŏm hơbĭt laih tơdah hlơi pô pơhaih hăng đaŏ kơ Yêsu jing Yang Krist, arăng či puh pơđuaĭ hĭ pô anŭn mơ̆ng sang bơjơnum. 
On this account his parents said, He is of age: ask *him*. @ Yua kơ anŭn yơh amĭ ama ñu laĭ: “Ñu tha laih, tơña ñu bĕ!”
They called therefore a second time the man who had been blind, and said to him, Give glory to God: we know that this man is sinful. @ Gơñu iâu pô bum mơ̆ng hrơi amĭ tơkeng tal dua dơ̆ng hăng laĭ: “Brơi ih pơpŭ bơni kơ Ơi Adai bĕ! Gơmơi thâo mơnuih anŭn jing mơnuih soh.”
He answered therefore, If he is sinful I know not. One thing I know, that, being blind [before], now I see. @ Ñu laĭ glaĭ: “Kâo ƀu thâo ôh Ñu jing mơnuih soh, ƀôdah ƀu soh. Kâo kơnơ̆ng thâo sa tơlơi, hlâo adih kâo bum, ră anai kâo thâo ƀuh.”
And they said to him again, What did he do to thee? how opened he thine eyes? @ Gơñu tơña dơ̆ng: “Hơgĕt ñu hmâo ngă laih kơ ih? Hyư̆m ñu hmâo pơsuaih laih mơta ih?”
He answered them, I told you already and ye did not hear: why do ye desire to hear again? do ye also wish to become his disciples? @ Gơ̆ laĭ glaĭ: “Kâo hmâo laĭ laih kơ ƀing gih, samơ̆ ƀing gih ƀu kiăng hmư̆ ôh, hyư̆m ƀing gih kiăng hmư̆ dơ̆ng hă? Djơ̆ mơ̆ ƀing gih ăt kiăng jing ding kơna Ñu?”
They railed at him, and said, Thou art his disciple, but we are disciples of Moses. @ Gơñu djik djak kơ gơ̆ hăng laĭ: “Ŏng yơh jing ding kơna ñu, gơmơi jing ding kơna Môis. 
We know that God spoke to Moses; but [as to] this [man], we know not whence he is. @ Ƀing gơmơi thâo Ơi Adai hmâo pơhiăp laih hăng Môis, samơ̆ kơ pô anai gơmơi ƀu thâo ôh mơ̆ng pơpă ñu tơbiă rai.”
The man answered and said to them, Now in this is a wonderful thing, that *ye* do not know whence he is, and he has opened mine eyes. @ Pô bum laĭ glaĭ: “Aƀơih, kâo kơtuă hling biă mă! Ƀing gih ƀu thâo ôh mơ̆ng pơpă ñu tơbiă rai, samơ̆ ñu hmâo pơsuaih laih mơta kâo. 
[But] we know that God does not hear sinners; but if any one be God-fearing and do his will, him he hears. @ Ƀing ta thâo Ơi Adai ƀu hmư̆ ôh hiăp ƀing mơnuih soh, samơ̆ hlơi pô hwĭ pơpŭ kơ Ơi Adai laih anŭn ngă tui tơlơi Ñu kiăng, pô anŭn yơh Ơi Adai hmư̆. 
Since time was, it has not been heard that any one opened the eyes of one born blind. @ Čơdơ̆ng mơ̆ng phŭn hmâo lŏn tơnah arăng aka hmư̆ ôh kơ sa čô mơnuih dưi pơsuaih mơta mơnuih bum mơ̆ng hrơi amĭ tơkeng. 
If this [man] were not of God he would be able to do nothing. @ Tơdah pô anai ƀu tơbiă rai mơ̆ng Ơi Adai, Ñu ƀu dưi ngă hơgĕt gĕt ôh.”
They answered and said to him, Thou hast been wholly born in sins, and thou teachest us? And they cast him out. @ Gơñu laĭ kơ gơ̆: “Arăng hmâo tơkeng laih ŏng amăng tơlơi soh, samơ̆ ŏng kiăng pơtô gơmơi hă?” Laih anŭn gơñu puh pơđuaĭ hĭ gơ̆ mơ̆ng sang bơjơnum.
Jesus heard that they had cast him out, and having found him, he said to him, Thou, dost thou believe on the Son of God? @ Yêsu hmư̆ gơñu hmâo puh pơđuaĭ hĭ laih gơ̆ mơ̆ng sang bơjơnum. Yêsu nao bưp gơ̆ hăng laĭ: “Ih đaŏ kơ Ană Mơnuih mơ̆?”
He answered and said, And who is he, Lord, that I may believe on him? @ Gơ̆ laĭ glaĭ: “Ơ khua, hlơi Ñu anŭn, kiăng kơ kâo dưi đaŏ kơ Ñu?”
And Jesus said to him, Thou hast both seen him, and he that speaks with thee is he. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ ñu: “Ih hmâo ƀuh Ñu laih, laih anŭn Ñu yơh pô pơhiăp hăng ih ră anai.”
And he said, I believe, Lord: and he did him homage. @ Gơ̆ laĭ: “Ơ Khua, kâo đaŏ.” Laih anŭn ñu bon kơkuh ƀơi anăp Yêsu.
And Jesus said, For judgment am I come into this world, that they which see not may see, and they which see may become blind. @ Yêsu laĭ: “Kâo hmâo rai laih pơ lŏn tơnah kiăng phat kơđi, kiăng kơ mơnuih bum dưi thâo ƀuh, laih anŭn mơnuih thâo ƀuh jing hĭ bum mơta.”
And [some] of the Pharisees who were with him heard these things, and they said to him, Are we blind also? @ Đơđa ƀing Pharisi dŏ giăm Ñu hmư̆ tơlơi anŭn, laih anŭn gơñu tơña kơ Yêsu: “Hyư̆m ƀing gơmơi ăt jing mơnuih bum mơ̆n hă?”
Jesus said to them, If ye were blind ye would not have sin; but now ye say, We see, your sin remains. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Tơdah ƀing gih bum mơta, ƀing gih ƀu hmâo tơlơi soh ôh; samơ̆ yua kơ ƀing gih laĭ: ‘Gơmơi ƀuh,’ tui anŭn yơh tơlơi soh ƀing gih ăt dŏ.”
Verily, verily, I say to you, He that enters not in by the door to the fold of the sheep, but mounts up elsewhere, *he* is a thief and a robber; @ “Kâo laĭ sĭt biă mă kơ ƀing gih, hlơi pô ƀu mŭt ôh mơ̆ng bah amăng war triu samơ̆ ñu đĭ mŭt ƀơi jơlan pơkŏn, pô anŭn jing sa čô mơnuih klĕ dŏp. 
but he that enters in by the door is [the] shepherd of the sheep. @ Samơ̆ pô mŭt mơ̆ng bah amăng war triu, ñu anŭn jing pô wai triu. 
To him the porter opens; and the sheep hear his voice; and he calls his own sheep by name, and leads them out. @ Pô gak wai bah amăng či pŏk bah amăng kơ ñu, khul triu hmư̆ asăp ñu, pô wai iâu anăn triu ñu hăng ba tơbiă pơ gah rơngiao. 
When he has put forth all his own, he goes before them, and the sheep follow him, because they know his voice. @ Tơ pô wai ba tơbiă abih bang triu pơ gah rơngiao laih, ñu nao hlâo laih anŭn khul triu tui klon, yua kơ khul triu thâo krăn hiăp ñu. 
But they will not follow a stranger, but will flee from him, because they know not the voice of strangers. @ Khul triu ƀu đuaĭ tui ƀing mơnuih tuai ôh, kơđai glaĭ, gơñu đuaĭ kơdŏp yua kơ gơñu ƀu thâo krăn hiăp ƀing djuai tuai ôh.”
This allegory spoke Jesus to them, but they did not know what it was [of] which he spoke to them. @ Yêsu pơhiăp tơlơi bơhmutu anai kơ gơñu samơ̆ gơñu ƀu thâo hluh ôh hơgĕt tơlơi Yêsu kiăng laĭ kơ gơñu.
Jesus therefore said again to them, Verily, verily, I say to you, I am the door of the sheep. @ Hnŭn yơh Yêsu pơhiăp dơ̆ng kơ gơñu: “Kâo laĭ sĭt biă mă kơ ƀing gih, Kâo jing bah amăng kơ triu. 
All whoever came before me are thieves and robbers; but the sheep did not hear them. @ Abih bang mơnuih rai hlâo kơ Kâo jing ƀing mơnuih klĕ dŏp soh sel, samơ̆ khul triu ƀu hmư̆ gơñu ôh. 
I am the door: if any one enter in by me, he shall be saved, and shall go in and shall go out and shall find pasture. @ Kâo jing bah amăng. Hlơi pô mŭt mơ̆ng Kâo ñu či dưi klaih, gơñu či mŭt laih anŭn tơbiă, bưp tơdrŏn rơ̆k mơda. 
The thief comes not but that he may steal, and kill, and destroy: I am come that they might have life, and might have [it] abundantly. @ Pô klĕ dŏp rai kơnơ̆ng kiăng kơ klĕ, pơdjai hăng pơrai hĭ triu. Samơ̆ Kâo hmâo rai laih kiăng kơ triu hmâo tơlơi hơdip, laih anŭn hmâo tơlơi hơdip rơbeh blai.”
I am the good shepherd. The good shepherd lays down his life for the sheep: @ “Kâo jing pô wai triu hiam klă. Pô wai triu hiam klă rơngiă tơlơi hơdip Ñu yua kơ khul triu ñu. 
but he who serves for wages, and who is not the shepherd, whose own the sheep are not, sees the wolf coming, and leaves the sheep and flees; and the wolf seizes them and scatters the sheep. @ Pô wai arăng apah ñu ƀu djơ̆ pô wai triu ôh, khul triu ƀu lơ̆m kơ ñu ôh, yua kơ anŭn yơh tơ ñu ƀuh asâo tan rai ñu lui hĭ khul triu hăng đuaĭ kơdŏp. Asâo glai kĕ pơrai hăng pơčơlah hĭ bru bra. 
Now he who serves for wages flees because he serves for wages, and is not himself concerned about the sheep. @ Pô wai apah dŏp yua kơ ñu kơnơ̆ng jing pô wai arăng apah, hnŭn yơh ñu ƀu bơngơ̆t kơ khul triu ôh. 
I am the good shepherd; and I know those that are mine, and am known of those that are mine, @ Kâo jing pô wai triu hiam klă. Kâo thâo krăn khul triu Kâo, laih anŭn triu Kâo thâo krăn Kâo, 
as the Father knows me and I know the Father; and I lay down my life for the sheep. @ kar hăng Ama thâo krăn Kâo, laih anŭn Kâo thâo krăn Ama; Kâo pơsăn lui tơlơi hơdip Kâo yua kơ khul triu. 
And I have other sheep which are not of this fold: those also I must bring, and they shall hear my voice; and there shall be one flock, one shepherd. @ Kâo dŏ hmâo khul triu pơkŏn dơ̆ng, gơñu aka dŏ amăng war anai ôh. Kâo ăt khŏm ba gơñu glaĭ mơ̆n. Khul triu anŭn či hmư̆ hiăp Kâo, tui anŭn kơnơ̆ng či hmâo sa khul triu hăng sa čô pô wai đôč.
On this account the Father loves me, because I lay down my life that I may take it again. @ Ama khăp kơ Kâo, yua kơ Kâo pơsăn lui tơlơi hơdip Kâo, kiăng kơ Kâo dưi mă glaĭ dơ̆ng. 
No one takes it from me, but I lay it down of myself. I have authority to lay it down and I have authority to take it again. I have received this commandment of my Father. @ Ƀu hmâo hlơi dưi mă lui hĭ tơlơi hơdip Kâo ôh, samơ̆ Kâo pơsăn hĭ Kâo pô tui hăng kâo pô kiăng, Kâo hmâo tơlơi dưi pơsăn lui ñu laih anŭn hmâo tơlơi dưi mă glaĭ. Kâo hmâo mă tŭ tơlơi pơtă anai mơ̆ng Ama Kâo.”
There was a division again among the Jews on account of these words; @ Sa wơ̆t dơ̆ng, yua kơ tơlơi pơhiăp anŭn hmâo tơlơi pơkah tơdruă tơ̆ng krah ƀing ană Yuđa. 
but many of them said, He has a demon and raves; why do ye hear him? @ Lu amăng ƀing ană Yuđa laĭ: “Ñu hmâo yang sat ngă, ñu jing hưt, hyư̆m ƀing gih kiăng dŏ hmư̆ ñu lĕ?”
Others said, These sayings are not [those] of one that is possessed by a demon. Can a demon open blind people's eyes? @ Samơ̆ đơđa ƀing pơkŏn laĭ: “Tơlơi pơhiăp anŭn ƀu djơ̆ mơ̆ng sa čô yang sat ngă ôh. Yang sat dưi pơsuaih sa čô mơnuih bum mơta mơ̆n hă?”
Now the feast of the dedication was celebrating at Jerusalem, and it was winter. @ Hlăk anŭn pơ plei Yêrusalem amăng bơyan puih hmâo phĕt pơhơdơr kơ hrơi pơyơr Sang Kơkuh Pơpŭ. 
And Jesus walked in the temple in the porch of Solomon. @ Yêsu rơbat ngui amăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ ƀơi adring Salômôn. 
The Jews therefore surrounded him, and said to him, Until when dost thou hold our soul in suspense? If thou art the Christ, say [so] to us openly. @ Ƀing Yuđa pơƀŭt jum dar Ñu hăng tơña kơ Ñu: “Hơdôm sui dơ̆ng Ih či lui gơmơi dŏ čang tơguan? Tơdah Ih jing Krist, brơi Ih pơhiăp klă rơđah kơ gơmơi bĕ.”
Jesus answered them, I told you, and ye do not believe. The works which I do in my Father's name, these bear witness concerning me: @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Kâo hmâo laĭ laih kơ ƀing gih, samơ̆ ƀing gih ƀu đaŏ ôh. Hơdôm bruă Kâo hmâo ngă amăng anăn Ama Kâo, bruă anŭn ngă gơ̆ng jơlan brơi kơ Kâo. 
but ye do not believe, for ye are not of my sheep, as I told you. @ Samơ̆ ƀing gih ƀu đaŏ, yua kơ ƀing gih ƀu djơ̆ khul triu Kâo ôh. 
My sheep hear my voice, and I know them, and they follow me; @ Khul triu Kâo hmư̆ hiăp Kâo, Kâo thâo krăn gơñu, laih anŭn gơñu đuaĭ tui Kâo. 
and I give them life eternal; and they shall never perish, and no one shall seize them out of my hand. @ Kâo pha brơi kơ gơñu tơlơi hơdip hlŏng lar, laih anŭn gơñu ƀu či răm rai hĭ ôh, laih anŭn ƀu hmâo hlơi dưi sua mă gơñu mơ̆ng tơngan Kâo lơi. 
My Father who has given [them] to me is greater than all, and no one can seize out of the hand of my Father. @ Ama Kâo jing pô hmâo pha brơi laih gơñu kơ Kâo, Ñu jing prŏng hloh kơ abih bang, laih anŭn ƀu hmâo hlơi pô dưi sua mă gơñu mơ̆ng tơngan Ama Kâo ôh. 
I and the Father are one. @ Kâo hăng Ama Kâo jing sa.”
The Jews therefore again took stones that they might stone him. @ Ƀing ană Yuđa mă boh pơtâo dơ̆ng kiăng glŏm pơdjai Yêsu. 
Jesus answered them, Many good works have I shewn you of my Father; for which work of them do ye stone me? @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Kâo hmâo pơrơđah laih kơ ƀing gih lu bruă hiam mơ̆ng Ama. Djơ̆ mơ̆ yua kơ bruă anŭn ƀing gih kiăng glŏm boh pơtâo kơ Kâo?”
The Jews answered him, For a good work we stone thee not, but for blasphemy, and because thou, being a man, makest thyself God. @ Ƀing ană Yuđa laĭ glaĭ: “Ƀu djơ̆ yua kơ bruă hiam ôh gơmơi kiăng glŏm boh pơtâo kơ Ih, samơ̆ yua kơ tơlơi Ih pơhiăp pơgao hmiah hăng Ơi Adai. Ih kơnơ̆ng jing ană mơnuih đôč samơ̆ Ih pơjing pô Ih jing Ơi Adai.”
Jesus answered them, Is it not written in your law, I said, Ye are gods? @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă arăng hmâo čih laih amăng tơlơi juăt ƀing gih: ‘Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih jing ƀing yang’? 
If he called *them* gods to whom the word of God came (and the scripture cannot be broken), @ Tơdah tơlơi juăt laĭ ƀing mă tŭ Boh Ơi Adai Pơhiăp jing ƀing yang, (laih anŭn Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp hmâo čih laih ƀu dưi pơplih ôh), 
do ye say of him whom the Father has sanctified and sent into the world, Thou blasphemest, because I said, I am Son of God? @ Bơ Kâo, jing pô Ama hmâo pơkah pioh kơ rơgoh hiam hăng pơkiaŏ rai amăng lŏn tơnah. Hyư̆m ƀing gih laĭ Kâo pơhiăp pơgao hmiah hăng Ơi Adai, tơdah Kâo laĭ: ‘Kâo jing Ană Ơi Adai lĕ?’ 
If I do not the works of my Father, believe me not; @ Tơdah kâo ƀu ngă ôh khul bruă Ama Kâo, ƀing gih anăm đaŏ kơ Kâo ôh. 
but if I do, even if ye believe not me, believe the works, that ye may know [and believe] that the Father is in me and I in him. @ Bơ tơdah Kâo ngă bruă Ama Kâo, wơ̆t dah ƀing gih ƀu đaŏ kơ Kâo tŭ mơ̆n, samơ̆ đaŏ bĕ kơ bruă Kâo hmâo ngă, kiăng kơ ƀing gih dưi thâo hăng hluh kơ Ama dŏ amăng Kâo laih anŭn Kâo dŏ amăng Ama.”
They sought therefore again to take him; and he went away from out of their hand @ Gơñu kiăng mă čaŏ Yêsu dơ̆ng, samơ̆ Yêsu klaih hĭ mơ̆ng tơngan gơñu.
and departed again beyond the Jordan to the place where John was baptising at the first: and he abode there. @ Yêsu găn nao pơ hang gah adih ia krong Yurdan dơ̆ng ƀơi anih Yôhan ngă ƀatem blŭng hlâo, laih anŭn Ñu dŏ pơ anŭn. 
And many came to him, and said, John did no sign; but all things which John said of this [man] were true. @ Lu mơnuih nao pơ Yêsu, gơñu laĭ: “Yôhan ƀu hmâo ngă sa mơta tơlơi mơsêh mơyang ôh, samơ̆ abih bang tơlơi Yôhan hmâo ngă gơ̆ng jơlan kơ mơnuih anai jing sĭt.” 
And many believed on him there. @ Pơ anŭn hmâo lu mơnuih đaŏ kơ Yêsu.
Now there was a certain [man] sick, Lazarus of Bethany, of the village of Mary and Martha her sister. @ Hmâo sa čô mơnuih ruă anăn ñu Lasar, plei Bêthani, jing plei HʼMari hăng amai ñu HʼMart. 
It was [the] Mary who anointed the Lord with ointment and wiped his feet with her hair, whose brother Lazarus was sick. @ HʼMari anŭn yơh jing pô hmâo pik ia klôñ ƀâu hiam ƀơi tơkai Khua Yang laih anŭn sut tơkai Khua Yang hăng ƀuk ñu. Ayŏng ñu Lasar dŏ ruă. 
The sisters therefore sent to him, saying, Lord, behold, he whom thou lovest is sick. @ Tui anŭn dua adơi amai ñu pơkiaŏ mơnuih nao laĭ pơthâo kơ Yêsu hăng laĭ: “Ơ Khua, pô Ih khăp dŏ ruă.”
But when Jesus heard [it], he said, This sickness is not unto death, but for the glory of God, that the Son of God may be glorified by it. @ Samơ̆ tơ Yêsu hmư̆ tơlơi anŭn, Ñu laĭ: “Tơlơi ruă anai ƀu truh kơ djai ôh, samơ̆ yua kơ tơlơi guh kơang kơ Ơi Adai, kiăng kơ Ană Ơi Adai dưi hmâo tơlơi ư-ang yua kơ tơlơi anŭn.”
Now Jesus loved Martha, and her sister, and Lazarus. @ Yêsu khăp kơ HʼMart, HʼMari adơi ñu, laih anŭn Lasar. 
When therefore he heard, He is sick, he remained two days then in the place where he was. @ Tơ Ñu hmư̆ Lasar dŏ ruă, Ñu dŏ glaĭ dua hrơi dơ̆ng pơ anih Ñu hlăk dŏ anŭn. 
Then after this he says to his disciples, Let us go into Judaea again. @ Giơ̆ng rơgao hĭ dua hrơi anŭn Ñu laĭ kơ ƀing ding kơna Ñu: “Brơi ƀing ta wơ̆t glaĭ pơ tring Yuđa dơ̆ng.”
The disciples say to him, Rabbi, [even but] now the Jews sought to stone thee, and goest thou thither again? @ Ƀing ding kơna Ñu laĭ: “Ơ Nai, ƀing ană Yuđa phrâo kiăng glŏm Ih hăng boh pơtâo, hyư̆m Ih kiăng wơ̆t glaĭ pơ anŭn dơ̆ng lĕ?”
Jesus answered, Are there not twelve hours in the day? If any one walk in the day, he does not stumble, because he sees the light of this world; @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă hmâo pluh dua mông amăng sa hrơi? Tơdah hlơi pô rơbat hlăk tơhrơi ñu ƀu tơhnač ôh, yua kơ ñu ƀuh tơlơi bơngač lŏn tơnah anai. 
but if any one walk in the night, he stumbles, because the light is not in him. @ Samơ̆ tơdah ñu rơbat amăng mlam, ñu či tơhnač, yua kơ tơlơi bơngač ƀu dŏ amăng ñu ôh.” 
These things said he; and after this he says to them, Lazarus, our friend, is fallen asleep, but I go that I may awake him out of sleep. @ Giơ̆ng Yêsu pơhiăp tui anŭn, Ñu laĭ dơ̆ng kơ ƀing gơ̆: “Lasar giăng mah ƀing ta pĭt yơh, samơ̆ Kâo nao kiăng râo mơdưh ñu.”
The disciples therefore said to him, Lord, if he be fallen asleep, he will get well. @ Ƀing ding kơna laĭ: “Ơ Khua, tơdah ñu pĭt, sĭt ñu či suaih yơh.”
But Jesus spoke of his death, but *they* thought that he spoke of the rest of sleep. @ Yêsu pơhiăp kơ tơlơi gơ̆ djai yơh, samơ̆ gơñu pơmĭn Yêsu pơhiăp kơ tơlơi pĭt pơdơi đôč. 
Jesus therefore then said to them plainly, Lazarus has died. @ Tui anŭn Yêsu pơhiăp klă rơđah kơ gơñu: “Lasar djai yơh; 
And I rejoice on your account that I was not there, in order that ye may believe. But let us go to him. @ samơ̆ yua kơ ƀing gih yơh Kâo mơak yua kơ Kâo ƀu dŏ pơ anŭn ôh, kiăng kơ ƀing gih dưi đaŏ. Brơi ƀing ta nao pơ ñu bĕ.”
Thomas therefore, called Didymus, said to his fellow disciples, Let *us* also go, that we may die with him. @ Thômas, anăn pơkŏn dơ̆ng Didim, laĭ kơ ƀing ding kơna pơkŏn: “Brơi kơ ƀing ta nao hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Ñu bĕ kiăng kơ ƀing ta dưi djai hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Ñu mơ̆n.”
Jesus therefore [on] arriving found him to have been four days already in the tomb. @ Tơ Yêsu truh, Ñu thâo kơ Lasar dŏ amăng pơsat pă hrơi laih. 
Now Bethany was near Jerusalem, about fifteen stadia off, @ Plei Bêthani ataih mơ̆ng plei Yêrusalem, năng ai klâo kilômet. 
and many of the Jews came to Martha and Mary, that they might console them concerning their brother. @ Hmâo lu ƀing ană Yuđa nao pơ HʼMart hăng HʼMari kiăng pơalum ƀing gơ̆ yua kơ ayŏng gơñu djai.
Martha then, when she heard Jesus is coming, went to meet him; but Mary sat in the house. @ Tơ HʼMart hmư̆ Yêsu rai, gơ̆ đuaĭ nao bưp Ñu tơdang HʼMari dŏ pơ sang. 
Martha therefore said to Jesus, Lord, if thou hadst been here, my brother had not died; @ HʼMart laĭ kơ Yêsu: “Ơ Khua, tơdah hmâo Ih pơ anai ayŏng kâo ƀu djai ôh. 
but even now I know, that whatsoever thou shalt ask of God, God will give thee. @ Samơ̆ wơ̆t ră anai kâo thâo hơgĕt tơlơi Ih rơkâo kơ Ơi Adai, Ơi Adai či brơi kơ Ih.” 
Jesus says to her, Thy brother shall rise again. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơ̆: “Ayŏng ih či hơdip glaĭ.”
Martha says to him, I know that he will rise again in the resurrection in the last day. @ HʼMart laĭ kơ Ñu: “Kâo thâo kơ gơ̆ či hơdip glaĭ amăng tơlơi hơdip glaĭ ƀơi hrơi đŭt tơdơi.”
Jesus said to her, I am the resurrection and the life: he that believes on me, though he have died, shall live; @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơ̆: “Kâo jing tơlơi hơdip glaĭ laih anŭn tơlơi hơdip. Hlơi pô đaŏ kơ Kâo, ñu či hơdip, wơ̆t dah ñu djai laih; 
and every one who lives and believes on me shall never die. Believest thou this? @ Laih anŭn hlơi pô dŏ hơdip đaŏ kơ Kâo, ñu ƀu či djai ôh. Ih đaŏ tơlơi anŭn mơ̆?”
She says to him, Yea, Lord; I believe that thou art the Christ, the Son of God, who should come into the world. @ HʼMart laĭ glaĭ: “Sĭt, Ơ Khua, kâo đaŏ Ih jing Yang Krist, Ană Ơi Adai, Pô khŏm rai amăng lŏn tơnah.”
And having said this, she went away and called her sister Mary secretly, saying, The teacher is come and calls thee. @ Giơ̆ng kơ HʼMart laĭ tơlơi anai, gơ̆ nao iâu HʼMari adơi ñu, hăng hiăp pơhač: “Nai rai pơ anai yơh, Ñu iâu ih.” 
She, when she heard [that], rises up quickly and comes to him. @ Tơ HʼMari hmư̆ tơlơi anŭn, gơ̆ tơgŭ mơtam hăng nao pơ Yêsu. 
Now Jesus had not yet come into the village, but was in the place where Martha came to meet him. @ Hlăk anŭn Yêsu aka mŭt amăng plei ôh, samơ̆ Ñu ăt dŏ ƀơi anih HʼMart hmâo bưp Ñu. 
The Jews therefore who were with her in the house and consoling her, seeing Mary that she rose up quickly and went out, followed her, saying, She goes to the tomb, that she may weep there. @ Tơ ƀing ană Yuđa amăng sang dŏ pơalum HʼMari ƀuh gơ̆ ječ meč hăng tơbiă nao, gơñu đuaĭ tui gơ̆, mĭn dah gơ̆ nao čŏk hia pơ pơsat.
Mary therefore, when she came where Jesus was, seeing him, fell at his feet, saying to him, Lord, if thou hadst been here, my brother had not died. @ Tơ HʼMari truh pơ anih Yêsu dŏ laih anŭn ƀuh Ñu, HʼMari glŏm ñu pô ƀơi tơkai Yêsu hăng laĭ: “Ơ Khua, tơdah hmâo Ih pơ anai, ayŏng kâo ƀu djai ôh.”
Jesus therefore, when he saw her weeping, and the Jews who came with her weeping, was deeply moved in spirit, and was troubled, @ Yêsu ƀuh HʼMari hia, laih anŭn ƀing ană Yuđa rai hrŏm hơbĭt hăng HʼMari ăt hia kar kaĭ mơ̆n, Ñu rơngot hơning hăng glưh pran jua. 
and said, Where have ye put him? They say to him, Lord, come and see. @ Ñu tơña: “Pơpă anih ƀing gih dơr gơ̆?”
Ƀing anŭn laĭ glaĭ kơ Ñu: “Ơ Khua, rai lăng bĕ.”
Jesus wept. @ Yêsu hia. 
The Jews therefore said, Behold how he loved him! @ Tui anŭn ƀing ană Yuđa laĭ: “Lăng bĕ, Ñu khăp biă mă kơ Lasar!”
And some of them said, Could not this [man], who has opened the eyes of the blind [man], have caused that this [man] also should not have died? @ Samơ̆ hmâo đơđa amăng ƀing gơñu laĭ: “Pô anai hmâo pơsuaih laih mơnuih bum mơta, hyư̆m Ñu ƀu dưi ôh hă ngă brơi pô anai ƀu djai?”
Jesus therefore, again deeply moved in himself, comes to the tomb. Now it was a cave, and a stone lay upon it. @ Sa wơ̆t dơ̆ng Yêsu glưh pran jua hăng nao pơ pơsat. Pơsat anŭn jing sa boh par, hmâo boh pơtâo kơđơ̆l hĭ. 
Jesus says, Take away the stone. Martha, the sister of the dead, says to him, Lord, he stinks already, for he is four days [there]. @ Yêsu pơđar: “Tơglung lui hĭ bĕ boh pơtâo anai.”
HʼMart jing adơi kơ pô djai anŭn laĭ: “Ơ Khua, ƀâu brŭ laih yơh, yua kơ ñu dŏ pơ anai pă hrơi laih.”
Jesus says to her, Did I not say to thee, that if thou shouldest believe, thou shouldest see the glory of God? @ Yêsu laĭ kơ HʼMart: “Hyư̆m kâo aka laĭ hăng ih ôh hă, tơdah ih đaŏ ih či ƀuh tơlơi guh kơang Ơi Adai?” 
They took therefore the stone away. And Jesus lifted up his eyes on high and said, Father, I thank thee that thou hast heard me; @ Tui anŭn gơñu tơglung hĭ boh pơtâo anŭn. Yêsu angak mơta hăng laĭ: “Ơ Ama, kâo bơni hơơč kơ Ih yua kơ Ih hmâo hmư̆ laih Kâo. 
but I knew that thou always hearest me; but on account of the crowd who stand around I have said [it], that they may believe that thou hast sent me. @ Kâo thâo Ih hmư̆ Kâo nanao, samơ̆ Kâo laĭ tơlơi anai yua kơ ƀing mơnuih dŏ jum dar anai, kiăng kơ gơñu dưi đaŏ kơ Ih Pô hmâo pơkiaŏ rai Kâo laih.” 
And having said this, he cried with a loud voice, Lazarus, come forth. @ Giơ̆ng Yêsu pơhiăp tui anŭn, Ñu iâu kraih tui anai: “Ơ Lasar, tơbiă bĕ!” 
And the dead came forth, bound feet and hands with graveclothes, and his face was bound round with a handkerchief. Jesus says to them, Loose him and let him go. @ Mơnuih djai tơbiă rai yơh, tơkai tơngan gơ̆ arăng pŏn hăng khăn, ƀô̆ Ñu arăng gom hăng sa blah khăn. Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Yaih brơi ñu bĕ, hăng brơi gơ̆ rơbat.”
Many therefore of the Jews who came to Mary and saw what he had done, believed on him; @ Hmâo lu ƀing ană Yuđa nao ngui pơalum HʼMari, hmâo ƀuh laih bruă Yêsu ngă, gơñu đaŏ kơ Yêsu. 
but some of them went to the Pharisees and told them what Jesus had done. @ Samơ̆ đơđa amăng ƀing anŭn nao pơ ƀing Pharisi hăng ră ruai brơi gơñu hơdôm tơlơi Yêsu hmâo ngă laih. 
The chief priests, therefore, and the Pharisees gathered a council, and said, What do we? for this man does many signs. @ Tui anŭn, ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng hăng ƀing Pharisi iâu pơƀŭt ƀing khua phat kơđi hăng laĭ: “Hơgĕt ƀing ta či ngă? Yua kơ pô anai ngă lu tơlơi mơsêh mơyang biă mă. 
If we let him thus alone, all will believe on him, and the Romans will come and take away both our place and our nation. @ Tơdah ƀing ta lui Ñu ăt ngă dơ̆ng, tui anŭn abih bang mơnuih či đaŏ kơ Ñu, laih anŭn ƀing Rôm či rai pơrai hĭ anih rơgoh hiam ƀing ta hăng pơdjai hĭ kơnŭng djuai ƀing ta.”
But a certain one of them, Caiaphas, being high priest that year, said to them, Ye know nothing @ Samơ̆ sa čô amăng ƀing gơñu, anăn ñu Kaip jing khua ngă yang prŏng hloh thŭn anŭn, laĭ kơ gơñu: “Ƀing gih ƀu thâo hluh sa mơta tơlơi ôh. 
nor consider that it is profitable for you that one man die for the people, and not that the whole nation perish. @ Ƀing gih ƀu thâo hluh ôh hă hiam hloh kơ ƀing gih hmâo sa čô mơnuih djai yua kơ abih bang ƀing ană plei hloh kơ abih bang kơnŭng djuai či răm rai.” 
But this he did not say of himself; but, being high priest that year, prophesied that Jesus was going to die for the nation; @ Ñu pơhiăp tơlơi anŭn ƀu djơ̆ tui hăng tơlơi pơmĭn ñu pô ôh, samơ̆ yua kơ ñu jing khua ngă yang prŏng hloh thŭn anŭn, ñu laĭ lui hlâo kơ Yêsu či djai yua kơ abih bang kơnŭng djuai ană Yuđa, 
and not for the nation only, but that he should also gather together into one the children of God who were scattered abroad. @ ƀu djơ̆ kơnơ̆ng kơ kơnŭng djuai ană Yuđa đôč ôh, samơ̆ ăt kiăng pơƀŭt glaĭ abih bang ƀing ană Ơi Adai hlăk bra hyu tar ƀar jing hĭ sa phung.
From that day therefore they took counsel that they might kill him. @ Mơ̆ng hrơi anŭn ƀing khua ngă yang črŏng sai hơduah jơlan kiăng pơdjai Yêsu. 
Jesus therefore walked no longer openly among the Jews, but went away thence into the country near the desert, to a city called Ephraim, and there he sojourned with the disciples. @ Yua kơ anŭn yơh, Yêsu ƀu dưi hyu hăng tơlơi rơngai dơ̆ng ôh tơ̆ng krah ƀing ană Yuđa, samơ̆ mơ̆ng anih anŭn Ñu nao pơ plei Êphraim jĕ tơdrŏn tač; laih anŭn Ñu dŏ pơ anŭn hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing ding kơna Ñu.
But the passover of the Jews was near, and many went up to Jerusalem out of the country before the passover, that they might purify themselves. @ Hrơi Phĕt Tơlơi Găn ƀing ană Yuđa jĕ truh, laih anŭn hmâo lu mơnuih mơ̆ng tring phara nao pơ plei Yêrusalem kiăng pơrơgoh gơñu pô hlâo kơ Hrơi phĕt Tơlơi Găn. 
They sought therefore Jesus, and said among themselves, standing in the temple, What do ye think? that he will not come to the feast? @ Gơñu hơduah sem Yêsu, laih anŭn tơdang gơñu dŏ dơ̆ng amăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ, gơñu bơlaĭ tơdruă: “Hyư̆m ƀing gih pơmĭn? Yêsu ƀu či rai ôh hă kơ tơlơi phĕt anai?” 
Now the chief priests and the Pharisees had given commandment that if any one knew where he was, he should make it known, that they might take him. @ Ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng hăng ƀing Pharisi hmâo pơtă laih hlơi pô thâo anih Yêsu dŏ, brơi pô anŭn laĭ brơi kơ gơñu thâo, kiăng kơ gơñu dưi mă čaŏ Yêsu.
Jesus therefore, six days before the passover, came to Bethany, where was the dead [man] Lazarus, whom Jesus raised from among [the] dead. @ Năm hrơi hlâo kơ phĕt Tơlơi Găn, Yêsu nao pơ Bêthani jing plei Lasar, pô Yêsu hmâo pơhơdip glaĭ mơ̆ng tơlơi djai. 
There therefore they made him a supper, and Martha served, but Lazarus was one of those at table with him. @ Pơ anŭn arăng pơkra mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă jum Yêsu. HʼMart buih bruă pŭ mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă, laih anŭn Lasar jing sa čô amăng ƀing dŏ ƀơ̆ng huă hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Ñu. 
Mary therefore, having taken a pound of ointment of pure nard of great price, anointed the feet of Jesus, and wiped his feet with her hair, and the house was filled with the odour of the ointment. @ Hlăk anŭn HʼMari mă sa mơkrah lit ia klôñ ngă hăng kơyâo nard sĭt, yom biă mă, pik tơkai Yêsu laih anŭn sut hăng ƀuk gơ̆, amăng sang bă hăng mơnâo ƀâu hiam. 
One of his disciples therefore, Judas [son] of Simon, Iscariote, who was about to deliver him up, says, @ Samơ̆ Yudas Iskariôt jing sa čô amăng ƀing ding kơna Yêsu (pô tơdơi anai či pơblư̆ lui Yêsu), ñu laĭ, 
Why was this ointment not sold for three hundred denarii and given to the poor? @ “Hyư̆m ƀu sĭ hĭ ia klôñ ƀâu hiam anŭn hăng nua klâo rơtuh đơniê laih anŭn pha brơi kơ ƀing mơnuih ƀun rin?” 
But he said this, not that he cared for the poor, but because he was a thief and had the bag, and carried what was put into [it]. @ Ñu laĭ tui anŭn ƀu djơ̆ yua kơ ñu bơngơ̆t kơ ƀing mơnuih ƀun rin ôh, samơ̆ yua kơ ñu jing mơnuih klĕ dŏp. Ñu jing pô djă kơdŭng prăk, hăng juăt kơđeo mă prăk arăng pioh amăng kơdŭng anŭn.
Jesus therefore said, Suffer her to have kept this for the day of my preparation for burial; @ Samơ̆ Yêsu laĭ: “Lui măk ai gơ̆ bĕ, ñu hmâo pioh ia klôñ ƀâu hiam anai kơ hrơi dơr kâo. 
for ye have the poor always with you, but me ye have not always. @ Ƀing gih dŏ hmâo mơnuih ƀun rin hrŏm hăng ƀing gih nanao, samơ̆ ƀing gih ƀu hmâo kâo nanao ôh.”
A great crowd therefore of the Jews knew that he was there; and they came, not because of Jesus only, but also that they might see Lazarus whom he raised from among [the] dead. @ Sa phung lu ƀing ană Yuđa hmâo hmư̆ Yêsu pơ Bêthani, anŭn yơh gơñu rai, ƀu djơ̆ kơnơ̆ng yua kơ Yêsu pơ anŭn đôč ôh samơ̆ ăt kiăng lăng Lasar mơ̆n, pô Yêsu hmâo pơhơdip glaĭ laih mơ̆ng tơlơi djai. 
But the chief priests took counsel that they might kill Lazarus also, @ Tui anŭn ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng črŏng sai kiăng pơdjai wơ̆t hăng Lasar mơ̆n. 
because many of the Jews went away on his account and believed on Jesus. @ Yua kơ mơ̆ng Lasar yơh hmâo lu ƀing ană Yuđa čơlah mơ̆ng gơñu hăng đaŏ kơ Yêsu.
On the morrow a great crowd who came to the feast, having heard that Jesus is coming into Jerusalem, @ Hrơi tơdơi kơ anŭn, hmâo sa phung lu rai kơ hrơi phĕt hmư̆ Yêsu hlăk rai pơ plei Yêrusalem. 
took branches of palms and went out to meet him, and cried, Hosanna, blessed [is] he that comes in the name of [the] Lord, the King of Israel. @ Tui anŭn gơñu mă than gol hăng nao drông Yêsu, hăng ur dreo: “Hôsana, mơyun hiam kơ pô rai amăng anăn Khua Yang, jing Pơtao ƀing Israel!”
And Jesus, having found a young ass, sat upon it; as it is written, @ Yêsu ƀuh sa drơi ană aseh kle, Ñu đĭ ƀơi gơ̆, tui hăng Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp hmâo čih laih:
Fear not, daughter of Zion: behold, thy King cometh, sitting on an ass's colt. @ “Anăm hwĭ ôh! Ơ ană dra plei Siôn;
Anai nê, pơtao ih rai, đĭ ƀơi ană aseh kle.”
[Now] his disciples knew not these things at the first; but when Jesus was glorified, then they remembered that these things were written of him, and that they had done these things to him. @ Hlăk anŭn ƀing ding kơna Ñu ƀu thâo hluh ôh kơ tơlơi anŭn; samơ̆ tơ Ơi Adai pơ-ư pơang laih Yêsu, hlăk anŭn gơñu hơdơr kơ Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp hmâo čih laih tơlơi anŭn djơ̆ kơ Ñu, hăng hmâo ngă laih kơ Ñu tui anŭn.
The crowd therefore that was with him bore witness because he had called Lazarus out of the tomb, and raised him from among [the] dead. @ Phung mơnuih lu hmâo dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Yêsu hlăk Ñu iâu Lasar tơbiă mơ̆ng pơsat hăng pơhơdip glaĭ gơ̆ mơ̆ng tơlơi djai, leng ngă gơ̆ng jơlan kơ tơlơi hmâo truh laih. 
Therefore also the crowd met him because they had heard that he had done this sign. @ Phung mơnuih lu nao drông Yêsu, yua kơ gơñu hmâo hmư̆ Yêsu ngă tơlơi mơsêh mơyang anŭn. 
The Pharisees therefore said to one another, Ye see that ye profit nothing: behold, the world is gone after him. @ Hnŭn yơh ƀing Pharisi bơlaĭ tơdruă gơñu: “Lăng adih, ƀing ta ƀu dưi ngă hơgĕt ôh. Lăng bĕ, abih lŏn tơnah hmâo đuaĭ tui Ñu soh sel.”
And there were certain Greeks among those who came up that they might worship in the feast; @ Amăng ƀing mơnuih nao kơkuh pơpŭ amăng hrơi phĕt tơlơi găn hmâo đơđa ƀing Grek. 
these therefore came to Philip, who was of Bethsaida of Galilee, and they asked him saying, Sir, we desire to see Jesus. @ Gơñu nao pơ Philip plei Bêtsaida amăng tring Galilê, hăng laĭ kơ ñu: “Ơ khua, gơmơi kiăng bưp Yêsu.”
Philip comes and tells Andrew, [and again] Andrew comes and Philip, and they tell Jesus. @ Philip nao laĭ kơ Andrê, laih anŭn Andrê nao hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Philip nao laĭ kơ Yêsu. 
But Jesus answered them saying, The hour is come that the Son of man should be glorified. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ kơ gơñu: “Mông Ană Mơnuih mă tŭ tơlơi ư-ang truh yơh. 
Verily, verily, I say unto you, Except the grain of wheat falling into the ground die, it abides alone; but if it die, it bears much fruit. @ Kâo laĭ sĭt biă mă kơ ƀing gih tơdah sa asar pơdai ƀu lĕ pơ lŏn hăng djai hĭ, ñu ăt dŏ kơnơ̆ng sa sar đôč; samơ̆ tơdah ñu djai hĭ, ñu či mơboh lu. 
He that loves his life shall lose it, and he that hates his life in this world shall keep it to life eternal. @ Hlơi pô khăp kơ tơlơi hơdip ñu, ñu či rơngiă hĭ. Samơ̆ hlơi pô bơrơmŭt kơ tơlơi hơdip ñu amăng lŏn tơnah anai, ñu či hmâo glaĭ tơlơi hơdip hlŏng lar. 
If any one serve me, let him follow me; and where I am, there also shall be *my* servant. [And] if any one serve me, him shall the Father honour. @ Hlơi pô mă bruă Kâo, ñu khŏm đuaĭ tui Kâo. Pơpă anih Kâo dŏ, ding kơna Kâo ăt dŏ pơ anŭn mơ̆n. Hlơi pô mă bruă Kâo, Ama kâo či pơpŭ pơyom kơ ñu.”
Now is my soul troubled, and what shall I say? Father, save me from this hour. But on account of this have I come to this hour. @ “Ră anai bơngăt jua Kâo rŭng răng biă mă. Hơgĕt Kâo či laĭ: ‘Ơ Ama, pơklaih Kâo mơ̆ng mông anai?’ Ơ ơh, samơ̆ yua kơ mông anai yơh Kâo hmâo rai laih. 
Father, glorify thy name. There came therefore a voice out of heaven, I both have glorified and will glorify [it] again. @ Ơ Ama, brơi tơlơi ư-ang kơ anăn Ih bĕ.” Hlăk anŭn hmâo asăp pơhiăp mơ̆ng adai: “Kâo hmâo ư-ang laih kơ anăn Kâo, laih anŭn Kâo či pơ-ư ang anăn Kâo dơ̆ng.” 
The crowd therefore, which stood [there] and heard [it], said that it had thundered. Others said, An angel has spoken to him. @ Phung mơnuih lu dŏ jĕ hmư̆ jua hiăp anŭn laĭ: “Anŭn jing dơnai grơ̆m.” Ƀing pơkŏn laĭ: “Sa čô ling jang adai pơhiăp hăng Ñu.” 
Jesus answered and said, Not on my account has this voice come, but on yours. @ Yêsu laĭ: “Asăp anai hmâo truh yua kơ ƀing gih, ƀu djơ̆ yua kơ Kâo ôh. 
Now is [the] judgment of this world; now shall the prince of this world be cast out: @ Ră anai tơlơi phat kơđi truh laih kơ lŏn tơnah, laih anŭn Ơi Adai či pơglưh hĭ khua wai lăng lŏn tơnah anai. 
and I, if I be lifted up out of the earth, will draw all to me. @ Bơ Kâo, tơ arăng yol đĭ drơi jan Kâo mơ̆ng lŏn, Kâo či dui ba abih bang mơnuih rai pơ Kâo.” 
But this he said signifying by what death he was about to die. @ Ñu laĭ tơlơi anŭn kiăng pơrơđah hyư̆m Ñu či djai.
The crowd answered him, We have heard out of the law that the Christ abides for ever; and how sayest thou that the Son of man must be lifted up? Who *is* this, the Son of man? @ Phung mơnuih lu laĭ glaĭ: “Ƀing gơmơi hmâo hmư̆ laih amăng hră tơlơi juăt laĭ kơ Yang Krist dŏ hlŏng lar. Hyư̆m Ih dưi laĭ arăng khŏm yol đĭ Ană Mơnuih pơ glong lĕ? Hlơi Ană Mơnuih anŭn?”
Jesus therefore said to them, Yet a little while is the light amongst you. Walk while ye have the light, that darkness may not overtake you. And he who walks in the darkness does not know where he goes. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Tơlơi bơngač dŏ hrŏm hăng ƀing gih ƀu sui dơ̆ng ôh. Rơbat nao bĕ tơdang ƀing gih dŏ hmâo tơlơi bơngač, hwĭ kơ tơlơi kơnăm mơmŏt plŭt gom hĭ ƀing gih. Hlơi pô rơbat amăng tơlơi kơnăm mơmŏt ñu ƀu thâo ôh pơpă anih ñu nao. 
While ye have the light, believe in the light, that ye may become sons of light. Jesus said these things, and going away hid himself from them. @ Tơdang gih dŏ hmâo tơlơi bơngač, đaŏ bĕ kơ tơlơi bơngač anŭn, kiăng kơ ƀing gih dưi jing ƀing ană kơ tơlơi bơngač.”
Giơ̆ng Yêsu pơhiăp tơlơi anŭn, Ñu đuaĭ kơdŏp mơ̆ng ƀing gơñu. 
But though he had done so many signs before them, they believed not on him, @ Wơ̆t dah Ñu hmâo ngă laih lu tơlơi mơsêh mơyang ƀơi anăp gơñu, gơñu ăt kŏn đaŏ kơ Ñu lơi. 
that the word of the prophet Esaias which he said might be fulfilled, Lord, who has believed our report? and to whom has the arm of the Lord been revealed? @ Tơlơi anŭn kiăng pơsĭt tơlơi pô laĭ lui hlâo Êsai hmâo pơhiăp laih:
“Ơ Khua Yang, hlơi hmâo đaŏ laih kơ tơlơi gơmơi pơtô,
laih anŭn kơ hlơi pô tơngan Khua Yang hmâo pơrơđah brơi laih lĕ?”
On this account they could not believe, because Esaias said again, @ Yua kơ anŭn yơh, gơñu ƀu dưi đaŏ ôh, yua kơ Êsai hmâo laĭ dơ̆ng mơ̆n,
He has blinded their eyes and hardened their heart, that they may not see with their eyes, and understand with their heart and be converted, and I should heal them. @ “Ơi Adai pơbum hĭ mơta gơñu,
Pơkhăng hĭ pran jua gơñu,
Hwĭ dah mơta gơñu thâo ƀuh,
Pran jua gơñu thâo hluh, laih anŭn gơñu wơ̆t glaĭ pơ Kâo,
Kiăng kơ Kâo pơsuaih hĭ gơñu.”
These things said Esaias because he saw his glory and spoke of him. @ Êsai pơhiăp tơlơi anŭn yua ñu ƀuh tơlơi ang yang Yang Krist, laih anŭn pơhiăp djơ̆ kơ Ñu.
Although indeed from among the rulers also many believed on him, but on account of the Pharisees did not confess [him], that they might not be put out of the synagogue: @ Wơ̆t dah tui anŭn ăt hmâo lu mơnuih amăng ƀing khua đaŏ kơ Yêsu, samơ̆ gơñu ƀu khĭn pơhaih tơlơi anŭn ôh, yua kơ gơñu hwĭ ƀing Pharisi puh pơđuaĭ gơñu mơ̆ng sang bơjơnum. 
for they loved glory from men rather than glory from God. @ Yua kơ gơñu khăp kơ tơlơi ư-ang mơ̆ng ană mơnuih hloh kơ tơlơi ư-ang mơ̆ng Ơi Adai.
But Jesus cried and said, He that believes on me, believes not on me, but on him that sent me; @ Yêsu pơhiăp kraih: “Hlơi pô đaŏ kơ Kâo, ƀu djơ̆ ñu kơnơ̆ng đaŏ kơ Kâo đôč ôh, samơ̆ đaŏ kơ Pô hmâo pơkiaŏ rai Kâo kar kaĭ mơ̆n. 
and he that beholds me, beholds him that sent me. @ Bơ hlơi pô ƀuh Kâo, ñu ăt ƀuh Pô hmâo pơkiaŏ rai Kâo mơ̆n. 
I am come into the world [as] light, that every one that believes on me may not abide in darkness; @ Kâo jing tơlơi bơngač hmâo rai laih amăng lŏn tơnah, kiăng kơ hlơi pô đaŏ kơ Kâo ñu ƀu dŏ amăng tơlơi kơnăm mơmŏt dơ̆ng ôh. 
and if any one hear my words and do not keep [them], I judge him not, for I am not come that I might judge the world, but that I might save the world. @ Tơdah hlơi pô hmư̆ boh pơhiăp Kâo laih anŭn ƀu gưt tui ôh, Kâo ƀu phat kơđi kơ ñu ôh; yua kơ Kâo rai ƀu djơ̆ kiăng kơ phat kơđi kơ lŏn tơnah ôh, samơ̆ kiăng pơklaih lŏn tơnah. 
He that rejects me and does not receive my words, has him who judges him: the word which I have spoken, that shall judge him in the last day. @ Hlơi pô hơngah Kâo laih anŭn ƀu mă tŭ ôh boh pơhiăp Kâo, hmâo laih sa čô phat kơđi kơ ñu; boh pơhiăp Kâo hmâo pơhiăp anŭn yơh či phat kơđi kơ ñu ƀơi hrơi đŭt tơdơi. 
For I have not spoken from myself, but the Father who sent me has himself given me commandment what I should say and what I should speak; @ Yua kơ kâo ƀu pơhiăp hăng tơlơi dưi Kâo pô ôh; samơ̆ Ama, Pô hmâo pơkiaŏ rai Kâo, pơđar Kâo pơhiăp tơlơi hơgĕt Kâo khŏm pơhiăp laih anŭn hơgĕt tơlơi Kâo khŏm pơhaih. 
and I know that his commandment is life eternal. What therefore I speak, as the Father has said to me, so I speak. @ Kâo thâo tơlơi Ñu pơđar anŭn jing tơlơi hơdip hlŏng lar. Yua kơ anŭn yơh hơgĕt tơlơi Kâo pơhiăp, Kâo pơhiăp tui hăng Ama hmâo pơđar laih kơ Kâo.”
Now before the feast of the passover, Jesus, knowing that his hour had come that he should depart out of this world to the Father, having loved his own who were in the world, loved them to the end. @ Hlâo kơ phĕt Tơlơi Găn, Yêsu thâo mông Ñu khŏm lui lŏn tơnah kiăng kơ glaĭ pơ Ama truh laih. Ñu hmâo khăp laih kơ ƀing lơ̆m kơ Ñu amăng lŏn tơnah, hnŭn yơh Ñu khăp hĭ kơ ƀing gơ̆ tơl đŭt.
And during supper, the devil having already put it into the heart of Judas [son] of Simon, Iscariote, that he should deliver him up, @ Tơdang gơñu dŏ ƀơ̆ng huă mlam, yang sat hmâo dưm laih amăng pran jua Yudas Iskariôt, ană đah rơkơi Simôn tơlơi pơmĭn pơblư̆ kơ Yêsu. 
[Jesus,] knowing that the Father had given him all things into his hands, and that he came out from God and was going to God, @ Yêsu thâo Ama hmâo jao laih abih bang mơnơ̆ng amăng tơngan Ñu, Ñu thâo Ñu hmâo rai mơ̆ng Ơi Adai laih anŭn Ñu či glaĭ pơ Ơi Adai. 
rises from supper and lays aside his garments, and having taken a linen towel he girded himself: @ Tui anŭn, Ñu tơgŭ mơ̆ng kơƀang ƀơ̆ng huă, toh hĭ ao phyung Ñu, mă khăn hăng hruă ƀơi kơiăng Ñu. 
then he pours water into the washhand basin, and began to wash the feet of the disciples, and to wipe them with the linen towel with which he was girded. @ Giơ̆ng anŭn, Ñu tuh ia amăng thao laih anŭn čơdơ̆ng rao tơkai ƀing ding kơna Ñu, Ñu sut tơkai ƀing gơ̆ hăng khăn Ñu pŏn kơiăng. 
He comes therefore to Simon Peter; and *he* says to him, Lord, dost thou wash *my* feet? @ Ñu nao pơ Simôn Pêtrôs, samơ̆ Pêtrôs laĭ: “Ơ Khua, Ih či rao tơkai kâo hă?”
Jesus answered and said to him, What I do thou dost not know now, but thou shalt know hereafter. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Hơgĕt Kâo ngă ih ƀu thâo hluh ôh ră anai, samơ̆ tơdơi ih či thâo hluh.”
Peter says to him, Thou shalt never wash my feet. Jesus answered him, Unless I wash thee, thou hast not part with me. @ Pêtrôs laĭ: “Ơ ơh, Ih ƀu či rao tơkai kâo ôh!”
Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Tơdah kâo ƀu rao tơkai ih, ih ƀu dưi jing ding kơna Kâo dơ̆ng ôh.”
Simon Peter says to him, Lord, not my feet only, but also my hands and my head. @ Simôn Pêtrôs laĭ glaĭ: “Ơ Khua, anăm kơnơ̆ng rao tơkai Kâo đôč ôh, samơ̆ rao wơ̆t tơngan hăng akŏ kâo mơ̆n!”
Jesus says to him, He that is washed all over needs not to wash save his feet, but is wholly clean; and ye are clean, but not all. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Hlơi mơnơi laih, kơnơ̆ng rao tơkai ñu đôč, dưi rơgoh abih yơh. Ƀing gih hmâo rơgoh laih, samơ̆ ƀu djơ̆ abih bang ƀing gih ôh.” 
For he knew him that delivered him up: on account of this he said, Ye are not all clean. @ Yua kơ Ñu thâo laih hlơi pô či pơblư̆ lui Ñu, yua anŭn yơh Yêsu laĭ: “Ƀu djơ̆ abih bang ƀing gih jing rơgoh soh sel ôh.”
When therefore he had washed their feet, and taken his garments, having sat down again, he said to them, Do ye know what I have done to you? @ Giơ̆ng kơ Yêsu rao tơkai ƀing gơ̆, Ñu buh glaĭ ao phyung Ñu, hăng dŏ ber ƀơi kơƀang ƀơ̆ng huă. Ñu laĭ kơ ƀing gơ̆: “Ƀing gih thâo hluh mơ̆ hơgĕt tơlơi Kâo hmâo ngă laih kơ ƀing gih?” 
Ye call me the Teacher and the Lord, and ye say well, for I am [so]. @ Ƀing gih iâu kâo jing nai laih anŭn Khua. Ƀing gih iâu djơ̆ yơh, yua kơ Kâo sĭt jing tui anŭn yơh. 
If I therefore, the Lord and the Teacher, have washed your feet, ye also ought to wash one another's feet; @ Tơdah kâo jing Khua laih anŭn Nai kơ ƀing gih, hmâo rao laih tơkai ƀing gih, tui anŭn brơi ƀing gih khŏm rao tơkai tơdruă ƀing gih kar kaĭ mơ̆n. 
for I have given you an example that, as I have done to you, ye should do also. @ Yua kơ kâo hmâo ngă bơhmutu laih brơi kơ ƀing gih, kiăng kơ ƀing gih ăt ngă mơ̆n kar hăng Kâo hmâo ngă laih kơ ƀing gih. 
Verily, verily, I say to you, The bondman is not greater than his lord, nor the sent greater than he who has sent him. @ Kâo laĭ sĭt biă mă kơ ƀing gih, ding kơna ƀu prŏng hloh kơ khua ñu ôh; laih anŭn pô arăng pơkiaŏ nao ƀu prŏng hloh kơ pô pơkiaŏ nao ñu ôh. 
If ye know these things, blessed are ye if ye do them. @ Tơdah ƀing gih thâo khul tơlơi anai laih anŭn ngă tui, ƀing gih či hmâo tơlơi mơyun hiam yơh.
I speak not of you all. I know those whom I have chosen; but that the scripture might be fulfilled, He that eats bread with me has lifted up his heel against me. @ “Kâo ƀu laĭ kơ abih bang ƀing gih ôh. Kâo thâo hlơi ƀing Kâo hmâo ruah laih, samơ̆ kiăng krĕp djơ̆ tui hăng Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp hmâo čih laih tui anai: ‘Pô ƀơ̆ng ƀañ tơpŭng Kâo, yŏng kơđôl pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ hăng Kâo,’ 
I tell you [it] now before it happens, that when it happens, ye may believe that I am [he]. @ Kâo laĭ tơlơi anŭn kơ ƀing gih hlâo kơ tơlơi anŭn truh, kiăng kơ tơ ñu truh, ƀing gih dưi đaŏ kơ Kâo jing pô Kâo Jing. 
Verily, verily, I say to you, He who receives whomsoever I shall send receives me; and he that receives me receives him who has sent me. @ Kâo laĭ sĭt biă mă kơ ƀing gih, hlơi pô tŭ jum mơnuih Kâo pơkiaŏ nao jing ñu tŭ jum Kâo mơ̆n; laih anŭn hlơi pô tŭ jum Kâo jing ñu tŭ jum Pô pơkiaŏ rai Kâo mơ̆n!”
Having said these things, Jesus was troubled in spirit, and testified and said, Verily, verily, I say to you, that one of you shall deliver me up. @ Giơ̆ng Yêsu pơhiăp tơlơi anŭn, bơngăt jua Ñu rŭng răng laih anŭn pơhiăp pơsĭt tui anai: “Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih sĭt biă mă, sa čô amăng ƀing gih či pơblư̆ lui Kâo.”
The disciples therefore looked one on another, doubting of whom he spoke. @ Ƀing ding kơna Ñu pơlăng tơdruă, ƀu thâo ôh kơ hlơi Yêsu laĭ nao. 
Now there was at table one of his disciples in the bosom of Jesus, whom Jesus loved. @ Sa čô amăng ƀing ding kơna, pô Yêsu khăp, dŏ ah akŏ ñu ƀơi tơda Yêsu. 
Simon Peter makes a sign therefore to him to ask who it might be of whom he spoke. @ Tui anŭn Simôn Pêtrôs yơr tơngan ngă gru kơ pô anŭn hăng laĭ: “Tơña bĕ Nai kơ hlơi Ñu laĭ tơlơi anŭn.”
But he, leaning on the breast of Jesus, says to him, Lord, who is it? @ Tui anŭn, tơdang ah ƀơi tơda Yêsu gơ̆ tơña kơ Yêsu: “Ơ Khua, hlơi pô anŭn?” 
Jesus answers, He it is to whom I, after I have dipped the morsel, give it. And having dipped the morsel, he gives it to Judas [son] of Simon, Iscariote. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Anŭn jing pô Kâo či brơi ƀañ tơpŭng Kâo či añrŭ anai”. Giơ̆ng anŭn Yêsu añrŭ sa čơđeh ƀañ hăng brơi Yudas ană đah rơkơi Simôn Iskariôt. 
And, after the morsel, then entered Satan into him. Jesus therefore says to him, What thou doest, do quickly. @ Giơ̆ng kơ Yudas mă čơđeh ƀañ anŭn, yang sat satan mŭt amăng Yudas. Yêsu laĭ kơ ñu: “Hơgĕt tơlơi ih či ngă, ngă tañ bĕ.” 
But none of those at table knew why he said this to him; @ Samơ̆ ƀu hmâo hlơi dŏ huă ƀơi kơƀang anŭn thâo hluh yua hơgĕt Yêsu laĭ tơlơi anŭn kơ ñu. 
for some supposed, because Judas had the bag, that Jesus was saying to him, Buy the things of which we have need for the feast; or that he should give something to the poor. @ Đơđa pơmĭn yua kơ Yudas djă kơdŭng prăk, Yêsu pơtă kơ Ñu: “Blơi bĕ hơgĕt mơnơ̆ng ƀing ta kiăng pioh kơ hrơi phĕt;” ƀôdah kiăng kơ ñu nao pơpha brơi kơ ƀing ƀun rin.
Having therefore received the morsel, he went out immediately; and it was night. @ Tui anŭn, giơ̆ng kơ Yudas mă čơđeh ƀañ anŭn, ñu tơbiă mơtam; hlăk anŭn mlam mơmŏt laih.
When therefore he was gone out Jesus says, Now is the Son of man glorified, and God is glorified in him. @ Giơ̆ng Yudas tơbiă laih, Yêsu laĭ: “Ră anai Ană Mơnuih hmâo tơlơi guh kơang laih, laih anŭn amăng Ñu Ơi Adai hmâo tơlơi guh kơang. 
If God be glorified in him, God also shall glorify him in himself, and shall glorify him immediately. @ Tơdah Ơi Adai hmâo tơlơi guh kơang amăng Ană Mơnuih, Ñu pô ăt či ngă guh kơang Ană Mơnuih amăng Ñu pô, laih anŭn či ngă guh kơang Ñu tañ mơtam. 
Children, yet a little while I am with you. Ye shall seek me; and, as I said to the Jews, Where I go ye cannot come, I say to you also now. @ Ơ ƀing ană anĕt, kâo kơnơ̆ng dŏ hrŏm hăng ƀing gih ƀiă hrơi đôč, ƀing gih či hơduah sem kâo, laih anŭn kar hăng kâo hmâo laĭ kơ ƀing ană Yuđa, ră anai kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih kar kaĭ mơ̆n. ‘Pơ anih Kâo nao, ƀing gih ƀu dưi nao ôh.’ 
A new commandment I give to you, that ye love one another; as I have loved you, that ye also love one another. @ Kâo brơi sa tơlơi pơtă phrâo kơ ƀing gih: Brơi ƀing gih khăp bĕ kơ tơdruă ƀing gih. Kar hăng kâo hmâo khăp laih kơ ƀing gih, brơi ƀing gih khŏm khăp kơ tơdruă ƀing gih kar kaĭ mơ̆n. 
By this shall all know that ye are disciples of mine, if ye have love amongst yourselves. @ Tơdah ƀing gih khăp kơ tơdruă, mơ̆ng tơlơi anŭn yơh abih bang mơnuih či thâo krăn ƀing gih jing ding kơna Kâo.”
Simon Peter says to him, Lord, where goest thou? Jesus answered him, Where I go thou canst not follow me now, but thou shalt follow me after. @ Simôn Pêtrôs tơña kơ Yêsu: “Ơ Khua Yang, pơpă Ih nao?”
Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Anih Kâo nao, ră anai ih ƀu dưi đuaĭ tui ôh, samơ̆ tơdơi ih či đuaĭ tui.”
Peter says to him, Lord, why cannot I follow thee now? I will lay down my life for thee. @ Pêtrôs tơña: “Ơ Khua, yua hơgĕt ră anai kâo ƀu dưi đuaĭ tui Ih ôh? Kâo či pơsăn tơlơi hơdip kâo yua kơ Ih.”
Jesus answers, Thou wilt lay down thy life for me! Verily, verily, I say to thee, The cock shall not crow till thou hast denied me thrice. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Ih či pơsăn tơlơi hơdip ih pô yua kơ Kâo hă? Kâo laĭ sĭt biă mă kơ ih, hlâo kơ mơnŭ aka tơdjô̆ ih či hơngah Kâo klâo wơ̆t!”
Let not your heart be troubled; ye believe on God, believe also on me. @ “Pran jua ƀing gih anăm bơngơ̆t bơngañ hăng rŭng răng ôh, đaŏ bĕ kơ Ơi Adai laih anŭn đaŏ kơ Kâo kar kaĭ mơ̆n. 
In my Father's house there are many abodes; were it not so, I had told you: for I go to prepare you a place; @ Amăng sang Ama Kâo hmâo lu anih dŏ, tơdah ƀu djơ̆ tui anŭn ôh, Kâo ƀu či laĭ kơ ƀing gih. Kâo nao kiăng kơ prăp pre sa boh anih kơ ƀing gih. 
and if I go and shall prepare you a place, I am coming again and shall receive you to myself, that where I am ye also may be. @ Giơ̆ng kơ Kâo nao hăng prăp pre laih kơ ƀing gih sa boh anih, Kâo či wơ̆t glaĭ hăng ba ƀing gih nao hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Kâo, kiăng kơ pơpă Kâo dŏ, ƀing gih ăt dŏ pơ anŭn mơ̆n. 
And ye know where I go, and ye know the way. @ Ƀing gih thâo pơpă Kâo nao, laih anŭn ƀing gih ăt thâo mơ̆n jơlan nao.”
Thomas says to him, Lord, we know not where thou goest, and how can we know the way? @ Thômas laĭ kơ Ñu: “Ơ Khua, gơmơi ƀu thâo ôh pơpă anih Ih nao, hyư̆m gơmơi dưi thâo jơlan anŭn lĕ?”
Jesus says to him, I am the way, and the truth, and the life. No one comes to the Father unless by me. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Kâo jing jơlan, tơlơi sĭt, laih anŭn tơlơi hơdip, ƀu hmâo hlơi pô dưi nao pơ Ama tơdah ƀu nao mơ̆ng Kâo. 
If ye had known me, ye would have known also my Father, and henceforth ye know him and have seen him. @ Tơdah ƀing gih thâo laih Kâo, ƀing gih ăt či thâo Ama Kâo mơ̆n. Mơ̆ng ră anai ƀing gih thâo laih Ñu, laih anŭn ƀing gih hmâo ƀuh Ñu laih.”
Philip says to him, Lord, shew us the Father and it suffices us. @ Philip laĭ kơ Yêsu: “Ơ Khua, kơčrâo brơi Ama kơ gơmơi bĕ, hơdôm anŭn djŏp laih.”
Jesus says to him, Am I so long a time with you, and thou hast not known me, Philip? He that has seen me has seen the Father; and how sayest thou, Shew us the Father? @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Ơ Philip, Kâo hmâo dŏ hăng ƀing ih sui laih samơ̆ ih ƀu thâo krăn Kâo ôh! Hlơi pô ƀuh laih Kâo, jing ñu ƀuh Ama yơh. Hyư̆m ih laĭ: ‘Kơčrâo brơi Ama kơ gơmơi bĕ?’ 
Believest thou not that I [am] in the Father, and that the Father is in me? The words which I speak to you I do not speak from myself; but the Father who abides in me, he does the works. @ Ih ƀu đaŏ ôh hă Kâo dŏ amăng Ama, laih anŭn Ama dŏ amăng Kâo? Hơdôm boh pơhiăp Kâo pơhiăp hăng ƀing gih, ƀu djơ̆ kâo pơhiăp mă mơ̆ng kâo pô ôh, samơ̆ Ama pô dŏ amăng kâo, Ñu pô yơh ngă bruă Ñu pô. 
Believe *me* that I [am] in the Father and the Father in me; but if not, believe me for the works' sake themselves. @ Đaŏ bĕ kơ kâo dŏ amăng Ama, laih anŭn Ama dŏ amăng Kâo, tơdah ƀu đaŏ, tŭ kơ đaŏ bĕ kơ bruă Kâo hmâo ngă. 
Verily, verily, I say to you, He that believes on me, the works which I do shall he do also, and he shall do greater than these, because I go to the Father. @ Kâo laĭ sĭt biă mă kơ ƀing gih, hlơi pô đaŏ kơ Kâo, ñu či ngă mơ̆n bruă Kâo ngă, laih anŭn ñu či ngă bruă prŏng hloh dơ̆ng, yua kơ Kâo glaĭ pơ Ama. 
And whatsoever ye shall ask in my name, this will I do, that the Father may be glorified in the Son. @ Hơgĕt tơlơi ƀing gih rơkâo amăng anăn kâo, kâo či ngă brơi, kiăng kơ Ama kâo dưi hmâo tơlơi pơ-ư pơang mơ̆ng Ană. 
If ye shall ask anything in my name, I will do it. @ Tơdah hơgĕt tơlơi ƀing gih rơkâo amăng anăn Kâo, Kâo či ngă brơi.”
If ye love me, keep my commandments. @ “Tơdah ƀing gih khăp kơ Kâo, ƀing gih tui gưt abih tơlơi Kâo pơtă. 
And I will beg the Father, and he will give you another Comforter, that he may be with you for ever, @ Kâo či rơkâo mơ̆ng Ama laih anŭn Ñu či brơi kơ ƀing gih sa čô Pô Djru pơkŏn, Ñu či dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing gih nanao, 
the Spirit of truth, whom the world cannot receive, because it does not see him nor know him; but ye know him, for he abides with you, and shall be in you. @ jing Yang Bơngăt Tơlơi Sĭt. Pô anŭn lŏn tơnah ƀu dưi tŭ mă ôh, yua kơ lŏn tơnah ƀu ƀuh Ñu ôh, kŏn thâo krăn Ñu lơi. Ƀing gih thâo krăn Yang Bơngăt Hiam, yua kơ Ñu dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing gih, laih anŭn či dŏ amăng ƀing gih.
I will not leave you orphans, I am coming to you. @ Kâo ƀu či lui ƀing gih dŏ tơhrit tơhroai ôh. Kâo či rai dơ̆ng pơ ƀing gih. 
Yet a little and the world sees me no longer; but ye see me; because I live ye also shall live. @ Dŏ ƀiă dơ̆ng lŏn tơnah ƀu či ƀuh Kâo tah, samơ̆ ƀing gih či ƀuh Kâo. Yua kơ Kâo hơdip, ƀing gih či dŏ hơdip kar kaĭ mơ̆n. 
In that day ye shall know that I [am] in my Father, and ye in me, and I in you. @ Amăng hrơi anŭn ƀing gih či thâo sĭt Kâo dŏ amăng Ama, ƀing gih dŏ amăng Kâo laih anŭn Kâo dŏ amăng ƀing gih.
He that has my commandments and keeps them, he it is that loves me; but he that loves me shall be loved by my Father, and I will love him and will manifest myself to him. @ Hlơi hmâo tŭ mă hiăp Kâo pơtă hăng gưt tui, ñu anŭn yơh jing pô khăp kơ Kâo. Hlơi pô khăp kơ Kâo, Ama Kâo či khăp kơ pô anŭn, Kâo či khăp kơ ñu hăng pơrơđah Kâo pô kơ ñu.”
Judas, not the Iscariote, says to him, Lord, how is it that thou wilt manifest thyself to us and not to the world? @ Yudas, ƀu djơ̆ Iskariôt ôh, tơña kơ Yêsu: “Ơ Khua, yua hơgĕt Ih či pơrơđah Ih pô kơ gơmơi, samơ̆ ƀu pơrơđah kơ lŏn tơnah ôh?”
Jesus answered and said to him, If any one love me, he will keep my word, and my Father will love him, and we will come to him and make our abode with him. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Tơdah hlơi pô khăp kơ Kâo, ñu či tui gưt hiăp Kâo pơtă, Ama Kâo či khăp kơ ñu, Gơmơi či nao pơ ñu, laih anŭn dŏ hrŏm hăng ñu. 
He that loves me not does not keep my words; and the word which ye hear is not mine, but [that] of the Father who has sent me. @ Hlơi pô ƀu khăp kơ Kâo, ñu ƀu tui gưt boh pơhiăp Kâo ôh, laih anŭn boh pơhiăp gih hmâo hmư̆ anŭn ƀu djơ̆ mơ̆ng Kâo pô ôh, samơ̆ mơ̆ng Ama, jing pô hmâo pơkiaŏ rai Kâo.”
These things I have said to you, abiding with you; @ “Kâo laĭ khul tơlơi anŭn kơ ƀing gih tơdang Kâo ăt dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing gih. 
but the Comforter, the Holy Spirit, whom the Father will send in my name, *he* shall teach you all things, and will bring to your remembrance all the things which I have said to you. @ Samơ̆ Pô Djru, jing Yang Bơngăt Hiam, pô Ama či pơkiaŏ rai amăng anăn Kâo, Ñu či pơtô abih bang tơlơi kơ ƀing gih, laih anŭn Ñu či pơhơdơr brơi kơ ƀing gih abih tơlơi Kâo hmâo pơtô laih kơ ƀing gih.
I leave peace with you; I give *my* peace to you: not as the world gives do I give to you. Let not your heart be troubled, neither let it fear. @ Kâo pioh glaĭ tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua kơ ƀing gih, Kâo brơi tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua Kâo pô kơ ƀing gih. Kâo brơi kơ ƀing gih ƀu djơ̆ kar hăng lŏn tơnah brơi ôh. Pran jua ƀing gih anăm bơngơ̆t bơngañ hăng rŭng răng ôh. 
Ye have heard that I have said unto you, I go away and I am coming to you. If ye loved me ye would rejoice that I go to the Father, for [my] Father is greater than I. @ Ƀing gih hmâo hmư̆ laih Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih: ‘Kâo nao, laih anŭn Kâo či wơ̆t glaĭ pơ ƀing gih dơ̆ng.’ Tơdah ƀing gih khăp laih kơ Kâo, ƀing gih hơ̆k mơak yơh, yua kơ Kâo nao pơ Ama; yua kơ Ama jing prŏng hloh kơ Kâo. 
And now I have told you before it comes to pass, that when it shall have come to pass ye may believe. @ Ră anai Kâo laĭ tơlơi anŭn kơ ƀing gih hlâo kơ ñu truh, kiăng kơ tơ ñu truh ƀing gih či đaŏ. 
I will no longer speak much with you, for the ruler of the world comes, and in me he has nothing; @ Kâo ƀu či pơhiăp lu hăng ƀing gih dơ̆ng tah, yua kơ khua wai lăng lŏn tơnah anai hlăk rai. Ñu ƀu hmâo tơlơi dưi ƀơi Kâo ôh. 
but that the world may know that I love the Father, and as the Father has commanded me, thus I do. Rise up, let us go hence. @ Samơ̆ Kâo ngă tui hăng tơlơi Ama hmâo pơtă laih kơ Kâo, kiăng kơ lŏn tơnah thâo Kâo khăp kơ Ama.
Tơgŭ bĕ, brơi ƀing ta đuaĭ mơ̆ng anih anai.”
I am the true vine, and my Father is the husbandman. @ “Kâo jing phŭn boh kơƀâu sĭt, Ama Kâo jing pô pla. 
[As to] every branch in me not bearing fruit, he takes it away; and [as to] every one bearing fruit, he purges it that it may bring forth more fruit. @ Rĭm than amăng Kâo ƀu mơboh, Ñu trơĭ lui hĭ, laih anŭn rĭm than mơboh, Ñu trơĭ pơkra hĭ kiăng kơ gơ̆ dưi mơboh lu hloh dơ̆ng. 
Ye are already clean by reason of the word which I have spoken to you. @ Ƀing gih jing rơgoh laih yua mơ̆ng boh pơhiăp Kâo hmâo pơtô laih kơ ƀing gih. 
Abide in me and I in you. As the branch cannot bear fruit of itself unless it abide in the vine, thus neither [can] ye unless ye abide in me. @ Dŏ nanao amăng Kâo bĕ, Kâo či dŏ amăng ƀing gih. Kar hăng than boh kơƀâu ƀu dưi mơboh mă ñu pô ôh, tơdah ñu ƀu dŏ klep hăng phŭn ñu, kar kaĭ mơ̆n, ƀing gih ƀu dưi mơboh ôh tơdah ƀing gih ƀu dŏ nanao amăng Kâo. 
I am the vine, ye [are] the branches. He that abides in me and I in him, *he* bears much fruit; for without me ye can do nothing. @ Kâo jing phŭn boh kơƀâu, ƀing gih jing than. Hlơi pô dŏ amăng Kâo nanao, Kâo dŏ amăng ñu, ñu anŭn či mơboh lu. Yua kơ gah rơngiao kơ Kâo ƀing gih ƀu dưi ngă hơgĕt gĕt ôh. 
Unless any one abide in me he is cast out as the branch, and is dried up; and they gather them and cast them into the fire, and they are burned. @ Tơdah hlơi pô ƀu dŏ nanao amăng Kâo, arăng glŏm lui hĭ ñu pơ rơngiao kar hăng than boh kơƀâu laih anŭn ñu kro, arăng duñ pơƀŭt than anŭn hăng glŏm hĭ amăng apui brơi apui ƀơ̆ng abih. 
If ye abide in me, and my words abide in you, ye shall ask what ye will and it shall come to pass to you. @ Tơdah ƀing gih dŏ nanao amăng kâo laih anŭn tơlơi kâo pơhiăp dŏ amăng ƀing gih, rơkâo bĕ hơgĕt tơlơi ƀing gih kiăng, ƀing gih či hmâo ñu yơh. 
In this is my Father glorified, that ye bear much fruit, and ye shall become disciples of mine. @ Ama Kâo hmâo tơlơi pơ-ư ang yua kơ gih mơboh lu, laih anŭn ƀing gih jing ding kơna Kâo. 
As the Father has loved me, I also have loved you: abide in my love. @ Kar hăng Ama hmâo khăp kơ Kâo, Kâo khăp kơ ƀing gih ăt kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n. Dŏ nanao hĭ bĕ amăng tơlơi Kâo khăp. 
If ye shall keep my commandments, ye shall abide in my love, as I have kept my Father's commandments and abide in his love. @ Tơdah ƀing gih gưt tui tơlơi Kâo pơtă, ƀing gih či dŏ amăng tơlơi Kâo khăp. Kar hăng Kâo hmâo gưt tui laih tơlơi Ama Kâo pơtă, laih anŭn Kâo dŏ nanao amăng tơlơi Ñu khăp.
I have spoken these things to you that my joy may be in you, and your joy be full. @ Kâo laĭ abih tơlơi anŭn kơ ƀing gih, kiăng kơ tơlơi mơak Kâo dŏ hĭ amăng ƀing gih, laih anŭn tơlơi mơak ƀing gih dưi jing klă tum. 
This is my commandment, that ye love one another, as I have loved you. @ Anai jing tơlơi Kâo pơtă: Brơi ƀing gih khăp bĕ kơ tơdruă ƀing gih kar hăng Kâo hmâo khăp laih kơ ƀing gih. 
No one has greater love than this, that one should lay down his life for his friends. @ Ƀu hmâo ôh tơlơi khăp pă prŏng hloh kơ tơlơi khăp tơl ñu pơsăn lui tơlơi hơdip ñu pô yua kơ gơyut ñu. 
Ye are my friends if ye practise whatever I command you. @ Tơdah gih gưt tui hiăp Kâo pơtô, ƀing gih jing gơyut Kâo. 
I call you no longer bondmen, for the bondman does not know what his master is doing; but I have called you friends, for all things which I have heard of my Father I have made known to you. @ Kâo ƀu iâu ƀing gih jing ding kơna dơ̆ng ôh, yua kơ ding kơna ƀu thâo ôh hơgĕt tơlơi khua ñu ngă. Samơ̆ Kâo iâu ƀing gih jing gơyut Kâo yua kơ abih bang tơlơi Kâo hmư̆ mơ̆ng Ama, Kâo hmâo pơrơđah laih brơi kơ ƀing gih. 
Ye have not chosen me, but I have chosen you, and have set you that ye should go and [that] ye should bear fruit, and [that] your fruit should abide, that whatsoever ye shall ask the Father in my name he may give you. @ Ƀu djơ̆ ƀing gih ôh hmâo ruah mă Kâo, samơ̆ Kâo hmâo ruah mă ƀing gih hăng jao bruă kiăng kơ ƀing gih nao laih anŭn mơboh, laih anŭn brơi boh ƀing gih ăt dŏ nanao; kiăng kơ hơgĕt tơlơi ƀing gih rơkâo mơ̆ng Ama amăng anăn Kâo, Ñu či pha brơi tơlơi anŭn kơ ƀing gih yơh. 
These things I command you, that ye love one another. @ Anai tơlơi Kâo pơtă kơ ƀing gih: brơi ƀing gih khăp bĕ kơ tơdruă ƀing gih.”
If the world hate you, know that it has hated me before you. @ “Tơdah lŏn tơnah bơrơmŭt kơ ƀing gih, brơi ƀing gih thâo kơ lŏn tơnah hmâo bơrơmŭt laih kơ Kâo hlâo kơ ƀing gih. 
If ye were of the world, the world would love its own; but because ye are not of the world, but I have chosen you out of the world, on account of this the world hates you. @ Tơdah ƀing gih lơ̆m kơ lŏn tơnah, lŏn tơnah či khăp kơ ƀing lơ̆m kơ ñu. Samơ̆ yua kơ ƀing gih ƀu lơ̆m kơ lŏn tơnah ôh, Kâo hmâo ruah laih ƀing gih mơ̆ng lŏn tơnah, yua kơ anŭn yơh lŏn tơnah bơrơmŭt kơ ƀing gih. 
Remember the word which I said unto you, The bondman is not greater than his master. If they have persecuted me, they will also persecute you; if they have kept my word, they will keep also yours. @ Hơdơr bĕ tơlơi Kâo hmâo laĭ laih kơ ƀing gih: ‘Ding kơna ƀu prŏng hloh kơ khua ñu ôh.’ Tơdah gơñu hmâo ngă sat laih kơ Kâo, gơñu či ngă sat kơ ƀing gih kar kaĭ mơ̆n. Tơdah gơñu tui gưt boh pơhiăp Kâo, gơñu či tui gưt mơ̆n boh pơhiăp ƀing gih. 
But they will do all these things to you on account of my name, because they have not known him that sent me. @ Samơ̆ yua kơ anăn Kâo, gơñu či ngă abih tơlơi anŭn kơ ƀing gih, yua kơ gơñu ƀu thâo krăn ôh Pô hmâo pơkiaŏ rai Kâo. 
If I had not come and spoken to them, they had not had sin; but now they have no excuse for their sin. @ Tơdah Kâo ƀu rai hăng ƀu pơhiăp kơ gơñu ôh, gơñu ƀu hmâo tơlơi soh ôh. Samơ̆ ră anai gơñu ƀu dưi pơgăl tơlơi soh gơñu ôh. 
He that hates me hates also my Father. @ Hlơi pô bơrơmŭt kơ Kâo ăt ñu bơrơmŭt kơ Ama Kâo mơ̆n. 
If I had not done among them the works which no other one has done, they had not had sin; but now they have both seen and hated both me and my Father. @ Tơdah Kâo ƀu hmâo ngă ôh tơ̆ng krah gơñu hơdôm bruă pô pơkŏn ƀu hmâo ngă ôh, gơñu ƀu hmâo tơlơi soh ôh. Samơ̆ ră anai gơñu ƀuh laih, laih anŭn gơñu ăt bơrơmŭt kơ Kâo wơ̆t Ama Kâo mơ̆n. 
But that the word written in their law might be fulfilled, They hated me without a cause. @ Tơlơi anŭn hmâo truh laih kiăng krĕp djơ̆ tui hăng tơlơi pơhiăp hmâo čih laih amăng tơlơi juăt gơñu: ‘Gơñu bơrơmŭt kơ Kâo ƀu hmâo tơhnal.’
But when the Comforter is come, whom I will send to you from the Father, the Spirit of truth who goes forth from with the Father, *he* shall bear witness concerning me; @ Tơ Pô Djru truh, Pô Kâo či pơkiaŏ rai mơ̆ng Ama kơ ƀing gih, jing Yang Tơlơi Sĭt, Pô rai mơ̆ng Ama, Ñu yơh či ngă gơ̆ng jơlan kơ Kâo. 
and ye too bear witness, because ye are with me from [the] beginning. @ Ƀing gih ăt ngă gơ̆ng jơlan kơ Kâo mơ̆n, yua kơ ƀing gih hmâo dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Kâo čơdơ̆ng mơ̆ng phŭn.”
These things I have spoken unto you that ye may not be offended. @ “Kâo hmâo laĭ laih kơ ƀing gih khul tơlơi anai, kiăng kơ ƀing gih ƀu tơhnač rơbuh ôh. 
They shall put you out of the synagogues; but the hour is coming that every one who kills you will think to render service to God; @ Gơñu či puh pơđuaĭ ƀing gih mơ̆ng sang jơnum. Mông či truh tơ hlơi pô pơdjai ƀing gih, gơñu pơmĭn tơlơi gơñu ngă anŭn gơñu hlăk mă bruă kơ Ơi Adai. 
and these things they will do because they have not known the Father nor me. @ Gơñu či ngă khul tơlơi anŭn, yua kơ gơñu ƀu thâo krăn Ama laih anŭn kŏn thâo krăn Kâo lơi. 
But I have spoken these things to you, that when their hour shall have come, ye may remember them, that I have said [them] unto you. But I did not say these things unto you from [the] beginning, because I was with you. @ Samơ̆ Kâo hmâo laĭ laih hơdôm tơlơi anŭn kơ ƀing gih, kiăng kơ tơ mông gơñu ngă tui anŭn truh, ƀing gih dưi hơdơr Kâo hmâo laĭ laih tơlơi anŭn kơ ƀing gih.
Mơ̆ng phŭn hlâo Kâo ƀu pơhiăp tơlơi anŭn kơ ƀing gih ôh yua kơ Kâo ăt dŏ hrŏm hăng ƀing gih. 
But now I go to him that has sent me, and none of you demands of me, Where goest thou? @ Samơ̆ ră anai Kâo či wơ̆t glaĭ pơ Pô hmâo pơkiaŏ rai Kâo, ƀu hmâo hlơi amăng ƀing gih tơña kơ Kâo: ‘Pơpă Ih nao?’ 
But because I have spoken these things to you, sorrow has filled your heart. @ Samơ̆ yua kơ Kâo hmâo laĭ laih hơdôm tơlơi anŭn kơ ƀing gih, pran jua ƀing gih bă hăng tơlơi rơngot hơning. 
But I say the truth to you, It is profitable for you that I go away; for if I do not go away, the Comforter will not come to you; but if I go I will send him to you. @ Wơ̆t dah tui anŭn, Kâo laǐ sĭt biă mă kơ ƀing gih: Kâo nao jing tơlơi tŭ yua brơi kơ ƀing gih. Yua kơ tơdah Kâo ƀu nao ôh, Pô Djru ƀu či rai pơ ƀing gih ôh. Samơ̆ tơdah Kâo nao, Kâo či pơkiaŏ Ñu rai pơ ƀing gih. 
And having come, he will bring demonstration to the world, of sin, and of righteousness, and of judgment: @ Laih anŭn tơ Ñu truh, Ñu či kơčrâo kơ lŏn tơnah kơ tơlơi soh, kơ tơlơi tơpă, laih anŭn kơ tơlơi phat kơđi. 
of sin, because they do not believe on me; @ Kơ tơlơi soh, yua kơ gơñu ƀu đaŏ kơ Kâo ôh; 
of righteousness, because I go away to [my] Father, and ye behold me no longer; @ Kơ tơlơi tơpă, yua kơ Kâo glaĭ pơ Ama, laih anŭn ƀing gih ƀu či ƀuh Kâo dơ̆ng ôh; 
of judgment, because the ruler of this world is judged. @ kơ tơlơi phat kơđi, yua kơ khua wai lăng lŏn tơnah anai Ơi Adai phat kơđi laih.
I have yet many things to say to you, but ye cannot bear them now. @ Kâo dŏ hmâo lu tơlơi kiăng laĭ hăng ƀing gih, samơ̆ ƀing gih ƀu dưi thâo hluh ôh ră anai. 
But when *he* is come, the Spirit of truth, he shall guide you into all the truth: for he shall not speak from himself; but whatsoever he shall hear he shall speak; and he will announce to you what is coming. @ Samơ̆ tơ Yang Tơlơi Sĭt truh, Ñu či atăt ba ƀing gih amăng abih bang tơlơi sĭt. Yua kơ Ñu ƀu pơhiăp mă mơ̆ng Ñu pô ôh, samơ̆ Ñu pơhiăp abih tơlơi Ñu hmư̆, hăng pơrơđah brơi kơ ƀing gih kơ tơlơi či truh tơdơi. 
He shall glorify me, for he shall receive of mine and shall announce [it] to you. @ Ñu yơh či pơ-ư pơang Kâo, yua kơ Ñu či mă abih tơlơi lơ̆m kơ Kâo hăng pơrơđah brơi kơ ƀing gih. 
All things that the Father has are mine; on account of this I have said that he receives of mine and shall announce [it] to you. @ Abih bang mơnơ̆ng Ama hmâo leng lơ̆m kơ Kâo soh sel; yua kơ anŭn Kâo hmâo laĭ Yang Tơlơi Sĭt či mă tơlơi lơ̆m kơ Kâo hăng pơrơđah brơi tơlơi anŭn kơ ƀing gih.”
A little while and ye do not behold me; and again a little while and ye shall see me, [because I go away to the Father]. @ “Dŏ ƀiă mông dơ̆ng ƀing gih ƀu či ƀuh Kâo dơ̆ng ôh; laih anŭn dŏ ƀiă mông dơ̆ng, ƀing gih či ƀuh Kâo dơ̆ng.”
[Some] of his disciples therefore said to one another, What is this he says to us, A little while and ye do not behold me; and again a little while and ye shall see me, and, Because I go away to the Father? @ Hmâo đơđa amăng ƀing ding kơna Yêsu bơlaĭ tơdruă gơñu: “Nai laĭ hăng ƀing ta: ‘Dŏ ƀiă mông ƀing gih ƀu či ƀuh Kâo ôh; laih anŭn dŏ ƀiă mông dơ̆ng ƀing gih či ƀuh Kâo dơ̆ng, yua kơ Kâo glaĭ pơ Ama.’ Hơgĕt tơlơi anai kiăng laĭ?” 
They said therefore, What is this which he says [of] the little while? We do not know [of] what he speaks. @ Gơñu laĭ: “‘Dŏ ƀiă mông’ hơgĕt tơlơi Ñu kiăng laĭ? Ƀing ta ƀu thâo hluh ôh tơlơi anŭn.” 
Jesus knew therefore that they desired to demand of him, and said to them, Do ye inquire of this among yourselves that I said, A little while and ye do not behold me; and again a little while and ye shall see me? @ Yêsu thâo yơh gơñu kiăng tơña kơ Ñu, tui anŭn Ñu laĭ kơ ƀing gơ̆: “Djơ̆ mơ̆ kơ tơlơi anai ƀing gih tơña tơdruă ƀing gih kơ tơlơi Kâo laĭ: ‘Dŏ ƀiă mông, ƀing gih ƀu či ƀuh Kâo dơ̆ng ôh, hăng dŏ ƀiă mông ƀing gih či ƀuh Kâo dơ̆ng?’ 
Verily, verily, I say to you, that ye shall weep and lament, ye, but the world shall rejoice; and ye will be grieved, but your grief shall be turned to joy. @ Kâo laĭ sĭt biă mă kơ ƀing gih, ƀing gih či hia hăng rơngot hơning, samơ̆ lŏn tơnah či hơ̆k kơdơ̆k. Ƀing gih či rơngot hơning samơ̆ tơlơi rơngot hơning ƀing gih či pơplih jing hĭ tơlơi hơ̆k mơak. 
A woman, when she gives birth to a child, has grief because her hour has come; but when the child is born, she no longer remembers the trouble, on account of the joy that a man has been born into the world. @ Hlăk đah kơmơi či tơkeng, ñu hmâo tơlơi rơngot, yua kơ mông ñu ruă nuă truh laih. Samơ̆ giơ̆ng ñu tơkeng hĭ ană, ñu ƀu hơdơr dơ̆ng tah tơlơi ruă ñu, ñu mơak yua kơ ñu tơkeng laih ană amăng lŏn tơnah. 
And ye now therefore have grief; but I will see you again, and your heart shall rejoice, and your joy no one takes from you. @ Ăt tui anŭn mơ̆n, ră anai ƀing gih hmâo tơlơi rơngot hơning, samơ̆ Kâo či ƀuh ƀing gih dơ̆ng, pran jua ƀing gih či hơ̆k mơak laih anŭn arăng ƀu dưi mă hĭ ôh tơlơi hơ̆k mơak anŭn mơ̆ng ƀing gih. 
And in that day ye shall demand nothing of me: verily, verily, I say to you, Whatsoever ye shall ask the Father in my name, he will give you. @ Amăng hrơi anŭn ƀing gih ƀu či tơña kơ Kâo sa mơta tơlơi hơgĕt dơ̆ng ôh. Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih sĭt biă mă, hơgĕt tơlơi ƀing gih rơkâo mơ̆ng Ama amăng anăn Kâo, Ñu či pha brơi kơ ƀing gih. 
Hitherto ye have asked nothing in my name: ask, and ye shall receive, that your joy may be full. @ Truh ră anai, ƀing gih aka rơkâo ôh sa tơlơi amăng anăn Kâo. Rơkâo bĕ laih anŭn ƀing gih či mă tŭ, kiăng kơ tơlơi hơ̆k mơak ƀing gih dưi klă tum.”
These things I have spoken to you in allegories; the hour is coming that I will no longer speak to you in allegories, but will declare to you openly concerning the Father. @ “Kâo hmâo yua tơlơi bơhmutu kiăng pơtô kơ ƀing gih abih tơlơi anŭn, samơ̆ hrơi či truh Kâo ƀu či yua tơlơi bơhmutu dơ̆ng ôh kiăng pơtô kơ ƀing gih, samơ̆ Kâo či pơhiăp rơđah rơđong kơ tơlơi Ama Kâo kơ ƀing gih. 
In that day ye shall ask in my name; and I say not to you that I will demand of the Father for you, @ Amăng hrơi anŭn ƀing gih či rơkâo amăng anăn Kâo. Kâo ƀu laĭ ôh kơ ƀing gih Kâo či rơkâo kơ Ama yua kơ ƀing gih; 
for the Father himself has affection for you, because ye have had affection for me, and have believed that I came out from God. @ yua kơ Ama pô yơh khăp kơ ƀing gih, yua kơ ƀing gih hmâo khăp laih kơ Kâo, hăng đaŏ kơ Kâo rai mơ̆ng Ama. 
I came out from the Father and have come into the world; again, I leave the world and go to the Father. @ Kâo mơ̆ng Ama rai pơ lŏn tơnah laih anŭn ră anai Kâo lui lŏn tơnah wơ̆t glaĭ pơ Ama.”
His disciples say to him, Lo, now thou speakest openly and utterest no allegory. @ Ƀing ding kơna Ñu laĭ: “Ră anai Ih pơhiăp rơđah rơđong yơh, ƀu yua hăng tơlơi bơhmutu ôh. 
Now we know that thou knowest all things, and hast not need that any one should demand of thee. By this we believe that thou art come from God. @ Ră anai gơmơi thâo yơh Ih thâo abih bang tơlơi, ƀu dŏ tơguan hmâo pô tơña Ih ôh. Yua kơ anŭn gơmơi đaŏ Ih hmâo rai mơ̆ng Ơi Adai.”
Jesus answered them, Do ye now believe? @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Ră anai ƀing gih đaŏ mơ̆? 
Behold, [the] hour is coming, and has come, that ye shall be scattered, each to his own, and shall leave me alone; and [yet] I am not alone, for the Father is with me. @ Lăng bĕ, mông či truh, laih anŭn ñu truh yơh, hlăk anŭn ƀing gih či čơlah bru bra, rĭm čô nao jơlan ñu pô, ƀing gih či lui hĭ Kâo dŏ hơjăn. Samơ̆ Kâo ƀu dŏ hơjăn ôh, yua kơ Ama dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Kâo. 
These things have I spoken to you that in me ye might have peace. In the world ye have tribulation; but be of good courage: I have overcome the world. @ Kâo hmâo laĭ laih hơdôm tơlơi anŭn kơ ƀing gih, kiăng kơ ƀing gih dưi hmâo tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua amăng Kâo. Ƀing gih či hmâo tơlơi tơnap tap amăng lŏn tơnah; samơ̆ dŏ kơjăp pran jua bĕ, Kâo hmâo dưi hĭ laih hăng lŏn tơnah.”
These things Jesus spoke, and lifted up his eyes to heaven and said, Father, the hour is come; glorify thy Son, that thy Son may glorify thee; @ Giơ̆ng kơ Yêsu pơhiăp hơdôm tơlơi anai, Ñu angak mơta pơ adai hăng laĭ: “Ơ Ama, mông truh laih; pơ-ư pơang bĕ kơ Ană Ih, kiăng kơ Ană dưi pơ-ư pơang kơ Ama. 
as thou hast given him authority over all flesh, that [as to] all that thou hast given to him, he should give them life eternal. @ Yua kơ Ama hmâo brơi laih kơ Ană tơlơi dưi wai lăng abih bang mơnuih kiăng kơ Ană dưi brơi tơlơi hơdip hlŏng lar kơ abih bang ƀing mơnuih Ama hmâo brơi laih kơ Ană. 
And this is the eternal life, that they should know thee, the only true God, and Jesus Christ whom thou hast sent. @ Tơlơi hơdip hlŏng lar jing thâo krăn Ama kơnơ̆ng Ih yơh jing Ơi Adai laih anŭn Pô sĭt, laih anŭn thâo krăn Yêsu Krist Pô Ih hmâo pơkiaŏ rai laih. 
I have glorified *thee* on the earth, I have completed the work which thou gavest me that I should do it; @ Kâo hmâo pơ-ư pơang laih Ih amăng lŏn tơnah laih anŭn Kâo hmâo ngă pơgiơ̆ng laih bruă Ih hmâo jao brơi Kâo. 
and now glorify *me*, *thou* Father, along with thyself, with the glory which I had along with thee before the world was. @ Ơ Ama, ră anai rơkâo kơ Ih pơ-ư pơang Kâo ƀơi anăp Ih hăng tơlơi guh kơang Kâo hmâo laih hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Ih hlâo kơ hrih lŏn tơnah.
I have manifested thy name to the men whom thou gavest me out of the world. They were thine, and thou gavest them me, and they have kept thy word. @ Kâo hmâo pơrơđah laih anăn Ih kơ ƀing mơnuih Ih hmâo brơi kơ Kâo mơ̆ng lŏn tơnah. Gơñu lơ̆m kơ Ih, Ih hmâo brơi laih gơñu kơ Kâo laih anŭn gơñu hmâo gưt tui boh pơhiăp Ih. 
Now they have known that all things that thou hast given me are of thee; @ Ră anai gơñu thâo laih kơ abih bang tơlơi Ih hmâo brơi laih kơ Kâo leng kơ tơbiă mơ̆ng Ih. 
for the words which thou hast given me I have given them, and they have received [them], and have known truly that I came out from thee, and have believed that thou sentest me. @ Yua kơ Kâo hmâo brơi laih kơ gơñu boh pơhiăp Ih hmâo brơi laih kơ Kâo. Gơñu hmâo mă tŭ laih hăng thâo Kâo hmâo rai mơ̆ng Ih sĭt, hăng đaŏ kơ Ih hmâo pơkiaŏ rai Kâo.
I demand concerning them; I do not demand concerning the world, but concerning those whom thou hast given me, for they are thine, @ Kâo iâu laĭ brơi kơ gơñu. Kâo ƀu iâu laĭ brơi kơ lŏn tơnah ôh, samơ̆ iâu laĭ kơ ƀing mơnuih Ih hmâo brơi laih kơ Kâo, yua kơ gơñu lơ̆m kơ Ih. 
(and all that is mine is thine, and [all] that is thine mine,) and I am glorified in them. @ Abih bang tơlơi mơnơ̆ng lơ̆m kơ Kâo jing lơ̆m kơ Ih, laih anŭn abih tơlơi mơnơ̆ng lơ̆m kơ Ih jing lơ̆m kơ Kâo mơ̆n, laih anŭn Kâo hmâo tơlơi pơ-ư pơang mơ̆ng gơñu. 
And I am no longer in the world, and these are in the world, and I come to thee. Holy Father, keep them in thy name which thou hast given me, that they may be one as we. @ Ră anai Kâo či glaĭ pơ Ih; Kâo ƀu dŏ amăng lŏn tơnah dơ̆ng ôh, samơ̆ gơñu ăt dŏ amăng lŏn tơnah. Ơ Ama Rơgoh Hiam, rơkâo kơ Ih wai lăng gơñu amăng anăn Ih, jing anăn Ih hmâo brơi laih kơ Kâo, kiăng kơ gơñu dưi jing sa kar hăng Ƀing Ta. 
When I was with them I kept them in thy name; those thou hast given me I have guarded, and not one of them has perished, but the son of perdition, that the scripture might be fulfilled. @ Tơdang Kâo dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng gơñu, Kâo hmâo wai lăng gơñu amăng anăn Ih, jing anăn Ih hmâo brơi laih kơ Kâo. Kâo hmâo pơgang gơñu, ƀu pơrơngiă sa čô hlơi ôh, kơnơ̆ng ană kơ tơlơi răm rai đôč, kiăng kơ krĕp djơ̆ tui hăng Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp hmâo čih laih. 
And now I come to thee. And these things I speak in the world, that they may have my joy fulfilled in them. @ Samơ̆ ră anai Kâo wơ̆t glaĭ pơ Ih. Kâo pơhiăp hơdôm tơlơi anai tơdang Kâo ăt dŏ amăng lŏn tơnah, kiăng kơ tơlơi hơ̆k mơak Kâo dưi bă blai amăng pran jua gơñu. 
I have given them thy word, and the world has hated them, because they are not of the world, as I am not of the world. @ Kâo hmâo brơi laih boh pơhiăp Ih kơ gơñu. Lŏn tơnah bơrơmŭt kơ gơñu, yua kơ gơñu ƀu lơ̆m kơ lŏn tơnah ôh, kar hăng Kâo ƀu lơ̆m lŏn tơnah mơ̆n. 
I do not demand that thou shouldest take them out of the world, but that thou shouldest keep them out of evil. @ Kâo ƀu rơkâo kơ Ih mă hĭ gơñu mơ̆ng lŏn tơnah ôh, samơ̆ rơkâo Ih pơgang gơñu mơ̆ng pô sat ƀai. 
They are not of the world, as I am not of the world. @ Gơñu ƀu lơ̆m kơ lŏn tơnah ôh, kar hăng Kâo ƀu lơ̆m kơ lŏn tơnah mơ̆n. 
Sanctify them by the truth: thy word is truth. @ Rơkâo kơ Ih yua tơlơi sĭt pơrơgoh hĭ gơñu; Boh Pơhiăp Ih jing tơlơi sĭt. 
As thou hast sent me into the world, I also have sent them into the world; @ Kar hăng Ih hmâo pơkiaŏ Kâo rai amăng lŏn tơnah, Kâo ăt pơkiaŏ gơñu nao amăng lŏn tơnah mơ̆n. 
and I sanctify myself for them, that they also may be sanctified by truth. @ Yua kơ ƀing gơñu yơh Kâo pơyơr hĭ Kâo pô, kiăng kơ gơñu ăt dưi pơrơgoh amăng tơlơi sĭt mơ̆n.
And I do not demand for these only, but also for those who believe on me through their word; @ Kâo ƀu kơnơ̆ng iâu laĭ brơi kơ ƀing gơñu đôč ôh, samơ̆ ăt iâu laĭ kơ ƀing či đaŏ kơ Kâo yua mơ̆ng tơlơi gơñu gơ̆ng jơlan mơ̆n. 
that they may be all one, as thou, Father, [art] in me, and I in thee, that they also may be one in us, that the world may believe that thou hast sent me. @ Kiăng kơ abih bang gơñu leng kơ jing hĭ hasa. Ơ Ama, kar hăng Ih dŏ amăng Kâo, laih anŭn Kâo dŏ amăng Ih, kar kaĭ mơ̆n kiăng kơ gơñu dŏ amăng Ƀing Ta; kiăng kơ lŏn tơnah đaŏ kơ Ih hmâo pơkiaŏ rai Kâo. 
And the glory which thou hast given me I have given them, that they may be one, as we are one; @ Kâo hmâo brơi laih kơ gơñu tơlơi ang yang Ih hmâo brơi kơ Kâo, kiăng kơ gơñu dưi jing hasa kar hăng Ƀing Ta jing hasa. 
I in them and thou in me, that they may be perfected into one [and] that the world may know that thou hast sent me, and [that] thou hast loved them as thou hast loved me. @ Kâo dŏ amăng gơñu, laih anŭn Ih dŏ amăng Kâo, kiăng kơ gơñu dưi jing hasa klă tum, kiăng kơ lŏn tơnah dưi thâo kơ Ih hmâo pơkiaŏ rai laih Kâo, laih anŭn Ih hmâo khăp laih gơñu kar hăng Ih hmâo khăp laih kơ Kâo.
Father, [as to] those whom thou hast given me, I desire that where I am they also may be with me, that they may behold my glory which thou hast given me, for thou lovedst me before [the] foundation of [the] world. @ Ơ Ama, kâo kiăng pơpă Kâo dŏ, ƀing mơnuih Ih hmâo brơi laih kơ Kâo ăt dưi dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Kâo pơ anŭn mơ̆n, kiăng kơ gơñu dưi ƀuh tơlơi ang yang Ih hmâo pha brơi laih kơ Kâo, yua kơ Ih hmâo khăp laih kơ Kâo hlâo kơ hrih lŏn tơnah. 
Righteous Father, and the world has not known thee, but I have known thee, and these have known that thou hast sent me. @ Ơ Ama tơpă hơnơ̆ng, lŏn tơnah ƀu thâo krăn Ih ôh, samơ̆ Kâo thâo krăn Ih laih, laih anŭn ƀing anai thâo krăn Ih yơh Pô hmâo pơkiaŏ Kâo rai. 
And I have made known to them thy name, and will make [it] known; that the love with which thou hast loved me may be in them and I in them. @ Kâo hmâo pơrơđah laih anăn Ih kơ gơñu, laih anŭn Kâo ăt či pơrơđah brơi kơ gơñu thâo krăn anăn Ih dơ̆ng, kiăng kơ tơlơi khăp Ih hmâo khăp laih kơ Kâo dŏ amăng ƀing gơñu, laih anŭn Kâo ăt dŏ amăng ƀing gơñu mơ̆n.”
Jesus, having said these things, went out with his disciples beyond the torrent Cedron, where was a garden, into which he entered, he and his disciples. @ Giơ̆ng kơ Yêsu iâu laĭ, Ñu nao hrŏm hăng ƀing ding kơna Ñu pơ hang gah adih ia hơnoh Kêdrôn. Pơ anŭn hmâo sa boh đang. Ñu mŭt pơ đang anŭn hrŏm hăng ƀing ding kơna Ñu. 
And Judas also, who delivered him up, knew the place, because Jesus was often there, in company with his disciples. @ Yudas pô pơblư̆ lui Yêsu, thâo anih anŭn mơ̆n; yua kơ Yêsu juăt pơbưp nanao pơ anŭn hrŏm hăng ƀing ding kơna Ñu. 
Judas therefore, having got the band, and officers of the chief priests and Pharisees, comes there with lanterns and torches and weapons. @ Tui anŭn Yudas ba sa phung tơhan Rôm hrŏm hăng đơđa ƀing tơhan mơ̆ng ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng hăng ƀing Pharisi, djă apui kơđen, apui arok nao pơ anŭn wơ̆t hăng gơnam pơblah. 
Jesus therefore, knowing all things that were coming upon him, went forth and said to them, Whom seek ye? @ Yêsu thâo abih bang tơlơi či truh kơ Ñu, tui anŭn Ñu nao hăng tơña ƀing anŭn: “Ƀing gih sem hlơi?”
They answered him, Jesus the Nazaraean. Jesus says to them, I am [he]. And Judas also, who delivered him up, stood with them. @ Gơñu laĭ glaĭ: “Yêsu Plei Nasaret.”
Yêsu laĭ: “Kâo yơh Yêsu.”
Yudas pô pơblư̆ lui Yêsu, ăt dŏ hrŏm hăng ƀing gơñu pơ anŭn. 
When therefore he said to them, I am [he], they went away backward and fell to the ground. @ Tơ Yêsu laĭ: “Kâo yơh Yêsu,” gơñu kơdŭn glaĭ pơ klon hăng rơbuh pơ lŏn. 
He demanded of them therefore again, Whom seek ye? And they said, Jesus the Nazaraean. @ Yêsu tơña dơ̆ng: “Hlơi gih sem?” Gơñu laĭ glaĭ: “Yêsu, Plei Nasaret.”
Jesus answered, I told you that I am [he]: if therefore ye seek me, let these go away; @ Yêsu laĭ: “Kâo laĭ laih kơ ƀing gih, Kâo yơh Yêsu. Tui anŭn tơdah ƀing gih sem Kâo, brơi bĕ ƀing anai đuaĭ.” 
that the word might be fulfilled which he spoke, [As to] those whom thou hast given me, I have not lost one of them. @ Tơlơi anŭn kiăng kơ krĕp djơ̆ tơlơi Ñu hmâo pơhiăp laih: “Kâo ƀu pơrơngiă ôh sa čô amăng ƀing mơnuih Ih hmâo brơi laih kơ Kâo.”
