Simon Peter therefore, having a sword, drew it, and smote the bondman of the high priest and cut off his right ear; and the bondman's name was Malchus. @ Hlăk anŭn Simôn Pêtrôs hmâo sa ƀĕ đao, suă hăng koh ding kơna khua ngă yang prŏng hloh, djơ̆ ƀơi tơngia gah hơnuă hăng tơĭ hĭ. Anăn ding kơna anŭn Malkus. 
Jesus therefore said to Peter, Put the sword into the sheath; the cup which the Father has given me, shall I not drink it? @ Yêsu laĭ kơ Pêtrôs: “Jek glaĭ bĕ đao ih amăng hrŭm ñu. Kơčok Ama hmâo brơi laih kơ Kâo, hyư̆m Kâo ƀu mơñum ôh hă?”
The band therefore, and the chiliarch, and the officers of the Jews, took Jesus and bound him: @ Giơ̆ng anŭn ƀing tơhan Rôm, khua tơhan hăng ƀing tơhan ană Yuđa mă čaŏ Yêsu. 
and they led him away to Annas first; for he was father-in-law to Caiaphas, who was high priest that year. @ Hlâo hloh gơñu ba nao Yêsu pơ Anas; yua kơ Anas jing tơhmua kơ Kaip. Kaip jing khua ngă yang prŏng hloh ƀơi thŭn anŭn. 
But it was Caiaphas who counselled the Jews that it was better that one man should perish for the people. @ Kaip anŭn mơ̆n hmâo pơtô brơi laih kơ ƀing ană Yuđa: sa čô mơnuih djai pơala kơ ană plei pla jing hiam hloh.
Now Simon Peter followed Jesus, and the other disciple. But that disciple was known to the high priest, and went in with Jesus into the palace of the high priest; @ Simôn Pêtrôs hăng sa čô ding kơna pơkŏn đuaĭ tui Yêsu. Yua kơ khua ngă yang prŏng hloh thâo krăn ding kơna anŭn, ñu mŭt amăng wăl sang khua ngă yang prŏng hloh hrŏm hăng Yêsu. 
but Peter stood at the door without. The other disciple therefore, who was known to the high priest, went out and spoke to the porteress and brought in Peter. @ Samơ̆ Pêtrôs ăt dŏ dơ̆ng pơ gah rơngiao ƀơi bah amăng. Hnŭn yơh pô ding kơna pơkŏn anŭn jing pô khua ngă yang prŏng hloh thâo krăn, tơbiă nao pơhiăp hăng sa čô đah kơmơi gak wai bah amăng, hăng ba Pêtrôs mŭt. 
The maid therefore, who was porteress, says to Peter, Art thou also of the disciples of this man? He says, I am not. @ Đah kơmơi gak wai bah amăng anŭn laĭ kơ Pêtrôs: “Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă ih ăt jing sa čô amăng ƀing ding kơna kơ pô anŭn?”
Pêtrôs laĭ glaĭ: “Kâo ƀu djơ̆ ôh.”
But the bondmen and officers, having made a fire of coals (for it was cold), stood and warmed themselves; and Peter was standing with them and warming himself. @ Yua kơ mlam anŭn rơŏt tui anŭn ƀing ding kơna hăng ƀing khua tơhan rơ̆m apui, laih anŭn gơñu mơdang. Pêtrôs ăt dŏ mơdang apui hrŏm hăng gơñu mơ̆n.
The high priest therefore demanded of Jesus concerning his disciples and concerning his doctrine. @ Khua ngă yang prŏng hloh tơña kơ Yêsu tơlơi djơ̆ kơ ƀing ding kơna Ñu laih anŭn kơ tơlơi Ñu pơtô. 
Jesus answered him, I spoke openly to the world; I taught always in [the] synagogue and in the temple, where all the Jews come together, and in secret I have spoken nothing. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Kâo hmâo pơhiăp rơđah laih ƀơi anăp abih bang mơnuih, Kâo pơtô nanao amăng sang bơjơnum hăng amăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ, anih abih bang ƀing ană Yuđa juăt bơjơnum. Kâo ƀu hmâo pơhiăp sa mơta hăng tơlơi hơgơ̆m ôh. 
Why demandest thou of me? Demand of those who have heard, what I have spoken to them; behold, they know what I have said. @ Hyư̆m ih tơña kơ Kâo? Tơña bĕ ƀing hmâo hmư̆ laih hơgĕt tơlơi Kâo hmâo pơhiăp laih hăng gơñu. Ƀing anŭn thâo laih hơdôm tơlơi Kâo hmâo pơhiăp.”
But as he said these things, one of the officers who stood by gave a blow on the face to Jesus, saying, Answerest thou the high priest thus? @ Tơdang Yêsu pơhiăp laih tơlơi anŭn, sa čô amăng ƀing tơhan dŏ wai pơ anŭn pah meng Yêsu hăng laĭ: “Hyư̆m Ih khĭn laĭ glaĭ hăng khua ngă yang prŏng hloh tui anŭn?”
Jesus answered him, If I have spoken evil, bear witness of the evil; but if well, why smitest thou me? @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Tơdah Kâo pơhiăp soh, laĭ brơi kơ Kâo thâo tơlơi ƀu djơ̆ anŭn bĕ, samơ̆ tơdah Kâo pơhiăp djơ̆ yua hơgĕt ih pah meng Kâo lĕ?”
Annas [then] had sent him bound to Caiaphas the high priest. @ Anas pơđar arăng ba Yêsu nao pơ Kaip khua ngă yang prŏng hloh, hlăk anŭn tơngan Yêsu arăng ăt dŏ čaŏ.
But Simon Peter was standing and warming himself. They said therefore to him, Art thou also of his disciples? He denied, and said, I am not. @ Hlăk anŭn Simôn Pêtrôs dŏ dơ̆ng mơdang apui, hmâo pô pơkŏn tơña kơ ñu: “Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă ih ăt jing sa čô amăng ƀing ding kơna Ñu?”
Pêtrôs hơngah hăng laĭ: “Ư ưh ƀu djơ̆ kâo ôh.”
One of the bondmen of the high priest, who was kinsman of him whose ear Peter cut off, says, Did not I see thee in the garden with him? @ Hmâo sa čô amăng ƀing hlŭn khua ngă yang prŏng hloh jing kơnŭng djuai pô Pêtrôs hmâo koh tơĭ tơngia, laih anŭn tơña: “Ƀu djơ̆ ih ôh hă kâo hmâo ƀuh amăng đang hrŏm hăng Ñu?”
Peter denied therefore again, and immediately [the] cock crew. @ Sa wơ̆t dơ̆ng Pêtrôs hơngah; laih anŭn mơnŭ tơdjô̆ mơtam.
They lead therefore Jesus from Caiaphas to the praetorium; and it was early morn. And *they* entered not into the praetorium, that they might not be defiled, but eat the passover. @ Ưm mơguah ƀing gơñu ba nao Yêsu mơ̆ng sang Kaip truh pơ sang khua čar. Gơñu pô ƀu mŭt ôh amăng sang khua čar, kiăng klaih kơ tơlơi hơƀak drak laih anŭn dưi ƀơ̆ng phĕt Tơlơi Găn. 
Pilate therefore went out to them and said, What accusation do ye bring against this man? @ Tui anŭn yơh Pilat tơbiă nao pơ ƀing gơñu hăng laĭ: “Yua kơ tơlơi hơgĕt ƀing gih phong kơ pô anai?”
They answered and said to him, If this [man] were not an evildoer, we should not have delivered him up to thee. @ Gơñu laĭ glaĭ: “Tơdah pô anai ƀu jing mơnuih soh sat ôh, gơmơi ƀu jao ñu kơ ih ôh.”
Pilate therefore said to them, Take him, ye, and judge him according to your law. The Jews therefore said to him, It is not permitted to us to put any one to death; @ Pilat laĭ hăng gơñu: “Brơi ƀing gih mă ñu hăng phat kơđi ñu tui hăng tơlơi juăt ƀing gih pô.”
Ƀing Yuđa laĭ glaĭ: “Ƀing gơmơi ƀu hmâo tơlơi dưi phat kơđi pơdjai hlơi ôh” 
that the word of Jesus might be fulfilled which he spoke, signifying what death he should die. @ Tơlơi anŭn krĕp djơ̆ tui hăng tơlơi Yêsu hmâo pơhiăp laih, tơdang laĭ nao kơ hyư̆m hơdră jơlan Ñu či djai.
Pilate therefore entered again into the praetorium and called Jesus, and said to him, Thou art the king of the Jews? @ Pilat mŭt glaĭ amăng sang pơtao, iâu Yêsu hăng tơña: “Djơ̆ mơ̆ Ih jing pơtao Ană Yuđa?”
Jesus answered [him], Dost thou say this of thyself, or have others said it to thee concerning me? @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Ih pơhiăp tơlơi anŭn mơ̆ng ih pô hă, ƀôdah hmâo pô pơkŏn laĭ brơi ih kơ tơlơi Kâo jing?”
Pilate answered, Am I a Jew? Thy nation and the chief priests have delivered thee up to me: what hast thou done? @ Pilat laĭ glaĭ: “Kâo ƀu djơ̆ ană Yuđa ôh. Ƀing kơnŭng djuai ih pô hăng ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng hmâo jao ih kơ kâo. Hơgĕt tơlơi ih hmâo ngă?”
Jesus answered, My kingdom is not of this world; if my kingdom were of this world, my servants had fought that I might not be delivered up to the Jews; but now my kingdom is not from hence. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Dêh čar pơtao Kâo ƀu lơ̆m kơ lŏn tơnah anai ôh. Tơdah dêh čar pơtao Kâo lơ̆m kơ lŏn tơnah anai, ƀing ding kơna Kâo či pơblah, kiăng kơ arăng ƀu dưi jao kâo kơ ƀing ană Yuđa ôh. Samơ̆ dêh čar pơtao Kâo ƀu lơ̆m kơ lŏn tơnah anai ôh.”
Pilate therefore said to him, Thou art then a king? Jesus answered, Thou sayest [it], that I am a king. I have been born for this, and for this I have come into the world, that I might bear witness to the truth. Every one that is of the truth hears my voice. @ Pilat laĭ: “Tui anŭn ih jing pơtao hă?” Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Sĭt djơ̆ yơh, ih laĭ Kâo jing pơtao. Yua kơ tơlơi anŭn arăng hmâo tơkeng laih Kâo, hăng yua kơ tơlơi anŭn mơ̆n Kâo hmâo rai laih amăng lŏn tơnah, anŭn yơh kiăng ngă gơ̆ng jơlan kơ tơlơi sĭt. Hlơi pô lơ̆m kơ tơlơi sĭt leng kơ hmư̆ hiăp Kâo.”
Pilate says to him, What is truth? And having said this he went out again to the Jews, and says to them, I find no fault whatever in him. @ Pilat tơña: “Hơgĕt jing tơlơi sĭt?”
Giơ̆ng kơ Pilat laĭ tơlơi anŭn, ñu tơbiă nao pơ ƀing ană Yuđa dơ̆ng hăng laĭ kơ gơñu: “Kâo ƀu ƀuh ôh tơlơi soh amăng Ñu. 
But ye have a custom that I release [some] one to you at the passover; will ye therefore that I release unto you the king of the Jews? @ Samơ̆ tui hăng tơlơi phiăn ƀing gih kâo či pŏk brơi kơ ƀing gih sa čô mơnă ƀơi hrơi phĕt Tơlơi Găn. Ƀing gih kiăng mơ̆ kâo phư brơi pơtao ană Yuđa kơ ƀing gih?”
They cried therefore again all, saying, Not this [man], but Barabbas. Now Barabbas was a robber. @ Samơ̆ gơñu ur kraih hăng laĭ: “Ƀu djơ̆ mơnuih anai ôh, samơ̆ pŏk brơi bĕ kơ gơmơi Barabas!” Barabas jing sa čô mơnuih klĕ dŏp.
Then Pilate therefore took Jesus and scourged [him]. @ Giơ̆ng kơ tơlơi anŭn, Pilat mă Yêsu hăng brơi ƀing tơhan taih Ñu hăng gai hnuăt ngă hăng hrĕ klĭ. 
And the soldiers having plaited a crown of thorns put it on his head, and put a purple robe on him, @ Ƀing tơhan mơñam sa boh mŭk pơtao ngă hăng drơi, hăng đua brơi ƀơi akŏ Yêsu. Laih anŭn gơñu mă ao phyung mriah buh brơi kơ Yêsu. 
and came to him and said, Hail, king of the Jews! and gave him blows on the face. @ Gơñu nao pơ Yêsu hăng laĭ: “Kơkuh kơ Ih, Ơ Pơtao ană Yuđa” Laih anŭn gơñu pah meng Yêsu.
And Pilate went out again and says to them, Lo, I bring him out to you, that ye may know that I find in him no fault whatever. @ Pilat tơbiă nao sa wơ̆t dơ̆ng hăng laĭ kơ ƀing ană Yuđa: “Lăng anai, kâo ba tơbiă Ñu kơ ƀing gih, kiăng kơ ƀing ih thâo kâo ƀu ƀuh ôh sa mơta tơlơi soh amăng Ñu.” 
(Jesus therefore went forth without, wearing the crown of thorn, and the purple robe.) And he says to them, Behold the man! @ Tui anŭn Yêsu tơbiă nao, akŏ Ñu đua mŭk pơtao ngă hăng drơi laih anŭn buh ao phyung mriah. Pilat laĭ hăng gơñu: “Lăng bĕ, mơnuih anai!”
When therefore the chief priests and the officers saw him they cried out saying, Crucify, crucify [him]. Pilate says to them, Take him ye and crucify [him], for I find no fault in him. @ Samơ̆ tơ ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng hăng ƀing tơhan ƀuh Ñu, gơñu ur kraih: “Pơ̆ng hĭ Ñu pơ kơyâo bơrơkal bĕ! Pơ̆ng hĭ Ñu pơ kơyâo bơrơkal bĕ!”
Pilat laĭ kơ ƀing anŭn: “Ƀing gih pô mă ba bĕ Ñu hăng pơ̆ng pơ kơyâo bơrơkal, yua kơ kâo ƀu ƀuh ôh sa mơta tơlơi soh amăng Ñu.” 
The Jews answered him, We have a law, and according to [our] law he ought to die, because he made himself Son of God. @ Ƀing ană Yuđa laĭ glaĭ: “Gơmơi hmâo sa tơlơi juăt laih anŭn tui hăng tơlơi juăt anŭn Ñu khŏm djai, yua kơ Ñu laĭ Ñu pô jing Ană Ơi Adai.”
When Pilate therefore heard this word, he was the rather afraid, @ Tơ Pilat hmư̆ boh pơhiăp anŭn ñu hwĭ kơtang hloh. 
and went into the praetorium again and says to Jesus, Whence art thou? But Jesus gave him no answer. @ Ñu mŭt glaĭ amăng sang pơtao hăng tơña kơ Yêsu: “Mơ̆ng pă ih rai?”
Samơ̆ Yêsu ƀu laĭ glaĭ ôh. 
Pilate therefore says to him, Speakest thou not to *me*? Dost thou not know that I have authority to release thee and have authority to crucify thee? @ Tui anŭn Pilat laĭ kơ Ñu: “Hyư̆m Ih ƀu kiăng pơhiăp hăng kâo? Ih ƀu thâo ôh hă kâo hmâo tơlơi dưi phư brơi ih ƀôdah pơ̆ng hĭ ih pơ kơyâo bơrơkal?” 
Jesus answered, Thou hadst no authority whatever against me if it were not given to thee from above. On this account he that has delivered me up to thee has [the] greater sin. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Ih ƀu hmâo tơlơi dưi ngă kơ Kâo ôh, tơdah Ơi Adai ƀu brơi tơlơi dưi anŭn kơ ih. Yua kơ anŭn yơh, hlơi pô jao Kâo kơ ih tơlơi soh ñu prŏng hloh dơ̆ng.” 
From this time Pilate sought to release him; but the Jews cried out saying, If thou releasest this [man], thou art not a friend to Caesar. Every one making himself a king speaks against Caesar. @ Giơ̆ng hmư̆ tơlơi anŭn, Pilat hơduah jơlan kiăng phư hĭ Yêsu, samơ̆ ƀing ană Yuđa ur kraih: “Tơdah ih phư brơi mơnuih anai, ih ƀu jing giăng mah hăng Sêsar ôh. Yua kơ hlơi pô pơjing ñu pô jing pơtao, ñu pơkơdơ̆ng hăng Sêsar yơh.”
Pilate therefore, having heard these words, led Jesus out and sat down upon [the] judgment-seat, at a place called Pavement, but in Hebrew Gabbatha; @ Tơ Pilat hmư̆ hơdôm boh pơhiăp anŭn, ñu ba Yêsu pơ gah rơngiao hăng dŏ ber ƀơi gre phat kơđi ƀơi anih arăng pia Wăl Tap Boh Pơtâo, amăng tơlơi Hêbrơ arăng pia Gabatha. 
(now it was [the] preparation of the passover; it was about the sixth hour;) and he says to the Jews, Behold your king! @ Hlăk anŭn jing hrơi prăp rơmet kơ phĕt Tơlơi Găn amăng kơplah wah yang hrơi dơ̆ng. Pilat laĭ kơ ƀing ană Yuđa: “Anai jing pơtao ƀing gih!” 
But they cried out, Take [him] away, take [him] away, crucify him. Pilate says to them, Shall I crucify your king? The chief priests answered, We have no king but Caesar. @ Gơñu ur kraih: “Pơdjai hĭ Ñu, pơdjai hĭ Ñu, pơ̆ng Ñu pơ kơyâo bơrơkal!” Pilat laĭ: “Hyư̆m ƀing gih kiăng kâo pơ̆ng hĭ pơtao ƀing gih pơ kơyâo bơrơkal?” Ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng laĭ glaĭ: “Gơmơi ƀu hmâo pơtao pơkŏn dơ̆ng ôh, kơnơ̆ng hơjăn Sêsar đôč.” 
Then therefore he delivered him up to them, that he might be crucified; and they took Jesus and led him away. @ Tui anŭn Pilat jao Yêsu kơ gơñu, brơi gơñu pơ̆ng hĭ Ñu pơ kơyâo bơrơkal.
Giơ̆ng anŭn gơñu mă Yêsu hăng ba nao mơtam. 
And he went out, bearing his cross, to the place called [place] of a skull, which is called in Hebrew, Golgotha; @ Yêsu tơbiă nao, glăm kơyâo bơrơkal Ñu pô truh pơ anih Klang Akŏ, arăng pia amăng tơlơi Hêbrơ Gôlgôtha. 
where they crucified him, and with him two others, [one] on this side, and [one] on that, and Jesus in the middle. @ Pơ anŭn gơñu pơ̆ng Yêsu ƀơi kơyâo bơrơkal, hrŏm hơbĭt hăng dua čô mơnuih pơkŏn, sa čô gah iao, sa čô gah hơnuă, laih anŭn Yêsu tơ̆ng krah. 
And Pilate wrote a title also and put it on the cross. But there was written: Jesus the Nazaraean, the King of the Jews. @ Pilat čih sa pŏk hơnal hăng yol ƀơi ngŏ kơyâo bơrơkal. Hnal anŭn čih tui anai: “YÊSU NASARET, PƠTAO ANĂ YUĐA.” 
This title therefore many of the Jews read, for the place of the city where Jesus was crucified was near; and it was written in Hebrew, Greek, Latin. @ Lu ƀing ană Yuđa lăng hơnal anŭn, yua kơ anih ƀing tơhan pơ̆ng Yêsu ƀơi kơyâo bơrơkal giăm plei prŏng; hơnal anŭn arăng čih hăng tơlơi Hêbrơ, tơlơi Latin, tơlơi Grek. 
The chief priests of the Jews therefore said to Pilate, Do not write, The king of the Jews, but that *he* said, I am king of the Jews. @ Ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng ană Yuđa laĭ kơ Pilat: “Anăm čih ôh: ‘Pơtao Ană Yuđa’ samơ̆ brơi čih: ‘Pô anai laĭ, Kâo jing pơtao ƀing Yuđa.’” 
Pilate answered, What I have written, I have written. @ Pilat laĭ glaĭ: “Tơlơi kâo hmâo čih laih, kâo ƀu pơplih dơ̆ng tah.”
The soldiers therefore, when they had crucified Jesus, took his clothes, and made four parts, to each soldier a part, and the body-coat; but the body-coat was seamless, woven through the whole from the top. @ Giơ̆ng kơ ƀing tơhan pơ̆ng Yêsu pơ kơyâo bơrơkal, gơñu mă ao phyung Yêsu laih anŭn pơpha pă črăn, sa črăn kơ rĭm čô tơhan. Gơñu mă kar kaĭ mơ̆n ao phyung Yêsu, samơ̆ ao phyung anŭn jing sa blah bơnal arăng mơñam mơ̆ng ngŏ truh pơ yŭ ƀu hmâo jơlan sĭt ôh. 
They said therefore to one another, Let us not rend it, but let us cast lots for it, whose it shall be; that the scripture might be fulfilled which says, They parted my garments among themselves, and on my vesture they cast lots. The soldiers therefore did these things. @ Tui anŭn gơñu bơlaĭ tơdruă gơñu: “Anăm ƀing ta hek hĭ ao anai ôh, samơ̆ brơi ƀing ta mă pơčrăm kiăng thâo kơ hlơi pô či djơ̆.” Tơlơi anŭn kiăng krĕp djơ̆ Hră Ơi Adai pơhiăp čih laih:
“Gơñu pơpha tơdruă gơñu ao Kâo,
Laih anŭn gơñu mă pơčrăm kiăng hmâo ao phyung Kâo.”
Anŭn jing bruă ƀing tơhan hmâo ngă.
And by the cross of Jesus stood his mother, and the sister of his mother, Mary the [wife] of Clopas, and Mary of Magdala. @ Dŏ giăm kơyâo bơrơkal Yêsu hmâo amĭ Ñu, amai amĭ Ñu, hrŏm hăng HʼMari bơnai Klôpas laih anŭn HʼMari Plei Madala. 
Jesus therefore, seeing his mother, and the disciple standing by, whom he loved, says to his mother, Woman, behold thy son. @ 59 Yêsu ƀuh amĭ Ñu hăng ding kơna pô Ñu khăp hlăk dŏ jĕ, Yêsu laĭ kơ amĭ Ñu: “Ơ amĭ, anai jing ană đah rơkơi ih!” 
Then he says unto the disciple, Behold thy mother. And from that hour the disciple took her to his own home. @ Laih anŭn Ñu laĭ kơ ding kơna anŭn: “Anai jing amĭ ih” Mơ̆ng mông anŭn ding kơna anŭn jak ba HʼMari glaĭ pơ sang ñu pô.
After this, Jesus, knowing that all things were now finished, that the scripture might be fulfilled, says, I thirst. @ Giơ̆ng kơ tơlơi anŭn, Yêsu thâo abih bang bruă hmâo giơ̆ng yơh, kiăng ngă krĕp djơ̆ Tơlơi Ơi Adai pơhiăp čih laih, Ñu laĭ: “Kâo mơhao.”
There was a vessel therefore there full of vinegar, and having filled a sponge with vinegar, and putting hyssop round it, they put it up to his mouth. @ Pơ anŭn hmâo sa boh get bă hăng ia tơpai mơsăm. Gơñu mă pông diăn añrŭ amăng ia mơsăm gơñu kă ƀơi sa ƀĕ than hisôp laih anŭn čŭt nao ƀơi tơƀuai Yêsu. 
When therefore Jesus had received the vinegar, he said, It is finished; and having bowed his head, he delivered up his spirit. @ Tơ Yêsu mơñum laih ia tơpai mơsăm, Ñu laĭ: “Abih bang bruă giơ̆ng laih!” Laih anŭn Ñu kŭp akŏ, tơĭ pran.
The Jews therefore, that the bodies might not remain on the cross on the sabbath, for it was [the] preparation, (for the day of that sabbath was a great [day],) demanded of Pilate that their legs might be broken and they taken away. @ Yua kơ hrơi anŭn jing hrơi prăp rơmet kơ phĕt Tơlơi Găn, laih anŭn ƀing Yuđa ƀu kiăng drơi jan dŏ ƀơi kơyâo bơrơkal tơdang hrơi saƀat (Yua kơ hrơi saƀat anŭn jing hrơi pơyom biă mă), ƀing Yuđa rơkâo Pilat brơi arăng taih joh hĭ tơkai gơñu, laih anŭn mă pơđuaĭ hĭ gơñu pơ anih pơkŏn. 
The soldiers therefore came and broke the legs of the first and of the other that had been crucified with him; @ Hnŭn yơh ƀing tơhan nao taih joh hĭ klang thông pô tal hlâo, hăng pô pơkŏn jing dua čô arăng pơ̆ng ƀơi kơyâo bơrơkal hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Yêsu. 
but coming to Jesus, when they saw that he was already dead they did not break his legs, @ Samơ̆ tơ gơñu nao jĕ pơ Yêsu gơñu ƀuh Ñu djai laih, hnŭn yơh ƀing tơhan ƀu taih joh klang thông Yêsu ôh. 
but one of the soldiers pierced his side with a spear, and immediately there came out blood and water. @ Samơ̆ hmâo sa čô amăng ƀing tơhan klaŏ ƀơi djeo Ñu hăng tơbăk laih anŭn drah hăng ia ƀlĕ mơtam. 
And he who saw it bears witness, and his witness is true, and he knows that he says true that ye also may believe. @ Pô hmâo ƀuh tơlơi anŭn ngă gơ̆ng jơlan, tơlơi ñu ngă gơ̆ng jơlan anŭn jing sĭt, laih anŭn ñu ăt thâo mơ̆n kơ tơlơi ñu pơhiăp anŭn jing sĭt, kiăng kơ ƀing gih dưi đaŏ mơ̆n. 
For these things took place that the scripture might be fulfilled, Not a bone of him shall be broken. @ Hơdôm tơlơi anai hmâo truh kiăng kơ krĕp djơ̆ tui hăng Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp hmâo čih laih: “Ƀu hmâo ôh sa ƀĕ klang Ñu či joh hĭ.” 
And again another scripture says, They shall look on him whom they pierced. @ Laih anŭn hmâo Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp tui anai dơ̆ng: “Gơñu či lăng kơ pô gơñu hmâo klaŏ laih.”
And after these things Joseph of Arimathaea, who was a disciple of Jesus, but secretly through fear of the Jews, demanded of Pilate that he might take the body of Jesus: and Pilate allowed it. He came therefore and took away the body of Jesus. @ Giơ̆ng kơ anŭn Yôsep plei Arimathê, jing sa čô ding kơna Yêsu, hăng tơlơi hơgơ̆m yua kơ ñu hwĭ kơ ƀing Yuđa, nao rơkâo Pilat tơlơi dưi mă drơi jan Yêsu. Pilat brơi mơ̆n. Tui anŭn ñu nao mă drơi jan Yêsu. 
And Nicodemus also, who at first came to Jesus by night, came, bringing a mixture of myrrh and aloes, about a hundred pounds [weight]. @ Nikôđem, pô hlâo anŭn hmâo nao pơ Yêsu sa wơ̆t amăng mlam, ăt nao mơ̆n, djă ba sa rơtuh kilôgram ia jrao phĭ ƀâu hiam lŭk hăng ia jrao alôê. 
They took therefore the body of Jesus and bound it up in linen with the spices, as it is the custom with the Jews to prepare for burial. @ Gơñu mă atâo Yêsu, hăng pŏn drơi jan Yêsu hăng khăn kơbuă laih anŭn hrŏm hăng ia jrao ƀâu hiam, tui hăng tơlơi phiăn ƀing Yuđa dơr mơnuih djai. 
But there was in the place where he had been crucified a garden, and in the garden a new tomb in which no one had ever been laid. @ Ƀơi jĕ anih arăng pơ̆ng Yêsu anŭn hmâo sa boh đang kơyâo, amăng đang kơyâo anŭn hmâo sa boh pơsat phrâo, arăng aka dơr mơnuih djai ôh. 
There therefore, on account of the preparation of the Jews, because the tomb was near, they laid Jesus. @ Yua kơ hrơi anŭn jing hrơi ƀing Yuđa prăp pre kơ phĕt Tơlơi Găn, gơñu pioh Yêsu amăng pơsat anŭn, yua kơ pơsat jĕ ƀơi anŭn.
And on the first [day] of the week Mary of Magdala comes in early morn to the tomb, while it was still dark, and sees the stone taken away from the tomb. @ Ưm mơguah hrơi tal sa amăng hrơi kơ̆m HʼMari Madala nao pơsat, tơdang adai dŏ mơmŏt, ƀuh boh pơtâo tơglung hĭ laih mơ̆ng bah amăng pơsat. 
She runs therefore and comes to Simon Peter, and to the other disciple, to whom Jesus was attached, and says to them, They have taken away the Lord out of the tomb, and we know not where they have laid him. @ Tui anŭn ñu nao pơ Simôn Pêtrôs laih anŭn pơ sa čô ding kơna pơkŏn, jing pô Yêsu khăp, laih anŭn laĭ: “Arăng hmâo ba pơđuaĭ laih Khua Yang mơ̆ng pơsat laih anŭn gơmơi ƀu thâo ôh pơpă anih arăng pioh hĭ Ñu.”
Peter therefore went forth, and the other disciple, and came to the tomb. @ Tui anŭn Pêtrôs hăng ding kơna pơkŏn anŭn, tơbiă nao pơ pơsat mơtam. 
And the two ran together, and the other disciple ran forward faster than Peter, and came first to the tomb, @ Abih dua gơñu đuaĭ hrŏm, samơ̆ ding kơna pơkŏn anŭn đuaĭ hơmăr hloh kơ Pêtrôs hăng truh hlâo pơ pơsat. 
and stooping down he sees the linen cloths lying; he did not however go in. @ Ñu tơkui ep lăng amăng pơsat, ƀuh khăn kơbuă ăt dŏ ƀơi anŭn, samơ̆ ñu ƀu mŭt amăng pơsat ôh. 
Simon Peter therefore comes, following him, and entered into the tomb, and sees the linen cloths lying, @ Simôn Pêtrôs truh tơdơi kơ ñu hăng mŭt amăng lăm pơsat mơtam. Gơ̆ ƀuh khăn kơbuă ƀơi anŭn, 
and the handkerchief which was upon his head, not lying with the linen cloths, but folded up in a distinct place by itself. @ samơ̆ khăn arăng klŭm akŏ Yêsu ƀu dŏ hrŏm hăng khăn kơbuă anŭn ôh, samơ̆ lŏp hĭ hăng pioh phara anih. 
Then entered in therefore the other disciple also who came first to the tomb, and he saw and believed; @ Hlăk anŭn ding kơna pơkŏn anŭn, pô truh hlâo pơ pơsat, ăt mŭt amăng pơsat mơ̆n. Gơ̆ ƀuh hăng đaŏ. 
for they had not yet known the scripture, that he must rise from among [the] dead. @ Hlăk anŭn gơñu ăt aka ƀu thâo hluh ôh Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp hmâo čih laih kơ Yêsu či hơdip glaĭ dơ̆ng mơ̆ng ƀing djai. 
The disciples therefore went away again to their own home. @ Laih anŭn ƀing ding kơna anŭn glaĭ hĭ pơ sang gơñu pô.
But Mary stood at the tomb weeping without. As therefore she wept, she stooped down into the tomb, @ HʼMari dŏ dơ̆ng hia ƀơi gah rơngiao jĕ pơsat, tơdang ñu hia ñu tơkui ep lăng amăng pơsat, 
and beholds two angels sitting in white [garments], one at the head and one at the feet, where the body of Jesus had lain. @ ñu ƀuh dua čô ling jang buh ao kŏ dŏ ber ƀơi anih arăng hmâo pioh atâo Yêsu. Sa čô dŏ ƀơi akŏ, sa čô dŏ ƀơi tơkai. 
And they say to her, Woman, why dost thou weep? She says to them, Because they have taken away my Lord, and I know not where they have laid him. @ Gơñu tơña: “Ơ đah kơmơi, yua hơgĕt ih hia lĕ?” HʼMari laĭ glaĭ: “Yua kơ arăng hmâo mă pơđuaĭ hĭ Khua Yang kâo, laih anŭn kâo ƀu thâo ôh pơpă anih arăng pioh Ñu.” 
Having said these things she turned backward and beholds Jesus standing [there], and knew not that it was Jesus. @ Tơdang laĭ tui anŭn, ñu wir lăng hăng ƀuh Yêsu dŏ dơ̆ng, samơ̆ ñu ƀu thâo ôh anŭn jing Yêsu. 
Jesus says to her, Woman, why dost thou weep? Whom seekest thou? She, supposing that it was the gardener, says to him, Sir, if thou hast borne him hence, tell me where thou hast laid him, and I will take him away. @ Yêsu tơña ñu: “Ơ đah kơmơi, yua hơgĕt ih hia lĕ? Hlơi ih sem?” HʼMari pơmĭn dah ñu jing pô wai đang kơyâo, hnŭn yơh ñu laĭ: “Ơ Khua tơdah ih hmâo mă pơđuaĭ hĭ Ñu, laĭ brơi kơ kâo pơpă anih ih pioh Ñu, laih anŭn kâo či nao mă tŭ Ñu.” 
Jesus says to her, Mary. She, turning round, says to him in Hebrew, Rabboni, which means Teacher. @ Yêsu laĭ: “Ơ HʼMari.” HʼMari wir lăng laih anŭn iâu kơ Ñu hăng tơlơi Hêbrơ: “Rabôni” (kiăng laĭ: “Nai”). 
Jesus says to her, Touch me not, for I have not yet ascended to my Father; but go to my brethren and say to them, I ascend to my Father and your Father, and [to] my God and your God. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ ñu: “Anăm ruaih Kâo ôh, yua kơ Kâo aka đĭ pơ Ama Kâo ôh; samơ̆ nao bĕ pơ ƀing adơi ayŏng Kâo hăng laĭ brơi gơñu: ‘Kâo či đĭ glaĭ pơ Ama Kâo laih anŭn Ama ƀing gih, pơ Ơi Adai Kâo laih anŭn Ơi Adai ƀing gih.’” 
Mary of Magdala comes bringing word to the disciples that she had seen the Lord, and [that] he had said these things to her. @ HʼMari Madala nao laĭ brơi kơ ƀing ding kơna: “Kâo ƀuh laih Khua Yang;” laih anŭn ñu ră ruai kơ ƀing ding kơna hơdôm tơlơi Yêsu hmâo laĭ laih kơ ñu.
When therefore it was evening on that day, which was the first [day] of the week, and the doors shut where the disciples were, through fear of the Jews, Jesus came and stood in the midst, and says to them, Peace [be] to you. @ Ƀơi klam hrơi anŭn, jing hrơi tal sa amăng hrơi kơ̆m, anih ƀing ding kơna dŏ krư̆ kơđơ̆l hĭ bah amăng yua kơ hwĭ kơ ƀing Yuđa, Yêsu rai hăng dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơi tơ̆ng krah ƀing gơñu hăng laĭ: “Rơnŭk rơnua kơ ƀing gih.” 
And having said this, he shewed to them his hands and his side. The disciples rejoiced therefore, having seen the Lord. @ Giơ̆ng kơ pơhiăp, Ñu pơƀuh brơi kơ ƀing gơñu lăng tơngan hăng djeo Ñu. Tơ gơñu ƀuh Khua Yang, ƀing ding kơna hơ̆k mơak biă mă. 
[Jesus] said therefore again to them, Peace [be] to you: as the Father sent me forth, I also send you. @ Yêsu laĭ dơ̆ng: “Rơnŭk rơnua kơ ƀing gih. Kar hăng Ama hmâo pơkiaŏ rai Kâo, Kâo ăt pơkiaŏ ƀing gih kar kaĭ mơ̆n.” 
And having said this, he breathed into [them], and says to them, Receive [the] Holy Spirit: @ Giơ̆ng Yêsu pơhiăp tơlơi anŭn, Ñu bluh ayuh kơ ƀing gơ̆ hăng laĭ: “Mă tŭ bĕ Yang Bơngăt Hiam. 
whose soever sins ye remit, they are remitted to them; whose soever [sins] ye retain, they are retained. @ Tơdah ƀing gih pap brơi tơlơi soh arăng, gơñu či hmâo tơlơi pap brơi; laih anŭn tơdah ƀing gih djă pioh tơlơi soh arăng, tơlơi soh gơñu ăt dŏ đom glaĭ.”
But Thomas, one of the twelve, called Didymus, was not with them when Jesus came. @ Thômas, sa čô amăng ƀing pluh dua čô khua ding kơna, pô arăng pia ană Kơmar, ƀu dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng gơñu ôh hlăk Yêsu rai. 
The other disciples therefore said to him, We have seen the Lord. But he said to them, Unless I see in his hands the mark of the nails, and put my finger into the mark of the nails, and put my hand into his side, I will not believe. @ Tui anŭn ƀing ding kơna pơkŏn laĭ hăng ñu: “Gơmơi hmâo ƀuh laih Khua Yang.” Samơ̆ Thômas laĭ kơ gơñu: “Kâo ƀu či đaŏ ôh, tơdah kâo ƀu ƀuh gru nam rơka kơđĭn amăng tơngan Ñu, laih anŭn čơđeng kâo ƀu ruaih ôh ƀơi nam rơka anŭn, laih anŭn ƀu dưm tơngan kâo ƀơi djeo Ñu.”
And eight days after, his disciples were again within, and Thomas with them. Jesus comes, the doors being shut, and stood in the midst and said, Peace [be] to you. @ Sapăn hrơi tơdơi, ƀing ding kơna Ñu dŏ pơtŭm glaĭ amăng sang anŭn dơ̆ng, laih anŭn Thômas ăt dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng gơñu mơ̆n. Abih bah amăng leng krư̆ soh sel, samơ̆ Yêsu rai dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơi tơ̆ng krah ƀing gơñu hăng laĭ: “Rơnŭk rơnua kơ ƀing gih.” 
Then he says to Thomas, Bring thy finger here and see my hands; and bring thy hand and put it into my side; and be not unbelieving, but believing. @ Laih anŭn Yêsu laĭ kơ Thômas: “Čơđeng ih ruaih bĕ ƀơi anai, hăng lăng bĕ tơngan Kâo; yơr tơngan ih hăng ruaih bĕ djeo Kâo; anăm đing đaŏ ôh, samơ̆ đaŏ bĕ.” 
Thomas answered and said to him, My Lord and my God. @ Thômas laĭ glaĭ: “Ơ Khua Yang kâo, Ơi Adai kâo!” 
Jesus says to him, Because thou hast seen me thou hast believed: blessed they who have not seen and have believed. @ Yêsu laĭ: “Djơ̆ mơ̆ ih đaŏ yua kơ ih ƀuh Kâo? Mơyun hiam yơh kơ ƀing ƀu ƀuh ôh samơ̆ ñu đaŏ.”
Many other signs therefore also Jesus did before his disciples, which are not written in this book; @ Yêsu hmâo ngă lu gru tơlơi mơsêh mơyang pơkŏn dơ̆ng ƀơi anăp ƀing ding kơna Ñu, arăng ƀu čih ôh amăng hơdrôm hră anai; 
but these are written that ye may believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and that believing ye might have life in his name. @ samơ̆ hơdôm tơlơi anai hmâo čih, kiăng kơ ƀing gih đaŏ kơ Yêsu jing Yang Krist, Ană Ơi Adai, laih anŭn hăng tơlơi ƀing gih đaŏ ƀing gih dưi hmâo tơlơi hơdip amăng anăn Ñu.
After these things Jesus manifested himself again to the disciples at the sea of Tiberias. And he manifested [himself] thus. @ Giơ̆ng kơ anŭn, Yêsu pơƀuh Ñu Pô dơ̆ng kơ ƀing ding kơna Ñu ƀơi hang ia rơsĭ Tibêrias. Tơlơi Ñu pơƀuh rai tui anai: 
There were together Simon Peter, and Thomas called Didymus, and Nathanael who was of Cana of Galilee, and the [sons] of Zebedee, and two others of his disciples. @ Simôn Pêtrôs, Thômas arăng pơanăn pô arăng tơkeng kơmar, Natanel mơ̆ng plei Kana tring Galilê, ƀing ană đah rơkơi Sêbêdê, hăng dua čô ƀing khua ding kơna pơkŏn dŏ pơƀŭt glaĭ hrŏm hơbĭt. 
Simon Peter says to them, I go to fish. They say to him, We also come with thee. They went forth, and went on board, and that night took nothing. @ Simôn Pêtrôs laĭ hăng gơñu: “Kâo nao trah akan.” Gơñu laĭ glaĭ: “Gơmơi či nao hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ih mơ̆n.” Gơñu tơbiă nao trŭn amăng sŏng yơh, samơ̆ amăng mlam anŭn gơñu ƀu hmâo hơgĕt gĕt ôh.
And early morn already breaking, Jesus stood on the shore; the disciples however did not know that it was Jesus. @ Truh sêng brêng mơguah, Yêsu dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơi hang; samơ̆ ƀing khua ding kơna ƀu thâo krăn ôh anŭn jing Yêsu. 
Jesus therefore says to them, Children, have ye anything to eat? They answered him, No. @ Yêsu tơña kơ ƀing gơñu: “Ơ ƀing ană Kâo, ƀing gih ƀu hmâo akan ôh hă?” Gơñu laĭ glaĭ: “Ƀu hmâo ôh.” 
And he said to them, Cast the net at the right side of the ship and ye will find. They cast therefore, and they could no longer draw it, from the multitude of fishes. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Dăng bĕ hơñual gah hơnuă kơ sŏng ƀing gih či hmâo akan yơh.” Tui anŭn gơñu dăng, djơ̆ akan lu biă mă tơl gơñu ƀu anăm dui đĭ ôh. 
That disciple therefore whom Jesus loved says to Peter, It is the Lord. Simon Peter therefore, having heard that it was the Lord, girded his overcoat [on him] (for he was naked), and cast himself into the sea; @ Ding kơna pô Yêsu khăp anŭn laĭ hăng Pêtrôs: “Khua Yang yơh anŭn!” Tơ Simôn Pêtrôs hmư̆ anŭn jing Khua Yang, ñu mă ao phyung buh sŏm drơi jan ñu, yua kơ ñu dŏ drơi mơhlŭn, laih anŭn kơdâo trŭn amăng ia. 
and the other disciples came in the small boat, for they were not far from the land, but somewhere about two hundred cubits, dragging the net of fishes. @ Samơ̆ ƀing khua ding kơna pơkŏn waih sŏng rai hrŏm hơbĭt, dui hơñual bă hăng akan, yua kơ gơñu ataih mơ̆ng hang kơnơ̆ng giăm sa rơtuh met đôč. 
When therefore they went out on the land, they see a fire of coals there, and fish laid on it, and bread. @ Tơ gơñu đĭ pơ hang, gơñu ƀuh pơ anŭn hmâo apui hơdăng, ƀơi hăng ngŏ apui anŭn hmâo akan hăng ƀañ tơpŭng. 
Jesus says to them, Bring of the fishes which ye have now taken. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Djă rai bĕ ƀiă akan ƀing gih phrâo mă anŭn pơ anai.” 
Simon Peter went up and drew the net to the land full of great fishes, a hundred and fifty-three; and though there were so many, the net was not rent. @ Tui anŭn Simôn Pêtrôs đĭ amăng sŏng hăng dui hơñual nao pơ hang, bă hăng sa rơtuh rơma pluh klâo drơi akan prŏng; wơ̆t dah akan lu kar hăng anŭn jal ƀu tơĭ ôh. 
Jesus says to them, Come [and] dine. But none of the disciples dared inquire of him, Who art thou? knowing that it was the Lord. @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Rai ƀơ̆ng bĕ.” Ƀu hmâo ôh sa čô amăng ƀing khua ding kơna khĭn tơña kơ Ñu: “Hlơi ih jing?” Yua kơ gơñu thâo sĭt anŭn jing Khua Yang. 
Jesus comes and takes the bread and gives it to them, and the fish in like manner. @ Yêsu nao, mă ƀañ tơpŭng brơi kơ gơñu, laih anŭn brơi wơ̆t akan mơ̆n. 
This is already the third time that Jesus had been manifested to the disciples, being risen from among [the] dead. @ Anŭn jing tal klâo Yêsu pơƀuh Ñu pô kơ ƀing khua ding kơna Ñu, tơdơi kơ Ñu hơdip glaĭ mơ̆ng ƀing djai.
When therefore they had dined, Jesus says to Simon Peter, Simon, [son] of Jonas, lovest thou me more than these? He says to him, Yea, Lord; thou knowest that I am attached to thee. He says to him, Feed my lambs. @ Giơ̆ng kơ gơñu ƀơ̆ng huă, Yêsu pơhiăp hăng Simôn Pêtrôs: “Ơ Simôn ană Yôhan, ih khăp kơ Kâo hloh kơ ƀing anai mơ̆?” Pêtrôs laĭ glaĭ: “Ơ Khua Yang, Ih thâo laih kâo khăp kơ Ih.”
Yêsu laĭ dơ̆ng: “Čem rong bĕ khul ană triu Kâo.” 
He says to him again a second time, Simon, [son] of Jonas, lovest thou me? He says to him, Yea, Lord; thou knowest that I am attached to thee. He says to him, Shepherd my sheep. @ Yêsu pơhiăp hăng ñu tal dua: “Ơ Simôn ană Yôhan, ih khăp kơ Kâo mơ̆?”
Pêtrôs laĭ glaĭ: “Ơ Khua Yang, Ih thâo laih kâo khăp kơ Ih.”
Yêsu laĭ kơ ñu: “Wai lăng bĕ khul triu Kâo.” 
He says to him the third time, Simon, [son] of Jonas, art thou attached to me? Peter was grieved because he said to him the third time, Art thou attached to me? and said to him, Lord, thou knowest all things; thou knowest that I am attached to thee. Jesus says to him, Feed my sheep. @ Yêsu pơhiăp hăng ñu tal klâo: “Ơ Simôn ană Yôhan, ih khăp kơ Kâo mơ̆?”
Pêtrôs rơngot yua kơ Yêsu tơña kơ ñu truh kơ klâo wơ̆t: “Ih khăp kơ Kâo mơ̆?” Tui anŭn Pêtrôs laĭ glaĭ: “Ơ Khua Yang, Ih thâo abih bang tơlơi, Ih thâo laih Kâo khăp kơ Ih.”
Yêsu laĭ kơ ñu: “Čem rong bĕ khul triu Kâo. 
Verily, verily, I say to thee, When thou wast young, thou girdedst thyself, and walkedst where thou desiredst; but when thou shalt be old, thou shalt stretch forth thy hands, and another shall gird thee, and bring thee where thou dost not desire. @ Kâo laĭ sĭt biă mă kơ ih, tơdang ih hlăk dŏ tơdăm, ih hrăng mă hơdrăng kơiăng ih pô, hăng nao pơpă anih ih kiăng; samơ̆ tơ ih tha laih, ih či yơr tơngan, laih anŭn pô pơkŏn či hrăng brơi hơdrăng kơiăng kơ ih, hăng či dui ba ih pơ anih ih ƀu kiăng nao ôh.” 
But he said this signifying by what death he should glorify God. And having said this, he says to him, Follow me. @ Yêsu pơhiăp tơlơi anŭn kiăng laĭ nao hyư̆m jơlan Pêtrôs či djai kiăng ngă ư-ang kơ Ơi Adai. Giơ̆ng Yêsu pơhiăp tơlơi anŭn, Yêsu laĭ kơ Pêtrôs: “Đuaĭ tui Kâo bĕ.”
Peter, turning round, sees the disciple whom Jesus loved following, who also leaned at supper on his breast, and said, Lord, who is it that delivers thee up? @ Pêtrôs wir glaĭ ƀuh ding kơna Yêsu khăp hlăk đuaĭ tui tơdơi, jing pô hmâo ah boh akŏ ƀơi tơda Yêsu amăng sa tơlơi ƀơ̆ng huă anŭn laih anŭn tơña kơ Yêsu: “Ơ Khua Yang, hlơi pô či pơblư̆ lui Ih?” 
Peter, seeing him, says to Jesus, Lord, and what [of] this [man]? @ Tơ ƀuh pô anŭn, Pêtrôs tơña kơ Yêsu: “Ơ Khua Yang, bơ kơ pô anai hơgĕt tơlơi či truh kơ ñu lĕ?”
Jesus says to him, If I will that he abide until I come, what [is that] to thee? Follow thou me. @ Yêsu laĭ glaĭ: “Tơdah Kâo kiăng kơ ñu dŏ hơdip tơl Kâo rai dơ̆ng, hơgĕt tơlơi anŭn djơ̆ kơ ih? Gah kơ ih, đuaĭ tui Kâo bĕ!” 
This word therefore went out among the brethren, That disciple does not die. And Jesus did not say to him, He does not die; but, If I will that he abide until I come, what [is that] to thee? @ Yua kơ anŭn, hmâo tơlơi hmư̆ hing tơ̆ng krah ƀing adơi ayŏng đaŏ kơ khua ding kơna anŭn ƀu či djai ôh; Yêsu ƀu laĭ ôh kơ khua ding kơna anŭn ƀu či djai, samơ̆ Ñu laĭ “Tơdah Kâo kiăng ñu dŏ hơdip tơl Kâo rai dơ̆ng, hơgĕt tơlơi anŭn djơ̆ kơ ih?”
This is the disciple who bears witness concerning these things, and who has written these things; and we know that his witness is true. @ Ding kơna anŭn yơh jing pô ngă gơ̆ng jơlan, hăng hmâo čih laih abih tơlơi anai; laih anŭn ƀing ta thâo kơ tơlơi ñu ngă gơ̆ng jơlan jing sĭt.
And there are also many other things which Jesus did, the which if they were written one by one, I suppose that not even the world itself would contain the books written. @ Yêsu hmâo ngă lu tơlơi pơkŏn dơ̆ng mơ̆n. Tơdah arăng čih abih bang tơlơi anŭn, kâo pơmĭn wơ̆t abih lŏn tơnah anai ăt ƀu dưi djŏp ôh anih pioh khul hơdrôm hră hmâo čih anŭn.
I composed the first discourse, O Theophilus, concerning all things which Jesus began both to do and to teach, @ Ơ Thêôphil, amăng hră tal sa kâo hmâo čih laih abih bang tơlơi Yêsu hmâo ngă laih anŭn hmâo pơtô laih mơ̆ng phŭn, 
until that day in which, having by the Holy Spirit charged the apostles whom he had chosen, he was taken up; @ hlŏng truh pơ hrơi Ơi Adai pŭ đĭ Ñu pơ adai. Hlâo kơ Ñu đĭ glaĭ pơ adai adih, hăng tơlơi dưi Yang Bơngăt Hiam Ñu pơtă brơi kơ ƀing khua ding kơna, jing ƀing Ñu hmâo ruah mă laih. 
to whom also he presented himself living, after he had suffered, with many proofs; being seen by them during forty days, and speaking of the things which concern the kingdom of God; @ Amăng pă pluh hrơi giơ̆ng kơ Ñu djai Ñu hmâo pơƀuh brơi kơ gơñu lu wơ̆t hăng lu gru mơsêh mơyang, Ñu pơsĭt kơ gơñu thâo Ñu ăt dŏ hơdip, gơñu ƀuh Yêsu laih anŭn Yêsu pơtô gơñu kơ dêh čar pơtao Ơi Adai. 
and, being assembled with [them], commanded them not to depart from Jerusalem, but to await the promise of the Father, which [said he] ye have heard of me. @ Tơdang Ñu dŏ bơjơnum hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing khua ding kơna, Ñu pơtă kơ ƀing gơñu tui anai: “Anăm ƀing gih tơbiă mơ̆ng plei Yêrusalem ôh, samơ̆ dŏ tơguan bĕ kơ tơlơi Ama hmâo ƀuăn laih, jing tơlơi Kâo hmâo laĭ laih kơ ƀing gih. 
For John indeed baptised with water, but *ye* shall be baptised with the Holy Spirit after now not many days. @ Yua kơ Yôhan hmâo ngă laih ƀatem hăng ia, samơ̆ dŏ ƀiă hrơi dơ̆ng ƀing gih či tŭ ƀatem hăng Yang Bơngăt Hiam.”
They therefore, being come together, asked him saying, Lord, is it at this time that thou restorest the kingdom to Israel? @ Tơdang ƀing khua ding kơna dŏ bơjơnum hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Yêsu, gơñu tơña: “Ơ Khua Yang, djơ̆ mơ̆ ră anai Ih či pơdơ̆ng glaĭ Dêh Čar Pơtao Israel?”
And he said to them, It is not yours to know times or seasons, which the Father has placed in his own authority; @ Yêsu laĭ kơ gơñu: “Kơ rơnŭk ƀôdah bơyan Ama Kâo hmâo pơkă laih tui hăng tơlơi dưi Ñu pô, tơlơi anŭn ƀing gih ƀu dưi thâo ôh. 
but ye will receive power, the Holy Spirit having come upon you, and ye shall be my witnesses both in Jerusalem, and in all Judaea and Samaria, and to the end of the earth. @ Samơ̆ tơ Yang Bơngăt Hiam trŭn ƀơi ƀing gih; ƀing gih či tŭ mă tơlơi dưi mơyang laih anŭn jing ƀing mơnuih ngă gơ̆ng jơlan kơ Kâo amăng plei Yêrusalem, amăng abih tring Yuđa laih anŭn tring Samari, truh pơ abih lŏn tơnah.” 
And having said these things he was taken up, they beholding [him], and a cloud received him out of their sight. @ Giơ̆ng kơ Ñu pơhiăp khul tơlơi anŭn, Ơi Adai pŭ Ñu đĭ pơ adai tơdang ƀing khua ding kơna Ñu dŏ lăng, laih anŭn hmâo sa ƀŭt hiăng rai gom hĭ Ñu, laih anŭn gơñu ƀu thâo ƀuh Ñu dơ̆ng ôh.
And as they were gazing into heaven, as he was going, behold, also two men stood by them in white clothing, @ Tơdang gơñu dŏ lăng đĭ ƀu ƀleh mơta ôh hlăk Yêsu đĭ glaĭ pơ adai, plŭt hmâo dua čô đah rơkơi buh ao phyung kŏ dŏ dơ̆ng giăm gơñu, 
who also said, Men of Galilee, why do ye stand looking into heaven? This Jesus who has been taken up from you into heaven, shall thus come in the manner in which ye have beheld him going into heaven. @ hăng laĭ: “Ơ ƀing mơnuih Galilê, hyư̆m ƀing gih dŏ dơ̆ng lăng đĭ nanao pơ adai lĕ? Yêsu anai, Pô Ơi Adai hmâo pŭ đĭ laih pơ adai mơ̆ng ƀing gih, ăt či trŭn rai dơ̆ng kar hăng ƀing gih hmâo ƀuh laih Ñu đĭ pơ adai.”
Then they returned to Jerusalem from the mount called [the mount] of Olives, which is near Jerusalem, a sabbath-day's journey off. @ Giơ̆ng anŭn mơ̆ng čư̆ arăng pia čư̆ Ôliwơ gơñu glaĭ pơ Yêrusalem, čư̆ anŭn jĕ plei Yêrusalem, sa rơwang phiăn arăng rơbat amăng hrơi saƀat. 
And when they were come into [the city], they went up to the upper chamber, where were staying both Peter, and John, and James, and Andrew, Philip and Thomas, Bartholomew and Matthew, James [son] of Alphaeus, and Simon the zealot, and Jude [the brother] of James. @ Tơ gơñu mŭt laih amăng plei, gơñu đĭ pơ adŭ tal glong, ƀơi anih gơñu juăt dŏ. Ƀing anŭn jing Pêtrôs, Yôhan, Yakơ, Andrê, Philip, Thômas, Bartêlômi, Mathiơ, Yakơ ană đah rơkơi Alphê, Simôn Sêlôt, laih anŭn Yudas ană đah rơkơi Yakơ. 
These gave themselves all with one accord to continual prayer, with [several] women, and Mary the mother of Jesus, and with his brethren. @ Abih bang ƀing anŭn sa pran jua, sa tơlơi pơmĭn iâu laĭ, hrŏm hăng ƀing đah kơmơi, hrŏm hơbĭt hăng HʼMari amĭ Yêsu laih anŭn hăng ƀing adơi ayŏng Ñu.
And in those days Peter, standing up in the midst of the brethren, said, (the crowd of names [who were] together [was] about a hundred and twenty,) @ Amăng khul hrơi anŭn, Pêtrôs tơgŭ dơ̆ng tơ̆ng krah ƀing adơi ayŏng (Hmâo năng ai sa rơtuh dua pluh čô), hăng laĭ, 
Brethren, it was necessary that the scripture should have been fulfilled, which the Holy Spirit spoke before, by the mouth of David, concerning Judas, who became guide to those who took Jesus; @ “Ơ ƀing adơi ayŏng, krĕp djơ̆ yơh Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp hmâo čih, tơlơi anŭn Yang Bơngăt Hiam hmâo laĭ hlâo laih hăng amăng bah Đawit, djơ̆ kơ Yudas pô hmâo ba jơlan kơ arăng mă čăp Yêsu. 
for he was numbered amongst us, and had received a part in this service. @ Yua kơ ñu ăt jing sa čô amăng ƀing ta, laih anŭn ñu hmâo črăn bruă hrŏm hăng ƀing ta.”
(This [man] then indeed got a field with [the] reward of iniquity, and, having fallen down headlong, burst in the midst, and all his bowels gushed out. @  “Đah rơkơi anŭn hmâo blơi laih sa blah hmua hăng prăk apah kơ tơlơi soh ñu. Laih anŭn ñu lĕ trŭn hơtơ̆p akŏ hlâo, pơčah hlŭng laih anŭn pruăi hơtai tơbiă abih gah rơngiao. 
And it was known to all the inhabitants of Jerusalem, so that that field was called in their own dialect Aceldama; that is, field of blood.) @ Tơlơi anŭn abih bang mơnuih plei Yêrusalem leng kơ thâo soh sel, tơl arăng iâu hmua anŭn hăng boh pơhiăp gơñu pô jing Akêldama, kiăng laĭ hmua drah.
For it is written in [the] book of Psalms, Let his homestead become desolate, and let there be no dweller in it; and, Let another take his overseership. @ Yua kơ amăng hră Adoh Hơđăp ăt hmâo čih mơ̆n tui anai:
‘Brơi sang ñu dŏ jing hĭ rơngol,
Laih anŭn anăm hmâo mơnuih dŏ pơ anŭn ôh;’
laih anŭn:
‘Brơi sa čô pô pơkŏn hrua mă bĕ bruă ñu.’
It is necessary therefore, that of the men who have assembled with us all [the] time in which the Lord Jesus came in and went out among us, @ Tui anŭn brơi sa čô mơnuih amăng ƀing hmâo đuaĭ tui laih ƀing ta amăng abih hrơi Khua Yang Yêsu hyu hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing ta, 
beginning from the baptism of John until the day in which he was taken up from us, one of these should be a witness with us of his resurrection. @ čơdơ̆ng mơ̆ng hrơi Yôhan ngă ƀatem kơ Ñu truh pơ hrơi Ơi Adai pŭ đĭ Ñu mơ̆ng ƀing ta, khŏm hmâo sa čô amăng ƀing anai jing pô ngă gơ̆ng jơlan hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing ta kơ tơlơi Yêsu hơdip glaĭ.” 
And they appointed two, Joseph, who was called Barsabas, who had been surnamed Justus, and Matthias. @ Gơñu črâo brơi dua čô, Yôsep arăng iâu Barsabas, ăt pơanăn dơ̆ng Justus, laih anŭn Mathias. 
And they prayed, and said, Thou Lord, knower of the hearts of all, shew which one of these two thou hast chosen, @ Giơ̆ng kơ anŭn gơñu iâu laĭ: “Ơ Khua Yang, Ih jing Pô thâo pran jua rĭm čô mơnuih, rơkâo kơ Ih pơrơđah brơi kơ gơmơi hlơi Ih ruah amăng dua čô anai, 
to receive the lot of this service and apostleship, from which Judas transgressing fell to go to his own place. @ kiăng kơ ñu djă bruă mă khua ding kơna hrua anih Yudas hmâo lui hĭ laih, kiăng nao pơ anih ñu pô.” 
And they gave lots on them, and the lot fell on Matthias, and he was numbered with the eleven apostles. @ Giơ̆ng kơ anŭn gơñu mă pơčrăm kơ dua čô anŭn, laih anŭn tơlơi mă pơčrăm anŭn djơ̆ kơ Mathias; tui anŭn arăng yap ñu hrŏm hơbĭt hăng pluh sa čô khua ding kơna.
And when the day of Pentecost was now accomplishing, they were all together in one place. @  Tơ hrơi phĕt Pantơkôt truh, abih bang gơñu bơjơnum glaĭ amăng sa boh anih. 
And there came suddenly a sound out of heaven as of a violent impetuous blowing, and filled all the house where they were sitting. @ Plŭt hmâo dơnai rai mơ̆ng adai kar hăng jua angĭn thut kơtang, pơbă abih amăng sang anih gơñu hlăk dŏ ber. 
And there appeared to them parted tongues, as of fire, and it sat upon each one of them. @ Laih anŭn gơñu ƀuh khul jơlah kar hăng jơlah apui pơdah rai, čơlah bru bra laih anŭn găm ƀơi rĭm čô gơñu. 
And they were all filled with [the] Holy Spirit, and began to speak with other tongues as the Spirit gave to them to speak forth. @ Abih bang gơñu leng kơ bă blai Yang Bơngăt Hiam, laih anŭn čơdơ̆ng pơhiăp amăng tơlơi pơhiăp tuai, tui hăng Yang Bơngăt Hiam brơi kơ gơñu pơhiăp.
Now there were dwelling at Jerusalem Jews, pious men, from every nation of those under heaven. @ Hlăk anŭn pơ plei Yêrusalem hmâo ƀing mơnuih Yuđa, jing ƀing mơnuih hur har kơkuh pơpŭ kơ Ơi Adai rai mơ̆ng abih bang djuai mơnuih amăng lŏn tơnah. 
But the rumour of this having spread, the multitude came together and were confounded, because each one heard them speaking in his own dialect. @ Tơ hmư̆ jua anŭn phung mơnuih lu rai hăng kơtuă hling hlang, yua kơ rĭm čô gơñu hmư̆ ƀing anŭn pơhiăp tơlơi pơhiăp gơñu pô. 
And all were amazed and wondered, saying, Behold, are not all these who are speaking Galilaeans? @ Gơñu kơtuă hling hlang biă mă, laih anŭn gơñu tơña: “Ƀu djơ̆ hă abih bang ƀing dŏ pơhiăp anŭn jing ƀing mơnuih Galilê? 
and how do *we* hear [them] each in our own dialect in which we have been born, @ Tui anŭn hyư̆m rĭm čô ƀing ta hmư̆ gơñu pơhiăp tơlơi pơhiăp čar ta pô lĕ? 
Parthians, and Medes, and Elamites, and those who inhabit Mesopotamia, and Judaea, and Cappadocia, Pontus and Asia, @ Ƀing ta mơ̆ng Parthê, mơ̆ng Mêdi, mơ̆ng Êlam, ƀing dŏ pơ Mêsôpôtami, mơ̆ng Yuđa, mơ̆ng Kapadôs, mơ̆ng Pônt laih anŭn Asi, 
both Phrygia and Pamphylia, Egypt, and the parts of Libya which adjoin Cyrene, and the Romans sojourning [here], both Jews and proselytes, @ Mơ̆ng Phriji, mơ̆ng Pamphili, mơ̆ng Êjip, tring Libi jĕ Siren, laih anŭn ƀing mơnuih rai mơ̆ng plei Rôm, 
Cretans and Arabians, we hear them speaking in our own tongues the great things of God? @ hmâo ƀing Yuđa wơ̆t hăng ƀing phrâo tui tơlơi đaŏ Yuđa, ƀing Kret, ƀing Arap, ƀing ta leng kơ hmư̆ ƀing gơñu yua boh pơhiăp ta pô kiăng pơhiăp abih tơlơi bruă mơyang Ơi Adai.” 
And they were all amazed and in perplexity, saying one to another, What would this mean? @ Abih bang gơñu hwĭ kơtuă hăng rŭng răng, bơlaĭ tơdruă gơñu: “Hơgĕt tơlơi anai jing?”
But others mocking said, They are full of new wine. @ Samơ̆ hmâo ƀing pơkŏn djik djak hăng laĭ: “Ƀing gơñu măt tơpai phrâo yơh anŭn.”
But Peter, standing up with the eleven, lifted up his voice and spoke forth to them, Men of Judaea, and all ye inhabitants of Jerusalem, let this be known to you, and give heed to my words: @ Samơ̆ Pêtrôs tơgŭ hrŏm hăng ƀing pluh sa čô ding kơna, pơhiăp kraih hăng ƀing anŭn: “Ơ ƀing Yuđa laih anŭn abih bang mơnuih dŏ amăng plei Yêrusalem, brơi ƀing gih thâo tơlơi anai, hăng pơđing tơngia kơ tơlơi kâo pơhiăp. 
for these are not full of wine, as *ye* suppose, for it is the third hour of the day; @ Ƀing anai ƀu djơ̆ măt tơpai kar hăng ƀing gih pơmĭn ôh, yua kơ ră anai hlăk dua rơpăn mông đôč; 
but this is that which was spoken through the prophet Joel, @ samơ̆ tơlơi anai jing tơlơi pô laĭ lui hlâo Yôel hmâo laĭ laih:
And it shall be in the last days, saith God, [that] I will pour out of my Spirit upon all flesh; and your sons and your daughters shall prophesy, and your young men shall see visions, and your elders shall dream with dreams; @ ‘Ơi Adai laĭ: Amăng rơnŭk hnal tuč či truh tui anai:
Kâo či tuh Yang Bơngăt Kâo ƀơi abih bang asar đeh;
Ƀing ană đah rơkơi laih anŭn ană đah kơmơi ƀing gih či laĭ lui hlâo,
Ƀing tơdăm či hmâo tơlơi pơƀuh,
Laih anŭn ƀing tha rơma či hmâo tơlơi rơpơi.
yea, even upon my bondmen and upon my bondwomen in those days will I pour out of my Spirit, and they shall prophesy. @ Sĭt biă mă amăng hrơi anŭn Kâo či tuh Yang Bơngăt Kâo ƀơi ƀing ding kơna đah rơkơi ding kơna đah kơmơi Kâo,
Laih anŭn gơñu či laĭ lui hlâo.
And I will give wonders in the heaven above and signs on the earth below, blood, and fire, and vapour of smoke: @ Kâo či pơrơđah tơlơi yom pơphan amăng adai adih,
Laih anŭn tơlơi gru kơnăl mơyang ƀơi lŏn tơnah, anŭn jing drah, apui, laih anŭn angĭn asăp apui;
the sun shall be changed to darkness and the moon to blood, before the great and gloriously appearing day of [the] Lord come. @ Yang hrơi či blư̆ jing hĭ kơnăm,
Laih anŭn blan či blư̆ jing hĭ drah,
Hlâo kơ Hrơi Prŏng hăng Hrơi guh kơang Khua Yang či truh.
And it shall be that whosoever shall call upon the name of [the] Lord shall be saved. @ Laih anŭn hlơi pô kơwưh rơkâo anăn Khua Yang či dưi klaih.’
Men of Israel, hear these words: Jesus the Nazaraean, a man borne witness to by God to you by works of power and wonders and signs, which God wrought by him in your midst, as yourselves know @ Ơ ană plei pla Israel, hmư̆ bĕ tơlơi pơhiăp anai: Yêsu plei Nasaret, Pô Ơi Adai hmâo ngă gơ̆ng jơlan pơklă laih tơlơi Ñu jing ƀơi anăp ƀing gih hăng bruă mơsêh mơyang, tơlơi yom pơphan laih anŭn tơlơi gru kơnăl mơyang Ơi Adai yua Ñu ngă tơ̆ng krah ƀing gih, kar hăng ƀing gih pô thâo laih — 
him, given up by the determinate counsel and foreknowledge of God, ye, by [the] hand of lawless [men], have crucified and slain. @ Yêsu anai, Pô Ơi Adai hmâo jao lui tui hăng hơdră Ơi Adai ruah hăng thâo hlâo, ƀing gih yua tơngan ƀing mơnuih soh pơ̆ng pơdjai hĭ Ñu ƀơi kơyâo bơrơkal. 
Whom God has raised up, having loosed the pains of death, inasmuch as it was not possible that he should be held by its power; @ Samơ̆ Ơi Adai hmâo pơhơdip glaĭ Ñu laih, pơrơngai hĭ Ñu mơ̆ng tơlơi ruă nuă kơ tơlơi djai, yua kơ tơlơi djai ƀu dưi kơ̆ng Ñu ôh. 
for David says as to him, I foresaw the Lord continually before me, because he is at my right hand that I may not be moved. @ Yua kơ Đawit hmâo laĭ laih djơ̆ kơ Ñu:
‘Kâo ƀuh nanao Khua Yang dŏ ƀơi anăp kâo,
Yua Ñu dŏ gah hơnuă kâo, kiăng kơ kâo ƀu pơpư̆ pơgơi ôh;
Therefore has my heart rejoiced and my tongue exulted; yea more, my flesh also shall dwell in hope, @ Yua kơ anŭn yơh, pran jua kâo mơak mơai, jơlah kâo pơhiăp hơ̆k mơak;
Laih anŭn drơi jan kâo ăt či pơdơi amăng tơlơi čang rơmang.
for thou wilt not leave my soul in hades, nor wilt thou give thy gracious one to see corruption. @ Yua kơ Ih ƀu či lui ôh bơngăt kâo amăng plei ƀing djai,
Kŏn brơi lơi Pô Rơgoh Hơčih Ih brŭ rai.
Thou hast made known to me [the] paths of life, thou wilt fill me with joy with thy countenance. @ Ih hmâo brơi kâo thâo jơlan tơlơi hơdip;
Ih či pơbă kâo hăng tơlơi hơ̆k mơak ƀơi anăp ƀô̆ mơta Ih.’
Brethren, let it be allowed to speak with freedom to you concerning the patriarch David, that he has both died and been buried, and his monument is amongst us unto this day. @ Ơ adơi ayŏng hơi, kâo laĭ khŭt khăt hăng ƀing gih kơ Đawit Ơi adon ƀing ta. Ñu djai laih, arăng dơr Ñu laih, laih anŭn pơsat Ñu ăt dŏ tơ̆ng krah ƀing ta truh hrơi anai. 
Being therefore a prophet, and knowing that God had sworn to him with an oath, of the fruit of his loins to set upon his throne; @ Yua kơ ñu jing sa čô pô laĭ lui hlâo, ñu thâo Ơi Adai hmâo hơtŏm ƀuăn Ñu či dưm sa čô mơnuih amăng ƀing ană tơčo ñu dŏ ber ƀơi gre pơtao ñu. 
he, seeing [it] before, spoke concerning the resurrection of the Christ, that neither has he been left in hades nor his flesh seen corruption. @ Ñu hmâo ƀuh hăng laĭ lui hlâo kơ Yang Krist hơdip glaĭ dơ̆ng:
‘Kơ tơlơi Ơi Adai ƀu lui Ñu amăng plei ƀing djai ôh,
Drơi jan Ñu kŏn brŭ rai lơi.’
This Jesus has God raised up, whereof all *we* are witnesses. @ Yêsu anai Ơi Adai hmâo pơhơdip glaĭ laih, laih anŭn abih bang ƀing gơmơi jing ƀing ngă gơ̆ng jơlan pơsĭt kơ tơlơi anŭn. 
Having therefore been exalted by the right hand of God, and having received of the Father the promise of the Holy Spirit, he has poured out this which *ye* behold and hear. @ Tui anŭn giơ̆ng kơ Ñu hmâo tơlơi pơpŭ đĭ ƀơi gah hơnuă Ơi Adai, laih anŭn hmâo mă tŭ laih mơ̆ng Ama tơlơi ƀuăn pha brơi Yang Bơngăt Hiam, Yêsu hmâo tuh brơi Yang Bơngăt Hiam kar hăng ƀing gih hmâo ƀuh hăng hmư̆ ră anai. 
For David has not ascended into the heavens, but he says himself, The Lord said unto my Lord, Sit at my right hand @ Yua kơ Đawit aka đĭ djơ̆ pơ adai ôh; samơ̆ ñu pô hmâo laĭ:
‘Khua Yang hmâo laĭ hăng Khua Yang kâo:
“Dŏ ber bĕ gah hơnuă kâo,
until I have put thine enemies [to be] the footstool of thy feet. @ Tơl kâo dưm ƀing ayăt ih jing hnăl tơkai ih juă.”’
Let the whole house of Israel therefore know assuredly that God has made him, this Jesus whom *ye* have crucified, both Lord and Christ. @ Tui anŭn brơi abih bang sang Israel thâo klă sĭt kơ Ơi Adai brơi Yêsu, Pô ƀing gih hmâo pơ̆ng laih pơ kơyâo bơrơkal, jing hĭ laih Khua Yang laih anŭn Yang Krist.”
And having heard [it] they were pricked in heart, and said to Peter and the other apostles, What shall we do, brethren? @ Tơ hmư̆ tơlơi anŭn, amăng pran jua gơñu hmâo tơlơi kơčut kơtang biă mă. Tui anŭn gơñu tơña kơ Pêtrôs laih anŭn kơ ƀing khua ding kơna pơkŏn: “Ơ ƀing adơi ayŏng, hơgĕt gơmơi khŏm ngă?”
And Peter said to them, Repent, and be baptised, each one of you, in the name of Jesus Christ, for remission of sins, and ye will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit. @ Pêtrôs laĭ glaĭ: “Kơhmal bĕ tơlơi soh ƀing gih, laih anŭn brơi rĭm čô ƀing gih khŏm tŭ tơlơi ƀatem amăng anăn Yêsu Krist, kiăng kơ hmâo tơlơi pap brơi tơlơi soh ƀing gih; laih anŭn ƀing gih či mă tŭ Yang Bơngăt Hiam, Ơi Adai pha brơi. 
For to you is the promise and to your children, and to all who [are] afar off, as many as [the] Lord our God may call. @ Yua kơ tơlơi ƀuăn anŭn pioh brơi kơ ƀing gih, kơ ƀing ană tơčo ƀing gih, laih anŭn kơ abih bang hlơi dŏ pơ ataih, anŭn jing kơ rĭm čô mơnuih Khua Yang Ơi Adai ƀing ta či iâu mă.”
And with many other words he testified and exhorted them, saying, Be saved from this perverse generation. @ Pêtrôs yua lu tơlơi pơhiăp pơtô pơkŏn dơ̆ng, pơđur pơtrŭt kơ gơñu tui anai: “Pơklaih bĕ ƀing gih pô mơ̆ng tơlơi phat kơđi či truh kơ rơnŭk soh sat anai.” 
Those then who had accepted his word were baptised; and there were added in that day about three thousand souls. @ Tui anŭn ƀing mơnuih tŭ mă tơlơi pơtô anŭn hăng tŭ ƀatem, laih anŭn amăng hrơi anŭn hmâo jĕ kơ klâo rơbâo čô mơnuih mŭt dơ̆ng amăng phung gơñu. 
And they persevered in the teaching and fellowship of the apostles, in breaking of bread and prayers. @ Gơñu gir kơtir djă pioh abih tơlơi pơtô mơ̆ng ƀing khua ding kơna, amăng tơlơi pơgop pơlir, phĕt wơ̆k ƀañ tơpŭng, laih anŭn tơlơi iâu laĭ.
And fear was upon every soul, and many wonders and signs took place through the apostles' means. @ Abih bang mơnuih hmâo tơlơi hwĭ pơpŭ yua kơ ƀing khua ding kơna ngă lu tơlơi yom pơphan laih anŭn gru kơnăl mơyang. 
And all that believed were together, and had all things common, @ Abih bang ƀing đaŏ pơgop hrŏm hơbĭt, dram gơnam gơñu pioh jing gơnam hrŏm hơbĭt. 
and sold their possessions and substance, and distributed them to all, according as any one might have need. @ Gơñu sĭ hĭ lŏn hmua laih anŭn kong ngăn gơñu hăng pơpha gơnam anŭn kơ abih bang tui hăng rĭm čô kiăng yua. 
And every day, being constantly in the temple with one accord, and breaking bread in [the] house, they received their food with gladness and simplicity of heart, @ Rĭm hrơi gơñu bơjơnum amăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ, laih anŭn wơ̆k ƀañ tơpŭng amăng sang gơñu pô, ƀơ̆ng huă hrŏm hơbĭt sa pran jua mơak mơai, thâo luă gŭ, 
praising God, and having favour with all the people; and the Lord added [to the assembly] daily those that were to be saved. @ bơni hơơč kơ Ơi Adai laih anŭn bơmơak pran jua ƀing ană plei pla. Laih anŭn rĭm hrơi Khua Yang thim dơ̆ng kơ ƀing mơnuih hmâo tơlơi pơklaih mŭt amăng Phung Sang Ơi Adai.
And Peter and John went up together into the temple at the hour of prayer, [which is] the ninth [hour]; @ Hmâo sa hrơi Pêtrôs hăng Yôhan nao pơ sang kơkuh pơpŭ amăng mông iâu laĭ, mông tal dua rơpăn. 
and a certain man who was lame from his mother's womb was being carried, whom they placed every day at the gate of the temple called Beautiful, to ask alms of those who were going into the temple; @ Hlăk anŭn arăng ba sa čô đah rơkơi rơwen mơ̆ng hrơi amĭ tơkeng, rĭm hrơi arăng pioh ñu ƀơi bah amăng jang sang kơkuh pơpŭ arăng pơanăn Amăng Jang Hiam, kiăng kơ ñu rơkâo dan ƀing mŭt amăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ. 
who, seeing Peter and John about to enter into the temple, asked to receive alms. @ Tơ ñu ƀuh Pêtrôs hăng Yôhan čơdơ̆ng mŭt amăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ, ñu rơkâo dan mơ̆ng dua gơñu. 
And Peter, looking stedfastly upon him with John, said, Look on us. @ Pêtrôs hăng Yôhan lăng pơñen ñu hăng laĭ: “Lăng bĕ gơmơi.” 
And he gave heed to them, expecting to receive something from them. @ Mơnuih rơwen anŭn lăng nao pơ gơñu ƀu ƀleh mơta ôh, mĭn dah či mă tŭ mơnơ̆ng mơ̆ng gơñu brơi. 
But Peter said, Silver and gold I have not; but what I have, this give I to thee: In the name of Jesus Christ the Nazaraean rise up and walk. @ Samơ̆ Pêtrôs laĭ hăng ñu: “Kâo ƀu hmâo prăk mah ôh, samơ̆ hơgĕt mơnơ̆ng kâo hmâo, kâo brơi kơ ih: Hăng anăn Yêsu Krist plei Nasaret, rơbat nao bĕ!” 
And having taken hold of him [by] the right hand he raised him up, and immediately his feet and ankle bones were made strong. @ Pêtrôs mă tơngan hơnuă ñu hăng rŭ đĭ ñu. Tañ mơtam plă tơkai hăng boh keñ ñu jing hĭ kơjăp kơtang. 
And leaping up he stood and walked, and entered with them into the temple, walking, and leaping, and praising God. @ Gơ̆ plŏng kơdăt, dŏ dơ̆ng hăng čơdơ̆ng rơbat nao, mŭt amăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ hrŏm hăng gơñu, rơbat rah, kơdăt rah, hăng bơni hơơč rah kơ Ơi Adai. 
And all the people saw him walking and praising God; @ Abih bang ƀing ană plei ƀuh gơ̆ rơbat hăng bơni hơơč kơ Ơi Adai. 
and they recognised him, that it was *he* who sat for alms at the Beautiful gate of the temple; and they were filled with wonder and amazement at what had happened to him. @ Tơ abih bang ană plei thâo krăn gơ̆ jing pô rơkâo dan dŏ ber ƀơi Amăng Jang Hiam sang kơkuh pơpŭ. Tui anŭn gơñu leng kơtuă hăng hling hlang biă mă kơ tơlơi hmâo truh laih kơ gơ̆.
And as he held Peter and John, all the people ran together to them in the portico which is called Solomon's, greatly wondering. @ Tơdang gơ̆ dŏ djă tơngan Pêtrôs hăng Yôhan, abih bang ƀing ană plei hling hlang laih anŭn abih gơñu luh nao pơ gơñu ƀơi adring arăng pơanăn adring Salômôn. 
And Peter, seeing it, answered the people, Men of Israel, why are ye astonished at this? or why do ye gaze on us as if we had by our own power or piety made him to walk? @ Tơ Pêtrôs ƀuh tơlơi anŭn, ñu laĭ hăng ƀing ană plei: “Ơ ƀing ană plei pla Israel, yua hơgĕt ƀing gih kơtuă hling kơ tơlơi anai? Yua hơgĕt ƀing gih lăng pơñen kơ ƀing gơmơi? Ƀing gih pơmĭn gơmơi dưi ngă brơi kơ mơnuih anai dưi rơbat yua mơ̆ng tơlơi dưi mơyang ƀôdah tơlơi tơpă gơmơi pô hă? 
The God of Abraham and Isaac and Jacob, the God of our fathers, has glorified his servant Jesus, whom *ye* delivered up, and denied him in the presence of Pilate, when *he* had judged that he should be let go. @ Ơi Adai kơ Abraham, Ơi Adai kơ Isak, laih anŭn Ơi Adai kơ Yakôp, Ơi Adai kơ ƀing ơi adon ƀing ta hmâo pơ-ư pơang laih kơ ding kơna Ñu Yêsu, Pô ƀing gih hmâo hơngah hăng jao hĭ laih ƀơi anăp Pilat, tơdang ñu hmâo tơlơi pơmĭn kiăng phư hĭ Ñu. 
But *ye* denied the holy and righteous one, and asked that a man [that was] a murderer should be granted to you; @ Ƀing gih hmâo hơngah lui kơ Pô Rơgoh Hiam hăng Pô Tơpă, laih anŭn rơkâo kơ arăng pŏk brơi sa čô pô pơdjai mơnuih kơ ƀing gih. 
but the originator of life ye slew, whom God raised from among [the] dead, whereof *we* are witnesses. @ Ƀing gih hmâo pơdjai laih Khua tơlơi hơdip, Pô Ơi Adai hmâo pơhơdip glaĭ laih mơ̆ng ƀing djai. Kơ tơlơi anŭn gơmơi jing ƀing ngă gơ̆ng jơlan. 
And, by faith in his name, his name has made this [man] strong whom ye behold and know; and the faith which is by him has given him this complete soundness in the presence of you all. @ Tơlơi đaŏ amăng anăn Ñu yơh hmâo pơkơtang laih mơnuih anai, pô ƀing gih ƀuh hăng thâo krăn. Tơlơi đaŏ ƀơi Yêsu Krist ngă brơi kơ đah rơkơi anai hmâo suaih laih ƀơi anăp abih bang ƀing gih.
And now, brethren, I know that ye did it in ignorance, as also your rulers; @ Ơ ƀing adơi ayŏng, ră anai kâo thâo ƀing gih laih anŭn ƀing khua ƀing gih ngă tơlơi anŭn yua kơ tơlơi ƀu thâo hluh. 
but God has thus fulfilled what he had announced beforehand by the mouth of all the prophets, that his Christ should suffer. @ Samơ̆ Ơi Adai hmâo yua jơlan anai kiăng ngă krĕp djơ̆ tơlơi Ñu laĭ hlâo hăng amăng bah abih bang ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo, kơ Yang Krist Ñu či tŭ tơlơi tơnap. 
Repent therefore and be converted, for the blotting out of your sins, so that times of refreshing may come from [the] presence of the Lord, @ Tui anŭn kơhmal bĕ tơlơi soh ƀing gih laih anŭn wơ̆t glaĭ kơ Ơi Adai, kiăng kơ Ñu pap brơi tơlơi soh ƀing gih, 
and he may send Jesus Christ, who was foreordained for you, @ laih anŭn kiăng kơ khul hrơi mơsêh mơyang či rai mơ̆ng Khua Yang, laih anŭn Ñu či pơkiaŏ rai Yang Krist, Pô Ñu hmâo ruah laih kơ ƀing gih, jing Yêsu. 
whom heaven indeed must receive till [the] times of [the] restoring of all things, of which God has spoken by the mouth of his holy prophets since time began. @ Krist yơh khŏm dŏ pơ adai tơl truh rơnŭk pơdơ̆ng glaĭ phrâo dơ̆ng abih bang mơnơ̆ng, krĕp djơ̆ tui hăng Ơi Adai hmâo pơhiăp laih hăng amăng bah ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo rơgoh hiam Ñu mơ̆ng đưm adih. 
Moses indeed said, A prophet shall [the] Lord your God raise up to you out of your brethren like me: him shall ye hear in everything whatsoever he shall say to you. @ Môis laĭ: ‘Khua Yang Ơi Adai či yŏng đĭ kơ ƀing gih sa čô pô laĭ lui hlâo mơ̆ng ƀing adơi ayŏng ƀing gih kar hăng kâo. Brơi ƀing gih khŏm gưt tui abih bang tơlơi Ñu pơtă kơ ƀing gih. 
And it shall be that whatsoever soul shall not hear that prophet shall be destroyed from among the people. @ Hlơi ƀu hmư̆ ôh pô laĭ lui hlâo anŭn, Ơi Adai či pơkah hăng pơrai hĭ gơñu mơ̆ng ană plei pla Ơi Adai.’ 
And indeed all the prophets from Samuel and those in succession after [him], as many as have spoken, have announced also these days. @ Abih bang ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo čơdơ̆ng mơ̆ng Samuel laih anŭn tơdơi kơ ñu hmâo laĭ lui hlâo mơ̆n kơ rơnŭk anai. 
*Ye* are the sons of the prophets and of the covenant which God appointed to our fathers, saying to Abraham, And in thy seed shall all the families of the earth be blessed. @ Ƀing gih jing ană tơčo kơ ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo laih anŭn kơ kơnol pơgop Ơi Adai hmâo ngă laih hăng ƀing ơi adon ƀing ta, tơ Ñu pơhiăp hăng Abraham: ‘Abih bang djuai mơnuih amăng lŏn tơnah či hmâo tơlơi mơyun hiam yua mơ̆ng ană tơčo ih.’ 
To you first God, having raised up his servant, has sent him, blessing you in turning each one [of you] from your wickedness. @ Ơi Adai hmâo yŏng đĭ laih Ding Kơna Ñu, hăng pơkiaŏ gơ̆ nao brơi tơlơi tuh mơyun hiam blŭng hlâo kơ ƀing gih, hăng tơlơi Ñu ngă brơi rĭm čô amăng ƀing gih lui hĭ jơlan soh sat pô ñu.”
And as they were speaking to the people, the priests and captain of the temple and the Sadducees came upon them, @ Tơdang gơñu dŏ pơhiăp hăng ană plei, ƀing khua ngă yang, khua tơhan wai sang kơkuh pơpŭ, laih anŭn ƀing Sadusi rai, 
being distressed on account of their teaching the people and preaching by Jesus the resurrection from among [the] dead; @ ƀing gơñu hil yua kơ dua gơñu dŏ pơtô ƀing ană plei hăng pơhaih brơi tơlơi Yêsu hơdip glaĭ mơ̆ng ƀing djai. Pơsĭt brơi kơ mơnuih djai či hơdip glaĭ dơ̆ng. 
and they laid hands on them, and put them in ward till the morrow; for it was already evening. @ Tui anŭn gơñu mă čaŏ dua čô anŭn hăng krư̆ hĭ gơñu amăng sang mơnă truh mơguah, yua kơ hlăk anŭn klam mơmŏt laih. 
But many of those who had heard the word believed; and the number of the men had become [about] five thousand. @ Wơ̆t dah tui anŭn hmâo lu ƀing hmư̆ tơlơi pơhiăp anŭn mă tŭ tơlơi đaŏ; laih anŭn yap mă ƀing mơnuih đaŏ kơnơ̆ng đah rơkơi đôč hmâo truh kơ rơma rơbâo čô.
And it came to pass on the morrow that their rulers and elders and scribes were gathered together at Jerusalem, @ Mơguah pơgi ƀing khua gơñu, ƀing kŏng tha, ƀing nai pơtô hăng ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt pơtŭm glaĭ pơ Yêrusalem 
and Annas the high priest, and Caiaphas, and John, and Alexander, and as many as were of [the] high priestly family; @ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Anas khua ngă yang prŏng hloh, Kaip, Yôhan, Aleksandơ, laih anŭn hăng abih bang ƀing kơnŭng djuai khua ngă yang prŏng. 
and having placed them in the midst they inquired, In what power or in what name have *ye* done this? @ Gơñu ba rai Pêtrôs hăng Yôhan dŏ tơ̆ng krah gơñu, hăng tơña: “Mơ̆ng tơlơi dưi mơyang pă ƀôdah amăng anăn hlơi ƀing gih dưi ngă tơlơi anai?”
Then Peter, filled with [the] Holy Spirit, said to them, Rulers of the people and elders [of Israel], @ Hlăk anŭn Pêtrôs bă blai Yang Bơngăt Hiam, laĭ glaĭ kơ gơñu: “Ơ ƀing khua wai lăng ƀing ană plei hăng ƀing kŏng tha, 
if *we* this day are called upon to answer as to the good deed [done] to the infirm man, how *he* has been healed, @ tơdah hrơi anai ƀing gih tơña kơsem kơ ƀing gơmơi, yua kơ gơmơi hmâo ngă laih tơlơi hiam kơ sa čô mơnuih rơwen, hyư̆m ñu dưi suaih laih, 
be it known to you all, and to all the people of Israel, that in the name of Jesus Christ the Nazaraean, whom *ye* have crucified, whom God has raised from among [the] dead, by *him* this [man] stands here before you sound [in body]. @ brơi abih bang ƀing gih hăng abih bang ƀing ană plei Israel thâo tơlơi anai, amăng anăn Yêsu Krist plei Nasaret yơh, Pô ƀing gih hmâo pơ̆ng laih ƀơi kơyâo bơrơkal, Pô Ơi Adai hmâo pơhơdip glaĭ laih mơ̆ng ƀing djai, Pô anŭn yơh hmâo pơsuaih laih mơnuih dŏ ƀơi anăp ƀing gih anai.
*He* is the stone which has been set at nought by you the builders, which is become the corner stone. @  Ñu yơh jing boh pơtâo ƀing gih jing ƀing ngă sang glŏm lui laih,
Samơ̆ boh pơtâo anŭn jing hĭ laih boh pơtâo phŭn ƀơi akiăng sang.
And salvation is in none other, for neither is there another name under heaven which is given among men by which we must be saved. @ Ƀu hmâo tơlơi pơklaih amăng pô pơkŏn ôh, yua kơ gah yŭ adai ƀu hmâo ôh anăn pơkŏn pha brơi laih kơ ană mơnuih kiăng kơ ƀing ta kơnang anăn anŭn dưi hmâo tơlơi pơklaih.”
But seeing the boldness of Peter and John, and perceiving that they were unlettered and uninstructed men, they wondered; and they recognised them that they were with Jesus. @ Tơ gơñu ƀuh tơlơi khĭn Pêtrôs hăng Yôhan, gơñu thâo klă dua gơñu jing mơnuih plei pla ƀu hmâo hrăm hră ôh, gơñu kơtuă hling biă mă. Laih anŭn gơñu thâo dua gơñu hmâo dŏ laih hrŏm hăng Yêsu. 
And beholding the man who had been healed standing with them, they had nothing to reply; @ Samơ̆ tơ gơñu ƀuh đah rơkơi rơwen hmâo suaih laih dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt Pêtrôs hăng Yôhan, hnŭn yơh gơñu ƀu dưi pơgăl hăng dua gơñu ôh. 
but having commanded them to go out of the council they conferred with one another, @ Tui anŭn, giơ̆ng gơñu pơtă kơ dua gơñu tơbiă mơ̆ng sang phat kơđi, gơñu črŏng sai tơdruă, laĭ, 
saying, What shall we do to these men? for that indeed an evident sign has come to pass through their means is manifest to all that inhabit Jerusalem, and we cannot deny it. @ “Hyư̆m ƀing ta či ngă kơ dua čô anai? Yua kơ abih bang ƀing ană plei Yêrusalem leng kơ thâo sĭt gơñu hmâo ngă tơlơi mơsêh mơyang rơđah rơđong, laih anŭn ƀing ta ƀu dưi hơngah kơ tơlơi anŭn ôh. 
But that it be not further spread among the people, let us threaten them severely no longer to speak to any man in this name. @ Samơ̆ kiăng kơ tơlơi anai ƀu hing hyu amăng ană plei pla dơ̆ng, brơi ƀing ta khă hăng tơlơi pơhwĭ gơñu, anăm ră ruai dơ̆ng ôh anăn pô anŭn kơ arăng.”
And having called them, they charged [them] not to speak at all nor teach in the name of Jesus. @ Tui anŭn gơñu iâu dua gơ̆ mŭt, hăng khă kơ dua gơñu anăm pơhiăp ƀôdah pơtô hăng anăn Yêsu dơ̆ng ôh. 
But Peter and John answering said to them, If it be righteous before God to listen to you rather than to God, judge ye; @ Samơ̆ Pêtrôs hăng Yôhan laĭ glaĭ: “Brơi ƀing gih kơsem pơmĭn bĕ, hơgĕt jing djơ̆ hloh ƀơi anăp Ơi Adai, gưt kơ ƀing gih ƀôdah gưt kơ Ơi Adai? 
for as for us *we* cannot refrain from speaking of the things which we have seen and heard. @ Yua kơ gơmơi ƀu dưi ôh dŏ rơiăt, samơ̆ kơnơ̆ng dưi pơhiăp kơ hơgĕt tơlơi gơmơi hmâo ƀuh hăng hmư̆ laih.” 
But they, having further threatened them, let them go, finding no way how they might punish them, on account of the people, because all glorified God for what had taken place; @ Tui anŭn, giơ̆ng gơñu pơhiăp pơhwĭ kơ dua ñu, gơñu phư lui ƀing gơ̆ yơh, yua kơ gơñu ƀu dưi hơduah ƀuh jơlan kiăng kơ pơkơhmal dua gơñu ôh, yua kơ abih bang ƀing ană plei pla leng kơ pơpŭ bơni hơơč kơ Ơi Adai kơ tơlơi hmâo truh laih. 
for the man on whom this sign of healing had taken place was above forty years old. @ Mơnuih đah rơkơi rơwen, pô tơlơi mơsêh mơyang hmâo pơsuaih laih, hmâo laih rơgao kơ pă pluh thŭn.
And having been let go, they came to their own [company], and reported all that the chief priests and elders had said to them. @ Giơ̆ng arăng phư laih gơñu, gơñu nao pơ ƀing giăng mah hăng ră glaĭ hyư̆m tơlơi ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng hăng ƀing kŏng tha hmâo laĭ laih kơ gơñu. 
And they, having heard [it], lifted up [their] voice with one accord to God, and said, Lord, *thou* art the God who made the heaven and the earth and the sea, and all that is in them; @ Giơ̆ng gơñu hmư̆ tơlơi anŭn, gơñu sa pran jua hrŏm hơbĭt iâu laĭ kơ Ơi Adai: “Ơ Khua Yang, Pô hrih adai, lŏn tơnah, ia rơsĭ, laih anŭn abih bang mơnơ̆ng amăng anŭn, 
who hast said by the mouth of thy servant David, Why have [the] nations raged haughtily and [the] peoples meditated vain things? @ Ih hmâo yua laih Yang Bơngăt Hiam pơhiăp găn amăng bah ơi adon gơmơi, Đawit ding kơna Ih:
‘Yua hơgĕt ƀing djuai tuai kreñ nač,
laih anŭn ƀing ană plei pla dưm tơlơi mơneč đôč đač?
The kings of the earth were there, and the rulers were gathered together against the Lord and against his Christ. @ Ƀing pơtao ƀơi lŏn tơnah tơgŭ đĭ,
Laih anŭn ƀing khua wai lăng pơgop glaĭ,
kiăng pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ hăng Khua Yang laih anŭn hăng Yang Krist Ñu.’
For in truth against thy holy servant Jesus, whom thou hadst anointed, both Herod and Pontius Pilate, with [the] nations, and peoples of Israel, have been gathered together in this city @  Sĭt biă mă yua kơ amăng plei prŏng anai Hêrôt hăng Pôntơ Pilat hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing djuai tuai laih anŭn ƀing ană plei Israel hmâo pơgop hrŏm hơbĭt, kiăng pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ hăng ding kơna rơgoh hiam Ih Yêsu, Pô Ih hmâo truač laih ia klôñ jing Yang Krist 
to do whatever thy hand and thy counsel had determined before should come to pass. @ kiăng ngă pơgiơ̆ng hĭ abih bang bruă tơngan Ih hăng tơlơi pơmĭn Ih hmâo dưm laih mơ̆ng hlâo. 
And now, Lord, look upon their threatenings, and give to thy bondmen with all boldness to speak thy word, @ Ră anai, Ơ Khua Yang, rơkâo kơ Ih kơsem lăng kơ tơlơi gơñu pơhwĭ, hăng brơi kơ ƀing ding kơna Ih ngă gơ̆ng jơlan tơlơi ih pơhiăp hăng tơlơi khĭn, 
in that thou stretchest out thy hand to heal, and that signs and wonders take place through the name of thy holy servant Jesus. @ rơkâo kơ Ih yơr tơngan Ih kiăng kơ pơsuaih tơlơi duăm ruă, laih anŭn hăng anăn ding kơna rơgoh hiam Ih Yêsu arăng ngă tơlơi yom pơphan laih anŭn tơlơi mơsêh mơyang.” 
And when they had prayed, the place in which they were assembled shook, and they were all filled with the Holy Spirit, and spoke the word of God with boldness. @ Giơ̆ng kơ gơñu Iâu laĭ, anih gơñu bơjơnum pơpư̆ pơgơi. Abih bang gơñu leng kơ bă blai Yang Bơngăt Hiam, pơtô boh pơhiăp Ơi Adai hăng tơlơi khĭn.
And the heart and soul of the multitude of those that had believed were one, and not one said that anything of what he possessed was his own, but all things were common to them; @  Hlăk anŭn abih bang ƀing đaŏ hmâo sa pran jua hăng sa tơlơi pơmĭn. Ƀu hmâo hlơi ôh yap gơnam ñu jing lơ̆m kơ hơjăn ñu pô, samơ̆ gơñu yap gơnam abih bang hrŏm hơbĭt. 
and with great power did the apostles give witness of the resurrection of the Lord Jesus, and great grace was upon them all. @ Hăng tơlơi dưi mơyang prŏng ƀing khua ding kơna ngă gơ̆ng jơlan kơ tơlơi Khua Yang Yêsu hơdip glaĭ, laih anŭn tơlơi pap prŏng Ơi Adai dŏ ƀơi abih bang gơñu. 
For neither was there any one in want among them; for as many as were owners of lands or houses, selling them, brought the price of what was sold @ Ƀu hmâo sa čô amăng ƀing gơñu kơƀah ôh, yua kơ hlơi pô hmâo lŏn hmua ƀôdah sang gơñu sĭ hĭ, hăng ba pơyơr prăk gơñu sĭ anŭn 
and laid it at the feet of the apostles; and distribution was made to each according as any one might have need. @ pioh ƀơi tơkai ƀing khua ding kơna. Laih anŭn arăng pơpha brơi kơ rĭm čô tui hăng hơnơ̆ng rĭm čô kiăng yua.
And Joseph, who had been surnamed Barnabas by the apostles (which is, being interpreted, Son of consolation), a Levite, Cyprian by birth, @ Tui anŭn Yôsep, pô ƀing khua ding kơna pơanăn dơ̆ng Barnabas, (kiăng laĭ pô thâo pơalum pran jua), sa čô mơnuih Lêwi tơkeng ƀơi plao ia Čiprơ, 
being possessed of land, having sold [it], brought the money and laid it at the feet of the apostles. @ sĭ hĭ hmua ñu hăng djă ba prăk anŭn pioh ƀơi tơkai ƀing khua ding kơna.
But a certain man, Ananias by name, with Sapphira his wife, sold a possession, @ Samơ̆ hmâo sa čô mơnuih anăn ñu Ananias hrŏm hơbĭt hăng bơnai ñu HʼSaphira sĭ sa blah lŏn. 
and put aside for himself part of the price, [his] wife also being privy to it; and having brought a certain part, laid it at the feet of the apostles. @ Ñu hăng bơnai ñu tŭ ư hrŏm hơbĭt djă pioh sa črăn prăk sĭ anŭn, laih anŭn ba prăk dŏ glaĭ pioh ƀơi tơkai ƀing khua ding kơna. 
But Peter said, Ananias, why has Satan filled thy heart that thou shouldest lie to the Holy Spirit, and put aside for thyself a part of the price of the estate? @ Pêtrôs laĭ hăng ñu: “Ơ Ananias, hyư̆m satan hmâo bă blai pran jua ih, tơl ih ƀlor kơ Yang Bơngăt Hiam, hăng djă pioh sa črăn nua lŏn? 
While it remained did it not remain to *thee*? and sold, was [it not] in thine own power? Why is it that thou hast purposed this thing in thine heart? Thou hast not lied to men, but to God. @ Hlăk ih aka sĭ lŏn anŭn ôh, hyư̆m ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă ñu ăt jing gơnam ih pô? Laih anŭn tơ ih sĭ laih lŏn anŭn, ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă ih dưi yua prăk anŭn tui hăng ih pô kiăng? Hyư̆m ih pơmĭn amăng pran jua tơl ih ngă tơlơi anai? Ih hmâo ƀlor ƀu djơ̆ kơ mơnuih ôh, samơ̆ ih ƀlor kơ Ơi Adai.” 
And Ananias, hearing these words, fell down and expired. And great fear came upon all who heard [it]. @ Ananias hmư̆ hơdôm tơlơi pơhiăp anŭn ñu rơbuh hăng djai mơtam. Abih bang ƀing hmư̆ tơlơi anŭn hwĭ krip biă mă. 
And the young men, rising up, swathed him up for burial, and having carried him out, buried him. @ Ƀing tơdăm tơgŭ pŏn drơi jan ñu hăng čơkung ba nao dơr hĭ.
And it came to pass about three hours afterwards, that his wife, not knowing what had happened, came in. @ Năng ai klâo mông tơdơi bơnai ñu mŭt nao aka ƀu thâo ôh hơgĕt tơlơi hmâo truh laih. 
And Peter answered her, Tell me if ye gave the estate for so much? And she said, Yes, for so much. @ Pêtrôs tơña ñu: “Laĭ brơi kâo thâo bĕ, djơ̆ mơ̆ nua ƀing gih sĭ lŏn hơdôm anŭn đôč?”
Ñu laĭ: “Ơ, hơdôm anŭn yơh.”
And Peter said to her, Why [is it] that ye have agreed together to tempt the Spirit of [the] Lord? Lo, the feet of those that have buried thy husband [are] at the door, and they shall carry thee out. @ Tui anŭn Pêtrôs laĭ: “Hyư̆m ƀing gih sa pran jua khĭn kiăng lông lăng Yang Bơngăt Hiam Khua Yang? Lăng adih, tơkai ƀing glaĭ mơ̆ng dơr rơkơi ih truh ƀơi bah amăng laih, laih anŭn gơñu či čơkung nao dơr ih kar kaĭ mơ̆n.” 
And she fell down immediately at his feet and expired. And when the young men came in they found her dead; and, having carried her out, they buried her by her husband. @ Ƀơi mông anŭn mơtam ñu rơbuh ƀơi tơkai Pêtrôs hăng djai hĭ. Ƀing tơdăm mŭt hăng ƀuh ñu djai laih, gơñu čơkung nao dơr ƀơi giăm rơkơi ñu. 
And great fear came upon all the assembly, and upon all who heard these things. @ Abih bang Phung Sang Ơi Adai hăng abih bang ƀing hmư̆ kơ tơlơi anŭn hmâo tơlơi hwĭ kơtang biă mă.
And by the hands of the apostles were many signs and wonders done among the people; (and they were all with one accord in Solomon's porch, @ Ƀing khua ding kơna ngă lu gru mơyang laih anŭn tơlơi mơsêh mơyang, ƀơi tơ̆ng krah ƀing ană plei pla. Abih bang ƀing gơñu sa pran jua bơjơnum glaĭ ƀơi adring Salômôn. 
but of the rest durst no man join them, but the people magnified them; @ Ƀu hmâo ôh ƀing mơnuih pơkŏn khĭn mŭt amăng ƀing gơñu, samơ̆ ƀing ană plei bơni pơpŭ kơ gơñu biă mă. 
and believers were more than ever added to the Lord, multitudes both of men and women;) @ Samơ̆ ƀing đaŏ kơ Khua Yang ƀrư̆ hrơi jai lu tui, wơ̆t đah rơkơi wơ̆t đah kơmơi. 
so that they brought out the sick into the streets and put [them] on beds and couches, that at least the shadow of Peter, when he came, might overshadow some one of them. @ Tơl arăng čơkung ba ƀing ruă dưm ƀơi jơlan prŏng, brơi gơñu dŏ đih ƀơi sưng ƀôdah ƀơi kiao buk, kiăng kơ tơ Pêtrôs găn ƀơi anŭn tơ-u ñu bang djơ̆ đơđa ƀing gơñu. 
And the multitude also of the cities round about came together to Jerusalem, bringing sick persons and persons beset by unclean spirits, who were all healed. @ Ƀing ană plei mơ̆ng plei jum dar ăt nao pơtŭm pơ plei Yêrusalem mơ̆n, ba nao ƀing duăm ruă hăng ƀing hmâo yang bơngăt grĭ hơƀak ngă; laih anŭn abih bang gơñu leng kơ suaih soh sel.
And the high priest rising up, and all they that were with him, which is the sect of the Sadducees, were filled with wrath, @ Samơ̆ khua ngă yang prŏng hloh hăng abih bang hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ñu, kiăng laĭ ƀing Sadusi, tơgŭ pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ bă hăng tơlơi moañ. 
and laid hands on the apostles and put them in the public prison. @ Gơñu mă čaŏ ƀing khua ding kơna laih anŭn krư̆ hĭ ƀing gơ̆ amăng sang mơnă. 
But an angel of [the] Lord during the night opened the doors of the prison, and leading them out, said, @ Samơ̆ tơdang amăng mlam hmâo sa čô ling jang Khua Yang pŏk brơi bah amăng war sang mơnă laih anŭn ba gơñu pơ gah rơngiao, hăng laĭ, 
Go ye and stand and speak in the temple to the people all the words of this life. @ “Nao bĕ, dŏ dơ̆ng amăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ laih anŭn pơtô kơ ƀing ană plei abih bang boh pơhiăp djơ̆ kơ Tơlơi Hơdip phrâo anai.” 
And when they heard it, they entered very early into the temple and taught. And when the high priest was come, and they that were with him, they called together the council and all the elderhood of the sons of Israel, and sent to the prison to have them brought. @ Hmư̆ tơlơi anŭn, mơguah ưm gơñu mŭt amăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ laih anŭn čơdơ̆ng pơtô.
Khua ngă yang prŏng hloh laih anŭn ƀing hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ñu truh. Gơñu iâu pơƀŭt ƀing khua phat kơđi hăng abih bang ƀing kŏng tha ană Israel. Giơ̆ng anŭn gơñu pơkiaŏ nao brơi arăng ba ƀing khua ding kơna mơ̆ng sang mơnă rai pơ gơñu. 
And when the officers were come, they did not find them in the prison; and returned and reported @ Samơ̆ tơ ƀing khua tơhan truh pơ sang mơnă, gơñu ƀu ƀuh dơ̆ng tah ƀing khua ding kơna dŏ amăng sang mơnă. Gơñu glaĭ hăng laĭ pơthâo tơlơi anŭn hăng laĭ, 
saying, We found the prison shut with all security, and the keepers standing at the doors; but when we had opened [them], within we found no one. @ “Gơmơi ƀuh sang mơnă khuă kơjăp khŏp, laih anŭn ƀing tơhan ăt dŏ gak ƀơi bah amăng, samơ̆ tơ gơmơi pŏk bah amăng, gơmơi ƀu ƀuh sa čô mơnuih amăng anŭn ôh.” 
And when they heard these words, both the priest and the captain of the temple and the chief priests were in perplexity as to them, what this would come to. @ Giơ̆ng hmư̆ tơlơi anŭn, khua tơhan wai lăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ laih anŭn ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng hmâo tơlơi rŭng răng yua ƀing khua ding kơna anŭn, ƀu thâo ôh hyư̆m tơlơi anai či jing.
