And some one coming reported to them, Lo, the men whom ye put in the prison are in the temple, standing and teaching the people. @ Hmâo sa čô rai hăng laĭ pơthâo kơ gơñu: “Gih lăng adih, ƀing mơnuih ƀing gih hmâo krư̆ anŭn, ră anai gơñu dŏ pơtô laĭ kơ ƀing ană plei amăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ.” 
Then the captain, having gone with the officers, brought them, not with violence, for they feared the people, lest they should be stoned. @ Giơ̆ng kơ anŭn khua kơ ƀing tơhan wai lăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ nao hrŏm hơbĭt hăng tơhan ñu nao mă ƀing khua ding kơna, samơ̆ ƀu khĭn ngă sat ôh, yua kơ gơñu hwĭ kơ ƀing ană plei glŏm boh pơtâo kơ gơñu.
And they bring them and set them in the council. And the high priest asked them, @ Giơ̆ng gơñu mă ba ƀing khua ding kơna, gơñu ba ƀing gơ̆ ƀơi anăp ƀing khua phat kơđi. Khua ngă yang prŏng hloh tơña kơ ƀing gơ̆, laĭ, 
saying, We strictly enjoined you not to teach in this name: and lo, ye have filled Jerusalem with your doctrine, and purpose to bring upon us the blood of this man. @ “Gơmơi hmâo khă laih ƀing gih kơtang kơtĭt ƀu brơi pơtô amăng anăn anai ôh, samơ̆ ƀing gih hmâo ngă pơbă amăng plei Yêrusalem hăng tơlơi ƀing gih pơtô, laih anŭn ƀing gih kiăng drah Mơnuih anŭn tuh ƀơi ƀing gơmơi dơ̆ng hă!”
But Peter answering, and the apostles, said, God must be obeyed rather than men. @ Samơ̆ Pêtrôs hăng ƀing khua ding kơna laĭ glaĭ: “Gơmơi khŏm gưt kơ Ơi Adai, hloh kơ gưt kơ mơnuih. 
The God of our fathers has raised up Jesus, whom *ye* have slain, having hanged on a cross. @ Ơi Adai kơ ƀing ơi adon ƀing ta hmâo pơhơdip glaĭ laih Yêsu, pô ƀing gih hmâo pơ̆ng pơdjai hĭ laih ƀơi kơyâo bơrơkal. 
Him has God exalted by his right hand as leader and saviour, to give repentance to Israel and remission of sins. @ Ơi Adai hmâo yŏng đĭ brơi Pô anŭn dŏ gah hơnuă Ñu, jing Khua Wai Lăng laih anŭn Pô Pơklaih, kiăng kơ ƀing ană Israel kơhmal tơlơi soh laih anŭn hmâo tơlơi pap brơi tơlơi soh gơñu. 
And *we* are [his] witnesses of these things, and the Holy Spirit also, which God has given to those that obey him. @ Gơmơi jing ƀing ngă gơ̆ng jơlan kơ tơlơi anai hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Yang Bơngăt Hiam Pô Ơi Adai hmâo pha brơi kơ ƀing gưt hiăp Ñu, ăt ngă gơ̆ng jơlan kar kaĭ mơ̆n.”
But they, when they heard [these things], were cut to the heart, and took counsel to kill them. @ Tơ hmư̆ hơdôm tơlơi anŭn gơñu hil biă mă laih anŭn gơñu kiăng pơdjai hĭ ƀing khua ding kơna. 
But a certain [man], a Pharisee, named Gamaliel, a teacher of the law, held in honour of all the people, rose up in the council, and commanded to put the men out for a short while, @ Samơ̆ sa čô Pharisi, amăng ƀing khua phat kơđi, anăn ñu Gamaliel, sa čô nai pơtô tơlơi juăt ƀing ană plei pla pơpŭ biă mă, tơgŭ dơ̆ng pơđar kơ arăng brơi ƀing khua ding kơna tơbiă hĭ pơ gah rơngiao amăng ƀiă mông. 
and said to them, Men of Israel, take heed to yourselves as regards these men what ye are going to do; @ Giơ̆ng anŭn ñu laĭ kơ ƀing khua phat kơđi: “Ơ ƀing ană plei pla Israel, răng bĕ kơ tơlơi ƀing gih ngă kơ ƀing anai. 
for before these days Theudas rose up, alleging himself to be somebody, to whom a number of men, about four hundred, were joined; who was slain, and all, as many as obeyed him, were dispersed and came to nothing. @ Hlăk hlâo adih Thiôdas tơgŭ đĭ, pơhaih kơ ñu pô jing sa čô khua gĭt gai, laih anŭn hmâo giăm pă rơtuh čô mơnuih đuaĭ tui ñu; samơ̆ arăng pơdjai hĭ ñu, laih anŭn abih bang ƀing đuaĭ tui ñu čơlah hĭ bru bra, laih anŭn bruă gơñu ngă ƀu jing ôh. 
After him rose Judas the Galilean in the days of the census, and drew away [a number of] people after him; and *he* perished, and all, as many as obeyed him, were scattered abroad. @ Tơdơi kơ ñu, hmâo dơ̆ng Yudas mơnuih Galilê tơgŭ đĭ amăng rơnŭk arăng yap akŏ mơnuih, laih anŭn ñu iâu mă lu mơnuih ƀing ană plei đuaĭ tui ñu. Ñu djai kar kaĭ mơ̆n, laih anŭn abih bang ƀing đuaĭ tui ñu čơlah bru bra. 
And now I say to you, Withdraw from these men and let them alone, for if this counsel or this work have its origin from men, it will be destroyed; @ Tui anŭn amăng tơlơi truh anai, kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih anăm hơduah tơlơi pơkơdơ̆ng hăng ƀing anai ôh. Lui măk ai gơñu bĕ. Yua kơ tơdah hơdră jơlan ƀôdah bruă anai tơbiă mơ̆ng mơnuih, ñu ƀu či jing ôh. 
but if it be from God, ye will not be able to put them down, lest ye be found also fighters against God. @ Samơ̆ tơdah bruă anai tơbiă mơ̆ng Ơi Adai ƀing gih ƀu dưi pơglưh hĭ ƀing anŭn ôh, samơ̆ kơđai glaĭ hwĭ kơ ƀing gih pơblah pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ hăng Ơi Adai.” 
And they listened to his advice; and having called the apostles, they beat them, and enjoined them not to speak in the name of Jesus, and dismissed them. @ Tui anŭn, ƀing gơñu gưt tui hiăp Gamaliel laĭ anŭn. Gơñu iâu ƀing khua ding kơna mŭt, gơñu taih ƀing gơ̆ hăng gai, khă ƀing gơ̆ ƀu brơi pơtô amăng anăn Yêsu ôh, laih anŭn phư hĭ gơñu. 
They therefore went their way from [the] presence of the council, rejoicing that they were counted worthy to be dishonoured for the name. @ Tui anŭn ƀing khua ding kơna tơbiă mơ̆ng anih phat kơđi, pran jua bă hăng tơlơi hơ̆k mơak yua kơ Ơi Adai yap kơ gơñu lăp tŭ tơlơi mlâo yua kơ anăn Yêsu. 
And every day, in the temple and in the houses, they ceased not teaching and announcing the glad tidings that Jesus [was] the Christ. @ Laih anŭn rĭm hrơi amăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ ƀôdah pơ rĭm boh sang ƀing đaŏ, gơñu ƀu pơdơi ôh pơtô pơhrăm hăng ră ruai Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam kơ tơlơi Yêsu jing Yang Krist.
But in those days, the disciples multiplying in number, there arose a murmuring of the Hellenists against the Hebrews because their widows were overlooked in the daily ministration. @ Hlăk anŭn mrô ƀing ding kơna đĭ jai lu hloh dơ̆ng, ƀing Hêlênist pơhiăp brŏk kơ ƀing Hêbrơ, yua kơ gơñu ƀu hơdơr ôh kơ ƀing đah kơmơi Hêlênist djai rơkơi amăng tơlơi gơñu pơpha gơnam ƀơ̆ng huă rĭm hrơi. 
And the twelve, having called the multitude of the disciples to [them], said, It is not right that we, leaving the word of God, should serve tables. @ Pluh dua čô khua ding kơna iâu pơƀŭt glaĭ abih bang ƀing ding kơna hăng laĭ: “Lui hĭ bruă pơtô boh pơhiăp Ơi Adai, pŭng kơ mă bruă gơnam ƀơ̆ng huă anŭn jing ƀu gal djơ̆ ôh. 
Look out therefore, brethren, from among yourselves seven men, well reported of, full of [the] [Holy] Spirit and wisdom, whom we will establish over this business: @ Tui anŭn, Ơ ƀing adơi ayŏng, ruah mă bĕ mơ̆ng amăng ƀing ta tơjuh čô mơnuih hmâo tơlơi hing ang hiam, bă blai Yang Bơngăt Hiam, hmâo tơlơi kơhnâo, laih anŭn ƀing gơmơi či jao brơi bruă anai kơ gơñu. 
but *we* will give ourselves up to prayer and the ministry of the word. @ Bơ kơ ƀing gơmơi, gơmơi či pioh kơ bruă iâu laĭ hăng pơtô pơblang boh pơhiăp Ơi Adai đôč.”
And the saying pleased the whole multitude: and they chose Stephen, a man full of faith and [the] Holy Spirit, and Philip, and Prochorus, and Nicanor, and Timon, and Parmenas, and Nicolas, a proselyte of Antioch, @ Abih bang ƀing ding kơna leng kơ mơak kơ tơlơi gơñu kơčĕ anŭn, laih anŭn gơñu hmâo ruah Êtiên pô bă tơlơi đaŏ laih anŭn Yang Bơngăt Hiam, Philip, Prokorus, Nikanor, Timôn, Parmênas, laih anŭn Nikôlas mơnuih plei Antiôs tui tơlơi đaŏ Yuđa. 
whom they set before the apostles; and, having prayed, they laid their hands on them. @ Gơñu pơdah tơjuh čô anŭn kơ ƀing khua ding kơna, giơ̆ng anŭn ƀing khua ding kơna iâu laĭ ah tơngan ƀơi gơñu.
And the word of God increased; and the number of the disciples in Jerusalem was very greatly multiplied, and a great crowd of the priests obeyed the faith. @ Boh Pơhiăp Ơi Adai lar hyu jai lu, laih anŭn ƀing ding kơna pơ plei Yêrusalem jai đĭ lu hloh dơ̆ng. Hmâo lu biă mă ƀing khua ngă yang ăt gưt kơ tơlơi đaŏ mơ̆n.
And Stephen, full of grace and power, wrought wonders and great signs among the people. @ Êtiên bă hăng tơlơi pap mơ̆ng Ơi Adai laih anŭn tơlơi dưi mơyang, ngă tơlơi mơsêh mơyang hăng gru kơnăl mơyang tơ̆ng krah ană plei pla. 
And there arose up certain of those of the synagogue called of freedmen, and of Cyrenians, and of Alexandrians, and of those of Cilicia and Asia, disputing with Stephen. @ Samơ̆ hmâo đơđa ƀing mơnuih amăng sang bơjơnum arăng pơanăn sang jơnum kơ ƀing mơnuih rơngai, laih anŭn plei Siren, ƀing plei Aleksandri, hăng ƀing Yuđa mơ̆ng čar Silisi laih anŭn čar Asi, tơgŭ đĭ pơrơjah hăng Êtiên. 
And they were not able to resist the wisdom and the Spirit with which he spoke. @ Samơ̆ gơñu ƀu dưi pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ ôh hăng boh pơhiăp kơhnâo Êtiên, Yang Bơngăt Hiam yơh Pô brơi ñu pơhiăp. 
Then they suborned men, saying, We have heard him speaking blasphemous words against Moses and God. @ Tui anŭn hăng tơlơi hơgơ̆m gơñu pơsur mơnuih brơi laĭ tui anai: “Gơmơi hmâo hmư̆ pô anai pơhiăp pơgao hmiah hăng Môis laih anŭn hăng Ơi Adai.” 
And they roused the people, and the elders, and the scribes. And coming upon [him] they seized him and brought [him] to the council. @ Gơñu pơsur ƀing ană plei, ƀing kŏng tha, hăng ƀing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt. Gơñu rai mă čaŏ Êtiên hăng ba ñu pơ anăp ƀing khua phat kơđi. 
And they set false witnesses, saying, This man does not cease speaking words against the holy place and the law; @ Gơñu brơi mơnuih ngă gơ̆ng jơlan ƀlor, laĭ tui anai: “Pô anai nanao pơhiăp ƀrưh hmiah pơkơdơ̆ng hăng anih rơgoh hiam anai laih anŭn hăng tơlơi juăt Môis. 
for we have heard him saying, This Jesus the Nazaraean shall destroy this place, and change the customs which Moses taught us. @ Yua kơ gơmơi hmâo hmư̆ ñu laĭ kơ Yêsu plei Nasaret či pơrai hĭ anih rơgoh hiam anai hăng pơplih hĭ tơlơi phiăn hơdip Môis hmâo brơi laih kơ ƀing ta.” 
And all who sat in the council, looking fixedly on him, saw his face as [the] face of an angel. @ Abih bang mơnuih dŏ ber amăng tơlơi phat kơđi anŭn dŏ krĕng lăng kơ Êtiên ƀu ƀleh mơta ôh, ƀuh ƀô̆ mơta ñu hrup kar hăng ƀô̆ mơta ling jang.
And the high priest said, Are these things then so? @ Khua ngă yang prŏng hloh tơña kơ Êtiên: “Djơ̆ sĭt tui anŭn mơ̆?”
And he said, Brethren and fathers, hearken. The God of glory appeared to our father Abraham when he was in Mesopotamia, before he dwelt in Charran, @ Êtiên laĭ glaĭ: “Ơ ƀing adơi ayŏng, Ơ ƀing ama, dŏ hmư̆ kâo bĕ! Ơi Adai kơ tơlơi ang yang hmâo pơƀuh brơi kơ Abraham, ơi adon ƀing ta hlăk ñu dŏ pơ Mêsôpôtami, hlâo kơ ñu nao dŏ pơ plei Čaran, 
and said to him, Go out of thy land and out of thy kindred, and come into the land which I will shew thee. @ hăng laĭ kơ Abraham: ‘Tơbiă bĕ mơ̆ng čar hăng mơ̆ng kơnŭng djuai ih, laih anŭn nao pơ čar Kâo či kơčrâo brơi ih.’ 
Then going out of the land of the Chaldeans he dwelt in Charran, and thence, after his father died, he removed him into this land in which *ye* now dwell. @ Hlăk anŭn ñu tơbiă mơ̆ng čar Kaldê hăng nao dŏ pơ plei Čaran. Tơdơi kơ ama ñu djai, Ơi Adai ngă brơi ñu tơbiă mơ̆ng plei anŭn nao dŏ amăng čar ƀing gih dŏ ră anai. 
And he did not give him an inheritance in it, not even what his foot could stand on; and promised to give it to him for a possession, and to his seed after him, when he had no child. @ Ơi Adai ƀu brơi kong ngăn hơgĕt kơ ñu ôh amăng čar anŭn, ƀôdah sa pŏk lŏn đơ plă tơkai juă kŏn hmâo lơi, samơ̆ Ơi Adai ƀuăn či brơi čar anŭn jing kong ngăn kơ ñu laih anŭn kơ ƀing ană tơčo ñu tơdơi adih, wơ̆t dah hlăk anŭn Abraham aka hmâo ană ôh. 
And God spoke thus: His seed shall be a sojourner in a strange land, and they shall enslave them and evil entreat [them] four hundred years; @ Ơi Adai laĭ ƀing ană tơčo ñu či jing tuai amăng čar arăng; arăng či mă ƀing gơñu ngă hlŭn hăng kơtư̆ juă gơñu amăng pă rơtuh thŭn. 
and the nation to which they shall be in bondage will *I* judge, said God; and after these things they shall come forth and serve me in this place. @ Samơ̆ Ơi Adai laĭ: ‘Kâo či phat kơđi djuai mơnuih ngă kơ gơñu jing hlŭn. Giơ̆ng kơ anŭn gơñu či tơbiă mơ̆ng čar djuai tuai hăng rai kơkuh pơpŭ kơ Kâo amăng anih anai.’ 
And he gave to him [the] covenant of circumcision; and thus he begat Isaac and circumcised him the eighth day; and Isaac Jacob, and Jacob the twelve patriarchs. @ Ơi Adai brơi kơ Abraham kơnol pơgop hăng phĕt khăt klĭ. Hnŭn yơh, tơ Abraham tơkeng Isak ñu khăt klĭ gơ̆ amăng hrơi tal sapăn. Isak khăt klĭ kơ Yakôp, Yakôp ăt kar kaĭ mơ̆n khăt klĭ kơ ƀing pluh dua čô ơi phŭn kơ ƀing Israel.
And the patriarchs, envying Joseph, sold him away into Egypt. And God was with him, @  Ƀing ơi phŭn anŭn moañ kơ Yôsep, sĭ hĭ ñu pơ čar Êjip. Samơ̆ Ơi Adai dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ñu, 
and delivered him out of all his tribulations, and gave him favour and wisdom in the sight of Pharaoh king of Egypt, and he appointed him chief over Egypt and all his house. @ laih anŭn pơklaih ñu mơ̆ng abih bang tơlơi tơnap tap hăng brơi kơ ñu hmâo tơlơi pap laih anŭn tơlơi kơhnâo ƀơi anăp Pharaôn, pơtao čar Êjip. Pơtao anŭn jao brơi gơ̆ jing khua prŏng wai lăng čar Êjip wơ̆t sang pơtao mơ̆n. 
But a famine came upon all the land of Egypt and Canaan, and great distress, and our fathers found no food. @ Hlăk anŭn hmâo tơlơi ư̆ rơpa tar ƀar čar Êjip hăng wơ̆t čar Kanaan. Hmâo tơlơi tơnap tap prŏng, laih anŭn tơl ƀing ơi adon ƀing ta ƀu dưi hyu sem gơnam ƀơ̆ng huă tah. 
But Jacob, having heard of there being corn in Egypt, sent out our fathers first; @ Tơ Yakôp hmư̆ hing amăng čar Êjip hmâo pơdai, ñu pơkiaŏ ƀing ơi adon ta nao pơ anŭn tal sa. 
and the second time Joseph was made known to his brethren, and the family of Joseph became known to Pharaoh. @ Truh tal dua, Yôsep brơi ƀing adơi ayŏng ñu thâo krăn ñu. Laih anŭn kah Pharaôn thâo krăn kơnŭng djuai Yôsep. 
And Joseph sent and called down to him his father Jacob and all [his] kindred, seventy-five souls. @ Yôsep pơkiaŏ arăng nao tŭ mă Yakôp ama ñu hăng abih bang kơnŭng djuai gơ̆, hmâo tơjuh pluh rơma čô. 
And Jacob went down into Egypt and died, he and our fathers, @ Tui anŭn Yakôp trŭn nao dŏ pơ čar Êjip, laih anŭn djai hĭ pơ anŭn, wơ̆t ƀing ơi phŭn ƀing ta ăt djai kar kaĭ mơ̆n. 
and were carried over to Sychem and placed in the sepulchre which Abraham bought for a sum of money of the sons of Emmor the [father] of Sychem. @ Klang gơñu arăng ba glaĭ pơ plei Sičem, hăng dơr gơñu amăng pơsat Abraham hmâo blơi laih hăng nua prăk mơ̆ng ƀing ană đah rơkơi Hamôr plei Sičem.
But as the time of promise drew near which God had promised to Abraham, the people increased and multiplied in Egypt, @  Tơ giăm truh rơnŭk Ơi Adai pơsĭt tơlơi Ñu ƀuăn hăng Abraham, ană plei ta amăng čar Êjip đĭ lar lu jai, 
until another king over Egypt arose who did not know Joseph. @ tơl hmâo sa čô pơtao pơkŏn wai lăng čar Êjip, pô anŭn ƀu thâo krăn Yôsep ôh. 
*He* dealt subtilly with our race, and evil entreated the fathers, casting out their infants that they might not live. @ Pơtao anŭn ngă tơlơi mơneč hăng ƀing kơnŭng djuai ta, laih anŭn pơgŏ ƀing ơi adon ta khŏm glŏm lui hĭ ană nge, ƀu brơi gơñu hơdip ôh. 
In which time Moses was born, and was exceedingly lovely, who was nourished three months in the house of his father. @ Amăng rơnŭk anŭn arăng tơkeng kơ Môis, ñu jing hiam rŏ biă mă ƀơi anăp Ơi Adai, laih anŭn amĭ ama ñu hmâo rong ñu pơ sang amăng klâo blan. 
And when he was cast out, the daughter of Pharaoh took him up, and brought him up for herself [to be] for a son. @ Tơ amĭ ama ñu lui hĭ ñu, hơbia ană Pharaôn mă rong ba ñu hrup hăng ană ñu pô. 
And Moses was instructed in all [the] wisdom of the Egyptians, and he was mighty in his words and deeds. @ Arăng pơhrăm Môis abih tơlơi kơhnâo ƀing Êjip. Ñu hmâo tơlơi dưi kơtang amăng tơlơi pơhiăp wơ̆t amăng bruă ngă.
And when a period of forty years was fulfilled to him, it came into his heart to look upon his brethren, the sons of Israel; @  Hlăk Môis hmâo pă pluh thŭn laih, ñu hmâo tơlơi pơmĭn amăng pran jua ñu kiăng nao čuă ngui ƀing adơi ayŏng ñu, jing ƀing Israel. 
and seeing a certain one wronged, he defended [him], and avenged him that was being oppressed, smiting the Egyptian. @ Tơ ñu ƀuh arăng ngă sat kơ sa čô amăng ƀing gơñu, ñu pơdŏng pô arăng kơtư̆ juă hăng taih pơdjai hĭ mơnuih Êjip anŭn kiăng kơ rŭ nua brơi. 
For he thought that his brethren would understand that God by his hand was giving them deliverance. But they understood not. @ Ñu mĭn dah adơi ayŏng ñu či thâo hluh Ơi Adai či yua hăng tơngan ñu pơklaih ƀing gơñu, samơ̆ gơñu ƀu thâo hluh ôh. 
And on the morrow he shewed himself to them as they were contending, and compelled them to peace, saying, *Ye* are brethren, why do ye wrong one another? @ Hrơi tơdơi ñu ƀuh dua čô Israel pơrơdjơ̆ pơtaih tơdruă gơñu, Môis nao jĕ kiăng ngă pơrơnom glaĭ hăng laĭ: ‘Hơi, hmư̆ kâo bĕ ƀing gih jing adơi ayŏng hyư̆m kiăng ngă pơrăm tơdruă lĕ?’ 
But he that was wronging his neighbour thrust him away, saying, Who established thee ruler and judge over us? @ Samơ̆ pô kơtư̆ juă ƀing gơ̆p ñu anŭn hơngah lui Môis hăng laĭ: ‘Hlơi hmâo pơjing ih khua wai lăng hăng khua phat kơđi kơ gơmơi? 
Dost *thou* wish to kill me as thou killedst the Egyptian yesterday? @ Ih kiăng pơdjai kâo kar hăng ih hmâo pơdjai laih mơnuih Êjip hrơi tơ̆m brôi anŭn hă?’ 
And Moses fled at this saying, and became a sojourner in the land of Madiam, where he begat two sons. @ Tơ hmư̆ tơlơi anŭn, Môis đuaĭ dŏp nao dŏ amăng čar Madian. Pơ anŭn ñu hmâo dua čô ană đah rơkơi.
And when forty years were fulfilled, an angel appeared to him in the wilderness of mount Sinai, in a flame of fire of a bush. @  Pă pluh thŭn tơdơi, sa čô ling jang pơƀuh kơ Môis amăng jơlah apui dŏ ƀơ̆ng pum drơi pơ tơdrŏn har čư̆ Sinai. 
And Moses seeing it wondered at the vision; and as he went up to consider it, there was a voice of [the] Lord, @ Môis ƀuh hăng kơtuă hling hlang kơ anŏ ñu ƀuh anŭn, laih anŭn ñu nao jĕ kiăng lăng rơđah hloh, samơ̆ ñu hmư̆ săp Khua Yang pơhiăp hăng ñu, 
*I* am the God of thy fathers, the God of Abraham, and of Isaac, and of Jacob. And Moses trembled, and durst not consider [it]. @ ‘Kâo jing Ơi Adai kơ ƀing ơi adon ih. Ơi Adai kơ Abraham, Ơi Adai kơ Isak, laih anŭn Ơi Adai kơ Yakôp.’ Môis hwĭ tơtư̆ ƀu khĭn lăng ôh. 
And the Lord said to him, Loose the sandal of thy feet, for the place on which thou standest is holy ground. @ Khua Yang laĭ kơ ñu: ‘kleh hĭ bĕ klĭ juă mơ̆ng tơkai ih, yua kơ anih ih dŏ dơ̆ng anŭn jing lŏn rơgoh hiam. 
I have surely seen the ill treatment of my people which is in Egypt, and I have heard their groan, and have come down to take them out of it; and now, come, I will send thee to Egypt. @ Sĭt biă mă Kâo ƀuh laih tơlơi arăng kơtư̆ juă ƀing ană plei pla Kâo amăng čar Êjip. Kâo hmư̆ laih tơlơi gơñu ur krao, hnŭn yơh Kâo trŭn rai kiăng pơklaih gơñu. Ră anai, rai bĕ, Kâo či pơkiaŏ nao ih pơ čar Êjip.’
This Moses, whom they refused, saying, Who made thee ruler and judge? him did God send [to be] a ruler and deliverer with the hand of the angel who appeared to him in the bush. @  Môis anai yơh, pô gơñu hmâo hơngah laih hăng laĭ: ‘Hlơi hmâo pơjing ih khua wai lăng hăng khua phat kơđi kơ gơmơi?’ ñu yơh Ơi Adai pơkiaŏ nao jing khua wai lăng laih anŭn jing pô pơrơngai hăng tơngan ling jang, pô hmâo pơƀuh laih kơ ñu amăng pum drơi. 
*He* led them out, having wrought wonders and signs in the land of Egypt, and in the Red sea, and in the wilderness forty years. @ Môis anŭn yơh jing pô hmâo ba gơñu tơbiă. Ñu hmâo ngă lu tơlơi mơsêh mơyang hăng gru kơnăl mơyang amăng čar Êjip, ƀơi ia Rơsĭ Mriah, laih anŭn ƀơi tơdrŏn har amăng pă pluh thŭn. 
This is the Moses who said to the sons of Israel, A prophet shall God raise up to you out of your brethren like me [him shall ye hear]. @ Môis anai yơh pô hmâo pơhiăp laih kơ ƀing ană Israel tui anai: ‘Ơi Adai či yŏng đĭ mơ̆ng tơ̆ng krah adơi ayŏng ƀing gih sa čô pô laĭ lui hlâo kơ ƀing gih kar hăng kâo.’ 
This is he who was in the assembly in the wilderness, with the angel who spoke to him in the mount Sinai, and with our fathers; who received living oracles to give to us; @ Môis anai yơh pô dŏ amăng tơ̆ng krah ană plei pla pơtŭm pơ tơdrŏn har hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ling jang, Pô hmâo pơhiăp laih hăng ñu ƀơi čư̆ Sinai, laih anŭn hăng ƀing ơi adon ƀing ta. Laih anŭn ñu mơ̆n hmâo tŭ mă laih boh pơhiăp hơdip kiăng brơi kơ ƀing ta. 
to whom our fathers would not be subject, but thrust [him] from them, and in their hearts turned back to Egypt, @ Samơ̆ ƀing ơi adon ƀing ta ƀu kiăng tui gưt kơ Môis ôh, hơngah hĭ ñu, laih anŭn pran jua ƀing gơñu kiăng glaĭ pơ čar Êjip. 
saying to Aaron, Make us gods who shall go before us; for this Moses, who brought us out of the land of Egypt, we know not what has happened to him. @ Tui anŭn gơñu laĭ kơ Arôn: ‘Ngă brơi bĕ kơ gơmơi ƀing yang nao hlâo ba jơlan kơ ƀing gơmơi. Bơ Môis, pô hmâo ba ƀing ta tơbiă mơ̆ng čar Êjip, gơmơi ƀu thâo ôh hơgĕt tơlơi hmâo truh laih kơ ñu.’ 
And they made a calf in those days, and offered sacrifice to the idol, and rejoiced in the works of their own hands. @ Amăng khul hrơi anŭn, gơñu tuh rup sa drơi rơmo ană. Gơñu pơyơr mơnơ̆ng ngă yang kơ rup trah anŭn, hăng hơ̆k mơak kơ bruă tơngan gơñu hmâo ngă anŭn. 
But God turned and delivered them up to serve the host of heaven; as it is written in [the] book of the prophets, Have ye offered me victims and sacrifices forty years in the wilderness, O house of Israel? @ Yua kơ anŭn, Ơi Adai lui hĭ gơñu hăng jao hĭ gơñu brơi kơkuh pơpŭ kơ khul pơtŭ amăng adai, tui hăng arăng hmâo čih laih amăng hơdrôm hră ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo:
‘Ơ ƀing Israel, ƀing gih hmâo pơyơr mơ̆ mơnơ̆ng ngă yang laih anŭn mơnơ̆ng pơyơr kơ Kâo,
Amăng pă pluh thŭn pơ tơdrŏn har?
Yea, ye took up the tent of Moloch, and the star of [your] god Remphan, the forms which ye made to do homage to them; and I will transport you beyond Babylon. @ Ư ưh, ƀing gih čơkung ba sang khăn yang Môlok,
Laih anŭn rup pơtŭ yang Rôphan,
Rup anŭn ƀing gih ngă pioh kiăng kơkuh pơpŭ.
Yua kơ anŭn yơh, Kâo či puh pơđuaĭ ƀing gih pơ gah adih čar Babilôn.’
Our fathers had the tent of the testimony in the wilderness, as he that spoke to Moses commanded to make it according to the model which he had seen; @  Ƀing ơi adon ƀing ta hmâo laih sang khăn tơlơi Gơ̆ng Jơlan Pơsĭt amăng tơdrŏn har, tui hăng Ơi Adai pô hmâo pơtă kơ Môis brơi ngă kar hăng rup sang ñu hmâo ƀuh laih. 
which also our fathers, receiving from their predecessors, brought in with Joshua when they entered into possession of [the lands of] the nations, whom God drove out from [the] face of our fathers, until the days of David; @ Amăng rơnŭk ơi adon ƀing ta, gơñu čơkung ba sang khăn anŭn hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Yôsuê, tơl gơñu sua mă lŏn ƀing djuai mơnuih Ơi Adai hmâo puh pơđuaĭ mơ̆ng anăp gơñu. Sang khăn anŭn ăt dŏ truh pơ rơnŭk pơtao Đawit. 
who found favour before God, and asked to find a tabernacle for the God of Jacob; @ Đawit hmâo tơlơi pap ƀơi anăp Ơi Adai laih anŭn ñu rơkâo kiăng pơdơ̆ng sa boh sang, anih dŏ pioh kơ Ơi Adai Yakôp; 
but Solomon built him a house. @ Samơ̆ Salômôn yơh pơdơ̆ng sa boh sang kơ Ơi Adai.
But the Most High dwells not in [places] made with hands; as says the prophet, @ Samơ̆ Ơi Adai Pô Glông Hloh ƀu dŏ amăng anih sang ngă hăng tơngan mơnuih ôh; kar hăng tơlơi pô laĭ lui hlâo hmâo pơhiăp laih,
The heaven [is] my throne and the earth the footstool of my feet: what house will ye build me? saith [the] Lord, or where [is the] place of my rest? @  ‘Khua Yang laĭ, Adai jing gre pơtao Kâo,
Laih anŭn lŏn tơnah jing hnăl tơkai Kâo juă.
Sang pă ƀing gih či pơdơ̆ng brơi kơ Kâo,
Ƀôdah anih pă jing anih brơi Kâo dŏ pơdơi?
has not my hand made all these things? @ Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă tơngan Kâo hmâo ngă abih bang tơlơi anai?’
O stiffnecked and uncircumcised in heart and ears, *ye* do always resist the Holy Spirit; as your fathers, *ye* also. @  Ơ ƀing mơnuih khăng akŏ, pran jua hăng tơngia ƀu khăt klĭ hơi! Nanao ƀing gih pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ hăng Yang Bơngăt Hiam. Kar hăng ơi adon ƀing gih hmâo ngă laih, ƀing gih ăt ngă kar kaĭ mơ̆n. 
Which of the prophets have not your fathers persecuted? and they have slain those who announced beforehand concerning the coming of the Just One, of whom *ye* have now become deliverers up and murderers! @ Hmâo mơ̆ hlơi amăng ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo ƀing ơi adon ƀing gih ƀu hmâo ngă sat ôh? Gơñu ăt pơdjai mơ̆n ƀing laĭ lui hlâo kơ Pô Tơpă či rai, Pô Tơpă anŭn ră anai ƀing gih hmâo pơblư̆ lui hăng pơdjai hĭ laih. 
who have received the law as ordained by [the] ministry of angels, and have not kept [it]. @ Ƀing gih hmâo mă tŭ laih tơlơi juăt mơ̆ng ƀing ling jang jao brơi, samơ̆ ƀing gih ƀu tui gưt tơlơi juăt anŭn ôh!”
And hearing these things they were cut to the heart, and gnashed their teeth against him. @ Tơ gơñu hmư̆ hơdôm tơlơi anŭn, gơñu bă hăng tơlơi hil kơtang, laih anŭn kĕ tơgơi kơ Êtiên. 
But being full of [the] Holy Spirit, having fixed his eyes on heaven, he saw [the] glory of God, and Jesus standing at the right hand of God, @ Samơ̆ Êtiên, bă blai Yang Bơngăt Hiam, angak lăng pơ adai, ƀuh tơlơi ang yang Ơi Adai laih anŭn Yêsu dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơi gah hơnuă Ơi Adai. 
and said, Lo, I behold the heavens opened, and the Son of man standing at the right hand of God. @ Êtiên laĭ: “Lăng adih, kâo ƀuh adai pŏk hĭ, laih anŭn Ană Mơnuih dŏ dơ̆ng gah hơnuă Ơi Adai.”
And they cried out with a loud voice, and held their ears, and rushed upon him with one accord; @ Samơ̆ gơñu ur kraih kơtang, kơđơ̆l hĭ amăng tơngia gơñu, laih anŭn hrŏm hơbĭt gơñu blŭng nao mă Êtiên, 
and having cast [him] out of the city, they stoned [him]. And the witnesses laid aside their clothes at the feet of a young man called Saul. @ gơñu dui hrơ̆t ba gơ̆ pơ gah rơngiao plei laih anŭn glŏm boh pơtâo kơ gơ̆. Ƀing ngă gơ̆ng jơlan pioh sum ao gơñu ƀơi tơkai sa čô tơdăm anăn ñu Sôl. 
And they stoned Stephen, praying, and saying, Lord Jesus, receive my spirit. @ Tơdang gơñu glŏm boh pơtâo kơ Êtiên, Êtiên iâu laĭ tui anai: “Ơ Khua Yang Yêsu, rơkâo kơ Ih tŭ mă bơngăt kâo.” 
And kneeling down, he cried with a loud voice, Lord, lay not this sin to their charge. And having said this, he fell asleep. @ Êtiên tŏ tơŭt hăng ur kraih kơtang: “Ơ Khua Yang, anăm yap tơlơi soh anai kơ ƀing gơñu ôh!” Giơ̆ng ñu pơhiăp tơlơi anŭn, gơ̆ pĭt yơh.
And Saul was consenting to his being killed. And on that day there arose a great persecution against the assembly which was in Jerusalem, and all were scattered into the countries of Judaea and Samaria except the apostles. @ Sôl ăt tŭ ư mơ̆n amăng tơlơi arăng pơdjai Êtiên. Amăng hrơi anŭn arăng čơdơ̆ng kơtư̆ juă ngă sat kơ Phung Sang Ơi Adai amăng plei Yêrusalem kơtang biă mă. Abih bang ƀing đaŏ bru bra čơlah čơlap amăng tring Yuđa hăng tring Samari. Kơnơ̆ng ƀing khua ding kơna đôč ăt dŏ amăng plei Yêrusalem. 
And pious men buried Stephen and made great lamentation over him. @ Ƀing đaŏ kơjăp tŏng ten dơr Êtiên hăng čŏk hia rơngot biă mă kơ gơ̆. 
But Saul ravaged the assembly, entering into the houses one after another, and dragging off both men and women delivered them up to prison. @ Bơ Sôl phara hơjăn ñu, ñu sem hơduah pơrai Phung Sang Ơi Adai, mŭt rĭm boh sang mă čaŏ ƀing đah rơkơi, đah kơmơi hăng ba krư̆ ƀing gơ̆ amăng sang mơnă.
Those then that had been scattered went through [the countries] announcing the glad tidings of the word. @ Tui anŭn, hơdôm ƀing mơnuih čơlah bra hyu tar ƀar anih gơñu pơtô Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam. 
And Philip, going down to a city of Samaria, preached the Christ to them; @ Philip trŭn nao pơ sa boh plei amăng tring Samari, ră ruai Yang Krist kơ ƀing gơñu. 
and the crowds with one accord gave heed to the things spoken by Philip, when they heard [him] and saw the signs which he wrought. @ Ƀing mơnuih lu hmư̆ tơlơi Philip pơtô hăng ƀuh gru kơnăl mơyang ñu ngă. Tui anŭn gơñu sa pran jua dŏ kơčăng hmư̆ ñu. 
For from many who had unclean spirits they went out, crying with a loud voice; and many that were paralysed and lame were healed. @ Lu yang bơngăt grĭ hơƀak ur kraih tơbiă mơ̆ng lu mơnuih gơñu hmâo ngă; laih anŭn hmâo lu ƀing mơnuih rơwen hăng jo ăt suaih mơ̆n. 
And there was great joy in that city. @ Yua kơ anŭn yơh amăng tring Samari hmâo tơlơi mơak mơai biă mă.
But a certain man, by name Simon, had been before in the city, using magic arts, and astonishing the nation of Samaria, saying that himself was some great one. @ Hlăk anŭn amăng plei anŭn hmâo sa čô đah rơkơi anăn ñu Simôn, hlâo adih ngă bruă pơjâu mơnăn laih anŭn ngă brơi ană plei pla Samari kơtuă hling, pơang ñu pô jing sa čô hing ang prŏng. 
To whom they had all given heed, from small to great, saying, This is the power of God which is called great. @ Abih bang mơnuih mơ̆ng čơđai truh pơ tha leng kơ hmư̆ tui ñu soh sel hăng laĭ: “Mơnuih anai jing tơlơi dưi mơyang Ơi Adai arăng pia Tơlơi Mơyang Prŏng.” 
And they gave heed to him, because that for a long time he had astonished them by his magic arts. @ Gơñu hmư̆ tui ñu, yua kơ mơ̆ng sui laih ñu yua tơlơi mơsêh pơjâu ngă kơ arăng kơtuă hling. 
But when they believed Philip announcing the glad tidings concerning the kingdom of God and the name of Jesus Christ, they were baptised, both men and women. @ Samơ̆ tơ gơñu đaŏ kơ tơlơi Philip, mơnuih pơtô Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam kơ dêh čar pơtao Ơi Adai laih anŭn anăn Khua Yang Yêsu Krist kơ ƀing gơñu, abih bang ƀing gơñu đah rơkơi wơ̆t đah kơmơi tŭ ƀatem. 
And Simon also himself believed; and, having been baptised, continued constantly with Philip; and, beholding the signs and great works of power which took place, was astonished. @ Wơ̆t Simôn pô ăt đaŏ kar kaĭ mơ̆n. Giơ̆ng kơ ñu tŭ ƀatem laih, ñu dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Philip. Tơ ñu ƀuh lu tơlơi mơsêh mơyang hăng gru kơnăl mơyang, ñu kơtuă biă mă.
And the apostles who were in Jerusalem, having heard that Samaria had received the word of God, sent to them Peter and John; @ Tơ ƀing khua ding kơna dŏ pơ plei Yêrusalem hmư̆ hing kơ ƀing Samari hmâo mă tŭ boh pơhiăp Ơi Adai, gơñu pơkiaŏ nao Pêtrôs hăng Yôhan nao pơ gơñu. 
who, having come down, prayed for them that they might receive [the] Holy Spirit; @ Tơ dua gơñu truh pơ anŭn laih, gơñu iâu laĭ brơi kơ ƀing mơnuih đaŏ anŭn kiăng kơ gơñu mă tŭ Yang Bơngăt Hiam; 
for he was not yet fallen upon any of them, only they were baptised to the name of the Lord Jesus. @ yua kơ Yang Bơngăt Hiam aka trŭn ôh kơ hlơi hlơi amăng ƀing gơñu, gơñu kơnơ̆ng hmâo tŭ ƀatem amăng anăn Khua Yang Yêsu đôč. 
Then they laid their hands upon them, and they received [the] Holy Spirit. @ Pêtrôs hăng Yôhan ah tơngan ƀơi ƀing gơñu, laih anŭn gơñu dưi tŭ mă Yang Bơngăt Hiam yơh. 
But Simon, having seen that by the laying on of the hands of the apostles the [Holy] Spirit was given, offered them money, @ Tơ Simôn ƀuh Ơi Adai brơi Yang Bơngăt Hiam yua mơ̆ng ƀing khua ding kơna ah tơngan, ñu pơyơr prăk kơ gơñu hăng laĭ, 
saying, Give to me also this power, in order that on whomsoever I may lay hands he may receive [the] Holy Spirit. @ “Brơi kơ kâo bĕ tơlơi mơyang anŭn kiăng kơ hlơi pô kâo ah tơngan, pô anŭn dưi tŭ mă Yang Bơngăt Hiam.”
And Peter said to him, Thy money go with thee to destruction, because thou hast thought that the gift of God can be obtained by money. @ Samơ̆ Pêtrôs laĭ glaĭ: “Prăk ih răm rai hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ih, yua kơ ih pơmĭn dưi blơi tơlơi Ơi Adai pha brơi hăng prăk mah! 
Thou hast neither part nor lot in this matter, for thy heart is not upright before God. @ Ih ƀu hmâo sa črăn hơgĕt ôh hrŏm hơbĭt amăng bruă anai, yua kơ pran jua ih ƀu tơpă ôh ƀơi anăp Ơi Adai. 
Repent therefore of this thy wickedness, and supplicate the Lord, if indeed the thought of thy heart may be forgiven thee; @ Tui anŭn kơhmal hĭ bĕ tơlơi soh sat ih anai, hăng iâu laĭ kơ Khua Yang, kiăng kơ tơlơi pơmĭn pran jua ih năng ai či hmâo tơlơi pap brơi mơ̆n thâo. 
for I see thee to be in the gall of bitterness, and bond of unrighteousness. @ Yua kơ kâo ƀuh ih ăt dŏ amăng tơlơi phĭ rơañ hăng amăng čuăk tơlơi soh akă ih.”
And Simon answering said, Supplicate *ye* for me to the Lord, so that nothing may come upon me of the things of which ye have spoken. @ Simôn laĭ glaĭ: “Rơkâo kơ ƀing gih iâu laĭ kơ Khua Yang brơi kơ kâo, kiăng kơ tơlơi ƀing gih hmâo laĭ anŭn ƀu lĕ kơ kâo ôh.”
They therefore, having testified and spoken the word of the Lord, returned to Jerusalem, and announced the glad tidings to many villages of the Samaritans. @ Giơ̆ng kơ Pêtrôs hăng Yôhan hmâo ngă gơ̆ng jơlan pơklă tơlơi đaŏ hăng pơtô laĭ boh pơhiăp Khua Yang, gơñu glaĭ pơ plei Yêrusalem, gơñu rơbat rah, ră ruai pơtô rah Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam amăng lu boh plei ƀing mơnuih Samari.
But [the] angel of [the] Lord spoke to Philip, saying, Rise up and go southward on the way which goes down from Jerusalem to Gaza: the same is desert. @ Hlăk anŭn sa čô ling jang Khua Yang laĭ kơ Philip: “Tơgŭ bĕ hăng nao pơ gah dơnŭng ƀơi jơlan mơ̆ng plei Yêrusalem trŭn nao pơ plei Gasa.” Jơlan anŭn hyăl amal biă mă. 
And he rose up and went. And lo, an Ethiopian, a eunuch, a man in power under Candace queen of the Ethiopians, who was over all her treasure, who had come to worship at Jerusalem, @ Philip tơgŭ hăng nao mơtam. Anai nê, hmâo sa čô khua mơnuih Êthiôpi arăng kriao ñu laih, ñu ngă khua mă bruă kơ HʼKandas, pơtao đah kơmơi čar Êthiôpi. Ñu wai lăng abih kong ngăn pơtao anŭn. Ñu hmâo nao laih pơ plei Yêrusalem kiăng kơkuh pơpŭ Ơi Adai, 
was returning and sitting in his chariot: and he was reading the prophet Esaias. @ Tơdang ñu đĭ rơdeh aseh wơ̆t glaĭ, ñu dŏ lăng hơdrôm hră pô laĭ lui hlâo Êsai. 
And the Spirit said to Philip, Approach and join this chariot. @ Yang Bơngăt Hiam laĭ kơ Philip: “Đuaĭ tui hơmao rơdeh aseh anŭn hăng nao jĕ bĕ.” 
And Philip, running up, heard him reading the prophet Esaias, and said, Dost thou then know what thou art reading of? @ Tui anŭn Philip đuaĭ nao pơ ñu, laih anŭn hmư̆ ñu dŏ đŏk hơdrôm hră pô laĭ lui hlâo Êsai, Philip tơña kơ ñu: “Ih thâo hluh mơ̆ tơlơi ih hlăk dŏ đŏk anŭn?”
And he said, How should I then be able unless some one guide me? And he begged Philip to come up and sit with him. @ Khua anŭn laĭ glaĭ: “Tơdah ƀu hmâo hlơi pơblang brơi kâo ôh, hyư̆m kâo dưi thâo hluh lĕ?” Giơ̆ng anŭn ñu jak Philip đĭ amăng rơdeh hrŏm hăng ñu. 
And the passage of the scripture which he read was this: He was led as a sheep to slaughter, and as a lamb is dumb in presence of him that shears him, thus he opens not his mouth. @ Anai jing črăn Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp ñu dŏ đŏk anŭn:
“Arăng hmâo dui ba gơ̆ kar hăng triu nao pơ anih kiăng čuh ƀơ̆ng,
Kar hăng sa drơi ană triu ƀu ur ôh hlăk arăng yuă blâu ñu, Ñu ƀu pơhiăp hơgĕt gĕt ôh.
In his humiliation his judgment has been taken away, and who shall declare his generation? for his life is taken from the earth. @ Tơdang Ñu tŭ tơlơi arăng pơmlâo Ñu, arăng ƀu phat kơđi tơpă kơ Ñu ôh.
Ƀu hmâo hlơi dưi ră ruai djơ̆ kơ ană tơčo Ñu ôh.
Yua kơ arăng mă pơđuaĭ hĭ laih tơlơi hơdip Ñu mơ̆ng lŏn tơnah.”
And the eunuch answering Philip said, I pray thee, concerning whom does the prophet say this? of himself or of some other? @ Khua anŭn laĭ hăng Philip: “Kâo tơña kơ ih, pô laĭ lui hlâo laĭ tơlơi anŭn kiăng laĭ nao kơ hlơi lĕ? Laĭ nao kơ ñu pô hă, ƀôdah kơ sa čô pô pơkŏn?” 
And Philip, opening his mouth and beginning from that scripture, announced the glad tidings of Jesus to him. @ Tui anŭn Philip ha pơhiăp, čơdơ̆ng mơ̆ng čăl Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp anŭn Philip pơtô Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam Yêsu kơ ñu. 
And as they went along the way, they came upon a certain water, and the eunuch says, Behold water; what hinders my being baptised? @ Tơdang dua gơñu rơbat ƀơi rŏk jơlan, gơñu ƀuh ia, ding kơna kriao laĭ: “Anai hmâo ia, hmâo tơlơi hơgĕt khă kâo kiăng tŭ ƀatem mơ̆?”
And he commanded the chariot to stop. And they went down both to the water, both Philip and the eunuch, and he baptised him. @ Ñu pơđar brơi dơ̆ng glaĭ hĭ rơdeh aseh, laih anŭn abih dua gơñu trŭn amăng ia, laih anŭn Philip ngă ƀatem brơi kơ ñu. 
But when they came up out of the water [the] Spirit of [the] Lord caught away Philip, and the eunuch saw him no longer, for he went on his way rejoicing. @ Tơ gơñu đĭ mơ̆ng ia, Yang Bơngăt Hiam Khua Yang mă pơđuaĭ hĭ Philip. Ding kơna kriao anŭn ƀu ƀuh ñu dơ̆ng tah, laih anŭn ñu hơ̆k mơak rơbat nao dơ̆ng ƀơi jơlan ñu pô. 
And Philip was found at Azotus, and passing through he announced the glad tidings to all the cities till he came to Caesarea. @ Arăng ƀuh Philip pơ plei Asôt, mơ̆ng plei anŭn ñu nao pơ plei Sêsarê, ră ruai Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam amăng abih plei ñu găn nao.
But Saul, still breathing out threatenings and slaughter against the disciples of the Lord, came to the high priest @ Hlăk anŭn, Sôl tŭt kơ pơhwĭ hăng pơdjai ƀing ding kơna kơ Khua Yang. Ñu nao pơ khua ngă yang prŏng hloh, 
and asked of him letters to Damascus, to the synagogues, so that if he found any who were of the way, both men and women, he might bring [them] bound to Jerusalem. @ rơkâo mơ̆ng ñu čih hră pơthâo kơ abih bang sang bơjơnum pơ plei Damas, kiăng kơ tơdah ñu ƀuh ƀing tui Jơlan Khua Yang, đah rơkơi ƀôdah đah kơmơi, ñu dưi mă čaŏ dui ba ƀing anŭn pơ plei Yêrusalem.
But as he was journeying, it came to pass that he drew near to Damascus; and suddenly there shone round about him a light out of heaven, @ Samơ̆ tơdang Sôl hlăk nao ƀơi jơlan jĕ truh pơ plei Damas, blĭp truh hmâo tơlơi bơngač kơmlă mơ̆ng adai pơčrang jum dar ñu. 
and falling on the earth he heard a voice saying to him, Saul, Saul, why dost thou persecute me? @ Ñu rơbuh lĕ pơ lŏn hăng hmư̆ asăp pơhiăp laĭ kơ ñu: “Ơ Sôl, Ơ Sôl, yua hơgĕt ih ngă sat kơ Kâo?” 
And he said, Who art thou, Lord? And he [said], *I* am Jesus, whom *thou* persecutest. @ Ñu laĭ glaĭ: “Ơ Khua, hlơi Ih?” Khua Yang laĭ: “Kâo jing Yêsu pô ih hlăk dŏ ngă sat. 
But rise up and enter into the city, and it shall be told thee what thou must do. @ Samơ̆ tơgŭ bĕ mŭt amăng plei, laih anŭn arăng či laĭ brơi abih bang bruă kơ ih khŏm ngă.”
But the men who were travelling with him stood speechless, hearing the voice but beholding no one. @ Ƀing mơnuih nao hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Sôl leng kơ dŏ dơ̆ng glaĭ tơngo, ƀu pơhiăp sa boh ôh, gơñu hmư̆ asăp pơhiăp samơ̆ ƀu ƀuh hlơi ôh. 
And Saul rose up from the earth, and his eyes being opened he saw no one. But leading [him] by the hand they brought him into Damascus. @ Sôl tơgŭ mơ̆ng lŏn, wơ̆t dah mơta ñu dŏ blang, samơ̆ ñu ƀu thâo ƀuh ôh. Tui anŭn arăng djă tơngan ñu hăng dui ba pơ plei Damas. 
And he was three days without seeing, and neither ate nor drank. @ Ñu dŏ pơ anŭn amăng klâo hrơi ƀu thâo ƀuh ôh, kŏn ƀơ̆ng huă hăng mơñum lơi.
And there was a certain disciple in Damascus by name Ananias. And the Lord said to him in a vision, Ananias. And he said, Behold, [here am] I, Lord. @ Hlăk anŭn pơ plei Damas hmâo sa čô ding kơna anăn ñu Ananias. Khua Yang pơhiăp hăng ñu amăng tơlơi pơƀuh: “Ơ Ananias.” Ñu laĭ: “Kâo pơ anai, Ơ Khua Yang.” 
And the Lord [said] to him, Rise up and go into the street which is called Straight, and seek in the house of Judas one by name Saul, [he is] of Tarsus: for, behold, he is praying, @ Khua Yang laĭ: “Tơgŭ bĕ hăng nao pơ jơlan arăng pia Jơlan Tơpă, amăng sang Yudas sem hơduah sa čô mơnuih anăn ñu Sôl, mơ̆ng plei Tars, ñu dŏ iâu laĭ. 
and has seen [in a vision] a man by name Ananias coming in and putting his hand on him, so that he should see. @ Laih anŭn amăng tơlơi pơƀuh ñu hmâo ƀuh sa čô mơnuih anăn Ananias, mŭt amăng sang ah tơngan ƀơi ñu kiăng kơ mơta ñu dưi ƀuh glaĭ dơ̆ng.” 
And Ananias answered, Lord, I have heard from many concerning this man how much evil he has done to thy saints at Jerusalem; @ Samơ̆ Ananias laĭ glaĭ: “Ơ Khua Yang, kâo hmâo hmư̆ lu mơnuih laĭ djơ̆ kơ pô anai hmâo ngă sat kơ ƀing rơgoh hiam Ih pơ plei Yêrusalem. 
and here he has authority from the chief priests to bind all who call upon thy name. @ Ră anai ñu dŏ pơ anai, hmâo abih tơlơi dưi mơ̆ng ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng jao brơi kiăng mă čaŏ hĭ abih ƀing iâu laĭ kơ anăn Ih.”
And the Lord said to him, Go, for this [man] is an elect vessel to me, to bear my name before both nations and kings and [the] sons of Israel: @ Samơ̆ Khua Yang laĭ: “Nao bĕ, yua kơ ñu jing pô Kâo hmâo ruah laih kiăng yua ñu pơhaih anăn Kâo ƀơi anăp ƀing djuai tuai, ƀing pơtao, laih anŭn ƀing ană Israel. 
for *I* will shew to him how much he must suffer for my name. @ Laih anŭn Kâo či pơrơđah brơi ñu thâo, ñu khŏm tŭ lu tơlơi tơnap tap yua anăn Kâo.” 
And Ananias went and entered into the house; and laying his hands upon him he said, Saul, brother, the Lord has sent me, Jesus that appeared to thee in the way in which thou camest, that thou mightest see, and be filled with [the] Holy Spirit. @ Tui anŭn Ananias tơbiă nao hăng mŭt amăng sang, ñu ah tơngan ƀơi Sôl hăng laĭ: “Ơ ayŏng Sôl, Khua Yang Yêsu Pô hmâo pơƀuh laih kơ ih ƀơi rŏk jơlan ih rai, hmâo pơkiaŏ kâo kiăng kơ mơta ih dưi ƀuh glaĭ dơ̆ng laih anŭn bă blai hăng Yang Bơngăt Hiam.” 
And straightway there fell from his eyes as it were scales, and he saw, and rising up was baptised; @ Tañ mơtam, hmâo sa mơnơ̆ng kar hăng kơmoh akan lĕ hĭ mơ̆ng mơta Sôl, laih anŭn mơta ñu rơđah glaĭ yơh. Ñu tơgŭ hăng tŭ ƀatem. 
and, having received food, got strength. And he was with the disciples who [were] in Damascus certain days. @ Giơ̆ng ñu ƀơ̆ng huă, pran ñu hmâo tơlơi kơtang glaĭ.
Sôl dŏ glaĭ ƀiă hrơi hrŏm hăng ƀing ding kơna pơ plei Damas. 
And straightway in the synagogues he preached Jesus that *he* is the Son of God. @ Ñu čơdơ̆ng pơtô mơtam amăng sang bơjơnum pơhaih Yêsu jing Ană Ơi Adai.
And all who heard were astonished and said, Is not this *he* who destroyed in Jerusalem those who called on this name, and here was come for this purpose, that he might bring them bound to the chief priests? @ Abih bang ƀing hmư̆ ñu, gơñu leng kơtuă hling biă mă hăng laĭ: “Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă mơnuih anai jing pô hmâo ngă sat laih kơ ƀing iâu laĭ kơ anăn anai pơ plei Yêrusalem, laih anŭn ñu hmâo rai pơ anai kiăng mă čaŏ ƀing đaŏ dui ba pơ ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng?”
But Saul increased the more in power, and confounded the Jews who dwelt in Damascus, proving that this is the Christ. @ Samơ̆ Sôl jai kơjăp kơtang hloh dơ̆ng, pơrơjah pơgăl hăng ƀing ană Yuđa dŏ pơ plei Damas hăng ngă gơ̆ng jơlan pơklă tơlơi Yêsu jing Yang Krist.
Now when many days were fulfilled, the Jews consulted together to kill him. @  Rơgao sui hrơi mơ̆ng anŭn, ƀing ană Yuđa dưm tơlơi mơneč kiăng pơdjai ñu. 
But their plot became known to Saul. And they watched also the gates both day and night, that they might kill him; @ Samơ̆ hmâo mơnuih nao laĭ pơthâo hĭ Sôl kơ tơlơi mơneč gơñu anŭn. Hrơi mlam gơñu dŏ krăp ƀơi amăng jang kiăng pơdjai Sôl. 
but the disciples took him by night and let him down through the wall, lowering him in a basket. @ Samơ̆ amăng mlam, ƀing ding kơna pioh Sôl amăng bai hăng pơañreng trŭn gah rơngiao kơ pơnăng plei.
And having arrived at Jerusalem he essayed to join himself to the disciples, and all were afraid of him, not believing that he was a disciple. @ Tơ truh pơ plei Yêrusalem ñu kiăng nao bưp ƀing ding kơna pơkŏn; samơ̆ abih bang gơñu leng kơ hwĭ kơ ñu, yua kơ ƀing gơñu ƀu đaŏ ôh kơ ñu jing ding kơna sĭt. 
But Barnabas took him and brought him to the apostles, and related to them how he had seen the Lord in the way, and that he had spoken to him, and how in Damascus he had spoken boldly in the name of Jesus. @ Tui anŭn, Barnabas nao djru hăng ba nao ñu pơ ƀing khua ding kơna, laih anŭn ră ruai brơi kơ ƀing gơñu kơ tơlơi Sôl hmâo ƀuh Khua Yang ƀơi rŏk jơlan, tơlơi Khua Yang hmâo pơhiăp laih kơ Sôl, laih anŭn hyư̆m Sôl hmâo pơtô laih anăn Yêsu hăng tơlơi khĭn amăng plei Damas. 
And he was with them coming in and going out at Jerusalem, @ Mơ̆ng anŭn, Sôl dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt, nao rai hăng ƀing ding kơna amăng Plei Yêrusalem, laih anŭn pơtô hăng tơlơi khĭn amăng anăn Khua Yang. 
and speaking boldly in the name of the Lord. And he spoke and discussed with the Hellenists; but they sought to kill him. @ Ñu pơhiăp hăng pơgăl hăng ƀing Hêlênist, samơ̆ ƀing anŭn hơduah tơlơi kiăng pơdjai ñu. 
And the brethren knowing it, brought him down to Caesarea and sent him away to Tarsus. @ Tơ ƀing adơi ayŏng thâo tơlơi anŭn gơñu ba Sôl nao pơ plei Sêsarê hăng brơi ñu nao pơ plei Tars.
The assemblies then throughout the whole of Judaea and Galilee and Samaria had peace, being edified and walking in the fear of the Lord, and were increased through the comfort of the Holy Spirit. @ Tui anŭn, abih Phung Sang Ơi Adai amăng tring Yuđa, tring Galilê hăng tring Samari hmâo tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua, prŏng đĭ tui; Phung Sang Ơi Adai rơbat amăng tơlơi hwĭ pơpŭ kơ Khua Yang laih anŭn mơ̆ng tơlơi Yang Bơngăt Hiam djru, hmâo mơnuih đaŏ thim lu jai.
Now it came to pass that Peter, passing through all [quarters], descended also to the saints who inhabited Lydda. @ Tơdang Pêtrôs hyu djŏp djang anih, ñu ăt trŭn nao mơ̆n pơ ƀing rơgoh hiam pơ plei Lida. 
And he found there a certain man, Aeneas by name, who had been lying for eight years upon a couch, who was paralysed. @ Pơ anŭn Pêtrôs ƀuh sa čô mơnuih rơwen anăn gơ̆ Ênê; dŏ đih ƀơi sưng hmâo sapăn thŭn laih. 
And Peter said to him, Aeneas, Jesus, the Christ, heals thee: rise up, and make thy couch for thyself. And straightway he rose up. @ Pêtrôs laĭ kơ ñu: “Ơ Ênê, Yêsu Krist pơsuaih brơi ih; tơgŭ bĕ hăng rơmet sưng pĭt ih.” Gơ̆ tơgŭ mơtam. 
And all who inhabited Lydda and the Saron saw him, who turned to the Lord. @ Abih bang ƀing amăng plei Lida hăng plei Sarôn ƀuh gơ̆, laih anŭn gơñu leng kơ wơ̆t glaĭ kơ Khua Yang.
And in Joppa there was a certain female disciple, by name Tabitha, which being interpreted means Dorcas. She was full of good works and alms-deeds which she did. @ Pơ plei Jôpa hmâo sa čô đah kơmơi ding kơna anăn ñu HʼTabitha, arăng iâu dơ̆ng HʼDôrkas (kiăng laĭ kơtŏng). Gơ̆ ngă lu bruă hiam hăng brơi lu mơnơ̆ng pap. 
And it came to pass in those days that she grew sick and died; and, having washed her, they put her in [the] upper room. @ Hlăk anŭn ñu ruă laih anŭn djai hĭ. Arăng rao drơi jan gơ̆ hăng pơđih hĭ pơ adŭ tal glong. 
But Lydda being near to Joppa, the disciples having heard that Peter was there, sent two men to him, beseeching him, Thou must not delay coming to us. @ Yua kơ plei Lida jĕ hăng plei Jôpa, ƀing ding kơna hmư̆ kơ Pêtrôs dŏ pơ anŭn, laih anŭn pơkiaŏ dua čô đah rơkơi nao laĭ kơ ñu: “Rơkâo kơ ih rai hrŏm hơbĭt hăng gơmơi tañ mơtam.” 
And Peter rising up went with them, whom, when arrived, they brought up into the upper chamber; and all the widows stood by him weeping and shewing him the body-coats and garments which Dorcas had made while she was with them. @ Tui anŭn Pêtrôs tơgŭ nao hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing anŭn. Tơ Pêtrôs truh laih, arăng ba ñu pơ adŭ tal glong anŭn. Abih bang ƀing đah kơmơi djai rơkơi dŏ hia jĕ Pêtrôs, brơi ñu lăng ao phyung hăng khăn ao pơkŏn HʼDôrkas hmâo čoh brơi gơñu hlăk ñu dŏ hơdip. 
But Peter, putting them all out, and kneeling down, prayed. And, turning to the body, he said, Tabitha, arise. And she opened her eyes, and, seeing Peter, sat up. @ Pêtrôs pơtă abih bang mơnuih tơbiă pơ gah rơngiao. Ñu tŏ tơŭt, iâu laĭ giơ̆ng anŭn ñu wir lăng drơi jan mơnuih djai hăng laĭ: “Ơ HʼTabitha, tơgŭ bĕ!” Gơ̆ blang mơta, laih anŭn tơ ñu ƀuh Pêtrôs, tañ mơtam gơ̆ pyut tơgŭ dŏ ber. 
And having given her [his] hand, he raised her up, and having called the saints and the widows, presented her living. @ Pêtrôs yơr tơngan rŭ gơ̆ tơgŭ; hăng iâu ƀing rơgoh hiam hăng ƀing đah kơmơi djai rơkơi brơi gơñu ƀuh gơ̆ dŏ hơdip. 
And it became known throughout the whole of Joppa, and many believed on the Lord. @ Bruă anŭn arăng hmư̆ hing hyu amăng abih plei Jôpa, laih anŭn lu mơnuih đaŏ kơ Khua Yang. 
And it came to pass that he remained many days in Joppa with a certain Simon, a tanner. @ Pêtrôs dŏ glaĭ pơ plei Jôpa lu hrơi amăng sang Simôn, sa čô mơnuih ngă bruă lok klĭ.
But a certain man in Caesarea, by name Cornelius, a centurion of the band called Italic, @ Amăng plei Sêsarê hmâo sa čô mơnuih anăn ñu Kôrnai, ngă khua kơ sa rơtuh čô ƀing tơhan Itali. 
pious, and fearing God with all his house, [both] giving much alms to the people, and supplicating God continually, @ Ñu jing mơnuih khăp hur kơ tơlơi đaŏ, thâo hwĭ pơpŭ kơ Ơi Adai hrŏm hơbĭt hăng abih mơnuih amăng sang ñu. Hăng tơlơi čơmah ñu brơi lu mơnơ̆ng pap kơ ƀing ană plei pla, laih anŭn ñu iâu laĭ kơ Ơi Adai nanao. 
saw plainly in a vision, about the ninth hour of the day, an angel of God coming unto him, and saying to him, Cornelius. @ Hlăk klâo mông klam ñu ƀuh rơđah amăng tơlơi pơƀuh sa čô ling jang Ơi Adai mŭt amăng sang ñu hăng laĭ kơ ñu: “Ơ Kôrnai.” 
But he, having fixed his eyes upon him, and become full of fear, said, What is it, Lord? And he said to him, Thy prayers and thine alms have gone up for a memorial before God. @ Hăng tơlơi hwĭ tơtư̆ ñu lăng pơñen ling jang hăng laĭ: “Ơ Khua, hmâo tơlơi hơgĕt?” Ling jang laĭ kơ ñu: “Tơlơi ih iâu laĭ laih anŭn mơnơ̆ng ih brơi pap hmâo đĭ truh pơ Ơi Adai laih yơh, laih anŭn Ơi Adai hơdơr pioh tơlơi anŭn. 
And now send men to Joppa and fetch Simon, who is surnamed Peter. @ Ră anai pơkiaŏ nao bĕ mơnuih pơ Jôpa iâu Simôn arăng pơanăn Pêtrôs. 
He lodges with a certain Simon, a tanner, whose house is by the sea. @ Ñu hlăk dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Simôn, sa čô mơnuih ngă bruă lok klĭ, sang ñu ƀơi hang ia rơsĭ.” 
And when the angel who was speaking to him had departed, having called two of his household and a pious soldier of those who were constantly with him, @ Tơ ling jang pơhiăp hăng ñu đuaĭ hĭ laih, Kôrnai iâu dua čô ding kơna ñu hăng sa čô tơhan hmâo tơlơi đaŏ amăng ƀing tơhan mă bruă kơ ñu. 
and related all things to them, he sent them to Joppa. @ Giơ̆ng ñu ră ruai abih tơlơi anŭn kơ ƀing gơ̆, ñu pơkiaŏ nao gơñu pơ plei Jôpa.
And on the morrow, as these were journeying and drawing near to the city, Peter went up on the house to pray, about the sixth hour. @ Tơdơi kơ hrơi anŭn, tơdang gơñu nao giăm truh pơ plei Jôpa, hlăk yang hrơi dơ̆ng Pêtrôs đĭ pơ bơbŭng sang kiăng iâu laĭ. 
And he became hungry and desired to eat. But as they were making ready an ecstasy came upon him: @ Ñu rơpa laih anŭn mơhao kiăng huă biă mă, samơ̆ tơdang arăng dŏ prăp pre mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă kơ ñu, ñu hmâo sa tơlơi pơƀuh. 
and he beholds the heaven opened, and a certain vessel descending, as a great sheet, [bound] by [the] four corners [and] let down to the earth; @ Ñu ƀuh adai pŏk hĭ, laih anŭn hmâo mơnơ̆ng kar hăng sa blah khăn prŏng akă pă gah akiăng pơañreng trŭn truh pơ lŏn. 
in which were all the quadrupeds and creeping things of the earth, and the fowls of the heaven. @ Amăng anŭn hmâo djŏp mơta hlô mơnơ̆ng pă ƀĕ tơkai, hlô mơnơ̆ng hro rui, hăng čĭm brĭm amăng adai. 
And there was a voice to him, Rise, Peter, slay and eat. @ Laih anŭn hmâo sa asăp pơhiăp laĭ kơ ñu: “Ơ Pêtrôs tơgŭ koh čuh ƀơ̆ng bĕ!” 
And Peter said, In no wise, Lord; for I have never eaten anything common or unclean. @ Samơ̆ Pêtrôs laĭ: “Ơ Khua Yang, ƀu dưi ôh; yua kơ kâo ƀu dưi ƀơ̆ng ôh mơnơ̆ng hơƀak drak tui hăng tơlơi juăt ƀôdah ƀu rơgoh.” 
And [there was] a voice again the second time to him, What God has cleansed, do not *thou* make common. @ Asăp pơhiăp anŭn laĭ kơ ñu tal dua dơ̆ng: “Hơgĕt mơnơ̆ng Ơi Adai hmâo pơrơgoh laih, anăm laĭ ñu grĭ grañ dơ̆ng ôh.” 
And this took place thrice, and the vessel was straightway taken up into heaven. @ Tơlơi pơhiăp anŭn truh klâo wơ̆t, laih anŭn thĕng lơleh, khăn anŭn dui đĭ hĭ pơ adai.
And as Peter doubted in himself what the vision which he had seen might mean, behold also the men who were sent by Cornelius, having sought out the house of Simon, stood at the gate, @ Tơdang Pêtrôs rŭng răng dŏ pơmĭn kơ hơgĕt tơlơi pơƀuh anŭn kiăng pia, ƀing mơnuih Kôrnai pơkiaŏ nao hmâo tơña ƀuh sang Simôn laih, laih anŭn gơñu hlăk dŏ ƀơi amăng jang. 
and having called [some one], they inquired if Simon who was surnamed Peter was lodged there. @ Gơñu iâu kiăng tơña lăng djơ̆ mơ̆ Simôn pô arăng pơanăn Pêtrôs hlăk dŏ pơ anai.
But as Peter continued pondering over the vision, the Spirit said to him, Behold, three men seek thee; @ Tơdang Pêtrôs dŏ pơmĭn kơ tơlơi pơƀuh anŭn, Yang Bơngăt Hiam laĭ kơ ñu: “Lăng adih, hmâo klâo čô mơnuih dŏ sem ih. 
but rise up, go down, and go with them, nothing doubting, because *I* have sent them. @ Tui anŭn tơgŭ bĕ hăng trŭn nao hrŏm hơbĭt hăng gơñu, anăm dŏ kĭ kơ̆ dơ̆ng ôh; yua kơ Kâo yơh pơkiaŏ gơñu rai.” 
And Peter going down to the men said, Behold, *I* am he whom ye seek: what is the cause for which ye come? @ Tui anŭn Pêtrôs trŭn nao pơ ƀing mơnuih anŭn hăng laĭ: “Kâo gơ̆ yơh pô ƀing gih sem. Hơgĕt bruă ƀing gih rai?”
And they said, Cornelius, a centurion, a righteous man, and fearing God, and borne witness to by the whole nation of the Jews, has been divinely instructed by a holy angel to send for thee to his house, and hear words from thee. @ Gơñu laĭ: “Kôrnai sa čô khua tơhan kơ sa rơtuh čô, sa čô tơpă hiam hăng hwĭ pơpŭ kơ Ơi Adai, pô abih bang ƀing ană plei pla Yuđa pơpŭ leng kơ ngă gơ̆ng jơlan hiam. Hmâo sa čô ling jang Ơi Adai pơtă brơi rai iâu ih nao pơ sang ñu, kiăng hmư̆ tơlơi ih pơtô.” 
Having therefore invited them in, he lodged them. And on the morrow, rising up he went away with them, and certain of the brethren from Joppa went with him. @ Tui anŭn Pêtrôs iâu gơñu mŭt amăng sang, brơi gơñu đih đơ̆m glaĭ pơ anŭn.
Hrơi pơgi Pêtrôs tơgŭ nao hrŏm hăng gơñu, hmâo đơđa adơi ayŏng mơ̆ng plei Jôpa nao hrŏm hơbĭt hăng gơñu mơ̆n. 
And on the morrow they came to Caesarea. But Cornelius was looking for them, having called together his kinsmen and [his] intimate friends. @ Hrơi tơdơi kơ anŭn gơñu truh pơ plei Sêsarê. Kôrnai hrŏm hăng ƀing gơ̆p djuai ñu, ƀing gơyut gơyâo ñu, pơƀŭt glaĭ amăng sang, hlăk dŏ tơguan gơñu. 
And when Peter was now coming in, Cornelius met him, and falling down did [him] homage. @ Tơ Pêtrôs mŭt, Kôrnai kluh nao čơkă hăng bon kơkuh ƀơi tơkai Pêtrôs. 
But Peter made him rise, saying, Rise up: *I* myself also am a man. @ Samơ̆ Pêtrôs rŭ ñu tơgŭ hăng laĭ: “Tơgŭ dơ̆ng bĕ, kâo ăt jing sa čô mơnuih đôč.” 
And he went in, talking with him, and found many gathered together. @ Tơdang Pêtrôs dŏ pơhiăp hăng Kôrnai ñu mŭt amăng sang laih anŭn ƀuh lu mơnuih dŏ pơtŭm glaĭ. 
And he said to them, *Ye* know how it is unlawful for a Jew to be joined or come to one of a strange race, and to *me* God has shewn to call no man common or unclean. @ Pêtrôs pơhiăp hăng gơñu: “Ƀing gih pô thâo laih ƀing ană Yuđa ƀu phiăn lir pơgop ƀôdah čuă ngui hăng sa čô mơnuih tuai ôh. Samơ̆ Ơi Adai pơrơđah laih kơ kâo anăm yap sa čô mơnuih jing hơƀak drak ƀôdah ƀu rơgoh ôh. 
Wherefore also, having been sent for, I came without saying anything against it. I inquire therefore for what reason ye have sent for me. @ Yua kơ anŭn, tơ ƀing gih pơkiaŏ mơnuih nao iâu kâo, kâo ƀu hơngah rai ôh. Hnŭn yơh kâo tơña yua hơgĕt ƀing gih kiăng kâo rai?”
And Cornelius said, Four days ago I had been [fasting] unto this hour, and the ninth [I was] praying in my house, and lo, a man stood before me in bright clothing, @ Kôrnai laĭ: “Rơgao pă hrơi laih, ƀơi mông anai mơ̆n, hlăk klâo mông klam tơdang kâo dŏ iâu laĭ amăng sang plŭt mơtam hmâo sa čô mơnuih buh ao bơngač biă mă pơƀuh rai ƀơi anăp kâo, 
and said, Cornelius, thy prayer has been heard, and thy alms have come in remembrance before God. @ hăng laĭ: ‘Ơ Kôrnai, Ơi Adai hmâo hmư̆ laih tơlơi ih iâu laĭ, laih anŭn Ñu hơdơr pioh laih abih bruă ih brơi pap. 
Send therefore to Joppa and fetch Simon, who is surnamed Peter; he lodges in the house of Simon, a tanner, by the sea [who when he is come will speak to thee]. @ Tui anŭn pơkiaŏ nao bĕ mơnuih pơ plei Jôpa laih anŭn iâu Simôn pơanăn dơ̆ng Pêtrôs rai pơ anai. Ñu hlăk dŏ amăng sang Simôn, sa čô mơnuih ngă bruă lok klĭ, dŏ ƀơi hang ia rơsĭ.’ 
Immediately therefore I sent to thee, and *thou* hast well done in coming. Now therefore *we* are all present before God to hear all things that are commanded thee of God. @ Tui anŭn kâo pơkiaŏ nao mơtam mơnuih iâu ih, laih anŭn ih hmâo pran jua hiam rai pơ anai. Tui anŭn ră anai abih bang gơmơi dŏ ƀơi anăp Ơi Adai, kiăng hmư̆ abih tơlơi Khua Yang pơtă kơ ih pơhiăp.”
And Peter opening his mouth said, Of a truth I perceive that God is no respecter of persons, @  Pêtrôs čơdơ̆ng pơhiăp: “Sĭt biă mă kâo thâo Ơi Adai ƀu yap mơnuih phara phara ôh, 
but in every nation he that fears him and works righteousness is acceptable to him. @ samơ̆ amăng abih bang djuai mơnuih, hlơi pô hwĭ pơpŭ kơ Ơi Adai laih anŭn ngă tơlơi tơpă, pô anŭn yơh Ơi Adai mơak kơ ñu. 
The word which he sent to the sons of Israel, preaching peace by Jesus Christ, (*he* is Lord of all things,) @ Ƀing gih thâo Ơi Adai hmâo brơi laih tơlơi pơhiăp Ñu kơ ƀing Israel, kiăng pơhaih Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam kơ tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua mơ̆ng Yêsu Krist (Ñu jing Khua Yang kơ abih bang). 
*ye* know; the testimony which has spread through the whole of Judaea, beginning from Galilee after the baptism which John preached @ Ƀing gih thâo laih bruă anŭn hmâo truh čơdơ̆ng mơ̆ng Galilê lar hyu truh pơ djŏp tring Yuđa, tơdơi kơ Yôhan pơtô kơ tơlơi ƀatem; 
Jesus who [was] of Nazareth: how God anointed him with [the] Holy Spirit and with power; who went through [all quarters] doing good, and healing all that were under the power of the devil, because God was with him. @ hyư̆m Ơi Adai hmâo truač ia jâu kơ Yêsu plei Nasaret hăng Yang Bơngăt Hiam laih anŭn tơlơi dưi mơyang; giơ̆ng anŭn Ñu nao djŏp anih ngă bruă hiam hăng pơsuaih abih bang ƀing mơnuih yang sat kơtư̆ juă, yua kơ Ơi Adai dŏ hăng Ñu. 
*We* also [are] witnesses of all things which he did both in the country of the Jews and in Jerusalem; whom they also slew, having hanged him on a cross. @ Ƀing gơmơi jing ƀing ngă gơ̆ng jơlan pơsĭt kơ abih bang tơlơi Ñu hmâo ngă laih amăng tring Yuđa laih anŭn amăng plei Yêrusalem. Ƀing Yuđa hmâo yol pơdjai Ñu ƀơi kơyâo bơrơkal. 
This [man] God raised up the third day and gave him to be openly seen, @ Samơ̆ hrơi tal klâo, Ơi Adai pơhơdip glaĭ Ñu hăng brơi Ñu pơrơđah rai, 
not of all the people, but of witnesses who were chosen before of God, *us* who have eaten and drunk with him after he arose from among [the] dead. @ ƀu djơ̆ kơ abih bang ană plei pla ôh, samơ̆ kơnơ̆ng kơ ƀing gơmơi đôč, jing ƀing ngă gơ̆ng jơlan Ơi Adai hmâo ruah mă hlâo, jing ƀing mơnuih hmâo dŏ ƀơ̆ng huă laih anŭn mơñum hrŏm hăng Ñu giơ̆ng kơ Ñu hmâo hơdip glaĭ mơ̆ng mơnuih djai. 
And he commanded us to preach to the people, and to testify that *he* it is who was determinately appointed of God [to be] judge of living and dead. @ Laih anŭn Ñu pơtă ƀing gơmơi khŏm pơtô laĭ kơ abih bang ană plei pla, hăng pơhaih pơsĭt kơ Ñu jing Pô Ơi Adai pơdŏ brơi kiăng phat kơđi kơ ƀing hơdip laih anŭn kơ ƀing mơnuih djai. 
To him all the prophets bear witness that every one that believes on him will receive through his name remission of sins. @ Abih bang pô laĭ lui hlâo hmâo pơhaih laih hlơi pô đaŏ kơ Ñu hmâo tơlơi pap brơi tơlơi soh mơ̆ng anăn Ñu.”
While Peter was yet speaking these words the Holy Spirit fell upon all those who were hearing the word. @ Tơdang Pêtrôs dŏ pơhiăp, Yang Bơngăt Hiam trŭn ƀơi abih bang ƀing dŏ hmư̆ tơlơi pơhiăp anŭn. 
And the faithful of the circumcision were astonished, as many as came with Peter, that upon the nations also the gift of the Holy Spirit was poured out: @ Ƀing đaŏ hmâo tŭ laih tơlơi khăt klĭ, jing ƀing rai hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Pêtrôs, dŏ kơtuă hling, yua kơ tơlơi pha brơi Yang Bơngăt Hiam Ơi Adai ăt tuh brơi wơ̆t kơ ƀing djuai tuai mơ̆n. 
for they heard them speaking with tongues and magnifying God. Then Peter answered, @ Yua kơ gơñu hmư̆ ƀing anŭn pơhiăp tơlơi tuai laih anŭn bơni hơơč kơ Ơi Adai. Hlăk anŭn Pêtrôs laĭ, 
Can any one forbid water that these should not be baptised, who have received the Holy Spirit as we also [did]? @ “Hlơi dưi hơngah hĭ tơlơi ƀatem hăng ia kơ ƀing ană plei hmâo mă tŭ laih Yang Bơngăt Hiam kar hăng ƀing ta mơ̆?” 
And he commanded them to be baptised in the name of the Lord. Then they begged him to stay some days. @ Giơ̆ng anŭn Pêtrôs pơtă brơi gơñu tŭ tơlơi ƀatem amăng anăn Yêsu Krist. Laih anŭn gơñu rơkâo kơ Pêtrôs dŏ glaĭ hăng gơñu ƀiă hrơi dơ̆ng.
And the apostles and the brethren who were in Judaea heard that the nations also had received the word of God; @ Ƀing khua ding kơna hăng ƀing adơi ayŏng amăng tring Yuđa hmư̆ hing ƀing djuai tuai ăt mă tŭ boh pơhiăp Ơi Adai mơ̆n. 
and when Peter went up to Jerusalem, they of the circumcision contended with him, @ Tui anŭn tơ Pêtrôs đĭ nao pơ plei Yêrusalem, ƀing đaŏ amăng ƀing khăt klĭ ƀuah kơčrâo kơ ñu, 
saying, Thou wentest in to men uncircumcised and hast eaten with them. @ hăng laĭ: “Hyư̆m ih mŭt amăng sang ƀing mơnuih ƀu khăt klĭ laih anŭn ƀơ̆ng huă hrŏm hăng gơñu?” 
But Peter began and set forth [the matter] to them in order, saying, @ Samơ̆ Pêtrôs čơdơ̆ng pơblang kơ gơñu djơ̆ tui rĭm tal abih bruă hmâo truh laih: 
I was in the city of Joppa praying, and in an ecstasy I saw a vision, a certain vessel descending like a great sheet, let down by four corners out of heaven, and it came even to me: @ “Tơdang kâo dŏ iâu laĭ amăng plei Jôpa, kâo djai huăt laih anŭn hmâo tơlơi pơƀuh. Hmâo mơnơ̆ng kar hăng sa blah khăn prŏng akă hĭ pă akiăng pơtrŭn rai mơ̆ng adai laih anŭn truh pơ kâo. 
on which having fixed mine eyes, I considered, and saw the quadrupeds of the earth, and the wild beasts, and the creeping things, and the fowls of the heaven. @ Tơdang kâo dŏ kơsem lăng ten, kâo ƀuh amăng anŭn hmâo khul hlô mơnơ̆ng pă ƀĕ tơkai, khul hlô glai, khul hlô mơnơ̆ng hro rui, laih anŭn khul čĭm brĭm amăng adai. 
And I heard also a voice saying to me, Rise up, Peter, slay and eat. @ Kâo hmư̆ asăp pơhiăp laĭ kơ kâo: ‘Ơ Pêtrôs, tơgŭ hăng mă čuh ƀơ̆ng bĕ!’ 
And I said, In no wise, Lord, for common or unclean has never entered into my mouth. @ Samơ̆ Kâo laĭ: ‘Ơ Khua Yang, ƀu dưi ôh; yua kơ khul mơnơ̆ng hơgĕt grĭ grañ ƀôdah ƀu rơgoh ƀu dưi mŭt amăng bah kâo ôh.’ 
And a voice answered the second time out of heaven, What God has cleansed, do not *thou* make common. @ Samơ̆ asăp mơ̆ng adai anŭn pơhiăp kơ kâo dơ̆ng tal dua: ‘Hơgĕt mơnơ̆ng Ơi Adai hmâo pơrơgoh laih, anăm ih yap ñu grĭ grañ ôh.’ 
And this took place thrice, and again all was drawn up into heaven; @ Tơlơi anŭn truh klâo wơ̆t, laih anŭn abih bang mơnơ̆ng anŭn dui glaĭ hĭ pơ adai adih. 
and lo, immediately three men were at the house in which I was, sent to me from Caesarea. @ Hlăk anŭn mơtam klâo čô mơnuih arăng pơkiaŏ rai pơ kâo mơ̆ng plei Sêsarê truh ƀơi bah amăng sang kâo dŏ. 
And the Spirit said to me to go with them, nothing doubting. And there went with me these six brethren also, and we entered into the house of the man, @ Yang Bơngăt Hiam laĭ kơ kâo brơi kâo nao hrŏm hơbĭt hăng gơñu anăm dŏ kĭ kơ̆ ôh. Ƀing năm čô adơi ayŏng anai ăt nao hrŏm hơbĭt hăng kâo mơ̆n, laih anŭn gơmơi mŭt amăng sang Kôrnai. 
and he related to us how he had seen the angel in his house, standing and saying [to him], Send [men] to Joppa and fetch Simon, who is surnamed Peter, @ Kôrnai ră ruai glaĭ kơ gơmơi ñu hmâo ƀuh sa čô ling jang Ơi Adai dŏ dơ̆ng amăng sang ñu hăng laĭ: ‘pơkiaŏ nao bĕ mơnuih pơ plei Jôpa, iâu Simôn arăng pơanăn Pêtrôs. 
who shall speak words to thee whereby *thou* shalt be saved, thou and all thy house. @ Ñu či pơtô kơ ih hơdôm boh pơhiăp kiăng mơ̆ng boh pơhiăp anŭn, ih hăng abih mơnuih amăng sang ih či hmâo tơlơi pơklaih.’ 
And as I began to speak, the Holy Spirit fell upon them even as upon us also at the beginning. @ Tơ kâo čơdơ̆ng pơhiăp, Yang Bơngăt Hiam trŭn ƀơi ƀing gơñu hrup hăng Ñu hmâo trŭn ƀơi ƀing ta hlăk blŭng hlâo. 
And I remembered the word of the Lord, how he said, John baptised with water, but *ye* shall be baptised with [the] Holy Spirit. @ Tui anŭn kâo hơdơr boh pơhiăp Khua Yang hmâo laĭ: ‘Yôhan hmâo ngă ƀatem ƀing gih hăng ia, samơ̆ ƀing gih či tŭ ƀatem hăng Yang Bơngăt Hiam.’ 
If then God has given them the same gift as also to us when we had believed on the Lord Jesus Christ, who indeed was *I* to be able to forbid God? @ Tui anŭn, tơdah Ơi Adai ăt brơi laih kơ gơñu gơnam brơi kar hăng Ñu hmâo brơi laih kơ ƀing ta hlăk ƀing ta đaŏ kơ Khua Yang Yêsu Krist, hlơi kâo jing tơl kâo khĭn čơgăn hĭ Ơi Adai?” 
And when they heard these things they held their peace, and glorified God, saying, Then indeed God has to the nations also granted repentance to life. @ Tơ ƀing ƀuah kơ Pêtrôs hmâo hmư̆ tơlơi anŭn, gơñu dŏ rơiăt, laih anŭn pơpŭ bơni hơơč kơ Ơi Adai, hăng laĭ: “Tui anŭn Ơi Adai ăt brơi mơ̆n kơ ƀing djuai tuai tơlơi kơhmal kơ tơlơi soh kiăng hmâo tơlơi hơdip.”
They then who had been scattered abroad through the tribulation that took place on the occasion of Stephen, passed through [the country] to Phoenicia and Cyprus and Antioch, speaking the word to no one but to Jews alone. @  Hmâo đơđa ƀing đaŏ čơlah bra hyu yua kơ tơlơi arăng ngă sat, mơ̆ng tơlơi arăng pơdjai Êtiên anŭn, gơñu nao truh pơ čar Phênisi, ƀơi plao ia Čiprơ, laih anŭn pơ Antiôs, pơtô tơlơi Ơi Adai pơhiăp kơnơ̆ng kơ ƀing ană Yuđa đôč. 
But there were certain of them, Cyprians and Cyrenians, who entering into Antioch spoke to the Greeks also, announcing the glad tidings of the Lord Jesus. @ Samơ̆ hmâo đơđa amăng ƀing anŭn mơ̆ng plao ia Čiprơ laih anŭn Siren nao pơ Antiôs, gơñu ăt pơtô Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam kơ ƀing mơnuih Grek mơ̆n, Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam Khua Yang Yêsu. 
And [the] Lord's hand was with them, and a great number believed and turned to the Lord. @ Tơngan Khua Yang dŏ hrŏm hăng gơñu, laih anŭn hmâo lu mơnuih đaŏ kơ Khua Yang. 
And the report concerning them reached the ears of the assembly which was in Jerusalem, and they sent out Barnabas to go through as far as Antioch: @ Hmư̆ tơlơi pơthâo anŭn, Phung Sang Ơi Adai pơ plei Yêrusalem mơit nao Barnabas pơ Antiôs. 
who, having arrived and seeing the grace of God, rejoiced, and exhorted all with purpose of heart to abide with the Lord; @ Tơ ñu truh pơ anŭn ƀuh tơlơi pap Ơi Adai ñu mơak biă mă; ñu pơalum pơtrŭt abih bang gơñu brơi dŏ kơjăp, hăng abih pran jua đuaĭ tui Khua Yang. 
for he was a good man and full of [the] Holy Spirit and of faith; and a large crowd [of people] were added to the Lord. @ Yua kơ Barnabas jing mơnuih hiam klă, bă blai Yang Bơngăt Hiam, laih anŭn tơlơi đaŏ. Hmâo lu mơnuih đaŏ kơ Khua Yang. 
And he went away to Tarsus to seek out Saul. @ Giơ̆ng kơ anŭn Barnabas nao pơ plei Tars kiăng hơduah sem Sôl. 
And having found [him], he brought him to Antioch. And so it was with them that for a whole year they were gathered together in the assembly and taught a large crowd: and the disciples were first called Christians in Antioch. @ Tơ ñu ƀuh laih Sôl, ñu ba Sôl pơ Antiôs. Abih amăng sa thŭn gơñu jơnum hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Phung Sang Ơi Adai, laih anŭn pơhrăm lu mơnuih. Blŭng hlâo amăng plei Antiôs anai yơh arăng pơphŭn iâu ƀing ding kơna jing mơnuih Krist.
Now in these days prophets went down from Jerusalem to Antioch; @ Amăng khul hrơi anŭn hmâo ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo trŭn mơ̆ng plei Yêrusalem nao pơ plei Antiôs. 
and one from among them, by name Agabus, rose up and signified by the Spirit that there was going to be a great famine over all the inhabited earth, which also came to pass under Claudius. @ Sa čô amăng ƀing gơñu, anăn gơ̆ Agabus, mơ̆ng tơlơi dưi mơyang Yang Bơngăt Hiam brơi ñu laĭ pơthâo hlâo či hmâo tơlơi ư̆ rơpa prŏng tar ƀar lŏn tơnah. Tơlơi ư̆ rơpa anŭn truh sĭt amăng rơnŭk pơtao Klôd wai lăng. 
And they determined, according as any one of the disciples was well off, each of them to send to the brethren who dwelt in Judaea, to minister [to them]; @ Ƀing ding kơna khư̆p ư mơit mơnơ̆ng djru kơ ƀing adơi ayŏng dŏ amăng tring Yuđa, tui hăng rĭm čô pô ñu dưi. 
which also they did, sending it to the elders by the hand of Barnabas and Saul. @ Gơñu ngă bruă anŭn laih anŭn mơit mơnơ̆ng djru kơ ƀing kŏng tha mơ̆ng tơngan Barnabas hăng Sôl.
At that time Herod the king laid his hands on some of those of the assembly to do them hurt, @ Hlăk anŭn pơtao Hêrôt čơdơ̆ng ngă sat kơ đơđa mơnuih amăng Phung Sang Ơi Adai. 
and slew James, the brother of John, with the sword. @ Pơtao yua đao pơdjai hĭ Yakơ ayŏng Yôhan. 
And seeing that it was pleasing to the Jews, he went on to take Peter also: (and they were the days of unleavened bread:) @ Tơ ñu ƀuh tơlơi anŭn ngă mơak kơ ƀing Yuđa, kar kaĭ mơ̆n ñu brơi arăng mă čaŏ Pêtrôs dơ̆ng. Tơlơi anŭn truh hlăk phĕt Ƀañ Tơpŭng Ƀu Hmâo Tơpơi. 
whom having seized he put in prison, having delivered him to four quaternions of soldiers to keep, purposing after the passover to bring him out to the people. @ Tơ mă čaŏ laih Pêtrôs, ñu brơi krư̆ hĭ gơ̆ amăng sang mơnă, jao ñu kơ pă khul tơhan gak wai, rĭm khul hmâo pă čô tơhan. Ñu pơmĭn giơ̆ng kơ hrơi phĕt Tơlơi Găn ñu či ba gơ̆ ƀơi anăp ană plei pla. 
Peter therefore was kept in the prison; but unceasing prayer was made by the assembly to God concerning him. @ Tui anŭn arăng krư̆ hĭ Pêtrôs amăng sang mơnă, samơ̆ Phung Sang Ơi Adai dŏ iâu laĭ kơ Ơi Adai brơi kơ ñu hăng abih pran jua.
And when Herod was going to bring him forth, that night Peter was sleeping between two soldiers, bound with two chains, and guards before the door kept the prison. @ Mlam hlâo kơ hrơi pơtao Hêrôt kiăng ba gơ̆ pơ anăp ƀing ană plei pla, Pêtrôs dŏ pĭt ƀơi tơ̆ng krah dua čô tơhan, arăng akă hăng dua ară hrĕ čuăk; laih anŭn hmâo tơhan dŏ gak ƀơi anăp bah amăng sang mơnă. 
And lo, an angel of [the] Lord came there, and a light shone in the prison: and having smitten the side of Peter, he roused him up, saying, Rise up quickly. And his chains fell off his hands. @ Plŭt mơtam, sa čô ling jang Khua Yang rai, laih anŭn hmâo tơlơi bơngač pơčrang amăng sang mơnă. Ling jang taih ƀơi djeo Pêtrôs, râo ñu hăng laĭ: “Tơgŭ tañ bĕ!” Laih anŭn hrĕ čuăk tơgloh mơ̆ng tơngan ñu lĕ trŭn hĭ. 
And the angel said to him, Gird thyself, and bind on thy sandals. And he did so. And he says to him, Cast thine upper garment about thee and follow me. @ Ling jang laĭ kơ ñu: “Hrăng hơdrăng kơiăng bĕ hăng čŭt klĭ juă ih bĕ.” Pêtrôs ngă tui anŭn. Ling jang laĭ dơ̆ng: “Buh ao phyung ih bĕ hăng đuaĭ tui kâo.” 
And going forth he followed [him] and did not know that what was happening by means of the angel was real, but supposed he saw a vision. @ Pêtrôs tơbiă hăng đuaĭ tui ñu. Ñu ƀu thâo ôh tơlơi ling jang ngă anŭn jing sĭt, samơ̆ ñu mĭn dah ñu hmâo tơlơi pơƀuh đôč. 
And having passed through a first and second guard, they came to the iron gate which leads into the city, which opened to them of itself; and going forth they went down one street, and immediately the angel left him. @ Tơ gơñu găn laih ƀing tơhan gak wai tal blŭng laih anŭn tal dua, gơñu truh pơ amăng jang pơsơi ƀơi jơlan nao pơ plei prŏng. Amăng jang anŭn pŏk mă ñu pô ƀơi anăp gơñu. Dua gơñu tơbiă nao truh pơ jơlan glung; tañ mơtam ling jang lui hĭ Pêtrôs.
And Peter, being come to himself, said, Now I know certainly that [the] Lord has sent forth his angel and has taken me out of the hand of Herod and all the expectation of the people of the Jews. @ Amlư̆ Pêtrôs thâo hluh tơlơi truh kơ ñu, hăng laĭ: “Ră anai kâo thâo sĭt Khua Yang pơkiaŏ rai ling jang ñu pơklaih kâo mơ̆ng tơngan pơtao Hêrôt laih anŭn mơ̆ng abih tơlơi ƀing Yuđa dŏ čang rơmang.”
And having become clearly conscious [in himself], he came to the house of Mary, the mother of John who was surnamed Mark, where were many gathered together and praying. @ Giơ̆ng kơ ñu dŏ pơmĭn tơlơi anŭn, ñu nao pơ sang HʼMari amĭ Yôhan pơanăn dơ̆ng Markôs. Pơ anŭn hmâo lu mơnuih dŏ pơtŭm hơbĭt iâu laĭ. 
And when he had knocked at the door of the entry, a maid came to listen, by name Rhoda; @ Pêtrôs khŏk bah amăng jang, sa čô ding kơna đah kơmơi anăn ñu HʼRôda tơbiă nao lăng. 
and having recognised the voice of Peter, through joy did not open the entry, but running in, reported that Peter was standing before the entry. @ Gơ̆ thâo krăn asăp Pêtrôs, ñu hơ̆k mơak đơi tơl ñu ƀu pŏk bah amăng ôh, samơ̆ ñu mŭt glaĭ laĭ pơthâo kơ arăng Pêtrôs dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơi bah amăng jang. 
And they said to her, Thou art mad. But she maintained that it was so. And they said, It is his angel. @ Gơñu laĭ: “Ih hưt hă!” Samơ̆ gơ̆ khŭt khăt anŭn jing sĭt. Gơñu laĭ: “Anŭn năng ai ling jang ñu.” 
But Peter continued knocking: and having opened, they saw him and were astonished. @ Samơ̆ Pêtrôs ăt dŏ khŏk nanao bah amăng. Tơ gơñu pŏk hĭ bah amăng laih, ƀuh Pêtrôs gơñu hwĭ kơtuă hling biă mă. 
And having made a sign to them with his hand to be silent, he related [to them] how the Lord had brought him out of prison; and he said, Report these things to James and to the brethren. And he went out and went to another place. @ Samơ̆ Pêtrôs yơr tơngan ngă gru brơi gơñu dŏ rơiăt, giơ̆ng anŭn Pêtrôs ruai glaĭ kơ gơñu hyư̆m tơlơi Khua Yang hmâo pơklaih ñu mơ̆ng sang mơnă. Laih anŭn ñu laĭ: “Laĭ pơthâo bĕ tơlơi anai kơ Yakơ hăng abih bang ƀing adơi ayŏng.” Giơ̆ng anŭn ñu tơbiă nao pơ anih pơkŏn.
And when it was day there was no small disturbance among the soldiers, what then was become of Peter. @ Tơ truh mơguah, hmâo tơlơi rŭng răng prŏng tơ̆ng krah ƀing tơhan, yua kơ gơñu ƀu thâo ôh hơgĕt tơlơi hmâo truh laih kơ Pêtrôs. 
And Herod having sought him and not found him, having examined the guards, commanded [them] to be executed. And he went down from Judaea to Caesarea and stayed [there]. @ Pơtao Hêrôt pơtă mơnuih hyu sem, samơ̆ ƀu dưi ƀuh Pêtrôs ôh, ñu tơña kơsem kơ ƀing tơhan gak wai, giơ̆ng anŭn pơtă brơi arăng pơdjai hĭ ƀing gơñu. Laih anŭn pơtao Hêrôt lui tring Yuđa nao pơ plei Sêsarê hăng dŏ hĭ pơ anŭn.
And he was in bitter hostility with [the] Tyrians and Sidonians; but they came to him with one accord, and, having gained Blastus the king's chamberlain, sought peace, because their country was nourished by the king's. @ Pơtao Hêrôt hil kơ djuai mơnuih Tir hăng Sidôn; tui anŭn, gơñu sa pran jua nao bưp pơtao. Giơ̆ng gơñu alum pơđur bơmơak hăng Blastus khua wai lăng sang pơtao Hêrôt, gơñu nao rơkâo ngă rơnŭk rơnua, yua kơ čar gơñu hmâo gơnam ƀơ̆ng huă mơ̆ng čar ơi pơtao anŭn. 
And on a set day, clothed in royal apparel and sitting on the elevated seat [of honour], Herod made a public oration to them. @ Truh hrơi hmâo pơkơčah laih, pơtao Hêrôt buh sum ao pơtao, dŏ ber ƀơi gre pơtao, laih anŭn hmâo tơlơi pơhiăp pơtă hăng gơñu. 
And the people cried out, A god's voice and not a man's. @ Ƀing ană plei ur kraih hăng laĭ: “Anai jing asăp yang pơhiăp, ƀu djơ̆ asăp mơnuih ôh!” 
And immediately an angel of [the] Lord smote him, because he did not give the glory to God, and he expired, eaten of worms. @ Ƀơi mông anŭn mơtam sa čô ling jang Khua Yang taih pơtao Hêrôt, yua kơ ñu ƀu brơi tơlơi ang yang kơ Ơi Adai ôh, laih anŭn hlăt čeo ƀơ̆ng hĭ ñu tơl djai.
But the word of God grew and spread itself. @ Hlăk anŭn boh pơhiăp Ơi Adai arăng hmư̆ hyu tar ƀar ƀrư̆ hrơi jai lu biă mă.
And Barnabas and Saul returned from Jerusalem, having fulfilled the service [entrusted to them], taking also with them John, surnamed Mark. @ Giơ̆ng kơ Barnabas hăng Sôl ngă laih bruă hmâo jao kơ gơñu, gơñu mơ̆ng plei Yêrusalem, wơ̆t glaĭ pơ Antiôs, jak ba Yôhan pô arăng pơanăn Markôs.
Now there were in Antioch, in the assembly which was [there], prophets and teachers: Barnabas, and Simeon who was called Niger, and Lucius the Cyrenian, and Manaen, foster-brother of Herod the tetrarch, and Saul. @ Amăng Phung Sang Ơi Adai pơ Plei Antiôs hmâo ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo, ƀing nai pơtô: Barnabas, Simêôn, pơanăn Niger, Lusius mơnuih čar Siren, Manahen jing adơi rong pơtao Hêrôt, laih anŭn Sôl. 
And as they were ministering to the Lord and fasting, the Holy Spirit said, Separate me now Barnabas and Saul for the work to which I have called them. @ Tơdang gơñu dŏ kơkuh pơpŭ kơ Khua Yang hăng ư̆ ƀơ̆ng huă, Yang Bơngăt Hiam pơhiăp hăng gơñu; “Pioh brơi bĕ Barnabas hăng Sôl kơ bruă Kâo hmâo iâu gơñu.”
Then, having fasted and prayed, and having laid [their] hands on them, they let [them] go. @ Giơ̆ng kơ gơñu ư̆ ƀơ̆ng huă hăng iâu laĭ, gơñu ah tơngan ƀơi dua gơñu laih anŭn pơkiaŏ nao.
They therefore, having been sent forth by the Holy Spirit, went down to Seleucia, and thence sailed away to Cyprus. @ Hmâo Yang Bơngăt Hiam pơkiaŏ nao Barnabas hăng Sôl. Dua gơñu trŭn nao pơ plei Sêlusi mơ̆ng anŭn gơñu đĭ kompăn nao pơ plao ia Čiprơ. 
And being in Salamis, they announced the word of God in the synagogues of the Jews. And they had John also as [their] attendant. @ Tơ gơñu truh laih pơ plei Salamin, gơñu pơtô boh pơhiăp Ơi Adai amăng abih bang sang bơjơnum ƀing Yuđa; ăt hmâo mơ̆n Yôhan Markôs djru bruă gơñu.
And having passed through the whole island as far as Paphos, they found a certain man a magician, a false prophet, a Jew, whose name was Bar-jesus, @ Gơñu găn abih plao ia truh pơ plei Paphôs, gơñu bưp sa čô pơjâu, sa čô Yuđa jing pô laĭ lui hlâo ƀlor anăn ñu Bar Yêsu. 
who was with the proconsul Sergius Paulus, an intelligent man. *He*, having called Barnabas and Saul to [him], desired to hear the word of God. @ Ñu dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng khua čar anăn ñu Serjus Pôlus, sa čô mơnuih kơhnâo. Ñu brơi arăng iâu Barnabas hăng Sôl nao pơ ñu, yua kơ ñu kiăng hmư̆ boh pơhiăp Ơi Adai. 
But Elymas the magician (for so his name is by interpretation) opposed them, seeking to turn away the proconsul from the faith. @ Samơ̆ pô pơjâu anŭn, anăn ñu amăng tơlơi Grek jing Êlimas, pơkơdơ̆ng hăng dua gơñu, hơduah lu jơlan khă čơgăn khua čar anŭn đaŏ. 
But Saul, who also [is] Paul, filled with [the] Holy Spirit, fixing his eyes upon him, @ Hlăk anŭn Sôl, arăng pơanăn dơ̆ng Pôl, bă blai Yang Bơngăt Hiam, lăng klă pơñen pơ pô pơjâu anŭn hăng laĭ, 
said, O full of all deceit and all craft: son of [the] devil, enemy of all righteousness; wilt thou not cease perverting the right paths of [the] Lord? @ “Ơ ană yang sat, pô ayăt hăng abih tơlơi tơpă, bă hăng tơlơi plư, tơlơi sat ƀai, ih tŭt kơ ngă pơrăm jơlan tơpă Khua Yang ƀu thâo lui amơĭ hă? 
And now behold, [the] Lord's hand [is] upon thee, and thou shalt be blind, not seeing the sun for a season. And immediately there fell upon him a mist and darkness; and going about he sought persons who should lead him by the hand. @ Lăng bĕ ră anai mơtam, tơngan Khua Yang ngă kơ ih, laih anŭn ih či bum mơta ƀu ƀuh tơlơi bơngač ôh amăng ƀiă hrơi.” Tañ mơtam tơlơi bum mơmŏt tĭt truh kơ Êlimas, laih anŭn ñu wir wư hyu hơduah mơnuih djă tơngan dui ba ñu. 
Then the proconsul, seeing what had happened, believed, being amazed at the teaching of the Lord. @ Khua čar ƀuh tơlơi truh anŭn ñu đaŏ mơtam yua kơ ñu hling hlang biă mă kơ tơlơi pơtô djơ̆ kơ Khua Yang.
And having sailed from Paphos, Paul and his company came to Perga of Pamphylia; and John separated from them and returned to Jerusalem. @ Pôl laih anŭn ƀing gơyut hrŏm hơbĭt hăng gơñu đĭ kompăn mơ̆ng Paphôs, nao truh pơ Pergi amăng čar Pamphili. Yôhan Markôs lui hĭ gơñu hăng glaĭ pơ plei Yêrusalem. 
But they, passing through from Perga, came to Antioch of Pisidia; and entering into the synagogue on the sabbath day they sat down. @ Bơ gơñu, mơ̆ng Pergi nao pơ Antiôs čar Pisidi. Truh hrơi Saƀat gơñu mŭt dŏ ber amăng sang bơjơnum. 
And after the reading of the law and the prophets, the rulers of the synagogue sent to them, saying, Brethren, if ye have any word of exhortation to the people, speak. @ Giơ̆ng kơ arăng đŏk hơdrôm hră tơlơi juăt, hră ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo, ƀing khua wai sang bơjơnum pơtă mơnuih nao laĭ hăng gơñu: “Ơ adơi ayŏng, tơdah ƀing gih hmâo tơlơi hơgĕt pơtô kiăng pơđĭ pran jua kơ ƀing ană plei, pơhiăp bĕ.” 
And Paul, rising up and making a sign with the hand, said, Israelites, and ye that fear God, hearken. @ Tui anŭn Pôl tơgŭ dơ̆ng yơr tơngan ngă gru, hăng laĭ: “Ơ ƀing ană plei pla Israel hăng ƀing djuai tuai hwĭ pơpŭ kơ Ơi Adai, brơi hmư̆ bĕ: 
The God of this people Israel chose our fathers, and exalted the people in their sojourn in [the] land of Egypt, and with a high arm brought them out of it, @ Ơi Adai kơ ƀing ană Israel hmâo ruah laih ơi adon ƀing ta, ngă brơi gơñu lar kơ prŏng hlăk gơñu dŏ amăng čar Êjip. Ñu yua tơngan dưi mơyang Ñu, ba tơbiă ƀing gơ̆ mơ̆ng čar anŭn. 
and for a time of about forty years he nursed them in the desert. @ Amăng pă pluh thŭn Ñu gir añ hăng gơñu amăng tơdrŏn har. 
And having destroyed seven nations in the land of Canaan, he gave them their land as an inheritance. @ Giơ̆ng kơ Ñu pơrai hĭ tơjuh djuai mơnuih amăng čar Kanaan, Ñu jao čar ƀing anŭn jing kong ngăn kơ ƀing Israel. 
And after these things he gave [them] judges till Samuel the prophet, [to the end of] about four hundred and fifty years. @ Abih tơlơi anai truh jĕ kơ pă rơtuh rơma pluh thŭn. Tơdơi kơ anŭn, Ñu brơi kơ ƀing gơñu hmâo khua phat kơđi hlŏng truh pơ rơnŭk pô laĭ lui hlâo Samuel.
