but he [is] a Jew [who is so] inwardly; and circumcision, of the heart, in spirit, not in letter; whose praise [is] not of men, but of God. @ Samơ̆ arăng jing sa čô Yuđa sĭt tui hăng jing amăng lăm, laih anŭn tơlơi khăt klĭ sĭt arăng ngă amăng pran jua, amăng Yang Bơngăt Hiam, ƀu djơ̆ ƀơi drơi jan ôh. Sa čô Yuđa kar hăng anŭn či hmâo tơlơi bơni mơ̆ng Ơi Adai ƀu djơ̆ mơ̆ng mơnuih ôh.
What then [is] the superiority of the Jew? or what the profit of circumcision? @ Tui anŭn hơgĕt tơlơi hiam hloh ƀing Ană Yuđa hmâo? Ƀôdah hơgĕt yom kơ tơlơi khăt klĭ? 
Much every way: and first, indeed, that to them were entrusted the oracles of God. @ Sĭt yơh hmâo tơlơi yom djŏp mơta. Blŭng hlâo, Ơi Adai hmâo jao brơi boh pơhiăp Ñu kơ ƀing Yuđa. 
For what? if some have not believed, shall their unbelief make the faith of God of none effect? @ Samơ̆ hơgĕt tơlơi či truh tơdah hmâo đơđa mơnuih amăng ƀing gơñu ƀu tŏng ten ôh? Tơlơi gơñu ƀu tŏng ten dưi pơrai hĭ tơlơi hơnơ̆ng ten Ơi Adai mơ̆? 
Far be the thought: but let God be true, and every man false; according as it is written, So that thou shouldest be justified in thy words, and shouldest overcome when thou art in judgment. @ Ƀu djơ̆ tui anŭn ôh! Ơi Adai jing sĭt, wơ̆t dah abih bang mơnuih leng kơ ƀlor, tui hăng Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp hmâo čih laih:
“Kiăng kơ arăng dưi yap Ih jing tơpă amăng tơlơi Ih pơhiăp,
laih anŭn Ih khŏm dưi hĭ tơ arăng phat kơđi Ih.”
But if our unrighteousness commend God's righteousness, what shall we say? Is God unrighteous who inflicts wrath? I speak according to man. @ Samơ̆ tơdah tơlơi ƀu tơpă ƀing ta bơrơđah tơlơi tơpă Ơi Adai, hơgĕt ƀing ta či laĭ? Djơ̆ mơ̆ Ơi Adai ƀu tơpă ôh tơ Ñu pơkơhmal ƀing ta? (Kâo pơhiăp tui hăng ană mơnuih juăt pơhiăp.) 
Far be the thought: since how shall God judge the world? @ Ƀu djơ̆ tui anŭn ôh! Yua kơ tơdah tui anŭn, hyư̆m Ơi Adai dưi phat kơđi kơ lŏn tơnah lĕ? 
For if the truth of God, in my lie, has more abounded to his glory, why yet am *I* also judged as a sinner? @ Samơ̆ tơdah mơ̆ng tơlơi kâo ƀlor dưi ngă brơi tơlơi sĭt Ơi Adai jai thim tơlơi guh kơang hloh dơ̆ng, tui anŭn yua hơgĕt arăng ăt klă kơđi kơ kâo kar hăng sa čô mơnuih soh lĕ? 
and not, according as we are injuriously charged, and according as some affirm that we say, Let us practise evil things, that good ones may come? whose judgment is just. @ Tui anŭn yua hơgĕt ƀing ta ƀu “ngă tơlơi sat kiăng hmâo tơlơi hiam”? — kar hăng đơđa mơnuih hmâo pơčeh ƀing gơmơi pơtô tơlơi anŭn. — Gơñu tŭ tơlơi pơkơhmal jing năng lăp biă mă.
What then? are we better? No, in no wise: for we have before charged both Jews and Greeks with being all under sin: @ Tui anŭn hyư̆m ngă? Ƀing ană Yuđa ta jing hiam hloh kơ ƀing tuai mơ̆? Ư ưh, ƀu hmâo ôh! Yua kơ kâo bơrơđah sĭt laih kơ abih bang mơnuih, ƀing Yuđa wơ̆t ƀing Grek, leng kơ dŏ gah yŭ kơ tơlơi dưi kơtang tơlơi soh, 
according as it is written, There is not a righteous [man], not even one; @ kar hăng Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp hmâo čih laih:
“Ƀu hmâo hlơi tơpă ôh,
Wơ̆t dah sa čô ăt kŏn hmâo lơi,
there is not the [man] that understands, there is not one that seeks after God. @ Ƀu hmâo sa čô mơnuih thâo hluh ôh,
Ƀu hmâo sa čô mơnuih hơduah sem Ơi Adai ôh.
All have gone out of the way, they have together become unprofitable; there is not one that practises goodness, there is not so much as one: @ Abih bang leng kơ jrok jơlan, laih anŭn gơñu soh laih soh sel;
Ƀu hmâo hlơi ngă tơlơi hiam ôh,
Wơ̆t dah sa čô ăt kŏn hmâo lơi.”
their throat is an open sepulchre; with their tongues they have used deceit; asps' poison [is] under their lips: @  “Rơkong đŏk gơñu kar hăng pơsat arăng pŏk lui;
Gơñu yua jơlah gơñu kiăng plư arăng.”
“Ia bih ala tơpơ̆ng dŏ gah yŭ tơƀong gơñu.”
whose mouth is full of cursing and bitterness; @ “Amăng bah gơñu bă hăng tơlơi hơtơ̆m pah laih anŭn tơlơi phĭ.”
swift their feet to shed blood; @ Tơkai gơñu hơmăr kiăng ngă tuh drah;
ruin and misery [are] in their ways, @ Ƀơi jơlan gơñu hmâo tơlơi pơrai laih anŭn tơlơi tơnap,
and way of peace they have not known: @  Gơñu ƀu thâo ôh jơlan tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua.
there is no fear of God before their eyes. @ “Gơñu ƀu hwĭ pơpŭ kơ Ơi Adai ôh.”
Now we know that whatever the things the law says, it speaks to those under the law, that every mouth may be stopped, and all the world be under judgment to God. @ Ƀing ta thâo hơgĕt khul tơlơi juăt hmâo pơhiăp, ñu laĭ kơ ƀing dŏ gah yŭ tơlơi juăt, kiăng kơ abih bang amăng bah khŏm dŏ rơiăt, laih anŭn abih bang mơnuih dŏ ƀơi lŏn tơnah leng kơ dŏ gah yŭ kơ tơlơi Ơi Adai phat kơđi. 
Wherefore by works of law no flesh shall be justified before him; for by law [is] knowledge of sin. @ Yua kơ ƀơi anăp Ơi Adai ƀu hmâo ôh sa čô mơnuih dưi hmâo tơlơi yap tơpă yua mơ̆ng bruă ngă tui tơlơi juăt, yua mơ̆ng tơlơi juăt yơh arăng thâo krăn tơlơi soh.
But now without law righteousness of God is manifested, borne witness to by the law and the prophets; @ Samơ̆ ră anai tơlơi tơpă Ơi Adai hmâo bơrơđah laih gah rơngiao tơlơi juăt; tơlơi anai, tơlơi juăt wơ̆t hăng ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo hmâo pơhaih pơsĭt brơi laih. 
righteousness of God by faith of Jesus Christ towards all, and upon all those who believe: for there is no difference; @ Jing tơlơi tơpă Ơi Adai, mơ̆ng tơlơi đaŏ kơ Yêsu Krist, pha brơi kơ abih bang hlơi pô đaŏ. Yua kơ ƀu hmâo pơkah mơnuih phara phara ôh. 
for all have sinned, and come short of the glory of God; @ Yua kơ abih bang mơnuih leng kơ ngă soh laih, kơƀah hĭ tơlơi ư-ang Ơi Adai, 
being justified freely by his grace through the redemption which [is] in Christ Jesus; @ laih anŭn gơñu hmâo tơlơi dưi yap tơpă yua mơ̆ng tơlơi pap Ơi Adai brơi đôč đač kơ gơñu, yua mơ̆ng tơlơi song mă amăng Krist Yêsu hmâo pơkra laih. 
whom God has set forth a mercy-seat, through faith in his blood, for [the] shewing forth of his righteousness, in respect of the passing by the sins that had taken place before, through the forbearance of God; @ Ơi Adai ruah laih Yêsu Krist brơi Ñu jing mơnơ̆ng ngă yang song mă tơlơi soh hăng drah Ñu, brơi kơ hlơi pô mă tŭ hăng tơlơi đaŏ. Tơlơi anai kiăng bơrơđah tơlơi tơpă Ơi Adai, yua kơ hăng tơlơi gir añ, Ñu lui hĭ ƀu hmâo pơkơhmal ôh tơlơi soh arăng ngă hlâo kơ anŭn. 
for [the] shewing forth of his righteousness in the present time, so that he should be just, and justify him that is of [the] faith of Jesus. @ Amăng rơnŭk anai, Ñu ăt bơrơđah Ñu pô jing tơlơi tơpă laih anŭn yap tơpă kơ hlơi pô đaŏ kơ Yêsu.
Where then [is] boasting? It has been excluded. By what law? of works? Nay, but by law of faith; @ Tui anŭn hmâo hơgĕt dưi pơang pô mơ̆? Ƀu dưi ôh! Hăng tơlơi juăt hơgĕt? Hăng tơlơi juăt bruă ngă mơ̆? Ƀu djơ̆ ôh, samơ̆ yua kơ tơlơi ƀing ta đaŏ. 
for we reckon that a man is justified by faith, without works of law. @ Yua kơ ƀing ta đaŏ, sa čô mơnuih dưi hmâo tơlơi yap tơpă hăng tơlơi đaŏ, ƀu djơ̆ hăng bruă tơlơi juăt ôh. 
Is [God] the God of Jews only? is he not of [the] nations also? Yea, of nations also: @ Ƀôdah djơ̆ mơ̆ Ơi Adai jing Ơi Adai kơnơ̆ng kơ ƀing Yuđa đôč? Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă Ñu ăt jing Ơi Adai wơ̆t kơ ƀing djuai tuai mơ̆n? Sĭt yơh, Ñu jing Ơi Adai wơ̆t kơ ƀing djuai tuai mơ̆n, 
since indeed [it is] one God who shall justify [the] circumcision on the principle of faith, and uncircumcision by faith. @ Yua kơ Ơi Adai jing hasa đôč. Ñu či yap tơpă kơ ƀing khăt klĭ hăng tơlơi đaŏ laih anŭn ƀing ƀu khăt klĭ ăt hăng tơlơi đaŏ anŭn mơ̆n. 
Do we then make void law by faith? Far be the thought: [no,] but we establish law. @ Tui anŭn hăng tơlơi đaŏ ƀing ta lơ̆m lui hĭ tơlơi juăt mơ̆? Ư ưh, ƀu djơ̆ ôh! Samơ̆ kơđai glaĭ, ƀing ta ngă pơkơjăp tơlơi juăt.
What shall we say then that Abraham our father according to flesh has found? @ Tui anŭn, hơgĕt ƀing ta či laĭ djơ̆ kơ Abraham ơi adon ƀing ta gah kơ asar đeh, hơgĕt ñu hmâo mă tŭ? 
For if Abraham has been justified on the principle of works, he has whereof to boast: but not before God; @ Tơdah Abraham hmâo tơlơi yap tơpă mơ̆ng bruă ñu ngă, ñu hmâo tơlơi dưi pơang ñu pô. Samơ̆ ñu ƀu dưi ôh pơang ñu pô ƀơi anăp Ơi Adai. 
for what does the scripture say? And Abraham believed God, and it was reckoned to him as righteousness. @ Yua kơ hơgĕt Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp laĭ? “Abraham đaŏ kơ Ơi Adai, laih anŭn yua mơ̆ng tơlơi đaŏ anŭn yơh Ơi Adai hmâo yap ñu tơpă.” 
Now to him that works the reward is not reckoned as of grace, but of debt: @ Kơ mơnuih mă bruă, prăk apah ñu ƀu djơ̆ jing tơlơi pha brơi ôh, samơ̆ yap kar hăng hơnưh. 
but to him who does not work, but believes on him who justifies the ungodly, his faith is reckoned as righteousness. @ Bơ kơ hlơi pô ƀu mă bruă ôh, samơ̆ đaŏ kơ Pô yap tơpă brơi kơ mơnuih soh, tơlơi đaŏ mơnuih anŭn hmâo yap jing tơpă. 
Even as David also declares the blessedness of the man to whom God reckons righteousness without works: @ Kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n, Đawit pơhiăp tơlơi mơyun hiam kơ mơnuih Ơi Adai yap tơpă ƀu djơ̆ yua mơ̆ng bruă ngă ôh:
Blessed [they] whose lawlessnesses have been forgiven, and whose sins have been covered: @ “Mơyun hiam yơh kơ hlơi pô Ơi Adai pap brơi laih tơlơi ngă gao ñu,
Tơlơi soh ñu Ơi Adai hmâo lơ̆m lui hĭ laih.
blessed [the] man to whom [the] Lord shall not at all reckon sin. @ Mơyun hiam yơh kơ mơnuih Khua Yang ƀu yap ôh tơlơi soh ñu.”
[Does] this blessedness then [rest] on the circumcision, or also on the uncircumcision? For we say that faith has been reckoned to Abraham as righteousness. @ Djơ̆ mơ̆ tơlơi mơyun hiam anŭn kơnơ̆ng kơ ƀing khăt klĭ đôč, ƀôdah wơ̆t kơ ƀing ƀu khăt klĭ? Ƀing ta laĭ yua mơ̆ng tơlơi đaŏ Abraham Ơi Adai yap ñu jing tơpă. 
How then has it been reckoned? when he was in circumcision, or in uncircumcision? Not in circumcision, but in uncircumcision. @ Tui anŭn hơbin Ơi Adai hmâo yap tơlơi anŭn kơ ñu? Hlâo kơ ñu khăt klĭ ƀôdah tơdơi kơ ñu khăt klĭ? Ƀu djơ̆ tơdơi ôh samơ̆ hlâo kơ ñu khăt klĭ yơh. 
And he received [the] sign of circumcision [as] seal of the righteousness of faith which [he had] being in uncircumcision, that he might be [the] father of all them that believe being in uncircumcision, that righteousness might be reckoned to them also; @ Ñu hmâo mă tŭ laih tơlơi khăt klĭ jing gru kơnăl kar hăng mơnơ̆ng kơđŏm tơlơi tơpă ñu hmâo laih mơ̆ng tơlơi đaŏ hlăk ñu aka khăt klĭ ôh. Tui anŭn, Abraham jing hĭ ama gah bơngăt kơ abih bang ƀing mơnuih đaŏ samơ̆ ƀu khăt klĭ ôh, laih anŭn gơñu ăt hmâo tơlơi yap tơpă mơ̆n. 
and father of circumcision, not only to those who are of [the] circumcision, but to those also who walk in the steps of the faith, during uncircumcision, of our father Abraham. @ Laih anŭn ñu ăt jing ama kơ ƀing khăt klĭ mơ̆n, jing ƀing ƀu djơ̆ kơnơ̆ng khăt klĭ đôč ôh, samơ̆ gơñu hơdip kar hăng tơlơi đaŏ Abraham, ơi adon ƀing ta hmâo hơdip laih hlâo kơ ñu khăt klĭ.
For [it was] not by law that the promise was to Abraham, or to his seed, that he should be heir of [the] world, but by righteousness of faith. @  Tơlơi Ơi Adai ƀuăn kơ Abraham hăng kơ ƀing ană tơčo ñu, brơi ñu mă tŭ lŏn tơnah jing kong ngăn, ƀu djơ̆ yua mơ̆ng tơlơi ñu gưt tơlơi juăt ôh, samơ̆ yua kơ tơlơi tơpă mơ̆ng tơlơi ñu đaŏ. 
For if they which [are] of law be heirs, faith is made vain, and the promise made of no effect. @ Yua kơ tơdah mơ̆ng tơlơi gưt kơ tơlơi juăt kah arăng dưi mă tŭ kong ngăn, tui anŭn tơlơi đaŏ jing hĭ đôč đač laih anŭn tơlơi ƀuăn jing ƀu tŭ yua ôh. 
For law works wrath; but where no law is neither [is there] transgression. @ Yua kơ tơlơi juăt ba rai tơlơi hil, samơ̆ pơpă anih ƀu hmâo tơlơi juăt, pơ anŭn ăt ƀu hmâo tơlơi gao tơlơi juăt ôh.
Therefore [it is] on the principle of faith, that [it might be] according to grace, in order to the promise being sure to all the seed, not to that only which [is] of the law, but to that also which [is] of Abraham's faith, who is father of us all, @ Yua kơ anŭn, mơ̆ng tơlơi đaŏ yơh tơlơi ƀuăn tơbiă mơ̆ng tơlơi pap či dưi truh sĭt kơ abih bang ană tơčo Abraham, ƀu djơ̆ kơnơ̆ng kơ ană tơčo gah yŭ kơ tơlơi juăt đôč ôh, samơ̆ wơ̆t kơ abih bang ană tơčo gah kơ tơlơi đaŏ Abraham. Yua kơ ñu ăt jing ơi adon kơ abih bang ƀing ta mơ̆n. 
(according as it is written, I have made thee father of many nations,) before the God whom he believed, who quickens the dead, and calls the things which be not as being; @ Kar hăng hră Ơi Adai hmâo čih laih: “Kâo hmâo pơjing ih jing ama kơ lu djuai mơnuih.” Tui anŭn tơlơi ƀuăn anŭn ăt dŏ tŭ yua ƀơi anăp Ơi Adai, Pô ñu đaŏ, jing Pô brơi tơlơi hơdip kơ ƀing djai, laih anŭn pơjing mơnơ̆ng mơ̆ng mơnơ̆ng aka hmâo hlâo ôh. 
who against hope believed in hope to his becoming father of many nations, according to that which was spoken, So shall thy seed be: @ Abraham hmâo đaŏ laih anŭn čang rơmang wơ̆t dah ƀu hmâo tơlơi čang rơmang dơ̆ng tah, kiăng kơ ñu dưi jing ama kơ lu djuai mơnuih, kar hăng Ơi Adai hmâo pơhiăp laih kơ ñu: “Ƀing ană tơčo ih či jing kar hăng anŭn yơh.” 
and not being weak in faith, he considered not his own body already become dead, being about a hundred years old, and the deadening of Sarah's womb, @ Ñu ƀuh drơi jan ñu jĕ či djai yua kơ ñu giăm hmâo sa rơtuh thŭn laih, laih anŭn ƀuh HʼSara ƀu dưi tơkeng dơ̆ng ôh, samơ̆ tơlơi đaŏ ñu ƀu tơdu ôh. 
and hesitated not at the promise of God through unbelief; but found strength in faith, giving glory to God; @ Ñu ƀu đing ôh kơ tơlơi Ơi Adai ƀuăn, samơ̆ jing kơtang hloh dơ̆ng amăng tơlơi đaŏ laih anŭn pơpŭ bơni hơơč kơ Ơi Adai. 
and being fully persuaded that what he has promised he is able also to do; @ Yua kơ ñu đaŏ hăng abih pran jua Ơi Adai dưi ngă pơgiơ̆ng hơgĕt tơlơi Ñu hmâo ƀuăn laih. 
wherefore also it was reckoned to him as righteousness. @ Yua kơ anŭn yơh Ơi Adai yap tơlơi ñu đaŏ jing tơlơi tơpă kơ ñu. 
Now it was not written on his account alone that it was reckoned to him, @ Samơ̆ boh pơhiăp “Ơi Adai yap tơlơi tơpă kơ ñu” arăng ƀu kơnơ̆ng čih kơ hơjăn ñu đôč ôh, 
but on ours also, to whom, believing on him who has raised from among [the] dead Jesus our Lord, @ samơ̆ wơ̆t kơ ƀing ta kar kaĭ mơ̆n. Ƀing ta hmâo yap tơpă yua mơ̆ng tơlơi đaŏ, jing ƀing mơnuih đaŏ kơ Pô hmâo pơhơdip glaĭ Yêsu, Khua Yang ƀing ta hơdip glaĭ mơ̆ng tơlơi djai. 
who has been delivered for our offences and has been raised for our justification, it will be reckoned. @ Arăng hmâo pơdjai laih Ñu yua kơ tơlơi soh ƀing ta laih anŭn Ơi Adai hmâo pơhơdip glaĭ Ñu kiăng kơ ƀing ta dưi hmâo tơlơi yap tơpă.
Therefore having been justified on the principle of faith, we have peace towards God through our Lord Jesus Christ; @ Tui anŭn yua kơ ƀing ta hmâo laih tơlơi yap tơpă mơ̆ng tơlơi đaŏ, ƀing ta hmâo tơlơi rơnom glaĭ hăng Ơi Adai amăng Yêsu Krist Khua Yang ƀing ta. 
by whom we have also access by faith into this favour in which we stand, and we boast in hope of the glory of God. @ Amăng Ñu ƀing ta hmâo laih tơlơi dưi mŭt dŏ amăng tơlơi pap anai yua mơ̆ng tơlơi đaŏ, mơ̆ng tơlơi pap anŭn yơh ƀing ta dưi dŏ kơjăp ră anai, laih anŭn hơ̆k mơak amăng tơlơi čang rơmang či hmâo tơlơi ang yang hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Ơi Adai. 
And not only [that], but we also boast in tribulations, knowing that tribulation works endurance; @ Ƀu djơ̆ kơnơ̆ng hơdôm anŭn đôč ôh, ƀing ta ăt hơ̆k mơak mơ̆n tơdang ƀing ta tŭ tơlơi tơnap, yua kơ ƀing ta thâo tơlơi tơnap tap anŭn pơjing kơ tơlơi thâo gir; 
and endurance, experience; and experience, hope; @ tơlơi gir pơjing tơlơi dưi amăng tơlơi lông lăng; laih anŭn tơlơi dưi amăng tơlơi lông lăng pơjing tơlơi čang rơmang; 
and hope does not make ashamed, because the love of God is shed abroad in our hearts by [the] Holy Spirit which has been given to us: @ laih anŭn tơlơi čang rơmang ƀu ngă brơi ƀing ta hơtah hơtai ôh, yua kơ tơlơi khăp Ơi Adai hmâo tuh bă blai amăng pran jua ƀing ta mơ̆ng Yang Bơngăt Hiam pô Ơi Adai hmâo pha brơi laih kơ ƀing ta.
for we being still without strength, in [the] due time Christ has died for [the] ungodly. @ Tơdang ƀing ta ăt dŏ tơdu đŭt ai, Krist hmâo djai laih yua kơ ƀing mơnuih soh djơ̆ mông Ơi Adai hmâo pơkă laih. 
For scarcely for [the] just [man] will one die, for perhaps for [the] good [man] some one might also dare to die; @ Tơnap biă mă hmâo sa čô mơnuih djai pơala kơ sa čô mơnuih tơpă, năng ai hmâo mơ̆n mơnuih khĭn djai pơala kơ sa čô mơnuih hiam. 
but God commends *his* love to us, in that, we being still sinners, Christ has died for us. @ Samơ̆ Ơi Adai pơrơđah tơlơi Ñu khăp kơ ƀing ta, tơdang ƀing ta ăt dŏ jing mơnuih soh, Krist hmâo djai hrua kơ ƀing ta laih. 
Much rather therefore, having been now justified in [the power of] his blood, we shall be saved by him from wrath. @ Hloh kơ anŭn dơ̆ng, ƀing ta hmâo tơlơi yap tơpă laih hăng drah Ñu laih anŭn yua kơ Ñu mơ̆n ƀing ta či klaih mơ̆ng tơlơi Ơi Adai hil. 
For if, being enemies, we have been reconciled to God through the death of his Son, much rather, having been reconciled, we shall be saved in [the power of] his life. @ Yua kơ tơdah hlăk ƀing ta ăt jing ayăt hăng Ơi Adai, tơlơi djai Ană Ơi Adai hmâo ngă rơnom glaĭ laih ƀing ta hăng Ñu, hloh kơ anŭn dơ̆ng, giơ̆ng kơ rơnom glaĭ laih, ƀing ta či hmâo tơlơi pơklaih yua mơ̆ng tơlơi hơdip Ñu. 
And not only [that], but [we are] making our boast in God, through our Lord Jesus Christ, through whom now we have received the reconciliation. @ Ƀu djơ̆ hơdôm anŭn đôč ôh, samơ̆ ƀing ta ăt hơ̆k mơak amăng Ơi Adai yua mơ̆ng Khua Yang ƀing ta Yêsu Krist. Mơ̆ng Ñu yơh ră anai ƀing ta hmâo laih tơlơi rơnom glaĭ hăng Ơi Adai.
For this [cause], even as by one man sin entered into the world, and by sin death; and thus death passed upon all men, for that all have sinned: @  Hnŭn yơh, kar hăng tơlơi soh hmâo mŭt laih amăng lŏn tơnah yua mơ̆ng sa čô mơnuih, laih anŭn mơ̆ng tơlơi soh tơbiă rai tơlơi djai. Tui anŭn mơ̆n tơlơi djai hmâo pơƀă hyu laih kơ abih bang mơnuih, yua kơ abih bang mơnuih leng kơ hmâo ngă soh laih. 
(for until law sin was in [the] world; but sin is not put to account when there is no law; @ Sĭt yơh tơlơi soh hmâo laih amăng lŏn tơnah hlâo kơ Ơi Adai brơi tơlơi juăt, samơ̆ tơdang tơlơi juăt aka hmâo arăng ƀu yap tơlơi soh ôh. 
but death reigned from Adam until Moses, even upon those who had not sinned in the likeness of Adam's transgression, who is [the] figure of him to come. @ Wơ̆t dah tơlơi djai hmâo wai lăng čơdơ̆ng mơ̆ng rơnŭk Ađam truh pơ rơnŭk Môis, wơ̆t kơ ƀing ƀu ngă soh ôh kar hăng mơta tơlơi soh Ađam. Ađam jing rup pơhmô kơ Pô khŏm rai.
But [shall] not the act of favour [be] as the offence? For if by the offence of one the many have died, much rather has the grace of God, and the free gift in grace, which [is] by the one man Jesus Christ, abounded unto the many. @ Samơ̆ tơlơi pha brơi đôč ƀu jing kar hăng tơlơi soh Ađam ôh. Yua kơ tơdah lu mơnuih djai laih yua mơ̆ng tơlơi soh sa čô mơnuih, hloh kơ anŭn dơ̆ng tơlơi Ơi Adai pap laih anŭn tơlơi pha brơi đôč hăng tơlơi pap mơ̆ng sa čô, Yêsu Krist, či truh rơbeh blai kơ lu mơnuih. 
And [shall] not as by one that has sinned [be] the gift? For the judgment [was] of one to condemnation, but the act of favour, of many offences unto justification. @ Laih anŭn tơlơi pha brơi đôč ƀu djơ̆ kar hăng boh than mơ̆ng sa čô mơnuih soh ôh. Yua kơ tơlơi phat kơđi yua mơ̆ng sa mơta tơlơi soh ba truh kơ tơlơi klă kơđi; samơ̆ tơlơi pha brơi mơ̆ng adai anŭn ba truh tơlơi yap tơpă tơdơi kơ arăng ngă tơlơi soh lu laih. 
For if by the offence of the one death reigned by the one, much rather shall those who receive the abundance of grace, and of the free gift of righteousness, reign in life by the one Jesus Christ:) @ Tơdah yua kơ tơlơi soh mơ̆ng sa čô mơnuih đôč, tơlơi djai hmâo wai lăng laih abih bang yua kơ mơ̆ng sa čô mơnuih anŭn, ăt kar kaĭ mơ̆n yua kơ mơ̆ng sa čô Mơnuih jing Yêsu Krist brơi kơ ƀing hlơi mă tŭ tơlơi pap laih anŭn tơlơi pha brơi đôč tơlơi yap tơpă rơbeh blai, či wai lăng amăng tơlơi hơdip kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n.
so then as [it was] by one offence towards all men to condemnation, so by one righteousness towards all men for justification of life. @ Tui anŭn, kar hăng mơ̆ng tơlơi sa čô mơnuih ngă soh ba truh tơlơi klă kơđi kơ abih bang mơnuih, ăt kar kaĭ mơ̆n mơ̆ng sa mơta bruă tơpă sa čô mơnuih ngă ba truh tơlơi yap tơpă laih anŭn tơlơi hơdip kơ abih bang mơnuih. 
For as indeed by the disobedience of the one man the many have been constituted sinners, so also by the obedience of the one the many will be constituted righteous. @ Yua kơ kar hăng mơ̆ng tơlơi sa čô mơnuih ƀu gưt hiăp, abih bang mơnuih jing hĭ mơnuih soh; ăt kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n, yua mơ̆ng tơlơi sa čô mơnuih gưt hiăp, lu mơnuih či jing hĭ tơpă hơnơ̆ng.
But law came in, in order that the offence might abound; but where sin abounded grace has overabounded, @ Tơlơi juăt hmâo rai laih ngă brơi tơlơi soh jing lu hloh; samơ̆ pơpă anih tơlơi soh lu jai, tơlơi pap jai rơbeh blai hloh dơ̆ng. 
in order that, even as sin has reigned in [the power of] death, so also grace might reign through righteousness to eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord. @ Tui anŭn kar hăng tơlơi soh gĭt gai hăng tơlơi djai, ăt kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n tơlơi pap dưi wai lăng hăng tơlơi tơpă laih anŭn ba ƀing ta truh kơ tơlơi hơdip hlŏng lar amăng Yêsu Krist Khua Yang ƀing ta.
What then shall we say? Should we continue in sin that grace may abound? @ Tui anŭn hơgĕt ƀing ta či laĭ lĕ? Djơ̆ mơ̆ ƀing ta ăt dŏ ngă soh dơ̆ng kiăng dưi hmâo tơlơi pap lu jai? 
Far be the thought. We who have died to sin, how shall we still live in it? @ Ư ưh, ƀu djơ̆ ôh! Ƀing ta hmâo djai laih kơ tơlơi soh hyư̆m ƀing ta dưi dŏ hơdip amăng tơlơi soh dơ̆ng lĕ? 
Are you ignorant that we, as many as have been baptised unto Christ Jesus, have been baptised unto his death? @ Ƀing gih ƀu thâo ôh hă kơ abih bang ƀing ta hmâo tŭ laih ƀatem amăng Yêsu Krist, jing tơlơi ƀing ta hmâo tŭ laih ƀatem amăng tơlơi djai Ñu? 
We have been buried therefore with him by baptism unto death, in order that, even as Christ has been raised up from among [the] dead by the glory of the Father, so *we* also should walk in newness of life. @ Tui anŭn, hăng tơlơi ƀatem Ơi Adai hmâo dơr laih ƀing ta hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Ñu amăng tơlơi djai Ñu. Kiăng kơ kar hăng Krist hmâo hơdip glaĭ laih mơ̆ng ƀing djai hăng tơlơi ang yang Ama, kar kaĭ mơ̆n ƀing ta dưi hơdip amăng tơlơi hơdip phrâo.
For if we are become identified with [him] in the likeness of his death, so also we shall be of [his] resurrection; @ Yua kơ tơdah ƀing ta hmâo pơgop laih jing sa hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Ñu amăng tơlơi djai Ñu, sĭt biă mă ƀing ta ăt či pơgop jing sa hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Ñu amăng tơlơi hơdip glaĭ kar hăng Ñu hmâo hơdip glaĭ laih. 
knowing this, that our old man has been crucified with [him], that the body of sin might be annulled, that we should no longer serve sin. @ Ƀing ta thâo kơ mơnuih hơđăp ƀing ta hmâo pơ̆ng laih ƀơi kơyâo bơrơkal hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Ñu, kiăng kơ drơi jan soh sat dưi răm rai hĭ, tui anŭn ƀing ta ƀu jing hlŭn kơ tơlơi soh dơ̆ng ôh. 
For he that has died is justified from sin. @ Yua kơ hlơi pô hmâo djai laih ñu jing klaih rơngai laih mơ̆ng tơlơi soh. 
Now if we have died with Christ, we believe that we shall also live with him, @ Samơ̆ tơdah ƀing ta hmâo djai hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Krist laih, ƀing ta đaŏ ƀing ta či hơdip hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Ñu mơ̆n. 
knowing that Christ having been raised up from among [the] dead dies no more: death has dominion over him no more. @ Yua kơ ƀing ta thâo Krist hmâo hơdip glaĭ laih mơ̆ng ƀing djai, Ñu ƀu či djai dơ̆ng tah; tơlơi djai ƀu dưi wai lăng Ñu dơ̆ng ôh. 
For in that he has died, he has died to sin once for all; but in that he lives, he lives to God. @ Yua kơ Ñu hmâo djai, anŭn jing tơlơi djai kơ tơlơi soh kơnơ̆ng sa wơ̆t djŏp laih; samơ̆ Ñu hơdip, jing Ñu hơdip kơ Ơi Adai. 
So also *ye*, reckon yourselves dead to sin and alive to God in Christ Jesus. @ Tui anŭn ăt kar kaĭ mơ̆n, brơi ƀing gih yap bĕ ƀing gih pô hmâo djai laih gah kơ tơlơi soh, laih anŭn hlăk hơdip gah kơ Ơi Adai amăng Krist Yêsu.
Let not sin therefore reign in your mortal body to obey its lusts. @ Yua kơ anŭn yơh, anăm brơi tơlơi soh gĭt gai amăng drơi jan thâo djai ƀing gih anai ôh, ñu ngă kơ ƀing gih khŏm pơhluai tui tơlơi amoaih kiăng ñu. 
Neither yield your members instruments of unrighteousness to sin, but yield yourselves to God as alive from among [the] dead, and your members instruments of righteousness to God. @ Anăm jao lui sa črăn amăng drơi jan ƀing gih kơ tơlơi soh ôh kiăng jing hĭ gơnam yua brơi kơ tơlơi soh sat, samơ̆ jao bĕ ƀing gih pô kơ Ơi Adai jing kar hăng ƀing mơnuih hơdip glaĭ laih mơ̆ng tơlơi djai, laih anŭn jao bĕ črăn amăng drơi jan ƀing gih jing gơnam yua brơi kơ tơlơi tơpă. 
For sin shall not have dominion over *you*, for ye are not under law but under grace. @ Yua kơ tơlơi soh ƀu či jing khua kơ ƀing gih dơ̆ng ôh, yua kơ ƀing gih ƀu dŏ gah yŭ tơlơi juăt, samơ̆ dŏ gah yŭ tơlơi pap.
What then? should we sin because we are not under law but under grace? Far be the thought. @ Tui anŭn hyư̆m jing? Ƀing ta ăt či dŏ ngă soh dơ̆ng mơ̆? Yua kơ ƀing ta ƀu dŏ gah yŭ kơ tơlơi juăt ôh, samơ̆ dŏ gah yŭ kơ tơlơi pap. Sĭt ƀu djơ̆ tui anŭn ôh! 
Know ye not that to whom ye yield yourselves bondmen for obedience, ye are bondmen to him whom ye obey, whether of sin unto death, or of obedience unto righteousness? @ Ƀing gih ƀu thâo ôh hă tơdah ƀing gih brơi drơi jan ngă hlŭn kiăng tui gưt kơ sa čô mơnuih, tui anŭn ƀing gih jing hĭ hlŭn kơ pô ƀing gih tui gưt anŭn yơh. Thâo dah hlŭn kơ tơlơi soh ba kơ tơlơi djai, ƀôdah hlŭn kơ tơlơi tui gưt ba kơ tơlơi tơpă. 
But thanks [be] to God, that ye were bondmen of sin, but have obeyed from the heart the form of teaching into which ye were instructed. @ Samơ̆ bơni hơơč kơ Ơi Adai, yua kơ hlăk hlâo adih ƀing gih hmâo jing hlŭn kơ tơlơi soh, samơ̆ ră anai hăng abih pran jua ƀing gih čơdơ̆ng tui gưt laih kơ mơta tơlơi pơtô kơ ƀing gih kơ tơlơi jao ƀing gih pô. 
Now, having got your freedom from sin, ye have become bondmen to righteousness. @ Tui anŭn yua kơ hmâo klaih rơngai laih mơ̆ng tơlơi soh, ƀing gih jing hĭ hlŭn kơ tơlơi tơpă. 
I speak humanly on account of the weakness of your flesh. For even as ye have yielded your members in bondage to uncleanness and to lawlessness unto lawlessness, so now yield your members in bondage to righteousness unto holiness. @ Kâo pơhiăp tui hăng ană mơnuih yua kơ tơlơi thâo hluh ƀing gih jing đêl. Kar hăng hlăk hlâo adih ƀing gih hmâo jao laih črăn drơi jan ƀing gih ngă hlŭn kơ tơlơi grĭ grañ laih anŭn tơlơi jŭ sat kiăng kơ ngă tơlơi soh sat lu hloh dơ̆ng, kar kaĭ mơ̆n ră anai, jao hĭ bĕ črăn drơi jan ƀing gih jing hlŭn kơ tơlơi tơpă hiam kiăng kơ hmâo tơlơi rơgoh hiam.
For when ye were bondmen of sin ye were free from righteousness. @ Tơdang ƀing gih ăt dŏ jing hlŭn kơ tơlơi soh, ƀing gih jing rơngai kơ tơlơi tơpă. 
What fruit therefore had ye *then* in the things of which ye are *now* ashamed? for the end of *them* [is] death. @ Hlăk anŭn, hơgĕt boh tŭ yua ƀing gih hmâo mơ̆ng tơlơi ƀing gih ngă anŭn tơl ră anai ƀing gih dŏ tŭ tơlơi mlâo hañ? Hnal tuč kơ tơlơi anŭn jing tơlơi djai. 
But *now*, having got your freedom from sin, and having become bondmen to God, ye have your fruit unto holiness, and the end eternal life. @ Samơ̆ ră anai ƀing gih klaih rơngai laih mơ̆ng tơlơi soh laih anŭn jing hlŭn kơ Ơi Adai laih, boh tŭ yua kơ ƀing gih hmâo ră anai jing tơlơi rơgoh hiam, laih anŭn hnal tuč kơ tơlơi anŭn jing tơlơi hơdip hlŏng lar. 
For the wages of sin [is] death; but the act of favour of God, eternal life in Christ Jesus our Lord. @ Yua kơ nua apah kơ tơlơi soh jing tơlơi djai, samơ̆ gơnam Ơi Adai pha brơi jing tơlơi hơdip hlŏng lar amăng Krist Yêsu, Khua Yang ƀing ta.
Are ye ignorant, brethren, (for I speak to those knowing law,) that law rules over a man as long as he lives? @ Ơ ƀing adơi ayŏng, kâo pơhiăp hăng ƀing thâo tơlơi juăt, ƀing gih ƀu thâo ôh hă tơlơi juăt kơnơ̆ng wai lăng ƀơi sa čô mơnuih hlăk ñu dŏ hơdip đôč? 
For the married woman is bound by law to her husband so long as he is alive; but if the husband should die, she is clear from the law of the husband: @ Tui anŭn tui hăng tơlơi juăt, đah kơmơi đom hăng rơkơi ñu tơdang ñu hlăk dŏ hơdip; samơ̆ tơ rơkơi ñu djai laih, ñu klaih rơngai yơh mơ̆ng tơlơi juăt akă ñu hăng rơkơi ñu. 
so then, the husband being alive, she shall be called an adulteress if she be to another man; but if the husband should die, she is free from the law, so as not to be an adulteress, though she be to another man. @ Hnŭn yơh tơdang rơkơi ñu ăt dŏ hơdip tơdah đah kơmơi anŭn dŏ hĭ rơkơi pơkŏn, arăng či iâu ñu đah kơmơi gao akŏ. Samơ̆ tơdah rơkơi ñu djai laih, ñu klaih rơngai yơh mơ̆ng tơlơi juăt anŭn, laih anŭn tơdah ñu dŏ rơkơi pơkŏn, ñu ƀu djơ̆ đah kơmơi klĕ pyu ôh. 
So that, my brethren, *ye* also have been made dead to the law by the body of the Christ, to be to another, who has been raised up from among [the] dead, in order that we might bear fruit to God. @ Ơ ƀing adơi ayŏng, kar hăng tui anŭn mơ̆n, amăng drơi jan Krist ƀing gih djai laih gah kơ tơlơi juăt laih anŭn ră anai ƀing gih lơ̆m kơ pô pơkŏn laih, Pô Ơi Adai hmâo pơhơdip glaĭ laih mơ̆ng ƀing djai, kiăng kơ ƀing ta dưi mơboh kơ Ơi Adai. 
For when we were in the flesh the passions of sins, which [were] by the law, wrought in our members to bring forth fruit to death; @ Tơdang ƀing ta ăt dŏ hơdip amăng asar đeh, khul tơlơi amoaih hưp kơ tơlơi soh mơ̆ng tơlơi juăt pơtrŭt pơsur, mă bruă amăng drơi jan ƀing ta, hnal tuč ba kơ tơlơi djai. 
but now we are clear from the law, having died in that in which we were held, so that we should serve in newness of spirit, and not in oldness of letter. @ Samơ̆ ră anai ƀing ta dưi klaih rơngai laih mơ̆ng tơlơi juăt, ƀing ta hmâo djai laih gah kơ tơlơi juăt hmâo pơjing ƀing ta ngă hlŭn, kiăng kơ ƀing ta mă bruă tui hăng tơlơi hơdip phrâo mơ̆ng Yang Bơngăt Hiam, ƀu djơ̆ tui hăng tơlơi juăt hơđăp kơ tơlơi čih amăng hră mơar dơ̆ng tah.
What shall we say then? [is] the law sin? Far be the thought. But I had not known sin, unless by law: for I had not had conscience also of lust unless the law had said, Thou shalt not lust; @ Tui anŭn hơgĕt ƀing ta či laĭ lĕ? Djơ̆ mơ̆ tơlơi juăt jing tơlơi soh? Ƀu djơ̆ tui anŭn ôh! Samơ̆ tơdah ƀu hmâo ôh tơlơi juăt, kâo ƀu dưi thâo krăn tơlơi soh ôh. Kâo ƀu či thâo krăn ôh hơgĕt tơlơi hưp ham jing tơdah tơlơi juăt ƀu laĭ: “Anăm hưp ham ôh.” 
but sin, getting a point of attack by the commandment, wrought in me every lust; for without law sin [was] dead. @ Samơ̆ mơ̆ng tơlơi juăt anŭn tơlơi soh hmâo mông gal pơjing amăng kâo djŏp mơta tơlơi amoaih hưp, yua kơ tơdah ƀu hmâo ôh tơlơi juăt, tơlơi soh djai yơh. 
But *I* was alive without law once; but the commandment having come, sin revived, but *I* died. @ Hlâo adih kâo dŏ hơdip ƀu hmâo tơlơi juăt ôh, samơ̆ tơ hmâo tơlơi pơtă truh, tơlơi soh jing hơdip hĭ, 
And the commandment, which [was] for life, was found, [as] to me, itself [to be] unto death: @ laih anŭn kâo djai hĭ, djơ̆ biă mă tơlơi pơtă ƀuăn brơi tơlơi hơdip kơ kâo, kơđai glaĭ ñu ba kâo kơ tơlơi djai. 
for sin, getting a point of attack by the commandment, deceived me, and by it slew [me]. @ Yua kơ mơ̆ng tơlơi pơtă, tơlơi soh hmâo mông gal plư kâo, tui anŭn mơ̆ng tơlơi juăt anŭn tơlơi soh pơdjai hĭ kâo.
So that the law indeed [is] holy, and the commandment holy, and just, and good. @ Tui anŭn tơlơi juăt jing rơgoh hiam, tơlơi pơtă ăt jing rơgoh hiam mơ̆n, tơpă hơnơ̆ng, laih anŭn hiam klă. 
Did then that which is good become death to me? Far be the thought. But sin, that it might appear sin, working death to me by that which is good; in order that sin by the commandment might become exceeding sinful. @ Tui anŭn, djơ̆ mơ̆ tơlơi hiam ba tơlơi djai kơ kâo? Ƀu djơ̆ tui anŭn ôh! Samơ̆ tơlơi soh yơh yua tơlơi hiam pơdjai hĭ kâo, kiăng kơ kơnuih sĭt tơlơi soh dưi pơrơđah, laih anŭn mơ̆ng tơlơi pơtă tơlơi soh jing hĭ sat răm biă mă.
For we know that the law is spiritual: but *I* am fleshly, sold under sin. @ Ƀing ta thâo tơlơi juăt jing mơyang; samơ̆ kâo jing mơnuih asar đeh, hmâo sĭ hĭ jing hlŭn kơ tơlơi soh. 
For that which I do, I do not own: for not what I will, this I do; but what I hate, this I practise. @ Kâo ƀu thâo hluh ôh tơlơi kâo ngă. Yua kơ kâo ƀu ngă ôh tơlơi kâo kiăng, samơ̆ kơđai glaĭ kâo ngă hĭ tơlơi kâo bơrơmŭt. 
But if what I do not will, this I practise, I consent to the law that [it is] right. @ Samơ̆ tơdah kâo ngă tơlơi kâo ƀu kiăng ôh, kâo tŭ ư tơlơi juăt jing hiam klă. 
Now then [it is] no longer *I* [that] do it, but the sin that dwells in me. @ Tui anŭn ƀu djơ̆ kâo ôh ngă tơlơi anŭn, samơ̆ tơlơi soh dŏ amăng kâo yơh ngă tơlơi anŭn. 
For I know that in me, that is, in my flesh, good does not dwell: for to will is there with me, but to do right [I find] not. @ Yua kơ kâo thâo ƀu hmâo ôh mơnơ̆ng hiam dŏ amăng kâo, kiăng laĭ amăng asar đeh kâo. Kâo dưi hmâo tơlơi kiăng ngă hiam, samơ̆ kâo ƀu anăm ngă tơlơi hiam ôh. 
For I do not practise the good that I will; but the evil I do not will, that I do. @ Yua kơ kâo ƀu ngă ôh tơlơi hiam kâo kiăng ngă, samơ̆ kâo ngă hĭ tơlơi sat kâo ƀu kiăng ngă. 
But if what *I* do not will, this I practise, [it is] no longer *I* [that] do it, but the sin that dwells in me. @ Tơdah kâo ngă tơlơi kâo ƀu kiăng ngă ôh, ƀu djơ̆ ôh kâo ngă tơlơi anŭn, samơ̆ anŭn jing tơlơi soh dŏ amăng kâo ngă tơlơi anŭn.
I find then the law upon *me* who will to practise what is right, that with *me* evil is there. @ Tui anŭn kâo ƀuh sa mơta tơlơi juăt tui anai: Tơ kâo kiăng ngă tơlơi hiam, tơlơi sat đuaĭ tui klep ƀơi kâo. 
For I delight in the law of God according to the inward man: @ Amăng lăm pran jua kâo, kâo hơ̆k mơak kơ tơlơi juăt Ơi Adai; 
but I see another law in my members, warring in opposition to the law of my mind, and bringing me into captivity to the law of sin which exists in my members. @ samơ̆ kâo mưn amăng drơi jan kâo hmâo sa tơlơi juăt pơkŏn pơblah hăng tơlơi juăt amăng tơlơi pơmĭn kâo, laih anŭn pơgŏ kâo ngă hlŭn kơ tơlơi juăt kơ tơlơi soh, jing tơlơi juăt dŏ amăng drơi jan kâo. 
O wretched man that I [am]! who shall deliver me out of this body of death? @ Răm ƀăm yơh kơ kâo! Hlơi či pơklaih kâo mơ̆ng drơi jan thâo djai anai? 
I thank God, through Jesus Christ our Lord. So then *I* *myself* with the mind serve God's law; but with the flesh sin's law. @ Bơni hơơč kơ Ơi Adai, mơ̆ng Yêsu Krist, Khua Yang ƀing ta!
Tui anŭn, hăng tơlơi pơmĭn kâo, kâo jing hlŭn kơ tơlơi juăt Ơi Adai; samơ̆ hăng asar đeh kâo, kâo jing hlŭn kơ tơlơi juăt tơlơi soh.
[There is] then now no condemnation to those in Christ Jesus. @ Hnŭn yơh ră anai, ƀu hmâo tơlơi klă kơđi dơ̆ng ôh kơ hlơi pô dŏ amăng Krist Yêsu; 
For the law of the Spirit of life in Christ Jesus has set me free from the law of sin and of death. @ yua kơ tơlơi juăt Yang Bơngăt Hiam brơi tơlơi hơdip amăng Krist Yêsu hmâo pơrơngai laih kâo mơ̆ng tơlơi juăt kơ tơlơi soh laih anŭn tơlơi djai. 
For what the law could not do, in that it was weak through the flesh, God, having sent his own Son, in likeness of flesh of sin, and for sin, has condemned sin in the flesh, @ Yua kơ hơgĕt tơlơi juăt ƀu dưi ngă ôh yua mơ̆ng asar đeh ngă tơdu hĭ tơlơi juăt, Ơi Adai hmâo ngă laih. Ñu pơkiaŏ rai Ană Ñu pô brơi gơ̆ jing mơnuih kar hăng mơnuih ƀing ta hmâo asar đeh soh sat, laih anŭn jing mơnơ̆ng ngă yang kơ tơlơi soh; tui anŭn Ñu hmâo klă kơđi tơlơi soh amăng asar đeh. 
in order that the righteous requirement of the law should be fulfilled in us, who do not walk according to flesh but according to Spirit. @ Kiăng kơ tơlơi tơpă tui hăng tơlơi juăt rơkâo tơña dưi ngă klă tum amăng ƀing ta, jing ƀing mơnuih ƀu hơdip tui hăng asar đeh ôh, samơ̆ tui hăng Yang Bơngăt Hiam. 
For they that are according to flesh mind the things of the flesh; and they that are according to Spirit, the things of the Spirit. @ Yua kơ ƀing hơdip tui hăng asar đeh, khăp pơmĭn kơ khul tơlơi tui hăng asar đeh kiăng. Samơ̆ ƀing hơdip tui hăng Yang Bơngăt Hiam, khăp pơmĭn kơ khul tơlơi Yang Bơngăt Hiam kiăng. 
For the mind of the flesh [is] death; but the mind of the Spirit life and peace. @ Khăp pơmĭn kơ tơlơi tui hăng asar đeh ba kơ tơlơi djai. Samơ̆ tơlơi khăp pơmĭn kơ tơlơi tui hăng Yang Bơngăt Hiam ba kơ tơlơi hơdip laih anŭn tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua. 
Because the mind of the flesh is enmity against God: for it is not subject to the law of God; for neither indeed can it be: @ Yua kơ tơlơi khăp pơmĭn gah kơ asar đeh jing ayăt hăng Ơi Adai. Ñu ƀu tui gưt kơ tơlơi juăt Ơi Adai ôh, kŏn ñu dưi tui gưt lơi. 
and they that are in flesh cannot please God. @ Ƀing hlơi hơdip tui hăng asar đeh ƀu dưi bơmơak kơ Ơi Adai ôh.
But *ye* are not in flesh but in Spirit, if indeed God's Spirit dwell in you; but if any one has not [the] Spirit of Christ *he* is not of him: @ Tui anŭn tơdah sĭt biă mă Yang Bơngăt Hiam Ơi Adai dŏ amăng ƀing gih, ƀing gih ƀu hơdip tui hăng asar đeh dơ̆ng ôh samơ̆ tui hăng Yang Bơngăt Hiam. Hlơi pô ƀu hmâo Yang Bơngăt Hiam Krist, ñu ƀu lơ̆m kơ Krist ôh. 
but if Christ be in you, the body is dead on account of sin, but the Spirit life on account of righteousness. @ Samơ̆ tơdah Krist dŏ amăng ƀing gih, wơ̆t dah drơi jan ƀing gih djai yua kơ tơlơi soh, bơngăt ƀing gih ăt hơdip yua mơ̆ng tơlơi tơpă. 
But if the Spirit of him that has raised up Jesus from among [the] dead dwell in you, he that has raised up Christ from among [the] dead shall quicken your mortal bodies also on account of his Spirit which dwells in you. @ Tơdah Yang Bơngăt Hiam kơ Pô hmâo pơhơdip glaĭ laih Yêsu Krist mơ̆ng ƀing djai dŏ amăng ƀing gih, Pô hmâo pơhơdip glaĭ laih Yêsu Krist mơ̆ng ƀing djai ăt či pơhơdip glaĭ drơi jan thâo djai ƀing gih kar kaĭ mơ̆n yua mơ̆ng Yang Bơngăt Hiam dŏ amăng ƀing gih.
So then, brethren, we are debtors, not to the flesh, to live according to flesh; @ Tui anŭn, Ơ ƀing adơi ayŏng, ƀing ta ƀu đom hơnưh kơ asar đeh dơ̆ng tah kiăng kơ hơdip tui hăng asar đeh. 
for if ye live according to flesh, ye are about to die; but if, by the Spirit, ye put to death the deeds of the body, ye shall live: @ Yua kơ tơdah ƀing gih hơdip tui hăng asar đeh, ƀing gih či djai; samơ̆ tơdah ƀing gih kơnang kơ Yang Bơngăt Hiam ƀing gih pơdjai hĭ bruă asar đeh, ƀing gih či hơdip yơh. 
for as many as are led by [the] Spirit of God, *these* are sons of God. @ Yua kơ abih bang ƀing hlơi hmâo Yang Bơngăt Hiam Ơi Adai dui ba leng kơ jing ƀing ană Ơi Adai. 
For ye have not received a spirit of bondage again for fear, but ye have received a spirit of adoption, whereby we cry, Abba, Father. @ Yua kơ ƀing gih ƀu tŭ mă ôh bơngăt jua brơi ƀing gih jing hlŭn kiăng kơ ăt dŏ hơdip nanao amăng tơlơi hwĭ; samơ̆ ƀing gih hmâo tŭ mă laih Yang Bơngăt Hiam brơi jing ană rong. Yua anŭn yơh ƀing ta iâu “Aba, Ama!” 
The Spirit itself bears witness with our spirit, that we are children of God. @ Yang Bơngăt Hiam pô yơh ngă pơsĭt kơ bơngăt jua ƀing ta kơ tơlơi ƀing ta jing ană Ơi Adai. 
And if children, heirs also: heirs of God, and Christ's joint heirs; if indeed we suffer with [him], that we may also be glorified with [him]. @ Tơdah ƀing ta jing ană bă, ƀing ta ăt jing ƀing tŭ mă kong ngăn mơ̆n, ƀing tŭ mă kong ngăn Ơi Adai, laih anŭn ƀing tŭ mă kong ngăn hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Krist, sĭt biă mă tơdah ƀing ta tŭ tơlơi ruă tơnap hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Ñu, ƀing ta ăt či dưi hmâo tơlơi ang yang hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Ñu kar kaĭ mơ̆n.
For I reckon that the sufferings of this present time are not worthy [to be compared] with the coming glory to be revealed to us. @ Kâo pơmĭn khul tơlơi ruă tơnap rơnŭk anai ƀu năng lăp ôh bơkơnar hăng tơlơi ang yang či pơrơđah brơi kơ ƀing ta rơnŭk tơdơi. 
For the anxious looking out of the creature expects the revelation of the sons of God: @ Yua kơ abih bang mơnơ̆ng mơnuă Ơi Adai hrih leng kơ hur har, čang rơmang biă mă kơ hrơi ƀing ană bă Ơi Adai či pơrơđah rai. 
for the creature has been made subject to vanity, not of its will, but by reason of him who has subjected [the same], in hope @ Yua kơ abih bang mơnơ̆ng mơnuă, hmâo tŭ tơlơi brŭ rai đôč đač, ƀu djơ̆ tui hăng gơñu pô kiăng ôh, samơ̆ tui hăng Pô brơi gơñu tŭ tơlơi anŭn hăng tơlơi čang rơmang 
that the creature itself also shall be set free from the bondage of corruption into the liberty of the glory of the children of God. @ kơ abih bang mơnơ̆ng mơnuă anŭn ăt či hmâo tơlơi pơrơngai mơ̆n mơ̆ng tơlơi jing hlŭn kơ tơlơi brŭ rai, kiăng kơ dưi mŭt hrŏm amăng tơlơi rơngai ang yang kơ ƀing ană Ơi Adai. 
For we know that the whole creation groans together and travails in pain together until now. @ Ƀing ta thâo abih bang mơnơ̆ng mơnuă hmâo hrih laih leng kơ ur krao amăng tơlơi dŏ ruă nuă kar hăng đah kơmơi ruă tơkeng truh pơ ră anai; 
And not only [that], but even *we* ourselves, who have the first-fruits of the Spirit, we also ourselves groan in ourselves, awaiting adoption, [that is] the redemption of our body. @ ƀu djơ̆ kơnơ̆ng kơ khul mơnơ̆ng mơnuă hmâo hrih laih đôč ôh, samơ̆ wơ̆t kơ ƀing ta pô mơ̆n, ƀing hmâo laih boh tal blŭng mơ̆ng Yang Bơngăt Hiam. Ƀing ta ur krao amăng pran jua tơdang dŏ tơguan kơ tơlơi Ơi Adai brơi jing ƀing ană bă Ñu, jing tơlơi song mă drơi jan ƀing ta. 
For we have been saved in hope; but hope seen is not hope; for what any one sees, why does he also hope? @ Yua kơ amăng tơlơi čang rơmang yơh ƀing ta hmâo tơlơi pơklaih. Samơ̆ tơdah tơlơi čang rơmang hmâo ƀuh laih, ñu ƀu jing tơlơi čang rơmang dơ̆ng tah. Yua kơ hlơi pô dŏ čang rơmang kơ mơnơ̆ng ñu ƀuh laih? 
But if what we see not we hope, we expect in patience. @ Samơ̆ tơdah ƀing ta dŏ čang rơmang kơ tơlơi ƀing ta aka ƀuh ôh, ƀing ta dŏ tơguan kơ tơlơi anŭn hăng tơlơi gir yơh.
And in like manner the Spirit joins also its help to our weakness; for we do not know what we should pray for as is fitting, but the Spirit itself makes intercession with groanings which cannot be uttered. @ Kar kaĭ mơ̆n Yang Bơngăt Hiam djru ƀing ta amăng tơlơi tơdu ƀing ta, yua kơ ƀing ta ƀu thâo ôh hyư̆m či iâu laĭ kiăng kơ djơ̆, samơ̆ Yang Bơngăt Hiam pô djru iâu laĭ pơala kơ ƀing ta hăng tơlơi kơwưh krao amăng pran jua ƀu thâo pơblang ôh. 
But he who searches the hearts knows what [is] the mind of the Spirit, because he intercedes for saints according to God. @ Laih anŭn Ơi Adai jing pô lăng kơsem pran jua mơnuih, thâo tơlơi pơmĭn Yang Bơngăt Hiam. Yua kơ Yang Bơngăt Hiam iâu laĭ pơala brơi ƀing rơgoh hiam tui hăng tơlơi Ơi Adai kiăng.
But we *do* know that all things work together for good to those who love God, to those who are called according to purpose. @ Ƀing ta thâo laih, abih bang tơlơi pơƀŭt glaĭ leng kơ jing hĭ tơlơi hiam kơ ƀing khăp kơ Ơi Adai, jing kơ ƀing mơnuih Ơi Adai hmâo iâu mă tui hăng tơlơi Ñu ruah mă hlâo. 
Because whom he has foreknown, he has also predestinated [to be] conformed to the image of his Son, so that he should be [the] firstborn among many brethren. @ Yua kơ ƀing mơnuih Ñu thâo laih mơ̆ng hlâo, ăt Ñu hmâo pơkă pioh laih kơ ƀing gơñu dưi jing kar hăng rup Ană Ñu, kiăng kơ Ană Ñu jing ayŏng tha kơ lu ƀing adơi ayŏng. 
But whom he has predestinated, these also he has called; and whom he has called, these also he has justified; but whom he has justified, these also he has glorified. @ Laih anŭn ƀing hlơi Ñu hmâo pơkă pioh laih, Ñu hmâo iâu laih mơ̆n, laih anŭn ƀing hlơi Ñu hmâo iâu laih, Ñu hmâo yap tơpă hơnơ̆ng laih mơ̆n, laih anŭn ƀing hlơi Ñu hmâo yap tơpă hơnơ̆ng laih, ăt Ñu hmâo brơi laih mơ̆n tơlơi ang yang kơ ƀing gơ̆.
What shall we then say to these things? If God [be] for us, who against us? @ Tui anŭn, hơgĕt tơlơi ƀing ta či laĭ kơ khul tơlơi anai lĕ? Tơdah Ơi Adai dŏ gah kơ ƀing ta, hlơi pô dưi pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ hăng ƀing ta dơ̆ng? 
He who, yea, has not spared his own Son, but delivered him up for us all, how shall he not also with him grant us all things? @ Yua kơ Ơi Adai ƀu hơ-ưi ôh Ană Ñu pô, samơ̆ hmâo jao lui hĭ Gơ̆ yua kơ abih bang ƀing ta, hyư̆m Ñu ƀu či pha brơi ôh hă abih bang tơlơi kơ ƀing ta hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Gơ̆? 
Who shall bring an accusation against God's elect? [It is] God who justifies: @ Hlơi pô či phong kơ ƀing Ơi Adai hmâo ruah mă lĕ? Ơi Adai pô yơh hmâo yap gơñu jing tơpă hơnơ̆ng. 
who is he that condemns? [It is] Christ who has died, but rather has been [also] raised up; who is also at the right hand of God; who also intercedes for us. @ Hlơi pô či klă kơđi gơñu? Yêsu Krist jing Pô hmâo djai laih anŭn hmâo hơdip glaĭ laih, Pô dŏ gah hơnuă kơ Ơi Adai laih anŭn iâu laĭ pơala brơi kơ ƀing ta. 
Who shall separate us from the love of Christ? tribulation or distress, or persecution, or famine, or nakedness, or danger, or sword? @ Hlơi pô či pơčơlah hĭ ƀing ta mơ̆ng tơlơi Yêsu Krist khăp? Djơ̆ mơ̆ tơlơi tơnap tap, tơlơi rŭng răng, tơlơi arăng ngă sat, tơlơi ư̆ rơpa, tơlơi jing mơhlŭn, tơlơi hwĭ hyưt, ƀôdah đao gưm? 
According as it is written, For thy sake we are put to death all the day long; we have been reckoned as sheep for slaughter. @ Tui hăng hră Ơi Adai hmâo čih:
“Rĭm hrơi arăng pơdjai ƀing gơmơi yua kơ Ih;
Arăng yap gơmơi kar hăng triu pioh čuh ƀơ̆ng.”
But in all these things we more than conquer through him that has loved us. @ Kơđai glaĭ, amăng abih bang tơlơi anŭn, ƀing ta jing ƀing dưi hloh nanao, yua mơ̆ng Pô khăp kơ ƀing ta. 
For I am persuaded that neither death, nor life, nor angels, nor principalities, nor things present, nor things to come, nor powers, @ Yua kơ kâo thâo sĭt biă mă thâo dah tơlơi djai, tơlơi hơdip, ƀing ling jang adai, ƀing khua wai lăng, bruă rơnŭk anai, bruă rơnŭk tơdơi, tơlơi dưi kơtang amăng lŏn adai, 
nor height, nor depth, nor any other creature, shall be able to separate us from the love of God, which [is] in Christ Jesus our Lord. @ boh glong, boh dlam, ƀôdah hơgĕt mơnơ̆ng pơkŏn amăng abih bang mơnơ̆ng hmâo hrih laih, ƀu dưi pơčơlah hĭ ôh ƀing ta mơ̆ng tơlơi Ơi Adai khăp hmâo pơrơđah laih amăng Krist Yêsu, Khua Yang ƀing ta.
I say [the] truth in Christ, I lie not, my conscience bearing witness with me in [the] Holy Spirit, @ Amăng Krist kâo pơhiăp sĭt biă mă, kâo ƀu ƀlor ôh; pran jua tơpă kâo ngă gơ̆ng jơlan kơ kâo amăng Yang Bơngăt Hiam. 
that I have great grief and uninterrupted pain in my heart, @ Pran jua kâo rơngot biă mă laih anŭn ruă nanao. 
for I have wished, I myself, to be a curse from the Christ for my brethren, my kinsmen, according to flesh; @ Yua kơ tơdah dưi kâo kiăng jing mơnuih Ơi Adai hơtơ̆m pah tŭ mơ̆n tơl čơlah hĭ mơ̆ng Krist pơala ƀing adơi ayŏng kâo, jing ƀing kơnŭng djuai kâo gah kơ asar đeh anai. 
who are Israelites; whose [is] the adoption, and the glory, and the covenants, and the law-giving, and the service, and the promises; @ Gơñu jing ƀing mơnuih Israel, hmâo tơlơi dưi jing ană rong, wơ̆t tơlơi ang yang, tơlơi kơnol pơgop, tơlơi juăt, tơlơi kơkuh pơpŭ, laih anŭn tơlơi ƀuăn. 
whose [are] the fathers; and of whom, as according to flesh, [is] the Christ, who is over all, God blessed for ever. Amen. @ Gơñu tơbiă rai mơ̆ng ƀing ơi adon, laih anŭn gah kơ asar đeh, Yang Krist tơbiă rai mơ̆ng kơnŭng djuai gơñu, Pô jing khua kơ abih bang, jing Ơi Adai Pô năng lăp hmâo tơlơi pơpŭ bơni hơơč hlŏng lar. Amen.
Not however as though the word of God had failed; for not all [are] Israel which [are] of Israel; @ Laĭ tui anŭn, ƀu djơ̆ ôh boh pơhiăp Ơi Adai jing đôč đač. Yua kơ ƀu djơ̆ ôh abih bang ƀing tơbiă rai mơ̆ng Israel leng kơ jing mơnuih Israel. 
nor because they are seed of Abraham [are] all children: but, In Isaac shall a seed be called to thee. @ Kŏn djơ̆ lơi abih bang mơnuih lơ̆m kơ kơnŭng djuai Abraham leng kơ jing ană tơčo Abraham; samơ̆ “Mơ̆ng Isak yơh arăng či yap kơnŭng djuai ih” 
That is, [they that are] the children of the flesh, these [are] not the children of God; but the children of the promise are reckoned as seed. @ Tơlơi anŭn kiăng laĭ ƀu djơ̆ ôh ƀing ană bă gah asar đeh anai jing ană bă Ơi Adai, samơ̆ ƀing ană bă tui hăng tơlơi Ơi Adai ƀuăn kah arăng yap jing ană tơčo sĭt. 
For this word [is] of promise, According to this time I will come, and there shall be a son to Sarah. @ Yua kơ tui hăng tơlơi ƀuăn hmâo laĭ: “Thŭn tơdơi amăng bơyan anai mơ̆n kâo či wơ̆t glaĭ dơ̆ng laih anŭn HʼSara či hmâo sa čô ană đah rơkơi.”
And not only [that], but Rebecca having conceived by one, Isaac our father, @ Ƀu djơ̆ kơnơ̆ng tui anŭn đôč ôh, samơ̆ ăt kar kaĭ mơ̆n tơ HʼRêbêka pi kian kơmar hăng Isak ơi ƀing ta. 
[the children] indeed being not yet born, or having done anything good or worthless (that the purpose of God according to election might abide, not of works, but of him that calls), @ Wơ̆t dah dua čô ană anŭn aka tơkeng rai ôh, laih anŭn gơñu aka hmâo ngă hiam ƀôdah sat ôh kiăng kơ tơlơi Ơi Adai hmâo ruah mă dưi jing kơjăp. 
it was said to her, The greater shall serve the less: @ Hmâo boh pơhiăp Ơi Adai laĭ kơ HʼRêbêka tui anai: “Ayŏng či mă bruă kơ adơi.” 
according as it is written, I have loved Jacob, and I have hated Esau. @ Hrup hăng Hră Ơi Adai hmâo čih laih: “Kâo khăp kơ Yakôp samơ̆ hil kơ Êsâo.”
What shall we say then? [Is there] unrighteousness with God? Far be the thought. @ Tui anŭn hơgĕt tơlơi ƀing ta či laĭ lĕ? Hmâo mơ̆ tơlơi ƀu tơpă amăng Ơi Adai? Ư ưh, ƀu hmâo ôh! 
For he says to Moses, I will shew mercy to whom I will shew mercy, and I will feel compassion for whom I will feel compassion. @ Yua kơ Ñu hmâo laĭ kơ Môis:
“Kâo či pap drap kơ hlơi pô kâo pap drap,
Laih anŭn kâo či hơeng kơ hlơi pô kâo hơeng.”
So then [it is] not of him that wills, nor of him that runs, but of God that shews mercy. @ Tui anŭn, tơlơi anŭn ƀu djơ̆ mơ̆ng tơlơi kiăng ană mơnuih ƀôdah mơ̆ng tơlơi gir run hơduah ôh, samơ̆ mơ̆ng tơlơi Ơi Adai pap drap. 
For the scripture says to Pharaoh, For this very thing I have raised thee up from amongst [men], that I might thus shew in thee my power, and so that my name should be declared in all the earth. @ Yua kơ Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp ăt laĭ laih kơ Pharaôn: “Kâo hmâo yŏng đĭ ih yua kơ Kâo kiăng bơrơđah tơlơi dưi mơyang Kâo amăng ih, kiăng kơ anăn Kâo arăng dưi pơhaih hyu tar ƀar lŏn tơnah.” 
So then, to whom he will he shews mercy, and whom he will he hardens. @ Tui anŭn Ñu pap drap kơ hlơi pô Ñu kiăng, laih anŭn Ñu pơkhăng hĭ pran jua kơ hlơi pô Ñu kiăng.
Thou wilt say to me then, Why does he yet find fault? for who resists his purpose? @ Tui anŭn ih či laĭ kơ kâo: “Hyư̆m Ơi Adai ăt klă kơđi kơ tơlơi soh mơ̆n lĕ? Yua kơ hlơi pô dưi pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ hăng tơlơi Ñu kiăng?” 
Aye, but thou, O man, who art *thou* that answerest again to God? Shall the thing formed say to him that has formed it, Why hast thou made me thus? @ Samơ̆ hlơi ih jing, ơ mơnuih, kiăng pơgăl glaĭ hăng Ơi Adai? Dưi mơ̆ lŏn kraĭ laĭ kơ pô man ñu: “Hyư̆m ih man kâo tui anai?” 
Or has not the potter authority over the clay, out of the same lump to make one vessel to honour, and another to dishonour? @ Pô bruă man lŏn ƀu hmâo tơlơi dưi hăng lŏn kraĭ ôh hă, hăng sa bôr lŏn kraĭ kiăng ngă sa boh čeh yua amăng bruă yom laih anŭn sa boh čeh pơkŏn yua amăng bruă ƀu yom ôh? 
And if God, minded to shew his wrath and to make his power known, endured with much long-suffering vessels of wrath fitted for destruction; @ Hyư̆m ih pơmĭn tơdah Ơi Adai kiăng bơrơđah tơlơi Ñu hil laih anŭn bơrơđah tơlơi dưi mơyang Ñu, Ñu hmâo gir añ hăng khul čeh năng lăp tŭ kơ tơlơi hil kiăng pioh tơlơi pơrai hĭ? 
and that he might make known the riches of his glory upon vessels of mercy, which he had before prepared for glory, @ Tơdah Ñu kiăng pơrơđah tơlơi pơdrŏng kơ tơlơi ang yang Ñu pioh brơi kơ lu boh čeh Ñu pap drap, khul čeh Ñu hmâo man laih mơ̆ng hlâo pioh brơi kơ tơlơi ang yang, 
us, whom he has also called, not only from amongst [the] Jews, but also from amongst [the] nations? @ ƀing ta yơh jing ƀing Ñu hmâo iâu laih, ƀu djơ̆ kơnơ̆ng mơ̆ng ƀing ană Yuđa đôč ôh, samơ̆ Ñu ăt iâu mơ̆ng ƀing djuai tuai mơ̆n. 
As he says also in Hosea, I will call not-my-people My people; and the-not-beloved Beloved. @ Tơlơi anai Ñu hmâo laĭ amăng hră Ôsê:
“Ƀing ƀu jing ană plei Kâo ôh, Kâo či iâu ‘Ƀing ană plei Kâo’
Laih anŭn pô Kâo ƀu khăp hơeng ôh: ‘Kâo či iâu pô Kâo khăp hơeng.’
And it shall be, in the place where it was said to them, *Ye* [are] not my people, there shall they be called Sons of [the] living God. @ Laih anŭn amăng anih Ơi Adai laĭ kơ ƀing gơ̆: ‘Ƀing gih ƀu djơ̆ ƀing ană plei pla kâo ôh,’
Ăt ƀơi anih anŭn mơ̆n Ơi Adai či iâu ƀing gơ̆ jing ‘Ƀing ană Ơi Adai hơdip.’”
But Esaias cries concerning Israel, Should the number of the children of Israel be as the sand of the sea, the remnant shall be saved: @ Laih anŭn Êsai ur kraih tơlơi djơ̆ kơ ƀing Israel: “Wơ̆t dah mrô ƀing ană Israel jing lu kar hăng čuah ƀơi ia rơsĭ, samơ̆ kơnơ̆ng sa črăn dŏ tơsot glaĭ ƀiă đôč či dưi klaih. 
for [he] is bringing the matter to an end, and [cutting [it] short in righteousness; because] a cutting short of the matter will [the] Lord accomplish upon the earth. @ Yua kơ Khua Yang či pơtruh tơlơi Ñu phat kơđi ƀơi lŏn tơnah hăng tơlơi tañ laih anŭn khŭt khăt.” 
And according as Esaias said before, Unless [the] Lord of hosts had left us a seed, we had been as Sodom, and made like even as Gomorrha. @ Laih anŭn tui hăng Êsai hmâo laĭ hlâo:
“Tơdah Khua Yang kơ phung tơhan ƀu pioh glaĭ ƀing ană tơčo kơ ƀing ta,
Ƀing ta jing hĭ laih kar hăng plei Sôđôm laih anŭn plei Gômôrơ.”
What then shall we say? That [they of the] nations, who did not follow after righteousness, have attained righteousness, but [the] righteousness that is on the principle of faith. @ Tui anŭn hơgĕt ƀing ta či laĭ lĕ? Ƀing djuai tuai ƀu tui hơduah ôh tơlơi tơpă, pŭng gơñu hmâo hĭ tơlơi tơpă. Anŭn jing tơlơi tơpă mơ̆ng tơlơi đaŏ. 
But Israel, pursuing after a law of righteousness, has not attained to [that] law. @ Ƀing Israel gir tui hơduah tơlơi tơpă anŭn tui hăng tơlơi juăt, samơ̆ gơñu ƀu dưi ngă pơgiơ̆ng tui hăng tơlơi juăt anŭn ôh. 
Wherefore? Because [it was] not on the principle of faith, but as of works. They have stumbled at the stumblingstone, @ Yua hơgĕt lĕ? Yua kơ gơñu ƀu tui hơduah ôh tơlơi tơpă hơnơ̆ng anŭn hăng tơlơi đaŏ, samơ̆ hăng bruă gơñu ngă. Gơñu tơhnač djơ̆ boh pơtâo čơgăn jơlan, 
according as it is written, Behold, I place in Zion a stone of stumbling and rock of offence: and he that believes on him shall not be ashamed. @ tui hăng Boh Pơhiăp Ơi Adai hmâo čih:
“Anai nê, Kâo dưm amăng plei Siôn sa boh pơtâo či ngă tơhnač kơ lu mơnuih,
sa boh pơtâo kli či ngă pơrơbuh hĭ gơñu;
Samơ̆ hlơi pô đaŏ kơ Ñu ƀu či rơngiă tơlơi čang rơmang ôh.”
Brethren, the delight of my own heart and my supplication which [I address] to God for them is for salvation. @ Ơ ƀing adơi ayŏng, tơlơi pran jua kâo kiăng laih anŭn tơlơi kâo iâu laĭ kơ Ơi Adai brơi kơ ƀing ană Israel kiăng kơ gơñu dưi hmâo tơlơi pơklaih. 
For I bear them witness that they have zeal for God, but not according to knowledge. @ Kâo gơ̆ng jơlan brơi gơñu, gơñu hmâo tơlơi hur har biă mă kơ Ơi Adai, samơ̆ tơlơi hur har anŭn ƀu djơ̆ hăng tơlơi thâo hluh ôh. 
For they, being ignorant of God's righteousness, and seeking to establish their own [righteousness], have not submitted to the righteousness of God. @ Yua kơ tơdang gơñu ƀu thâo krăn ôh tơlơi tơpă tơbiă rai mơ̆ng Ơi Adai, laih anŭn gơñu hơduah jơlan kiăng pơjing tơlơi tơpă kơ gơñu pô, tui anŭn gơñu ƀu tui gưt tơlơi tơpă Ơi Adai ôh. 
For Christ is [the] end of law for righteousness to every one that believes. @ Yua kơ Krist jing hnal tuč kơ tơlơi juăt, kiăng yap tơpă kơ abih bang hlơi pô đaŏ.
For Moses lays down in writing the righteousness which is of the law, The man who has practised those things shall live by them. @ Pơhiăp djơ̆ kơ tơlơi tơpă tơbiă rai mơ̆ng tơlơi juăt, Môis čih tui anai: “Hlơi pô gưt abih tơlơi juăt, yua kơ mơ̆ng tơlơi anŭn ñu či hơdip.” 
But the righteousness of faith speaks thus: Do not say in thine heart, Who shall ascend to the heavens? that is, to bring Christ down; @ Samơ̆ tơlơi tơpă tơbiă rai mơ̆ng tơlơi đaŏ laĭ tui anai: “Anăm laĭ ôh amăng pran jua ih, Hlơi či đĭ nao pơ adai?” (Jing, kiăng ba Krist trŭn) 
or, Who shall descend into the abyss? that is, to bring up Christ from among [the] dead. @ ƀôdah “Hlơi či trŭn nao pơ hlŭng dlam?” (Jing, kiăng ba Krist hơdip glaĭ mơ̆ng mơnuih djai). 
But what says it? The word is near thee, in thy mouth and in thy heart: that is, the word of faith, which we preach: @ Samơ̆ hơgĕt tơlơi ñu laĭ?
“Boh Pơhiăp dŏ jĕ ih,
Dŏ ƀơi amăng bah ih laih anŭn amăng pran jua ih”
Anŭn jing Boh Pơhiăp kơ tơlơi đaŏ, tơlơi gơmơi pơtô. 
that if thou shalt confess with thy mouth Jesus as Lord, and shalt believe in thine heart that God has raised him from among [the] dead, thou shalt be saved. @ Yua kơ tơdah amăng bah ih pơhaih Yêsu jing Khua Yang, laih anŭn pran jua đaŏ kơ tơlơi Ơi Adai hmâo pơhơdip glaĭ Ñu mơ̆ng tơlơi djai, ih či klaih yơh. 
For with [the] heart is believed to righteousness; and with [the] mouth confession made to salvation. @ Yua kơ hăng pran jua đaŏ, ƀing ta dưi hmâo tơlơi yap tơpă; laih anŭn hăng amăng bah pơhaih, ƀing ta dưi hmâo tơlơi pơklaih. 
For the scripture says, No one believing on him shall be ashamed. @ Hră Ơi Adai pơhiăp čih: “Hlơi pô đaŏ kơ Ñu ƀu či hmâo tơlơi mlâo hañ ôh.” 
For there is no difference of Jew and Greek; for the same Lord of all [is] rich towards all that call upon him. @ Yua kơ ƀu hmâo tơlơi pơkah pơpha ôh tơ̆ng krah ƀing Yuđa hăng ƀing Grek. Yua kơ gơñu hmâo hrŏm hơbĭt kơnơ̆ng hasa Khua Yang jing Khua Yang kơ abih bang mơnuih. Pô pha brơi tơlơi pap rơbeh blai kơ hlơi pô iâu laĭ kơ Ñu. 
For every one whosoever, who shall call on the name of the Lord, shall be saved. @ Yua kơ “hlơi iâu kơwưh kơ anăn Khua Yang či dưi klaih.”
How then shall they call upon him in whom they have not believed? and how shall they believe on him of whom they have not heard? and how shall they hear without one who preaches? @ Samơ̆ hyư̆m gơñu dưi iâu laĭ kơ Ơi Adai tơdah gơñu aka đaŏ ôh? Hyư̆m gơñu dưi đaŏ kơ Ơi Adai tơdah gơñu aka hmư̆ ôh? Laih anŭn hyư̆m gơñu dưi hmư̆ tơdah ƀu hmâo mơnuih hyu pơtô? 
and how shall they preach unless they have been sent? according as it is written, How beautiful the feet of them that announce glad tidings of peace, of them that announce glad tidings of good things! @ Laih anŭn hyư̆m mơnuih dưi pơtô tơdah arăng ƀu pơkiaŏ nao gơñu ôh? Tui hăng Boh Pơhiăp Ơi Adai hmâo čih “Hiam rŏ yơh kơ plă tơkai ƀing mơnuih nao pơhaih Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam!” 
But they have not all obeyed the glad tidings. For Esaias says, Lord, who has believed our report? @ Samơ̆ ƀu djơ̆ ôh abih bang ƀing gơñu tŭ mă Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam; yua kơ Êsai laĭ: “Ơ Khua Yang hlơi đaŏ kơ tơlơi gơmơi pơtô?” 
So faith then [is] by a report, but the report by God's word. @ Tui anŭn, tơlơi đaŏ tơbiă rai mơ̆ng tơlơi arăng hmư̆, laih anŭn tơlơi arăng hmư̆ tơbiă rai mơ̆ng boh pơhiăp Yang Krist arăng hmâo pơtô.
But I say, Have they not heard? Yea, surely, Their voice has gone out into all the earth, and their words to the extremities of the habitable world. @ Samơ̆ kâo tơña, djơ̆ mơ̆ gơñu aka ƀu hmư̆ djơ̆ ôh? Sĭt biă mă gơñu hmâo hmư̆ laih! Yua kơ:
“Jua hiăp ƀing nao ră ruai Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam arăng hmâo hmư̆ laih tar ƀar lŏn tơnah,
Laih anŭn boh pơhiăp gơñu hmâo nao truh pơ rơnuč lŏn tơnah.”
But I say, Has not Israel known? First, Moses says, *I* will provoke you to jealousy through [them that are] not a nation: through a nation without understanding I will anger you. @ Kâo tơña dơ̆ng, ƀing Israel aka ƀu thâo hluh ôh hă? Sĭt biă mă, blŭng hlâo Môis hmâo laĭ:
“Kâo či ngă brơi ƀing gih hmâo tơlơi gar moañ kơ ƀing djuai mơnuih ƀu jing sa djuai mơnuih ôh;
Kâo či ngă brơi ƀing gih hil rơañ yua kơ sa djuai mơnuih mlŭk mơgu.”
But Esaias is very bold, and says, I have been found by those not seeking me; I have become manifest to those not inquiring after me. @ Laih anŭn Êsai pơhiăp hăng tơlơi khĭn tui anai:
“Ƀing mơnuih ƀu sem hơduah kâo ôh, gơñu hmâo ƀuh laih Kâo.
Kâo hmâo pơrơđah laih Kâo pô kơ ƀing mơnuih ƀu rơkâo tơña Kâo ôh.”
But unto Israel he says, All the day long I have stretched out my hands unto a people disobeying and opposing. @ Samơ̆ djơ̆ kơ ƀing Israel Ñu laĭ: “Abih hrơi Kâo păng tơngan anăp nao kơ sa djuai mơnuih khăng akŏ hăng ƀu tui gưt anai.”
I say then, Has God cast away his people? Far be the thought. For *I* also am an Israelite, of [the] seed of Abraham, of [the] tribe of Benjamin. @ Tui anŭn kâo tơña, Ơi Adai hmâo hrah lui ƀing ană plei Ñu mơ̆? Sĭt ƀu djơ̆ tui anŭn ôh! Kâo pô mơ̆n jing sa čô mơnuih Israel, ană tơčo Abraham, sa čô mơ̆ng djuai Benjamin. 
God has not cast away his people whom he foreknew. Know ye not what the scripture says in [the history of] Elias, how he pleads with God against Israel? @ Ơi Adai ƀu hrah lui hĭ ôh ană plei Ñu jing ƀing Ñu thâo krăn laih mơ̆ng hlâo. Ƀing gih ƀu thâo ôh hă hơgĕt Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp hmâo čih laih djơ̆ kơ Êli, hyư̆m ñu phong ană Israel ƀơi anăp Ơi Adai? 
Lord, they have killed thy prophets, they have dug down thine altars; and *I* have been left alone, and they seek my life. @ “Ơ Khua Yang, gơñu hmâo pơdjai laih ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo Ih, gơñu pơglưh hĭ laih abih bang kơƀang ngă yang kơ Ih. Dŏ kơnơ̆ng hơjăn kâo đôč, laih anŭn gơñu ăt hơduah kiăng pơdjai kâo mơ̆n.” 
But what says the divine answer to him? I have left to myself seven thousand men, who have not bowed knee to Baal. @ Samơ̆ hyư̆m Ơi Adai laĭ glaĭ kơ ñu? “Kâo hmâo răk pioh laih kơ Kâo pô tơjuh rơbâo đah rơkơi aka ƀu tŏ tơŭt ƀơi anăp yang Baal ôh.” 
Thus, then, in the present time also there has been a remnant according to election of grace. @ Kar kaĭ mơ̆n amăng rơnŭk anai, hmâo sa črăn dŏ tơsot glaĭ dưi ruah mă laih hăng tơlơi pap. 
But if by grace, no longer of works: since [otherwise] grace is no more grace. @ Samơ̆ Ñu ruah mă gơñu mơ̆ng tơlơi pap, ƀu djơ̆ mơ̆ng bruă gơñu ngă ôh. Tơdah ƀu djơ̆ tui anŭn, tơlơi pap anŭn ƀu jing tơlơi pap dơ̆ng ôh.
What [is it] then? What Israel seeks for, that he has not obtained; but the election has obtained, and the rest have been blinded, @ Hyư̆m tui anŭn? Tơlơi ƀing ană Israel tui hơduah, gơñu ƀu dưi hmâo ôh. Samơ̆ ƀing Ơi Adai ruah hmâo laih tơlơi anŭn, samơ̆ ƀing dŏ glaĭ Ơi Adai pơkhăng hĭ pran jua gơñu, 
according as it is written, God has given to them a spirit of slumber, eyes not to see, and ears not to hear, unto this day. @ Tui hăng hră Ơi Adai pơhiăp hmâo čih:
“Ơi Adai hmâo brơi kơ gơñu bơngăt jua mơmŏt,
Mơta ƀu thâo ƀuh, laih anŭn tơngia tơngil hlŏng truh pơ hrơi anai.”
And David says, Let their table be for a snare, and for a gin, and for a fall-trap, and for a recompense to them: @ Laih anŭn Đawit laĭ:
“Brơi kơƀang gơñu ƀơ̆ng huă jing hĭ čơđong laih anŭn jal klŭp,
Boh pơtâo pơtơhnač laih anŭn jing tơlơi rŭ nua kơ ƀing gơñu;
let their eyes be darkened not to see, and bow down their back alway. @ Brơi kơ mơta gơñu jing mơmŏt hĭ, kiăng kơ gơñu ƀu thâo ƀuh,
Laih anŭn brơi rŏng gơñu gô nanao.”
I say then, Have they stumbled in order that they might fall? Far be the thought: but by their fall [there is] salvation to the nations to provoke them to jealousy. @ Tui anŭn kâo tơña, djơ̆ mơ̆ ƀing ană Israel hmâo tơhnač laih tơl rơbuh hăng răm rai hĭ? Ƀu djơ̆ tui anŭn ôh! Samơ̆ yua kơ tơlơi gơñu ngă soh, tơlơi pơklaih truh laih kơ ƀing djuai tuai, kiăng ngă brơi kơ ƀing Israel gar kơtưn. 
But if their fall [be the] world's wealth, and their loss [the] wealth of [the] nations, how much rather their fulness? @ Tui anŭn tơdah tơlơi gơñu ngă soh anŭn pơjing pơdrŏng brơi kơ lŏn tơnah, laih anŭn tơdah tơlơi gơñu rơbuh pơjing tơlơi pơdrŏng kơ ƀing djuai tuai, ƀai jai yơh tơlơi pơdrŏng sah hloh dơ̆ng či truh tơdah abih bang ƀing gơñu wơ̆t glaĭ kơ Ơi Adai dơ̆ng!
For I speak to you, the nations, inasmuch as *I* am apostle of nations, I glorify my ministry; @ Ră anai kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih ơ ƀing djuai tuai, tơdang kâo ăt dŏ jing khua ding kơna kơ ƀing djuai tuai, kâo či pơpŭ kơdrưh kơ bruă kâo, 
if by any means I shall provoke to jealousy [them which are] my flesh, and shall save some from among them. @ kâo kiăng râo mơdưh pran jua gar kơtưn kơ ƀing kơnŭng djuai kâo, kiăng kơ hmâo đơđa mơnuih amăng ƀing gơñu dưi klaih. 
For if their casting away [be the] world's reconciliation, what [their] reception but life from among [the] dead? @ Yua kơ tơdah tơlơi Ơi Adai hrah lui gơñu jing hĭ tơlơi pơgop rơnom kơ abih lŏn tơnah, hơgĕt tơlơi či truh yua mơ̆ng tơlơi jum glaĭ gơñu? Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă jing kar hăng brơi tơlơi hơdip kơ ƀing djai laih?
Now if the first-fruit [be] holy, the lump also; and if the root [be] holy, the branches also. @ Tơdah boh blŭng hlâo pơyơr jing rơgoh hiam, tui anŭn abih bang jing rơgoh hiam kar kaĭ mơ̆n. Laih anŭn tơdah akha kơyâo pơyơr jing rơgoh hiam, abih bang than jing rơgoh hiam kar kaĭ mơ̆n. 
Now if some of the branches have been broken out, and *thou*, being a wild olive tree, hast been grafted in amongst them, and hast become a fellow-partaker of the root and of the fatness of the olive tree, @ Samơ̆ tơdah hmâo đơđa than arăng trơĭ hĭ laih, laih anŭn ih jing sa ƀĕ than ôliwơ glai, arăng pơtĕp ƀlir ƀơi anih arăng trơĭ hĭ gơ̆ laih, kiăng kơ ih dưi hmâo kơtăk hơdip mơ̆ng akha boh ôliwơ, 
boast not against the branches; but if thou boast, [it is] not *thou* bearest the root, but the root thee. @ anăm pơgao hăng than pơkŏn ôh. Tơdah ih ngă pơgao, hơdơr bĕ ƀu djơ̆ ih ôh krơ̆ng akha, samơ̆ akha krơ̆ng ih.
Thou wilt say then, The branches have been broken out in order that *I* might be grafted in. @ Ih či laĭ: “Khul than arăng hmâo trơĭ hĭ, kiăng kơ dưi pơtĕp ƀlir kâo ƀơi anih anŭn.” 
Right: they have been broken out through unbelief, and *thou* standest through faith. Be not high-minded, but fear: @ Tơlơi anŭn djơ̆ sĭt. Arăng hmâo trơĭ hĭ gơñu yua kơ tơlơi gơñu ƀu đaŏ. Samơ̆ ih kơnơ̆ng dưi dŏ kơjăp yua kơ tơlơi ih đaŏ. Tui anŭn anăm pơgao ôh, samơ̆ brơi hwĭ bĕ. 
if God indeed has not spared the natural branches; lest it might be he spare not thee either. @ Yua kơ tơdah Ơi Adai ƀu hơ-ưi ôh kơ than hơđăp, Ñu ăt ƀu či hơ-ưi kơ ih lơi. 
Behold then [the] goodness and severity of God: upon them who have fallen, severity; upon thee goodness of God, if thou shalt abide in goodness, since [otherwise] *thou* also wilt be cut away. @ Brơi ih thâo hluh bĕ tơlơi hiam klă hăng tơlơi khăng khĭp Ơi Adai: khăng khĭp hăng ƀing hmâo rơbuh laih, samơ̆ Ơi Adai ngă hiam klă kơ ih, tŭ kơ ih ăt dŏ nanao amăng tơlơi hiam klă Ñu. Tơdah ih ƀu dŏ amăng tơlơi hiam klă Ñu ôh, Ñu či trơĭ hĭ ih kar kaĭ mơ̆n. 
And *they* too, if they abide not in unbelief, shall be grafted in; for God is able again to graft them in. @ Wơ̆t kơ ƀing Yuđa kar kaĭ mơ̆n, tơdah gơñu lui hĭ tơlơi ƀu đaŏ, Ơi Adai či pơklep glaĭ gơñu dơ̆ng, yua kơ Ơi Adai hmâo tơlơi dưi pơklep glaĭ gơñu. 
For if *thou* hast been cut out of the olive tree wild by nature, and, contrary to nature, hast been grafted into the good olive tree, how much rather shall they, who are according to nature be grafted into their own olive tree? @ Yua kơ tơdah arăng hmâo trơĭ mă ih mơ̆ng phŭn ôliwơ hơđăp jing phŭn ôliwơ glai, ăt dưi mơ̆n pơklep ih hăng phŭn ôliwơ arăng pla hăng wai rơnăk, phara hăng tơlơi juăt yang đar, ƀai jai yơh amuñ hloh dơ̆ng arăng či pơklep glaĭ than sĭt amăng phŭn ôliwơ hơđăp gơñu pô.
For I do not wish you to be ignorant, brethren, of this mystery, that ye may not be wise in your own conceits, that blindness in part is happened to Israel, until the fulness of the nations be come in; @ Ơ adơi ayŏng, kâo kiăng kơ ƀing gih thâo hluh tơlơi yom hơgơ̆m anai, hwĭ kơ ƀing gih pơgao pơmĭn dah ƀing gih jing ƀing mơnuih kơhnâo, anŭn jing: sa črăn amăng ƀing Israel ăt dŏ khăng pran jua, tơl mrô ƀing djuai tuai mŭt tum laih tui hăng Ơi Adai hmâo pơkơčah. 
and so all Israel shall be saved. According as it is written, The deliverer shall come out of Zion; he shall turn away ungodliness from Jacob. @ Giơ̆ng kơ anŭn kah abih bang ƀing ană Israel či klaih; tui hăng Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp hmâo čih:
“Pô Pơrơngai či rai mơ̆ng Siôn,
Ñu či mă pơđuaĭ hĭ tơlơi ƀu đaŏ mơ̆ng phung Yakôp.
And this is the covenant from me to them, when I shall have taken away their sins. @ Laih anŭn anai jing kơnol pơgop Kâo hmâo pơdơ̆ng laih hăng gơñu,
Tơ Kâo sut lui hĭ tơlơi soh gơñu.”
As regards the glad tidings, [they are] enemies on your account; but as regards election, beloved on account of the fathers. @ Tui hăng Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam, gơñu jing ayăt hăng Ơi Adai, tơlơi anŭn jing tơlơi tŭ yua brơi kơ ƀing gih jing ƀing djuai tuai; samơ̆ tui hăng tơlơi Ơi Adai ruah, gơñu jing phung Ơi Adai hmâo khăp laih yua kơ ƀing ơi adon gơñu. 
For the gifts and the calling of God [are] not subject to repentance. @ Yua kơ khul tơlơi Ơi Adai pha brơi laih anŭn tơlơi Ñu ruah iâu ƀu thâo plih ôh. 
For as indeed *ye* [also] once have not believed in God, but now have been objects of mercy through the unbelief of *these*; @ Kar hăng hlâo adih ƀing gih ƀu tui gưt kơ Ơi Adai ôh, samơ̆ ră anai ƀing gih hmâo laih tơlơi pap drap yua kơ tơlơi gơñu ƀu tui gưt, 
so these also have now not believed in your mercy, in order that *they* also may be objects of mercy. @ kar kaĭ mơ̆n ră anai gơñu ƀu tui gưt ôh kiăng kơ mơ̆ng tơlơi pap drap hmâo pơrơđah laih kơ ƀing gih, gơñu ăt dưi hmâo tơlơi pap drap mơ̆n. 
For God hath shut up together all in unbelief, in order that he might shew mercy to all. @ Yua kơ Ơi Adai hmâo krư̆ laih abih bang mơnuih amăng tơlơi ƀu tui gưt, kiăng kơ Ñu dưi pap drap brơi kơ abih bang.
O depth of riches both of [the] wisdom and knowledge of God! how unsearchable his judgments, and untraceable his ways! @ Aƀơih dlam đơi! Tơlơi pơdrŏng Ơi Adai, wơ̆t tơlơi kơhnâo laih anŭn tơlơi rơgơi Ñu! Hyư̆m dưi pơblang tơlơi Ñu phat kơđi laih anŭn hyư̆m dưi thâo hluh kơ khul jơlan Ñu!
For who has known [the] mind of [the] Lord, or who has been his counsellor? @ “Yua kơ hlơi dưi thâo tơlơi pơmĭn Khua Yang,
Hlơi jing pô kơčĕ brơi kơ Ñu?”
or who has first given to him, and it shall be rendered to him? @ Ƀôdah “hlơi hmâo brơi laih sa mơta mơnơ̆ng kơ Ñu hlâo,
Kiăng kơ Ñu kla glaĭ?”
For of him, and through him, and for him [are] all things: to him be glory for ever. Amen. @ Yua kơ abih mơnơ̆ng leng kơ tơbiă rai mơ̆ng Ñu, yua mơ̆ng Ñu, laih anŭn anăp nao pơ Ñu. Tơlơi ư-ang, tơlơi ang yang lơ̆m kơ Ơi Adai hlŏng lar, Amen!
I beseech you therefore, brethren, by the compassions of God, to present your bodies a living sacrifice, holy, acceptable to God, [which is] your intelligent service. @ Hnŭn yơh, Ơ adơi ayŏng, yua kơ tơlơi pap Ơi Adai, kâo pơđur kơ ƀing gih, pơyơr bĕ drơi jan ƀing gih jing mơnơ̆ng ngă yang dŏ hơdip, rơgoh hiam, laih anŭn bơmơak kơ Ơi Adai. Anŭn jing tơlơi kơkuh pơpŭ gal djơ̆ kơ ƀing gih. 
And be not conformed to this world, but be transformed by the renewing of [your] mind, that ye may prove what [is] the good and acceptable and perfect will of God. @ Anăm hla tui rơnŭk anai ôh, samơ̆ brơi Ơi Adai pơplih hĭ bĕ tơlơi hơdip ƀing gih yua mơ̆ng tơlơi Ñu pơphrâo glaĭ jua pơmĭn ƀing gih, kiăng kơ ƀing gih dưi thâo hơgĕt jing tơlơi Ơi Adai kiăng, hơgĕt ngă bơmơak kơ Ñu, laih anŭn hơgĕt jing klă tum.
For I say, through the grace which has been given to me, to every one that is among you, not to have high thoughts above what he should think; but to think so as to be wise, as God has dealt to each a measure of faith. @ Yua kơ mơ̆ng tơlơi pap Ơi Adai hmâo pha brơi laih kơ kâo, kâo laĭ hăng rĭm čô amăng ƀing gih anăm pơmĭn rơgao hlah đơi ôh kơ gih pô, samơ̆ brơi kơ rĭm čô pơmĭn djơ̆ tui hăng hơnơ̆ng tơlơi đaŏ Ơi Adai hmâo brơi laih kơ ñu. 
For, as in one body we have many members, but all the members have not the same office; @ Yua kơ kar hăng amăng sa drơi jan, ƀing ta hmâo lu črăn, laih anŭn abih bang črăn anŭn ngă bruă phara phara, 
thus we, [being] many, are one body in Christ, and each one members one of the other. @ ăt kar kaĭ mơ̆n, ƀing ta wơ̆t dah jing lu, samơ̆ kơnơ̆ng jing sa drơi jan amăng Krist đôč; laih anŭn rĭm čô ƀing ta jing črăn phara phara amăng sa drơi jan. 
But having different gifts, according to the grace which has been given to us, whether [it be] prophecy, [let us prophesy] according to the proportion of faith; @ Ƀing ta hmâo tơlơi pha brơi phara phara tui hăng tơlơi pap Ơi Adai hmâo brơi laih kơ ƀing ta. Kơ hlơi pô hmâo tơlơi pha brơi tơlơi laĭ lui hlâo, brơi ñu laĭ lui hlâo djơ̆ tui hăng hơnơ̆ng tơlơi đaŏ ñu; 
or service, [let us occupy ourselves] in service; or he that teaches, in teaching; @ kơ hlơi pô buih bruă, brơi ñu buih bruă yơh; hlơi pô jing nai pơtô brơi ñu pơtô bĕ; 
or he that exhorts, in exhortation; he that gives, in simplicity; he that leads, with diligence; he that shews mercy, with cheerfulness. @ Hlơi pô thâo pơtrŭt pơđĭ pran jua, brơi ñu pơđĭ pran jua arăng bĕ; hlơi pô thâo pha brơi gơnam, brơi ñu pha brơi hăng tơlơi čơmah; hlơi pô jing khua wai lăng, brơi ñu hur har wai lăng hiam bĕ; hlơi pô ngă bruă tơlơi pap, brơi ñu ngă bĕ hăng tơlơi hơ̆k mơak.
Let love be unfeigned; abhorring evil; cleaving to good: @ Tơlơi khăp ƀing gih khŏm jing tơpă sĭt. Bơrơmŭt bĕ kơ tơlơi sat, djă kơjăp hơgĕt jing tơlơi hiam. 
as to brotherly love, kindly affectioned towards one another: as to honour, each taking the lead in paying it to the other: @ Brơi ƀing gih khăp bĕ kơ tơdruă ƀing gih kar hăng adơi ayŏng; pơpŭ bĕ kơ tơdruă ƀing gih hăng abih pran jua. 
as to diligent zealousness, not slothful; in spirit fervent; serving the Lord. @ Mă bruă triăng bĕ, anăm dŏ alah ôh. Mă bruă bĕ kơ Khua Yang hăng pran jua hur har. 
As regards hope, rejoicing: as regards tribulation, enduring: as regards prayer, persevering: @ Hơ̆k mơak bĕ amăng tơlơi čang rơmang, gir amăng tơlơi tơnap tap, laih anŭn dŏ kơjăp amăng tơlơi iâu laĭ. 
distributing to the necessities of the saints; given to hospitality. @ Pha brơi bĕ kơ ƀing rơgoh hiam mơnơ̆ng gơñu kiăng, brơi kơ ƀing gih thâo tŭ jum tuai.
Bless them that persecute you; bless, and curse not. @ Hơơč mơyun bĕ kơ hlơi pô ngă sat kơ ƀing gih; hơơč tơlơi hiam kơ gơñu, anăm hơtơ̆m pah ôh. 
Rejoice with those that rejoice, weep with those that weep. @ Hơ̆k mơak bĕ hăng ƀing hơ̆k mơak, čŏk hia bĕ hăng ƀing čŏk hia. 
Have the same respect one for another, not minding high things, but going along with the lowly: be not wise in your own eyes: @ Brơi ƀing gih hơdip rơnom hăng tơdruă ƀing gih; anăm hmâo tơlơi pơmĭn pơgao ôh, samơ̆ lir pơgop bĕ hăng ƀing ƀu rup rap. Anăm yap ƀing gih pô jing kơhnâo ôh.
recompensing to no one evil for evil: providing things honest before all men: @ Anăm pơglaĭ tơlơi sat kơ tơlơi sat arăng ôh, samơ̆ gir ngă bĕ bruă hiam ƀơi anăp abih bang mơnuih. 
if possible, as far as depends on you, living in peace with all men; @ Tơdah dưi, gir hơdip rơnom bĕ hăng abih bang mơnuih. 
not avenging yourselves, beloved, but give place to wrath; for it is written, Vengeance [belongs] to me, *I* will recompense, saith the Lord. @ Ơ ƀing kâo khăp hơeng, anăm ƀing gih rŭ nua kơ arăng ôh, samơ̆ jao hĭ bĕ tơlơi anŭn kơ tơlơi Ơi Adai hil. Yua kơ Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp hmâo čih laih: “Tơlơi rŭ nua lơ̆m kơ Kâo; Kâo či pơglaĭ brơi, Khua Yang laĭ.” 
If therefore thine enemy should hunger, feed him; if he should thirst, give him drink; for, so doing, thou shalt heap coals of fire upon his head. @ Samơ̆: “tơdah pô ayăt ih rơpa brơi bĕ ñu ƀơ̆ng; tơdah ñu mơhao, brơi bĕ ñu mơñum, yua kơ ngă tui anŭn ƀu phara ôh ih pioh anga apui ƀơi akŏ ñu.” 
Be not overcome by evil, but overcome evil with good. @ Anăm brơi tơlơi sat dưi hăng ih ôh, samơ̆ brơi tơlơi hiam ih ngă dưi hĭ hăng tơlơi sat.
Let every soul be subject to the authorities that are above [him]. For there is no authority except from God; and those that exist are set up by God. @ Brơi abih bang mơnuih khŏm gưt kơ tơlơi dưi kơnuk kơna. Yua kơ ƀu hmâo ôh tơlơi dưi wai lăng pă ƀu hmâo tơbiă rai mơ̆ng Ơi Adai, laih anŭn tơlơi dưi wai lăng leng kơ tơbiă rai mơ̆ng Ơi Adai hmâo pơdưm brơi laih. 
So that he that sets himself in opposition to the authority resists the ordinance of God; and they who [thus] resist shall bring sentence of guilt on themselves. @ Yua kơ anŭn, hlơi pô pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ hăng tơlơi dưi kơnuk kơna, ñu anŭn pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ tơlơi Ơi Adai hmâo pơdưm brơi. Laih anŭn hlơi pô pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ či tŭ tơlơi phat kơđi kơ ñu pô. 
For rulers are not a terror to a good work, but to an evil [one]. Dost thou desire then not to be afraid of the authority? practise [what is] good, and thou shalt have praise from it; @ Yua kơ ƀing khua wai lăng ƀu ngă pơhwĭ kơ ƀing ngă hiam ôh, samơ̆ kơ ƀing ngă sat. Ih kiăng mơ̆ ƀu hwĭ ôh kơ khua wai lăng? Tui anŭn ngă hiam bĕ laih anŭn ih či hmâo tơlơi gơñu bơni. 
for it is God's minister to thee for good. But if thou practisest evil, fear; for it bears not the sword in vain; for it is God's minister, an avenger for wrath to him that does evil. @ Yua kơ ƀing khua moa jing ding kơna kơ Ơi Adai kiăng ngă tơlơi hiam kơ ih. Samơ̆ tơdah ih ngă tơlơi sat, hwĭ bĕ: yua kơ gơñu djă đao gưm ƀu djơ̆ đôč đač ôh. Yua kơ gơñu jing ding kơna kơ Ơi Adai ngă bruă tơlơi Ơi Adai hil, phak pơkra kơ hlơi pô ngă tơlơi soh sat. 
Wherefore it is necessary to be subject, not only on account of wrath, but also on account of conscience. @ Tui anŭn brơi kơ ƀing gih khŏm gưt kơ ƀing khua wai lăng, ƀu djơ̆ kơnơ̆ng kiăng hơbĕ đuaĭ mơ̆ng tơlơi Ơi Adai hil đôč ôh, samơ̆ yua kơ pran jua tơpă mơ̆n.
For on this account ye pay tribute also; for they are God's officers, attending continually on this very thing. @ Yua kơ bruă anai mơ̆n ƀing gih khŏm duh jia, yua kơ ƀing khua wai lăng jing ƀing ding kơna Ơi Adai, kiăng kơ ngă bruă anai. 
Render to all their dues: to whom tribute [is due], tribute; to whom custom, custom; to whom fear, fear; to whom honour, honour. @ Kla glaĭ bĕ abih hơnưh ƀing gih đom kơ arăng: duh jia bĕ kơ ƀing mơnuih gih khŏm duh jia; pơđup brơi bĕ kơmlai kơ ƀing mơnuih gih khŏm pơđup brơi. Hwĭ bĕ kơ hlơi ƀing gih lăp hwĭ; pơpŭ kơ hlơi ƀing gih lăp pơpŭ.
Owe no one anything, unless to love one another: for he that loves another has fulfilled the law. @ Anăm đom hơnưh tơlơi hơgĕt kơ hlơi hlơi ôh, kơnơ̆ng đom bĕ hơnưh kơ tơlơi khăp tơdruă ƀing gih đôč; yua kơ hlơi pô khăp kơ pô jum dar ñu, ñu ngă klă tum tơlơi juăt laih. 
For, Thou shalt not commit adultery, Thou shalt not kill, Thou shalt not steal, Thou shalt not lust; and if there be any other commandment, it is summed up in this word, namely, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself. @ Tơlơi juăt pơtă: “Anăm klĕ pyu ôh; anăm pơdjai mơnuih ôh; anăm klĕ gơnam arăng ôh; anăm hưp ham ôh,” laih anŭn abih bang tơlơi juăt pơkŏn klah čŭn glaĭ amăng tơlơi anai: “Ih khŏm khăp kơ pô jum dar ih kar hăng ih khăp kơ ih pô.” 
Love works no ill to its neighbour; love therefore [is the] whole law. @ Tơlơi khăp ƀu hmâo ngă răm kơ mơnuih jum dar ôh; tui anŭn tơlơi khăp jing tơlơi ngă klă tum tơlơi juăt.
This also, knowing the time, that it is already time that *we* should be aroused out of sleep; for now [is] our salvation nearer than when we believed. @ Ngă bĕ tui anŭn, yua kơ ƀing gih thâo laih kơ rơnŭk ƀing ta dŏ hơdip. Truh laih mông ƀing gih khŏm pơdưh mơ̆ng pĭt, yua kơ hrơi anai tơlơi pơklaih giăm hăng ƀing ta hloh kơ hlăk hrơi ƀing ta phrâo đaŏ. 
The night is far spent, and the day is near; let us cast away therefore the works of darkness, and let us put on the armour of light. @ Mlam giăm rơgao, hrơi giăm rơđah. Tui anŭn brơi ƀing ta toh lui hĭ bĕ bruă tơlơi kơnăm mơmŏt laih anŭn buh ao pơsơi kơ tơlơi bơngač. 
As in the day, let us walk becomingly; not in rioting and drunkenness, not in chambering and lasciviousness, not in strife and emulation. @ Brơi ƀing ta dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă hăng tơlơi gal djơ̆ kar hăng amăng tơhrơi; anăm ngă tă tăn ƀôdah măt tơpai ôh. Anăm ngă tơlơi grĭ grañ ƀôdah tơlơi pyu pơde; anăm pơrơdjơ̆ pơrơsao ƀôdah moañ hil ôh. 
But put on the Lord Jesus Christ, and do not take forethought for the flesh to [fulfil its] lusts. @ Samơ̆ buh mă bĕ Khua Yang Yêsu Krist, laih anŭn anăm kơčăng hơduah kiăng bơmơak kơ asar đeh ôh, hăng kiăng ngă pơhrăp tơlơi amoaih hưp ñu.
Now him that is weak in the faith receive, not to [the] determining of questions of reasoning. @ Tŭ jum bĕ ƀing tơdu amăng tơlơi đaŏ, anăm pơrơjah ôh yua kơ tơlơi pơmĭn phara phara. 
One man is assured that he may eat all things; but the weak eats herbs. @ Đơđa mơnuih đaŏ ñu dưi ƀơ̆ng abih bang mơnơ̆ng, samơ̆ pô tơdu kơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng añăm pơtăm đôč. 
Let not him that eats make little of him that eats not; and let not him that eats not judge him that eats: for God has received him. @ Pô dưi ƀơ̆ng abih bang mơnơ̆ng anăm mưč kơ pô ƀu dưi ƀơ̆ng ôh; laih anŭn pô ƀu ƀơ̆ng anăm phat kơđi ôh kơ pô ƀơ̆ng, yua kơ Ơi Adai hmâo tŭ jum gơñu soh sel. 
Who art *thou* that judgest the servant of another? to his own master he stands or falls.
