And he shall be made to stand; for the Lord is able to make him stand. @ Hlơi ih jing tơl ih phat kơđi ƀing ding kơna arăng? Ñu dŏ dơ̆ng ƀôdah ñu rơbuh, anŭn jing bruă khua ñu. Samơ̆ ñu či dŏ dơ̆ng, yua kơ Khua Yang dưi brơi ñu dŏ dơ̆ng.
One man esteems day more than day; another esteems every day [alike]. Let each be fully persuaded in his own mind. @ Pô anai pơmĭn hrơi anai jing hiam hloh kơ hrơi pơkŏn, pô pơkŏn pơmĭn abih bang hrơi kar kaĭ soh sel. Brơi rĭm čô thâo klă sĭt amăng tơlơi pơmĭn ñu pô. 
He that regards the day, regards it to [the] Lord. And he that eats, eats to [the] Lord, for he gives God thanks; and he that does not eat, [it is] to [the] Lord he does not eat, and gives God thanks. @ Hlơi hơdơr pơpŭ kơ sa hrơi, ñu ngă tui anŭn kiăng pơpŭ kơ Khua Yang. Kar kaĭ mơ̆n hlơi pô ƀơ̆ng, ñu ƀơ̆ng kiăng pơpŭ kơ Khua Yang mơ̆n, yua kơ gơñu leng bơni hơơč kơ Ơi Adai; tơdang sa čô ƀu ƀơ̆ng ôh, ñu ƀu ƀơ̆ng kiăng pơpŭ kơ Khua Yang laih anŭn ñu ăt bơni hơơč kơ Ơi Adai mơ̆n. 
For none of us lives to himself, and none dies to himself. @ Ƀu hmâo ôh sa čô amăng ƀing ta hơdip kơ ñu pô, ƀôdah djai kơ ñu pô. 
For both if we should live, [it is] to the Lord we live; and if we should die, [it is] to the Lord we die: both if we should live then, and if we should die, we are the Lord's. @ Tơdah ƀing ta hơdip, ƀing ta hơdip kơ Khua Yang; laih anŭn tơdah ƀing ta djai, ƀing ta djai kơ khua Yang mơ̆n. Tui anŭn thâo dah ƀing ta dŏ hơdip ƀôdah ƀing ta djai, ăt ƀing ta leng lơ̆m kơ Khua Yang soh sel. 
For to this [end] Christ has died and lived [again], that he might rule over both dead and living. @ Yua kơ tơlơi anŭn yơh Krist hmâo djai laih anŭn hmâo hơdip glaĭ laih kiăng kơ Ñu dưi jing Khua Yang kơ ƀing djai wơ̆t kơ ƀing hơdip. 
But thou, why judgest thou thy brother? or again, thou, why dost thou make little of thy brother? for we shall all be placed before the judgment-seat of God. @ Hyư̆m ih phat kơđi kơ adơi ayŏng ih lĕ? Ƀôdah hyư̆m ih bơrơmŭt kơ adơi ayŏng ih? Yua kơ abih bang ƀing ta či dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơi anăp gre phat kơđi Ơi Adai. 
For it is written, *I* live, saith [the] Lord, that to me shall bow every knee, and every tongue shall confess to God. @ Yua kơ Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp hmâo čih:
“Khua Yang laĭ, sĭt kar hăng Kâo jing pô hơdip, abih bang tơŭt či čon ƀơi anăp kâo,
Laih anŭn abih bang jơlah či bơni hơơč kơ Ơi Adai.”
So then each of us shall give an account concerning himself to God. @ Tui anŭn rĭm čô ƀing ta či pơhaih bruă ta pô ƀơi anăp Ơi Adai.
Let us no longer therefore judge one another; but judge ye this rather, not to put a stumbling-block or a fall-trap before his brother. @ Tui anŭn, anăm ƀing ta phat kơđi tơdruă ƀing ta ôh, samơ̆ hiam hloh khư̆p ư anăm ngă tơhnač ƀôdah pơgŭn jơlan kơ adơi ayŏng ƀing ta ôh. 
I know, and am persuaded in the Lord Jesus, that nothing is unclean of itself; except to him who reckons anything to be unclean, to that man [it is] unclean. @ Amăng Khua Yang Yêsu, kâo thâo sĭt ƀu hmâo mơnơ̆ng hơgĕt jing pơgrĭ mă ñu pô ôh; samơ̆ hlơi pô pơmĭn kơ mơnơ̆ng anŭn jing grĭ, ñu jing grĭ kơ pô anŭn. 
For if on account of meat thy brother is grieved, thou walkest no longer according to love. Destroy not him with thy meat for whom Christ has died. @ Tơdah mơnơ̆ng ih ƀơ̆ng ngă pơrơngot hĭ kơ ƀing adơi ayŏng ih, ih ƀu hmâo rơbat amăng tơlơi khăp dơ̆ng ôh. Anăm ôh yua kơ mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă ngă pơrơngiă hĭ sa čô mơnuih Krist hmâo djai pơala. 
Let not then your good be evil spoken of; @ Anăm brơi ôh tơlơi ih ngă hiam anŭn jing hĭ tơlơi arăng pơhiăp sat. 
for the kingdom of God is not eating and drinking, but righteousness, and peace, and joy in [the] Holy Spirit. @ Yua kơ dêh čar pơtao Ơi Adai ƀu djơ̆ tơlơi ƀơ̆ng mơñum ôh, samơ̆ tơlơi tơpă, tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua, laih anŭn tơlơi hơ̆k mơak amăng Yang Bơngăt Hiam. 
For he that in this serves the Christ [is] acceptable to God and approved of men. @ Hlơi pô mă bruă kơ Krist kar hăng anŭn, ñu ngă bơmơak kơ Ơi Adai laih; laih anŭn hmâo tơlơi ană mơnuih pơpŭ.
So then let us pursue the things which tend to peace, and things whereby one shall build up another. @ Tui anŭn brơi ƀing ta tui hơduah bĕ khul tơlơi ba glaĭ tơlơi rơnom laih anŭn tơlơi dưi pơdơ̆ng kơjăp tơdruă. 
For the sake of meat do not destroy the work of God. All things indeed [are] pure; but [it is] evil to that man who eats while stumbling [in doing so]. @ Anăm pơrai hĭ ôh bruă Ơi Adai yua kơ mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă. Abih bang mơnơ̆ng leng kơ rơgoh hiam, soh sel, samơ̆ tơdah yua kơ mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă ih ngă brơi pô pơkŏn tơhnač, ih jing soh yơh. 
[It is] right not to eat meat, nor drink wine, nor [do anything] in which thy brother stumbles, or is offended, or is weak. @ Hiam hloh anăm ƀơ̆ng mơnơ̆ng, anăm mơñum tơpai ƀôdah ngă tơlơi hơgĕt pơkŏn ngă tơhnač kơ adơi ayŏng ih. 
Hast *thou* faith? have [it] to thyself before God. Blessed [is] he who does not judge himself in what he allows. @ Hơdơ̆ tơlơi đaŏ ih hmâo, brơi ih djă pioh bĕ kơ ih pô hơdơ̆ anŭn mơ̆n ƀơi anăp Ơi Adai. Mơyun hiam yơh kơ hlơi pô ngă sa mơta bruă laih anŭn ñu thâo sĭt bruă anŭn ƀu soh ôh. 
But he that doubts, if he eat, is condemned; because [it is] not of faith; but whatever [is] not of faith is sin. @ Samơ̆ hlơi pô đing ăt dŏ ƀơ̆ng, ñu soh laih, yua kơ ñu ƀu ƀơ̆ng hăng tơlơi đaŏ ôh. Yua kơ hơgĕt tơlơi arăng ngă ƀu djơ̆ mơ̆ng tơlơi đaŏ ôh leng kơ jing soh yơh.
But *we* ought, we that are strong, to bear the infirmities of the weak, and not to please ourselves. @ Ƀing ta jing ƀing kơtang amăng tơlơi đaŏ, khŏm ƀing ta djru gui ba bĕ tơlơi kơtraŏ kơ ƀing tơdu, anăm kơnơ̆ng ngă bơmơak kơ pô ta đôč ôh. 
Let each one of us please his neighbour with a view to what is good, to edification. @ Brơi rĭm čô amăng ƀing ta ngă bơmơak kơ mơnuih jum dar ƀing ta, kiăng djru brơi tơlơi hiam kơ gơñu laih anŭn pơdơ̆ng kơjăp tơlơi đaŏ gơñu. 
For the Christ also did not please himself; but according as it is written, The reproaches of them that reproach thee have fallen upon me. @ Yua kơ wơ̆t Yang Krist ăt ƀu hmâo ngă bơmơak kơ Ñu pô ôh; kar hăng hră Ơi Adai pơhiăp hmâo čih laih: “Tơlơi arăng hơtoh djraĭ kơ ih hmâo lĕ laih ƀơi kâo.” 
For as many things as have been written before have been written for our instruction, that through endurance and through encouragement of the scriptures we might have hope. @ Yua kơ abih bang tơlơi hmâo čih laih mơ̆ng đưm leng kơ kiăng pơtô pơhrăm ƀing ta, kiăng kơ yua mơ̆ng tơlơi kơjăp hơđơ̆ng laih anŭn tơlơi alum pơđur mơ̆ng Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp hmâo čih laih brơi kơ ƀing ta hmâo tơlơi čang rơmang. 
Now the God of endurance and of encouragement give to you to be like-minded one toward another, according to Christ Jesus; @ Rơkâo kơ Ơi Adai, Pô jing tơlơi kơjăp hơđơ̆ng laih anŭn tơlơi alum pơđur brơi kơ ƀing gih dưi dŏ hơdip pơgop rơnom tơdruă ƀing gih, hla tui Yêsu Krist, 
that ye may with one accord, with one mouth, glorify the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ. @ kiăng kơ ƀing gih hrŏm hơbĭt sa hiăp jua dưi pơpŭ bơni hơơč kơ Ơi Adai, Ama kơ Khua Yang ƀing ta Yêsu Krist.
Wherefore receive ye one another, according as the Christ also has received you to [the] glory of God. @ Tui anŭn tŭ jum bĕ tơdruă ƀing gih, kar hăng Krist hmâo tŭ jum laih ƀing gih kiăng ngă ư-ang kơ Ơi Adai. 
For I say that Jesus Christ became a minister of [the] circumcision for [the] truth of God, to confirm the promises of the fathers; @ Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing gih, Yang Krist hmâo jing laih ding kơna kơ ƀing khăt klĭ kiăng pơrơđah tơlơi sĭt Ơi Adai, kiăng pơsĭt tơlơi Ñu hmâo ƀuăn laih kơ ƀing ơi adon ƀing ta, 
and that the nations should glorify God for mercy; according as it is written, For this cause I will confess to thee among [the] nations, and will sing to thy name. @ laih anŭn kiăng kơ ƀing djuai tuai dưi pơ-ư pơang kơ Ơi Adai yua kơ tơlơi pap drap Ñu. Tui hăng hră Ơi Adai pơhiăp hmâo čih laih:
“Yua kơ anŭn yơh, Kâo či pơ-ư bơni kơ Ih ƀơi tơ̆ng krah phung tuai,
Laih anŭn hơơč pơpŭ kơ anăn Ih.”
And again he says, Rejoice, nations, with his people. @ Laih anŭn hră Ơi Adai pơhiăp laĭ dơ̆ng:
“Ơ ƀing djuai tuai, hơ̆k mơak bĕ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng phung ană plei pla Ơi Adai”;
And again, Praise the Lord, all [ye] nations, and let all the peoples laud him. @ laih anŭn laĭ dơ̆ng mơ̆n,
“Ơ abih bang ƀing djuai tuai, pơ-ư bơni bĕ kơ Khua Yang,
Laih anŭn brơi abih bang ƀing ană plei pla pơpŭ bơni kơ Ñu”;
And again, Esaias says, There shall be the root of Jesse, and one that arises, to rule over [the] nations: in him shall [the] nations hope. @ laih anŭn Êsai ăt laĭ dơ̆ng:
“Mơ̆ng akha Yêsê či tơbiă rai,
Jing Pô či tơgŭ đĭ wai lăng phung tuai;
Amăng Ñu djuai tuai či hmâo tơlơi čang rơmang.”
Now the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing, so that ye should abound in hope by [the] power of [the] Holy Spirit. @ Rơkâo kơ Ơi Adai, jing phŭn kơ tơlơi čang rơmang, pơbă ƀing gih hăng abih tơlơi hơ̆k mơak laih anŭn tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua amăng tơlơi đaŏ, kiăng kơ mơ̆ng tơlơi dưi mơyang Yang Bơngăt Hiam ƀing gih dưi hmâo tơlơi čang rơmang rơbeh blai.
But I am persuaded, my brethren, I myself also, concerning you, that yourselves also are full of goodness, filled with all knowledge, able also to admonish one another. @ Ơ ƀing adơi ayŏng, kâo pô hmâo đaŏ sĭt kơ ƀing gih hmâo bă laih hăng pran jua thâo khăp, bă hăng tơlơi thâo hluh, laih anŭn dưi pơhrăm kơ tơdruă ƀing gih. 
But I have written to you the more boldly, [brethren,] in part, as putting you in mind, because of the grace given to me by God, @ Wơ̆t dah tui anŭn, amăng hră kâo mơit kơ ƀing gih, hmâo đơđa tơlơi kâo pơhiăp kơtang ƀiă, kơnơ̆ng kiăng pơhơdơr kơ ƀing gih đôč yua kơ tơlơi pap Ơi Adai hmâo brơi laih kơ kâo, 
for me to be minister of Christ Jesus to the nations, carrying on as a sacrificial service the [message of] glad tidings of God, in order that the offering up of the nations might be acceptable, sanctified by [the] Holy Spirit. @ kiăng pơjing kâo ding kơna Yêsu Krist kơ phung tuai, jing khua ngă yang amăng bruă ră ruai Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam Ơi Adai, kiăng kơ ƀing djuai tuai jing sa mơnơ̆ng pơyơr bơmơak kơ Ơi Adai, laih anŭn Yang Bơngăt Hiam pơrơgoh hiam ƀing gơñu. 
I have therefore [whereof to] boast in Christ Jesus in the things which pertain to God. @ Tui anŭn, amăng Krist Yêsu kâo hmâo tơlơi gal dưi pơ-ư bruă kâo ngă kơ Ơi Adai. 
For I will not dare to speak anything of the things which Christ has not wrought by me, for [the] obedience of [the] nations, by word and deed, @ Yua kơ kâo ƀu khĭn pơhiăp sa tơlơi hơgĕt pơkŏn ôh, gah rơngiao kơ khul tơlơi Krist hmâo ngă laih găn kâo, kiăng atăt ba djuai tuai kơ tơlơi gưt hiăp kơ Ơi Adai. Ñu hmâo ngă laih tơlơi anai hăng tơlơi pơhiăp laih anŭn bruă ngă, 
in [the] power of signs and wonders, in [the] power of [the] Spirit of God; so that I, from Jerusalem, and in a circuit round to Illyricum, have fully preached the glad tidings of the Christ; @ mơ̆ng tơlơi gru kơnăl yom pơphan dưi mơyang laih anŭn tơlơi mơsêh mơyang, mơ̆ng tơlơi dưi kơtang Yang Bơngăt Hiam Ơi Adai, kâo hmâo pơhaih laih Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam Yêsu Krist djŏp djang anih, čơdơ̆ng mơ̆ng plei Yêrusalem wơ̆t kơ plei jum dar tơl truh pơ čar Iliri. 
and so aiming to announce the glad tidings, not where Christ has been named, that I might not build upon another's foundation; @ Tui anŭn tơlơi kâo kiăng anŭn jing pơtô Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam pơ anih arăng aka hmâo pơhaih anăn Krist ôh, kiăng kơ ƀu pơdơ̆ng ƀơi atur pô pơkŏn, 
but according as it is written, To whom there was nothing told concerning him, they shall see; and they that have not heard shall understand. @ samơ̆ tui hăng hră Ơi Adai pơhiăp hmâo čih laih:
“Ƀing mơnuih arăng aka ƀu pơthâo Ñu brơi kơ gơñu, či ƀuh Ñu,
Laih anŭn ƀing mơnuih aka ƀu hmư̆ djơ̆ kơ Ñu, či thâo hluh Ñu.”
Wherefore also I have been often hindered from coming to you. @  Yua kơ anŭn yơh nanao hmâo tơlơi čơgăn hĭ kâo nao pơ ƀing gih. 
But now, having no longer place in these regions, and having great desire to come to you these many years, @ Samơ̆ ră anai ƀu hmâo bruă hơgĕt dơ̆ng tah kơ̆ng kâo amăng tring anai, laih anŭn yua kơ mơ̆ng sui thŭn laih kâo čang rơmang biă mă kiăng nao pơ ƀing gih, 
whenever I should go to Spain; (for I hope to see you as I go through, and by you to be set forward thither, if first I shall have been in part filled with your company;) @ Kâo čang rơmang či ƀuh ƀing gih tơdang kâo găn nao pơ čar Êspañ. Laih kâo mưn tơlơi hơ̆k mơak yua kơ dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing gih ƀiă hrơi, kâo kiăng kơ ƀing gih djru kâo nao pơ čar anŭn. 
but now I go to Jerusalem, ministering to the saints; @ Samơ̆ ră anai kâo nao pơ plei Yêrusalem djă ba mơnơ̆ng djru kơ ƀing rơgoh hiam. 
for Macedonia and Achaia have been well pleased to make a certain contribution for the poor of the saints who [are] in Jerusalem. @ Yua kơ ƀing đaŏ čar Masêđôn hăng čar Akai hơ̆k mơak hmâo pơđup pơyơr laih mơnơ̆ng djru kơ ƀing rơgoh hiam ƀun rin dŏ pơ plei Yêrusalem. 
They have been well pleased indeed, and they are their debtors; for if the nations have participated in their spiritual things, they ought also in fleshly to minister to them. @ Gơñu hơ̆k mơak ngă bruă anŭn, samơ̆ biă mă ñu, gơñu ăt đom hơnưh kơ ƀing gơ̆ mơ̆n, yua tơdah djuai tuai hmâo mă tŭ laih tơlơi hiam mơak mơyang mơ̆ng ƀing Yuđa, tui anŭn phiăn yơh gơñu khŏm djru ƀing gơ̆ hăng dram gơnam mơnơ̆ng mơnuă tŭ yua gah asar đeh. 
Having finished this therefore, and having sealed to them this fruit, I will set off by you into Spain. @ Tui anŭn, giơ̆ng kơ ngă bruă anai, kiăng laĭ giơ̆ng kơ jao brơi gơnam pap anai kơ ƀing gơñu laih, kâo či weh nao pơ ƀing gih hlŏng nao pơ čar Êspañ. 
But I know that, coming to you, I shall come in [the] fulness of [the] blessing of Christ. @ Kâo thâo tơ kâo nao pơ ƀing gih, kâo či ba tơlơi mơyun hiam bă blai mơ̆ng Krist hrŏm hơbĭt.
But I beseech you, brethren, by our Lord Jesus Christ, and by the love of the Spirit, that ye strive together with me in prayers for me to God; @ Ơ ƀing adơi ayŏng, yua kơ Khua Yang ƀing ta Yêsu Krist laih anŭn yua kơ tơlơi khăp mơ̆ng Yang Bơngăt Hiam, kâo kơwưh kơ ƀing gih djru pơblah hrŏm hơbĭt hăng kâo amăng tơlơi ƀing gih iâu laĭ kơ Ơi Adai yua kơ kâo, 
that I may be saved from those that do not believe in Judaea; and that my ministry which [I have] for Jerusalem may be acceptable to the saints; @ kiăng kơ kâo dưi klaih mơ̆ng ƀing mơnuih ƀu đaŏ ôh amăng čar Yuđa, laih anŭn kiăng kơ ƀing rơgoh hiam amăng plei Yêrusalem tŭ ư kơ bruă kâo ngă. 
in order that I may come to you in joy by God's will, and that I may be refreshed with you. @ Tui anŭn, tơdah djơ̆ tui hăng tơlơi Ơi Adai kiăng, kâo či truh pơ ƀing gih hăng tơlơi hơ̆k mơak laih anŭn dưi pơdơi mơak mơai hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing gih. 
And the God of peace be with you all. Amen. @ Rơkâo kơ Ơi Adai tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua, dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng abih bang ƀing gih. Amen.
But I commend to you Phoebe, our sister, who is minister of the assembly which is in Cenchrea; @ Kâo pơthâo kơ ƀing gih HʼPhêbê amai ƀing ta sa čô đah kơmơi tha sang yang Phung Sang Ơi Adai plei Sankrê. 
that ye may receive her in [the] Lord worthily of saints, and that ye may assist her in whatever matter she has need of you; for *she* also has been a helper of many, and of myself. @ Brơi ƀing gih jum ñu amăng Khua Yang tui hăng tơlơi năng lăp kơ ƀing rơgoh hiam, laih anŭn brơi ƀing gih djru ñu hơgĕt tơlơi ñu kiăng ƀing gih djru. Yua kơ ñu pô ăt hmâo djru laih lu mơnuih, djru wơ̆t kơ kâo mơ̆n.
Salute Prisca and Aquila, my fellow-workmen in Christ Jesus, @ Kâo mơit tơlơi kơkuh kơ HʼPrisil hăng Akilas ƀing gơyut mă bruă hrŏm hơbĭt hăng kâo amăng Krist Yêsu. 
(who for my life staked their own neck; to whom not *I* only am thankful, but also all the assemblies of the nations,) @ Gơñu pơsăn drơi jan kiăng pơklaih tơlơi hơdip kâo. Ƀu djơ̆ kơnơ̆ng hơjăn kâo đôč ôh bơni kơ gơñu, samơ̆ wơ̆t abih bang Phung Sang Ơi Adai amăng ƀing djuai tuai bơni hơơč kơ gơñu kar kaĭ mơ̆n. 
and the assembly at their house. Salute Epaenetus, my beloved, who is [the] first-fruits of Asia for Christ. @ Kâo mơit tơlơi kơkuh kơ Phung Sang Ơi Adai bơjơnum amăng sang gơñu kar kaĭ mơ̆n. Kâo mơit kơkuh kơ Êpanêtus pô kâo khăp hơeng, pô đaŏ kơ Krist tal blŭng hlâo amăng čar Asi. 
Salute Maria, who laboured much for you. @ Kâo mơit tơlơi kơkuh kơ HʼMari pô mă bruă gleh glăn tơ̆ng krah ƀing gih. 
Salute Andronicus and Junias, my kinsmen and fellow-captives, who are of note among the apostles; who were also in Christ before me. @ Kâo mơit tơlơi kơkuh kơ Andrônikus hăng Junias, jing phung wang kâo, ƀing arăng krư̆ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng kâo. Gơñu hmâo tơlơi hing ang tơ̆ng krah ƀing khua ding kơna, gơñu đaŏ kơ Krist hlâo kơ kâo.
Salute Amplias, my beloved in the Lord. @ Kâo mơit tơlơi kơkuh Amplias, pô kâo khăp hơeng amăng Khua Yang. 
Salute Urbanus, our fellow-workman in Christ, and Stachys, my beloved. @ Kâo mơit tơlơi kơkuh kơ Urban, gơyut mă bruă hrŏm hơbĭt hăng kâo amăng Krist, hăng Stakis pô kâo khăp. 
Salute Apelles, approved in Christ. Salute those who belong to Aristobulus. @ Kâo mơit tơlơi kơkuh kơ Apêlê, pô dŏ tŏng ten hăng Krist tơdang hmâo tơlơi lông lăng. Kâo mơit tơlơi kơkuh kơ phung wang Aristôbul. 
Salute Herodion, my kinsman. Salute those who belong to Narcissus, who are in [the] Lord. @ Kâo mơit tơlơi kơkuh kơ Hêrôdiôn, phung wang kâo. Kâo kơkuh kơ ƀing mơnuih amăng sang Narsis, jing ƀing dŏ amăng Khua Yang.
Salute Tryphaena and Tryphosa, who labour in [the] Lord. Salute Persis, the beloved, who has laboured much in [the] Lord. @ Kâo mơit tơlơi kơkuh kơ HʼTriphen hăng HʼTriphôs, ƀing mă bruă kơ Khua Yang. Kâo kơkuh kơ Pêrsis, gơyut gơyâo kâo khăp hơeng, pô hmâo mă bruă gleh glăn kơ Khua Yang. 
Salute Rufus, chosen in [the] Lord; and his mother and mine. @ Kâo mơit tơlơi kơkuh kơ Ruphus, pô Khua Yang hmâo ruah mă, laih anŭn kơkuh kơ amĭ ih ăt jing amĭ kâo mơ̆n. 
Salute Asyncritus, Phlegon, Hermes, Patrobas, Hermas, and the brethren with them. @ Kâo mơit tơlơi kơkuh kơ Asinkrit, Phalêgôn, Hêrmê, Patrôbas, Hêrmas, laih anŭn ƀing ayŏng amai adơi dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng gơñu. 
Salute Philologus, and Julia, Nereus, and his sister, and Olympas, and all the saints with them. @ Kâo mơit tơlơi kơkuh kơ Philôlôgô hăng HʼJuli, Nêrê laih anŭn amai ñu, laih anŭn Ôlimpơ, laih anŭn abih bang ƀing rơgoh hiam dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing gơñu.
Salute one another with a holy kiss. All the assemblies of Christ salute you. @ Kơkuh bĕ tơdruă ƀing gih hăng tơlơi čŭm rơgoh hiam. Abih bang Phung Sang Ơi Adai Yang Krist kơkuh čuă ngui hăng ƀing gih.
But I beseech you, brethren, to consider those who create divisions and occasions of falling, contrary to the doctrine which *ye* have learnt, and turn away from them. @ Ơ ƀing adơi ayŏng, kâo kơwưh kơ ƀing gih, răng bĕ kơ ƀing pơkah pơpha phung laih anŭn ngă tơhnač arăng, pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ hăng tơlơi pơtô ƀing gih hmâo hrăm laih, weh ataih mơ̆ng ƀing gơñu bĕ. 
For such serve not our Lord Christ, but their own belly, and by good words and fair speeches deceive the hearts of the unsuspecting. @ Yua kơ ƀing mơnuih kar hăng anŭn ƀu mă bruă kơ Krist Khua Yang ƀing ta ôh, samơ̆ mă bruă kơ hlŭng gơñu pô đôč, laih anŭn hăng tơlơi pơhiăp mơmih, hăng tơlơi plư pơhlô̆ gơñu mă pran jua ƀing mơnuih rơgoh hiam. 
For your obedience has reached to all. I rejoice therefore as it regards you; but I wish you to be wise [as] to that which is good, and simple [as] to evil. @ Yua kơ abih bang mơnuih leng kơ thâo laih kơ tơlơi ƀing gih thâo gưt hiăp, yua kơ anŭn yơh kâo hmâo tơlơi hơ̆k mơak kơ ƀing gih, kâo kiăng kơ ƀing gih rơgơi kơhnâo amăng tơlơi hiam, laih anŭn jơngeh ƀơhač kơ tơlơi sat ƀai. 
But the God of peace shall bruise Satan under your feet shortly. The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ [be] with you. @ Ơi Adai tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua či tañ juă Satan gah yŭ tơkai ƀing gih. Rơkâo tơlơi pap Khua Yang ƀing ta Yêsu Krist dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing gih.
Timotheus, my fellow-workman, and Lucius, and Jason, and Sosipater, my kinsmen, salute you. @ Timôthê, pô mă bruă hrŏm hơbĭt hăng kâo, kơkuh kơ ƀing gih. Lusius, Jason, laih anŭn Sôsipater, ƀing phung wang kâo, kơkuh kơ ƀing gih kar kaĭ mơ̆n.
I Tertius, who have written this epistle, salute you in [the] Lord. @ Kâo jing Tertius, pô čih hră anai, kơkuh kơ ƀing gih amăng Khua Yang.
Gaius, my host and of the whole assembly, salutes you. Erastus, the steward of the city, salutes you, and the brother Quartus. @  Gaius, pô tŭ jum kâo laih anŭn pô tŭ jum abih bang Phung Sang Ơi Adai amăng sang ñu, kơkuh kơ ƀing gih. Êrast, khua djă prăk plei prŏng, laih anŭn Kartus, adơi ayŏng ƀing ta, kơkuh kơ ƀing gih. 
The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ [be] with you all. Amen. @ Rơkâo tơlơi pap Khua Yang ƀing ta Yêsu Krist dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng abih bang ƀing gih. Amen.
Now to him that is able to establish you, according to my glad tidings and the preaching of Jesus Christ, according to [the] revelation of [the] mystery, as to which silence has been kept in [the] times of the ages, @ Pơpŭ bơni kơ Pô dưi pơkơjăp ƀing gih tui hăng Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam kâo laih anŭn tơlơi Yêsu Krist pơtô, tui hăng tơlơi pơrơđah tơlơi yom hơgơ̆m Ơi Adai hmâo pơdŏp laih mơ̆ng đưm adih, 
but [which] has now been made manifest, and by prophetic scriptures, according to commandment of the eternal God, made known for obedience of faith to all the nations @ samơ̆ ră anai hmâo pơrơđah laih mơ̆ng hră ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo čih brơi laih kơ abih bang djuai mơnuih thâo, tui hăng tơlơi pơđar mơ̆ng Ơi Adai Pô hơdip hlŏng lar, kiăng ba abih bang djuai mơnuih kơ tơlơi đaŏ laih anŭn gưt.
[the] only wise God, through Jesus Christ, to whom be glory for ever. Amen. @ Kơ Ơi Adai, kơnơ̆ng hơjăn Ñu đôč jing Pô kơhnâo, hmâo tơlơi ư-ang amăng abih bang rơnŭk amăng Yêsu Krist hlŏng lar! Amen.
Paul, [a] called apostle of Jesus Christ, by God's will, and Sosthenes the brother, @ Pôl, pô Ơi Adai iâu tui hăng tơlơi Ñu kiăng, brơi ñu jing sa čô khua ding kơna Krist Yêsu, laih anŭn Sôsthen, adơi ayŏng ƀing ta,
to the assembly of God which is in Corinth, to [those] sanctified in Christ Jesus, called saints, with all that in every place call on the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, both theirs and ours: @  Čih mơit kơ Phung Sang Ơi Adai kơ Ơi Adai pơ plei Kôrantô, kơ phung hmâo rơgoh hiam laih amăng Krist Yêsu, phung Ơi Adai hmâo iâu laih brơi jing phung rơgoh hiam hrŏm hơbĭt hăng abih bang ƀing mơnuih dŏ tar ƀar anih hlăk iâu kơwưh kơ anăn Khua Yang ƀing ta Yêsu Krist, Khua Yang kơ gơñu laih anŭn Khua Yang ƀing ta mơ̆n.
Grace to you and peace from God our Father, and [the] Lord Jesus Christ. @ Rơkâo kơ Ơi Adai, Ama ƀing ta laih anŭn Khua Yang Yêsu Krist brơi tơlơi pap laih anŭn tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua kơ ƀing gih.
I thank my God always about you, in respect of the grace of God given to you in Christ Jesus; @ Kâo bơni hơơč kơ Ơi Adai nanao yua kơ ƀing gih, yua kơ tơlơi pap Ñu hmâo brơi laih kơ ƀing gih amăng Krist Yêsu, 
that in everything ye have been enriched in him, in all word [of doctrine], and all knowledge, @ yua kơ amăng Ñu ƀing gih jing pơdrŏng laih amăng djŏp mơta tơlơi, wơ̆t amăng tơlơi thâo pơhiăp laih anŭn wơ̆t amăng tơlơi thâo hluh mơ̆n — 
(according as the testimony of the Christ has been confirmed in you,) @ kar hăng tơlơi ngă gơ̆ng jơlan kơ Krist ăt hmâo pơkơjăp laih amăng ƀing gih — 
so that ye come short in no gift, awaiting the revelation of our Lord Jesus Christ; @ kiăng kơ ƀing gih ƀu kơƀah ôh kơ sa mơta tơlơi Yang Bơngăt Hiam pha brơi, tơdang ƀing gih dŏ tơguan hrơi Khua Yang ƀing ta Yêsu Krist či pơrơđah Ñu pô. 
who shall also confirm you to [the] end, unimpeachable in the day of our Lord Jesus Christ. @ Ơi Adai či pơkơjăp ƀing gih tơl hrơi hnal tuč, kiăng kơ ƀu hmâo tơlơi dưi ƀuah ôh ƀơi hrơi Khua Yang ƀing ta, Yêsu Krist. 
God [is] faithful, by whom ye have been called into [the] fellowship of his Son Jesus Christ our Lord. @ Ơi Adai jing Pô hơnơ̆ng ten; Ñu Pô hmâo iâu laih ƀing gih kơ tơlơi pơgop pơlir hăng Ană Ñu, Yêsu Krist, Khua Yang ƀing ta.
Now I exhort you, brethren, by the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that ye all say the same thing, and that there be not among you divisions; but that ye be perfectly united in the same mind and in the same opinion. @ Ơ ƀing adơi ayŏng, amăng anăn Khua Yang ƀing ta Yêsu Krist kâo kơwưh kơ ƀing gih, brơi abih bang ƀing gih hrŏm sa tơlơi pơhiăp bĕ, laih anŭn anăm hmâo tơlơi pơkah pơpha phung ôh. Samơ̆ khŏm hmâo tơlơi pơgop amăng sa tơlơi pơmĭn hăng sa tơlơi anăp kơñăm. 
For it has been shewn to me concerning you, my brethren, by those of [the house of] Chloe, that there are strifes among you. @ Ơ ƀing adơi ayŏng, ƀing mơnuih amăng sang Klôe laĭ brơi kâo thâo tơ̆ng krah ƀing gih hmâo tơlơi pơrơdjơ̆ tơdruă. 
But I speak of this, that each of you says, *I* am of Paul, and *I* of Apollos, and *I* of Cephas, and *I* of Christ. @ Tơlơi kâo kiăng laĭ anŭn jing rĭm čô amăng ƀing gih laĭ: “Kâo gah kơ Pôl”, ƀôdah “Kâo gah Apôlôs,” ƀôdah “Kâo gah kơ Sêphas”, ƀôdah “Kâo gah kơ Krist”. 
Is the Christ divided? has Paul been crucified for you? or have ye been baptised unto the name of Paul? @ Krist arăng pơkah pơpha laih hă? Djơ̆ mơ̆ arăng pơ̆ng laih Pôl ƀơi kơyâo bơrơkal yua kơ ƀing gih? Djơ̆ mơ̆ ƀing gih tŭ ƀatem hăng anăn Pôl?
I thank God that I have baptised none of you, unless Crispus and Gaius, @  Kâo bơni kơ Ơi Adai yua kơ kâo ƀu hmâo ngă ƀatem kơ sa čô hlơi hlơi ôh amăng ƀing gih, kơnơ̆ng hơjăn kơ Krispus hăng Gaius đôč; 
that no one may say that I have baptised unto my own name. @ kiăng kơ ƀu hmâo hlơi dưi laĭ ƀing gih hmâo tŭ laih ƀatem amăng anăn kâo. 
Yes, I baptised also the house of Stephanas; for the rest I know not if I have baptised any other. @ (Kâo hmâo ngă ƀatem laih mơ̆n kơ ƀing sang Sêphanas. Gah rơngiao kơ anŭn, kâo ƀu thâo ôh thâo dah kâo hmâo ngă laih ƀatem kơ sa čô pô pơkŏn dơ̆ng.) 
For Christ has not sent me to baptise, but to preach glad tidings; not in wisdom of word, that the cross of the Christ may not be made vain. @ Yua kơ Krist ƀu pơkiaŏ kâo nao ngă ƀatem ôh, samơ̆ kiăng pơtô Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam, laih anŭn ƀu djơ̆ mơ̆ng tơlơi rơgơi kơhnâo pơhiăp ôh, hwĭ kơ rơngiă hĭ tơlơi dưi mơyang kơyâo bơrơkal Krist.
For the word of the cross is to them that perish foolishness, but to us that are saved it is God's power. @ Yua kơ tơlơi pơtô kơ kơyâo bơrơkal jing tơlơi mlŭk mơgu kơ ƀing răm rơngiă, samơ̆ kơ ƀing ta jing ƀing hmâo tơlơi pơklaih, anŭn jing tơlơi dưi mơyang Ơi Adai. 
For it is written, I will destroy the wisdom of the wise, and set aside the understanding of the understanding ones. @ Yua kơ hră Ơi Adai hmâo čih:
“Kâo či pơrai hĭ tơlơi kơhnâo kơ ƀing kơhnâo,
Laih anŭn Kâo či pơrơngiă hĭ tơlơi rơgơi kơ ƀing rơgơi.”
Where [is the] wise? where scribe? where disputer of this world? has not God made foolish the wisdom of the world? @  Pơpă ƀing kơhnâo lĕ? Pơpă nai pơtô tơlơi juăt lĕ? Pơpă ƀing pơrơjah pơgăl rơnŭk anai lĕ? Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă Ơi Adai hmâo ngă brơi tơlơi kơhnâo lŏn tơnah anai jing hĭ mlŭk mơgu?
For since, in the wisdom of God, the world by wisdom has not known God, God has been pleased by the foolishness of the preaching to save those that believe. @ Yua kơ amăng tơlơi kơhnâo Ơi Adai, lŏn tơnah ƀu dưi kơnang hăng tơlơi kơhnâo ñu pô ôh kiăng kơ thâo krăn Ơi Adai, samơ̆ Ơi Adai mơak kiăng yua “tơlơi pơtô mlŭk” kơ gơmơi pơtô kiăng pơklaih ƀing mơnuih đaŏ. 
Since Jews indeed ask for signs, and Greeks seek wisdom; @ Yua kơ ƀing Yuđa rơkâo gru kơnăl mơyang, laih anŭn ƀing Grek tui hơduah tơlơi kơhnâo. 
but *we* preach Christ crucified, to Jews an offence, and to nations foolishness; @ Samơ̆ gơmơi pơtô Krist arăng hmâo pơ̆ng laih ƀơi kơyâo bơrơkal jing tơlơi tơhnač kơ ƀing Yuđa, laih anŭn tơlơi mlŭk mơgu kơ ƀing djuai tuai. 
but to those that [are] called, both Jews and Greeks, Christ God's power and God's wisdom. @ Samơ̆ kơ ƀing Ơi Adai hmâo iâu mă laih, ƀing Yuđa wơ̆t ƀing Grek, Krist jing tơlơi dưi mơyang laih anŭn tơlơi kơhnâo Ơi Adai. 
Because the foolishness of God is wiser than men, and the weakness of God is stronger than men. @ Yua kơ tơlơi lăng kar hăng tơlơi mlŭk kơ Ơi Adai jing kơhnâo hloh kơ tơlơi kơhnâo ană mơnuih, laih anŭn tơlơi lăng kar hăng tơlơi tơdu kơ Ơi Adai, jing kơtang hloh kơ tơlơi kơtang ană mơnuih.
For consider your calling, brethren, that [there are] not many wise according to flesh, not many powerful, not many high-born. @ Ơ ƀing adơi ayŏng, kơsem lăng bĕ tơlơi Ơi Adai iâu ƀing gih, amăng ƀing gih ƀu hmâo ôh lu mơnuih kơhnâo tui hăng asar đeh, ƀu hmâo ôh lu ƀing hmâo tơlơi dưi, ăt kŏn hmâo lơi lu mơnuih lơ̆m kơ kơnŭng djuai pơpŭ pơyom; 
But God has chosen the foolish things of the world, that he may put to shame the wise; and God has chosen the weak things of the world, that he may put to shame the strong things; @ samơ̆ Ơi Adai hmâo ruah laih tơlơi mlŭk ƀơi lŏn tơnah kiăng pơmlâo ƀing kơhnâo. Ơi Adai hmâo ruah laih khul tơlơi tơdu ƀơi lŏn tơnah kiăng pơmlâo ƀing kơtang. 
and the ignoble things of the world, and the despised, has God chosen, [and] things that are not, that he may annul the things that are; @ Ơi Adai hmâo ruah laih khul tơlơi ƀu yom laih anŭn tơlơi arăng mưč mač ƀơi lŏn tơnah, wơ̆t tơlơi ƀu hmâo ôh, kiăng pơjing hĭ tơlơi hmâo laih jing hĭ đôč đač. 
so that no flesh should boast before God. @ Kiăng kơ ƀu hmâo ôh sa čô mơnuih dưi pơ-ư pơang ñu pô ƀơi anăp Ơi Adai. 
But of him are *ye* in Christ Jesus, who has been made to us wisdom from God, and righteousness, and holiness, and redemption; @ Ơi Adai hmâo ba ƀing gih kơ tơlơi pơgop hăng Krist Yêsu laih, laih anŭn Ơi Adai hmâo ngă brơi Krist jing hĭ tơlơi rơgơi kơ ƀing ta. Yua mơ̆ng Ñu ƀing ta hmâo tơlơi yap tơpă ƀơi anăp Ơi Adai, jing ƀing ană plei pla hiam klă Ñu laih anŭn jing mơnuih klaih rơngai yơh. 
that according as it is written, He that boasts, let him boast in [the] Lord. @ Tui anŭn, tui hăng hră Ơi Adai hmâo čih laih:
“Hlơi pô pơ-ư kơ ñu pô, brơi ñu pơ-ư bĕ amăng Khua Yang.”
And *I*, when I came to you, brethren, came not in excellency of word, or wisdom, announcing to you the testimony of God. @ Ơ ƀing adơi ayŏng, tơ kâo truh pơ ƀing gih, kâo ƀu pơhaih ôh kơ ƀing gih tơlơi yom hơgơ̆m Ơi Adai hăng boh pơhiăp dlam ƀôdah hăng tơlơi kơhnâo. 
For I did not judge [it well] to know anything among you save Jesus Christ, and *him* crucified. @ Yua kơ tơdang kâo dŏ hăng ƀing gih, kâo hmâo khư̆p ư ƀu thâo tơlơi hơgĕt pơkŏn ôh gah rơngiao kơ Yêsu Krist, laih anŭn Yêsu Krist arăng pơ̆ng ƀơi kơyâo bơrơkal. 
And *I* was with you in weakness and in fear and in much trembling; @ Kâo dŏ tơ̆ng krah ƀing gih amăng tơlơi tơdu, bă hăng tơlơi hwĭ laih anŭn tơtư̆. 
and my word and my preaching, not in persuasive words of wisdom, but in demonstration of [the] Spirit and of power; @ Boh pơhiăp laih anŭn tơlơi kâo pơtô ƀu djơ̆ hăng tơlơi pơhiăp kơhnâo kơhnăk ană mơnuih ôh, samơ̆ hăng tơlơi pơrơđah tơlơi dưi mơyang Yang Bơngăt Hiam, 
that your faith might not stand in men's wisdom, but in God's power. @ kiăng kơ tơlơi đaŏ ƀing gih ƀu pơdơ̆ng ƀơi tơlơi kơhnâo ană mơnuih ôh, samơ̆ ƀơi tơlơi dưi mơyang Ơi Adai.
But we speak wisdom among the perfect; but wisdom not of this world, nor of the rulers of this world, who come to nought. @ Samơ̆ gơmơi ăt pơtô mơ̆n tơlơi kơhnâo kơ ƀing tha laih amăng tơlơi đaŏ, samơ̆ tơlơi kơhnâo anŭn ƀu djơ̆ tui hăng rơnŭk anai, ƀôdah tơlơi kơhnâo ƀing khua wai lăng lŏn tơnah anai ôh, jing ƀing či rơgao đŭt hĭ. 
But we speak God's wisdom in [a] mystery, that hidden [wisdom] which God had predetermined before the ages for our glory: @ Samơ̆ gơmơi pơtô tơlơi kơhnâo, tơlơi yom hơgơ̆m, laih anŭn tơlơi Ơi Adai aka bơrơđah ôh, tơlơi kơhnâo anŭn Ơi Adai hmâo pơkă pioh laih mơ̆ng hlâo kơ abih bang rơnŭk brơi tơlơi guh kơang kơ ƀing ta. 
which none of the princes of this age knew, (for had they known, they would not have crucified the Lord of glory;) @ Ƀu hmâo ôh sa čô amăng ƀing khua wai lăng amăng lŏn tơnah anai thâo tơlơi anŭn; yua kơ tơdah gơñu thâo laih tơlơi anŭn, gơñu ƀu pơ̆ng hĭ ôh Khua Yang tơlơi guh kơang ƀơi kơyâo bơrơkal. 
but according as it is written, Things which eye has not seen, and ear not heard, and which have not come into man's heart, which God has prepared for them that love him, @ Samơ̆, tui hăng hră Ơi Adai hmâo čih laih:
“Hơgĕt tơlơi mơta aka ƀuh, tơngia aka hmư̆,
Laih anŭn pran jua ană mơnuih kŏn pơmĭn nao lơi,
Samơ̆ Ơi Adai hmâo pơkra pioh brơi laih kơ ƀing khăp kơ Ñu,”
but God has revealed to us by [his] Spirit; for the Spirit searches all things, even the depths of God. @ Samơ̆ Ơi Adai hmâo pơrơđah laih kơ ƀing ta khul tơlơi anŭn mơ̆ng Yang Bơngăt Hiam. Yua kơ Yang Bơngăt Hiam thâo rơđah abih bang tơlơi, wơ̆t kơ khul tơlơi dlam hơgơ̆m Ơi Adai. 
For who of men hath known the things of a man except the spirit of the man which is in him? thus also the things of God knows no one except the Spirit of God. @ Yua kơ hlơi dưi thâo tơlơi pơmĭn sa čô mơnuih, kơnơ̆ng bơngăt jua ñu pô yơh. Kar kaĭ mơ̆n ƀu hmâo hlơi dưi thâo tơlơi pơmĭn Ơi Adai ôh, kơnơ̆ng Yang Bơngăt Hiam Ơi Adai đôč. 
But *we* have received, not the spirit of the world, but the Spirit which [is] of God, that we may know the things which have been freely given to us of God: @ Ƀing ta ƀu mă tŭ bơngăt lŏn tơnah ôh, samơ̆ ƀing ta mă tŭ laih Yang Bơngăt Hiam mơ̆ng Ơi Adai, kiăng kơ ƀing ta dưi hluh tơlơi pha brơi Ơi Adai hmâo pha brơi laih kơ ƀing ta. 
which also we speak, not in words taught by human wisdom, but in those taught by the Spirit, communicating spiritual [things] by spiritual [means]. @ Laih anŭn gơmơi pơhiăp tơlơi anŭn, ƀu djơ̆ hăng boh pơhiăp mơ̆ng tơlơi kơhnâo ană mơnuih pơtô ôh, samơ̆ mơ̆ng tơlơi Yang Bơngăt Hiam pơtô, hăng boh pơhiăp mơyang pơblang khul tơlơi sĭt gah mơyang. 
But [the] natural man does not receive the things of the Spirit of God, for they are folly to him; and he cannot know [them] because they are spiritually discerned; @ Mơnuih ƀu hmâo Yang Bơngăt Hiam ƀu dưi mă tŭ ôh khul tơlơi Yang Bơngăt Hiam Ơi Adai pha brơi, yua kơ mơnuih anŭn lăng tơlơi anŭn jing tơlơi mlŭk, laih anŭn ñu ƀu dưi hluh tơlơi anŭn ôh, yua kơ hăng tơlơi pơmĭn mơyang yơh arăng dưi kơsem tơlơi anŭn. 
but the spiritual discerns all things, and *he* is discerned of no one. @ Mơnuih hmâo Yang Bơngăt Hiam dưi kơsem lăng abih bang tơlơi, samơ̆ ƀu hmâo hlơi dưi kơsem lăng ñu ôh.
For who has known the mind of [the] Lord, who shall instruct him? But *we* have the mind of Christ. @ “Yua kơ hlơi dưi thâo tơlơi pơmĭn Khua Yang,
Kiăng kơ dưi pơhrăm brơi Ñu?”
Samơ̆ ƀing ta hmâo tơlơi pơmĭn Yang Krist.
And *I*, brethren, have not been able to speak to you as to spiritual, but as to fleshly; as to babes in Christ. @ Ơ ƀing adơi ayŏng, kâo ƀu dưi pơhiăp hăng ƀing gih kar hăng pơhiăp hăng ƀing mơnuih gah bơngăt ôh, samơ̆ kar hăng mơnuih gah asar đeh, kar hăng ƀing ană nge amăng Krist. 
I have given you milk to drink, not meat, for ye have not yet been able, nor indeed are ye yet able; @ Kâo hmâo čem laih ƀing gih hăng ia tơsâo, ƀu djơ̆ hăng mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng khăng ôh. Yua kơ ƀing gih aka dưi ƀơ̆ng mơnơ̆ng khăng ôh; wơ̆t kơ ră anai ƀing gih ăt aka dưi ƀơ̆ng lơi, 
for ye are yet carnal. For whereas [there are] among you emulation and strife, are ye not carnal, and walk according to man? @ yua kơ ƀing gih ăt dŏ lơ̆m kơ asar đeh. Yua kơ amăng ƀing gih ăt dŏ hmâo tơlơi moañ hil laih anŭn tơlơi pơrơdjơ̆ pơrơsao tơdruă, tui anŭn ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă ƀing gih ăt dŏ lơ̆m gah kơ asar đeh, laih anŭn ăt dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă kar hăng mơnuih lŏn tơnah anai? 
For when one says, *I* am of Paul, and another, *I* of Apollos, are ye not men? @ Yua kơ hmâo mơnuih laĭ: “Kâo gah Pôl,” laih anŭn pô pơkŏn laĭ: “Kâo gah Apôlôs,” tui anŭn, ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă ƀing gih jing mơnuih lŏn tơnah?
Who then is Apollos, and who Paul? Ministering servants, through whom ye have believed, and as the Lord has given to each. @ Tui anŭn hlơi Apôlôs jing? Hlơi Pôl jing? Gơmơi kơnơ̆ng jing ƀing ding kơna đôč; yua kơ mơ̆ng gơñu yơh ƀing gih hmâo đaŏ laih, tui hăng Khua Yang hmâo jao laih bruă kơ rĭm čô. 
*I* have planted; Apollos watered; but God has given the increase. @ Kâo hmâo pla laih, Apôlôs hmâo tuh ia laih, samơ̆ Ơi Adai brơi čăt đĭ kơ prŏng. 
So that neither the planter is anything, nor the waterer; but God the giver of the increase. @ Tui anŭn pô pla hăng pô tuh ia ƀu jing yom ôh, samơ̆ kơnơ̆ng Ơi Adai Pô ngă brơi čăt đĭ kơ prŏng yơh jing yom. 
But the planter and the waterer are one; but each shall receive his own reward according to his own labour. @ Pô pla hăng pô tuh ia jing kar kaĭ đôč, rĭm čô či mă tŭ pri apah tui hăng bruă ñu hmâo ngă. 
For we are God's fellow-workmen; ye are God's husbandry, God's building. @ Yua kơ ƀing gơmơi jing gơyut mă bruă hrŏm hơbĭt kơ Ơi Adai, ƀing gih jing hmua kơ Ơi Adai, ƀing gih ăt jing sang kơ Ơi Adai mơ̆n.
According to the grace of God which has been given to me, as a wise architect, I have laid the foundation, but another builds upon it. But let each see how he builds upon it. @ Tui hăng tơlơi pap Ơi Adai hmâo brơi laih kơ kâo, kâo hmâo dưm atur kar hăng sa čô mơnuih kơhnăk bruă, laih anŭn pô pơkŏn dŏ pơdơ̆ng sang ƀơi atur anŭn. Brơi rĭm čô khŏm răng kơ tơlơi ñu pơdơ̆ng ƀơi atur anŭn. 
For other foundation can no man lay besides that which [is] laid, which is Jesus Christ. @ Yua kơ, ƀu hmâo hlơi dưi pơdơ̆ng sa atur pơkŏn dơ̆ng tah gah rơngiao kơ atur hmâo pơdơ̆ng laih, anŭn jing Khua Yang Yêsu Krist. 
Now if any one build upon [this] foundation, gold, silver, precious stones, wood, grass, straw, @ Tơdah arăng pơdơ̆ng ƀơi atur anŭn hăng mah, hăng prăk, hăng boh pơtâo yom, hăng kơyâo, hăng rơ̆k kro, hăng adrăng pơdai, 
the work of each shall be made manifest; for the day shall declare [it], because it is revealed in fire; and the fire shall try the work of each what it is. @ bruă rĭm čô či pơrơđah, ƀơi hrơi Khua Yang či pơrơđah brơi hyư̆m bruă anŭn jing, laih anŭn apui či pơrơđah brơi bruă anŭn, apui či lông lăng nua yom kơ bruă rĭm čô hmâo ngă laih. 
If the work of any one which he has built upon [the foundation] shall abide, he shall receive a reward. @ Tơdah bruă hlơi pô hmâo pơdơ̆ng laih ƀơi atur anŭn ăt dŏ, pô anŭn či mă tŭ pri apah. 
If the work of any one shall be consumed, he shall suffer loss, but *he* shall be saved, but so as through [the] fire. @ Tơdah bruă hlơi pô apui ƀơ̆ng hĭ, pô anŭn či rơngiă hĭ pri apah; bơ ñu pô či klaih mơ̆n, samơ̆ kar hăng tơbiă mơ̆ng apui đôč.
Do ye not know that ye are [the] temple of God, and [that] the Spirit of God dwells in you? @  Ƀing gih ƀu thâo ôh hă ƀing gih jing sang kơkuh pơpŭ kơ Ơi Adai, laih anŭn Yang Bơngăt Hiam Ơi Adai dŏ amăng ƀing gih? 
If any one corrupt the temple of God, *him* shall God destroy; for the temple of God is holy, and such are *ye*. @ Tơdah hlơi pô pơrai sang kơkuh pơpŭ kơ Ơi Adai, Ơi Adai či pơrai hĭ ñu. Yua kơ sang kơkuh pơpŭ kơ Ơi Adai jing rơgoh hiam, laih anŭn ƀing gih jing sang kơkuh pơpŭ anŭn.
Let no one deceive himself: if any one thinks himself to be wise among you in this world, let him become foolish, that he may be wise. @ Anăm hlơi ƀlor mă ñu pô ôh. Tơdah sa čô amăng ƀing gih pơmĭn ñu jing kơhnâo tui hăng rơnŭk anai, brơi ñu jing hĭ sa čô mlŭk, kiăng kơ ñu dưi jing kơhnâo. 
For the wisdom of this world is foolishness with God; for it is written, He who takes the wise in their craftiness. @ Yua kơ Ơi Adai yap tơlơi kơhnâo lŏn tơnah anai jing tơlơi mlŭk. Kar hăng hră Ơi Adai hmâo čih laih:
“Ơi Adai mă ƀing mơnuih kơhnâo
Amăng tơlơi mơneč gơñu pô,”
And again, [The] Lord knows the reasonings of the wise that they are vain. @  Laih anŭn,
“Khua Yang thâo tơlơi pơmĭn ƀing kơhnâo
Leng kơ jing đôč đač.”
So that let no one boast in men; for all things are yours. @ Tui anŭn, anăm hlơi pơ-ư pơang kơ bruă ană mơnuih ngă ôh. Yua kơ abih bang tơlơi leng kơ lơ̆m kơ ƀing gih soh sel, 
Whether Paul, or Apollos, or Cephas, or [the] world, or life, or death, or things present, or things coming, all are yours; @ thâo dah Pôl, Apôlôs, Sêphas, lŏn tơnah, tơlơi hơdip, tơlơi djai, rơnŭk anai, ƀôdah rơnŭk tơdơi, abih bang leng kơ lơ̆m kơ ƀing gih soh sel. 
and *ye* [are] Christ's, and Christ [is] God's. @ Laih anŭn ƀing gih lơ̆m kơ Krist; laih anŭn Krist lơ̆m kơ Ơi Adai.
Let a man so account of us as servants of Christ, and stewards of [the] mysteries of God. @ Tui anŭn, abih bang mơnuih lăng bĕ ƀing gơmơi kar hăng ƀing ding kơna Krist, laih anŭn ƀing ngă bruă wai lăng khul tơlơi yom hơgơ̆m Ơi Adai. 
Here, further, it is sought in stewards, that a man be found faithful. @ Tơlơi arăng kiăng khŏm kơ hmâo ƀơi mơnuih ngă bruă wai lăng anŭn jing khŏm tŏng ten. 
But for me it is the very smallest matter that I be examined of you or of man's day. Nor do I even examine myself. @ Bơ kâo, kâo ƀu yap yom ôh kơ tơlơi ƀing gih ƀôdah ƀing mơnuih pơkŏn phat kơđi kâo. Kâo pô ăt kŏn phat kơđi kâo pô lơi. 
For I am conscious of nothing in myself; but I am not justified by this: but he that examines me is the Lord. @ Kâo ƀu ƀuh ôh sa mơta tơlơi soh glaĭ amăng kâo, samơ̆ ƀu djơ̆ yua kơ tơlơi anŭn kâo hmâo laih tơlơi yap tơpă hơnơ̆ng. Khua Yang jing Pô phat kơđi kâo. 
So that do not judge anything before [the] time, until the Lord shall come, who shall also both bring to light the hidden things of darkness, and shall make manifest the counsels of hearts; and then shall each have [his] praise from God. @ Tui anŭn, anăm phat kơđi arăng ôh hlâo kơ hrơi pơkơčah, hlâo kơ Khua Yang truh. Ñu či ngă rơđah abih bang tơlơi hmâo pơdŏp laih amăng tơlơi kơnăm mơmŏt, laih anŭn či pơrơđah tơlơi pran jua arăng ruah. Hlăk anŭn rĭm čô či mă tŭ tơlơi Ơi Adai bơni lăp kơ ñu.
Now these things, brethren, I have transferred, in their application, to myself and Apollos, for your sakes, that ye may learn in us the [lesson of] not [letting your thoughts go] above what is written, that ye may not be puffed up one for [such a] one against another. @ Ơ ƀing adơi ayŏng, yua kơ tơlơi tŭ yua kơ ƀing gih, kâo hmâo hrăm mă laih khul tơlơi anai kơ kâo pô laih anŭn kơ Apôlôs, kiăng kơ ƀing gih dưi hrăm mơ̆ng gơmơi tơlơi kiăng laĭ kơ boh pơhiăp: “Anăm rơgao hĭ tơlơi hmâo čih laih,” kiăng kơ ƀu hmâo ôh sa čô amăng ƀing gih ngă tơlơi pơgao hluai tui pô anai pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ hăng pô pơkŏn. 
For who makes thee to differ? and what hast thou which thou hast not received? but if also thou hast received, why boastest thou as not receiving? @ Hlơi ngă brơi kơ ih yom hloh kơ pô pơkŏn? Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă Ơi Adai hmâo brơi laih ih abih mơnơ̆ng ih hmâo? Tơdah ih mă tŭ laih tơlơi anŭn, hyư̆m ih pơ-ư pơang kơ ih pô kar hăng ih aka mă tŭ ôh lĕ?
Already ye are filled; already ye have been enriched; ye have reigned without us; and I would that ye reigned, that *we* also might reign with you. @ Ƀing gih hmâo djŏp tum laih! Ƀing gih jing pơdrŏng laih! Ƀing gih jing khua wai lăng yơh, ƀu kiăng gơmơi dơ̆ng tah! Sĭt biă mă kâo kiăng kơ ƀing gih jing khua wai lăng, tui anŭn gơmơi dưi wai lăng hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing gih! 
For I think that God has set us the apostles for the last, as appointed to death. For we have become a spectacle to the world, both to angels and men. @ Yua kơ kâo pơmĭn Ơi Adai hmâo dưm gơmơi ƀing khua ding kơna jing ƀing ƀơi rơnuč tuč hloh kơ abih bang mơnuih, kar hăng ƀing arăng klă kơđi kơ tơlơi pơdjai. Yua kơ gơmơi jing hĭ mơnơ̆ng klao kơ lŏn tơnah, kơ ƀing ling jang laih anŭn kơ ană mơnuih. 
*We* [are] fools for Christ's sake, but *ye* prudent in Christ: *we* weak, but *ye* strong: *ye* glorious, but *we* in dishonour. @ Gơmơi jing ƀing mơnuih mlŭk mơgu yua kơ Krist, samơ̆ ƀing gih jing kơhnâo amăng Krist. Gơmơi jing tơdu, samơ̆ ƀing gih jing kơtang. Ƀing gih hmâo tơlơi arăng pơpŭ, samơ̆ gơmơi arăng mưč mač. 
To the present hour we both hunger and thirst, and are in nakedness, and buffeted, and wander without a home, @ Hlŏng truh pơ ră anai, gơmơi tŭ tơlơi rơpa, mơhao, sum ao tơĭ, arăng ngă sat kơ gơmơi, laih anŭn gơmơi hyu rưng djŏp anih, 
and labour, working with our own hands. Railed at, we bless; persecuted, we suffer [it]; @ gơmơi gleh glăn mă bruă hăng tơngan gơmơi pô. Tơ arăng hơtoh djraĭ, gơmơi hơơč mơyun; tơ arăng ngă sat, gơmơi gir añ; 
insulted, we entreat: we are become as [the] offscouring of the world, [the] refuse of all, until now. @ tơdang arăng pơhiăp sat, gơmơi pơhiăp hiam glaĭ; hlŏng truh pơ ră anai gơmơi jing hĭ djah kơ lŏn tơnah, aru kơ ană mơnuih!
Not [as] chiding do I write these things to you, but as my beloved children I admonish [you]. @ Kâo čih hơdôm tơlơi anai ƀu djơ̆ kiăng pơmlâo ƀing gih ôh, samơ̆ kiăng pơtô pơđur ƀing gih kar hăng ƀing ană kâo khăp hơeng. 
For if ye should have ten thousand instructors in Christ, yet not many fathers; for in Christ Jesus *I* have begotten you through the glad tidings. @ Wơ̆t dah ƀing gih hmâo lu rơbâo ƀing atăt gai amăng Krist, samơ̆ ƀing gih ƀu hmâo lu ama ôh. Yua kơ kâo jing laih ama kơ ƀing gih amăng Yêsu Krist yua mơ̆ng Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam. 
I entreat you therefore, be my imitators. @ Tui anŭn kâo pơtrŭt ƀing gih: Brơi hla tui kâo bĕ. 
For this reason I have sent to you Timotheus, who is my beloved and faithful child in [the] Lord, who shall put you in mind of my ways [as] they [are] in Christ, according as I teach everywhere in every assembly. @ Yua kơ anŭn yơh kâo pơkiaŏ Timôthê nao pơ ƀing gih. Ñu jing ană kâo khăp hơeng laih anŭn tŏng ten amăng Khua Yang. Kâo kiăng ñu pơhơdơr kơ ƀing gih hyư̆m tơlơi kâo dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă amăng Krist, kar hăng kâo juăt pơtô tơlơi anŭn amăng Phung Sang Ơi Adai pơ djŏp anih.
But some have been puffed up, as if I were not coming to you; @ Hmâo đơđa amăng ƀing gih pơgao, yua kơ pơmĭn dah kâo ƀu či truh pơ ƀing gih ôh. 
but I will come quickly to you, if the Lord will; and I will know, not the word of those that are puffed up, but the power. @ Samơ̆ tơdah Khua Yang kiăng, kâo či truh tañ pơ ƀing gih; laih anŭn kâo či thâo ƀu djơ̆ kơnơ̆ng tơlơi pơhiăp ƀing pơgao anŭn đôč ôh, samơ̆ wơ̆t kơ tơlơi dưi mơyang ƀing gơñu mơ̆n. 
For the kingdom of God [is] not in word, but in power. @ Yua kơ dêh čar pơtao Ơi Adai ƀu djơ̆ pơrơđah amăng boh pơhiăp ôh, samơ̆ mơ̆ng tơlơi dưi mơyang. 
What will ye? that I come to you with a rod; or in love, and [in] a spirit of meekness? @ Hơgĕt tơlơi ƀing gih kiăng? Ƀing gih kiăng kâo nao pơ ƀing gih hăng sa ƀĕ gai hnuăt, ƀôdah hăng tơlơi khăp laih anŭn hăng pran jua tơdu rơun?
It is universally reported [that there is] fornication among you, and such fornication as [is] not even among the nations, so that one should have his father's wife. @  Hmư̆ hing hmâo tơlơi rih răm tơ̆ng krah ƀing gih, tơlơi rih răm kar hăng anŭn arăng aka ƀuh djơ̆ ôh wơ̆t dah tơ̆ng krah ƀing djuai tuai: hmâo mơnuih đih hăng bơnai ama ñu. 
And *ye* are puffed up, and ye have not rather mourned, in order that he that has done this deed might be taken away out of the midst of you. @ Laih anŭn ƀing gih ăt dŏ pơgao dơ̆ng! Djơ̆ biă mă ƀing gih khŏm rơngot! Brơi ƀing gih sut lui hĭ pô ngă tơlơi anŭn mơ̆ng tơ̆ng krah ƀing gih. 
For *I*, [as] absent in body but present in spirit, have already judged as present, @ Yua kơ wơ̆t dah drơi jan kâo rơkut, bơngăt jua kâo ăt dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing gih. Kâo klă kơđi laih pô ngă tơlơi soh anŭn kar hăng kâo hmâo ƀô̆ mơta pơ anŭn. 
[to deliver,] in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ (ye and my spirit being gathered together, with the power of our Lord Jesus Christ), him that has so wrought this: @ Tơ ƀing gih pơƀŭt glaĭ hrŏm hơbĭt, bơngăt jua kâo ăt pơgop hrŏm hơbĭt hăng tơlơi dưi mơyang Khua Yang Yêsu ƀing ta; amăng anăn Khua Yang Yêsu. 
to deliver him, [I say,] [being] such, to Satan for destruction of the flesh, that the spirit may be saved in the day of the Lord Jesus. @ Brơi ƀing gih jao hĭ mơnuih kar hăng anŭn kơ Satan pơrai hĭ drơi jan ñu, kiăng kơ bơngăt ñu dưi klaih amăng hrơi Khua Yang Yêsu.
Your boasting [is] not good. Do ye not know that a little leaven leavens the whole lump? @  Tơlơi ƀing gih pơgao ƀu hiam ôh. Ƀing gih ƀu thâo ôh hă đơsĕt tơpơi dưi ngă pơbô̆ hĭ abih sa bôr tơpŭng? 
Purge out the old leaven, that ye may be a new lump, according as ye are unleavened. For also our passover, Christ, has been sacrificed; @ Pơrơgoh hĭ bĕ tơpơi hơđăp, kiăng kơ ƀing gih dưi jing tơpŭng phrâo, yua kơ biă mă ƀing gih jing ƀañ tơpŭng ƀu hmâo tơpơi ôh. Yua kơ Yang Krist, Ană Triu phĕt Tơlơi Găn kơ ƀing ta, arăng hmâo pơyơr jing mơnơ̆ng ngă yang laih. 
so that let us celebrate the feast, not with old leaven, nor with leaven of malice and wickedness, but with unleavened [bread] of sincerity and truth. @ Tui anŭn brơi ƀing ta hơdơr pioh phĕt anŭn, ƀu djơ̆ hăng tơpơi hơđăp ôh, jing tơpơi tơlơi plư laih anŭn tơlơi sat ƀai, samơ̆ hăng tơpŭng ƀu hmâo tơpơi jing tơlơi rơgoh hiam laih anŭn tơlơi sĭt.
I have written to you in the epistle not to mix with fornicators; @ Amăng hră kâo čih laih kơ ƀing gih, kâo hmâo pơtă anăm ƀing gih pơgop ôh hăng ƀing rih răm. 
not altogether with the fornicators of this world, or with the avaricious and rapacious, or idolaters, since [then] ye should go out of the world. @ Ƀu djơ̆ kâo kiăng laĭ ƀing rih răm amăng lŏn tơnah anai ôh, ƀôdah kơ ƀing hưp ham, ƀing klĕ dŏp, laih anŭn ƀing kơkuh kơ rup trah; tơdah tui anŭn ƀing gih khŏm tơbiă đuaĭ mơ̆ng lŏn tơnah yơh. 
But now I have written to you, if any one called brother be fornicator, or avaricious, or idolater, or abusive, or a drunkard, or rapacious, not to mix with [him]; with such a one not even to eat. @ Samơ̆ kâo hmâo čih laih kơ ƀing gih anăm pơgop ôh hăng abih bang mơnuih hmâo anăn jing adơi ayŏng đaŏ samơ̆ ñu jing rih răm, ƀôdah hưp ham, kơkuh kơ rup trah, kraih hơtoh djraĭ, kraih măt tơpai, ƀôdah klĕ dŏp, kŏn dưi ƀơ̆ng huă lơi hăng ƀing mơnuih kar hăng anŭn.
For what have *I* [to do] with judging those outside also? *ye*, do not ye judge them that are within? @ Kâo phat kơđi ƀing mơnuih gah rơngiao kiăng ngă hơgĕt? Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă ƀing gih yơh khŏm phat kơđi ƀing mơnuih amăng lăm ƀing gih? 
But those without God judges. Remove the wicked person from amongst yourselves. @ Ơi Adai či phat kơđi ƀing gah rơngiao.
“Pơpuh đuaĭ bĕ mơnuih soh anŭn mơ̆ng tơ̆ng krah ƀing gih.”
Dare any one of you, having a matter against another, prosecute his suit before the unjust, and not before the saints? @ Tơ sa čô amăng ƀing gih hmâo tơlơi hăng tơdruă adơi ayŏng, hyư̆m ñu khĭn brơi ƀing ƀu tơpă phat kơđi tơlơi anŭn, samơ̆ ƀu brơi ôh ƀing rơgoh hiam phat kơđi? 
Do ye not then know that the saints shall judge the world? and if the world is judged by you, are ye unworthy of [the] smallest judgments? @ Ƀing gih ƀu thâo ôh hă ƀing rơgoh hiam yơh či phat kơđi kơ lŏn tơnah? Laih anŭn tơdah ƀing gih či phat kơđi kơ lŏn tơnah, tui anŭn yua hơgĕt ƀing gih ƀu dưi ôh hă phat kơđi khul tơlơi anĕt aneo? 
Do ye not know that we shall judge angels? and not then matters of this life? @ Ƀing gih ƀu thâo ôh hă ƀing ta yơh či phat kơđi kơ ƀing ling jang? Ƀai jai dơ̆ng ƀing ta dưi phat kơđi khul tơlơi ƀơi lŏn tơnah anai! 
If then ye have judgments as to things of this life, set those [to judge] who are little esteemed in the assembly. @ Tơdah ƀing gih hmâo tơlơi kar hăng anŭn, hyư̆m ƀing gih ba tơlơi anŭn ƀơi anăp ƀing mơnuih Phung Sang Ơi Adai ƀu pơpŭ pơyom ôh phat kơđi? 
I speak to you [to put you] to shame. Thus there is not a wise person among you, not even one, who shall be able to decide between his brethren! @ Kâo laĭ tơlơi anŭn kiăng kơ pơmlâo ƀing gih! Hyư̆m, djơ̆ mơ̆ ƀu hmâo ôh sa čô amăng ƀing gih jing mơnuih rơgơi dưi phat kơđi tơdruă adơi ayŏng đaŏ? 
But brother prosecutes his suit with brother, and that before unbelievers. @ Samơ̆ ƀing gih pơphong tơdruă ƀing gih ƀơi anăp ƀing ƀu đaŏ ôh!
Already indeed then it is altogether a fault in you that ye have suits between yourselves. Why do ye not rather suffer wrong? why are ye not rather defrauded? @ Tơdah ƀing gih hmâo tơlơi pơphong tơdruă ƀing gih, tơlơi anŭn jing tơlơi ƀing gih soh yơh. Yua hơgĕt ƀing gih ƀu tŭ ôh tơlơi arăng pơsoh kơ ƀing gih? Yua hơgĕt ƀing gih ƀu tŭ ôh tơlơi arăng plah sua gơnam ƀing gih? 
But *ye* do wrong, and defraud, and this [your] brethren. @ Samơ̆ ƀing gih pô yơh ngă soh laih anŭn plah sua gơnam arăng, laih anŭn ƀing gih ngă tui anŭn wơ̆t hăng ƀing adơi ayŏng ƀing gih pô. 
Do ye not know that unrighteous [persons] shall not inherit [the] kingdom of God? Do not err: neither fornicators, nor idolaters, nor adulterers, nor those who make women of themselves, nor who abuse themselves with men, @ Ƀing gih ƀu thâo ôh hă ƀing ƀu tơpă ƀu dưi tŭ mă Dêh Čar Pơtao Ơi Adai ôh? Anăm ƀlor mă ƀing gih pô ôh; ƀing rih răm, ƀing kơkuh kơ rup trah, ƀing klĕ pyu, ƀing đah rơkơi ngă soh hăng đah rơkơi, laih anŭn ƀing đah kơmơi ngă soh hăng ƀing đah kơmơi, 
nor thieves, nor covetous, nor drunkards, nor abusive persons, nor [the] rapacious, shall inherit [the] kingdom of God. @ ƀing klĕ dŏp, ƀing hưp ham, ƀing kraih măt tơpai, ƀing kraih hơtoh djraĭ, ƀing klĕ sua, ƀu či dưi tŭ mă Dêh Čar Pơtao Ơi Adai ôh. 
And these things were some of you; but ye have been washed, but ye have been sanctified, but ye have been justified in the name of the Lord Jesus, and by the Spirit of our God. @ Hlâo adih, hmâo đơđa mơnuih amăng ƀing gih jing kar hăng tui anŭn laih mơ̆n. Samơ̆ Ơi Adai hmâo rao laih ƀing gih, pơrơgoh hiam ƀing gih laih, yap tơpă ƀing gih laih amăng anăn Khua Yang Yêsu Krist laih anŭn amăng Yang Bơngăt Hiam Ơi Adai ƀing ta.
All things are lawful to me, but all things do not profit; all things are lawful to me, but *I* will not be brought under the power of any. @  “Kâo hmâo tơlơi dưi ngă abih bang tơlơi,” samơ̆ ƀu djơ̆ ôh abih bang tơlơi leng kơ hmâo tơlơi tŭ yua. “Kâo hmâo tơlơi dưi abih bang tơlơi,” samơ̆ kâo ƀu či jing hlŭn kơ sa mơta tơlơi hơgĕt ôh. 
Meats for the belly, and the belly for meats; but God will bring to nothing both it and them: but the body [is] not for fornication, but for the Lord, and the Lord for the body. @ “Mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă yua kơ hlŭng, laih anŭn hlŭng yua kơ mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă.” Laih anŭn Ơi Adai či pơrai hĭ abih dua kar kaĭ. Drơi jan ƀu djơ̆ pioh brơi kơ tơlơi rih răm ôh, samơ̆ pioh brơi kơ Khua Yang, laih anŭn Khua Yang pioh brơi kơ drơi jan. 
And God has both raised up the Lord, and will raise us up from among [the dead] by his power. @ Ơi Adai hmâo pơhơdip glaĭ laih Khua Yang, Ñu ăt či pơhơdip glaĭ ƀing ta kar kaĭ mơ̆n hăng tơlơi dưi mơyang Ñu.
Do ye not know that your bodies are members of Christ? Shall I then, taking the members of the Christ, make [them] members of a harlot? Far be the thought. @ Ƀing gih ƀu thâo ôh hă drơi jan ƀing gih jing sa črăn amăng drơi jan Krist? Dưi mơ̆, kâo mă sa črăn drơi jan Krist laih anŭn pơjing hĭ ñu jing sa črăn amăng drơi jan đah kơmơi rih răm? Ư ưh, ƀu dưi ôh! 
Do ye not know that he [that is] joined to the harlot is one body? for the two, he says, shall be one flesh. @ Ƀing gih ƀu thâo ôh hă, hlơi pô pơgop ñu pô hăng sa čô đah kơmơi rih răm ñu jing hĭ hasa drơi jan hăng đah kơmơi anŭn? Yua kơ tui hăng Hră Ơi Adai hmâo čih laih:
“Dua gơñu či jing hasa drơi jan.”
But he that [is] joined to the Lord is one Spirit. @ Samơ̆ hlơi pô pơgop hăng Khua Yang jing hasa bơngăt jua hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Ñu.
Flee fornication. Every sin which a man may practise is without the body, but he that commits fornication sins against his own body. @ Anăm ngă tơlơi rih răm ôh. Abih bang tơlơi soh pơkŏn sa čô mơnuih ngă leng kơ dŏ gah rơngiao kơ drơi jan; samơ̆ hlơi ngă tơlơi rih răm jing pơsoh hăng drơi jan ñu pô yơh. 
Do ye not know that your body is [the] temple of the Holy Spirit which [is] in you, which ye have of God; and ye are not your own? @ Ƀing gih ƀu thâo ôh hă drơi jan ƀing gih jing sang kơkuh pơpŭ kơ Yang Bơngăt Hiam hlăk dŏ amăng ƀing gih, Pô ƀing gih hmâo tŭ mă laih mơ̆ng Ơi Adai? Ƀing gih ƀu lơ̆m kơ ƀing gih pô dơ̆ng ôh. 
for ye have been bought with a price: glorify now then God in your body. @ Yua kơ Ơi Adai hmâo blơi mă laih ƀing gih hăng nua yom biă mă; tui anŭn yua bĕ drơi jan ƀing gih ngă pơ-ư pơang kơ Ơi Adai.
But concerning the things of which ye have written [to me]: [It is] good for a man not to touch a woman; @ Kơ khul tơlơi ƀing gih hmâo čih kơ kâo: “Sa čô đah rơkơi ƀu bơ̆t djơ̆ đah kơmơi jing klă hloh.” 
but on account of fornications, let each have his own wife, and each [woman] have her own husband. @ Samơ̆ kiăng kơ klaih mơ̆ng tơlơi rih răm, brơi kơ rĭm čô đah rơkơi khŏm hmâo bơnai, laih anŭn rĭm čô đah kơmơi khŏm hmâo rơkơi. 
Let the husband render her due to the wife, and in like manner the wife to the husband. @ Rơkơi khŏm ngă tum bruă kơ sa čô rơkơi hơdip hăng bơnai ñu laih anŭn bơnai khŏm ngă tum bruă kơ sa čô bơnai dŏ hơdip hăng rơkơi ñu mơ̆n. 
The wife has not authority over her own body, but the husband: in like manner also the husband has not authority over his own body, but the wife. @ Bơnai ƀu jing khua kơ drơi jan ñu pô ôh, samơ̆ rơkơi ñu jing khua. Kar kaĭ mơ̆n, rơkơi ƀu jing khua kơ drơi jan ñu pô ôh, samơ̆ bơnai ñu jing khua. 
Defraud not one another, unless, it may be, by consent for a time, that ye may devote yourselves to prayer, and again be together, that Satan tempt you not because of your incontinency. @ Anăm hơngah kơ tơdruă ƀing gih ôh, kơnơ̆ng tơdah ƀing gih tŭ ư jang jai ƀiă hrơi kiăng pioh mông iâu laĭ. Samơ̆ giơ̆ng tơlơi anŭn brơi ƀing gih dŏ hrŏm glaĭ dơ̆ng, hwĭ kơ Satan plư ƀing gih amăng mông ƀing gih ƀu dưi krơ̆ng.
But this I say, as consenting [to], not as commanding [it]. @ Anai jing tơlơi kâo tŭ ư brơi kơ ƀing gih dưi ngă, ƀu djơ̆ tơlơi kâo pơđar ôh. 
Now I wish all men to be even as myself: but every one has his own gift of God: one man thus, and another thus. @ Kâo kiăng kơ abih bang mơnuih jing kar hăng kâo; samơ̆ rĭm čô hmâo tơlơi Ơi Adai pha brơi phara phara, sa čô tui anai, sa čô pô pơkŏn tui anŭn.
But I say to the unmarried and to the widows, It is good for them that they remain even as I. @ Kâo laĭ kơ ƀing aka dŏ rơkơi bơnai ôh laih anŭn kơ ƀing đah kơmơi djai rơkơi, jing hiam kơ gơñu ăt dŏ hlai kar hăng kâo anai. 
But if they have not control over themselves, let them marry; for it is better to marry than to burn. @ Samơ̆ tơdah gơñu ƀu dưi krơ̆ng kơjăp ôh, hiam hloh dŏ rơkơi bơnai bĕ, hloh kơ tŭ apui tơlơi amoaih hưč čuh kơtang.
But to the married I enjoin, not *I*, but the Lord, Let not wife be separated from husband; @  Kơ ƀing dŏ rơkơi bơnai laih, kâo pơtă tui anai, ƀu djơ̆ kâo ôh samơ̆ Khua Yang pơtă: Bơnai ƀu dưi klaih lui rơkơi ñu ôh. 
(but if also she shall have been separated, let her remain unmarried, or be reconciled to her husband;) and let not husband leave wife. @ (Samơ̆ tơdah ñu klaih lui rơkơi ñu laih, brơi kơ ñu khŏm dŏ hlai ƀôdah rơnom glaĭ hăng rơkơi ñu dơ̆ng), laih anŭn rơkơi ƀu dưi klaih lui bơnai ñu ôh.
But as to the rest, *I* say, not the Lord, If any brother have an unbelieving wife, and *she* consent to dwell with him, let him not leave her. @ Kơ ƀing pơkŏn, ƀu djơ̆ ôh Khua Yang laĭ, samơ̆ kâo laĭ: Tơdah sa čô adơi ayŏng hmâo bơnai ƀu đaŏ ôh, laih anŭn tơdah gơ̆ ăt khăp dŏ kơ ñu, anăm ñu klaih lui gơ̆ ôh. 
And a woman who has an unbelieving husband, and he consents to dwell with her, let her not leave [her] husband. @ Tơdah sa čô đah kơmơi hmâo rơkơi ƀu đaŏ ôh, laih anŭn gơ̆ ăt khăp dŏ kơ ñu, anăm ñu klaih lui gơ̆ ôh. 
For the unbelieving husband is sanctified in the wife, and the unbelieving wife is sanctified in the brother; since [otherwise] indeed your children are unclean, but now they are holy. @ Yua kơ rơkơi ƀu đaŏ anŭn či jing rơgoh hiam yua mơ̆ng bơnai ñu. Laih anŭn bơnai ƀu đaŏ anŭn či jing rơgoh hiam yua mơ̆ng rơkơi ñu. Tơdah ƀu djơ̆ tui anŭn ôh, ană bă ƀing gih jing hơƀak drak yơh, samơ̆ ră anai gơñu leng kơ rơgoh hiam soh sel. 
But if the unbeliever go away, let them go away; a brother or a sister is not bound in such [cases], but God has called us in peace. @ Samơ̆ tơdah pô ƀu đaŏ kiăng pơklah, brơi ñu pơklah yơh. Amăng tơlơi tui anŭn ayŏng, amai, adơi ƀu hmâo tơlơi đom gŭn ôh. Yua kơ Ơi Adai hmâo iâu laih ƀing ta kơ tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua. 
For what knowest thou, O wife, if thou shalt save thy husband? or what knowest thou, O husband, if thou shalt save thy wife? @ Ơ pô jing bơnai, thâo dah ih či pơklaih rơkơi ih mơ̆n thâo? Ơ pô jing rơkơi, thâo dah ih či pơklaih bơnai ih mơ̆n thâo?
However, as the Lord has divided to each, as God has called each, so let him walk; and thus I ordain in all the assemblies. @ Brơi kơ rĭm čô khŏm hơdip tui hăng Khua Yang hmâo brơi laih kơ ñu, tui hăng ñu jing hlăk Ơi Adai iâu ñu. Anŭn jing tơlơi kâo hmâo pơtô laih kơ abih bang Phung Sang Ơi Adai. 
Has any one been called circumcised? let him not become uncircumcised: has any one been called in uncircumcision? let him not be circumcised. @ Hmâo mơ̆ sa čô khăt klĭ laih hlâo kơ Ơi Adai iâu ñu? Anăm brơi ñu hơduah sut rơngiă hĭ gru tơlơi khăt klĭ ôh. Hmâo mơ̆ sa čô aka khăt klĭ hlăk Ơi Adai iâu ñu? Anăm ñu hơduah kiăng khăt klĭ ôh. 
Circumcision is nothing, and uncircumcision is nothing; but keeping God's commandments. @ Yua kơ tơlơi khăt klĭ ƀôdah tơlơi ƀu khăt klĭ ƀu yom ôh, samơ̆ gưt tơlơi Ơi Adai pơtă jing yom. 
Let each abide in that calling in which he has been called. @ Brơi kơ rĭm čô dŏ hơnơ̆ng tui hăng ñu jing hlăk hrơi Ơi Adai iâu ñu. 
Hast thou been called [being] a bondman, let it not concern thee; but and if thou canst become free, use [it] rather. @ Ih jing hlŭn mơ̆ hlăk Ơi Adai iâu ih? Măk ai ñu anăm bơngơ̆t ôh. Samơ̆ tơdah ih dưi hmâo tơlơi rơngai, brơi ih mă tŭ bĕ. 
For the bondman that is called in [the] Lord is the Lord's freedman; in like manner [also] the freeman being called is Christ's bondman. @ Yua kơ hlơi pô jing hlŭn hlăk Khua Yang iâu ñu, ñu jing mơnuih rơngai amăng Khua Yang. Kar kaĭ mơ̆n pô rơngai hlăk Khua Yang iâu ñu, ñu jing hlŭn kơ Krist yơh. 
Ye have been bought with a price; do not be the bondmen of men. @ Ơi Adai hmâo blơi mă laih ƀing gih hăng nua yom biă mă; anăm jing hlŭn kơ ană mơnuih ôh. 
Let each, wherein he is called, brethren, therein abide with God. @ Tui anŭn Ơ adơi ayŏng, ƀơi anăp Ơi Adai brơi rĭm čô dŏ kar hăng ñu jing laih hlăk Ơi Adai iâu ñu.
But concerning virgins, I have no commandment of [the] Lord; but I give my opinion, as having received mercy of [the] Lord to be faithful. @ Bơ kơ ƀing dra hmŭm, kâo ƀu hmâo tơlơi pơtă mơ̆ng Khua Yang ôh, samơ̆ kâo pơdah tơlơi kâo pơmĭn kar hăng sa čô dŏ tŏng ten hăng tơlơi Khua Yang pap drap.
I think then that this is good, on account of the present necessity, that [it is] good for a man to remain so as he is. @ Yua kơ khul tơlơi tơnap ră anai, kâo pơmĭn hiam hloh sa čô mơnuih dŏ kar hăng ñu hmâo jing laih. 
Art thou bound to a wife? seek not to be loosed; art thou free from a wife? do not seek a wife. @ Ih hmâo bơnai laih hă? Anăm hơduah pơklaih lui ôh. Ih jing mơnuih hlai hă? Anăm ih hơduah bơnai ôh. 
But if thou shouldest also marry, thou hast not sinned; and if the virgin marry, they have not sinned: but such shall have tribulation in the flesh; but I spare you. @ Samơ̆ tơdah ih dŏ bơnai, ih ƀu soh ôh; laih anŭn tơdah sa čô dra hmŭm dŏ rơkơi, ñu anŭn ƀu soh ôh. Samơ̆ mơnuih dŏ rơkơi bơnai či hmâo tơlơi tơnap rŭng yơh amăng tơlơi hơdip, laih anŭn kâo kiăng ƀing gih klaih kơ khul tơlơi anŭn.
But this I say, brethren, the time is straitened. For the rest, that they who have wives, be as not having [any]: @ Ơ adơi ayŏng, anai yơh tơlơi kâo kiăng laĭ: Rơnŭk ƀing ta dŏ hơdip ƀu sui ôh. Mơ̆ng anai pơ anăp, ƀing hmâo bơnai laih khŏm hơdip bĕ kar hăng gơñu ƀu hmâo bơnai ôh; 
and they that weep, as not weeping; and they that rejoice, as not rejoicing; and they that buy, as not possessing; @ ƀing čŏk hia, hơdip bĕ kar hăng ƀing ƀu čŏk hia; ƀing hơ̆k mơak, hơdip bĕ kar hăng ƀing ƀu hmâo tơlơi hơ̆k mơak; ƀing blơi gơnam, hơdip bĕ kar hăng ƀing ƀu hmâo gơnam hơgĕt ôh; 
and they that use the world, as not disposing of it as their own; for the fashion of this world passes. @ hlơi pơgop hăng lŏn tơnah anai, hơdip bĕ kar hăng ƀu pơgop hăng lŏn tơnah ôh, yua kơ hơbŏ rup lŏn tơnah anai či rơgao tuč hĭ.
But I wish you to be without care. The unmarried cares for the things of the Lord, how he shall please the Lord; @ Kâo kiăng kơ ƀing gih klaih mơ̆ng tơlơi rơngot hơning. Đah rơkơi dŏ hlai ñu kơnơ̆ng bơngơ̆t kơ bruă Khua Yang, kiăng kơ dưi bơmơak kơ Khua Yang. 
but he that has married cares for the things of the world, how he shall please his wife. @ Samơ̆ đah rơkơi hmâo bơnai bơngơ̆t kơ bruă lŏn tơnah, kiăng dưi bơmơak kơ bơnai ñu. 
There is a difference between the wife and the virgin. The unmarried cares for the things of the Lord, that she may be holy both in body and spirit; but she that has married cares for the things of the world, how she shall please her husband. @ Tui anŭn pran jua gơñu pơpha hĭ yơh. Đah kơmơi ƀu hmâo rơkơi laih anŭn dra hmŭm bơngơ̆t kơnơ̆ng kơ bruă Khua Yang, kiăng jing rơgoh hiam amăng drơi jan wơ̆t hăng jua bơngăt. Samơ̆ đah kơmơi hmâo rơkơi bơngơ̆t kơ bruă lŏn tơnah kiăng dưi bơmơak kơ rơkơi ñu.
But I say this for your own profit; not that I may set a snare before you, but for what [is] seemly, and waiting on the Lord without distraction. @ Kâo laĭ tơlơi anŭn kiăng djru ƀing gih ƀu djơ̆ kiăng pơgleh ƀing gih ôh, samơ̆ kiăng ba ƀing gih kơ tơlơi tŭ yua, laih anŭn kiăng kơ ƀing gih ƀu hmâo ôh tơlơi pơmĭn kơ̆ng kư amăng bruă ƀing gih ngă kơ Khua Yang.
But if any one think that he behaves unseemly to his virginity, if he be beyond the flower of his age, and so it must be, let him do what he will, he does not sin: let them marry. @ Tơdah sa čô pơmĭn ƀu hiam ôh ană đah kơmơi ñu jing dra hmŭm rơgao hĭ thŭn dŏ rơkơi, laih anŭn ñu kiăng brơi gơ̆ dŏ rơkơi, brơi ñu ngă bĕ tui hăng ñu kiăng; brơi gơ̆ dŏ rơkơi yơh — tơlơi anŭn ƀu soh ôh. 
But he who stands firm in his heart, having no need, but has authority over his own will, and has judged this in his heart to keep his own virginity, he does well. @ Samơ̆ hlơi pô khư̆p ư kơjăp laih amăng pran jua ñu, ƀu hmâo tơlơi amoaih hưč pơgŏ ñu ôh, samơ̆ dưi kơ̆ng hĭ ană đah kơmơi ñu jing dra hmŭm, ñu ngă hiam yơh. 
So that he that marries himself does well; and he that does not marry does better. @ Tui anŭn hlơi pô brơi ană đah kơmơi ñu dŏ rơkơi ñu ngă hiam yơh; samơ̆ hlơi pô ƀu brơi ană đah kơmơi ñu dŏ rơkơi ôh ñu ngă hiam hloh.
A wife is bound for whatever time her husband lives; but if the husband be fallen asleep, she is free to be married to whom she will, only in [the] Lord. @ Sa čô đah kơmơi khŏm đom hăng rơkơi ñu amăng abih hrơi ñu dŏ hơdip. Tơdah rơkơi ñu djai, ñu rơngai dưi dŏ rơkơi yơh tui hăng ñu kiăng, tŭ kơ ñu dŏ ƀing đaŏ kơ Khua Yang. 
But she is happier if she so remain, according to my judgment; but I think that *I* also have God's Spirit. @ Samơ̆ tui hăng kâo pơmĭn, hiam mơak hloh kơ ñu tơdah ñu ăt dŏ kar hăng ñu jing laih. Laih anŭn kâo pơmĭn kâo ăt hmâo Yang Bơngăt Ơi Adai mơ̆n.
But concerning things sacrificed to idols, we know, (for we all have knowledge: knowledge puffs up, but love edifies. @ Kơ mơnơ̆ng arăng pơyơr laih kơ rup trah: ƀing ta thâo “abih bang ƀing ta leng kơ hmâo tơlơi thâo hluh soh sel.” Samơ̆ tơlơi thâo hluh ba tơlơi pơgao, samơ̆ tơlơi khăp pơđĭ pran jua. 
If any one think he knows anything, he knows nothing yet as he ought to know [it]. @ Tơdah sa čô pơmĭn ñu thâo sa mơta tơlơi hơgĕt, biă mă ñu aka thâo kar hăng ñu khŏm thâo ôh. 
But if any one love God, *he* is known of him): @ Samơ̆ tơdah sa čô khăp kơ Ơi Adai, Ơi Adai thâo krăn ñu.
concerning then the eating of things sacrificed to idols, we know that an idol [is] nothing in [the] world, and that there [is] no other God save one. @ Tui anŭn, kơ tơlơi ƀơ̆ng mơnơ̆ng arăng pơyơr kơ rup trah, ƀing ta thâo “rup trah amăng lŏn tơnah ƀu hmâo sĭt ôh,” laih anŭn “ƀu hmâo yang pơkŏn ôh, kơnơ̆ng hơjăn Ơi Adai đôč.” 
For and if indeed there are [those] called gods, whether in heaven or on earth, (as there are gods many, and lords many,) @ Wơ̆t dah hmâo lu mơnơ̆ng arăng pia yang amăng adai ƀôdah ƀơi lŏn tơnah — kar hăng biă mă ñu hmâo lu “yang” laih anŭn lu “khua” — 
yet to us [there is] one God, the Father, of whom all things, and *we* for him; and one Lord, Jesus Christ, by whom [are] all things, and *we* by him. @ samơ̆ gah kơ ƀing ta hmâo kơnơ̆ng sa Ơi Adai, jing Ama. Ñu yơh hrih abih bang tơlơi mơnơ̆ng laih anŭn ƀing ta hơdip kơ Ñu; laih anŭn hmâo kơnơ̆ng sa čô Khua Yang, Yêsu Krist, mơ̆ng Ñu abih bang mơnơ̆ng hmâo jing laih, laih anŭn mơ̆ng Ñu ƀing ta hmâo tơlơi hơdip.
But knowledge [is] not in all: but some, with conscience of the idol, until now eat as of a thing sacrificed to idols; and their conscience, being weak, is defiled. @ Samơ̆ ƀu djơ̆ ôh abih bang mơnuih leng kơ hmâo tơlơi thâo hluh anŭn. Samơ̆ hmâo đơđa juăt kơkuh pơpŭ kơ rup trah đơi, laih anŭn tơ gơñu ƀơ̆ng mơnơ̆ng ngă yang anŭn gơñu pơmĭn kar hăng pơyơr sĭt laih kơ rup trah. Tui anŭn yua kơ pran jua tơpă gơñu tơdu, gơñu jing hĭ hơƀak drak laih. 
But meat does not commend us to God; neither if we should not eat do we come short; nor if we should eat have we an advantage. @ Mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă ƀu ba ƀing ta nao giăm Ơi Adai hloh ôh. Tơdah ƀing ta ƀu ƀơ̆ng ƀing ta ƀu jing sat hloh ôh; laih anŭn tơdah ƀing ta ƀơ̆ng ƀing ta kŏn jing hiam hloh lơi.
But see lest anywise this your right [to eat] itself be a stumbling-block to the weak. @ Samơ̆ brơi kơ ƀing gih răng bĕ, anăm brơi tơlơi rơngai ƀing gih jing hĭ tơlơi tơhnač kơ ƀing tơdu ôh. 
For if any one see thee, who hast knowledge, sitting at table in an idol-house, shall not his conscience, he being weak, be emboldened to eat the things sacrificed to the idol? @ Yua kơ tơdah sa čô hmâo pran jua tơpă tơdu ƀuh ih jing mơnuih thâo hluh, dŏ ber ƀơ̆ng mơñum amăng sang rup trah, ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă ñu či hmâo tơlơi pơtrŭt ƀơ̆ng mơnơ̆ng arăng pơyơr laih kơ rup trah? 
and the weak [one], the brother for whose sake Christ died, will perish through thy knowledge. @ Tui anŭn, tơlơi ih thâo hluh pơrai hĭ pô tơdu anŭn, yua kơ adơi ayŏng anŭn yơh Krist hmâo djai pơala laih. 
Now, thus sinning against the brethren, and wounding their weak conscience, ye sin against Christ. @ Tơdang ƀing gih ngă soh hăng adơi ayŏng ƀing gih kar hăng anŭn, ngă rơka pran jua tơpă tơdu gơñu, jing ƀing gih ngă soh hăng Krist yơh. 
Wherefore if meat be a fall-trap to my brother, I will eat no flesh for ever, that I may not be a fall-trap to my brother. @ Yua kơ anŭn, tơdah mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă ngă brơi adơi ayŏng kâo lĕ amăng tơlơi soh, kâo ƀu či ƀơ̆ng añăm mơnơ̆ng ôh, kiăng kơ kâo ƀu ngă brơi adơi ayŏng kâo lĕ amăng tơlơi soh.
Am I not free? am I not an apostle? have I not seen Jesus our Lord? are not *ye* my work in [the] Lord? @ Kâo ƀu rơngai ôh hă? Kâo ƀu jing sa čô khua ding kơna ôh hă? Kâo ƀu ƀuh Yêsu Krist Khua Yang ƀing ta ôh hă? Ƀing gih ƀu djơ̆ bruă kâo amăng Khua Yang ôh hă? 
If I am not an apostle to others, yet at any rate I am to you: for the seal of mine apostleship are *ye* in [the] Lord. @ Tơdah kâo ƀu jing ôh khua ding kơna kơ ƀing pơkŏn, ƀiă hloh ăt kâo jing mơ̆n khua ding kơna kơ ƀing gih. Yua kơ ƀing gih jing gru kơđŏm kơ bruă kâo jing khua ding kơna amăng Khua Yang.
My defence to those who examine me is this: @ Anai yơh jing tơlơi kâo pơgang kơ kâo pô ƀơi anăp ƀing tơña kơsem kâo. 
Have we not a right to eat and to drink? @ Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă ƀing gơmơi ƀu hmâo tơlơi dưi ƀơ̆ng laih anŭn mơñum? 
have we not a right to take round a sister [as] wife, as also the other apostles, and the brethren of the Lord, and Cephas? @ Djơ̆ mơ̆ ƀing gơmơi ƀu hmâo ôh tơlơi dưi djă ba sa čô bơnai jing ƀing đaŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing gơmơi, kar hăng ƀing khua ding kơna pơkŏn laih anŭn ƀing adơi ayŏng Khua Yang, wơ̆t hăng Sêphas hmâo ngă laih? 
Or *I* alone and Barnabas, have we not a right not to work? @ Ƀôdah kơnơ̆ng Barnabas hăng kâo đôč ƀu hmâo tơlơi dưi lui mă bruă hơduah mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă? 
Who ever carries on war at his own charges? who plants a vineyard and does not eat of its fruit? or who herds a flock and does not eat of the milk of the flock? @ Hmâo mơ̆ hlơi nao ngă tơhan samơ̆ ƀơ̆ng prăk sang ñu pô? Hmâo hlơi pla đang boh kơƀâu samơ̆ ƀu ƀơ̆ng boh ñu ôh? Ƀôdah hlơi pô rong khul hlô mơnơ̆ng samơ̆ ƀu mơñum ia tơsâo gơñu?
Do I speak these things as a man, or does not the law also say these things? @ Kâo pơhiăp tui anŭn, djơ̆ mơ̆ tui hăng tơlơi dưi kơhưm ană mơnuih juăt laĭ? Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă tơlơi juăt ăt laĭ kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n? 
For in the law of Moses it is written, Thou shalt not muzzle the ox that is treading out corn. Is God occupied about the oxen, @ Yua kơ tơlơi juăt Môis hmâo čih laih:
“Anăm truă ôh tơƀong rơmo hlăk ñu juă pơdai.”
Djơ̆ mơ̆ Ơi Adai bơngơ̆t brơi kơ rơmo? 
or does he say [it] altogether for our sakes? For for our sakes it has been written, that the plougher should plough in hope, and he that treads out corn, in hope of partaking of [it]. @ Ƀôdah Ñu laĭ tui anŭn yua kơ ƀing ta? Djơ̆ yơh, yua kơ ƀing ta Ñu laĭ tơlơi anŭn, yua kơ pô čuar hmua khŏm čuar hăng tơlơi čang rơmang, laih anŭn pô juă pơdai či juă hăng tơlơi čang rơmang dưi hmâo črăn wơ̆t kơ ñu mơ̆n. 
If we have sown to you spiritual things, [is it a] great [thing] if *we* shall reap your carnal things? @ Tơdah gơmơi hmâo sai laih pơjeh mơyang tơ̆ng krah ƀing gih, jing rơgao hơnơ̆ng đơi hă tơdah gơmơi hơpuă gơnam gah kơ drơi jan mơ̆ng ƀing gih? 
If others partake of this right over you, should not rather *we*? But we have not used this right, but we bear all things, that we may put no hindrance in the way of the glad tidings of the Christ. @ Tơdah ƀing pơkŏn ăt dưi mă tŭ tơlơi anŭn mơ̆ng ƀing gih, ƀai jai ƀing gơmơi dơ̆ng?
Samơ̆ gơmơi ƀu yua ôh tơlơi dưi anŭn. Gơmơi gir tŭ abih bang tơlơi, kiăng kơ ƀu ngă pơgŭn hĭ jơlan Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam Krist. 
Do ye not know that they who labour [at] sacred things eat of the [offerings offered in the] temple; they that attend at the altar partake with the altar? @ Ƀing gih ƀu thâo ôh hă hlơi pô mă bruă amăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ ñu ƀơ̆ng mơnơ̆ng pơyơr amăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ anŭn; laih anŭn hlơi pô mă bruă ƀơi kơƀang ngă yang ñu hmâo črăn amăng mơnơ̆ng ngă yang ƀơi kơnưl anŭn? 
So also the Lord has ordained to those that announce the glad tidings to live of the glad tidings. @ Kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n, Khua Yang hmâo pơtă laih ƀing pơtô Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam či hơdip mơ̆ng Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam.
But *I* have used none of these things. Now I have not written these things that it should be thus in my case; for [it were] good for me rather to die than that any one should make vain my boast. @ Samơ̆ kâo ƀu yua tơlơi dưi anŭn ôh, kâo čih tơlơi anai ăt kŏn kiăng rơkâo tơlơi dưi anŭn lơi. Yua kơ, hiam hloh kâo djai đôč kơ brơi arăng mă pơđuaĭ hĭ tơlơi dưi pơ-ư anŭn mơ̆ng kâo. 
For if I announce the glad tidings, I have nothing to boast of; for a necessity is laid upon me; for it is woe to me if I should not announce the glad tidings. @ Tơdah kâo pơtô Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam, kâo ƀu hmâo tơhnal hơgĕt kiăng pơ-ư kơ kâo pô ôh, yua kơ hmâo tơlơi pơtă kâo khŏm ngă bruă anŭn, laih anŭn răm ƀăm yơh kơ kâo tơdah kâo ƀu pơtô ôh Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam! 
For if I do this voluntarily, I have a reward; but if not of my own will, I am entrusted with an administration. @ Yua kơ, tơdah kâo ngă bruă anai tui hăng tơlơi pô kâo kiăng, kâo hmâo pri yơh; samơ̆ tơdah kâo ngă bruă anai ƀu djơ̆ tui hăng tơlơi kâo pô kiăng ôh, bruă mă anŭn ăt jao brơi kơ kâo laih mơ̆n. 
What is the reward then that I have? That in announcing the glad tidings I make the glad tidings costless [to others], so as not to have made use, as belonging to me, of my right in [announcing] the glad tidings. @ Tui anŭn hơgĕt pri kơ kâo lĕ? Tơlơi anŭn jing tơdang kâo pơtô Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam, kâo pơtô hăng tơlơi đôč đač, ƀu tơña rơkâo ôh tơlơi dưi tŭ yua kơ mơnuih pơtô Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam hmâo.
For being free from all, I have made myself bondman to all, that I might gain the most [possible]. @ Wơ̆t dah, hăng abih bang mơnuih kâo jing mơnuih rơngai, samơ̆ kâo hmâo pơjing laih kâo pô jing hĭ hlŭn kơ abih bang, kiăng kơ kâo dưi atăt ba lu mơnuih kơ tơlơi đaŏ. 
And I became to the Jews as a Jew, in order that I might gain the Jews: to those under law, as under law, not being myself under law, in order that I might gain those under law: @ Hăng ƀing Yuđa, kâo jing kar hăng mơnuih Yuđa, kiăng dưi atăt ba ƀing Yuđa; hăng ƀing dŏ gah yŭ tơlơi juăt, kâo jing kar hăng pô dŏ gah yŭ tơlơi juăt — wơ̆t dah kâo pô ƀu dŏ gah yŭ tơlơi juăt ôh — kiăng kơ kâo dưi atăt ba ƀing dŏ gah yŭ tơlơi juăt. 
to those without law, as without law, (not as without law to God, but as legitimately subject to Christ,) in order that I might gain [those] without law. @ Hăng ƀing dŏ gah rơngiao kơ tơlơi juăt, kâo jing kar hăng sa čô dŏ gah rơngiao tơlơi juăt — ƀu djơ̆ ôh kâo ƀu gưt tơlơi juăt Ơi Adai, samơ̆ kâo dŏ gah yŭ tơlơi juăt Yang Krist — kiăng kơ kâo dưi atăt ba ƀing dŏ gah rơngiao kơ tơlơi juăt. 
I became to the weak, [as] weak, in order that I might gain the weak. To all I have become all things, in order that at all events I might save some. @ Kâo jing tơdu hăng ƀing tơdu, kiăng kơ kâo dưi atăt ba ƀing tơdu. Hnŭn yơh, kâo jing hĭ abih hơdră jơlan kơ abih bang mơnuih, kiăng kơ kâo dưi pơklaih đơđa amăng ƀing gơñu. 
And I do all things for the sake of the glad tidings, that I may be fellow-partaker with them. @ Kâo ngă abih bang tơlơi anŭn yua kơ Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam, kiăng kơ kâo dưi hmâo tơlơi mơyun hiam mơ̆ng Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam.
Know ye not that they who run in [the] race-course run all, but one receives the prize? Thus run in order that ye may obtain. @ Ƀing gih ƀu thâo ôh hă, amăng anih plong tong abih bang mơnuih leng kơ đuaĭ soh sel, samơ̆ kơnơ̆ng sa čô đôč hmâo pri? Tui anŭn, brơi ƀing gih đuaĭ bĕ hyư̆m pă kiăng kơ ƀing gih dưi hmâo pri. 
But every one that contends [for a prize] is temperate in all things: *they* then indeed that they may receive a corruptible crown, but *we* an incorruptible. @ Abih bang ƀing mơnuih plong tong khŏm pơtơ̆p pơjuăt tơlơi djơ̆ hơnơ̆ng amăng djŏp mơta tơlơi; gơñu ngă tui anŭn kơnơ̆ng kiăng hmâo mŭk pơtao thâo răm rai đôč. Samơ̆ ƀing ta ngă tơlơi anŭn kiăng hmâo mŭk pơtao ƀu thâo răm rai ôh. 
*I* therefore thus run, as not uncertainly; so I combat, as not beating the air. @ Hnŭn yơh, kâo đuaĭ, ƀu djơ̆ đuaĭ ƀu hmâo anih kơñăm ôh; kâo taih ƀu djơ̆ taih angĭn ôh. 
But I buffet my body, and lead it captive, lest [after] having preached to others I should be myself rejected. @ Samơ̆ kâo pơtơnap drơi jan kâo pô hăng pơgŏ ñu khŏm gưt, hwĭ dah giơ̆ng kâo pơtô ƀing pơkŏn, bơ kâo pô Ơi Adai či lui hĭ.
For I would not have you ignorant, brethren, that all our fathers were under the cloud, and all passed through the sea; @  Ơ ƀing adơi ayŏng, kâo kiăng ƀing gih thâo kơ abih bang ƀing ơi adon ƀing ta leng kơ dŏ gah yŭ kơ ƀŭt gơnăm, laih anŭn abih bang hmâo găn laih ia rơsĭ. 
and all were baptised unto Moses in the cloud and in the sea; @ Abih bang gơñu hmâo tŭ laih ƀatem amăng ƀŭt gơnăm laih anŭn amăng ia rơsĭ kiăng kơ đuaĭ tui Môis. 
and all ate the same spiritual food, @ Abih bang ƀing gơñu hmâo ƀơ̆ng laih sa mơta mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă mơyang, 
and all drank the same spiritual drink, for they drank of a spiritual rock which followed [them]: (now the rock was the Christ;) @ laih anŭn mơñum hrŏm hơbĭt laih sa mơta ia mơñum mơyang, yua kơ gơñu mơñum laih ia mơ̆ng boh pơtâo mơyang nao hăng gơñu, laih anŭn boh pơtâo anŭn jing Yang Krist. 
yet God was not pleased with the most of them, for they were strewed in the desert. @ Samơ̆ lu amăng ƀing gơñu ƀu bơmơak kơ Ơi Adai ôh; yua kơ anŭn yơh Ơi Adai pơdjai hĭ gơñu amăng tơdrŏn tač.
But these things happened [as] types of us, that we should not be lusters after evil things, as they also lusted. @  Khul tơlơi anŭn truh kiăng ngă bơhmutu brơi kơ ƀing ta, kiăng kơ ƀing ta anăm hluai tui tơlơi amoaih soh sat kar hăng ƀing gơñu ôh. 
Neither be ye idolaters, as some of them; as it is written, The people sat down to eat and to drink, and rose up to play. @ Kŏn anăm kơkuh kơ rup trah kar hăng ƀing gơñu lơi; tui hăng Hră Ơi Adai hmâo čih laih:
“Ƀing ană plei dŏ ber ƀơ̆ng mơñum,
Laih anŭn tơgŭ suang.”
Neither let us commit fornication, as some of them committed fornication, and fell in one day three and twenty thousand. @  Anăm ƀing ta ngă tơlơi rih răm ôh kar hăng đơđa amăng ƀing gơñu, laih anŭn dua pluh klâo rơbâo čô djai amăng sa hrơi. 
Neither let us tempt the Christ, as some of them tempted, and perished by serpents. @ Anăm ƀing ta lông lăng Khua Yang ôh, kar hăng đơđa amăng ƀing gơñu ngă laih, laih anŭn ala čoh pơdjai gơñu.
