Neither murmur ye, as some of them murmured, and perished by the destroyer. @ Anăm pơhiăp brŏk ôh, kar hăng đơđa amăng ƀing gơñu hmâo ngă laih, laih anŭn Pô Pơrai pơdjai hĭ gơñu.
Now all these things happened to them [as] types, and have been written for our admonition, upon whom the ends of the ages are come. @ Khul tơlơi anŭn hmâo truh kơ ƀing gơñu kiăng ngă bơhmutu kơ ƀing ta, laih anŭn hmâo čih pioh laih tơlơi anŭn kiăng kơ pơhrăm kơ ƀing ta jing ƀing dŏ hơdip amăng rơnŭk hnal tuč. 
So that let him that thinks that he stands take heed lest he fall. @ Hnŭn yơh, hlơi pô pơmĭn ñu dŏ dơ̆ng, brơi ñu răng bĕ, hwĭ kơ ñu lĕ rơbuh. 
No temptation has taken you but such as is according to man's nature; and God is faithful, who will not suffer you to be tempted above what ye are able [to bear], but will with the temptation make the issue also, so that [ye] should be able to bear [it]. @ Ƀu hmâo ôh sa mơta tơlơi lông lăng truh kơ ƀing gih phara hloh kơ tơlơi truh kơ ƀing pơkŏn. Ơi Adai jing Pô hơnơ̆ng ten, Ñu ƀu brơi ôh tơlơi lông lăng truh kơ ƀing gih rơgao hloh kơ pran kơtang ƀing gih, samơ̆ amăng tơlơi lông lăng anŭn, Ñu ăt či pŏk mơ̆n jơlan kơ ƀing gih dưi tơbiă, kiăng kơ ƀing gih dưi tŭ tơlơi anŭn.
Wherefore, my beloved, flee from idolatry. @ Hnŭn yơh, Ơ ƀing kâo khăp hơeng hơi, hơbĕ đuaĭ bĕ mơ̆ng tơlơi kơkuh kơ rup trah. 
I speak as to intelligent [persons]: do *ye* judge what I say. @ Kâo pơhiăp hăng ƀing gih kar hăng pơhiăp hăng ƀing mơnuih kơhnâo, brơi ƀing gih pơmĭn lăng bĕ tơlơi kâo laĭ. 
The cup of blessing which we bless, is it not [the] communion of the blood of the Christ? The bread which we break, is it not [the] communion of the body of the Christ? @ Kơčok tơlơi mơyun hiam ƀing ta bơni kơ Ơi Adai, ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă ñu jing tơlơi pơgop amăng drah Krist? Ƀañ tơpŭng ƀing ta wơ̆k anŭn ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă ñu jing tơlơi pơgop amăng drơi jan Krist? 
Because we, [being] many, are one loaf, one body; for we all partake of that one loaf. @ Yua kơ hmâo kơnơ̆ng sa klŏ ƀañ tơpŭng đôč, wơ̆t dah ƀing ta jing lu, samơ̆ kơnơ̆ng sa drơi jan đôč, yua kơ abih bang ƀing ta pơpha hrŏm sa klŏ ƀañ tơpŭng anŭn. 
See Israel according to flesh: are not they who eat the sacrifices in communion with the altar? @ Lăng bĕ ƀing mơnuih Israel: Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă ƀing mơnuih ƀơ̆ng mơnơ̆ng ngă yang hmâo lir hơbĭt laih hăng kơƀang ngă yang? 
What then do I say? that what is sacrificed to an idol is anything, or that an idol is anything? @ Hơgĕt tơlơi kâo kiăng laĭ kơ tơlơi anŭn lĕ? Mơnơ̆ng arăng pơyơr kơ rup trah, ƀôdah rup trah jing yom hă? 
But that what [the nations] sacrifice they sacrifice to demons, and not to God. Now I do not wish you to be in communion with demons. @ Ư ưh, tơlơi kâo kiăng laĭ jing tui anai, mơnơ̆ng ƀing djuai tuai ngă yang, gơñu pơyơr kơ ƀing yang sat ƀu djơ̆ pơyơr kơ Ơi Adai ôh. Kâo ƀu kiăng ôh ƀing gih pơgop hăng ƀing yang sat. 
Ye cannot drink [the] Lord's cup, and [the] cup of demons: ye cannot partake of [the] Lord's table, and of [the] table of demons. @ Ƀing gih ƀu dưi ôh mơñum kơčok Khua Yang laih anŭn ăt mơñum kơčok yang sat dơ̆ng. Ƀing gih ƀu dưi ƀơ̆ng huă hrŏm ƀơi kơƀang Khua Yang laih anŭn ăt ƀơ̆ng ƀơi kơƀang ƀing yang sat dơ̆ng ôh. 
Do we provoke the Lord to jealousy? are we stronger than he? @ Ƀôdah ƀing ta pơsur kơ Khua Yang khŏm gar hă? Ƀing ta kơtang hloh kơ Ñu mơ̆?
All things are lawful, but all are not profitable; all things are lawful, but all do not edify. @  “Abih bang tơlơi kâo hmâo tơlơi dưi ngă soh sel,” samơ̆ ƀu djơ̆ ôh abih bang tơlơi leng kơ hmâo tŭ yua. “Abih bang tơlơi kâo hmâo tơlơi dưi ngă soh sel,” samơ̆ ƀu djơ̆ ôh abih bang tơlơi leng kơ djru pơdơ̆ng pơjing tơdruă. 
Let no one seek his own [advantage], but that of the other. @ Anăm hmâo hlơi hơduah tơlơi hiam kơ ñu pô ôh, samơ̆ hơduah bĕ tơlơi hiam kơ pô pơkŏn.
Everything sold in the shambles eat, making no inquiry for conscience sake. @ Ƀơ̆ng bĕ hơgĕt mơta añăm mơnơ̆ng arăng sĭ amăng sang mơdrô, anăm tơña ôh yua kơ pran jua tơpă. 
For the earth [is] the Lord's and its fulness. @ Yua kơ “lŏn tơnah laih anŭn abih bang mơnơ̆ng amăng lŏn tơnah jing gơnam Khua Yang soh sel.”
But if any one of the unbelievers invite you, and ye are minded to go, all that is set before you eat, making no inquiry for conscience sake. @ Tơdah sa čô ƀu đaŏ jak ƀing gih ƀơ̆ng huă, laih anŭn ƀing gih kiăng nao, ƀơ̆ng bĕ hơgĕt mơnơ̆ng arăng pŭ brơi laih ƀơi anăp ƀing gih, anăm tơña ôh yua kơ pran jua tơpă. 
But if any one say to you, This is offered to holy purposes, do not eat, for his sake that pointed it out, and conscience sake; @ Samơ̆ tơdah arăng laĭ kơ ƀing gih: “Mơnơ̆ng anai arăng ngă yang laih,” tui anŭn anăm ƀơ̆ng ôh, yua kơ mơnuih anŭn laĭ laih tơlơi anŭn kơ ƀing gih, laih anŭn yua kơ pran jua tơpă mơ̆n — 
but conscience, I mean, not thine own, but that of the other: for why is my liberty judged by another conscience? @ kâo ƀu pơhiăp djơ̆ kơ pran jua tơpă ƀing gih ôh, samơ̆ kâo pơhiăp djơ̆ kơ pran jua tơpă pô anŭn. Kơlih yua hơgĕt pran jua tơpă pô pơkŏn phat kơđi kơ tơlơi rơngai kâo? 
If *I* partake with thanksgiving, why am I spoken evil of for what *I* give thanks for? @ Tơdah kâo ƀơ̆ng hăng tơlơi bơni hơơč kơ Ơi Adai, yua hơgĕt arăng ƀuah kâo yua kơ mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng kâo hmâo bơni laih kơ Ơi Adai?
Whether therefore ye eat, or drink, or whatever ye do, do all things to God's glory. @ Tui anŭn, thâo dah ƀing gih ƀơ̆ng, thâo dah mơñum, thâo dah hơgĕt bruă ƀing gih ngă, ngă bĕ abih bang yua kơ tơlơi guh kơang Ơi Adai. 
Give no occasion to stumbling, whether to Jews, or Greeks, or the assembly of God. @ Anăm ngă teč tơhnač ôh kơ ƀing Yuđa, kơ ƀing Grek, ƀôdah kơ Phung Sang Ơi Adai, 
Even as *I* also please all in all things; not seeking my own profit, but that of the many, that they may be saved. @ kar hăng kâo hơduah bơmơak kơ abih bang mơnuih amăng djŏp mơta tơlơi kâo ngă, ƀu hơduah tơlơi hiam kơ kâo pô ôh, samơ̆ tơlơi hiam kơ lu mơnuih kiăng kơ gơñu dưi klaih.
Be my imitators, even as *I* also [am] of Christ. @  Brơi kơ ƀing gih hla tui kâo bĕ, kar hăng kâo hla tui Krist.
Now I praise you, that in all things ye are mindful of me; and that as I have directed you, ye keep the directions. @ Kâo bơni kơ ƀing gih yua kơ ƀing gih hơdơr kơ kâo amăng abih bang tơlơi, laih anŭn tui gưt tơlơi phiăn kar hăng kâo pơtô laih kơ ƀing gih. 
But I wish you to know that the Christ is the head of every man, but woman's head [is] the man, and the Christ's head God. @ Samơ̆ kâo kiăng kơ ƀing gih thâo hluh, Yang Krist jing akŏ kơ rĭm čô đah rơkơi, laih anŭn rơkơi jing akŏ kơ bơnai ñu, laih anŭn Ơi Adai jing akŏ kơ Yang Krist. 
Every man praying or prophesying, having [anything] on his head, puts his head to shame. @ Đah rơkơi iâu laĭ ƀôdah laĭ lui hlâo samơ̆ gom hĭ akŏ ñu, ñu anŭn ƀu pơpŭ kơ Krist ôh. 
But every woman praying or prophesying with her head uncovered puts her own head to shame; for it is one and the same as a shaved [woman]. @ Samơ̆ đah kơmơi iâu laĭ ƀôdah laĭ lui hlâo ƀu gom akŏ ôh, ñu anŭn ƀu pơpŭ kơ rơkơi ñu ôh — tơlơi anŭn jing kar hăng ñu kuah hĭ laih ƀuk ñu. 
For if a woman be not covered, let her hair also be cut off. But if [it be] shameful to a woman to have her hair cut off or to be shaved, let her be covered. @ Tơdah sa čô đah kơmơi ƀu gom akŏ ñu ôh, tui anŭn brơi ñu kăp lui hĭ ƀuk ñu. Samơ̆ tơdah tơlơi kăp ƀuk ƀôdah kuah akŏ jing tơlơi mlâo hañ kơ đah kơmơi, tui anŭn brơi ñu gom akŏ bĕ. 
For man indeed ought not to have his head covered, being God's image and glory; but woman is man's glory. @ Sa čô đah rơkơi ƀu phiăn ôh gom akŏ ñu, yua kơ ñu jing rup laih anŭn tơlơi guh kơang kơ Ơi Adai; samơ̆ đah kơmơi jing tơlơi guh kơang kơ đah rơkơi. 
For man is not of woman, but woman of man. @ Yua kơ Ơi Adai ƀu pơjing đah rơkơi mơ̆ng đah kơmơi ôh, samơ̆ Ơi Adai pơjing đah kơmơi mơ̆ng đah rơkơi. 
For also man was not created for the sake of the woman, but woman for the sake of the man. @ Kŏn djơ̆ lơi Ơi Adai hrih pơjing đah rơkơi yua kơ đah kơmơi, samơ̆ Ơi Adai pơjing đah kơmơi yua kơ đah rơkơi. 
Therefore ought the woman to have authority on her head, on account of the angels. @ Tui anŭn yua kơ ƀing ling jang, đah kơmơi khŏm hmâo khăn gom akŏ ñu jing gru kơnăl ñu dŏ gah yŭ kơ tơlơi dưi rơkơi ñu. 
However, neither [is] woman without man, nor man without woman, in [the] Lord. @ Samơ̆ amăng Khua Yang, đah kơmơi kiăng biă mă dưi hmâo đah rơkơi, laih anŭn đah rơkơi kiăng biă mă dưi hmâo đah kơmơi. 
For as the woman [is] of the man, so also [is] the man by the woman, but all things of God. @ Yua kơ, kar hăng Ơi Adai hrih đah kơmơi mơ̆ng đah rơkơi, kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n đah kơmơi tơkeng rai đah rơkơi; laih anŭn abih bang tơlơi leng kơ tơbiă rai mơ̆ng Ơi Adai yơh.
Judge in yourselves: is it comely that a woman should pray to God uncovered? @ Brơi ƀing gih pô thâo kơsem lăng bĕ, phiăn mơ̆ đah kơmơi iâu laĭ kơ Ơi Adai samơ̆ ƀu gom akŏ ñu ôh? 
Does not even nature itself teach you, that man, if he have long hair, it is a dishonour to him? @ Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă tơlơi phiăn yang đar pơtô kơ ƀing gih thâo jing mlâo hañ yơh kơ sa čô đah rơkơi lui ƀuk glong? 
But woman, if she have long hair, [it is] glory to her; for the long hair is given [to her] in lieu of a veil. @ Samơ̆ tơdah sa čô đah kơmơi lui ƀuk ñu glong anŭn jing tơlơi guh kơang kơ ñu; yua kơ Ơi Adai brơi ƀuk jing mơnơ̆ng gom akŏ ñu. 
But if any one think to be contentious, *we* have no such custom, nor the assemblies of God. @ Samơ̆ tơdah hlơi pô kiăng pơrơjah pơgăl, anŭn jing tơlơi ƀing gơmơi ƀu juăt ngă ôh, laih anŭn abih bang Phung Sang Ơi Adai kơ Ơi Adai ăt kŏn juăt ngă lơi.
But [in] prescribing [to you on] this [which I now enter on], I do not praise, [namely,] that ye come together, not for the better, but for the worse. @ Amăng tơlơi pơtô gah yŭ anai, kâo ƀu bơni kơ ƀing gih ôh, yua kơ ƀing gih bơjơnum ƀu ba glaĭ tơlơi hiam hloh ôh, samơ̆ jing sat hloh dơ̆ng. 
For first, when ye come together in assembly, I hear there exist divisions among you, and I partly give credit [to it]. @ Hlâo kơ abih bang, kâo hmư̆ laih tơ ƀing gih bơjơnum amăng Phung Sang Ơi Adai, hmâo tơlơi pơkah pha phung tơ̆ng krah ƀing gih; kâo đaŏ tơlơi anai hmâo mơ̆n tơlơi djơ̆. 
For there must also be sects among you, that the approved may become manifest among you. @ Ƀu hmâo tơlơi hơgĕt đing ôh, khŏm hmâo yơh tơlơi pơkah pha phung tơ̆ng krah ƀing gih, kiăng kơ arăng dưi thâo klă rơđah hlơi jing mơnuih tơpă sĭt. 
When ye come therefore together into one place, it is not to eat [the] Lord's supper. @ Tơ ƀing gih bơjơnum glaĭ, ƀing gih ƀu ƀơ̆ng tơlơi pơgop rơgoh hiam Khua Yang ôh. 
For each one in eating takes his *own* supper before [others], and one is hungry and another drinks to excess. @ Yua kơ tơdang ƀơ̆ng, rĭm čô hăt ƀơ̆ng mơnơ̆ng ñu pô, tơl kơ pô anai rơpa laih anŭn pô pơkŏn măt tơpai. 
Have ye not then houses for eating and drinking? or do ye despise the assembly of God, and put to shame them who have not? What shall I say to you? shall I praise you? In this [point] I do not praise. @ Hyư̆m ngă! Ƀing gih ƀu hmâo ôh hă sang pioh kơ ƀơ̆ng huă laih anŭn mơñum? Ƀôdah ƀing gih mưč mač kơ Phung Sang Ơi Adai kơ Ơi Adai, laih anŭn ngă pơmlâo kơ ƀing ƀu hmâo mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă? Hơgĕt kâo či laĭ kơ ƀing gih? Kâo či bơni kơ ƀing gih mơ̆ amăng tơlơi anai? Ư ưh kâo ƀu bơni kơ ƀing gih ôh!
For *I* received from the Lord, that which I also delivered to you, that the Lord Jesus, in the night in which he was delivered up, took bread, @ Yua kơ kâo hmâo mă tŭ laih mơ̆ng Khua Yang tơlơi kâo hmâo pơtô laih kơ ƀing gih: Amăng mlam arăng pơblư̆ Khua Yang Yêsu, Ñu mă ƀañ tơpŭng, 
and having given thanks broke [it], and said, This is my body, which [is] for you: this do in remembrance of me. @ giơ̆ng kơ iâu laĭ bơni hơơč, Ñu wơ̆k ƀañ tơpŭng laih anŭn laĭ: “Anai jing drơi jan Kâo hmâo pơčah laih yua kơ ƀing gih. Ngă bĕ tơlơi anai kiăng hơdơr kơ kâo.” 
In like manner also the cup, after having supped, saying, This cup is the new covenant in my blood: this do, as often as ye shall drink [it], in remembrance of me. @ Kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n, giơ̆ng kơ ƀơ̆ng huă mlam, Ñu mă kơčok laih anŭn laĭ: “Kơčok anai jing Kơnol Pơgop Phrâo amăng drah Kâo. Rĭm wơ̆t ƀing gih mơñum, ngă bĕ tơlơi anai kiăng hơdơr kơ Kâo.” 
For as often as ye shall eat this bread, and drink the cup, ye announce the death of the Lord, until he come. @ Tui anŭn, rĭm wơ̆t ƀing gih ƀơ̆ng ƀañ tơpŭng anai, laih anŭn mơñum kơčok anai, brơi kơ ƀing gih ră ruai tơlơi Khua Yang djai tơl hrơi Ñu rai dơ̆ng.
So that whosoever shall eat the bread, or drink the cup of the Lord, unworthily, shall be guilty in respect of the body and of the blood of the Lord. @ Yua kơ anŭn yơh, hlơi pô ƀơ̆ng ƀañ tơpŭng ƀôdah mơñum kơčok Khua Yang hăng tơlơi ƀu năng lăp ôh, ñu anŭn či soh hăng drơi jan laih anŭn hăng drah Khua Yang. 
But let a man prove himself, and thus eat of the bread, and drink of the cup. @ Tui anŭn, brơi kơ rĭm čô khŏm kơsem lăng ñu pô hlâo, hnŭn yơh ñu dưi ƀơ̆ng ƀañ tơpŭng laih anŭn mơñum kơčok anŭn. 
For [the] eater and drinker eats and drinks judgment to himself, not distinguishing the body. @ Yua kơ hlơi pô ƀơ̆ng laih anŭn mơñum hăng tơlơi ƀu thâo hluh ôh kơ drơi jan Khua Yang, ñu anŭn ƀơ̆ng laih anŭn mơñum kơ tơlơi phat kơđi kơ ñu pô yơh. 
On this account many among you [are] weak and infirm, and a good many are fallen asleep. @ Yua kơ tơlơi anŭn amăng ƀing gih hmâo lu mơnuih tơdu, ruă duăm laih anŭn đơđa djai laih. 
But if we judged ourselves, so were we not judged. @ Tơdah ƀing ta thâo kơsem lăng ƀing ta pô hlâo, ƀing ta ƀu či tŭ tơlơi phat kơđi ôh. 
But being judged, we are disciplined of [the] Lord, that we may not be condemned with the world. @ Samơ̆ tơ Khua Yang phat kơđi ƀing ta, Ñu pơkra ƀing ta, kiăng kơ ƀing ta ƀu či tŭ ôh tơlơi klă kơđi hrŏm hơbĭt hăng lŏn tơnah.
So that, my brethren, when ye come together to eat, wait for one another. @ Tui anŭn, Ơ ƀing adơi ayŏng, tơ ƀing gih bơjơnum glaĭ kơ tơlơi ƀơ̆ng pơgop rơgoh hiam, dŏ tơguan bĕ tơdruă ƀing gih. 
If any one be hungry, let him eat at home, that ye may not come together for judgment. But the other things, whenever I come, I will set in order. @ Tơdah hmâo hlơi rơpa, brơi ñu ƀơ̆ng huă bĕ pơ sang ñu pô, kiăng kơ tơlơi ƀing gih bơjơnum ƀu ba glaĭ tơlơi klă kơđi kơ ƀing gih ôh. Bơ kơ bruă pơkŏn, kâo či pơkra tơ kâo truh.
But concerning spiritual [manifestations], brethren, I do not wish you to be ignorant. @ Ơ ƀing adơi ayŏng, kâo ƀu kiăng ôh ƀing gih ƀu thâo hluh kơ khul tơlơi pha brơi mơ̆ng Yang Bơngăt Hiam. 
Ye know that when ye were [of the] nations [ye were] led away to dumb idols, in whatever way ye might be led. @ Ƀing gih thâo laih hlăk ƀing gih aka đaŏ, khul rup trah kơmlô dui ba ƀing gih nao jrok jơlan. 
I give you therefore to know, that no one, speaking in [the power of the] Spirit of God, says, Curse [on] Jesus; and no one can say, Lord Jesus, unless in [the power of the] Holy Spirit. @ Yua kơ anŭn, kâo kiăng ƀing gih thâo hluh tơlơi anai, ƀu hmâo ôh hlơi hmâo Yang Bơngăt Hiam Ơi Adai dui ba ñu laih anŭn dưi laĭ: “Hơtơ̆m pah kơ Yêsu!” Laih anŭn ƀu hmâo ôh sa čô dưi pơhaih: “Yêsu jing Khua Yang,” tơdah ƀu hmâo Yang Bơngăt Hiam atăt gai ñu.
But there are distinctions of gifts, but the same Spirit; @  Hmâo lu mơta tơlơi pha brơi phara phara, samơ̆ kơnơ̆ng hmâo hasa Yang Bơngăt Hiam đôč. 
and there are distinctions of services, and the same Lord; @ Hmâo lu mơta bruă phara phara, samơ̆ kơnơ̆ng hmâo hasa Khua Yang; 
and there are distinctions of operations, but the same God who operates all things in all. @ Hmâo lu mơta bruă ngă phara phara, samơ̆ kơnơ̆ng hmâo hasa Ơi Adai brơi tơlơi dưi ngă abih bang bruă amăng rĭm čô mơnuih. 
But to each the manifestation of the Spirit is given for profit. @ Tơlơi Yang Bơngăt Hiam bơrơđah brơi hmâo pha brơi laih kơ rĭm čô mơnuih, yua kơ tơlơi tŭ yua brơi kơ abih bang. 
For to one, by the Spirit, is given [the] word of wisdom; and to another [the] word of knowledge, according to the same Spirit; @ Kơ pô anai Yang Bơngăt Hiam pha brơi tơlơi dưi thâo pơhiăp hăng tơlơi kơhnâo; kơ pô pơkŏn ăt Yang Bơngăt Hiam anŭn mơ̆n pha brơi tơlơi dưi pơhiăp hăng tơlơi thâo thaĭ. 
and to a different one faith, in [the power of] the same Spirit; and to another gifts of healing in [the power of] the same Spirit; @ Ăt hasa Yang Bơngăt Hiam anŭn mơ̆n pha brơi kơ pô anai tơlơi đaŏ, ăt hasa Yang Bơngăt Hiam anŭn mơ̆n pha brơi kơ pô pơkŏn tơlơi dưi pơsuaih tơlơi duăm ruă. 
and to another operations of miracles; and to another prophecy; and to another discerning of spirits; and to a different one kinds of tongues; and to another interpretation of tongues. @ Yang Bơngăt hiam brơi kơ pô anai tơlơi dưi ngă tơlơi mơsêh mơyang, brơi kơ pô pơkŏn tơlơi dưi laĭ lui hlâo, kơ pô pơkŏn dơ̆ng tơlơi dưi thâo bơkơnăl yang phara phara. Kơ pô anai Ñu brơi tơlơi dưi pơhiăp tơlơi tuai phara phara, laih anŭn kơ pô pơkŏn Ñu brơi tơlơi thâo pơblang tơlơi tuai. 
But all these things operates the one and the same Spirit, dividing to each in particular according as he pleases. @ Abih bang tơlơi pha brơi anŭn tơbiă mơ̆ng hasa Yang Bơngăt Hiam đôč, Pô pha brơi kơ rĭm čô tui hăng Ñu kiăng.
For even as the body is one and has many members, but all the members of the body, being many, are one body, so also [is] the Christ. @  Yua kơ kar hăng sa drơi jan samơ̆ hmâo lu črăn; wơ̆t dah hmâo lu črăn samơ̆ kơnơ̆ng jing sa drơi jan đôč, Yang Krist ăt kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n. 
For also in [the power of] one Spirit *we* have all been baptised into one body, whether Jews or Greeks, whether bondmen or free, and have all been given to drink of one Spirit. @ Yua kơ mơ̆ng hasa Yang Bơngăt Hiam abih bang ƀing ta tŭ laih ƀatem pơgop amăng sa drơi jan — ƀing Yuđa ƀôdah ƀing Grek, ƀing hlŭn ƀôdah ƀing rơngai — laih anŭn Ơi Adai brơi abih bang ƀing ta mơñum hrŏm hơbĭt sa Yang Bơngăt Hiam anŭn.
For also the body is not one member but many. @ Yua kơ drơi jan ƀu djơ̆ kơnơ̆ng jing rai mơ̆ng sa črăn đôč ôh, samơ̆ mơ̆ng lu črăn. 
If the foot say, Because I am not a hand I am not of the body, is it on account of this not indeed of the body? @ Tơdah tơkai laĭ: “Yua kơ kâo ƀu jing sa ƀĕ tơngan, kâo ƀu lơ̆m kơ drơi jan ôh,” tơlơi anŭn ƀu dưi pơklah ñu mơ̆ng drơi jan ôh. 
And if the ear say, Because I am not an eye I am not of the body, is it on account of this not indeed of the body? @ Laih anŭn tơdah tơngia laĭ: “Yua kơ kâo ƀu jing mơta ôh, kâo ƀu dŏ amăng drơi jan ôh,” tơlơi anŭn ƀu dưi pơklah ñu mơ̆ng drơi jan ôh. 
If the whole body [were] an eye, where the hearing? if all hearing, where the smelling? @ Tơdah abih drơi jan jing mơta soh sel, hyư̆m dưi thâo hmư̆ lĕ? Tơdah abih drơi jan leng kơ jing tơngia soh sel, hyư̆m dưi thâo ƀâu lĕ? 
But now God has set the members, each one of them in the body, according as it has pleased [him]. @ Kar hăng ñu hmâo jing laih, Ơi Adai hmâo pơdăp laih rĭm črăn amăng drơi jan tui hăng tơlơi Ñu kiăng yơh. 
But if all were one member, where the body? @ Tơdah abih bang kơnơ̆ng jing sa črăn đôč, hyư̆m dưi jing drơi jan lĕ? 
But now the members [are] many, and the body one. @ Tui anŭn, hmâo lu črăn samơ̆ kơnơ̆ng hmâo sa drơi jan đôč.
The eye cannot say to the hand, I have not need of thee; or again, the head to the feet, I have not need of you. @ Mơta ƀu dưi laĭ ôh kơ tơngan: “Kâo ƀu kiăng kơ ih ôh!” Akŏ kŏn dưi laĭ lơi kơ tơkai: “Kâo ƀu kiăng kơ ih ôh!” 
But much rather, the members of the body which seem to be weaker are necessary; @ Kơđai glaĭ, khul črăn pă amăng drơi jan lăng jing kar hăng tơdu hloh, samơ̆ ñu ăt jing yom brơi kơ drơi jan mơ̆n. 
and those [parts] of the body which we esteem to be the more void of honour, these we clothe with more abundant honour; and our uncomely [parts] have more abundant comeliness; @ Khul črăn pă amăng drơi jan ƀing ta pơmĭn ƀu pơpŭ đơi ôh, jing črăn ƀing ta pơpŭ lu hloh dơ̆ng, laih anŭn črăn pă amăng drơi ƀing ta pơmĭn ƀu hiam rŏ ôh, ƀing ta pơhrôp hiam rŏ hloh dơ̆ng. 
but our comely [parts] have not need. But God has tempered the body together, having given more abundant honour to [the part] that lacked; @ Bơ kơ črăn pă hiam rŏ laih, ƀing ta ƀu kiăng pơhrôp dơ̆ng ôh. Samơ̆ Ơi Adai hmâo pơdăp dưm laih drơi jan kar hăng anŭn, kiăng kơ črăn pă ƀu pơpŭ đơi ôh dưi hmâo tơlơi pơpŭ lu hloh, 
that there might be no division in the body, but that the members might have the same concern one for another. @ kiăng kơ ƀu hmâo ôh tơlơi pơkah pơpha amăng drơi jan, samơ̆ rĭm črăn hyơ̆k bơngơ̆t brơi kơ tơdruă. 
And if one member suffer, all the members suffer with [it]; and if one member be glorified, all the members rejoice with [it]. @ Tơdah sa črăn hmâo tơlơi tơnap tap, abih bang črăn hmâo tơlơi tơnap tap hrŏm hơbĭt; tơdah sa črăn hmâo tơlơi pơpŭ, abih bang črăn hơ̆k mơak hrŏm hơbĭt.
Now *ye* are Christ's body, and members in particular. @ Ƀing gih jing drơi jan Krist, laih anŭn rĭm čô jing sa črăn amăng drơi jan Ñu. 
And God has set certain in the assembly: first, apostles; secondly, prophets; thirdly, teachers; then miraculous powers; then gifts of healings; helps; governments; kinds of tongues. @ Ơi Adai hmâo dăp dưm laih amăng Phung Sang Ơi Adai, tal sa jing ƀing khua ding kơna, tal dua jing ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo, tal klâo jing ƀing nai pơtô, laih anŭn ƀing ngă tơlơi mơsêh mơyang, ƀing hmâo tơlơi dưi pơsuaih tơlơi duăm ruă, ƀing thâo djru, ƀing thâo wai lăng, laih anŭn ƀing dưi pơhiăp tơlơi tuai phara phara. 
[Are] all apostles? [are] all prophets? [are] all teachers? [are] all [in possession of] miraculous powers? @ Djơ̆ mơ̆ abih bang leng kơ jing ƀing khua ding kơna? Djơ̆ mơ̆ abih bang leng kơ jing pô laĭ lui hlâo? Djơ̆ mơ̆ abih bang leng kơ jing nai pơtô? Djơ̆ mơ̆ abih bang leng kơ ngă tơlơi mơsêh mơyang? 
have all gifts of healings? do all speak with tongues? do all interpret? @ Djơ̆ mơ̆ abih bang hmâo tơlơi dưi pơsuaih tơlơi duăm ruă? Djơ̆ mơ̆ abih bang dưi pơhiăp tơlơi tuai phara phara? Djơ̆ mơ̆ abih bang dưi pơblang tơlơi tuai? 
But desire earnestly the greater gifts, and yet shew I unto you a way of more surpassing excellence. @ Samơ̆ brơi ƀing gih čang kiăng bĕ khul tơlơi pha brơi yom hloh.
Ră anai kâo či kơčrâo brơi kơ ƀing gih sa jơlan hiam hloh dơ̆ng.
If I speak with the tongues of men and of angels, but have not love, I am become sounding brass or a clanging cymbal. @ Wơ̆t dah kâo thâo pơhiăp abih bang tơlơi pơhiăp ană mơnuih laih anŭn tơlơi pơhiăp ƀing ling jang mơ̆n, samơ̆ tơdah kâo ƀu hmâo tơlơi khăp ôh, kâo kơnơ̆ng jing kar hăng dơnai čing ƀôdah răng rai kuang asăp đôč. 
And if I have prophecy, and know all mysteries and all knowledge, and if I have all faith, so as to remove mountains, but have not love, I am nothing. @ Wơ̆t dah kâo hmâo tơlơi dưi laĭ lui hlâo, laih anŭn thâo abih bang tơlơi hơgơ̆m wơ̆t hăng hmâo abih bang tơlơi thâo thaĭ; wơ̆t dah kâo hmâo abih bang tơlơi đaŏ tơl dưi yŏng hĭ čư̆, samơ̆ ƀu hmâo tơlơi khăp ôh, kâo kơnơ̆ng jing đôč đač yơh. 
And if I shall dole out all my goods in food, and if I deliver up my body that I may be burned, but have not love, I profit nothing. @ Wơ̆t dah kâo pha brơi kơ arăng abih dram gơnam kâo hmâo, laih anŭn kâo jao brơi drơi jan kâo arăng čuh hĭ amăng apui, samơ̆ tơdah kâo ƀu hmâo ôh tơlơi khăp, tơlơi anŭn ƀu hmâo tŭ yua kơ kâo ôh.
Love has long patience, is kind; love is not emulous [of others]; love is not insolent and rash, is not puffed up, @ Tơlơi khăp thâo gir añ laih anŭn bă hăng pran jua hiam klă; tơlơi khăp ƀu gar hil ƀôdah pơđĭ ñu pô ôh; ñu ƀu pơang ôh, 
does not behave in an unseemly manner, does not seek what is its own, is not quickly provoked, does not impute evil, @ ƀu ngă tơlơi wĕ wŏ, ƀu hơduah tơlơi tŭ yua kơ ñu pô, ƀu tañ hil, ƀu djă pioh tơlơi sat ôh; 
does not rejoice at iniquity but rejoices with the truth, @ ƀu mơak ôh kơ tơlơi ƀu tơpă, samơ̆ ñu mơak amăng tơlơi tơpă sĭt. 
bears all things, believes all things, hopes all things, endures all things. @ Tơlơi khăp tŭ abih bang, đaŏ abih bang, čang rơmang abih bang, gir añ abih bang.
Love never fails; but whether prophecies, they shall be done away; or tongues, they shall cease; or knowledge, it shall be done away. @ Tơlơi khăp ƀu thâo rơngiă ôh; samơ̆ tơlơi laĭ lui hlâo či đŭt. Tơlơi thâo pơhiăp tơlơi tuai phara phara či abih; tơlơi thâo hluh či rơgao hĭ. 
For we know in part, and we prophesy in part: @ Yua kơ tơlơi ƀing ta thâo hluh hmâo hơnơ̆ng, laih anŭn tơlơi ƀing ta laĭ lui hlâo hmâo guai; 
but when that which is perfect has come, that which is in part shall be done away. @ samơ̆ tơ tơlơi klă tum truh, tơlơi ƀu klă tum či rơgao đŭt hĭ.
When I was a child, I spoke as a child, I felt as a child, I reasoned as a child; when I became a man, I had done with what belonged to the child. @ Tơdang kâo dŏ čơđai kâo pơhiăp kar hăng čơđai, kâo pơmĭn kar hăng čơđai, kâo pơgăl kar hăng čơđai; samơ̆ tơ kâo jing mơnuih tha truh laih, kâo lui hĭ abih bang tơlơi lơ̆m kơ čơđai. 
For we see now through a dim window obscurely, but then face to face; now I know partially, but then I shall know according as I also have been known. @ Yua kơ ră anai ƀing ta ƀuh ƀu rơđah ôh kar hăng lăng amăng mơnĭl; tơdơi ƀing ta či ƀuh anăp klă anăp. Ră anai kâo kơnơ̆ng thâo sa črăn đôč, tơdơi kâo či thâo hluh abih bang, kar hăng Ơi Adai thâo krăn laih kâo.
And now abide faith, hope, love; these three things; and the greater of these [is] love. @ Ră anai dŏ hmâo klâo tơlơi anai: tơlơi đaŏ, tơlơi čang rơmang laih anŭn tơlơi khăp; samơ̆ amăng klâo tơlơi anai tơlơi khăp jing yom hloh kơ abih bang.
Follow after love, and be emulous of spiritual [manifestations], but rather that ye may prophesy. @ Tui hơduah bĕ tơlơi khăp, laih anŭn čang kiăng bĕ kơ tơlơi Yang Bơngăt Hiam pha brơi, biă mă ñu tơlơi dưi laĭ lui hlâo. 
For he that speaks with a tongue does not speak to men but to God: for no one hears; but in spirit he speaks mysteries. @ Yua kơ hlơi pô pơhiăp tơlơi tuai ñu ƀu pơhiăp hăng ană mơnuih ôh, samơ̆ pơhiăp hăng Ơi Adai hnŭn yơh ƀu hmâo hlơi thâo hluh ôh, yua kơ mơnuih anŭn pơhiăp khul tơlơi yom hơgơ̆m amăng Yang Bơngăt Hiam. 
But he that prophesies speaks to men [in] edification, and encouragement, and consolation. @ Samơ̆ hlơi pô laĭ lui hlâo, ñu pơhiăp hăng mơnuih kiăng djru gơñu rai kơ prŏng, pơđĭ pran jua laih anŭn pơalum gơñu. 
He that speaks with a tongue edifies himself; but he that prophesies edifies [the] assembly. @ Hlơi pô pơhiăp tơlơi tuai pơdơ̆ng đĭ ñu pô đôč, samơ̆ hlơi pô laĭ lui hlâo pơdơ̆ng đĭ Phung Sang Ơi Adai.
Now I desire that ye should all speak with tongues, but rather that ye should prophesy. But greater is he that prophesies than he that speaks with tongues, unless he interpret, that the assembly may receive edification. @ Kâo kiăng kơ abih bang ƀing gih pơhiăp tơlơi tuai, samơ̆ kâo kiăng hloh ƀing gih laĭ lui hlâo. Pô laĭ lui hlâo jing yom hloh kơ pô pơhiăp tơlơi tuai, kơnơ̆ng tơdah hmâo pô pơblang brơi, kiăng kơ Phung Sang Ơi Adai dưi hmâo tơlơi pơđĭ pran jua. 
And now, brethren, if I come to you speaking with tongues, what shall I profit you, unless I shall speak to you either in revelation, or in knowledge, or in prophecy, or in teaching? @ Tui anŭn, Ơ ƀing adơi ayŏng, tơdah kâo nao pơ ƀing gih, kâo pơhiăp tơlơi tuai, hyư̆m kâo dưi djru ƀing gih tơdah kâo ƀu pơhiăp hăng ƀing gih hăng tơlơi bơrơđah, hăng tơlơi thâo thaĭ, hăng tơlơi laĭ lui hlâo, ƀôdah hăng tơlơi pơtô?
Even lifeless things giving a sound, whether pipe or harp, if they give not distinction to the sounds, how shall it be known what is piped or harped? @ Wơ̆t kơ khul kơdrăp ayŭ hri ƀu hmâo tơlơi hơdip, kar hăng đing klơt ƀôdah brŏ, tơdah asăp gơñu mơñi ƀu hmâo tơlơi phara klă rơđah ôh, hyư̆m arăng dưi thâo krăn ayŭ đing klơt ƀôdah ayŭ brŏ? 
For also, if the trumpet give an uncertain sound, who shall prepare himself for war? @ Laih anŭn tơdah asăp tơki ƀu klă rơđah ôh, hlơi pô či prăp rơmet kơ tơlơi pơblah? 
Thus also *ye* with the tongue, unless ye give a distinct speech, how shall it be known what is spoken? for ye will be speaking to the air. @ Ƀing gih ăt kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n, tơdah ƀing gih pơhiăp tơlơi tuai arăng ƀu thâo hluh ôh, hyư̆m arăng dưi thâo hluh hơgĕt tơlơi ƀing gih laĭ? Yua kơ ƀing gih pơhiăp amăng angĭn yơh. 
There are, it may be, so many kinds of voices in the world, and none of undistinguishable sound. @ Sĭt biă mă hmâo lu mơta tơlơi pơhiăp phara phara amăng lŏn tơnah anai, laih anŭn rĭm mơta tơlơi pơhiăp leng kơ hmâo tơlơi kiăng pơblang soh sel. 
If therefore I do not know the power of the sound, I shall be to him that speaks a barbarian, and he that speaks a barbarian for me. @ Samơ̆ tơdah kâo ƀu thâo hluh tơlơi pơhiăp anŭn ôh, kâo či jing sa čô mơnuih tuai hăng pô pơhiăp anŭn, laih anŭn pô pơhiăp či jing sa čô tuai hăng kâo. 
Thus *ye* also, since ye are desirous of spirits, seek that ye may abound for the edification of the assembly. @ Ƀing gih ăt kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n, yua kơ ƀing gih hur har kiăng hmâo tơlơi pha brơi mơ̆ng Yang Bơngăt Hiam, tui hơduah bĕ kiăng kơ hmâo rơbeh blai tơlơi pha brơi mơ̆ng Yang Bơngăt Hiam kiăng kơ pơdơ̆ng pơđĭ Phung Sang Ơi Adai rai kơ prŏng.
Wherefore let him that speaks with a tongue pray that he may interpret. @ Yua kơ anŭn, hlơi pô pơhiăp tơlơi tuai, brơi ñu iâu laĭ kiăng hmâo tơlơi dưi pơblang boh pơhiăp anŭn. 
For if I pray with a tongue, my spirit prays, but my understanding is unfruitful. @ Yua kơ tơdah kâo iâu laĭ hăng tơlơi tuai, bơngăt kâo dŏ iâu laĭ, samơ̆ tơlơi pơmĭn kâo ƀu mă tŭ tơlơi hơgĕt ôh. 
What is it then? I will pray with the spirit, but I will pray also with the understanding; I will sing with the spirit, but I will sing also with the understanding. @ Tui anŭn hơgĕt kâo khŏm ngă? Kâo či iâu laĭ hăng bơngăt jua, samơ̆ kâo ăt či iâu laĭ hăng tơlơi pơmĭn mơ̆n. Kâo či adoh hăng bơngăt, samơ̆ kâo ăt či adoh hăng tơlơi pơmĭn kar kaĭ mơ̆n. 
Since otherwise, if thou blessest with [the] spirit, how shall he who fills the place of the simple [Christian] say Amen, at thy giving of thanks, since he does not know what thou sayest? @ Samơ̆ tơdah ih bơni hơơč kơ Ơi Adai kơnơ̆ng hăng bơngăt đôč, hyư̆m ƀing mơnuih ƀu hmâo tơlơi pha brơi amăng ƀing bơjơnum anŭn dưi laĭ “Amen” kơ tơlơi ih iâu laĭ bơni hơơč; yua kơ ñu ƀu thâo hluh ôh tơlơi ih pơhiăp? 
For *thou* indeed givest thanks well, but the other is not edified. @ Wơ̆t dah tơlơi ih iâu laĭ bơni hơơč anŭn hiam biă mă, samơ̆ ƀu pơdơ̆ng pơđĭ pô pơkŏn ôh.
I thank God I speak in a tongue more than all of you: @ Kâo bơni hơơč kơ Ơi Adai yua kơ kâo dưi pơhiăp tơlơi tuai lu hloh kơ abih bang ƀing gih; 
but in [the] assembly I desire to speak five words with my understanding, that I may instruct others also, [rather] than ten thousand words in a tongue. @ samơ̆ amăng Phung Sang Ơi Adai, hiam hloh kâo pơhiăp rơma boh hăng tơlơi pơmĭn kâo kiăng pơhrăm ƀing pơkŏn, hloh kơ pơhiăp pluh rơbâo boh amăng tơlơi tuai.
Brethren, be not children in [your] minds, but in malice be babes; but in [your] minds be grown [men]. @ Ơ ƀing adơi ayŏng, kơ tơlơi thâo hluh, anăm jing kar hăng čơđai ôh, samơ̆ kơ tơlơi sat, jing bĕ kar hăng čơđai. Kơ tơlơi thâo hluh jing bĕ kar hăng mơnuih truh tha. 
It is written in the law, By people of other tongues, and by strange lips, will I speak to this people; and neither thus will they hear me, saith the Lord. @ Amăng tơlơi juăt hmâo čih laih:
“Khua Yang laĭ: Hăng ƀing mơnuih pơhiăp tơlơi tuai laih anŭn hăng amăng bah ƀing djuai tuai kâo či pơhiăp hăng ƀing ană plei anai,
Samơ̆ wơ̆t dah tui anŭn, ƀing gơñu ƀu či hmư̆ Kâo ôh.”
So that tongues are for a sign, not to those who believe, but to unbelievers; but prophecy, not to unbelievers, but to those who believe. @ Tui anŭn, khul boh pơhiăp tơlơi tuai ƀu djơ̆ jing gru kơnăl kơ ƀing mơnuih đaŏ ôh, samơ̆ kơ ƀing mơnuih ƀu đaŏ; tơdang anŭn tơlơi laĭ lui hlâo ƀu djơ̆ jing gru kơnăl kơ ƀing ƀu đaŏ ôh, samơ̆ kơ ƀing mơnuih đaŏ.
If therefore the whole assembly come together in one place, and all speak with tongues, and simple [persons] enter in, or unbelievers, will not they say ye are mad? @ Tui anŭn, tơ abih bang Phung Sang Ơi Adai bơjơnum glaĭ, laih anŭn abih bang leng kơ pơhiăp tơlơi tuai soh sel, laih anŭn hmâo ƀing gah rơngiao ƀôdah ƀing ƀu đaŏ yak mŭt, ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă gơñu či laĭ ƀing gih jing hưt? 
But if all prophesy, and some unbeliever or simple [person] come in, he is convicted of all, he is judged of all; @ Samơ̆ tơdah abih bang leng kơ laĭ lui hlâo, laih anŭn sa čô ƀu đaŏ ƀôdah sa čô gah rơngiao mŭt, ñu hmâo tơlơi kơčut laih anŭn tơlơi phat kơđi mơ̆ng abih bang tơlơi ñu hmư̆; 
the secrets of his heart are manifested; and thus, falling upon [his] face, he will do homage to God, reporting that God is indeed amongst you. @ Khul tơlơi hơgơ̆m amăng pran jua gơñu či pơrơđah hĭ, tui anŭn gơñu či kŭp ƀô̆ ƀơi lŏn, kơkuh pơpŭ kơ Ơi Adai, laih anŭn pơhaih:
“Ơi Adai dŏ tơ̆ng krah ƀing gih biă mă.”
What is it then, brethren? whenever ye come together, each [of you] has a psalm, has a teaching, has a tongue, has a revelation, has an interpretation. Let all things be done to edification. @ Ơ ƀing adơi ayŏng, hyư̆m ƀing gih khŏm ngă lĕ? Tơ ƀing gih bơjơnum glaĭ hmâo mơnuih hmâo tơlơi adoh, tơlơi pơtô, tơlơi bơrơđah, tơlơi pơhiăp tơlơi tuai, ƀôdah tơlơi pơblang tơlơi tuai. Brơi ƀing gih ngă abih bang tơlơi kiăng kơ pơdơ̆ng pơđĭ tơdruă ƀing gih. 
If any one speak with a tongue, [let it be] two, or at the most three, and separately, and let one interpret; @ Tơdah hmâo hlơi pơhiăp tơlơi tuai, brơi hmâo kơnơ̆ng dua ƀôdah lu hloh jing klâo čô đôč pơhiăp, laih anŭn rĭm čô pơhiăp djơ̆ tuôr ñu; laih anŭn khŏm hmâo pô pơblang. 
but if there be no interpreter, let him be silent in [the] assembly, and let him speak to himself and to God. @ Samơ̆ tơdah ƀu hmâo pô pơblang ôh, brơi ñu dŏ rơiăt amăng Phung Sang Ơi Adai laih anŭn kơnơ̆ng pơhiăp hơjăn ñu pô hăng Ơi Adai đôč. 
And let two or three prophets speak, and let the others judge. @ Brơi kơnơ̆ng dua ƀôdah klâo čô đôč laĭ lui hlâo, laih anŭn brơi ƀing pơkŏn kơsem pơmĭn kơ tơlơi ñu pơhiăp. 
But if there be a revelation to another sitting [there], let the first be silent. @ Tơdah sa čô dŏ ber ƀơi anŭn hmâo tơlơi bơrơđah, brơi pô pơhiăp tal hlâo anŭn dŏ rơiăt. 
For ye can all prophesy one by one, that all may learn and all be encouraged. @ Yua kơ abih bang ƀing gih dưi laĭ lui hlâo, sa čô sa čô, kiăng kơ abih bang dưi hrăm laih anŭn hmâo tơlơi pơđĭ pran jua. 
And spirits of prophets are subject to prophets. @ Bơngăt jua ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo khŏm đup gưt kơ ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo. 
For God is not [a God] of disorder but of peace, as in all the assemblies of the saints. @ Yua kơ Ơi Adai ƀu jing Ơi Adai kơ tơlơi sŭl kŭl ôh; samơ̆ kơ tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua.
Kar hăng amăng abih bang Phung Sang Ơi Adai kơ ƀing rơgoh hiam, 
Let [your] women be silent in the assemblies, for it is not permitted to them to speak; but to be in subjection, as the law also says. @ ƀing đah kơmơi khŏm dŏ rơiăt amăng Phung Sang Ơi Adai. Yua kơ gơñu ƀu dưi pơhiăp ôh, samơ̆ khŏm gơñu tui gưt kar hăng tơlơi juăt hmâo pơtô laih. 
But if they wish to learn anything, let them ask their own husbands at home; for it is a shame for a woman to speak in assembly. @ Tơdah hmâo tơlơi gơñu kiăng thâo hluh, brơi gơñu tơña rơkơi gơñu pơ sang. Yua kơ sa čô đah kơmơi pơhiăp amăng Phung Sang Ơi Adai jing sa tơlơi mlâo hañ biă mă.
Did the word of God go out from you, or did it come to you only? @ Djơ̆ mơ̆ boh pơhiăp Ơi Adai tơbiă rai mơ̆ng ƀing gih, ƀôdah boh pơhiăp Ơi Adai kơnơ̆ng truh kơ ƀing gih đôč? 
If any one thinks himself to be a prophet or spiritual, let him recognise the things that I write to you, that it is [the] Lord's commandment. @ Tơdah hlơi pô pơmĭn ñu jing pô laĭ lui hlâo ƀôdah jing mơnuih hmâo tơlơi pha brơi gah mơyang, brơi ñu khŏm tŭ ư tơlơi kâo čih kơ ƀing gih anai jing tơlơi pơtă mơ̆ng Khua Yang. 
But if any be ignorant, let him be ignorant. @ Tơdah hlơi pô ƀu tŭ ư ôh tơlơi anai, anăm ƀing gih bơngơ̆t kơ ñu ôh.
So that, brethren, desire to prophesy, and do not forbid the speaking with tongues. @ Tui anŭn Ơ ƀing adơi ayŏng kâo, čang kiăng bĕ kơ tơlơi dưi laĭ lui hlâo laih anŭn anăm khă ôh arăng pơhiăp tơlơi tuai. 
But let all things be done comelily and with order. @ Samơ̆ brơi ƀing gih ngă abih bang tơlơi hăng tơlơi geh gal laih anŭn djơ̆ hăng tơlơi thâo piăt.
But I make known to you, brethren, the glad tidings which I announced to you, which also ye received, in which also ye stand, @ Ơ ƀing adơi ayŏng, kâo kiăng pơhơdơr kơ ƀing gih kơ Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam kâo hmâo pơtô laih kơ ƀing gih, tơlơi anŭn ƀing gih hmâo mă tŭ laih, laih anŭn amăng tơlơi anŭn mơ̆n ƀing gih dŏ kơjăp. 
by which also ye are saved, (if ye hold fast the word which I announced to you as the glad tidings,) unless indeed ye have believed in vain. @ Mơ̆ng Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam anŭn yơh ƀing gih dưi klaih laih, tơdah ƀing gih djă kơjăp Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam kâo hmâo pơtô laih — tơdah ƀu djơ̆ tui anŭn ôh, tơlơi ƀing gih đaŏ jing đôč đač yơh.
For I delivered to you, in the first place, what also I had received, that Christ died for our sins, according to the scriptures; @  Yua kơ kâo hmâo pơtô laih kơ ƀing gih tơlơi yom hloh, tơlơi kâo pô ăt hmâo mă tŭ laih mơ̆n, anŭn jing Krist hmâo djai laih yua tơlơi soh ƀing ta tui hăng Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp hmâo čih laih, 
and that he was buried; and that he was raised the third day, according to the scriptures; @ arăng dơr Ñu laih, Ñu hmâo hơdip glaĭ laih ƀơi hrơi tal klâo, tui hăng Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp hmâo čih laih; 
and that he appeared to Cephas, then to the twelve. @ Ñu hmâo pơƀuh Ñu pô kơ Sêphas, laih anŭn kơ ƀing pluh dua čô khua ding kơna. 
Then he appeared to above five hundred brethren at once, of whom the most remain until now, but some also have fallen asleep. @ Laih anŭn Ñu pơƀuh brơi kơ rơbeh rơma rơtuh čô ƀing adơi ayŏng đaŏ amăng sa wơ̆t. Lu amăng ƀing anŭn ăt dŏ hơdip, samơ̆ hmâo đơđa djai laih. 
Then he appeared to James; then to all the apostles; @ Ñu ăt pơƀuh brơi kơ Yakơ mơ̆n, tơdơi kơ anŭn Ñu pơƀuh brơi kơ abih bang ƀing Khua ding kơna. 
and last of all, as to an abortion, he appeared to *me* also. @ Tơdơi hloh kơ abih bang, Ñu pơƀuh brơi kơ kâo mơ̆n, kar hăng kơ sa čô ană arăng tơkeng ƀu djơ̆ hrơi blan. 
For *I* am the least of the apostles, who am not fit to be called apostle, because I have persecuted the assembly of God. @ Yua kơ kâo jing khua ding kơna anĕt hloh kơ abih bang, ƀu năng lăp ôh arăng iâu kâo khua ding kơna, yua kơ kâo hmâo ngă sat laih Phung Sang Ơi Adai kơ Ơi Adai. 
But by God's grace I am what I am; and his grace, which [was] towards me, has not been vain; but I have laboured more abundantly than they all, but not *I*, but the grace of God which [was] with me. @ Samơ̆ hăng tơlơi pap Ơi Adai, kâo jing kar hăng kâo jing ră anai, laih anŭn tơlơi pap Ñu pha brơi kâo ƀu jing đôč đač ôh. Samơ̆ kâo mă bruă gleh hloh kơ abih bang ƀing khua ding kơna pơkŏn, ƀu djơ̆ kâo pô ôh, samơ̆ tơlơi pap Ơi Adai dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng kâo. 
Whether, therefore, I or they, thus we preach, and thus ye have believed. @ Tui anŭn, wơ̆t dah kâo ƀôdah ƀing gơñu, tơlơi anŭn yơh ƀing gơmơi pơtô, laih anŭn jing tơlơi ƀing gih hmâo đaŏ laih.
Now if Christ is preached that he is raised from among [the] dead, how say some among you that there is not a resurrection of [those that are] dead? @ Tui anŭn, tơdah arăng pơtô tơlơi Krist hmâo hơdip glaĭ mơ̆ng ƀing djai, hyư̆m hmâo đơđa amăng ƀing gih laĭ ƀu hmâo tơlơi hơdip glaĭ ôh kơ ƀing djai? 
But if there is not a resurrection of [those that are] dead, neither is Christ raised: @ Tơdah ƀing djai ƀu hơdip glaĭ ôh, Krist kŏn hmâo hơdip glaĭ lơi. 
but if Christ is not raised, then, indeed, vain also [is] our preaching, and vain also your faith. @ Laih anŭn tơdah Krist ƀu hơdip glaĭ ôh, tơlơi gơmơi pơtô jing đôč đač, laih anŭn tơlơi ƀing gih đaŏ ăt jing đôč đač mơ̆n. 
And we are found also false witnesses of God; for we have witnessed concerning God that he raised the Christ, whom he has not raised if indeed [those that are] dead are not raised. @ Hloh kơ anŭn dơ̆ng, tơdah sĭt ƀing djai ƀu hơdip glaĭ ôh laih anŭn ƀing ta laĭ Ơi Adai hmâo pơhơdip glaĭ Krist mơ̆ng ƀing djai jing ƀing ta ngă gơ̆ng jơlan ƀlor kơ Ơi Adai, yua kơ Ñu ƀu hmâo pơhơdip glaĭ Krist ôh. 
For if [those that are] dead are not raised, neither is Christ raised; @ Yua kơ tơdah ƀing djai ƀu hơdip glaĭ ôh, Yang Krist kŏn hơdip glaĭ lơi. 
but if Christ be not raised, your faith [is] vain; ye are yet in your sins. @ Tơdah Krist ƀu hơdip glaĭ ôh, tơlơi ƀing gih đaŏ ăt jing đôč đač mơ̆n laih anŭn ƀing gih ăt dŏ amăng tơlơi soh ƀing gih. 
Then indeed also those who have fallen asleep in Christ have perished. @ Tui anŭn ƀing djai laih amăng Krist ăt răm rơngiă kar kaĭ mơ̆n. 
If in this life only we have hope in Christ, we are [the] most miserable of all men. @ Tơdah amăng Krist ƀing ta kơnơ̆ng hmâo tơlơi čang rơmang amăng kơ tơlơi hơdip anai đôč, ƀing ta jing ƀing lăp kơ arăng pap mơñai hloh kơ abih bang mơnuih yơh.
(But now Christ is raised from among [the] dead, first-fruits of those fallen asleep. @ Samơ̆ Krist hmâo hơdip glaĭ laih mơ̆ng ƀing djai, Ñu jing boh hlâo hlang kơ ƀing djai. 
For since by man [came] death, by man also resurrection of [those that are] dead. @ Yua kơ kar hăng tơlơi djai hmâo truh laih mơ̆ng sa čô mơnuih, ăt kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n tơlơi hơdip glaĭ mơ̆ng ƀing djai hmâo truh laih mơ̆ng sa čô mơnuih. 
For as in the Adam all die, thus also in the Christ all shall be made alive. @ Yua kơ kar hăng amăng Ađam abih bang leng kơ djai, kar kaĭ mơ̆n amăng Krist abih bang leng kơ či hơdip glaĭ. 
But each in his own rank: [the] first-fruits, Christ; then those that are the Christ's at his coming. @ Samơ̆ rĭm čô djơ̆ tui hăng tal ñu; Krist jing boh hlâo hlang, tơdơi kơ anŭn ƀing lơ̆m kơ Krist či hơdip glaĭ ƀơi hrơi Ñu či rai dơ̆ng. 
Then the end, when he gives up the kingdom to him [who is] God and Father; when he shall have annulled all rule and all authority and power. @ Giơ̆ng anŭn tơlơi hnal tuč či truh, hlăk anŭn Ñu či jao dêh čar pơtao kơ Ơi Adai jing Ama, giơ̆ng Ñu pơrai hĭ abih tơlơi dưi wai lăng, abih tơlơi dưi prŏng, laih anŭn abih tơlơi dưi mơyang. 
For he must reign until he put all enemies under his feet. @ Yua kơ Ñu khŏm wai lăng, tơl Ơi Adai dưm abih bang ƀing ayăt Ñu ƀơi yŭ tơkai Ñu. 
[The] last enemy [that] is annulled [is] death. @ Pô ayăt hnal tuč Ñu či pơrai hĭ jing tơlơi djai. 
For he has put all things in subjection under his feet. But when he says that all things are put in subjection, [it is] evident that [it is] except him who put all things in subjection to him. @ “Yua kơ Ơi Adai hmâo pioh laih abih bang mơnơ̆ng gah yŭ tơkai Ñu.” Samơ̆ tơ Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp laĭ: “Abih bang mơnơ̆ng dŏ gah yŭ kơ tơkai Ñu,” jing ƀu hmâo yap Ơi Adai amăng anŭn ôh; Ñu jing pô pioh abih bang tơlơi mơnơ̆ng gah yŭ tơkai Krist. 
But when all things shall have been brought into subjection to him, then the Son also himself shall be placed in subjection to him who put all things in subjection to him, that God may be all in all.) @ Tơ abih bang tơlơi mơnơ̆ng hmâo dŏ gah yŭ laih kơ tơlơi Krist wai lăng, hlăk anŭn mơ̆n Ñu Pô jing Ană ăt či dŏ gah yŭ kơ Ơi Adai, jing Pô hmâo ngă brơi abih bang tơlơi mơnơ̆ng dŏ gah yŭ kơ Ñu, kiăng kơ Ơi Adai dưi jing abih bang amăng abih bang.
Since what shall the baptised for the dead do if [those that are] dead rise not at all? why also are they baptised for them? @ Tơdah ƀu djơ̆ tui anŭn ôh, hơgĕt yom arăng tŭ ƀatem pơala brơi ƀing djai? Tơdah sĭt ƀing djai ƀu hơdip glaĭ ôh, hyư̆m arăng tŭ ƀatem pơala brơi ƀing gơñu lĕ? 
Why do *we* also endanger ourselves every hour? @ Hyư̆m ƀing gơmơi dŏ amăng tơlơi hyưt pưt rĭm mông? 
Daily I die, by your boasting which I have in Christ Jesus our Lord. @ Ơ ƀing adơi ayŏng, kâo dŏ ƀơi anăp tơlơi djai rĭm hrơi, sĭt yơh kar hăng ƀing gih jing tơlơi guh kơang kơ kâo amăng Krist Yêsu, Khua Yang ƀing ta! 
If, [to speak] after the manner of man, I have fought with beasts in Ephesus, what is the profit to me if [those that are] dead do not rise? let us eat and drink; for to-morrow we die. @ Tơdah pơhiăp tui hăng mơnuih hơgĕt tơlơi tŭ yua kâo hmâo tơdah kâo pơblah hăng hlô glai pơ plei Êphêsô? Tơdah ƀing djai ƀu hơdip glaĭ ôh,
“Brơi ƀing ta ƀơ̆ng huă laih anŭn mơñum bĕ,
Yua kơ hrơi pơgi ƀing ta či djai!”
Be not deceived: evil communications corrupt good manners. @ Anăm lĕ amăng tơlơi plư ôh: “Ƀing giăng mah sat pơrai kơnuih hiam.” 
Awake up righteously, and sin not; for some are ignorant of God: I speak to you as a matter of shame. @ Klă djrưng bĕ, pơmĭn glaĭ hăng tơlơi djơ̆, laih anŭn anăm ngă soh dơ̆ng ôh. Yua kơ hmâo đơđa amăng ƀing gih ƀu thâo krăn Ơi Adai ôh. Kâo laĭ tơlơi anai kiăng pơmlâo ƀing gih.
But some one will say, How are the dead raised? and with what body do they come? @ Samơ̆ hmâo mơnuih či tơña: “Hyư̆m ƀing djai či hơdip glaĭ? Hăng mơta drơi jan hơgĕt gơñu či hmâo glaĭ lĕ?” 
Fool; what *thou* sowest is not quickened unless it die. @ Ơ mơnuih mlŭk! Hơgĕt mơnơ̆ng ih sai tơdah blŭng hlâo ñu ƀu djai hĭ ôh, ñu ƀu thâo hơdip glaĭ ôh. 
And what thou sowest, thou sowest not the body that shall be, but a bare grain: it may be of wheat, or some one of the rest: @ Laih anŭn mơnơ̆ng ih sai anŭn, ƀu djơ̆ ôh jing ana či čăt đĭ, samơ̆ kơnơ̆ng sa sar pơjeh đôč, năng ai pơjeh pơdai ƀôdah pơjeh pơkŏn. 
and God gives to it a body as he has pleased, and to each of the seeds its own body. @ Samơ̆ Ơi Adai brơi gơ̆ ana tui hăng Ñu kiăng, laih anŭn kơ rĭm mơta pơjeh Ñu brơi ana gơ̆ pô.
Every flesh [is] not the same flesh, but one [is] of men, and another flesh of beasts, and another [flesh] of birds, and another of fishes. @ Ƀu djơ̆ ôh abih bang asar jing kar kaĭ, asar mơnuih phara, asar hlô mơnơ̆ng phara, asar čĭm brĭm phara, laih anŭn asar akan phara. 
And [there are] heavenly bodies, and earthly bodies: but different is the glory of the heavenly, different that of the earthly: @ Hmâo drơi jan gah kơ adai, laih anŭn hmâo drơi jan gah kơ lŏn tơnah; samơ̆ tơlơi guh kơang drơi jan gah kơ adai phara hăng tơlơi guh kơang gah lŏn kơ tơnah. 
one [the] sun's glory, and another [the] moon's glory, and another [the] stars' glory; for star differs from star in glory. @ Tơlơi guh kơang yang hrơi phara, tơlơi guh kơang yang blan phara, laih anŭn tơlơi guh kơang pơtŭ phara; laih anŭn tơlơi guh kơang sa sar pơtŭ anai phara hăng tơlơi guh kơang sa sar pơtŭ pơkŏn.
Thus also [is] the resurrection of the dead. It is sown in corruption, it is raised in incorruptibility. @ Tơlơi hơdip glaĭ kơ ƀing mơnuih djai ăt kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n. Drơi jan arăng sai, thâo brŭ ro; samơ̆ drơi jan hơdip glaĭ, ƀu thâo brŭ ro ôh. 
It is sown in dishonour, it is raised in glory. It is sown in weakness, it is raised in power. @ Hlăk arăng dơr lui, ñu sat laih anŭn tơdu; samơ̆ hlăk hơdip glaĭ ñu či jing hiam rŏ laih anŭn kơtang. 
It is sown a natural body, it is raised a spiritual body: if there is a natural body, there is also a spiritual [one]. @ Arăng sai ñu jing drơi jan asar; hơdip glaĭ ñu hmâo drơi jan mơyang. Tơdah hmâo drơi jan asar, tui anŭn ăt hmâo mơ̆n drơi jan mơyang. 
Thus also it is written, The first man Adam became a living soul; the last Adam a quickening spirit. @ Tui anai Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp hmâo čih laih:
“Mơnuih tal blŭng hlâo, Ađam jing drơi jan hơdip; samơ̆ Ađam hnal tuč jing bơngăt mơyang pha brơi tơlơi hơdip.”
But that which is spiritual [was] not first, but that which is natural, then that which is spiritual: @ Ƀu djơ̆ ôh gah bơngăt mơyang truh blŭng hlâo, samơ̆ gah asar; tơdơi kơ anŭn gah bơngăt mơyang truh. 
the first man out of [the] earth, made of dust; the second man, out of heaven. @ Mơnuih tal blŭng rai mơ̆ng lŏn, jing gah kơ lŏn, mơnuih tal dua rai mơ̆ng adai. 
Such as he made of dust, such also those made of dust; and such as the heavenly [one], such also the heavenly [ones]. @ Ƀing mơnuih gah kơ lŏn, gơñu jing kar hăng mơnuih mơ̆ng lŏn, ƀing mơnuih gah kơ adai, gơñu jing kar hăng Pô rai mơ̆ng adai. 
And as we have borne the image of the [one] made of dust, we shall bear also the image of the heavenly [one]. @ Kar hăng ƀing ta hmâo laih rup mơnuih gah kơ lŏn, ăt tui anŭn mơ̆n ƀing ta či hmâo rup mơnuih mơ̆ng adai.
But this I say, brethren, that flesh and blood cannot inherit God's kingdom, nor does corruption inherit incorruptibility. @ Ơ adơi ayŏng, kâo laĭ sĭt tơlơi anai kơ ƀing gih: asar laih anŭn drah ƀu dưi mă tŭ dêh čar pơtao Ơi Adai ôh, hơgĕt tơlơi thâo brŭ ro kŏn dưi mă tŭ lơi tơlơi ƀu thâo brŭ ro. 
Behold, I tell you a mystery: We shall not all fall asleep, but we shall all be changed, @ Anai nê, tơlơi yom hơgơ̆m kâo laĭ brơi kơ ƀing gih: ƀing ta ƀu či djai abih bang ôh, samơ̆ abih bang ƀing ta či hmâo tơlơi hrih pơblih, 
in an instant, in [the] twinkling of an eye, at the last trumpet; for the trumpet shall sound, and the dead shall be raised incorruptible, and *we* shall be changed. @ blĭp hơmăr kar hăng añĕp mơta, hlăk hmư̆ asăp tơki hnal tuč. Hlăk anŭn ƀing djai či hơdip glaĭ ƀu thâo brŭ rai dơ̆ng ôh, laih anŭn ƀing ta či hmâo tơlơi hrih pơblih. 
For this corruptible must needs put on incorruptibility, and this mortal put on immortality. @ Yua kơ drơi jan thâo brŭ ro anai khŏm buh mă drơi jan ƀu thâo brŭ ro ôh; laih anŭn drơi jan thâo djai anai khŏm buh mă drơi jan ƀu thâo djai ôh. 
But when this corruptible shall have put on incorruptibility, and this mortal shall have put on immortality, then shall come to pass the word written: Death has been swallowed up in victory. @ Tơdah drơi jan thâo brŭ ro anai khŏm buh mă drơi jan ƀu thâo brŭ ro ôh, laih anŭn drơi jan thâo djai anai khŏm buh mă drơi jan ƀu thâo djai ôh, hlăk anŭn či jing krĕp djơ̆ Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp hmâo čih laih tui anai: “Tơlơi dưi lun hĭ laih tơlơi djai.”
Where, O death, [is] thy sting? where, O death, thy victory? @  “Ơ tơlơi djai, pơpă tơlơi dưi ŏng lĕ?
Ơ tơlơi djai, pơpă ia bih ŏng lĕ?”
Now the sting of death [is] sin, and the power of sin the law; @ Ia bih tơlơi djai jing tơlơi soh, laih anŭn tơlơi kơtang kơ tơlơi soh jing tơlơi juăt. 
but thanks to God, who gives us the victory by our Lord Jesus Christ. @ Samơ̆ bơni hơơč kơ Ơi Adai, Pô brơi kơ ƀing ta tơlơi dưi amăng Yêsu Krist Khua Yang ƀing ta.
So then, my beloved brethren, be firm, immovable, abounding always in the work of the Lord, knowing that your toil is not in vain in [the] Lord. @ Hnŭn yơh, Ơ ƀing adơi ayŏng kâo khăp hơeng, dŏ kơjăp bĕ anăm rŭng răng ôh, laih anŭn ngă bĕ bruă Khua Yang rơbeh blai nanao, yua kơ ƀing gih thâo laih bruă ƀing gih ngă amăng Khua Yang ƀu jing đôč đač ôh.
Now concerning the collection for the saints, as I directed the assemblies of Galatia, so do *ye* do also. @  Kơ bruă đup pơyơr kiăng djru ƀing rơgoh hiam, kar hăng kâo hmâo pơtă laih kơ Phung Sang Ơi Adai pơ Galati, brơi ƀing gih ăt ngă kar kaĭ mơ̆n. 
On [the] first of [the] week let each of you put by at home, laying up [in] whatever [degree] he may have prospered, that there may be no collections when I come. @ Ƀơi hrơi tal sa rĭm hrơi kơ̆m, brơi rĭm čô amăng ƀing gih pơkom pioh bĕ sa črăn tui hăng ñu dưi, anăm ôh dŏ tơguan tơ kâo truh amơĭ kah nao ring đup pơyơr. 
And when I am arrived, whomsoever ye shall approve, these I will send with letters to carry your bounty to Jerusalem: @ Laih anŭn tơ kâo truh, kâo či pơkiaŏ nao ƀing mơnuih ƀing gih tŭ ư ba hră kâo laih anŭn gơnam ƀing gih pha brơi, nao pơ plei Yêrusalem. 
and if it be suitable that *I* also should go, they shall go with me. @ Tơdah kiăng kơ kâo khŏm nao, ƀing gơñu či nao hrŏm hơbĭt hăng kâo.
But I will come to you when I shall have gone through Macedonia; for I do go through Macedonia. @  Kâo či nao čuă ngui ƀing gih giơ̆ng kâo găn čar Masêđôn, yua kơ kâo pơčrăp kiăng rơbat găn čar Masêđôn. 
But perhaps I will stay with you, or even winter with you, that *ye* may set me forward wheresoever I may go. @ Kâo či dŏ glaĭ hăng ƀing gih, năng ai abih bơyan puih, kiăng kơ ƀing gih dưi djru tơlơi kâo đuaĭ hyu pơ anih kâo či nao. 
For I will not see you now in passing, for I hope to remain a certain time with you, if the Lord permit. @ Yua kơ kâo ƀu kiăng ôh ƀuh ƀing gih kơnơ̆ng tơdang kâo găn nao đôč; tơdah Khua Yang kiăng, kâo čang rơmang dŏ glaĭ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing gih sui ƀiă. 
But I remain in Ephesus until Pentecost. @ Samơ̆ kâo či dŏ glaĭ pơ Plei Êphêsô tơl truh phĕt Pantơkôt, 
For a great door is opened to me and an effectual [one], and [the] adversaries many. @ yua kơ hmâo sa boh bah amăng prŏng kơ bruă tŭ yua hmâo pŏk laih kơ kâo, wơ̆t dah pơ anŭn ăt dŏ hmâo lu ƀing pơkơdơ̆ng.
Now if Timotheus come, see that he may be with you without fear; for he works the work of the Lord, even as I. @  Tơdah Timôthê truh, brơi ƀing gih jum ñu hăng tơlơi hiam, yua kơ ñu ăt mă bruă kơ Khua Yang kar hăng kâo mơ̆n. 
Let not therefore any one despise him; but set him forward in peace, that he may come to me; for I expect him with the brethren. @ Tui anŭn anăm hlơi hlơi lăng jrăp kơ ñu ôh. Djru brơi tơlơi ñu đuaĭ hyu hăng tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua bĕ, kiăng kơ ñu dưi wơ̆t glaĭ pơ kâo dơ̆ng; yua kơ kâo dŏ tơguan ñu hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing adơi ayŏng pơkŏn.
Now concerning the brother Apollos, I begged him much that he would go to you with the brethren; but it was not at all [his] will to go now; but he will come when he shall have good opportunity. @ Bơ kơ Apôlôs adơi ayŏng ƀing ta, kâo hmâo gir pơtrŭt laih ñu kiăng kơ ñu hrŏm hơbĭt hăng adơi ayŏng pơkŏn nao čuă ngui ƀing gih, samơ̆ ră anai ñu aka kiăng nao ôh. Ñu či nao tơ ñu hmâo mông gal.
Be vigilant; stand fast in the faith; quit yourselves like men; be strong. @ Brơi ƀing gih dŏ răng nanao, dŏ kơjăp bĕ amăng tơlơi đaŏ, brơi ƀing gih khĭn laih anŭn kơtang. 
Let all things ye do be done in love. @ Abih bang tơlơi ƀing gih ngă, ngă bĕ hăng pran jua khăp.
But I beseech you, brethren, (ye know the house of Stephanas, that it is the first-fruits of Achaia, and they have devoted themselves to the saints for service,) @  Ơ ƀing adơi ayŏng, kâo dŏ hmâo sa tơlơi pơtă dơ̆ng, ƀing gih thâo laih sang anŏ Sêphanas, jing khul boh hlâo hlang amăng čar Akai, laih anŭn gơñu hmâo jao laih gơñu pô kiăng djru bruă kơ ƀing rơgoh hiam. 
that *ye* should also be subject to such, and to every one joined in the work and labouring. @ Kâo pơđur pơtrŭt ƀing gih brơi ƀing gih pơpŭ kơ ƀing mơnuih kar hăng anŭn, laih anŭn wơ̆t kơ abih bang ƀing mă bruă hrŏm hơbĭt hăng gơñu.
But I rejoice in the coming of Stephanas and Fortunatus and Achaicus; because *they* have supplied what was lacking on your part. @ Kâo hơ̆k mơak tơ ƀuh Sêphanas, Pôrtunatus, laih anŭn Akaikus rai truh pơ anai; yua kơ gơñu hrua pơala ƀing gih rơkut. 
For they have refreshed my spirit and yours: own therefore such. @ Yua kơ ƀing gơñu hmâo pơđĭ laih pran jua kâo kar hăng ƀing gơñu pơđĭ pran jua ƀing gih mơ̆n. Brơi ƀing gih pơpŭ pơyom bĕ kơ ƀing mơnuih kar hăng anŭn.
The assemblies of Asia salute you. Aquila and Priscilla, with the assembly in their house, salute you much in [the] Lord. @  Phung Sang Ơi Adai čar Asi mơit tơlơi čuă ngui kơ ƀing gih. Akilas laih anŭn HʼPrisil hrŏm hăng Phung Sang Ơi Adai bơjơnum amăng sang gơñu mơit tơlơi čuă ngui hăng tơlơi khăp kơ ƀing gih amăng Khua Yang. 
All the brethren salute you. Salute one another with a holy kiss. @ Abih bang ƀing adơi ayŏng mơit tơlơi čuă ngui. Brơi ƀing gih kơkuh čuă ngui bĕ tơdruă ƀing gih hăng tơlơi čŭm rơgoh hiam.
The salutation of [me] Paul with my own hand. @ Kâo Pôl, hăng tơngan kâo pô čih tơlơi čuă ngui anai.
If any one love not the Lord [Jesus Christ] let him be Anathema Maranatha. @ Tơdah hmâo hlơi ƀu khăp ôh kơ Khua Yang, brơi ñu tŭ Anathem. Maranatha!
The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ [be] with you. @ Rơkâo tơlơi pap Khua Yang Yêsu dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing gih.
My love [be] with you all in Christ Jesus. Amen. @ Tơlơi khăp kâo dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng abih bang ƀing gih amăng Krist Yêsu. Amen.
Paul, apostle of Jesus Christ by God's will, and the brother Timotheus, to the assembly of God which is in Corinth, with all the saints who are in the whole of Achaia. @  Pôl, sa čô khua ding kơna Krist Yêsu tui hăng tơlơi Ơi Adai kiăng, laih anŭn adơi ayŏng ƀing ta Timôthê, mơit kơ Phung Sang Ơi Adai kơ Ơi Adai pơ plei Kôrantô, hrŏm hơbĭt hăng abih bang ƀing rơgoh hiam dŏ tar ƀar čar Akai. 
Grace to you, and peace from God our Father, and [the] Lord Jesus Christ. @ Rơkâo kơ Ơi Adai Ama ƀing ta laih anŭn Khua Yang Yêsu Krist pha brơi tơlơi pap hăng tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua kơ ƀing gih.
Blessed [be] the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of compassions, and God of all encouragement; @ Hơơč bơni kơ Ơi Adai, Ama Yêsu Krist Khua Yang ƀing ta, Ama kơ tơlơi thâo pap laih anŭn Ơi Adai kơ abih tơlơi pơalum. 
who encourages us in all our tribulation, that we may be able to encourage those who are in any tribulation whatever, through the encouragement with which we ourselves are encouraged of God. @ Ñu pơalum kơ gơmơi amăng abih bang tơlơi tơnap gơmơi, kiăng kơ gơmơi dưi pơalum ƀing dŏ amăng tơlơi tơnap tap, hăng tơlơi pơalum Ơi Adai hmâo pơalum laih ƀing gơmơi. 
Because, even as the sufferings of the Christ abound towards us, so through the Christ does our encouragement also abound. @ Yua kơ kar hăng ƀing gơmơi hmâo tŭ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Yang Krist amăng lu tơlơi tơnap tap, kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n amăng Krist gơmơi hmâo tŭ hrŏm hơbĭt lu tơlơi pơalum. 
But whether we are in tribulation, [it is] for your encouragement and salvation, wrought in the endurance of the same sufferings which *we* also suffer, @ Tơdah gơmơi hmâo tŭ tơlơi tơnap tap, tơlơi anŭn kiăng kơ ƀing gih dưi hmâo tơlơi pơalum laih anŭn tơlơi pơklaih. Tơdah gơmơi hmâo tơlơi pơalum, tơlơi anŭn kiăng pơalum ƀing gih. Tơlơi pơalum anŭn pơjing amăng ƀing gih tơlơi gir tơdang tŭ tơlơi tơnap tap kar hăng gơmơi hmâo tŭ laih. 
(and our hope for you [is] sure;) or whether we are encouraged, [it is] for your encouragement and salvation: knowing that as ye are partakers of the sufferings, so also of the encouragement. @ Tơlơi gơmơi čang rơmang ƀơi ƀing gih kơjăp biă mă; yua kơ gơmơi thâo tơdang ƀing gih tŭ tơlơi tơnap hrŏm hơbĭt hăng gơmơi, kar kaĭ mơ̆n ƀing gih či hmâo tơlơi pơalum hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing gơmơi.
For we do not wish you to be ignorant, brethren, as to our tribulation which happened [to us] in Asia, that we were excessively pressed beyond [our] power, so as to despair even of living. @  Ơ ƀing adơi ayŏng, gơmơi kiăng kơ ƀing gih thâo kơ tơlơi tơnap tap hmâo truh laih kơ ƀing gơmơi amăng čar Asi. Yua kơ gơmơi hmâo tơlơi kơtraŏ biă mă rơgao hloh kơ tơlơi gơmơi dưi tŭ, tơl gơmơi ƀu hmâo tơlơi čang rơmang dưi dŏ hơdip dơ̆ng ôh. 
But we ourselves had the sentence of death in ourselves, that we should not have our trust in ourselves, but in God who raises the dead; @ Gơmơi pơmĭn gơmơi mă tŭ laih tơlơi klă kơđi tŭ tơlơi djai; samơ̆ tơlơi anŭn kiăng kơ gơmơi ƀu kơnang kơ gơmơi pô ôh, samơ̆ kơnang kơ Ơi Adai, Pô hmâo pơhơdip glaĭ ƀing djai. 
who has delivered us from so great a death, and does deliver; in whom we confide that he will also yet deliver; @ Ñu pô hmâo pơklaih laih ƀing gơmơi mơ̆ng tơlơi hyưt pưt krip yip kơ tơlơi djai, Ñu hmâo pơklaih laih ƀing gơmơi; laih anŭn gơmơi čang rơmang kơ Ñu či pơklaih gơmơi nanao dơ̆ng, 
ye also labouring together by supplication for us that the gift towards us, through means of many persons, may be the subject of the thanksgiving of many for us. @ brơi ƀing gih ăt djru ƀing gơmơi hăng tơlơi ƀing gih iâu laĭ, kiăng kơ mơ̆ng tơlơi iâu laĭ kơ lu mơnuih gơmơi dưi hmâo tơlơi pap, hăng tơlơi anŭn, lu mơnuih či bơni hơơč kơ Ơi Adai yua kơ ƀing gơmơi.
For our boasting is this, the testimony of our conscience, that in simplicity and sincerity before God, (not in fleshly wisdom but in God's grace,) we have had our conversation in the world, and more abundantly towards you. @ Tơlơi ngă kơ ƀing gơmơi dưi pơ-ư pô, anŭn yơh pran jua tơpă gơmơi gơ̆ng jơlan pơsĭt kơ tơlơi gơmơi dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă hăng tơlơi rơgoh hiam mơ̆ng Ơi Adai amăng lŏn tơnah anai, boh nik nak ƀơi anăp ƀing gih ƀu djơ̆ hăng tơlơi kơhnâo gah kơ asar đeh ôh, samơ̆ hăng tơlơi pap Ơi Adai. 
For we do not write other things to you but what ye well know and recognise; and I hope that ye will recognise to the end, @ Yua kơ ƀing gơmơi kơnơ̆ng čih kơ ƀing gih tơlơi ƀing gih dưi đŏk laih anŭn thâo hluh. Kâo čang rơmang ƀing gih či thâo hluh klă rơđah, 
even as also ye have recognised us in part, that we are your boast, even as *ye* [are] ours in the day of the Lord Jesus. @ kar hăng ƀing gih hmâo thâo hluh laih ƀing gơmơi amăng đơđa tơlơi, jing tơlơi ƀing gih dưi pơ-ư gih pô yua kơ ƀing gơmơi, kar hăng ƀing gơmơi dưi pơ-ư gơmơi pô yua kơ ƀing gih ƀơi hrơi Khua Yang Yêsu.
And with this confidence I purposed to come to you previously, that ye might have a second favour; @ Yua kơ kâo thâo sĭt tơlơi anŭn, kâo kiăng nao pơ ƀing gih hlâo, tui anŭn ƀing gih dưi hmâo tơlơi mơyun hiam dua wơ̆t lu hloh. 
and to pass through to Macedonia by you, and again from Macedonia to come to you, and to be set forward by you to Judaea. @ Kâo kiăng čuă ngui ƀing gih tơdang kâo nao pơ čar Masêđôn laih anŭn mơ̆ng čar Masêđôn wơ̆t glaĭ pơ ƀing gih dơ̆ng, laih anŭn brơi ƀing gih djru tơlơi kâo đuaĭ hyu pơ čar Yuđa. 
Having therefore this purpose, did I then use lightness? Or what I purpose, do I purpose according to flesh, that there should be with me yea yea, and nay nay? @ Djơ̆ mơ̆ kâo kĭ kơ̆ tơ kâo kiăng ngă tui anŭn? Kâo pơčrăp hơdră kar hăng sa čô mơnuih lŏn tơnah hă, tơl hmeč laĭ Ư, hmeč laĭ Ư ưh? 
Now God [is] faithful, that our word to you is not yea and nay. @ Sĭt biă mă kar hăng Ơi Adai jing hơnơ̆ng ten, tơlơi gơmơi hmâo pơhiăp laih hăng ƀing gih ƀu djơ̆ hmeč jing “Ư” laih anŭn hmeč jing “Ư ưh” ôh. 
For the Son of God, Jesus Christ, he who has been preached by us among you (by me and Silvanus and Timotheus), did not become yea and nay, but yea *is* in him. @ Yua kơ Yêsu Krist Ană Ơi Adai, tơlơi Silwan, Timôthê laih anŭn kâo hmâo pơtô laih tơ̆ng krah ƀing gih ƀu djơ̆ hmeč jing “Ư” laih anŭn hmeč jing “Ư ưh” ôh, samơ̆ amăng Ñu jing “Ư” nanao. 
For whatever promises of God [there are], in him is the yea, and in him the amen, for glory to God by us. @ Yua kơ amăng Krist, abih bang tơlơi Ơi Adai ƀuăn jing “Ư”. Yua kơ anŭn yơh amăng Krist ƀing ta laĭ Amen, kiăng pơ-ư pơang kơ Ơi Adai. 
Now he that establishes us with you in Christ, and has anointed us, [is] God, @ Ơi Adai yơh jing Pô ngă brơi laih kơ ƀing gơmơi hăng ƀing gih kơjăp amăng Krist, laih anŭn hmâo truač laih ia jâu kơ gơmơi. 
who also has sealed us, and given the earnest of the Spirit in our hearts. @ Ñu ăt hmâo kơđŏm laih gru Ñu kơ ƀing gơmơi, laih anŭn hmâo brơi laih Yang Bơngăt Hiam Ñu dŏ amăng pran jua ƀing gơmơi jing mơnơ̆ng ƀuăn grơ̆ng.
But I call God to witness upon my soul that to spare you I have not yet come to Corinth. @ Samơ̆ kâo rơkâo kơ Ơi Adai ngă gơ̆ng jơlan pơsĭt kơ bơngăt kâo, kâo ƀu nao ôh pơ plei Kôrantô, yua kơ kâo pap kơ ƀing gih. 
Not that we rule over your faith, but are fellow-workmen of your joy: for by faith ye stand. @ Ƀu djơ̆ ƀing gơmơi kiăng jing khua gĭt gai tơlơi đaŏ ƀing gih ôh; samơ̆ gơmơi kiăng mă bruă hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing gih kiăng kơ ƀing gih hmâo tơlơi mơak, yua kơ ƀing gih dŏ kơjăp amăng tơlơi đaŏ.
But I have judged this with myself, not to come back to you in grief. @ Tui anŭn, kâo khư̆p ư ƀu wơ̆t glaĭ čuă ngui ƀing gih dơ̆ng ôh hwĭ kơ pơrơngot ƀing gih. 
For if *I* grieve you, who also [is] it that gladdens me, if not he that is grieved through me? @ Yua kơ tơdah kâo pơrơngot ƀing gih, hlơi dưi bơmơak kơ kâo, kơnơ̆ng ƀing kâo hmâo pơrơngot laih yơh? 
And I have written this very [letter] [to you], that coming I may not have grief from those from whom I ought to have joy; trusting in you all that my joy is [that] of you all. @ Kâo hmâo čih laih kơ ƀing gih tui anŭn, kiăng kơ tơ kâo truh kâo ƀu či hmâo tơlơi rơngot ôh mơ̆ng ƀing mơnuih tui hăng tơlơi djơ̆ či bơmơak kơ kâo. Yua kơ kâo đaŏ sĭt biă mă tơlơi mơak kâo či jing tơlơi mơak kơ abih bang ƀing gih. 
For out of much tribulation and distress of heart I wrote to you, with many tears; not that ye may be grieved, but that ye may know the love which I have very abundantly towards you. @ Yua kơ kâo hmâo čih laih kơ ƀing gih hăng pran jua ruă nuă, rơngot biă mă, hăng lu ia mơta, ƀu djơ̆ kiăng ngă pơrơngot ƀing gih ôh, samơ̆ kiăng kơ ƀing gih thâo tơlơi kâo khăp biă mă kơ ƀing gih.
But if any one has grieved, he has grieved, not me, but in part (that I may not overcharge [you]) all of you. @ Samơ̆ tơdah sa čô ngă brơi tơlơi pơrơngot, ñu anŭn ƀu djơ̆ kơnơ̆ng pơrơngot kơ kâo đôč ôh, samơ̆ ƀiă lu ăt hmâo pơrơngot kơ abih bang ƀing gih mơ̆n. (Kâo ƀu pơhiăp rơgao đơi ôh.) 
Sufficient to such a one [is] this rebuke which [has been inflicted] by the many; @ Mơnuih anŭn hmâo tŭ tơlơi pơkơhmal mơ̆ng lu mơnuih kar hăng anŭn jing djŏp laih. 
so that on the contrary ye should rather shew grace and encourage, lest perhaps such a one should be swallowed up with excessive grief. @ Tui anŭn ră anai hiam hloh brơi kơ ƀing gih pap brơi laih anŭn pơalum ñu bĕ, hwĭ kơ ñu rơngot kơtraŏ kơtang đơi tơl ƀu anăm tŭ ôh. 
Wherefore I exhort you to assure him of [your] love. @ Tui anŭn, kâo pơđur ƀing gih pơrơđah bĕ tơlơi ƀing gih khăp kơ ñu. 
For to this end also I have written, that I might know, by putting you to the test, if as to everything ye are obedient. @ Yua kơ tơlơi hơgĕt kâo hmâo čih laih kơ ƀing gih, anŭn yơh kiăng kơ lông lăng ƀing gih thâo dah ƀing gih gưt asăp mơ̆ amăng djŏp mơta. 
But to whom ye forgive anything, *I* also; for I also, what I have forgiven, if I have forgiven anything, [it is] for your sakes in [the] person of Christ; @ Hlơi pô ƀing gih pap brơi laih, kâo pap brơi kar kaĭ mơ̆n. Hơgĕt tơlơi kâo pap brơi laih, ăt yua kơ ƀing gih mơ̆n kâo pap brơi ƀơi anăp Yang Krist, 
that we might not have Satan get an advantage against us, for we are not ignorant of *his* thoughts. @ kiăng kơ Satan ƀu dưi mơneč yua ƀing ta ôh; yua kơ ƀing ta thâo laih tơlơi mơneč ñu.
Now when I came to Troas for the [publication of the] glad tidings of the Christ, a door also being opened to me in [the] Lord, @  Tơ kâo truh pơ plei Trôas kiăng pơtô Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam Krist, wơ̆t dah Khua Yang hmâo pŏk brơi laih bah amăng kơ kâo; 
I had no rest in my spirit at not finding Titus my brother; but bidding them adieu, I came away to Macedonia. @ samơ̆ pran jua tơlơi pơmĭn kâo ƀu rơnŭk rơnua ôh, yua kơ pơ anŭn kâo ƀu ƀuh ôh Tit adơi ayŏng kâo. Tui anŭn, kâo pơhiăp tơlơi čơlah jang jai hăng ƀing gơñu laih anŭn nao pơ čar Masêđôn.
But thanks [be] to God, who always leads us in triumph in the Christ, and makes manifest the odour of his knowledge through us in every place. @ Samơ̆ bơni hơơč kơ Ơi Adai, Pô atăt ba ƀing gơmơi dưi hĭ nanao amăng Yang Krist, laih anŭn mơ̆ng gơmơi, Ñu sai mơnâo ƀâu mơngưi kơ tơlơi thâo krăn Ñu lar tar ƀar anih. 
For we are a sweet odour of Christ to God, in the saved and in those that perish: @ Yua kơ gơmơi jing mơnâo ƀâu mơngưi Yang Krist pơyơr kơ Ơi Adai ƀơi tơ̆ng krah ƀing dưi klaih laih, laih anŭn ƀơi tơ̆ng krah ƀing dŏ răm rơngiă. 
to the one an odour from death unto death, but to the others an odour from life unto life; and who [is] sufficient for these things? @ Kơ ƀing mơnuih răm rơngiă, gơmơi jing mơnâo tơlơi djai, ba kơ tơlơi djai; kơ ƀing mơnuih hmâo tơlơi pơklaih laih, gơmơi jing mơnâo tơlơi hơdip, ba kơ tơlơi hơdip. Hlơi năng lăp dưi ngă khul bruă anai? 
For we do not, as the many, make a trade of the word of God; but as of sincerity, but as of God, before God, we speak in Christ. @ Yua kơ gơmơi ƀu sĭ mia boh pơhiăp Ơi Adai kar hăng ƀing mơnuih pơkŏn ôh. Samơ̆ jing ƀing mơnuih Ơi Adai pơkiaŏ nao, ƀing gơmơi pơtô hăng tơlơi tơpă sĭt amăng Yang Krist, ƀơi anăp Ơi Adai.
Do we begin again to commend ourselves? or do we need, as some, commendatory letters to you, or [commendatory] from you? @ Djơ̆ mơ̆ gơmơi čơdơ̆ng pơ-ư kơ gơmơi pô dơ̆ng? Ƀôdah gơmơi kiăng kar hăng ƀing pơkŏn hmâo hră pơsĭt brơi kơ gơmơi ba kơ ƀing gih, ƀôdah hră pơsĭt brơi mơ̆ng ƀing gih kơ gơmơi? 
*Ye* are our letter, written in our hearts, known and read of all men, @ Ƀing gih pô yơh jing hră pơthâo kơ gơmơi, hmâo čih laih amăng pran jua gơmơi, kiăng kơ abih bang mơnuih thâo laih anŭn đŏk. 
being manifested to be Christ's epistle ministered by us, written, not with ink, but [the] Spirit of [the] living God; not on stone tables, but on fleshy tables of [the] heart. @ Laih anŭn ƀing gih bơrơđah kơ ƀing gih jing hră mơ̆ng Krist, hmâo čih laih yua mơ̆ng bruă mă ƀing gơmơi, ƀu djơ̆ čih hăng ia hră ôh, samơ̆ hăng Yang Bơngăt Hiam Ơi Adai Pô hơdip, ƀu djơ̆ čih ƀơi hnal boh pơtâo ôh, samơ̆ ƀơi hơnal pran jua mơnuih.
And such confidence have we through the Christ towards God: @ Kơnang kơ Yang Krist, ƀing gơmơi đaŏ sĭt tui anŭn ƀơi anăp Ơi Adai. 
not that we are competent of ourselves to think anything as of ourselves, but our competency [is] of God; @ Ƀu djơ̆ ôh ƀing gơmơi hmâo tơlơi rơgơi tơl dưi laĭ ƀing gơmơi dưi ngă sa mơta bruă tơbiă rai mơ̆ng gơmơi pô; samơ̆ tơlơi rơgơi gơmơi tơbiă rai mơ̆ng Ơi Adai. 
who has also made us competent, [as] ministers of [the] new covenant; not of letter, but of spirit. For the letter kills, but the Spirit quickens. @ Ñu yơh hmâo pha brơi ƀing gơmơi tơlơi dưi kiăng mă bruă kơ kơnol pơgop phrâo, ƀu djơ̆ kơnol pơgop ngă hăng boh hră ôh, samơ̆ hăng Yang Bơngăt Hiam. Yua kơ boh hră ngă brơi djai, samơ̆ Yang Bơngăt Hiam brơi tơlơi hơdip.
(But if the ministry of death, in letters, graven in stones, began with glory, so that the children of Israel could not fix their eyes on the face of Moses, on account of the glory of his face, [a glory] which is annulled; @  Tơdah bruă mă ba kơ tơlơi djai, arăng hmâo ƀoh boh hră ƀơi boh pơtâo ăt truh mơ̆n hăng tơlơi guh kơang, tơl ƀing Israel ƀu dưi lăng ƀô̆ mơta Môis ôh yua kơ mơñal, wơ̆t dah tơlơi mơñal anŭn dŏ kơnơ̆ng ƀiă đôč, 
how shall not rather the ministry of the Spirit subsist in glory? @ tui anŭn ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă bruă mă Yang Bơngăt či hmâo tơlơi guh kơang hloh dơ̆ng? 
For if the ministry of condemnation [be] glory, much rather the ministry of righteousness abounds in glory. @ Yua kơ tơdah bruă mă ba truh kơ tơlơi klă kơđi ăt hmâo mơ̆n tơlơi guh kơang, tui anŭn bruă mă ba truh tơlơi yap tơpă či hmâo tơlơi guh kơang rơgao hloh dơ̆ng. 
For also that [which was] glorified is not glorified in this respect, on account of the surpassing glory. @ Sĭt yơh, amăng tơlơi anai, tơlơi hơgĕt hmâo laih tơlơi guh kơang ƀu či hmâo tơlơi guh kơang dơ̆ng tah gah anăp kơ tơlơi guh kơang prŏng hloh anai. 
For if that annulled [was introduced] with glory, much rather that which abides [subsists] in glory. @ Yua kơ tơdah tơlơi dŏ kơnơ̆ng jang jai đôč ăt hmâo mơ̆n tơlơi guh kơang, ƀai jai tơlơi dŏ nanao hmâo tơlơi guh kơang hloh dơ̆ng.
Having therefore such hope, we use much boldness: @ Yua kơ gơmơi hmâo tơlơi čang rơmang kar hăng anŭn, hnŭn yơh gơmơi hmâo tơlơi khĭn biă mă, 
and not according as Moses put a veil on his own face, so that the children of Israel should not fix their eyes on the end of that annulled. @ ƀu ngă ôh kar hăng Môis gom hĭ ƀô̆ mơta ñu hăng khăn, kiăng kơ ƀing Israel ƀu dưi ƀuh ôh tơlơi mơñal anŭn rơngiă ƀrư̆ ƀrư̆ laih anŭn thĕng hĭ. 
But their thoughts have been darkened, for unto this day the same veil remains in reading the old covenant, unremoved, which in Christ is annulled. @ Samơ̆ pran jua gơñu ăt dŏ khăng đôč; yua kơ hlŏng truh pơ hrơi anai, tơdang gơñu đŏk hră Pơgop Hơđăp, khăn anŭn ăt aka mă lui hĭ ôh mơ̆ng gơñu. Yua kơ kơnơ̆ng amăng Krist đôč, khăn anŭn dưi mă lui hĭ. 
But unto this day, when Moses is read, the veil lies upon their heart. @ Sĭt biă mă, truh pơ hrơi anai, rĭm wơ̆t đŏk hră Môis, khăn anŭn ăt dŏ gom hĭ tơlơi pơmĭn gơñu. 
But when it shall turn to [the] Lord, the veil is taken away.) @ Samơ̆ tơdang sa čô mơnuih wơ̆t glaĭ kơ Khua Yang, khăn anŭn dưi mă lui hĭ. 
Now the Lord is the Spirit, but where the Spirit of [the] Lord [is, there is] liberty. @ Khua Yang jing Yang Bơngăt, laih anŭn pơpă anih hmâo Yang Bơngăt Khua Yang, pơ anŭn hmâo tơlơi rơngai. 
But *we* all, looking on the glory of the Lord, with unveiled face, are transformed according to the same image from glory to glory, even as by [the] Lord [the] Spirit. @ Laih anŭn abih bang ƀing ta hăng ƀô̆ mơta ƀu gom ôh dŏ lăng kơ tơlơi guh kơang Khua Yang kar hăng amăng mơnĭl, hmâo tơlơi pơplih dưi jing hrup hăng rup Ñu, mơ̆ng tơlơi guh kơang anai truh tơlơi guh kơang pơkŏn. Yua kơ tơlơi anai tơbiă rai mơ̆ng Khua Yang, Pô jing Yang Bơngăt.
Therefore, having this ministry, as we have had mercy shewn us, we faint not. @ Yua mơ̆ng tơlơi pap drap Ơi Adai, ƀing gơmơi tŭ mă bruă mă anai, hnŭn yơh gơmơi ƀu hơtah hơtai ôh. 
But we have rejected the hidden things of shame, not walking in deceit, nor falsifying the word of God, but by manifestation of the truth commending ourselves to every conscience of men before God. @ Ƀing gơmơi hơngah khul bruă ngă amăng tơlơi ƀu klă rơđah laih anŭn mlâo hañ. Gơmơi hơngah ngă tơlơi mơneč ƀôdah pơsoh hĭ boh pơhiăp Ơi Adai, samơ̆ tơdang gơmơi pơrơđah tơlơi sĭt hăng tơlơi tơpă; ƀing gơmơi pơ-ư gơmơi pô ƀơi anăp pran jua tơpă abih bang mơnuih, ƀơi anăp Ơi Adai. 
But if also our gospel is veiled, it is veiled in those that are lost; @ Wơ̆t dah Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam gơmơi ăt dŏ gom, ñu kơnơ̆ng gom kơ ƀing dŏ răm rai đôč. 
in whom the god of this world has blinded the thoughts of the unbelieving, so that the radiancy of the glad tidings of the glory of the Christ, who is [the] image of God, should not shine forth [for them]. @ Kơ ƀing ƀu đaŏ anŭn, yang rơnŭk anai ngă pơbum hĭ laih tơlơi pơmĭn gơñu, kiăng kơ gơñu ƀu thâo hluh ôh tơlơi bơngač mơ̆ng Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam kơ tơlơi guh kơang Krist, Pô jing rup Ơi Adai. 
For we do not preach ourselves, but Christ Jesus Lord, and ourselves your bondmen for Jesus' sake. @ Yua kơ ƀing gơmơi ƀu pơtô tơlơi gơmơi pô ôh, samơ̆ gơmơi pơtô Yêsu Krist jing Khua Yang, laih anŭn gơmơi pô jing ding kơna kơ ƀing gih yua kơ Khua Yang Yêsu Krist. 
Because [it is] the God who spoke that out of darkness light should shine who has shone in our hearts for the shining forth of the knowledge of the glory of God in [the] face of [Jesus] Christ. @ Yua kơ Ơi Adai Pô hmâo laĭ laih: “Brơi tơlơi bơngač pơčrang amăng anih kơnăm mơmŏt,” hmâo pơčrang laih amăng pran jua ƀing gơmơi, kiăng kơ tơlơi bơngač mơ̆ng tơlơi thâo hluh tơlơi guh kơang Ơi Adai pơčrang mơ̆ng ƀô̆ mơta Yêsu Krist.
But we have this treasure in earthen vessels, that the surpassingness of the power may be of God, and not from us: @ Samơ̆ gơmơi pioh kong ngăn yom anai amăng lu boh čeh lŏn, kiăng pơrơđah tơlơi dưi mơyang prŏng prin anai rai mơ̆ng Ơi Adai, ƀu djơ̆ mơ̆ng ƀing gơmơi ôh. 
every way afflicted, but not straitened; seeing no apparent issue, but our way not entirely shut up; @ Arăng pơtơnap ƀing gơmơi hăng djŏp mơta tơlơi, samơ̆ ƀu glit pơphač gơmơi ôh; gơmơi hmâo tơlơi rŭng răng, samơ̆ ƀu truh tơl rơngiă hĭ abih bang tơlơi čang rơmang; 
persecuted, but not abandoned; cast down, but not destroyed; @ arăng ngă sat kơ ƀing gơmơi samơ̆ Ơi Adai ƀu lui raih ƀing gơmơi ôh; arăng taih pơrơbuh ƀing gơmơi, samơ̆ ƀu răm djai ôh. 
always bearing about in the body the dying of Jesus, that the life also of Jesus may be manifested in our body; @ Nanao ƀing gơmơi gui tơlơi djai Yêsu Krist amăng drơi jan ƀing gơmơi, kiăng kơ tơlơi hơdip Yêsu ăt dưi bơrơđah amăng drơi jan ƀing gơmơi mơ̆n. 
for we who live are always delivered unto death on account of Jesus, that the life also of Jesus may be manifested in our mortal flesh; @ Yua kơ tơdang ƀing gơmơi dŏ hơdip, nanao arăng jao ƀing gơmơi kơ tơlơi djai yua kơ Krist, kiăng tơlơi hơdip Yêsu dưi bơrơđah amăng drơi jan thâo djai ƀing gơmơi. 
so that death works in us, but life in you. @ Tui anŭn tơlơi djai dŏ mă bruă amăng ƀing gơmơi, samơ̆ tơlơi hơdip mă bruă amăng ƀing gih.
And having the same spirit of faith, according to what is written, I have believed, therefore have I spoken; *we* also believe, therefore also we speak; @  Yua kơ gơmơi hmâo sa pran jua đaŏ kar hăng Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp hmâo čih laih: “Kâo hmâo đaŏ laih, hnŭn yơh kâo pơhiăp,” kar kaĭ mơ̆n ƀing gơmơi đaŏ, hnŭn yơh ƀing gơmơi pơhiăp, 
knowing that he who has raised the Lord Jesus shall raise us also with Jesus, and shall present [us] with you. @ yua kơ ƀing gơmơi thâo Pô hmâo pơhơdip glaĭ laih Khua Yang Yêsu ăt či pơhơdip glaĭ ƀing gơmơi hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Yêsu, laih anŭn ba ƀing gơmơi hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing gih mŭt nao ƀơi anăp Ñu. 
For all things [are] for your sakes, that the grace abounding through the many may cause thanksgiving to abound to the glory of God. @ Abih bang khul tơlơi anŭn truh yua kơ ƀing gih, kiăng kơ tơlơi pap truh kơ lu mơnuih hloh dơ̆ng, laih anŭn jai hmâo lu mơnuih pơyơr đĭ tơlơi bơni hloh dơ̆ng, kiăng ngă guh kơang kơ Ơi Adai.
Wherefore we faint not; but if indeed our outward man is consumed, yet the inward is renewed day by day. @ Hnŭn yơh, ƀing gơmơi ƀu hmâo hơtah hơtai ôh. Wơ̆t dah drơi jan gah rơngiao ƀing gơmơi čơdơ̆ng răm rai tui, samơ̆ kơnuih amăng lăm ƀing gơmơi ƀrư̆ hrơi ƀrư̆ pơplih jai phrâo hloh. 
For our momentary [and] light affliction works for us in surpassing measure an eternal weight of glory; @ Yua kơ tơlơi tơnap djhul laih anŭn jang jai anai, či ba glaĭ ƀing ta tơlơi guh kơang prŏng hloh laih anŭn hlŏng lar rơgao hloh kơ tơlơi arăng dưi pơkă. 
while we look not at the things that are seen, but at the things that are not seen; for the things that are seen [are] for a time, but those that are not seen eternal. @ Yua kơ ƀing gơmơi ƀu lăng ôh kơ tơlơi arăng dưi ƀuh, samơ̆ tơlơi arăng ƀu dưi ƀuh ôh. Yua kơ tơlơi arăng dưi ƀuh dŏ kơnơ̆ng jang jai đôč, samơ̆ tơlơi arăng ƀu dưi ƀuh ôh dŏ hlŏng lar.
For we know that if our earthly tabernacle house be destroyed, we have a building from God, a house not made with hands, eternal in the heavens. @ Yua kơ ƀing ta thâo tơdah sang khăn jing drơi jan ƀing ta ƀơi lŏn tơnah răm rai hĭ, ƀing ta hmâo sang hlŏng lar amăng adai, Ơi Adai pô pơdơ̆ng, ƀu djơ̆ hăng tơngan ană mơnuih ngă ôh. 
For indeed in this we groan, ardently desiring to have put on our house which [is] from heaven; @ Sĭt yơh amăng sang khăn anai ƀing ta ur krao, kiăng biă mă buh mă sang ƀing ta amăng adai. 
if indeed being also clothed we shall not be found naked. @ Tui anŭn giơ̆ng kơ ƀing ta buh mă sang anŭn, arăng ƀu ƀuh ƀing ta dŏ mơhlŭn dơ̆ng ôh. 
For indeed we who are in the tabernacle groan, being burdened; while yet we do not wish to be unclothed, but clothed, that [what is] mortal may be swallowed up by life. @ Yua kơ tơdang ƀing ta ăt dŏ amăng sang khăn anai, ƀing ta ur krao amăng tơlơi gleh kơtraŏ; ƀu djơ̆ ôh ƀing ta kiăng toh hĭ drơi jan asar đeh anai, samơ̆ ƀing ta kiăng buh mă drơi jan phrâo, kiăng kơ tơlơi hơdip či lun hĭ drơi jan thâo djai. 
Now he that has wrought us for this very thing [is] God, who also has given to us the earnest of the Spirit. @ Ơi Adai jing Pô hmâo prăp pre laih ƀing ta brơi kơ tơlơi anai, Pô hmâo pha brơi laih Yang Bơngăt Hiam kơ ƀing ta jing mơnơ̆ng ƀuăn grơ̆ng.
Therefore [we are] always confident, and know that while present in the body we are absent from the Lord, @ Tui anŭn ƀing ta bă hăng tơlơi kơnang kơjăp nanao. Ƀing ta thâo tơdang ƀing ta dŏ amăng sang drơi jan anai, ƀing ta dŏ ataih mơ̆ng Khua Yang, 
(for we walk by faith, not by sight;) @ yua kơ ƀing ta rơbat nao hăng tơlơi đaŏ, ƀu djơ̆ hăng mơta ƀuh ôh. 
we are confident, I say, and pleased rather to be absent from the body and present with the Lord. @ Tui anŭn, ƀing ta bă hăng tơlơi khĭn, laih anŭn kiăng biă mă lui hĭ drơi jan anai laih anŭn kiăng dưi dŏ hrŏm hăng Khua Yang. 
Wherefore also we are zealous, whether present or absent, to be agreeable to him. @ Hnŭn yơh thâo dah ƀing ta dŏ amăng drơi jan anai ƀôdah tơbiă hĭ, ƀing ta hơduah kiăng biă mă bơmơak kơ Ñu. 
For we must all be manifested before the judgment-seat of the Christ, that each may receive the things [done] in the body, according to those he has done, whether [it be] good or evil. @ Yua kơ abih bang ƀing ta leng kơ khŏm dŏ ƀơi anăp gre phat kơđi Yang Krist, kiăng kơ rĭm čô dưi mă tŭ tui hăng ñu hmâo ngă laih tơlơi hiam ƀôdah tơlơi sat tơdang ñu dŏ hơdip amăng drơi jan anai.
