Knowing therefore the terror of the Lord we persuade men, but have been manifested to God, and I hope also that we have been manifested in your consciences. @ Yua kơ ƀing gơmơi thâo hwĭ kơ Khua Yang, gơmơi pơtrŭt pơđur ƀing mơnuih pơkŏn. Samơ̆ Ơi Adai thâo klă laih hyư̆m ƀing gơmơi jing, laih anŭn kâo čang rơmang pran jua tơpă ƀing gih ăt thâo klă ƀing gơmơi kar kaĭ mơ̆n. 
[For] we do not again commend ourselves to you, but [we are] giving to you occasion of boast in our behalf, that ye may have [such] with those boasting in countenance, and not in heart. @ Gơmơi ƀu pơđĭ gơmơi pô ƀơi anăp ƀing gih dơ̆ng ôh, samơ̆ gơmơi brơi kơ ƀing gih mông gal dưi pơ-ư yua kơ ƀing gơmơi, kiăng kơ ƀing gih dưi laĭ glaĭ kơ ƀing pơ-ư gơñu pô tui hăng tơlơi pơrơđah gah rơngiao ƀu djơ̆ ôh tui hăng amăng pran jua gơñu. 
For whether we are beside ourselves, [it is] to God; or are sober, [it is] for you. @ Yua tơdah ƀing gơmơi jing mlŭk, anŭn jing yua kơ Ơi Adai; tơdah ƀing gơmơi hmâo tơlơi pơmĭn djơ̆, anŭn jing yua kơ ƀing gih yơh. 
For the love of the Christ constrains us, having judged this: that one died for all, then all have died; @ Tơlơi Krist khăp pơtrŭt kơtang ƀing gơmơi, yua kơ ƀing gơmơi thâo klă, sĭt sa čô hmâo djai laih yua kơ abih bang mơnuih, yua kơ anŭn yơh abih bang mơnuih leng kơ djai laih. 
and he died for all, that they who live should no longer live to themselves, but to him who died for them and has been raised. @ Ñu djai pơala kơ abih bang mơnuih, kiăng kơ ƀing dŏ hơdip ƀu či dŏ hơdip kơ gơñu pô dơ̆ng ôh, samơ̆ hơdip kơ Pô hmâo djai, laih anŭn hmâo hơdip glaĭ laih yua kơ ƀing gơñu.
So that *we* henceforth know no one according to flesh; but if even we have known Christ according to flesh, yet now we know [him thus] no longer. @ Yua kơ anŭn, mơ̆ng anai pơ anăp, ƀing gơmơi ƀu pơkă hơnơ̆ng mơnuih tui hăng asar đeh ôh, wơ̆t dah hlâo adih ƀing gơmơi hmâo pơkă hơnơ̆ng laih Krist tui hăng asar đeh, samơ̆ ră anai gơmơi ƀu pơkă hơnơ̆ng Ñu kar hăng anŭn dơ̆ng ôh. 
So if any one [be] in Christ, [there is] a new creation; the old things have passed away; behold all things have become new: @ Tui anŭn, tơdah hlơi pô dŏ amăng Krist, ñu anŭn jing mơnuih hrih kơphrâo yơh, abih tơlơi so rơgao hĭ laih, anai nê, abih bang tơlơi leng kơ jing kơphrâo soh sel. 
and all things [are] of the God who has reconciled us to himself by [Jesus] Christ, and given to us the ministry of that reconciliation: @ Abih bang tơlơi anŭn rai mơ̆ng Ơi Adai, Pô hmâo pơrơnom glaĭ laih ƀing ta hăng Ñu amăng Yang Krist, laih anŭn hmâo jao laih kơ ƀing gơmơi bruă mă tơlơi pơrơnom. 
how that God was in Christ, reconciling the world to himself, not reckoning to them their offences; and putting in us the word of that reconciliation. @ Anŭn jing, Ơi Adai hmâo dŏ laih amăng Krist pơsir glaĭ lŏn tơnah hăng Ñu pô, ƀu yap ôh tơlơi soh kiăng pơkơhmal ƀing gơñu, laih anŭn jao kơ ƀing gơmơi hiăp pơtô kơ tơlơi pơrơnom.
We are ambassadors therefore for Christ, God as [it were] beseeching by us, we entreat for Christ, Be reconciled to God. @ Tui anŭn, ƀing gơmơi jing pô pơala kơ Yang Krist, Ơi Adai yua ƀing gơmơi pơđur kơwưh kơ arăng. Amăng anăn Yang Krist gơmơi kơwưh ƀing gih, brơi ƀing gih rơnom glaĭ bĕ hăng Ơi Adai. 
Him who knew not sin he has made sin for us, that *we* might become God's righteousness in him. @ Krist ƀu hmâo tơlơi soh ôh, samơ̆ Ơi Adai ngă brơi Ñu jing soh yua kơ ƀing ta, kiăng kơ amăng Ñu ƀing ta dưi hmâo tơlơi tơpă Ơi Adai.
But [as] fellow-workmen, we also beseech that ye receive not the grace of God in vain: @ Yua kơ gơmơi mă bruă hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Ơi Adai, gơmơi pơđur kơ ƀing gih anăm mă tŭ tơlơi Ơi Adai pap jing hĭ đôč đač ôh. 
(for he says, I have listened to thee in an accepted time, and I have helped thee in a day of salvation: behold, now [is the] well-accepted time; behold, now [the] day of salvation:) @ Yua kơ Ơi Adai laĭ:
“Kâo hmâo hmư̆ laih ih amăng hrơi gal,
Kâo hmâo djru laih ih amăng hrơi pơklaih.”
Lăng adih, hrơi anai jing hrơi gal; lăng adih hrơi anai jing hrơi pơklaih!
giving no manner of offence in anything, that the ministry be not blamed; @ Gơmơi ƀu ngă tơhnač kơ arăng ôh, kiăng kơ arăng ƀu dưi ƀuah ôh bruă gơmơi ngă. 
but in everything commending ourselves as God's ministers, in much endurance, in afflictions, in necessities, in straits, @ Samơ̆ amăng abih bang tơlơi, ƀing gơmơi pơrơđah pơsĭt gơmơi jing ding kơna Ơi Adai: gir kơtir biă mă amăng tơlơi tơnap tap, amăng tơlơi gleh glăn, amăng tơlơi jŭ sat, 
in stripes, in prisons, in riots, in labours, in watchings, in fastings, @ amăng tơlơi arăng taih, amăng tơlơi arăng krư̆, amăng tơlơi rŭng răng, tơlơi mă bruă gleh, tơlơi dŏ krŏng, tơlơi ư̆ rơpa, 
in pureness, in knowledge, in longsuffering, in kindness, in [the] Holy Spirit, in love unfeigned, @ amăng tơlơi tơpă rơgoh, tơlơi thâo hluh, tơlơi gir, tơlơi hiam, amăng Yang Bơngăt Hiam, amăng tơlơi khăp tơpă sĭt, 
in [the] word of truth, in [the] power of God; through the arms of righteousness on the right hand and left, @ amăng tơlơi pơhiăp tơpă sĭt, laih anŭn hăng tơlơi dưi mơyang Ơi Adai; djă gơnam pơblah tơpă ƀơi tơngan gah hơnuă laih anŭn tơngan gah iao; 
through glory and dishonour, through evil report and good report: as deceivers, and true; @ amăng tơlơi pơpŭ ƀôdah tơlơi mlâo, amăng tơlơi arăng bơrơmŭt ƀôdah tơlơi arăng bơni. Arăng yap ƀing gơmơi kar hăng pô ƀlor, samơ̆ ƀing gơmơi jing ƀing tơpă sĭt, 
as unknown, and well known; as dying, and behold, we live; as disciplined, and not put to death; @ kar hăng arăng ƀu thâo krăn ôh, samơ̆ jing ƀing arăng thâo krăn laih, kar hăng giăm djai, samơ̆ sĭt gơmơi ăt dŏ hơdip, kar hăng arăng pơkơhmal laih, samơ̆ arăng ƀu pơdjai ôh, 
as grieved, but always rejoicing; as poor, but enriching many; as having nothing, and possessing all things. @ kar hăng rơngot, samơ̆ nanao gơmơi hơ̆k mơak, kar hăng ƀun rin, samơ̆ gơmơi pơdrŏng brơi kơ lu mơnuih, kar hăng ƀu hmâo mơnơ̆ng hơgĕt ôh, samơ̆ gơmơi hmâo djŏp mơta.
Our mouth is opened to you, Corinthians, our heart is expanded. @ Gơmơi hmâo pơhiăp tơpă kơ ƀing gih; Ơ ƀing mơnuih Kôrantô; pran jua ƀing gơmơi hmâo pŏk rơhaih kơ ƀing gih. 
Ye are not straitened in us, but ye are straitened in your affections; @ Ƀu djơ̆ ƀing gơmơi kơđơ̆l hĭ laih pran jua ƀing gơmơi kơ ƀing gih ôh, samơ̆ ƀing gih pô kơđơ̆l hĭ pran jua ƀing gih kơ ƀing gơmơi. 
but for an answering recompense, (I speak as to children,) let *your* heart also expand itself. @ Ba glaĭ bĕ kơ ƀing gơmơi kar hăng ƀing gơmơi hmâo ngă laih kơ ƀing gih — kâo pơhiăp kơ ƀing gih kar hăng pơhiăp hăng ană bă — Pŏk rơhaih bĕ pran jua ƀing gih kar kaĭ mơ̆n.
Be not diversely yoked with unbelievers; for what participation [is there] between righteousness and lawlessness? or what fellowship of light with darkness? @ Anăm glăm ač hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing ƀu đaŏ ôh. Yua kơ tơlơi tơpă hăng tơlơi wĕ wŏ dưi pơgop mơ̆? Ƀôdah tơlơi bơngač hăng tơlơi kơnăm mơmŏt dưi pơgop mơ̆? 
and what consent of Christ with Beliar, or what part for a believer along with an unbeliever? @ Yang Krist hăng yang Bêlial dưi pơgop hrŏm hơbĭt mơ̆? Ƀôdah mơnuih đaŏ dưi hmâo črăn hơgĕt hrŏm hăng mơnuih ƀu đaŏ mơ̆? 
and what agreement of God's temple with idols? for *ye* are [the] living God's temple; according as God has said, I will dwell among them, and walk among [them]; and I will be their God, and they shall be to me a people. @ Hyư̆m dưi hmâo tơlơi pơgop tơ̆ng krah sang kơkuh pơpŭ Ơi Adai hăng khul rup trah lĕ? Yua kơ ƀing ta jing sang kơkuh pơpŭ Ơi Adai pô hơdip, tui hăng Ơi Adai hmâo laĭ laih:
“Kâo či dŏ amăng ƀing gơñu laih anŭn rơbat nao tơ̆ng krah ƀing gơñu,
Kâo či jing Ơi Adai gơñu,
Laih anŭn gơñu či jing ƀing ană plei Kâo.
Wherefore come out from the midst of them, and be separated, saith [the] Lord, and touch not [what is] unclean, and *I* will receive you; @  Yua kơ anŭn yơh Khua Yang laĭ:
Brơi ƀing gih tơbiă bĕ mơ̆ng gơñu,
Pơčơlah hĭ bĕ mơ̆ng gơñu,
Laih anŭn anăm ruaih djơ̆ ôh mơnơ̆ng hơƀak drak,
Tui anŭn Kâo či jum ƀing gih;
and I will be to you for a Father, and ye shall be to me for sons and daughters, saith [the] Lord Almighty. @  Kâo či jing Ama kơ ƀing gih,
laih anŭn ƀing gih či jing ană đah rơkơi, ană đah kơmơi Kâo,
Khua Yang Pô hmâo abih Tơlơi Dưi Mơyang, laĭ.”
Having therefore these promises, beloved, let us purify ourselves from every pollution of flesh and spirit, perfecting holiness in God's fear. @ Ơ ƀing kâo khăp hơeng hơi, yua kơ ƀing ta hmâo khul tơlơi ƀuăn anai, brơi ƀing ta pơrơgoh hĭ ta pô bĕ mơ̆ng abih bang tơlơi grĭ grañ amăng asar đeh laih anŭn bơngăt, laih anŭn ngă brơi bĕ tơlơi hrih rơgoh hiam dưi klă tum amăng tơlơi hwĭ pơpŭ kơ Ơi Adai.
Receive us: we have injured no one, we have ruined no one, we have made gain of no one. @ Pioh brơi bĕ sa anih kơ gơmơi amăng pran jua ƀing gih; gơmơi ƀu hmâo ngă soh hăng arăng ôh, gơmơi ƀu hmâo ngă răm kơ hlơi ôh, gơmơi ƀu hmâo ƀơ̆ng kong ngăn arăng ôh. 
I do not speak for condemnation, for I have already said that ye are in our hearts, to die together, and live together. @ Kâo ƀu laĭ tơlơi anŭn kiăng klă kơđi kơ ƀing gih ôh, yua kơ hlâo adih kâo hmâo laĭ laih ƀing gih dŏ nanao amăng pran jua ƀing gơmơi, djai hrŏm hơbĭt laih anŭn hơdip hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing gơmơi. 
Great [is] my boldness towards you, great my exulting in respect of you; I am filled with encouragement; I overabound in joy under all our affliction. @ Kâo hmâo tơlơi kơnang biă mă kơ ƀing gih; kâo pơ-ư kâo pô lu biă mă yua kơ ƀing gih; kâo bă hăng tơlơi pơalum. Kâo bă hăng tơlơi hơ̆k mơak ƀơi tơ̆ng krah tơlơi tơnap tap ƀing gơmơi.
For indeed, when we came into Macedonia, our flesh had no rest, but [we were] afflicted in every way; without combats, within fears. @  Yua kơ mơ̆ng hrơi gơmơi truh pơ čar Masêđôn, drơi jan gơmơi ƀu hmâo tơlơi pơdơi ôh, samơ̆ gơmơi hmâo tơlơi tơnap tap djŏp mơta — tơlơi pơblah mơ̆ng gah rơngiao laih anŭn tơlơi hyưt hwĭ amăng pran jua. 
But he who encourages those that are [brought] low, [even] God, encouraged us by the coming of Titus; @ Samơ̆ Ơi Adai, Pô pơalum ƀing hơtah hơtai, hmâo pơalum laih ƀing gơmơi hăng tơlơi Tit truh, 
and not by his coming only, but also through the encouragement with which he was encouraged as to you; relating to us your ardent desire, your mourning, your zeal for me; so that I the more rejoiced. @ ƀu djơ̆ kơnơ̆ng yua kơ tơlơi ñu truh đôč ôh, samơ̆ ăt yua kơ mơ̆ng tơlơi pơalum ñu hmâo mă tŭ laih mơ̆ng ƀing gih. Ñu laĭ hăng ƀing gơmơi tơlơi ƀing gih čang tơguan, tơlơi ƀlơ̆ng rơngot, laih anŭn tơlơi ƀing gih hur har kơ kâo, tui anŭn kâo hmâo tơlơi hơ̆k mơak lu hloh dơ̆ng.
For if also I grieved you in the letter, I do not regret [it], if even I have regretted it; for I see that that letter, if even [it were] only for a time, grieved you. @ Yua kơ wơ̆t dah kâo pơrơngot ƀing gih hăng hră kâo hmâo čih mơit laih kơ ƀing gih, kâo ƀu hơƀlŏk ôh tơlơi anŭn. (Wơ̆t dah hlâo anŭn kâo hmâo hơƀlŏk laih, yua kơ kâo thâo hră anŭn hmâo pơrơngot laih ƀing gih, wơ̆t dah kơnơ̆ng ƀiă đôč). 
Now I rejoice, not that ye have been grieved, but that ye have been grieved to repentance; for ye have been grieved according to God, that in nothing ye might be injured by us. @ Ră anai kâo hmâo tơlơi mơak, ƀu djơ̆ ôh yua kơ ƀing gih hmâo tơlơi rơngot laih, samơ̆ yua kơ tơlơi rơngot ƀing gih hmâo ba ƀing gih kơ tơlơi kơhmal tơlơi soh; yua kơ ƀing gih hmâo tơlơi rơngot tui hăng Ơi Adai kiăng, hnŭn yơh, ƀing gơmơi ƀu hmâo ngă răm hơgĕt kơ ƀing gih ôh. 
For grief according to God works repentance to salvation, never to be regretted; but the grief of the world works death. @ Yua kơ tơlơi rơngot hơning tui hăng tơlơi Ơi Adai kiăng pơjing kơ tơlơi kơhmal kơ tơlơi soh kiăng kơ dưi hmâo tơlơi pơklaih, tơlơi anai ƀu hmâo tơlơi hơgĕt năng lăp kơ hơƀlŏk ôh; samơ̆ tơlơi rơngot hơning tui hăng lŏn tơnah ba truh kơ tơlơi djai. 
For, behold, this same thing, your being grieved according to God, how much diligence it wrought in *you*, but [what] excusing [of yourselves], but [what] indignation, but [what] fear, but [what] ardent desire, but [what] zeal, but [what] vengeance: in every way ye have proved yourselves to be pure in the matter. @ Hnŭn yơh, ƀing gih lăng bĕ, tơlơi rơngot tui hăng tơlơi Ơi Adai kiăng anŭn hmâo pơjing laih amăng ƀing gih: tơlơi hur har, tơlơi kiăng pơsĭt tơlơi ƀing gih jing jơngeh, tơlơi hơƀlŏk, tơlơi hwĭ bral, tơlơi čang kiăng biă mă, tơlơi tŏng ten, tơlơi pơkơhmal! Amăng djŏp mơta, ƀing gih hmâo pơrơđah laih ƀing gih pô ƀu hmâo tơlơi soh ôh amăng bruă anŭn. 
So then, if also I wrote to you, [it was] not for the sake of him that injured, nor for the sake of him that was injured, but for the sake of our diligent zeal for you being manifested to you before God. @ Tui anŭn, wơ̆t dah kâo hmâo čih laih kơ ƀing gih, samơ̆ ƀu djơ̆ kâo čih yua kơ pô ngă soh anŭn ôh, kŏn djơ̆ lơi yua kơ pô arăng hmâo pơsoh laih, samơ̆ kiăng kơ tơlơi hur har ƀing gih hăng gơmơi dưi pơrơđah brơi ƀing gih ƀơi anăp Ơi Adai. 
For this reason we have been encouraged. And we the rather rejoiced in our encouragement more abundantly by reason of the joy of Titus, because his spirit has been refreshed by you all. @ Anŭn jing tơlơi pơalum ƀing gơmơi.
Gah rơngiao kơ tơlơi pơalum anŭn, ƀing gơmơi hmâo tơlơi mơak hloh dơ̆ng yua kơ tơlơi hơ̆k mơak Tit. Yua kơ abih bang ƀing gih hmâo ngă brơi pran jua ñu dŏ rơnŭk rơnua. 
Because if I boasted to him anything about you, I have not been put to shame; but as we have spoken to you all things in truth, so also our boasting to Titus has been [the] truth; @ Tơdah kâo hmâo pơ-ư laih ƀing gih ƀơƀiă ƀơi anăp Tit, kâo ăt ƀu hmâo tơlơi mlâo hơgĕt ôh; samơ̆ kar hăng abih bang tơlơi gơmơi hmâo laĭ laih kơ ƀing gih jing tơlơi sĭt, ăt kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n tơlơi ƀing gơmơi hmâo pơ-ư ƀơi anăp Tit hmâo pơrơđah laih jing tơlơi sĭt mơ̆n. 
and his affections are more abundantly towards you, calling to mind the obedience of you all, how with fear and trembling ye received him. @ Tui anŭn tơlơi ñu khăp kơ ƀing gih lu hloh, tơdang ñu hơdơr kơ tơlơi abih bang ƀing gih gưt asăp, laih anŭn tơlơi ƀing gih tŭ jum ñu hăng tơlơi hwĭ laih anŭn tơtư̆ drơi jan. 
I rejoice that in everything I am confident as to you. @ Kâo hơ̆k mơak, yua kơ kâo dưi kơnang kơ ƀing gih amăng djŏp mơta tơlơi.
But we make known to you, brethren, the grace of God bestowed in the assemblies of Macedonia; @  Ơ adơi ayŏng, gơmơi kiăng kơ ƀing gih thâo tơlơi pap Ơi Adai hmâo pha brơi laih kơ Phung Sang Ơi Adai amăng čar Masêđôn. 
that in a great trial of affliction the abundance of their joy and their deep poverty has abounded to the riches of their [free-hearted] liberality. @ Tơdang hmâo tơlơi lông lăng amăng tơlơi tơnap tap, samơ̆ gơñu bă blai tơlơi hơ̆k mơak. Amăng tơlơi ƀun rin biă mă, pran jua gơñu čơmah rơbeh blai jai hloh dơ̆ng. 
For according to [their] power, I bear witness, and beyond [their] power, [they were] willing of their own accord, @ Kâo dưi ngă gơ̆ng jơlan pơsĭt kơ ƀing gơñu, gơñu hmâo hơ̆k mơak pơđup pơyơr tui hăng tơlơi gơñu dưi, laih anŭn ngă rơgao hloh tơlơi gơñu dưi ngă dơ̆ng, 
begging of us with much entreaty [to give effect to] the grace and fellowship of the service which [was to be rendered] to the saints. @ ƀing gơñu kơwưh kơ ƀing gơmơi hăng abih pran jua kiăng biă mă gơmơi brơi ƀing gơñu dưi pơgop djru kơ ƀing rơgoh hiam. 
And not according as we hoped, but they gave themselves first to the Lord, and to us by God's will. @ Gơñu hmâo ngă rơgao hloh kơ tơlơi ƀing gơmơi čang rơmang, yua kơ blŭng hlâo gơñu hmâo pơyơr laih gơñu pô kơ Khua Yang, giơ̆ng anŭn kơ ƀing gơmơi, tui hăng tơlơi kiăng Ơi Adai. 
So that we begged Titus that, according as he had before begun, so he would also complete as to you this grace also; @ Yua kơ anŭn yơh, ƀing gơmơi hmâo pơtrŭt laih Tit ngă pơgiơ̆ng hĭ bruă tơlơi pap anai tơ̆ng krah ƀing gih, kar hăng ñu hmâo čơdơ̆ng ngă laih. 
but even as ye abound in every way, in faith, and word, and knowledge, and all diligence, and in love from you to us, that ye may abound in this grace also. @ Kar hăng ƀing gih hmâo ngă hiam biă mă laih amăng abih bang bruă: amăng tơlơi đaŏ, tơlơi pơhiăp, tơlơi thâo hluh, amăng abih tơlơi hur har, laih anŭn amăng tơlơi ƀing gih khăp kơ ƀing gơmơi. Brơi ƀing gih ăt ngă hiam hloh dơ̆ng amăng bruă tơlơi pap anai.
I do not speak as commanding [it], but through the zeal of others, and proving the genuineness of your love. @ Kâo laĭ tơlơi anai ƀu djơ̆ kiăng pơđar ƀing gih ôh, samơ̆ kâo kơnơ̆ng pơrơđah tơlơi hur har ƀing pơkŏn, kiăng pơlông lăng tơlơi khăp ƀing gih jing hur har dơ̆ pă. 
For ye know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, that for your sakes he, being rich, became poor, in order that *ye* by *his* poverty might be enriched. @ Yua kơ ƀing gih thâo laih tơlơi pap Khua Yang ƀing ta Yêsu Krist: wơ̆t dah Ñu jing pơdrŏng, samơ̆ Ñu jing hĭ ƀun rin yua kơ ƀing gih, kiăng kơ mơ̆ng tơlơi ƀun rin Ñu, ƀing gih dưi jing pơdrŏng sah. 
And I give [my] opinion in this, for this is profitable for you who began before, not only to do, but also to be willing, a year ago. @ Anai tơlơi pơmĭn kâo kơ tơlơi anai: jing sa tơlơi hiam kơ ƀing gih, yua kơ mơ̆ng thŭn hlâo, ƀing gih ƀu djơ̆ kơnơ̆ng jing ƀing mơnuih blŭng hlâo ngă tơlơi anai ôh, samơ̆ ăt dŏ kiăng ngă dơ̆ng. 
But now also complete the doing of it; so that as [there was] the readiness to be willing, so also to complete out of what ye have. @ Ră anai pơgiơ̆ng hĭ bĕ bruă ƀing gih ngă, kar hăng ƀing gih hmâo hur har laih kiăng ngă, brơi ƀing gih pơgiơ̆ng bruă anŭn tui hăng tơlơi ƀing gih dưi. 
For if the readiness be there, [a man is] accepted according to what he may have, not according to what he has not. @ Tơdah sa čô mơnuih pơyơr hăng pran jua khăp, mơnơ̆ng pơyơr anŭn či dưi mă tŭ, tui hăng tơlơi ƀing gơñu hmâo, ƀu djơ̆ tui hăng tơlơi gơñu ƀu hmâo ôh.
For [it is] not in order that there may be ease for others, and for you distress, @ Kâo ƀu kiăng ôh ngă pơdjhul kơ ƀing pơkŏn, laih anŭn ngă pơkơtraŏ kơ ƀing gih, samơ̆ kiăng hmâo tơlơi bơkơnar đôč. 
but [on the principle] of equality; in the present time your abundance for their lack, that their abundance may be for your lack, so that there should be equality. @ Tơlơi ƀing gih hmâo rơbeh lu ră anai či pơdjơ̆p hĭ tơlơi gơñu kơƀah, laih anŭn kiăng kơ tơlơi ƀing gơñu hmâo rơbeh lu či pơdjơ̆p tơlơi ƀing gih kơƀah. Tui anŭn jing bơkơnar. 
According as it is written, He who [gathered] much had no excess, and he who [gathered] little was nothing short. @ Tui hăng hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp čih laih:
“Hlơi pô pơƀŭt pioh lu ăt ƀu rơbeh ôh,
Laih anŭn hlơi pô pơƀŭt pioh ƀiă ăt ƀu kơƀah mơ̆n.”
But thanks [be] to God, who gives the same diligent zeal for you in the heart of Titus. @ Kâo bơni kơ Ơi Adai, Pô hmâo dưm laih amăng pran jua Tit tơlơi hur har thâo bơngơ̆t kơ ƀing gih kar hăng kâo mơ̆n. 
For he received indeed the entreaty, but, being full of zeal, he went of his own accord to you; @ Yua kơ ƀu djơ̆ ñu kơnơ̆ng tŭ tơlơi gơmơi rơkâo đôč ôh, samơ̆ ñu pô mơ̆n hur har kiăng nao čuă ƀing gih. 
but we have sent with him the brother whose praise [is] in the glad tidings through all the assemblies; @ Ƀing gơmơi ăt mơit nao mơ̆n sa čô adơi ayŏng nao hrŏm hăng Tit, jing pô hmâo tơlơi hing ang amăng abih bang Phung Sang Ơi Adai yua kơ tơlơi ñu pơtô Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam. 
and not only [so], but [is] also chosen by the assemblies as our fellow-traveller with this grace, ministered by us to the glory of the Lord himself, and [a witness of] our readiness; @ Ƀu djơ̆ kơnơ̆ng hơdôm anŭn đôč ôh, samơ̆ Phung Sang Ơi Adai hmâo ruah laih ñu brơi hyu hrŏm hăng ƀing gơmơi amăng bruă tơlơi pap gơmơi hlăk dŏ ngă anai, kiăng ngă guh kơang Khua Yang, laih anŭn kiăng pơrơđah pran jua hiam ƀing gơmơi.
avoiding this, that any one should blame us in this abundance [which is] administered by us; @ Ƀing gơmơi ƀu kiăng ôh arăng jăm ƀuah ƀing gơmơi amăng tơlơi wai lăng mơnơ̆ng brơi pap lu rơbeh anai; 
for we provide for things honest, not only before [the] Lord, but also before men. @ Yua kơ ƀing gơmơi gir kơtir ngă tơlơi tơpă djơ̆, ƀu djơ̆ kơnơ̆ng ƀơi anăp Ơi Adai đôč ôh, samơ̆ wơ̆t ƀơi anăp mơnuih kar kaĭ mơ̆n.
And we have sent with them our brother whom we have often proved to be of diligent zeal in many things, and now more diligently zealous through the great confidence [he has] as to you. @ Ƀing gơmơi ăt mơit mơ̆n adơi ayŏng ƀing gơmơi nao hrŏm hơbĭt hăng gơñu, pô gơmơi hmâo lông lăng laih lu wơ̆t laih anŭn ƀuh ñu hur har amăng lu mơta bruă, samơ̆ ră anai ñu hur har hloh dơ̆ng yua kơ ñu đaŏ biă mă kơ ƀing gih. 
Whether as regards Titus, [he is] my companion and fellow-labourer in your behalf; or our brethren, [they are] deputed messengers of assemblies, Christ's glory. @ Bơ kơ Tit, ñu jing gơyut mă bruă laih anŭn pô mă bruă hrŏm hơbĭt hăng kâo kiăng djru ƀing gih. Bơ kơ ƀing adơi ayŏng pơkŏn dơ̆ng, gơñu jing ƀing mơnuih Phung Sang Ơi Adai pơkiaŏ nao, laih anŭn jing tơlơi guh kơang kơ Yang Krist. 
Shew therefore to them, before the assemblies, the proof of your love, and of our boasting about you. @ Yua kơ anŭn yơh, ƀơi anăp Phung Sang Ơi Adai, pơrơđah pơsĭt bĕ tơlơi khăp ƀing gih, laih anŭn tơlơi gơmơi pơ-ư kơ ƀing gơmơi pô yua kơ ƀing gih.
For concerning the ministration which [is] for the saints, it is superfluous my writing to you. @ Ră anai ƀu yom ôh kơ kâo čih hră kơ ƀing gih kơ tơlơi pơyơr mơnơ̆ng djru kơ ƀing rơgoh hiam dơ̆ng. 
For I know your readiness, which I boast of as respects you to Macedonians, that Achaia is prepared since a year ago, and the zeal [reported] of you has stimulated the mass [of the brethren]. @ Yua kơ kâo thâo laih tơlơi ƀing gih hur har kiăng djru. Yua kơ tơlơi anŭn kâo hmâo pơ-ư ƀing gih ƀơi anăp ƀing mơnuih pơ Masêđôn tui anai: “Ƀing mơnuih Akai hmâo prăp rơmet laih gơnam kiăng djru mơ̆ng thŭn hlâo.” Laih anŭn tơlơi ƀing gih hur har hmâo pơđĭ pran jua kơ lu ƀing gơñu. 
But I have sent the brethren, in order that our boasting about you may not be made void in this respect, in order that, as I have said, ye may be prepared; @ Samơ̆ kâo hmâo pơkiaŏ laih ƀing adơi ayŏng anai nao, kiăng kơ tơlơi gơmơi pơ-ư kơ ƀing gih ƀu jing hĭ đôč đač ôh amăng bruă anai, laih anŭn kiăng kơ ƀing gih prăp rơmet lui hlâo, tui hăng tơlơi kâo hmâo laĭ laih; 
lest haply, if Macedonians come with me and find you unprepared, *we*, that we say not *ye*, may be put to shame in this confidence. @ hwĭ dah tơdang đơđa ƀing mơnuih Masêđôn rai hrŏm hăng kâo, ƀuh ƀing gih aka prăp rơmet ôh, ƀing gơmơi či mlâo — amăng anŭn wơ̆t kơ ƀing gih ăt kar kaĭ mơ̆n — yua kơ gơmơi đaŏ biă mă kơ ƀing gih. 
I thought it necessary therefore to beg the brethren that they would come to you, and complete beforehand your fore-announced blessing, that this may be ready thus as blessing, and not as got out of you. @ Tui anŭn, kâo pơmĭn khŏm pơtrŭt ƀing adơi ayŏng nao hlâo pơ ƀing gih, laih anŭn prăp rơmet lui hlâo gơnam đup pơyơr ƀing gih hmâo ƀuăn laih, kiăng kơ bruă đup pơyơr anai hmâo tơlơi prăp pre lui kar hăng gơnam pha brơi mơ̆ng pran jua čơmah ƀu djơ̆ yua kơ tơlơi pơgŏ ôh.
But this [is true], he that sows sparingly shall reap also sparingly; and he that sows in [the spirit of] blessing shall reap also in blessing: @ Brơi ƀing gih thâo tơlơi anai: hlơi pô sai ƀiă či hơpuă ƀiă, laih anŭn hlơi pô sai lu či hơpuă lu. 
each according as he is purposed in his heart; not grievingly, or of necessity; for God loves a cheerful giver. @ Brơi rĭm čô đup pơyơr tui hăng ñu pơmĭn laih hlâo, ƀu djơ̆ ôh hăng tơlơi rơngot ƀôdah hăng tơlơi pơgŏ, yua kơ Ơi Adai khăp kơ pô pơyơr hăng tơlơi hơ̆k mơak. 
But God is able to make every gracious gift abound towards you, that, having in every way always all-sufficiency, ye may abound to every good work: @ Ơi Adai dưi pha brơi kơ ƀing gih tơlơi pap rơbeh rơbai, kiăng kơ ƀing gih dưi hmâo djŏp mơta mơnơ̆ng ƀing gih kiăng, laih anŭn hmâo rơbeh rơbai dơ̆ng kiăng ngă lu mơta bruă hiam. 
according as it is written, He has scattered abroad, he has given to the poor, his righteousness remains for ever. @ Tui hăng Hơdrôm Hră Ơi Adai hmâo čih:
“Ñu pha brơi hăng tơlơi čơmah, gŭm djru kơ ƀing ƀun rin;
Tơlơi tơpă Ñu ăt dŏ nanao hlŏng lar.”
Now he that supplies seed to the sower and bread for eating shall supply and make abundant your sowing, and increase the fruits of your righteousness: @  Pô hmâo brơi pơjeh kơ pô sai laih anŭn ƀañ tơpŭng jing mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng, či brơi laih anŭn pơlar pơjeh ƀing gih sai, laih anŭn či pơđĭ lu boh tŭ yua kơ tơlơi tơpă ƀing gih. 
enriched in every way unto all free-hearted liberality, which works through us thanksgiving to God. @ Ƀing gih či čăt đĭ amăng lu mơta tơlơi, kiăng kơ dưi ngă bruă tơlơi pap. Laih anŭn găn mơ̆ng ƀing gơmơi arăng či bơni kơ Ơi Adai. 
Because the ministration of this service is not only filling up the measure of what is lacking to the saints, but also abounding by many thanksgivings to God; @ Yua kơ bruă ƀing gih ngă anai ƀu djơ̆ kơnơ̆ng pơhrăp tơlơi kiăng kơ ƀing rơgoh hiam đôč ôh, samơ̆ ăt ngă brơi lu mơnuih bơni kơ Ơi Adai dơ̆ng. 
they glorifying God through the proof of this ministration, by reason of your subjection, by profession, to the glad tidings of the Christ, and your free-hearted liberality in communicating towards them and towards all; @ Yua mơ̆ng bruă djru anai lu mơnuih či pơ-ư pơang Ơi Adai, yua kơ tơlơi gưt asăp kơ Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam Yang Krist ƀing gih hmâo pơhaih, laih anŭn yua kơ tơlơi ƀing gih čơmah pha brơi ƀing gơñu wơ̆t kơ abih bang ƀing pơkŏn; 
and in their supplication for you, full of ardent desire for you, on account of the exceeding grace of God [which is] upon you. @ gơñu khăp hơeng laih anŭn iâu laĭ kơ ƀing gih, yua kơ tơlơi Ơi Adai pap yom pơphan hmâo pha brơi ƀing gih. 
Thanks [be] to God for his unspeakable free gift. @ Bơni kơ Ơi Adai yua kơ tơlơi Ñu pha brơi ƀu dưi pơblang ôh.
But I myself, Paul, entreat you by the meekness and gentleness of the Christ, who, as to appearance, [when present] [am] mean among you, but absent am bold towards you; @ Kâo, Pôl, hăng tơlơi tơdu rơun laih anŭn tơlơi hiam klă Yang Krist kâo kơwưh ƀing gih — kâo jing mơnuih rơun tơdu tơdang ƀơi anăp ƀing gih, samơ̆ tơdang ataih mơ̆ng ƀing gih kâo jing hơtai khĭn biă mă. 
but I beseech that present I may not be bold with the confidence with which I think to be daring towards some who think of us as walking according to flesh. @ Kâo kơwưh ƀing gih tơdang kâo dŏ ƀơi anăp ƀing gih, anăm pơgŏ ôh kâo yua tơlơi hơtai khĭn jing tơlơi kâo yua kiăng pơkơdơ̆ng hăng ƀing pơmĭn kơ ƀing gơmơi ngă tui hăng tơlơi phiăn asar đeh. 
For walking in flesh, we do not war according to flesh. @ Yua kơ wơ̆t dah ƀing gơmơi hơdip amăng asar đeh, samơ̆ ƀing gơmơi ƀu pơblah tui hăng asar đeh ôh. 
For the arms of our warfare [are] not fleshly, but powerful according to God to [the] overthrow of strongholds; @ Gơnam pơblah ƀing gơmơi yua kiăng pơblah ƀu djơ̆ jing khul gơnam pơblah asar đeh ôh, samơ̆ jing tơlơi dưi mơyang Ơi Adai kiăng kơ pơrai kơđông yang sat; 
overthrowing reasonings and every high thing that lifts itself up against the knowledge of God, and leading captive every thought into the obedience of the Christ; @ gơmơi pơglưh hĭ khul tơlơi pơrơjah pơgăl laih anŭn abih bang tơlơi pơgao pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ tơlơi thâo krăn Ơi Adai, laih anŭn pơgŏ abih bang tơlơi pơmĭn khŏm tui gưt kơ Yang Krist. 
and having in readiness to avenge all disobedience when your obedience shall have been fulfilled. @ Ƀing gơmơi ăt pre rơmet kiăng pơkra abih bang ƀing ƀu tui gưt, tơdah tơlơi ƀing gih tui gưt tum klă laih.
Do ye look at what concerns appearance? If any one has confidence in himself that he is of Christ, let him think this again in himself, that even as he [is] of Christ, so also [are] we. @ Ƀing gih kơnơ̆ng ƀuh mơnơ̆ng ƀơi anăp mơta ƀing gih đôč. Tơdah sĭt ih lơ̆m kơ Yang Krist, brơi ih pơmĭn glaĭ bĕ, tơdah ih lơ̆m kơ Yang Krist, ƀing gơmơi ăt lơ̆m kơ Yang Krist kar kaĭ mơ̆n. 
For and if I should boast even somewhat more abundantly of our authority, which the Lord has given [to us] for building up and not for your overthrowing, I shall not be put to shame; @ Wơ̆t dah kâo pơ-ư kơ kâo pô rơgao hơnơ̆ng ƀiă yua kơ tơlơi dưi Khua Yang hmâo brơi laih kơ kâo kiăng djru ƀing gih rai kơ prŏng ƀu djơ̆ kiăng pơrai pơglưh hĭ ƀing gih ôh, kâo ăt ƀu mlâo ôh. 
that I may not seem as if I was frightening you by letters: @ Kâo ƀu kiăng ôh arăng pơmĭn kâo pơhwĭ ƀing gih hăng hră kâo mơit. 
because his letters, he says, [are] weighty and strong, but his presence in the body weak, and his speech naught. @ Yua kơ hmâo pô laĭ: “Hră ñu mơit jing kơtraŏ laih anŭn khăng khơ̆t, samơ̆ tơdah ƀuh ƀô̆ mơta ñu jing tơdu laih anŭn tơlơi ñu pơhiăp ƀu yom ôh.” 
Let such a one think this, that such as we are in word by letters [when] absent, such also present in deed. @ Brơi kơ ƀing pơhiăp tui anŭn khŏm thâo hluh hyư̆m tơlơi ƀing gơmơi čih amăng hră hlăk gơmơi rơkut, ƀing gơmơi ăt či ngă tui anŭn mơ̆n tơdah gơmơi ƀuh ƀô̆ mơta.
For we dare not class ourselves or compare ourselves with some who commend themselves; but these, measuring themselves by themselves, and comparing themselves with themselves, are not intelligent. @ Ƀing gơmơi ƀu khĭn pơkă ƀôdah pơhmô gơmơi pô hăng ƀing mơnuih pơ-ư kơ gơñu pô. Samơ̆ tơdah ƀing gơñu pơkă gơñu pô hăng pô pơkŏn, laih anŭn tơdah gơñu pơhmô gơñu pô hăng pô pơkŏn, tui anŭn ƀing gơñu ƀu hmâo tơlơi thâo hluh ôh. 
Now *we* will not boast out of measure, but according to the measure of the rule which the God of measure has apportioned to us, to reach to you also. @ Gah kơ ƀing gơmơi, ƀu či pơ-ư kơ gơmơi pô rơgao hơnơ̆ng đơi ôh, samơ̆ kơnơ̆ng amăng hơnơ̆ng Ơi Adai hmâo pơkơčah laih, amăng hơnơ̆ng hmâo pơkơčah anŭn hmâo wơ̆t kơ ƀing gih mơ̆n. 
For we do not, as not reaching to you, overstretch ourselves, (for we have come to you also in the glad tidings of the Christ;) @ Yua kơ ƀing gơmơi ƀu nao rơgao hơnơ̆ng gơmơi pô ôh, kar hăng ƀing gơmơi aka nao djơ̆ pơ ƀing gih; samơ̆ biă mă ƀing gơmơi jing ƀing blŭng hlâo ba Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam Yang Krist kơ ƀing gih. 
not boasting out of measure in other people's labours, but having hope, your faith increasing, to be enlarged amongst you, according to our rule, yet more abundantly @ Ƀing gơmơi ƀu pơ-ư gơmơi pô rơgao hơnơ̆ng đơi ôh amăng bruă ƀing pơkŏn ngă; samơ̆ tơlơi ƀing gơmơi čang rơmang anŭn jing tơlơi đaŏ ƀing gih rai kơ prŏng, bruă ƀing gơmơi tơ̆ng krah ƀing gih či jing prŏng hloh dơ̆ng, 
to announce the glad tidings to that [which is] beyond you, not to be boasting in another's rule of things made ready to hand. @ hnŭn kah ƀing gơmơi dưi ră ruai Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam amăng čar pơkŏn dơ̆ng, samơ̆ ƀu pơ-ư kơ khul bruă hmâo ngă laih amăng anih pô pơkŏn. 
But he that boasts, let him boast in the Lord. @ “Hlơi pô pơ-ư kơ ñu pô brơi ñu pơ-ư bĕ ñu pô amăng Khua Yang.” 
For not *he* that commends himself is approved, but whom the Lord commends. @ Yua kơ ƀu djơ̆ ôh mơnuih pơ-ư kơ ñu pô či hmâo tơlơi arăng tŭ ư, samơ̆ kơ pô Khua Yang bơni yơh.
Would that ye would bear with me [in] a little folly; but indeed bear with me. @ Kâo kiăng kơ ƀing gih gir tŭ ƀiă amăng tơlơi mlŭk kâo. Sĭt yơh, brơi ƀing gih gir tŭ. 
For I am jealous as to you with a jealousy [which is] of God; for I have espoused you unto one man, to present [you] a chaste virgin to Christ. @ Kâo gar kơ ƀing gih kar hăng tơlơi gar Ơi Adai. Yua kơ kâo hmâo djă kong brơi laih ƀing gih hăng sa čô rơkơi đôč, ba pơdah ƀing gih kar hăng sa čô đah kơmơi dra hmŭm rơgoh hơčih kơ Yang Krist. 
But I fear lest by any means, as the serpent deceived Eve by his craft, [so] your thoughts should be corrupted from simplicity as to the Christ. @ Samơ̆ kâo hwĭ, kar hăng ala hmâo plư laih HʼÊwa hăng tơlơi ñu pleč ƀlor hyư̆m pă, ăt kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n tơlơi pơmĭn ƀing gih či weh đuaĭ hĭ mơ̆ng tơlơi tơpă sĭt laih anŭn rơgoh hơčih ƀing gih hmâo jao laih gih pô kơ Yang Krist. 
For if indeed he that comes preaches another Jesus, whom we have not preached, or ye get a different Spirit, which ye have not got, or a different glad tidings, which ye have not received, ye might well bear with [it]. @ Yua kơ tơdah hmâo hlơi rai pơtô kơ ƀing gih sa Yêsu pơkŏn phara hăng Pô ƀing gơmơi hmâo pơtô laih, ƀôdah tơdah ƀing gih hmâo mă tŭ laih sa yang pơkŏn phara hăng Yang Bơngăt Hiam ƀing gih hmâo tŭ mă laih, ƀôdah tơdah ƀing gih tŭ mă sa Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam pơkŏn phara hăng Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam ƀing gih hmâo tŭ mă laih, sĭt yơh ƀing gih ăt tañ tŭ tơlơi anŭn mơ̆n!
For I reckon that in nothing I am behind those who are in surpassing degree apostles. @ Kâo pơmĭn, kâo ƀu jing anĕt hloh kơ ƀing khua ding kơna prŏng yom pơphan hloh anŭn ôh. 
But if [I am] a simple person in speech, yet not in knowledge, but in everything making [the truth] manifest in all things to you. @ Wơ̆t dah kâo pơhiăp ƀu hiam ôh, samơ̆ kâo hmâo tơlơi thâo hluh, amăng djŏp mơta tơlơi ƀing gơmơi hmâo pơrơđah klă laih tơlơi anŭn ƀơi tơ̆ng krah abih bang mơnuih.
Have I committed sin, abasing myself in order that *ye* might be exalted, because I gratuitously announced to you the glad tidings of God? @ Kâo hmâo tơlơi soh glaĭ hơgĕt mơ̆ tơdang kâo luă gŭ kâo pô kiăng kơ ƀing gih dưi hmâo tơlơi pŭ pơđĭ? Ƀôdah tơdang kâo hmâo pơtô laih Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam Ơi Adai kơ ƀing gih hăng tơlơi đôč đač? 
I spoiled other assemblies, receiving hire for ministry towards you. @ Kâo klĕ dŏp mơ̆ng Phung Sang Ơi Adai pơkŏn, tơdang kâo mă tŭ mơnơ̆ng djru mơ̆ng ƀing gơñu, kiăng buih bruă kơ ƀing gih. 
And being present with you and lacking, I did not lazily burden any one, (for the brethren who came from Macedonia supplied what I lacked,) and in everything I kept myself from being a burden to you, and will keep myself. @ Laih anŭn tơdang dŏ hrŏm hăng ƀing gih, hlăk kâo kơƀah mơnơ̆ng, kâo ƀu hmâo pơkơtraŏ ƀing gih ôh. Yua kơ ƀing adơi ayŏng hmâo rai mơ̆ng čar Masêđôn djru laih khul mơnơ̆ng kâo kơƀah. Wơ̆t dah bruă hơgĕt tŭ mơ̆n, kâo ăt răng kiăng kơ ƀu ngă pơkơtraŏ ƀing gih ôh, laih anŭn kâo či ngă nanao tui anŭn. 
[The] truth of Christ is in me that this boasting shall not be stopped as to me in the regions of Achaia. @ Tui hăng tơlơi sĭt Yang Krist hmâo dŏ amăng kâo, ƀu hmâo hlơi amăng čar Akai anai dưi ngă brơi kâo lui hĭ kơ tơlơi kâo dưi pơ-ư kơ kâo pô amăng bruă anai. 
Why? because I do not love you? God knows. @ Hyư̆m? Yua kơ kâo ƀu khăp kơ ƀing gih hă? Ơi Adai thâo kâo khăp kơ ƀing gih!
But what I do, I will also do, that I may cut off the opportunity of those wishing [for] an opportunity, that wherein they boast they may be found even as we. @ Samơ̆ tơlơi kâo hlăk ngă, kâo či ngă dơ̆ng, kiăng pơglưh hĭ mông gal kơ ƀing mơnuih hơduah mông gal kiăng pơđĭ gơñu pô, gơñu laĭ gơñu ăt jing kar hăng ƀing gơmơi mơ̆n. 
For such [are] false apostles, deceitful workers, transforming themselves into apostles of Christ. @ Yua kơ ƀing anŭn jing ƀing khua ding kơna ƀlor, ƀing mă bruă apah pleč ƀlor, gơñu ngă ƀlor mă gơñu pô jing ƀing khua ding kơna Yang Krist. 
And [it is] not wonderful, for Satan himself transforms himself into an angel of light. @ Tơlơi anŭn ƀu hmâo dŏ kơtuă ôh, wơ̆t kơ Satan ăt ngă ƀlor mă ñu pô jing sa čô ling jang adai bơngač kơmlă. 
It is no great thing therefore if his ministers also transform themselves as ministers of righteousness; whose end shall be according to their works. @ Tui anŭn ƀu hmâo dŏ kơtuă ôh tơdah ƀing ding kơna Satan ngă ƀlor mă ñu pô jing ding kơna kơ tơlơi tơpă. Ƀơi hnal tuč ƀing gơñu či mă tŭ tui hăng bruă ƀing gơñu hmâo ngă.
Again I say, Let not any one think me to be a fool; but if otherwise, receive me then even as a fool, that *I* also may boast myself some little. @ Kâo laĭ glaĭ dơ̆ng, anăm hlơi pơmĭn kơ kâo jing kar hăng mơnuih mlŭk ôh; samơ̆ wơ̆t dah ƀing gih pơmĭn tui anŭn, tŭ ư bĕ kâo kar hăng sa čô mơnuih mlŭk, kiăng kơ kâo ăt dưi pơ-ư kâo pô ƀiă. 
What I speak I do not speak according to [the] Lord, but as in folly, in this confidence of boasting. @ Tơlơi kâo dŏ pơhiăp, kâo ƀu pơhiăp tui hăng tơlơi dưi mơ̆ng Khua Yang ôh, samơ̆ kar hăng sa čô mơnuih mlŭk hăng tơlơi khĭn pơ-ư kâo pô. 
Since many boast according to flesh, *I* also will boast. @ Yua kơ hmâo lu mơnuih pơ-ư gơñu pô tui hăng asar đeh, kâo ăt kar kaĭ mơ̆n či pơ-ư kơ kâo pô. 
For ye bear fools readily, being wise. @ Yua kơ ƀing gih yap ƀing gih jing mơnuih kơhnâo, samơ̆ mơak gir tŭ hăng ƀing mơnuih mlŭk. 
For ye bear if any one bring you into bondage, if any one devour [you], if any one get [your money], if any one exalt himself, if any one beat you on the face. @ Yua kơ ƀing gih tŭ ư mă ƀing gih jing hlŭn, ƀôdah plah sua mă dram gơnam ƀing gih, ƀôdah ƀơ̆ng kong ngăn ƀing gih, mưč mač kơ ƀing gih ƀôdah pah meng ƀing gih. 
I speak as to dishonour, as though *we* had been weak; but wherein any one is daring, (I speak in folly,) *I* also am daring. @ Kâo mlâo hañ tơdang kâo laĭ, ƀing gơmơi hơtai lêl ƀu dưi ngă tui anŭn ôh.
Kâo pơhiăp kar hăng sa čô mơnuih mlŭk, samơ̆ tơdah arăng khĭn pơ-ư kơ ñu pô kâo pô ăt khĭn pơ-ư kơ kâo pô kar kaĭ mơ̆n kơ tơlơi anŭn. 
Are they Hebrews? *I* also. Are they Israelites? *I* also. Are they seed of Abraham? *I* also. @ Ƀing gơñu jing mơnuih Hêbrơ mơ̆? Kâo kar kaĭ mơ̆n. Ƀing gơñu jing mơnuih Israel mơ̆? Kâo kar kaĭ mơ̆n. Ƀing gơñu jing ƀing ană tơčo Abraham mơ̆? Kâo kar kaĭ mơ̆n. 
Are they ministers of Christ? (I speak as being beside myself) *I* above measure [so]; in labours exceedingly abundant, in stripes to excess, in prisons exceedingly abundant, in deaths oft. @ Ƀing gơñu jing ƀing ding kơna Yang Krist mơ̆? Kâo pơhiăp kar hăng sa čô mơnuih hưt, Kâo hloh kơ anŭn dơ̆ng, kâo mă bruă lu hloh. Arăng krư̆ kâo lu wơ̆t hloh. Arăng taih kâo ƀu thâo yap ôh, laih anŭn lu wơ̆t kâo ƀiă či djai. 
From the Jews five times have I received forty [stripes], save one. @ Rơma wơ̆t ƀing Yuđa taih kâo, rĭm wơ̆t klâo pluh dua rơpăn hmăt; 
Thrice have I been scourged, once I have been stoned, three times I have suffered shipwreck, a night and day I passed in the deep: @ Klâo wơ̆t arăng taih kâo hăng gai, sa wơ̆t arăng glŏm kâo boh pơtâo, klâo wơ̆t kâo bưp kompăn trăm; kâo hmâo dŏ laih sa hrơi sa mlam amăng ia rơsĭ pơpuh pơđung hyu. 
in journeyings often, in perils of rivers, in perils of robbers, in perils from [my own] race, in perils from [the] nations, in perils in [the] city, in perils in [the] desert, in perils on [the] sea, in perils among false brethren; @ Amăng lu tơlơi kâo hyu, kâo bưp tơlơi hyưt pưt ƀơi ia krong, hyưt pưt mơ̆ng ƀing klĕ dŏp, mơ̆ng ƀing ană plei kâo pô, mơ̆ng ƀing djuai tuai, hyưt pưt amăng plei prŏng, amăng tơdrŏn tač, ƀơi ia rơsĭ, mơ̆ng ƀing adơi ayŏng ƀlor. 
in labour and toil, in watchings often, in hunger and thirst, in fastings often, in cold and nakedness. @ Kâo gir mă bruă gleh laih anŭn tơnap tap, lu wơ̆t kâo dŏ krŏng amăng mlam, ư̆ rơpa laih anŭn mơhao, lu wơ̆t ƀu hmâo mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă ôh, rơŏt guam, laih anŭn ƀu hmâo sum ao ôh. 
Besides those things that are without, the crowd [of cares] pressing on me daily, the burden of all the assemblies. @ Laih anŭn gah rơngiao kơ khul tơlơi anŭn, rĭm hrơi kâo hmâo tơlơi kơtraŏ yua kơ ƀlơ̆ng bơngơ̆t kơ abih bang Phung Sang Ơi Adai. 
Who is weak, and I am not weak? Who is stumbled, and I burn not? @ Hmâo hlơi tơdu, kâo ƀu tơdu ôh hă? Hmâo mơ̆ hlơi rơbuh amăng tơlơi soh, laih anŭn kâo ƀu ruă pran jua rơngot kơ tơlơi anŭn ôh?
If it is needful to boast, I will boast in the things which concern my infirmity. @ Tơdah khŏm pơ-ư kơ kâo pô, kâo či pơ-ư kơ khul tơlơi tơdu kâo đôč. 
The God and Father of the Lord Jesus knows he who is blessed for ever that I do not lie. @ Ơi Adai, Ama kơ Khua Yang Yêsu, Pô lăp arăng pơpŭ bơni hlŏng lar, thâo kâo ƀu ƀlor ôh. 
In Damascus the ethnarch of Aretas the king kept the city of the Damascenes shut up, wishing to take me; @ Pơ plei Damas khua prŏng dŏ gah yŭ kơ pơtao Arêtas brơi arăng gak wai plei Damas kiăng mă čaŏ kâo, 
and through a window in a basket I was let down by the wall, and escaped his hands. @ samơ̆ arăng pơañreng trŭn kâo hăng bai mơ̆ng amăng phă anĕt kơtuai pơnăng plei, laih anŭn kâo hmâo klaih mơ̆ng tơngan ñu.
Well, it is not of profit to me to boast, for I will come to visions and revelations of [the] Lord. @ Kâo khŏm pơ-ư kơ kâo pô, wơ̆t dah tơlơi anŭn ƀu hmâo tơlơi tŭ yua ôh, samơ̆ kâo či pơhiăp djơ̆ kơ khul tơlơi pơƀuh laih anŭn tơlơi bơrơđah mơ̆ng Khua Yang. 
I know a man in Christ, fourteen years ago, (whether in [the] body I know not, or out of the body I know not, God knows;) such [a one] caught up to [the] third heaven. @ Kâo thâo sa čô mơnuih amăng Krist, rơgao mơ̆ng anai pluh pă thŭn Ơi Adai hmâo ba đĭ ñu truh pơ adai tal klâo, (thâo dah amăng drơi jan ƀôdah gah rơngiao kơ drơi jan, kâo ƀu thâo ôh, Ơi Adai yơh thâo.) 
And I know such a man, (whether in [the] body or out of the body I know not, God knows;) @ Kâo thâo mơnuih anŭn (thâo dah amăng drơi jan ƀôdah gah rơngiao drơi jan, kâo ƀu thâo ôh, Ơi Adai thâo) 
that he was caught up into paradise, and heard unspeakable things said which it is not allowed to man to utter. @ Ơi Adai hmâo pŭ ba laih truh pơ Parađi, pơ anŭn, ñu hmư̆ tơlơi ƀu dưi ră ruai glaĭ ôh, laih anŭn ƀu hmâo hlơi dưi ruai glaĭ mơ̆n. 
Of such [a one] I will boast, but of myself I will not boast, unless in my weaknesses. @ Kâo či pơ-ư kơ kâo pô yua kơ mơnuih anŭn, samơ̆ kơ kâo pô kâo ƀu či pơ-ư ôh, kơnơ̆ng kâo či pơ-ư kơ kâo pô kơ khul tơlơi tơdu kâo đôč. 
For if I shall desire to boast, I shall not be a fool; for I will say [the] truth; but I forbear, lest any one should think as to me above what he sees me [to be], or whatever he may hear of me. @ Samơ̆ tơdah kâo kiăng pơ-ư kơ kâo pô, kâo ăt ƀu jing mơnuih mlŭk lơi, yua kơ kâo pơhiăp tơlơi sĭt. Samơ̆ kâo ƀu ngă tui anŭn ôh, kiăng anăm hmâo mơnuih pơmĭn kơ kâo rơgao hloh kơ tơlơi gơñu ƀuh amăng kâo, ƀôdah hmư̆ mơ̆ng kâo.
And that I might not be exalted by the exceeding greatness of the revelations, there was given to me a thorn for the flesh, a messenger of Satan that he might buffet me, that I might not be exalted. @ Kiăng djă krơ̆ng kâo klaih mơ̆ng tơlơi pơgao kơ lu tơlơi bơrơđah yom pơphan anai, sa ară drơi dưm amăng drơi jan kâo, jing sa čô ding kơna Satan ngă pơtơnap kâo, kiăng kơ kâo ƀu pơgao ôh. 
For this I thrice besought the Lord that it might depart from me. @ Klâo wơ̆t laih kâo kơwưh kơ Khua Yang mă pơđuaĭ tơlơi anŭn mơ̆ng kâo; 
And he said to me, My grace suffices thee; for [my] power is perfected in weakness. Most gladly therefore will I rather boast in my weaknesses, that the power of the Christ may dwell upon me. @ samơ̆ Ñu laĭ: “Tơlơi pap Kâo djŏp laih kơ ih, yua kơ tơlơi dưi kơtang Kâo dưi jing tum klă amăng tơlơi tơdu ih.” Yua kơ anŭn yơh kâo hơ̆k mơak biă mă pơ-ư kâo pô kơ khul tơlơi tơdu kâo, kiăng kơ tơlơi dưi kơtang Yang Krist dưi dŏ amăng kâo. 
Wherefore I take pleasure in weaknesses, in insults, in necessities, in persecutions, in straits, for Christ: for when I am weak, then I am powerful. @ Hnŭn yơh yua kơ Yang Krist kâo mơak tŭ tơlơi tơdu, tơlơi arăng hơtoh djraĭ, tơlơi gleh glăn, tơlơi arăng ngă sat, laih anŭn tơlơi răm ruă; yua kơ tơdang kâo tơdu, hlăk anŭn yơh kâo jing kơtang.
I have become a fool; *ye* have compelled me; for *I* ought to have been commended by you; for I have been nothing behind those who were in surpassing degree apostles, if also I am nothing. @ Kâo jing hĭ laih mơnuih mlŭk! Yua kơ ƀing gih pơgŏ kâo khŏm tui anŭn, djơ̆ biă mă ƀing gih khŏm pơ-ư kâo. Yua kơ wơ̆t dah kâo ƀu rup rap tŭ mơ̆n, kâo ăt ƀu jing anĕt hloh kơ ƀing khua ding kơna prŏng prin yom pơphan anŭn ôh. 
The signs indeed of the apostle were wrought among you in all endurance, signs, and wonders, and works of power. @ Khul gru kơnăl kơ tơlơi kâo jing sa čô khua ding kơna sĭt hmâo bơrơđah laih tơ̆ng krah ƀing gih hăng tơlơi gir añ, khul gru mơsêh mơyang, khul tơlơi yom pơphan laih anŭn khul bruă dưi mơyang. 
For in what is it that ye have been inferior to the other assemblies, unless that I myself have not been in laziness a charge upon you? Forgive me this injury. @ Yua kơ, gah rơngiao kơ tơlơi kâo ƀu pơkơtraŏ ƀing gih, hmâo tơlơi hơgĕt ƀing gih ƀu dơm kơnar hăng ƀing Phung Sang Ơi Adai pơkŏn mơ̆? Pap brơi kơ kâo yua tơlơi ƀu dơm kơnar anŭn hŏ.
Behold, this third time I am ready to come to you, and I will not be in laziness a charge; for I do not seek yours, but you; for the children ought not to lay up for the parents, but the parents for the children. @ Anai jing tal klâo kâo prăp rơmet kiăng nao pơ ƀing gih, laih anŭn kâo ƀu či pơkơtraŏ ƀing gih ôh, yua kơ kâo ƀu sem hơduah dram gơnam ƀing gih ôh, samơ̆ kâo kiăng pô ƀing gih. Yua kơ ƀu djơ̆ ôh ƀing ană bă khŏm pơkom pioh dram gơnam kơ amĭ ama, samơ̆ amĭ ama yơh pơkom pioh dram gơnam kơ ƀing ană bă gơñu. 
Now *I* shall most gladly spend and be utterly spent for your souls, if even in abundantly loving you I should be less loved. @ Kâo mơak biă mă plai hĭ abih hơgĕt mơnơ̆ng kâo hmâo wơ̆t tơlơi hơdip kâo pô yua kơ ƀing gih. Tơdah kâo khăp kơ ƀing gih jai lu hloh, ƀing gih či khăp kơ kâo jai ƀiă hloh hă?
But be it so. *I* did not burden you, but being crafty I took you by guile. @ Kâo pô aka pơkơtraŏ ƀing gih ôh, samơ̆ ƀing gih yap kâo kar hăng mơnuih mơneč sat, dưi hăng ƀing gih yua mơ̆ng tơlơi plư. 
Did I make gain of you by any of those whom I have sent to you? @ Kâo ƀơ̆ng dram gơnam ƀing gih mơ̆, mơ̆ng ƀing mơnuih kâo hmâo pơkiaŏ nao laih pơ ƀing gih? 
I begged Titus, and sent the brother with [him]: did Titus at all make gain of you? have we not walked in the same spirit? [have we] not in the same steps? @ Kâo hmâo pơtrŭt Tit nao, laih anŭn pơkiaŏ sa čô adơi ayŏng nao hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ñu, hyư̆m Tit hmâo pơplơ̆m ƀing gih mơ̆? Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă ƀing gơmơi hmâo hrŏm hơbĭt sa tơlơi pơmĭn hăng hrŏm hơbĭt sa jơlan rơbat?
Ye have long been supposing that we excuse ourselves to you: we speak before God in Christ; and all things, beloved, for your building up. @ Năng ai ƀing gih pơmĭn ƀing gơmơi pơgang gơmơi pô ƀơi anăp ƀing gih. Ư ưh, Ơ ƀing kâo khăp hơeng, amăng Krist gơmơi pơhiăp ƀơi anăp Ơi Adai, laih anŭn amăng abih bang tơlơi anŭn kơnơ̆ng yua kơ kiăng djru pơdơ̆ng pơjing ƀing gih. 
For I fear lest perhaps coming I find you not such as I wish, and that *I* be found by you such as ye do not wish: lest [there might be] strifes, jealousies, angers, contentions, evil speakings, whisperings, puffings up, disturbances; @ Yua kơ kâo hwĭ, tơdang kâo truh laih anŭn ƀuh ƀing gih ƀu djơ̆ tui hăng tơlơi kâo čang tơguan ôh, laih anŭn ƀing gih či ƀuh kâo ƀu djơ̆ tui hăng tơlơi ƀing gih čang tơguan kar kaĭ mơ̆n. Kâo hwĭ tơ̆ng krah ƀing gih ăt hmâo tơlơi pơrơdjơ̆ pơrơsao, tơlơi moañ, tơlơi hil, tơlơi et klih, tơlơi pơhiăp sat, tơlơi pơčeh, tơlơi pơgao, laih anŭn tơlơi rŭng ƀung. 
lest my God should humble me as to you when I come again, and that I shall grieve over many of those who have sinned before, and have not repented as to the uncleanness and fornication and licentiousness which they have practised. @ Kâo hwĭ, tơdang kâo truh dơ̆ng, Ơi Adai kâo či pơmlâo kâo ƀơi anăp ƀing gih, laih anŭn kâo khŏm čŏk hia yua kơ hmâo lu ƀing mơnuih ngă soh laih mơ̆ng hlâo, samơ̆ ƀu kơhmal ôh tơlơi hơƀak drak, tơlơi rih răm, tơlơi sat ƀai ƀing gơñu ngă laih.
This third time I am coming to you. In the mouth of two or three witnesses shall every matter be established. @  Anai jing tal klâo kâo nao pơ ƀing gih. “Abih tơlơi phong arăng či pơklă kơjăp hăng tơlơi ngă gơ̆ng jơlan mơ̆ng dua ƀôdah klâo čô mơnuih.” 
I have declared beforehand, and I say beforehand as present the second time, and now absent, to those that have sinned before, and to all the rest, that if I come again I will not spare. @ Kâo hmâo khă pơthâo laih ƀing ngă soh hlâo adih laih anŭn abih bang ƀing pơkŏn khŏm răng mơ̆n, laih anŭn kâo khă pơthâo ƀing gơñu ră anai tơdang kâo rơkut kar hăng kâo hmâo ngă laih hlăk kâo nao čuă ngui ƀing gih tal dua, tơdah kâo truh dơ̆ng kâo ƀu či pap brơi ƀing gơñu ôh — 
Since ye seek a proof of Christ speaking in me, (who is not weak towards you, but is powerful among you, @ Yua kơ ƀing gih kiăng ƀuh tơlơi pơsĭt Krist pơhiăp găn kâo. Ñu ƀu jing tơdu ôh amăng bruă Ñu ngă kơ ƀing gih, samơ̆ Ñu jing pô bă hăng tơlơi dưi mơyang tơ̆ng krah ƀing gih. 
for if indeed he has been crucified in weakness, yet he lives by God's power; for indeed *we* are weak in him, but we shall live with him by God's power towards you,) @ Wơ̆t dah arăng hmâo pơ̆ng laih Ñu ƀơi kơyâo bơrơkal amăng tơlơi Ñu tơdu, samơ̆ Ñu dŏ hơdip amăng tơlơi dưi mơyang Ơi Adai. Ƀing gơmơi kar kaĭ mơ̆n, wơ̆t dah tơdu amăng Ñu, samơ̆ hăng tơlơi dưi mơyang Ơi Adai ƀing gơmơi či hơdip hăng Ñu, kiăng kơ dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă hăng ƀing gih.
examine your own selves if ye be in the faith; prove your own selves: do ye not recognise yourselves, that Jesus Christ is in you, unless indeed ye be reprobates? @ Kơsem lăng bĕ ƀing gih pô kiăng kơ thâo ƀing gih ăt dŏ amăng tơlơi đaŏ mơ̆. Lông lăng bĕ ƀing gih pô. Ƀing gih ƀu thâo ôh hă Yêsu Krist dŏ amăng ƀing gih? — kơnơ̆ng tơdah ƀing gih ƀu dưi tơl ôh hơnơ̆ng pơkă. 
Now I hope that ye will know that *we* are not reprobates. @ Kâo čang rơmang ƀing gih či thâo ƀu djơ̆ ôh ƀing gơmơi ƀu tơl hơnơ̆ng pơkă. 
But we pray to God that ye may do nothing evil; not that *we* may appear approved, but that *ye* may do what is right, and *we* be as reprobates. @ Samơ̆ ƀing gơmơi iâu laĭ kơ Ơi Adai, kiăng kơ ƀing gih ƀu ngă khul tơlơi soh ôh — ƀu djơ̆ ôh kiăng pơrơđah ƀing gơmơi pô tơl hơnơ̆ng pơkă, samơ̆ kiăng kơ ƀing gih dưi ngă khul tơlơi djơ̆, wơ̆t dah arăng pơmĭn ƀing gơmơi ƀu tơl ôh amăng hơnơ̆ng pơkă anŭn. 
For we can do nothing against the truth, but for the truth. @ Yua kơ ƀing gơmơi ƀu dưi ngă ôh sa mơta tơlơi pơkơdơ̆ng hăng tơlơi sĭt, samơ̆ kơnơ̆ng pơhluai tui tơlơi sĭt đôč. 
For we rejoice when *we* may be weak and *ye* may be powerful. But this also we pray for, your perfecting. @ Yua kơ ƀing gơmơi mơak hlăk ƀing gơmơi tơdu laih anŭn ƀing gih jing kơtang. Tơlơi gơmơi iâu laĭ anŭn jing kiăng kơ ƀing gih truh tơl kơ tơlơi tum klă. 
On this account I write these things being absent, that being present I may not use severity according to the authority which the Lord has given me for building up, and not for overthrowing. @ Hnŭn yơh, hlăk kâo rơkut mơ̆ng ƀing gih, kâo čih khul tơlơi anai, kiăng kơ tơ kâo truh pơ ƀing gih kâo ƀu či khăng khĭp ôh tơdang kâo yua tơlơi dưi Khua Yang hmâo brơi laih kơ kâo jing tơlơi dưi kiăng djru ƀing gih rai kơ prŏng, ƀu djơ̆ kiăng pơglưh ƀing gih ôh.
For the rest, brethren, rejoice; be perfected; be encouraged; be of one mind; be at peace; and the God of love and peace shall be with you. @ Hnal tuč, Ơ ƀing adơi ayŏng, hơ̆k mơak bĕ, gir kơtir bĕ tơl truh tơlơi tum klă, pơtrŭt pơđĭ pran jua tơdruă bĕ, brơi ƀing gih hmâo sa pran jua, hơdip rơnŭk rơnua bĕ hăng tơdruă, Ơi Adai kơ tơlơi khăp laih anŭn tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua či dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing gih.
Salute one another with a holy kiss. @ Brơi ƀing gih kơkuh tơña kơ tơdruă ƀing gih hăng tơlơi čŭm rơgoh hiam. Abih bang ƀing rơgoh hiam mơit tơlơi čuă ngui hăng ƀing gih.
All the saints salute you. @ Rơkâo tơlơi pap Khua Yang Yêsu Krist, tơlơi khăp Ơi Adai, laih anŭn tơlơi pơgop lir Yang Bơngăt Hiam, dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng abih bang ƀing gih.
Paul, apostle, not from men nor through man, but through Jesus Christ, and God [the] Father who raised him from among [the] dead, @ Pôl, khua ding kơna ƀu djơ̆ mơ̆ng ană mơnuih ƀôdah mơ̆ng tơlơi dưi ană mơnuih pơjing brơi ôh, samơ̆ mơ̆ng Khua Yang Yêsu Krist laih anŭn Ơi Adai Ama, Pô hmâo pơhơdip glaĭ Yêsu mơ̆ng ƀing djai, 
and all the brethren with me, to the assemblies of Galatia. @ wơ̆t abih bang ƀing adơi ayŏng dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng kâo, čih mơit kơ Phung Sang Ơi Adai pơ čar Galati.
Grace to you, and peace, from God [the] Father, and our Lord Jesus Christ, @ Rơkâo kơ Ơi Adai, Ama ƀing ta, laih anŭn Khua Yang Yêsu Krist pha brơi kơ ƀing gih tơlơi pap laih anŭn tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua. 
who gave himself for our sins, so that he should deliver us out of the present evil world, according to the will of our God and Father; @ Khua Yang Yêsu Krist hmâo jao laih Ñu pô yua kơ tơlơi soh ƀing ta, kiăng pơklaih ƀing ta mơ̆ng rơnŭk soh sat anai, tui hăng tơlơi Ơi Adai Ama ƀing ta kiăng. 
to whom [be] glory to the ages of ages. Amen. @ Kơ Ñu yơh tơlơi guh kơang nanao hlŏng lar. Amen!
I wonder that ye thus quickly change, from him that called you in Christ's grace, to a different gospel, @ Kâo dŏ kơtuă biă mă kơ ƀing gih hăt lui hĭ Pô hmâo iâu laih ƀing gih hăng tơlơi pap Yang Krist, kiăng kơ đuaĭ tui Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam pơkŏn. 
which is not another [one]; but there are some that trouble you, and desire to pervert the glad tidings of the Christ. @ Ƀu hmâo ôh Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam pơkŏn dơ̆ng, samơ̆ hmâo đơđa mơnuih kiăng ngă pơrŭng tơlơi pơmĭn ƀing gih laih anŭn kiăng pơsoh Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam Yang Krist. 
But if even *we* or an angel out of heaven announce as glad tidings to you [anything] besides what we have announced as glad tidings to you, let him be accursed. @ Samơ̆ wơ̆t dah gơmơi, ƀôdah sa čô ling jang mơ̆ng adai pơtô kơ ƀing gih sa Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam phara hăng Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam ƀing gơmơi hmâo pơtô laih kơ ƀing gih, mơnuih anŭn lăp kơ Ơi Adai hơtơ̆m pah hĭ ñu yơh! 
As we have said before, now also again I say, If any one announce to you as glad tidings [anything] besides what ye have received, let him be accursed. @ Kar hăng ƀing gơmơi hmâo laĭ laih hlâo dih, tui anŭn ră anai kâo lơ̆k glaĭ dơ̆ng, tơdah hlơi pơtô kơ ƀing gih sa Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam phara hăng Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam ƀing gih hmâo mă tŭ laih, mơnuih anŭn lăp kơ Ơi Adai hơtơ̆m pah hĭ ñu.
For do I now seek to satisfy men or God? or do I seek to please men? If I were yet pleasing men, I were not Christ's bondman. @ Ră anai, kâo tui hơduah tơlơi ană mơnuih tŭ ư mơ̆, ƀôdah tơlơi Ơi Adai tŭ ư? Ƀôdah kâo kiăng bơmơak kơ ană mơnuih mơ̆? Tơdah kâo ăt kiăng bơmơak kơ ană mơnuih, kâo ƀu jing ding kơna Yang Krist tah.
But I let you know, brethren, [as to] the glad tidings which were announced by me, that they are not according to man. @ Ơ ƀing adơi ayŏng, kâo kiăng kơ ƀing gih thâo Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam kâo hmâo pơtô laih ƀu djơ̆ Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam tơbiă rai mơ̆ng ană mơnuih ôh. 
For neither did I receive them from man, neither was I taught [them], but by revelation of Jesus Christ. @ Yua kơ kâo ƀu mă tŭ ôh tơlơi anŭn mơ̆ng ană mơnuih, ăt kŏn hmâo hlơi pô pơhrăm brơi kâo lơi, samơ̆ ñu tơbiă rai mơ̆ng tơlơi Yêsu Krist hmâo bơrơđah brơi laih kơ kâo.
For ye have heard [what was] my conversation formerly in Judaism, that I excessively persecuted the assembly of God, and ravaged it; @  Yua kơ ƀing gih hmâo hmư̆ hing laih tơlơi kâo dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă hlâo dih tơdang kâo tui tơlơi đaŏ ƀing Yuđa. Kâo hmâo ngă sat kơtang biă mă, gir kơtir kiăng pơrai Phung Sang Ơi Adai kơ Ơi Adai. 
and advanced in Judaism beyond many [my] contemporaries in my nation, being exceedingly zealous of the doctrines of my fathers. @ Amăng tơlơi đaŏ ƀing Yuđa, kâo rơgao hloh kơ abih bang ƀing mơnuih Yuđa hrŏm hơbĭt rơnŭk hăng kâo, yua kơ kâo hur har biă mă tui hăng tơlơi phiăn ƀing ơi adon kâo.
But when God, who set me apart [even] from my mother's womb, and called [me] by his grace, @  Samơ̆ Ơi Adai, Pô hmâo ruah laih kâo mơ̆ng kian amĭ kâo, laih anŭn hăng tơlơi pap Ñu iâu kâo, 
was pleased to reveal his Son in me, that I may announce him as glad tidings among the nations, immediately I took not counsel with flesh and blood, @ Ñu mơak kiăng bơrơđah Ană Ñu kơ kâo, kiăng kơ kâo dưi pơtô Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam Ană Ñu amăng ƀing djuai tuai, mơtam kâo ƀu črŏng sai hăng ană mơnuih ôh. 
nor went I up to Jerusalem to those [who were] apostles before me; but I went to Arabia, and again returned to Damascus. @ Kâo kŏn đĭ nao pơ plei Yêrusalem lơi kiăng kơ bưp ƀing khua ding kơna hlâo kơ kâo, samơ̆ kâo nao pơ čar Arabi mơtam; giơ̆ng anŭn kâo wơ̆t glaĭ plei Damas dơ̆ng. 
Then after three years I went up to Jerusalem to make acquaintance with Peter, and I remained with him fifteen days; @ Klâo thŭn tơdơi mơ̆ng anŭn, kâo đĭ nao plei Yêrusalem kiăng čuă ngui Sêphas laih anŭn kâo dŏ glaĭ hăng ñu pluh rơma hrơi. 
but I saw none other of the apostles, but James the brother of the Lord. @ Samơ̆ kâo ƀu bưp ƀing khua ding kơna pơkŏn ôh, kơnơ̆ng hơjăn Yakơ adơi Khua Yang đôč.
Now what I write to you, behold, before God, I do not lie. @ Ƀơi anăp Ơi Adai kâo laĭ sĭt biă mă tơlơi kâo čih kơ ƀing gih ƀu djơ̆ tơlơi ƀlor ôh!
Then I came into the regions of Syria and Cilicia. @ Tơdơi kơ anŭn, kâo nao pơ čar Siri laih anŭn čar Silisi. 
But I was unknown personally to the assemblies of Judaea which [are] in Christ; @ Hlăk anŭn lu Phung Sang Ơi Adai kơ Krist amăng Čar Yuđa aka thâo krăn ƀô̆ mơta kâo ôh. 
only they were hearing that he who persecuted us formerly now announces the glad tidings of the faith which formerly he ravaged: @ Kơnơ̆ng ƀing gơñu hmư̆ hing arăng laĭ: “Pô ngă sat kơ ƀing ta hlâo dih, ră anai dŏ pơtô tơlơi đaŏ hlâo dih ñu kiăng pơrai.” 
and they glorified God in me. @ Tui anŭn, ƀing gơñu pơpŭ bơni kơ Ơi Adai yua kơ kâo.
Then after a lapse of fourteen years I went up again to Jerusalem with Barnabas, taking Titus also with [me]; @  Pluh pă thŭn tơdơi, kâo đĭ nao pơ plei Yêrusalem dơ̆ng hrŏm hăng Barnabas, djă ba Tit hrŏm hăng kâo mơ̆n. 
and I went up according to revelation, and I laid before them the glad tidings which I preach among the nations, but privately to those conspicuous [among them], lest in any way I run or had run in vain; @ Kâo đĭ nao pơ anŭn tui hăng tơlơi Ơi Adai bơrơđah, laih anŭn kâo pơblang brơi kơ ƀing gơñu Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam kâo hmâo pơtô laih tơ̆ng krah ƀing djuai tuai. Samơ̆ kâo kơnơ̆ng ruai pơdah kơ ƀing akŏ wai lăng đôč, hwĭ dah tơlơi kâo hmâo pơtô laih, laih anŭn hlăk dŏ hyu pơtô či jing hĭ đôč đač. 
(but neither was Titus, who was with me, being a Greek, compelled to be circumcised;) @ Samơ̆ wơ̆t kơ Tit, pô nao hrŏm hăng kâo, wơ̆t dah ñu jing sa čô Grek tŭ mơ̆n, arăng ƀu pơgŏ ñu khŏm tŭ tơlơi juăt khăt klĭ ôh. 
and [it was] on account of the false brethren brought in surreptitiously, who came in surreptitiously to spy out our liberty which we have in Christ Jesus, that they might bring us into bondage; @ Samơ̆ hmâo đơđa ƀing adơi ayŏng đaŏ ƀlor klĕ mŭt amăng ƀing gơmơi, lăng sŭ tơlơi rơngai ƀing gơmơi hmâo amăng Krist Yêsu, kiăng pơjing ƀing gơmơi jing hlŭn gơñu. 
to whom we yielded in subjection not even for an hour, that the truth of the glad tidings might remain with you. @ Ƀing gơmơi ƀu tui gưt gơñu ôh, wơ̆t dah kơnơ̆ng ƀiă mơnĭt đôč, kiăng kơ tơlơi sĭt kơ Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam dưi dŏ kơjăp amăng ƀing gih.
But from those who were conspicuous as being somewhat whatsoever they were, it makes no difference to me: God does not accept man's person; for to me those who were conspicuous communicated nothing; @  Bơ kơ ƀing rŏ dah jing akŏ wai lăng (hơgĕt gơñu jing hlâo dih tơlơi anŭn ƀu yom kơ kâo ôh, Ơi Adai ƀu pơkah phara ôh), kâo laĭ, ƀing akŏ wai lăng anŭn ƀu hmâo djru thim tơlơi hơgĕt kơ kâo ôh. 
but, on the contrary, seeing that the glad tidings of the uncircumcision were confided to me, even as to Peter that of the circumcision, @ Samơ̆ kơđai glaĭ, tơ gơñu ƀuh Ơi Adai hmâo jao laih kơ kâo bruă pơtô Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam kơ ƀing ƀu khăt klĭ ôh, kar hăng Ơi Adai hmâo jao laih kơ Pêtrôs bruă pơtô Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam kơ ƀing khăt klĭ. 
(for he that wrought in Peter for [the] apostleship of the circumcision wrought also in me towards the Gentiles,) @ Yua kơ Ơi Adai, Pô hmâo mă bruă laih amăng Pêtrôs, pơjing ñu jing khua ding kơna kơ ƀing khăt klĭ, ăt hmâo mă bruă laih mơ̆n amăng kâo laih anŭn pơjing kâo khua ding kơna kơ ƀing djuai tuai. 
and recognising the grace given to me, James and Cephas and John, who were conspicuous as being pillars, gave to me and Barnabas [the] right hands of fellowship, that *we* [should go] to the nations, and *they* to the circumcision; @ Laih anŭn tơ gơñu thâo hluh tơlơi pap Ơi Adai hmâo brơi laih kơ kâo, Yakơ, Sêphas, laih anŭn Yôhan, ƀing arăng pơpŭ yap kar hăng tơmeh, hmâo jao tơngan hơnuă pơgop hăng kâo laih anŭn Barnabas, kiăng brơi kơ ƀing gơmơi nao pơ ƀing djuai tuai, bơ ƀing gơñu nao pơ ƀing khăt klĭ. 
only that we should remember the poor, which same thing also I was diligent to do. @ Ƀing gơñu kơnơ̆ng rơkâo kơ ƀing gơmơi sa mơta bruă đôč, anŭn jing khŏm hơdơr djru kơ ƀing ƀun rin, jing bruă ƀing gơmơi hmâo ngă laih hăng tơlơi hur har.
But when Peter came to Antioch, I withstood him to [the] face, because he was to be condemned: @ Samơ̆ tơ Sêphas truh pơ plei Antiôs, kâo pơkơdơ̆ng hăng ñu ƀơi anăp lu mơnuih, yua kơ ñu lăp kơ ƀuah. 
for before that certain came from James, he ate with [those of] the nations; but when they came, he drew back and separated himself, fearing those of [the] circumcision; @ Yua kơ hlâo kơ ƀing mơnuih Yakơ pơkiaŏ rai truh, ñu ƀơ̆ng huă hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing djuai tuai; samơ̆ tơ ƀing gơñu truh, ñu kơdŭn laih anŭn pơčơlah dŏ hĭ phara, yua kơ hwĭ kơ ƀing khăt klĭ. 
and the rest of the Jews also played the same dissembling part with him; so that even Barnabas was carried away too by their dissimulation. @ Abih bang ƀing Yuđa pơkŏn kar kaĭ mơ̆n hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ñu ngă tơlơi ƀu tơpă sĭt, tơl wơ̆t Barnabas pô ăt kar kaĭ mơ̆n pơhluai tui tơlơi pơrup mă ƀing gơñu. 
But when I saw that they do not walk straightforwardly, according to the truth of the glad tidings, I said to Peter before all, If *thou*, being a Jew, livest as the nations and not as the Jews, how dost thou compel the nations to Judaize? @ Samơ̆ tơ kâo ƀuh ƀing gơñu ƀu ngă tơlơi tơpă sĭt tui hăng tơlơi sĭt mơ̆ng Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam ôh, kâo laĭ kơ Sêphas ƀơi anăp abih bang ƀing gơñu: “Tơdah ih jing mơnuih Yuđa, samơ̆ dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă kar hăng mơnuih tuai, ƀu djơ̆ kar hăng mơnuih Yuđa ôh, hyư̆m ih dưi pơgŏ ƀing djuai tuai dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă kar hăng ƀing mơnuih Yuđa?”
We, Jews by nature, and not sinners of [the] nations, @ Bơ ƀing gơmơi, gơmơi jing ƀing Yuđa mơ̆ng amĭ tơkeng, ƀu djơ̆ jing “ƀing mơnuih soh amăng djuai tuai” kar hăng gơñu laĭ ôh. 
but knowing that a man is not justified on the principle of works of law [nor] but by the faith of Jesus Christ, *we* also have believed on Christ Jesus, that we might be justified on the principle of [the] faith of Christ; and not of works of law; because on the principle of works of law no flesh shall be justified. @ Samơ̆ ƀing gơmơi thâo Ơi Adai yap mơnuih tơpă ƀu djơ̆ yua kơ khul bruă ngă tui tơlơi juăt ôh, samơ̆ mơ̆ng tơlơi đaŏ kơ Yêsu Krist. Wơ̆t kơ ƀing gơmơi pô mơ̆n hmâo đaŏ laih kơ Yêsu Krist, kiăng dưi hmâo tơlơi yap tơpă mơ̆ng tơlơi đaŏ kơ Yêsu Krist ƀu djơ̆ mơ̆ng khul bruă ngă tui tơlơi juăt ôh, yua kơ arăng ƀu dưi hmâo ôh tơlơi yap tơpă mơ̆ng khul bruă ngă tui tơlơi juăt. 
Now if in seeking to be justified in Christ we also have been found sinners, then [is] Christ minister of sin? Far be the thought. @ Samơ̆ tơdah tơdang ƀing gơmơi hơduah jơlan kiăng dưi hmâo tơlơi yap tơpă amăng Krist, arăng lăng ƀing gơmơi jing ƀing mơnuih soh, tui anŭn djơ̆ mơ̆ Krist jing ding kơna kơ tơlơi soh? Ư ưh, ƀu djơ̆ tui anŭn ôh! 
For if the things I have thrown down, these I build again, I constitute myself a transgressor. @ Samơ̆, tơdah kâo pơdơ̆ng glaĭ tơlơi kâo hmâo pơglưh hĭ laih, tui anŭn kâo bơrơđah pơsĭt kơ kâo pô jing sa čô ngă soh. 
For *I*, through law, have died to law, that I may live to God. @ Yua mơ̆ng tơlơi juăt kâo hmâo djai laih kơ tơlơi juăt anŭn, kiăng kơ kâo dưi hơdip kơ Ơi Adai. 
I am crucified with Christ, and no longer live, *I*, but Christ lives in me; but [in] that I now live in flesh, I live by faith, the [faith] of the Son of God, who has loved me and given himself for me. @ Arăng pơ̆ng laih kâo ƀơi kơyâo bơrơkal hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Yang Krist, tui anŭn kâo hơdip, ƀu djơ̆ kâo pô dŏ hơdip dơ̆ng ôh, samơ̆ Yang Krist dŏ hơdip amăng kâo. Laih anŭn tơlơi kâo dŏ hơdip amăng asar đeh ră anai, jing kâo dŏ hơdip hăng tơlơi đaŏ amăng Ană Ơi Adai, Pô hmâo khăp laih kơ kâo laih anŭn hmâo jao laih Ñu pô yua kơ kâo. 
I do not set aside the grace of God; for if righteousness [is] by law, then Christ has died for nothing. @ Kâo ƀu kiăng ngă brơi tơlơi Ơi Adai pap jing hĭ đôč đač ôh, yua kơ tơdah arăng dưi hmâo tơlơi Ơi Adai yap tơpă mơ̆ng tơlơi ngă tui tơlơi juăt, tui anŭn tơlơi Yang Krist tŭ tơlơi djai jing hĭ đôč đač yơh.
O senseless Galatians, who has bewitched you; to whom, as before your very eyes, Jesus Christ has been portrayed, crucified [among you]? @ Ơ ƀing mơnuih Galati mlŭk mơgu! Hlơi hmâo ngă pơhưč ƀing gih? Ƀơi anăp mơta ƀing gih hmâo pơrơđah laih Yêsu Krist arăng pơ̆ng laih ƀơi kơyâo bơrơkal. 
This only I wish to learn of you, Have ye received the Spirit on the principle of works of law, or of [the] report of faith? @ Kâo kơnơ̆ng kiăng ƀing gih brơi kâo thâo tơlơi anai đôč: ƀing gih hmâo mă tŭ laih Yang Bơngăt Hiam yua kơ mơ̆ng bruă ngă tui tơlơi juăt hă, ƀôdah yua kơ mơ̆ng tơlơi ƀing gih hmư̆ laih anŭn đaŏ? 
Are ye so senseless? having begun in Spirit, are ye going to be made perfect in flesh? @ Hyư̆m ƀing gih mlŭk kar hăng anŭn? Ƀing gih hmâo pơphŭn laih hăng Yang Bơngăt Hiam, yua hơgĕt ră anai ƀing gih kiăng pơđŭt hĭ hăng tơlơi kơnang kơ asar đeh? 
Have ye suffered so many things in vain, if indeed also in vain? @ Djơ̆ mơ̆ abih tơlơi tơnap tap ƀing gih hmâo tŭ laih, pioh kơ tơlơi đôč đač? — tơdah tui anŭn jing đôč đač sĭt yơh. 
He therefore who ministers to you the Spirit, and works miracles among you, [is it] on the principle of works of law, or of [the] report of faith? @ Pô hmâo pha brơi Yang Bơngăt Hiam kơ ƀing gih laih anŭn ngă lu tơlơi mơsêh mơyang tơ̆ng krah ƀing gih, yua kơ mơ̆ng tơlơi ƀing gih ngă tui tơlơi juăt, ƀôdah yua kơ tơlơi ƀing gih hmư̆ laih anŭn đaŏ?
Even as Abraham believed God, and it was reckoned to him as righteousness. @  Kar hăng Abraham: “đaŏ kơ Ơi Adai, laih anŭn Ơi Adai yap ñu jing tơpă.” 
Know then that they that are on the principle of faith, these are Abraham's sons; @ Tui anŭn, brơi kơ ƀing gih thâo hluh ƀing hmâo tơlơi đaŏ yơh jing ană tơčo Abraham sĭt. 
and the scripture, foreseeing that God would justify the nations on the principle of faith, announced beforehand the glad tidings to Abraham: In thee all the nations shall be blessed. @ Laih anŭn Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp hmâo laĭ laih hlâo kơ tơlơi Ơi Adai či yap tơpă ƀing djuai tuai hăng tơlơi đaŏ, tui anŭn hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp anŭn hmâo pơtô laih kơ Abraham Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam anai, laĭ: “Amăng ih yơh abih bang djuai mơnuih či hmâo tơlơi mơyun hiam.” 
So that they who are on the principle of faith are blessed with believing Abraham. @ Hnŭn yơh, hlơi pô đaŏ ñu hmâo tơlơi mơyun hiam hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Abraham, pô hmâo laih tơlơi đaŏ.
For as many as are on the principle of works of law are under curse. For it is written, Cursed is every one who does not continue in all things which [are] written in the book of the law to do them; @  Yua kơ abih bang hlơi pô kơnang kơ bruă ngă tui tơlơi juăt ñu dŏ gah yŭ tơlơi hơtơ̆m pah yơh; yua kơ hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp hmâo čih laih: “Lăp hơtơ̆m pah yơh kơ hlơi pô ƀu ngă tui abih bang tơlơi hmâo čih laih amăng hơdrôm hră tơlơi juăt.” 
but that by law no one is justified with God [is] evident, because The just shall live on the principle of faith; @ Sĭt klă rơđah biă mă, ƀu hmâo ôh sa čô dưi hmâo tơlơi yap tơpă ƀơi anăp Ơi Adai mơ̆ng tơlơi juăt; yua kơ “Pô tơpă či hơdip hăng tơlơi đaŏ.” 
but the law is not on the principle of faith; but, He that shall have done these things shall live by them. @ Samơ̆ tơlơi juăt ƀu hmâo pơdơ̆ng ƀơi tơlơi đaŏ ôh, yua kơ “Hlơi pô ngă tui tơlơi juăt či hơdip yua kơ tơlơi juăt.”
Christ has redeemed us out of the curse of the law, having become a curse for us, (for it is written, Cursed [is] every one hanged upon a tree,) @  Krist hmâo song mă laih ƀing ta mơ̆ng tơlơi hơtơ̆m pah tơbiă rai mơ̆ng tơlơi juăt, yua kơ Ñu hmâo jing laih pô arăng hơtơ̆m pah yua kơ ƀing ta — yua kơ boh pơhiăp Ơi Adai hmâo či laih: “Hơtơ̆m pah hĭ kơ Pô arăng yol ƀơi kơyâo” — 
that the blessing of Abraham might come to the nations in Christ Jesus, that we might receive the promise of the Spirit through faith. @ kiăng kơ tơlơi mơyun hiam Ơi Adai hmâo ƀuăn laih kơ Abraham dưi truh kơ ƀing djuai tuai amăng Krist Yêsu, tui anŭn mơ̆ng tơlơi đaŏ ƀing ta dưi mă tŭ Yang Bơngăt Hiam jing tơlơi Ơi Adai hmâo ƀuăn laih.
Brethren, (I speak according to man,) even man's confirmed covenant no one sets aside, or adds other dispositions to. @ Ơ ƀing adơi ayŏng, kâo pơhiăp kar hăng arăng juăt pơhiăp tui anai: Tơ dua čô mơnuih hmâo pơjing laih kơnol pơgop, ƀu hmâo hlơi dưi lơ̆m lui ôh, ƀôdah thim dơ̆ng. 
But to Abraham were the promises addressed, and to his seed: he does not say, And to seeds, as of many; but as of one, And to thy seed; which is Christ. @ Kơ khul tơlơi ƀuăn Ơi Adai hmâo brơi laih kơ Abraham laih anŭn kơ ană tơčo ñu. Hră Ơi Adai pơhiăp ƀu laĭ ôh: “Kơ ƀing ană tơčo”, kar hăng laĭ djơ̆ kơ lu mơnuih, samơ̆ laĭ “kơ ană tơčo ih”, kar hăng laĭ djơ̆ kơ sa čô mơnuih, Pô anŭn jing Yang Krist. 
Now I say this, A covenant confirmed beforehand by God, the law, which took place four hundred and thirty years after, does not annul, so as to make the promise of no effect. @ Tơlơi kâo kiăng laĭ tui anai: Tơlơi juăt, jing tơlơi truh tơdơi kơ kơnol pơgop pă rơtuh klâo pluh thŭn, ƀu dưi lui hĭ ôh tơlơi akă kơnol Ơi Adai hmâo pơjing laih mơ̆ng hlâo, kŏn dưi ngă brơi tơlơi ƀuăn jing hĭ đôč đač mơ̆n. 
For if the inheritance [be] on the principle of law, [it is] no longer on the principle of promise; but God gave it in grace to Abraham by promise. @ Yua kơ tơdah mơ̆ng tơlơi juăt dưi mă tŭ kong ngăn, ñu ƀu djơ̆ yua kơ mơ̆ng tơlơi ƀuăn dơ̆ng ôh. Samơ̆ Ơi Adai hmâo yua tơlơi ƀuăn kiăng pha brơi tơlơi pap kơ Abraham.
Why then the law? It was added for the sake of transgressions, until the seed came to whom the promise was made, ordained through angels in [the] hand of a mediator. @ Tui anŭn tơlơi juăt pioh ngă hơgĕt? Tơlơi kơñăm kơ tơlơi juăt anŭn jing kiăng bơrơđah brơi tơlơi soh arăng ngă, tơl hrơi ană tơčo anŭn truh, kơ Pô anŭn yơh hmâo tơlơi ƀuăn brơi laih. Ơi Adai hmâo yua ƀing ling jang ba tơlơi juăt găn sa čô pô dŏ kơplah. 
But a mediator is not of one, but God is one. @ Pô dŏ kơplah ƀu jing pô pơala brơi kơ sa gah ôh, samơ̆ Ơi Adai hmâo kơnơ̆ng hasa đôč.
[Is] then the law against the promises of God? Far be the thought. For if a law had been given able to quicken, then indeed righteousness were on the principle of law; @ Tui anŭn tơlơi juăt pơkơdơ̆ng hăng khul tơlơi Ơi Adai ƀuăn mơ̆? Ư ưh, ƀu hmâo ôh! Yua kơ tơdah tơlơi juăt hmâo pha brơi laih dưi brơi tơlơi hơdip, tui anŭn tơlơi tơpă či rai mơ̆ng tơlơi juăt. 
but the scripture has shut up all things under sin, that the promise, on the principle of faith of Jesus Christ, should be given to those that believe. @ Samơ̆ Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp hmâo laĭ abih bang tơlơi leng kơ dŏ krư̆ gah yŭ tơlơi dưi kơ tơlơi soh, kiăng kơ mơ̆ng tơlơi đaŏ kơ Yêsu Krist, Ơi Adai pha brơi tơlơi ƀuăn kơ ƀing đaŏ.
But before faith came, we were guarded under law, shut up to faith [which was] about to be revealed. @ Hlâo kơ tơlơi đaŏ truh, ƀing ta dŏ gah yŭ tơlơi juăt krư̆ laih anŭn wai lăng, tơl truh hrơi tơlơi đaŏ hmâo bơrơđah rai. 
So that the law has been our tutor up to Christ, that we might be justified on the principle of faith. @ Tui anŭn tơlơi juăt jing kar hăng pô pơtô wai lăng atăt ba ƀing ta tơl Krist truh, kiăng ƀing ta dưi hmâo tơlơi yap tơpă mơ̆ng tơlơi đaŏ. 
But, faith having come, we are no longer under a tutor; @ Samơ̆ tơ tơlơi đaŏ truh laih, ƀing ta ƀu dŏ gah yŭ kơ pô pơtô wai lăng anŭn dơ̆ng tah.
for ye are all God's sons by faith in Christ Jesus. @ Yua kơ mơ̆ng tơlơi đaŏ kơ Krist Yêsu, abih bang ƀing gih leng kơ jing hĭ ană Ơi Adai. 
For ye, as many as have been baptised unto Christ, have put on Christ. @ Kar hăng lu mơnuih amăng ƀing gih hmâo tŭ laih ƀatem amăng Krist, leng kơ buh mă Yang Krist laih. 
There is no Jew nor Greek; there is no bondman nor freeman; there is no male and female; for ye are all one in Christ Jesus: @ Ƀu hmâo tơlơi yap phara dơ̆ng ôh ƀing Yuđa hăng ƀing Grek, ƀing hlŭn hăng ƀing rơngai, ƀing đah rơkơi hăng ƀing đah kơmơi; yua kơ abih bang ƀing gih leng kơ jing laih sa amăng Krist Yêsu. 
but if *ye* [are] of Christ, then ye are Abraham's seed, heirs according to promise. @ Laih anŭn tơdah ƀing gih lơ̆m kơ Krist, ƀing gih jing ƀing ană tơčo Abraham, jing ƀing mă tŭ kong ngăn tui hăng tơlơi ƀuăn.
Now I say, As long as the heir is a child, he differs nothing from a bondman, though he be lord of all; @ Kâo kiăng laĭ, pô tŭ mă kong ngăn, tơdang ñu dŏ čơđai ƀu hmâo tơlơi phara ôh hăng sa čô hlŭn, wơ̆t dah ñu jing khua kơ abih bang kong ngăn. 
but he is under guardians and stewards until the period fixed by the father. @ Samơ̆ ñu khŏm dŏ gah yŭ tơlơi dưi ƀing rong ba laih anŭn ƀing wai lăng dram gơnam ñu tơl truh hrơi ama ñu hmâo pơkơčah laih. 
So we also, when we were children, were held in bondage under the principles of the world; @ Ƀing ta ăt kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n; tơdang ƀing ta ăt dŏ čơđai, ƀing ta jing hlŭn kơ ƀing yang đêl mơda wai lăng lŏn tơnah. 
but when the fulness of the time was come, God sent forth his Son, come of woman, come under law, @ Samơ̆ tơ rơnŭk pơkơčah truh laih, Ơi Adai pơkiaŏ rai ană Ñu, tơkeng rai mơ̆ng sa čô đah kơmơi, tơkeng gah yŭ tơlơi juăt, 
that he might redeem those under law, that we might receive sonship. @ kiăng kơ song mă ƀing dŏ gah yŭ tơlơi juăt, yua kơ anŭn ƀing ta dưi mă tŭ tơlơi dưi jing ană rong ba.
But because ye are sons, God has sent out the Spirit of his Son into our hearts, crying, Abba, Father. @ Yua kơ ƀing gih jing ană, hnŭn yơh Ơi Adai hmâo pơkiaŏ rai laih Yang Bơngăt Hiam Ană Ñu dŏ amăng pran jua ƀing ta, iâu đĭ “Aba, Ama!” 
So thou art no longer bondman, but son; but if son, heir also through God. @ Tui anŭn, mơ̆ng tơlơi pap Ơi Adai, ƀing gih ƀu jing hlŭn dơ̆ng ôh, samơ̆ jing ană; laih anŭn tơdah jing ană, jing pô mă tŭ kong ngăn mơ̆n.
But then indeed, not knowing God, ye were in bondage to those who by nature are not gods; @ Hlâo adih hlăk ƀing gih aka thâo krăn Ơi Adai ôh, ƀing gih jing laih hlŭn kơ ƀing yang ƀu hmâo sĭt ôh. 
but now, knowing God, but rather being known by God, how do ye turn again to the weak and beggarly principles to which ye desire to be again anew in bondage? @ Samơ̆ ră anai ƀing gih thâo krăn Ơi Adai laih, biă mă Ơi Adai thâo krăn laih ƀing gih, tui anŭn hyư̆m ƀing gih kiăng wơ̆t glaĭ yang rơbang tơdu ƀu ai, ƀun rin anŭn? Ƀing gih kiăng jing hlŭn kơ ƀing gơñu dơ̆ng hă? 
Ye observe days and months and times and years. @ Ƀing gih ăt dŏ kơ̆m kơ hrơi, blan, bơyan, laih anŭn thŭn. 
I am afraid of you, lest indeed I have laboured in vain as to you. @ Kâo hwĭ kơ bruă kâo hmâo ngă brơi laih kơ ƀing gih jing hĭ đôč đač.
Be as *I* [am], for *I* also [am] as *ye*, brethren, I beseech you: ye have not at all wronged me. @ Ơ ƀing adơi ayŏng, kâo kơwưh kơ ƀing gih, brơi ƀing gih jing bĕ kar hăng kâo, yua kơ kâo ăt jing kar hăng ƀing gih mơ̆n. Ƀing gih ƀu ngă sat kơ kâo ôh. 
But ye know that in weakness of the flesh I announced the glad tidings to you at the first; @ Ƀing gih thâo laih tal blŭng hlâo kâo nao pơtô Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam kơ ƀing gih hăng sa drơi jan hmâo tơlơi ruă nuă. 
and my temptation, which [was] in my flesh, ye did not slight nor reject with contempt; but ye received me as an angel of God, as Christ Jesus. @ Wơ̆t dah tơlơi ruă nuă drơi jan kâo jing hĭ sa tơlơi lông lăng kơ ƀing gih, ƀing gih ƀu mưč ƀôdah bơrơmŭt kơ kâo ôh, samơ̆ ƀing gih hmâo tŭ jum kâo laih kar hăng sa čô ling jang Ơi Adai, kar hăng Yêsu Krist pô. 
What then [was] your blessedness? for I bear you witness that, if possible, plucking out your own eyes ye would have given [them] to me. @ Tui anŭn, tơlơi mơyun hiam ƀing gih anŭn ră anai pơpă lĕ? Yua kơ kâo dưi ngă gơ̆ng jơlan kơ ƀing gih tui anai: Hlăk anŭn tơdah dưi, ƀing gih kiăng blač mơta ƀing gih pô brơi kâo. 
So I have become your enemy in speaking the truth to you? @ Tui anŭn, kâo jing hĭ ayăt kơ ƀing gih yua kơ kâo pơhiăp tơlơi sĭt hăng ƀing gih hă?
They are not rightly zealous after you, but desire to shut you out [from us], that ye may be zealous after them. @ Ƀing anŭn hmâo tơlơi hur har hăng ƀing gih ƀu djơ̆ gơñu hmâo pran jua hiam sĭt ôh, samơ̆ ƀing gơñu kiăng pơkah pơpha hĭ ƀing gih hăng ƀing gơmơi, kiăng kơ ƀing gih hur har hăng ƀing gơñu. 
But [it is] right to be zealous at all times in what is right, and not only when I am present with you @ Sĭt hiam biă mă yơh tơdah hur har nanao kơ tơlơi hiam, ƀu djơ̆ kơnơ̆ng hlăk kâo dŏ hrŏm hăng ƀing gih đôč ôh. 
my children, of whom I again travail in birth until Christ shall have been formed in you: @ Ơ ƀing ană anĕt kâo hơi, sa wơ̆t dơ̆ng yua kơ ƀing gih kâo tŭ tơlơi ruă tơnap kar hăng tơlơi ruă tơkeng, tơl kơnuih Krist dưi jing hĭ amăng ƀing gih. 
and I should wish to be present with you now, and change my voice, for I am perplexed as to you. @ Kâo kiăng biă mă dưi dŏ hrŏm hăng ƀing gih ră anai laih anŭn ruah boh pơhiăp geh gal pơhiăp hăng ƀing gih, yua kơ kâo hyơ̆k bơngơ̆t biă mă kơ ƀing gih.
Tell me, ye who are desirous of being under law, do ye not listen to the law? @ Laĭ brơi kâo bĕ, Ơ ƀing kiăng dŏ gah yŭ tơlơi juăt, ƀing gih ƀu hmư̆ ôh hă tơlơi juăt laĭ? 
For it is written that Abraham had two sons; one of the maid servant, and one of the free woman. @ Yua kơ hmâo čih laih: Abraham hmâo dua čô ană đah rơkơi, sa čô mơ̆ng đah kơmơi hlŭn, sa čô mơ̆ng đah kơmơi rơngai. 
But he [that was] of the maid servant was born according to flesh, and he [that was] of the free woman through the promise. @ Samơ̆ ană đah kơmơi hlŭn tơkeng tui hăng asar đeh, ană đah kơmơi rơngai tơkeng tui hăng tơlơi ƀuăn. 
Which things have an allegorical sense; for these are two covenants: one from mount Sinai, gendering to bondage, which is Hagar. @ Tơlơi anŭn jing kar hăng: dua čô đah kơmơi anŭn jing dua kơnol ƀuăn. Sa jing kơnol pơgop tơbiă mơ̆ng čư̆ Sinai, tơkeng kơ ƀing ană jing hlŭn. Ñu anŭn HʼAga. 
For Hagar is mount Sinai in Arabia, and corresponds to Jerusalem which [is] now, for she is in bondage with her children; @ HʼAga jing čư̆ Sinai amăng čar Arabi, kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n ñu bơkơnar hăng plei Yêrusalem ră anai, yua kơ ñu hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ană bă ñu leng kơ jing hlŭn. 
but the Jerusalem above is free, which is our mother. @ Samơ̆ Plei Yêrusalem hăng adai jing plei rơngai, ñu jing amĭ ƀing ta. 
For it is written, Rejoice, thou barren that bearest not; break out and cry, thou that travailest not; because the children of the desolate are more numerous than [those] of her that has a husband. @ Yua kơ Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp čih:
“Hơ̆k mơak bĕ, Ơ đah kơmơi plao ƀu tơkeng djơ̆ ôh;
Ur dreo bĕ, Ơ pô ƀu hmâo ruă tơkeng djơ̆ ôh;
Yua kơ đah kơmơi arăng hơngah hĭ laih hmâo ană bă lu hloh kơ ƀing đah kơmơi hmâo rơkơi.”
But *ye*, brethren, after the pattern of Isaac, are children of promise. @ Ơ ƀing adơi ayŏng, ƀing gih jing kar hăng Isak, jing ƀing ană mơ̆ng tơlơi ƀuăn. 
But as then he that was born according to flesh persecuted him [that was born] according to Spirit, so also [it is] now. @ Samơ̆ kar hăng rơnŭk anŭn, ană tơkeng tui hăng asar đeh ngă sat kơ ană tơkeng tui hăng Yang Bơngăt Hiam, ră anai ăt kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n. 
But what says the scripture? Cast out the maid servant and her son; for the son of the maid servant shall not inherit with the son of the free woman. @ Samơ̆ hơgĕt Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp laĭ? “Puh pơđuaĭ bĕ đah kơmơi hlŭn hăng ană đah rơkơi ñu; yua kơ ană đah rơkơi đah kơmơi hlŭn ƀu dưi mă tŭ kong ngăn hrŏm hăng ană đah rơkơi đah kơmơi rơngai ôh.” 
So then, brethren, we are not maid servant's children, but [children] of the free woman. @ Tui anŭn, Ơ ƀing adơi ayŏng, ƀing ta ƀu jing ană mơ̆ng đah kơmơi hlŭn ôh, samơ̆ ƀing ană mơ̆ng đah kơmơi rơngai.
Christ has set us free in freedom; stand fast therefore, and be not held again in a yoke of bondage. @ Yang Krist hmâo pơrơngai laih ƀing ta, kiăng kơ ƀing ta dưi rơngai. Tui anŭn dŏ kơjăp bĕ, anăm dưm ƀing gih pô gah yŭ ač kơ tơlơi hlŭn dơ̆ng ôh.
Behold, I, Paul, say to you, that if ye are circumcised, Christ shall profit you nothing. @ Kâo, Pôl, laĭ hăng ƀing gih, tơdah ƀing gih khŏm tŭ tơlơi khăt klĭ, Yang Krist ƀu tŭ yua kơ ƀing gih ôh. 
And I witness again to every man [who is] circumcised, that he is debtor to do the whole law. @ Kâo pơhaih pơklă hăng abih bang hlơi pô tŭ khăt klĭ, ñu khŏm tui gưt abih bang tơlơi juăt.
