Ye are deprived of all profit from the Christ as separated [from him], as many as are justified by law; ye have fallen from grace. @ Tơdah ƀing gih kiăng hmâo tơlơi dưi yap tơpă mơ̆ng tơlơi juăt, ƀing gih čơlah laih mơ̆ng Yang Krist, ƀing gih pơrơngiă hĭ tơlơi pap laih. 
For we, by [the] Spirit, on the principle of faith, await the hope of righteousness. @ Mơ̆ng tơlơi đaŏ laih anŭn yua mơ̆ng Yang Bơngăt Hiam, ƀing ta čang tơguan tơlơi čang rơmang kơ tơlơi yap tơpă. 
For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision has any force, nor uncircumcision; but faith working through love. @ Yua kơ amăng Krist Yêsu, tơlơi khăt klĭ ƀôdah ƀu khăt klĭ ƀu hmâo nua yom ôh, samơ̆ tơlơi đaŏ pơrơđah amăng tơlơi khăp hmâo nua yom.
Ye ran well; who has stopped you that ye should not obey the truth? @ Ƀing gih hlăk đuaĭ hiam kar hăng anŭn, hlơi pô hmâo khă ƀing gih tui gưt tơlơi sĭt? 
The persuasibleness [is] not of him that calls you. @ Tơlơi pơtrŭt anŭn ƀu djơ̆ tơbiă rai mơ̆ng Pô iâu ƀing gih ôh. 
A little leaven leavens the whole lump. @ “Đơsĕt tơpơi đôč dưi ngă pơbô̆ đĭ sa bôr tơpŭng.” 
*I* have confidence as to you in [the] Lord, that ye will have no other mind; and he that is troubling you shall bear the guilt [of it], whosoever he may be. @ Amăng Khua Yang kâo đaŏ sĭt kơ ƀing gih ƀu či hmâo tơlơi pơmĭn phara hăng tơlơi pơmĭn kâo ôh; samơ̆ hlơi pô pơrŭng ƀing gih ñu khŏm tŭ tơlơi pơkơhmal.
But *I*, brethren, if I yet preach circumcision, why am I yet persecuted? Then the scandal of the cross has been done away. @ Ơ ƀing adơi ayŏng, tơdah kâo ăt pơtô tơlơi khăt klĭ, yua hơgĕt arăng ăt dŏ ngă sat kơ kâo? Tơdah djơ̆ tui anŭn, tơlơi kâo pơtô kơ kơyâo bơrơkal ƀu hmâo tơlơi pơgŭn dơ̆ng ôh. 
I would that they would even cut themselves off who throw you into confusion. @ Kâo kiăng ƀing pơrŭng kơ ƀing gih hiam hloh kriao hĭ gơñu pô bĕ!
For *ye* have been called to liberty, brethren; only [do] not [turn] liberty into an opportunity to the flesh, but by love serve one another. @ Ơ ƀing adơi ayŏng, Ơi Adai iâu laih ƀing gih kơ tơlơi mă tŭ tơlơi rơngai; samơ̆ anăm yua ôh tơlơi rơngai anŭn kar hăng sa mông gal kiăng hơdip brơi kơ asar đeh, samơ̆ brơi ƀing gih thâo gŭm djru bĕ kơ tơdruă hăng pran jua khăp. 
For the whole law is fulfilled in one word, in Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself; @ Yua kơ abih bang tơlơi juăt hmâo klah čŭn amăng sa tơlơi anai: “Khăp bĕ kơ mơnuih jum dar ih kar hăng ih khăp kơ ih pô.” 
but if ye bite and devour one another, see that ye are not consumed one of another. @ Samơ̆ tơdah ƀing gih pơkĕ lun tơdruă ƀing gih, răng bĕ hwĭ dah ƀing gih pơrai hĭ tơdruă ƀing gih.
But I say, Walk in [the] Spirit, and ye shall no way fulfil flesh's lust. @ Kâo laĭ, hơdip tui hăng Yang Bơngăt Hiam bĕ, laih anŭn anăm ƀing gih ngă pơhrăp kơ khul tơlơi asar đeh kiăng ôh. 
For the flesh lusts against the Spirit, and the Spirit against the flesh: and these things are opposed one to the other, that ye should not do those things which ye desire; @ Yua kơ tơlơi asar kiăng phara hăng tơlơi Yang Bơngăt Hiam kiăng, laih anŭn tơlơi Yang Bơngăt Hiam kiăng phara hăng tơlơi asar đeh kiăng. Yua kơ dua gah pơkơdơ̆ng nao rai kar hăng anŭn, hnŭn yơh ƀing gih ƀu dưi ngă tui tơlơi ƀing gih kiăng ôh. 
but if ye are led by the Spirit, ye are not under law. @ Samơ̆ tơdah Yang Bơngăt Hiam dui ba ƀing gih, ƀing gih ƀu dŏ gah yŭ tơlơi juăt ôh.
Now the works of the flesh are manifest, which are fornication, uncleanness, licentiousness, @ Bruă asar đeh jing klă rơđah biă mă, anŭn jing: Tơlơi rih răm, tơlơi hơƀak drak, tơlơi hrah hrong, 
idolatry, sorcery, hatred, strifes, jealousies, angers, contentions, disputes, schools of opinion, @ tơlơi kơkuh kơ rup trah, tơlơi ngă pơjâu, tơlơi ayăt roh, tơlơi pơrơdjơ̆ pơrơsao, tơlơi nač moañ, tơlơi hil kreñ, tơlơi et klih, tơlơi ƀu tŭ tơdruă, tơlơi pơkah pơpha phung, 
envyings, murders, drunkennesses, revels, and things like these; as to which I tell you beforehand, even as I also have said before, that they who do such things shall not inherit God's kingdom. @ tơlơi gar moañ, tơlơi măt tơpai, tơlơi ră ƀơ̆ng mơñum, laih anŭn abih bang tơlơi pơkŏn kar hăng anŭn. Kâo ƀuah pơthâo ƀing gih brơi răng kar hăng kâo hmâo ƀuah pơthâo hlâo laih, ƀing hlơi ngă khul bruă kar hăng anŭn ƀu dưi mă tŭ dêh čar pơtao Ơi Adai ôh.
But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, long-suffering, kindness, goodness, fidelity, @ Samơ̆ boh mơ̆ng Yang Bơngăt Hiam jing: Tơlơi khăp, tơlơi hơ̆k mơak, tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua, tơlơi gir run, tơlơi klă djrưng, tơlơi hiam klă, tơlơi tŏng ten, tơlơi tơdu rơun, tơlơi djơ̆ hơnơ̆ng. 
meekness, self-control: against such things there is no law. @ Ƀu hmâo ôh tơlơi juăt khă khul tơlơi kar hăng anŭn. 
But they that [are] of the Christ have crucified the flesh with the passions and the lusts. @ Ƀing hlơi lơ̆m kơ Krist Yêsu, hmâo pơ̆ng hĭ laih asar đeh ñu hrŏm hơbĭt hăng tơlơi amoaih kiăng laih anŭn tơlơi hưp ham ñu ƀơi kơyâo bơrơkal. 
If we live by the Spirit, let us walk also by the Spirit. @ Tơdah ƀing ta kơnang kơ Yang Bơngăt Hiam kiăng kơ hơdip, brơi ƀing ta ăt rơbat tui hăng Yang Bơngăt Hiam mơ̆n. 
Let us not become vain-glorious, provoking one another, envying one another. @ Anăm ƀing ta hơduah tơlơi hing ang amuñ rơngiă, pơčôih laih anŭn pơhil bơnač tơdruă ôh.
Brethren, if even a man be taken in some fault, ye who are spiritual restore such a one in a spirit of meekness, considering thyself lest *thou* also be tempted. @ Ơ ƀing adơi ayŏng, tơdah ƀing gih ƀuh sa čô lĕ amăng tơlơi soh, ƀing gih jing mơnuih hmâo Yang Bơngăt Hiam, brơi ƀing gih pơkra glaĭ ñu hăng tơlơi tơdu rơun. Ƀing gih khŏm răng, hwĭ dah hmâo tơlơi plư truh kơ ƀing gih pô. 
Bear one another's burdens, and thus fulfil the law of the Christ. @ Djru gui tơlơi kơtraŏ kơ tơdruă ƀing gih bĕ, tui anŭn ƀing gih či ngă tum klă tơlơi juăt Krist. 
For if any man reputes himself to be something, being nothing, he deceives himself; @ Yua kơ tơdah hlơi pô pơmĭn ñu jing mơnuih yom, biă mă ñu ƀu jing tui anŭn ôh, tui anŭn ñu ƀlor mă ñu pô đôč. 
but let each prove his own work, and then he will have his boast in what belongs to himself alone, and not in what belongs to another. @ Brơi rĭm čô khŏm kơsem lăng bruă ñu pô, tui anŭn ñu či ƀuh tơlơi klih yua kiăng pơ-ư ñu pô jing mơ̆ng ñu pô, ƀu djơ̆ mơ̆ng ƀing pơkŏn ôh. 
For each shall bear his own burden. @ Yua kơ rĭm čô khŏm gui tơlơi kơtraŏ ñu pô.
Let him that is taught in the word communicate to him that teaches in all good things. @ Ƀing hlơi mă tŭ tơlơi arăng pơtô ñu, ñu khŏm pơpha brơi abih bang mơnơ̆ng hiam klă kơ pô pơtô ñu.
Be not deceived: God is not mocked; for whatever a man shall sow, that also shall he reap. @ Anăm ƀlor mă ƀing gih pô ôh; Ơi Adai ƀu tŭ tơlơi arăng ƀrưh mưč ôh. Yua kơ hơgĕt pơjeh arăng sai, ñu či hơpuă pơjeh anŭn mơ̆n. 
For he that sows to his own flesh, shall reap corruption from the flesh; but he that sows to the Spirit, from the Spirit shall reap eternal life: @ Yua kơ hlơi pô sai gah kơ asar đeh, mơ̆ng asar đeh ñu či hơpuă tơlơi răm rơngiă; samơ̆ hlơi pô sai gah kơ Yang Bơngăt Hiam, mơ̆ng Yang Bơngăt Hiam ñu či hơpuă tơlơi hơdip hlŏng lar. 
but let us not lose heart in doing good; for in due time, if we do not faint, we shall reap. @ Anăm ƀing ta tơdu rơmơ̆n ôh amăng tơlơi ngă bruă hiam, yua kơ tơdah ƀing ta ƀu hơtah hơtai ôh, tơ truh bơyan ƀing ta či hơpuă yơh. 
So then, as we have occasion, let us do good towards all, and specially towards those of the household of faith. @ Tui anŭn, tơdang hmâo mông hrơi gal, brơi ƀing ta ngă bĕ bruă hiam kơ abih bang mơnuih, biă mă ñu kơ ƀing adơi ayŏng amăng sang anŏ tơlơi đaŏ.
See how long a letter I have written to you with my own hand. @ Lăng bĕ, khul ară boh hră prŏng tơngan kâo pô čih kơ ƀing gih.
As many as desire to have a fair appearance in [the] flesh, these compel you to be circumcised, only that they may not be persecuted because of the cross of Christ. @ Ƀing hlơi kiăng pơrơđah bruă hiam amăng asar đeh kiăng pơgŏ ƀing gih tŭ tơlơi khăt klĭ. Ƀing gơñu ngă tui anŭn kơnơ̆ng kiăng kơ arăng ƀu ngă sat kơ ƀing gơñu yua kơ kơyâo bơrơkal Krist đôč. 
For neither do they that are circumcised themselves keep the law; but they wish you to be circumcised, that they may boast in your flesh. @ Yua kơ wơ̆t ƀing hmâo tŭ tơlơi khăt klĭ anŭn, ăt ƀu tui gưt tơlơi juăt mơ̆n, samơ̆ gơñu kiăng kơ ƀing gih tŭ tơlơi khăt klĭ kiăng kơ ƀing gơñu dưi pơ-ư kơ gơñu pô amăng asar đeh yua kơ ƀing gih đôč. 
But far be it from me to boast save in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ, through whom [the] world is crucified to me, and I to the world. @ Bơ kơ kâo, kâo ƀu pơ-ư pơang kơ sa mơta tơlơi hơgĕt ôh gah rơngiao kơ kơyâo bơrơkal Khua Yang ƀing ta Yêsu Krist. Yua kơ mơ̆ng kơyâo bơrơkal anŭn, gah lŏn tơnah arăng pơ̆ng laih kâo ƀơi kơyâo bơrơkal, laih anŭn kâo hăng lŏn tơnah ăt kar kaĭ mơ̆n. 
For [in Christ Jesus] neither is circumcision anything, nor uncircumcision; but new creation. @ Yua kơ tơlơi yom ƀu djơ̆ ôh jing tơlơi khăt klĭ, ƀôdah ƀu khăt klĭ, samơ̆ tơlơi yom jing mơnuih hrih kơphrâo. 
And as many as shall walk by this rule, peace upon them and mercy, and upon the Israel of God. @ Rơkâo tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua laih anŭn tơlơi pap drap dŏ hrŏm hăng abih bang ƀing hlơi rơbat tui jơlan gal djơ̆ anai, laih anŭn wơ̆t kơ ƀing Israel kơ Ơi Adai mơ̆n.
For the rest let no one trouble me, for *I* bear in my body the brands of the Lord Jesus. @ Mơ̆ng anai pơ anăp, anăm hlơi ngă pơrŭng kâo dơ̆ng ôh; yua kơ kâo djă khul gru rơka Yêsu amăng drơi jan kâo.
The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ [be] with your spirit, brethren. Amen. @ Ơ ƀing adơi ayŏng, rơkâo tơlơi pap Khua Yang ƀing ta jing Khua Yang Yêsu Krist dŏ hrŏm hăng bơngăt jua ƀing gih! Amen.
Paul, apostle of Jesus Christ by God's will, to the saints and faithful in Christ Jesus who are at Ephesus. @  Pôl, dưi jing sa čô khua ding kơna kơ Yêsu Krist tui hăng tơlơi Ơi Adai kiăng, čih mơit kơ ƀing rơgoh hiam pơ Êphêsô, jing ƀing mơnuih tŏng ten amăng Krist Yêsu.
Grace to you and peace from God our Father, and [the] Lord Jesus Christ. @ Rơkâo kơ Ơi Adai, Ama ƀing ta laih anŭn Khua Yang Yêsu Krist pha brơi kơ ƀing gih tơlơi pap laih anŭn tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua.
Blessed [be] the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who has blessed us with every spiritual blessing in the heavenlies in Christ; @ Hơơč bơni kơ Ơi Adai, Ama Khua Yang ƀing ta Yêsu Krist, Ñu pô hmâo pha brơi laih kơ ƀing ta djŏp mơta tơlơi mơyun hiam mơyang hăng adai adih yua mơ̆ng ƀing ta pơgop hăng Krist. 
according as he has chosen us in him before [the] world's foundation, that we should be holy and blameless before him in love; @ Ñu hmâo ruah laih ƀing ta amăng Yang Krist hlâo kơ tơlơi hrih pơjing lŏn tơnah, kiăng kơ ƀing ta dưi jing rơgoh hiam laih anŭn ƀu hmâo tơlơi arăng dưi ƀuah ôh ƀơi anăp Ñu. 
having marked us out beforehand for adoption through Jesus Christ to himself, according to the good pleasure of his will, @ Yua kơ mơ̆ng tơlơi Ñu khăp, Ñu hmâo pơkă pioh laih kơ ƀing ta dưi jing ƀing ană Ñu amăng Yêsu Krist, tui hăng tơlơi kơñăm hiam kơ tơlơi Ñu kiăng, 
to [the] praise of [the] glory of his grace, wherein he has taken us into favour in the Beloved: @ kiăng kơ ƀing ta pơ-ư bơni kơ tơlơi pap guh kơang Ñu hmâo pha brơi đôč kơ ƀing ta amăng Ană Ñu khăp hơeng biă mă.
in whom we have redemption through his blood, the forgiveness of offences, according to the riches of his grace; @  Amăng Yang Krist, ƀing ta dưi hmâo tơlơi song mă hăng drah Ñu, tơlơi pap brơi kơ tơlơi soh ƀing ta, tui hăng tơlơi pơdrŏng kơ tơlơi Ñu pap, 
which he has caused to abound towards us in all wisdom and intelligence, @ jing tơlơi pap Ñu hmâo pha brơi rơbeh blai kơ ƀing ta. Hăng abih bang tơlơi kơhnâo laih anŭn tơlơi thâo hluh, 
having made known to us the mystery of his will, according to his good pleasure which he purposed in himself @ Ơi Adai ngă brơi kơ ƀing ta dưi thâo hluh tơlơi yom hơgơ̆m kơ tơlơi Ñu kiăng, tui hăng tơlơi kơñăm hiam klă Ñu hmâo pơkă pioh laih amăng Yang Krist, 
for [the] administration of the fulness of times; to head up all things in the Christ, the things in the heavens and the things upon the earth; in him, @ kiăng kơ truh amăng rơnŭk Ñu hmâo pơkơčah laih, pơƀŭt glaĭ abih bang mơnơ̆ng amăng Yang Krist, wơ̆t mơnơ̆ng amăng adai laih anŭn mơnơ̆ng amăng lŏn tơnah.
in whom we have also obtained an inheritance, being marked out beforehand according to the purpose of him who works all things according to the counsel of his own will, @ Amăng Krist, ƀing ta ăt dưi jing ƀing mơnuih mă tŭ kong ngăn tui hăng tơlơi Ñu hmâo pơkă pioh laih mơ̆ng Pô ngă abih bang mơnơ̆ng tui hơdră jơlan Ơi Adai, Pô hmâo pơgiơ̆ng abih bang mơnơ̆ng tui hăng tơlơi kơñăm Ñu kiăng, 
that we should be to [the] praise of his glory who have pre-trusted in the Christ: @ kiăng kơ ƀing ta, jing ƀing mơnuih blŭng hlâo hmâo pơdơ̆ng laih tơlơi čang rơmang amăng Yang Krist, pơ-ư bơni kơ tơlơi guh kơang Ñu.
in whom *ye* also [have trusted], having heard the word of the truth, the glad tidings of your salvation; in whom also, having believed, ye have been sealed with the Holy Spirit of promise, @ Amăng Krist, ƀing gih jing ƀing mơnuih hmâo hmư̆ laih boh pơhiăp tơlơi sĭt, jing Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam kơ tơlơi pơklaih ƀing gih, hmâo đaŏ laih kơ Ñu, ăt hmâo tơlơi kơđŏm laih hăng Yang Bơngăt Hiam kar hăng hmâo ƀuăn laih, 
who is [the] earnest of our inheritance to the redemption of the acquired possession to [the] praise of his glory. @ Yang Bơngăt Hiam anŭn jing mơnơ̆ng grơ̆ng brơi kơ ƀing ta dưi mă tŭ kong ngăn, tơl ƀing lơ̆m kơ Ñu mă tŭ tơlơi song mă, kiăng kơ pơ-ư bơni kơ tơlơi guh kơang Ñu.
Wherefore *I* also, having heard of the faith in the Lord Jesus which [is] in you, and the love which [ye have] towards all the saints, @ Hnŭn yơh, giơ̆ng kơ kâo hmư̆ kơ tơlơi ƀing gih đaŏ kơ Khua Yang Yêsu Krist, laih anŭn kơ tơlơi ƀing gih khăp kơ abih bang ƀing rơgoh hiam, 
do not cease giving thanks for you, making mention [of you] at my prayers, @ kâo ƀu pơdơi ôh bơni hơơč kơ Ơi Adai yua kơ ƀing gih, rĭm wơ̆t kâo iâu laĭ, nanao kâo hơdơr kơ ƀing gih. 
that the God of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of glory, would give you [the] spirit of wisdom and revelation in the full knowledge of him, @ Kâo rơkâo Ơi Adai kơ Khua Yang ƀing ta Yêsu Krist, Ama tơlơi guh kơang, pha brơi ƀing gih bơngăt mơyang kơ tơlơi kơhnâo laih anŭn tơlơi bơrơđah, kiăng kơ ƀing gih thâo krăn Ñu. 
being enlightened in the eyes of your heart, so that ye should know what is the hope of his calling, [and] what the riches of the glory of his inheritance in the saints, @ Kâo rơkâo Ơi Adai pŏk brơi tơlơi pơmĭn ƀing gih kiăng kơ ƀing gih ƀuh tơlơi bơngač Ñu, hnŭn kah ƀing gih dưi thâo hơgĕt jing tơlơi čang rơmang kơ tơlơi Ñu hmâo iâu laih ƀing gih, hơgĕt jing tơlơi pơdrŏng sah kơ tơlơi mă tŭ kong ngăn guh kơang Ñu amăng ƀing rơgoh hiam, 
and what the surpassing greatness of his power towards us who believe, according to the working of the might of his strength, @ laih anŭn hơgĕt jing tơlơi dưi prŏng prin ƀu dưi pơkă Ñu hlăk dŏ mă bruă amăng ƀing ta jing ƀing đaŏ, tui hăng bruă ngă kơ tơlơi dưi mơyang prŏng prin Ñu. 
[in] which he wrought in the Christ [in] raising him from among [the] dead, and he set him down at his right hand in the heavenlies, @ Ơi Adai hmâo yua laih tơlơi dưi mơyang anŭn mă bruă amăng Krist tơ Ñu pơhơdip glaĭ laih Yang Krist mơ̆ng ƀing djai, laih anŭn brơi Gơ̆ dŏ ber gah hơnuă Ñu amăng khul anih pơ adai, 
above every principality, and authority, and power, and dominion, and every name named, not only in this age, but also in that to come; @ ƀơi glong hloh kơ abih bang ƀing khua wai lăng, ƀing hmâo tơlơi dưi, ƀing hmâo tơlơi dưi kơtang, ƀing khua prŏng, laih anŭn ƀơi hăng glong hloh kơ abih bang anăn arăng dưi pơhaih, ƀu djơ̆ kơnơ̆ng rơnŭk anai đôč ôh, samơ̆ wơ̆t amăng rơnŭk či truh kar kaĭ mơ̆n. 
and has put all things under his feet, and gave him [to be] head over all things to the assembly, @ Ñu hmâo dưm laih abih bang mơnơ̆ng gah yŭ tơkai Yang Krist, laih anŭn brơi Ñu jing akŏ kơ abih bang mơnơ̆ng yua kơ Phung Sang Ơi Adai. 
which is his body, the fulness of him who fills all in all: @ Phung Sang Ơi Adai jing drơi jan Yang Krist, kiăng laĭ tơlơi bă tum Yang Krist, Pô pơbă tum abih bang tơlơi amăng abih bang mơnơ̆ng.
and *you*, being dead in your offences and sins @  Ƀing gih djai laih yua kơ ngă gao tơlơi juăt laih anŭn tơlơi soh, 
in which ye once walked according to the age of this world, according to the ruler of the authority of the air, the spirit who now works in the sons of disobedience: @ amăng tơlơi ƀing gih dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă hlâo dih, tui hluai tơlơi lŏn tơnah juăt ngă, tui hluai khua hmâo tơlơi dưi amăng rơngit, yang anŭn ră anai hlăk dŏ mă bruă amăng ƀing ƀu thâo tui gưt. 
among whom *we* also all once had our conversation in the lusts of our flesh, doing what the flesh and the thoughts willed to do, and were children, by nature, of wrath, even as the rest: @ Hlâo adih abih bang ƀing ta ăt jing kar hăng ƀing anŭn mơ̆n. Ƀing ta hmâo hơdip laih tui hăng tơlơi asar đeh amoaih hưp, hluai tui asar đeh laih anŭn tơlơi pơmĭn ƀing ta kiăng. Tui anŭn tui hăng kơnuih yang đar ƀing ta jing ƀing ană bă dŏ gah yŭ tơlơi Ơi Adai hil, kar hăng abih bang mơnuih pơkŏn mơ̆n.
but God, being rich in mercy, because of his great love wherewith he loved us, @ Samơ̆ Ơi Adai, jing Pô pơdrŏng amăng tơlơi pap drap, hmâo khăp laih kơ ƀing ta hăng tơlơi khăp prŏng prin biă mă, 
(we too being dead in offences,) has quickened us with the Christ, (ye are saved by grace,) @ wơ̆t dah ƀing ta hmâo djai laih amăng tơlơi soh ƀing ta tŭ mơ̆n, Ñu hmâo pơhơdip glaĭ laih ƀing ta hrŏm hăng Yang Krist (yua kơ mơ̆ng tơlơi pap yơh ƀing gih dưi klaih). 
and has raised [us] up together, and has made [us] sit down together in the heavenlies in Christ Jesus, @ Amăng Krist Yêsu, Ñu hmâo pơhơdip glaĭ laih ƀing ta hrŏm hăng Ñu, laih anŭn brơi ƀing ta dŏ ber hrŏm hăng Ñu ƀơi abih bang anih amăng adai, 
that he might display in the coming ages the surpassing riches of his grace in kindness towards us in Christ Jesus. @ kiăng kơ Ñu dưi pơrơđah amăng rơnŭk či truh amăng tơlơi pơdrŏng sah kơ tơlơi Ñu pap, ƀu dưi pơkă ôh amăng tơlơi hiam klă Ñu ngă kơ ƀing ta amăng Krist Yêsu. 
For ye are saved by grace, through faith; and this not of yourselves; it is God's gift: @ Yua mơ̆ng tơlơi pap yơh, ƀing gih klaih laih hăng tơlơi đaŏ. Tơlơi pơklaih anŭn ƀu tơbiă rai mơ̆ng ƀing gih pô ôh, samơ̆ jing tơlơi Ơi Adai pha brơi — 
not on the principle of works, that no one might boast. @ ƀu djơ̆ yua kơ bruă ƀing gih ngă ôh, kiăng kơ ƀu hmâo hlơi dưi pơ-ư kơ ñu pô ôh. 
For we are his workmanship, having been created in Christ Jesus for good works, which God has before prepared that we should walk in them. @ Yua kơ ƀing ta jing bruă Ñu hmâo ngă laih, Ñu hrih pơjing ƀing ta amăng Krist Yêsu pioh kơ ngă khul bruă hiam Ơi Adai hmâo prăp rơmet laih mơ̆ng hlâo, kiăng kơ ƀing ta ngă tui.
Wherefore remember that *ye*, once nations in [the] flesh, who [are] called uncircumcision by that called circumcision in [the] flesh done with the hand; @ Hnŭn yơh hơdơr glaĭ bĕ hlâo dih tui hăng asar đeh ƀing gih jing ƀing djuai tuai, ƀing khăt klĭ tui hăng tơngan mơnuih ngă amăng asar đeh yap kơ ƀing gih ƀing ƀu khăt klĭ ôh. 
that ye were at that time without Christ, aliens from the commonwealth of Israel, and strangers to the covenants of promise, having no hope, and without God in the world: @ Hơdơr glaĭ bĕ hlăk anŭn ƀing gih ƀu hmâo ôh Yang Krist, ƀu hmâo tơlơi dưi jing ƀing djuai Israel ôh, jing ƀing djuai tuai kơ kơnol pơgop kơ tơlơi ƀuăn, ƀu hmâo tơlơi čang rơmang laih anŭn ƀu hmâo Ơi Adai ôh amăng lŏn tơnah anai. 
but now in Christ Jesus *ye* who once were afar off are become nigh by the blood of the Christ. @ Hlâo adih ƀing gih dŏ ataih, samơ̆ ră anai amăng Krist Yêsu ƀing gih dŏ jĕ laih yua kơ drah Yang Krist. 
For *he* is our peace, who has made both one, and has broken down the middle wall of enclosure, @ Yua kơ Ñu jing tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua kơ ƀing ta, Ñu hmâo ngă brơi ƀing Yuđa laih anŭn ƀing djuai tuai jing hĭ sa, laih anŭn pơglưh hĭ pơnăng pơkah pơpha, anŭn jing tơlơi ayăt roh kơ ƀing gơñu, 
having annulled the enmity in his flesh, the law of commandments in ordinances, that he might form the two in himself into one new man, making peace; @ Ñu hmâo lơ̆m hĭ laih tơlơi juăt laih anŭn tơlơi pơtă, tơlơi pơkă gal, kiăng kơ mơ̆ng dua djuai mơnuih anŭn, Ñu dưi hrih pơjing sa phung mơnuih phrâo amăng Ñu pô, tui anŭn tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua dưi jing rai, 
and might reconcile both in one body to God by the cross, having by it slain the enmity; @ mơ̆ng kơyâo bơrơkal, Ñu dưi pơgrăng glaĭ abih dua djuai mơnuih hăng Ơi Adai amăng sa drơi jan; hăng tơlơi anŭn Ñu dưi pơrai hĭ tơlơi ayăt roh tơdruă. 
and, coming, he has preached the glad tidings of peace to you who [were] afar off, and [the glad tidings of] peace to those [who were] nigh. @ Tui anŭn Ñu rai pơtô tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua kơ ƀing gih jing ƀing dŏ ataih, laih anŭn tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua wơ̆t kơ ƀing dŏ jĕ. 
For through him we have both access by one Spirit to the Father. @ Yua kơ amăng Ñu abih dua djuai ƀing ta dưi nao pơ Ama amăng sa Yang Bơngăt Hiam.
So then ye are no longer strangers and foreigners, but ye are fellow-citizens of the saints, and of the household of God, @ Tui anŭn, ƀing gih ƀu jing ƀing mơnuih tuai laih anŭn ƀing đih đơ̆m ôh, samơ̆ ƀing gih jing ƀing ană plei pla hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing rơgoh hiam, laih anŭn jing ƀing mơnuih amăng sang anŏ Ơi Adai; 
being built upon the foundation of the apostles and prophets, Jesus Christ himself being the corner-stone, @ ƀing gih hmâo pơdơ̆ng laih ƀơi atur ƀing khua ding kơna laih anŭn ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo, laih anŭn Yêsu Krist Pô yơh jing boh pơtâo akiăng sang. 
in whom all [the] building fitted together increases to a holy temple in the Lord; @ Amăng Ñu, abih sa boh sang hmâo đom pơklep hrŏm hơbĭt laih anŭn jing hĭ sang kơkuh pơpŭ rơgoh hiam amăng Khua Yang. 
in whom *ye* also are built together for a habitation of God in [the] Spirit. @ Amăng Ñu, ƀing gih ăt dưi pơdơ̆ng đĭ hrŏm hơbĭt amăng sang anŭn, kiăng kơ jing hĭ sa boh anih dŏ kơ Ơi Adai amăng Yang Bơngăt Hiam.
For this reason *I* Paul, prisoner of the Christ Jesus for you nations, @ Kơlih yua tơlơi anŭn, kâo Pôl, jing sa čô mơnă kơ Krist Yêsu yua kơ ƀing gih jing ƀing mơnuih djuai tuai. 
(if indeed ye have heard of the administration of the grace of God which has been given to me towards you, @ Sĭt ƀing gih hmâo hmư̆ laih kơ tơlơi Ơi Adai hmâo jao kơ kâo bruă tơlơi Ñu pap kiăng kơ djru ƀing gih, 
that by revelation the mystery has been made known to me, (according as I have written before briefly, @ Ơi Adai hmâo bơrơđah brơi laih kơ kâo hơdră yom hơgơ̆m Ñu, kar hăng kâo hmâo čih laih ƀiă đơsĕt kơ ƀing gih. 
by which, in reading it, ye can understand my intelligence in the mystery of the Christ,) @ Tơ ƀing gih đŏk tơlơi kâo čih anŭn, ƀing gih dưi thâo tơlơi kâo thâo hluh kơ tơlơi yom hơgơ̆m Yang Krist. 
which in other generations has not been made known to the sons of men, as it has now been revealed to his holy apostles and prophets in [the power of the] Spirit, @ Tơlơi yom hơgơ̆m anŭn aka bơrơđah ôh kơ ƀing ană mơnuih amăng khul rơnŭk hlâo adih, samơ̆ ră anai Ơi Adai hmâo yua Yang Bơngăt Hiam bơrơđah brơi laih kơ ƀing khua ding kơna rơgoh hiam laih anŭn kơ ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo Ñu. 
that [they who are of] the nations should be joint heirs, and a joint body, and joint partakers of [his] promise in Christ Jesus by the glad tidings; @ Tơlơi yom hơgơ̆m anŭn jing: Mơ̆ng Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam, djuai mơnuih tuai dưi jing hĭ ƀing mă tŭ kong ngăn, jing khul črăn amăng sa drơi jan, laih anŭn jing ƀing mă tŭ hrŏm hơbĭt tơlơi ƀuăn amăng Krist Yêsu.
of which I am become minister according to the gift of the grace of God given to me, according to the working of his power. @ Kâo dưi jing sa čô ding kơna kơ Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam yua mơ̆ng tơlơi pap Ơi Adai, anŭn tơlơi Ñu hmâo pha brơi laih kơ kâo mơ̆ng bruă tơlơi dưi mơyang Ñu. 
To me, less than the least of all saints, has this grace been given, to announce among the nations the glad tidings of the unsearchable riches of the Christ, @ Wơ̆t dah kâo jing pô anĕt hloh kơ abih bang amăng ƀing rơgoh hiam, Ñu ăt pha brơi tơlơi pap anŭn kơ kâo mơ̆n, kiăng kơ kâo pơtô kơ ƀing djuai tuai tơlơi pơdrŏng sah Yang Krist ƀu dưi pơkă ôh, 
and to enlighten all [with the knowledge of] what is the administration of the mystery hidden throughout the ages in God, who has created all things, @ laih anŭn ngă brơi abih bang mơnuih thâo hluh hơdră tơlơi yom hơgơ̆m anŭn, hmâo pơdŏp laih amăng lu rơnŭk amăng Ơi Adai, Pô hmâo hrih pơjing abih bang mơnơ̆ng, 
in order that now to the principalities and authorities in the heavenlies might be made known through the assembly the all-various wisdom of God, @ kiăng kơ mơ̆ng Phung Sang Ơi Adai ƀing khua wai lăng laih anŭn ƀing hmâo tơlơi dưi djŏp djang anih amăng adai dưi thâo tơlơi kơhnâo Ơi Adai ƀu dưi pơkă. 
according to [the] purpose of the ages, which he purposed in Christ Jesus our Lord, @ Tui hăng tơlơi kơñăm hlŏng lar Ñu, Ñu hmâo pơgiơ̆ng laih amăng Krist Yêsu Khua Yang ƀing ta. 
in whom we have boldness and access in confidence by the faith of him. @ Amăng Ñu laih anŭn hăng tơlơi đaŏ kơ Ñu, ƀing ta hmâo tơlơi khĭn laih anŭn đaŏ kơnang dưi nao giăm Ơi Adai. 
Wherefore I beseech [you] not to faint through my tribulations for you, which is your glory. @ Tui anŭn kâo kơwưh kơ ƀing gih, anăm ƀing gih hơtah hơtai ôh yua kơ khul tơlơi tơnap tap kâo hlăk dŏ tŭ yua kơ ƀing gih. Tơlơi anŭn jing tơlơi guh kơang kơ ƀing gih.
For this reason I bow my knees to the Father [of our Lord Jesus Christ], @ Yua kơ kơlih anŭn yơh, kâo tŏ tơŭt ƀơi anăp Ama, 
of whom every family in [the] heavens and on earth is named, @ yua mơ̆ng Ñu abih bang djuai mơnuih amăng adai laih anŭn ƀơi lŏn tơnah dưi hmâo anăn. 
in order that he may give you according to the riches of his glory, to be strengthened with power by his Spirit in the inner man; @ Tui hăng tơlơi pơdrŏng sah tơlơi guh kơang Ñu, kâo rơkâo kơ Ñu pha brơi ƀing gih tơlơi dưi kơtang mơ̆ng Yang Bơngăt Hiam, kiăng kơ mơnuih amăng lăm ƀing gih dưi jing kơtang, 
that the Christ may dwell, through faith, in your hearts, being rooted and founded in love, @ kiăng kơ mơ̆ng tơlơi đaŏ Yang Krist dưi dŏ amăng pran jua ƀing gih. Kâo ăt iâu laĭ kiăng kơ ƀing gih čăt akha laih anŭn pơdơ̆ng kơjăp amăng tơlơi khăp, 
in order that ye may be fully able to apprehend with all the saints what [is] the breadth and length and depth and height; @ Tui anŭn kah ƀing gih dưi thâo hluh hrŏm hăng abih bang ƀing rơgoh hiam, boh ƀai, boh ataih, boh glong, laih anŭn boh dlam kơ tơlơi khăp anŭn, 
and to know the love of the Christ which surpasses knowledge; that ye may be filled [even] to all the fulness of God. @ laih anŭn dưi thâo krăn tơlơi khăp Krist Yêsu, jing tơlơi khăp rơgao hloh kơ tơlơi arăng dưi thâo hluh, kiăng kơ ƀing gih dưi bă blai hăng djŏp mơta tơlơi rơbeh blai Ơi Adai.
But to him that is able to do far exceedingly above all which we ask or think, according to the power which works in us, @ Ơi Adai jing Pô mă bruă amăng ƀing ta hăng tơlơi dưi mơyang Ñu, dưi ngă rơgao hloh kơ abih bang tơlơi ƀing ta rơkâo ƀôdah tơlơi ƀing ta pơmĭn, 
to him be glory in the assembly in Christ Jesus unto all generations of the age of ages. Amen). @ kơ Ñu yơh tơlơi guh kơang amăng Phung Sang Ơi Adai laih anŭn amăng Krist Yêsu amăng abih bang rơnŭk, nanao hlŏng lar. Amen.
*I*, the prisoner in [the] Lord, exhort you therefore to walk worthy of the calling wherewith ye have been called, @ Hnŭn yơh, kâo jing sa čô mơnă amăng Khua Yang, pơđur kơ ƀing gih hơdip bĕ năng lăp hăng tơlơi Ơi Adai hmâo iâu laih ƀing gih, 
with all lowliness and meekness, with long-suffering, bearing with one another in love; @ hăng abih tơlơi luă gŭ, tơdu rơun, laih anŭn tơlơi gir tŭ, brơi ƀing gih gir tŭ tơdruă ƀing gih amăng tơlơi khăp, 
using diligence to keep the unity of the Spirit in the uniting bond of peace. @ gir kơtir djă pioh bĕ tơlơi pơgop hasa Yang Bơngăt Hiam brơi, hăng hrĕ tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua. 
[There is] one body and one Spirit, as ye have been also called in one hope of your calling; @ Hmâo kơnơ̆ng sa drơi jan, sa Yang bơngăt Hiam kar hăng Ơi Adai hmâo iâu laih kơ ƀing gih kơ sa tơlơi čang rơmang đôč. 
one Lord, one faith, one baptism; @ Hmâo kơnơ̆ng sa Khua Yang, sa tơlơi đaŏ, sa ƀatem, 
one God and Father of all, who is over all, and through all, and in us all. @ sa Ơi Adai, Ama kơ abih bang, Pô dŏ hăng ngŏ kơ abih bang, tơ̆ng krah abih bang, laih anŭn dŏ amăng abih bang.
But to each one of us has been given grace according to the measure of the gift of the Christ. @ Samơ̆ rĭm čô ƀing ta hmâo mă tŭ laih tơlơi pap tui hăng hơnơ̆ng Yang Krist pha brơi. 
Wherefore he says, Having ascended up on high, he has led captivity captive, and has given gifts to men. @ Yua kơ anŭn yơh Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp hmâo čih laih:
“Tơdang Ñu đĭ hăng ngŏ, Ñu atăt ba lu mơnă,
Laih anŭn Ñu brơi khul tơlơi pha brơi kơ ană mơnuih.”
But that he ascended, what is it but that he also descended into the lower parts of the earth? @ Tơdang Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp laĭ: “Ñu đĭ hăng ngŏ,” hơgĕt tơlơi anŭn kiăng laĭ? Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă jing tơlơi Ñu hmâo trŭn laih mơ̆n amăng khul lŏn gah yŭ? 
He that descended is the same who has also ascended up above all the heavens, that he might fill all things; @ Pô hmâo trŭn laih jing Pô hmâo đĭ laih mơ̆n pơ hăng ngŏ kơ abih bang tal adai, kiăng dưi pơbă blai abih bang tơlơi. 
and *he* has given some apostles, and some prophets, and some evangelists, and some shepherds and teachers, @ Ñu pô yơh hmâo brơi: đơđa jing khua ding kơna, đơđa jing ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo, đơđa jing ƀing hyu pơtô Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam, đơđa jing khua pô pơtô laih anŭn ƀing nai pơhrăm, 
for the perfecting of the saints; with a view to [the] work of [the] ministry, with a view to the edifying of the body of Christ; @ kiăng kơ prăp pơhrôp brơi ƀing rơgoh hiam hmâo tơlơi dưi mă bruă kơ Ơi Adai, laih anŭn pơdơ̆ng đĭ drơi jan Yang Krist rai kơ prŏng, 
until we all arrive at the unity of the faith and of the knowledge of the Son of God, at [the] full-grown man, at [the] measure of the stature of the fulness of the Christ; @ tơl abih bang ƀing ta leng kơ jing hasa amăng tơlơi đaŏ, laih anŭn amăng tơlơi thâo hluh kơ ană Ơi Adai, kiăng kơ dưi jing tha truh, tơl truh rup hơbŏ bă tum klă Yang Krist. 
in order that we may be no longer babes, tossed and carried about by every wind of *that* teaching [which is] in the sleight of men, in unprincipled cunning with a view to systematized error; @ Kiăng kơ ƀing ta ƀu jing ƀing čơđai dơ̆ng ôh, pơhluai tui angĭn pơpuh pơđung yŭ ngŏ, tui hăng tơlơi pơtô phara mơ̆ng ƀing mơnuih pleč ƀlor laih anŭn ƀing kơhnăk plư. 
but, holding the truth in love, we may grow up to him in all things, who is the head, the Christ: @ Samơ̆ tơdang ƀing ta pơhiăp tơlơi sĭt hăng tơlơi khăp, kiăng kơ ƀing ta dưi rai kơ prŏng amăng djŏp mơta anăp nao kơ Pô jing akŏ, jing Yang Krist. 
from whom the whole body, fitted together, and connected by every joint of supply, according to [the] working in [its] measure of each one part, works for itself the increase of the body to its self-building up in love. @ Mơ̆ng Krist abih drơi jan pơgop hơbĭt laih anŭn đom kơjăp hăng tơdruă mơ̆ng khul hrĕ lir akă djru tơdruă; tơdang abih črăn mă bruă hăng tơlơi djơ̆ klă, tui anŭn drơi jan dưi rai kơ prŏng, laih anŭn pơdơ̆ng ñu pô amăng tơlơi khăp.
This I say therefore, and testify in [the] Lord, that ye should no longer walk as [the rest of] the nations walk in [the] vanity of their mind, @ Hnŭn yơh, amăng anăn Khua Yang kâo laĭ sĭt kơ ƀing gih: Ƀing gih ƀu dưi hơdip kar hăng ƀing djuai tuai dơ̆ng ôh, yua kơ ƀing gơñu hơdip hluai tui tơlơi pơmĭn đôč đač gơñu pô. 
being darkened in understanding, estranged from the life of God by reason of the ignorance which is in them, by reason of the hardness of their hearts, @ Tơlơi pơmĭn gơñu jing kơnăm mơmŏt hĭ laih, pơčơlah laih mơ̆ng tơlơi hơdip Ơi Adai yua kơ tơlơi mlŭk mơgu laih anŭn pran jua khăng ƀing gơñu. 
who having cast off all feeling, have given themselves up to lasciviousness, to work all uncleanness with greedy unsatisfied lust. @ Ƀing gơñu ƀu thâo mlâo hañ dơ̆ng ôh, laih anŭn jao gơñu pô kơ tơlơi hrah hrong, hưp amoaih ngă djŏp mơta tơlơi hơƀak drak.
But *ye* have not thus learnt the Christ, @ Samơ̆ anŭn ƀu djơ̆ ôh khul tơlơi ƀing gih hrăm gah kơ Yang Krist! 
if ye have heard him and been instructed in him according as [the] truth is in Jesus; @ Yua kơ ƀing gih hmâo hmư̆ laih tơlơi kơ Ñu, laih anŭn hmâo hrăm laih amăng Ñu djơ̆ tui hăng tơlơi sĭt dŏ amăng Yêsu. 
[namely] your having put off according to the former conversation the old man which corrupts itself according to the deceitful lusts; @ Hnŭn yơh, brơi ƀing gih toh glŏm lui hĭ bĕ kơnuih hơđăp ƀing gih tui hăng tơlơi dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă hlâo dih, jing tơlơi hmâo brŭ rai laih yua kơ khul tơlơi hưp amoaih pleč ƀlor, 
and being renewed in the spirit of your mind; @ kơnang kơ Yang Bơngăt Hiam pơplih phrâo tơlơi pơmĭn ƀing gih, 
and [your] having put on the new man, which according to God is created in truthful righteousness and holiness. @ laih anŭn ƀing gih khŏm buh mă mơnuih phrâo, jing mơnuih hmâo hrih laih tui hăng rup hơbŏ Ơi Adai amăng tơlơi sĭt tơpă hơnơ̆ng laih anŭn tơlơi rơgoh hơčih.
Wherefore, having put off falsehood, speak truth every one with his neighbour, because we are members one of another. @  Tui anŭn yơh, brơi rĭm čô amăng ƀing gih lui hĭ tơlơi ƀlor,
“Pơhiăp bĕ tơlơi sĭt hăng ƀing jum dar ƀing gih,”
Yua kơ ƀing ta leng kơ jing khul črăn amăng sa drơi jan kơ tơdruă ƀing ta. 
Be angry, and do not sin; let not the sun set upon your wrath, @ Tơdang ƀing gih hmâo tơlơi hil, anăm ngă soh; anăm kreñ hil tơl truh yang hrơi lĕ ôh, 
neither give room for the devil. @ anăm brơi yang sat hmâo mông gal ôh. 
Let the stealer steal no more, but rather let him toil, working what is honest with [his] hands, that he may have to distribute to him that has need. @ Hlơi pô juăt klĕ, anăm klĕ dơ̆ng tah; samơ̆ hiam hloh brơi ñu gir mă bruă hăng tơlơi tơpă hiam hăng tơngan ñu pô, kiăng kơ ñu dưi djru kơ pô kơƀah. 
Let no corrupt word go out of your mouth, but if [there be] any good one for needful edification, that it may give grace to those that hear [it]. @ Anăm hmâo sa tơlơi pơhiăp sat tơbiă rai mơ̆ng amăng bah ƀing gih ôh, samơ̆ tơdah yom kiăng pơhiăp, brơi pơhiăp bĕ khul boh pơhiăp hiam, dưi djru brơi arăng rai kơ prŏng, kiăng dưi pha brơi tơlơi pap kơ ƀing mơnuih dŏ hmư̆. 
And do not grieve the Holy Spirit of God, with which ye have been sealed for [the] day of redemption. @ Anăm ngă pơrơngot Yang Bơngăt Hiam Ơi Adai ôh, yua kơ amăng Ñu ƀing gih hmâo gru kơđŏm pioh kơ hrơi song mă. 
Let all bitterness, and heat of passion, and wrath, and clamour, and injurious language, be removed from you, with all malice; @ Mă lui hĭ bĕ mơ̆ng ƀing gih abih tơlơi phĭ, tơlơi hil, tơlơi kreñ, tơlơi ur krač, tơlơi ngă pơmlâo arăng, hrŏm hăng abih tơlơi sat ƀai. 
and be to one another kind, compassionate, forgiving one another, so as God also in Christ has forgiven you. @ Brơi ƀing gih ngă hiam hăng tơdruă ƀing gih, tơdu rơun, pap brơi tơdruă ƀing gih kar hăng Ơi Adai hmâo pap brơi laih kơ ƀing gih amăng Krist.
Be ye therefore imitators of God, as beloved children, @ Hnŭn yơh, brơi ƀing gih jing mơnuih hla tui Ơi Adai kar hăng ƀing ană bă Ñu khăp hơeng. 
and walk in love, even as the Christ loved us, and delivered himself up for us, an offering and sacrifice to God for a sweet-smelling savour. @ Rơbat nao bĕ amăng tơlơi khăp, kar hăng Yang Krist hmâo khăp laih kơ ƀing ta, laih anŭn pơsăn drơi jan Ñu pô yua kơ ƀing ta, kar hăng mơnơ̆ng pơyơr laih anŭn mơnơ̆ng ngă yang ƀâu hiam pơyơr kơ Ơi Adai.
But fornication and all uncleanness or unbridled lust, let it not be even named among you, as it becomes saints; @ Bơ kơ tơlơi pyu pơde, abih bang tơlơi grĭ grañ, ƀôdah tơlơi hưp ham dram gơnam, anăm ră ruai ôh tơ̆ng krah ƀing gih, tui anŭn kah năng lăp kơ ƀing rơgoh hiam. 
and filthiness and foolish talking, or jesting, which are not convenient; but rather thanksgiving. @ Anăm ră ruai ôh tơlơi di mri, tă tăn, ƀôdah tơlơi grĭ grañ, jing khul tơlơi ƀu gal lăp ôh; hiam hloh brơi ƀing gih pơyơr đĭ tơlơi bơni hơơč kơ Ơi Adai. 
For this ye are [well] informed of, knowing that no fornicator, or unclean person, or person of unbridled lust, who is an idolater, has inheritance in the kingdom of the Christ and God. @ Ƀing gih khŏm thâo klă tơlơi anai: ƀing pyu pơde, ƀing grĭ grañ, ƀôdah ƀing hưp ham kơ dram gơnam (hưp ham dram gơnam jing kơkuh kơ rup trah), ƀu dưi mă tŭ kong ngăn amăng dêh čar pơtao Yang Krist laih anŭn Ơi Adai ôh.
Let no one deceive you with vain words, for on account of these things the wrath of God comes upon the sons of disobedience. @ Anăm brơi arăng plư ƀing gih hăng khul boh pơhiăp đôč đač ôh, yua kơ tơlơi anŭn yơh tơlơi Ơi Adai hil či tuh trŭn kơ ƀing ƀu thâo gưt hiăp. 
Be not ye therefore fellow-partakers with them; @ Tui anŭn yơh, anăm pơgop hăng ƀing gơñu ôh. 
for ye were once darkness, but now light in [the] Lord; walk as children of light, @ Hlâo adih ƀing gih dŏ amăng tơlơi kơnăm mơmŏt, samơ̆ ră anai amăng Khua Yang ƀing gih jing tơlơi bơngač. Rơbat nao bĕ kar hăng ƀing ană kơ tơlơi bơngač, 
(for the fruit of the light [is] in all goodness and righteousness and truth,) @ (Yua kơ boh tơlơi bơngač jing abih bang tơlơi hiam klă, tơlơi tơpă, laih anŭn tơlơi tơpă sĭt.) 
proving what is agreeable to the Lord; @ Pơmĭn sem lăng bĕ hơgĕt tơlơi bơmơak kơ Khua Yang. 
and do not have fellowship with the unfruitful works of darkness, but rather also reprove [them], @ Anăm pơgop hrŏm ôh khul bruă ƀu hmâo tơlơi tŭ yua, jing khul bruă kơ tơlơi kơnăm mơmŏt, samơ̆ hiam hloh brơi ƀing gih pơrơđah hĭ gơñu amăng tơlơi bơngač. 
for the things that are done by them in secret it is shameful even to say. @ Yua kơ wơ̆t dah kơnơ̆ng ră ruai khul tơlơi gơñu ngă amăng tơlơi hơgơ̆m ăt mlâo laih mơ̆n. 
But all things having their true character exposed by the light are made manifest; for that which makes everything manifest is light. @ Samơ̆ abih bang tơlơi hơgĕt pơrơđah laih amăng tơlơi bơngač leng kơ rơđah laih, yua kơ abih bang tơlơi hơgĕt dưi pơrơđah laih leng kơ jing tơlơi bơngač yơh. 
Wherefore he says, Wake up, [thou] that sleepest, and arise up from among the dead, and the Christ shall shine upon thee. @ Yua kơ anŭn tơlơi Ơi Adai pơhiăp hmâo laĭ:
“Ơ pô dŏ pĭt, mơdưh bĕ,
Tơgŭ bĕ mơ̆ng tơ̆ng krah ƀing djai,
Laih anŭn Yang Krist či pơčrang ƀơi ih.”
See therefore how ye walk carefully, not as unwise but as wise, @ Tui anŭn, răng bĕ kơ tơlơi ƀing gih hơdip, anăm hơdip kar hăng ƀing mlŭk ôh, samơ̆ kar hăng ƀing kơhnâo. 
redeeming the time, because the days are evil. @ Thâo mơneč yua hrơi mông, yua kơ khul hrơi jing sat. 
For this reason be not foolish, but understanding what [is] the will of the Lord. @ Tui anŭn yơh, anăm jing ngă kar hăng ƀing mlŭk mơgu ôh, samơ̆ brơi ƀing gih khŏm thâo hluh hơgĕt tơlơi Khua Yang kiăng.
And be not drunk with wine, in which is debauchery; but be filled with the Spirit, @ Anăm măt tơpai ôh, yua kơ tơlơi anŭn či ngă răm kơ ƀing gih, samơ̆ khŏm bă blai Yang Bơngăt Hiam. 
speaking to yourselves in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, singing and chanting with your heart to the Lord; @ Brơi ƀing gih yua tơlơi adoh hơđăp, tơlơi adoh rơgoh hiam, laih anŭn khul tơlơi adoh bơngăt, kiăng adoh pơkhă nao rai, laih anŭn adoh bơni hơơč bĕ kơ Khua Yang hăng abih pran jua. 
giving thanks at all times for all things to him [who is] God and [the] Father in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, @ Amăng abih bang tơlơi, brơi ƀing gih pơyơr tơlơi bơni nanao kơ Ơi Adai, Ama amăng anăn Yêsu Krist, Khua Yang ƀing ta.
submitting yourselves to one another in [the] fear of Christ. @ Yua kơ tơlơi hwĭ pơpŭ kơ Yang Krist, brơi ƀing gih gưt bĕ kơ tơdruă.
Wives, [submit yourselves] to your own husbands, as to the Lord, @  Ơ ƀing jing bơnai, gưt bĕ kơ rơkơi ƀing gih, kar hăng gưt kơ Khua Yang. 
for a husband is head of the wife, as also the Christ [is] head of the assembly. *He* [is] Saviour of the body. @ Yua kơ rơkơi jing akŏ kơ bơnai, kar hăng Yang Krist jing akŏ kơ Phung Sang Ơi Adai. Phung Sang Ơi Adai jing drơi jan Ñu, laih anŭn Ñu jing Pô pơklaih kơ Phung Sang Ơi Adai. 
But even as the assembly is subjected to the Christ, so also wives to their own husbands in everything. @ Kar hăng Phung Sang Ơi Adai gưt kơ Yang Krist, kar kaĭ mơ̆n ƀing bơnai khŏm gưt kơ rơkơi ñu amăng djŏp mơta tơlơi.
Husbands, love your own wives, even as the Christ also loved the assembly, and has delivered himself up for it, @  Ơ ƀing jing rơkơi, khăp bĕ kơ bơnai ƀing gih, kar hăng Yang Krist hmâo khăp laih kơ Phung Sang Ơi Adai laih anŭn pơsăn drơi jan Ñu pô yua kơ Phung Sang Ơi Adai, 
in order that he might sanctify it, purifying [it] by the washing of water by [the] word, @ kiăng pơrơgoh Phung Sang Ơi Adai, giơ̆ng kơ Ñu pơrơgoh laih ƀing gơ̆ hăng ia laih anŭn hăng boh pơhiăp Ñu, 
that *he* might present the assembly to himself glorious, having no spot, or wrinkle, or any of such things; but that it might be holy and blameless. @ kiăng pơrơđah ƀơi anăp Ñu sa Phung Sang Ơi Adai guh kơang, ƀu hmâo anih grĭ, ƀu hmâo anih kơčun, ƀu hmâo mơnơ̆ng hơgĕt kar hăng anŭn ôh, kiăng kơ dưi jing rơgoh hiam laih anŭn klă tum. 
So ought men also to love their own wives as their own bodies: he that loves his own wife loves himself. @ Ăt tui anŭn mơ̆n, rơkơi khŏm khăp kơ bơnai ñu kar hăng ñu khăp kơ drơi jan ñu pô. Hlơi pô khăp kơ bơnai ñu jing khăp kơ ñu pô yơh. 
For no one has ever hated his own flesh, but nourishes and cherishes it, even as also the Christ the assembly: @ Yua kơ ƀu hmâo hlơi pô bơrơmŭt kơ drơi jan ñu pô ôh, samơ̆ ñu čem rong laih anŭn khăp kơ gơ̆ kar hăng Yang Krist wai lăng Phung Sang Ơi Adai, 
for we are members of his body; [we are of his flesh, and of his bones.] @ yua kơ ƀing ta jing khul črăn amăng drơi jan Ñu. 
Because of this a man shall leave his father and mother, and shall be united to his wife, and the two shall be one flesh. @ Kar hăng hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp laĭ: “Kơlih yua kơ tơlơi anŭn yơh rơkơi či čơlah hĭ mơ̆ng amĭ ama ñu, laih anŭn pơgop hăng bơnai ñu, laih anŭn abih dua gơñu jing hĭ sa asar yơh.” 
This mystery is great, but *I* speak as to Christ, and as to the assembly. @ Anai jing sa tơlơi yom hơgơ̆m prŏng; kâo kiăng laĭ nao kơ Yang Krist hăng Phung Sang Ơi Adai. 
But *ye* also, every one of you, let each so love his own wife as himself; but as to the wife [I speak] that she may fear the husband. @ Tui anŭn rĭm čô ƀing gih khŏm khăp kơ bơnai ñu kar hăng ñu khăp kơ ñu pô, laih anŭn bơnai khŏm pơpŭ kơ rơkơi ñu.
Children, obey your parents in [the] Lord, for this is just. @  Ơ ƀing jing ană, tui gưt bĕ kơ amĭ ama ƀing gih amăng Khua Yang, yua kơ tơlơi anŭn jing sa tơlơi gal djơ̆ yơh. 
Honour thy father and thy mother, which is the first commandment with a promise, @ “Pơpŭ bĕ kơ amĭ ama ih” (anai jing tơlơi pơtă mrô sa hmâo wơ̆t hăng tơlơi ƀuăn nao hrŏm hơbĭt), 
that it may be well with thee, and that thou mayest be long-lived on the earth. @ “kiăng kơ ƀing gih dưi hmâo tơlơi mơyun hiam laih anŭn dưi dŏ hơdip sui ƀơi lŏn tơnah.”
And [ye] fathers, do not provoke your children to anger, but bring them up in [the] discipline and admonition of [the] Lord. @  Ơ ƀing jing ama, anăm pơčôih ngă kơ ană bă ƀing gih đet hil ôh, samơ̆ čem rong ƀing gơ̆ hăng tơlơi pơkra pơjuăt laih anŭn pơhrăm pơđur tui hăng tơlơi Khua Yang pơtô.
Bondmen, obey masters according to flesh, with fear and trembling, in simplicity of your heart as to the Christ; @  Ơ ƀing jing hlŭn, tui gưt bĕ kơ ƀing khua ƀing gih amăng lŏn tơnah, hăng tơlơi hwĭ laih anŭn tơtư̆, hăng pran jua tơpă sĭt kar hăng tui gưt kơ Yang Krist mơ̆n; 
not with eye-service as men-pleasers; but as bondmen of Christ, doing the will of God from [the] soul, @ ƀu djơ̆ kơnơ̆ng gưt asăp ƀơi anăp ƀing gơñu, kar hăng kiăng mă pran jua arăng đôč ôh, samơ̆ kar hăng ƀing hlŭn kơ Yang Krist, hăng abih pran jua ngă tui hăng tơlơi Ơi Adai kiăng. 
serving with good will as to the Lord, and not to men; @ Mă bruă bĕ kơ ƀing gơñu hăng tơlơi khăp, kar hăng mă bruă kơ Khua Yang, ƀu djơ̆ kơ ană mơnuih ôh. 
knowing that whatever good each shall do, this he shall receive of [the] Lord, whether bond or free. @ Yua kơ ƀing gih thâo laih, wơ̆t dah jing hlŭn ƀôdah jing rơngai, rĭm čô či mă tŭ tơlơi bơni mơ̆ng Khua Yang tui hăng bruă hiam ñu hmâo ngă laih.
And, masters, do the same things towards them, giving up threatening, knowing that both their and your Master is in heaven, and there is no acceptance of persons with him. @  Ơ ƀing jing khua, brơi ƀing gih ngă bĕ kơ ƀing hlŭn ƀing gih ăt kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n, laih anŭn anăm pơhwĭ pơbral ƀing gơñu ôh, yua kơ ƀing gih thâo laih ƀing gơñu wơ̆t kơ ƀing gih hmâo hrŏm hơbĭt sa čô Khua dŏ amăng adai, laih anŭn Ñu ƀu pơkah phara mơnuih ôh.
For the rest, brethren, be strong in [the] Lord, and in the might of his strength. @ Hnal tuč, brơi kơ ƀing gih jing kơtang amăng Khua Yang laih anŭn kơnang kơ tơlơi kơtang mơyang Ñu. 
Put on the panoply of God, that ye may be able to stand against the artifices of the devil: @ Brơi ƀing gih buh mă bĕ abih bang gơnam pơblah Ơi Adai brơi, kiăng kơ ƀing gih dưi dŏ kơjăp pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ hăng tơlơi plư pleč yang sat. 
because our struggle is not against blood and flesh, but against principalities, against authorities, against the universal lords of this darkness, against spiritual [power] of wickedness in the heavenlies. @ Yua kơ ƀing ta pơblah, ƀu djơ̆ pơblah glaĭ hăng asar đeh laih anŭn drah ôh, samơ̆ ƀing ta pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ hăng ƀing khua wai lăng, ƀing hmâo tơlơi dưi, ƀing khua pơtao lŏn tơnah rơnŭk kơnăm mơmŏt anai, hăng ƀing yang sat ƀai dŏ amăng khul tal adai. 
For this reason take [to you] the panoply of God, that ye may be able to withstand in the evil day, and, having accomplished all things, to stand. @ Yua kơ anŭn yơh, mă yua bĕ abih bang gơnam pơblah Ơi Adai brơi, kiăng kơ ƀing gih dưi pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ amăng rơnŭk sat, laih anŭn tơ dưi hĭ abih bang laih, ƀing gih ăt či dŏ kơjăp.
Stand therefore, having girt about your loins with truth, and having put on the breastplate of righteousness, @  Tui anŭn, dŏ kơjăp bĕ, hrăng bĕ hơdrăng kơiăng hăng tơlơi sĭt, buh bĕ ao pơsơi jing tơlơi tơpă, 
and shod your feet with [the] preparation of the glad tidings of peace: @ yua tơlơi hur har ră ruai Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam rơnŭk rơnua kar hăng čŭt čơkhŏ. 
besides all [these], having taken the shield of faith with which ye will be able to quench all the inflamed darts of the wicked one. @ Hăng abih khul tơlơi anai, mă bĕ khiơl jing tơlơi đaŏ. Hăng gơnam anŭn ƀing gih dưi pơdjai abih bang ƀrŏm apui yang sat. 
Have also the helmet of salvation, and the sword of the Spirit, which is God's word; @ Buh bĕ tơlơi pơklaih jing mŭk pơsơi, laih anŭn djă đao gưm Yang Bơngăt Hiam, jing boh pơhiăp Ơi Adai. 
praying at all seasons, with all prayer and supplication in [the] Spirit, and watching unto this very thing with all perseverance and supplication for all the saints; @ Amăng Yang Bơngăt Hiam iâu laĭ nanao laih anŭn kơwưh rơkâo. Kiăng kơ truh tơlơi kơñăm, brơi kơ ƀing gih gir run, dŏ răng, laih anŭn iâu laĭ brơi kơ abih bang ƀing rơgoh hiam. 
and for me in order that utterance may be given to me in [the] opening of my mouth to make known with boldness the mystery of the glad tidings, @ Ăt iâu laĭ brơi kơ kâo kar kaĭ mơ̆n, kiăng kơ tơdang kâo pơhiăp, Ơi Adai pha brơi kơ kâo tơlơi pơtô mơ̆ng Ñu, laih anŭn pơtô tơlơi yom hơgơ̆m kơ Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam hăng tơlơi khĭn. 
for which I am an ambassador [bound] with a chain, that I may be bold in it as I ought to speak. @ Yua kơ Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam yơh, kâo jing pô pơala, arăng krư̆ kơđơ̆l kâo. Tui anŭn iâu laĭ brơi kâo kiăng kơ kâo hmâo tơlơi khĭn pơhaih Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam anŭn kar hăng kâo khŏm pơhiăp.
But in order that *ye* also may know what concerns me, how I am getting on, Tychicus, the beloved brother and faithful minister in [the] Lord, shall make all things known to you; @   Kar kaĭ mơ̆n kiăng kơ ƀing gih dưi thâo hyư̆m kâo jing laih anŭn hơgĕt kâo dŏ ngă, Tisik adơi ayŏng ƀing ta khăp hơeng, sa čô ding kơna tŏng ten amăng Khua Yang, či ruai glaĭ brơi kơ ƀing gih thâo abih tơlơi. 
whom I have sent to you for this very thing, that ye may know of our affairs and that he may encourage your hearts. @ Kâo pơkiaŏ nao ñu pơ ƀing gih hăng tơlơi kơñăm anai, kiăng kơ ƀing gih dưi thâo hyư̆m tơlơi gơmơi jing, laih anŭn kiăng kơ ñu dưi pơtrŭt pơđĭ pran jua ƀing gih.
Peace to the brethren, and love with faith, from God [the] Father and [the] Lord Jesus Christ. @ Rơkâo tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua, tơlơi khăp, laih anŭn tơlơi đaŏ, mơ̆ng Ơi Adai jing Ama, laih anŭn Khua Yang jing Yêsu Krist dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng adơi ayŏng. 
Grace with all them that love our Lord Jesus Christ in incorruption. @ Rơkâo tơlơi pap dŏ hrŏm hăng abih bang ƀing mơnuih khăp kơ Khua Yang ƀing ta jing Yêsu Krist hăng tơlơi khăp hlŏng lar.
Paul and Timotheus, bondmen of Jesus Christ, to all the saints in Christ Jesus who are in Philippi, with [the] overseers and ministers; @  Pôl laih anŭn Timôthê, ƀing ding kơna Krist Yêsu, čih mơit kơ abih bang ƀing rơgoh hiam amăng Krist Yêsu dŏ pơ plei Philip hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing wai lăng Phung Sang Ơi Adai laih anŭn ƀing tha sang yang.
grace to you, and peace from God our Father and [the] Lord Jesus Christ. @ Rơkâo Ơi Adai Ama ƀing ta, laih anŭn Khua Yang jing Yêsu Krist pha brơi ƀing gih tơlơi pap laih anŭn tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua.
I thank my God for my whole remembrance of you, @ Kâo bơni kơ Ơi Adai kâo, rĭm wơ̆t kâo hơdơr kơ ƀing gih, 
constantly in my every supplication, making the supplication for you all with joy, @ laih anŭn amăng rĭm wơ̆t kâo iâu laĭ brơi kơ abih bang ƀing gih, nanao kâo iâu laĭ hăng tơlơi hơ̆k mơak, 
because of your fellowship with the gospel, from the first day until now; @ yua kơ čơdơ̆ng mơ̆ng phŭn hlŏng truh kơ ră anai, ƀing gih hmâo djru hrŏm hơbĭt mă bruă amăng tơlơi ră ruai Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam. 
having confidence of this very thing, that he who has begun in you a good work will complete it unto Jesus Christ's day: @ Kâo đaŏ sĭt kơ Pô hmâo pơphŭn laih bruă hiam amăng ƀing gih, Ñu či ngă pơgiơ̆ng hĭ bruă anŭn tơl truh hrơi Yêsu Krist. 
as it is righteous for me to think this as to you all, because ye have *me* in your hearts, and that both in my bonds and in the defence and confirmation of the glad tidings ye are all participators in my grace. @ Jing djơ̆ yơh kâo pơmĭn tui anŭn kơ abih bang ƀing gih, yua kơ ƀing gih dŏ nanao amăng pran jua kâo, yua kơ abih bang ƀing gih hmâo mă tŭ laih tơlơi pap hrŏm hăng kâo, wơ̆t dah amăng tơlơi arăng krư̆ kâo ƀôdah amăng tơlơi pơgang laih anŭn pơgăl pơsĭt Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam. 
For God is my witness how I long after you all in [the] bowels of Christ Jesus. @ Yua kơ Ơi Adai ngă gơ̆ng jơlan laih kơ kâo, kơ tơlơi kâo khăp hơeng kơ abih bang ƀing gih hăng tơlơi khăp Krist Yêsu.
And this I pray, that your love may abound yet more and more in full knowledge and all intelligence, @ Tơlơi kâo iâu laĭ, kâo rơkâo kiăng kơ tơlơi khăp ƀing gih dưi đĭ lu tui nanao, hrŏm hăng tơlơi thâo hluh laih anŭn tơlơi thâo kơsem dlam, 
that ye may judge of and approve the things that are more excellent, in order that ye may be pure and without offence for Christ's day, @ djru ƀing gih thâo klă hơgĕt jing tơlơi hiam hloh abih bang, kiăng kơ amăng hrơi Yang Krist ƀing gih dưi jing rơgoh hiam, ƀu hmâo tơlơi dưi ƀuah ôh, 
being complete as regards the fruit of righteousness, which [is] by Jesus Christ, to God's glory and praise. @ bă hăng tơlơi tơpă tơbiă rai mơ̆ng Yêsu Krist, kiăng pơ-ư pơang laih anŭn pơ-ư bơni kơ Ơi Adai.
But I would have you know, brethren, that the circumstances in which I am have turned out rather to the furtherance of the glad tidings, @ Ơ adơi ayŏng, kâo kiăng kơ ƀing gih thâo hơgĕt tơlơi hmâo truh laih kơ kâo, sĭt jing tơlơi hmâo djru pơđĭ brơi laih bruă Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam; 
so that my bonds have become manifest [as being] in Christ in all the praetorium and to all others; @ tơl abih bang tơhan gak amăng sang khua čar laih anŭn abih bang mơnuih pơkŏn leng kơ thâo arăng hmâo krư̆ kâo yua kơ Krist, 
and that the most of the brethren, trusting in [the] Lord through my bonds, dare more abundantly to speak the word of God fearlessly. @ laih anŭn lu ƀing adơi ayŏng hmâo tơlơi đaŏ kơnang kơ Khua Yang hloh dơ̆ng yua mơ̆ng tơlơi arăng krư̆ kâo, laih anŭn gơñu khĭn pơhaih boh pơhiăp Ơi Adai ƀu hmâo tơlơi hwĭ ôh.
Some indeed also for envy and strife, but some also for good will, preach the Christ. @ Sĭt biă mă hmâo đơđa pơtô Yang Krist hăng tơlơi gar moañ laih anŭn tơlơi pơrơsua, samơ̆ ăt hmâo mơ̆n ƀing mơnuih pơtô hăng tơlơi pơmĭn hiam. 
These indeed out of love, knowing that I am set for the defence of the glad tidings; @ Ƀing mơnuih anai pơtô hăng pran jua khăp, yua kơ gơñu thâo Ơi Adai hmâo kơčrâo pơdŏ brơi kâo kơ bruă anai kiăng kơ pơgang brơi Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam. 
but those out of contention, announce the Christ, not purely, supposing to arouse tribulation for my bonds. @ Bơ kơ ƀing pơkŏn pơtô Yang Krist hăng tơlơi kiăng kah pơpha, ƀu djơ̆ hăng tơlơi tơpă sĭt ôh, laih anŭn pơmĭn dah tui anŭn či thim tơlơi tơnap tap kơ tơlơi arăng krư̆ kơđơ̆l kâo. 
What is it then? at any rate, in every way, whether in pretext or in truth, Christ is announced; and in this I rejoice, yea, also I will rejoice; @ Măk ai ñu! Wơ̆t dah hyư̆m pă tŭ mơ̆n, thâo dah hăng tơlơi ngă mă ƀôdah hăng tơlơi tơpă sĭt, Yang Krist ăt arăng pơtô mơ̆n. Anŭn jing tơlơi kâo hơ̆k mơak laih anŭn ăt či hơ̆k mơak dơ̆ng. 
for I know that this shall turn out for me to salvation, through your supplication and [the] supply of the Spirit of Jesus Christ; @ Yua kơ kâo thâo mơ̆ng tơlơi ƀing gih iâu laĭ laih anŭn Yang Bơngăt Hiam Yêsu Krist djru, tơlơi anŭn či ba glaĭ tơlơi rơngai kơ kâo, 
according to my earnest expectation and hope, that in nothing I shall be ashamed, but in all boldness, as always, now also Christ shall be magnified in my body whether by life or by death. @ Tơlơi kâo kiăng biă mă laih anŭn čang rơmang anŭn jing, kâo ƀu či mlâo hañ kơ tơlơi hơgĕt ôh, samơ̆ hăng tơlơi khĭn biă mă ră anai laih anŭn nanao kar kaĭ mơ̆n, Yang Krist ăt či hmâo tơlơi guh kơang amăng drơi jan kâo, thâo dah kâo hơdip ƀôdah dah kâo djai. 
For for me to live [is] Christ, and to die gain; @ Gah kơ kâo, hơdip jing Yang Krist, djai jing tơlơi tŭ yua. 
but if to live in flesh [is my lot], this is for me worth the while: and what I shall choose I cannot tell. @ Samơ̆ tơdah kâo ăt dŏ hơdip amăng drơi jan laih anŭn bruă kâo ngă ăt dŏ hmâo boh tŭ yua mơ̆n, hnŭn yơh kâo ƀu thâo hơgĕt tơlơi kâo khŏm či ruah ôh. 
But I am pressed by both, having the desire for departure and being with Christ, [for] [it is] very much better, @ Hmâo dua bơnah tơlơi kơpĭ kâo: kâo kiăng nao laih anŭn dŏ hrŏm hăng Yang Krist, jing tơlơi hiam kơ kâo hloh kơ abih bang. 
but remaining in the flesh [is] more necessary for your sakes; @ Samơ̆ kâo ăt dŏ glaĭ amăng drơi jan, anŭn jing tơlơi kiăng biă mă yơh brơi kơ ƀing gih. 
and having confidence of this, I know that I shall remain and abide along with you all, for your progress and joy in faith; @ Kâo đaŏ sĭt tơlơi anai, kâo thâo kâo ăt či dŏ glaĭ laih anŭn dŏ hăng abih bang ƀing gih dơ̆ng, kiăng djru ƀing gih đĭ kơprŏng laih anŭn hơ̆k mơak amăng tơlơi đaŏ, 
that your boasting may abound in Christ Jesus through me by my presence again with you. @ tui anŭn tơ kâo wơ̆t glaĭ čuă ƀing gih dơ̆ng, ƀing gih či hmâo lu tơlơi kơlih yua kiăng pơ-ư kơ kâo amăng Yang Krist Yêsu.
Only conduct yourselves worthily of the glad tidings of the Christ, in order that whether coming and seeing you, or absent, I may hear of what concerns you, that ye stand firm in one spirit, with one soul, labouring together in the same conflict with the faith of the glad tidings; @ Kơnơ̆ng brơi ƀing gih khŏm hơdip năng lăp hăng Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam Yang Krist, kiăng kơ hlăk kâo nao čuă ngui ƀing gih ƀôdah hlăk kâo rơkut, kâo ăt či hmư̆ hing kơ ƀing gih ăt dŏ kơjăp, sa pran jua, sa tơlơi pơmĭn hrŏm hơbĭt pơblah brơi kơ tơlơi đaŏ kơ Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam, 
and not frightened in anything by the opposers, which is to them a demonstration of destruction, but of your salvation, and that from God; @ laih anŭn ƀu hmâo tơlơi hwĭ hơgĕt ôh mơ̆ng ƀing ayăt ƀing gih. Tơlơi anŭn jing sa gru kơnăl pơsĭt kơ tơlơi ƀing gơñu či răm rai, samơ̆ jing gru kơnăl pơsĭt tơlơi ƀing gih hmâo tơlơi pơklaih, laih anŭn tơlơi anai tơbiă rai mơ̆ng Ơi Adai. 
because to you has been given, as regards Christ, not only the believing on him but the suffering for him also, @ Yua kơ Ơi Adai hmâo pha brơi laih kơ ƀing gih ƀu djơ̆ kơnơ̆ng đaŏ kơ Krist đôč ôh, samơ̆ wơ̆t kơ dưi tŭ tơlơi tơnap yua kơ Ñu kar kaĭ mơ̆n, 
having the same conflict which ye have seen in me, and now hear of in me. @ ƀing gih hlăk dŏ pơblah kar hăng tơlơi pơblah ƀing gih hmâo ƀuh laih kâo pơblah mơ̆ng hlâo dih, laih anŭn ră anai ƀing gih hmư̆ kâo ăt dŏ pơblah mơ̆n.
If then [there be] any comfort in Christ, if any consolation of love, if any fellowship of [the] Spirit, if any bowels and compassions, @ Tui anŭn, tơdah amăng Yang Krist hmâo tơlơi pơđĭ pran jua, tơdah amăng tơlơi khăp hmâo tơlơi pơalum, tơdah amăng Yang Bơngăt Hiam hmâo tơlơi pơgop pơlir, tơdah hmâo pran jua thâo khăp laih anŭn tơlơi pap mơñai kơ tơdruă, 
fulfil my joy, that ye may think the same thing, having the same love, joined in soul, thinking one thing; @ brơi ƀing gih bơmơak kơ kâo tum num bĕ amăng tơlơi ƀing gih hmâo sa jua pơmĭn, sa tơlơi khăp, sa bơngăt jua laih anŭn sa tơlơi pơmĭn. 
[let] nothing [be] in the spirit of strife or vain glory, but, in lowliness of mind, each esteeming the other as more excellent than themselves; @ Anăm ngă ôh sa mơta tơlơi hơgĕt yua kơ pran jua et klih, ƀôdah kiăng pơang kơ pô, samơ̆ luă gŭ bĕ, lăng kơ pô pơkŏn lăp pơpŭ pơyom hloh kơ ƀing gih pô. 
regarding not each his own [qualities], but each those of others also. @ Rĭm čô amăng ƀing gih anăm pơmĭn tơlơi tŭ yua kơnơ̆ng kơ ƀing gih pô đôč ôh, samơ̆ khŏm pơmĭn tơlơi tŭ yua kơ ƀing pơkŏn kar kaĭ mơ̆n. 
For let this mind be in you which [was] also in Christ Jesus; @ Brơi kơ ƀing gih hmâo bĕ jua pơmĭn kar hăng Krist Yêsu hmâo laih,
who, subsisting in the form of God, did not esteem it an object of rapine to be on an equality with God; @ Wơ̆t dah Ñu hmâo kơnuih Ơi Adai pô,
Samơ̆ Ñu ƀu lăng tơlơi Ñu bơmơđơr hăng Ơi Adai
Jing tơlơi Ñu khŏm djă pioh ôh;
but emptied himself, taking a bondman's form, taking his place in [the] likeness of men; @ Ñu hmâo lui hĭ laih Ñu pô,
Laih anŭn buh mă rup sa čô hlŭn,
Jing hĭ kar hăng ană mơnuih.
and having been found in figure as a man, humbled himself, becoming obedient even unto death, and [that the] death of [the] cross. @ Ñu hmâo pơrơđah rai kar hăng sa čô mơnuih,
Ñu pơtrŭn Ñu pô, laih anŭn gưt asăp tơl djai,
Hloh kơ anŭn dơ̆ng tŭ tơlơi djai ƀơi kơyâo bơrơkal.
Wherefore also God highly exalted him, and granted him a name, that which is above every name, @ Yua kơ anŭn yơh Ơi Adai hmâo pơpŭ Ñu đĭ glong biă mă,
Laih anŭn brơi kơ Ñu anăn glong hloh kơ abih bang anăn,
that at the name of Jesus every knee should bow, of heavenly and earthly and infernal [beings], @  Kiăng kơ tơ hmư̆ djơ̆ anăn Yêsu,
Abih bang tơŭt amăng adai, ƀơi lŏn tơnah, laih anŭn gah yŭ kơ lŏn tơnah
Leng kơ khŏm tŏ tơŭt,
and every tongue confess that Jesus Christ [is] Lord to God [the] Father's glory. @ Laih anŭn abih bang jơlah leng kơ khŏm pơhaih
Yêsu Krist jing Khua Yang,
Kiăng ngă guh kơang kơ Ơi Adai Ama.
So that, my beloved, even as ye have always obeyed, not as in my presence only, but now much rather in my absence, work out your own salvation with fear and trembling, @ Tui anŭn yơh, Ơ adơi ayŏng kâo khăp hơeng, kar hăng ƀing gih ăt gưt nanao, ƀu djơ̆ kơnơ̆ng ƀơi anăp kâo đôč ôh, samơ̆ ră anai gưt lu hloh dơ̆ng tơdang kâo rơkut, ngă pơgiơ̆ng bĕ tơlơi pơklaih ƀing gih hăng pran jua hwĭ laih anŭn tơtư̆. 
for it is God who works in you both the willing and the working according to [his] good pleasure. @ Yua kơ Ơi Adai jing pô dŏ mă bruă amăng ƀing gih, kiăng kơ ƀing gih hmâo tơlơi kiăng laih anŭn dưi ngă tui hăng tơlơi Ñu kiăng.
Do all things without murmurings and reasonings, @ Ngă bĕ abih bang bruă anăm hiăp brŏk ƀôdah kĭ kơ̆ ôh, 
that ye may be harmless and simple, irreproachable children of God in the midst of a crooked and perverted generation; among whom ye appear as lights in [the] world, @ kiăng kơ ƀing gih jing jơngeh rơgoh laih anŭn ƀu hmâo tơlơi arăng dưi ƀuah ôh, jing ƀing ană bă Ơi Adai ƀu hmâo tơlơi grĭ grañ ôh tơ̆ng krah rơnŭk răm rai laih anŭn soh sat. Tơ̆ng krah ƀing gơñu brơi ƀing gih pơčrang bĕ kar hăng pơtŭ amăng lŏn tơnah, 
holding forth [the] word of life, so as to be a boast for me in Christ's day, that I have not run in vain nor laboured in vain. @ djă kơjăp bĕ boh pơhiăp hơdip, kiăng kơ amăng Hrơi Krist kâo dưi pơ-ư kơ kâo pô yua kơ tơlơi kâo đuaĭ ƀu jing đôč đač ôh, kŏn mă bruă đôč đač lơi. 
But if also I am poured out as a libation on the sacrifice and ministration of your faith, I rejoice, and rejoice in common with you all. @ Wơ̆t dah kâo khŏm tuh drah kar hăng ngă phĕt tuh ia tơpai kiăng pruih ƀơi mơnơ̆ng ngă yang ƀing gih pơyơr đĭ hăng tơlơi đaŏ, kâo ăt mơak mơ̆n laih anŭn hơ̆k mơak hrŏm hăng abih bang ƀing gih. 
In like manner do *ye* also rejoice, and rejoice with me. @ Ƀing gih kar kaĭ mơ̆n, hơ̆k mơak bĕ laih anŭn hơ̆k mơak hrŏm hơbĭt hăng kâo.
But I hope in [the] Lord Jesus to send Timotheus to you shortly, that *I* also may be refreshed, knowing how ye get on. @ Amăng Khua Yang Yêsu kâo čang rơmang dưi pơkiaŏ nao tañ Timôthê pơ ƀing gih, kiăng kơ kâo dưi hmâo tơlơi pơđĭ pran jua tơdang hmư̆ tơlơi phrâo phrang mơ̆ng ƀing gih. 
For I have no one like-minded who will care with genuine feeling how ye get on. @ Kâo ƀu hmâo ôh pô pơkŏn hmâo sa jua pơmĭn kar hăng ñu, bơngơ̆t sĭt kơ tơlơi ƀing gih. 
For all seek their own things, not the things of Jesus Christ. @ Abih bang ƀing gơñu kơnơ̆ng hơduah sem tơlơi tŭ yua kơ gơñu pô đôč, ƀu djơ̆ tơlơi tŭ yua kơ Yêsu Krist ôh. 
But ye know the proof of him, that, as a child a father, he has served with me in the work of the glad tidings. @ Samơ̆ ƀing gih thâo laih tơlơi tŏng ten Timôthê, ñu hmâo mă bruă kơ Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam hrŏm hơbĭt hăng kâo, kar hăng ană hăng ama. 
Him therefore I hope to send immediately, as soon as I shall see how it goes with me: @ Tui anŭn kâo čang rơmang či pơkiaŏ nao ñu mơtam pơ ƀing gih, tơ laih kâo thâo tơlơi či truh kơ kâo; 
but I trust in [the] Lord that I myself also shall soon come; @ samơ̆ amăng Khua Yang, kâo đaŏ kâo pô ăt či nao tañ pơ ƀing gih mơ̆n.
but I have thought it necessary to send to you Epaphroditus, my brother and fellow-workman and fellow-soldier, but your messenger and minister to my need, @ Kâo pơmĭn kiăng đơi yơh brơi Êpaphôdit glaĭ pơ ƀing gih. Ñu jing sa čô adơi ayŏng kâo, sa čô pô mă bruă hrŏm hơbĭt laih anŭn pô pơblah hrŏm hăng kâo, ăt jing pô arăng pơkiaŏ nao laih anŭn jing mơnuih buih bruă ƀing gih hmâo mơit rai kiăng djru tơlơi kâo kiăng. 
since he had a longing desire after you all, and was distressed because ye had heard that he was sick; @ Yua kơ ñu kiăng biă mă bưp glaĭ abih bang ƀing gih, laih anŭn ñu hmâo tơlơi ƀlơ̆ng bơngơ̆t yua kơ ƀing gih hmâo hmư̆ laih kơ tơlơi ñu ruă. 
for he was also sick close to death, but God had mercy on him, and not indeed on him alone, but also on me, that I might not have sorrow upon sorrow. @ Sĭt biă mă ñu hmâo ruă ƀiă či djai, samơ̆ Ơi Adai pap drap kơ ñu, laih anŭn ƀu djơ̆ kơnơ̆ng pap drap kơ ñu đôč ôh samơ̆ wơ̆t kơ kâo kar kaĭ mơ̆n, hwĭ kơ thim tơlơi rơngot dơ̆ng kơ tơlơi rơngot kâo hmâo laih. 
I have sent him therefore the more diligently, that seeing him ye might again rejoice, and that *I* might be the less sorrowful. @ Yua kơ anŭn yơh, kâo hăt pơkiaŏ nao ñu, kiăng kơ ƀing gih hmâo tơlơi hơ̆k mơak tơdang ƀing gih ƀuh glaĭ ñu dơ̆ng, laih anŭn kiăng kơ kâo plai ƀiă ƀlơ̆ng bơngơ̆t. 
Receive him therefore in [the] Lord with all joy, and hold such in honour; @ Tui anŭn brơi ƀing gih tŭ jum ñu amăng Khua Yang hăng tơlơi hơ̆k mơak sĭt, laih anŭn brơi ƀing gih pơpŭ bĕ kơ ƀing mơnuih kar hăng anŭn, 
because for the sake of the work he drew near even to death, venturing his life that he might fill up what lacked in your ministration toward me. @ yua kơ bruă Yang Krist ñu ƀiă či djai. Ñu pơsăn tơlơi hơdip kiăng kơ pơgiơ̆ng khul bruă ƀing gih ƀu dưi djru kâo ôh.
For the rest, my brethren, rejoice in [the] Lord: to write the same things to you, to me [is] not irksome, and for you safe. @ Hnal tuč, Ơ adơi ayŏng, hơ̆k mơak bĕ amăng Khua Yang. Kâo ƀu guam ôh čih khul tơlơi kar hăng anŭn dơ̆ng kơ ƀing gih, yua kơ anŭn jing tơlơi hlom rơnŭk kơ ƀing gih. 
See to dogs, see to evil workmen, see to the concision. @ Răng bĕ kơ ƀing khul asâo, răng bĕ kơ ƀing mă bruă sat, răng bĕ kơ ƀing ngă mă khăt klĭ. 
For *we* are the circumcision, who worship by [the] Spirit of God, and boast in Christ Jesus, and do not trust in flesh. @ Yua kơ ƀing ta jing ƀing khăt klĭ sĭt, ƀing kơkuh pơpŭ kơ Ơi Adai amăng Yang Bơngăt Hiam, laih anŭn pơ-ư amăng Krist Yêsu, ƀu đaŏ kơnang kơ asar đeh ôh. 
Though *I* have [my] trust even in flesh; if any other think to trust in flesh, *I* rather: @ Wơ̆t dah kâo ăt hmâo tơlơi kơlih yua kiăng kơnang kơ asar đeh. Tơdah hmâo hlơi pơmĭn kơ ñu hmâo tơlơi kơlih yua kiăng kơnang kơ asar đeh, kâo hmâo lu tơlơi kơlih yua hloh dơ̆ng: 
as to circumcision, [I received it] the eighth day; of [the] race of Israel, of [the] tribe of Benjamin, Hebrew of Hebrews; as to [the] law, a Pharisee; @ amăng hrơi tal sapăn arăng khăt klĭ kâo, kâo jing sa čô mơnuih tơkeng rai mơ̆ng ƀing ană tơčo Israel, mơ̆ng kơnŭng djuai Benjamin, mơnuih Hêbrơ ană kơ mơnuih Hêbrơ; gah kơ tơlơi juăt kâo jing sa čô mơnuih Pharisi; 
as to zeal, persecuting the assembly; as to righteousness which [is] in [the] law, found blameless; @ gah kơ pran jua hur har, kâo jing pô ngă sat kơ Phung Sang Ơi Adai; gah kơ tơlơi tơpă tui hăng tơlơi juăt, kâo ƀu hmâo anih arăng dưi ƀuah ôh. 
but what things were gain to me these I counted, on account of Christ, loss. @ Samơ̆ yua kơ Yang Krist, kâo lăng khul tơlơi tŭ yua kâo hmâo anŭn kar hăng jing lŭp đôč. 
But surely I count also all things to be loss on account of the excellency of the knowledge of Christ Jesus my Lord, on account of whom I have suffered the loss of all, and count them to be filth, that I may gain Christ; @ Hloh kơ anŭn dơ̆ng, kâo ăt lăng abih bang tơlơi kar hăng lŭp, yua kơ tơlơi kâo thâo krăn Yang Krist Yêsu, Khua Yang kâo, jing yom hloh kơ abih bang. Yua kơ Ñu yơh, kâo tŭ tơlơi lŭp abih bang, laih anŭn kâo lăng khul tơlơi anŭn kar hăng djah, kiăng kơ dưi hmâo Yang Krist, 
and that I may be found in him, not having my righteousness, which [would be] on the principle of law, but that which is by faith of Christ, the righteousness which [is] of God through faith, @ laih anŭn dưi dŏ amăng Ñu. Kâo hmâo tui anŭn ƀu djơ̆ yua mơ̆ng tơlơi tơpă kâo hmâo mơ̆ng tơlơi juăt ôh samơ̆ yua mơ̆ng tơlơi đaŏ kơ Yang Krist, jing tơlơi tơpă tơbiă rai mơ̆ng Ơi Adai yua mơ̆ng tơlơi đaŏ; 
to know him, and the power of his resurrection, and the fellowship of his sufferings, being conformed to his death, @ kiăng kơ kâo dưi thâo krăn Krist laih anŭn tơlơi dưi mơyang mơ̆ng tơlơi Ñu hơdip glaĭ, laih anŭn dưi tŭ tơlơi tơnap tap hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Ñu, laih anŭn dưi jing kar hăng Ñu amăng tơlơi Ñu djai, 
if any way I arrive at the resurrection from among [the] dead. @ čang rơmang kâo dưi truh kơ tơlơi hơdip glaĭ mơ̆ng ƀing djai.
Not that I have already obtained [the prize], or am already perfected; but I pursue, if also I may get possession [of it], seeing that also I have been taken possession of by Christ [Jesus]. @ Ƀu djơ̆ ôh kâo hmâo mă tŭ laih pri, ƀôdah tơl laih kơ tơlơi hiam tum klă, samơ̆ kâo hlăk gir đuaĭ nao pơ anăp kiăng dưi mă tŭ tơlơi anŭn kơ kâo pô, yua kơ Yang Krist hmâo mă tŭ laih kâo kơ Ñu pô. 
Brethren, *I* do not count to have got possession myself; but one thing forgetting the things behind, and stretching out to the things before, @ Ơ adơi ayŏng, kâo ƀu pơmĭn ôh kâo hmâo mă tŭ laih tơlơi anŭn, samơ̆ kâo kơnơ̆ng ngă sa mơta tơlơi, kâo wơr bĭt hĭ khul tơlơi hơgĕt gah rŏng laih anŭn kơtưn nao pơ anăp. 
I pursue, [looking] towards [the] goal, for the prize of the calling on high of God in Christ Jesus. @ Kâo đuaĭ kơñăm nao pơ anih pơkơčah, kiăng dưi mă tŭ pri kơ tơlơi iâu hăng adai kơ Ơi Adai amăng Krist Yêsu. 
As many therefore as [are] perfect, let us be thus minded; and if ye are any otherwise minded, this also God shall reveal to you. @ Brơi abih bang ƀing mơnuih truh tha laih amăng ƀing ta khŏm hmâo tơlơi pơmĭn kar hăng anŭn; laih anŭn tơdah ƀing gih pơmĭn kơ tơlơi pơkŏn, Ơi Adai či pơrơđah brơi tơlơi anŭn kơ ƀing gih kar kaĭ mơ̆n. 
But whereto we have attained, [let us] walk in the same steps. @ Kơnơ̆ng dơ̆ pă hơnơ̆ng ƀing ta tơl, ƀing ta rơbat nao bĕ kar hăng hơnơ̆ng anŭn.
Be imitators [all] together of me, brethren, and fix your eyes on those walking thus as you have us for a model; @  Ơ ƀing adơi ayŏng, hla tui kâo bĕ, laih anŭn brơi ƀing gih kơčăng lăng kơ ƀing hơdip tui gru pơhmô hiam ƀing gih ƀuh laih amăng ƀing gơmơi. 
(for many walk of whom I have told you often, and now tell you even weeping, that they [are] the enemies of the cross of Christ: @ Yua kơ kâo juăt laĭ laih kơ ƀing gih tơlơi anai, laih anŭn ră anai kâo pơhiăp dơ̆ng hăng tơlơi hia, hmâo lu ƀing mơnuih hơdip kar hăng ƀing ayăt kơ kơyâo bơrơkal Yang Krist. 
whose end [is] destruction, whose god [is] the belly, and [their] glory in their shame, who mind earthly things:) @ Tơlơi đŭt kơ gơñu jing tơlơi răm rai. Gơñu lăng hlŭng gơñu jing khua yang kơ gơñu. Gơñu yap tơlơi mlâo hañ jing tơlơi ư-ang kơ gơñu, laih anŭn kơnơ̆ng pơmĭn kơ khul bruă lŏn tơnah đôč. 
for *our* commonwealth has its existence in [the] heavens, from which also we await the Lord Jesus Christ [as] Saviour, @ Samơ̆ ƀing ta jing ană plei pla amăng adai, mơ̆ng anih anŭn ƀing ta dŏ čang tơguan Pô Pơklaih, Khua Yang Yêsu Krist. 
who shall transform our body of humiliation into conformity to his body of glory, according to the working of [the] power which he has even to subdue all things to himself. @ Ñu či pơplih drơi jan tơdu ƀing ta jing hĭ kar hăng drơi jan guh kơang Ñu, hăng tơlơi dưi mơyang Ñu dưi brơi abih bang mơnơ̆ng mŭt gưt kơ Ñu.
So that, my brethren, beloved and longed for, my joy and crown, thus stand fast in [the] Lord, beloved. @ Tui anŭn yơh, Ơ adơi ayŏng kâo khăp hơeng, jing ƀing kâo khăp laih anŭn hơning hơdơr, jing tơlơi hơ̆k mơak laih anŭn mŭk pơtao kơ kâo, dŏ kơjăp nanao bĕ amăng Khua Yang.
I exhort Euodia, and exhort Syntyche, to be of the same mind in [the] Lord; @ Kâo pơđur kơ HʼÊwôdi laih anŭn HʼSintič pơgop bĕ hasa tơlơi pơmĭn amăng Khua Yang. 
yea, I ask thee also, true yokefellow, assist them, who have contended along with me in the glad tidings, with Clement also, and my other fellow-labourers, whose names [are] in [the] book of life. @ Laih anŭn, Ơ pô mă bruă tŏng ten hrŏm hơbĭt hăng kâo, kâo ăt rơkâo kơ ih kar kaĭ mơ̆n djru bĕ ƀing đah kơmơi anŭn, yua kơ gơñu hmâo mă bruă laih hrŏm hăng kâo amăng Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam, hrŏm hăng Klêmang laih anŭn ƀing gơyut mă bruă hrŏm hơbĭt pơkŏn hăng kâo. Anăn gơñu Ơi Adai čih laih amăng hră tơlơi hơdip.
Rejoice in [the] Lord always: again I will say, Rejoice. @ Hơ̆k mơak nanao bĕ amăng Khua Yang, kâo laĭ dơ̆ng, hơ̆k mơak bĕ! 
Let your gentleness be known of all men. The Lord [is] near. @ Brơi abih bang mơnuih ƀuh kơnuih tơdu rơun ƀing gih bĕ. Khua Yang giăm truh yơh. 
Be careful about nothing; but in everything, by prayer and supplication with thanksgiving, let your requests be made known to God; @ Anăm ƀlơ̆ng bơngơ̆t kơ tơlơi hơgĕt gĕt ôh, samơ̆ amăng djŏp mơta tơlơi brơi ƀing gih yua bĕ hăng tơlơi iâu laĭ, tơlơi rơkâo kơwưh hrŏm hơbĭt hăng tơlơi bơni hơơč, pơhaih đĭ hơdôm tơlơi ƀing gih kiăng kơ Ơi Adai. 
and the peace of God, which surpasses every understanding, shall guard your hearts and your thoughts by Christ Jesus. @ Laih anŭn tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua Ơi Adai, rơgao hloh kơ abih bang tơlơi thâo hluh, či wai lăng pran jua laih anŭn tơlơi pơmĭn ƀing gih amăng Krist Yêsu.
For the rest, brethren, whatsoever things [are] true, whatsoever things [are] noble, whatsoever things [are] just, whatsoever things [are] pure, whatsoever things [are] amiable, whatsoever things [are] of good report; if [there be] any virtue and if any praise, think on these things. @ Hnal tuč, Ơ adơi ayŏng, kâo pơtă kơ ƀing gih, tơlơi hơgĕt jing sĭt, tơlơi hơgĕt năng lăp kơ pơpŭ, tơlơi hơgĕt jing tơpă, tơlơi hơgĕt jing rơgoh hiam, tơlơi hơgĕt jing năng lăp khăp kiăng, tơlơi hơgĕt hmâo tơlơi hing ang hiam, tơdah hmâo tơlơi hiam hloh, tơdah hmâo tơlơi năng lăp pơ-ư, ƀing gih khŏm pơmĭn kơ tơlơi anŭn bĕ. 
What ye have both learned, and received, and heard, and seen in me, these things do; and the God of peace shall be with you. @ Hơgĕt tơlơi ƀing gih hmâo hrăm laih, mă tŭ laih, hmư̆ laih, laih anŭn ƀuh laih amăng kâo, brơi ƀing gih ngă bĕ, laih anŭn Ơi Adai kơ tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua či dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing gih.
But I rejoiced in [the] Lord greatly, that now however at length ye have revived your thinking of me, though surely ye did also think [of me], but lacked opportunity. @ Ră anai kâo mơak biă mă amăng Khua Yang, yua kơ hnal tuč ƀing gih čơdơ̆ng hyơ̆k bơngơ̆t kơ kâo dơ̆ng, sĭt yơh ƀing gih ăt dŏ hyơ̆k bơngơ̆t kơ kâo, samơ̆ ƀing gih ƀu hmâo mông gal kiăng pơrơđah ôh. 
Not that I speak as regards privation, for as to me *I* have learnt in those circumstances in which I am, to be satisfied in myself. @ Kâo laĭ tui anŭn ƀu djơ̆ yua kơ kâo kơƀah ôh, yua kơ kâo hmâo hrăm laih hơdip hrăp pran jua hăng hơgĕt mơnơ̆ng kâo hmâo. 
I know both how to be abased and I know how to abound. In everything and in all things I am initiated both to be full and to be hungry, both to abound and to suffer privation. @ Kâo thâo hyư̆m jing tơlơi kơƀah, hyư̆m jing tơlơi rơbeh blai. Amăng djŏp anih, amăng abih bang tơlơi truh, kâo hmâo hrăm hơdră jơlan kiăng kơ hơdip, thâo dah trơi ƀôdah rơpa, thâo dah rơbeh ƀôdah kơƀah. 
I have strength for all things in him that gives me power. @ Kâo dưi ngă abih bang tơlơi yua mơ̆ng Pô pha brơi tơlơi dưi kơtang kơ kâo.
But ye have done well in taking part in my affliction. @ Amăng djŏp mơta tơlơi ƀing gih hmâo pơgop djru kâo amăng tơlơi tơnap tap, anŭn jing tơlơi ƀing gih ngă hiam yơh. 
And know also *ye*, O Philippians, that in [the] beginning of the gospel, when I came out of Macedonia, no assembly communicated [anything] to me in [the] way of giving and receiving save *ye* alone; @ Ơ ƀing Philip, ƀing gih thâo laih amăng khul hrơi tal blŭng kơ Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam, hlăk kâo đuaĭ mơ̆ng Masêđôn, gah rơngiao kơ ƀing gih, ƀu hmâo ôh Phung Sang Ơi Adai pă pơgop hrŏm hơbĭt hăng kâo amăng bruă pha brơi laih anŭn mă tŭ. 
for also in Thessalonica once and even twice ye sent to me for my need. @ Yua kơ pơ Têsalônik ƀing gih hmâo mơit laih mơnơ̆ng djru kâo sa dua wơ̆t. 
Not that I seek gift, but I seek fruit abounding to your account. @ Kâo ƀu sem hơduah mơnơ̆ng arăng pơyơr ôh; samơ̆ kâo sem hơduah boh than pơkom pioh amăng atông ƀing gih. 
But I have all things in full supply and abound; I am full, having received of Epaphroditus the things [sent] from you, an odour of sweet savour, an acceptable sacrifice, agreeable to God. @ Kâo hmâo mă tŭ djŏp laih, laih anŭn rơbeh dơ̆ng mơ̆n; kâo hmâo lu laih, yua kơ kâo hmâo mă tŭ laih mơ̆ng Êpaphôdit mơnơ̆ng ƀing gih mơit kơ kâo, jing sa mơnơ̆ng pơyơr ƀâu hiam, mơnơ̆ng ngă yang Ơi Adai tŭ ư laih anŭn bơmơak kơ Ñu. 
But my God shall abundantly supply all your need according to his riches in glory in Christ Jesus. @ Laih anŭn Ơi Adai kâo či pha brơi abih tơlơi ƀing gih kiăng tui hăng tơlơi pơdrŏng sah Ñu amăng tơlơi guh kơang amăng Krist Yêsu. 
But to our God and Father [be] glory to the ages of ages. Amen. @ Rơkâo tơlơi guh kơang lơ̆m kơ Ơi Adai jing Ama ƀing ta nanao hlŏng lar. Amen.
Salute every saint in Christ Jesus. The brethren who [are] with me salute you. @ Kơkuh tơña bĕ abih bang ƀing rơgoh hiam amăng Krist Yêsu. Ƀing adơi ayŏng dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng kâo mơit tơlơi kơkuh tơña kơ ƀing gih. 
All the saints salute you, and specially those of the household of Caesar. @ Abih bang ƀing rơgoh hiam, biă mă ñu ƀing amăng sang Sêsar, mơit tơlơi kơkuh tơña kơ ƀing gih.
The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ [be] with your spirit. Amen. @ Rơkâo tơlơi pap Khua Yang Yêsu Krist dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt bơngăt jua ƀing gih.
Paul, apostle of Christ Jesus, by God's will, and Timotheus the brother, @ Pôl, tui hăng tơlơi Ơi Adai kiăng jing khua ding kơna kơ Krist Yêsu, laih anŭn Timôthê adơi ayŏng ƀing ta, 
to the holy and faithful brethren in Christ which [are] in Colosse. Grace to you and peace from God our Father [and Lord Jesus Christ]. @ mơit kơ ƀing rơgoh hiam laih anŭn ƀing adơi ayŏng tŏng ten amăng Krist Yêsu pơ Kôlôs.
Rơkâo kơ Ơi Adai Ama ƀing ta pha brơi ƀing gih tơlơi pap laih anŭn tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua.
We give thanks to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ continually [when] praying for you, @ Tơdang iâu laĭ brơi kơ ƀing gih, gơmơi nanao bơni kơ Ơi Adai, Ama kơ Khua Yang ƀing ta jing Yêsu Krist, 
having heard of your faith in Christ Jesus, and the love which ye have towards all the saints, @ yua kơ ƀing gơmơi hmâo hmư̆ laih tơlơi đaŏ ƀing gih amăng Krist Yêsu, laih anŭn tơlơi ƀing gih khăp kơ abih bang ƀing rơgoh hiam, 
on account of the hope which [is] laid up for you in the heavens; of which ye heard before in the word of the truth of the glad tidings, @ yua kơ tơlơi čang rơmang hmâo pioh brơi laih kơ ƀing gih amăng adai. Anŭn jing tơlơi hlâo dih ƀing gih hmâo hmư̆ laih amăng boh pơhiăp tơlơi sĭt, jing Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam hmâo truh kơ ƀing gih. 
which are come to you, as [they are] in all the world, [and] are bearing fruit and growing, even as also among you, from the day ye heard [them] and knew indeed the grace of God, in truth: @ Tơlơi phrâo hiam anai hlăk hmâo boh than laih anŭn đĭ kơ prŏng amăng tar ƀar lŏn tơnah ăt kar hăng tơ̆ng krah ƀing gih mơ̆n, čơdơ̆ng mơ̆ng hrơi ƀing gih hmâo hmư̆ laih anŭn thâo hluh sĭt tơlơi Ơi Adai pap. 
even as ye learned from Epaphras our beloved fellow-bondman, who is a faithful minister of Christ for you, @ Tui hăng ƀing gih hmâo hrăm laih tơlơi anŭn mơ̆ng Êpapras, gơyut mă bruă khăp hơeng hrŏm hơbĭt ƀing gơmơi. Ñu jing ding kơna tŏng ten pơala ƀing gơmơi mă bruă kơ Yang Krist, 
who has also manifested to us your love in [the] Spirit. @ laih anŭn ñu jing pô brơi ƀing gơmơi thâo tơlơi khăp ƀing gih amăng Yang Bơngăt Hiam.
For this reason *we* also, from the day we heard [of your faith and love], do not cease praying and asking for you, to the end that ye may be filled with the full knowledge of his will, in all wisdom and spiritual understanding, @ Yua kơ anŭn yơh, mơ̆ng hrơi gơmơi hmâo hmư̆ tơlơi anŭn, gơmơi ƀu pơdơi ôh iâu laĭ brơi kơ ƀing gih, rơkâo kơ Ơi Adai pơbă ƀing gih hăng tơlơi thâo krăn tơlơi Ñu kiăng amăng abih bang tơlơi kơhnâo laih anŭn tơlơi thâo hluh gah bơngăt, 
[so as] to walk worthily of the Lord unto all well-pleasing, bearing fruit in every good work, and growing by the true knowledge of God; @ kiăng kơ ƀing gih hơdip năng lăp kơ Khua Yang, bơmơak kơ Ñu amăng abih bang tơlơi, hmâo boh than amăng abih bang bruă hiam, prŏng tui amăng tơlơi thâo krăn Ơi Adai dơ̆ng. 
strengthened with all power according to the might of his glory unto all endurance and longsuffering with joy; @ Kơnang tơlơi dưi mơyang guh kơang Ơi Adai pơkơtang ƀing gih hăng abih tơlơi dưi kơtang, kiăng kơ ƀing gih dưi hmâo tơlơi gir tŭ abih bang tơlơi hăng tơlơi hơ̆k mơak, 
giving thanks to the Father, who has made us fit for sharing the portion of the saints in light, @ laih anŭn bơni kơ Ơi Adai Ama, Pô hmâo ngă brơi kơ ƀing ta năng lăp dưi tŭ mă kong ngăn ƀing rơgoh hiam amăng tơlơi bơngač.
