who has delivered us from the authority of darkness, and translated [us] into the kingdom of the Son of his love: @ Ñu hmâo pơklaih laih ƀing ta mơ̆ng tơlơi dưi kơtang kơ tơlơi kơnăm mơmŏt, laih anŭn atăt ba ƀing ta pơ dêh čar pơtao Ană Ñu khăp hơeng biă mă. 
in whom we have redemption, the forgiveness of sins; @ Amăng Ană Ñu ƀing ta hmâo tơlơi song mă, jing tơlơi pap brơi kơ tơlơi soh.
who is image of the invisible God, firstborn of all creation; @ Ñu pô jing rup kơ Ơi Adai arăng ƀu thâo ƀuh ôh, jing Pô tơkeng hlâo hloh kơ abih bang mơnơ̆ng hmâo hrih laih. 
because by him were created all things, the things in the heavens and the things upon the earth, the visible and the invisible, whether thrones, or lordships, or principalities, or authorities: all things have been created by him and for him. @ Yua kơ amăng Ñu Ơi Adai hmâo hrih laih abih bang mơnơ̆ng amăng adai, ƀơi lŏn tơnah, mơnơ̆ng thâo ƀuh ƀôdah mơnơ̆ng ƀu thâo ƀuh ôh, ƀôdah gre pơtao, ƀôdah tơlơi dưi kơtang, ƀôdah ƀing khua wai lăng, ƀôdah ƀing hmâo tơlơi dưi. Abih bang mơnơ̆ng leng kơ hmâo hrih laih mơ̆ng Ñu laih anŭn pioh kơ Ñu. 
And *he* is before all, and all things subsist together by him. @ Ñu jing Pô hlâo hloh kơ abih bang mơnơ̆ng, laih anŭn abih bang mơnơ̆ng ăt dŏ kơjăp amăng Ñu. 
And *he* is the head of the body, the assembly; who is [the] beginning, firstborn from among the dead, that *he* might have the first place in all things: @ Ñu jing akŏ kơ drơi jan, kiăng laĭ Phung Sang Ơi Adai. Ñu jing čơdơ̆ng phŭn, jing Pô tơkeng blŭng hlâo kơ ƀing djai, kiăng kơ Ñu dưi dŏ ƀơi anih hlâo hloh kơ abih bang amăng abih bang tơlơi. 
for in him all the fulness [of the Godhead] was pleased to dwell, @ Yua kơ Ơi Adai hmâo hơ̆k mơak pioh abih bang tơlơi bă tum Ơi Adai dŏ amăng Ñu, 
and by him to reconcile all things to itself, having made peace by the blood of his cross by him, whether the things on the earth or the things in the heavens. @ laih anŭn mơ̆ng Krist, Ơi Adai hmâo pơsir glaĭ laih Ñu pô hăng abih bang mơnơ̆ng, yua kơ mơ̆ng drah Ană Ñu ƀơi kơyâo bơrơkal ba glaĭ tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua kơ abih bang mơnơ̆ng ƀơi lŏn tơnah wơ̆t amăng adai.
And you, who once were alienated and enemies in mind by wicked works, yet now has it reconciled @ Bơ kơ ƀing gih hlâo dih dŏ ataih mơ̆ng Ơi Adai, laih anŭn ayăt hăng Ñu amăng tơlơi pơmĭn laih anŭn bruă ngă soh sat gih. 
in the body of his flesh through death; to present you holy and unblamable and irreproachable before it, @ Samơ̆ ră anai Ơi Adai hmâo pơsir glaĭ laih hăng ƀing gih mơ̆ng tơlơi Krist djai amăng drơi jan asar đeh, kiăng pơrơđah ƀing gih ƀơi anăp Ñu hăng tơlơi rơgoh hiam, ƀu hmâo gru rơka, ƀu hmâo tơlơi arăng dưi ƀuah ƀơi anăp Ñu; 
if indeed ye abide in the faith founded and firm, and not moved away from the hope of the glad tidings, which ye have heard, which have been proclaimed in the whole creation which [is] under heaven, of which *I* Paul became minister. @ tŭ kơ ƀing gih ăt dŏ kơjăp nanao amăng tơlơi đaŏ, ƀu pơpư̆ pơgơi, ƀu tơpleh đuaĭ mơ̆ng tơlơi čang rơmang kơ Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam ƀing gih hmâo hmư̆ laih, jing Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam hmâo pơtô laih kơ abih bang mơnuih gah yŭ adai; laih anŭn kâo, Pôl, jing hĭ laih mơnuih mă bruă kơ Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam anŭn.
Now, I rejoice in sufferings for you, and I fill up that which is behind of the tribulations of Christ in my flesh, for his body, which is the assembly; @ Ră anai kâo hơ̆k mơak amăng tơlơi tơnap tap yua kơ ƀing gih, laih anŭn ăt yua kơ drơi jan Ñu, jing Phung Sang Ơi Adai, ba drơi jan kâo ngă pơgiơ̆ng hĭ črăn dŏ glaĭ amăng tơlơi tơnap tap Yang Krist. 
of which *I* became minister, according to the dispensation of God which [is] given me towards you to complete the word of God, @ Kâo hmâo jing hĭ mơnuih mă bruă kơ Phung Sang Ơi Adai, tui hăng bruă Ơi Adai hmâo jao laih kơ kâo kiăng pơtô boh pơhiăp Ñu kơ ƀing gih hăng tơlơi tum num, 
the mystery which [has been] hidden from ages and from generations, but has now been made manifest to his saints; @ jing tơlơi yom hơgơ̆m hmâo pơdŏp hĭ amăng lu rơnŭk mơnuih laih anŭn khul djuai mơnuih, samơ̆ ră anai hmâo pơrơđah brơi kơ ƀing rơgoh hiam Ñu. 
to whom God would make known what are the riches of the glory of this mystery among the nations, which is Christ in you the hope of glory: @ Yua kơ Ơi Adai kiăng ƀing rơgoh hiam Ñu pơrơđah tơlơi pơdrŏng sah laih anŭn tơlơi guh kơang kơ tơlơi yom hơgơ̆m anai tơ̆ng krah ƀing djuai tuai hyư̆m ñu jing, anŭn jing Yang Krist dŏ amăng ƀing gih, jing tơlơi čang rơmang guh kơang. 
whom *we* announce, admonishing every man, and teaching every man, in all wisdom, to the end that we may present every man perfect in Christ. @ Ñu yơh jing Pô ƀing gơmơi pơtô. Ƀing gơmơi yua abih bang tơlơi kơhnâo kiăng khă pơgăn abih bang mơnuih, pơtô pơhrăm abih bang mơnuih, kiăng ba pơrơđah abih bang mơnuih hăng tơlơi tum num amăng Yang Krist. 
Whereunto also I toil, combating according to his working, which works in me in power. @ Yua kơ tơlơi anai yơh kâo tuh yuh hăng abih pran jua mă bruă laih anŭn pơblah hăng abih bang tơlơi dưi kơtang Ñu hmâo mă bruă kơtang tĭt amăng kâo.
For I would have you know what combat I have for you, and those in Laodicea, and as many as have not seen my face in flesh; @ Kâo kiăng kơ ƀing gih thâo hyư̆m tơlơi tơnap tap kâo hmâo pơblah yua kơ ƀing gih, yua kơ ƀing mơnuih dŏ pơ Laôdisê, laih anŭn yua kơ abih bang ƀing aka ƀuh ƀô̆ mơta kâo ôh gah asar đeh. 
to the end that their hearts may be encouraged, being united together in love, and unto all riches of the full assurance of understanding, to [the] full knowledge of the mystery of God; @ Kiăng kơ gơñu hmâo tơlơi pơtrŭt pơđĭ pran jua, pơgop pơlir amăng tơlơi khăp, laih anŭn dưi hmâo tơlơi thâo hluh rơbeh blai laih anŭn klă sĭt kiăng kơ thâo krăn tơlơi yom hơgơ̆m Ơi Adai, jing Yang Krist, 
in which are hid all the treasures of wisdom and of knowledge. @ amăng Ñu pơdŏp abih bang dram gơnam yom kơ tơlơi kơhnâo laih anŭn tơlơi thâo hluh. 
And I say this to the end that no one may delude you by persuasive speech. @ Kâo laĭ tơlơi anai kiăng kơ ƀu hmâo hlơi yua tơlơi pơrơjah pơgăl hưč mơak kiăng plư pleč ƀing gih. 
For if indeed in the flesh I am absent, yet I am with you in spirit, rejoicing and seeing your order, and the firmness of your faith in Christ. @ Yua kơ wơ̆t dah drơi jan kâo rơkut, samơ̆ bơngăt jua kâo ăt dŏ hrŏm hăng ƀing gih, laih anŭn hơ̆k mơak biă mă ƀuh ƀing gih hmâo tơlơi thâo piăt laih anŭn tơlơi ƀing gih đaŏ kơjăp kơ Krist.
As therefore ye have received the Christ, Jesus the Lord, walk in him, @ Hnŭn yơh, kar hăng ƀing gih hmâo mă tŭ laih Yang Krist Yêsu jing Khua Yang hyư̆m pă, brơi ƀing gih rơbat nao amăng Ñu kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n; 
rooted and built up in him, and assured in the faith, even as ye have been taught, abounding in it with thanksgiving. @ čăt akha bĕ, pơdơ̆ng atur amăng Ñu, kơtang bĕ amăng tơlơi đaŏ kar hăng ƀing gih hmâo hrăm laih, laih anŭn rơbeh blai amăng tơlơi bơni hơơč.
See that there be no one who shall lead *you* away as a prey through philosophy and vain deceit, according to the teaching of men, according to the elements of the world, and not according to Christ. @ Răng bĕ, anăm brơi arăng plư ƀing gih hăng tơlơi hrăm thâo lu laih anŭn hăng boh pơhiăp plư đôč đač, tui hăng tơlơi phiăn ană mơnuih, tui hăng bơngăt yang lŏn tơnah, ƀu djơ̆ tui hăng Yang Krist ôh. 
For in him dwells all the fulness of the Godhead bodily; @ Yua kơ tơlơi bă tum kơnuih mơyang dŏ amăng drơi jan asar Yang Krist, 
and ye are complete in him, who is the head of all principality and authority, @ laih anŭn ƀing gih hmâo mă tŭ laih tơlơi bă tum amăng Ñu, Ñu jing akŏ kơ abih bang tơlơi dưi wai lăng laih anŭn tơlơi dưi kơtang. 
in whom also ye have been circumcised with circumcision not done by hand, in the putting off of the body of the flesh, in the circumcision of the Christ; @ Amăng Ñu ƀing gih ăt mă tŭ laih tơlơi khăt klĭ, ƀu djơ̆ tơlơi khăt klĭ hăng tơngan mơnuih ôh, samơ̆ tơlơi khăt klĭ mơ̆ng Yang Krist, jing tơlơi toh lui hĭ kơnuih asar đeh ƀing ta. 
buried with him in baptism, in which ye have been also raised with [him] through faith of the working of God who raised him from among the dead. @ Hăng tơlơi ƀatem arăng hmâo dơr laih ƀing gih hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Krist, laih anŭn ƀing gih ăt hơdip glaĭ laih hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Ñu mơ̆ng tơlơi đaŏ ƀơi tơlơi dưi mơyang Ơi Adai, Pô hmâo pơhơdip glaĭ laih Ñu mơ̆ng ƀing djai. 
And you, being dead in offences and in the uncircumcision of your flesh, he has quickened together with him, having forgiven us all the offences; @ Hlâo adih ƀing gih djai laih yua kơ tơlơi soh laih anŭn asar đeh ƀu khăt klĭ, Ơi Adai hmâo pơhơdip glaĭ laih ƀing gih hrŏm hăng Yang Krist. Ñu hmâo pap brơi laih tơlơi soh ƀing ta. 
having effaced the handwriting in ordinances which [stood out] against us, which was contrary to us, he has taken it also out of the way, having nailed it to the cross; @ Ñu hmâo lơ̆m hĭ laih hră hơnưh hrŏm hơbĭt hăng tơlơi juăt akă đom ƀing ta, tơlơi juăt anŭn pơkơdơ̆ng hăng ƀing ta, samơ̆ Ñu lơ̆m hĭ tơlơi juăt anŭn hăng tơlơi Ñu pơ̆ng hĭ ñu ƀơi kơyâo bơrơkal. 
having spoiled principalities and authorities, he made a show of them publicly, leading them in triumph by it. @ Ñu hmâo mă lui hĭ khul tơlơi dưi wai lăng, khul tơlơi dưi kơtang. Ñu yua kơyâo bơrơkal dưi hĭ hăng ƀing gơñu, laih anŭn pơmlâo ƀing gơñu ƀơi tơ̆ng krah ană mơnuih.
Let none therefore judge you in meat or in drink, or in matter of feast, or new moon, or sabbaths, @  Yua kơ anŭn yơh, anăm brơi arăng phat kơđi ƀing gih yua kơ mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng mơñum ôh, ƀôdah yua kơ hrơi phĕt, hrơi blan mơda, ƀôdah hrơi saƀat. 
which are a shadow of things to come; but the body [is] of Christ. @ Khul tơlơi anŭn kơnơ̆ng jing tơ-u kơ khul tơlơi či truh đôč; samơ̆ rup sĭt jing Yang Krist. 
Let no one fraudulently deprive you of your prize, doing his own will in humility and worship of angels, entering into things which he has not seen, vainly puffed up by the mind of his flesh, @ Anăm brơi ƀing gir ngă mă tơlơi luă gŭ laih anŭn kơkuh kơ ƀing ling jang adai pơplơ̆m kơ ƀing gih hwĭ kơ ƀing gih rơngiă hĭ pri. Gơñu kơnang kơ khul tơlơi pơƀuh phara, mơ̆ng tơlơi pơmĭn asar đeh pơgao ƀu hmâo tơhnal ôh. 
and not holding fast the head, from whom all the body, ministered to and united together by the joints and bands, increases with the increase of God. @ Gơñu ƀu lir pơgop kơjăp hăng Akŏ ôh, kiăng kơ mơ̆ng Ñu abih drơi jan hmâo tơlơi čem rong, dưi pơgop hrŏm hơbĭt hăng khul atŭt klang pơtŏ, hrĕ lir akă, laih anŭn đĭ kơ prŏng tui hăng tơlơi Ơi Adai kiăng.
If ye have died with Christ from the elements of the world, why as [if] alive in [the] world do ye subject yourselves to ordinances? @ Tơdah ƀing gih hmâo djai laih hrŏm hăng Yang Krist, klaih laih mơ̆ng khul bơngăt yang lŏn tơnah, yua hơgĕt ƀing gih ăt dŏ hơdip kar hăng ƀing gih ăt dŏ lơ̆m kơ lŏn tơnah? Yua hơgĕt ăt dŏ gưt khul tơlơi phiăn lŏn tơnah: 
Do not handle, do not taste, do not touch, @ “Anăm mă,” “Anăm liah,” “Anăm ruaih,” 
(things which are all for destruction in the using [of them]:) according to the injunctions and teachings of men, @ abih bang khul tơlơi anŭn leng kơ răm rai tơdah hmâo yua laih ñu? Gơñu kơnơ̆ng jing khul tơlơi phiăn laih anŭn tơlơi pơtô mơ̆ng ană mơnuih đôč. 
(which have indeed an appearance of wisdom in voluntary worship, and humility, and harsh treatment of the body, not in a certain honour,) to [the] satisfaction of the flesh. @ Sĭt yơh khul tơlơi anŭn, gah rơngiao rŏ dah jing kơhnâo yua kơ kơkuh pơpŭ tui hăng tơlơi ta pô kiăng, hrŏm hơbĭt hăng tơlơi pơluă gŭ, laih anŭn tơlơi ngă pơtơnap kơ drơi jan, samơ̆ ƀu hmâo nua yom ôh amăng bruă khă kơ̆ng tơlơi amoaih hưp asar đeh.
If therefore ye have been raised with the Christ, seek the things [which are] above, where the Christ is, sitting at [the] right hand of God: @  Tui anŭn yơh, tơdah ƀing gih hơdip glaĭ laih hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Yang Krist, hơduah sem bĕ khul mơnơ̆ng amăng adai jing anih Yang Krist dŏ ber gah hơnuă kơ Ơi Adai. 
have your mind on the things [that are] above, not on the things [that are] on the earth; @ Khăp pơmĭn bĕ kơ khul mơnơ̆ng amăng adai, ƀu djơ̆ kơ mơnơ̆ng ƀơi lŏn tơnah ôh. 
for ye have died, and your life is hid with the Christ in God. @ Yua kơ ƀing gih djai laih, laih anŭn tơlơi hơdip ƀing gih pơdŏp laih hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Yang Krist amăng Ơi Adai. 
When the Christ is manifested who [is] our life, then shall *ye* also be manifested with him in glory. @ Tơ Yang Krist, jing tơlơi hơdip ƀing gih, hmâo pơrơđah rai, hlăk anŭn ƀing gih ăt či pơrơđah hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Ñu mơ̆n amăng tơlơi guh kơang.
Put to death therefore your members which [are] upon the earth, fornication, uncleanness, vile passions, evil lust, and unbridled desire, which is idolatry. @ Tui anŭn, pơdjai hĭ bĕ khul tơlơi amoaih kiăng lŏn tơnah dŏ amăng ƀing gih kar hăng: tơlơi rih răm, tơlơi hơƀak drak, tơlơi amoaih hưp, tơlơi kiăng sat răm, tơlơi hưp ham; yua kơ tơlơi hưp ham jing sa tơlơi kơkuh kơ rup trah. 
On account of which things the wrath of God comes upon the sons of disobedience. @ Yua kơ khul tơlơi anai yơh tơlơi Ơi Adai hil či tuh trŭn ƀơi ƀing mơnuih ƀu thâo gưt hiăp Ñu. 
In which *ye* also once walked when ye lived in these things. @ Hlâo adih ƀing gih ăt jing kar anŭn mơ̆n hlăk ƀing gih dŏ hơdip amăng tơlơi anŭn. 
But now, put off, *ye* also, all [these] things, wrath, anger, malice, blasphemy, vile language out of your mouth. @ Samơ̆ ră anai lui hĭ bĕ abih bang khul tơlơi anŭn: tơlơi hil, tơlơi kreñ, tơlơi sat ƀai, tơlơi pơhiăp pơgao hmiah, laih anŭn tơlơi pơhiăp di mri mơ̆ng amăng bah ƀing gih, 
Do not lie to one another, having put off the old man with his deeds, @ Anăm pơhiăp ƀlor tơdruă ƀing gih ôh, yua kơ ƀing gih toh lui hĭ laih mơnuih hơđăp wơ̆t hăng khul bruă ñu, 
and having put on the new, renewed into full knowledge according to [the] image of him that has created him; @ laih anŭn buh mă mơnuih phrâo, jing mơnuih hlăk dŏ pơplih phrâo amăng tơlơi thâo hluh, tui hăng rup Pô hrih pơjing ñu. 
wherein there is not Greek and Jew, circumcision and uncircumcision, barbarian, Scythian, bondman, freeman; but Christ [is] everything, and in all. @ Amăng mơnuih phrâo anai, ƀu pơkah ôh ƀing mơnuih Grek ƀôdah ƀing mơnuih Yuđa, mơnuih khăt klĭ ƀôdah mơnuih ƀu khăt klĭ, mơnuih sat hơtai, mơnuih Sythe, mơnuih hlŭn, mơnuih rơngai, samơ̆ Yang Krist jing abih bang laih anŭn amăng abih bang.
Put on therefore, as [the] elect of God, holy and beloved, bowels of compassion, kindness, lowliness, meekness, longsuffering; @  Tui anŭn yua kơ ƀing gih jing ƀing Ơi Adai hmâo ruah laih, jing ƀing rơgoh hiam laih anŭn ƀing Ơi Adai khăp hơeng biă mă, buh mă bĕ pran jua thâo pap, tơlơi hiam klă, tơlơi luă gŭ, tơlơi tơdu rơun, laih anŭn tơlơi gir tŭ. 
forbearing one another, and forgiving one another, if any should have a complaint against any; even as the Christ has forgiven you, so also [do] *ye*. @ Gir tŭ bĕ tơdruă ƀing gih, laih anŭn tơdah sa čô hmâo brŏk ƀuah hăng pô pơkŏn, pơpap brơi bĕ kơ tơdruă ƀing gih. Kar hăng Khua Yang hmâo pap brơi laih kơ ƀing gih, brơi ƀing gih khŏm pap brơi kơ tơdruă kar kaĭ mơ̆n.
And to all these [add] love, which is the bond of perfectness. @ Samơ̆ hloh kơ abih bang khul tơlơi anai, khŏm buh mă tơlơi khăp, yua kơ ñu jing hrĕ akă lir kơ tơlơi klă tum. 
And let the peace of Christ preside in your hearts, to which also ye have been called in one body, and be thankful. @ Brơi tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua Yang Krist wai lăng amăng pran jua ƀing gih bĕ, kơ tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua Ơi Adai hmâo iâu laih ƀing gih jing sa amăng drơi jan. Laih anŭn ƀing gih khŏm thâo hơdơr tơngia. 
Let the word of the Christ dwell in you richly, in all wisdom teaching and admonishing one another, in psalms, hymns, spiritual songs, singing with grace in your hearts to God. @ Kar kaĭ mơ̆n brơi boh pơhiăp Yang Krist dŏ bă blai amăng pran jua ƀing gih, pơtô laih anŭn ƀuah pơkra bĕ tơdruă ƀing gih hăng abih tơlơi kơhnâo, yua adoh tơlơi adoh hơđăp, tơlơi adoh rơgoh hiam, tơlơi adoh gah bơngăt kiăng kơ adoh bơni hơơč kơ Ơi Adai hăng pran jua thâo bơni. 
And everything, whatever ye may do in word or in deed, [do] all things in [the] name of [the] Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God the Father by him. @ Laih anŭn hơgĕt bruă ƀing gih ngă, amăng tơlơi pơhiăp ƀôdah bruă ngă, ngă bĕ abih bang amăng anăn Khua Yang Yêsu, laih anŭn kơnang kơ Ñu ƀing ta bơni hơơč kơ Ơi Adai, jing Ama.
Wives, be subject to [your] husbands, as is fitting in [the] Lord. @  Ơ ƀing jing bơnai, gưt bĕ kơ rơkơi ƀing gih, anŭn jing tơlơi gal djơ̆ kơ ƀing mơnuih dŏ amăng Khua Yang.
Husbands, love your wives, and be not bitter against them. @  Ơ ƀing jing rơkơi, khăp bĕ kơ bơnai ƀing gih, anăm hơdip kreñ phĭ hăng ñu ôh.
Children, obey your parents in all things, for this is well-pleasing in [the] Lord. @  Ơ ƀing jing ană, gưt bĕ kơ amĭ ama ƀing gih amăng abih bang tơlơi, yua kơ tơlơi anai bơmơak kơ Khua Yang.
Fathers, do not vex your children, to the end that they be not disheartened. @  Ơ ƀing jing ama, anăm pơčôih ƀing ană bă ƀing gih ôh, hwĭ kơ ƀing gơñu hơtah hơtai.
Bondmen, obey in all things your masters according to flesh; not with eye-services, as men-pleasers, but in simplicity of heart, fearing the Lord. @  Ơ ƀing hlŭn, gưt bĕ kơ khua ƀing gih ƀơi lŏn tơnah amăng abih bang tơlơi, ƀu djơ̆ kơnơ̆ng gưt asăp ƀơi anăp gơñu đôč ôh, kar hăng ƀing gir ngă bơmơak kơ mơnuih, samơ̆ yua kơ hwĭ pơpŭ kơ Khua Yang, gưt asăp hăng pran jua tơpă sĭt. 
Whatsoever ye do, labour at it heartily, as [doing it] to the Lord, and not to men; @ Djŏp mơta bruă ƀing gih ngă, ngă bĕ hăng abih pran jua, kar hăng ngă kơ Khua Yang, ƀu djơ̆ ngă kơ ană mơnuih ôh. 
knowing that of [the] Lord ye shall receive the recompense of the inheritance; ye serve the Lord Christ. @ Yua kơ ƀing gih thâo laih ƀing gih či mă tŭ pri jing kong ngăn mơ̆ng Khua Yang brơi. Ƀing gih hlăk dŏ mă bruă kơ Yang Krist jing Khua Yang. 
For he that does a wrong shall receive the wrong he has done, and there is no respect of persons. @ Yua kơ hlơi pô ngă tơlơi ƀu djơ̆ ñu či mă tŭ tơlơi ƀu djơ̆ tui hăng tơlơi ñu hmâo ngă laih, ƀu hmâo tơlơi pơkah phara hlơi hlơi ôh.
Masters, give to bondmen what is just and fair, knowing that *ye* also have a Master in [the] heavens. @  Ơ ƀing jing khua, ngă bĕ tơlơi gal djơ̆ laih anŭn tơlơi tơpă hơnơ̆ng hăng ƀing hlŭn ƀing gih, yua kơ ƀing gih thâo laih ƀing gih ăt hmâo sa čô Khua amăng adai.
Persevere in prayer, watching in it with thanksgiving; @ Brơi ƀing gih gir amăng tơlơi iâu laĭ hăng abih pran jua, dŏ kơčăng amăng tơlơi iâu laĭ laih anŭn bơni hơơč. 
praying at the same time for us also, that God may open to us a door of the word to speak the mystery of Christ, on account of which also I am bound, @ Iâu laĭ brơi wơ̆t kơ ƀing gơmơi kar kaĭ mơ̆n, rơkâo kơ Ơi Adai pŏk bah amăng kơ ƀing gơmơi dưi pơtô boh pơhiăp Ñu, kiăng pơhaih tơlơi yom hơgơ̆m Yang Krist, yua kơ tơlơi anŭn arăng hmâo krư̆ kâo. 
to the end that I may make it manifest as I ought to speak. @ Iâu laĭ bĕ kiăng kơ kâo dưi pơrơđah tơlơi yom hơgơ̆m anŭn hăng tơlơi klă rơđah tui hăng tơlơi djơ̆ kơ kâo khŏm pơhiăp.
Walk in wisdom towards those without, redeeming opportunities. @  Brơi ƀing gih dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă hăng tơlơi kơhnâo ƀơi anăp ƀing ƀu đaŏ, laih anŭn thâo mơneč yua hrơi mông. 
[Let] your word [be] always with grace, seasoned with salt, [so as] to know how ye ought to answer each one. @ Boh pơhiăp ƀing gih nanao khŏm klă djrưng, laih anŭn buh thim hra, kiăng kơ ƀing gih thâo hyư̆m ƀing gih či laĭ glaĭ kơ rĭm čô mơnuih.
Tychicus, the beloved brother and faithful minister and fellow-bondman in [the] Lord, will make known to you all that concerns me; @   Tisik či ră brơi kơ ƀing gih thâo abih tơlơi truh kơ kâo. Ñu jing adơi ayŏng ƀing gơmơi khăp hơeng, ding kơna tŏng ten laih anŭn gơyut mă bruă hrŏm hơbĭt hăng kâo amăng Khua Yang. 
whom I have sent to you for this very purpose, that he might know your state, and that he might encourage your hearts: @ Yua kơ tơlơi anai yơh kâo hmâo pơkiaŏ nao ñu pơ ƀing gih, kiăng kơ ƀing gih dưi thâo hyư̆m gơmơi jing, laih anŭn kiăng kơ ñu dưi pơtrŭt pơđĭ pran jua ƀing gih. 
with Onesimus, the faithful and beloved brother, who is [one] of you. They shall make known to you everything here. @ Nao hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ñu hmâo Ônêsim, adơi ayŏng tŏng ten laih anŭn pô gơmơi khăp hơeng, ñu jing sa čô mơnuih mơ̆ng ƀing gih mơ̆n. Gơñu či laĭ brơi kơ ƀing gih thâo abih bang tơlơi hmâo truh pơ anai.
Aristarchus my fellow-captive salutes you, and Mark, Barnabas's cousin, concerning whom ye have received orders, (if he come to you, receive him,) @  Aristark, jing gơyut mơnă hrŏm hơbĭt hăng kâo mơit tơlơi čuă ngui kơ ƀing gih, wơ̆t Markôs, adơi ayŏng phung wang Barnabas kar kaĭ mơ̆n. Kơ Markôs, ƀing gih hmâo laih tơlơi pơtă; tơdah ñu truh pơ ƀing gih, tŭ jum ñu hiam hŏ, 
and Jesus called Justus, who are of the circumcision. These [are the] only fellow-workers for the kingdom of God who have been a consolation to me. @ Yêsu arăng pơanăn Justus ăt mơit tơlơi čuă ngui hăng ƀing gih. Amăng ƀing mơnuih khăt klĭ, kơnơ̆ng ƀing anai yơh mă bruă hrŏm hơbĭt hăng kâo kơ dêh čar pơtao Ơi Adai, laih anŭn gơñu jing tơlơi pơalum kơ kâo.
Epaphras, who is [one] of you, [the] bondman of Christ Jesus, salutes you, always combating earnestly for you in prayers, to the end that ye may stand perfect and complete in all [the] will of God. @  Êpapras, ñu jing sa čô mơnuih mơ̆ng ƀing gih mơ̆n, sa čô ding kơna Yang Krist Yêsu, mơit tơlơi čuă ngui hăng ƀing gih. Ñu pơblah nanao amăng tơlơi iâu laĭ yua kơ ƀing gih, kiăng kơ ƀing gih tha truh laih anŭn pơgiơ̆ng abih bang tơlơi Ơi Adai kiăng. 
For I bear him witness that he labours much for you, and them in Laodicea, and them in Hierapolis. @ Yua kơ kâo ngă gơ̆ng jơlan pơsĭt brơi kơ ñu, ñu hmâo mă bruă gleh biă mă kơ ƀing gih laih anŭn yua kơ ƀing mơnuih Laôdisê laih anŭn ƀing mơnuih pơ Hierapôlis. 
Luke, the beloved physician, salutes you, and Demas. @ Luk, ơi ia jrao, pô ƀing gơmơi khăp hơeng, laih anŭn Dêmas mơit tơlơi čuă ngui hăng ƀing gih.
Salute the brethren in Laodicea, and Nymphas, and the assembly which [is] in his house. @ Mơit bĕ tơlơi kâo čuă ngui hăng ƀing adơi ayŏng pơ Laôdisê, laih anŭn hăng HʼNimpas laih anŭn hăng Phung Sang Ơi Adai bơjơnum amăng sang ñu. 
And when the letter has been read among you, cause that it be read also in the assembly of Laodiceans, and that *ye* also read that from Laodicea. @ Tơ ƀing gih đŏk hră anai tơ̆ng krah ƀing adơi ayŏng, brơi ƀing gih đŏk hră anai amăng Phung Sang Ơi Adai pơ Laôdisê kar kaĭ mơ̆n; laih anŭn brơi ƀing gih ăt lăng mơ̆n hră mơ̆ng Laôdisê. 
And say to Archippus, Take heed to the ministry which thou hast received in [the] Lord, to the end that thou fulfil it. @ Laih anŭn, laĭ bĕ hăng Arčip: “Khŏm ih răng laih anŭn pơgiơ̆ng bruă mă ih hmâo mă tŭ laih mơ̆ng Khua Yang.”
The salutation by the hand of me Paul. Remember my bonds. Grace [be] with you. @ Kâo Pôl, hăng tơngan kâo pô čih boh pơhiăp čuă ngui anai. Hơdơr bĕ hrĕ čuăk arăng akă kâo. Rơkâo tơlơi pap Ơi Adai dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing gih.
Paul and Silvanus and Timotheus to the assembly of Thessalonians in God [the] Father and [the] Lord Jesus Christ. Grace to you and peace. @  Pôl, Silwan, laih anŭn Timôthê. Čih mơit kơ Phung Sang Ơi Adai pơ Têsalônik dŏ amăng Ơi Adai, Ama laih anŭn amăng Yêsu Krist jing Khua Yang. Rơkâo tơlơi pap laih anŭn tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing gih.
We give thanks to God always for you all, making mention of you at our prayers, @ Ƀing gơmơi nanao bơni kơ Ơi Adai yua kơ abih bang ƀing gih, laih anŭn hơdơr nanao kơ ƀing gih amăng tơlơi gơmơi iâu laĭ. 
remembering unceasingly your work of faith, and labour of love, and enduring constancy of hope, of our Lord Jesus Christ, before our God and Father; @ Ƀơi anăp Ơi Adai, Ama ƀing ta, ƀing gơmơi hơdơr bruă tơlơi đaŏ ƀing gih, bruă gleh glăn kơ tơlơi khăp ƀing gih, laih anŭn tơlơi ƀing gih gir run amăng tơlơi čang rơmang amăng Khua Yang ƀing ta Yêsu Krist. 
knowing, brethren beloved by God, your election. @ Ơ adơi ayŏng jing ƀing mơnuih khăp hơeng kơ Ơi Adai, gơmơi thâo Ơi Adai hmâo ruah laih ƀing gih, 
For our glad tidings were not with you in word only, but also in power, and in [the] Holy Spirit, and in much assurance; even as ye know what we were among you for your sakes: @ yua kơ Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam ƀing gơmơi hmâo pơtô truh laih pơ ƀing gih, ƀu djơ̆ kơnơ̆ng hăng boh pơhiăp đôč ôh, samơ̆ wơ̆t hăng tơlơi dưi mơyang, hăng Yang Bơngăt Hiam, laih anŭn hăng abih tơlơi thâo klă. Ƀing gih thâo klă tơdang gơmơi ăt dŏ tơ̆ng krah ƀing gih, hyư̆m ƀing gơmơi hmâo hơdip laih yua kơ ƀing gih, 
and *ye* became our imitators, and of the Lord, having accepted the word in much tribulation with joy of [the] Holy Spirit, @ laih anŭn ƀing gih jing laih ƀing hla tui ƀing gơmơi laih anŭn hla tui Khua Yang. Yua kơ ƀing gih hmâo tŭ jum laih boh pơhiăp wơ̆t dah tơ̆ng krah lu tơlơi tơnap tap hăng tơlơi hơ̆k mơak mơ̆ng Yang Bơngăt Hiam; 
so that ye became models to all that believe in Macedonia and in Achaia: @ yua kơ anŭn yơh, ƀing gih jing hĭ laih sa hnal pơhmô hiam brơi kơ abih bang ƀing đaŏ amăng čar Masêđôn laih anŭn čar Akai. 
for the word of the Lord sounded out from you, not only in Macedonia and Achaia, but in every place your faith which [is] towards God has gone abroad, so that we have no need to say anything; @ Yua kơ arăng hmâo hmư̆ hing laih boh pơhiăp Khua Yang mơ̆ng ƀing gih, ƀu djơ̆ kơnơ̆ng amăng čar Masêđôn laih anŭn čar Akai đôč ôh, samơ̆ tơlơi đaŏ ƀing gih amăng Ơi Adai hmâo lar hyu tar ƀar anih laih, tơl ƀu yom ôh kơ gơmơi ră ruai dơ̆ng. 
for they themselves relate concerning us what entering in we had to you, and how ye turned to God from idols to serve a living and true God, @ Yua kơ ƀing gơñu pô hmâo ruai glaĭ tơlơi ƀing gih hmâo tŭ jum ƀing gơmơi, laih anŭn hyư̆m ƀing gih hmâo lui hĭ rup trah wơ̆t glaĭ hăng Ơi Adai, kiăng mă bruă kơ Ơi Adai hơdip laih anŭn sĭt, 
and to await his Son from the heavens, whom he raised from among the dead, Jesus, our deliverer from the coming wrath. @ laih anŭn kiăng kơ dŏ tơguan Ană Ñu mơ̆ng adai, jing Yêsu, Pô Ñu hmâo pơhơdip glaĭ laih mơ̆ng ƀing djai, jing Pô pơklaih ƀing ta mơ̆ng tơlơi hil či truh.
For ye know yourselves, brethren, our entering in which [we had] to you, that it has not been in vain; @ Ơ adơi ayŏng, ƀing gih pô thâo laih bruă ƀing gơmơi nao pơ ƀing gih ƀu jing đôč đač ôh. 
but, having suffered before and been insulted, even as ye know, in Philippi, we were bold in our God to speak unto you the glad tidings of God with much earnest striving. @ Samơ̆ kar hăng ƀing gih thâo laih, wơ̆t dah hmâo tŭ tơlơi tơnap tap, laih anŭn tơlơi arăng ngă sat, tơlơi pơmlâo hañ pơ Philip, ƀing gơmơi ăt dŏ khĭn amăng Ơi Adai kiăng kơ ră ruai Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam Ñu kơ ƀing gih ƀơi tơ̆ng krah lu tơlơi pơkơdơ̆ng. 
For our exhortation [was] not of deceit, nor of uncleanness, nor in guile; @ Yua kơ tơlơi ƀing gơmơi pơtô pơtrŭt ƀu tơbiă rai mơ̆ng tơlơi soh glaĭ ôh, kŏn hmâo tơlơi pơmĭn soh sat ƀôdah kiăng plư pleč hlơi hlơi ôh; 
but even as we have been approved of God to have the glad tidings entrusted to us, so we speak; not as pleasing men, but God, who proves our hearts. @ samơ̆ kar hăng Ơi Adai hmâo tŭ ư laih gơmơi laih anŭn jao Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam kơ ƀing gơmơi, hnŭn yơh ƀing gơmơi pơhiăp, ƀu djơ̆ kiăng bơmơak kơ mơnuih ôh, samơ̆ kiăng bơmơak kơ Ơi Adai, Pô kơsem pran jua ƀing gơmơi. 
For we have not at any time been [among you] with flattering discourse, even as ye know, nor with a pretext for covetousness, God [is] witness; @ Kar hăng ƀing gih thâo laih, laih anŭn Ơi Adai jing Pô pơsĭt brơi, ƀing gơmơi ƀu hmâo yua ôh khul boh pơhiăp pơhlô̆, ƀôdah yua kơ kiăng hơduah tơlơi kơmlai kơ gơmơi pô. 
nor seeking glory from men, neither from you nor from others, when we might have been a charge as Christ's apostles; @ Kŏn ƀing gơmơi hơduah sem tơlơi pơpŭ bơni mơ̆ng ană mơnuih lơi, thâo dah mơ̆ng ƀing gih ƀôdah mơ̆ng ƀing pơkŏn. 
but have been gentle in the midst of you, as a nurse would cherish her own children. @ Wơ̆t dah ƀing gơmơi hmâo tơlơi dưi pơđar ƀing gih pơpŭ kơ ƀing gơmơi, yua kơ ƀing gơmơi jing sa čô khua ding kơna Yang Krist. Samơ̆ tơ̆ng krah ƀing gih, ƀing gơmơi hmâo hơdip hăng ƀing gih rơun tơdu kar hăng sa čô amĭ wai lăng ƀing ană ñu pô. 
Thus, yearning over you, we had found our delight in having imparted to you not only the glad tidings of God, but our own lives also, because ye had become beloved of us. @ Tui anŭn ƀing gơmơi khăp biă mă kơ ƀing gih, tơl ƀing gơmơi kiăng pơpha hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing gih, ƀu djơ̆ kơnơ̆ng Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam Ơi Adai đôč ôh, samơ̆ wơ̆t kơ tơlơi hơdip ƀing gơmơi pô dơ̆ng mơ̆n, yua kơ ƀing gih hmâo jing hĭ laih ƀing mơnuih khăp hơeng kơ ƀing gơmơi. 
For ye remember, brethren, our labour and toil: working night and day, not to be chargeable to any one of you, we have preached to you the glad tidings of God. @ Ơ adơi ayŏng, sĭt ƀing gih ăt dŏ hơdơr kơ bruă kơtraŏ laih anŭn tơlơi gleh glăn ƀing gơmơi. Tơdang ƀing gơmơi pơtô Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam Ơi Adai kơ ƀing gih, ƀing gơmơi mă bruă hrơi mlam yua kơ ƀu kiăng ngă kơtraŏ kơ sa čô hlơi amăng ƀing gih ôh. 
*Ye* [are] witnesses, and God, how piously and righteously and blamelessly we have conducted ourselves with you that believe: @ Ƀing gih ngă gơ̆ng jơlan pơsĭt brơi, laih anŭn Ơi Adai ăt ngă gơ̆ng jơlan pơsĭt brơi hăng ƀing gih, jing ƀing đaŏ, ƀing gơmơi hmâo dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă hăng tơlơi rơgoh hiam, tơpă hơnơ̆ng laih anŭn ƀu hmâo tơlơi dưi ƀuah ôh. 
as ye know how, as a father his own children, we used to exhort each one of you, and comfort and testify, @ Kar hăng ƀing gih thâo laih, ƀing gơmơi hmâo dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă hăng rĭm čô amăng ƀing gih, kar hăng sa čô ama hơdip hăng ƀing ană ñu pô, 
that ye should walk worthy of God, who calls you to his own kingdom and glory. @ ƀing gơmơi pơtô, pơtrŭt, laih anŭn pơđur rĭm čô ƀing gih dŏ hơdip năng lăp hăng Ơi Adai, jing Pô iâu ƀing gih mŭt amăng dêh čar pơtao laih anŭn tơlơi guh kơang Ñu.
And for this cause we also give thanks to God unceasingly that, having received [the] word of [the] report of God by us, ye accepted, not men's word, but, even as it is truly, God's word, which also works in you who believe. @ Yua kơ anŭn yơh, ƀing gơmơi bơni hơơč kơ Ơi Adai ƀu pơdơi ôh, yua kơ tơdang ƀing gih hmư̆ laih anŭn mă tŭ boh pơhiăp Ơi Adai mơ̆ng ƀing gơmơi, ƀing gih ƀu mă tŭ boh pơhiăp anŭn kar hăng boh pơhiăp ană mơnuih ôh, samơ̆ sĭt biă mă ñu jing boh pơhiăp Ơi Adai, jing boh pơhiăp mă bruă amăng ƀing gih, jing ƀing đaŏ. 
For *ye*, brethren, have become imitators of the assemblies of God which are in Judaea in Christ Jesus; for *ye* also have suffered the same things of your own countrymen as also *they* of the Jews, @ Ơ adơi ayŏng, ƀing gih jing ƀing hla tui Phung Sang Ơi Adai kơ Ơi Adai amăng Yang Krist Yêsu pơ čar Yuđa, yua kơ ƀing gih ăt tŭ khul tơlơi tơnap tap mơ̆ng ƀing ană plei pla gih pô, kar hăng Phung Sang Ơi Adai anŭn, hmâo tŭ laih mơ̆ng ƀing mơnuih Yuđa, 
who have both slain the Lord Jesus and the prophets, and have driven us out by persecution, and do not please God, and [are] against all men, @ jing ƀing mơnuih hmâo pơdjai Khua Yang jing Khua Yang Yêsu, laih anŭn ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo, laih anŭn puh pơđuaĭ ƀing gơmơi. Gơñu ƀu bơmơak kơ Ơi Adai ôh laih anŭn pơkơdơ̆ng hăng abih bang mơnuih, 
forbidding us to speak to the nations that they may be saved, that they may fill up their sins always: but wrath has come upon them to the uttermost. @ hăng tơlơi gơñu khă ƀu brơi ƀing gơmơi pơtô kiăng pơklaih djuai tuai. Nanao gơñu ngă brơi tơlơi soh gơñu bă blai đĭ. Samơ̆ hnal tuč tơlơi Ơi Adai hil hmâo tuh trŭn ƀơi gơñu.
But we, brethren, having been bereaved of you and separated for a little moment in person, not in heart, have used more abundant diligence to see your face with much desire; @ Ơ adơi ayŏng, gah kơ ƀing gơmơi, wơ̆t dah pơklah ataih mơ̆ng ƀing gih ƀiă, ataih ƀô̆ mơta samơ̆ ƀu pơklah pran jua ôh, ƀing gơmơi čang rơmang biă mă kiăng dưi bưp glaĭ ƀing gih dơ̆ng, anăp klă anăp. 
wherefore we have desired to come to you, even I Paul, both once and twice, and Satan has hindered us. @ Yua kơ anŭn, hmâo dua wơ̆t laih, ƀing gơmơi, biă mă kâo, Pôl, kiăng nao pơ ƀing gih, samơ̆ Satan pơgŭn ƀing gơmơi. 
For what [is] our hope, or joy, or crown of boasting? [are] not *ye* also before our Lord Jesus at his coming? @ Yua kơ, hơgĕt jing tơlơi čang rơmang kơ ƀing gơmơi, tơlơi hơ̆k mơak, laih anŭn mŭk pơtao lăp pơ-ư kơ ƀing gơmơi ƀơi anăp Khua Yang ƀing ta jing Khua Yang Yêsu ƀơi hrơi Ñu trŭn rai lĕ? Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă jing ƀing gih? 
for ye are our glory and joy. @ Sĭt yơh, ƀing gih jing tơlơi guh kơang laih anŭn tơlơi hơ̆k mơak kơ ƀing gơmơi!
Wherefore, being no longer able to refrain ourselves, we thought good to be left alone in Athens, @  Yua kơ ƀing gơmơi ƀu dưi dŏ tơguan sui dơ̆ng ôh, hnŭn yơh ƀing gơmơi mơak tŭ dŏ hơjăn pơ Athen, 
and sent Timotheus, our brother and fellow-workman under God in the glad tidings of Christ, to confirm you and encourage [you] concerning your faith, @ laih anŭn ƀing gơmơi pơkiaŏ nao Timôthê adơi ayŏng gơmơi, pô mă bruă kơ Ơi Adai hrŏm hăng ƀing gơmơi amăng tơlơi ră ruai Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam Yang Krist, kiăng kơ pơkơjăp laih anŭn pơtrŭt pơđĭ pran jua ƀing gih amăng tơlơi đaŏ, 
that no one might be moved by these afflictions. (For yourselves know that we are set for this; @ kiăng kơ ƀu hmâo hlơi amăng ƀing gih pơpư̆ pơgơi ôh yua kơ khul tơlơi tơnap tap anai. Yua kơ ƀing gih pô thâo laih tơlơi anŭn jing tơlơi hmâo pơkă pioh brơi laih kơ ƀing ta. 
for also, when we were with you, we told you beforehand we are about to be in tribulation, even as also it came to pass, and ye know.) @ Tơdang ƀing gơmơi dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing gih, ƀing gơmơi hmâo laĭ laih mơ̆ng hlâo kơ tơlơi ƀing ta khŏm tŭ tơlơi tơnap tap, kar hăng ƀing gih thâo, tơlơi anŭn hmâo truh laih. 
For this reason *I* also, no longer able to refrain myself, sent to know your faith, lest perhaps the tempter had tempted you and our labour should be come to nothing. @ Hnŭn yơh, yua kơ ƀu dưi dŏ tơguan sui dơ̆ng ôh, kâo pơkiaŏ nao laih Timôthê kiăng kơ thâo hyư̆m tơlơi đaŏ ƀing gih, hwĭ kơ pô plư hmâo plư laih ƀing gih, laih anŭn bruă gleh ƀing gơmơi jing hĭ đôč đač.
But Timotheus having just come to us from you, and brought to us the glad tidings of your faith and love, and that ye have always good remembrance of us, desiring much to see us, even as we also you; @  Samơ̆ ră anai Timôthê phrâo wơ̆t glaĭ mơ̆ng ƀing gih, hmâo ruai brơi ƀing gơmơi tơlơi phrâo phrang hiam mơak kơ tơlơi đaŏ laih anŭn tơlơi khăp ƀing gih. Ñu ăt laĭ ƀing gih djă pioh tơlơi hơdơr hiam kơ ƀing gơmơi nanao, laih anŭn čang kiăng bưp ƀing gơmơi, kar hăng ƀing gơmơi čang kiăng bưp ƀing gih mơ̆n. 
for this reason we have been comforted in you, brethren, in all our distress and tribulation, through your faith, @ Yua kơ tơlơi anai, Ơ adơi ayŏng, tui anŭn amăng abih bang tơlơi gleh glăn laih anŭn tơlơi tơnap tap ƀing gơmơi hmâo laih tơlơi pơalum yua kơ tơlơi đaŏ ƀing gih. 
because now we live if *ye* stand firm in [the] Lord. @ Yua kơ ră anai ƀing gơmơi hơdip, yua kơ ƀing gih dŏ kơjăp amăng Khua Yang. 
For what thanksgiving can we render to God for you, for all the joy wherewith we rejoice on account of you before our God, @ Hyư̆m ƀing gơmơi dưi hmâo djŏp boh pơhiăp kiăng bơni hơơč kơ Ơi Adai yua kơ ƀing gih, yua kơ abih bang tơlơi hơ̆k mơak ƀing gơmơi hmâo yua mơ̆ng ƀing gih ƀơi anăp Ơi Adai ƀing ta? 
night and day beseeching exceedingly to the end that we may see your face, and perfect what is lacking in your faith? @ Hrơi mlam hăng abih pran jua ƀing gơmơi rơkâo kơwưh kơ Ơi Adai brơi ƀing gơmơi dưi bưp ƀô̆ mơta ƀing gih, laih anŭn kiăng kơ pơdjơ̆p brơi khul tơlơi dŏ kơƀah amăng tơlơi đaŏ ƀing gih.
But our God and Father himself, and our Lord Jesus, direct our way to you. @ Rơkâo kơ Ơi Adai pô, Ama ƀing ta, laih anŭn Khua Yang Yêsu, Khua ƀing ta, ba jơlan ƀing gơmơi nao pơ ƀing gih. 
But you, may the Lord make to exceed and abound in love toward one another, and toward all, even as we also towards you, @ Rơkâo kơ Khua Yang ngă brơi ƀing gih jai thim đĭ laih anŭn bă blai tơlơi khăp tơdruă ƀing gih laih anŭn khăp kơ abih bang mơnuih, kar hăng ƀing gơmơi khăp kơ ƀing gih, 
in order to the confirming of your hearts unblamable in holiness before our God and Father at the coming of our Lord Jesus with all his saints. @ rơkâo kơ Ơi Adai pơkơjăp brơi pran jua ƀing gih, rơgoh hơčih ƀu hmâo anih arăng dưi ƀuah ƀơi anăp Ơi Adai, Ama ƀing ta, tơdang Yêsu, Khua Yang ƀing ta trŭn rai hrŏm hơbĭt hăng abih bang ƀing rơgoh hiam Ñu.
For the rest, then, brethren, we beg you and exhort you in [the] Lord Jesus, even as ye have received from us how ye ought to walk and please God, even as ye also do walk, that ye would abound still more. @ Hnal tuč, Ơ adơi ayŏng, amăng Khua Yang Yêsu, ƀing gơmơi rơkâo kơwưh laih anŭn pơtrŭt pơđur ƀing gih kar hăng ƀing gih hmâo hrăm laih mơ̆ng ƀing gơmơi khŏm hơdip hyư̆m pă kiăng bơmơak kơ Ơi Adai laih anŭn ƀing gih hlăk dŏ hơdip kar hăng anŭn, tui anŭn hơdip bĕ ƀrư̆ hrơi ƀrư̆ hiam hloh dơ̆ng. 
For ye know what charges we gave you through the Lord Jesus. @ Yua kơ ƀing gih thâo laih hơgĕt khul tơlơi pơtô ƀing gơmơi hmâo brơi kơ ƀing gih amăng anăn Khua Yang Yêsu. 
For this is [the] will of God, [even] your sanctification, that ye should abstain from fornication; @ Yua kơ tơlơi Ơi Adai kiăng anŭn jing ƀing gih khŏm jing rơgoh hiam yơh; kiăng laĭ khŏm hơbĕ đuaĭ hĭ mơ̆ng tơlơi pyu pơde; 
that each of you know how to possess his own vessel in sanctification and honour, @ rĭm čô ƀing gih khŏm thâo răng wai drơi jan gih pô amăng tơlơi rơgoh hiam laih anŭn pơpŭ, 
(not in passionate desire, even as the nations who know not God,) @ anăm pơgop hăng tơlơi rih răm hrah hrong kar hăng ƀing djuai tuai juăt ngă, jing ƀing ƀu thâo krăn Ơi Adai ôh. 
not overstepping the rights of and wronging his brother in the matter, because the Lord [is] the avenger of all these things, even as we also told you before, and have fully testified. @ Anăm hmâo hlơi ngă soh, ƀôdah mơneč yua adơi ayŏng ñu, yua kơ Khua Yang jing Pô pơkơhmal abih bang tơlơi anŭn kar hăng ƀing gơmơi hmâo laĭ hlâo laih anŭn ƀuah pơgăn ƀing gih laih. 
For God has not called us to uncleanness, but in sanctification. @ Yua kơ Ơi Adai ƀu iâu ƀing ta kơ tơlơi hơƀak drak ôh, samơ̆ kơ tơlơi rơgoh hiam. 
He therefore that [in this] disregards [his brother], disregards, not man, but God, who has given also his Holy Spirit to you. @ Tui anŭn yơh, hlơi pô hơngah tơlơi ƀing gơmơi laĭ, ƀu djơ̆ ñu hơngah kơ ană mơnuih ôh, samơ̆ ñu hơngah kơ Ơi Adai, jing Pô hmâo pha brơi Yang Bơngăt Hiam Ñu kơ ƀing gih.
Now concerning brotherly love ye have no need that we should write to you, for ye yourselves are taught of God to love one another. @ Bơ kơ tơlơi khăp ƀing adơi ayŏng, ƀu kiăng kơ hlơi čih kơ ƀing gih dơ̆ng ôh, yua Ơi Adai hmâo pơtô laih kơ ƀing gih khŏm khăp kơ tơdruă ƀing gih; 
For also ye do this towards all the brethren in the whole of Macedonia; but we exhort you, brethren, to abound still more, @ laih anŭn sĭt biă mă ƀing gih ăt hlăk dŏ ngă tui anŭn hăng abih bang adơi ayŏng amăng čar Masêđôn. Samơ̆ Ơ adơi ayŏng, ƀing gơmơi pơđur ƀing gih khăp bĕ tơdruă jai lu hloh dơ̆ng, 
and to seek earnestly to be quiet and mind your own affairs, and work with your [own] hands, even as we charged you, @ brơi hrăm hơdip hơđơ̆ng rơiăt, kơčăng pơmĭn kơ bruă ƀing gih pô laih anŭn mă bruă hăng tơngan gih pô, kar hăng ƀing gơmơi hmâo pơtă pơtăn laih kơ ƀing gih; 
that ye may walk reputably towards those without, and may have need of no one. @ kiăng kơ ƀing mơnuih aka đaŏ pơpŭ kơ ƀing gih, laih anŭn kiăng kơ ƀing gih hơdip ƀu kơnang kơ arăng ôh.
But we do not wish you to be ignorant, brethren, concerning them that are fallen asleep, to the end that ye be not grieved even as also the rest who have no hope. @ Ơ adơi ayŏng, ƀing gơmơi ƀu kiăng ôh ƀing gih ƀu thâo kơ ƀing mơnuih hmâo pĭt laih, kiăng kơ ƀing gih ƀu rơngot ruă kar hăng ƀing mơnuih pơkŏn ƀu hmâo tơlơi čang rơmang. 
For if we believe that Jesus has died and has risen again, so also God will bring with him those who have fallen asleep through Jesus. @ Yua kơ tơdah ƀing ta đaŏ kơ Khua Yang Yêsu hmâo djai laih anŭn hơdip glaĭ laih, ăt kar kaĭ mơ̆n Ơi Adai či ba ƀing mơnuih pĭt laih amăng Khua Yang Yêsu nao hăng Ñu.
(For this we say to you in [the] word of [the] Lord, that *we*, the living, who remain to the coming of the Lord, are in no way to anticipate those who have fallen asleep; @  Anai tơlơi ƀing gơmơi laĭ hăng ƀing gih tui hăng boh pơhiăp Khua Yang: Ƀing ta jing ƀing ăt dŏ hơdip tơl truh hrơi Khua Yang či rai dơ̆ng, ƀing ta ƀu či nao hlâo kơ ƀing hmâo pĭt laih ôh. 
for the Lord himself, with an assembling shout, with archangel's voice and with trump of God, shall descend from heaven; and the dead in Christ shall rise first; @ Yua kơ tơ hmâo asăp pơtă pơtrŭn rai, hrŏm hăng asăp khua ling jang adai iâu, hrŏm hăng asăp tơki Ơi Adai, laih anŭn Khua Yang pô mơ̆ng adai či trŭn rai. Hlăk anŭn, ƀing mơnuih djai amăng Yang Krist či hơdip glaĭ hlâo hloh. 
then *we*, the living who remain, shall be caught up together with them in [the] clouds, to meet the Lord in [the] air; and thus we shall be always with [the] Lord. @ Giơ̆ng anŭn, ƀing ta jing ƀing mơnuih dŏ hơdip ăt dŏ glaĭ, či pŭ đĭ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng gơñu amăng hiăng kơthul kiăng bưp Khua Yang amăng anih hông hang; tui anŭn ƀing ta či dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Khua Yang hlŏng lar. 
So encourage one another with these words.) @ Hnŭn yơh, brơi ƀing gih yua bĕ khul boh pơhiăp anai pơalum tơdruă ƀing gih.
But concerning the times and the seasons, brethren, ye have no need that ye should be written to, @ Ơ adơi ayŏng, bơ kơ hrơi mông laih anŭn bơyan ƀu yom ôh kiăng kơ kâo čih kơ ƀing gih; 
for ye know perfectly well yourselves, that the day of [the] Lord so comes as a thief by night. @ Yua kơ ƀing gih pô thâo klă laih kơ hrơi Khua Yang či truh kar hăng ƀing mơnuih klĕ amăng mlam. 
When they may say, Peace and safety, then sudden destruction comes upon them, as travail upon her that is with child; and they shall in no wise escape. @ Tơdang arăng laĭ: “Rơnŭk rơnua laih anŭn hơ-ĭng rơnŭk”, hlăk anŭn tơlơi răm rai blĭp truh kơ gơñu kar hăng tơlơi ruă tơkeng kơ sa čô đah kơmơi pi kian, laih anŭn gơñu ƀu dưi klaih ôh. 
But *ye*, brethren, are not in darkness, that the day should overtake you as a thief: @ Samơ̆ Ơ adơi ayŏng, ƀing gih ƀu dŏ amăng tơlơi kơnăm mơmŏt ôh, tơl hrơi anŭn ngă kơ ƀing gih kơtuă kar hăng sa čô mơnuih klĕ. 
for all *ye* are sons of light and sons of day; we are not of night nor of darkness. @ Yua kơ abih bang ƀing gih jing ană kơ tơlơi bơngač laih anŭn ană kơ tơhrơi. Ƀing ta ƀu djơ̆ ƀing ană kơ mlam ƀôdah kơ tơlơi kơnăm mơmŏt ôh. 
So then do not let us sleep as the rest do, but let us watch and be sober; @ Tui anŭn anăm ƀing ta pĭt ôh kar hăng ƀing mơnuih pơkŏn, samơ̆ brơi ƀing ta khŏm dŏ răng laih anŭn djơ̆ hơnơ̆ng. 
for they that sleep sleep by night, and they that drink drink by night; @ Yua kơ ƀing pĭt gơñu pĭt amăng mlam, laih anŭn ƀing măt tơpai gơñu măt amăng mlam. 
but *we* being of [the] day, let us be sober, putting on [the] breastplate of faith and love, and as helmet [the] hope of salvation; @ Samơ̆ ƀing ta jing ƀing lơ̆m kơ tơhrơi, hnŭn yơh brơi ƀing ta hơdip djơ̆ hơnơ̆ng, buh mă ao pơsơi jing tơlơi đaŏ laih anŭn tơlơi khăp, mă tơlơi čang rơmang kơ tơlơi pơklaih ngă mŭk pơsơi pơblah. 
because God has not set us for wrath, but for obtaining salvation through our Lord Jesus Christ, @ Yua kơ Ơi Adai ƀu pơkă pioh ƀing ta kơ tơlơi Ñu hil ôh, samơ̆ kơ tơlơi dưi mă tŭ tơlơi pơklaih amăng Khua Yang ƀing ta Yêsu Krist, 
who has died for us, that whether we may be watching or sleep, we may live together with him. @ jing Pô hmâo djai laih yua kơ ƀing ta kiăng kơ thâo dah ƀing ta mơdưh ƀôdah pĭt, ƀing ta leng kơ dưi hơdip hăng Ñu. 
Wherefore encourage one another, and build up each one the other, even as also ye do. @ Hnŭn yơh brơi ƀing gih pơtrŭt pơđĭ pran jua laih anŭn pơkơjăp tơdruă ƀing gih bĕ, kar hăng ƀing gih ăt dŏ ngă.
But we beg you, brethren, to know those who labour among you, and take the lead among you in [the] Lord, and admonish you, @ Samơ̆ Ơ adơi ayŏng, ƀing gơmơi kơwưh kơ ƀing gih, brơi ƀing gih pơpŭ bĕ kơ ƀing mă bruă gleh amăng tơ̆ng krah ƀing gih, jing ƀing mơnuih yua kơ Khua Yang gơñu atăt gai pơtô pơđur ƀing gih. 
and to regard them exceedingly in love on account of their work. Be in peace among yourselves. @ Pơpŭ bĕ kơ ƀing gơñu hăng tơlơi khăp yua kơ bruă gơñu ngă. Brơi ƀing gih hơdip rơnŭk rơnua hăng tơdruă.
But we exhort you, brethren, admonish the disorderly, comfort the faint-hearted, sustain the weak, be patient towards all. @ Ơ adơi ayŏng, rơkâo kơ ƀing gih pơtô pơtrŭt bĕ ƀing alah, pơđĭ pran jua ƀing hơtah hơtai, djru ƀing tơdu, gir tŭ hăng abih bang mơnuih. 
See that no one render to any evil for evil, but pursue always what is good towards one another and towards all; @ Brơi răng bĕ, anăm mă tơlơi sat ba glaĭ tơlơi sat ôh, samơ̆ nanao hơduah mông gal ngă tơlơi hiam mơak kơ tơdruă laih anŭn kơ abih bang mơnuih kar kaĭ mơ̆n.
rejoice always; @ Hơ̆k mơak nanao bĕ, 
pray unceasingly; @ Iâu laĭ ƀu pơdơi ôh; 
in everything give thanks, for this is [the] will of God in Christ Jesus towards you; @ bơni hơơč bĕ kơ Ơi Adai amăng abih bang tơlơi truh; yua kơ anŭn jing tơlơi Ơi Adai kiăng ƀơi ƀing gih amăng Krist Yêsu.
quench not the Spirit; @ Anăm čruih pơthăm Yang Bơngăt Hiam ôh. 
do not lightly esteem prophecies; @ Anăm mưč kơ khul boh pơhiăp laĭ lui hlâo, 
but prove all things, hold fast the right; @ brơi kơsem lăng abih bang tơlơi. Tơlơi hơgĕt hiam klă djă pioh bĕ; 
hold aloof from every form of wickedness. @ khŏm hơbĕ đuaĭ ataih mơ̆ng abih bang rup hơbŏ tơlơi sat.
Now the God of peace himself sanctify you wholly: and your whole spirit, and soul, and body be preserved blameless at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ. @ Rơkâo kơ Ơi Adai tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua pơrơgoh hiam ƀing gih tum num; laih anŭn rơkâo kơ Ñu wai lăng bơngăt, jua pơmĭn, laih anŭn drơi jan ƀing gih klă tum, ƀu hmâo tơlơi dưi ƀuah ôh ƀơi hrơi Khua Yang Yêsu Krist trŭn rai. 
He [is] faithful who calls you, who will also perform [it]. @ Pô hmâo iâu laih ƀing gih jing hơnơ̆ng ten, Ñu pô či ngă bruă anŭn.
Brethren, pray for us. @ Ơ adơi ayŏng, rơkâo ƀing gih iâu laĭ brơi kơ ƀing gơmơi.
Greet all the brethren with a holy kiss. @ Kơkuh bĕ abih bang adơi ayŏng hăng tơlơi čŭm rơgoh hiam.
I adjure you by the Lord that the letter be read to all the [holy] brethren. @ Hăng anăn Khua Yang, kâo rơkâo kơ ƀing gih đŏk brơi hră anai kơ abih bang adơi ayŏng dưi hmư̆ bĕ.
The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ [be] with you. @ Rơkâo tơlơi pap mơ̆ng Khua Yang ƀing ta, jing Yêsu Krist, dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing gih.
Paul and Silvanus and Timotheus to the assembly of Thessalonians in God our Father and [the] Lord Jesus Christ. @  Pôl, Silwan laih anŭn Timôthê. Mơit kơ Phung Sang Ơi Adai pơ Têsalônik dŏ amăng Ơi Adai, Ama ƀing ta, laih anŭn amăng Yêsu Krist, jing Khua Yang ƀing ta: 
Grace to you, and peace from God our Father, and [the] Lord Jesus Christ. @ Rơkâo kơ Ơi Adai, Ama ƀing ta, laih anŭn Khua Yang Yêsu Krist pha brơi tơlơi pap laih anŭn tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua kơ ƀing gih.
We ought to thank God always for you, brethren, even as it is meet, because your faith increases exceedingly, and the love of each one of you all towards one another abounds; @ Ơ adơi ayŏng, jing tơlơi djơ̆ yơh ƀing gơmơi khŏm bơni nanao kơ Ơi Adai yua kơ ƀing gih, yua kơ tơlơi đaŏ ƀing gih rai kơ prŏng lu biă mă, laih anŭn tơlơi ƀing gih khăp tơdruă ƀrư̆ hrơi ƀrư̆ kơtang jai. 
so that we ourselves make our boast in you in the assemblies of God for your endurance and faith in all your persecutions and tribulations, which ye are sustaining; @ Yua kơ anŭn yơh ƀing gơmơi ăt pơ-ư gơmơi pô yua kơ ƀing gih amăng Phung Sang Ơi Adai kơ Ơi Adai, yua kơ tơlơi ƀing gih dŏ kơjăp laih anŭn tơlơi đaŏ ƀing gih amăng abih bang tơlơi arăng ngă sat kơ ƀing gih laih anŭn tơlơi tơnap tap ƀing gih hlăk dŏ tŭ.
a manifest token of the righteous judgment of God, to the end that ye should be counted worthy of the kingdom of God, for the sake of which ye also suffer; @ Tơlơi anŭn jing sa tơlơi pơsĭt kơ tơlơi Ơi Adai phat kơđi tơpă, kiăng kơ ƀing gih dưi jing năng lăp hăng dêh čar pơtao Ơi Adai, yua kơ dêh čar pơtao anŭn yơh ƀing gih tŭ tơlơi tơnap. 
if at least [it is a] righteous thing with God to render tribulation to those that trouble you, @ Tui hăng tơlơi tơpă hơnơ̆ng Ơi Adai, sĭt biă mă Ñu či mă tơlơi tơnap tap ba glaĭ kơ ƀing ngă pơtơnap tap kơ ƀing gih, 
and to you that are troubled repose with us, at the revelation of the Lord Jesus from heaven, with [the] angels of his power, @ laih anŭn brơi kơ ƀing gih jing ƀing mơnuih hmâo tŭ tơlơi tơnap tap, dưi hmâo tơlơi pơdơi hrŏm hăng ƀing gơmơi, amăng hrơi Khua Yang Yêsu mơ̆ng adai pơrơđah rai hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing ling jang dưi kơtang Ñu, ƀơi tơ̆ng krah jơlah apui jă kơtang, 
in flaming fire taking vengeance on those who know not God, and those who do not obey the glad tidings of our Lord Jesus Christ; @ kiăng pơkơhmal ƀing ƀu thâo krăn Ơi Adai ôh, laih anŭn ƀing ƀu tui gưt ôh Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam Yêsu, Khua Yang ƀing ta. 
who shall pay the penalty [of] everlasting destruction from [the] presence of the Lord, and from the glory of his might, @ Gơñu či tŭ tơlơi pơkơhmal răm rai hlŏng lar, pơklah ataih mơ̆ng ƀô̆ mơta Khua Yang laih anŭn tơlơi guh kơang kơ tơlơi dưi mơyang Ñu, 
when he shall have come to be glorified in his saints, and wondered at in all that have believed, (for our testimony to you has been believed,) in that day. @ hlăk Ñu rai amăng hrơi anŭn, kiăng hmâo tơlơi guh kơang tơ̆ng krah ƀing rơgoh hiam laih anŭn tơlơi pơpŭ mơ̆ng abih bang ƀing đaŏ laih, amăng anŭn hmâo ƀing gih, yua kơ ƀing gih hmâo đaŏ laih tơlơi ƀing gơmơi ngă gơ̆ng jơlan ƀơi anăp ƀing gih.
To which end we also pray always for you, that our God may count you worthy of the calling, and fulfil all [the] good pleasure of [his] goodness and [the] work of faith with power, @ Yua kơ anŭn yơh, ƀing gơmơi iâu laĭ nanao kơ ƀing gih, kiăng kơ Ơi Adai ƀing ta ngă brơi ƀing gih hmâo tơlơi năng lăp hăng tơlơi Ñu iâu, laih anŭn Ñu ngă pơgiơ̆ng abih bang tơlơi kiăng hiam klă laih anŭn bruă tơlơi đaŏ ƀing gih hăng tơlơi dưi mơyang Ñu, 
so that the name of our Lord Jesus [Christ] may be glorified in you and *ye* in him, according to the grace of our God, and of [the] Lord Jesus Christ. @ kiăng kơ anăn Yêsu Khua Yang ƀing ta dưi hmâo tơlơi guh kơang amăng ƀing gih, laih anŭn ƀing gih hmâo tơlơi guh kơang amăng Ñu, tui hăng tơlơi pap Ơi Adai ƀing ta laih anŭn tơlơi pap Khua Yang Yêsu Krist.
Now we beg you, brethren, by the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ and our gathering together to him, @  Ơ adơi ayŏng, kơ tơlơi Khua Yang ƀing ta Yêsu Krist či rai dơ̆ng, laih anŭn tơlơi ƀing ta či bơjơnum hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Ñu, gơmơi rơkâo kơwưh kơ ƀing gih, 
that ye be not soon shaken in mind, nor troubled, neither by spirit, nor by word, nor by letter, as [if it were] by us, as that the day of the Lord is present. @ pran jua, tơlơi pơmĭn ƀing gih anăm hăt pơpư̆ pơgơi ôh ƀôdah hwĭ bral mơ̆ng bơngăt sat, mơ̆ng boh pơhiăp ƀôdah hră čih mơ̆ng pă rŏ dah hră mơ̆ng ƀing gơmơi mơit nao, laĭ kơ hrơi Khua Yang truh laih. 
Let not any one deceive you in any manner, because [it will not be] unless the apostasy have first come, and the man of sin have been revealed, the son of perdition; @ Anăm brơi arăng plư ƀlor ƀing gih ôh hăng lu hơdră jơlan. Yua kơ tơlơi lui wir khŏm truh hlâo, laih anŭn Mơnuih Soh Sat, ană kơ tơlơi răm rai khŏm tơbiă rai. 
who opposes and exalts himself on high against all called God, or object of veneration; so that he himself sits down in the temple of God, shewing himself that he is God. @ Pô soh sat anŭn jing pô pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ, pơđĭ ñu pô glong hloh kơ abih bang khul tơlơi hơgĕt arăng iâu jing yang ƀôdah tơlơi mơnơ̆ng arăng kơkuh pơpŭ, tơl ñu mŭt dŏ ber amăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ Ơi Adai, laih anŭn pơhaih ñu pô jing Ơi Adai.
Do ye not remember that, being yet with you, I said these things to you? @ Ƀing gih ƀu hơdơr ôh hă kâo hmâo pơhaih laih tơlơi anŭn kơ ƀing gih tơdang kâo ăt dŏ hrŏm hăng ƀing gih? 
And now ye know that which restrains, that he should be revealed in his own time. @ Laih anŭn ƀing gih thâo hơgĕt tơlơi dŏ djă kơ̆ng ñu ră anai, kiăng kơ ñu kơnơ̆ng dưi pơrơđah djơ̆ rơnŭk ñu. 
For the mystery of lawlessness already works; only [there is] he who restrains now until he be gone, @ Yua kơ tơlơi dưi kơtang hơgơ̆m kơ tơlơi soh čơdơ̆ng mă bruă laih; samơ̆ Pô dŏ djă kơ̆ng ñu ăt dŏ mă bruă tơl hrơi Ơi Adai mă pơđuaĭ hĭ Ñu. 
and then the lawless one shall be revealed, whom the Lord Jesus shall consume with the breath of his mouth, and shall annul by the appearing of his coming; @ Hlăk anŭn pô soh či pơrơđah rai, laih anŭn Khua Yang Yêsu či pơdjai ñu hăng asăp jua suă pran mơ̆ng amăng bah Ñu pô, pơrai hĭ ñu hăng tơlơi guh kơang tơlơi Ñu trŭn rai. 
whose coming is according to the working of Satan in all power and signs and wonders of falsehood, @ Pô soh anŭn či rai tui hăng tơlơi pơtrŭt mơ̆ng Satan, ngă abih tơlơi dưi mơyang, gru kơnăl laih anŭn tơlơi yom pơphan ƀlor; 
and in all deceit of unrighteousness to them that perish, because they have not received the love of the truth that they might be saved. @ laih anŭn ñu yua djŏp mơta tơlơi mơneč soh sat kiăng kơ plư ƀlor ƀing răm rơngiă, yua kơ ƀing gơñu ƀu mă tŭ ôh tơlơi khăp kơ tơlơi sĭt kiăng kơ dưi hmâo tơlơi pơklaih. 
And for this reason God sends to them a working of error, that they should believe what is false, @ Yua kơ anŭn yơh Ơi Adai jao hĭ ƀing gơñu kơ tơlơi jrok rơngiă, lui gơñu đaŏ kơ tơlơi pleč ƀlor, 
that all might be judged who have not believed the truth, but have found pleasure in unrighteousness. @ kiăng kơ abih bang ƀing ƀu đaŏ ôh kơ tơlơi sĭt, samơ̆ khăp hơr kơ tơlơi soh sat či tŭ mă tơlơi klă kơđi.
But we ought to give thanks to God always for you, brethren beloved of [the] Lord, that God has chosen you from [the] beginning to salvation in sanctification of [the] Spirit and belief of [the] truth: @ Samơ̆ Ơ adơi ayŏng jing ƀing Khua Yang khăp hơeng, ƀing gơmơi khŏm bơni kơ Ơi Adai nanao yua kơ ƀing gih, yua kơ mơ̆ng blŭng hlâo Ơi Adai hmâo ruah laih ƀing gih kiăng brơi tơlơi pơklaih kơ ƀing gih, mơ̆ng Yang Bơngăt Hiam pơrơgoh hiam brơi laih anŭn mơ̆ng tơlơi đaŏ kơ tơlơi sĭt. 
whereto he has called you by our glad tidings, to [the] obtaining of [the] glory of our Lord Jesus Christ. @ Ăt yua kơ anŭn mơ̆n Ñu hmâo iâu laih ƀing gih mơ̆ng Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam ƀing gơmơi hmâo pơtô, kiăng kơ ƀing gih dưi hmâo tơlơi guh kơang Yêsu Krist, Khua Yang ƀing ta. 
So then, brethren, stand firm, and hold fast the instructions which ye have been taught, whether by word or by our letter. @ Tui anŭn, Ơ adơi ayŏng, dŏ kơjăp bĕ, laih anŭn djă pioh kơjăp khul tơlơi pơtô ƀing gơmơi hmâo brơi laih kơ ƀing gih, thâo dah hăng boh pơhiăp ƀôdah hăng hră gơmơi čih.
But our Lord Jesus Christ himself, and our God and Father, who has loved us, and given [us] eternal consolation and good hope by grace, @ Ră anai rơkâo kơ Khua Yang ƀing ta Yêsu Krist pô, laih anŭn Ơi Adai, Ama ƀing ta, Pô hmâo khăp kơ ƀing ta, laih anŭn mơ̆ng tơlơi pap pha brơi ƀing ta, tơlơi pơalum hlŏng lar hrŏm hơbĭt hăng tơlơi čang rơmang hiam mơak, 
encourage your hearts, and establish you in every good work and word. @ pơđĭ pran jua hăng pơkơjăp ƀing gih amăng djŏp mơta bruă ngă hiam klă laih anŭn boh pơhiăp hiam klă.
For the rest, brethren, pray for us, that the word of the Lord may run and be glorified, even as also with you; @ Tơdơi kơ abih bang, Ơ adơi ayŏng kâo rơkâo kơ ƀing gih iâu laĭ brơi kơ ƀing gơmơi bĕ, kiăng kơ boh pơhiăp Khua Yang dưi lar hyu tañ laih anŭn hmâo tơlơi pơpŭ kar hăng ñu truh laih tơ̆ng krah ƀing gih, 
and that we may be delivered from bad and evil men, for faith [is] not [the portion] of all. @ laih anŭn kiăng kơ ƀing gơmơi dưi klaih mơ̆ng ƀing mơnuih soh sat laih anŭn sat ƀai; yua kơ ƀu djơ̆ ôh abih bang leng kơ hmâo tơlơi đaŏ.
But the Lord is faithful, who shall establish you and keep [you] from evil. @ Samơ̆ Khua Yang jing hơnơ̆ng ten. Ñu či pơkơtang ƀing gih laih anŭn pơgang ƀing gih mơ̆ng ƀing mơnuih sat ƀai. 
But we trust in the Lord as to you, that the things which we enjoin, ye both do and will do. @ Amăng Khua Yang ƀing gơmơi đaŏ biă mă kơ ƀing gih hlăk dŏ ngă laih anŭn či ngă tơlơi ƀing gơmơi hmâo pơtă laih kơ ƀing gih.
But the Lord direct your hearts into the love of God, and into the patience of the Christ. @ Rơkâo kơ Khua Yang atăt gai pran jua ƀing gih truh pơ tơlơi khăp Ơi Adai laih anŭn tơlơi Yang Krist gir tŭ.
Now we enjoin you, brethren, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that ye withdraw from every brother walking disorderly and not according to the instruction which he received from us. @ Ơ adơi ayŏng, amăng anăn Khua Yang ƀing ta Yêsu Krist, ƀing gơmơi pơđur ƀing gih brơi kơ ƀing gih khŏm dŏ ataih mơ̆ng ƀing adơi ayŏng alah, ƀing ƀu ngă tui tơlơi pơtô ƀing gih hmâo mă tŭ laih mơ̆ng ƀing gơmơi. 
For ye know yourselves how ye ought to imitate us, because we have not walked disorderly among you; @ Yua kơ ƀing gih pô thâo hyư̆m khŏm hơdip kiăng kơ hla tui ƀing gơmơi; yua kơ tơdang dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing gih, ƀing gơmơi ƀu alah ôh. 
nor have we eaten bread from any one without cost; but in toil and hardship working night and day not to be chargeable to any one of you: @ Ƀing gơmơi ƀu ƀơ̆ng đôč ƀañ tơpŭng arăng ôh, samơ̆ hrơi mlam ƀing gơmơi mă bruă gleh glăn tơnap tap, kiăng kơ ƀu pơkơtraŏ kơ sa čô hlơi amăng ƀing gih ôh. 
not that we have not the right, but that we might give ourselves as an example to you, in order to your imitating us. @ Ƀu djơ̆ ƀing gơmơi ƀu hmâo tơlơi dưi mă tŭ tơlơi djru ôh, samơ̆ kiăng ngă tơlơi bơhmutu hiam brơi kơ ƀing gih hla tui. 
For also when we were with you we enjoined you this, that if any man does not like to work, neither let him eat. @ Hlăk ƀing gơmơi ăt dŏ hăng ƀing gih, ƀing gơmơi hmâo pơtă laih kơ ƀing gih tơlơi anai: Tơdah hlơi pô ƀu kiăng mă bruă, anăm brơi ñu ƀơ̆ng huă ôh. 
For we hear that [there are] some walking among you disorderly, not working at all, but busybodies. @ Yua kơ ƀing gơmơi hmư̆ hmâo đơđa amăng ƀing gih hơdip alah, ƀu mă bruă ôh, laih anŭn khăp čer mŭt amăng bruă pô pơkŏn. 
Now such we enjoin and exhort in [the] Lord Jesus Christ, that working quietly they eat their own bread. @ Amăng Khua Yang Yêsu Krist ƀing gơmơi pơtă laih anŭn pơtrŭt ƀing mơnuih kar hăng anŭn, brơi gơñu khŏm dŏ rơiăt laih anŭn mă bruă, kiăng kơ čem ñu pô. 
But *ye*, brethren, do not faint in well-doing. @ Ơ adơi ayŏng, anăm hơtah hơtai ôh amăng tơlơi ngă bruă hiam.
But if any one obey not our word by the letter, mark that man, and do not keep company with him, that he may be ashamed of himself; @ Tơdah hmâo hlơi ƀu tui gưt kơ tơlơi ƀing gơmơi pơhiăp amăng hră anai, brơi ƀing gih kơčăng kơ pô anŭn, laih anŭn anăm pơgop hăng ƀing gơñu ôh, kiăng kơ gơñu thâo mlâo. 
and do not esteem him as an enemy, but admonish [him] as a brother. @ Wơ̆t dah tui anŭn, anăm lăng gơñu kar hăng ayăt ôh, kơđai glaĭ brơi ƀing gih pơđur ƀuah bĕ gơñu kar hăng adơi ayŏng.
But the Lord of peace himself give you peace continually in every way. The Lord [be] with you all. @ Rơkâo kơ Khua Yang pô, jing tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua pha brơi kơ ƀing gih tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua amăng rĭm mông, amăng djŏp hơdră jơlan. Rơkâo kơ Khua Yang dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng abih bang ƀing gih.
The salutation by the hand of me, Paul, which is [the] mark in every letter; so I write. @ Kâo pô, Pôl, hăng tơngan kâo pô čih tơlơi čuă ngui anai. Anai jing boh hră kơnăl kâo amăng abih bang hră kâo; kâo juăt čih kar hăng anŭn yơh.
The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ [be] with you all. @ Rơkâo tơlơi pap mơ̆ng Khua Yang ƀing ta Yêsu Krist, dŏ hrŏm hăng abih bang ƀing gih!
Paul, apostle of Jesus Christ, according to [the] command of God our Saviour, and of Christ Jesus our hope, @ Pôl, khua ding kơna Krist Yêsu tui hăng tơlơi pơtă mơ̆ng Ơi Adai jing Pô Pơklaih ƀing ta laih anŭn Krist Yêsu jing tơlơi čang rơmang kơ ƀing ta. 
to Timotheus, [my] true child in faith: grace, mercy, peace, from God our Father and Christ Jesus our Lord. @ Mơit kơ Timôthê, ană kâo sĭt amăng tơlơi đaŏ, rơkâo kơ Ơi Adai, Ama ƀing ta, laih anŭn Krist Yêsu, Khua Yang ƀing ta pha brơi kơ ih tơlơi pap, tơlơi pap drap laih anŭn tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua.
Even as I begged thee to remain in Ephesus, [when I was] going to Macedonia, that thou mightest enjoin some not to teach other doctrines, @ Kar hăng kâo hmâo pơtô pơđur laih ih hlăk kâo nao pơ čar Masêđôn, brơi ih dŏ glaĭ pơ plei Êphêsô kiăng kơ ih pơtô pơtă kơ đơđa mơnuih anăm pơtô ôh mơta tơlơi đaŏ pơkŏn. 
nor to turn their minds to fables and interminable genealogies, which bring questionings rather than [further] God's dispensation, which [is] in faith. @ Laih anŭn anăm bơngơ̆t pơmĭn ôh kơ tơlơi ră ruai ƀu hmâo sĭt laih anŭn tơlơi rok ruai anăn ơi yă ƀu thâo đŭt. Khul tơlơi anŭn kơnơ̆ng ba truh tơlơi pơrơjah hloh kơ tơlơi pŏk lar bruă Ơi Adai amăng tơlơi đaŏ. 
But the end of what is enjoined is love out of a pure heart and a good conscience and unfeigned faith; @ Samơ̆ tơlơi kơñăm kơ tơlơi pơtô pơđur jing tơlơi khăp tơbiă mơ̆ng pran jua rơgoh hiam, pran jua tơpă rơgoh bơngač laih anŭn tơlơi đaŏ tơpă sĭt. 
which [things] some having missed, have turned aside to vain discourse, @ Hmâo đơđa mơnuih klah laih mơ̆ng tơlơi kơñăm anŭn laih anŭn pơtô tơlơi đôč đač. 
desiring to be law-teachers, not understanding either what they say or concerning what they [so] strenuously affirm. @ Gơñu kiăng jing nai pơtô tơlơi juăt, samơ̆ gơñu ƀu thâo hluh ôh tơlơi gơñu pô pơhiăp, kŏn thâo hluh lơi kơ tơlơi gơñu pô khŭt khăt.
Now we know that the law [is] good if any one uses it lawfully, @ Ƀing ta thâo tơlơi juăt jing hiam, tơdah ƀing ta yua ñu hăng tơlơi djơ̆ klă. 
knowing this, that law has not its application to a righteous person, but to [the] lawless and insubordinate, to [the] impious and sinful, to [the] unholy and profane, to smiters of fathers and smiters of mothers; to murderers, @ Laih anŭn ƀing ta thâo arăng pơjing rai tơlơi juăt ƀu djơ̆ kơ ƀing mơnuih tơpă ôh samơ̆ kơ ƀing ngă gao tơlơi juăt, ƀing ƀu tui gưt, ƀing ƀu thâo pơpŭ kơ Ơi Adai, laih anŭn ƀing soh, ƀing ƀu rơgoh laih anŭn ƀing grĭ grañ, ƀing pơdjai ama laih anŭn pơdjai amĭ, ƀing pơdjai mơnuih, 
fornicators, sodomites, kidnappers, liars, perjurers; and if any other thing is opposed to sound teaching, @ ƀing klĕ pyu, ƀing ngă soh đah rơkơi hăng đah rơkơi ƀôdah đah kơmơi hăng đah kơmơi, ƀing sĭ mơnuih, ƀing ƀlor, ƀing ngă gơ̆ng jơlan ƀlor, laih anŭn abih bang tơlơi pơkơdơ̆ng hăng mơta tơlơi đaŏ djơ̆. 
according to the glad tidings of the glory of the blessed God, with which *I* have been entrusted. @ Tui hăng Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam guh kơang mơyun hiam Ơi Adai, Pô năng lăp kơ arăng bơni, Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam anŭn Ơi Adai hmâo jao brơi laih kơ kâo.
[And] I thank Christ Jesus our Lord, who has given me power, that he has counted me faithful, appointing to ministry him @ Kâo bơni hơơč kơ Pô hmâo pha brơi tơlơi kơtang kơ kâo dưi mă bruă anai, jing Krist Yêsu Khua Yang ƀing ta, yua kơ Ñu hmâo yap kâo jing pô tŏng ten hăng tơlơi Ñu jao brơi kâo mă bruă kơ Ñu. 
who before was a blasphemer and persecutor, and an insolent overbearing [man]: but mercy was shewn me because I did it ignorantly, in unbelief. @ Wơ̆t dah hlâo dih kâo jing sa čô pơhiăp pơgao hmiah, ngă sat, laih anŭn hơtoh djraĭ kơ Ñu. Samơ̆ kâo hmâo mă tŭ laih tơlơi pap drap Ñu, yua kơ kâo ngă hăng tơlơi ƀu thâo hluh amăng tơlơi ƀu đaŏ. 
But the grace of our Lord surpassingly over-abounded with faith and love, which [is] in Christ Jesus. @ Laih anŭn tơlơi pap Khua Yang ƀing ta bă blai amăng kâo, hrŏm hăng tơlơi đaŏ laih anŭn tơlơi khăp amăng Krist Yêsu. 
Faithful [is] the word, and worthy of all acceptation, that Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners, of whom *I* am [the] first. @ Anai jing boh pơhiăp sĭt laih anŭn năng lăp kơ mă tŭ biă mă yơh: Krist Yêsu hmâo rai laih amăng lŏn tơnah kiăng kơ pơklaih ƀing mơnuih soh; amăng ƀing mơnuih soh anŭn, kâo yơh jing pô soh mrô sa. 
But for this reason mercy was shewn me, that in me, [the] first, Jesus Christ might display the whole long-suffering, for a delineation of those about to believe on him to life eternal. @ Samơ̆ yua hơgĕt kâo dưi mă tŭ tơlơi pap drap, anŭn jing kiăng kơ Krist Yêsu pơrơđah tơlơi Ñu gir tŭ biă mă yơh hăng kâo, jing pô soh sat hloh kơ abih bang, yua kâo ngă tơlơi bơhmutu brơi kơ ƀing či đaŏ kơ Ñu kiăng kơ dưi hmâo tơlơi hơdip hlŏng lar. 
Now to the King of the ages, [the] incorruptible, invisible, only God, honour and glory to the ages of ages. Amen. @ Brơi tơlơi pơpŭ laih anŭn tơlơi guh kơang hlŏng lar lơ̆m kơ Pơtao hlŏng lar, ƀu thâo djai, Pô arăng ƀu thâo ƀuh, kơnơ̆ng hơjăn Ñu đôč jing Ơi Adai! Amen.
This charge, [my] child Timotheus, I commit to thee, according to the prophecies as to thee preceding, in order that thou mightest war by them the good warfare, @ Ơ Timôthê, ană kâo, kâo pơtă kơ ih tơlơi anai, tui hăng tơlơi laĭ lui hlâo djơ̆ kơ ih mơ̆ng hlâo, kiăng kơ mơ̆ng khul tơlơi laĭ lui hlâo anŭn ih dưi pơblah khĭn kơtang, 
maintaining faith and a good conscience; which [last] some, having put away, have made shipwreck as to faith; @ djă kơjăp tơlơi đaŏ laih anŭn pran jua tơpă rơgoh bơngač. Hmâo đơđa yua kơ hơngah lui hĭ laih pran jua tơpă anŭn, tơlơi đaŏ gơñu glưh răm hĭ laih. 
of whom is Hymenaeus and Alexander, whom I have delivered to Satan, that they may be taught by discipline not to blaspheme. @ Amăng ƀing gơñu anŭn hmâo Himênê laih anŭn Aleksandơ. Kâo jao hĭ laih ƀing gơñu kơ satan kiăng kơ gơñu hrăm ƀu pơhiăp pơgao hmiah hăng Ơi Adai dơ̆ng ôh.
I exhort therefore, first of all, that supplications, prayers, intercessions, thanksgivings be made for all men; @ Hnŭn yơh, hlâo hloh kơ abih bang tơlơi, kâo pơđur ih khŏm kơwưh, rơkâo, bơni hơơč laih anŭn iâu laĭ pơala brơi kơ abih bang mơnuih, 
for kings and all that are in dignity, that we may lead a quiet and tranquil life in all piety and gravity; @ kơ ƀing pơtao laih anŭn kơ abih bang ƀing khua wai lăng kiăng kơ ƀing ta dưi dŏ hơdip hơđơ̆ng rơiăt, rơnŭk rơnua hrŏm hăng abih pran jua kơkuh pơpŭ laih anŭn dŏ hơdip hiam mơak hăng arăng. 
for this is good and acceptable before our Saviour God, @ Anŭn jing tơlơi hiam laih anŭn bơmơak kơ Ơi Adai, Pô Pơklaih ƀing ta. 
who desires that all men should be saved and come to [the] knowledge of [the] truth. @ Ñu kiăng kơ abih bang mơnuih dưi klaih laih anŭn thâo krăn tơlơi sĭt. 
For God is one, and [the] mediator of God and men one, [the] man Christ Jesus, @ Yua kơ hmâo kơnơ̆ng hasa Ơi Adai đôč, laih anŭn hmâo kơnơ̆ng hasa Pô Dŏ Kơplah tơ̆ng krah Ơi Adai hăng ană mơnuih, jing Krist Yêsu, ăt jing mơnuih mơ̆n. 
who gave himself a ransom for all, the testimony [to be rendered] in its own times; @ Pô hmâo jao laih Ñu pô jing nua song mă abih bang mơnuih. Jing tơlơi gơ̆ng jơlan hmâo pha brơi laih djơ̆ rơnŭk. 
to which *I* have been appointed a herald and apostle, (I speak [the] truth, I do not lie,) a teacher of [the] nations in faith and truth. @ Yua kơ tơlơi gơ̆ng jơlan anŭn, Ơi Adai hmâo jao brơi laih kâo jing sa čô pô pơtô, laih anŭn khua ding kơna (Kâo pơhiăp sĭt, kâo ƀu ƀlor ôh), ngă nai kơ ƀing djuai tuai, kiăng pơtô kơ gơñu tơlơi đaŏ laih anŭn tơlơi sĭt.
I will therefore that the men pray in every place, lifting up pious hands, without wrath or reasoning. @ Hnŭn yơh, amăng djŏp djang anih kâo kiăng kơ ƀing đah rơkơi iâu laĭ, yơr tơngan hơčih ƀu hmâo tơlơi hil ƀôdah tơlơi pơrơdjơ̆ pơrơsao ôh.
In like manner also that the women in decent deportment and dress adorn themselves with modesty and discretion, not with plaited [hair] and gold, or pearls, or costly clothing, @  Kâo ăt kiăng mơ̆n kơ ƀing đah kơmơi pơhrôp gơñu pô djơ̆ tui hăng tơlơi phiăn lăp ai laih anŭn tơpă hơnơ̆ng, ƀu amoañ ƀuk gao hơnơ̆ng, ƀôdah buh mah, boh pơtâo yom ƀôdah čŭt hơô sum ao pơmă prăk. 
but, what becomes women making profession of the fear of God, by good works. @ Samơ̆ ngă bĕ khul bruă hiam, jing tơlơi lăp djơ̆ kơ ƀing đah kơmơi thâo hwĭ pơpŭ. 
Let a woman learn in quietness in all subjection; @ Brơi kơ ƀing đah kơmơi thâo dŏ rơiăt hmư̆ tơlơi pơtô hăng tơlơi thâo đup thâo gưt. 
but I do not suffer a woman to teach nor to exercise authority over man, but to be in quietness; @ Kâo ƀu brơi ôh ƀing đah kơmơi pơtô laĭ ƀôdah jing khua kơ đah rơkơi, samơ̆ khŏm dŏ rơiăt. 
for Adam was formed first, then Eve: @ Yua kơ Ơi Adai pơjing Ađam hlâo laih anŭn HʼÊwa tơdơi. 
and Adam was not deceived; but the woman, having been deceived, was in transgression. @ Laih anŭn ƀu djơ̆ ôh Ađam lĕ amăng tơlơi plư, samơ̆ đah kơmơi yơh lĕ amăng tơlơi plư laih anŭn ngă soh. 
But she shall be preserved in childbearing, if they continue in faith and love and holiness with discretion. @ Samơ̆ ƀing đah kơmơi či klaih yua kơ tơlơi ñu tơkeng kơ ană, tơdah ñu gir dŏ kơjăp amăng tơlơi đaŏ, amăng tơlơi khăp, amăng tơlơi rơgoh hơčih, hăng tơlơi lăp djơ̆ tui tơlơi juăt.
The word [is] faithful: if any one aspires to exercise oversight, he desires a good work. @ Boh pơhiăp anai jing sĭt biă mă: Tơdah hmâo mơnuih kiăng jing pô wai lăng bruă Phung Sang Ơi Adai, pô anŭn čang kiăng kơ sa bruă hiam yom yơh. 
The overseer then must be irreproachable, husband of one wife, sober, discreet, decorous, hospitable, apt to teach; @ Hnŭn yơh, pô wai lăng bruă Phung Sang Ơi Adai khŏm jing sa čô mơnuih ƀu hmâo tơlơi arăng dưi ƀuah ôh, kơnơ̆ng dŏ sa čô bơnai, thâo gơ̆n răng, hmâo akŏ glo bơngač, hơdjă hiam, rơhmač jum arăng, hmâo tơlơi thâo pơtô, 
not given to excesses from wine, not a striker, but mild, not addicted to contention, not fond of money, @ ƀu jing mơnuih ră kơ tơpai, ƀu kreñ đet samơ̆ tơdu rơun, ƀu pơrơdjơ̆ pơrơsao, ƀu hưp ham kơ prăk ôh. 
conducting his own house well, having [his] children in subjection with all gravity; @ Ñu khŏm thâo wai lăng sang anŏ ñu pô kơ hiam klă, pơtô ană bă thâo gưt hiăp laih anŭn thâo pơpŭ amăng abih bang tơlơi; 
(but if one does not know how to conduct his own house, how shall he take care of the assembly of God?) @ Yua kơ hlơi pô ƀu thâo wai lăng sang anŏ ñu pô, hyư̆m ñu dưi thâo wai lăng Phung Sang Ơi Adai lĕ? 
not a novice, that he may not, being inflated, fall into [the] fault of the devil. @ Sa čô phrâo đaŏ ƀu dưi jing pô wai lăng bruă Phung Sang Ơi Adai ôh, hwĭ kơ ñu či pơgao lĕ hĭ amăng tơlơi pơkơhmal pioh brơi kơ yang sat. 
But it is necessary that he should have also a good testimony from those without, that he may fall not into reproach and [the] snare of the devil. @ Pô wai lăng bruă Phung Sang Ơi Adai khŏm hmâo tơlơi ngă gơ̆ng jơlan hiam mơ̆ng ƀing ƀu đaŏ dơ̆ng, kiăng kơ huaĭ lĕ amăng tơlơi mlâo hañ laih anŭn djơ̆ čơđong yang sat.
Ministers, in like manner, grave, not double-tongued, not given to much wine, not seeking gain by base means, @ Ăt kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n, ƀing tha sang yang khŏm klă djrưng, ƀu pơhiăp dua tal, ƀu ră kơ tơpai, ƀu hưp ham kơ prăk ôh; 
holding the mystery of the faith in a pure conscience. @ gơñu khŏm djă pioh tơlơi yom hơgơ̆m kơ tơlơi đaŏ hrŏm hăng pran jua tơpă bơngač. 
And let these be first proved, then let them minister, being without charge [against them]. @ Ƀing gơñu ăt khŏm tŭ tơlơi pơlông lăng hlâo amơĭ; tơdah ƀu hmâo tơlơi dưi ƀuah ôh, hnŭn kah gơñu dưi djă bruă tha sang yang. 
[The] women in like manner grave, not slanderers, sober, faithful in all things. @ Ƀing đah kơmơi ăt kar kaĭ mơ̆n, khŏm klă djrưng, ƀu pơhiăp sat kơ arăng ôh, samơ̆ thâo gơ̆n răng, tŏng ten amăng abih bang bruă. 
Let [the] ministers be husbands of one wife, conducting [their] children and their own houses well: @ Ƀing tha sang yang kơnơ̆ng dŏ sa čô bơnai đôč, laih anŭn gơñu khŏm thâo wai lăng ƀing ană bă, sang anŏ gơñu kơ hiam klă. 
for those who shall have ministered well obtain for themselves a good degree, and much boldness in faith which [is] in Christ Jesus. @ Yua kơ ƀing tha sang yang ngă hiam bruă gơñu, gơñu či hmâo tơlơi arăng pơpŭ kơ gơñu, laih anŭn hmâo tơlơi khĭn amăng tơlơi đaŏ ƀơi Krist Yêsu.
These things I write to thee, hoping to come to thee more quickly; @ Kâo čang rơmang nao čuă ih tañ, samơ̆ ăt khŏm čih khul tơlơi anai, kiăng kơ 
but if I delay, in order that thou mayest know how one ought to conduct oneself in God's house, which is [the] assembly of [the] living God, [the] pillar and base of the truth. @ tơdah kâo kaih truh, ih dưi thâo hyư̆m pă tơlơi gal djơ̆ kiăng kơ dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă amăng sang anŏ Ơi Adai, jing Phung Sang Ơi Adai kơ Ơi Adai Pô hơdip, jing tơmeh laih anŭn atur kơ tơlơi sĭt. 
And confessedly the mystery of piety is great. God has been manifested in flesh, has been justified in [the] Spirit, has appeared to angels, has been preached among [the] nations, has been believed on in [the] world, has been received up in glory. @ Tơlơi yom hơgơ̆m kơ tơlơi ƀing ta đaŏ prŏng biă mă yơh, tơlơi anŭn ƀu hmâo hlơi dưi hơngah ôh:
Pô hmâo bơrơđah rai laih amăng drơi jan mơnuih,
Yang Bơngăt Hiam hmâo pơsĭt laih Ñu jing tơpă,
Ƀing ling jang adai ep lăng Ñu laih,
Arăng pơtô laih anăn Ñu tơ̆ng krah ƀing djuai tuai,
Djŏp djang lŏn tơnah đaŏ laih kơ Ñu,
Ñu đĭ glaĭ laih pơ adai amăng tơlơi guh kơang.
But the Spirit speaks expressly, that in latter times some shall apostatise from the faith, giving their mind to deceiving spirits and teachings of demons @ Yang Bơngăt Hiam laĭ klă rơđah amăng rơnŭk hnal tuč hmâo đơđa mơnuih hơngah lui tơlơi đaŏ, tui ƀing yang plư ƀlor laih anŭn tơlơi yang sat pơtô, 
speaking lies in hypocrisy, cauterised as to their own conscience, @ mơ̆ng tơlơi pơtô plơ̆m ƀlor kơ ƀing mơnuih ƀlor, pran jua tơpă gơñu jing kơpĭl hĭ laih kar hăng pơsơi ngur amăng apui. 
forbidding to marry, [bidding] to abstain from meats, which God has created for receiving with thanksgiving for them who are faithful and know the truth. @ Ƀing anŭn khă arăng pơdŏ rơkơi bơnai, laih anŭn khă kơ̆m arăng ƀơ̆ng đơđa khul mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă, mơnơ̆ng anŭn Ơi Adai hmâo hrih pơjing laih brơi kơ ƀing đaŏ laih anŭn thâo hluh tơlơi sĭt mă tŭ hăng pran jua hơdơr tơngia. 
For every creature of God [is] good, and nothing [is] to be rejected, being received with thanksgiving; @ Yua kơ abih bang mơnơ̆ng Ơi Adai hmâo hrih pơjing laih leng kơ hiam soh sel, ƀu hmâo mơnơ̆ng hơgĕt lăp lui hĭ, tŭ kơ mă tŭ hăng pran jua thâo hơdơr tơngia; 
for it is sanctified by God's word and freely addressing [him]. @ yua kơ khul mơnơ̆ng anŭn hmâo jing rơgoh hiam hĭ yua mơ̆ng boh pơhiăp Ơi Adai laih anŭn mơ̆ng tơlơi iâu laĭ.
Laying these things before the brethren, thou wilt be a good minister of Christ Jesus, nourished with the words of the faith and of the good teaching which thou hast fully followed up. @ Tơdah ih pơtô abih khul tơlơi anai kơ adơi ayŏng, ih či jing sa čô ding kơna hiam kơ Krist Yêsu, čem rong ih pô hăng boh pơhiăp kơ tơlơi đaŏ, laih anŭn mơta tơlơi pơtô djơ̆ sĭt ih hmâo đaŏ laih. 
But profane and old wives' fables avoid, but exercise thyself unto piety; @ Hơbĕ ataih bĕ mơ̆ng tơlơi ră ruai đôč đač grĭ grañ, tơlơi pơčeh mă mơ̆ng ƀing đah kơmơi tha, samơ̆ brơi ih hrăm pơjuăt ih pô pran jua thâo hwĭ pơpŭ kơ Ơi Adai; 
for bodily exercise is profitable for a little, but piety is profitable for everything, having promise of life, of the present one, and of that to come. @ yua kơ tơlơi pơhrăm pơjuăt drơi jan kơnơ̆ng tŭ yua ƀơƀiă đôč, samơ̆ tơlơi thâo hwĭ pơpŭ kơ Ơi Adai hmâo tơlơi tŭ yua amăng djŏp mơta tơlơi. Yua kơ hmâo tơlơi ƀuăn brơi kơ tơlơi hơdip rơnŭk anai laih anŭn wơ̆t kơ tơlơi hơdip rơnŭk tơdơi mơ̆n. 
The word [is] faithful and worthy of all acceptation; @ Anŭn jing boh pơhiăp sĭt biă mă, năng lăp đaŏ laih anŭn mă tŭ. 
for, for this we labour and suffer reproach, because we hope in a living God, who is preserver of all men, specially of those that believe. @ Ƀing ta tŭ tơlơi gleh tơnap laih anŭn pơblah brơi kơ tơlơi anai, yua kơ ƀing ta pioh tơlơi čang rơmang ƀơi Ơi Adai hơdip, jing Pô Pơklaih kơ abih bang mơnuih, biă mă ñu kơ ƀing đaŏ.
Enjoin and teach these things. @ Anŭn jing khul tơlơi ih khŏm pơđur laih anŭn pơtô. 
Let no one despise thy youth, but be a model of the believers, in word, in conduct, in love, in faith, in purity. @ Anăm brơi arăng mưč mač kơ ih yua kơ ih dŏ tơdăm ôh, samơ̆ brơi ih ngă tơlơi bơhmutu hiam brơi kơ ƀing đaŏ amăng tơlơi pơhiăp, tơlơi dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă, tơlơi thâo khăp, tơlơi đaŏ laih anŭn tơlơi rơgoh hiam. 
Till I come, give thyself to reading, to exhortation, to teaching. @ Brơi kơ ih pơyom kơ tơlơi đŏk Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp amăng tơlơi bơjơnum, pơtô pơtrŭt laih anŭn pơhrăm tơl kâo truh. 
Be not negligent of the gift [that is] in thee, which has been given to thee through prophecy, with imposition of the hands of the elderhood. @ Anăm wơr lui ôh tơlơi pha brơi amăng ih, jing tơlơi pha brơi hmâo brơi kơ ih mơ̆ng tơlơi laĭ lui hlâo hlăk tơpul ƀing kŏng tha hmâo ah tơngan ƀơi ih. 
Occupy thyself with these things; be wholly in them, that thy progress may be manifest to all. @ Ngă bĕ bruă anai laih anŭn pioh abih pran jua kơ bruă anai, kiăng abih bang mơnuih ƀuh tơlơi ih đĭ kơyar.
Give heed to thyself and to the teaching; continue in them; for, doing this, thou shalt save both thyself and those that hear thee. @ Răng bĕ kơ ih pô laih anŭn kơ tơlơi ih pơtô; khŏm gir ƀel amăng abih bang bruă anŭn, yua kơ ngă tui anŭn, ih či pơklaih ih pô laih anŭn ƀing mơnuih hmư̆ ih kar kaĭ mơ̆n.
Rebuke not an elder sharply, but exhort [him] as a father, younger [men] as brethren, @ Anăm ƀuah ôh ƀing đah rơkơi tha rơma, samơ̆ pơalum bĕ gơñu kar hăng ama, hăng ƀing tơdăm kar hăng adơi ayŏng, 
elder women as mothers, younger women as sisters, with all purity. @ hăng ƀing đah kơmơi tha kar hăng amĭ, hăng ƀing đah kơmơi dra kar hăng amai adơi, hăng abih bang tơlơi rơgoh hiam.
Honour widows who are really widows; @ Pơpŭ bĕ kơ ƀing đah kơmơi blao jing ƀing đah kơmơi blao sĭt. 
but if any widow have children or descendants, let them learn first to be pious as regards their own house, and to render a return on their side to [their] parents; for this is acceptable in the sight of God. @ Tơdah sa čô đah kơmơi blao hmâo ană ƀôdah tơčo, blŭng hlâo ƀing ană tơčo ñu khŏm hrăm pơrơđah pran jua thâo pơpŭ hăng sang anŏ gơñu pô, laih anŭn thâo ba glaĭ tơlơi gleh tơnap amĭ ama; yua kơ tơlơi anŭn bơmơak kơ Ơi Adai. 
Now she who [is] a widow indeed, and is left alone, has put [her] hope in God, and continues in supplications and prayers night and day. @ Hlơi pô jing đah kơmơi blao sĭt, hơdip hơjăn păn, pioh tơlơi čang rơmang ƀơi Ơi Adai brơi ñu hrơi mlam dŏ gir iâu laĭ kơwưh rơkâo. 
But she that lives in habits of self-indulgence is dead [while] living. @ Samơ̆ bơnai blao pă hơdip hăng tơlơi tŭt kơ hơduah tơlơi ngui ngơr mơak tui hăng drơi jan amoaih, wơ̆t dah hơdip ăt kar hăng djai laih mơ̆n. 
And these things enjoin, that they may be irreproachable. @ Brơi ih pơtô pơtă hơdôm tơlơi anai kiăng kơ ƀing gơñu ƀu hmâo tơlơi arăng dưi ƀuah ôh. 
But if any one does not provide for his own, and specially for those of [his] house, he has denied the faith, and is worse than the unbeliever. @ Tơdah hlơi pô ƀu čem rong kơnŭng djuai ñu pô, biă mă kơ sang anŏ ñu pô, mơnuih anŭn hmâo hơngah tơlơi đaŏ laih, laih anŭn sat hloh kơ ƀing ƀu đaŏ dơ̆ng.
Let a widow be put upon the list, being of not less than sixty years, [having been] wife of one man, @ Kiăng kơ dưi čih anăn ƀing đah kơmơi blao amăng sŏp hră ƀing đah kơmơi djai rơkơi, ñu anŭn khŏm năm pluh thŭn pơ ngŏ laih anŭn ñu kơnơ̆ng hmâo sa čô rơkơi đôč; 
borne witness to in good works, if she have brought up children, if she have exercised hospitality, if she have washed saints' feet, if she have imparted relief to the distressed, if she have diligently followed every good work. @ khŏm hmâo tơlơi gơ̆ng jơlan kơ ñu hmâo ngă khul bruă hiam, kar hăng thâo rong ba ană bă, tŭ jum ƀing djuai tuai, rao brơi tơkai ƀing rơgoh hiam, djru gŭm ƀing tơnap, laih anŭn jao ñu pô ngă djŏp mơta bruă hiam.
