But younger widows decline; for when they grow wanton against Christ, they desire to marry, @ Samơ̆ anăm čih ôh anăn ƀing đah kơmơi blao dŏ mơda; yua kơ tơ tơlơi amoaih sat ngă kơ ñu ataih hĭ mơ̆ng Yang Krist, hlăk anŭn ñu kiăng dŏ rơkơi, 
being guilty, because they have cast off their first faith. @ tui anŭn gơñu či tŭ tơlơi klă kơđi kơ gơñu pô, yua kơ gơñu ngă gao hĭ tơlơi gơñu ƀuăn laih mơ̆ng blŭng hlâo. 
And, at the same time, they learn also [to be] idle, going about to people's houses; and not only idle, but also gossipers and meddlers, speaking things not becoming. @ Hloh kơ anŭn dơ̆ng gơñu hrăm dŏ ngui đôč đač, hyu mơ̆ng sang anai nao sang pơkŏn, laih anŭn ƀu djơ̆ gơñu kơnơ̆ng dŏ đôč đač đôč ôh samơ̆ gơñu jing ƀing pơhiăp rơkut kơ arăng, čer mŭt amăng bruă pô pơkŏn, pơhiăp khul tơlơi ƀu lăp pơhiăp ôh. 
I will therefore that the younger marry, bear children, rule the house, give no occasion to the adversary in respect of reproach. @ Hnŭn yơh, kâo kiăng ƀing đah kơmơi blao hlăk thŭn mơda dŏ bĕ rơkơi, hmâo ană bă, wai lăng sang anŏ gơñu pô, ƀu ngă brơi ƀing ayăt hmâo mông gal pơhiăp sat ôh. 
For already some have turned aside after Satan. @ Yua kơ hmâo laih đơđa ƀing đah kơmơi blao jrok jơlan tui Satan. 
If any believing man or woman have widows, let them impart relief to them, and let not the assembly be charged, that it may impart relief to those [that are] widows indeed. @ Tơdah sa čô đah kơmơi đaŏ hmâo đah kơmơi blao amăng sang ñu, ñu khŏm djru gơ̆, anăm thim brơi tơlơi kơtraŏ kơ Phung Sang Ơi Adai dơ̆ng ôh, kiăng kơ Phung Sang Ơi Adai dưi gŭm djru ƀing mơnuih blao sĭt.
Let the elders who take the lead [among the saints] well be esteemed worthy of double honour, specially those labouring in word and teaching; @ Ƀing kŏng tha kơhnăk wai lăng Phung Sang Ơi Adai khŏm hmâo tơlơi pơpŭ lu hloh, biă mă ñu ƀing mơnuih tŭ tơlơi gleh glăn amăng tơlơi pơtô laih anŭn tơlơi pơhrăm. 
for the scripture says, Thou shalt not muzzle an ox that treadeth out corn, and, The workman [is] worthy of his hire. @ Yua kơ Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp laĭ: “Anăm ƀing gih kho hĭ ôh tơƀong rơmo hlăk ñu juă pơdai,” laih anŭn “Pô mă bruă năng lăp mă tŭ prăk apah yơh.” 
Against an elder receive not an accusation unless where there are two or three witnesses. @ Anăm tŭ ôh tơlơi arăng phong pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ sa čô kŏng tha, kơnơ̆ng tơdah hmâo tơlơi ngă gơ̆ng jơlan pơsĭt mơ̆ng dua ƀôdah klâo čô. 
Those that sin convict before all, that the rest also may have fear. @ Bơ kơ ƀing juăt ngă soh, brơi ih ƀuah gơñu ƀơi anăp abih bang, kiăng kơ ƀing pơkŏn hmâo tơlơi hwĭ.
I testify before God and Christ Jesus and the elect angels, that thou keep these things without prejudice, doing nothing by favour. @ Ƀơi anăp Ơi Adai, ƀơi anăp Krist Yêsu, laih anŭn hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing ling jang adai hmâo ruah, kâo pơtă brơi ih djă pioh khul tơlơi pơtă pơtô anai, anăm hmâo tơlơi pơmĭn sat, kŏn anăm ngă bruă hơgĕt yua kơ tơlơi pơkah pơpha lơi. 
Lay hands quickly on no man, nor partake in others' sins. Keep thyself pure. @ Anăm hăt ah tơngan brơi kơ hlơi hlơi ôh, kŏn anăm mŭt hrŏm lơi amăng bruă tơlơi soh pô pơkŏn, răng bĕ ih pô kơ tơlơi rơgoh hiam.
Drink no longer only water, but use a little wine on account of thy stomach and thy frequent illnesses. @ Yua kơ hlŭng asơi ih laih anŭn yua kơ ih juăt ruă, hnŭn yơh ih anăm kơnơ̆ng mơñum ia ƀlăng đôč ôh, brơi ih yua ƀiă tơpai.
Of some men the sins are manifest beforehand, going before to judgment, and some also they follow after. @ Tơlơi soh đơđa mơnuih arăng dưi ƀuh mơtam hlâo kơ hrơi phat kơđi; samơ̆ ăt hmâo đơđa ƀing pơkŏn, arăng dưi ƀuh tơdơi kơ anŭn đôč. 
In like manner good works also are manifest beforehand, and those that are otherwise cannot be hid. @ Kar kaĭ mơ̆n, bruă hiam đơđa mơnuih arăng dưi ƀuh mơtam, laih anŭn đơđa arăng ƀu dưi ƀuh mơtam ôh, samơ̆ kŏn thâo pơdŏp nanao lơi.
Let as many bondmen as are under yoke count their own masters worthy of all honour, that the name of God and the teaching be not blasphemed. @ Brơi abih bang ƀing dŏ gah yŭ ač jing hlŭn khŏm pơpŭ kơ khua ñu amăng djŏp tơlơi, kiăng kơ arăng ƀu ƀrưh hmiah kơ anăn Ơi Adai laih anŭn kơ tơlơi ƀing ta pơtô ôh. 
And they that have believing masters, let them not despise [them] because they are brethren; but let them the rather serve them with subjection, because they are faithful and beloved, who profit by the good and ready service [rendered]. These things teach and exhort. @ Ƀing hlơi hmâo khua jing ƀing đaŏ, anăm kơƀah hĭ ôh tơlơi hwĭ pơpŭ yua gơñu jing ƀing adơi ayŏng amăng tơlơi đaŏ, samơ̆ jai mă bruă hăng abih pran jua hloh dơ̆ng, yua kơ pô ƀing ta mă bruă anŭn jing ƀing đaŏ laih anŭn adơi ayŏng khăp hơeng. Anŭn jing khul tơlơi ih khŏm pơtô laih anŭn pơđur ƀing gơñu.
If any one teach differently, and do not accede to sound words, those of our Lord Jesus Christ, and the teaching which [is] according to piety, @ Tơdah hmâo hlơi pô pơtô tơlơi pơkŏn, ƀu djơ̆ hăng boh pơhiăp sĭt laih anŭn tơlơi pơtô kơ tơlơi thâo pơpŭ kơ Yêsu Krist Khua Yang ƀing ta, 
he is puffed up, knowing nothing, but sick about questions and disputes of words, out of which arise envy, strife, injurious words, evil suspicions, @ ñu anŭn jing mơnuih pơgao, laih anŭn ƀu thâo sa mơta tơlơi hơgĕt ôh. Ñu hmâo tơlơi ruă khăp pơrơjah pơgăl, pơgăl yua kơ boh hră, tơlơi anŭn ba truh tơlơi moañ, tơlơi pơkah pơpha phung, tơlơi pơhiăp sat, tơlơi đing sat, 
constant quarrellings of men corrupted in mind and destitute of the truth, holding gain to be [the end of] piety. @ laih anŭn tơlơi pơrơjah tơ̆ng krah ƀing mơnuih hmâo tơlơi pơmĭn soh sat, pơrơngiă hĭ tơlơi sĭt, lăng tơlơi thâo pơpŭ kar hăng jơlan dưi hmâo kơmlai tŭ yua.
But piety with contentment *is* great gain. @ Tơlơi thâo pơpŭ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng pran jua thâo hrăp, jing phŭn kơ tơlơi tŭ yua prŏng. 
For we have brought nothing into the world: [it is] [manifest] that neither can we carry anything out. @ Yua kơ hlăk ƀing ta tơkeng rai amăng lŏn tơnah, ƀing ta ƀu hmâo djă ba sa mơta mơnơ̆ng hơgĕt ôh, kar kaĭ mơ̆n hlăk ƀing ta djai ƀing ta kŏn dưi djă ba mơnơ̆ng hơgĕt lơi; 
But having sustenance and covering, we will be content with these. @ yua kơ anŭn yơh, hmâo asơi huă, ao buh brơi kơ ƀing ta khŏm hrăp pran jua bĕ. 
But those who desire to be rich fall into temptation and a snare, and many unwise and hurtful lusts, which plunge men into destruction and ruin. @ Bơ kơ ƀing hlơi hưp ham jing pơdrŏng sah či lĕ amăng tơlơi plư, djơ̆ čơđong, lĕ amăng khul tơlơi hưp ham mlŭk mơgu laih anŭn hyưt răm, jing khul tơlơi pơtrăm ană mơnuih amăng tơlơi răm rai laih anŭn djai rơngiă. 
For the love of money is [the] root of every evil; which some having aspired after, have wandered from the faith, and pierced themselves with many sorrows. @ Yua kơ pran jua khăp kơ prăk jing phŭn akha kơ abih bang tơlơi sat, laih anŭn yua kơ tơlơi amoaih dưi jing pơdrŏng hmâo đơđa klah lui laih mơ̆ng tơlơi đaŏ, mă tŭ kơ gơñu pô lu tơlơi ruă nuă.
But *thou*, O man of God, flee these things, and pursue righteousness, piety, faith, love, endurance, meekness of spirit. @ Samơ̆ bơ kơ ih, jing mơnuih kơ Ơi Adai, ataih bĕ mơ̆ng abih bang khul tơlơi anŭn; laih anŭn sem hơduah tơlơi tơpă, tơlơi thâo pơpŭ, tơlơi đaŏ, tơlơi khăp, tơlơi gir tŭ, tơlơi tơdu rơun. 
Strive earnestly [in] the good conflict of faith. Lay hold of eternal life, to which thou hast been called, and hast confessed the good confession before many witnesses. @ Yua kơ tơlơi đaŏ pơblah bĕ hăng tơlơi khĭn; sua mă tơlơi hơdip hlŏng lar, jing tơlơi hơdip Ơi Adai hmâo iâu laih ih, laih anŭn kơlih yua kơ tơlơi anŭn ih hmâo tơlơi pơhaih hiam klă ƀơi anăp lu mơnuih ngă gơ̆ng jơlan. 
I enjoin thee before God who preserves all things in life, and Christ Jesus who witnessed before Pontius Pilate the good confession, @ Ƀơi anăp Ơi Adai jing Pô brơi tơlơi hơdip kơ abih bang mơnơ̆ng, laih anŭn ƀơi anăp Krist Yêsu, Pô hmâo tơlơi pơhaih hiam klă hlăk ngă gơ̆ng jơlan ƀơi anăp Pôntơ Pilat, kâo pơtrŭt kơ ih 
that thou keep the commandment spotless, irreproachable, until the appearing of our Lord Jesus Christ; @ khŏm djă pioh tơlơi pơtă anai hăng tơlơi tum num, tơl arăng ƀu dưi ƀuah ôh, truh hrơi Khua Yang ƀing ta Yêsu Krist rai dơ̆ng. 
which in its own time the blessed and only Ruler shall shew, the King of those that reign, and Lord of those that exercise lordship; @ Ñu či pơrơđah djơ̆ amăng rơnŭk Ñu, kơnơ̆ng hơjăn Ñu jing Pô mơyun hiam laih anŭn kơnơ̆ng hơjăn Ñu jing Pô Prŏng Hloh, jing Pơtao kơ abih bang Pơtao, Khua Yang kơ abih bang Khua Yang. 
who only has immortality, dwelling in unapproachable light; whom no man has seen, nor is able to see; to whom [be] honour and eternal might. Amen. @ Kơnơ̆ng hơjăn Ñu đôč jing Pô ƀu thâo djai, laih anŭn dŏ tơ̆ng krah tơlơi bơngač ƀu hmâo hlơi dưi nao giăm, jing Pô aka hmâo hlơi ƀuh ƀôdah dưi ƀuh ôh. Kơ Ñu yơh tơlơi pơpŭ laih anŭn tơlơi dưi mơyang hlŏng lar! Amen.
Enjoin on those rich in the present age not to be high-minded, nor to trust on the uncertainty of riches; but in the God who affords us all things richly for [our] enjoyment; @ Pơtô pơtrŭt bĕ ƀing mơnuih pơdrŏng ƀơi lŏn tơnah anai, anăm pơgao laih anŭn anăm pioh tơlơi čang rơmang ƀơi dram gơnam ƀu kơjăp ôh, samơ̆ brơi pioh bĕ tơlơi čang rơmang ƀơi Ơi Adai, jing Pô rĭm hrơi pha brơi djŏp mơta mơnơ̆ng hăng tơlơi rơbeh blai kiăng ƀing ta hơ̆k mơak mă tŭ. 
to do good, to be rich in good works, to be liberal in distributing, disposed to communicate [of their substance], @ Gơñu khŏm ngă bruă hiam, ngă lu bruă mơyun hiam, hmâo pran jua čơmah laih anŭn hơ̆k mơak pha brơi, 
laying by for themselves a good foundation for the future, that they may lay hold of [what is] really life. @ tui anŭn gơñu pơƀŭt pioh kơ gơñu pô dram gơnam yom hmâo atur kơjăp kơ hrơi pơ anăp, tui anŭn gơñu dưi djă kơjăp tơlơi hơdip jing tơlơi hơdip sĭt.
O Timotheus, keep the entrusted deposit, avoiding profane, vain babblings, and oppositions of false-named knowledge, @ Ơ Timôthê, djă pioh bĕ hơdôm tơlơi hơgĕt hmâo jao brơi laih kơ ih, hơbĕ đuaĭ mơ̆ng khul boh pơhiăp tă tăn grĭ grañ, laih anŭn khul tơlơi pơrơjah kơ khul tơlơi arăng tơhwơl pơmĭn dah jing tơlơi rơgơi; 
of which some having made profession, have missed the faith. Grace [be] with thee. @ yua kơ kiăng hmâo mơta tơlơi thâo hluh anŭn, hmâo đơđa mơnuih pơrơngiă hĭ tơlơi đaŏ.
Rơkâo tơlơi pap Ơi Adai dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing gih!
Paul, apostle of Jesus Christ by God's will, according to promise of life, the [life] which [is] in Christ Jesus, @ Pôl, khua ding kơna kơ Krist Yêsu, mơ̆ng tơlơi Ơi Adai kiăng, tui hăng tơlơi ƀuăn pha brơi tơlơi hơdip amăng Krist Yêsu, 
to Timotheus, [my] beloved child: grace, mercy, peace, from God [the] Father, and Christ Jesus our Lord. @ mơit kơ Timôthê, ană kâo khăp hơeng biă mă: Rơkâo kơ Ơi Adai jing Ama, laih anŭn Krist Yêsu, Khua Yang ƀing ta pha brơi kơ ih tơlơi pap, tơlơi pap drap laih anŭn tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua.
I am thankful to God, whom I serve from [my] forefathers with pure conscience, how unceasingly I have the remembrance of thee in my supplications night and day, @ Kâo bơni kơ Ơi Adai, jing Pô kâo mă bruă hăng pran jua tơpă bơngač, kar hăng ơi adon kâo hmâo ngă laih, hrơi hăng mlam nanao kâo hơdơr kơ ih tơdang kâo iâu laĭ. 
earnestly desiring to see thee, remembering thy tears, that I may be filled with joy; @ Tơdang kâo hơdơr kơ ia mơta ih, kâo kiăng biă mă nao čuă ih kiăng kơ pran jua bă blai tơlơi hơ̆k mơak. 
calling to mind the unfeigned faith which [has been] in thee, which dwelt first in thy grandmother Lois, and in thy mother Eunice, and I am persuaded that in thee also. @ Kâo ăt hơdơr mơ̆n tơlơi ih đaŏ sĭt, jing tơlơi đaŏ hlâo anŭn hmâo laih amăng yă ih HʼLôis, laih anŭn amăng amĭ ih HʼÔnis, laih anŭn kâo đaŏ biă mă tơlơi đaŏ anŭn ră anai hlăk hơdip amăng ih. 
For which cause I put thee in mind to rekindle the gift of God which is in thee by the putting on of my hands. @ Yua kơ anŭn yơh, kâo pơhơdơr kơ ih săr glaĭ bĕ tơlơi pha brơi mơ̆ng Ơi Adai ih hmâo mă tŭ laih mơ̆ng tơlơi kâo ah tơngan kơ ih. 
For God has not given us a spirit of cowardice, but of power, and of love, and of wise discretion. @ Yua kơ Ơi Adai ƀu pha brơi kơ ƀing ta bơngăt jua lêl ôh, samơ̆ bơngăt jua kơtang, hmâo tơlơi thâo khăp laih anŭn thâo wai ta pô.
Be not therefore ashamed of the testimony of our Lord, nor of me his prisoner; but suffer evil along with the glad tidings, according to the power of God; @ Hnŭn yơh, anăm mlâo ôh ngă gơ̆ng jơlan kơ Khua Yang ƀing ta, kŏn mlâo lơi yua kơ kâo, pô jing mơnă yua kơ Ñu; samơ̆ kơnang bĕ kơ tơlơi dưi mơyang Ơi Adai, hrŏm hơbĭt hăng kâo tŭ tơlơi tơnap tap yua kơ Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam. 
who has saved us, and has called us with a holy calling, not according to our works, but according to [his] own purpose and grace, which [was] given to us in Christ Jesus before [the] ages of time, @ Ơi Adai hmâo pơklaih laih ƀing ta, hmâo iâu laih ƀing ta hăng tơlơi iâu rơgoh hiam, ƀu djơ̆ yua kơ bruă ƀing ta ngă ôh, samơ̆ tui hăng tơlơi kơñăm Ñu pô laih anŭn tơlơi pap Ñu. Tơlơi pap anŭn Ñu hmâo pha brơi laih kơ ƀing ta čơdơ̆ng mơ̆ng rơnŭk đưm đă amăng Krist Yêsu. 
but has been made manifest now by the appearing of our Saviour Jesus Christ, who has annulled death, and brought to light life and incorruptibility by the glad tidings; @ Tơlơi pap anŭn ră anai hmâo pơrơđah laih găn mơ̆ng tơlơi Yêsu Krist rai, Pô pơklaih ƀing ta, Pô hmâo pơrai hĭ tơlơi djai, yua Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam ngă pơrơđah brơi tơlơi hơdip laih anŭn tơlơi ƀu thâo djai.
to which *I* have been appointed a herald and apostle and teacher of [the] nations. @  Yua kơ Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam anai yơh, Ơi Adai hmâo pơjing kâo jing pô pơtô tơlơi Phrâo Hiam, khua ding kơna laih anŭn nai pơhrăm, 
For which cause also I suffer these things; but I am not ashamed; for I know whom I have believed, and am persuaded that he is able to keep for that day the deposit I have entrusted to him. @ yua kơ tơlơi anŭn yơh kâo tŭ tơlơi tơnap tap anai. Samơ̆ kâo ƀu mlâo ôh, yua kơ kâo thâo hlơi Pô kâo đaŏ, laih anŭn kâo thâo sĭt kơ Ñu hmâo tơlơi dưi mơyang, dưi wai lăng tơlơi kâo hmâo jao laih kơ Ñu tơl truh hrơi anŭn. 
Have an outline of sound words, which [words] thou hast heard of me, in faith and love which [are] in Christ Jesus. @ Brơi ih djă pioh khul tơlơi pơtô sĭt ih hmâo hmư̆ laih mơ̆ng kâo, amăng tơlơi đaŏ laih anŭn tơlơi khăp amăng Krist Yêsu. 
Keep, by the Holy Spirit which dwells in us, the good deposit entrusted. @ Kơnang bĕ kơ Yang Bơngăt Hiam, Pô hlăk dŏ amăng ƀing ta, djă pioh tơlơi hiam klă hmâo jao brơi laih kơ ih.
Thou knowest this, that all who [are] in Asia, of whom is Phygellus and Hermogenes, have turned away from me. @ Ih thâo laih abih bang mơnuih amăng čar Asi lui laih kâo; amăng ƀing anŭn hmâo Phigel laih anŭn Hermôgen mơ̆n; 
The Lord grant mercy to the house of Onesiphorus, for he has often refreshed me, and has not been ashamed of my chain; @ rơkâo kơ Khua Yang pap drap kơ sang anŏ Ônêsiphor, yua kơ ñu hmâo pơalum laih kâo nanao. Ñu ƀu mlâo ôh kơ tơlơi arăng akă kâo hăng hrĕ čuăk, 
but being in Rome sought me out very diligently, and found [me] @ kơđai glaĭ, tơ ñu man truh pơ Rôm, ñu hur har ječ meč tui hơduah kâo laih anŭn hmâo ƀuh kâo yơh. 
the Lord grant to him to find mercy from [the] Lord in that day and how much service he rendered in Ephesus *thou* knowest best. @ Rơkâo kơ Khua Yang brơi kơ ñu hơduah ƀuh tơlơi pap drap Khua Yang amăng Hrơi anŭn! Laih anŭn ih thâo klă rơđah pơ Êphêsô ñu hmâo buih bruă kâo hăng abih pran jua.
Thou therefore, my child, be strong in the grace which [is] in Christ Jesus. @ Tui anŭn, Ơ ană kâo, ngă pơkơtang bĕ ih pô amăng tơlơi pap Krist Yêsu. 
And the things thou hast heard of me in the presence of many witnesses, these entrust to faithful men, such as shall be competent to instruct others also. @ Hơdôm tơlơi ih hmâo hmư̆ laih mơ̆ng kâo ƀơi anăp lu mơnuih ngă gơ̆ng jơlan, brơi ih jao bĕ tơlơi anŭn kơ ƀing mơnuih năng lăp đaŏ kơnang, jing ƀing mơnuih hmâo tơlơi dưi pơtô glaĭ ƀing mơnuih pơkŏn.
Take thy share in suffering as a good soldier of Jesus Christ. @ Tŭ bĕ tơlơi tơnap tap hrŏm hơbĭt hăng kâo kar hăng sa čô tơhan khĭn kơtang kơ Krist Yêsu. 
No one going as a soldier entangles himself with the affairs of life, that he may please him who has enlisted him as a soldier. @ Ƀu hmâo ôh sa čô tơhan hlăk dŏ mă bruă dŏ đom hăng bruă lŏn tơnah dơ̆ng, yua kơ tơlơi kơñăm kơ pô anŭn jing kiăng ngă bơmơak kơ pô hmâo iâu mă ñu. 
And if also any one contend [in the games], he is not crowned unless he contend lawfully. @ Kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n, sa čô pơplong ƀu či dưi mă tŭ mŭk pơtao ôh tơdah ñu ƀu pơrơsua djơ̆ tui tơlơi juăt. 
The husbandman must labour before partaking of the fruits. @ Pô mă bruă hmua gleh glăn ñu khŏm mă tŭ boh than hlâo hloh. 
Think of what I say, for the Lord will give thee understanding in all things. @ Brơi pơmĭn bĕ tơlơi kâo laĭ, yua kơ Khua Yang či pha brơi ih tơlơi thâo hluh amăng abih bang bruă.
Remember Jesus Christ raised from among [the] dead, of [the] seed of David, according to my glad tidings, @ Brơi hơdơr bĕ Khua Yang Yêsu Krist, hmâo hơdip glaĭ laih mơ̆ng ƀing djai, hmâo tơkeng rai mơ̆ng ană tơčo Đawit tui hăng Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam kâo. 
in which I suffer even unto bonds as an evil-doer: but the word of God is not bound. @ Yua kơ Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam anŭn kâo tŭ tơlơi tơnap tap, tơl arăng akă kâo hăng čuăk kar hăng sa čô mơnuih soh. Samơ̆ boh pơhiăp Ơi Adai arăng ƀu dưi akă kling ñu ôh. 
For this cause I endure all things for the sake of the elect, that *they* also may obtain the salvation which [is] in Christ Jesus with eternal glory. @ Hnŭn yơh, kâo gir tŭ abih bang tơlơi yua kơ ƀing mơnuih Ơi Adai hmâo ruah laih, kiăng kơ ƀing gơñu ăt dưi mă tŭ tơlơi pơklaih amăng Krist Yêsu hrŏm hơbĭt tơlơi guh kơang hlŏng lar. 
The word [is] faithful; for if we have died together with [him], we shall also live together; @ Boh pơhiăp anai jing sĭt biă mă:
Tơdah ƀing ta djai laih hrŏm hăng Ñu,
Ƀing ta ăt či hơdip hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Ñu mơ̆n;
if we endure, we shall also reign together; if we deny, *he* also will deny us; @  Tơdah ƀing ta gir tŭ tơlơi tơnap tap,
Ƀing ta ăt či wai lăng hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Ñu mơ̆n;
Tơdah ƀing ta hơngah lui Ñu,
Ñu ăt či hơngah lui ƀing ta mơ̆n;
if we are unfaithful, *he* abides faithful, for he cannot deny himself. @ Tơdah ƀing ta ƀu tŏng ten ôh,
Ñu ăt dŏ hơnơ̆ng ten;
Yua kơ Ñu ƀu dưi hơngah lui Ñu pô ôh.
Of these things put in remembrance, testifying earnestly before the Lord not to have disputes of words, profitable for nothing, to the subversion of the hearers. @ Brơi ih pơhơdơr ƀing gơñu khul tơlơi anai, laih anŭn ƀơi anăp Ơi Adai brơi ih pơthâo răng kơ ƀing gơñu khŏm hơbĕ đuaĭ tơlơi pơrơjah kơ boh hră, anŭn jing tơlơi ƀu tŭ yua ôh, kơnơ̆ng pơrai ƀing dŏ hmư̆ đôč. 
Strive diligently to present thyself approved to God, a workman that has not to be ashamed, cutting in a straight line the word of truth. @ Mă bruă bĕ hăng abih pran jua kiăng kơ jing mơnuih Ơi Adai tŭ, sa čô mă bruă ƀu hmâo tơlơi hơgĕt mlâo ôh, pơtô boh pơhiăp tơlơi sĭt hăng tơlơi tơpă. 
But profane, vain babblings shun, for they will advance to greater impiety, @ Đuaĭ ataih bĕ mơ̆ng khul boh pơhiăp tă tăn grĭ grañ, yua kơ ƀing pơhiăp kar hăng anŭn či nao dlam jai amăng tơlơi ƀu thâo hwĭ pơpŭ kơ Ơi Adai, 
and their word will spread as a gangrene; of whom is Hymenaeus and Philetus; @ laih anŭn tơlơi gơñu pơhiăp či ƀơ̆ng kar hăng brŭ kren lar hyu, amăng ƀing anŭn hmâo Himênê laih anŭn Philêt. 
[men] who as to the truth have gone astray, saying that the resurrection has taken place already; and overthrow the faith of some. @ Gơñu klah laih mơ̆ng tơlơi sĭt, tơdang laĭ tơlơi hơdip glaĭ rơgao laih. Gơñu ngă pơblư̆ blang tơlơi đaŏ đơđa mơnuih. 
Yet the firm foundation of God stands, having this seal, [The] Lord knows those that are his; and, Let every one who names the name of [the] Lord withdraw from iniquity. @ Samơ̆ atur kơjăp Ơi Adai ăt dŏ dơ̆ng kơjăp, hăng boh pơhiăp kơđŏm anai: “Khua Yang thâo ƀing mơnuih lơ̆m kơ Ñu,” laih anŭn “Hlơi iâu kơwưh anăn Khua Yang khŏm hơbĕ ataih mơ̆ng tơlơi soh.”
But in a great house there are not only gold and silver vessels, but also wooden and earthen; and some to honour, and some to dishonour. @ Amăng sa boh sang prŏng, ƀu djơ̆ ôh hmâo kơnơ̆ng get mah, get prăk, samơ̆ ăt hmâo get ngă hăng kơyâo, ngă hăng lŏn mơ̆n, hmâo đơđa yua brơi kơ bruă yom, hmâo đơđa yua brơi kơ bruă ƀu yom đơi ôh. 
If therefore one shall have purified himself from these, [in separating himself from them], he shall be a vessel to honour, sanctified, serviceable to the Master, prepared for every good work. @ Yua kơ anŭn yơh hlơi pô pơrơgoh ñu pô mơ̆ng tơlơi kâo laĭ anŭn, ñu či jing get arăng yua kơ bruă yom, hmâo pơrơgoh hiam, tŭ yua kơ khua ñu laih anŭn prăp pre brơi kơ abih bang bruă hiam.
But youthful lusts flee, and pursue righteousness, faith, love, peace, with those that call upon the Lord out of a pure heart. @ Hơngah lui bĕ khul tơlơi amoaih hưp ƀing tơdăm dra, laih anŭn tui hơduah tơlơi tơpă hơnơ̆ng, tơlơi đaŏ, tơlơi khăp, laih anŭn tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing iâu kơwưh kơ anăn Khua Yang hăng pran jua rơgoh hiam. 
But foolish and senseless questionings avoid, knowing that they beget contentions. @ Brơi ih hơngah hĭ khul tơlơi pơrơjah mlŭk mơgu ƀu hmâo tơlơi tŭ yua ôh, yua kơ ih thâo tơlơi anŭn kơnơ̆ng ba truh tơlơi pơrơdjơ̆ đôč. 
And a bondman of [the] Lord ought not to contend, but be gentle towards all; apt to teach; forbearing; @ Laih anŭn ding kơna Khua Yang ƀu dưi pơrơjah ôh, samơ̆ brơi ih rơhmač hăng abih bang mơnuih, rơgơi thâo pơtô, gir tŭ, 
in meekness setting right those who oppose, if God perhaps may sometime give them repentance to acknowledgment of [the] truth, @ pơkra ƀing mơnuih pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ hăng tơlơi tơdu rơun, năng ai Ơi Adai či djru ƀing gơñu kơhmal tơlơi soh laih anŭn thâo krăn tơlơi sĭt, 
and that they may awake up out of the snare of the devil, [who are] taken by him, for *his* will. @ laih anŭn ƀing gơñu mơdưh hĭ kiăng kơ klaih mơ̆ng čơđong yang sat, yua kơ yang sat hmâo mă krư̆ ƀing gơñu kiăng kơ ngă tui tơlơi ñu kiăng.
But this know, that in [the] last days difficult times shall be there; @ Ih khŏm thâo hluh tơlơi anai, amăng hrơi hnal tuč či hmâo khul rơnŭk tơnap tap. 
for men shall be lovers of self, lovers of money, boastful, arrogant, evil speakers, disobedient to parents, ungrateful, profane, @ Yua kơ arăng či jing hĭ et klih, khăp kơ prăk, pơang pơgao, ƀrưh hmiah, pơhiăp sat, ƀu thâo gưt asăp amĭ ama, ƀu thâo hơdơr tơngia, grĭ grañ, 
without natural affection, implacable, slanderers, of unsubdued passions, savage, having no love for what is good, @ ƀu hmâo tơlơi khăp kơ mơnuih, ƀu thâo pap, pơčeh ƀlor, kreñ hưt, sat ƀai, bơrơmŭt kơ tơlơi hiam, 
traitors, headlong, of vain pretensions, lovers of pleasure rather than lovers of God; @ pơblư̆ tơdruă, ƀơhok kreñ, yap pô ñu rơgơi, khăp kơ tơlơi ngui ngơr mơak hloh kơ khăp kơ Ơi Adai, 
having a form of piety but denying the power of it: and from these turn away. @ pơrơđah tơlơi thâo pơpŭ gah rơngiao đôč, samơ̆ hơngah hĭ laih tơlơi dưi mơyang tơlơi pơpŭ anŭn. Brơi ih đuaĭ ataih mơ̆ng ƀing mơnuih kar hăng anŭn bĕ. 
For of these are they who are getting into houses, and leading captive silly women, laden with sins, led by various lusts, @ Yua kơ amăng ƀing gơñu hmâo đơđa klĕ mŭt amăng sang arăng laih anŭn plư ƀing đah kơmơi mlŭk lĕ trăm amăng tơlơi soh, hmâo djŏp mơta tơlơi amoaih soh pơtrŭt. 
always learning, and never able to come to [the] knowledge of [the] truth. @ Gơñu hrăm nanao, samơ̆ ƀu thâo krăn tơlơi sĭt ôh. 
Now in the same manner in which Jannes and Jambres withstood Moses, thus these also withstand the truth; men corrupted in mind, found worthless as regards the faith. @ Janes laih anŭn Jambres pơkơdơ̆ng hăng Môis hyư̆m pă, kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n ƀing anŭn pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ hăng tơlơi sĭt. Anŭn jing ƀing mơnuih hmâo tơlơi pơmĭn brŭ răm laih anŭn tơlơi đaŏ ƀu sĭt. 
But they shall not advance farther; for their folly shall be completely manifest to all, as that of those also became. @ Samơ̆ bruă gơñu ngă ƀu či đĭ dơ̆ng ôh, yua kơ kar hăng bruă dua čô anŭn, tơlơi mlŭk mơgu dua gơñu či pơrơđah brơi abih bang mơnuih.
But *thou* hast been thoroughly acquainted with my teaching, conduct, purpose, faith, longsuffering, love, endurance, @ Ih hmâo tui hluai laih tơlơi kâo pơtô, tơlơi kâo dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă, tơlơi kơñăm hơdip, tơlơi đaŏ, tơlơi gir tŭ, tơlơi khăp, pran jua gir añ kâo, 
persecutions, sufferings: what [sufferings] happened to me in Antioch, in Iconium, in Lystra; what persecutions I endured; and the Lord delivered me out of all. @ tơlơi arăng ngă sat kơ kâo, tơlơi tơnap tap kâo tŭ, hmâo truh laih kơ kâo pơ Antiôs, pơ Ikôni laih anŭn pơ Listrơ. Kâo hmâo tŭ laih khul tơlơi ngă sat anŭn, samơ̆ Khua Yang pơklaih kâo mơ̆ng abih bang tơlơi anŭn. 
And all indeed who desire to live piously in Christ Jesus will be persecuted. @ Sĭt biă mă, abih bang hlơi pô kiăng hơdip tơlơi hơdip thâo pơpŭ amăng Krist Yêsu leng kơ khŏm tŭ tơlơi arăng ngă sat. 
But wicked men and juggling impostors shall advance in evil, leading and being led astray. @ Samơ̆ ƀing sat ƀai laih anŭn ƀing pleč ƀlor ƀrư̆ hrơi sat kơtang jai, plư ƀlor arăng laih anŭn lĕ amăng tơlơi arăng plư ƀlor glaĭ. 
But *thou*, abide in those things which thou hast learned, and [of which] thou hast been fully persuaded, knowing of whom thou hast learned [them]; @ Samơ̆ bơ kơ ih, djă kơjăp bĕ hơgĕt tơlơi ih hmâo hrăm laih anŭn đaŏ sĭt, yua kơ ih thâo ih hmâo hrăm laih tơlơi anŭn mơ̆ng hlơi, 
and that from a child thou hast known the sacred letters, which are able to make thee wise unto salvation, through faith which [is] in Christ Jesus. @ laih anŭn mơ̆ng ih hlăk dŏ čơđai ih thâo laih Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp dưi ngă brơi ih jing hĭ kơhnâo kiăng kơ dưi klaih yua mơ̆ng tơlơi đaŏ amăng Krist Yêsu. 
Every scripture [is] divinely inspired, and profitable for teaching, for conviction, for correction, for instruction in righteousness; @ Abih bang Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp leng kơ tơbiă rai mơ̆ng Ơi Adai bluh jua, hmâo tơlơi tŭ yua brơi kơ tơlơi pơtô, ƀuah, pơkra laih anŭn pơhrăm arăng amăng tơlơi tơpă hơnơ̆ng, 
that the man of God may be complete, fully fitted to every good work. @ kiăng kơ mơnuih lơ̆m kơ Ơi Adai dưi jing klă tum laih anŭn pre pioh brơi kơ djŏp mơta bruă hiam.
I testify before God and Christ Jesus, who is about to judge living and dead, and by his appearing and his kingdom, @ Ƀơi anăp Ơi Adai laih anŭn ƀơi anăp Yang Krist Yêsu, Pô či phat kơđi mơnuih hơdip laih anŭn mơnuih djai, laih anŭn yua kơ tơlơi Ñu či pơrơđah rai dơ̆ng laih anŭn dêh čar pơtao Ñu, kâo pơđur ih: 
proclaim the word; be urgent in season [and] out of season, convict, rebuke, encourage, with all longsuffering and doctrine. @ brơi ih pơtô boh pơhiăp Ơi Adai, gir bĕ thâo dah hrơi hiam ƀôdah hrơi ƀu hiam, pơblang pơđur, ƀuah pơkra, pơtrŭt pơđĭ pran jua laih anŭn hăng abih pran jua gir añ amăng tơlơi pơtô. 
For the time shall be when they will not bear sound teaching; but according to their own lusts will heap up to themselves teachers, having an itching ear; @ Yua kơ či hmâo sa rơnŭk arăng ƀu kiăng hmư̆ dơ̆ng tah tơlơi pơtô mơta tơlơi đaŏ sĭt, samơ̆ yua kơ gơñu kiăng hmư̆ tơlơi mơak tui hăng tơngia gơñu pô, gơñu či pơƀŭt pioh kơ gơñu pô ƀing nai pơtô tui hăng pran jua gơñu pô khăp, 
and they will turn away their ear from the truth, and will have turned aside to fables. @ gơñu puih đuaĭ ƀu kiăng hmư̆ tơlơi sĭt, laih anŭn anăp nao kơ khul tơlơi ră ruai ƀu hmâo sĭt. 
But *thou*, be sober in all things, bear evils, do [the] work of an evangelist, fill up the full measure of thy ministry. @ Samơ̆ bơ kơ ih, brơi hơdip djơ̆ hơnơ̆ng bĕ amăng abih bang tơlơi, gir tŭ tơlơi tơnap tap, ngă bruă kơ sa čô pô pơtô Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam, laih anŭn pơgiơ̆ng bruă mă ih.
For *I* am already being poured out, and the time of my release is come. @ Gah kơ kâo, kâo hlăk tŭ tơlơi arăng tuh tơlơi hơdip kâo kar hăng mơnơ̆ng ngă yang tuh; mông kâo djai jĕ truh yơh. 
I have combated the good combat, I have finished the race, I have kept the faith. @ Kâo hmâo pơblah laih hăng tơlơi pơblah hiam klă, hmâo pơgiơ̆ng laih tơlơi pơplong đuaĭ, hmâo djă pioh laih tơlơi đaŏ. 
Henceforth the crown of righteousness is laid up for me, which the Lord, the righteous Judge, will render to me in that day; but not only to me, but also to all who love his appearing. @ Mơ̆ng ră anai mŭk pơtao tơlơi tơpă hmâo pioh brơi laih kơ kâo. Khua Yang jing khua phat kơđi tơpă, či pha brơi mŭk anŭn kơ kâo amăng Hrơi anŭn, samơ̆ ƀu djơ̆ kơnơ̆ng kơ kâo đôč ôh, ăt pha brơi abih bang ƀing hlơi khăp kơ tơlơi Ñu pơrơđah rai.
Use diligence to come to me quickly; @ Gir rai pơ kâo tañ bĕ; 
for Demas has forsaken me, having loved the present age, and is gone to Thessalonica; Crescens to Galatia, Titus to Dalmatia. @ Dêmas hmâo lui laih kâo, laih anŭn nao pơ Têsalônik, yua kơ ñu khăp kơ lŏn tơnah anai, Krêsen nao laih pơ Galati, Tit nao laih pơ Dalmati, 
Luke alone is with me. Take Mark, and bring [him] with thyself, for he is serviceable to me for ministry. @ kơnơ̆ng hơjăn Luk dŏ hăng kâo. Jak ba Markôs nao hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ih, yua kơ ñu hmâo tơlơi tŭ yua biă mă kơ bruă mă kâo. 
But Tychicus I have sent to Ephesus. @ Kâo hmâo pơkiaŏ nao laih Tisik pơ Êphêsô. 
The cloak which I left behind [me] in Troas at Carpus's, bring when thou comest, and the books, especially the parchments. @ Tơ ih rai, hơdơr djă ba ao phyung kâo pioh glaĭ pơ sang Karpus, pơ plei Trôas, laih anŭn kar kaĭ mơ̆n djă ba wơ̆t abih bang čơkul hră, biă mă ñu čơkul hră klĭ.
Alexander the smith did many evil things against me. The Lord will render to him according to his works. @  Aleksandơ, mơnuih tuh kong hmâo ngă lu tơlơi sat kơ kâo; Khua Yang či rŭ nua tui hăng bruă ñu hmâo ngă laih. 
Against whom be *thou* also on thy guard, for he has greatly withstood our words. @ Wơ̆t kơ ih kar kaĭ mơ̆n khŏm kơčăng răng kơ mơnuih anŭn, yua kơ ñu pơkơdơ̆ng hăng tơlơi ƀing ta pơtô kơtang biă mă.
At my first defence no man stood with me, but all deserted me. May it not be imputed to them. @ Amăng tơlơi kâo pơgang kâo pô tal blŭng, ƀu hmâo hlơi ôh dŏ gah kâo; abih bang lui hĭ laih kâo. Rơkâo kơ Khua Yang anăm yap tơlơi anŭn kơ ƀing gơñu ôh. 
But the Lord stood with [me], and gave me power, that through me the proclamation might be fully made, and all [those of] the nations should hear; and I was delivered out of the lion's mouth. @ Samơ̆ Khua Yang hmâo dŏ gah kâo laih anŭn pha brơi tơlơi kơtang kơ kâo, kiăng kơ kâo dưi pơtô Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam hăng tơlơi klă tum kơ abih bang djuai tuai leng kơ hmư̆. Tui anŭn kâo dưi klaih laih mơ̆ng amăng bah rơmông dŭl. 
The Lord shall deliver me from every wicked work, and shall preserve [me] for his heavenly kingdom; to whom [be] glory for the ages of ages. Amen. @ Khua Yang či pơklaih kâo mơ̆ng abih bang tơlơi sat laih anŭn ba kâo mŭt amăng dêh čar pơtao plei hiam Ñu. Rơkâo tơlơi guh kơang lơ̆m kơ Ñu hlŏng lar ƀu đŭt ôh! Amen.
Salute Prisca and Aquila, and the house of Onesiphorus. @  Mơit tơlơi kơkuh kơ HʼPrisil laih anŭn Akilas, laih anŭn sang anŏ Ônêsiphor. 
Erastus remained in Corinth, but Trophimus I left behind in Miletus sick. @ Êrast ăt dŏ pơ Kôrantô, bơ Trôphim hlăk dŏ ruă tui anŭn yơh kâo pioh ñu dŏ glaĭ pơ Milê. 
Use diligence to come before winter. Eubulus salutes thee, and Pudens, and Linus, and Claudia, and the brethren all. @ Brơi ih gir kơtir bĕ rai truh hlâo kơ bơyan puih. Ôbulus, Puden, Linus, Klôdia, laih anŭn hrŏm hơbĭt hăng abih bang ƀing adơi ayŏng mơit tơlơi kơkuh kơ ih.
The Lord Jesus Christ [be] with your spirit. Grace [be] with you. @ Rơkâo kơ Khua Yang dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng bơngăt jua ih! Rơkâo tơlơi pap dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing gih.
Paul, bondman of God, and apostle of Jesus Christ according to [the] faith of God's elect, and knowledge of [the] truth which [is] according to piety; @ Pôl ding kơna kơ Ơi Adai laih anŭn khua ding kơna kơ Yêsu Krist, kiăng ba ƀing mơnuih Ơi Adai hmâo ruah laih kơ tơlơi đaŏ laih anŭn kơ tơlơi thâo hluh kơ tơlơi sĭt, jing tơlơi gal djơ̆ hăng pran jua thâo pơpŭ kơ Ơi Adai, 
in [the] hope of eternal life, which God, who cannot lie, promised before the ages of time, @ amăng tơlơi čang rơmang kơ tơlơi hơdip hlŏng lar, jing tơlơi hơdip Ơi Adai hmâo ƀuăn laih mơ̆ng lu rơnŭk hlâo adih, Ñu ƀu pơhiăp ƀlor ôh. 
but has manifested in its own due season his word, in [the] proclamation with which *I* have been entrusted, according to [the] commandment of our Saviour God; @ Djơ̆ amăng rơnŭk Ơi Adai hmâo pơkă laih, Ñu hmâo pơrơđah boh pơhiăp Ñu găn mơ̆ng bruă pơtô pơblang hmâo jao brơi laih kơ kâo tui hăng Ơi Adai, Pô Pơklaih ƀing ta, hmâo pơtă laih.
to Titus, my own child according to [the] faith common [to us]: Grace and peace from God [the] Father, and Christ Jesus our Saviour. @  Čih mơit kơ Tit, jing ană kâo sĭt amăng tơlơi đaŏ hrŏm hơbĭt: Rơkâo kơ Ơi Adai jing Ama, laih anŭn Krist Yêsu Pô Pơklaih ƀing ta pha brơi kơ ih tơlơi pap laih anŭn tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua.
For this cause I left thee in Crete, that thou mightest go on to set right what remained [unordered], and establish elders in each city, as *I* had ordered thee: @ Kâo hmâo pioh ih dŏ glaĭ pơ Kret kiăng kơ ih pơkra glaĭ khul bruă aka hiam ôh, laih anŭn pơdưm pơjao bruă kơ ƀing kŏng tha amăng rĭm boh plei tui hăng tơlơi kâo hmâo pơtă laih kơ ih. 
if any one be free from all charge [against him], husband of one wife, having believing children not accused of excess or unruly. @ Kŏng tha khŏm jing sa čô mơnuih ƀu hmâo tơlơi arăng dưi ƀuah ôh, dŏ kơnơ̆ng sa čô bơnai; ƀing ană bă khŏm đaŏ kơ Ơi Adai, ƀu hmâo tơlơi arăng kơčut jing pô hơdip tă tăn ƀôdah khăng akŏ. 
For the overseer must be free from all charge [against him] as God's steward; not headstrong, not passionate, not disorderly through wine, not a striker, not seeking gain by base means; @ Yua kơ pô wai lăng bruă phung sang Ơi Adai jing pô wai lăng sang Ơi Adai; khŏm kơ ñu jing mơnuih arăng ƀu dưi ƀuah ôh, ƀu pơgao, ƀu ƀơhok kreñ, ƀu ră kơ tơpai, ƀu hơtai sat ƀôdah hưp ham ôh; 
but hospitable, a lover of goodness, discreet, just, pious, temperate, @ samơ̆ ñu khŏm jing mơnuih thâo jum arăng, khăp kơ bruă hiam, thâo kơđiăng, tơpă, rơgoh hơčih, thâo dŏ djơ̆ hơnơ̆ng, 
clinging to the faithful word according to the doctrine taught, that he may be able both to encourage with sound teaching and refute gainsayers. @ djă kơjăp boh pơhiăp năng lăp kơ đaŏ kơnang tui hăng arăng pơtô laih kơ ñu, kiăng kơ dưi yua mơta tơlơi đaŏ djơ̆ sĭt pơtô pơđur laih anŭn pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ hăng ƀing pơkơdơ̆ng.
For there are many and disorderly vain speakers and deceivers of people's minds, specially those of [the] circumcision, @ Yua kơ hmâo lu mơnuih ƀu thâo gưt asăp ôh, biă mă ñu amăng ƀing khăt klĭ, ƀing pơhiăp tơlơi ƀu tŭ yua laih anŭn plư pleč, 
who must have their mouths stopped, who subvert whole houses, teaching things which ought not [to be taught] for the sake of base gain. @ Ih khŏm ngă brơi ƀing gơñu dŏ rơiăt. Yua kơ tơlơi kơmlai grĭ grañ, ƀing gơñu hmâo pơtô tơlơi arăng ƀu phiăn pơtô ôh, ngă pơglưh răm abih bang sang anŏ arăng. 
One of themselves, a prophet of their own, has said, Cretans are always liars, evil wild beasts, lazy gluttons. @ Sa čô amăng ƀing gơñu, sa čô pô laĭ lui hlâo kơ ƀing gơñu pô hmâo laĭ: “Mơnuih Kret nanao jing ƀing pơhiăp ƀlor, khul hlô hơtai, ƀing ră ƀơ̆ng alah bruă.” 
This testimony is true; for which cause rebuke them severely, that they may be sound in the faith, @ Boh pơhiăp gơ̆ng jơlan anŭn jing sĭt. Yua kơ anŭn yơh, brơi ih ƀuah gơñu hăng tơlơi khư̆p kơtang, kiăng kơ ƀing gơñu dưi kơjăp amăng tơlơi đaŏ, 
not turning [their] minds to Jewish fables and commandments of men turning away from the truth. @ anăm brơi ƀing gơñu kơčăng pơmĭn nao kơ tơlơi ră ruai đưm ƀu sĭt ƀing mơnuih Yuđa ôh, ƀôdah tơlơi pơtă mơ̆ng ƀing hơngah laih tơlơi sĭt. 
All things [are] pure to the pure; but to the defiled and unbelieving nothing [is] pure; but both their mind and their conscience are defiled. @ Kơ ƀing rơgoh hiam, abih bang tơlơi leng kơ jing rơgoh hiam soh sel; samơ̆ kơ ƀing grĭ grañ laih anŭn kơ ƀing ƀu đaŏ ôh, ƀu hmâo sa mơta mơnơ̆ng hơgĕt ôh jing rơgoh. Kơđai glaĭ, jua pơmĭn laih anŭn pran jua tơpă ƀing gơñu leng kơ hơƀak drak laih. 
They profess to know God, but in works deny [him], being abominable, and disobedient, and found worthless as to every good work. @ Ƀing gơñu laĭ gơñu pô thâo krăn Ơi Adai, samơ̆ bruă gơñu ngă pơrơđah tơlơi gơñu hơngah Ơi Adai. Gơñu lăp biă mă arăng bơrơmŭt, ƀing ƀu thâo gưt asăp, laih anŭn ƀu dưi ngă sa mơta bruă hiam ôh.
But do *thou* speak the things that become sound teaching; @ Samơ̆ gah kơ ih, brơi ih pơtô khul tơlơi djơ̆ gal hăng mơta tơlơi đaŏ sĭt. 
that the elder men be sober, grave, discreet, sound in faith, in love, in patience; @ Brơi ih pơtă bĕ kơ ƀing đah rơkơi tha dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă djơ̆ hơnơ̆ng, klă djrưng, kơhnâo, dŏ kơjăp amăng tơlơi đaŏ, amăng tơlơi khăp laih anŭn amăng tơlơi gir tŭ. 
that the elder women in like manner be in deportment as becoming those who have to say to sacred things, not slanderers, not enslaved to much wine, teachers of what is right; @ Kar kaĭ mơ̆n brơi ƀing đah kơmơi tha dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă hăng tơlơi rơgoh hiam, anăm jing ôh mơnuih pơčeh ƀlor ƀôdah jing hlŭn kơ tơpai. Ƀing gơñu khŏm thâo pơtô tơlơi hơgĕt jing hiam, 
that they may admonish the young women to be attached to [their] husbands, to be attached to [their] children, @ tui anŭn gơñu dưi pơhrăm ƀing đah kơmơi dra thâo khăp kơ rơkơi, thâo hơeng kơ ƀing ană bă, 
discreet, chaste, diligent in home work, good, subject to their own husbands, that the word of God may not be evil spoken of. @ dŏ djơ̆ hơnơ̆ng, tơpă hiam, kơhnâo triăng bruă mơnuă amăng sang anŏ, rơhmač, thâo đup gưt kơ rơkơi gơñu, kiăng kơ boh pơhiăp Ơi Adai arăng ƀu mưč mač hĭ ôh.
The younger men in like manner exhort to be discreet: @ Kar kaĭ mơ̆n, pơtă bĕ kơ ƀing tơdăm brơi gơñu dŏ djơ̆ hơnơ̆ng. 
in all things affording thyself as a pattern of good works; in teaching uncorruptedness, gravity, @ Amăng abih bang bruă, ih pô khŏm ngă hnal pơhmô amăng khul bruă hiam, laih anŭn pơrơđah amăng tơlơi klă sĭt, klă djrưng tơdang ih pơtô, 
a sound word, not to be condemned; that he who is opposed may be ashamed, having no evil thing to say about us: @ boh pơhiăp khŏm djơ̆ klă, ƀu hmâo hlơi dưi ƀuah ôh, kiăng kơ ƀing pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ khŏm mlâo, ƀu dưi pơhiăp sat kơ ƀing ta kơ tơlơi hơgĕt ôh.
bondmen to be subject to their own masters, to make themselves acceptable in everything; not gainsaying; @ Brơi ih pơtă kơ ƀing hlŭn thâo đup gưt kơ khua gơñu, ngă bơmơak kơ ƀing khua amăng djŏp mơta tơlơi; ƀu dưi khăng akŏ ôh, 
not robbing [their masters], but shewing all good fidelity, that they may adorn the teaching which [is] of our Saviour God in all things. @ ƀu klĕ dŏp, samơ̆ khŏm pơrơđah pran jua tŏng ten tum num, kiăng kơ amăng djŏp tơlơi, mơta tơlơi đaŏ kơ Ơi Adai, Pô Pơklaih ƀing ta, dưi guh kơang.
For the grace of God which carries with it salvation for all men has appeared, @ Yua kơ tơlơi pap song mă mơ̆ng Ơi Adai pioh brơi kơ abih bang mơnuih hmâo pơrơđah brơi laih. 
teaching us that, having denied impiety and worldly lusts, we should live soberly, and justly, and piously in the present course of things, @ Tơlơi pap anŭn pơtô ƀing ta lui hĭ tơlơi ƀu thâo pơpŭ laih anŭn tơlơi amoaih hưp lŏn tơnah, kiăng kơ hơdip djơ̆ hơnơ̆ng, tơpă hơnơ̆ng, laih anŭn thâo pơpŭ amăng rơnŭk anai, 
awaiting the blessed hope and appearing of the glory of our great God and Saviour Jesus Christ; @ tơdang dŏ tơguan tơlơi čang rơmang mơyun hiam, laih anŭn tơlơi pơrơđah rai guh kơang kơ Ơi Adai prŏng prin, ăt jing Pô Pơklaih ƀing ta mơ̆n, jing Khua Yang Yêsu Krist. 
who gave himself for us, that he might redeem us from all lawlessness, and purify to himself a peculiar people, zealous for good works. @ Ñu hmâo pơsăn laih tơlơi hơdip Ñu pô yua kơ ƀing ta, kiăng kơ song mă ƀing ta mơ̆ng tơlơi soh sat, laih anŭn kiăng pơrơgoh hiam ƀing ta jing sa phung djuai mơnuih lơ̆m kơ hơjăn Ñu, jing djuai mơnuih hur har ngă khul bruă hiam.
These things speak, and exhort, and rebuke with all authority. Let no one despise thee. @ Brơi ih pơtô bĕ khul tơlơi anŭn; hăng tơlơi dưi kơhưm pơtô pơđur laih anŭn ƀuah pơkra. Anăm brơi arăng mưč kơ ih ôh.
Put them in mind to be subject to rulers, to authorities, to be obedient to rule, to be ready to do every good work, @ Brơi kơ ih pơhơdơr kơ ƀing đaŏ khŏm tui gưt kơ ƀing khua wai lăng laih anŭn kơ ƀing hmâo tơlơi dưi amăng kơnuk kơna, khŏm gưt asăp laih anŭn pre krăp ngă abih bang bruă hiam, 
to speak evil of no one, not to be contentious, [to be] mild, shewing all meekness towards all men. @ anăm pơhiăp sat kơ arăng, răng anăm pơrơdjơ̆ pơrơsao ôh, samơ̆ brơi tơdu rơun laih anŭn hơdip hiam mơak hăng abih bang mơnuih. 
For we were once ourselves also without intelligence, disobedient, wandering in error, serving various lusts and pleasures, living in malice and envy, hateful, [and] hating one another. @ Yua kơ hlâo adih ƀing ta pô ăt mlŭk mơgu mơ̆n, ƀu thâo gưt asăp ôh, lĕ tơlơi arăng plư, jing hlŭn kơ djŏp mơta tơlơi amoaih hưp asar đeh laih anŭn tơlơi ngui ngơr asar kiăng, hơdip amăng tơlơi soh sat, tơlơi moañ ƀlah, năng lăp mưč laih anŭn bơrơmŭt tơdruă. 
But when the kindness and love to man of our Saviour God appeared, @ Samơ̆ tơ tơlơi hiam klă laih anŭn tơlơi khăp Ơi Adai, jing Pô Pơklaih ƀing ta, hmâo pơrơđah Ñu hmâo pơklaih ƀing ta, 
not on the principle of works which [have been done] in righteousness which *we* had done, but according to his own mercy he saved us through [the] washing of regeneration and renewal of [the] Holy Spirit, @ ƀu djơ̆ yua kơ bruă tơpă ƀing ta hmâo ngă ôh, samơ̆ mơ̆ng tơlơi pap drap Ñu, hăng tơlơi pơrơgoh hiam kơ tơlơi tơkeng glaĭ dơ̆ng laih anŭn tơlơi pơplih phrâo mơ̆ng Yang Bơngăt Hiam, 
which he poured out on us richly through Jesus Christ our Saviour; @ jing Pô Ñu hmâo tuh laih rơbeh blai ƀơi ƀing ta mơ̆ng Khua Yang Yêsu Krist, Pô Pơklaih ƀing ta, 
that, having been justified by *his* grace, we should become heirs according to [the] hope of eternal life. @ kiăng kơ ƀing ta dưi hmâo tơlơi yap tơpă hăng tơlơi pap Ñu, laih anŭn dưi jing ƀing tŭ mă kong ngăn tơlơi čang rơmang kơ tơlơi hơdip hlŏng lar. 
The word [is] faithful, and I desire that thou insist strenuously on these things, that they who have believed God may take care to pay diligent attention to good works. These things are good and profitable to men. @ Boh pơhiăp anŭn jing sĭt.
Kâo kiăng kơ ih kơñăm kơtang kơ khul tơlơi anŭn, kiăng kơ ƀing hlơi đaŏ laih kơ Ơi Adai či pioh abih pran jua pơmĭn nao kơ bruă hiam. Anŭn jing tơlơi hiam klă laih anŭn tŭ yua kơ abih bang mơnuih. 
But foolish questions, and genealogies, and strifes, and contentions about the law, shun; for they are unprofitable and vain. @ Samơ̆ brơi hơbĕ đuaĭ mơ̆ng khul tơlơi pơrơjah mlŭk, khul tơlơi rok ruai kơnŭng djuai, tơlơi pơrơdjơ̆, laih anŭn tơlơi pơrơjah pơgăl kơ tơlơi juăt, yua kơ khul tơlơi anai leng kơ ƀu tŭ yua ôh laih anŭn kŏn hmâo nua yom lơi. 
An heretical man after a first and second admonition have done with, @ Bơ kơ ƀing mơnuih pơkah pơpha phung, giơ̆ng ih ƀuah laih gơñu tal sa, laih anŭn tal dua, anăm pơgop hăng gơñu dơ̆ng ôh, 
knowing that such a one is perverted, and sins, being self-condemned. @ yua kơ ih thâo laih ƀing mơnuih jrok jơlan laih anŭn ngă soh kar hăng anŭn, mă tŭ laih tơlơi klă kơđi kơ ñu pô.
When I shall send Artemas to thee, or Tychicus, use diligence to come to me to Nicopolis; for I have decided to winter there. @  Tơ kâo pơkiaŏ Artêmas ƀôdah Tisik nao pơ ih, brơi ih gir rai tañ bưp kâo pơ Nikôpôlis, yua kơ kâo hmâo khư̆p ư laih kiăng dŏ pơ anŭn amăng abih bơyan puih. 
Zenas the lawyer and Apollos set forward diligently on their way, that nothing may be lacking to them; @ Brơi ih gir djru bruă Sênas khua tơlơi juăt laih anŭn Apôlôs amăng tơlơi gơñu hyu, anăm brơi gơñu kơƀah sa mơta mơnơ̆ng hơgĕt ôh. 
and let ours also learn to apply themselves to good works for necessary wants, that they may not be unfruitful. @ Brơi ƀing đaŏ khŏm hrăm ngă bruă hiam, kiăng kơ dưi djru mơtam ƀơi mông hmâo tơlơi kơƀah ječ, tui anŭn anăm gơñu hơdip hăng tơlơi hơdip ƀu mơboh ôh.
All with me salute thee. Salute those who love us in [the] faith. Grace [be] with you all. @ Abih bang ƀing dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng kâo mơit tơlơi čuă ngui kơ ih. Kơkuh čuă ngui ƀing mơnuih khăp kơ ƀing ta amăng tơlơi đaŏ. Rơkâo tơlơi pap dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng abih bang ƀing gih!
Paul, prisoner of Christ Jesus, and Timotheus the brother, to Philemon the beloved and our fellow-workman, @ Pôl, sa čô mơnă kơ Krist Yêsu, laih anŭn Timôthê adơi ayŏng ƀing ta, mơit kơ Philêmôn, pô gơmơi khăp hơeng biă mă, jing gơyut mă bruă hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing gơmơi, 
and to the sister Apphia and to Archippus our fellow-soldier, and to the assembly which [is] in thine house. @ laih anŭn kơ HʼApia amai ƀing gơmơi, kơ Arčip, gơyut pơblah hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing gơmơi, laih anŭn Phung Sang Ơi Adai amăng sang ñu:
Grace to you and peace from God our Father, and [the] Lord Jesus Christ. @ Rơkâo Ơi Adai jing Ama kơ ƀing ta laih anŭn Khua Yang Yêsu Krist pha brơi tơlơi pap laih anŭn tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua kơ ƀing gih.
I thank my God, always making mention of thee at my prayers, @ Kâo bơni kơ Ơi Adai kâo nanao, rĭm wơ̆t kâo hơdơr kơ ih amăng tơlơi iâu laĭ, 
hearing of thy love and the faith which thou hast towards the Lord Jesus, and towards all the saints, @ yua kơ kâo hmâo hmư̆ laih tơlơi ih khăp kơ abih bang ƀing rơgoh hiam laih anŭn tơlơi ih đaŏ kơ Khua Yang Yêsu. 
in such sort that thy participation in the faith should become operative in the acknowledgment of every good thing which is in us towards Christ [Jesus]. @ Kâo iâu laĭ kiăng kơ mơ̆ng tơlơi ih pơpha brơi tơlơi đaŏ dưi ngă brơi tơlơi thâo hluh kơ abih bang tơlơi hiam klă ƀing ta hmâo laih amăng Yang Krist. 
For we have great thankfulness and encouragement through thy love, because the bowels of the saints are refreshed by thee, brother. @ Sĭt biă mă, Ơ adơi kâo, kâo hmâo lu tơlơi mơak laih anŭn tơlơi pơalum mơ̆ng tơlơi ih khăp, yua mơ̆ng ih ƀing rơgoh hiam hmâo tơlơi pơđĭ pran jua.
Wherefore having much boldness in Christ to enjoin thee what is fitting, @ Yua kơ anŭn yơh, wơ̆t dah amăng Yang Krist kâo hmâo tơlơi dưi pơđar ih ngă tơlơi ih khŏm ngă, 
for love's sake I rather exhort, being such a one as Paul the aged, and now also prisoner of Jesus Christ. @ samơ̆ yua kơ tơlơi khăp, kâo ƀu pơtă ôh samơ̆ kâo kơwưh kơ ih đôč. Kâo, Pôl, sa čô ding kơna pơala kơ Krist Yêsu, laih anŭn ră anai jing sa čô mơnă yua kơ Ñu mơ̆n, 
I exhort thee for *my* child, whom I have begotten in [my] bonds, Onesimus, @ kâo rơkâo ih djru kơ Ônêsim, ană kâo hmâo tơkeng laih amăng sang mơnă. 
once unserviceable to thee, but now serviceable to thee and to me: @ Hlâo adih ñu ƀu tŭ yua ôh kơ ih, samơ̆ ră anai ñu tŭ yua biă mă kơ ih wơ̆t kơ kâo.
whom I have sent back to thee: [but do *thou* receive] him, that is, *my* bowels: @ Kâo pơkiaŏ ñu wơ̆t glaĭ pơ ih, jing pơkiaŏ nao pran jua kâo pô yơh. 
whom *I* was desirous of keeping with myself, that for thee he might minister to me in the bonds of the glad tidings; @ Kâo kiăng biă mă kơ̆ng glaĭ ñu dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng kâo, kiăng kơ ñu dưi mă bruă kơ kâo pơala kơ ih tơdang arăng krư̆ kâo yua kơ Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam. 
but I have wished to do nothing without thy mind, that thy good might not be as of necessity but of willingness: @ Samơ̆ kâo ƀu kiăng ngă ôh sa mơta tơlơi tơdang aka hmâo tơlơi tŭ ư mơ̆ng ih, kiăng kơ bruă hiam ih ngă ƀu djơ̆ ôh hăng tơlơi pơgŏ, samơ̆ tui hăng tơlơi kiăng rơngai ih. 
for perhaps for this reason he has been separated [from thee] for a time, that thou mightest possess him fully for ever; @ Năng ai yua kơ tơlơi anai yơh ñu hmâo pơčơlah laih mơ̆ng ih ƀơƀiă hrơi, kiăng kơ ih dưi hmâo glaĭ ñu nanao hlŏng lar, 
not any longer as a bondman, but above a bondman, a beloved brother, specially to me, and how much rather to thee, both in [the] flesh and in [the] Lord? @ ƀu djơ̆ kar hăng sa čô hlŭn dơ̆ng ôh, samơ̆ rơgao hloh kơ sa čô hlŭn, jing sa čô adơi ayŏng khăp hơeng. Hăng kâo mơnuih anai khăp hơeng yom biă mă, samơ̆ hăng ih jai khăp hơeng hloh dơ̆ng, gah asar đeh wơ̆t amăng Khua Yang mơ̆n.
If therefore thou holdest me to be a partner [with thee], receive him as me; @ Tui anŭn tơdah ih yap kâo jing gơyut mă bruă hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ih, jum bĕ ñu kar hăng ih jum kâo yơh. 
but if he have wronged thee anything or owe anything [to thee], put this to my account. @ Tơdah ñu hmâo ngă soh hơgĕt hăng ih, ƀôdah tơdah ñu đom hơnưh kơ ih, ih yap bĕ hơnưh anŭn jing đom ƀơi kâo. 
*I* Paul have written [it] with mine own hand; *I* will repay [it]: that I say not to thee that thou owest even thine own self also to me. @ Kâo gơ̆ Pôl, hăng tơngan kâo pô čih tơlơi anai. Kâo či kla hơnưh anŭn kơ ih — samơ̆ kâo ƀu laĭ ôh kơ ih đom ih pô kơ kâo. 
Yea, brother, *I* would have profit of *thee* in [the] Lord: refresh my bowels in Christ. @ Djơ̆ yơh, Ơ adơi, rơkâo kơ ih brơi kâo dưi hmâo tơlơi hơ̆k mơak anai amăng Khua Yang, laih anŭn ngă brơi bơngăt jua kâo hơ̆k mơak amăng Yang Krist.
Being confident of thine obedience, I have written to thee, knowing that thou wilt do even more than I say. @ Kâo čih hră anai kơ ih yua kơ kâo đaŏ ih či tŭ ư, laih anŭn thâo sĭt ih či ngă rơgao hloh kơ tơlơi kâo rơkâo. 
But withal prepare me also a lodging; for I hope that I shall be granted to you through your prayers. @ Kar kaĭ mơ̆n prăp rơmet bĕ anih dŏ kơ kâo, yua kơ kâo čang rơmang mơ̆ng tơlơi ƀing gih iâu laĭ, kâo či wơ̆t glaĭ pơ ƀing gih.
Epaphras salutes thee, my fellow-prisoner in Christ Jesus; @  Êpapras, gơyut arăng krư̆ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng kâo amăng Krist Yêsu, mơit tơlơi čuă ngui kơ ƀing gih; 
Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, Luke, my fellow-workmen. @ laih anŭn Markôs, Aristark, Dêmas, laih anŭn Luk, ƀing mă bruă hrŏm hơbĭt hăng kâo, mơit tơlơi čuă ngui kar kaĭ mơ̆n.
The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ [be] with your spirit. @ Rơkâo tơlơi pap mơ̆ng Khua Yang Yêsu Krist dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt bơngăt jua ƀing gih!
God having spoken in many parts and in many ways formerly to the fathers in the prophets, @ Đưm adih, Ơi Adai hmâo pơhiăp laih hăng ơi adon ƀing ta amăng lu wơ̆t laih anŭn amăng lu jơlan găn mơ̆ng ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo; 
at the end of these days has spoken to us in [the person of the] Son, whom he has established heir of all things, by whom also he made the worlds; @ samơ̆ amăng rơnŭk hnal tuč anai Ñu pơhiăp laih hăng ƀing ta găn mơ̆ng Ană Đah Rơkơi Ñu. Pô Ñu hmâo pơkă brơi jing Pô mă tŭ abih bang mơnơ̆ng laih anŭn ăt mơ̆ng Ană anŭn mơ̆n Ñu hmâo hrih laih adai lŏn tơnah. 
who being [the] effulgence of his glory and [the] expression of his substance, and upholding all things by the word of his power, having made [by himself] the purification of sins, set himself down on the right hand of the greatness on high, @ Ñu jing tơlơi kơmlă mơ̆ng tơlơi guh kơang Ơi Adai laih anŭn jing rup nik kơnuih Ơi Adai pô. Hăng boh pơhiăp dưi mơyang Ñu djă grơ̆ng abih bang tơlơi mơnơ̆ng. Giơ̆ng Ñu pơrơgoh tơlơi soh mơnuih Ñu dŏ ber gah hơnuă kơ Pô Guh Kơang amăng adai adih.
taking a place by so much better than the angels, as he inherits a name more excellent than they. @ Dơ̆ pă Ñu hmâo tơlơi pơpŭ prŏng hloh kơ ƀing ling jang, dơ̆ anŭn mơ̆n anăn Ñu jing yom hloh kơ anăn ƀing ling jang.
For to which of the angels said he ever, *Thou* art my Son: this day have *I* begotten thee? and again, *I* will be to him for father, and *he* shall be to me for son? @   Yua kơ hmâo hơbin pă Ơi Adai laĭ hăng sa čô ling jang tui anai:
“Ih jing Ană Kâo,
Hrơi anai Kâo tơkeng laih Ih”?
Ƀôdah hmâo hơbin pă Ñu laĭ:
“Kâo či jing Ama Ih,
Ih či jing Ană Kâo”?
and again, when he brings in the firstborn into the habitable world, he says, And let all God's angels worship him. @ Laih anŭn hlăk Ñu brơi Ană kơčoa Ñu trŭn pơ lŏn tơnah, Ñu laĭ:
“Abih bang ƀing ling jang Ơi Adai khŏm kơkuh pơpŭ kơ Ñu.”
And as to the angels he says, Who makes his angels spirits and his ministers a flame of fire; @  Kơ ƀing ling jang adai Ñu laĭ:
“Ñu ngă brơi ƀing ling jang Ñu kar hăng angĭn,
Laih anŭn ƀing ding kơna Ñu kar hăng jơlah apui.”
but as to the Son, Thy throne, O God, [is] to the age of the age, and a sceptre of uprightness [is] the sceptre of thy kingdom. @  Samơ̆ kơ Ană Ñu laĭ:
“Ơ Ơi Adai, gre pơtao Ih dŏ nanao hlŏng lar,
laih anŭn gai jra pơtao Ih wai lăng dêh čar pơtao jing gai jra pơtao tơpă hơnơ̆ng.
Thou hast loved righteousness and hast hated lawlessness; therefore God, thy God, has anointed thee with oil of gladness above thy companions. @ Ih khăp kơ tơlơi tơpă hơnơ̆ng, laih anŭn bơrơmŭt kơ tơlơi soh;
Yua kơ anŭn yơh, Ơi Adai jing Ơi Adai Ih, hmâo truač laih ia jâu tơlơi hơ̆k mơak kơ Ih,
Ngă brơi Ih hơ̆k mơak hloh kơ ƀing gơyut gơyâo Ih.”
And, *Thou* in the beginning, Lord, hast founded the earth, and works of thy hands are the heavens. @  Laih anŭn,
“Ơ Khua Yang, hlăk phŭn blŭng Ih hmâo pơdơ̆ng atur lŏn tơnah,
Laih anŭn khul tal adai jing bruă kơ tơngan Ih ngă;
They shall perish, but *thou* continuest still; and they all shall grow old as a garment, @ Abih mơnơ̆ng anŭn či răm rai hĭ, samơ̆ Ih ăt dŏ;
Gơñu či so hĭ kar hăng sum ao;
and as a covering shalt thou roll them up, and they shall be changed; but *thou* art the Same, and thy years shall not fail. @ Ih či blĭu hĭ gơñu kar hăng sa blah ao phyung,
Laih anŭn gơñu či pơplih hĭ kar hăng sum ao.
Samơ̆ Ih ăt dŏ hơnơ̆ng nanao,
Laih anŭn khul thŭn Ih ƀu thâo đŭt ôh.”
But as to which of the angels said he ever, Sit at my right hand until I put thine enemies [as] footstool of thy feet? @  Hmâo hơbin pă Ơi Adai laĭ kơ ling jang Ñu tui anai:
“Dŏ ber bĕ gah hơnuă Kâo,
Tơl Kâo pioh ƀing ayăt Ih jing hnăl tơkai Ih juă.”?
Are they not all ministering spirits, sent out for service on account of those who shall inherit salvation? @ Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă abih bang ƀing ling jang jing ƀing yang buih bruă, Ơi Adai hmâo pơkiaŏ trŭn kiăng djru bruă kơ ƀing mă tŭ tơlơi pơklaih?
For this reason we should give heed more abundantly to the things [we have] heard, lest in any way we should slip away. @ Tui anŭn yơh, ƀing ta khŏm kơčăng ten hloh dơ̆ng kơ tơlơi ƀing ta hmâo hmư̆ laih, hwĭ kơ ƀing ta či pơđung đuaĭ mơ̆ng tơlơi anŭn. 
For if the word which was spoken by angels was firm, and every transgression and disobedience received just retribution, @ Yua kơ tơdah tơlơi ƀing ling jang pơhaih jing sĭt, laih anŭn abih bang tơlơi ngă soh ƀôdah tơlơi ƀu tui gưt leng kơ či tŭ mă tơlơi pơkơhmal năng lăp kơ ñu, 
how shall *we* escape if we have been negligent of so great salvation, which, having had its commencement in being spoken [of] by the Lord, has been confirmed to us by those who have heard; @ hyư̆m ƀing ta dưi klaih, tơdah ƀing ta ƀu pơyom ôh kơ tơlơi pơklaih prŏng kar hăng anŭn? Anŭn jing tơlơi pơklaih Khua Yang hmâo pơhaih laih mơ̆ng blŭng hlâo, laih anŭn ƀing hmâo hmư̆ ngă gơ̆ng jơlan pơsĭt brơi kơ ƀing ta, 
God bearing, besides, witness with [them] to [it], both by signs and wonders, and various acts of power, and distributions of [the] Holy Spirit, according to his will? @ tơdang anŭn Ơi Adai ăt hmâo ngă gơ̆ng jơlan hăng khul gru kơnăl, tơlơi yom pơphan laih anŭn lu bruă tơlơi dưi mơyang hrŏm hơbĭt hăng khul tơlơi pha brơi mơ̆ng Yang Bơngăt Hiam hmâo pha brơi tui hăng tơlơi Ñu kiăng.
For he has not subjected to angels the habitable world which is to come, of which we speak; @ Ơi Adai ƀu dưm ôh lŏn tơnah pơ anăp, jing lŏn tơnah phrâo ƀing ta hlăk pơhiăp anŭn dŏ gah yŭ tơlơi dưi ƀing ling jang. 
but one has testified somewhere, saying, What is man, that thou rememberest him, or son of man that thou visitest him? @ Samơ̆ hmâo sa anih amăng hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp hmâo ngă gơ̆ng jơlan laih tui anai:
“Hơgĕt ană mơnuih jing tơl Ih hơdơr pơmĭn nao kơ gơñu?
Hlơi ană mơnuih jing tơl Ih wai lăng gơñu?
Thou hast made him some little inferior to the angels; thou hast crowned him with glory and honour, [and hast set him over the works of thy hands;] @ Ih hmâo ngă brơi laih Ană Mơnuih gah yŭ ƀiă kơ ƀing ling jang amăng ƀiă hrơi;
Ih hmâo đua brơi Ană Mơnuih mŭk pơtao tơlơi guh kơang laih anŭn tơlơi pơpŭ.
thou hast subjected all things under his feet. For in subjecting all things to him, he has left nothing unsubject to him. But now we see not yet all things subjected to *him*, @ Ih brơi Ană Mơnuih wai lăng abih bang mơnơ̆ng.”
Amăng tơlơi Ơi Adai brơi Khua Yang Yêsu wai lăng abih bang mơnơ̆ng, Ơi Adai ƀu lui sa mơta mơnơ̆ng gah rơngiao kơ tơlơi Ñu wai lăng ôh. Samơ̆ ră anai ƀing ta aka ƀuh ôh Ană Mơnuih wai lăng abih bang mơnơ̆ng. 
but we see Jesus, who [was] made some little inferior to angels on account of the suffering of death, crowned with glory and honour; so that by the grace of God he should taste death for every thing. @ Samơ̆ ƀing ta ƀuh Yêsu, Pô Ơi Adai pioh gah yŭ ƀiă kơ ƀing ling jang amăng ƀiă hrơi, ră anai Ơi Adai đua laih mŭk pơtao tơlơi guh kơang laih anŭn tơlơi pơpŭ kơ Ñu yua kơ tơlơi djai Ñu tŭ laih, kiăng kơ mơ̆ng tơlơi pap Ơi Adai, Ñu dưi tŭ tơlơi djai hrua kơ abih bang mơnuih.
For it became him, for whom [are] all things, and by whom [are] all things, in bringing many sons to glory, to make perfect the leader of their salvation through sufferings. @ Jing gal djơ̆ yơh kơ Ơi Adai, yua kơ abih bang mơnơ̆ng tơbiă rai mơ̆ng Ơi Adai laih anŭn yua kơ Ơi Adai, hnŭn yơh tơ Ñu kiăng ba lu ană bă kơ tơlơi guh kơang, Ñu hmâo ngă brơi Pô phŭn tơlơi pơklaih kơ ƀing gơñu khŏm găn tơlơi ruă tơnap kiăng kơ jing klă tum.
For both he that sanctifies and those sanctified [are] all of one; for which cause he is not ashamed to call them brethren, @ Yua kơ Pô pơrơgoh hiam laih anŭn ƀing mơnuih Ñu hmâo pơrơgoh hiam leng kơ tơbiă rai mơ̆ng sa čô Ama. Yua kơ anŭn yơh Ñu ƀu mlâo ôh iâu ƀing gơ̆ jing adơi ayŏng, 
saying, I will declare thy name to my brethren; in [the] midst of [the] assembly will I sing thy praises. @ tơdang Ñu laĭ:
“Kâo či pơhaih anăn Ih brơi kơ ƀing adơi ayŏng Kâo,
Kâo či bơni hơơč kơ anăn Ih ƀơi tơ̆ng krah ƀing bơjơnum.”
And again, I will trust in him. And again, Behold, I and the children which God has given me. @  Ñu laĭ dơ̆ng:
“Kâo či đaŏ kơnang kơ Ih.”
Ñu laĭ dơ̆ng mơ̆n:
“Kâo dŏ pơ anai hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing ană bă Ơi Adai hmâo brơi laih kơ Kâo.”
Since therefore the children partake of blood and flesh, he also, in like manner, took part in the same, that through death he might annul him who has the might of death, that is, the devil; @ Yua kơ ƀing ană bă hmâo hrŏm hơbĭt asar đeh laih anŭn drah, yua kơ anŭn mơ̆n Khua Yang Yêsu pô ăt hmâo asar đeh laih anŭn drah kar hăng gơñu, kiăng kơ hăng tơlơi djai Ñu pơrai hĭ pô djă tơlơi dưi kơ tơlơi djai, jing yang sat, 
and might set free all those who through fear of death through the whole of their life were subject to bondage. @ laih anŭn dưi pơrơngai abih bang mơnuih jing hlŭn abih tơlơi hơdip gơñu yua hwĭ kơ tơlơi djai. 
For he does not indeed take hold of angels [by the hand], but he takes hold of the seed of Abraham. @ Yua kơ klă rơđah biă mă, ƀu djơ̆ Ñu rai djru ƀing ling jang ôh, samơ̆ kiăng djru ƀing ană tơčo Abraham. 
Wherefore it behoved him in all things to be made like to [his] brethren, that he might be a merciful and faithful high priest in things relating to God, to make propitiation for the sins of the people; @ Yua kơ anŭn yơh Ñu khŏm jing kar hăng ƀing adơi ayŏng Ñu amăng djŏp mơta tơlơi, kiăng kơ Ñu dưi jing khua ngă yang prŏng hloh bă hăng pran jua thâo pap drap laih anŭn tŏng ten amăng tơlơi mă bruă kơ Ơi Adai, kiăng kơ dưi song mă tơlơi soh ƀing ană plei pla. 
for, in that himself has suffered, being tempted, he is able to help those that are being tempted. @ Yua kơ Ñu pô hmâo tŭ laih tơlơi ruă nuă amăng tơlơi plư, hnŭn yơh Ñu dưi djru mơ̆n kơ ƀing hlơi dŏ amăng tơlơi plư.
Wherefore, holy brethren, partakers of [the] heavenly calling, consider the Apostle and High Priest of our confession, Jesus, @ Tui anŭn, Ơ adơi ayŏng rơgoh hiam, jing ƀing mă tŭ laih tơlơi iâu mơ̆ng adai, brơi ƀing gih pơmĭn bĕ kơ Yêsu, Pô pơala laih anŭn khua ngă yang prŏng hloh kơ tơlơi đaŏ ƀing ta hmâo pơhaih. 
who is faithful to him that has constituted him, as Moses also in all his house. @ Ñu hmâo tŏng ten hăng Pô pơdŏ bruă kơ Ñu, kar hăng Môis tŏng ten amăng abih bang sang Ơi Adai. 
For *he* has been counted worthy of greater glory than Moses, by how much he that has built it has more honour than the house. @ Samơ̆ Yêsu jing pô năng lăp hmâo tơlơi guh kơang hloh kơ Môis kar hăng pô ngă sang hmâo tơlơi pơpŭ hloh kơ sang ñu ngă. 
For every house is built by some one; but he who has built all things [is] God. @ (Sĭt biă mă, rĭm boh sang khŏm hmâo pô ngă ñu, samơ̆ Ơi Adai jing Pô hmâo hrih pơjing abih bang mơnơ̆ng mơnuă.) 
And Moses indeed [was] faithful in all his house, as a ministering servant, for a testimony of the things to be spoken after; @ Môis hmâo tŏng ten amăng abih bang sang Ơi Adai kar hăng sa čô ding kơna, kiăng ngă gơ̆ng jơlan kơ tơlơi arăng či pơhaih tơdơi. 
but Christ, as Son over his house, whose house are *we*, if indeed we hold fast the boldness and the boast of hope firm to the end. @ Samơ̆ Yang Krist tŏng ten kar hăng sa čô ană đah rơkơi wai lăng sang Ơi Adai. Ƀing ta jing sang kơ Ñu, tơdah ƀing ta djă kơjăp tơlơi đaŏ kơnang laih anŭn pơ-ư pô amăng tơlơi ƀing ta čang rơmang tơl đŭt.
Wherefore, even as says the Holy Spirit, To-day if ye will hear his voice, @  Hnŭn yơh, kar hăng Yang Bơngăt Hiam laĭ:
“Hrơi anai tơdah ƀing gih hmư̆ hiăp Ñu,
harden not your hearts, as in the provocation, in the day of temptation in the wilderness; @ Anăm khăng pran jua ƀing gih ôh kar hăng hlăk hrơi arăng pơkơdơ̆ng,
Amăng hrơi hmâo tơlơi lông lăng amăng tơdrŏn tač;
where your fathers tempted [me], by proving [me], and saw my works forty years. @ Ƀơi anŭn ƀing ơi adon ƀing gih hmâo lông lăng Kâo,
Wơ̆t dah gơñu ƀuh bruă Kâo ngă amăng pă pluh thŭn.
Wherefore I was wroth with this generation, and said, They always err in heart; and *they* have not known my ways; @ Yua kơ anŭn yơh, Kâo hil kơ ƀing rơnŭk anŭn,
Laih anŭn laĭ: ‘Pran jua ƀing gơñu jrok jơlan nanao;
Gơñu ƀu thâo krăn ôh jơlan Kâo.’
so I swore in my wrath, If they shall enter into my rest. @ Hnŭn yơh, Kâo hmâo ƀuăn rơ̆ng laih amăng tơlơi Kâo hil:
‘Gơñu ƀu či mŭt pơdơi hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Kâo ôh!’”
See, brethren, lest there be in any one of you a wicked heart of unbelief, in turning away from [the] living God. @ Ơ adơi ayŏng, răng bĕ, hwĭ dah amăng ƀing gih hmâo pran jua sat laih anŭn ƀu đaŏ, wir lui hĭ Ơi Adai Pô hơdip. 
But encourage yourselves each day, as long as it is called To-day, that none of you be hardened by the deceitfulness of sin. @ Samơ̆ rĭm hrơi pơtô pơđur tơdruă ƀing gih bĕ tơdang ăt dŏ laĭ “Hrơi anai”, kiăng kơ ƀu hmâo hlơi ôh amăng ƀing gih khăng pran jua yua kơ tơlơi soh plư. 
For we are become companions of the Christ if indeed we hold the beginning of the assurance firm to the end; @ Yua kơ tơdah ƀing ta djă kơjăp tơlơi đaŏ kơnang ƀing ta mơ̆ng blŭng hlâo tơl đŭt, ƀing ta dưi hmâo črăn hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Yang Krist. 
in that it is said, To-day if ye will hear his voice, do not harden your hearts, as in the provocation; @ Tui hăng Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp laĭ:
“Hrơi anai, tơdah ih hmư̆ asăp Ñu,
Anăm khăng pran jua ƀing gih ôh kar hăng amăng hrơi arăng pơkơdơ̆ng.”
(for who was it, who, having heard, provoked? but [was it] not all who came out of Egypt by Moses? @  Hlơi jing ƀing hmư̆ asăp Ñu samơ̆ ăt dŏ pơkơdơ̆ng? Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă abih bang ƀing mơnuih Môis hmâo atăt tơbiă laih mơ̆ng čar Êjip? 
And with whom was he wroth forty years? [Was it] not with those who had sinned, whose carcases fell in the wilderness? @ Laih anŭn kơ hlơi ƀing Ơi Adai hil amăng pă pluh thŭn? Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă ƀing hmâo ngă soh laih, drơi jan gơñu djai amăng tơdrŏn tač? 
And to whom sware he that they should not enter into his rest, but to those who had not hearkened to the word? @ Laih anŭn kơ hlơi ƀing Ñu ƀuăn rơ̆ng ƀu brơi mŭt pơdơi hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Ñu ôh? Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă kơ ƀing ƀu gưt hiăp Ñu? 
And we see that they could not enter in on account of unbelief;) @ Anŭn yơh, ƀing ta ƀuh ƀing mơnuih anŭn ƀu dưi mŭt ôh amăng tơlơi pơdơi anŭn yua kơ ƀu đaŏ.
Let us therefore fear, lest, a promise being left of entering into his rest, any one of you might seem to have failed [of it]. @ Tui anŭn, tơdang tơlơi ƀuăn kơ tơlơi mŭt amăng tơlơi pơdơi Ñu ăt dŏ, brơi ƀing ta thâo hwĭ bĕ kiăng kơ ƀu hmâo sa čô hlơi amăng ƀing ta ƀu tơl ôh hơnơ̆ng pơkă. 
For indeed we have had glad tidings presented to us, even as they also; but the word of the report did not profit *them*, not being mixed with faith in those who heard. @ Yua kơ Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam truh laih kơ ƀing ta kar hăng hmâo truh laih kơ ƀing gơñu; samơ̆ tơlơi pơtô gơñu hmâo hmư̆ anŭn ƀu tŭ yua kơ ƀing gơñu ôh, yua kơ tơdang ƀing gơñu hmư̆, gơñu ƀu mă tŭ ôh tơlơi anŭn hăng tơlơi đaŏ. 
For we enter into the rest who have believed; as he said, As I have sworn in my wrath, If they shall enter into my rest; although the works had been completed from [the] foundation of [the] world. @ Bơ kơ ƀing ta đaŏ laih mŭt laih amăng tơlơi pơdơi anŭn, kar hăng Ñu hmâo laĭ:
“Kar hăng tơlơi Kâo hmâo ƀuăn rơ̆ng laih amăng tơlơi Kâo hil:
‘Ƀing gơñu ƀu či mŭt pơdơi hrŏm hơbĭt ôh amăng tơlơi Kâo pơdơi!’”
Wơ̆t dah bruă Ñu hmâo pơgiơ̆ng laih čơdơ̆ng mơ̆ng rơnŭk hrih lŏn tơnah. 
For he has said somewhere of the seventh [day] thus, And God rested on the seventh day from all his works: @ Yua kơ hmâo anih Ñu hmâo pơhiăp djơ̆ kơ hrơi tal tơjuh tui anai:
“Hrơi tal tơjuh, Ơi Adai pơdơi mơ̆ng abih bang bruă Ñu hmâo ngă laih.”
and in this again, If they shall enter into my rest. @  Laih anŭn Ñu hmâo pơhiăp dơ̆ng amăng anih pơkŏn:
“Gơñu ƀu či mŭt ôh amăng tơlơi Kâo pơdơi.”
Seeing therefore it remains that some enter into it, and those who first received the glad tidings did not enter in on account of not hearkening to the word, @ Tui anŭn, ăt dŏ hmâo đơđa mơnuih či dưi mŭt amăng tơlơi pơdơi anŭn, laih anŭn ƀing mơnuih hlâo adih hmâo hmư̆ laih Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam samơ̆ ƀu dưi mŭt ôh yua kơ tơlơi ƀing gơñu ƀu gưt hiăp, 
again he determines a certain day, saying, in David, 'To-day,' after so long a time; (according as it has been said before), To-day, if ye will hear his voice, harden not your hearts. @ Ơi Adai pơkơčah sa hrơi dơ̆ng arăng iâu: “Hrơi anai,” tơdang Ñu pơhiăp mơ̆ng amăng bah Đawit sui thŭn tơdơi, kar hăng tơlơi čih laih hlâo adih:
“Hrơi anai, tơdah ƀing gih hmư̆ asăp Ñu,
Anăm khăng pran jua ƀing gih ôh.”
For if Jesus had brought them into rest, he would not have spoken afterwards about another day. @  Yua kơ tơdah Yôsuê brơi laih gơñu pơdơi, Ơi Adai ƀu pơhiăp kơ sa hrơi pơkŏn dơ̆ng ôh. 
There remains then a sabbatism to the people of God. @ Tui anŭn ăt dŏ hmâo sa hrơi pơdơi saƀat brơi kơ ƀing ană plei pla Ơi Adai. 
For he that has entered into his rest, he also has rested from his works, as God did from his own. @ Yua kơ hlơi pô mŭt amăng tơlơi Ơi Adai pơdơi, ñu ăt pơdơi mơ̆n mơ̆ng bruă ñu, kar hăng Ơi Adai pơdơi laih mơ̆ng bruă Ñu. 
Let us therefore use diligence to enter into that rest, that no one may fall after the same example of not hearkening to the word. @ Hnŭn yơh, brơi ƀing ta gir hăng abih pran jua mŭt amăng tơlơi pơdơi anŭn, kiăng kơ ƀu hmâo sa čô hlơi amăng ƀing ta lĕ rơbuh yua kơ hla tui hnal pơhmô kơ ƀing ƀu gưt hiăp.
For the word of God [is] living and operative, and sharper than any two-edged sword, and penetrating to [the] division of soul and spirit, both of joints and marrow, and a discerner of the thoughts and intents of [the] heart. @ Sĭt biă mă boh pơhiăp Ơi Adai jing boh pơhiăp hơdip laih anŭn mơyang, ƀơ̆ng hloh kơ sa ƀĕ đao dua bơnah mơta, tơma tơl blah pha jua pơmĭn hăng bơngăt, klang pơtơkuh hăng glo, kơsem khul tơlơi pơmĭn laih anŭn tơlơi pran jua kiăng. 
And there is not a creature unapparent before him; but all things [are] naked and laid bare to his eyes, with whom we have to do. @ Laih anŭn ƀơi anăp Ñu ƀu hmâo sa mơta mơnơ̆ng hmâo hrih laih dưi dŏ hơgơ̆m ôh, samơ̆ abih bang mơnơ̆ng pŏk laih anŭn pơrơđah ƀơi anăp mơta Pô ƀing ta khŏm ruai pơdah.
Having therefore a great high priest who has passed through the heavens, Jesus the Son of God, let us hold fast the confession. @ Tui anŭn, yua kơ ƀing ta hmâo sa čô khua ngă yang prŏng hloh hmâo găn laih abih tal adai jing Yêsu, Ană Ơi Adai, brơi ƀing ta djă kơjăp bĕ tơlơi đaŏ ƀing ta pơhaih. 
For we have not a high priest not able to sympathise with our infirmities, but tempted in all things in like manner, sin apart. @ Yua kơ ƀing ta ƀu hmâo ôh sa čô khua ngă yang prŏng ƀu thâo pap mơñai tơlơi tơdu ƀing ta, samơ̆ hmâo sa čô khua ngă yang prŏng hloh bưp djŏp mơta tơlơi plư kar hăng ƀing ta, samơ̆ Ñu ƀu ngă soh ôh. 
Let us approach therefore with boldness to the throne of grace, that we may receive mercy, and find grace for seasonable help. @ Tui anŭn brơi ƀing ta kơjăp pran jua bĕ nao jĕ gre pơtao tơlơi pap, kiăng kơ ƀing ta dưi tŭ mă tơlơi pap drap laih anŭn hơduah ƀuh tơlơi pap djru kơ ƀing ta djơ̆ mông tơdang ƀing ta hmâo tơlơi kơƀah.
For every high priest taken from amongst men is established for men in things relating to God, that he may offer both gifts and sacrifices for sins; @ Rĭm čô khua ngă yang prŏng hloh hmâo tơlơi ruah laih mơ̆ng tơ̆ng krah ană mơnuih laih anŭn pơdŏ bruă pơala brơi ană mơnuih ƀơi anăp Ơi Adai, kiăng kơ pơyơr mơnơ̆ng brơi laih anŭn mơnơ̆ng ngă yang yua kơ tơlơi soh. 
being able to exercise forbearance towards the ignorant and erring, since he himself also is clothed with infirmity; @ Ñu thâo pap kơ ƀing mlŭk laih anŭn kơ ƀing jrok jơlan, yua kơ ñu pô ăt dŏ amăng tơlơi tơdu wang dar kar kaĭ mơ̆n. 
and, on account of this [infirmity], he ought, even as for the people, so also for himself, to offer for sins. @ Kơlih yua tơlơi anŭn, ñu khŏm pơyơr mơnơ̆ng ngă yang yua kơ tơlơi soh ñu pô, laih anŭn yua kơ tơlơi soh ƀing ană plei pla mơ̆n. 
And no one takes the honour to himself but [as] called by God, even as Aaron also. @ Ƀu hmâo hlơi ruah mă kơ ñu pô ôh bruă pơpŭ anŭn, samơ̆ khŏm hmâo tơlơi Ơi Adai iâu, kar hăng Arôn.
Thus the Christ also has not glorified himself to be made a high priest; but he who had said to him, *Thou* art my Son, *I* have to-day begotten thee. @  Kar kaĭ mơ̆n, Yang Krist ƀu pơpŭ pơđĭ Ñu pô jing khua ngă yang prŏng hloh ôh, samơ̆ mơ̆ng Pô hmâo laĭ kơ Ñu tui anai:
“Ih jing Ană Kâo,
Hrơi anai Kâo tơkeng laih Ih.”
Even as also in another [place] he says, *Thou* [art] a priest for ever according to the order of Melchisedec. @  Amăng sa anih pơkŏn, Ñu ăt laĭ mơ̆n:
“Ih jing khua ngă yang hlŏng lar,
Tui hăng tơpul Mêlkisadek.”
Who in the days of his flesh, having offered up both supplications and entreaties to him who was able to save him out of death, with strong crying and tears; (and having been heard because of his piety;) @  Amăng khul hrơi ăt dŏ amăng asar đeh Yang Krist hmâo pơyơr đĭ khul tơlơi iâu laĭ laih anŭn tơlơi kơwưh hăng tơlơi ur kraih bă hăng ia mơta kơ Pô hmâo tơlơi dưi pơklaih Ñu mơ̆ng tơlơi djai, laih anŭn yua kơ tơlơi Ñu thâo pơpŭ kơ Ơi Adai, Ơi Adai hmư̆ Ñu. 
though he were Son, he learned obedience from the things which he suffered; @ Wơ̆t dah Ñu jing Ană, Ñu ăt hrăm laih tơlơi gưt hiăp găn tơlơi ruă nuă Ñu tŭ laih, 
and having been perfected, became to all them that obey him, author of eternal salvation; @ tơ Ñu pơgiơ̆ng klă tum laih, Ñu jing phŭn kơ tơlơi pơklaih hlŏng lar kơ abih bang hlơi pô gưt hiăp Ñu, 
addressed by God [as] high priest according to the order of Melchisedec. @ Ơi Adai dưm pioh laih Ñu jing khua ngă yang prŏng hloh tui hăng tơpul Mêlkisadek.
Concerning whom we have much to say, and hard to be interpreted in speaking [of it], since ye are become dull in hearing. @ Kơ tơlơi anŭn gơmơi hmâo lu tơlơi kiăng laĭ, samơ̆ tơnap biă mă pơblang, yua kơ ƀing gih jing hĭ kaih thâo hluh. 
For when for the time ye ought to be teachers, ye have again need that [one] should teach you what [are] the elements of the beginning of the oracles of God, and are become such as have need of milk, [and] not of solid food. @ Tui hăng tơlơi djơ̆, ră anai ƀing gih khŏm jing nai laih, samơ̆ ƀing gih ăt kiăng arăng pơtô kơ ƀing gih khul tơlơi hrăm đêl kơ boh pơhiăp Ơi Adai brơi kơ ƀing gih. Ƀing gih ăt dŏ khŏm mơñum ia tơsâo pơala kơ mơnơ̆ng khăng. 
For every one that partakes of milk [is] unskilled in the word of righteousness, for he is a babe; @ Yua kơ hlơi pô kơnơ̆ng mơñum ia tơsâo đôč ñu aka hluh ôh boh pơhiăp kơ tơlơi tơpă hơnơ̆ng, yua kơ ñu ăt dŏ čơđai. 
but solid food belongs to full-grown men, who, on account of habit, have their senses exercised for distinguishing both good and evil. @ Samơ̆ mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng khăng pioh brơi kơ ƀing tha truh, jing brơi kơ ƀing mơnuih dưi hmâo tơlơi pơhrăm laih yua mơ̆ng tơlơi hrăm ngă, kiăng kơ thâo bơkơnăl tơlơi hiam hăng tơlơi sat.
Wherefore, leaving the word of the beginning of the Christ, let us go on [to what belongs] to full growth, not laying again a foundation of repentance from dead works and faith in God, @ Hnŭn yơh, brơi ƀing ta lui hĭ khul mơta tơlơi hrăm amuñ đêl kơ Krist, kơtưn nao bĕ kơ tơlơi klă tum, anăm wơ̆t glaĭ kơ khul tơlơi phŭn atur dơ̆ng ôh, kar hăng: tơlơi kơhmal kơ khul bruă djai, tơlơi đaŏ kơ Ơi Adai, 
of [the] doctrine of washings, and of imposition of hands, and of resurrection of [the] dead, and of eternal judgment; @ tơlơi pơtô kơ tơlơi ƀatem, kơ tơlơi ah tơngan, kơ tơlơi hơdip glaĭ mơ̆ng ƀing djai, laih anŭn kơ tơlơi phat kơđi hlŏng lar. 
and this will we do if God permit. @ Tơdah Ơi Adai brơi, tơlơi anŭn ƀing ta či ngă.
For it is impossible to renew again to repentance those once enlightened, and who have tasted of the heavenly gift, and have been made partakers of [the] Holy Spirit, @ Yua kơ ƀing mơnuih hmâo laih tơlơi bơngač pơčrang sa wơ̆t, hmâo liah laih tơlơi pha brơi mơ̆ng adai, hmâo tŭ hrŏm hơbĭt laih Yang Bơngăt Hiam, 
and have tasted the good word of God, and [the] works of power of [the] age to come, @ hmâo liah laih tơlơi hiam klă amăng boh pơhiăp Ơi Adai, laih anŭn tơlơi dưi mơyang kơ rơnŭk či truh, 
and have fallen away, crucifying for themselves [as they do] the Son of God, and making a show of [him]. @ tơdah gơñu lĕ rơbuh dơ̆ng, ƀu dưi ba ƀing gơñu glaĭ kơ tơlơi kơhmal dơ̆ng ôh, yua kơ ƀing gơñu pơ̆ng Ană Ơi Adai ƀơi kơyâo bơrơkal sa wơ̆t dơ̆ng, laih anŭn brơi arăng mưč kơ Gơ̆ ƀơi anăp abih bang mơnuih.
For ground which drinks the rain which comes often upon it, and produces useful herbs for those for whose sakes also it is tilled, partakes of blessing from God; @ Yua kơ anih lŏn pă ia hơjan hram pơsah ngă brơi añăm tăm čăt đĭ, hmâo tơlơi tŭ yua kơ pô čoh pla, lŏn anŭn mă tŭ tơlơi mơyun hiam mơ̆ng Ơi Adai. 
but bringing forth thorns and briars, it is found worthless and nigh to a curse, whose end [is] to be burned. @ Samơ̆ tơdah anih lŏn pă kơnơ̆ng čăt phŭn drơi laih anŭn hrĕ drơi đôč, ñu ƀu hmâo nua yom ôh laih anŭn tŭ tơlơi hơtơ̆m pah; hnal tuč ñu khŏm tŭ apui ƀơ̆ng ñu.
But we are persuaded concerning you, beloved, better things, and connected with salvation, even if we speak thus. @ Ơ ƀing kâo khăp hơeng, wơ̆t dah gơmơi pơhiăp tui anŭn, samơ̆ ƀing gơmơi ăt đaŏ sĭt kơ khul bruă hiam hloh mơ̆ng ƀing gih, jing khul bruă nao hrŏm hăng tơlơi pơklaih. 
For God [is] not unrighteous to forget your work, and the love which ye have shewn to his name, having ministered to the saints, and [still] ministering. @ Ƀu djơ̆ Ơi Adai ƀu tơpă ôh; Ñu ƀu wơr bĭt hĭ ôh bruă ƀing gih laih anŭn tơlơi khăp ƀing gih pơrơđah laih yua kơ anăn Ñu, amăng tơlơi ƀing gih hmâo djru laih kơ ƀing rơgoh hiam, laih anŭn ăt dŏ ngă mơ̆n. 
But we desire earnestly that each one of you shew the same diligence to the full assurance of hope unto the end; @ Laih anŭn gơmơi kiăng kơ rĭm čô ƀing gih či pơrơđah tơlơi hur har kar hăng anŭn kiăng djă kơjăp tơlơi čang rơmang ƀing gih tum klă tơl hnal tuč. 
that ye be not sluggish, but imitators of those who through faith and patience have been inheritors of the promises. @ Tui anŭn ƀing gih ƀu či rơmơ̆n rơbưi ôh, samơ̆ brơi hla tui ƀing mơnuih hmâo tŭ mă tơlơi ƀuăn yua mơ̆ng tơlơi đaŏ laih anŭn pran jua gir tŭ.
For God, having promised to Abraham, since he had no greater to swear by, swore by himself, @ Tơdang Ơi Adai ƀuăn hăng Abraham, yua kơ ƀu hmâo ôh pô prŏng hloh kơ Ñu kiăng kơ ƀuăn rơ̆ng, tui anŭn Ñu ƀuăn rơ̆ng hăng Ñu pô. 
saying, Surely blessing I will bless thee, and multiplying I will multiply thee; @ Ñu laĭ: “Sĭt biă mă Kâo či pha brơi tơlơi mơyun hiam kơ ih, laih anŭn Kâo či pơjing brơi ană tơčo ih hrôh lar.” 
and thus, having had long patience, he got the promise. @ Abraham hmâo gir dŏ tơguan, tui anŭn ñu mă tŭ tơlơi ƀuăn mơ̆ng Ơi Adai. 
For men indeed swear by a greater, and with them the oath is a term to all dispute, as making matters sure. @ Sĭt biă mă, arăng juăt ƀuăn rơ̆ng hăng anăn pô prŏng hloh kơ gơñu pô, laih anŭn abih bang tơlơi pơrơjah dưi pơđŭt hĭ hăng sa tơlơi ƀuăn rơ̆ng kiăng pơsĭt brơi. 
Wherein God, willing to shew more abundantly to the heirs of the promise the unchangeableness of his purpose, intervened by an oath, @ Ăt tui anŭn mơ̆n, Ơi Adai kiăng pơrơđah klă hloh brơi kơ ƀing či tŭ mă tơlơi Ñu ƀuăn thâo tơlơi kơñăm Ñu ƀu dưi pơplih ôh, Ñu pơsĭt hăng sa tơlơi ƀuăn rơ̆ng, 
that by two unchangeable things, in which [it was] impossible that God should lie, we might have a strong encouragement, who have fled for refuge to lay hold on the hope set before us, @ kiăng kơ mơ̆ng dua tơlơi ƀu dưi pơplih anŭn — amăng dua tơlơi anŭn Ơi Adai ƀu pơhiăp ƀlor ôh — ƀing ta jing ƀing mơnuih nao kơđap amăng Ñu, dưi hmâo tơlơi pơalum prŏng, laih anŭn djă kơjăp tơlơi čang rơmang hmâo pioh laih ƀơi anăp ƀing ta. 
which we have as anchor of the soul, both secure and firm, and entering into that within the veil, @ Ƀing ta hmâo laih tơlơi čang rơmang anŭn, kơjăp laih anŭn sĭt biă mă kar hăng pơsơi kơ̆ng bơngăt ƀing ta găn khăn păng mŭt nao amăng lăm sang kơkuh pơpŭ. 
where Jesus is entered as forerunner for us, become for ever a high priest according to the order of Melchisedec. @ Ƀơi anŭn Yêsu mŭt hlâo laih yua kơ ƀing ta, laih anŭn hmâo jing laih khua ngă yang prŏng hloh hlŏng lar tui hăng tơpul Mêlkisadek.
For this Melchisedec, King of Salem, priest of the most high God, who met Abraham returning from smiting the kings, and blessed him; @  Mêlkisadek anai jing pơtao plei Salem, khua ngă yang kơ Ơi Adai Pô Glông Hloh, hmâo nao čơkă hăng hơơč tơlơi mơyun hiam kơ Abraham tơdang ñu wơ̆t glaĭ mơ̆ng tơlơi pơblah dưi hăng ƀing pơtao, 
to whom Abraham gave also the tenth portion of all; first being interpreted King of righteousness, and then also King of Salem, which is King of peace; @ Abraham hmâo mă sa črăn amăng pluh mơ̆ng abih bang dram gơnam ñu hmâo laih anŭn pơyơr kơ pơtao. Anăn pơtao anŭn, blŭng hlâo kiăng pơblang jing “pơtao tơpă hơnơ̆ng”, laih anŭn ăt jing pơtao kơ Salem, kiăng laĭ “pơtao rơnŭk rơnua”. 
without father, without mother, without genealogy; having neither beginning of days nor end of life, but assimilated to the Son of God, abides a priest continually. @ Ñu ƀu hmâo ama, ƀu hmâo amĭ, ƀu hmâo djuai hrĕ, ƀu hmâo hrơi tơkeng, kŏn hmâo hrơi djai lơi, samơ̆ kar hăng Ană Ơi Adai, jing khua ngă yang hlŏng lar.
Now consider how great this [personage] was, to whom [even] the patriarch Abraham gave a tenth out of the spoils. @ Pơmĭn lăng bĕ pơtao anŭn prŏng dơ̆ pă! Wơ̆t kơ Abraham jing ơi adon phŭn, ăt khŏm mă sa črăn amăng pluh dram gơnam ñu sua mă amăng tơlơi pơblah pơyơr kơ ñu. 
And they indeed from among the sons of Levi, who receive the priesthood, have commandment to take tithes from the people according to the law, that is from their brethren, though these are come out of the loins of Abraham: @ Hmâo sa tơlơi pơtă amăng tơlơi juăt ƀing ană tơčo Lêwi jing ƀing khua ngă yang dưi mă sa črăn amăng pluh mơ̆ng ƀing ană plei pla, kiăng laĭ mơ̆ng ƀing adơi ayŏng gơñu pô, wơ̆t dah ƀing anŭn leng kơ jing ană tơčo Abraham soh sel. 
but he who has no genealogy from them has tithed Abraham, and blessed him who had the promises. @ Samơ̆ Mêlkisadek anai, ƀu tơbiă rai mơ̆ng kơnŭng djuai Lêwi ôh, ăt mă tŭ sa črăn amăng pluh mơ̆ng Abraham laih anŭn hơơč tơlơi mơyun hiam kơ ñu jing pô hmâo tơlơi Ơi Adai ƀuăn.
