But beyond all gainsaying, the inferior is blessed by the better. @ Arăng ƀu dưi pơrơjah ôh kơ tơlơi anai, pô prŏng hloh hơơč mơyun hiam kơ pô anĕt hloh. 
And here dying men receive tithes; but there [one] of whom the witness is that he lives; @ Amăng tơlơi anai, ƀing mơnuih mă tŭ sa črăn amăng pluh jing ƀing mơnuih thâo djai; amăng tơlơi pơkŏn, mơnuih anŭn Ơi Adai gơ̆ng jơlan pơsĭt jing mơnuih hlăk dŏ hơdip. 
and, so to speak, through Abraham, Levi also, who received tithes, has been made to pay tithes. @ Arăng dưi laĭ kơ Lêwi, jing pô mă tŭ sa črăn amăng pluh, hmâo pơyơr laih sa črăn amăng pluh găn mơ̆ng Abraham, 
For he was yet in the loins of his father when Melchisedec met him. @ yua kơ hlăk Mêlkisadek nao čơkă Abraham, Lêwi ăt dŏ amăng hơtai pruăi Abraham.
If indeed then perfection were by the Levitical priesthood, for the people had their law given to them in connexion with *it*, what need [was there] still that a different priest should arise according to the order of Melchisedec, and not be named after the order of Aaron? @ Tơdah bruă khua ngă yang Lêwi dưi tơl tơlơi klă tum (yua kơ ƀing ană plei pla mă tŭ laih tơlơi juăt gah yŭ kơ bruă ngă yang anai) hơgĕt yom kiăng hmâo sa čô khua ngă yang pơkŏn dơ̆ng tơbiă rai tui hăng tơpul Mêlkisadek, ƀu djơ̆ tui hăng tơpul Arôn ôh? 
For, the priesthood being changed, there takes place of necessity a change of law also. @ Bruă khua ngă yang hmâo tơlơi pơplih laih, hnŭn yơh tơlơi juăt ăt khŏm pơplih mơ̆n. 
For he, of whom these things are said, belongs to a different tribe, of which no one has [ever] been attached to the service of the altar. @ Bơ kơ Pô hơdôm boh pơhiăp anŭn hmâo laĭ nao jing lơ̆m kơ sa kơnŭng djuai pơkŏn, laih anŭn amăng kơnŭng djuai anŭn aka hmâo hlơi ôh buih bruă ƀơi kơƀang ngă yang. 
For it is clear that our Lord has sprung out of Juda, as to which tribe Moses spake nothing as to priests. @ Yua kơ sĭt biă mă Khua Yang ƀing ta tơbiă rai mơ̆ng kơnŭng djuai Yuđa, jing kơnŭng djuai Môis ƀu hmâo pơhiăp djơ̆ ôh kơ bruă khua ngă yang.
And it is yet more abundantly evident, since a different priest arises according to the similitude of Melchisedec, @ Tơlơi anai jai klă rơđah hloh dơ̆ng, tơ hmâo khua ngă yang pơkŏn tơbiă rai kar hăng Mêlkisadek, 
who has been constituted not according to law of fleshly commandment, but according to power of indissoluble life. @ jing khua ngă yang ƀu djơ̆ tui hăng tơlơi juăt kơ tơlơi phiăn ană mơnuih ôh, samơ̆ tui hăng tơlơi dưi mơyang kơ tơlơi hơdip ƀu thâo răm rai. 
For it is borne witness, *Thou* art a priest for ever according to the order of Melchisedec. @ Yua kơ hmâo boh pơhiăp ngă gơ̆ng jơlan kơ Ñu tui anai:
“Ih jing khua ngă yang hlŏng lar,
Tui hăng tơpul Mêlkisadek.”
For there is a setting aside of the commandment going before for its weakness and unprofitableness, @ Tui anŭn, sa bơnah tơlơi juăt so arăng lui hĭ laih ñu yua kơ ñu tơdu laih anŭn ƀu tŭ yua ôh 
(for the law perfected nothing,) and the introduction of a better hope by which we draw nigh to God. @ (yua kơ tơlơi juăt ƀu dưi ngă brơi tơlơi hơgĕt jing klă tum ôh); bơnah pơkŏn, hmâo sa tơlơi čang rơmang hiam hloh hmâo pha brơi, kiăng kơ mơ̆ng tơlơi anŭn ƀing ta nao giăm Ơi Adai.
And by how much [it was] not without the swearing of an oath; @ Bruă anai hmâo pơjing laih hăng sa tơlơi ƀuăn rơ̆ng. Ƀing khua ngă yang pơkŏn hmâo pơjing đĭ samơ̆ ƀu hmâo tơlơi ƀuăn rơ̆ng ôh; 
(for they are become priests without the swearing of an oath, but he with the swearing of an oath, by him who said, as to him, The Lord has sworn, and will not repent [of it], *Thou* [art] priest for ever [according to the order of Melchisedec];) @ samơ̆ Khua Yang Yêsu jing hĭ khua ngă yang hăng tơlơi ƀuăn rơ̆ng, yua kơ Ơi Adai hmâo laĭ kơ Ñu tui anai:
“Khua Yang hmâo ƀuăn rơ̆ng laih, laih anŭn Ñu ƀu či pơplih ôh,
‘Ih či jing khua ngă yang hlŏng lar.’”
by so much Jesus became surety of a better covenant. @ Yua kơ anŭn yơh, Khua Yang Yêsu hmâo jing hĭ laih Pô grơ̆ng kơjăp brơi sa kơnol pơgop hiam hloh.
And they have been many priests, on account of being hindered from continuing by death; @ Đưm hlâo adih mrô ƀing khua ngă yang jing lu, yua kơ gơñu khŏm djai ƀu dưi ngă nanao bruă mă anŭn ôh. 
but he, because of his continuing for ever, has the priesthood unchangeable. @ Samơ̆ Khua Yang Yêsu djă bruă khua ngă yang nanao, yua kơ Ñu dŏ hơdip hlŏng lar. 
Whence also he is able to save completely those who approach by him to God, always living to intercede for them. @ Yua kơ anŭn, Ñu dưi pơklaih tum num ƀing mơnuih kơnang kơ Ñu kiăng nao giăm Ơi Adai, yua kơ Ñu hơdip hlŏng lar kiăng iâu laĭ pơala brơi kơ ƀing mơnuih anŭn.
For such a high priest became us, holy, harmless, undefiled, separated from sinners, and become higher than the heavens: @ Sĭt yơh, Ñu jing khua ngă yang prŏng hloh Pô ƀing ta kiăng biă mă: rơgoh hơčih, ƀu hmâo tơlơi soh, ƀu hmâo tơlơi hơƀak drak, pơčơlah hĭ mơ̆ng ƀing mơnuih soh, hmâo tơlơi pơpŭ glong hloh kơ khul tal adai. 
who has not day by day need, as the high priests, first to offer up sacrifices for his own sins, then [for] those of the people; for this he did once for all [in] having offered up himself. @ Ƀu hrup hăng ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng hloh pơkŏn ôh, Ñu ƀu khŏm pơyơr mơnơ̆ng ngă yang rĭm hrơi, blŭng hlâo yua kơ tơlơi soh ñu pô, tơdơi yua kơ tơlơi soh ană plei pla. Ñu pơyơr Ñu pô jing mơnơ̆ng ngă yang sa wơ̆t djŏp laih. 
For the law constitutes men high priests, having infirmity; but the word of the swearing of the oath which [is] after the law, a Son perfected for ever. @ Yua kơ tơlơi juăt pơjing ƀing mơnuih tơdu hơđăp amơĭ ngă khua ngă yang prŏng hloh; bơ kơ tơlơi ƀuăn rơ̆ng hmâo tơdơi kơ tơlơi juăt, pơdơ̆ng pioh Ană, jing Pô hmâo tơlơi klă tum hlŏng lar.
Now a summary of the things of which we are speaking [is], We have such a one high priest who has sat down on [the] right hand of the throne of the greatness in the heavens; @  Tơlơi phŭn kơnel ƀing ta dŏ pơhiăp jing: Ƀing ta hmâo sa čô khua ngă yang prŏng hloh, Pô dŏ ber gah hơnuă gre pơtao Pô Guh Kơang amăng adai. 
minister of the holy places and of the true tabernacle, which the Lord has pitched, [and] not man. @ Ñu jing pô buih bruă amăng anih rơgoh hiam, jing amăng sang khăn sĭt, Khua Yang Pô pơdơ̆ng laih ƀu djơ̆ mơnuih ôh. 
For every high priest is constituted for the offering both of gifts and sacrifices; whence it is needful that this one also should have something which he may offer. @ Yua kơ abih bang ƀing khua ngă yang prŏng hloh arăng hmâo pơdưm brơi kiăng kơ pơyơr mơnơ̆ng brơi laih anŭn mơnơ̆ng ngă yang; yua kơ anŭn, khua ngă yang prŏng anai khŏm hmâo mơnơ̆ng pơyơr kar kaĭ mơ̆n. 
If then indeed he were upon earth, he would not even be a priest, there being those who offer the gifts according to the law, @ Tơdah Ñu ăt dŏ ƀơi lŏn tơnah, Ñu ƀu jing khua ngă yang ôh, yua kơ ƀơi lŏn tơnah anai hmâo laih ƀing khua ngă yang pơyơr mơnơ̆ng brơi tui hăng tơlơi juăt. 
(who serve the representation and shadow of heavenly things, according as Moses was oracularly told [when] about to make the tabernacle; for See, saith He, that thou make all things according to the pattern which has been shewn to thee in the mountain.) @ Tơlơi buih bruă gơñu amăng anih rơgoh hiam, jing rup hruă tui laih anŭn pô̆ kơ anih rơgoh hiam amăng adai; yua kơ tơdang Môis čơdơ̆ng pơdơ̆ng sang khăn, Ơi Adai pơtă kơ ñu tui anai: “Răng bĕ, brơi ih ngă abih bang tui hăng rup Kâo hmâo bơrơđah brơi laih kơ ih ƀơi ngŏ čư̆.” 
But now he has got a more excellent ministry, by so much as he is mediator of a better covenant, which is established on the footing of better promises. @ Samơ̆ ră anai Yêsu hmâo mă tŭ laih bruă mă prŏng hloh, yua kơ Ñu jing Pô Dŏ Kơplah kơ kơnol pơgop hiam hloh, yua kơ kơnol pơgop anŭn hmâo pơdơ̆ng ƀơi tơlơi ƀuăn hiam hloh.
For if that first was faultless, place had not been sought for a second. @ Yua kơ tơdah tơlơi kơnol pơgop anŭn jing klă tum laih, ƀu yom dơ̆ng ôh pơdơ̆ng kơnol pơgop tal dua. 
For finding fault, he says to them, Behold, days come, saith the Lord, and I will consummate a new covenant as regards the house of Israel, and as regards the house of Juda; @ Samơ̆ Ơi Adai ƀuh tơlơi soh glaĭ amăng ƀing ană plei pla, tơdang Ñu laĭ:
“Khul hrơi či truh,
Hlăk anŭn Kâo či pơjing kơnol pơgop phrâo hăng sang Israel laih anŭn hăng sang Yuđa;
not according to the covenant which I made to their fathers in [the] day of my taking their hand to lead them out of the land of Egypt; because *they* did not continue in my covenant, and *I* did not regard them, saith [the] Lord. @ Ƀu djơ̆ hrup hăng kơnol pơgop Kâo hmâo ngă laih hăng ƀing ơi adon gơñu ôh,
Amăng hrơi Kâo djă tơngan gơñu atăt ba tơbiă mơ̆ng čar Êjip;
Yua kơ gơñu ƀu tŏng ten djă kơnol pơgop Kâo,
Anŭn yơh Kâo lui măk ai gơñu,” Khua Yang laĭ.
Because this [is] the covenant that I will covenant to the house of Israel after those days, saith the Lord: Giving my laws into their mind, I will write them also upon their hearts; and I will be to them for God, and *they* shall be to me for people. @ Khua Yang laĭ dơ̆ng: “Anai jing kơnol pơgop Kâo či pơjing hăng sang Israel:
Tơdơi kơ khul hrơi anŭn, Kâo či dưm tơlơi juăt Kâo amăng tơlơi pơmĭn gơñu,
Laih anŭn Kâo či čih tơlơi juăt anŭn amăng pran jua gơñu,
Kâo či jing Ơi Adai gơñu,
Laih anŭn gơñu či jing ană plei pla Kâo.
And they shall not teach each his fellow-citizen, and each his brother, saying, Know the Lord; because all shall know me in themselves, from [the] little one [among them] unto [the] great among them. @ Gơñu ƀu či pơhrăm ană plei gơñu
Ƀôdah adơi ayŏng gơñu dơ̆ng ôh, laih anŭn laĭ: ‘Brơi gih thâo krăn Khua Yang.’
Yua kơ abih bang leng kơ či thâo krăn Kâo,
Čơdơ̆ng mơ̆ng pô anĕt hloh truh kơ pô prŏng hloh amăng ƀing gơñu,
Because I will be merciful to their unrighteousnesses, and their sins and their lawlessnesses I will never remember any more. @ Yua kơ Kâo či pap drap brơi kơ tơlơi wĕ wŏ gơñu,
Laih anŭn Kâo ƀu či hơdơr dơ̆ng ôh kơ tơlơi soh sat gơñu.”
In that he says New, he has made the first old; but that which grows old and aged [is] near disappearing. @ Pơhiăp djơ̆ kơ kơnol pơgop phrâo, Ñu hmâo yap kơnol pơgop hlâo anŭn jing so laih. Laih anŭn hơgĕt rơgao rơnŭk laih, so hơđăp laih ƀu sui dơ̆ng ôh či răm rai yơh.
The first therefore also indeed had ordinances of service, and the sanctuary, a worldly one. @ Tui anŭn, wơ̆t kơ kơnol pơgop tal sa ăt hmâo mơ̆n khul tơlơi pơkă hơnơ̆ng kơ tơlơi kơkuh pơpŭ laih anŭn sa anih rơgoh hiam ƀơi lŏn tơnah. 
For a tabernacle was set up; the first, in which [were] both the candlestick and the table and the exposition of the loaves, which is called Holy; @ Yua kơ sa boh sang khăn hmâo pơdơ̆ng đĭ laih. Amăng wang tal sa arăng iâu ñu Anih Rơgoh Hiam, hmâo gơ̆ng apui kơđen, kơƀang laih anŭn ƀañ tơpŭng pơyơr kơ Ơi Adai. 
but after the second veil a tabernacle which is called Holy of holies, @ Gah klon khăn păng tal dua hmâo sa sang khăn arăng pia Anih Rơgoh Hiam Hloh, 
having a golden censer, and the ark of the covenant, covered round in every part with gold, in which [were] the golden pot that had the manna, and the rod of Aaron that had sprouted, and the tables of the covenant; @ Hmâo kơnưl pơyơr mơnơ̆ng ƀâu mơngưi ngă hăng mah laih anŭn hip kơnol pơgop lom hăng mah soh sel. Amăng hip anŭn hmâo sa boh get mah arăng pioh mana, gai jra Arôn čăt bơnga, laih anŭn khul hnal boh pơtâo kơnol pơgop. 
and above over it the cherubim of glory shadowing the mercy-seat; concerning which it is not now [the time] to speak in detail. @ Ƀơi ngŏ hip anŭn hmâo Čêrubim guh kơang gom kơhnơ̆p tơlơi pap. Kơ mơnơ̆ng anŭn ƀing gơmơi ƀu dưi pơblang abih rĭm mơta ôh ră anai.
Now these things being thus ordered, into the first tabernacle the priests enter at all times, accomplishing the services; @  Giơ̆ng abih bang mơnơ̆ng hmâo pơkra laih tui anŭn, rĭm hrơi ƀing khua ngă yang mŭt amăng wang tal sa amăng sang khăn kiăng kơ ngă khul phĕt kơkuh pơpŭ; 
but into the second, the high priest only, once a year, not without blood, which he offers for himself and for the errors of the people: @ samơ̆ amăng wang tal dua khua ngă yang prŏng hloh đôč dưi mŭt, rĭm thŭn sa wơ̆t, laih anŭn khŏm djă ba drah kiăng pơyơr ngă yang song mă tơlơi soh kơ ñu pô laih anŭn kơ tơlơi soh ană plei pla ƀu pơrơ̆ng ngă ôh. 
the Holy Spirit shewing this, that the way of the [holy of] holies has not yet been made manifest while as yet the first tabernacle has [its] standing; @ Yang Bơngăt Hiam yua tơlơi anai kiăng pơrơđah brơi tơdang sang khăn tal sa ăt dŏ, jơlan mŭt amăng Anih Rơgoh Hiam Hloh aka pŏk ôh. 
the which [is] an image for the present time, according to which both gifts and sacrifices, unable to perfect as to conscience him that worshipped, are offered, @ (Tơlơi anai jing rup bơhmutu kơ rơnŭk anai). Tui hăng tơlơi anŭn, khul mơnơ̆ng pơyơr brơi laih anŭn mơnơ̆ng ngă yang arăng pơyơr ƀu dưi ngă brơi pran jua tơpă kơ ƀing mơnuih kơkuh pơpŭ jing klă tum ôh, 
[consisting] only of meats and drinks and divers washings, ordinances of flesh, imposed until [the] time of setting things right. @ samơ̆ mơnơ̆ng anŭn kơnơ̆ng pơhiăp djơ̆ kơ mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă, mơnơ̆ng mơñum, laih anŭn khul phĕt pơrơgoh pơkŏn, jing khul tơlơi pơkă hơnơ̆ng kơ asar đeh khŏm ngă tui tơl truh rơnŭk pơplih phrâo.
But Christ being come high priest of the good things to come, by the better and more perfect tabernacle not made with hand, (that is, not of this creation,) @ Samơ̆ tơ Yang Krist hmâo truh laih jing kar hăng sa čô khua ngă yang prŏng hloh kơ khul tơlơi hiam klă či truh, tui anŭn Ñu găn sang khăn prŏng hloh laih anŭn klă tum hloh ƀu djơ̆ tơngan ană mơnuih ngă ôh, kiăng laĭ ƀu lơ̆m kơ khul mơnơ̆ng ƀơi lŏn tơnah anai ôh. 
nor by blood of goats and calves, but by his own blood, has entered in once for all into the [holy of] holies, having found an eternal redemption. @ Ñu mŭt laih amăng Anih Rơgoh Hiam Hloh sa wơ̆t djŏp laih, ƀu yua drah bơbe tơno laih anŭn drah ană rơmo, samơ̆ yua drah Ñu pô, kiăng ba rai tơlơi song mă hlŏng lar kơ ƀing ta. 
For if the blood of goats and bulls, and a heifer's ashes sprinkling the defiled, sanctifies for the purity of the flesh, @ Yua kơ tơdah tơlơi arăng prăh drah bơbe tơno laih anŭn rơmo tơno laih anŭn hơbâo rơmo dra ƀơi mơnuih hơƀak drak laih, ăt dưi pơrơgoh mơ̆n gơñu kiăng kơ gơñu dưi rơgoh gah kơ asar đeh, 
how much rather shall the blood of the Christ, who by the eternal Spirit offered himself spotless to God, purify your conscience from dead works to worship [the] living God? @ hloh kơ anŭn dơ̆ng drah Yang Krist, jing Pô kơnang mơ̆ng Yang Bơngăt Hiam hlŏng lar, pơyơr Ñu pô kơ Ơi Adai kar hăng mơnơ̆ng pơyơr ƀu hmâo rơka, dưi pơrơgoh pran jua tơpă ƀing gih mơ̆ng bruă mơnuă djai, kiăng kơ ƀing gih buih bruă kơ Ơi Adai hơdip.
And for this reason he is mediator of a new covenant, so that, death having taken place for redemption of the transgressions under the first covenant, the called might receive the promise of the eternal inheritance. @ Yua kơ tơlơi anŭn yơh, Yang Krist jing Pô Dŏ Kơplah kơ kơnol pơgop phrâo, yua mơ̆ng anŭn ƀing mơnuih hmâo iâu laih dưi mă tŭ kong ngăn hlŏng lar hmâo ƀuăn brơi laih kơ gơñu, yua kơ tơlơi djai Ñu hmâo tŭ laih, dưi song mă ƀing mơnuih hmâo ngă soh laih gah yŭ kơnol pơgop tal sa.
(For where [there is] a testament, the death of the testator must needs come in. @ Yua kơ pơpă hmâo hră čih pơtă pioh, brơi khŏm pơsĭt pô ngă hră čih pơtă pioh anŭn djai laih. 
For a testament [is] of force when men are dead, since it is in no way of force while the testator is alive.) @ Hră čih pơtă pioh hmâo tơlơi tŭ yua kơnơ̆ng tơdơi kơ tơlơi djai đôč, yua kơ tơdah pô ngă hră čih pơtă pioh ăt dŏ hơdip ñu ƀu hmâo tơlơi tŭ yua hơgĕt ôh. 
Whence neither the first was inaugurated without blood. @ Tui anŭn wơ̆t kơnol pơgop tal sa ăt ƀu hmâo tơlơi tŭ yua ôh tơdah ƀu hmâo drah. 
For every commandment having been spoken according to [the] law by Moses to all the people; having taken the blood of calves and goats, with water and scarlet wool and hyssop, he sprinkled both the book itself and all the people, @ Yua kơ tơdang Môis pơhaih abih bang tơlơi pơtă amăng tơlơi juăt kơ abih bang ƀing ană plei pla, ñu mă drah ană rơmo, bơbe tơno hơbĭt hăng ia, blâu triu mriah laih anŭn hla hisôp ñu prăh ƀơi hơdrôm hră wơ̆t ƀơi abih bang ană plei pla, 
saying, This [is] the blood of the covenant which God has enjoined to you. @ laih anŭn laĭ: “Anai jing drah kơnol pơgop Ơi Adai hmâo pơtă laih kơ ƀing gih.” 
And the tabernacle too and all the vessels of service he sprinkled in like manner with blood; @ Ăt kar hăng tui anŭn mơ̆n, ñu prăh drah ƀơi sang khăn wơ̆t ƀơi abih bang gơnam yua pioh kơ bruă kơkuh pơpŭ. 
and almost all things are purified with blood according to the law, and without blood-shedding there is no remission. @ Sĭt biă mă, tui hăng tơlơi juăt abih bang mơnơ̆ng dưi jing hĭ rơgoh yua mơ̆ng drah, laih anŭn ƀu hmâo tơlơi tuh drah, ƀu hmâo tơlơi pap brơi tơlơi soh ôh.
[It was] necessary then that the figurative representations of the things in the heavens should be purified with these; but the heavenly things themselves with sacrifices better than these. @ Tui anŭn, tơdah khul rup pơhmô kơ abih mơnơ̆ng amăng adai khŏm kơnang kơ mơnơ̆ng ngă yang anŭn kiăng dưi rơgoh, tui anŭn mơ̆n khul mơnơ̆ng sĭt amăng adai khŏm kơnang kơ mơnơ̆ng ngă yang hiam hloh kiăng dưi rơgoh. 
For the Christ is not entered into holy places made with hand, figures of the true, but into heaven itself, now to appear before the face of God for us: @ Yua kơ Yang Krist ƀu mŭt ôh amăng anih rơgoh hiam yua mơ̆ng tơngan ană mơnuih ngă, jing rup kơ anih rơgoh sĭt; samơ̆ mŭt laih amăng plei hiam, laih anŭn kiăng kơ ră anai Ñu pơala kơ ƀing ta nao ƀơi anăp Ơi Adai. 
nor in order that he should offer himself often, as the high priest enters into the holy places every year with blood not his own; @ Ñu ăt ƀu pơyơr Ñu pô lu wơ̆t ôh, kar hăng khua ngă yang prŏng hloh rĭm thŭn ñu mŭt amăng Anih Rơgoh Hiam Hloh pơyơr drah ƀu djơ̆ hăng drah ñu pô ôh. 
since he had [then] been obliged often to suffer from the foundation of the world. But now once in the consummation of the ages he has been manifested for [the] putting away of sin by his sacrifice. @ Yua kơ tơdah tui anŭn, Ñu hmâo tŭ laih tơlơi ruă nuă lu wơ̆t mơ̆ng hrơi čơdơ̆ng phŭn lŏn tơnah. Samơ̆ ră anai, Ñu hmâo pơrơđah rai sa wơ̆t djŏp laih amăng hnal tuč rơnŭk, kiăng mă lui hĭ tơlơi soh găn mơ̆ng tơlơi ngă yang hăng drơi jan Ñu pô. 
And forasmuch as it is the portion of men once to die, and after this judgment; @ Tui hăng tơlơi hmâo pơkă laih kơ ană mơnuih khŏm djai sa wơ̆t, giơ̆ng anŭn tŭ tơlơi phat kơđi, 
thus the Christ also, having been once offered to bear the sins of many, shall appear to those that look for him the second time without sin for salvation. @ Ăt kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n, Yang Krist hmâo pơyơr Ñu pô kơnơ̆ng sa wơ̆t đôč kiăng sut lui hĭ tơlơi soh kơ lu mơnuih; laih anŭn Ñu či pơrơđah rai tal dua dơ̆ng, ƀu djơ̆ kiăng mă lui tơlơi soh dơ̆ng ôh, samơ̆ kiăng pơklaih ƀing mơnuih dŏ tơguan Ñu.
For the law, having a shadow of the coming good things, not the image itself of the things, can never, by the same sacrifices which they offer continually yearly, perfect those who approach. @ Yua kơ tơlơi juăt kơnơ̆ng jing pô̆ kơ khul tơlơi hiam či truh tơdơi đôč, ƀu djơ̆ jing rup sĭt kơ tơlơi mơnơ̆ng ôh, hnŭn yơh ƀing mơnuih nao jĕ Ơi Adai ƀu dưi jing klă tum ôh yua mơ̆ng khul mơnơ̆ng ngă yang hmâo pơyơr nanao rĭm thŭn. 
Since, would they not indeed have ceased being offered, on account of the worshippers once purged having no longer any conscience of sins? @ Tơdah dưi, gơñu pơdơi laih pơyơr mơnơ̆ng ngă yang, yua kơ ƀing mơnuih kơkuh pơpŭ dưi hmâo pơrơgoh sa wơ̆t djŏp laih, tui anŭn gơñu ƀu či mưn tơlơi soh dơ̆ng tah. 
But in these [there is] a calling to mind of sins yearly. @ Samơ̆ khul mơnơ̆ng ngă yang anŭn kơnơ̆ng kiăng pơhơdơr kơ tơlơi soh rĭm thŭn đôč. 
For blood of bulls and goats [is] incapable of taking away sins. @ Yua kơ drah khul rơmo tơno laih anŭn bơbe tơno ƀu dưi mă lui tơlơi soh ôh.
Wherefore coming into the world he says, Sacrifice and offering thou willedst not; but thou hast prepared me a body. @  Yua kơ hnŭn yơh, tơ Yang Krist mŭt laih amăng lŏn tơnah, Ñu laĭ:
“Ih ƀu kiăng ôh mơnơ̆ng ngă yang, ăt kŏn kiăng lơi mơnơ̆ng pơyơr,
Samơ̆ Ih hmâo pơkra laih sa drơi jan kơ kâo.
Thou tookest no pleasure in burnt-offerings and sacrifices for sin. @ Ih ƀu mơak ôh kơ mơnơ̆ng ngă yang čuh
Laih anŭn mơnơ̆ng ngă yang song mă tơlơi soh.
Then I said, Lo, I come (in [the] roll of the book it is written of me) to do, O God, thy will. @ Hnŭn yơh, Kâo laĭ: ‘Ơ Ơi Adai, anai nê Kâo rai laih,
Kiăng ngă tơlơi Ih kiăng,’
Amăng hră hmâo čih laih kơ Kâo.”
Above, saying Sacrifices and offerings and burnt-offerings and sacrifices for sin thou willedst not, neither tookest pleasure in (which are offered according to the law); @ Hlâo anŭn Ñu hmâo laĭ: “Ih ƀu kiăng ôh, kŏn mơak lơi kơ mơnơ̆ng ngă yang, mơnơ̆ng pơyơr, mơnơ̆ng ngă yang čuh laih anŭn mơnơ̆ng ngă yang song mă tơlơi soh” (arăng pơyơr mơnơ̆ng anŭn tui hăng tơlơi juăt), 
then he said, Lo, I come to do thy will. He takes away the first that he may establish the second; @ laih anŭn Ñu laĭ dơ̆ng: “Anai nê, Kâo rai kiăng ngă tui tơlơi Ih kiăng.” Tui anŭn Ñu lui hĭ laih tơlơi ngă yang tal hlâo kiăng pơjing tơlơi ngă yang tal dua. 
by which will we have been sanctified through the offering of the body of Jesus Christ once for all. @ Tui hăng tơlơi Ơi Adai kiăng, ƀing ta dưi hmâo tơlơi rơgoh hiam yua mơ̆ng Yang Yêsu Krist hmâo pơyơr laih drơi jan Ñu pô sa wơ̆t djŏp laih.
And every priest stands daily ministering, and offering often the same sacrifices, which can never take away sins. @  Laih anŭn rĭm čô khua ngă yang rĭm hrơi dŏ dơ̆ng buih bruă nanao pơyơr sa mơta mơnơ̆ng ngă yang kar kaĭ, mơnơ̆ng ngă yang anŭn ƀu dưi mă lui tơlơi soh ôh. 
But *he*, having offered one sacrifice for sins, sat down in perpetuity at [the] right hand of God, @ Samơ̆ Yang Krist hmâo pơyơr laih sa mơnơ̆ng ngă yang kơnơ̆ng hasa yua kơ tơlơi soh kơ abih bang rơnŭk, giơ̆ng anŭn Ñu dŏ ber gah hơnuă kơ Ơi Adai, 
waiting from henceforth until his enemies be set [for the] footstool of his feet. @ giơ̆ng mơ̆ng anŭn, Ñu dŏ tơguan tơl Ơi Adai pơjing ƀing ayăt Ñu jing hnăl tơkai Ñu juă. 
For by one offering he has perfected in perpetuity the sanctified. @ Yua kơ mơ̆ng sa mơnơ̆ng ngă yang kơnơ̆ng hasa, Ñu pơjing brơi ƀing mơnuih hmâo pơrơgoh laih jing hĭ klă tum nanao.
And the Holy Spirit also bears us witness [of it]; for after what was said: @ Laih anŭn Yang Bơngăt Hiam ăt ngă gơ̆ng jơlan brơi ƀing ta, yua kơ giơ̆ng Ñu pơhiăp:
This [is] the covenant which I will establish towards them after those days, saith [the] Lord: Giving my laws into their hearts, I will write them also in their understandings; @  Khua Yang laĭ: “Anai jing kơnol pơgop Kâo či pơjing hăng gơñu:
Tơdơi kơ khul hrơi anŭn,
Kâo či dưm tơlơi juăt Kâo amăng pran jua gơñu
Laih anŭn Kâo či čih tơlơi juăt anŭn amăng tơlơi pơmĭn gơñu.”
and their sins and their lawlessnesses I will never remember any more. @ Ñu laĭ dơ̆ng:
“Kâo ƀu či hơdơr dơ̆ng ôh kơ tơlơi soh laih anŭn tơlơi sat ƀai gơñu.”
But where there [is] remission of these, [there is] no longer a sacrifice for sin. @ Anih pă hmâo laih tơlơi pap brơi tơlơi soh, anih anŭn ƀu kiăng pơyơr mơnơ̆ng ngă yang yua kơ tơlơi soh dơ̆ng tah.
Having therefore, brethren, boldness for entering into the [holy of] holies by the blood of Jesus, @ Tui anŭn, Ơ adơi ayŏng, ƀing ta hmâo tơlơi khĭn dưi mŭt amăng Anih Rơgoh Hiam Hloh yua mơ̆ng drah Yêsu, 
the new and living way which he has dedicated for us through the veil, that is, his flesh, @ mơ̆ng jơlan phrâo laih anŭn hơdip Ñu hmâo pŏk brơi laih kơ ƀing ta găn nao khăn păng, kiăng laĭ găn drơi jan Ñu, 
and [having] a great priest over the house of God, @ laih anŭn yua kơ ƀing ta hmâo sa čô khua ngă yang prŏng wai lăng sang Ơi Adai, 
let us approach with a true heart, in full assurance of faith, sprinkled as to our hearts from a wicked conscience, and washed as to our body with pure water. @ brơi ƀing ta nao jĕ Ơi Adai hăng pran jua tơpă sĭt laih anŭn hăng tơlơi đaŏ kơjăp, pran jua hmâo pơrơgoh laih mơ̆ng pran jua tơpă soh sat, drơi jan rao laih hăng ia rơgoh. 
Let us hold fast the confession of the hope unwavering, (for he [is] faithful who has promised;) @ Brơi ƀing ta djă pioh kơjăp bĕ tơlơi pơhaih kơ tơlơi ƀing ta čang rơmang ƀu pơpư̆ pơgơi, yua kơ Pô hmâo ƀuăn laih hăng ƀing ta jing hơnơ̆ng ten. 
and let us consider one another for provoking to love and good works; @ Brơi ƀing ta kơčăng pơmĭn nao bĕ kiăng kơ pơtrŭt pơđĭ pran jua tơdruă ƀing ta kơ tơlơi khăp laih anŭn kơ khul bruă hiam. 
not forsaking the assembling of ourselves together, as the custom [is] with some; but encouraging [one another], and by so much the more as ye see the day drawing near. @ Anăm lui ôh tơlơi bơjơnum kar hăng đơđa arăng juăt ngă, samơ̆ khŏm pơtrŭt pơđur tơdruă, laih anŭn ngă tơlơi anŭn lu hloh dơ̆ng tơdah ƀing gih ƀuh hrơi Khua Yang jĕ truh.
For where we sin wilfully after receiving the knowledge of the truth, there no longer remains any sacrifice for sins, @ Yua kơ tơdah ƀing ta thâo krăn laih tơlơi sĭt, samơ̆ ăt dŏ pơrơ̆ng ngă soh, tui anŭn ƀu hmâo dơ̆ng tah mơnơ̆ng ngă yang dưi song mă tơlơi soh, 
but a certain fearful expectation of judgment, and heat of fire about to devour the adversaries. @ samơ̆ kơnơ̆ng hmâo tơlơi hwĭ biă mă dŏ tơguan tơlơi phat kơđi laih anŭn apui kơdir či ƀơ̆ng ƀing pơkơdơ̆ng. 
Any one that has disregarded Moses' law dies without mercy on [the testimony of] two or three witnesses: @ Hlơi pô gao tơlơi juăt Môis djai ƀu hmâo tơlơi pap drap ôh, tơdah hmâo dua klâo čô pô pơhaih pơsĭt brơi. 
of how much worse punishment, think ye, shall he be judged worthy who has trodden under foot the Son of God, and esteemed the blood of the covenant, whereby he has been sanctified, common, and has insulted the Spirit of grace? @ Hơgĕt tơlơi phat kơđi kơtang hloh ƀing gih pơmĭn či lăp truh kơ pô juă lin laih Ană Ơi Adai, mưč mač drah kơnol pơgop, jing drah hmâo pơrơgoh hiam ñu laih, laih anŭn ƀrưh hmiah Yang Bơngăt Hiam kơ tơlơi pap? 
For we know him that said, To me [belongs] vengeance; *I* will recompense, saith the Lord: and again, The Lord shall judge his people. @ Yua kơ ƀing ta thâo krăn laih Pô laĭ tui anai: “Kâo či rŭ nua. Kâo či phat kơđi.” Laih anŭn Ñu laĭ dơ̆ng: “Khua Yang či phat kơđi ƀing ană plei pla Ñu.” 
[It is] a fearful thing falling into [the] hands of [the] living God. @ Jing sa tơlơi hwĭ biă mă yơh lĕ amăng tơngan Ơi Adai hơdip.
But call to mind the earlier days in which, having been enlightened, ye endured much conflict of sufferings; @ Samơ̆ brơi ƀing gih hơdơr glaĭ bĕ kơ khul hrơi blŭng hlâo adih, laih ƀing gih hmâo laih tơlơi bơngač pơčrang, ƀing gih hmâo tŭ laih tơlơi pơblah hăng lu tơlơi tơnap tap. 
on the one hand, when ye were made a spectacle both in reproaches and afflictions; and on the other, when ye became partakers with those who were passing through them. @ Djơ̆ anŏ ƀing gih tŭ tơlơi mlâo laih anŭn tơlơi tơnap tap rơđah rơđong ƀơi anăp ană plei pla, laih anŭn djơ̆ anŏ ƀing gih tŭ hrŏm hơbĭt tơlơi tơnap tap hăng ƀing arăng ngă sat tui anŭn. 
For ye both sympathised with prisoners and accepted with joy the plunder of your goods, knowing that ye have for yourselves a better substance, and an abiding one. @ Yua kơ ƀing gih thâo pap mơñai laih hăng ƀing mơnă, laih anŭn ƀing gih hơ̆k mơak tŭ ư brơi arăng plah sua mă dram gơnam ƀing gih, yua kơ ƀing gih thâo laih ƀing gih hmâo dram gơnam yom hloh laih anŭn dŏ hlŏng lar. 
Cast not away therefore your confidence, which has great recompense. @ Tui anŭn, anăm ƀing gih lui hĭ ôh tơlơi ƀing gih đaŏ kơnang sĭt, yua kơ ñu či ba glaĭ pri apah prŏng. 
For ye have need of endurance in order that, having done the will of God, ye may receive the promise. @ Yua kơ ƀing gih khŏm gir tŭ, kiăng kơ giơ̆ng ƀing gih ngă tui laih tơlơi Ơi Adai kiăng, ƀing gih či mă tŭ tơlơi Ñu hmâo ƀuăn brơi. 
For yet a very little while he that comes will come, and will not delay. @ “Yua kơ
Ƀu sui dơ̆ng ôh,
Pô hlăk rai či truh;
Ñu ƀu dŏ kaih ôh.
But the just shall live by faith; and, if he draw back, my soul does not take pleasure in him. @ Mơnuih tơpă kâo či hơdip mơ̆ng tơlơi đaŏ,
Samơ̆ tơdah ñu kơdŭn klon,
Bơngăt kâo ƀu mơak hăng ñu ôh.”
But *we* are not drawers back to perdition, but of faith to saving [the] soul. @ Samơ̆ ƀing ta ƀu djơ̆ jing ƀing kơdŭn hĭ laih anŭn kiăng kơ rơngiă hĭ ôh, samơ̆ jing ƀing djă kơjăp tơlơi đaŏ kiăng kơ bơngăt hmâo tơlơi pơklaih.
Now faith is [the] substantiating of things hoped for, [the] conviction of things not seen. @ Tơlơi đaŏ jing tơlơi thâo sĭt kơ khul tơlơi ƀing ta čang rơmang, jing tơlơi pơsĭt kơ khul tơlơi ƀing ta ƀu thâo ƀuh ôh. 
For in [the power of] this the elders have obtained testimony. @ Sĭt yơh, hăng tơlơi đaŏ ƀing ơi adon ta đưm hmâo laih tơlơi Ơi Adai gơ̆ng jơlan hiam.
By faith we apprehend that the worlds were framed by [the] word of God, so that that which is seen should not take its origin from things which appear. @  Hăng tơlơi đaŏ ƀing ta thâo Ơi Adai hrih laih lŏn tơnah hăng boh pơhiăp Ñu, tui anŭn khul mơnơ̆ng arăng thâo ƀuh hmâo jing rai laih mơ̆ng khul mơnơ̆ng arăng ƀu thâo ƀuh ôh.
By faith Abel offered to God a more excellent sacrifice than Cain, by which he obtained testimony of being righteous, God bearing testimony to his gifts, and by it, having died, he yet speaks. @  Hăng tơlơi đaŏ Abel pơyơr kơ Ơi Adai mơnơ̆ng ngă yang hiam hloh kơ Kain. Hăng tơlơi đaŏ anŭn mơ̆n Ơi Adai yap ñu jing tơpă, pơsĭt pơrơđah tơlơi anŭn tơdang tŭ mơnơ̆ng ñu pơyơr. Ñu djai laih samơ̆ hăng tơlơi ñu đaŏ ñu ăt dŏ pơhiăp.
By faith Enoch was translated that he should not see death; and was not found, because God had translated him; for before [his] translation he has the testimony that he had pleased God. @  Hăng tơlơi đaŏ Ơi Adai pŭ đĭ Ênok pơ adai yua kơ anŭn ñu ƀu găn tơlơi djai ôh; laih anŭn arăng ƀu ƀuh ñu dơ̆ng ôh, yua kơ Ơi Adai pŭ đĭ ñu laih. Hlâo kơ Ơi Adai pŭ đĭ ñu pơ adai, Ơi Adai pơhaih pơsĭt kơ ñu hmâo bơmơak laih kơ Ơi Adai. 
But without faith [it is] impossible to please [him]. For he that draws near to God must believe that he is, and [that] he is a rewarder of them who seek him out. @ Laih anŭn ƀu hmâo tơlơi đaŏ, ƀu dưi bơmơak kơ Ơi Adai ôh. Yua kơ hlơi pô kiăng nao jĕ Ơi Adai, khŏm đaŏ hmâo Ơi Adai, laih anŭn Ơi Adai jing Pô apah bơni kơ ƀing hlơi pô hơduah sem Ñu.
By faith, Noah, oracularly warned concerning things not yet seen, moved with fear, prepared an ark for the saving of his house; by which he condemned the world, and became heir of the righteousness which [is] according to faith. @  Hăng tơlơi đaŏ Nôê hmâo tơlơi Ơi Adai pơthâo pơgăn kơ khul tơlơi aka ƀu ƀuh ôh laih anŭn hăng abih pran jua hwĭ pơpŭ ñu ngă sa boh kompăn kiăng pơklaih abih sang anŏ ñu. Hăng tơlơi anŭn ñu klă kơđi lŏn tơnah laih anŭn jing hĭ mơnuih mă tŭ tơlơi tơpă mơ̆ng tơlơi đaŏ.
By faith Abraham, being called, obeyed to go out into the place which he was to receive for an inheritance, and went out, not knowing where he was going. @  Hăng tơlơi đaŏ Abraham gưt hiăp Ơi Adai iâu ñu, nao pơ anih ñu či mă tŭ jing kong ngăn. Ñu nao, samơ̆ ƀu thâo ôh pơpă anih ñu nao. 
By faith he sojourned as a stranger in the land of promise as a foreign country, having dwelt in tents with Isaac and Jacob, the heirs with [him] of the same promise; @ Hăng tơlơi đaŏ ñu dŏ amăng čar Ơi Adai hmâo ƀuăn laih, kar hăng amăng čar tuai. Ñu dŏ amăng khul sang khăn hrŏm hăng Isak laih anŭn Yakôp, jing ƀing hrŏm hơbĭt mă tŭ sa tơlơi ƀuăn. 
for he waited for the city which has foundations, of which God is [the] artificer and constructor. @ Yua kơ ñu čang tơguan sa boh plei hmâo atur kơjăp, Ơi Adai jing pô čih rup laih anŭn pơdơ̆ng plei anŭn.
By faith also Sarah herself received strength for [the] conception of seed, and [that] beyond a seasonable age; since she counted him faithful who promised. @  Hăng tơlơi đaŏ, HʼSara ăt dưi tơkeng kơ ană mơ̆n wơ̆t dah ñu tha laih, yua kơ ñu đaŏ Pô hmâo ƀuăn laih hăng ñu jing hơnơ̆ng ten. 
Wherefore also there have been born of one, and that of one become dead, even as the stars of heaven in multitude, and as the countless sand which [is] by the sea shore. @ Yua kơ anŭn yơh, ăt mơ̆ng sa čô mơnuih tha jĕ či djai laih, tơbiă rai sa phung ană tơčo lu hrup hăng pơtŭ amăng adai, hrup hăng čuah ƀơi hang ia rơsĭ, ƀu dưi yap ôh.
All these died in faith, not having received the promises, but having seen them from afar off and embraced [them], and confessed that they were strangers and sojourners on the earth. @  Abih bang ƀing mơnuih anŭn leng kơ djai laih amăng tơlơi đaŏ, aka mă tŭ ôh khul tơlơi Ơi Adai hmâo ƀuăn; kơnơ̆ng lăng ƀuh laih anŭn kơkuh čơkă khul tơlơi anŭn mơ̆ng ataih. Yap gơñu pô jing tuai laih anŭn ƀing hyu jang jai amăng lŏn tơnah. 
For they who say such things shew clearly that they seek [their] country. @ Yua kơ ƀing pơhiăp tui anŭn pơrơđah kơ gơñu hlăk tui hơduah sa boh lŏn čar kơ gơñu pô. 
And if they had called to mind that from whence they went out, they had had opportunity to have returned; @ Tơdah gơñu hmâo pơmĭn nao kơ lŏn čar gơñu hmâo tơbiă đuaĭ laih, gơñu ăt hmâo laih mơ̆n mông gal wơ̆t glaĭ dơ̆ng. 
but now they seek a better, that is, a heavenly; wherefore God is not ashamed of them, to be called their God; for he has prepared for them a city. @ Samơ̆ gơñu čang kiăng sa boh čar hiam hloh, jing čar amăng adai. Yua kơ anŭn yơh Ơi Adai ƀu mlâo ôh laĭ Ñu pô jing Ơi Adai kơ ƀing gơñu, yua kơ Ơi Adai hmâo pơkra brơi laih kơ ƀing gơñu sa boh plei.
By faith Abraham, [when] tried, offered up Isaac, and he who had received to himself the promises offered up his only begotten [son], @  Hăng tơlơi đaŏ, Abraham pơyơr laih Isak tơdang Ơi Adai lông lăng ñu. Ñu hơ̆k mơak pơyơr ană đah rơkơi ñu hmâo kơnơ̆ng sa čô, ñu hmâo mă tŭ laih tui hăng tơlơi ƀuăn. 
as to whom it had been said, In Isaac shall thy seed be called: @ Kơ pô anŭn Ơi Adai laĭ laih: “Mơ̆ng Isak yơh, ih či hmâo ană tơčo arăng či iâu hăng anăn ih.” 
counting that God [was] able to raise [him] even from among [the] dead, whence also he received him in a figure. @ Ñu pơmĭn Ơi Adai hmâo tơlơi mơyang dưi pơhơdip glaĭ ƀing djai; kiăng laĭ ñu hmâo mă glaĭ laih ană ñu mơ̆ng tơlơi djai.
By faith Isaac blessed Jacob and Esau concerning things to come. @  Hăng tơlơi đaŏ, Isak hơơč mơyun hiam kơ Yakôp laih anŭn Êsâo kơ khul bruă či truh pơ anăp.
By faith Jacob [when] dying blessed each of the sons of Joseph, and worshipped on the top of his staff. @  Hăng tơlơi đaŏ, Yakôp hlăk ñu jĕ tơĭ pran, hmâo hơơč mơyun hiam brơi kơ rĭm čô ană Yôsep, grơ̆ng ƀơi akŏ gai jra kŭp akŏ kơkuh pơpŭ kơ Ơi Adai.
By faith Joseph [when] dying called to mind the going forth of the sons of Israel, and gave commandment concerning his bones. @  Hăng tơlơi đaŏ, Yôsep hlăk ñu jĕ tơĭ pran hmâo pơhiăp kơ bruă ană tơčo Israel tơbiă mơ̆ng čar Êjip, laih anŭn pơtă pơtăn kơ bruă dơr klang ñu.
By faith Moses, being born, was hid three months by his parents, because they saw the child beautiful; and they did not fear the injunction of the king. @  Hăng tơlơi đaŏ, laih tơkeng kơ Môis, amĭ ama ñu pơdŏp ñu amăng klâo blan, yua kơ gơñu ƀuh ană anŭn hiam rŏ, laih anŭn gơñu ƀu hwĭ ôh kơ tơlơi pơtao pơtrŭn săp.
By faith Moses, when he had become great, refused to be called son of Pharaoh's daughter; @  Hăng tơlơi đaŏ, hlăk Môis prŏng laih, hơngah lui hĭ tơlơi arăng iâu jing ană đah rơkơi kơ hơbia pơtao Pharaôn. 
choosing rather to suffer affliction along with the people of God than to have [the] temporary pleasure of sin; @ Samơ̆ ruah tŭ tơlơi arăng ngă sat hrŏm hăng ƀing ană plei pla Ơi Adai hloh kơ dŏ amăng tơlơi hơ̆k mơak jang jai amăng tơlơi soh. 
esteeming the reproach of the Christ greater riches than the treasures of Egypt, for he had respect to the recompense. @ Ñu lăng tơlơi mlâo hañ yua kơ Yang Krist jing yom hloh kơ dram gơnam yom čar Êjip, yua kơ ñu čang tơguan tơlơi apah bơni.
By faith he left Egypt, not fearing the wrath of the king; for he persevered, as seeing him who is invisible. @ Hăng tơlơi đaŏ ñu đuaĭ mơ̆ng čar Êjip, ƀu hwĭ kơ tơlơi pơtao hil ôh; yua kơ ñu gir kar hăng ñu ƀuh laih Pô arăng ƀu thâo ƀuh ôh. 
By faith he celebrated the passover and the sprinkling of the blood, that the destroyer of the firstborn might not touch them. @ Hăng tơlơi đaŏ ñu pơkra phĕt Tơlơi Găn laih anŭn tơlơi prăh drah, kiăng kơ Pô Pơrai ană kơčoa ƀu pơdjai ôh ƀing ană kơčoa Israel.
By faith they passed through the Red sea as through dry land; of which the Egyptians having made trial were swallowed up. @  Hăng tơlơi đaŏ ƀing ană plei Israel găn ia rơsĭ mriah kar hăng rơbat ƀơi lŏn thu. Samơ̆ ƀing Êjip gir kơtưn găn nao, ƀing gơñu trăm djai hĭ.
By faith the walls of Jericho fell, having been encircled for seven days. @  Hăng tơlơi đaŏ, pơnăng plei prŏng Yêrikô glưh trŭn, tơdơi kơ ƀing Israel rơbat jum dar plei anŭn amăng tơjuh hrơi. 
By faith Rahab the harlot did not perish along with the unbelieving, having received the spies in peace. @ Hăng tơlơi đaŏ, HʼRahap, đah kơmơi rih răm, ƀu djai hrŏm hăng ƀing mơnuih ƀu tui gưt Ơi Adai ôh, yua kơ ñu hmâo jum laih ƀing kơnuă hăng tơlơi sŭ mơak.
And what more do I say? For the time would fail me telling of Gideon, and Barak, and Samson, and Jephthah, and David and Samuel, and of the prophets: @ Laih anŭn hơgĕt tơlơi kâo či laĭ dơ̆ng? Yua kơ tơdah kâo ră ruai kơ Gidêôn, Barak, Samson, Jêptê, Đawit, Samuel, laih anŭn kơ ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo, kâo ƀu hmâo djŏp mông ôh. 
who by faith overcame kingdoms, wrought righteousness, obtained promises, stopped lions' mouths, @ Ƀing mơnuih anŭn hăng tơlơi đaŏ gơñu dưi laih hăng dêh čar pơtao phara phara, phat kơđi hăng tơlơi tơpă, mă tŭ tơlơi ƀuăn, kơđĭp hĭ amăng bah rơmông dŭl. 
quenched [the] power of fire, escaped [the] edge of the sword, became strong out of weakness, became mighty in war, made [the] armies of strangers give way. @ Pơthăm hĭ apui jă kơtang, klaih mơ̆ng mơta đao, tơdang tơdu jing hĭ kơtang dơ̆ng, dưi amăng tơlơi pơblah, puh pơđuaĭ phung tơhan tuai. 
Women received their dead again by resurrection; and others were tortured, not having accepted deliverance, that they might get a better resurrection; @ Hmâo ƀing đah kơmơi tŭ glaĭ ƀing sang anŏ gơñu mơ̆ng tơlơi djai hơdip glaĭ. Hmâo ƀing pơkŏn dơ̆ng ƀu tŭ arăng phư brơi ôh, samơ̆ gơñu tŭ arăng pơtơnap tơl djai yua kơ gơñu kiăng hmâo tơlơi hơdip glaĭ hiam hloh. 
and others underwent trial of mockings and scourgings, yea, and of bonds and imprisonment. @ Ƀing pơkŏn tŭ tơlơi arăng mưč laih anŭn taih čŏm, tơlơi arăng kă hăng čuăk laih anŭn tơlơi arăng krư̆ kơđơ̆l. 
They were stoned, were sawn asunder, were tempted, died by the death of the sword; they went about in sheepskins, in goatskins, destitute, afflicted, evil treated, @ Arăng glŏm boh pơtâo pơdjai ƀing gơñu, arăng uă gơñu jing dua, arăng pơdjai gơñu hăng đao; gơñu hyu pơ anai pơ adih, buh klĭ triu laih anŭn klĭ bơbe, kơƀah kơƀap, arăng pơtơnap, arăng ngă sat kơ ƀing gơñu — 
(of whom the world was not worthy,) wandering in deserts and mountains, and [in] dens and caverns of the earth. @ lŏn tơnah ƀu năng lăp kơ ƀing gơñu dŏ ôh — gơñu khŏm rưng hyu amăng tơdrŏn tač, amăng čư̆, amăng par hlô glai, laih anŭn amăng drŏng čư̆.
And these all, having obtained witness through faith, did not receive the promise, @ Abih bang ƀing mơnuih anŭn, wơ̆t dah hmâo tơlơi gơ̆ng jơlan hiam kơ tơlơi đaŏ ƀing gơñu, samơ̆ aka mă tŭ ôh tơlơi Ơi Adai ƀuăn. 
God having foreseen some better thing for us, that they should not be made perfect without us. @ Yua kơ Ơi Adai hmâo pha brơi laih tơlơi hiam hloh kơ ƀing ta, kiăng kơ gah rơngiao kơ ƀing ta, gơñu ƀu tơl truh tơlơi klă tum ôh.
Let *us* also therefore, having so great a cloud of witnesses surrounding us, laying aside every weight, and sin which so easily entangles us, run with endurance the race that lies before us, @ Hnŭn yơh, yua kơ ƀing ta hmâo lu mơnuih kơtang tơlơi đaŏ dŏ jum dar lăng kơ ƀing ta kar hăng gơnăm kơthul prŏng biă mă, brơi ƀing ta toh lui hĭ bĕ khul mơnơ̆ng kơtraŏ laih anŭn tơlơi soh dŏ kơ̆ng kơjăp ƀing ta, laih anŭn brơi ƀing ta gir amăng tơlơi pơlông đuaĭ hmâo pơkra pioh laih ƀơi anăp ƀing ta. 
looking stedfastly on Jesus the leader and completer of faith: who, in view of the joy lying before him, endured [the] cross, having despised [the] shame, and is set down at the right hand of the throne of God. @ Brơi lăng bĕ kơ Yêsu, Pô pơphŭn laih anŭn Pô ngă pơgiơ̆ng hĭ tơlơi đaŏ ƀing ta, jing Pô yua kơ tơlơi mơak hmâo pioh laih ƀơi anăp Ñu, Ñu hơ̆k mơak tŭ mă kơyâo bơrơkal, mưč mač kơ tơlơi mlâo hañ, laih anŭn ră anai Ñu hlăk dŏ ber gah hơnuă kơ gre pơtao Ơi Adai.
For consider well him who endured so great contradiction from sinners against himself, that ye be not weary, fainting in your minds. @ Tui anŭn, brơi ƀing gih pơmĭn bĕ kơ Pô hmâo tŭ laih tơlơi ƀing mơnuih soh sat pơkơdơ̆ng kơ Ñu kar hăng anŭn, kiăng kơ ƀing gih ƀu tơdu rơmơ̆n ôh laih anŭn kŏn hơtah hơtai lơi.
Ye have not yet resisted unto blood, wrestling against sin. @ Amăng tơlơi ƀing gih pơblah pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ hăng tơlơi soh, ƀing gih aka hmâo pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ truh kơ ƀlĕ drah djai ôh. 
And ye have quite forgotten the exhortation which speaks to you as to sons: My son, despise not [the] chastening of [the] Lord, nor faint [when] reproved by him; @ Ƀing gih wơr bĭt laih boh pơhiăp pơtrŭt pơđur pioh brơi kơ ƀing gih hrup hăng pơđur kơ sa čô ană:
“Ơ ană kâo hơi, anăm ih mưč ôh kơ tơlơi Khua Yang phak pơkra,
Laih anŭn anăm hơtah hơtai ôh, tơdah Ñu ƀuah kơ ih.
for whom [the] Lord loves he chastens, and scourges every son whom he receives. @ Yua kơ Khua Yang phak pơkra kơ hlơi pô Ñu khăp,
Ƀing hlơi pô Ñu yap laih jing ană Ñu pô, ƀing anŭn yơh Ñu taih.”
Ye endure for chastening, God conducts himself towards you as towards sons; for who is the son that the father chastens not? @ Ƀing gih tŭ mă tơlơi phak pơkra, anŭn jing tơlơi Ơi Adai ngă kơ ƀing gih kar hăng sa čô ană; yua kơ hmâo mơ̆ hlơi jing ană samơ̆ ama ñu ƀu phak pơkra kơ ñu ôh? 
But if ye are without chastening, of which all have been made partakers, then are ye bastards, and not sons. @ Samơ̆ tơdah ƀing gih ƀu tŭ ôh tơlơi phak pơkra kar hăng abih bang ƀing ană leng kơ khŏm mă tŭ, tui anŭn ƀing gih jing ană gem pôm yơh, ƀu djơ̆ jing ană sĭt ôh. 
Moreover we have had the fathers of our flesh as chasteners, and we reverenced [them]; shall we not much rather be in subjection to the Father of spirits, and live? @ Hloh kơ anŭn dơ̆ng, ama gah kơ asar đeh phak pơkra kơ ƀing ta, ƀing ta ăt hwĭ pơpŭ kơ gơñu mơ̆n, ƀai jai Ama gah kơ bơngăt, ƀing ta ƀu či tui gưt lu hloh dơ̆ng ôh hă kiăng kơ dưi hmâo tơlơi hơdip? 
For they indeed chastened for a few days, as seemed good to them; but he for profit, in order to the partaking of his holiness. @ Yua kơ ama gah asar đeh phak pơkra ƀing ta kơnơ̆ng ƀiă hrơi đôč tui hăng tơlơi gơñu pơmĭn jing hiam, samơ̆ Ơi Adai phak pơkra kơ ƀing jing yua kơ tơlơi tŭ yua brơi kơ ƀing ta, kiăng kơ ƀing ta dưi hmâo hrŏm hơbĭt amăng tơlơi rơgoh hiam Ñu. 
But no chastening at the time seems to be [matter] of joy, but of grief; but afterwards yields [the] peaceful fruit of righteousness to those exercised by it. @ Abih bang tơlơi phak pơkra hlăk anŭn rŏ dah kơnơ̆ng jing tơlơi ruă nuă đôč ƀu djơ̆ jing tơlơi hơ̆k mơak ôh; samơ̆ tơdơi kơ anŭn ñu či ba rai boh than tơlơi tơpă laih anŭn tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua brơi kơ ƀing mơnuih hmâo tŭ laih tơlơi pơtơ̆p pơjuăt kar hăng anŭn.
Wherefore lift up the hands that hang down, and the failing knees; @  Tui anŭn, yơr bĕ tơngan tơdu ƀing gih laih anŭn pơkơtang bĕ tơŭt rơmuăn ƀing gih, 
and make straight paths for your feet, that that which is lame be not turned aside; but that rather it may be healed. @ Ngă tơpă bĕ jơlan kơ tơkai ƀing gih, kiăng kơ tơkai rơwen ƀu tơpleh hĭ ôh mơ̆ng anih pơtơkuh, samơ̆ dưi hmâo tơlơi suaih hĭ.
Pursue peace with all, and holiness, without which no one shall see the Lord: @ Tui hơduah bĕ tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua hăng abih bang mơnuih, laih anŭn tơlơi rơgoh hiam, yua kơ tơdah kơƀah tơlơi rơgoh hiam ƀu hmâo hlơi dưi ƀuh Khua Yang ôh. 
watching lest [there be] any one who lacks the grace of God; lest any root of bitterness springing up trouble [you], and many be defiled by it; @ Răng bĕ, hwĭ kơ hmâo hlơi tơbleñ hĭ mơ̆ng tơlơi pap Ơi Adai, hwĭ kơ “akha phĭ” čăt đĭ, pơrŭng laih anŭn ngă hơƀak drak kơ lu ƀing pơkŏn. 
lest [there be] any fornicator, or profane person, as Esau, who for one meal sold his birthright; @ Brơi răng bĕ, anăm hmâo hlơi rih răm ƀôdah jing mơnuih asar đeh kar hăng Êsâo, kơnơ̆ng yua kơ sa mơta mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng đôč ñu sĭ hĭ tơlơi dưi ană kơčoa. 
for ye know that also afterwards, desiring to inherit the blessing, he was rejected, (for he found no place for repentance) although he sought it earnestly with tears. @ Yua kơ ƀing gih thâo laih tơdơi kơ tơlơi anŭn, ñu kiăng hmâo tơlơi hơơč mơyun anŭn, samơ̆ ama ñu hơngah lui hĭ, wơ̆t dah ñu hia rơkâo kơwưh ăt ƀu hmâo mông gal tah kiăng kơ dưi pơplih tơlơi ama ñu hmâo ngă laih.
For ye have not come to [the mount] that might be touched and was all on fire, and to obscurity, and darkness, and tempest, @  Ƀing gih ƀu nao jĕ pơ čư̆ arăng dưi ruaih ôh, apui jă kơtang ƀôdah anih kơnăm mơmŏt, adai ip ap, rơbŭ kơthel, 
and trumpet's sound, and voice of words; which they that heard, excusing themselves, declined [the] word being addressed to them any more: @ asăp tơki, laih anŭn asăp pơhiăp tơl ngă kơ ƀing hmư̆ leng kơ kơwưh rơkâo boh pơhiăp anŭn anăm pơhiăp hăng gơñu dơ̆ng ôh. 
(for they were not able to bear what was enjoined: And if a beast should touch the mountain, it shall be stoned; @ Yua kơ ƀing gơñu ƀu dưi tŭ ôh tơlơi pơtă anai: “Wơ̆t dah hlô mơnơ̆ng nao giăm čư̆ anai ăt arăng khŏm glŏm boh pơtâo.” 
and, so fearful was the sight, Moses said, I am exceedingly afraid and full of trembling;) @ Sĭt yơh tơlơi gơñu ƀuh krip yip biă mă, tơl Môis laĭ: “Kâo hwĭ biă mă laih anŭn tơtư̆ djir djar.”
but ye have come to mount Zion; and to [the] city of [the] living God, heavenly Jerusalem; and to myriads of angels, @ Samơ̆ ƀing gih hmâo nao jĕ laih pơ čư̆ Siôn laih anŭn jĕ plei prŏng Ơi Adai pô hơdip, jing Yêrusalem pơ adai, jĕ klăk klai ling jang hlăk pơtŭm pơƀŭt mơak mơai, 
the universal gathering; and to [the] assembly of the firstborn [who are] registered in heaven; and to God, judge of all; and to [the] spirits of just [men] made perfect; @ jĕ Phung Sang Ơi Adai kơ ƀing ană kơčoa hmâo anăn čih laih amăng khul tal adai. Ƀing gih nao jĕ Ơi Adai, jing khua phat kơđi kơ abih bang mơnuih, jĕ bơngăt ƀing mơnuih tơpă tum klă laih, 
and to Jesus, mediator of a new covenant; and to [the] blood of sprinkling, speaking better than Abel. @ jĕ Khua Yang Yêsu, jing Pô Dŏ Kơplah kơ Kơnol Pơgop Phrâo, kiăng laĭ jĕ drah hmâo prăh laih, jing drah pơhiăp hiam hloh kơ drah Abel.
See that ye refuse not him that speaks. For if those did not escape who had refused him who uttered the oracles on earth, much more we who turn away from him [who does so] from heaven: @  Răng bĕ, anăm hơngah kơ Pô dŏ pơhiăp ôh. Yua kơ gơñu ƀu či klaih ôh tơdah gơñu hơngah mơnuih pơtă pơhiăp pơthâo pơgăn kơ ƀing gơñu ƀơi lŏn tơnah, ƀai jai dơ̆ng ƀing ta ƀu dưi klaih ôh tơdah ƀing ta hơngah kơ Pô pơtă pơhiăp pơthâo pơgăn ƀing ta mơ̆ng adai. 
whose voice then shook the earth; but now he has promised, saying, Yet once will *I* shake not only the earth, but also the heaven. @ Hlăk anŭn asăp Pô anŭn pơhiăp rơyuh lŏn tơnah; samơ̆ ră anai Ñu laĭ: “Dŏ sa wơ̆t dơ̆ng Kâo či rơyuh ƀu djơ̆ kơnơ̆ng lŏn tơnah đôč ôh, samơ̆ wơ̆t adai mơ̆n.” 
But this Yet once, signifies the removing of what is shaken, as being made, that what is not shaken may remain. @ Khul boh pơhiăp anai: “Dŏ sa wơ̆t dơ̆ng” kiăng laĭ kơ tơlơi mă pơđuaĭ hĭ laih khul mơnơ̆ng pơpư̆ pơgơi, anŭn jing khul mơnơ̆ng hmâo hrih pơjing laih, kiăng kơ khul mơnơ̆ng ƀu dưi pơpư̆ pơgơi ôh ăt dŏ glaĭ.
Wherefore let us, receiving a kingdom not to be shaken, have grace, by which let us serve God acceptably with reverence and fear. @ Hnŭn yơh, yua kơ ƀing ta mă tŭ laih dêh čar pơtao ƀu dưi pơpư̆ pơgơi ôh. Brơi ƀing ta thâo hơdơr bơni hăng tơlơi pơyơr đĭ kơ Ơi Adai tơlơi kơkuh pơpŭ bơmơak kơ Ñu laih anŭn tơlơi pơpŭ hăng tơlơi hwĭ. 
For also our God [is] a consuming fire. @ Yua kơ Ơi Adai ƀing ta jing apui čuh pơrai.
Let brotherly love abide. @ Brơi ƀing gih djă kơjăp nanao tơlơi khăp adơi ayŏng. 
Be not forgetful of hospitality; for by it some have unawares entertained angels. @ Anăm wơr bĭt ôh pran jua thâo jum ƀing tuai, yua kơ tơdang ngă tơlơi anŭn hmâo đơđa jum laih ƀing ling jang, wơ̆t dah gơñu ƀu thâo krăn ôh. 
Remember prisoners, as bound with [them]; those that are evil-treated, as being yourselves also in [the] body. @ Hơdơr bĕ kơ ƀing mơnuih hlăk dŏ amăng sang krư̆, kar hăng ƀing gih ăt dŏ krư̆ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng gơñu mơ̆n; laih anŭn hơdơr bĕ kơ ƀing arăng ngă sat, kar hăng arăng ngă sat laih ƀing gih mơ̆n.
[Let] marriage [be held] every way in honour, and the bed [be] undefiled; for fornicators and adulterers will God judge. @ Brơi kơ abih bang mơnuih pơpŭ bĕ kơ tơlơi dŏ rơkơi bơnai, laih anŭn anăm ngă hơƀak drak ôh anih pĭt ƀing gih, yua kơ Ơi Adai či phat kơđi kơ ƀing mơnuih rih răm laih anŭn kơ ƀing mơnuih ngă pyu pơde.
[Let your] conversation [be] without love of money, satisfied with [your] present circumstances; for *he* has said, I will not leave thee, neither will I forsake thee. @  Anăm hưp ham kơ prăk ôh, hơ̆k mơak bĕ hăng mơnơ̆ng ƀing gih hmâo laih; yua kơ Ơi Adai hmâo laĭ laih: “Kâo ƀu či klah mơ̆ng ih ôh kŏn lui ih lơi.” 
So that, taking courage, we may say, The Lord [is] my helper, and I will not be afraid: what will man do unto me? @ Tui anŭn ƀing ta dưi laĭ hăng tơlơi khĭn tui anai:
“Khua Yang jing Pô djru kâo, kâo ƀu či hwĭ ôh;
Hơgĕt mơnuih dưi ngă kơ kâo?”
Remember your leaders who have spoken to you the word of God; and considering the issue of their conversation, imitate their faith. @ Hơdơr bĕ kơ ƀing khua atăt gai ƀing gih, jing ƀing pơtô boh pơhiăp Ơi Adai kơ ƀing gih. Kơsem lăng bĕ boh than kơ tơlơi hơdip gơñu laih anŭn hla tui bĕ tơlơi đaŏ gơñu. 
Jesus Christ [is] the same yesterday, and to-day, and to the ages [to come]. @ Khua Yang Yêsu Krist tơ̆m brôi, hrơi anai, laih anŭn hlŏng lar ƀu thâo pơplih ôh. 
Be not carried away with various and strange doctrines; for [it is] good that the heart be confirmed with grace, not meats; those who have walked in which have not been profited by [them]. @ Anăm brơi khul mơta tơlơi pơtô soh phara phara dui ba ƀing gih ôh; yua kơ mơ̆ng pran jua kơnang kơ tơlơi pap hmâo tơlơi kơtang jing hiam, ƀu djơ̆ ôh kơnang kơ khul pơkă hơnơ̆ng kơ mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă, jing tơlơi ƀu tŭ yua ôh kơ ƀing gưt djă pioh gơñu.
We have an altar of which they have no right to eat who serve the tabernacle; @ Ƀing ta hmâo sa boh kơƀang ngă yang ƀing mă bruă amăng sang khăn ƀu dưi ƀơ̆ng mơnơ̆ng hơgĕt ƀơi anŭn ôh. 
for of those beasts whose blood is carried [as sacrifices for sin] into the [holy of] holies by the high priest, of these the bodies are burned outside the camp. @ Yua kơ drah hlô mơnơ̆ng khua ngă yang prŏng hloh ba mŭt amăng Anih Rơgoh Hiam Hloh kiăng kơ ngă phĕt song mă tơlơi soh, bơ drơi jan ñu arăng čuh hĭ pơ gah rơngiao wăl plei. 
Wherefore also Jesus, that he might sanctify the people by his own blood, suffered without the gate: @ Yua kơ anŭn, Khua Yang Yêsu tŭ laih tơlơi tơnap gah rơngiao amăng jang plei, kiăng pơrơgoh ƀing ană plei pla hăng drah Ñu Pô. 
therefore let us go forth to him without the camp, bearing his reproach: @ Yua kơ anŭn, brơi ƀing ta tơbiă nao pơ Ñu gah rơngiao wăl plei, kiăng tŭ hrŏm hơbĭt tơlơi mlâo Ñu hmâo tŭ laih. 
for we have not here an abiding city, but we seek the coming one. @ Yua kơ ƀơi lŏn tơnah anai ƀing ta ƀu hmâo plei dŏ nanao hlŏng lar ôh, samơ̆ ƀing ta hlăk hơduah sem sa boh plei či truh. 
By him therefore let us offer [the] sacrifice of praise continually to God, that is, [the] fruit of [the] lips confessing his name. @ Tui anŭn, amăng Ñu brơi ƀing ta pơyơr nanao mơnơ̆ng ngă yang hăng tơlơi adoh bơni kơ Ơi Adai, jing boh than mơ̆ng amăng bah ƀing ta pơhaih anăn Ñu. 
But of doing good and communicating [of your substance] be not forgetful, for with such sacrifices God is well pleased. @ Anăm wơr bĭt ôh ngă bruă hiam laih anŭn pơpha brơi mơnơ̆ng ƀing gih hmâo kơ ƀing pơkŏn, yua kơ khul mơnơ̆ng ngă yang kar hăng anŭn bơmơak kơ Ơi Adai.
Obey your leaders, and be submissive; for *they* watch over your souls as those that shall give account; that they may do this with joy, and not groaning, for this [would be] unprofitable for you. @ Tui gưt bĕ kơ ƀing atăt gai ƀing gih laih anŭn thâo gưt kơ gơñu; yua kơ ƀing gơñu wai lăng bơngăt ƀing gih laih anŭn či ruai pơrơđah glaĭ. Brơi djru bĕ gơñu ngă pơgiơ̆ng bruă hăng tơlơi hơ̆k mơak, ƀu hmâo tơlơi hơtah hơtai ôh, yua kơ tơlơi anŭn ƀu tŭ yua kơ ƀing gih ôh.
Pray for us: for we persuade ourselves that we have a good conscience, in all things desirous to walk rightly. @ Iâu laĭ brơi kơ ƀing gơmơi bĕ, yua kơ ƀing gơmơi thâo klă gơmơi hmâo pran jua tơpă jơngeh, kiăng kơ dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă klă hiam amăng abih bang tơlơi. 
But I much more beseech [you] to do this, that I may the more quickly be restored to you. @ Kâo kơwưh kơ ƀing gih brơi ƀing gih iâu laĭ kơtang hloh, kiăng kơ kâo dưi wơ̆t glaĭ tañ pơ ƀing gih.
But the God of peace, who brought again from among [the] dead our Lord Jesus, the great shepherd of the sheep, in [the power of the] blood of [the] eternal covenant, @ Rơkâo kơ Ơi Adai tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua, jing Pô yua mơ̆ng drah kơnol pơgop hlŏng lar, Ñu hmâo pơhơdip glaĭ laih Pô Wai Triu Prŏng jing Yêsu, Khua Yang ƀing ta mơ̆ng ƀing djai, 
perfect you in every good work to the doing of his will, doing in you what is pleasing before him through Jesus Christ; to whom [be] glory for the ages of ages. Amen. @ pha brơi kơ ƀing gih tơlơi dưi ngă djŏp mơta bruă hiam, kiăng kơ ƀing gih dưi ngă tơlơi Ñu kiăng, laih anŭn ngă tơlơi bơmơak kơ Ñu amăng ƀing ta găn mơ̆ng Yêsu Krist. Kơ Ñu yơh hmâo tơlơi guh kơang nanao hlŏng lar! Amen.
But I beseech you, brethren, bear the word of exhortation, for it is but in few words that I have written to you. @ Ơ adơi ayŏng, kâo kơwưh kơ ƀing gih mă tŭ bĕ khul tơlơi pơtô anai, yua kơ kâo kơnơ̆ng čih klah čŭn đôč brơi kơ ƀing gih. 
Know that our brother Timotheus is set at liberty; with whom, if he should come soon, I will see you. @ Kâo kiăng kơ ƀing gih thâo kơ adơi ƀing ta Timôthê, arăng hmâo phư laih ñu mơ̆ng sang mơnă. Tơdah ñu rai tañ, kâo či jak ba ñu nao čuă ngui ƀing gih hrŏm hơbĭt hăng kâo mơ̆n.
Salute all your leaders, and all the saints. They from Italy salute you. @ Kơkuh kơ abih bang ƀing atăt gai ƀing gih laih anŭn abih bang ƀing rơgoh hiam. Ƀing rơgoh hiam pơ čar Itali mơit tơlơi čuă ngui kơ ƀing gih.
Grace [be] with you all. Amen. @ Rơkâo kơ tơlơi pap mơ̆ng Ơi Adai dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng abih bang ƀing gih. Amen.
James, bondman of God and of [the] Lord Jesus Christ, to the twelve tribes which [are] in the dispersion, greeting. @  Yakơ, sa čô ding kơna kơ Ơi Adai laih anŭn kơ Khua Yang Yêsu Krist, čih mơit kơ pluh dua kơnŭng djuai bra hyu tar ƀar lŏn tơnah. Kơkuh kơ ƀing gih.
Count it all joy, my brethren, when ye fall into various temptations, @ Ơ adơi ayŏng, tơdah ƀing gih bưp lu mơta tơlơi lông lăng, brơi ƀing gih yap tơlơi anŭn jing tơlơi hơ̆k mơak klă tum, 
knowing that the proving of your faith works endurance. @ yua kơ ƀing gih thâo laih tơlơi lông lăng kơ tơlơi đaŏ ƀing gih pơjing rai tơlơi thâo gir. 
But let endurance have [its] perfect work, that ye may be perfect and complete, lacking in nothing. @ Samơ̆ brơi tơlơi thâo gir ngă pơgiơ̆ng hĭ bruă ñu, kiăng kơ ƀing gih dưi jing tha truh, klă tum, ƀu kơƀah sa mơta tơlơi hơgĕt ôh.
But if any one of you lack wisdom, let him ask of God, who gives to all freely and reproaches not, and it shall be given to him: @ Tơdah hlơi amăng ƀing gih kơƀah tơlơi kơhnâo, rơkâo bĕ kơ Ơi Adai, laih anŭn Ơi Adai či brơi kơ ñu, yua kơ Ơi Adai jing Pô pha brơi kơ abih bang mơnuih hăng tơlơi čơmah laih anŭn ƀu hmâo ƀuah ôh. 
but let him ask in faith, nothing doubting. For he that doubts is like a wave of the sea driven by the wind and tossed about; @ Samơ̆ brơi ñu khŏm rơkâo hăng tơlơi đaŏ, anăm đing ôh, yua kơ hlơi pô đing jing kar hăng ia rơsĭ poh yă, angĭn pah pŭng laih anŭn pơđung hyu ñu. 
for let not that man think that he shall receive anything from the Lord; @ Mơnuih đing kar hăng anŭn anăm pơmĭn ñu či mă tŭ mơnơ̆ng hơgĕt mơ̆ng Khua Yang ôh, 
[he is] a double-minded man, unstable in all his ways. @ yua kơ anŭn jing mơnuih kơ̆ng kư, ƀu hơnơ̆ng ôh amăng abih bang jơlan ñu.
But let the brother of low degree glory in his elevation, @ Kơ ƀing adơi ayŏng dŏ amăng anih ƀu rup rap ôh, brơi hơ̆k mơak bĕ amăng tơlơi Ơi Adai pơđĭ gơñu. 
and the rich in his humiliation, because as [the] grass's flower he will pass away. @ Samơ̆ ƀing mơnuih pơdrŏng thâo mơak bĕ amăng tơlơi Ơi Adai pơtrŭn gơñu; yua kơ tơlơi pơdrŏng či rơgao hĭ kar hăng bơnga rơ̆k. 
For the sun has risen with its burning heat, and has withered the grass, and its flower has fallen, and the comeliness of its look has perished: thus the rich also shall wither in his goings. @ Yua kơ yang hrơi ƀlĕ hmâo pơ-iă hang, laih anŭn ngă hĭ rơ̆k kro; bơnga ñu ruh, tơlơi hiam rŏ ñu rơngiă hĭ. Kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n ƀing pơdrŏng či răm rơngiă tơ̆ng krah tơlơi ƀlơ̆ng bơngơ̆t kơ bruă gơñu.
Blessed [is the] man who endures temptation; for, having been proved, he shall receive the crown of life, which He has promised to them that love him. @ Mơyun hiam yơh kơ mơnuih gir tŭ tơlơi lông lăng, yua kơ tơ ñu dưi laih, ñu či mă tŭ mŭk pơtao tơlơi hơdip Ơi Adai hmâo ƀuăn laih kơ ƀing khăp kơ Ñu. 
Let no man, being tempted, say, I am tempted of God. For God cannot be tempted by evil things, and himself tempts no one. @ Tơdang tŭ tơlơi plư anăm hlơi laĭ ôh: “Ơi Adai plư kâo,” yua kơ tơlơi sat ƀu dưi plư Ơi Adai ôh, laih anŭn Ơi Adai Pô kŏn plư hlơi hlơi lơi. 
But every one is tempted, drawn away, and enticed by his own lust; @ Samơ̆ rĭm čô mơnuih tŭ tơlơi plư yua kơ mơ̆ng tơlơi amoaih sat ñu pô dui ba laih anŭn pơsur ñu. 
then lust, having conceived, gives birth to sin; but sin fully completed brings forth death. @ Tơdah tơlơi amoaih sat rai kơ prŏng laih, ñu tơkeng rai tơlơi soh; tơdah tơlơi soh rai kơ prŏng, ñu tơkeng rai kơ tơlơi djai.
Do not err, my beloved brethren. @ Ơ adơi ayŏng kâo khăp hơeng, anăm lĕ ôh amăng tơlơi arăng plơ̆m ƀlor. 
Every good gift and every perfect gift comes down from above, from the Father of lights, with whom is no variation nor shadow of turning. @ Abih bang tơlơi pha brơi čơmah laih anŭn gơnam brơi klă tum leng kơ trŭn mơ̆ng adai, mơ̆ng Ama kơ tơlơi bơngač soh sel, amăng Ñu ƀu hmâo tơlơi pơplih ôh, kŏn hmâo tơ-u kơ tơlơi pơplih lơi. 
According to his own will begat he us by the word of truth, that we should be a certain first-fruits of *his* creatures. @ Tui hăng tơlơi kơñăm Ñu, Ñu hmâo tơkeng laih ƀing ta hăng boh pơhiăp tơlơi sĭt, kiăng kơ ƀing ta jing boh hlâo hlang amăng khul mơnơ̆ng Ñu hrih laih.
So that, my beloved brethren, let every man be swift to hear, slow to speak, slow to wrath; @ Ơ adơi ayŏng kâo khăp hơeng, ƀing gih khŏm thâo tơlơi anai: abih bang mơnuih khŏm tañ hmư̆, kaih pơhiăp, kaih hil; 
for man's wrath does not work God's righteousness. @ yua kơ tơlơi mơnuih hil ƀu ba rai tơlơi tơpă hơnơ̆ng Ơi Adai ôh. 
Wherefore, laying aside all filthiness and abounding of wickedness, accept with meekness the implanted word, which is able to save your souls. @ Tui anŭn, lui hĭ bĕ tơlơi hơƀak drak laih anŭn abih tơlơi sat ƀai hlăk lar hyu, hăng pran jua tơdu rơun ƀing gih mă tŭ boh pơhiăp hmâo pla laih amăng ƀing gih, jing boh pơhiăp dưi pơklaih bơngăt ƀing gih.
But be ye doers of [the] word and not hearers only, beguiling yourselves. @ Samơ̆ ngă tui bĕ boh pơhiăp, anăm kơnơ̆ng hmư̆ đôč laih anŭn plơ̆m ƀlor ƀing gih pô. 
For if any man be a hearer of [the] word and not a doer, *he* is like to a man considering his natural face in a mirror: @ Yua kơ tơdah hlơi pô hmư̆ boh pơhiăp samơ̆ ƀu ngă tui ôh, ñu anŭn kar hăng sa čô mơnuih lăng ƀô̆ mơta ñu amăng mơnĭl, 
for he has considered himself and is gone away, and straightway he has forgotten what he was like. @ lăng giơ̆ng ƀô̆ mơta ñu, laih anŭn đuaĭ hĭ wơr bĭt mơtam hyư̆m ñu jing. 
But *he* that fixes his view on [the] perfect law, that of liberty, and abides in [it], being not a forgetful hearer but a doer of [the] work, *he* shall be blessed in his doing. @ Samơ̆ hlơi pô kơsem lăng ten en tơlơi juăt klă tum anai, jing tơlơi juăt ba glaĭ tơlơi rơngai, laih anŭn gir kơtir kơsem lăng, ƀu jing mơnuih kơnơ̆ng hmư̆ laih anŭn wơr bĭt hĭ ôh, samơ̆ jing sa čô ngă tui, mơnuih anŭn či hmâo tơlơi mơyun hiam amăng bruă ñu.
If any one think himself to be religious, not bridling his tongue, but deceiving his heart, this man's religion is vain. @ Tơdah hlơi pơmĭn ñu jing mơnuih đaŏ sĭt, samơ̆ ƀu thâo kơ̆ng wai jơlah ñu pô, ñu anŭn plơ̆m ƀlor pran jua ñu pô, tơlơi ñu đaŏ anŭn jing đôč đač. 
Pure and undefiled religion before God and the Father is this: to visit orphans and widows in their affliction, to keep oneself unspotted from the world. @ Tơlơi đaŏ rơgoh hiam laih anŭn ƀu hơƀak drak ôh ƀơi anăp Ơi Adai, Ama ƀing ta, anŭn jing: djru ƀing ană tơhrit laih anŭn ƀing đah kơmơi djai rơkơi amăng tơlơi tơnap tap gơñu, laih anŭn răng wai ñu pô mơ̆ng tơlơi hơƀak drak lŏn tơnah.
My brethren, do not have the faith of our Lord Jesus Christ, [Lord] of glory, with respect of persons: @ Ơ adơi ayŏng kâo, ƀing gih đaŏ laih kơ Khua Yang Yêsu Krist, jing Khua Yang guh kơang kơ ƀing ta, anăm lăng mơnuih tui hăng gah rơngiao ñu jing ôh. 
for if there come unto your synagogue a man with a gold ring in splendid apparel, and a poor man also come in in vile apparel, @ Bơhmutu hmâo sa čô mơnuih čŭt rơbưn mah, buh sum ao hiam yom mŭt amăng sang bơjơnum ƀing gih, laih anŭn dơ̆ng hmâo sa čô mơnuih ƀun rin buh ao tơĭ brơĭ ăt mŭt mơ̆n, 
and ye look upon him who wears the splendid apparel, and say, Do thou sit here well, and say to the poor, Do thou stand there, or sit here under my footstool: @ laih anŭn tơdah ƀing gih pơpŭ kơ mơnuih buh ao hiam yom hăng laĭ: “Rơkâo kơ ih dŏ ber bĕ ƀơi anai,” samơ̆ ƀing gih laĭ kơ pô ƀun rin: “Dŏ dơ̆ng bĕ ƀơi anŭn,” ƀôdah: “Dŏ ber bĕ jĕ ƀơi tơkai kâo,” 
have ye not made a difference among yourselves, and become judges having evil thoughts? @ ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă ƀing gih pơjing tơlơi pơkah phara mơnuih tơ̆ng krah tơdruă ƀing gih, laih anŭn phat kơđi hăng tơlơi pơmĭn sat?
Hear, my beloved brethren: Has not God chosen the poor as to the world, rich in faith, and heirs of the kingdom, which he has promised to them that love him? @ Hmư̆ bĕ, Ơ adơi ayŏng kâo khăp hơeng. Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă Ơi Adai hmâo ruah laih ƀing ƀun rin amăng lŏn tơnah anai kiăng kơ gơñu dưi jing pơdrŏng amăng tơlơi đaŏ, laih anŭn jing ƀing mă tŭ dêh čar pơtao Ñu ƀuăn laih kơ ƀing khăp kơ Ñu? 
But *ye* have despised the poor [man]. Do not the rich oppress you, and [do not] *they* drag you before [the] tribunals? @ Samơ̆ ƀing gih mưč kơ ƀing ƀun rin! Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă ƀing pơdrŏng yơh kơtư̆ juă laih anŭn dui ba ƀing gih pơ sang phat kơđi? 
And [do not] *they* blaspheme the excellent name which has been called upon you? @ Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă gơñu yơh pơhiăp sat kơ anăn arăng pơpŭ, anăn Ơi Adai brơi laih kơ ƀing gih?
If indeed ye keep [the] royal law according to the scripture, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself, ye do well. @  Tơdah ƀing gih gưt sĭt kơ tơlơi juăt pơtao tui hăng Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp hmâo čih laih: “Khăp bĕ kơ mơnuih jum dar gih kar hăng gih pô,” ƀing gih ngă djơ̆ yơh. 
But if ye have respect of persons, ye commit sin, being convicted by the law as transgressors. @ Samơ̆ tơdah ƀing gih pơdŏng ha gah, ƀing gih ngă soh yơh, laih anŭn tơlơi juăt yap ƀing gih jing ƀing soh. 
For whoever shall keep the whole law and shall offend in one [point], he has come under the guilt of [breaking] all. @ Yua kơ hlơi pô gưt abih tơlơi juăt, samơ̆ kơnơ̆ng ngă gao sa tơlơi đôč, ăt yap kar hăng ngă gao abih tơlơi juăt laih. 
For he who said, Thou shalt not commit adultery, said also, Thou shalt not kill. Now if thou dost not commit adultery, but killest, thou art become transgressor of [the] law. @ Yua kơ Ơi Adai laĭ laih: “Anăm klĕ pyu ôh,” ăt laĭ dơ̆ng mơ̆n: “Anăm pơdjai mơnuih ôh.” Tơdah ƀing gih ƀu klĕ pyu ôh, samơ̆ pơdjai mơnuih, ƀing gih jing laih mơnuih gao tơlơi juăt. 
So speak ye, and so act, as those that are to be judged by [the] law of liberty; @ Pơhiăp laih anŭn ngă bĕ kar hăng ƀing mơnuih arăng či phat kơđi tui hăng tơlơi juăt kơ tơlơi rơngai. 
for judgment [will be] without mercy to him that has shewn no mercy. Mercy glories over judgment. @ Yua kơ tơlơi phat kơđi ƀu či pap drap ôh kơ pô ƀu thâo pap drap kơ arăng, samơ̆ tơlơi pap drap dưi hăng tơlơi phat kơđi.
What [is] the profit, my brethren, if any one say he have faith, but have not works? can faith save him? @ Ơ adơi ayŏng kâo, hơgĕt hmâo tŭ yua tơdah sa čô laĭ ñu hmâo tơlơi đaŏ, samơ̆ ƀu hmâo pơrơđah amăng bruă ngă ôh? Tơlơi đaŏ anŭn dưi pơklaih ñu mơ̆? 
Now if a brother or a sister is naked and destitute of daily food, @ Tơdah hmâo ayŏng amai adơi ƀu hmâo sum ao, laih anŭn kơƀah mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă rĭm hrơi, 
and one from amongst you say to them, Go in peace, be warmed and filled; but give not to them the needful things for the body, what [is] the profit? @ laih anŭn sa čô amăng ƀing gih laĭ hăng gơñu: “Nao bĕ rơnŭk rơnua, mơdang pơđao laih anŭn ƀơ̆ng trơi bĕ,” samơ̆ ƀu pha brơi ôh hơdôm tơlơi kiăng kơ drơi jan gơñu, hơgĕt yom tơlơi anŭn? 
So also faith, if it have not works, is dead by itself. @ Tơlơi đaŏ kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n, tơdah tơlơi đaŏ ƀu hmâo pơrơđah amăng bruă ngă ôh, tơlơi đaŏ anŭn djai yơh.
But some one will say, *Thou* hast faith and *I* have works. Shew me thy faith without works, and *I* from my works will shew thee my faith. @ Samơ̆ hmâo mơnuih či laĭ: “Ih hmâo tơlơi đaŏ, laih anŭn kâo hmâo bruă ngă.” Anai tơlơi kâo laĭ: “Kơčrâo brơi kơ kâo bĕ kơ tơlơi ih đaŏ ƀu hmâo bruă ngă, laih anŭn kâo či pơrơđah kơ ih tơlơi kâo đaŏ amăng bruă kâo ngă.” 
*Thou* believest that God is one. Thou doest well. The demons even believe, and tremble. @ Ih đaŏ hmâo kơnơ̆ng ha čô Ơi Adai; djơ̆ yơh, wơ̆t kơ ƀing yang sat ăt đaŏ kar kaĭ mơ̆n — laih anŭn gơñu hwĭ tơtư̆. 
But wilt thou know, O vain man, that faith without works is dead? @ Ơ mơnuih mlŭk anŭn, ih kiăng thâo mơ̆ tơlơi đaŏ ƀu hmâo ôh bruă ngă jing đôč đač? 
Was not Abraham our father justified by works when he had offered Isaac his son upon the altar? @ Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă Abraham ơi ƀing ta hmâo tơlơi yap tơpă laih yua mơ̆ng bruă ngă, tơdang ñu pơyơr ană đah rơkơi ñu Isak ƀơi kơƀang ngă yang? 
Thou seest that faith wrought with his works, and that by works faith was perfected. @ Tui anŭn ih ƀuh tơlơi đaŏ nao hrŏm hơbĭt hăng bruă ngă, laih anŭn yua mơ̆ng bruă ngă tơlơi đaŏ dưi jing klă tum, 
And the scripture was fulfilled which says, Abraham believed God, and it was reckoned to him as righteousness, and he was called Friend of God. @ tui anŭn Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp hmâo krĕp djơ̆ laih: “Abraham đaŏ kơ Ơi Adai, laih anŭn yua kơ tơlơi anŭn Ơi Adai yap ñu jing tơpă.” Laih anŭn arăng iâu ñu jing giăng mah Ơi Adai. 
Ye see that a man is justified on the principle of works, and not on the principle of faith only. @ Tui anŭn ƀing gih ƀuh, arăng hmâo yap tơpă mơ̆ng bruă ngă, ƀu djơ̆ kơnơ̆ng mơ̆ng tơlơi đaŏ đôč ôh.
But was not in like manner also Rahab the harlot justified on the principle of works, when she had received the messengers and put [them] forth by another way? @  Ăt kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n, ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă đah kơmơi rih HʼRahap hmâo tơlơi yap tơpă mơ̆ng bruă ngă tơdang ñu jum ƀing mơnuih Yôsuê pơkiaŏ nao laih anŭn brơi gơñu đuaĭ glaĭ hăng jơlan pơkŏn? 
For as the body without a spirit is dead, so also faith without works is dead. @ Kar hăng drơi jan ƀu hmâo bơngăt drơi jan anŭn djai, kar kaĭ mơ̆n tơlơi đaŏ ƀu hmâo bruă ngă tơlơi đaŏ anŭn djai yơh.
Be not many teachers, my brethren, knowing that we shall receive greater judgment. @ Ơ adơi ayŏng kâo, amăng ƀing gih anăm hmâo lu mơnuih pơjing mă pô ñu ngă nai ôh, yua kơ ƀing gih thâo laih hlơi amăng ƀing ta jing nai, ñu či tŭ tơlơi arăng phat kơđi kơtang hloh dơ̆ng. 
For we all often offend. If any one offend not in word, *he* [is] a perfect man, able to bridle the whole body too. @ Yua kơ abih bang ƀing ta leng kơ hơneč lu mơta tơlơi. Hlơi pô ƀu hơneč ôh amăng tơlơi ñu pơhiăp, ñu anŭn jing mơnuih klă tum, thâo kơ̆ng wai abih drơi jan ñu. 
Behold, we put the bits in the mouths of the horses, that they may obey us, and we turn round their whole bodies. @ Tơdah ƀing ta dưm pơsơi kho ƀơi tơƀong aseh kiăng kơ gơñu gưt kơ ƀing ta, tui anŭn yơh ƀing ta dưi gai abih drơi jan gơñu. 
Behold also the ships, which are so great, and driven by violent winds, are turned about by a very small rudder, wherever the pleasure of the helmsman will. @ Lăng bĕ khul kompăn; wơ̆t dah gơñu prŏng biă mă laih anŭn angĭn kơtang pơpuh gơñu tŭ mơ̆n, samơ̆ kơnơ̆ng sa ƀĕ gai găt anĕt đôč ăt dưi gai gơñu tui hăng pô găt kiăng. 
Thus also the tongue is a little member, and boasts great things. See how little a fire, how large a wood it kindles! @ Kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n, jơlah jing sa črăn anĕt amăng drơi jan, samơ̆ pơ-ư pơang khul bruă prŏng.
Đơsĕt apui đôč dưi ƀơ̆ng hĭ sa ƀŭt glai prŏng mơ̆n. 
and the tongue [is] fire, the world of unrighteousness; the tongue is set in our members, the defiler of the whole body, and which sets fire to the course of nature, and is set on fire of hell. @ Laih anŭn jơlah ăt kar hăng apui mơ̆n. Amăng khul črăn drơi jan ƀing ta, jơlah jing lŏn čar kơ tơlơi soh sat, ngă pơgrĭ abih drơi jan, čuh abih tơlơi hơdip, laih anŭn apui tơbiă mơ̆ng war apui ăt čuh ƀơ̆ng ñu mơ̆n. 
For every species both of beasts and of birds, both of creeping things and of sea animals, is tamed and has been tamed by the human species; @ Djŏp mơta hlô mơnơ̆ng, čĭm brĭm, hlô mơnơ̆ng hro rui, laih anŭn hlô mơnơ̆ng amăng ia rơsĭ leng kơ dưi pơsăng soh sel, laih anŭn ană mơnuih hmâo pơsăng laih gơñu; 
but the tongue can no one among men tame; [it is] an unsettled evil, full of death-bringing poison. @ samơ̆ ƀu hmâo ôh mơnuih dưi pơsăng jơlah — ñu jing mơnơ̆ng sat biă mă, arăng ƀu thâo gai ñu ôh, bă blai ia bih ngă djai mơnuih. 
Therewith bless we the Lord and Father, and therewith curse we men made after [the] likeness of God. @ Hăng jơlah ƀing ta bơni hơơč kơ Khua Yang, Ama ƀing ta, laih anŭn ăt hăng jơlah mơ̆n ƀing ta hơtơ̆m pah kơ mơnuih, jing ƀing Ơi Adai hrih laih tui hăng rup Ñu pô. 
Out of the same mouth goes forth blessing and cursing. It is not right, my brethren, that these things should be thus. @ Mơ̆ng amăng bah anŭn mơ̆n tơbiă rai tơlơi hơơč bơni laih anŭn tơlơi hơtơ̆m pah. Ơ adơi ayŏng kâo, anăm ngă tui anŭn ôh. 
Does the fountain, out of the same opening, pour forth sweet and bitter? @ Hmâo mơ̆ sa akŏ ia ƀlĕ rai ia hiam laih anŭn ia phĭ? 
Can, my brethren, a fig produce olives, or a vine figs? Neither [can] salt [water] make sweet water. @ Ơ adơi ayŏng kâo, phŭn hra dưi mơ̆ mơboh rai boh ôliwơ, ƀôdah phŭn boh kơƀâu mơboh rai boh hra? Akŏ ia mơsĭn ăt ƀu dưi ƀlĕ rai ia hiam ôh.
Who [is] wise and understanding among you; let him shew out of a good conversation his works in meekness of wisdom; @ Hlơi amăng ƀing gih jing mơnuih kơhnâo laih anŭn thâo hluh? Brơi ñu dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă hiam klă kiăng pơrơđah khul bruă ñu ngă tơbiă mơ̆ng tơlơi luă gŭ laih anŭn pran jua kơhnâo. 
but if ye have bitter emulation and strife in your hearts, do not boast and lie against the truth. @ Samơ̆ tơdah amăng pran jua ƀing gih hmâo tơlơi moañ phĭ laih anŭn tơlơi klih, anăm pơang kơ ƀing gih pô ƀôdah yua boh pơhiăp ƀlor pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ hăng tơlơi sĭt ôh. 
This is not the wisdom which comes down from above, but earthly, natural, devilish. @ Tơlơi kơhnâo anŭn ƀu djơ̆ tơbiă rai mơ̆ng ngŏ ôh, samơ̆ tơbiă rai mơ̆ng lŏn tơnah, mơ̆ng asar đeh, laih anŭn mơ̆ng yang sat. 
For where emulation and strife [are], there [is] disorder and every evil thing. @ Yua kơ pơpă anih hmâo tơlơi moañ laih anŭn tơlơi klih, pơ anŭn hmâo tơlơi rŭng răng laih anŭn djŏp mơta bruă sat. 
But the wisdom from above first is pure, then peaceful, gentle, yielding, full of mercy and good fruits, unquestioning, unfeigned. @ Samơ̆ tơlơi rơgơi tơbiă rai mơ̆ng ngŏ adih, hlâo hloh jing rơgoh hiam, tŏ tui jing rơnŭk rơnua, tơdu rơun, gir tŭ tơdruă, bă hăng tơlơi pap drap laih anŭn boh than hiam, ƀu hmâo lăng phara ƀôdah pơrup mă ôh. 
But [the] fruit of righteousness in peace is sown for them that make peace. @ Ƀing mơnuih pơdơ̆ng tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua či hơpuă tŭ boh tơlơi tơpă hơnơ̆ng hmâo sai laih amăng tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua.
Whence [come] wars and whence fightings among you? [Is it] not thence, from your pleasures, which war in your members? @ Mơ̆ng pă tơbiă rai tơlơi pơblah laih anŭn khul tơlơi pơrơdjơ̆ pơrơsao tơ̆ng krah ƀing gih? Ƀu djơ̆ ôh hă tơlơi anŭn tơbiă rai mơ̆ng tơlơi asar đeh amoaih hưp dŏ pơblah amăng pran jua ƀing gih? 
Ye lust and have not: ye kill and are full of envy, and cannot obtain; ye fight and war; ye have not because ye ask not. @ Ƀing gih hưp ham kơ mơnơ̆ng samơ̆ ƀu hmâo ôh, tui anŭn ƀing gih pơdjai mơnuih; laih anŭn ƀing gih amoaih kiăng biă mă kơ mơnơ̆ng, samơ̆ ƀu dưi hmâo ôh tui anŭn yơh ƀing gih hmâo tơlơi pơrơdjơ̆ laih anŭn pơblah. Ƀing gih ƀu dưi hmâo hơgĕt ôh, yua kơ ƀing gih ƀu rơkâo. 
Ye ask and receive not, because ye ask evilly, that ye may consume [it] in your pleasures. @ Ƀing gih rơkâo samơ̆ ƀu mă tŭ ôh, yua kơ ƀing gih rơkâo ƀu djơ̆ tơlơi, kiăng yua mơnơ̆ng anŭn tui hăng tơlơi amoaih hưp ƀing gih pô. 
Adulteresses, know ye not that friendship with the world is enmity with God? Whoever therefore is minded to be [the] friend of the world is constituted enemy of God. @ Ơ ƀing rih răm! Ƀing gih ƀu thâo ôh hă tơlơi ngă gơyut gơyâo hăng lŏn tơnah jing ayăt hăng Ơi Adai? Yua kơ anŭn yơh hlơi pô kiăng jing gơyut gơyâo hăng lŏn tơnah ñu anŭn pơjing ñu pô jing ayăt hăng Ơi Adai. 
Think ye that the scripture speaks in vain? Does the Spirit which has taken his abode in us desire enviously? @ Ƀôdah ƀing gih pơmĭn Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp jing đôč đač hă? Tơdang ñu laĭ: “Yang Bơngăt Hiam, Ơi Adai brơi dŏ amăng ƀing ta khăp kơ ƀing ta biă mă tơl Ñu gar.” 
But he gives more grace. Wherefore he says, God sets himself against [the] proud, but gives grace to [the] lowly. @ Samơ̆ Ñu brơi tơlơi pap lu hloh; yua kơ anŭn Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp čih laĭ: “Ơi Adai pơkơdơ̆ng hăng ƀing pơgao, samơ̆ brơi tơlơi pap kơ ƀing luă gŭ.”
Subject yourselves therefore to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you. @ Tui anŭn đup gưt bĕ kơ Ơi Adai. Pơkơdơ̆ng bĕ hăng yang sat, laih anŭn ñu či đuaĭ ataih mơ̆ng ƀing gih. 
Draw near to God, and he will draw near to you. Cleanse [your] hands, sinners, and purify [your] hearts, ye double-minded. @ Nao jĕ bĕ pơ Ơi Adai, laih anŭn Ñu či rai jĕ pơ ƀing gih. Ơ ƀing mơnuih soh, pơrơgoh bĕ tơngan ƀing gih. Ơ ƀing hmâo pran jua dua gah, pơrơgoh bĕ pran jua ƀing gih. 
Be wretched, and mourn, and weep: let your laughter be turned to mourning, and [your] joy to heaviness. @ Brơi ƀing gih rơngot bĕ, kơ-ŭ uăn laih anŭn čŏk hia bĕ. Blư̆ tơlơi klao jing hĭ tơlơi kơ-ŭ uăn bĕ, laih anŭn blư̆ tơlơi hơ̆k kơdơ̆k jing hĭ tơlơi rơngot hơning. 
Humble yourselves before [the] Lord, and he shall exalt you. @ Luă gŭ bĕ ƀing gih pô ƀơi anăp Khua Yang, laih anŭn Ñu či yŏng đĭ ƀing gih.
Speak not against one another, brethren. He that speaks against [his] brother, or judges his brother, speaks against [the] law and judges [the] law. But if thou judgest [the] law, thou art not doer of [the] law, but judge. @ Ơ adơi ayŏng, anăm pơhiăp sat tơdruă ƀing gih ôh. Hlơi pô pơhiăp sat ƀôdah phat kơđi kơ adơi ayŏng ñu, jing pơhiăp sat laih anŭn phat kơđi kơ tơlơi juăt yơh. Samơ̆ tơdah ih phat kơđi kơ tơlơi juăt, ih ƀu jing mơnuih tui gưt tơlơi juăt ôh, samơ̆ jing pô phat kơđi tơlơi juăt. 
One is the lawgiver and judge, who is able to save and to destroy: but who art *thou* who judgest thy neighbour? @ Kơnơ̆ng hơjăn Ơi Adai đôč pô brơi tơlơi juăt laih anŭn jing khua phat kơđi. Hơjăn Ñu jing Pô dưi song mă laih anŭn dưi pơrai. Samơ̆ hlơi ih jing tơl ih khĭn phat kơđi kơ pô jum dar ih?
Go to now, ye who say, To-day or to-morrow will we go into such a city and spend a year there, and traffic and make gain, @  Ră anai hmư̆ bĕ kâo, Ơ ƀing mơnuih laĭ tui anai: “Hrơi anai ƀôdah hrơi pơgi gơmơi či nao pơ sa boh plei anŭn, dŏ pơ anŭn sa thŭn, sĭ mia laih anŭn hơduah kơmlai lu.” 
ye who do not know what will be on the morrow, ([for] what [is] your life? It is even a vapour, appearing for a little while, and then disappearing,) @ Samơ̆ ƀing gih ƀu thâo ôh hơgĕt tơlơi či truh amăng hrơi pơgi, hơgĕt tơlơi hơdip ƀing gih jing? Yua kơ ƀing gih kơnơ̆ng jing kar hăng hyuh ia đôč, tơbiă rai đơsĕt laih anŭn rơngiă thĕng hĭ mơtam. 
instead of your saying, If the Lord should [so] will and we should live, we will also do this or that. @ Djơ̆ biă mă ƀing gih khŏm laĭ: “Tơdah Khua Yang kiăng laih anŭn ƀing ta ăt dŏ hơdip, ƀing ta či ngă bruă anai bruă anŭn.” 
But now ye glory in your vauntings: all such glorying is evil. @ Samơ̆ ră anai ƀing gih pơ-ư pơang kơ ƀing gih pô amăng tơlơi pơmĭn pơgao. Abih tơlơi pơ-ư pơang tui anŭn leng kơ sat yơh. 
To him therefore who knows how to do good, and does it not, to him it is sin. @ Tui anŭn, hlơi pô thâo tơlơi hiam lăp khŏm ngă samơ̆ ƀu ngă ôh, jing soh laih.
Go to now, ye rich, weep, howling over your miseries that [are] coming upon [you]. @ Ră anai, Ơ ƀing mơnuih pơdrŏng sah! Čŏk hia laih anŭn ur krao bĕ yua kơ tơlơi tơnap tap či truh kơ ƀing gih. 
Your wealth is become rotten, and your garments moth-eaten. @ Dram gơnam ƀing gih brŭ, laih anŭn sum ao ƀing gih moa reh mot ƀơ̆ng laih. 
Your gold and silver is eaten away, and their canker shall be for a witness against you, and shall eat your flesh as fire. Ye have heaped up treasure in [the] last days. @ Prăk mah ƀing gih bring dom laih, bring anŭn či jing mơnơ̆ng gơ̆ng jơlan pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ hăng ƀing gih, laih anŭn či ƀơ̆ng asar đeh ƀing gih kar hăng apui ƀơ̆ng. Ƀing gih hmâo pơkom pioh laih dram gơnam anŭn kơ rơnŭk hnal tuč anai! 
Behold, the wages of your labourers, who have harvested your fields, wrongfully kept back by you, cry, and the cries of those that have reaped are entered into the ears of [the] Lord of sabaoth. @ Lăng bĕ, nua apah ƀing yuă pơdai amăng hmua ƀing gih, nua anŭn ƀing gih klĕ pioh ƀing gih pô, ñu ur uah đĭ; laih anŭn asăp ƀing hơpuă anŭn ur krao đĭ truh laih pơ tơngia Khua Yang Pô mơyang hloh. 
Ye have lived luxuriously on the earth and indulged yourselves; ye have nourished your hearts [as] in a day of slaughter; @ Ƀing gih hmâo hơdip plai jơnap, mơak mơai ƀơi lŏn tơnah anai; ƀing gih hmâo čem rong ngă rơmŏng pran jua ƀing gih pô pioh brơi kơ hrơi pơdjai. 
ye have condemned, ye have killed the just; he does not resist you. @ Ƀing gih hmâo klă kơđi, laih anŭn pơdjai laih mơnuih tơpă; samơ̆ ñu ƀu pơtăng glaĭ hăng ƀing gih ôh.
Have patience, therefore, brethren, till the coming of the Lord. Behold, the labourer awaits the precious fruit of the earth, having patience for it until it receive [the] early and [the] latter rain. @ Yua kơ anŭn yơh, Ơ adơi ayŏng, brơi ƀing gih gir run bĕ tơl hrơi Khua Yang rai dơ̆ng. Lăng bĕ mơnuih ngă hmua dŏ tơguan boh troh yom mơ̆ng lŏn tơnah, gir run dŏ tơguan tơl hmâo ia hơjan lĕ rah laih anŭn ia hơjan tơkuh thŭn. 
*Ye* also have patience: stablish your hearts, for the coming of the Lord is drawn nigh. @ Ƀing gih ăt kar kaĭ mơ̆n gir run bĕ, laih anŭn dŏ kơjăp pran jua ƀing gih bĕ, yua kơ hrơi Khua Yang rai dơ̆ng jĕ truh laih.
Complain not one against another, brethren, that ye be not judged. Behold, the judge stands before the door. @ Ơ adơi ayŏng, anăm pơhiăp brŏk tơdruă ƀing gih ôh, kiăng kơ Ơi Adai ƀu phat kơđi kơ ƀing gih. Anai nê, Pô phat kơđi dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơi bah amăng laih.
