Take [as] an example, brethren, of suffering and having patience, the prophets, who have spoken in the name of [the] Lord. @ Ơ adơi ayŏng, hơdơr bĕ kơ ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo jing ƀing hmâo pơhiăp laih amăng anăn Khua Yang, hla tui bĕ hnal pơhmô tơlơi tŏng ten, gir run amăng tơlơi tơnap tap kơ ƀing gơñu. 
Behold, we call them blessed who have endured. Ye have heard of the endurance of Job, and seen the end of the Lord; that the Lord is full of tender compassion and pitiful. @ Anai nê, ƀing ta laĭ ƀing mơnuih gir run jing ƀing mơnuih hmâo tơlơi mơyun hiam. Ƀing gih hmâo hmư̆ laih arăng ră ruai kơ tơlơi Jôp gir run, laih anŭn hmâo ƀuh laih tơlơi kơñăm Khua Yang; yua kơ Khua Yang bă hăng tơlơi thâo pap laih anŭn tơlơi hiam klă.
But before all things, my brethren, swear not, neither by heaven, nor by the earth, nor by any other oath; but let your yea be yea, and your nay, nay, that ye do not fall under judgment. @  Samơ̆ hloh kơ abih bang, Ơ adơi ayŏng, anăm ƀuăn rơ̆ng ôh, thâo dah hăng adai ƀôdah hăng lŏn tơnah, ƀôdah ƀuăn rơ̆ng hăng mơnơ̆ng hơgĕt pơkŏn, samơ̆ brơi tơlơi ƀing gih Ơ jing Ơ sĭt, laih anŭn tơlơi ƀing gih Ơ ơh jing Ơ ơh sĭt, kiăng kơ Ơi Adai ƀu phat kơđi kơ ƀing gih ôh.
Does any one among you suffer evil? let him pray. Is any happy? let him sing psalms. @ Hmâo hlơi amăng ƀing gih dŏ amăng tơlơi tơnap tap mơ̆? Brơi ñu iâu laĭ bĕ. Hmâo hlơi dŏ amăng tơlơi hơ̆k mơak mơ̆? Brơi ñu adoh bĕ tơlơi adoh bơni hơơč. 
Is any sick among you? let him call to [him] the elders of the assembly, and let them pray over him, anointing him with oil in the name of [the] Lord; @ Hmâo hlơi amăng ƀing gih dŏ amăng tơlơi duăm ruă mơ̆? Brơi ñu iâu ƀing kŏng tha amăng Phung Sang Ơi Adai, hăng anăn Khua Yang gơñu či iâu laĭ laih anŭn pik ia jâu kơ pô duăm ruă. 
and the prayer of faith shall heal the sick, and the Lord shall raise him up; and if he be one who has committed sins, it shall be forgiven him. @ Tơlơi iâu laĭ hăng tơlơi đaŏ či pơklaih pô duăm ruă anŭn, Khua Yang či pơsuaih ñu; laih anŭn tơdah pô duăm ruă anŭn ngă soh, Ơi Adai či pap brơi kơ ñu mơ̆n. 
Confess therefore your offences to one another, and pray for one another, that ye may be healed. [The] fervent supplication of the righteous [man] has much power. @ Yua kơ anŭn yơh, pơhaih bĕ tơlơi soh tơdruă ƀing gih, laih anŭn iâu laĭ brơi tơdruă, kiăng kơ ƀing gih dưi suaih. Tơlơi sa čô mơnuih tơpă iâu laĭ hmâo tơlơi dưi mơyang laih anŭn hmâo tơlơi jing sĭt. 
Elias was a man of like passions to us, and he prayed with prayer that it should not rain; and it did not rain upon the earth three years and six months; @ Êli jing mơnuih hrup hăng ƀing ta mơ̆n. Ñu iâu laĭ hăng abih pran jua kiăng kơ adai ƀu hơjan ôh, laih anŭn amăng klâo thŭn ha mơkrah adai ƀu hơjan ôh ƀơi lŏn tơnah. 
and again he prayed, and the heaven gave rain, and the earth caused its fruit to spring forth. @ Giơ̆ng anŭn ñu iâu laĭ, adai hơjan dơ̆ng, laih anŭn lŏn čăt añăm tăm, boh troh.
My brethren, if any one among you err from the truth, and one bring him back, @ Ơ adơi ayŏng, tơdah amăng ƀing gih hmâo hlơi čơlah đuaĭ mơ̆ng tơlơi sĭt, laih anŭn hmâo pô pơkŏn ba ñu wơ̆t glaĭ, 
let him know that he that brings back a sinner from [the] error of his way shall save a soul from death and shall cover a multitude of sins. @ brơi ƀing gih thâo hlơi pô ba mơnuih soh glaĭ mơ̆ng jơlan gơ̆ hmâo čơlah đuaĭ laih, ñu pơklaih bơngăt gơ̆ mơ̆ng tơlơi djai laih anŭn gom brơi lu tơlơi soh.
Peter, apostle of Jesus Christ, to [the] sojourners of [the] dispersion of Pontus, Galatia, Cappadocia, Asia, and Bithynia, @ Pêtrôs, khua ding kơna kơ Yêsu Krist, čih mơit kơ ƀing hơdip prăh hyu amăng čar Pônt, Galati, Kapadôs, Asi laih anŭn Bithini, 
elect according to [the] foreknowledge of God [the] Father, by sanctification of [the] Spirit, unto [the] obedience and sprinkling of [the] blood of Jesus Christ: Grace to you and peace be multiplied. @ jing ƀing Ơi Adai Ama hmâo ruah mă laih tui hăng tơlơi Ñu pơkă hlâo, ƀing dưi hmâo tơlơi pơrơgoh hiam mơ̆ng Yang Bơngăt Hiam, kiăng kơ gưt asăp Khua Yang Yêsu Krist laih anŭn hmâo hrŏm hơbĭt amăng tơlơi prăh drah Ñu.
Rơkâo Ơi Adai brơi tơlơi pap laih anŭn tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua rơbeh blai kơ ƀing gih.
Blessed [be] the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who, according to his great mercy, has begotten us again to a living hope through [the] resurrection of Jesus Christ from among [the] dead, @ Hơơč bơni kơ Ơi Adai, Ama Khua Yang ƀing ta Yêsu Krist! Yua mơ̆ng tơlơi pap drap prŏng prin Ñu, ƀing ta dưi hmâo tơkeng dơ̆ng kơphrâo, kiăng kơ hmâo sa tơlơi čang rơmang hơdip, yua mơ̆ng tơlơi Khua Yang Yêsu Krist hơdip glaĭ mơ̆ng tơlơi djai. 
to an incorruptible and undefiled and unfading inheritance, reserved in [the] heavens for you, @ Laih anŭn Ñu brơi ƀing ta mă tŭ kong ngăn ƀu thâo răm rai, ƀu thâo hơƀak drak, ƀu thâo gliu, hmâo pioh laih kơ ƀing gih amăng adai, 
who are kept guarded by [the] power of God through faith for salvation ready to be revealed in [the] last time. @ jing ƀing yua mơ̆ng tơlơi đaŏ, Ơi Adai hmâo wai lăng hăng tơlơi dưi mơyang Ñu, kiăng kơ mă tŭ tơlơi pơklaih jing tơlơi hmâo prăp pre či pơrơđah amăng rơnŭk hnal tuč. 
Wherein ye exult, for a little while at present, if needed, put to grief by various trials, @ Brơi ƀing gih hơ̆k mơak bĕ kơ tơlơi anŭn, wơ̆t dah ră anai ƀing gih ăt dŏ tŭ tơlơi rơngot hơning amăng ƀiă hrơi yua mơ̆ng lu tơlơi lông lăng; 
that the proving of your faith, much more precious than of gold which perishes, though it be proved by fire, be found to praise and glory and honour in [the] revelation of Jesus Christ: @ kiăng kơ tơlơi đaŏ tơpă sĭt ƀing gih giơ̆ng kơ tŭ tơlơi pơlông lăng či jing yom hloh kơ mah — wơ̆t dah mah tŭ laih tơlơi pơlông lăng hăng apui, samơ̆ ăt thâo răm rai mơ̆n — dưi hmâo tơlơi bơni hơơč, tơlơi guh kơang, laih anŭn tơlơi pơpŭ ƀơi hrơi Yêsu Krist pơrơđah rai. 
whom, having not seen, ye love; on whom [though] not now looking, but believing, ye exult with joy unspeakable and filled with [the] glory, @ Wơ̆t dah ƀing gih aka ƀuh Ñu ôh, ƀing gih ăt khăp kơ Ñu. Wơ̆t dah ƀing gih aka bưp Ñu ôh ră anai, ƀing gih ăt đaŏ kơ Ñu, laih anŭn hơ̆k mơak hăng tơlơi mơak guh kơang, ƀu thâo pơblang ôh; 
receiving the end of your faith, [the] salvation of [your] souls. @ yua kơ ƀing gih hmâo mă tŭ laih boh than kơ tơlơi đaŏ ƀing gih, jing tơlơi pơklaih bơngăt ƀing gih.
Concerning which salvation prophets, who have prophesied of the grace towards you, sought out and searched out; @ Kơ tơlơi pơklaih anŭn, ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo hmâo hơduah, kơsem pơklă, laih anŭn hmâo laĭ lui hlâo kơ tơlơi pap hmâo prăp pioh brơi laih kơ ƀing gih. 
searching what, or what manner of time, the Spirit of Christ which [was] in them pointed out, testifying before of the sufferings which [belonged] to Christ, and the glories after these. @ Gơñu hmâo hơduah kơsem kiăng thâo hơbin rơnŭk anŭn či truh laih anŭn hyư̆m Ñu či truh tui hăng Yang Bơngăt Hiam Yang Krist amăng gơñu hmâo pơrơđah brơi, gơñu laĭ lui hlâo kơ tơlơi tơnap tap Yang Krist laih anŭn tơlơi guh kơang tui klon. 
To whom it was revealed, that not to themselves but to you they ministered those things, which have now been announced to you by those who have declared to you the glad tidings by [the] Holy Spirit, sent from heaven, which angels desire to look into. @ Ơi Adai hmâo pơrơđah laih kơ ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo anŭn thâo gơñu ƀu buih bruă kơ gơñu pô ôh, samơ̆ gơñu buih bruă kơ ƀing gih, kơ khul tơlơi anŭn ră anai hmâo pơthâo laih kơ ƀing gih mơ̆ng ƀing mơnuih hăng Yang Bơngăt Hiam jing Pô Ơi Adai hmâo pơkiaŏ rai laih mơ̆ng adai, pơtô Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam kơ ƀing gih. Wơ̆t ƀing ling jang ăt čang kiăng dưi lăng ƀuh khul tơlơi anŭn mơ̆n.
Wherefore, having girded up the loins of your mind, [be] sober [and] hope with perfect stedfastness in the grace [which will be] brought to you at [the] revelation of Jesus Christ; @ Hnŭn yơh, brơi ƀing gih prăp rơmet bĕ pran jua tơlơi pơmĭn, dŏ djơ̆ hơnơ̆ng bĕ, pơdơ̆ng tơlơi čang rơmang ƀing gih kơnơ̆ng amăng tơlơi pap či pha brơi ƀing gih ƀơi hrơi Yêsu Krist pơrơđah rai. 
as children of obedience, not conformed to [your] former lusts in your ignorance; @ Kar hăng ƀing ană bă thâo gưt asăp, anăm pơhluai tui ôh tơlơi amoaih ƀing gih hlâo adih, hlăk ƀing gih ăt dŏ mlŭk mơgu. 
but as he who has called you is holy, be ye also holy in all [your] conversation; @ Samơ̆, kar hăng Pô iâu ƀing gih jing rơgoh hiam, brơi ƀing gih ăt jing rơgoh hiam mơ̆n amăng abih tơlơi ƀing gih dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă. 
because it is written, Be ye holy, for *I* am holy. @ Yua kơ Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp laĭ: “Khŏm kơ ƀing gih jing rơgoh hiam, yua kơ Kâo jing rơgoh hiam.”
And if ye invoke as Father him who, without regard of persons, judges according to the work of each, pass your time of sojourn in fear, @ Tơdah ƀing gih iâu Ơi Adai jing Ama, Pô phat kơđi rĭm čô tui hăng bruă gơñu ngă, Ñu ƀu lăng mơnuih tui hăng gah rơngiao ôh. Tui anŭn, brơi ƀing gih hơdip bĕ hăng pran jua hwĭ pơpŭ amăng rơnŭk jang jai anai. 
knowing that ye have been redeemed, not by corruptible [things, as] silver or gold, from your vain conversation handed down from [your] fathers, @ Ƀing gih thâo laih, nua Ơi Adai yua kiăng song mă ƀing gih mơ̆ng tơlơi dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă ƀu tŭ yua ơi adon ƀing gih pioh glaĭ, ƀu djơ̆ hăng mơnơ̆ng thâo răm rơngiă kar hăng prăk ƀôdah mah ôh, 
but by precious blood, as of a lamb without blemish and without spot, [the blood] of Christ, @ samơ̆ hăng drah yom Yang Krist, kar hăng drah ană triu ƀu hmâo gru tơlơi soh sat, ƀu hmâo rơka rơkeñ ôh. 
foreknown indeed before [the] foundation of [the] world, but who has been manifested at the end of times for your sakes, @ Ơi Adai hmâo pơkă pioh laih Ñu mơ̆ng hlâo kơ tơlơi hrih lŏn tơnah, samơ̆ bơrơđah laih amăng rơnŭk hnal tuč anai yua kơ ƀing gih. 
who by him do believe on God, who has raised him from among [the] dead and given him glory, that your faith and hope should be in God. @ Yua mơ̆ng Ñu ƀing gih hmâo tơlơi đaŏ kơnang kơ Ơi Adai, jing Pô pơhơdip glaĭ laih Ñu mơ̆ng tơlơi djai laih anŭn brơi kơ Ñu tơlơi guh kơang, kiăng kơ tơlơi đaŏ laih anŭn tơlơi čang rơmang ƀing gih dưi pơdơ̆ng ƀơi Ơi Adai.
Having purified your souls by obedience to the truth to unfeigned brotherly love, love one another out of a pure heart fervently; @ Yua mơ̆ng gưt kơ tơlơi sĭt, bơngăt ƀing gih hmâo tơlơi pơrơgoh laih, kiăng kơ hmâo tơlơi khăp adơi ayŏng hăng tơlơi tơpă sĭt. Tui anŭn khăp bĕ tơdruă ƀing gih hăng tơlơi hur har laih anŭn hăng abih pran jua. 
being born again, not of corruptible seed, but of incorruptible, by [the] living and abiding word of God. @ Ƀing gih hmâo laih tơlơi tơkeng glaĭ dơ̆ng, ƀu djơ̆ mơ̆ng pơjeh thâo răm rơngiă ôh, samơ̆ mơ̆ng pơjeh ƀu thâo răm rơngiă, anŭn jing boh pơhiăp hơdip Ơi Adai laih anŭn dŏ kơjăp hlŏng lar. 
Because all flesh [is] as grass, and all its glory as [the] flower of grass. The grass has withered and [its] flower has fallen; @ Yua kơ,
“Abih asar đeh kar hăng rơ̆k,
Laih anŭn abih tơlơi guh kơang ñu kar hăng bơnga rơ̆k.
Rơ̆k kro, laih anŭn bơnga ñu hlŭng yơh,
but the word of [the] Lord abides for eternity. But this is the word which in the glad tidings [is] preached to you. @ Samơ̆ boh pơhiăp Khua Yang dŏ nanao hlŏng lar.”
Boh pơhiăp anŭn jing Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam hmâo pơhaih brơi laih kơ ƀing gih.
Laying aside therefore all malice and all guile and hypocrisies and envyings and all evil speakings, @ Hnŭn yơh, brơi ƀing gih lui hĭ bĕ abih bang tơlơi sat ƀai, tơlơi mơneč, tơlơi pơrup mă, tơlơi moañ gar, laih anŭn abih tơlơi pơčeh ƀlor. 
as newborn babes desire earnestly the pure mental milk of the word, that by it ye may grow up to salvation, @ Brơi ƀing gih mơhao bĕ kơ ia tơsâo mơyang rơgoh hiam kar hăng ană nge phrâo tơkeng, kiăng kơ mơ̆ng mơnơ̆ng anŭn ƀing gih dưi rai kơ prŏng amăng tơlơi pơklaih, 
if indeed ye have tasted that the Lord [is] good. @ tơdah ƀing gih mưn thâo Khua Yang jing hiam klă.
To whom coming, a living stone, cast away indeed as worthless by men, but with God chosen, precious, @ Nao jĕ Ñu bĕ, Pô jing boh pơtâo hơdip, ană mơnuih hơngah lui hĭ laih samơ̆ jing Pô Ơi Adai hmâo ruah laih anŭn pơpŭ pơyom. 
yourselves also, as living stones, are being built up a spiritual house, a holy priesthood, to offer spiritual sacrifices acceptable to God by Jesus Christ. @ Ƀing gih jing kar hăng khul boh pơtâo hơdip, brơi Ơi Adai yua bĕ ƀing gih kiăng pơdơ̆ng đĭ sang gah mơyang, laih anŭn yua mơ̆ng Yêsu Krist ƀing gih jing khua ngă yang rơgoh hiam, kiăng pơyơr mơnơ̆ng ngă yang gah mơyang, bơmơak kơ Ơi Adai. 
Because it is contained in the scripture: Behold, I lay in Zion a corner stone, elect, precious: and he that believes on him shall not be put to shame. @ Yua kơ Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp hmâo čih laih:
“Anai nê, Kâo dưm ƀơi Siôn sa boh pơtâo,
Boh pơtâo akiăng sang Ơi Adai hmâo ruah laih anŭn pơyom;
Hlơi pô đaŏ kơ boh pơtâo anŭn ñu ƀu či mlâo ôh.”
To you therefore who believe [is] the preciousness; but to the disobedient, the stone which the builders cast away as worthless, this is become head of [the] corner, @  Anŭn yơh, kơ ƀing gih jing mơnuih đaŏ laih, Ñu jing boh pơtâo yom; samơ̆ kơ ƀing ƀu đaŏ, Ñu jing:
“Boh pơtâo pô man sang pơkah lui hĭ,
hmâo jing hĭ laih boh pơtâo akiăng sang yom hloh kơ abih bang,”
and a stone of stumbling and rock of offence; [who] stumble at the word, being disobedient to which also they have been appointed. @  laih anŭn jing
“Boh pơtâo ngă tơhnač tơkai arăng,
laih anŭn boh pơtâo prŏng ngă arăng lĕ rơbuh;”
Gơñu rơbuh, yua kơ ƀu gưt boh pơhiăp, kar hăng Ơi Adai hmâo pơkă pioh brơi laih kơ gơñu.
But *ye* [are] a chosen race, a kingly priesthood, a holy nation, a people for a possession, that ye might set forth the excellencies of him who has called you out of darkness to his wonderful light; @  Samơ̆ ƀing gih jing kơnŭng djuai Ơi Adai ruah mă laih, jing ƀing khua ngă yang kơ pơtao, jing sa kơnŭng djuai rơgoh hiam, jing ƀing ană plei pla lơ̆m kơ Ơi Adai Pô, kiăng kơ ƀing gih dưi pơhaih bruă yom pơphan Pô iâu laih ƀing gih tơbiă mơ̆ng tơlơi mơmŏt truh pơ tơlơi bơngač yom pơphan Ñu. 
who once [were] not a people, but now God's people; who were not enjoying mercy, but now have found mercy. @ Hlâo adih ƀing gih ƀu jing ană plei pla Ơi Adai ôh, samơ̆ ră anai ƀing gih jing laih ană plei pla Ñu; hlâo adih ƀing gih aka tŭ mă ôh tơlơi pap drap Ơi Adai, samơ̆ ră anai ƀing gih hmâo tŭ mă laih tơlơi pap drap.
Beloved, I exhort [you], as strangers and sojourners, to abstain from fleshly lusts, which war against the soul; @ Ơ adơi ayŏng kâo khăp hơeng, ƀing gih jing kar hăng ƀing tuai, ƀing dŏ ataih mơ̆ng čar ƀing gih pô amăng lŏn tơnah anai, kâo kơwưh ƀing gih, khŏm ƀing gih hơngah hĭ bĕ tơlơi asar đeh amoaih, jing tơlơi pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ hăng bơngăt ƀing gih. 
having your conversation honest among the Gentiles, that [as to that] in which they speak against you as evildoers, they may through [your] good works, [themselves] witnessing [them], glorify God in [the] day of visitation. @ Brơi kơ ƀing gih dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă tơpă hiam tơ̆ng krah ƀing mơnuih ƀu đaŏ, kiăng kơ wơ̆t dah gơñu pơhiăp sat ƀing gih jing mơnuih soh sat, gơñu ăt dưi ƀuh mơ̆n bruă hiam ƀing gih ngă laih anŭn pơpŭ bơni kơ Ơi Adai ƀơi hrơi Ñu či rai dơ̆ng.
Be in subjection [therefore] to every human institution for the Lord's sake; whether to [the] king as supreme, @ Yua kơ Khua Yang, brơi kơ ƀing gih tui gưt bĕ abih tơlơi dưi ană mơnuih, ƀôdah hăng pơtao jing pô djă tơlơi dưi prŏng hloh, 
or to rulers as sent by him, for vengeance on evildoers, and praise to them that do well. @ ƀôdah hăng ƀing khua kơdreč čar jing ding kơna pơtao pơkiaŏ nao kiăng pơkơhmal ƀing ngă tơlơi sat laih anŭn bơni pơ-ư kơ ƀing ngă tơlơi hiam. 
Because so is the will of God, that by well-doing ye put to silence the ignorance of senseless men; @ Yua kơ tơlơi Ơi Adai kiăng anŭn jing ƀing gih ngă tơlơi hiam kiăng kơ kơđĭp hĭ amăng bah ƀing mơnuih mlŭk mơgu, pơhiăp tă tăn. 
as free, and not as having liberty as a cloak of malice, but as God's bondmen. @ Jing ding kơna kơ Ơi Adai, brơi kơ ƀing gih hơdip bĕ kar hăng ƀing mơnuih rơngai, samơ̆ anăm yua tơlơi rơngai ƀing gih ngă bơnal gom tơlơi sat ƀai ôh. 
Shew honour to all, love the brotherhood, fear God, honour the king. @ Pơpŭ bĕ kơ abih bang mơnuih, khăp kơ adơi ayŏng hrŏm sa tơlơi đaŏ, hwĭ pơpŭ kơ Ơi Adai, pơpŭ kơ pơtao.
Servants, [be] subject with all fear to your masters, not only to the good and gentle, but also to the ill-tempered. @ Ơ ƀing ding kơna, ƀing gih đup gưt bĕ kơ khua ƀing gih hăng pran jua hwĭ pơpŭ sĭt, ƀu djơ̆ kơnơ̆ng kơ ƀing khua hiam klă laih anŭn tơdu rơun đôč ôh, samơ̆ wơ̆t kơ ƀing khua hmâo kơnuih khăng dơ̆ng mơ̆n. 
For this [is] acceptable, if one, for conscience sake towards God, endure griefs, suffering unjustly. @ Tơdah ƀing gih tŭ tơlơi ruă nuă, tơnap tap hăng tơlơi ƀu tơpă, yua kơ ƀing gih thâo krăn Ơi Adai, anŭn jing sa tơlơi mơyun hiam yơh. 
For what glory [is it], if sinning and being buffeted ye shall bear [it]? but if, doing good and suffering, ye shall bear [it], this is acceptable with God. @ Tơdah ƀing gih tŭ tơlơi arăng taih čŏm yua kơ ƀing gih ngă tơlơi soh, hơgĕt yom kơ ƀing gih? Samơ̆ tơdah ƀing gih tŭ tơlơi ruă nuă yua kơ ƀing gih ngă tơlơi hiam, anai jing sa tơlơi mơyun hiam ƀơi anăp Ơi Adai. 
For to this have ye been called; for Christ also has suffered for you, leaving you a model that ye should follow in his steps: @ Ơi Adai hmâo iâu laih ƀing gih kơ tơlơi anŭn, yua kơ Yang Krist ăt hmâo tŭ laih tơlơi tơnap tap brơi kơ ƀing gih, pioh glaĭ kơ ƀing gih sa hnal pơhmô, kiăng kơ ƀing gih tui kru Ñu.
who did no sin, neither was guile found in his mouth; @  Ñu ƀu hmâo ngă soh djơ̆ ôh,
Kŏn arăng hmư̆ djơ̆ lơi tơlơi ƀlor mơ̆ng amăng bah Ñu.
who, [when] reviled, reviled not again; [when] suffering, threatened not; but gave [himself] over into the hands of him who judges righteously; @  Tơdang arăng ngă pơmlâo hañ kơ Ñu, Ñu ƀu pơmlâo glaĭ kơ arăng ôh; tơdang Ñu tŭ tơlơi tơnap tap, Ñu ƀu hmâo pơhwĭ arăng ôh, samơ̆ Ñu jao Ñu pô kơ Pô phat kơđi hăng tơlơi tơpă hơnơ̆ng. 
who himself bore our sins in his body on the tree, in order that, being dead to sins, we may live to righteousness: by whose stripes ye have been healed. @ Ñu pô glăm tơlơi soh ƀing ta amăng drơi jan Ñu ƀơi kơyâo bơrơkal, kiăng kơ ƀing ta djai gah kơ tơlơi soh, laih anŭn hơdip kơ tơlơi tơpă hơnơ̆ng; mơ̆ng khul nam rơka Ñu ƀing gih dưi suaih. 
For ye were going astray as sheep, but have now returned to the shepherd and overseer of your souls. @ Yua kơ ƀing gih jing kar hăng triu jrok jơlan, samơ̆ ră anai ƀing gih wơ̆t glaĭ laih hăng Pô Wai Triu laih anŭn Pô Wai Lăng kơ bơngăt ƀing gih.
Likewise, wives, [be] subject to your own husbands, that, even if any are disobedient to the word, they may be gained without [the] word by the conversation of the wives, @  Kar kaĭ mơ̆n, Ơ ƀing jing bơnai đup gưt bĕ kơ rơkơi ƀing gih, kiăng kơ tơdah hmâo đơđa rơkơi ƀu đaŏ ôh kơ boh pơhiăp Ơi Adai, gơñu dưi hluai tui tơlơi đaŏ mơ̆n, ƀu djơ̆ yua mơ̆ng boh pơhiăp ôh, samơ̆ mơ̆ng tơlơi dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă ƀing bơnai gơñu, 
having witnessed your pure conversation [carried out] in fear; @ yua kơ gơñu hmâo ƀuh laih tơlơi rơgoh hiam laih anŭn tơlơi thâo hwĭ pơpŭ amăng tơlơi hơdip ƀing amai adơi. 
whose adorning let it not be that outward one of tressing of hair, and wearing gold, or putting on apparel; @ Anăm ƀing gih pơmĭn đơi ôh kơ tơlơi pơhrôp gah rơngiao kar hăng tơlơi amoañ ƀuk, buh mah, čŭt hơô băn ao phara hăng yang đar, 
but the hidden man of the heart, in the incorruptible [ornament] of a meek and quiet spirit, which in the sight of God is of great price. @ samơ̆ pơhrôp bĕ mơnuih gah lăm hơgơ̆m hăng tơlơi hiam rŏ ƀu thâo răm rơngiă ôh, anŭn jing kơnuih tơdu rơun laih anŭn rơiăt hơđơ̆ng. Tơlơi anŭn jing yom biă mă ƀơi anăp Ơi Adai. 
For thus also the holy women who have hoped in God heretofore adorned themselves, being subject to their own husbands; @ Yua kơ ƀing đah kơmơi rơgoh hiam đưm, gơñu čang rơmang amăng Ơi Adai, laih anŭn thâo đup gưt kơ rơkơi gơñu, leng kơ pơhrôp tui anŭn soh sel; 
as Sarah obeyed Abraham, calling him lord; whose children ye have become, doing good, and not fearing with any kind of consternation. @ Kar hăng HʼSara đup gưt kơ Abraham laih anŭn iâu gơ̆ khua. Tơdah ƀing gih ngă tơlơi hiam, ƀu hmâo tơlơi hơgĕt ngă brơi ƀing gih hwĭ bral ôh, tui anŭn ƀing gih jing ană đah kơmơi HʼSara yơh.
[Ye] husbands likewise, dwell with [them] according to knowledge, as with a weaker, [even] the female, vessel, giving [them] honour, as also fellow-heirs of [the] grace of life, that your prayers be not hindered. @  Kar kaĭ mơ̆n, Ơ ƀing jing rơkơi, brơi ƀing gih dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă hăng bơnai ƀing gih hăng tơlơi kơhnâo, pơpŭ pơyom kơ gơñu jing ƀing tơdu hloh amăng drơi jan, yua kơ gơñu či tŭ mă tơlơi pap kơ tơlơi hơdip hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing gih mơ̆n, kiăng kơ ƀu hmâo tơlơi hơgĕt pơgŭn tơlơi ƀing gih iâu laĭ ôh.
Finally, [be] all of one mind, sympathising, full of brotherly love, tender hearted, humble minded; @ Hnal tuč, abih bang ƀing gih khŏm hmâo hrŏm sa jua pơmĭn, thâo pap mơñai, thâo khăp tơdruă, hmâo pran jua hiam klă laih anŭn pran jua luă gŭ. 
not rendering evil for evil, or railing for railing; but on the contrary, blessing [others], because ye have been called to this, that ye should inherit blessing. @ Anăm mă tơlơi sat kiăng ba glaĭ tơlơi sat arăng ngă ôh, kŏn ba glaĭ tơlơi hơtơ̆m pah kơ ƀing hơtơ̆m pah lơi; samơ̆ kơđai glaĭ, brơi hơơč mơyun bĕ, yua kơ tơlơi anŭn yơh Ơi Adai hmâo iâu laih ƀing gih, kiăng kơ ƀing gih dưi tŭ mă tơlơi mơyun hiam. 
For he that will love life and see good days, let him cause his tongue to cease from evil and his lips that they speak no guile. @ Yua kơ,
“Hlơi kiăng khăp kơ tơlơi hơdip
Laih anŭn kiăng ƀuh khul hrơi hiam mơak,
Brơi ñu wai lăng bĕ jơlah ñu klaih mơ̆ng tơlơi sat ƀai,
Laih anŭn tơƀuai ñu klaih mơ̆ng pơhiăp tơlơi pleč ƀlor;
And let him avoid evil, and do good; let him seek peace and pursue it; @ Weh đuaĭ bĕ mơ̆ng tơlơi sat laih anŭn ngă tơlơi hiam;
Hơduah bĕ tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua laih anŭn kiaŏ tui tơlơi anŭn,
because [the] eyes of [the] Lord [are] on [the] righteous, and his ears towards their supplications; but [the] face of [the] Lord [is] against them that do evil. @ Yua kơ mơta Khua Yang krăp lăng ƀing mơnuih tơpă,
Laih anŭn tơngia Ñu krăp hmư̆ tơlơi ƀing gơ̆ iâu laĭ.
Samơ̆ ƀô̆ mơta Khua Yang pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ hăng ƀing ngă soh sat.”
And who shall injure you if ye have become imitators of that which [is] good? @ Tơdah ƀing gih hur har ngă tơlơi hiam, hmâo hlơi či ngă sat kơ ƀing gih? 
But if also ye should suffer for righteousness' sake, blessed [are ye]; but be not afraid of their fear, neither be troubled; @ Samơ̆ tơdah ƀing gih tŭ tơlơi tơnap tap yua kơ tơlơi tơpă, ƀing gih či hmâo tơlơi mơyun hiam yơh. Anăm hwĭ ôh kơ tơlơi ƀing gơñu hwĭ, kŏn anăm rŭng răng lơi. 
but sanctify [the] Lord the Christ in your hearts, and [be] always prepared to [give] an answer [to] every one that asks you to give an account of the hope that [is] in you, but with meekness and fear; @ Samơ̆ pơpŭ pơyom bĕ Yang Krist jing rơgoh hiam, jing Khua Yang amăng pran jua ƀing gih. Nanao krăp pre kiăng kơ laĭ glaĭ brơi ƀing mơnuih tơña kơ tơlơi čang rơmang amăng ƀing gih, 
having a good conscience, that [as to that] in which they speak against you as evildoers, they may be ashamed who calumniate your good conversation in Christ. @ samơ̆ brơi ƀing gih laĭ glaĭ hăng tơlơi tơdu rơun laih anŭn pơpŭ. Tơ arăng pơhiăp sat ƀing gih, ƀing gih khŏm wai lăng pran jua tơpă jơngeh, kiăng kơ ƀing pơčeh ƀlor kơ tơlơi ƀing gih dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă hiam amăng Yang Krist či hmâo tơlơi mlâo. 
For [it is] better, if the will of God should will it, to suffer [as] well-doers than [as] evildoers; @ Yua kơ tơdah tơlơi tơnap tap anŭn jing tơlơi Ơi Adai kiăng, hiam hloh tŭ tơlơi tơnap tap yua kơ ngă tơlơi hiam hloh kơ tŭ tơlơi tơnap tap yua kơ ngă tơlơi sat. 
for Christ indeed has once suffered for sins, [the] just for [the] unjust, that he might bring us to God; being put to death in flesh, but made alive in [the] Spirit, @ Yua kơ Yang Krist ăt hmâo djai laih yua kơ tơlơi soh kơnơ̆ng sa wơ̆t djŏp laih, jing Pô tơpă pơala kơ ƀing ƀu tơpă, kiăng ba ƀing ta nao pơ Ơi Adai; Ñu hmâo tŭ laih tơlơi djai gah drơi jan asar, samơ̆ dưi hơdip gah bơngăt; 
in which also going he preached to the spirits [which are] in prison, @ mơ̆ng bơngăt anŭn mơ̆n, Ñu nao laih anŭn pơtô kơ ƀing bơngăt arăng krư̆ laih, 
heretofore disobedient, when the longsuffering of God waited in [the] days of Noah while the ark was preparing, into which few, that is, eight souls, were saved through water: @ jing ƀing đưm adih ƀu tui gưt kơ Ơi Adai ôh, tơdang Ơi Adai gir dŏ tơguan amăng rơnŭk Nôê, amăng abih khul hrơi ñu ngă kompăn. Amăng kompăn anŭn kơnơ̆ng hmâo ƀiă mơnuih đôč, abih bang gơñu jing sapăn čô, dưi klaih mơ̆ng ia. 
which figure also now saves you, [even] baptism, not a putting away of [the] filth of flesh, but [the] demand as before God of a good conscience, by [the] resurrection of Jesus Christ, @ Ƀatem anai jing rup pơhmu kơ tơlơi anŭn kiăng kơ pơklaih ƀing gih; ƀatem ƀu djơ̆ jing tơlơi pơrơgoh hĭ tơlơi grĭ hơƀak mơ̆ng drơi jan ôh, samơ̆ jing tơlơi ƀuăn hăng Ơi Adai mơ̆ng pran jua tơpă rơgoh bơngač, găn mơ̆ng tơlơi Yêsu Krist hơdip glaĭ, 
who is at [the] right hand of God, gone into heaven, angels and authorities and powers being subjected to him. @ jing Pô hmâo đĭ laih pơ adai, hlăk dŏ gah hơnuă kơ Ơi Adai. Ƀing ling jang, ƀing hmâo tơlơi dưi, laih anŭn abih tơlơi dưi kơtang leng kơ đup gưt Ñu soh sel.
Christ, then, having suffered for us in [the] flesh, do *ye* also arm yourselves with the same mind; for he that has suffered in [the] flesh has done with sin, @ Tui anŭn, yua kơ Yang Krist hmâo tŭ laih tơlơi tơnap tap amăng asar đeh, brơi ƀing gih pơkơjăp bĕ tơlơi pơmĭn ƀing gih kar hăng Krist hmâo ngă laih, yua kơ hlơi pô hmâo tŭ laih tơlơi tơnap tap amăng asar đeh ñu ƀu đom hăng tơlơi soh dơ̆ng tah. 
no longer to live the rest of [his] time in [the] flesh to men's lusts, but to God's will. @ Kiăng kơ tơdang ñu ăt dŏ hơdip amăng asar đeh, ñu ƀu hơdip tui hăng tơlơi amoaih hưp mơnuih dơ̆ng ôh, samơ̆ tui hăng tơlơi Ơi Adai kiăng. 
For the time past [is] sufficient [for us] to have wrought the will of the Gentiles, walking in lasciviousness, lusts, wine-drinking, revels, drinkings, and unhallowed idolatries. @ Đưm adih ƀing gih hmâo plai djŏp laih hrơi mông kiăng ngă khul bruă ƀing mơnuih ƀu đaŏ khăp ngă: hơdip amăng tơlơi grĭ grañ, ngă tơlơi amoaih hưp, măt tơpai, tơlơi ƀơ̆ng mơñum gao hơnơ̆ng, tơlơi ngă tă tăn, laih anŭn tơlơi kơkuh kơ rup trah grĭ grañ. 
Wherein they think it strange that ye run not with [them] to the same sink of corruption, speaking injuriously [of you]; @ Tơ gơñu ƀuh ƀing gih ƀu hơdip hrah hrong ngă hrŏm hơbĭt hăng bruă ƀing gơñu ôh, gơñu kơtuă hling laih anŭn pơhiăp sat kơ ƀing gih. 
who shall render account to him who is ready to judge [the] living and [the] dead. @ Samơ̆ gơñu khŏm ruai pơrơđah tơlơi gơñu ngă kơ Pô či phat kơđi mơnuih hơdip laih anŭn ƀing djai. 
For to this [end] were the glad tidings preached to [the] dead also, that they might be judged, as regards men, after [the] flesh, but live, as regards God, after [the] Spirit. @ Yua kơ anŭn yơh, Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam ăt hmâo ră ruai brơi laih mơ̆n kơ ƀing djai, kiăng kơ giơ̆ng gơñu tŭ laih tơlơi phat kơđi tui hăng ană mơnuih gah kơ asar đeh, gơñu dưi hơdip gah bơngăt kar hăng Ơi Adai.
But the end of all things is drawn nigh: be sober therefore, and be watchful unto prayers; @ Tơlơi hnal tuč kơ abih bang mơnơ̆ng jĕ truh laih; tui anŭn brơi dŏ mơdưh bĕ laih anŭn hơdip djơ̆ hơnơ̆ng kiăng kơ iâu laĭ. 
but before all things having fervent love among yourselves, because love covers a multitude of sins; @ Hlâo kơ abih bang tơlơi, brơi ƀing gih khăp tơdruă hăng tơlơi hur har; yua kơ tơlơi khăp gom lu tơlơi soh. 
hospitable one to another, without murmuring; @ Tŭ jum tơdruă bĕ anăm pơhiăp brŏk ôh. 
each according as he has received a gift, ministering it to one another, as good stewards of [the] various grace of God. @ Brơi rĭm čô yua bĕ tơlơi Ơi Adai pha brơi ñu hmâo mă tŭ laih kiăng kơ buih bruă kơ tơdruă, kar hăng ding kơna wai lăng tŏng ten kơhnăk yua tơlơi pap Ơi Adai hăng lu hơdră jơlan phara. 
If any one speak as oracles of God; if any one minister as of strength which God supplies; that God in all things may be glorified through Jesus Christ, to whom is the glory and the might for the ages of ages. Amen. @ Hlơi pô pơtô, brơi ñu pơtô kar hăng pô pơhaih boh pơhiăp Ơi Adai. Hlơi pô buih bruă, brơi ñu buih bruă hăng tơlơi kơtang mơ̆ng Ơi Adai pha brơi, kiăng kơ amăng abih bang tơlơi, Ơi Adai dưi hmâo tơlơi pơ-ư pơang amăng Khua Yang Yêsu Krist. Kơ Ơi Adai yơh tơlơi guh kơang laih anŭn tơlơi dưi mơyang dŏ hlŏng lar ƀu thâo đŭt ôh. Amen.
Beloved, take not [as] strange the fire [of persecution] which has taken place amongst you for [your] trial, as if a strange thing was happening to you; @ Ơ adơi ayŏng kâo khăp hơeng, tơ apui lông lăng truh kiăng lông lăng kơ ƀing gih, anăm ƀing gih dŏ kơtuă ôh kar hăng sa tơlơi phrâo ƀu juăt ƀuh truh kơ ƀing gih. 
but as ye have share in the sufferings of Christ, rejoice, that in the revelation of his glory also ye may rejoice with exultation. @ Samơ̆ dơ̆ pă ƀing gih tŭ hrŏm hơbĭt tơlơi tơnap tap Yang Krist, brơi ƀing gih hơ̆k mơak dơ̆ anŭn mơ̆n; kiăng kơ tơ tơlơi guh kơang Ñu hmâo pơrơđah laih, ƀing gih ăt či tŭ mă tơlơi hơ̆k mơak kar kaĭ mơ̆n. 
If ye are reproached in [the] name of Christ, blessed [are ye]; for the [Spirit] of glory and the Spirit of God rests upon you: [on their part he is blasphemed, but on your part he is glorified.] @ Tơdah arăng hơtoh djraĭ ƀing gih yua kơ anăn Yang Krist, ƀing gih hmâo tơlơi mơyun hiam yơh, yua kơ Yang Bơngăt Hiam guh kơang, jing Yang Bơngăt Hiam Ơi Adai dŏ amăng ƀing gih. 
Let none of you suffer indeed as murderer, or thief, or evildoer, or as overseer of other people's matters; @ Samơ̆ anăm hmâo hlơi amăng ƀing gih tŭ tơlơi tơnap tap kar mơnuih pơdjai mơnuih, pô klĕ dŏp, pô ngă gao tơlơi juăt, ƀôdah pô khăp tăk tơwăk kơ bruă arăng. 
but if as a christian, let him not be ashamed, but glorify God in this name. @ Kơđai glaĭ, tơdah sa čô tŭ tơlơi tơnap tap yua kơ ñu jing pô đaŏ kơ Yang Krist, anăm ñu mlâo hañ ôh, samơ̆ brơi ñu pơpŭ bơni kơ Ơi Adai yua kơ ñu djă anăn Yang Krist. 
For the time of having the judgment begin from the house of God [is come]; but if first from us, what [shall be] the end of those who obey not the glad tidings of God? @ Yua kơ rơnŭk phat kơđi truh laih, ñu čơdơ̆ng mơ̆ng ană plei Ơi Adai. Tơdah tơlơi phat kơđi anŭn čơdơ̆ng mơ̆ng ƀing ta, hơgĕt tơlơi hnal tuč či truh kơ ƀing ƀu tui gưt kơ Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam Ơi Adai? 
And if the righteous is difficultly saved, where shall the impious and [the] sinner appear? @ Laih anŭn
“Tơdah mơnuih tơpă ăt dŏ tơnap mơ̆n dưi hmâo tơlơi pơklaih,
Hơgĕt tơlơi či truh kơ ƀing ƀu pơpŭ kơ Ơi Adai laih anŭn kơ ƀing mơnuih soh?”
Wherefore also let them who suffer according to the will of God commit their souls in well-doing to a faithful Creator. @ Hnŭn yơh, ƀing mơnuih tŭ tơlơi tơnap tap tui hăng tơlơi Ơi Adai kiăng, brơi ñu ngă hiam nanao bĕ laih anŭn jao bơngăt ñu kơ Pô Hrih Pơjing hơnơ̆ng ten.
The elders which [are] among you I exhort, who [am their] fellow-elder and witness of the sufferings of the Christ, who also [am] partaker of the glory about to be revealed: @ Kâo kơwưh rơkâo kơ ƀing kŏng tha amăng ƀing gih, yua kơ kâo pô jing sa čô kŏng tha mơ̆n. Kâo jing pô ngă gơ̆ng jơlan kơ tơlơi tơnap tap Yang Krist tŭ, laih anŭn jing pô či hmâo hrŏm hơbĭt tơlơi guh kơang jĕ či pơrơđah. 
shepherd the flock of God which [is] among you, exercising oversight, not by necessity, but willingly; not for base gain, but readily; @ Brơi ƀing gih kiaŏ wai bĕ khul triu Ơi Adai hmâo jao brơi laih kơ ƀing gih, ƀu djơ̆ hăng tơlơi pơgŏ ôh, samơ̆ hăng pran jua mơak ngă, ƀu djơ̆ yua kơ nua apah grĭ grañ ôh, samơ̆ hăng tơlơi khăp abih pran jua. 
not as lording it over your possessions, but being models for the flock. @ Ƀu yua ôh tơlơi dưi jing khua kiăng kơ gĭt gai ƀing mơnuih Ơi Adai hmâo jao laih kơ ƀing gih, samơ̆ brơi ƀing gih ngă tơlơi pơhmutu hiam brơi kơ abih phung triu. 
And when the chief shepherd is manifested ye shall receive the unfading crown of glory. @ Laih anŭn tơ Khua kơ ƀing Kiaŏ Triu či pơrơđah, ƀing gih či mă tŭ mŭk pơtao tơlơi guh kơang ƀu thâo răm rơngiă ôh.
Likewise [ye] younger, be subject to [the] elder, and all of you bind on humility towards one another; for God sets himself against [the] proud, but to [the] humble gives grace. @  Kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n, brơi ƀing tơdăm dra đup gưt bĕ kơ ƀing kŏng tha. Brơi abih bang ƀing gih buh mă bĕ tơlơi luă gŭ tơdang hơdip hăng tơdruă, yua kơ “Ơi Adai pơkơdơ̆ng hăng ƀing pơgao, samơ̆ Ñu brơi tơlơi pap kơ ƀing luă gŭ.” 
Humble yourselves therefore under the mighty hand of God, that he may exalt you in [the due] time; @ Tui anŭn luă gŭ bĕ ƀing gih pô gah yŭ tơngan dưi mơyang Ơi Adai, kiăng kơ truh mông gal Ñu či yŏng đĭ ƀing gih. 
having cast all your care upon him, for he cares about you. @ Jao bĕ abih bang tơlơi ƀlơ̆ng bơngơ̆t ƀing gih kơ Ñu, yua kơ Ñu wai lăng čem rong ƀing gih nanao.
Be vigilant, watch. Your adversary [the] devil as a roaring lion walks about seeking whom he may devour. @ Brơi ƀing gih dŏ djơ̆ hơnơ̆ng laih anŭn thâo răng bĕ, pô ayăt ƀing gih jing yang sat; kar hăng rơmông dŭl ur grañ jum dar ƀing gih, hơduah sem hlơi pô ñu dưi, ñu mă ƀơ̆ng hĭ. 
Whom resist, stedfast in faith, knowing that the selfsame sufferings are accomplished in your brotherhood which [is] in [the] world. @ Dŏ kơjăp bĕ amăng tơlơi đaŏ laih anŭn pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ hăng ñu, yua kơ ƀing gih thâo ƀing adơi ayŏng hrŏm hơbĭt tơlơi đaŏ hăng ƀing gih tar ƀar lŏn tơnah ăt hlăk dŏ tŭ tơlơi tơnap tap kar hăng ƀing gih mơ̆n. 
But the God of all grace who has called you to his eternal glory in Christ Jesus, when ye have suffered for a little while, himself shall make perfect, stablish, strengthen, ground: @ Giơ̆ng kơ ƀing gih tŭ laih tơlơi tơnap tap amăng ƀiă hrơi, Ơi Adai kơ abih bang tơlơi pap, Pô hmâo iâu laih ƀing gih kơ tơlơi guh kơang hlŏng lar Ñu amăng Yang Krist, Ñu pô či pơhiam klă glaĭ ƀing gih, pơkơjăp, man pơdơ̆ng laih anŭn pha brơi tơlơi kơtang ƀing gih. 
to him [be] the glory and the might for the ages of the ages. Amen. @ Kơ Ñu yơh tơlơi dưi mơyang nanao hlŏng lar. Amen.
By Silvanus, the faithful brother, as I suppose, I have written to you briefly; exhorting and testifying that this is [the] true grace of God in which ye stand. @  Kâo kơnang kơ Silwan, pô kâo lăng kar hăng sa čô adơi ayŏng tŏng ten, čih dua klâo jơlan kiăng pơđĭ pran jua ƀing gih laih anŭn ngă gơ̆ng jơlan pơsĭt hăng ƀing gih anai jing tơlơi pap sĭt Ơi Adai. Dŏ kơjăp bĕ amăng tơlơi pap anŭn.
She that is elected with [you] in Babylon salutes you, and Marcus my son. @  Phung Sang Ơi Adai pơ Babilôn, jing ƀing Ơi Adai hmâo ruah laih kar hăng ƀing gih mơ̆n, mơit tơlơi kơkuh tơña kơ ƀing gih. Wơ̆t Markôs ană đah rơkơi kâo mơit tơlơi kơkuh tơña kơ ƀing gih mơ̆n. 
Salute one another with a kiss of love. Peace be with you all who [are] in Christ. @ Kơkuh bĕ tơdruă ƀing gih hăng tơlơi čŭm tơlơi khăp ƀing đaŏ.
Rơkâo tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng abih bang adơi ayŏng jing ƀing mơnuih dŏ amăng Yang Krist.
Simon Peter, bondman and apostle of Jesus Christ, to them that have received like precious faith with us through [the] righteousness of our God and Saviour Jesus Christ: @ Simôn Pêtrôs jing ding kơna laih anŭn khua ding kơna kơ Yêsu Krist, čih mơit kơ ƀing kơnang kơ tơlơi tơpă Ơi Adai ƀing ta laih anŭn Khua Yang Yêsu Krist Pô Pơklaih, hmâo mă tŭ laih sa tơlơi đaŏ yom hrup hăng ƀing ta. 
Grace and peace be multiplied to you in [the] knowledge of God and of Jesus our Lord. @ Rơkâo tơlơi pap laih anŭn tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua bă blai ƀing gih yua mơ̆ng tơlơi thâo krăn Ơi Adai laih anŭn Yêsu, Khua Yang ƀing ta!
As his divine power has given to us all things which relate to life and godliness, through the knowledge of him that has called us by glory and virtue, @ Tơlơi dưi mơyang Ơi Adai hmâo brơi laih kơ ƀing ta abih bang tơlơi mơnơ̆ng ta khŏm hmâo kiăng kơ dưi hmâo tơlơi hơdip laih anŭn tơlơi thâo pơpŭ kơ Ơi Adai, găn mơ̆ng tơlơi thâo krăn Ñu jing Pô hmâo iâu laih ƀing ta kiăng pha brơi kơ ƀing ta tơlơi guh kơang laih anŭn tơlơi hiam klă Ñu. 
through which he has given to us the greatest and precious promises, that through these ye may become partakers of [the] divine nature, having escaped the corruption that is in the world through lust. @ Mơ̆ng tơlơi anŭn, Ñu pha brơi ƀing ta khul tơlơi ƀuăn prŏng prin laih anŭn yom, kiăng kơ mơ̆ng khul tơlơi anŭn ƀing gih dưi klaih mơ̆ng tơlơi răm rơngiă amăng lŏn tơnah yua kơ tơlơi amoaih hưp ba rai, laih anŭn dưi jing ƀing hrŏm hơbĭt mă tŭ kơnuih mơyang Ñu. 
But for this very reason also, using therewith all diligence, in your faith have also virtue, in virtue knowledge, @ Yua kơ tơlơi anŭn yơh ƀing gih khŏm gir hăng abih pran jua kiăng thim pran jua hiam klă kơ tơlơi đaŏ, thim tơlơi thâo hluh kơ pran jua hiam klă. 
in knowledge temperance, in temperance endurance, in endurance godliness, @ Thim tơlơi djơ̆ hơnơ̆ng kơ tơlơi thâo hluh, thim tơlơi thâo gir kơ tơlơi djơ̆ hơnơ̆ng, thim pran jua thâo pơpŭ kơ tơlơi thâo gir. 
in godliness brotherly love, in brotherly love love: @ Thim tơlơi khăp tơdruă adơi ayŏng kơ tơlơi thâo pơpŭ kơ Ơi Adai, thim pran jua khăp kơ tơlơi khăp tơdruă adơi ayŏng. 
for these things existing and abounding in you make [you] to be neither idle nor unfruitful as regards the knowledge of our Lord Jesus Christ; @ Yua kơ tơdah ƀing gih hmâo abih khul tơlơi anŭn, laih anŭn hmâo rơbeh blai, tơlơi anŭn či ngă brơi kơ ƀing gih hmâo tơlơi dưi, laih anŭn hmâo boh than amăng tơlơi thâo krăn Yêsu Krist Khua Yang ƀing ta. 
for he with whom these things are not present is blind, short-sighted, and has forgotten the purging of his former sins. @ Yua kơ hlơi pô kơƀah khul tơlơi anŭn, ñu jing mơnuih thâo ƀuh jĕ đôč, mơnuih bum, wơr bĭt hĭ Ơi Adai hmâo pơrơgoh laih ñu mơ̆ng khul tơlơi soh so hơđăp. 
Wherefore the rather, brethren, use diligence to make your calling and election sure, for doing these things ye will never fall; @ Tui anŭn Ơ ƀing adơi ayŏng, brơi ƀing gih gir kơtir hloh dơ̆ng kiăng pơklă tơlơi Ơi Adai iâu laih anŭn ruah mă ƀing gih; ngă tui anŭn ƀing gih ƀu či tơhnač rơbuh ôh. 
for thus shall the entrance into the everlasting kingdom of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ be richly furnished unto you. @ Tui anŭn, jơlan mŭt amăng dêh čar pơtao hlŏng lar Khua Yang ƀing ta laih anŭn Yêsu Krist Pô Pơklaih či pŏk rơhaih rơhông kơ ƀing gih.
Wherefore I will be careful to put you always in mind of these things, although knowing [them] and established in the present truth. @ Yua kơ anŭn yơh, kâo či pơhơdơr ƀing gih nanao kơ khul tơlơi anŭn, wơ̆t dah ƀing gih thâo laih, laih anŭn hlăk dŏ kơjăp amăng tơlơi sĭt ƀing gih hmâo mă tŭ. 
But I account it right, as long as I am in this tabernacle, to stir you up by putting [you] in remembrance, @ Kâo pơmĭn jing djơ̆ yơh, hơdôm sui kâo ăt dŏ hơdip amăng drơi jan anai, kâo khŏm pơhơdơr ƀing gih kiăng râo mơdưh ƀing gih, 
knowing that the putting off of my tabernacle is speedily [to take place], as also our Lord Jesus Christ has manifested to me; @ yua kơ kâo thâo sĭt ƀu sui dơ̆ng ôh kâo či tơbiă đuaĭ mơ̆ng drơi jan thâo djai anai, tui hăng Khua Yang ƀing ta Yêsu Krist, hmâo bơrơđah laih kơ kâo. 
but I will use diligence, that after my departure ye should have also, at any time, [in your power] to call to mind these things. @ Samơ̆ kâo či gir kiăng kơ giơ̆ng kơ kâo tơbiă đuaĭ laih, ƀing gih ăt hơdơr nanao khul tơlơi anai.
For we have not made known to you the power and coming of our Lord Jesus Christ, following cleverly imagined fables, but having been eyewitnesses of *his* majesty. @ Tơdang ƀing gơmơi ruai pơrơđah kơ ƀing gih thâo tơlơi dưi mơyang laih anŭn tơlơi Yêsu Krist Khua Yang ƀing ta trŭn rai dơ̆ng, ƀing gơmơi ƀu tui hluai khul tơlơi ră ruai arăng pơčeh mă ôh, samơ̆ ƀing gơmơi hmâo ƀuh laih tơlơi guh kơang Ñu hăng mơta gơmơi pô. 
For he received from God [the] Father honour and glory, such a voice being uttered to him by the excellent glory: This is my beloved Son, in whom *I* have found my delight; @ Yua kơ Ñu hmâo mă tŭ laih tơlơi pơpŭ laih anŭn tơlơi guh kơang mơ̆ng Ơi Adai, jing Ama, tơ hmâo asăp mơ̆ng Pô Guh Kơang Hloh laĭ hăng Ñu: “Anai jing Ană Kâo khăp hơeng biă mă; amăng Ñu Kâo hmâo tơlơi mơak biă mă,” 
and this voice *we* heard uttered from heaven, being with him on the holy mountain. @ Gơmơi pô hmâo hmư̆ laih asăp anai mơ̆ng adai, hlăk ƀing gơmơi dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Ñu ƀơi čư̆ rơgoh hiam. 
And we have the prophetic word [made] surer, to which ye do well taking heed (as to a lamp shining in an obscure place) until [the] day dawn and [the] morning star arise in your hearts; @ Tui anŭn, boh pơhiăp laĭ lui hlâo ƀing gơmơi hmâo jai pơklă sĭt hloh dơ̆ng. Brơi ƀing gih pơmĭn kơ boh pơhiăp anai kar hăng apui kơđen pơčrang amăng anih kơnăm mơmŏt, tơl tơhrơi rơđah laih anŭn tơlơi bơngač pơtŭ sêng mơguah čăt amăng pran jua ƀing gih. 
knowing this first, that [the scope of] no prophecy of scripture is had from its own particular interpretation, @ Hlâo hloh, ƀing gih khŏm thâo hluh tơlơi anai: ƀu hmâo hlơi dưi pơblang boh pơhiăp laĭ lui hlâo amăng Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp tui hăng tơlơi pơmĭn gơñu pô, 
for prophecy was not ever uttered by [the] will of man, but holy men of God spake under the power of [the] Holy Spirit. @ yua kơ ƀu hmâo boh pơhiăp laĭ lui hlâo pă tơbiă rai mơ̆ng tơlơi pơmĭn ană mơnuih ôh, samơ̆ Yang Bơngăt Hiam pơtrŭt mơnuih pơhiăp boh pơhiăp tơbiă mơ̆ng Ơi Adai.
But there were false prophets also among the people, as there shall be also among you false teachers, who shall bring in by the bye destructive heresies, and deny the master that bought them, bringing upon themselves swift destruction; @ Samơ̆ kar kaĭ mơ̆n hmâo laih lu ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo ƀlor amăng ană plei pla, laih anŭn ăt či hmâo mơ̆n ƀing pô pơtô ƀlor amăng ƀing gih. Hăng tơlơi hơgơ̆m gơñu či pơtô khul mơta tơlơi đaŏ soh ba tơlơi răm rai, laih anŭn hơngah lui Khua Yang Pô hmâo song mă ƀing gơñu, gơñu či tŭ mă tañ tơlơi pơrai. 
and many shall follow their dissolute ways, through whom the way of the truth shall be blasphemed. @ Lu mơnuih či tui hluai jơlan tơlơi hrah hrong gơñu, laih anŭn yua kơ ƀing gơñu arăng či pơhiăp sat kơ jơlan tơlơi sĭt. 
And through covetousness, with well-turned words, will they make merchandise of you: for whom judgment of old is not idle, and their destruction slumbers not. @ Yua kơ pran jua hưp ham, gơñu yua khul boh pơhiăp pơčeh ƀlor kiăng ƀơ̆ng dram gơnam ƀing gih; mơ̆ng sui tơlơi phat kơđi hmâo pơkra laih kơ gơñu, laih anŭn tơlơi pơrai pioh brơi kơ gơñu ƀu pơdơi ôh.
For if God spared not [the] angels who had sinned, but having cast them down to the deepest pit of gloom has delivered them to chains of darkness [to be] kept for judgment; @ Yua kơ tơdah Ơi Adai ƀu pap brơi ôh kơ ƀing ling jang tơdang gơñu ngă soh, samơ̆ glŏm hĭ gơñu amăng war apui, laih anŭn kơ̆ng pioh gơñu amăng anih kơnăm mơmŏt, tơl truh Hrơi Phat Kơđi. 
and spared not [the] old world, but preserved Noe, [the] eighth, a preacher of righteousness, having brought in [the] flood upon [the] world of [the] ungodly; @ Laih anŭn tơdah Ơi Adai ƀu pap brơi ôh lŏn tơnah đưm, samơ̆ Ñu brơi ia lip truh kơ lŏn tơnah ƀu thâo hwĭ pơpŭ kơ Ơi Adai, Ñu pơklaih kơnơ̆ng hơjăn Nôê, sa čô pô pơtô kơ tơlơi tơpă, hrŏm hơbĭt hăng tơjuh čô pơkŏn; 
and having reduced [the] cities of Sodom and Gomorrha to ashes, condemned [them] with an overthrow, setting [them as] an example to those that should [afterwards] live an ungodly life; @ tơdah Ñu hmâo pơkơhmal hĭ laih plei Sôđôm hăng plei Gômôrơ, ngă brơi gơñu jing hĭ hơbâo tơpur kiăng kơ ngă tơlơi bơhmutu kơ arăng thâo hơgĕt tơlơi či truh kơ ƀing ƀu thâo hwĭ pơpŭ kơ Ơi Adai. 
and saved righteous Lot, distressed with the abandoned conversation of the godless, @ Laih anŭn tơdah Ñu hmâo pơklaih laih Lot, jing mơnuih tơpă hơnơ̆ng ruă pran jua biă mă yua kơ tơlơi dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă hrah hrong kơ ƀing mơnuih soh sat anŭn 
(for the righteous man through seeing and hearing, dwelling among them, tormented [his] righteous soul day after day with [their] lawless works,) @ (yua kơ mơnuih tơpă hơnơ̆ng anai dŏ hơdip tơ̆ng krah ƀing gơñu, rĭm hrơi bơngăt jua tơpă hơnơ̆ng ñu ruă rơngot yua kơ khul bruă ngă soh sat ƀing gơñu). 
[the] Lord knows [how] to deliver the godly out of trial, and to keep [the] unjust to [the] day of judgment [to be] punished; @ Tui anŭn Khua Yang thâo ngă hyư̆m pă kiăng pơklaih ƀing mơnuih thâo pơpŭ kơ Ơi Adai mơ̆ng tơlơi lông lăng, laih anŭn djă kơ̆ng ƀing mơnuih ƀu tơpă gah yŭ tơlơi pơkơhmal tơl truh Hrơi Phat Kơđi, 
and specially those who walk after the flesh in [the] lust of uncleanness, and despise lordship. Bold [are they], self-willed; they do not fear speaking injuriously of dignities: @ biă mă ñu kơ ƀing pơhluai tui tơlơi amoaih hưp soh sat kơ asar đeh, laih anŭn mưč mač tơlơi dưi Ơi Adai.
Ƀing anŭn jing ƀing kơpĭl laih anŭn pơgao, ƀu hwĭ ôh hơtoh djraĭ kơ ƀing guh kơang; 
when angels, who are greater in might and power, do not bring against them, before the Lord, an injurious charge. @ wơ̆t kơ ƀing ling jang, jing ƀing kơtang laih anŭn mơyang hloh, ƀu khĭn ôh pơhiăp hơtoh djraĭ kơ ƀing anŭn hăng tơlơi phong kơđi gơñu ƀơi anăp Khua Yang. 
But these, as natural animals without reason, made to be caught and destroyed, speaking injuriously in things they are ignorant of, shall also perish in their own corruption, @ Samơ̆ ƀing gơñu jing kar hăng hlô glai ƀu thâo phe pho, hơdip tui hăng kơnuih gơñu jing, tơkeng rai pioh kơ arăng mă laih anŭn ngă añăm, ƀing anŭn hơtoh djraĭ wơ̆t kơ hơgĕt khul tơlơi gơñu ƀu thâo, ăt či răm rai kar hăng hlô mơnơ̆ng anŭn mơ̆n. 
receiving [the] reward of unrighteousness; accounting ephemeral indulgence pleasure; spots and blemishes, rioting in their own deceits, feasting with you; @ Gơñu či mă tŭ tơlơi apah yua mơ̆ng bruă ngă ƀu tơpă. Gơñu lăng tơlơi ngă tă tăn tơdang tơhrơi jing tơlơi mơak. Gơñu jing khul gru grĭ, gru hơƀak, hơ̆k mơak hăng djŏp mơta tơlơi ƀlor, tơdang dŏ ber ƀơ̆ng huă hrŏm hăng ƀing gih; 
having eyes full of adultery, and that cease not from sin, alluring unestablished souls; having a heart practised in covetousness, children of curse; @ mơta gơñu bă hăng tơlơi pơmĭn pyu pơde, laih anŭn ngă soh ƀu thâo hrăp ôh. Gơñu plư ƀing mơnuih pran jua đêl, pran jua gơñu bă hăng tơlơi hưp ham. Gơñu jing ƀing ană bă năng lăp hơtơ̆m pah! 
having left [the] straight way they have gone astray, having followed in the path of Balaam [the son] of Bosor, who loved [the] reward of unrighteousness; @ Gơñu hơngah lui laih jơlan tơpă, hnŭn yơh gơñu jrok jơlan. Gơñu tui hluai laih jơlan Balaam ană đah rơkơi Bôsôr, jing pô khăp nua apah kơ bruă ngă soh. 
but had reproof of his own wickedness [the] dumb ass speaking with man's voice forbad the folly of the prophet. @ Samơ̆ Ơi Adai hmâo ƀuah laih Balaam yua kơ tơlơi soh ñu; sa drơi aseh kle kơmlô pơhiăp hăng hiăp mơnuih khă găn tơlơi hưt mlŭk pô laĭ lui hlâo anŭn.
These are springs without water, and mists driven by storm, to whom the gloom of darkness is reserved [for ever]. @ Ƀing anŭn jing akŏ ia thu, kar hăng kơthul angĭn rơbŭ pơpuh pơđung hyu; Ơi Adai pioh laih kơ gơñu tơlơi kơnăm mơmŏt tĭt. 
For [while] speaking great highflown words of vanity, they allure with [the] lusts of [the] flesh, by dissoluteness, those who have just fled those who walk in error, @ Yua kơ gơñu pơhiăp khul tơlơi pơ-ư pơang đôč đač, yua khul tơlơi amoaih hưp soh sat asar đeh gơñu plư ƀing mơnuih phrâo tơbiă đuaĭ mơ̆ng tơngan ƀing hơdip jrok jơlan. 
promising them liberty, while they themselves are slaves of corruption; for by whom a man is subdued, by him is he also brought into slavery. @ Gơñu ƀuăn brơi tơlơi rơngai kơ arăng, samơ̆ gơñu pô jing hlŭn kơ tơlơi răm rai. Yua kơ tơlơi hơgĕt dưi laih hăng sa čô mơnuih, mơnuih anŭn jing hĭ hlŭn kơ tơlơi anŭn yơh. 
For if after having escaped the pollutions of the world through [the] knowledge of the Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ, again entangled, they are subdued by these, their last state is worse than the first. @ Yua kơ tơdah mơ̆ng tơlơi thâo krăn Khua Yang laih anŭn Pô Pơklaih ƀing ta jing Yêsu Krist gơñu klaih laih mơ̆ng tơlơi hơƀak drak lŏn tơnah, samơ̆ ră anai gơñu lĕ glaĭ amăng tơlơi hơƀak drak laih anŭn khŏm tui gưt khul tơlơi anŭn sa wơ̆t dơ̆ng, tơlơi hơdip ƀing mơnuih anŭn jing sat răm hloh kơ hlâo yơh. 
For it were better for them not to have known the way of righteousness, than having known [it] to turn back from the holy commandment delivered to them. @ Hiam hloh gơñu ƀu thâo jơlan tơlơi tơpă ôh hăng giơ̆ng kơ gơñu thâo samơ̆ gơñu wir lui hĭ mơ̆ng tơlơi juăt rơgoh hiam hmâo pơtô laih kơ gơñu. 
But that [word] of the true proverb has happened to them: [The] dog [has] turned back to his own vomit; and, [The] washed sow to [her] rolling in mud. @ Tơlơi truh kơ ƀing gơñu djơ̆ sĭt kar hăng boh pơhiăp arăng juăt laĭ: “Asâo ƀơ̆ng glaĭ dơ̆ng mơnơ̆ng ñu hmâo pơtah” laih anŭn “Bơbui mơnơi rơgoh laih, pŭk glaĭ hlŭ dơ̆ng.”
This, a second letter, beloved, I already write to you, in [both] which I stir up, in the way of putting you in remembrance, your pure mind, @ Ơ ƀing kâo khăp hơeng, anai jing hră mơit tal dua kâo čih kơ ƀing gih. Amăng abih dua hră mơit anŭn, kâo leng kơ pơhơdơr kiăng kơ râo mơdưh tơlơi pơmĭn tơpă hơnơ̆ng amăng ƀing gih. 
to be mindful of the words spoken before by the holy prophets, and of the commandment of the Lord and Saviour by your apostles; @ Kâo kiăng ƀing gih hơdơr glaĭ khul boh pơhiăp ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo rơgoh hiam hmâo laĭ lui hlâo laih đưm adih, laih anŭn khul tơlơi pơtă Khua Yang laih anŭn Pô Pơklaih ƀing ta hmâo yua ƀing khua ding kơna pơtô laih. 
knowing this first, that there shall come at [the] close of the days mockers with mocking, walking according to their own lusts, @ Hlâo kơ abih bang, ƀing gih khŏm thâo hluh tơlơi anai: amăng khul hrơi hnal tuč hmâo ƀing djik djak či rai hăng boh pơhiăp plar ngơr, hơdip tui hăng tơlơi ñu pô amoaih hưp. 
and saying, Where is the promise of his coming? for from the time the fathers fell asleep all things remain thus from [the] beginning of [the] creation. @ Gơñu či laĭ: “Pơpă lĕ tơlơi ƀuăn kơ tơlơi Ñu rai dơ̆ng? Yua kơ mơ̆ng ƀing ơi adon ƀing ta djai, abih mơnơ̆ng ăt dŏ hơnơ̆ng kar hăng rơnŭk čơdơ̆ng phŭn hrih đôč.” 
For this is hidden from them through their own wilfulness, that heavens were of old, and an earth, having its subsistence out of water and in water, by the word of God, @ Gơñu prơ̆ng kiăng wơr bĭt tơlơi sĭt anai: mơ̆ng sui laih Ơi Adai hmâo pơjing adai laih anŭn lŏn tơnah hăng boh pơhiăp Ñu Pô, lŏn tơnah hmâo tơbiă rai mơ̆ng ia laih anŭn yua mơ̆ng ia. 
through which [waters] the then world, deluged with water, perished. @ Laih anŭn ăt yua mơ̆ng ia mơ̆n, lŏn tơnah rơnŭk anŭn ia lip hĭ laih anŭn răm rai. 
But the present heavens and the earth by his word are laid up in store, kept for fire unto a day of judgment and destruction of ungodly men. @ Samơ̆ hăng boh pơhiăp anŭn mơ̆n khul adai laih anŭn lŏn tơnah ră anai Ơi Adai hmâo pioh brơi laih kơ apui, laih anŭn djă pioh tơl truh hrơi phat kơđi laih anŭn pơrai ƀing ƀu hwĭ pơpŭ kơ Ơi Adai.
But let not this one thing be hidden from you, beloved, that one day with [the] Lord [is] as a thousand years, and a thousand years as one day. @  Samơ̆ ơ ƀing kâo khăp hơeng, anăm wơr bĭt ôh tơlơi anai, ƀơi anăp Khua Yang sa hrơi jing kar hăng sa rơbâo thŭn, laih anŭn sa rơbâo thŭn jing kar hăng sa hrơi. 
[The] Lord does not delay his promise, as some account of delay, but is longsuffering towards you, not willing that any should perish, but that all should come to repentance. @ Khua Yang ƀu kaih ôh pơsĭt tơlơi Ñu ƀuăn kar hăng đơđa mơnuih pơmĭn, samơ̆ Ñu dŏ gir hăng ƀing gih, ƀu kiăng sa čô hlơi či răm rơngiă ôh, samơ̆ kiăng kơ abih bang leng kơ kơhmal tơlơi soh. 
But the day of [the] Lord will come as a thief, in which the heavens will pass away with a rushing noise, and [the] elements, burning with heat, shall be dissolved, and [the] earth and the works in it shall be burnt up. @ Samơ̆ hrơi Khua Yang či rai kar hăng sa čô mơnuih klĕ, hlăk anŭn khul adai či rơngiă hĭ thĕng hăng dơnai kơtang, khul mơnơ̆ng amăng adai či lik hĭ amăng apui, lŏn tơnah wơ̆t abih bruă arăng ngă amăng anŭn apui či ƀơ̆ng abih.
All these things then being to be dissolved, what ought ye to be in holy conversation and godliness, @ Yua kơ abih bang mơnơ̆ng anŭn či răm rai hĭ, hnŭn yơh brơi kơ ƀing gih khŏm hơdip hăng tơlơi hơdip rơgoh hiam laih anŭn thâo hwĭ pơpŭ kơ Ơi Adai, 
waiting for and hastening the coming of the day of God, by reason of which [the] heavens, being on fire, shall be dissolved, and [the] elements, burning with heat, shall melt? @ tơdang ƀing gih dŏ tơguan hrơi Khua Yang brơi ƀing gih ngă hăng abih pran jua kiăng kơ hrơi anŭn tañ truh. Anŭn jing hrơi apui či ƀơ̆ng laih anŭn răm rai hĭ khul adai, khul mơnơ̆ng amăng anŭn či lik hĭ amăng apui! 
But, according to his promise, we wait for new heavens and a new earth, wherein dwells righteousness. @ Samơ̆ tui hăng tơlơi Ñu ƀuăn, ƀing ta dŏ tơguan khul adai phrâo laih anŭn lŏn tơnah phrâo jing anih tơlơi tơpă wai lăng.
Wherefore, beloved, as ye wait for these things, be diligent to be found of him in peace, without spot and blameless; @ Tui anŭn, ơ ƀing kâo khăp hơeng, tơdang ƀing gih dŏ tơguan khul tơlơi anŭn, ƀing gih khŏm gir kơtir hăng abih pran jua kiăng kơ Ñu ƀuh ƀing gih ƀu hmâo grĭ grañ, ƀu hmâo tơlơi hơgĕt năng lăp ƀuah laih anŭn hơdip amăng tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua. 
and account the longsuffering of our Lord [to be] salvation; according as our beloved brother Paul also has written to you according to the wisdom given to him, @ Brơi ƀing gih hơdơr bĕ tơlơi gir Khua Yang ƀing ta jing yua kơ tơlơi pơklaih ƀing gih. Kar hăng Pôl, ayŏng pô ƀing ta khăp hơeng, hmâo čih laih kơ ƀing gih tui hăng tơlơi kơhnâo Ơi Adai hmâo brơi laih kơ ñu. 
as also in all [his] epistles, speaking in them of these things; among which some things are hard to be understood, which the untaught and ill-established wrest, as also the other scriptures, to their own destruction. @ Amăng abih hră ñu čih, ñu pơhiăp laih kơ tơlơi anŭn. Amăng hră anŭn hmâo đơđa tơlơi čih tơnap hluh, ƀing mlŭk laih anŭn ƀing ƀu kơjăp pơblang soh, kar hăng ƀing gơñu pơblang soh anih pơkŏn amăng Hră Ơi Adai Pơhiăp, jing mă tŭ tơlơi pơrai kơ ƀing gơñu pô. 
*Ye* therefore, beloved, knowing [these] things before, take care lest, being led away along with the error of the wicked, ye should fall from your own stedfastness: @ Ơ ƀing kâo khăp hơeng, yua kơ ƀing gih thâo hlâo laih tơlơi anŭn; tui anŭn, răng bĕ hwĭ dah ƀing soh sat či ba pơđuaĭ ƀing gih hăng tơlơi jrok jơlan gơñu, laih anŭn ƀing gih rơngiă tơlơi kơjăp ƀing gih. 
but grow in grace, and in [the] knowledge of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ. To him [be] glory both now and to [the] day of eternity. Amen. @ Samơ̆ brơi ƀing gih rai kơ prŏng bĕ amăng tơlơi pap laih anŭn tơlơi thâo krăn Khua Yang Pô Pơklaih ƀing ta Yêsu Krist. Kơ ñu yơh tơlơi guh kơang, ră anai laih anŭn nanao hlŏng lar. Amen.
That which was from [the] beginning, that which we have heard, which we have seen with our eyes; that which we contemplated, and our hands handled, concerning the word of life; @  Gơmơi čih kơ ƀing gih kơ Boh Pơhiăp Tơlơi Hơdip, jing tơlơi hmâo laih mơ̆ng phŭn blŭng, tơlơi gơmơi hmâo hmư̆ laih, tơlơi mơta gơmơi hmâo ƀuh laih, tơlơi gơmơi hmâo lăng laih, laih anŭn tơngan gơmơi hmâo ruaih laih. 
(and the life has been manifested, and we have seen, and bear witness, and report to you the eternal life, which was with the Father, and has been manifested to us:) @ Tơlơi hơdip anŭn hmâo bơrơđah laih, gơmơi hmâo ƀuh laih tơlơi hơdip anŭn, laih anŭn ngă gơ̆ng jơlan pơsĭt kơ ñu, hnŭn yơh gơmơi pơhaih kơ ƀing gih tơlơi hơdip hlŏng lar anŭn hmâo dŏ laih hrŏm hăng Ama, laih anŭn hmâo bơrơđah laih kơ gơmơi. 
that which we have seen and heard we report to you, that *ye* also may have fellowship with us; and our fellowship [is] indeed with the Father, and with his Son Jesus Christ. @ Tơlơi gơmơi hmâo ƀuh laih anŭn hmư̆ laih, gơmơi ăt pơhaih kơ ƀing gih mơ̆n, kiăng kơ ƀing gih dưi hmâo tơlơi pơgop hăng gơmơi, laih anŭn ƀing ta hmâo tơlơi pơgop hăng Ama laih anŭn hăng Ană Ñu Yêsu Krist. 
And these things write we to you that your joy may be full. @ Gơmơi čih tơlơi anai kơ ƀing gih kiăng kơ tơlơi mơak ƀing ta jing klă tum.
And this is the message which we have heard from him, and declare to you, that God is light, and in him is no darkness at all. @ Anai jing tơlơi pơtô gơmơi hmâo hmư̆ laih mơ̆ng Ñu laih anŭn pơhaih kơ ƀing gih: Ơi Adai jing tơlơi bơngač, amăng Ñu ƀu hmâo kơnăm mơmŏt ôh. 
If we say that we have fellowship with him, and walk in darkness, we lie, and do not practise the truth. @ Tơdah ƀing ta laĭ ƀing ta hmâo tơlơi pơgop hăng Ñu samơ̆ ƀing ta ăt rơbat amăng tơlơi kơnăm mơmŏt, ƀing ta ƀlor yơh laih anŭn ƀu ngă tui tơlơi sĭt ôh. 
But if we walk in the light as *he* is in the light, we have fellowship with one another, and the blood of Jesus Christ his Son cleanses us from all sin. @ Samơ̆ tơdah ƀing ta rơbat amăng tơlơi bơngač kar hăng Ñu dŏ amăng tơlơi bơngač, anŭn yơh ƀing ta hmâo tơlơi lir pơgop tơdruă, laih anŭn drah Yêsu, Ană Ñu pơrơgoh hĭ ƀing ta mơ̆ng abih bang tơlơi soh. 
If we say that we have no sin, we deceive ourselves, and the truth is not in us. @ Tơdah ƀing ta laĭ ƀing ta ƀu hmâo tơlơi soh ôh, ƀing ta pơƀlor ƀing ta pô yơh, laih anŭn tơlơi sĭt ƀu dŏ amăng ƀing ta ôh. 
If we confess our sins, he is faithful and righteous to forgive us [our] sins, and cleanse us from all unrighteousness. @ Samơ̆ tơdah ƀing ta pơhaih tơlơi soh ƀing ta, Ñu jing Pô hơnơ̆ng ten laih anŭn tơpă, či pap brơi tơlơi soh ƀing ta laih anŭn pơrơgoh hĭ ƀing ta mơ̆ng abih bang tơlơi wĕ wŏ. 
If we say that we have not sinned, we make him a liar, and his word is not in us. @ Tơdah ƀing ta laĭ ƀing ta ƀu ngă soh djơ̆ ôh, ƀing ta pơjing Ñu jing pô ƀlor laih anŭn boh pơhiăp Ñu ƀu dŏ amăng ƀing ta ôh.
My children, these things I write to you in order that ye may not sin; and if any one sin, we have a patron with the Father, Jesus Christ [the] righteous; @ Ơ ƀing ană anĕt kâo, kâo čih tơlơi anai kơ ƀing gih kiăng kơ ƀing gih ƀu ngă soh ôh. Samơ̆ tơdah hmâo hlơi pô ngă soh, ƀing ta hmâo sa čô Pô Pơhiăp Pơgăl brơi ƀing ta ƀơi anăp Ama, jing Khua Yang Yêsu Krist, Pô tơpă klă. 
and *he* is the propitiation for our sins; but not for ours alone, but also for the whole world. @ Ñu Pô jing mơnơ̆ng ngă yang song mă tơlơi soh ƀing ta, laih anŭn ƀu djơ̆ kơnơ̆ng kơ tơlơi soh ƀing ta đôč ôh, samơ̆ wơ̆t kơ tơlơi soh abih lŏn tơnah mơ̆n.
And hereby we know that we know him, if we keep his commandments. @ Tơdah ƀing ta gưt tơlơi Ñu pơtă, hăng tơlơi anai ƀing ta dưi thâo sĭt kơ ƀing ta thâo krăn laih Ñu. 
He that says, I know him, and does not keep his commandments, is a liar, and the truth is not in him; @ Hlơi pô laĭ: “Kâo thâo krăn Ñu,” samơ̆ ƀu gưt ôh tơlơi Ñu pơtă, mơnuih anŭn jing sa čô pô ƀlor yơh, laih anŭn tơlơi sĭt ƀu dŏ amăng ñu ôh. 
but whoever keeps his word, in him verily the love of God is perfected. Hereby we know that we are in him. @ Samơ̆ hlơi pô gưt boh pơhiăp Ñu, tơlơi ñu khăp kơ Ơi Adai jing klă tum yơh. Hăng tơlơi anai yơh ƀing ta dưi thâo sĭt kơ ƀing ta dŏ amăng Ñu. 
He that says he abides in him ought, even as *he* walked, himself also [so] to walk. @ Hlơi pô laĭ ñu dŏ amăng Yêsu, brơi ñu khŏm hơdip kar hăng Yêsu hmâo hơdip laih.
Beloved, I write no new commandment to you, but an old commandment, which ye have had from the beginning. The old commandment is the word which ye heard. @  Ơ ƀing kâo khăp hơeng, kâo ƀu čih kơ ƀing gih tơlơi pơtă phrâo ôh, samơ̆ tơlơi pơtă hơđăp ƀing gih hmâo laih mơ̆ng phŭn blŭng. Tơlơi pơtă hơđăp anŭn jing boh pơhiăp ƀing gih hmâo hmư̆ laih. 
Again, I write a new commandment to you, which thing is true in him and in you, because the darkness is passing and the true light already shines. @ Samơ̆ kâo ăt čih mơ̆n kơ ƀing gih sa tơlơi pơtă phrâo, jing tơlơi sĭt amăng Ñu laih anŭn amăng ƀing gih, yua kơ tơlơi mơmŏt hmâo đuaĭ laih, tơlơi bơngač sĭt hlăk dŏ pơčrang. 
He who says he is in the light, and hates his brother, is in the darkness until now. @ Hlơi pô laĭ ñu dŏ amăng tơlơi bơngač samơ̆ bơrơmŭt kơ adơi ayŏng ñu, ñu anŭn ăt dŏ amăng tơlơi kơnăm mơmŏt yơh. 
He that loves his brother abides in light, and there is no occasion of stumbling in him. @ Hlơi pô khăp kơ adơi ayŏng ñu, ñu anŭn dŏ amăng tơlơi bơngač, laih anŭn amăng pô anŭn ƀu hmâo tơlơi hơgĕt ngă brơi arăng tơhnač ôh. 
But he that hates his brother is in the darkness, and walks in the darkness, and knows not where he goes, because the darkness has blinded his eyes. @ Samơ̆ hlơi pô bơrơmŭt kơ adơi ayŏng ñu, pô anŭn ăt dŏ amăng tơlơi kơnăm mơmŏt, rơbat amăng tơlơi kơnăm mơmŏt, laih anŭn ƀu thâo ôh pơpă anih ñu nao, yua kơ tơlơi kơnăm mơmŏt ngă bum hĭ laih mơta ñu.
I write to you, children, because [your] sins are forgiven you for his name's sake. @ Ơ ƀing ană anĕt, kâo čih kơ ƀing gih, yua kơ tơlơi soh ƀing gih Ơi Adai hmâo pap brơi laih yua mơ̆ng Anăn Krist. 
I write to you, fathers, because ye have known him [that is] from the beginning. I write to you, young men, because ye have overcome the wicked [one]. I write to you, little children, because ye have known the Father. @ Ơ ƀing ama, kâo čih kơ ƀing gih, yua kơ ƀing gih thâo krăn laih Pô jing mơ̆ng phŭn blŭng. Ơ ƀing hlăk ai, kâo čih kơ ƀing gih yua kơ ƀing gih dưi laih hăng Pô sat. 
I have written to you, fathers, because ye have known him [that is] from the beginning. I have written to you, young men, because ye are strong, and the word of God abides in you, and ye have overcome the wicked [one]. @ Ơ ƀing ană anĕt, kâo čih kơ ƀing gih, yua kơ ƀing gih thâo krăn laih Ama. Ơ ƀing ama, kâo čih kơ ƀing gih, yua kơ ƀing gih thâo krăn laih Pô hmâo mơ̆ng phŭn blŭng. Ơ ƀing hlăk ai, kâo čih kơ ƀing gih, yua kơ ƀing gih jing kơtang, boh pơhiăp Ơi Adai dŏ amăng ƀing gih, laih anŭn ƀing gih dưi laih hăng Pô sat.
Love not the world, nor the things in the world. If any one love the world, the love of the Father is not in him; @ Anăm khăp kơ lŏn tơnah ƀôdah hơgĕt mơnơ̆ng lơ̆m kơ lŏn tơnah ôh. Tơdah hlơi pô khăp kơ lŏn tơnah, tơlơi khăp Ama ƀu dŏ amăng ñu ôh. 
because all that [is] in the world, the lust of the flesh, and the lust of the eyes, and the pride of life, is not of the Father, but is of the world. @ Yua kơ abih bang tơlơi mơnơ̆ng amăng lŏn tơnah kar hăng tơlơi đeh asar amoaih, tơlơi mơta hưp kiăng, tơlơi pơgao kơ tơlơi hơdip, ƀu tơbiă rai mơ̆ng Ama ôh samơ̆ mơ̆ng lŏn tơnah. 
And the world is passing, and its lust, but he that does the will of God abides for eternity. @ Lŏn tơnah laih anŭn khul tơlơi amoaih sat ñu či rơgao hĭ, samơ̆ hlơi pô ngă tui tơlơi Ơi Adai kiăng dŏ hơdip hlŏng lar.
Little children, it is [the] last hour, and, according as ye have heard that antichrist comes, even now there have come many antichrists, whence we know that it is [the] last hour. @ Ơ ƀing ană anĕt, anai jing mông hnal tuč; laih anŭn kar hăng ƀing gih hmâo hmư̆ laih pô ayăt hăng Yang Krist khŏm rai, laih anŭn ră anai hmâo lu ƀing pơkơdơ̆ng hăng Yang Krist truh laih. Yua kơ anŭn yơh, ƀing ta thâo anai jing mông hnal tuč. 
They went out from among us, but they were not of us; for if they had been of us, they would have surely remained with us, but that they might be made manifest that none are of us. @ Gơñu tơbiă mơ̆ng ƀing ta, samơ̆ gơñu ƀu lơ̆m kơ ƀing ta ôh; yua kơ tơdah gơñu lơ̆m kơ ƀing ta, gơñu ăt khŏm dŏ hrŏm hăng ƀing ta. Samơ̆ ƀing gơñu tơbiă đuaĭ laih mơ̆ng ƀing ta, tơlơi anŭn pơklă ƀing gơñu ƀu lơ̆m kơ ƀing ta ôh.
And *ye* have [the] unction from the holy [one], and ye know all things. @ Samơ̆ ƀing gih hmâo tŭ laih tơlơi truač ia jâu mơ̆ng Pô Rơgoh Hiam, laih anŭn abih bang ƀing gih leng kơ hmâo tơlơi thâo hluh soh sel. 
I have not written to you because ye do not know the truth, but because ye know it, and that no lie is of the truth. @ Kâo čih kơ ƀing gih, ƀu djơ̆ yua kơ ƀing gih ƀu thâo tơlơi sĭt ôh, samơ̆ yua kơ ƀing gih thâo laih tơlơi sĭt anŭn, laih anŭn ƀing gih thâo ƀu hmâo tơlơi ƀlor tơbiă mơ̆ng tơlơi sĭt ôh. 
Who is the liar but he who denies that Jesus is the Christ? *He* is the antichrist who denies the Father and the Son. @ Hlơi jing pô ƀlor lĕ? Jing pô hơngah hĭ kơ Khua Yang Yêsu jing Yang Krist yơh! Anŭn jing pô ayăt hăng Yang Krist, pô hơngah hĭ Ama laih anŭn Ană. 
Whoever denies the Son has not the Father either; he who confesses the Son has the Father also. @ Hlơi pô hơngah lui Ană jing ñu hơngah wơ̆t Ama mơ̆n. Hlơi pô tŭ jum Ană, ñu ăt tŭ jum Ama mơ̆n. 
As for *you* let that which ye have heard from the beginning abide in you: if what ye have heard from the beginning abides in you, *ye* also shall abide in the Son and in the Father. @ Brơi tơlơi ƀing gih hmâo hmư̆ laih mơ̆ng phŭn blŭng dŏ nanao amăng ƀing gih. Tơdah tơlơi ƀing gih hmâo hmư̆ laih mơ̆ng phŭn blŭng dŏ nanao amăng ƀing gih, tui anŭn ƀing gih či dŏ nanao amăng Ană laih anŭn amăng Ama. 
And this is the promise which *he* has promised us, life eternal. @ Laih anŭn tơlơi hơdip hlŏng lar jing tơlơi Ñu pô hmâo ƀuăn brơi laih kơ ƀing ta.
These things have I written to you concerning those who lead you astray: @ Kâo čih khul tơlơi anai kơ ƀing gih kiăng laĭ djơ̆ kơ ƀing mơnuih plư ƀing gih. 
and *yourselves*, the unction which ye have received from him abides in you, and ye have not need that any one should teach you; but as the same unction teaches you as to all things, and is true and is not a lie, and even as it has taught you, ye shall abide in him. @ Bơ kơ ƀing gih, tơlơi truač ia jâu ƀing gih hmâo mă tŭ laih mơ̆ng Ñu dŏ nanao amăng ƀing gih, laih anŭn ƀing gih ƀu kiăng hlơi hlơi pơtô ƀing gih dơ̆ng ôh. Yua kơ tơlơi Ñu truač ia jâu pơtô kơ ƀing gih abih bang tơlơi, laih anŭn tơlơi truač ia jâu anŭn jing sĭt, ƀu djơ̆ ƀlor ôh; tui hăng Ñu hmâo pơtô laih ƀing gih, dŏ bĕ nanao amăng Ñu.
And now, children, abide in him, that if he be manifested we may have boldness, and not be put to shame from before him at his coming. @ Ơ ƀing ană anĕt, ră anai dŏ bĕ amăng Ñu, kiăng kơ hlăk Ñu pơrơđah rai, ƀing ta dưi hmâo tơlơi hơ-ĭn kơnang, ƀu hmâo tơlơi mlâo ôh ƀơi anăp Ñu hlăk hrơi Ñu rai dơ̆ng. 
If ye know that he is righteous, know that every one who practises righteousness is begotten of him. @ Tơdah ƀing gih thâo Ñu jing tơpă, brơi kơ ƀing gih thâo mơ̆n hlơi pô ngă tơlơi tơpă jing ană Ơi Adai yơh.
See what love the Father has given to us, that we should be called [the] children of God. For this reason the world knows us not, because it knew him not. @  Lăng bĕ tơlơi khăp Ama hmâo brơi laih kơ ƀing ta jing prŏng biă mă, tơl Ñu iâu ƀing ta jing ană bă Ơi Adai; laih anŭn, sĭt yơh ƀing ta jing ană Ñu. Yua hơgĕt lŏn tơnah ƀu thâo krăn ƀing ta, yua kơ lŏn tơnah ƀu thâo krăn Ơi Adai ôh. 
Beloved, now are we children of God, and what we shall be has not yet been manifested; we know that if it is manifested we shall be like him, for we shall see him as he is. @ Ơ ƀing kâo khăp hơeng, ră anai ƀing ta jing ană bă Ơi Adai; hyư̆m ƀing ta či jing, tơlơi anŭn aka pơrơđah ôh. Samơ̆ ƀing ta thâo hlăk Ñu pơrơđah rai, ƀing ta či jing hrup hăng Ñu, yua kơ ƀing ta či ƀuh Ñu kar hăng sĭt Ñu jing. 
And every one that has this hope in him purifies himself, even as *he* is pure. @ Hlơi pô hmâo tơlơi čang rơmang kar hăng anŭn amăng Krist, ñu anŭn khŏm wai lăng ñu pô kơ rơgoh hiam, hrup hăng Krist jing pô rơgoh hơčih.
Every one that practises sin practises also lawlessness; and sin is lawlessness. @ Samơ̆ hlơi pô ngă soh jing ngă gao tơlơi juăt; yua kơ tơlơi soh jing tơlơi ngă gao tơlơi juăt. 
And ye know that *he* has been manifested that he might take away our sins; and in him sin is not. @ Ƀing gih thâo Yêsu hmâo pơrơđah rai laih kiăng mă lui hĭ tơlơi soh, laih anŭn amăng Ñu ƀu hmâo tơlơi soh ôh. 
Whoever abides in him, does not sin: whoever sins, has not seen him or known him. @ Hlơi pô dŏ amăng Ñu ƀu ngă soh ôh; samơ̆ hlơi pô ngă soh ñu anŭn aka ƀuh djơ̆ Ñu ôh, kŏn thâo krăn Ñu lơi.
Children, let no man lead you astray; he that practises righteousness is righteous, even as *he* is righteous. @ Ơ ƀing ană anĕt, anăm brơi arăng plư ƀing gih ôh. Hlơi pô ngă tơlơi tơpă jing mơnuih tơpă, kar hăng Yang Krist jing Pô tơpă. 
He that practises sin is of the devil; for from [the] beginning the devil sins. To this end the Son of God has been manifested, that he might undo the works of the devil. @ Hlơi pô ngă soh, ñu anŭn lơ̆m kơ yang sat; yua kơ yang sat hmâo ngă soh laih mơ̆ng phŭn blŭng. Ană Ơi Adai hmâo pơrơđah rai laih kiăng pơrai lui hĭ bruă yang sat. 
Whoever has been begotten of God does not practise sin, because his seed abides in him, and he cannot sin, because he has been begotten of God. @ Hlơi pô tơkeng mơ̆ng Ơi Adai, ñu ƀu ngă tơlơi soh ôh, yua kơ pơjeh Ơi Adai dŏ amăng ñu; laih anŭn ñu ƀu dưi ngă soh dơ̆ng ôh, yua kơ Ơi Adai hmâo tơkeng ñu laih. 
In this are manifest the children of God and the children of the devil. Whoever does not practise righteousness is not of God, and he who does not love his brother. @ Hăng tơlơi anai arăng dưi thâo krăn hlơi jing ană Ơi Adai laih anŭn hlơi jing ană yang sat: Hlơi pô ƀu ngă tơlơi tơpă ƀôdah ƀu khăp kơ adơi ayŏng ñu, ñu anŭn ƀu jing ană Ơi Adai ôh.
For this is the message which ye have heard from the beginning, that we should love one another: @  Anai jing tơlơi pơtô ƀing gih hmâo hmư̆ laih mơ̆ng phŭn blŭng: brơi ƀing ta khăp bĕ kơ tơdruă, 
not as Cain was of the wicked one, and slew his brother; and on account of what slew he him? because his works were wicked, and those of his brother righteous. @ anăm ƀing ta jing hrup hăng Kain ôh, pô lơ̆m kơ yang sat laih anŭn hmâo pơdjai hĭ laih adơi ñu. Yua hơgĕt Kain pơdjai adơi ñu? Yua kơ khul bruă ñu ngă jing sat laih anŭn khul bruă adơi ñu ngă jing tơpă. 
Do not wonder, brethren, if the world hate you. @ Ơ ƀing adơi ayŏng, anăm dŏ kơtuă ôh tơdah lŏn tơnah bơrơmŭt ƀing gih. 
*We* know that we have passed from death to life, because we love the brethren. He who does not love [his] brother abides in death. @ Ƀing ta thâo ƀing ta hmâo tơbiă laih mơ̆ng tơlơi djai laih anŭn mŭt amăng tơlơi hơdip, yua kơ ƀing ta khăp kơ ƀing adơi ayŏng. Hlơi pô ƀu thâo khăp ôh, ñu anŭn ăt dŏ amăng tơlơi djai. 
Every one that hates his brother is a murderer, and ye know that no murderer has eternal life abiding in him. @ Hlơi pô bơrơmŭt kơ adơi ayŏng ñu, ñu anŭn jing pô pơdjai mơnuih, laih anŭn ƀing gih thâo mơnuih pơdjai mơnuih ƀu hmâo ôh tơlơi hơdip hlŏng lar dŏ amăng ñu. 
Hereby we have known love, because *he* has laid down his life for us; and *we* ought for the brethren to lay down [our] lives. @ Hăng tơlơi anai yơh ƀing ta dưi thâo hơgĕt tơlơi khăp jing: Ñu hmâo pơsăn laih tơlơi hơdip Ñu yua kơ ƀing ta. Tui anŭn, ƀing ta ăt khŏm pơsăn tơlơi hơdip ƀing ta yua kơ adơi ayŏng ƀing ta mơ̆n. 
But whoso may have the world's substance, and see his brother having need, and shut up his bowels from him, how abides the love of God in him? @ Tơdah arăng hmâo dram gơnam ƀơi lŏn tơnah anai laih anŭn ñu ƀuh adơi ayŏng ñu hmâo tơlơi kơƀah, samơ̆ ñu kơđơ̆l hĭ pran jua hăng ƀing gơ̆, hyư̆m tơlơi Ơi Adai khăp dưi dŏ amăng ñu lĕ? 
Children, let us not love with word, nor with tongue, but in deed and in truth. @ Ơ ƀing ană anĕt, anăm ƀing ta khăp kơnơ̆ng hăng boh pơhiăp laih anŭn ƀơi tơƀuai jơlah đôč ôh, samơ̆ khŏm khăp hăng bruă ngă laih anŭn hăng tơlơi tơpă sĭt.
And hereby we shall know that we are of the truth, and shall persuade our hearts before him @ Hăng tơlơi anai, ƀing ta thâo kơ ƀing ta lơ̆m kơ tơlơi sĭt, laih anŭn pran jua ƀing ta dưi dŏ hơ-ĭt ƀơi anăp Ñu 
that if our heart condemn us, God is greater than our heart and knows all things. @ rĭm wơ̆t pran jua ƀing ta pơčŭt kơ ƀing ta. Yua kơ Ơi Adai jing prŏng hloh kơ pran jua ƀing ta dơ̆ng, laih anŭn Ñu thâo abih bang tơlơi. 
Beloved, if our heart condemn us not, we have boldness towards God, @ Ơ ƀing kâo khăp hơeng, tơdah pran jua ƀing ta ƀu pơčŭt kơ ƀing ta ôh, ƀing ta hmâo pran jua kơjăp ƀơi anăp Ơi Adai; 
and whatsoever we ask we receive from him, because we keep his commandments, and practise the things which are pleasing in his sight. @ laih anŭn ƀing ta mă tŭ mơ̆ng Ñu hơgĕt tơlơi ƀing ta rơkâo, yua kơ ƀing ta gưt kơ tơlơi Ñu pơtă, laih anŭn ngă tơlơi bơmơak kơ Ñu. 
And this is his commandment, that we believe on the name of his Son Jesus Christ, and that we love one another, even as he has given us commandment. @ Laih anŭn anai jing tơlơi Ñu pơtă: Brơi ƀing ta đaŏ kơ anăn Ană Ñu Khua Yang Yêsu Krist laih anŭn khăp kơ tơdruă ƀing ta, kar hăng Yêsu hmâo pơtă laih kơ ƀing ta. 
And he that keeps his commandments abides in him, and he in him. And hereby we know that he abides in us, by the Spirit which he has given to us. @ Hlơi pô gưt abih bang tơlơi Ơi Adai pơtă, ñu anŭn dŏ amăng Ơi Adai, laih anŭn Ơi Adai dŏ amăng ñu. Ƀing ta thâo Ơi Adai hlăk dŏ amăng ƀing ta, jing mơ̆ng Yang Bơngăt Hiam Ñu hmâo pha brơi laih kơ ƀing ta.
Beloved, believe not every spirit, but prove the spirits, if they are of God; because many false prophets are gone out into the world. @ Ơ ƀing kâo khăp hơeng, anăm đaŏ kơ abih bang yang bơngăt ôh, samơ̆ pơlông lăng bĕ ƀing yang bơngăt anŭn kiăng kơ thâo krăn gơñu hmâo tơbiă rai mơ̆ng Ơi Adai mơ̆, yua kơ hmâo lu ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo ƀlor hmâo rai laih amăng lŏn tơnah. 
Hereby ye know the Spirit of God: every spirit which confesses Jesus Christ come in flesh is of God; @ Hăng tơlơi anai ƀing gih dưi thâo krăn Yang Bơngăt Hiam Ơi Adai: Yang bơngăt pă tŭ ư Khua Yang Yêsu Krist hmâo rai laih amăng asar đeh, yang bơngăt anŭn rai mơ̆ng Ơi Adai. 
and every spirit which does not confess Jesus Christ come in flesh is not of God: and this is that [power] of the antichrist, [of] which ye have heard that it comes, and now it is already in the world. @ Samơ̆ yang bơngăt pă ƀu tŭ ư Yang Yêsu kar hăng anŭn, yang bơngăt anŭn ƀu tơbiă rai mơ̆ng Ơi Adai ôh. Ñu anŭn jing yang pô ayăt hăng Yang Krist. Ƀing gih hmâo hmư̆ laih ñu či rai, laih anŭn ră anai ñu dŏ laih amăng lŏn tơnah.
*Ye* are of God, children, and have overcome them, because greater is he that [is] in you than he that [is] in the world. @ Ơ ƀing ană anĕt, ƀing gih lơ̆m kơ Ơi Adai laih anŭn hmâo dưi laih hăng ƀing gơñu; yua kơ Pô dŏ amăng ƀing gih jing prŏng hloh kơ pô dŏ amăng lŏn tơnah. 
*They* are of the world; for this reason they speak [as] of the world, and the world hears them. @ Ƀing gơñu lơ̆m kơ lŏn tơnah, hnŭn yơh gơñu pơhiăp khul bruă lŏn tơnah, laih anŭn lŏn tơnah hmư̆ ƀing gơñu. 
*We* are of God; he that knows God hears us; he who is not of God does not hear us. From this we know the spirit of truth and the spirit of error. @ Ƀing ta lơ̆m kơ Ơi Adai. Hlơi pô thâo krăn Ơi Adai, gơñu hmư̆ ƀing ta, laih anŭn hlơi pô ƀu lơ̆m kơ Ơi Adai, gơñu ƀu hmư̆ ƀing ta ôh. Hăng tơlơi anai ƀing ta thâo krăn Yang Bơngăt tơlơi sĭt laih anŭn yang bơngăt tơlơi tơhwơl.
Beloved, let us love one another; because love is of God, and every one that loves has been begotten of God, and knows God. @ Ơ ƀing kâo khăp hơeng, brơi ƀing ta khăp bĕ tơdruă; yua kơ tơlơi khăp tơbiă rai mơ̆ng Ơi Adai. Hlơi pô thâo khăp, ñu anŭn tơkeng rai laih mơ̆ng Ơi Adai laih anŭn ñu thâo krăn Ơi Adai. 
He that loves not has not known God; for God is love. @ Hlơi pô ƀu thâo khăp, ñu anŭn ƀu thâo krăn Ơi Adai ôh; yua kơ Ơi Adai jing tơlơi khăp. 
Herein as to us has been manifested the love of God, that God has sent his only begotten Son into the world, that we might live through him. @ Tơlơi khăp Ơi Adai hmâo pơrơđah laih kơ ƀing ta amăng tơlơi anai: Ơi Adai hmâo pơkiaŏ rai laih Ană Ñu hmâo kơnơ̆ng ha čô trŭn amăng lŏn tơnah, kiăng kơ ƀing ta dưi hmâo tơlơi hơdip yua mơ̆ng Ană anŭn. 
Herein is love, not that we loved God, but that he loved us, and sent his Son a propitiation for our sins. @ Anai yơh hơgĕt tơlơi khăp jing: Ƀu djơ̆ ƀing ta hmâo khăp laih kơ Ơi Adai ôh, samơ̆ Ơi Adai hmâo khăp laih kơ ƀing ta, laih anŭn pơkiaŏ rai Ană Ñu jing mơnơ̆ng ngă yang song mă tơlơi soh ƀing ta.
Beloved, if God has so loved us, we also ought to love one another. @ Ơ ƀing kâo khăp, tơdah Ơi Adai hmâo khăp laih kơ ƀing ta tui anŭn, ƀing ta ăt khŏm khăp kơ tơdruă kar kaĭ mơ̆n. 
No one has seen God at any time: if we love one another, God abides in us, and his love is perfected in us. @ Ƀu hmâo hlơi ƀuh djơ̆ Ơi Adai ôh; tơdah ƀing ta thâo khăp kơ tơdruă, Ơi Adai dŏ amăng ƀing ta, laih anŭn tơlơi Ñu khăp jing klă tum amăng ƀing ta.
Hereby we know that we abide in him and he in us, that he has given to us of his Spirit. @ Mơ̆ng tơlơi anai ƀing ta thâo sĭt ƀing ta dŏ amăng Ñu laih anŭn Ñu dŏ amăng ƀing ta, yua kơ Ñu hmâo pha brơi laih Yang Bơngăt Hiam Ñu kơ ƀing ta. 
And *we* have seen, and testify, that the Father has sent the Son [as] Saviour of the world. @ Ƀing gơmơi hmâo ƀuh laih anŭn ngă gơ̆ng jơlan kơ Ama hmâo pơkiaŏ rai laih Ană Ñu jing Pô Pơklaih kơ lŏn tơnah. 
Whosoever shall confess that Jesus is the Son of God, God abides in him, and he in God. @ Hlơi pô pơhaih Khua Yang Yêsu jing Ană Ơi Adai, Ơi Adai dŏ amăng ñu, laih anŭn ñu dŏ amăng Ơi Adai. 
And *we* have known and have believed the love which God has to us. God is love, and he that abides in love abides in God, and God in him. @ Tui anŭn ƀing ta thâo krăn laih anŭn đaŏ kơ tơlơi khăp Ơi Adai hmâo khăp kơ ƀing ta. Ơi Adai jing tơlơi khăp, hlơi pô dŏ amăng tơlơi khăp ñu anŭn dŏ amăng Ơi Adai, laih anŭn Ơi Adai dŏ amăng ñu.
Herein has love been perfected with us that we may have boldness in the day of judgment, that even as *he* is, *we* also are in this world. @ Mơ̆ng tơlơi anai, tơlơi khăp dưi jing klă tum amăng ƀing ta, kiăng kơ ƀing ta dưi kơjăp pran jua amăng hrơi phat kơđi, yua kơ hyư̆m Ñu jing, ƀing ta ăt jing kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n amăng lŏn tơnah anai. 
There is no fear in love, but perfect love casts out fear; for fear has torment, and he that fears has not been made perfect in love. @ Ƀu hmâo ôh tơlơi hwĭ amăng tơlơi khăp, samơ̆ tơlơi khăp klă tum pơđuaĭ hĭ tơlơi hwĭ. Yua kơ tơlơi hwĭ nao hrŏm hơbĭt hăng tơlơi pơkơhmal, laih anŭn hlơi pô hwĭ ƀu dưi klă tum ôh amăng tơlơi khăp. 
*We* love because *he* has first loved us. @ Ƀing ta khăp, yua kơ Ơi Adai hmâo khăp laih ƀing ta hlâo. 
If any one say, I love God, and hate his brother, he is a liar: for he that loves not his brother whom he has seen, how can he love God whom he has not seen? @ Tơdah hlơi pô laĭ: “Kâo khăp kơ Ơi Adai,” samơ̆ bơrơmŭt kơ adơi ayŏng ñu, ñu anŭn jing sa čô ƀlor đôč. Yua kơ hlơi pô ƀu khăp ôh kơ adơi ayŏng ñu, pô ñu thâo ƀuh, hyư̆m ñu dưi khăp kơ Ơi Adai, Pô ñu ƀu thâo ƀuh ôh. 
And this commandment have we from him, That he that loves God love also his brother. @ Ƀing ta hmâo mă tŭ laih mơ̆ng Ñu tơlơi pơtă anai: Hlơi pô khăp kơ Ơi Adai, ñu khŏm khăp kơ ƀing adơi ayŏng ñu mơ̆n.
Every one that believes that Jesus is the Christ is begotten of God; and every one that loves him that has begotten loves also him that is begotten of him. @ Hlơi pô đaŏ kơ Khua Yang Yêsu jing Yang Krist, pô anŭn tơkeng laih mơ̆ng Ơi Adai, laih anŭn hlơi pô khăp kơ Ama, ñu ăt khăp kơ Ană kar kaĭ mơ̆n. 
Hereby know we that we love the children of God, when we love God and keep his commandments. @ Mơ̆ng tơlơi anai ƀing ta thâo ƀing ta khăp kơ ƀing ană bă Ơi Adai: Tơ ƀing ta khăp kơ Ơi Adai laih anŭn gưt abih khul tơlơi Ñu pơtă. 
For this is the love of God, that we keep his commandments; and his commandments are not grievous. @ Tơdah ƀing ta khăp kơ Ơi Adai ƀing ta khŏm gưt kơ khul tơlơi Ñu pơtă yơh; laih anŭn tơlơi Ñu pơtă ƀu djơ̆ tơnap đơi kơ ƀing ta ôh. 
For all that has been begotten of God gets the victory over the world; and this is the victory which has gotten the victory over the world, our faith. @ Yua kơ hlơi pô tơkeng mơ̆ng Ơi Adai ñu dưi hĭ hăng lŏn tơnah; laih anŭn tơlơi ngă brơi ƀing ta dưi hĭ hăng lŏn tơnah jing tơlơi đaŏ ƀing ta.
