Who is he that gets the victory over the world, but he that believes that Jesus is the Son of God? @ Hlơi jing pô dưi hĭ hăng lŏn tơnah? Kơnơ̆ng hlơi pô đaŏ kơ Khua Yang Yêsu jing Ană Ơi Adai yơh.
This is he that came by water and blood, Jesus [the] Christ; not by water only, but by water and blood. And it is the Spirit that bears witness, for the Spirit is the truth. @ Khua Yang Yêsu Krist jing Pô hmâo rai laih hăng ia laih anŭn hăng drah, ƀu djơ̆ kơnơ̆ng hăng ia đôč ôh, samơ̆ hăng ia laih anŭn hăng drah. 
For they that bear witness are three: @ Yang Bơngăt Hiam jing pô ngă gơ̆ng jơlan, yua kơ Yang Bơngăt Hiam jing tơlơi sĭt. 
the Spirit, and the water, and the blood; and the three agree in one. @ Hmâo klâo mơta tơlơi gơ̆ng jơlan pơsĭt: Yang Bơngăt Hiam, ia laih anŭn drah, laih anŭn abih klâo mơta tơlơi anŭn tŭ ư hrŏm hơbĭt. 
If we receive the witness of men, the witness of God is greater. For this is the witness of God [which] he has witnessed concerning his Son. @ Tơdah ƀing ta đaŏ kơ tơlơi ană mơnuih ngă gơ̆ng jơlan, tui anŭn tơlơi Ơi Adai gơ̆ng jơlan jing prŏng hloh dơ̆ng; yua kơ anai jing tơlơi Ơi Adai ngă gơ̆ng jơlan kơ Ană Ñu. 
He that believes on the Son of God has the witness in himself; he that does not believe God has made him a liar, because he has not believed in the witness which God has witnessed concerning his Son. @ Hlơi pô đaŏ kơ Ană Ơi Adai ñu hmâo tơlơi gơ̆ng jơlan anŭn amăng ñu pô. Hlơi pô ƀu đaŏ kơ Ană Ơi Adai ôh, ñu anŭn yap Ơi Adai jing pô pơhiăp ƀlor, yua kơ ñu ƀu đaŏ ôh kơ tơlơi Ơi Adai hmâo ngă gơ̆ng jơlan djơ̆ kơ Ană Ñu. 
And this is the witness, that God has given to us eternal life; and this life is in his Son. @ Anai jing tơlơi gơ̆ng jơlan: Ơi Adai hmâo pha brơi laih tơlơi hơdip hlŏng lar kơ ƀing ta, laih anŭn tơlơi hơdip anai dŏ amăng Ană Ñu. 
He that has the Son has life: he that has not the Son of God has not life. @ Hlơi pô hmâo Yang Ană, ñu anŭn hmâo laih tơlơi hơdip; hlơi pô ƀu hmâo ôh Ană Ơi Adai, pô anŭn ƀu hmâo tơlơi hơdip ôh.
These things have I written to you that ye may know that ye have eternal life who believe on the name of the Son of God. @ Kâo čih tơlơi anai kơ ƀing gih jing ƀing mơnuih hmâo đaŏ laih kơ anăn Ană Ơi Adai, kiăng kơ ƀing gih thâo ƀing gih hmâo laih tơlơi hơdip hlŏng lar. 
And this is the boldness which we have towards him, that if we ask him anything according to his will he hears us. @ Anai tơlơi kơnang ƀing ta hmâo amăng Ñu: Tơdah ƀing ta rơkâo tui hăng Ñu kiăng, Ñu hmư̆ ƀing ta. 
And if we know that he hears us, whatsoever we ask, we know that we have the petitions which we have asked of him. @ Laih anŭn tơdah ƀing ta thâo Ñu hmư̆ abih bang tơlơi hơgĕt ƀing ta rơkâo, ƀing ta thâo kơ ƀing ta hmâo mă tŭ laih mơnơ̆ng ƀing ta rơkâo kơ Ñu.
If any one see his brother sinning a sin not unto death, he shall ask, and he shall give him life, for those that do not sin unto death. There is a sin to death: I do not say of that that he should make a request. @ Tơdah hlơi ƀuh adơi ayŏng ñu ngă soh, tơlơi soh anŭn ƀu ba truh kơ djai ôh, brơi ñu rơkâo bĕ, laih anŭn Ơi Adai či pha brơi tơlơi hơdip kơ pô anŭn. Tơlơi anai kiăng laĭ kơ ƀing ngă tơlơi soh ƀu ba truh kơ tơlơi djai. Ăt hmâo mơ̆n tơlơi soh ba truh kơ djai, kâo ƀu laĭ ôh kơ ƀing gih khŏm rơkâo brơi tơlơi soh kar hăng anŭn. 
Every unrighteousness is sin; and there is a sin not to death. @ Abih bang tơlơi ƀu tơpă leng kơ jing tơlơi soh yơh, samơ̆ ăt hmâo mơ̆n tơlơi soh ƀu truh kơ tơlơi djai ôh.
We know that every one begotten of God does not sin, but he that has been begotten of God keeps himself, and the wicked [one] does not touch him. @ Ƀing ta thâo hlơi pô tơkeng laih mơ̆ng Ơi Adai ñu anŭn ƀu ngă soh dơ̆ng ôh, yua kơ Pô tơkeng rai mơ̆ng Ơi Adai wai lăng mơnuih anŭn, laih anŭn yang sat ƀu dưi ruaih djơ̆ ñu ôh. 
We know that we are of God, and the whole world lies in the wicked [one]. @ Ƀing ta thâo ƀing ta lơ̆m kơ Ơi Adai, laih anŭn abih bang lŏn tơnah dŏ gah yŭ kơ tơlơi dưi yang sat. 
And we know that the Son of God has come, and has given us an understanding that we should know him that [is] true; and we are in him that [is] true, in his Son Jesus Christ. He is the true God and eternal life. @ Ƀing ta thâo Ană Ơi Adai hmâo rai laih, laih anŭn pha brơi laih kơ ƀing ta tơlơi thâo hluh kiăng kơ ƀing ta thâo Ñu jing Pô sĭt; ƀing ta dŏ amăng Pô sĭt, kiăng laĭ jing dŏ amăng Ană Ñu Khua Yang Yêsu Krist. Ñu yơh jing Ơi Adai Pô sĭt, laih anŭn jing tơlơi hơdip hlŏng lar. 
Children, keep yourselves from idols. @ Ơ ƀing ană anĕt kâo, răng bĕ ƀing gih pô mơ̆ng rup trah.
The elder to [the] elect lady and her children, whom *I* love in truth, and not *I* only but also all who have known the truth, @ Kŏng tha čih mơit kơ yă, mơnuih Ơi Adai ruah, wơ̆t kơ ƀing ană bă ñu, ƀing kâo khăp amăng tơlơi sĭt, ƀu djơ̆ kơnơ̆ng kâo đôč ôh, samơ̆ wơ̆t kơ abih bang ƀing thâo laih tơlơi sĭt kar kaĭ mơ̆n, 
for the truth's sake which abides in us and shall be with us to eternity. @ yua kơ tơlơi sĭt dŏ amăng ƀing ta laih anŭn či dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing ta hlŏng lar.
Grace shall be with you, mercy, peace from God [the] Father, and from [the] Lord Jesus Christ, the Son of the Father, in truth and love. @ Rơkâo tơlơi pap, tơlơi pap drap, laih anŭn tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua mơ̆ng Ơi Adai jing Ama, laih anŭn mơ̆ng Khua Yang Yêsu Krist, jing Ană kơ Ama, dŏ hăng ƀing ta amăng tơlơi sĭt laih anŭn tơlơi khăp.
I rejoiced greatly that I have found of thy children walking in truth, as we have received commandment from the Father. @ Kâo hơ̆k mơak biă mă ƀuh đơđa ană ih rơbat tui amăng tơlơi sĭt, djơ̆ tui hăng tơlơi pơtă ƀing ta hmâo mă tŭ laih mơ̆ng Ama. 
And now I beseech thee, lady, not as writing to thee a new commandment, but that which we have had from [the] beginning, that we should love one another. @ Ơ yă, ră anai kâo rơkâo kơwưh kơ ih, ƀu djơ̆ kâo čih kơ ih sa tơlơi pơtă phrâo ôh, samơ̆ jing tơlơi pơtă ƀing ta hmâo mă tŭ laih mơ̆ng phŭn blŭng, anŭn jing brơi ƀing ta khăp bĕ kơ tơdruă. 
And this is love, that we should walk according to his commandments. This is the commandment, according as ye have heard from the beginning, that ye might walk in it. @ Tơlơi khăp anŭn jing ƀing ta rơbat tui khul tơlơi Ñu pơtă. Anai jing tơlơi pơtă ƀing gih hmâo hmư̆ laih mơ̆ng phŭn blŭng, kiăng kơ rơbat tui.
For many deceivers have gone out into the world, they who do not confess Jesus Christ coming in flesh this is the deceiver and the antichrist. @ Yua kơ lu ƀing mơnuih ƀlor hmâo rai laih amăng lŏn tơnah, jing ƀing ƀu tŭ ư ôh kơ Khua Yang Yêsu Krist hmâo rai laih amăng asar đeh. Anŭn jing pô ƀlor laih anŭn pô ayăt hăng Yang Krist. 
See to yourselves, that we may not lose what we have wrought, but may receive full wages. @ Răng bĕ, kiăng kơ ƀing gih ƀu rơngiă hĭ ôh boh than mơ̆ng bruă ƀing gih hmâo ngă laih, samơ̆ dưi mă tŭ pri tum num.
Whosoever goes forward and abides not in the doctrine of the Christ has not God. He that abides in the doctrine, *he* has both the Father and the Son. @ Hlơi pô nao rơgao hloh laih anŭn ƀu dŏ nanao ôh amăng tơlơi Yang Krist pơtô, pô anŭn ƀu hmâo Ơi Adai ôh. Samơ̆ hlơi pô dŏ nanao amăng tơlơi pơtô anŭn, ñu anŭn hmâo wơ̆t Yang Ama laih anŭn Yang Ană mơ̆n. 
If any one come to you and bring not this doctrine, do not receive him into [the] house, and greet him not; @ Tơdah hlơi pô nao pơ ƀing gih samơ̆ ƀu djă ba ôh tơlơi pơtô anai, anăm tŭ jum mơnuih anŭn mŭt amăng sang ôh laih anŭn anăm kơkuh tơña kơ ñu lơi. 
for he who greets him partakes in his wicked works. @ Yua kơ hlơi pô kơkuh tơña kơ mơnuih anŭn jing sa pran jua amăng bruă sat ñu ngă.
Having many things to write to you, I would not with paper and ink; but hope to come to you, and to speak mouth to mouth, that our joy may be full. @ Kâo hmâo lu tơlơi kiăng čih kơ ƀing gih, samơ̆ kâo ƀu kiăng čih hăng hla mơar laih anŭn hăng ia hră ôh. Kâo čang rơmang či nao pơ ƀing gih laih anŭn pơhiăp hrŏm hăng ƀing gih anăp klă anăp, kiăng kơ tơlơi hơ̆k mơak ƀing ta jing klă tum.
The children of thine elect sister greet thee. @ Ƀing ană amai adơi ih, pô Ơi Adai hmâo ruah laih mơit tơlơi kơkuh tơña kơ ih.
The elder to the beloved Gaius, whom I love in truth. @  Hră mơ̆ng kŏng tha čih mơit kơ Gaius giăng mah kâo, pô kâo khăp amăng tơlơi sĭt.
Beloved, I desire that in all things thou shouldest prosper and be in health, even as thy soul prospers. @ Ơ pô kâo khăp, kâo iâu laĭ kiăng kơ ih pơdrŏng kơjăp amăng djŏp mơta tơlơi, hmâo tơlơi suaih prăl gah drơi jan kar hăng ih hmâo tơlơi pơdrŏng kơjăp gah kơ bơngăt ih mơ̆n. 
For I rejoiced exceedingly when [the] brethren came and bore testimony to thy [holding fast the] truth, even as *thou* walkest in truth. @ Kâo hmâo tơlơi hơ̆k mơak biă mă tơdang ƀing adơi ayŏng truh pơ anai, hmâo ră pơthâo kơ kâo kơ tơlơi ih dŏ tŏng ten amăng tơlơi sĭt, kar hăng ih ăt dŏ rơbat tui tơlơi sĭt. 
I have no greater joy than these things that I hear of my children walking in the truth. @ Ƀu hmâo tơlơi hơgĕt ngă brơi kâo hơ̆k mơak hloh kơ tơlơi kâo hmư̆ ƀing ană bă kâo rơbat tui tơlơi sĭt.
Beloved, thou doest faithfully [in] whatever thou mayest have wrought towards the brethren and that strangers, @ Ơ pô kâo khăp, ih tŏng ten biă mă yơh amăng bruă ih ngă brơi kơ ƀing adơi ayŏng, boh nik ñu kơ ƀing tuai. 
(who have witnessed of thy love before [the] assembly,) in setting forward whom on their journey worthily of God, thou wilt do well; @ Ƀing gơñu hmâo ngă gơ̆ng jơlan glaĭ kơ tơlơi khăp ih ƀơi anăp phung sang Ơi Adai. Rơkâo kơ ih djru ƀing gơñu rơbat nao dơ̆ng amăng bruă gơñu đuaĭ hyu, amăng tơlơi ngă bơmơak kơ Ơi Adai. 
for for the name have they gone forth, taking nothing of those of the nations. @ Gơñu hmâo đuaĭ hyu yua kơ anăn Yang Krist, laih anŭn ƀu mă tŭ mơnơ̆ng hơgĕt mơ̆ng ƀing mơnuih ƀu đaŏ ôh. 
*We* therefore ought to receive such, that we may be fellow-workers with the truth. @ Hnŭn yơh, ƀing ta khŏm djru ƀing mơnuih anai, kiăng kơ ƀing ta dưi jing hĭ ƀing mơnuih mă bruă hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing gơñu yua kơ tơlơi sĭt.
I wrote something to the assembly; but Diotrephes, who loves to have the first place among them, receives us not. @ Kâo hmâo čih mơit laih dua klâo boh kơ phung sang Ơi Adai; samơ̆ Diôtrep, pô khăp ngă khua, ƀu tŭ ư ƀing gơmơi ôh. 
For this reason, if I come, I will bring to remembrance his works which he does, babbling against us with wicked words; and not content with these, neither does he himself receive the brethren; and those who would he prevents, and casts [them] out of the assembly. @ Hnŭn yơh, tơdah kâo truh, kâo či ră glaĭ hơgĕt tơlơi ñu hmâo ngă laih, jing hơdôm boh pơhiăp sat pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ hăng ƀing ta. Kar hăng anŭn ñu ăt aka hrăp pran jua ôh, laih anŭn dơ̆ng ñu ƀu kiăng tŭ jum ƀing adơi ayŏng ôh, hlơi pô kiăng tŭ jum, ñu khă găn hĭ laih anŭn puh pơđuaĭ mơ̆ng phung sang Ơi Adai.
Beloved, do not imitate what is evil, but what is good. He that does good is of God. He that does evil has not seen God. @ Ơ pô kâo khăp, anăm hla tui tơlơi sat ôh, samơ̆ hla tui bĕ tơlơi hiam. Hlơi pô ngă tơlơi hiam ñu lơ̆m kơ Ơi Adai; hlơi pô ngă tơlơi sat ñu aka ƀuh Ơi Adai ôh.
Demetrius has witness borne to him by all, and by the truth itself; and *we* also bear witness, and thou knowest that our witness is true. @ Abih bang mơnuih leng kơ ngă gơ̆ng jơlan hiam kơ Dêmêtrius, wơ̆t tơlơi sĭt ăt ngă gơ̆ng jơlan mơ̆n. Ƀing gơmơi ăt ngă gơ̆ng jơlan kơ ñu kar kaĭ mơ̆n, laih anŭn ih thâo tơlơi ƀing gơmơi ngă gơ̆ng jơlan jing sĭt.
I had many things to write to thee, but I will not with ink and pen write to thee; @ Kâo hmâo lu tơlơi kiăng čih kơ ih, samơ̆ kâo ƀu kiăng čih hăng gai čih laih anŭn hăng ia hră ôh. 
but I hope soon to see thee, and we will speak mouth to mouth. Peace [be] to thee. The friends greet thee. Greet the friends by name. @ Kâo čang rơmang tañ či ƀuh ih, laih anŭn ƀing ta či pơhiăp hrŏm hơbĭt anăp klă anăp.
Jude, bondman of Jesus Christ, and brother of James, to the called ones beloved in God [the] Father and preserved in Jesus Christ: @  Yut, sa čô ding kơna kơ Khua Yang Yêsu Krist laih anŭn jing adơi Yakơ, čih mơit kơ ƀing mơnuih Ơi Adai hmâo iâu, jing ƀing Ơi Adai Ama khăp laih anŭn ƀing Khua Yang Yêsu Krist pơgang wai. 
Mercy to you, and peace, and love be multiplied. @ Rơkâo tơlơi pap drap, tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua laih anŭn tơlơi khăp brơi kơ ƀing gih jai lu tui.
Beloved, using all diligence to write to you of our common salvation, I have been obliged to write to you exhorting [you] to contend earnestly for the faith once delivered to the saints. @ Ơ ƀing kâo khăp hơeng, kâo kiăng biă mă čih kơ ƀing gih kơ tơlơi pơklaih ƀing ta hmâo hrŏm hơbĭt, kâo pơmĭn yom biă mă khŏm kơ kâo čih kiăng kơ pơtrŭt pơđur ƀing gih pơblah yua kơ tơlơi đaŏ, jing tơlơi đaŏ hmâo brơi laih kơ ƀing rơgoh hiam sa wơ̆t djŏp laih. 
For certain men have got in unnoticed, they who of old were marked out beforehand to this sentence, ungodly [persons], turning the grace of our God into dissoluteness, and denying our only Master and Lord Jesus Christ. @ Yua kơ hmâo đơđa mơnuih klĕ mŭt amăng ƀing gih, jing ƀing hlâo adih hmâo pơkă pioh laih kơ tơlơi klă kơđi, jing ƀing ƀu thâo pơpŭ kơ Ơi Adai ôh, ƀing pơjing hĭ tơlơi pơtô kơ tơlơi pap Ơi Adai ƀing ta jing hĭ soh sat hrah hrong, laih anŭn hơngah hĭ Yang Yêsu Krist, hơjăn Ñu đôč jing Khua laih anŭn Khua Yang ƀing ta.
But I would put you in remembrance, you who once knew all things, that the Lord, having saved a people out of [the] land of Egypt, in the second place destroyed those who had not believed. @  Wơ̆t dah ƀing gih thâo klă laih abih tơlơi anai, kâo ăt kiăng pơhơdơr kơ ƀing gih hyư̆m Khua Yang hmâo pơklaih laih ƀing ană plei pla Israel mơ̆ng čar Êjip đưm adih, samơ̆ tơdơi kơ anŭn Ñu pơrai lui hĭ ƀing ƀu đaŏ. 
And angels who had not kept their own original state, but had abandoned their own dwelling, he keeps in eternal chains under gloomy darkness, to [the] judgment of [the] great day; @ Bơ kơ ƀing ling jang ƀu djă pioh ôh anih bruă gơñu jing, samơ̆ lui hĭ anih dŏ gơñu pô, Ơi Adai akă ƀing gơñu hăng čuăk hlŏng lar kiăng djă pioh gơñu amăng anih kơnăm mơmŏt tơl truh tơlơi phat kơđi ƀơi Hrơi Prŏng. 
as Sodom and Gomorrha, and the cities around them, committing greedily fornication, in like manner with them, and going after other flesh, lie there as an example, undergoing the judgment of eternal fire. @ Hrup hăng plei Sôđôm, plei Gômôrơ, laih anŭn ƀing plei jum dar; gơñu ngă soh kar hăng ƀing ling jang anŭn mơ̆n, gơñu ngă tơlơi rih răm laih anŭn tơlơi amoaih hưp phara hăng tơlơi phiăn yang đar, gơñu hmâo tŭ laih tơlơi pơkơhmal hăng apui hlŏng lar kiăng kơ ngă tơlơi bơhmutu. 
Yet in like manner these dreamers also defile [the] flesh, and despise lordship, and speak railingly against dignities. @ Ăt kar hăng anŭn mơ̆n, amăng tơlơi rơpơi, ƀing mơnuih anai hmâo ngă hơƀak drak hĭ drơi jan gơñu, hơngah hĭ tơlơi dưi, laih anŭn pơhiăp ƀrưh hmiah kơ ƀing guh kơang. 
But Michael the archangel, when disputing with the devil he reasoned about the body of Moses, did not dare to bring a railing judgment against [him], but said, [The] Lord rebuke thee. @ Wơ̆t khua ling jang Mikel tơdang pơrơjah, pơrơsua drơi jan Môis hăng yang sat, ñu ƀu khĭn yua boh pơhiăp ƀrưh hmiah kiăng kơ phat kơđi yang sat ôh, samơ̆ kơnơ̆ng laĭ:
“Rơkâo Khua Yang ƀuah ih.”
But these, whatever things they know not, they speak railingly against; but what even, as the irrational animals, they understand by mere nature, in these things they corrupt themselves. @ Samơ̆ ƀing anai ƀrưh hmiah kơ abih bang tơlơi ƀing gơñu ƀu thâo hluh ôh, laih anŭn hơgĕt khul tơlơi gơñu thâo hluh mơ̆ng kơnuih gơñu pô hrup hăng hlô mơnơ̆ng, khul tơlơi anŭn pơrai gơñu yơh. 
Woe to them! because they have gone in the way of Cain, and given themselves up to the error of Balaam for reward, and perished in the gainsaying of Core. @ Răm ƀăm yơh kơ ƀing gơñu! Yua kơ ƀing gơñu đuaĭ tui jơlan Kain, yua kơ hưp ham dram gơnam ƀing gơñu lĕ laih amăng tơlơi soh Balaam, laih anŭn tŭ tơlơi răm rai yua tơlơi pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ hrup hăng Kôra.
These are spots in your love-feasts, feasting together [with you] without fear, pasturing themselves; clouds without water, carried along by [the] winds; autumnal trees, without fruit, twice dead, rooted up; @ Ƀing mơnuih anai jing khul tơlơi grĭ grañ amăng tơlơi ƀơ̆ng huă tơlơi khăp kơ ƀing gih, ƀu thâo mlâo ôh tơdang gơñu huă ƀơ̆ng hrŏm hơbĭt, gơñu kơnơ̆ng pơmĭn kơ gơñu pô đôč. Ƀing gơñu jing hrup hăng khul gơnăm ƀu hmâo ia angĭn pơpuh pơđung hyu; jing hrup hăng khul kơyâo ƀu hmâo boh amăng bơyan hla răng, djai dua wơ̆t, akha tơbuč hĭ laih. 
raging waves of the sea, foaming out their own shames; wandering stars, to whom has been reserved the gloom of darkness for eternity. @ Ƀing gơñu hrup jơlah ia rơsĭ pah pŭng, tơbiă blôk tơlơi mlâo hañ ƀing gơñu pô; ƀing gơñu hrup hăng pơtŭ jrok hyu, Ơi Adai pioh brơi laih tơlơi mơmŏt tĭt hlŏng lar kơ ƀing gơñu.
And Enoch, [the] seventh from Adam, prophesied also as to these, saying, Behold, [the] Lord has come amidst his holy myriads, @  Kơ ƀing gơñu mơ̆n, Ênok jing pô hơdip amăng rơnŭk tal tơjuh mơ̆ng Ađam, hmâo laĭ lui hlâo laih: “Anai nê, Khua Yang či rai hrŏm hăng klăk klai ƀing ling jang rơgoh hiam Ñu, 
to execute judgment against all; and to convict all the ungodly of them of all their works of ungodliness, which they have wrought ungodlily, and of all the hard [things] which ungodly sinners have spoken against him. @ kiăng phat kơđi kơ abih bang mơnuih, laih anŭn kiăng klă kơđi kơ abih bang ƀing mơnuih soh ƀu pơpŭ kơ Ơi Adai, kơ abih bang bruă ƀu thâo pơpŭ kơ Ơi Adai ƀing gơñu hmâo ngă, laih anŭn kơ abih bang boh pơhiăp ƀrưh hmiah, ƀing gơñu hmâo pơhiăp pơkơdơ̆ng glaĭ hăng Ơi Adai.” 
These are murmurers, complainers, walking after their lusts; and their mouth speaks swelling words, admiring persons for the sake of profit. @ Ƀing gơñu jing ƀing pơhiăp brŏk, ƀu thâo hrăp mơak ôh, pơhluai tui khul tơlơi amoaih hưp ƀing gơñu pô, amăng bah pơhiăp pơ-ư pơang kơ gơñu pô, laih anŭn pơhiăp pơhlô̆ ƀing ană plei pla kiăng hmâo tơlơi kơmlai kơ ƀing gơñu pô.
But *ye*, beloved, remember the words spoken before by the apostles of our Lord Jesus Christ, @ Samơ̆ Ơ ƀing kâo khăp hơeng, brơi ƀing gih hơdơr bĕ kơ khul boh pơhiăp ƀing khua ding kơna Khua Yang ƀing ta Yêsu Krist hmâo pơhiăp hlâo adih. 
that they said to you, that at [the] end of the time there should be mockers, walking after their own lusts of ungodlinesses. @ Ƀing gơñu hmâo laĭ laih kơ ƀing gih: “Amăng rơnŭk hnal tuč či hmâo ƀing djik djak, đuaĭ tui khul tơlơi amoaih grĭ grañ gơñu pô.” 
These are they who set [themselves] apart, natural [men], not having [the] Spirit. @ Ƀing gơñu jing ƀing phŭn kơ tơlơi pơkah pha phung, ƀing mơnuih asar đeh, ƀu hmâo Yang Bơngăt Hiam ôh. 
But *ye*, beloved, building yourselves up on your most holy faith, praying in the Holy Spirit, @ Samơ̆, Ơ ƀing adơi ayŏng kâo khăp hơeng, pơdơ̆ng pơjing bĕ ƀing gih pô amăng tơlơi đaŏ rơgoh hiam đŭt hlah ƀing gih, laih anŭn iâu laĭ bĕ amăng Yang Bơngăt Hiam. 
keep yourselves in the love of God, awaiting the mercy of our Lord Jesus Christ unto eternal life. @ Răng wai bĕ ƀing gih pô amăng tơlơi khăp Ơi Adai; dŏ tơguan bĕ tơlơi pap drap Khua Yang ƀing ta jing Khua Yang Yêsu Krist, kiăng hmâo tơlơi hơdip hlŏng lar. 
And of some have compassion, making a difference, @ Pap drap bĕ kơ đơđa mơnuih hmâo tơlơi đing. 
but others save with fear, snatching [them] out of the fire; hating even the garment spotted by the flesh. @ Pơklaih bĕ đơđa ƀing pơkŏn, dui ƀing gơñu tơbiă mơ̆ng apui; bơ kơ ƀing mơnuih pơkŏn dơ̆ng, brơi hmâo pran jua thâo pap drap hrŏm hơbĭt hăng tơlơi hyưt hwĭ mơ̆n, bơrơmŭt wơ̆t ao gơñu yua kơ asar đeh hmâo ngă pơgrĭ laih.
But to him that is able to keep you without stumbling, and to set [you] with exultation blameless before his glory, @ Rơkâo kơ Pô hmâo tơlơi dưi mơyang wai lăng ƀing gih klaih kơ tơlơi lĕ rơbuh, laih anŭn ngă brơi ƀing gih dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơi anăp tơlơi guh kơang Ñu hăng tơlơi ƀu hmâo anih dưi ƀuah ôh laih anŭn hơ̆k mơak, 
to the only God our Saviour, through Jesus Christ our Lord, [be] glory, majesty, might, and authority, from before the whole age, and now, and to all the ages. Amen. @ jing Ơi Adai kơnơ̆ng hasa, Pô Pơklaih ƀing ta, amăng Khua Yang Yêsu Krist, Khua Yang ƀing ta, hmâo tơlơi guh kơang, tơlơi kơdrưh kơdrŏm, tơlơi dưi kơtang laih anŭn tơlơi dưi mơ̆ng abih bang rơnŭk hlâo adih, ră anai laih anŭn nanao hlŏng lar! Amen.
Revelation of Jesus Christ, which God gave to him, to shew to his bondmen what must shortly take place; and he signified [it], sending by his angel, to his bondman John, @ Tơlơi Yêsu Krist pơrơđah tui hăng Ơi Adai hmâo pha brơi laih kơ Ñu, kiăng kơ Ñu pơrơđah kơ ƀing ding kơna Ñu khul tơlơi khŏm truh tañ. Ñu pơkiaŏ ling jang Ñu nao pơrơđah tơlơi anai kơ Yôhan, ding kơna Ñu, 
who testified the word of God, and the testimony of Jesus Christ, all things that he saw. @ jing pô hmâo ngă gơ̆ng jơlan laih kơ boh pơhiăp Ơi Adai laih anŭn kơ tơlơi Yêsu Krist gơ̆ng jơlan, anŭn jing abih tơlơi Ñu hmâo ƀuh laih. 
Blessed [is] he that reads, and they that hear the words of the prophecy, and keep the things written in it; for the time [is] near. @ Mơyun hiam yơh kơ hlơi pô đŏk laih anŭn kơ hlơi pô hmư̆ boh pơhiăp laĭ lui hlâo anai, laih anŭn gưt tui tơlơi arăng hmâo čih laih ƀơi anai; yua kơ mông jĕ truh laih.
John to the seven assemblies which [are] in Asia: Grace to you and peace from [him] who is, and who was, and who is to come; and from the seven Spirits which [are] before his throne; @  Yôhan čih mơit kơ tơjuh Phung Sang Ơi Adai amăng čar Asi:
Hơơč kơ ƀing gih hmâo tơlơi pap laih anŭn tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua mơ̆ng Pô Hlăk Dŏ Hmâo, Pô Hmâo Laih, laih anŭn Pô Či Rai Dơ̆ng, laih anŭn mơ̆ng tơjuh Yang Bơngăt dŏ ƀơi anăp gre pơtao Ñu, 
and from Jesus Christ, the faithful witness, the firstborn from the dead, and the prince of the kings of the earth. To him who loves us, and has washed us from our sins in his blood, @ laih anŭn mơ̆ng Yêsu Krist, Pô ngă gơ̆ng jơlan hơnơ̆ng ten, Pô Ơi Adai tơkeng blŭng hlâo mơ̆ng ƀing djai, laih anŭn khua kơ ƀing pơtao ƀơi lŏn tơnah.
Kơ Pô khăp kơ ƀing ta laih anŭn hmâo pơrơngai laih ƀing ta mơ̆ng tơlơi soh ƀing ta hăng drah Ñu pô, 
and made us a kingdom, priests to his God and Father: to him [be] the glory and the might to the ages of ages. Amen. @ laih anŭn ngă brơi ƀing ta jing hĭ dêh čar pơtao, jing ƀing khua ngă yang kơ Ơi Adai, Ama Ñu, kơ Ñu yơh tơlơi guh kơang laih anŭn tơlơi dưi wai lăng nanao hlŏng lar. Amen.
Behold, he comes with the clouds, and every eye shall see him, and they which have pierced him, and all the tribes of the land shall wail because of him. Yea. Amen. @  Anai nê, Ñu či rai hăng khul hiăng kơthul, abih bang mơta či ƀuh Ñu, wơ̆t ƀing hmâo klaŏ laih Ñu, laih anŭn abih bang djuai mơnuih ƀơi lŏn tơnah či čŏk hia yua kơ Ñu. Sĭt biă mă. Amen.
I am the Alpha and the Omega, saith [the] Lord God, he who is, and who was, and who is to come, the Almighty. @  Khua Yang Ơi Adai laĭ, Pô ră anai hlăk hmâo, Pô hmâo laih, laih anŭn Pô či rai dơ̆ng, Pô Hmâo Abih Tơlơi Dưi Mơyang laĭ: “Kâo jing Alpha laih anŭn Ômêga.”
I John, your brother and fellow-partaker in the tribulation and kingdom and patience, in Jesus, was in the island called Patmos, for the word of God, and for the testimony of Jesus. @ Kâo jing Yôhan, ayŏng kơ ƀing gih, pô tŭ hrŏm hơbĭt tơlơi tơnap tap, dêh čar pơtao laih anŭn tơlơi gir hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing gih amăng Khua Yang Yêsu Krist, ră anai kâo hlăk dŏ pơ plao ia arăng pơanăn Patmôs, yua kơ boh pơhiăp Ơi Adai laih anŭn tơlơi gơ̆ng jơlan kơ Khua Yang Yêsu. 
I became in [the] Spirit on the Lord's day, and I heard behind me a great voice as of a trumpet, @ Amăng hrơi Khua Yang, Yang Bơngăt Hiam gom kâo, laih anŭn kâo hmư̆ gah klon kâo asăp kraih kar hăng asăp tơki, 
saying, What thou seest write in a book, and send to the seven assemblies: to Ephesus, and to Smyrna, and to Pergamos, and to Thyatira, and to Sardis, and to Philadelphia, and to Laodicea. @ laĭ: “Čih bĕ hơgĕt khul tơlơi ih ƀuh amăng sa sŏp hră, laih anŭn mơit kơ tơjuh Phung Sang Ơi Adai pơ plei: Êphêsô, Smirna, Pergam, Thiatir, Sardis, Philadelphi, laih anŭn Laôdisê.”
And I turned back to see the voice which spoke with me; and having turned, I saw seven golden lamps, @ Tui anŭn kâo wir glaĭ lăng kiăng thâo asăp hlơi dŏ pơhiăp hăng kâo. Kâo man wir glaĭ, kâo ƀuh tơjuh ƀĕ gơ̆ng apui kơđen ngă hăng mah, 
and in the midst of the [seven] lamps [one] like [the] Son of man, clothed with a garment reaching to the feet, and girt about at the breasts with a golden girdle: @ laih anŭn ƀơi tơ̆ng krah khul gơ̆ng apui kơđen hmâo sa čô hrup hăng Ană Mơnuih, ƀuh ao phyung glong laih anŭn hrăng bơnal mah jum dar tơda Ñu. 
his head and hair white like white wool, as snow; and his eyes as a flame of fire; @ Akŏ laih anŭn ƀuk Ñu kŏ kar hăng blâu triu, kŏ kar hăng pler tơpŭng, mơta Ñu kar hăng jơlah apui, 
and his feet like fine brass, as burning in a furnace; and his voice as the voice of many waters; @ tơkai Ñu kar hăng kong čêr dơnar arăng pơrơgoh laih amăng tơpur apui, laih anŭn asăp Ñu kar hăng dơnai jrai ia prŏng; 
and having in his right hand seven stars; and out of his mouth a sharp two-edged sword going forth; and his countenance as the sun shines in its power. @ Tơngan hơnuă Ñu djă tơjuh boh pơtŭ, mơ̆ng amăng bah Ñu tơbiă rai sa ƀĕ đao dua bơnah mơta ƀơ̆ng biă mă, laih anŭn ƀô̆ mơta Ñu kar hăng yang hrơi pơčrang hăng abih tơlơi kơtang ñu.
And when I saw him I fell at his feet as dead; and he laid his right hand upon me, saying, Fear not; *I* am the first and the last, @  Tơ kâo ƀuh Ñu, kâo rơbuh ƀơi tơkai Ñu kar hăng djai. Samơ̆ Ñu ah tơngan hơnuă Ñu ƀơi kâo laih anŭn laĭ: “Anăm Hwĭ ôh, Kâo jing Pô Blŭng Hlâo Hloh laih anŭn Pô Hnal tuč, 
and the living one: and I became dead, and behold, I am living to the ages of ages, and have the keys of death and of hades. @ laih anŭn Pô Hơdip; Kâo hmâo djai laih, ră anai Kâo hơdip hlŏng lar, Kâo djă kơmla kăl tơlơi djai laih anŭn Plei Ƀing Djai. 
Write therefore what thou hast seen, and the things that are, and the things that are about to be after these. @ Ră anai čih pioh bĕ hơgĕt khul tơlơi ih hmâo ƀuh laih, khul tơlơi hlăk hmâo ră anai, laih anŭn khul tơlơi či truh tơdơi kơ tơlơi anai. 
The mystery of the seven stars which thou hast seen on my right hand, and the seven golden lamps. The seven stars are angels of the seven assemblies; and the seven lamps are seven assemblies. @ Anai tơlơi yom hơgơ̆m kơ tơjuh boh pơtŭ ih hmâo ƀuh laih amăng tơngan gah hơnuă Kâo, laih anŭn tơjuh ƀĕ gơ̆ng apui kơđen ngă hăng mah, tơjuh boh pơtŭ anŭn jing tơjuh čô ling jang kơ tơjuh Phung Sang Ơi Adai, bơ kơ tơjuh ƀĕ gơ̆ng apui kơđen jing tơjuh Phung Sang Ơi Adai.”
To the angel of the assembly in Ephesus write: These things says he that holds the seven stars in his right hand, who walks in the midst of the seven golden lamps: @ “Čih bĕ kơ ling jang Phung Sang Ơi Adai Êphêsô tui anai: ‘Anai jing boh pơhiăp Pô djă tơjuh boh pơtŭ amăng tơngan hơnuă Ñu, rơbat tơ̆ng krah tơjuh ƀĕ gơ̆ng apui kơđen ngă hăng mah: 
I know thy works and [thy] labour, and thine endurance, and that thou canst not bear evil [men]; and thou hast tried them who say that themselves [are] apostles and are not, and hast found them liars; @ “Kâo thâo khul bruă ih hmâo ngă, tơlơi gleh glăn ih, tơlơi gir ih. Kâo thâo ih ƀu tŭ ôh ƀing sat ƀai, samơ̆ ih hmâo pơlông lăng laih ƀing mơnuih laĭ ƀing gơñu jing ƀing khua ding kơna samơ̆ ƀu djơ̆ ôh, laih anŭn ih thâo krăn ƀing gơñu jing ƀing ƀlor. 
and endurest, and hast borne for my name's sake, and hast not wearied: @ Ih gir tŭ tơlơi tơnap tap yua kơ anăn kâo, laih anŭn ih ƀu hơtah hơtai ôh. 
but I have against thee, that thou hast left thy first love. @ Samơ̆ anai tơlơi kâo ƀuah kơ ih, ih hmâo lui hĭ laih tơlơi khăp ih hmâo mơ̆ng blŭng hlâo. 
Remember therefore whence thou art fallen, and repent, and do the first works: but if not, I am coming to thee, and I will remove thy lamp out of its place, except thou shalt repent. @ Tui anŭn hơdơr glaĭ bĕ mơ̆ng pă ih hmâo lĕ rơbuh laih, kơhmal bĕ laih anŭn ngă glaĭ dơ̆ng bruă ih hmâo ngă laih mơ̆ng blŭng hlâo. Tơdah ih ƀu kơhmal ôh, kâo či rai pơ ih laih anŭn či mă hĭ gơ̆ng apui kơđen ih mơ̆ng anih gơ̆. 
But this thou hast, that thou hatest the works of the Nicolaitanes, which *I* also hate. @ Samơ̆ anai tơlơi hiam ih hmâo: Ih bơrơmŭt kơ bruă ƀing Nikôlas, bruă anŭn kâo ăt bơrơmŭt kar kaĭ mơ̆n.”
He that has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the assemblies. To him that overcomes, I will give to him to eat of the tree of life which is in the paradise of God. @  Hlơi pô hmâo tơngia, brơi ñu hmư̆ bĕ tơlơi Yang Bơngăt Hiam laĭ kơ Phung Sang Ơi Adai. Hlơi pô dưi, Kâo či brơi ñu ƀơ̆ng boh kơyâo tơlơi hơdip amăng Parađi Ơi Adai.’”
And to the angel of the assembly in Smyrna write: These things says the first and the last, who became dead, and lived: @  “Čih bĕ kơ ling jang Phung Sang Ơi Adai Smirna tui anai: ‘Anai jing boh pơhiăp Pô blŭng hlâo laih anŭn Pô hnal tuč, Pô hmâo djai laih samơ̆ hmâo hơdip glaĭ laih, 
I know thy tribulation and thy poverty; but thou art rich; and the railing of those who say that they themselves are Jews, and are not, but a synagogue of Satan. @ “Kâo thâo tơlơi tơnap tap ih laih anŭn tơlơi ƀun rin ih samơ̆ biă mă ih jing pơdrŏng. Kâo thâo tơlơi pơčeh mơ̆ng ƀing laĭ ƀing gơñu jing ƀing Yuđa samơ̆ biă mă ƀu djơ̆ ôh, gơñu jing ƀing kơkuh pơpŭ kơ Satan. 
Fear nothing [of] what thou art about to suffer. Behold, the devil is about to cast of you into prison, that ye may be tried; and ye shall have tribulation ten days. Be thou faithful unto death, and I will give to thee the crown of life. @ Anăm hwĭ ôh kơ khul tơlơi tơnap tap ih či tŭ. Nai nê yang sat či glŏm đơđa mơnuih amăng ƀing gih amăng sang krư̆, kiăng lông lăng ƀing gih; laih anŭn ƀing gih či tŭ tơlơi tơnap amăng pluh hrơi. Brơi ih tŏng ten tơl djai, laih anŭn kâo či brơi kơ ih mŭk pơtao tơlơi hơdip.” 
He that has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the assemblies. He that overcomes shall in no wise be injured of the second death. @ Hlơi hmâo tơngia, brơi ñu hmư̆ bĕ tơlơi Yang Bơngăt Hiam laĭ kơ Phung Sang Ơi Adai: Hlơi pô dưi ñu či klaih yơh kơ tơlơi tơnap tap mơ̆ng tơlơi djai tal dua.’”
And to the angel of the assembly in Pergamos write: These things says he that has the sharp two-edged sword: @ “Čih bĕ kơ ling jang Phung Sang Ơi Adai Pergam tui anai: ‘Anai jing boh pơhiăp Pô djă đao gưm dua bơnah mơta ƀơ̆ng biă mă,
I know where thou dwellest, where the throne of Satan [is]; and thou holdest fast my name, and hast not denied my faith, even in the days in which Antipas my faithful witness [was], who was slain among you, where Satan dwells. @ “Kâo thâo anih ih dŏ, ƀơi anŭn hmâo gre pơtao Satan. Ih hmâo djă kơjăp anăn Kâo, ƀu hơngah ôh tơlơi ih đaŏ kơ Kâo, wơ̆t kơ amăng khul hrơi Antipas, pô ngă gơ̆ng jơlan tŏng ten kơ Kâo, pô arăng hmâo pơdjai laih ƀơi tơ̆ng krah ƀing gih, anih Satan dŏ. 
But I have a few things against thee: that thou hast there those who hold the doctrine of Balaam, who taught Balak to cast a snare before the sons of Israel, to eat [of] idol sacrifices and commit fornication. @ Samơ̆ Kâo hmâo đơđa tơlơi ƀuah kơ ih: Ƀơi anih ih dŏ hmâo đơđa ƀing mơnuih tui hluai tơlơi Balaam pơtô, jing pô hmâo pơhrăm Balak dưm mơnơ̆ng pơtơhnač ƀơi anăp ƀing ană Israel, kiăng kơ ƀing gơ̆ ƀơ̆ng mơnơ̆ng arăng pơyơr laih kơ rup trah, laih anŭn ngă tơlơi soh rih răm. 
So thou also hast those who hold the doctrine of Nicolaitanes in like manner. @ Kar kaĭ mơ̆n ih dŏ hmâo dơ̆ng đơđa ƀing mơnuih tui hluai tơlơi Nikôlas pơtô. 
Repent therefore: but if not, I come to thee quickly, and I will make war with them with the sword of my mouth. @ Tui anŭn kơhmal bĕ. Tơdah ih ƀu kơhmal ôh, Kâo či rai tañ pơ ih, yua đao mơ̆ng amăng bah Kâo pơblah hăng ƀing gơñu.”
He that has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the assemblies. To him that overcomes, to him will I give of the hidden manna; and I will give to him a white stone, and on the stone a new name written, which no one knows but he that receives [it]. @  Hlơi pô hmâo tơngia, brơi ñu hmư̆ bĕ tơlơi Yang Bơngăt Hiam laĭ kơ Phung Sang Ơi Adai. Hlơi pô dưi Kâo či brơi kơ ñu ƀañ tơpŭng mana pơdŏp hơgơ̆m; laih anŭn Kâo či brơi kơ ñu sa boh pơtâo kŏ, ƀơi boh pơtâo kŏ anŭn arăng hmâo čih laih sa anăn phrâo ƀu hmâo hlơi thâo ôh, kơnơ̆ng pô mă tŭ đôč thâo.’”
And to the angel of the assembly in Thyatira write: These things says the Son of God, he that has his eyes as a flame of fire, and his feet [are] like fine brass: @ “Čih bĕ kơ ling jang Phung Sang Ơi Adai Thiatir tui anai: Anai jing boh pơhiăp Ană Ơi Adai laĭ, Pô hmâo mơta kar hăng jơlah apui laih anŭn tơkai kar hăng kong čêr dơnar:
I know thy works, and love, and faith, and service, and thine endurance, and thy last works [to be] more than the first. @ ‘Kâo thâo bruă ih, tơlơi khăp ih, tơlơi đaŏ ih, tơlơi ih buih bruă, laih anŭn tơlơi gir ih, khul bruă ih ngă tơdơi anai jing lu hloh kơ khul bruă ih ngă blŭng hlâo. 
But I have against thee that thou permittest the woman Jezebel, she who calls herself prophetess, and she teaches and leads astray my servants to commit fornication and eat of idol sacrifices. @ Samơ̆ hmâo tơlơi Kâo ƀuah kơ ih, ih jum HʼJêsabel, đah kơmơi laĭ mă ñu pô jing sa čô pô laĭ lui hlâo, ñu pơtô laih anŭn plư ƀing ding kơna Kâo ngă tơlơi soh rih răm laih anŭn ƀơ̆ng mơnơ̆ng ngă yang arăng pơyơr laih kơ rup trah. 
And I gave her time that she should repent, and she will not repent of her fornication. @ Kâo hmâo brơi laih kơ ñu hrơi mông dưi kơhmal tơlơi soh, samơ̆ ñu hơngah ƀu kiăng kơhmal ôh kơ tơlơi rih răm ñu. 
Behold, I cast her into a bed, and those that commit adultery with her into great tribulation, unless they repent of her works, @ Anai nê, Kâo či glŏm hĭ ñu ƀơi sưng ruă duăm, laih anŭn glŏm ƀing mơnuih ngă tơlơi soh rih răm hăng ñu amăng tơlơi tơnap tap prŏng, tơdah ñu ƀu kơhmal ôh khul bruă ñu ngă. 
and her children will I kill with death; and all the assemblies shall know that *I* am he that searches [the] reins and [the] hearts; and I will give to you each according to your works. @ Kâo či pơdjai ƀing ană ñu. Hlăk anŭn, abih bang Phung Sang Ơi Adai či thâo Kâo jing Pô thâo tơlơi pơmĭn laih anŭn pran jua mơnuih, Kâo či pơglaĭ kơ rĭm čô amăng ƀing gih tui hăng khul bruă ƀing gih ngă. 
But to you I say, the rest who [are] in Thyatira, as many as have not this doctrine, who have not known the depths of Satan, as they say, I do not cast upon you any other burden; @ Samơ̆ Kâo laĭ hăng ƀing dŏ glaĭ amăng ƀing gih pơ Thiatir, jing ƀing mơnuih ƀu mă tŭ ôh tơlơi pơtô mơta tơlơi đaŏ anŭn, jing ƀing ƀu thâo ôh kơ tơlơi gơñu laĭ khul tơlơi hơgơ̆m dlam kơ Satan, tui anai: Kâo ƀu dưm tơlơi kơtraŏ pơkŏn dơ̆ng ôh ƀơi ƀing gih. 
but what ye have hold fast till I shall come. @ Samơ̆ kơnơ̆ng brơi ƀing gih djă kơjăp tơlơi ƀing gih hmâo tơl Kâo truh. 
And he that overcomes, and he that keeps unto the end my works, to him will I give authority over the nations, @ Hlơi pô dưi laih anŭn djă pioh bruă Kâo tơl hnal tuč, Kâo či brơi kơ mơnuih anŭn tơlơi dưi ƀơi khul djuai mơnuih, 
and he shall shepherd them with an iron rod; as vessels of pottery are they broken in pieces, as I also have received from my Father; @ ñu či gĭt gai ƀing gơñu hăng gai pơsơi, kar hăng arăng taih pơčah gŏ lŏn, kar hăng Kâo pô hmâo mă tŭ laih tơlơi dưi anŭn mơ̆ng Ama Kâo. 
and I will give to him the morning star. @ Kâo či brơi kơ pô anŭn pơtŭ sêng mơguah. 
He that has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the assemblies. @ Hlơi pô hmâo tơngia, brơi ñu hmư̆ bĕ tơlơi Yang Bơngăt Hiam laĭ kơ Phung Sang Ơi Adai!’”
And to the angel of the assembly in Sardis write: These things saith he that has the seven Spirits of God, and the seven stars: I know thy works, that thou hast a name that thou livest, and art dead. @ “Čih bĕ kơ ling jang Phung Sang Ơi Adai Sardis tui anai: ‘Anai jing boh pơhiăp Pô hmâo tơjuh Yang Bơngăt Ơi Adai, laih anŭn tơjuh boh pơtŭ: “Kâo thâo khul bruă ih; ih hmâo anăn jing hơdip, samơ̆ biă mă ih djai laih. 
Be watchful, and strengthen the things that remain, which are about to die, for I have not found thy works complete before my God. @ Tui anŭn, dŏ răng bĕ laih anŭn ngă pơkơjăp hơgĕt tơlơi dŏ glaĭ, jing khul tơlơi giăm djai, yua kơ Kâo ƀu ƀuh ôh khul bruă ih jing klă tum ƀơi anăp Ơi Adai Kâo. 
Remember therefore how thou hast received and heard, and keep [it] and repent. If therefore thou shalt not watch, I will come [upon thee] as a thief, and thou shalt not know at what hour I shall come upon thee. @ Tui anŭn brơi ih hơdơr glaĭ bĕ hyư̆m ih hmâo mă tŭ laih anŭn hmư̆; brơi ih djă pioh laih anŭn kơhmal bĕ. Tơdah ih ƀu dŏ mơdưh ôh, Kâo či rai kar hăng mơnuih klĕ, laih anŭn ih ƀu thâo ôh hrơi mông pă Kâo či rai. 
But thou hast a few names in Sardis which have not defiled their garments, and they shall walk with me in white, because they are worthy. @ Samơ̆ pơ plei Sardis ih ăt hmâo đơđa mơnuih aka pơgrĭ ao gơñu ôh; ƀing gơñu či buh ao kŏ rơbat hrŏm hơbĭt hăng kâo, yua kơ ƀing gơñu năng lăp biă mă. 
He that overcomes, *he* shall be clothed in white garments, and I will not blot his name out of the book of life, and will confess his name before my Father and before his angels. @ Hlơi pô dưi, ñu či buh ao kŏ kar hăng anŭn, laih anŭn Kâo ƀu či sut hĭ ôh anăn ñu mơ̆ng hơdrôm hră tơlơi hơdip; laih anŭn Kâo či pơhaih anăn ñu ƀơi anăp Ama Kâo laih anŭn ƀơi ƀing ling jang Ñu.”
He that has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the assemblies. @ Hlơi pô hmâo tơngia, brơi ñu hmư̆ bĕ tơlơi Yang Bơngăt Hiam laĭ kơ Phung Sang Ơi Adai.’”
And to the angel of the assembly in Philadelphia write: These things saith the holy, the true; he that has the key of David, he who opens and no one shall shut, and shuts and no one shall open: @  “Čih bĕ kơ ling jang Phung Sang Ơi Adai Philadelphi tui anai: ‘Anai jing boh pơhiăp Pô Rơgoh Hiam laih anŭn Sĭt tơpă, Pô hmâo kơmla kăl Đawit; Ñu pŏk ƀu hmâo hlơi dưi krư̆, Ñu krư̆ ƀu hmâo hlơi dưi pŏk ôh: 
I know thy works: behold, I have set before thee an opened door, which no one can shut, because thou hast a little power, and hast kept my word, and hast not denied my name. @ “Kâo thâo khul bruă ih. Anai nê, kâo hmâo pŏk laih ƀơi anăp ih sa boh bah amăng, ƀu hmâo hlơi pô dưi krư̆ hĭ ôh. Kâo thâo ih hmâo kơnơ̆ng ƀiă tơlơi kơtang, samơ̆ ăt djă pioh tơlơi kâo pơhiăp, laih anŭn ƀu hơngah anăn kâo ôh. 
Behold, I make them of the synagogue of Satan who say that they are Jews, and are not, but lie; behold, I will cause that they shall come and shall do homage before thy feet, and shall know that *I* have loved thee. @ Kâo pha brơi kơ ih ƀing lơ̆m kơ Satan, ƀing laĭ gơñu pô jing ƀing Yuđa samơ̆ ƀu djơ̆ ôh, gơñu ƀlor đôč. Kâo či ngă brơi ƀing gơñu rai bon kơkuh ƀơi tơkai ih laih anŭn ƀing gơñu či thâo Kâo hmâo khăp kơ ih. 
Because thou hast kept the word of my patience, *I* also will keep thee out of the hour of trial, which is about to come upon the whole habitable world, to try them that dwell upon the earth. @ Yua kơ ih hmâo gir djă pioh boh pơhiăp Kâo laih, hnŭn yơh Kâo ăt či pơgang ih klaih mơ̆ng mông tơlơi lông lăng, jing mông či truh tar ƀar lŏn tơnah, kiăng lông lăng ƀing mơnuih dŏ ƀơi lŏn tơnah. 
I come quickly: hold fast what thou hast, that no one take thy crown. @ Kâo či rai tañ. Djă pioh kơjăp bĕ hơgĕt tơlơi ih hlăk dŏ hmâo, kiăng kơ arăng ƀu sua mă hĭ ôh mŭk pơtao ih. 
He that overcomes, him will I make a pillar in the temple of my God, and he shall go no more at all out; and I will write upon him the name of my God, and the name of the city of my God, the new Jerusalem, which comes down out of heaven, from my God, and my new name. @ Hlơi pô dưi, Kâo či pơjing ñu tơmeh amăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ Ơi Adai Kâo, ñu ƀu či tơbiă mơ̆ng anŭn ôh. Kâo či čih ƀơi ñu anăn Ơi Adai Kâo, laih anŭn anăn plei Ơi Adai Kâo, jing Yêrusalem phrâo pơ adai, trŭn rai mơ̆ng Ơi Adai, laih anŭn čih anăn phrâo Kâo.” 
He that has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the assemblies. @ Hlơi pô hmâo tơngia, brơi ñu hmư̆ bĕ tơlơi Yang Bơngăt Hiam laĭ kơ Phung Sang Ơi Adai.’”
And to the angel of the assembly in Laodicea write: These things says the Amen, the faithful and true witness, the beginning of the creation of God: @  “Čih bĕ kơ ling jang Phung Sang Ơi Adai Laôdisê tui anai: ‘Anai jing boh pơhiăp mơ̆ng Pô Amen, Pô ngă gơ̆ng jơlan hơnơ̆ng ten laih anŭn sĭt, Pô phŭn kơ tơlơi Ơi Adai hrih pơjing. 
I know thy works, that thou art neither cold nor hot; I would thou wert cold or hot. @ “Kâo thâo bruă ih; ih ƀu rơŏt kŏn pơ-iă lơi, Kâo kiăng kơ ih rơŏt sĭt ƀôdah pơ-iă sĭt. 
Thus because thou art lukewarm, and neither cold nor hot, I am about to spue thee out of my mouth. @ Tui anŭn, yua kơ ih pơđao hơhor đôč, ƀu rơŏt kŏn pơ-iă lơi, anŭn yơh Kâo či ĕk lui ih mơ̆ng amăng bah Kâo. 
Because thou sayest, I am rich, and am grown rich, and have need of nothing, and knowest not that *thou* art the wretched and the miserable, and poor, and blind, and naked; @ Yua kơ ih laĭ: Kâo pơdrŏng, kâo đĭ kơyar laih, kâo ƀu kiăng hơgĕt dơ̆ng ôh. Samơ̆ ih ƀu thâo ôh ih hlăk tơnap tap, pap mơñai đơi, ƀun rin, bum mơta laih anŭn mơhlŭn. 
I counsel thee to buy of me gold purified by fire, that thou mayest be rich; and white garments, that thou mayest be clothed, and that the shame of thy nakedness may not be made manifest; and eye-salve to anoint thine eyes, that thou mayest see. @ Tui anŭn, Kâo pơđur ih blơi bĕ mơ̆ng Kâo mah arăng hmâo pơrơgoh laih hăng apui, kiăng kơ ih dưi jing pơdrŏng; blơi mă khul ao kŏ laih anŭn buh kiăng kơ gom hĭ tơlơi mlâo kơ tơlơi mơhlŭn ih, laih anŭn blơi ia jrao pik mơta ih kiăng kơ ih dưi ƀuh. 
I rebuke and discipline as many as I love; be zealous therefore and repent. @ Ƀing mơnuih Kâo khăp, Kâo ƀuah laih anŭn pơkra pơjuăt; tui anŭn brơi ih hur har laih anŭn kơhmal bĕ. 
Behold, I stand at the door and am knocking; if any one hear my voice and open the door, I will come in unto him and sup with him, and he with me. @ Anai nê, Kâo dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơi bah amăng laih anŭn khŏk, tơdah hlơi pô hmư̆ asăp Kâo laih anŭn pŏk bah amăng, Kâo či mŭt amăng sang ñu, ƀơ̆ng huă hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ñu, laih anŭn ñu hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Kâo. 
He that overcomes, to him will I give to sit with me in my throne; as *I* also have overcome, and have sat down with my Father in his throne. @ Hlơi pô dưi, Kâo či brơi ñu dŏ ber hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Kâo ƀơi gre pơtao Kâo, kar hăng Kâo pô dưi laih, laih anŭn dŏ ber laih hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Ama Kâo ƀơi gre pơtao Ñu.” 
He that has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the assemblies. @ Hlơi pô hmâo tơngia, brơi ñu hmư̆ bĕ tơlơi Yang Bơngăt Hiam laĭ kơ Phung Sang Ơi Adai.’”
After these things I saw, and behold, a door opened in heaven, and the first voice which I heard as of a trumpet speaking with me, saying, Come up here, and I will shew thee the things which must take place after these things. @ Tơdơi kơ tơlơi anŭn, kâo ƀuh amăng adai hmâo sa boh bah amăng pŏk laih! Asăp tal blŭng kâo hmư̆ kar hăng asăp tơki pơhiăp hăng kâo tui anai: “Đĭ pơ anai bĕ, laih anŭn Kâo či kơčrâo brơi kơ ih ƀuh khul tơlơi khŏm či truh tơdơi anai.” 
Immediately I became in [the] Spirit; and behold, a throne stood in the heaven, and upon the throne one sitting, @ Tañ mơtam, Yang Bơngăt Hiam gom hĭ kâo, anai nê, hmâo sa boh gre pơtao amăng adai, ƀơi gre anŭn hmâo Pô hlăk dŏ ber. 
and he [that was] sitting like in appearance to a stone [of] jasper and a sardius, and a rainbow round the throne like in appearance to an emerald. @ Pô dŏ ber ƀơi anŭn lăng kar boh pơtâo yom jasper laih anŭn karnêlian, laih anŭn jum dar gre pơtao anŭn hmâo mrơ̆t kar hăng boh pơtâo yom êmêrôt. 
And round the throne twenty-four thrones, and on the thrones twenty-four elders sitting, clothed with white garments; and on their heads golden crowns. @ Jum dar gre pơtao anŭn hmâo dua pluh pă boh gre pơkŏn dơ̆ng, laih anŭn hmâo dua pluh pă čô kŏng tha hlăk dŏ ber ƀơi gre anŭn, buh ao phyung kŏ laih anŭn đua mŭk pơtao mah. 
And out of the throne go forth lightnings, and voices, and thunders; and seven lamps of fire, burning before the throne, which are the seven Spirits of God; @ Mơ̆ng gre pơtao anŭn tơbiă kơmlă, asăp pơhiăp laih anŭn dơnai grơ̆m. Ƀơi anăp gre pơtao hmâo tơjuh ƀĕ apui arok dŏ jă, anŭn jing tơjuh yang bơngăt Ơi Adai. 
and before the throne, as a glass sea, like crystal. And in the midst of the throne, and around the throne, four living creatures, full of eyes, before and behind; @ Ƀơi anăp gre pơtao hmâo mơnơ̆ng lăng kar hăng ia rơsĭ mơnĭl, jơngeh kar hăng boh pơtâo bơngač; tơ̆ng krah laih anŭn jum dar gre pơtao hmâo pă drơi mơnơ̆ng hơdip, bă hăng mơta ƀơi anăp laih anŭn gah klon. 
and the first living creature like a lion, and the second living creature like a calf, and the third living creature having the face as of a man, and the fourth living creature like a flying eagle. @ Mơnơ̆ng hơdip tal sa kar hăng rơmông dŭl, mơnơ̆ng hơdip tal dua kar hăng rơmo tơno, mơnơ̆ng hơdip tal klâo hmâo ƀô̆ mơta kar hăng ƀô̆ mơta mơnuih, laih anŭn mơnơ̆ng hơdip tal pă kar hăng čĭm klang dŏ pơr. 
And the four living creatures, each one of them having respectively six wings; round and within they are full of eyes; and they cease not day and night saying, Holy, holy, holy, Lord God Almighty, who was, and who is, and who is to come. @ Pă mơnơ̆ng hơdip anŭn, rĭm drơi hmâo năm pŏk čăng, jum dar laih anŭn amăng lăm ñu bă hăng khul mơta; hrơi mlam gơñu adoh ƀu pơdơi ôh:
“Rơgoh hiam, rơgoh hiam, rơgoh hiam,
Khua Yang jing Ơi Adai Dưi Kơtang,
Pô Hmâo Laih, Hlăk Hmâo, laih anŭn Hlăk Rai!”
And when the living creatures shall give glory and honour and thanksgiving to him that sits upon the throne, who lives to the ages of ages, @ Rĭm wơ̆t khul hlô mơnơ̆ng hơdip pơyơr tơlơi guh kơang, tơlơi pơpŭ laih anŭn tơlơi bơni hơơč kơ Pô dŏ ber ƀơi gre pơtao, Pô hơdip hlŏng lar, 
the twenty-four elders shall fall before him that sits upon the throne, and do homage to him that lives to the ages of ages; and shall cast their crowns before the throne, saying, @ dua pluh pă čô ƀing kŏng tha bon kŭp ƀơi anăp Pô dŏ ber ƀơi gre pơtao, laih anŭn kơkuh pơpŭ kơ Pô dŏ hơdip hlŏng lar. Gơñu glŏm mŭk pơtao gơñu ƀơi anăp gre pơtao, laih anŭn laĭ:
Thou art worthy, O our Lord and [our] God, to receive glory and honour and power; for *thou* hast created all things, and for thy will they were, and they have been created. @ “Ơ Khua Yang Ơi Adai gơmơi,
Ih lăp mă tŭ tơlơi guh kơang, tơlơi pơpŭ, laih anŭn tơlơi dưi mơyang,
Yua kơ Ih hmâo hrih laih abih bang mơnơ̆ng,
Laih anŭn yua mơ̆ng tơlơi Ih kiăng abih mơnơ̆ng dưi hrih pơjing laih anŭn hmâo rai.”
And I saw on the right hand of him that sat upon the throne a book, written within and on the back, sealed with seven seals. @  Giơ̆ng tơlơi anŭn kâo ƀuh amăng tơngan hơnuă Pô dŏ ƀơi gre pơtao sa čơkul hră klĭ hmâo čih laih amăng lăm wơ̆t gah rơngiao, arăng hmâo kơđơ̆l laih hăng tơjuh mơnơ̆ng kơđŏm. 
And I saw a strong angel proclaiming with a loud voice, Who [is] worthy to open the book, and to break its seals? @ Laih anŭn kâo ƀuh sa čô ling jang bă hăng tơlơi kơtang pơhaih hăng asăp kraih: “Hlơi pô năng lăp pŏk čơkul hră klĭ laih anŭn yaih khul mơnơ̆ng kơđŏm anai?” 
And no one was able in the heaven, or upon the earth, or underneath the earth, to open the book, or to regard it. @ Samơ̆ amăng adai adih, ƀơi lŏn tơnah, ƀôdah gah yŭ lŏn tơnah ƀu hmâo hlơi dưi pŏk čơkul hră anŭn ƀôdah dưi lăng ñu. 
And *I* wept much because no one had been found worthy to open the book nor to regard it. @ Laih anŭn kâo hia ơh ơ̆l, yua kơ ƀu hmâo hlơi năng lăp pŏk čơkul hră ƀôdah lăng ñu ôh. 
And one of the elders says to me, Do not weep. Behold, the lion which [is] of the tribe of Juda, the root of David, has overcome [so as] to open the book, and its seven seals. @ Laih anŭn hmâo sa čô amăng ƀing kŏng tha laĭ kơ kâo: “Anăm hia ôh; anai nê, Rơmông Dŭl kơnŭng djuai Yuđa, ană tơčo Đawit dưi laih, Ñu yơh dưi pŏk čơkul hră klĭ anŭn, laih anŭn yaih tơjuh mơnơ̆ng kơđŏm anai.”
And I saw in the midst of the throne and of the four living creatures, and in the midst of the elders, a Lamb standing, as slain, having seven horns and seven eyes, which are the seven Spirits of God [which are] sent into all the earth: @  Kâo ƀuh Ană Triu hrup hăng arăng hmâo pơdjai Ñu laih, hlăk dŏ dơ̆ng tơ̆ng krah gre pơtao, jum dar gre hmâo pă drơi hlô mơnơ̆ng hơdip laih anŭn ƀing kŏng tha. Ană Triu hmâo tơjuh ƀĕ tơki laih anŭn tơjuh boh mơta, kiăng laĭ kơ tơjuh yang bơngăt Ơi Adai hmâo pơkiaŏ nao laih tar ƀar lŏn tơnah. 
and it came and took [it] out of the right hand of him that sat upon the throne. @ Ană Triu nao mă čơkul hră klĭ mơ̆ng tơngan hơnuă Pô dŏ ber ƀơi gre pơtao. 
And when it took the book, the four living creatures and the twenty-four elders fell before the Lamb, having each a harp and golden bowls full of incenses, which are the prayers of the saints. @ Giơ̆ng Ñu mă čơkul hră klĭ anŭn, pă drơi hlô mơnơ̆ng hơdip laih anŭn ƀing dua pluh pă čô kŏng tha bon ƀơi anăp Ană Triu, rĭm čô djă sa boh gong, laih anŭn khul čơlŭ mah bă hăng mơnơ̆ng ƀâu mơngưi, anŭn jing tơlơi iâu laĭ kơ ƀing rơgoh hiam. 
And they sing a new song, saying, Thou art worthy to take the book, and to open its seals; because thou hast been slain, and hast redeemed to God, by thy blood, out of every tribe, and tongue, and people, and nation, @ Ƀing gơñu adoh sa tơlơi adoh phrâo tui anai:
“Ih yơh năng lăp mă čơkul hră klĭ anŭn
Laih anŭn yaih mơnơ̆ng kơđŏm, yua kơ arăng hmâo pơdjai Ih laih,
Laih anŭn hăng drah Ih pô Ih hmâo song mă laih ƀing mơnuih kơ Ơi Adai
Ƀing mơnuih lơ̆m kơ abih bang kơnŭng djuai, abih bang tơlơi pơhiăp, abih bang djuai mơnuih, laih anŭn abih bang lŏn čar.
and made them to our God kings and priests; and they shall reign over the earth. @  Ih ngă brơi gơñu jing hĭ sa boh dêh čar pơtao laih anŭn ƀing khua ngă yang kơ Ơi Adai ƀing ta,
Laih anŭn gơñu či gĭt gai ƀơi lŏn tơnah.”
And I saw, and I heard [the] voice of many angels around the throne and the living creatures and the elders; and their number was ten thousands of ten thousands and thousands of thousands; @  Kâo lăng, laih anŭn hmư̆ asăp lu ling jang jum dar gre pơtao, laih anŭn khul hlô mơnơ̆ng hơdip hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing kŏng tha. Hmâo klăk klăk, klai klai ling jang. 
saying with a loud voice, Worthy is the Lamb that has been slain, to receive power, and riches, and wisdom, and strength, and honour, and glory, and blessing. @ Gơñu adoh hăng asăp kraih:
“Ană Triu arăng hmâo pơdjai laih,
Năng lăp mă tŭ tơlơi dưi mơyang, tơlơi pơdrŏng, tơlơi kơhnâo,
Tơlơi kơtang, tơlơi pơpŭ, tơlơi guh kơang, laih anŭn tơlơi arăng pơ-ư bơni!”
And every creature which is in the heaven and upon the earth and under the earth, and [those that are] upon the sea, and all things in them, heard I saying, To him that sits upon the throne, and to the Lamb, blessing, and honour, and glory, and might, to the ages of ages. @ Laih anŭn kâo hmư̆ abih bang mơnơ̆ng hrih pơjing amăng adai, ƀơi lŏn tơnah, gah yŭ lŏn tơnah, amăng ia rơsĭ, laih anŭn abih bang mơnơ̆ng amăng khul anih anŭn adoh:
“Kơ Pô dŏ ber ƀơi gre pơtao laih anŭn kơ Ană Triu
Năng lăp hmâo tơlơi arăng pơ-ư bơni, tơlơi pơpŭ, tơlơi guh kơang, laih anŭn tơlơi dưi kơtang amăng abih bang rơnŭk hlŏng lar!”
And the four living creatures said, Amen; and the elders fell down and did homage. @ Pă drơi hlô mơnơ̆ng hơdip laĭ: “Amen!” Laih anŭn ƀing kŏng tha bon laih anŭn kơkuh pơpŭ.
And I saw when the Lamb opened one of the seven seals, and I heard one of the four living creatures saying, as a voice of thunder, Come [and see]. @ Kâo ƀuh tơdang Ană Triu pŏk mơnơ̆ng kơđŏm tal sa amăng tơjuh mơnơ̆ng kơđŏm, laih anŭn kâo hmư̆ sa amăng pă drơi hlô mơnơ̆ng hơdip laĭ kraih kar hăng dơnai grơ̆m: “Rai bĕ!” 
And I saw: and behold, a white horse, and he that sat upon it having a bow; and a crown was given to him, and he went forth conquering and that he might conquer. @ Kâo lăng, anai nê hmâo sa drơi aseh kŏ. Pô đĭ aseh anŭn djă sa ƀĕ hraŏ, laih anŭn arăng brơi kơ ñu sa boh mŭk pơtao. Ñu đuaĭ nao kar hăng sa čô mơnuih pơblah dưi laih anŭn pơpă ñu nao pơ anŭn ñu dưi.
And when it opened the second seal, I heard the second living creature saying, Come [and see]. @ Tơdang Ană Triu pŏk mơnơ̆ng kơđŏm tal dua, kâo hmư̆ hlô mơnơ̆ng hơdip tal dua laĭ tui anai: “Rai bĕ!” 
And another, a red horse, went forth; and to him that sat upon it, to him it was given to take peace from the earth, and that they should slay one another; and there was given to him a great sword. @ Laih anŭn sa drơi aseh pơkŏn, mriah hêm tơbiă rai. Pô đĭ aseh anŭn hmâo tơlơi dưi mă lui hĭ tơlơi rơnŭk rơnua mơ̆ng lŏn tơnah, kiăng kơ ƀing mơnuih pơdjai tơdruă gơñu; laih anŭn arăng ăt brơi kơ ñu sa ƀĕ đao prŏng.
And when it opened the third seal, I heard the third living creature saying, Come [and see]. And I saw: and behold, a black horse, and he that sat upon it having a balance in his hand. @  Tơdang Ană Triu pŏk mơnơ̆ng kơđŏm tal klâo, kâo hmư̆ hlô mơnơ̆ng hơdip tal klâo laĭ: “Rai bĕ!” Kâo lăng, anai nê hmâo sa drơi aseh jŭ. Pô đĭ aseh anŭn amăng tơngan ñu djă boh kơnăng. 
And I heard as a voice in the midst of the four living creatures saying, A choenix of wheat for a denarius, and three choenixes of barley for a denarius: and do not injure the oil and the wine. @ Laih anŭn kâo hmư̆ kar hăng sa asăp tơ̆ng krah pă drơi hlô mơnơ̆ng hơdip laĭ: “Sa ƀuat pơdai tơpŭng mơdôm sa đơniê, laih anŭn klâo ƀuat pơdai ôrgơ mơdôm sa đơniê, samơ̆ anăm ngă răm ôh kơ ia ôliwơ laih anŭn ia tơpai!”
And when it opened the fourth seal, I heard [the voice of] the fourth living creature saying, Come [and see]. @ Tơdang Ană Triu pŏk mơnơ̆ng kơđŏm tal pă, kâo hmư̆ asăp hlô mơnơ̆ng hơdip tal pă laĭ: “Rai bĕ!” 
And I saw: and behold, a pale horse, and he that sat upon it, his name [was] Death, and hades followed with him; and authority was given to him over the fourth of the earth to slay with sword, and with hunger, and with death, and by the beasts of the earth. @ Kâo lăng, anai nê hmâo sa drơi aseh ƀhul. Anăn pô đĭ aseh anŭn jing Tơlơi Djai, laih anŭn plei Ƀing Djai tui klon ñu. Gơñu hmâo tơlơi dưi ƀơi sa črăn amăng pă črăn lŏn tơnah, kiăng pơdjai hăng đao, hăng tơlơi ư̆ rơpa, hăng tơlơi ruă klin, laih anŭn hăng khul hlô glai hơtai ƀơi lŏn tơnah.
And when it opened the fifth seal, I saw underneath the altar the souls of them that had been slain for the word of God, and for the testimony which they held; @ Tơdang Ană Triu pŏk mơnơ̆ng kơđŏm tal rơma, kâo ƀuh gah yŭ kơƀang ngă yang hmâo bơngăt ƀing arăng pơdjai laih yua kơ boh pơhiăp Ơi Adai laih anŭn yua kơ tơlơi gơñu ngă gơ̆ng jơlan. 
and they cried with a loud voice, saying, How long, O sovereign Ruler, holy and true, dost thou not judge and avenge our blood on them that dwell upon the earth? @ Gơñu ur kraih tui anai: “Ơ Khua Yang jing Pô rơgoh hiam laih anŭn sĭt, hơdôm sui dơ̆ng Ih či phat kơđi, laih anŭn rŭ nua kơ ƀing dŏ ƀơi lŏn tơnah yua kơ drah ƀing gơmơi?” 
And there was given to them, to each one a white robe; and it was said to them that they should rest yet a little while, until both their fellow-bondmen and their brethren, who were about to be killed as they, should be fulfilled. @ Arăng brơi kơ rĭm čô gơñu sa blah ao phyung kŏ, laih anŭn arăng pơtă gơñu khŏm pơdơi sui ƀiă dơ̆ng, tơl mrô ƀing mă bruă hrŏm hơbĭt hăng gơñu tum laih, laih anŭn ƀing adơi ayŏng gơñu khŏm tŭ tơlơi djai kar hăng gơñu tŭ laih.
And I saw when it opened the sixth seal, and there was a great earthquake; and the sun became black as hair sackcloth, and the whole moon became as blood, @  Tơdang Ană Triu pŏk mơnơ̆ng kơđŏm tal năm, kâo ƀuh tơlơi pơpư̆ lŏn tơnah kơtang kơtĭt; yang hrơi jing hĭ kơnăm kar hăng bơnal jŭ, yang blan jing hĭ mriah kar hăng drah, 
and the stars of heaven fell upon the earth, as a fig tree, shaken by a great wind, casts its unseasonable figs. @ khul pơtŭ amăng adai lĕ trŭn ƀơi lŏn tơnah kar hăng khul boh hra mơtah ruh trŭn mơ̆ng phŭn hra hlăk angĭn kơtang. 
And the heaven was removed as a book rolled up, and every mountain and island were removed out of their places. @ Adai rơngiă hĭ kar hăng čơkul hră klĭ lom glaĭ, abih bang khul čư̆, abih bang khul plao ia leng kơ tơglưh đuaĭ mơ̆ng anih gơñu. 
And the kings of the earth, and the great, and the chiliarchs, and the rich, and the strong, and every bondman and freeman, hid themselves in the caves and in the rocks of the mountains; @ Laih anŭn ƀing pơtao ƀơi lŏn tơnah, ƀing khua prŏng, ƀing khua tơhan, ƀing pơdrŏng, ƀing hmâo tơlơi dưi, abih bang ƀing hlŭn laih anŭn ƀing rơngai leng kơ đuaĭ kơdŏp amăng par laih anŭn amăng anih boh pơtâo ƀơi čư̆. 
and they say to the mountains and to the rocks, Fall on us, and have us hidden from [the] face of him that sits upon the throne, and from the wrath of the Lamb; @ Gơñu laĭ hăng čư̆ laih anŭn khul boh pơtâo tui anai: “Lĕ trŭn bĕ ƀơi gơmơi laih anŭn pơdŏp gơmơi mơ̆ng ƀô̆ mơta Pô dŏ ber ƀơi gre pơtao laih anŭn mơ̆ng tơlơi Ană Triu hil. 
because the great day of his wrath is come, and who is able to stand? @ Yua kơ hrơi ƀing Gơñu hil kơtang truh laih, laih anŭn hlơi dưi dŏ dơ̆ng?”
And after this I saw four angels standing upon the four corners of the earth, holding fast the four winds of the earth, that no wind might blow upon the earth, nor upon the sea, nor upon any tree. @  Tơdơi kơ anŭn, kâo ƀuh pă čô ling jang dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơi pă akiăng lŏn tơnah, gơñu kơ̆ng hĭ pă glung angĭn, kiăng kơ ƀu hmâo angĭn thut ƀơi lŏn tơnah, ƀơi ia rơsĭ ƀôdah ƀơi phŭn kơyâo. 
And I saw another angel ascending from [the] sunrising, having [the] seal of [the] living God; and he cried with a loud voice to the four angels to whom it had been given to hurt the earth and the sea, @ Laih anŭn kâo ƀuh sa čô ling jang pơkŏn dơ̆ng đĭ rai mơ̆ng anih yang hrơi ƀlĕ, djă mơnơ̆ng kơđŏm mơ̆ng Ơi Adai hơdip. Ñu iâu kraih pă čô ling jang arăng hmâo brơi laih tơlơi dưi ngă sat kơ lŏn tơnah laih anŭn kơ ia rơsĭ. 
saying, Hurt not the earth, nor the sea, nor the trees, until we shall have sealed the bondmen of our God upon their foreheads. @ Ñu laĭ: “Anăm ngă sat kơ lŏn tơnah, kơ ia rơsĭ, ƀôdah kơ khul kơyâo pơtâo ôh, tơl ƀing gơmơi hmâo kơđŏm laih ƀơi athơi ƀing ding kơna Ơi Adai ƀing ta.” 
And I heard the number of the sealed, a hundred [and] forty-four thousand, sealed out of every tribe of [the] sons of Israel: @ Kâo hmư̆ mrô ƀing mơnuih hmâo gru kơđŏm: Hmâo sa rơtuh pă pluh pă rơbâo čô mơ̆ng abih bang kơnŭng djuai ană Israel.
out of [the] tribe of Juda, twelve thousand sealed; out of [the] tribe of Reuben, twelve thousand; out of [the] tribe of Gad, twelve thousand; @ Arăng hmâo kơđŏm laih pluh dua rơbâo čô mơ̆ng kơnŭng djuai Yuđa;
Pluh dua rơbâo čô mơ̆ng kơnŭng djuai Ruben;
Pluh dua rơbâo čô mơ̆ng kơnŭng djuai Gat;
out of [the] tribe of Aser, twelve thousand; out of [the] tribe of Nepthalim, twelve thousand; out of [the] tribe of Manasseh, twelve thousand; @ Pluh dua rơbâo čô mơ̆ng kơnŭng djuai Aser;
Pluh dua rơbâo čô mơ̆ng kơnŭng djuai Naptali;
Pluh dua rơbâo čô mơ̆ng kơnŭng djuai Manasê;
out of [the] tribe of Simeon, twelve thousand; out of [the] tribe of Levi, twelve thousand; out of [the] tribe of Issachar, twelve thousand; @ Pluh dua rơbâo čô mơ̆ng kơnŭng djuai Simêôn;
Pluh dua rơbâo čô mơ̆ng kơnŭng djuai Lêwi;
Pluh dua rơbâo čô mơ̆ng kơnŭng djuai Isakar;
out of [the] tribe of Zabulun, twelve thousand; out of [the] tribe of Joseph, twelve thousand; out of [the] tribe of Benjamin, twelve thousand sealed. @ Pluh dua rơbâo čô mơ̆ng kơnŭng djuai Sabulôn;
Pluh dua rơbâo čô mơ̆ng kơnŭng djuai Yôsep;
Pluh dua rơbâo čô mơ̆ng kơnŭng djuai Benjamin.
After these things I saw, and lo, a great crowd, which no one could number, out of every nation and tribes and peoples and tongues, standing before the throne, and before the Lamb, clothed with white robes, and palm branches in their hands. @ Tơdơi kơ anŭn, kâo lăng, anai nê hmâo sa phung mơnuih lu biă mă arăng ƀu dưi yap ôh, mơ̆ng abih bang lŏn čar, mơ̆ng abih bang kơnŭng djuai, mơ̆ng abih bang djuai mơnuih, laih anŭn abih bang tơlơi pơhiăp. Ƀing gơñu dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơi anăp gre pơtao laih anŭn ƀơi anăp Ană Triu, buh ao phyung kŏ laih anŭn amăng tơngan gơñu djă than gol. 
And they cry with a loud voice, saying, Salvation to our God who sits upon the throne, and to the Lamb. @ Gơñu ur dreo tui anai: “Tơlơi pơklaih lơ̆m kơ Ơi Adai ƀing ta, Pô dŏ ber ƀơi gre pơtao, laih anŭn lơ̆m kơ Ană Triu!” 
And all the angels stood around the throne, and the elders, and the four living creatures, and fell before the throne upon their faces, and worshipped God, @ Laih anŭn abih bang ƀing ling jang dŏ dơ̆ng jum dar gre pơtao, jum dar ƀing kŏng tha laih anŭn pă drơi hlô mơnơ̆ng hơdip, ƀing gơñu bon kŭp ƀô̆ ƀơi anăp gre pơtao laih anŭn kơkuh pơpŭ Ơi Adai, 
saying, Amen: Blessing, and glory, and wisdom, and thanksgiving, and honour, and power, and strength, to our God, to the ages of ages. Amen. @ gơñu laĭ: “Amen! Tơlơi pơ-ư bơni, tơlơi guh kơang, tơlơi kơhnâo, tơlơi bơni hơơč, tơlơi pơpŭ, tơlơi dưi mơyang laih anŭn tơlơi dưi kơtang lơ̆m kơ Ơi Adai ƀing ta nanao hlŏng lar. Amen!” 
And one of the elders answered, saying to me, These who are clothed with white robes, who are they, and whence came they? @ Sa čô amăng ƀing kŏng tha tơña kơ kâo tui anai: “Ƀing hlơi buh ao phyung kŏ anŭn, laih anŭn mơ̆ng pă ƀing gơñu rai?” 
And I said to him, My lord, *thou* knowest. And he said to me, These are they who come out of the great tribulation, and have washed their robes, and have made them white in the blood of the Lamb. @ Kâo laĭ glaĭ: “Ơ Khua, ih yơh thâo tơlơi anŭn.” Ñu laĭ kơ kâo: “Anai jing ƀing mơnuih tơbiă rai mơ̆ng tơlơi tơnap tap prŏng. Ƀing gơñu hmâo boh laih ao phyung gơñu laih anŭn ngă brơi gơñu jing kŏ hăng drah Ană Triu. 
Therefore are they before the throne of God, and serve him day and night in his temple, and he that sits upon the throne shall spread his tabernacle over them. @ Yua kơ anŭn yơh ƀing gơñu dưi dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơi anăp gre pơtao Ơi Adai, hrơi mlam buih bruă Ơi Adai amăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ Ñu; laih anŭn Pô dŏ ber ƀơi gre pơtao či gom pơgang gơñu. 
They shall not hunger any more, neither shall they thirst any more, nor shall the sun at all fall on them, nor any burning heat; @ Ƀing gơñu ƀu či rơpa, kŏn mơhao dơ̆ng lơi, yang hrơi ƀôdah tơlơi pơ-iă kơtang ăt kŏn dưi čuh ƀing gơñu lơi. 
because the Lamb which is in the midst of the throne shall shepherd them, and shall lead them to fountains of waters of life, and God shall wipe away every tear from their eyes. @ Yua kơ Ană Triu dŏ tơ̆ng krah gre pơtao či jing pô kiaŏ wai ƀing gơñu, laih anŭn Ñu či atăt ba ƀing gơ̆ pơ akŏ ia hơdip; laih anŭn Ơi Adai či sut hĭ abih ia mơta mơ̆ng mơta ƀing gơñu.”
And when it opened the seventh seal, there was silence in the heaven about half an hour. @ Tơdang Ană Triu yaih mơnơ̆ng kơđŏm tal tơjuh, amăng adai hmâo tơlơi rơiăt amăng ha mơkrah mông. 
And I saw the seven angels who stand before God, and seven trumpets were given to them. @ Laih anŭn kâo ƀuh tơjuh čô ling jang dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơi anăp Ơi Adai, laih anŭn arăng brơi ƀing gơñu tơjuh ƀĕ tơdiăp.
And another angel came and stood at the altar, having a golden censer; and much incense was given to him, that he might give [efficacy] to the prayers of all saints at the golden altar which [was] before the throne. @  Hmâo sa čô ling jang pơkŏn dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơi anăp kơƀang ngă yang djă get mơnơ̆ng ƀâu mơngưi ngă hăng mah. Arăng hmâo brơi laih kơ ñu lu mơnơ̆ng ƀâu mơngưi kiăng pơyơr hrŏm hơbĭt hăng tơlơi iâu laĭ abih bang ƀing rơgoh hiam ƀơi hăng ngŏ kơnưl mah ƀơi anăp gre pơtao. 
And the smoke of the incense went up with the prayers of the saints, out of the hand of the angel before God. @ Asăp mơnơ̆ng ƀâu mơngưi mơ̆ng tơngan ling jang hrŏm hơbĭt hăng tơlơi iâu laĭ ƀing rơgoh hiam pơr đĭ nao pơ anăp Ơi Adai. 
And the angel took the censer, and filled it from the fire of the altar, and cast [it] on the earth: and there were voices, and thunders and lightnings, and an earthquake. @ Laih anŭn ling jang mă get mơnơ̆ng ƀâu mơngưi, mă apui mơ̆ng kơƀang ngă yang pioh pơbă get anŭn, laih anŭn glŏm trŭn ƀơi lŏn tơnah. Hmâo khul dơnai grơ̆m, dơnai pơhiăp, khul kơmlă laih anŭn tơlơi pơpư̆ lŏn tơnah.
And the seven angels who had the seven trumpets prepared themselves that they might sound with [their] trumpets. @ Tơdơi kơ anŭn, tơjuh čô ling jang djă tơjuh tơdiăp prăp pre ayŭp.
And the first sounded [his] trumpet: and there was hail and fire, mingled with blood, and they were cast upon the earth; and the third part of the earth was burnt up, and the third part of the trees was burnt up, and all green grass was burnt up. @  Ling jang tal sa ayŭp tơdiăp, tui anŭn hmâo hơjan pler hăng apui pơlŭk hăng drah lĕ trŭn pơ lŏn tơnah. Apui ƀơ̆ng sa črăn amăng klâo črăn lŏn tơnah, sa črăn amăng klâo črăn kơyâo pơtâo, laih anŭn abih bang rơ̆k mơtah apui ƀơ̆ng hĭ.
And the second angel sounded [his] trumpet: and as a great mountain burning with fire was cast into the sea, and the third part of the sea became blood; @ Ling jang tal dua ayŭp tơdiăp, laih anŭn hmâo mơnơ̆ng hrup hăng sa boh čư̆ prŏng apui dŏ ƀơ̆ng arăng glŏm trŭn amăng ia rơsĭ. Sa črăn amăng klâo črăn ia rơsĭ jing hĭ drah, 
and the third part of the creatures which were in the sea which had life died; and the third part of the ships were destroyed. @ sa črăn amăng klâo črăn mơnơ̆ng hơdip amăng ia rơsĭ djai hĭ, laih anŭn sa črăn amăng klâo črăn kompăn răm rai hĭ.
And the third angel sounded [his] trumpet: and there fell out of the heaven a great star, burning as a torch, and it fell upon the third part of the rivers, and upon the fountains of waters. @  Ling jang tal klâo ayŭp tơdiăp, laih anŭn sa boh pơtŭ prŏng apui ƀơ̆ng jă kar hăng sa ƀĕ apui arok lĕ trŭn mơ̆ng adai. Boh pơtŭ anŭn lĕ trŭn ƀơi sa črăn amăng klâo črăn khul ia krong laih anŭn khul akŏ ia. 
And the name of the star is called Wormwood; and the third part of the waters became wormwood, and many of the men died of the waters because they were made bitter. @ Anăn pơtŭ anŭn “Kơyâo phĭ”. Sa črăn amăng klâo črăn ia jing hĭ phĭ, laih anŭn lu mơnuih djai yua kơ ia anai, yua kơ ñu jing phĭ hĭ laih.
And the fourth angel sounded [his] trumpet: and the third part of the sun was smitten, and the third part of the moon, and the third part of the stars; so that the third part of them should be darkened, and that the day should not appear [for] the third part of it, and the night the same. @  Ling jang tal pă ayŭp tơdiăp, laih anŭn sa črăn amăng klâo črăn yang hrơi, sa črăn amăng klâo črăn yang blan, laih anŭn sa črăn amăng klâo črăn khul pơtŭ pơjrơ̆m kơtang tơl sa črăn amăng klâo črăn tơlơi bơngač gơñu jing hĭ mơmŏt, ngă brơi sa črăn amăng klâo črăn tơhrơi rơngiă hĭ tơlơi bơngač, laih anŭn mlam ăt kar kaĭ mơ̆n.
And I saw, and I heard an eagle flying in mid-heaven, saying with a loud voice, Woe, woe, woe, to them that dwell upon the earth, for the remaining voices of the trumpet of the three angels who are about to sound. @ Kâo lăng laih anŭn hmư̆ sa drơi čĭm klang tơdang ñu pơr tơ̆ng krah adai, ur kraih tui anai: “Răm ƀăm yơh! Răm ƀăm yơh! Răm ƀăm yơh kơ ƀing mơnuih dŏ ƀơi lŏn tơnah tơdang asăp tơdiăp klâo čô ling jang pơkŏn giăm či ayŭp dơ̆ng!”
And the fifth angel sounded [his] trumpet: and I saw a star out of the heaven fallen to the earth; and there was given to it the key of the pit of the abyss. @ Ling jang tal rơma ayŭp tơdiăp, kâo ƀuh sa boh pơtŭ mơ̆ng adai lĕ trŭn ƀơi lŏn tơnah, arăng brơi kơ pơtŭ anŭn kơmla kăl hlŭng dlam. 
And it opened the pit of the abyss; and there went up smoke out of the pit as [the] smoke of a great furnace; and the sun and the air were darkened with the smoke of the pit. @ Pơtŭ anŭn pŏk hlŭng dlam anŭn, laih anŭn mơ̆ng hlŭng dlam anŭn hmâo asăp apui tơbiă đĭ kar hăng asăp apui mơ̆ng sa boh tơpur prŏng biă mă. Yang hrơi laih anŭn rơngit adai jing mơmŏt hĭ yua kơ asăp apui mơ̆ng hlŭng dlam anŭn. 
And out of the smoke came forth locusts on the earth, and power was given to them as the scorpions of the earth have power; @ Mơ̆ng asăp apui anŭn hmâo khul kơtop tơbiă pơr bra hyu tar ƀar amăng lŏn tơnah, laih anŭn arăng brơi tơlơi dưi kơtang kơ ƀing gơñu kar hăng tơlơi dưi kơtang kơ aguăt ƀơi lŏn tơnah. 
and it was said to them, that they should not injure the grass of the earth, nor any green thing, nor any tree, but the men who have not the seal of God on their foreheads: @ Arăng hmâo pơtă kơ ƀing gơñu anăm ngă răm rai ôh kơ rơ̆k ƀơi lŏn tơnah, khul mơnơ̆ng săt mơtah laih anŭn kơyâo pơtâo, samơ̆ kơnơ̆ng ngă răm kơ ƀing mơnuih ƀu hmâo ôh mơnơ̆ng Ơi Adai kơđŏm ƀơi athơi gơñu đôč. 
and it was given to them that they should not kill them, but that they should be tormented five months; and their torment [was] as [the] torment of a scorpion when it strikes a man. @ Arăng brơi kơ ƀing gơñu dưi ngă pơtơnap ƀing mơnuih amăng rơma blan, samơ̆ ƀu dưi pơdjai ƀing gơñu ôh. Tơlơi ruă nuă ƀing gơñu ngă jing kar hăng tơlơi ruă nuă aguăt duĭ. 
And in those days shall men seek death, and shall in no way find it; and shall desire to die, and death flees from them. @ Amăng rơma blan anŭn ƀing gơñu tui hơduah tơlơi djai, samơ̆ ƀu dưi ƀuh ôh. Gơñu kiăng biă mă djai, samơ̆ tơlơi djai đuaĭ ataih hĭ mơ̆ng ƀing gơñu.
And the likenesses of the locusts [were] like to horses prepared for war; and upon their heads as crowns like gold, and their faces as faces of men; @  Rup hơbŏ khul kơtop anŭn lăng hrup hăng khul aseh prăp pre kơ tơlơi pơblah. Ƀơi akŏ ƀing gơñu hmâo mơnơ̆ng hơgĕt hrup hăng mŭk pơtao ngă hăng mah, ƀô̆ mơta ƀing gơñu hrup hăng ƀô̆ mơta mơnuih, 
and they had hair as women's hair, and their teeth were as of lions, @ ƀuk gơñu kar hăng ƀuk đah kơmơi, laih anŭn tơgơi gơñu kar hăng tơgơi rơmông dŭl. 
and they had breastplates as breastplates of iron, and the sound of their wings [was] as the sound of chariots of many horses running to war; @ Gơñu hmâo kơmoh gom tơda kar hăng ao pơsơi, laih anŭn dơnai čăng gơñu kar hăng dơnai lu boh rơdeh aseh kơsung nao pơ tơdrŏn pơblah. 
and they have tails like scorpions, and stings; and their power [was] in their tails to hurt men five months. @ Ƀing gơñu hmâo tơku laih anŭn ia bih kar hăng aguăt, amăng khul tơku anŭn hmâo tơlơi dưi kơtang ngă pơruă ană mơnuih amăng rơma blan. 
They have a king over them, the angel of the abyss: his name in Hebrew, Abaddon, and in Greek he has [for] name Apollyon. @ Ling jang kơ hlŭng dlam jing pơtao kơ ƀing gơñu, anăn ñu amăng tơlơi Hêbrơ jing “Abadôn”, laih anŭn amăng tơlơi Grek arăng iâu “Apôliôn”.
The first woe has passed. Behold, there come yet two woes after these things. @ Tơlơi tơnap tap tal sa rơgao hĭ; anai nê ăt dŏ dua tơlơi tơnap tap dơ̆ng či truh.
And the sixth angel sounded [his] trumpet: and I heard a voice from the four horns of the golden altar which [is] before God, @  Ling jang tal năm ayŭp tơdiăp, kâo hmư̆ asăp mơ̆ng pă akiăng kơƀang ngă yang ngă hăng mah dŏ ƀơi anăp Ơi Adai. 
saying to the sixth angel that had the trumpet, Loose the four angels which are bound at the great river Euphrates. @ Asăp anŭn laĭ kơ ling jang tal năm pô djă tơdiăp: “Kleh bĕ pă čô ling jang arăng dŏ čaŏ ƀơi ia krong Ơphrat.” 
And the four angels were loosed, who are prepared for the hour and day and month and year, that they might slay the third part of men; @ Tui anŭn, arăng kleh hĭ pă čô ling jang jing ƀing hmâo prăp pre laih kơ mông, kơ hrơi, kơ blan, laih anŭn kơ thŭn kiăng kơ ƀing gơñu pơdjai hĭ sa črăn amăng klâo črăn mơnuih mơnam. 
and the number of the hosts of horse [was] twice ten thousand times ten thousand. I heard their number. @ Mrô tơhan đĭ aseh hmâo dua rơtuh klăk. Anŭn yơh mrô ƀing gơñu kâo hmâo hmư̆. 
And thus I saw the horses in the vision, and those that sat upon them, having breastplates of fire and jacinth and brimstone; and the heads of the horses [were] as heads of lions, and out of their mouths goes out fire and smoke and brimstone. @ Amăng tơlơi pơƀuh, kâo ƀuh aseh laih anŭn ƀing mơnuih đĭ aseh tui anai: Ƀing gơñu buh ao pơsơi pơgang tơda gơñu mriah kar hăng apui, mơtah kar hăng boh pơtâo bơngač, laih anŭn kơñĭ kar hăng apui kơsŭm; akŏ aseh kar hăng akŏ rơmông dŭl laih anŭn amăng bah gơñu bluh tơbiă apui, asăp laih anŭn apui kơsŭm. 
By these three plagues were the third part of men killed, by the fire and the smoke and the brimstone which goes out of their mouths. @ Sa črăn amăng klâo črăn mơnuih mơnam djai yua kơ klâo mơta tơlơi răm rai anai: apui, asăp apui, laih anŭn apui kơsŭm tơbiă mơ̆ng amăng bah aseh anŭn. 
For the power of the horses is in their mouth and in their tails: for their tails [are] like serpents, having heads, and with them they injure. @ Yua kơ tơlơi kơtang aseh anŭn dŏ ƀơi amăng bah laih anŭn ƀơi tơku gơñu. Aku gơñu kar hăng ala hmâo akŏ, laih anŭn hăng akŏ anŭn yơh gơñu ngă răm rai mơnuih mơnam.
And the rest of men who were not killed with these plagues repented not of the works of their hands, that they should not worship demons, and the golden and silver and brazen and stone and wooden idols, which can neither see nor hear nor walk. @  Đơ ƀing mơnuih dŏ glaĭ, jing ƀing ƀu djai ôh yua kơ tơlơi răm rai anŭn, ăt ƀu kơhmal ôh kơ bruă tơngan ƀing gơñu ngă, kŏn lui lơi tơlơi kơkuh pơpŭ kơ yang sat, kơ rup trah ngă hăng mah, hăng prăk, hăng kong, hăng boh pơtâo, laih anŭn hăng kơyâo, khul rup trah anŭn ƀu thâo ƀuh, ƀu thâo hmư̆ laih anŭn ƀu thâo rơbat lơi. 
And they repented not of their murders, nor of their witchcrafts, nor of their fornication, nor of their thefts. @ Ƀing gơñu ăt ƀu kơhmal ôh kơ tơlơi ƀing gơñu pơdjai mơnuih, kơ tơlơi ngă pơjâu, kơ tơlơi rih răm ƀôdah kơ tơlơi ƀing gơñu klĕ dŏp.
And I saw another strong angel coming down out of the heaven, clothed with a cloud, and the rainbow upon his head, and his countenance as the sun, and his feet as pillars of fire, @ Giơ̆ng anŭn, kâo ƀuh sa čô ling jang pơkŏn bă hăng tơlơi dưi kơtang trŭn rai mơ̆ng adai, hmâo ƀŭt kơthul gom ñu. Hmâo mrơ̆t jum dar akŏ ñu, ƀô̆ mơta ñu kar hăng yang hrơi, laih anŭn tơkai ñu kar hăng tơmeh apui. 
and having in his hand a little opened book. And he set his right foot on the sea, and the left upon the earth, @ Amăng tơngan ñu djă sa čơkul hră klĭ anĕt pŏk hĭ laih. Tơkai gah hơnuă ñu juă ƀơi ia rơsĭ, laih anŭn tơkai gah iao ñu juă ƀơi lŏn. 
and cried with a loud voice as a lion roars. And when he cried, the seven thunders uttered their own voices. @ Ñu ur hăng asăp kraih kar hăng sa drơi rơmông dŭl grañ. Tơdang ñu ur, hmâo tơjuh dơnai grơ̆m kuang đĭ. 
And when the seven thunders spoke, I was about to write: and I heard a voice out of the heaven saying, Seal the things which the seven thunders have spoken, and write them not. @ Tŏ tui tơjuh grơ̆m kuang đĭ, kâo pơmĭn či čih pioh, samơ̆ kâo hmư̆ asăp mơ̆ng adai laĭ: “Kơđơ̆l kơđŏm hĭ bĕ khul tơlơi tơjuh dơnai grơ̆m anŭn hmâo laĭ laih; anăm čih pioh ôh.”
And the angel whom I saw stand on the sea and on the earth lifted up his right hand to the heaven, @  Ling jang kâo hmâo ƀuh dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơi ia rơsĭ laih anŭn ƀơi lŏn yơr tơngan hơnuă ñu pơ adai, 
and swore by him that lives to the ages of ages, who created the heaven and the things that are in it, and the earth and the things that are in it, and the sea and the things that are in it, that there should be no longer delay; @ hăng anăn Pô hơdip hlŏng lar, jing Pô hrih pơjing adai laih anŭn abih bang mơnơ̆ng amăng adai, lŏn tơnah laih anŭn abih bang mơnơ̆ng ƀơi lŏn tơnah, ia rơsĭ laih anŭn abih bang mơnơ̆ng amăng ia rơsĭ, ñu ƀuăn rơ̆ng tui anai: “Ƀu či pơhrưĭ dơ̆ng ôh, 
but in the days of the voice of the seventh angel, when he is about to sound the trumpet, the mystery of God also shall be completed, as he has made known the glad tidings to his own bondmen the prophets. @ samơ̆ truh hrơi ling jang tal tơjuh ayŭp tơdiăp, Ơi Adai či ngă pơgiơ̆ng hĭ tơlơi yom hơgơ̆m Ñu, kar hăng Ñu hmâo pơhaih laih kơ ƀing ding kơna Ñu, jing ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo.”
And the voice which I heard out of the heaven [was] again speaking with me, and saying, Go, take the little book which is opened in the hand of the angel who is standing on the sea and on the earth. @  Asăp kâo hmâo hmư̆ laih mơ̆ng adai pơhiăp hăng kâo dơ̆ng: “Nao bĕ, mă čơkul hră klĭ hmâo pŏk laih amăng tơngan ling jang hlăk dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơi ia rơsĭ laih anŭn ƀơi lŏn.” 
And I went to the angel, saying to him to give me the little book. And he says to me, Take and eat it up: and it shall make thy belly bitter, but in thy mouth it shall be sweet as honey. @ Tui anŭn, kâo nao pơ ling jang, laih anŭn rơkâo kơ ñu brơi kâo čơkul hră klĭ anĕt anŭn. Ñu laĭ: “Mă laih anŭn ƀơ̆ng bĕ; ñu či jing hĭ phĭ amăng hlŭng ih, samơ̆ či jing mơmih hrup hăng ia hơni ƀơi amăng bah ih.” 
And I took the little book out of the hand of the angel, and ate it up; and it was in my mouth as honey, sweet; and when I had eaten it my belly was made bitter. @ Kâo mă čơkul hră klĭ anĕt anŭn mơ̆ng tơngan ling jang laih anŭn kâo ƀơ̆ng. Ñu jing mơmih kar ia hơni ƀơi amăng bah kâo, samơ̆ giơ̆ng kâo lun laih ñu, ñu jing hĭ phĭ amăng hlŭng kâo. 
And it was said to me, Thou must prophesy again as to peoples and nations and tongues and many kings. @ Giơ̆ng anŭn gơñu laĭ kơ kâo: “Ih ăt khŏm laĭ lui hlâo kơ lu djuai mơnuih, lu lŏn čar, lu khul tơlơi pơhiăp laih anŭn kơ lu pơtao dơ̆ng.”
And there was given to me a reed like a staff, saying, Rise, and measure the temple of God, and the altar, and them that worship in it. @  Hlăk anŭn arăng brơi kơ kâo sa ƀĕ gai pơkă hrup hăng sa ƀĕ gai jra, laih anŭn ñu pơtă kâo: “Tơgŭ bĕ laih anŭn pơkă sang kơkuh pơpŭ kơ Ơi Adai, kơƀang ngă yang, laih anŭn ƀing kơkuh pơpŭ amăng anŭn. 
And the court which [is] without the temple cast out, and measure it not; because it has been given [up] to the nations, and the holy city shall they tread under foot forty-two months. @ Samơ̆ anăm pơkă ôh wăl gah rơngiao kơ sang kơkuh pơpŭ; yua kơ arăng hmâo jao laih ñu kơ ƀing djuai tuai, laih anŭn ƀing gơñu či juă hĭ plei rơgoh hiam amăng pă pluh dua blan. 
And I will give [power] to my two witnesses, and they shall prophesy a thousand two hundred [and] sixty days, clothed in sackcloth. @ Kâo či brơi dua čô pô gơ̆ng jơlan kơ Kâo buh ao kơƀao laih anŭn dưi laĭ lui hlâo amăng sa rơbâo dua rơtuh năm pluh hrơi.”
These are the two olive trees and the two lamps which stand before the Lord of the earth; @  Ƀing anŭn jing dua ƀĕ phŭn kơyâo ôliwơ laih anŭn dua ƀĕ gơ̆ng apui kơđen dŏ dơ̆ng ƀơi anăp Khua Yang kơ lŏn tơnah. 
and if any one wills to injure them, fire goes out of their mouth, and devours their enemies. And if any one wills to injure them, thus must he be killed. @ Tơdah hlơi kiăng ngă sat kơ dua čô anai, apui tơbiă mơ̆ng amăng bah gơñu čuh hĭ ƀing ayăt gơñu; hlơi pô kiăng ngă sat kơ ƀing gơñu, gơñu khŏm či tŭ tơlơi pơdjai kar hăng anŭn yơh. 
These have power to shut the heaven that no rain may fall during the days of their prophecy; and they have power over the waters to turn them into blood, and to smite the earth as often as they will with every plague. @ Gơñu hmâo tơlơi dưi krư̆ hĭ adai, kiăng kơ ƀu hmâo ia hơjan ôh amăng khul hrơi gơñu laĭ lui hlâo; gơñu ăt hmâo tơlơi dưi pơblih ia jing hĭ drah mơ̆n, laih anŭn dưi yua djŏp mơta tơlơi răm ruă ngă sat kơ lŏn tơnah tui hluai hăng gơñu kiăng.
And when they shall have completed their testimony, the beast who comes up out of the abyss shall make war with them, and shall conquer them, and shall kill them: @  Tơ dua gơñu hmâo ngă gơ̆ng jơlan giơ̆ng laih, hlô glai tơbiă đĭ mơ̆ng hlŭng dlam pơblah hăng gơñu, hlô anŭn dưi hĭ hăng gơñu laih anŭn pơdjai hĭ gơñu. 
and their body [shall be] on the street of the great city, which is called spiritually Sodom and Egypt, where also their Lord was crucified. @ Drơi jan djai dua gơñu či đih ƀơi jơlan glung kơ plei prŏng, arăng iâu hăng anăn rup pơhmô jing Sôđôm laih anŭn čar Êjip, anih arăng hmâo pơ̆ng pơdjai laih Khua Yang gơñu ƀơi kơyâo bơrơkal.
