And [men] of the peoples and tribes and tongues and nations see their body three days and a half, and they do not suffer their bodies to be put into a sepulchre. @ Mơnuih mơ̆ng abih khul djuai mơnuih, abih kơnŭng djuai, abih tơlơi pơhiăp, abih lŏn čar či ep lăng kơ drơi jan djai gơñu amăng klâo hrơi mơkrah, laih anŭn ƀu brơi arăng dơr hĭ amăng pơsat ôh. 
And they that dwell upon the earth rejoice over them, and are full of delight, and shall send gifts one to another, because these, the two prophets, tormented them that dwell upon the earth. @ Ƀing mơnuih dŏ ƀơi lŏn tơnah či hơ̆k mơak yua kơ gơñu, hơ̆k kơdơ̆k mơit nao rai gơnam brơi tơdruă gơñu, yua kơ dua čô pô laĭ lui hlâo anai hmâo ngă pơtơnap laih kơ ƀing mơnuih dŏ ƀơi lŏn tơnah. 
And after the three days and a half [the] spirit of life from God came into them, and they stood upon their feet; and great fear fell upon those beholding them. @ Tơdơi kơ klâo hrơi mơkrah, jua hơdip mơ̆ng Ơi Adai mŭt amăng dua gơñu, laih anŭn gơñu tơgŭ dơ̆ng, ngă brơi ƀing ƀuh gơñu hwĭ biă mă. 
And I heard a great voice out of the heaven saying to them, Come up here; and they went up to the heaven in the cloud, and their enemies beheld them. @ Dua gơñu hmư̆ asăp kraih mơ̆ng adai laĭ kơ dua gơñu tui anai: “Đĭ pơ anai bĕ!” Laih anŭn gơñu đĭ pơ adai amăng ƀŭt hiăng ƀơi anăp mơta ƀing ayăt gơñu. 
And in that hour there was a great earthquake, and the tenth of the city fell, and seven thousand names of men were slain in the earthquake. And the remnant were filled with fear, and gave glory to the God of the heaven. @ Ƀơi mông anŭn hmâo tơlơi pơpư̆ lŏn tơnah kơtang, sa črăn amăng pluh črăn plei prŏng răm rai. Tơjuh rơbâo čô mơnuih djai amăng tơlơi lŏn tơnah pơpư̆ anŭn, bơ kơ ƀing pơkŏn hwĭ biă mă laih anŭn gơñu pơpŭ bơni kơ Ơi Adai amăng adai.
The second woe has passed; behold, the third woe comes quickly. @ Tơlơi tơnap tal dua rơgao hĭ; anai nê tơlơi tơnap tap tal klâo či truh tañ.
And the seventh angel sounded [his] trumpet: and there were great voices in the heaven, saying, The kingdom of the world of our Lord and of his Christ is come, and he shall reign to the ages of ages. @  Ling jang tal tơjuh ayŭp tơdiăp, hmâo asăp kraih mơ̆ng adai, laĭ:
“Dêh čar pơtao lŏn tơnah lơ̆m kơ Khua Yang ƀing ta
Laih anŭn lơ̆m kơ Krist Ñu.
Ñu či wai lăng hlŏng lar.”
And the twenty-four elders, who sit on their thrones before God, fell upon their faces, and worshipped God, @ Ƀing dua pluh pă čô kŏng tha dŏ ber ƀơi gre pơtao ƀơi anăp Ơi Adai, gơñu bon kŭp ƀô̆ laih anŭn kơkuh pơpŭ kơ Ơi Adai, 
saying, We give thee thanks, Lord God Almighty, [He] who is, and who was, that thou hast taken thy great power and hast reigned. @ laĭ tui anai:
“Ơ Khua Yang Ơi Adai Dưi Kơtang, Pô Hlăk Hmâo Ră Anai, laih anŭn Pô Hmâo Laih,
Gơmơi bơni hơơč kơ Ih, yua kơ Ih hmâo djă tơlơi dưi prŏng prin,
Laih anŭn wai lăng.
And the nations have been full of wrath, and thy wrath is come, and the time of the dead to be judged, and to give the recompense to thy servants the prophets, and to the saints, and to those who fear thy name, small and great; and to destroy those that destroy the earth. @  Ƀing djuai mơnuih hil kơtang tĭt,
Samơ̆ tơlơi Ih hil hmâo truh laih,
Laih anŭn mông phat kơđi kơ khul djuai mơnuih truh laih,
Pha brơi pri kơ ƀing ding kơna Ih, ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo, ƀing rơgoh hiam,
Laih anŭn ƀing hwĭ pơpŭ kơ anăn Ih,
ƀing anĕt wơ̆t ƀing prŏng,
Laih anŭn pơrai hĭ ƀing pơrai lŏn tơnah.”
And the temple of God in the heaven was opened, and the ark of his covenant was seen in his temple: and there were lightnings, and voices, and thunders, and an earthquake, and great hail. @  Sang kơkuh pơpŭ kơ Ơi Adai amăng adai pŏk hĭ, amăng lăm arăng ƀuh hmâo Hip Kơnol Pơgop Ñu, laih anŭn hmâo khul kơmlă, asăp pơhiăp, asăp grơ̆m, lŏn tơnah pơpư̆ laih anŭn hơjan pler prŏng.
And a great sign was seen in the heaven: a woman clothed with the sun, and the moon under her feet, and upon her head a crown of twelve stars; @ Hmâo sa gru kơnăl prŏng tơbiă rai amăng adai adih: Sa čô đah kơmơi hmâo yang hrơi gom jum dar ñu, laih anŭn yang blan ƀơi gah yŭ tơkai ñu, ƀơi akŏ ñu hmâo sa boh mŭk pơtao ngă hăng pluh dua asar pơtŭ. 
and being with child she cried, [being] in travail, and in pain to bring forth. @ Ñu pi kian, laih anŭn ñu ur krao amăng tơlơi ruă nuă, ruă rơhet yua kơ giăm tơkeng. 
And another sign was seen in the heaven: and behold, a great red dragon, having seven heads and ten horns, and on his heads seven diadems; @ Giơ̆ng anŭn amăng adai tơbiă rai gru kơnăl pơkŏn dơ̆ng: Hmâo sa drơi ana grai mriah prŏng hmâo tơjuh boh akŏ, pluh ƀĕ tơki, laih anŭn ƀơi tơjuh boh akŏ hmâo tơjuh boh mŭk pơtao. 
and his tail draws the third part of the stars of the heaven; and he cast them to the earth. And the dragon stood before the woman who was about to bring forth, in order that when she brought forth he might devour her child. @ Aku ñu hua ba sa črăn amăng klâo črăn pơtŭ amăng adai, laih anŭn glŏm hĭ ƀing gơ̆ pơ lŏn tơnah. Ana grai dŏ ƀơi anăp đah kơmơi giăm tơkeng anŭn, kiăng kơ tơ đah kơmơi tơkeng ană ñu lun ƀơ̆ng hĭ ană gơ̆. 
And she brought forth a male son, who shall shepherd all the nations with an iron rod; and her child was caught up to God and to his throne. @ Đah kơmơi tơkeng sa čô ană đah rơkơi, pô či wai lăng abih bang djuai mơnuih hăng sa ƀĕ gai pơsơi. Samơ̆ arăng glŏm lui hĭ ñu pơ gah rơngiao laih anŭn pŭ ba ană gơ̆ truh pơ Ơi Adai, truh pơ gre pơtao Ñu. 
And the woman fled into the wilderness, where she has there a place prepared of God, that they should nourish her there a thousand two hundred [and] sixty days. @ Samơ̆ đah kơmơi anŭn đuaĭ kơdŏp amăng tơdrŏn har, pơ anŭn Ơi Adai hmâo prăp pre brơi laih kơ ñu sa boh anih, kiăng kơ ñu dưi hmâo mơnơ̆ng ƀơ̆ng huă amăng sa rơbâo dua rơtuh năm pluh hrơi.
And there was war in the heaven: Michael and his angels went to war with the dragon. And the dragon fought, and his angels; @  Hlăk anŭn hmâo sa tơlơi pơblah amăng adai, Mikel hăng ƀing ling jang ñu pơblah hăng ana grai; ana grai laih anŭn ding kơna ñu ăt pơblah glaĭ mơ̆n. 
and he prevailed not, nor was their place found any more in the heaven. @ Samơ̆ ana grai hăng ƀing ling jang ñu ƀu dưi ôh, laih anŭn ƀu hmâo anih brơi kơ ƀing gơñu dơ̆ng ôh amăng adai. 
And the great dragon was cast out, the ancient serpent, he who is called Devil and Satan, he who deceives the whole habitable world, he was cast out into the earth, and his angels were cast out with him. @ Laih anŭn arăng glŏm trŭn hĭ ana grai prŏng pơ lŏn tơnah, jing ala đưm adih, arăng pia ñu jing Yang Sat ƀôdah Satan, pô plư pleč abih bang mơnuih mơnam amăng lŏn tơnah. Arăng ăt glŏm trŭn ƀing ding kơna ñu hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ñu mơ̆n.
And I heard a great voice in the heaven saying, Now is come the salvation and the power and the kingdom of our God, and the authority of his Christ; for the accuser of our brethren has been cast out, who accused them before our God day and night: @  Kâo hmư̆ amăng adai asăp kraih laĭ:
“Ră anai tơlơi pơklaih, tơlơi dưi mơyang,
Dêh čar pơtao kơ Ơi Adai ƀing ta,
Laih anŭn tơlơi dưi Yang Krist Ñu hmâo truh laih,
Yua kơ pô phong kơ ƀing adơi ayŏng ƀing ta, hrơi mlam ñu phong ƀing gơ̆ ƀơi anăp Ơi Adai,
Ơi Adai hmâo glŏm trŭn ñu laih.
and *they* have overcome him by reason of the blood of the Lamb, and by reason of the word of their testimony, and have not loved their life even unto death. @ Ƀing gơñu hmâo dưi hĭ laih hăng ñu yua mơ̆ng drah Ană Triu,
Laih anŭn yua mơ̆ng boh pơhiăp ƀing gơñu ngă gơ̆ng jơlan;
Ƀing gơñu ƀu hơ-ưi ôh kơ tơlơi hơdip gơñu tơl djai.
Therefore be full of delight, ye heavens, and ye that dwell in them. Woe to the earth and to the sea, because the devil has come down to you, having great rage, knowing he has a short time. @ Hnŭn yơh, Ơ khul tal adai, laih anŭn ƀing mơnuih dŏ amăng anŭn,
Hơ̆k mơak bĕ!
Samơ̆ răm ƀăm yơh kơ lŏn tơnah laih anŭn ia rơsĭ,
Yua kơ yang sat thâo hrơi mông ñu ƀu dŏ sui dơ̆ng tah,
Hnŭn yơh ñu kreñ hil laih anŭn trŭn nao pơ ƀing gih.”
And when the dragon saw that he had been cast out into the earth, he persecuted the woman which bore the male [child]. @ Tơ ana grai thâo Ơi Adai glŏm trŭn laih ñu pơ lŏn tơnah, ñu kiaŏ tui đah kơmơi hmâo tơkeng laih ană đah rơkơi anŭn. 
And there were given to the woman the two wings of the great eagle, that she might fly into the desert into her place, where she is nourished there a time, and times, and half a time, from [the] face of the serpent. @ Samơ̆ arăng brơi kơ đah kơmơi anŭn dua pŏk čăng čĭm klang prŏng, kiăng kơ ñu dưi pơr đuaĭ mơ̆ng ana grai nao pơ anih ñu amăng tơdrŏn tač, ƀơi anŭn arăng či čem ñu amăng sa rơnŭk, lu rơnŭk laih anŭn sa mơkrah rơnŭk. 
And the serpent cast out of his mouth behind the woman water as a river, that he might make her be [as] one carried away by a river. @ Ana grai pruih tơbiă ia mơ̆ng amăng bah ñu hrup hăng ia krong tui klon đah kơmơi, kiăng kơr pơđuaĭ hĭ ñu. 
And the earth helped the woman, and the earth opened its mouth and swallowed the river which the dragon cast out of his mouth. @ Samơ̆ lŏn djru pơklaih đah kơmơi anŭn, lŏn ha amăng bah laih anŭn lun hĭ ia krong ana grai pruih mơ̆ng amăng bah ñu anŭn. 
And the dragon was angry with the woman, and went to make war with the remnant of her seed, who keep the commandments of God, and have the testimony of Jesus. @ Ana grai hil biă mă kơ đah kơmơi anŭn, laih anŭn ñu nao pơblah hăng ƀing ană kơ đah kơmơi anŭn dŏ glaĭ, jing ƀing tui gưt boh pơhiăp Ơi Adai pơtă laih anŭn hmâo tơlơi Yêsu ngă gơ̆ng jơlan. 
And I stood upon the sand of the sea; and I saw a beast rising out of the sea, having ten horns and seven heads, and upon its horns ten diadems, and upon its heads names of blasphemy. @  Giơ̆ng anŭn kâo ƀuh sa drơi hlô glai tơbiă mơ̆ng ia rơsĭ, hmâo pluh ƀĕ tơki laih anŭn tơjuh boh akŏ. Ƀơi tơki ñu hmâo pluh boh mŭk pơtao, laih anŭn ƀơi rĭm boh akŏ ñu hmâo anăn ƀrưh hmiah kơ Ơi Adai. 
*** @ Hlô kâo ƀuh anŭn hrup hăng djrang, tơkai ñu hrup hăng tơkai čơgâo, amăng bah ñu hrup hăng amăng bah rơmông dŭl. Ana grai brơi kơ hlô glai anŭn tơlơi kơtang, gre pơtao, laih anŭn tơlơi dưi prŏng ñu pô. 
And the beast which I saw was like to a leopardess, and its feet as of a bear, and its mouth as a lion's mouth; and the dragon gave to it his power, and his throne, and great authority; @ Sa amăng tơjuh boh akŏ ñu hrup hăng hmâo tơlơi rơka kơtang, samơ̆ anih rơka anŭn hmâo hlao hĭ laih, laih anŭn abih bang lŏn tơnah hling hlang biă mă laih anŭn đuaĭ tui hlô glai anŭn. 
and one of his heads [was] as slain to death, and his wound of death had been healed: and the whole earth wondered after the beast. @ Arăng kơkuh pơpŭ kơ ana grai, yua kơ ñu hmâo brơi laih tơlơi dưi kơ hlô glai anŭn, hăng laĭ tui anai: “Hlơi pô jing hrup hăng hlô anŭn, laih anŭn hlơi pô dưi pơblah hăng ñu?”
And they did homage to the dragon, because he gave the authority to the beast; and they did homage to the beast, saying, Who [is] like to the beast? and who can make war with it? @  Arăng brơi kơ hlô anŭn amăng bah pơhiăp pơgao laih anŭn ƀrưh hmiah kơ Ơi Adai, ñu hmâo tơlơi dưi wai lăng amăng pă pluh dua blan. 
And there was given to it a mouth, speaking great things and blasphemies; and there was given to it authority to pursue its career forty-two months. @ Hlô anŭn ha amăng bah pơhiăp ƀrưh hmiah hăng Ơi Adai, ƀrưh hmiah kơ anăn Ơi Adai laih anŭn kơ anih Ñu dŏ, laih anŭn kơ ƀing dŏ amăng adai. 
And it opened its mouth for blasphemies against God, to blaspheme his name and his tabernacle, and those who have their tabernacle in the heaven. @ Kar kaĭ mơ̆n arăng brơi kơ ñu dưi nao pơblah hăng ƀing rơgoh hiam laih anŭn ñu dưi hĭ hăng ƀing gơ̆. Laih anŭn arăng brơi kơ ñu tơlơi dưi wai lăng abih bang djuai mơnuih, abih bang ană plei pla, abih bang tơlơi pơhiăp, laih anŭn abih bang lŏn čar. 
And there was given to it to make war with the saints, and to overcome them; and there was given to it authority over every tribe, and people, and tongue, and nation; @ Abih bang mơnuih hơdip ƀơi lŏn tơnah či kơkuh pơpŭ kơ ñu, jing ƀing mơnuih ƀu hmâo ôh anăn čih amăng hơdrôm hră tơlơi hơdip Ană Triu, Pô arăng hmâo pơdjai laih hlâo kơ hrơi hrih lŏn tơnah. 
and all that dwell on the earth shall do it homage, [every one] whose name had not been written from [the] founding of [the] world in the book of life of the slain Lamb. @ Hlơi pô hmâo tơngia, brơi ñu hmư̆ bĕ!
If any one has an ear, let him hear. @  Tơdah hlơi pô khŏm jing mơnă,
Brơi ñu jing mơnă yơh.
Tơdah hlơi pô khŏm tŭ tơlơi pơdjai hăng đao,
Ñu anŭn khŏm či tŭ tơlơi pơdjai hăng đao yơh.
Anai jing tơlơi gir laih anŭn tơlơi đaŏ kơ ƀing rơgoh hiam.
If any one [leads] into captivity, he goes into captivity. If any one shall kill with [the] sword, he must with [the] sword be killed. Here is the endurance and the faith of the saints. @ Tơdơi kơ anŭn kâo ƀuh sa drơi hlô glai pơkŏn tơbiă đĭ mơ̆ng lŏn. Ñu hmâo dua ƀĕ tơki hrup hăng tơki ană triu, laih anŭn pơhiăp hrup hăng ana grai. 
And I saw another beast rising out of the earth; and it had two horns like to a lamb, and spake as a dragon; @ Ñu yua abih tơlơi dưi prŏng hlô tal sa ƀơi anăp hlô glai tal sa anŭn, ñu ngă brơi lŏn tơnah laih anŭn abih bang ƀing mơnuih dŏ ƀơi lŏn tơnah kơkuh pơpŭ kơ hlô tal sa, jing hlô rơka kơtang hmâo hlao laih. 
and it exercises all the authority of the first beast before it, and causes the earth and those that dwell in it to do homage to the first beast, whose wound of death was healed. @ Ñu ngă lu gru kơnăl prŏng, tơl ngă brơi apui mơ̆ng adai lĕ trŭn pơ lŏn tơnah ƀơi anăp mơnuih; 
And it works great signs, that it should cause even fire to come down from heaven to the earth before men. @ ñu plư ƀing dŏ ƀơi lŏn tơnah hăng khul gru kơnăl ñu hmâo tơlơi dưi ngă ƀơi anăp hlô. Ñu pơtă kơ ƀing anŭn ngă rup hlô hmâo rơka yua kơ đao samơ̆ ăt dŏ hơdip. 
And it deceives those that dwell upon the earth by reason of the signs which it was given to it to work before the beast, saying to those that dwell upon the earth to make an image to the beast, which has the wound of the sword, and lived. @ Ñu ăt hmâo tơlơi dưi brơi jua suă pran kơ rup hlô anŭn, kiăng kơ rup hlô dưi pơhiăp, laih anŭn brơi arăng pơdjai hĭ ƀing ƀu kơkuh pơpŭ ôh kơ rup hlô anŭn. 
And it was given to it to give breath to the image of the beast, that the image of the beast should also speak, and should cause that as many as should not do homage to the image of the beast should be killed. @ Ñu ăt ngă brơi abih bang mơnuih, ƀing anĕt wơ̆t ƀing prŏng, ƀing pơdrŏng wơ̆t ƀing ƀun rin, ƀing rơngai wơ̆t ƀing hlŭn leng kơ hmâo gru kơnăl ƀơi tơngan gah hơnuă ƀôdah ƀơi athơi ƀing gơñu, 
And it causes all, the small and the great, and the rich and the poor, and the free and the bondmen, that they should give them a mark upon their right hand or upon their forehead; @ kiăng kơ ƀu hmâo hlơi dưi blơi ƀôdah sĭ mia tơdah gơñu ƀu hmâo ôh hră čih anăn hlô ƀôdah mrô hlô.
and that no one should be able to buy or sell save he that had the mark, the name of the beast, or the number of its name. @ Amăng tơlơi anai khŏm hmâo tơlơi kơhnâo. Hlơi jing mơnuih thâo hluh brơi ñu tĭng bĕ mrô hlô anŭn, yua kơ mrô anŭn jing mrô kơ anăn sa čô mơnuih; mrô anŭn jing mrô năm rơtuh năm pluh năm.
And I saw, and behold, the Lamb standing upon mount Zion, and with him a hundred [and] forty-four thousand, having his name and the name of his Father written upon their foreheads. @  Kâo lăng, anai nê Ană Triu dŏ ƀơi čư̆ Siôn, laih anŭn hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Ñu hmâo sa rơtuh pă pluh pă rơbâo čô mơnuih hmâo anăn Ană Triu, laih anŭn anăn Ama kơ Ană Triu hmâo čih laih ƀơi athơi ƀing gơñu. 
And I heard a voice out of the heaven as a voice of many waters, and as a voice of great thunder. And the voice which I heard [was] as of harp-singers harping with their harps; @ Kâo hmư̆ asăp mơ̆ng adai kar hăng dơnai lu glung ia, laih anŭn kar hăng dơnai grơ̆m kơtang. Asăp kâo hmư̆ hrup hăng asăp gong ƀing pĕ gong hlăk dŏ pĕ gong gơñu. 
and they sing a new song before the throne, and before the four living creatures and the elders. And no one could learn that song save the hundred [and] forty-four thousand who were bought from the earth. @ Laih anŭn gơñu adoh sa tơlơi adoh phrâo ƀơi anăp gre pơtao, ƀơi anăp pă drơi hlô mơnơ̆ng hơdip, laih anŭn ƀơi anăp ƀing kŏng tha. Ƀu hmâo ôh pô dưi hrăm tơlơi adoh anŭn, kơnơ̆ng ƀing sa rơtuh pă pluh pă rơbâo čô Ơi Adai hmâo song mă laih mơ̆ng lŏn tơnah. 
These are they who have not been defiled with women, for they are virgins: these are they who follow the Lamb wheresoever it goes. These have been bought from men [as] first-fruits to God and to the Lamb: @ Ƀing anŭn yơh jing ƀing aka ƀu pơgrĭ gơñu pô hăng đah kơmơi ôh, yua kơ ƀing gơñu jing ƀing dra hmŭm. Pơpă Ană Triu nao, ƀing gơñu đuaĭ tui pơ anŭn mơ̆n. Ơi Adai hmâo song mă laih ƀing gơñu mơ̆ng mơnuih mơnam, kiăng kơ jing boh hlâo hlang kơ Ơi Adai laih anŭn kơ Ană Triu. 
and in their mouths was no lie found; [for] they are blameless. @ Ƀu dưi hơduah ƀuh tơlơi ƀlor ƀơi amăng bah ƀing gơñu ôh, gơñu jing ƀing mơnuih ƀu hmâo anih dưi ƀuah ôh.
And I saw another angel flying in mid-heaven, having [the] everlasting glad tidings to announce to those settled on the earth, and to every nation and tribe and tongue and people, @ Giơ̆ng anŭn kâo ƀuh sa čô ling jang pơkŏn pơr tơ̆ng krah adai. Ñu hmâo Tơlơi Phrâo Hiam hlŏng lar kiăng pơthâo brơi kơ ƀing dŏ ƀơi lŏn tơnah, kơ abih bang lŏn čar, kơ abih bang djuai mơnuih, kơ abih bang tơlơi pơhiăp, laih anŭn abih bang ană plei pla. 
saying with a loud voice, Fear God and give him glory, for the hour of his judgment has come; and do homage to him who has made the heaven and the earth and the sea and fountains of waters. @ Ñu laĭ hăng asăp kraih: “Hwĭ pơpŭ bĕ kơ Ơi Adai laih anŭn pơpŭ bơni kơ Ñu, yua kơ mông Ñu phat kơđi truh laih. Kơkuh pơpŭ bĕ kơ Ñu, Pô hrih pơjing adai, lŏn tơnah, ia rơsĭ laih anŭn abih bang akŏ ia.”
And another, a second, angel followed, saying, Great Babylon has fallen, has fallen, which of the wine of the fury of her fornication has made all nations drink. @  Sa čô ling jang pơkŏn, jing pô tal dua tui klon ñu laih anŭn laĭ: “Plei prŏng Babilôn tơglưh laih, tơglưh laih! Pô hmâo ngă brơi abih bang kơnŭng djuai mơnuih mơñum tơpai tơlơi hil kơtang kơ tơlơi rih răm ñu.”
And another, a third, angel followed them, saying with a loud voice, If any one do homage to the beast and its image, and receive a mark upon his forehead or upon his hand, @ Sa čô ling jang pơkŏn, jing pô tal klâo, tui klon ñu laih anŭn laĭ hăng asăp kraih: “Tơdah hlơi kơkuh pơpŭ kơ hlô laih anŭn kơ rup ñu, laih anŭn mă tŭ gru ƀơi athơi ƀôdah ƀơi tơngan ñu, 
he also shall drink of the wine of the fury of God prepared unmixed in the cup of his wrath, and he shall be tormented in fire and brimstone before the holy angels and before the Lamb. @ ñu anŭn či mơñum tơpai tơlơi Ơi Adai hil ƀu pơklai ôh, hmâo hling laih amăng kơčok tơlơi Ơi Adai hil, laih anŭn ñu či tŭ tơlơi tơnap tap amăng apui, laih anŭn boh pơtâo kơsŭm ƀơi anăp ƀing ling jang rơgoh hiam laih anŭn ƀơi anăp Ană Triu. 
And the smoke of their torment goes up to ages of ages, and they have no respite day and night who do homage to the beast and to its image, and if any one receive the mark of its name. @ Asăp apui tơlơi tơnap tap ƀing anŭn pơr đĭ nanao hlŏng lar. Ƀing mơnuih kơkuh pơpŭ kơ hlô laih anŭn rup ñu, laih anŭn abih bang hlơi pô mă tŭ gru anăn ñu, ƀing anŭn hrơi mlam ƀu hmâo tơlơi pơdơi ôh.”
Here is the endurance of the saints, who keep the commandments of God and the faith of Jesus. @ Anai yơh tơlơi gir kơ ƀing rơgoh hiam, jing ƀing djă pioh kơjăp tơlơi Ơi Adai pơtă laih anŭn tơlơi đaŏ kơ Yêsu.
And I heard a voice out of the heaven saying, Write, Blessed the dead who die in [the] Lord from henceforth. Yea, saith the Spirit, that they may rest from their labours; for their works follow with them. @ Kâo hmư̆ asăp mơ̆ng adai laĭ: “Čih bĕ tơlơi anai: Mơ̆ng ră anai pơ anăp, mơyun hiam yơh kơ ƀing djai jing ƀing djai amăng Khua Yang!” Yang Bơngăt Hiam laĭ: “Sĭt biă mă, gơñu či pơdơi mơ̆ng tơlơi gleh glăn gơñu, laih anŭn khul bruă gơñu đuaĭ tui gơñu.”
And I saw, and behold, a white cloud, and on the cloud one sitting like [the] Son of man, having upon his head a golden crown, and in his hand a sharp sickle. @  Giơ̆ng anŭn kâo lăng, anai nê hmâo sa ƀŭt hiăng kŏ; ƀơi hiăng anŭn hmâo sa čô hrup hăng Ană Mơnuih hlăk dŏ ber. Akŏ Ñu đua mŭk pơtao mah, tơngan Ñu djă sa ƀĕ mơnek ƀơ̆ng biă mă. 
And another angel came out of the temple, crying with a loud voice to him that sat on the cloud, Send thy sickle and reap; for the hour of reaping is come, for the harvest of the earth is dried. @ Sa čô ling jang pơkŏn tơbiă mơ̆ng sang kơkuh pơpŭ, laih anŭn hăng asăp kraih ñu iâu Pô dŏ ber ƀơi hiăng kŏ: “Yơr mơnek Ih laih anŭn yuă bĕ, yua kơ mông yuă truh laih, bơyan yuă ƀơi lŏn tơnah truh laih.” 
And he that sat on the cloud put his sickle on the earth, and the earth was reaped. @ Tui anŭn Pô dŏ ber ƀơi hiăng kŏ glŏm mơnek Ñu pơ lŏn tơnah laih anŭn Ñu yuă abih lŏn tơnah yơh.
And another angel came out of the temple which [is] in the heaven, he also having a sharp sickle. @ Sa čô ling jang pơkŏn tơbiă mơ̆ng sang kơkuh pơpŭ amăng adai. Ñu ăt hmâo sa ƀĕ mơnek ƀơ̆ng kar kaĭ mơ̆n.
And another angel came out of the altar, having power over fire, and called with a loud cry to him that had the sharp sickle, saying, Send thy sharp sickle, and gather the bunches of the vine of the earth; for her grapes are fully ripened. @ Sa čô ling jang pơkŏn tơbiă mơ̆ng kơƀang ngă yang, pô hmâo tơlơi dưi ƀơi apui, hăng asăp kraih ñu iâu pô hmâo mơnek ƀơ̆ng biă mă, laĭ: “Yơr mơnek ih laih anŭn trơĭ bĕ khul boh kơƀâu ƀơi lŏn tơnah, yua kơ boh kơƀâu tơsă laih.” 
And the angel put his sickle to the earth, and gathered the vine of the earth, and cast [the bunches] into the great wine-press of the fury of God; @ Tui anŭn ling jang anŭn glŏm mơnek ñu pơ lŏn tơnah, laih anŭn trơĭ khul kơtul boh kơƀâu ƀơi lŏn tơnah, laih anŭn glŏm boh kơƀâu anŭn amăng kơthŭng djet prŏng kơ tơlơi Ơi Adai hil. 
and the wine-press was trodden without the city, and blood went out of the wine-press to the bits of the horses for a thousand six hundred stadia. @ Arăng khŏm juă hĭ gơñu amăng kơthŭng djet boh kơƀâu anŭn pơ gah rơngiao plei, laih anŭn drah tơbiă mơ̆ng kơthŭng anŭn đĭ dơ̆ bra aseh, laih anŭn ling ataih truh kơ kơplah wah klâo rơtuh wang kilômet.
And I saw another sign in the heaven, great and wonderful: seven angels having seven plagues, the last; for in them the fury of God is completed. @ Kâo ƀuh sa gru kơnăl pơkŏn amăng adai, prŏng laih anŭn yom pơphan biă mă. Hmâo tơjuh čô ling jang djă tơjuh mơta tơlơi răm ruă jing tơlơi răm ruă hnal tuč, yua kơ hăng tơlơi răm ruă anŭn Ơi Adai pơđŭt hĭ tơlơi Ñu hil.
And I saw as a glass sea, mingled with fire, and those that had gained the victory over the beast, and over its image, and over the number of its name, standing upon the glass sea, having harps of God. @ Kâo ƀuh sa mơnơ̆ng hơgĕt hrup hăng ia rơsĭ mơnĭl pơlŭk hăng apui, laih anŭn ƀing mơnuih hmâo dưi hĭ laih hăng hlô, hăng rup ñu, hăng mrô kơ anăn ñu, dŏ dơ̆ng jĕ ia rơsĭ mơnĭl, djă gong Ơi Adai amăng tơngan ñu. 
And they sing the song of Moses bondman of God, and the song of the Lamb, saying, Great and wonderful [are] thy works, Lord God Almighty; righteous and true [are] thy ways, O King of nations. @ Ƀing gơñu adoh tơlơi adoh Môis, ding kơna Ơi Adai, laih anŭn tơlơi adoh Ană Triu, tui anai:
“Ơ Khua Yang Ơi Adai Dưi Kơtang!
Bruă Ih prŏng prin laih anŭn yom pơphan biă mă.
Ơ Pơtao kơ abih bang rơnŭk,
Hơdră jơlan Ih jing tơpă laih anŭn sĭt!
Who shall not fear [thee], O Lord, and glorify thy name? for [thou] only [art] holy; for all nations shall come and do homage before thee; for thy righteousnesses have been made manifest. @  Ơ Khua Yang, hlơi pô ƀu či hwĭ pơpŭ kơ Ih,
Laih anŭn ƀu ngă guh kơang kơ anăn Ih?
Yua kơ kơnơ̆ng hơjăn Ih đôč jing hiam hơčih.
Abih bang kơnŭng djuai mơnuih či rai
Kơkuh pơpŭ ƀơi anăp Ih,
Yua kơ khul bruă tơpă hơnơ̆ng Ih hmâo pơrơđah laih.”
And after these things I saw, and the temple of the tabernacle of witness in the heaven was opened; @  Giơ̆ng anŭn kâo ƀuh sang kơkuh pơpŭ, jing Sang Khăn Gơ̆ng Jơlan amăng adai pŏk hĭ. 
and the seven angels who had the seven plagues came out of the temple, clothed in pure bright linen, and girded about the breasts with golden girdles. @ Laih anŭn tơjuh čô ling jang djă tơjuh mơta tơlơi răm ruă tơbiă mơ̆ng sang kơkuh pơpŭ, buh ao kơbuă rơgoh bơngač laih anŭn hrăng bơnal mah ƀơi tơda. 
And one of the four living creatures gave to the seven angels seven golden bowls, full of the fury of God, who lives to the ages of ages. @ Sa drơi amăng pă drơi hlô mơnơ̆ng hơdip brơi kơ tơjuh čô ling jang tơjuh boh čơlŭ mah bă hăng tơlơi Ơi Adai hil, Pô hơdip hlŏng lar. 
And the temple was filled with smoke from the glory of God and from his power: and no one could enter into the temple until the seven plagues of the seven angels were completed. @ Sang kơkuh pơpŭ bă hăng asăp apui mơ̆ng tơlơi ang yang Ơi Adai laih anŭn mơ̆ng tơlơi mơyang Ñu, ƀu hmâo hlơi dưi mŭt amăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ tơl tơjuh mơta tơlơi răm ruă mơ̆ng tơjuh čô ling jang hmâo pơgiơ̆ng hĭ.
And I heard a great voice out of the temple, saying to the seven angels, Go and pour out the seven bowls of the fury of God upon the earth. @ Giơ̆ng anŭn kâo hmư̆ asăp kraih tơbiă mơ̆ng sang kơkuh pơpŭ laĭ kơ tơjuh čô ling jang: “Nao tuh bĕ pơ lŏn tơnah tơjuh boh čơlŭ tơlơi Ơi Adai hil.”
And the first went and poured out his bowl on the earth; and there came an evil and grievous sore upon the men that had the mark of the beast, and those who worshipped its image. @  Tui anŭn ling jang tal sa nao laih anŭn tuh čơlŭ ñu pơ lŏn tơnah. Laih anŭn hmâo teng akăm ruă biă mă truh kơ ƀing mơnuih hmâo laih gru mơ̆ng hlô laih anŭn kơkuh pơpŭ kơ rup hlô.
And the second poured out his bowl on the sea; and it became blood, as of a dead man; and every living soul died in the sea. @ Ling jang tal dua tuh čơlŭ ñu amăng ia rơsĭ, laih anŭn ia rơsĭ jing hĭ hrup hăng drah mơnuih djai, laih anŭn abih bang mơnơ̆ng hơdip dŏ amăng ia rơsĭ leng kơ djai hĭ soh sel.
And the third poured out his bowl on the rivers, and [on] the fountains of waters; and they became blood. @ Ling jang tal klâo tuh čơlŭ ñu amăng ia krong laih anŭn ƀơi khul akŏ ia, laih anŭn gơñu jing hĭ drah. 
And I heard the angel of the waters saying, Thou art righteous, who art and wast, the holy one, that thou hast judged so; @ Kâo hmư̆ ling jang wai lăng ia rơsĭ laĭ:
“Ơ Pô Rơgoh Hơčih, Pô Hlăk Hmâo, Pô Hmâo Laih, Ih jing tơpă.
Yua kơ Ih hmâo phat kơđi laih abih bang tơlơi anai.
for they have poured out the blood of saints and prophets, and thou hast given them blood to drink; they are worthy. @ Yua kơ ƀing gơñu hmâo ngă tuh drah laih kơ ƀing rơgoh hiam laih anŭn kơ ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo,
Yua kơ anŭn Ih hmâo brơi laih kơ ƀing gơñu mơñum drah.
Ƀing gơñu năng lăp yơh kơ tơlơi anŭn!”
And I heard the altar saying, Yea, Lord God Almighty, true and righteous [are] thy judgments. @ Laih anŭn kâo hmư̆ asăp pơhiăp mơ̆ng kơƀang ngă yang laĭ:
“Sĭt biă mă, Ơ Khua Yang jing Ơi Adai Dưi Kơtang,
Tơlơi Ih phat kơđi jing sĭt laih anŭn tơpă!”
And the fourth poured out his bowl on the sun; and it was given to it to burn men with fire. @ Ling Jang tal pă tuh čơlŭ ñu ƀơi yang hrơi, yang hrơi hmâo tơlơi dưi yua apui čuh ană mơnuih. 
And the men were burnt with great heat, and blasphemed the name of God, who had authority over these plagues, and did not repent to give him glory. @ Tơlơi pơ-iă kơtang čuh hĭ ană mơnuih, laih anŭn ƀing gơñu hơtơ̆m pah kơ anăn Ơi Adai, Pô hmâo tơlơi dưi ƀơi tơlơi răm ruă anŭn. Samơ̆ ƀing gơñu ăt ƀu kơhmal tơlơi soh gơñu ôh, kiăng ngă guh kơang kơ Ơi Adai.
And the fifth poured out his bowl on the throne of the beast; and its kingdom became darkened; and they gnawed their tongues with distress, @ Ling Jang tal rơma tuh čơlŭ ñu ƀơi gre pơtao hlô, laih anŭn dêh čar pơtao hlô jing hĭ kơnăm mơmŏt; laih anŭn ană mơnuih kĕ jơlah gơñu pô yua kơ ruă nuă biă mă. 
and blasphemed the God of the heaven for their distresses and their sores, and did not repent of their works. @ Ƀing gơñu hơtơ̆m pah kơ Ơi Adai amăng adai yua kơ tơlơi ruă nuă laih anŭn yua kơ teng gơñu, samơ̆ ƀu kơhmal ôh kơ khul bruă gơñu ngă.
And the sixth poured out his bowl on the great river Euphrates; and its water was dried up, that the way of the kings from the rising of the sun might be prepared. @  Ling jang tal năm tuh čơlŭ ñu ƀơi ia krong prŏng Ơphrat, ia krong anŭn thu hĭ, kiăng pơkra jơlan brơi kơ ƀing pơtao mơ̆ng čar gah ngŏ. 
And I saw out of the mouth of the dragon, and out of the mouth of the beast, and out of the mouth of the false prophet, three unclean spirits, as frogs; @ Kâo ƀuh mơ̆ng amăng bah ana grai, mơ̆ng amăng bah hlô, laih anŭn mơ̆ng amăng bah pô laĭ lui hlâo ƀlor klâo čô yang grĭ hơƀak hrup hăng ajĭ tơbiă rai. 
for they are [the] spirits of demons, doing signs; which go out to the kings of the whole habitable world to gather them together to the war of [that] great day of God the Almighty. @ Gơñu jing bơngăt yang sat, ngă khul gru kơnăl, nao pơ ƀing pơtao kơ abih bang lŏn tơnah, kiăng pơƀŭt glaĭ gơñu kơ tơlơi pơblah ƀơi hrơi prŏng Ơi Adai Dưi Kơtang. 
(Behold, I come as a thief. Blessed [is] he that watches and keeps his garments, that he may not walk naked, and that they [may not] see his shame.) @ “Anai nê, kâo rai hrup hăng mơnuih klĕ! Mơyun hiam yơh kơ hlơi pô dŏ kơčăng laih anŭn wai lăng sum ao gơñu kiăng kơ ñu ƀu rơbat amăng tơlơi mơhlŭn ôh, laih anŭn arăng ƀu ƀuh ôh tơlơi mlâo hañ ñu!” 
And he gathered them together to the place called in Hebrew, Armagedon. @ Ƀing yang sat anŭn pơƀŭt glaĭ ƀing pơtao ƀơi sa anih arăng pia amăng tơlơi Hêbrơ Harmagêdôn.
And the seventh poured out his bowl on the air; and there came out a great voice from the temple of the heaven, from the throne, saying, It is done. @ Ling jang tal tơjuh tuh čơlŭ ñu amăng angĭn, laih anŭn hmâo asăp kraih tơbiă mơ̆ng gre pơtao amăng sang kơkuh pơpŭ, laĭ: “Giơ̆ng laih yơh!” 
And there were lightnings, and voices, and thunders; and there was a great earthquake, such as was not since men were upon the earth, such an earthquake, so great. @ Laih anŭn hmâo kơmlă, dơnai pơhiăp, dơnai grơ̆m, laih anŭn lŏn tơnah pơpư̆ kơtang biă mă, aka hmâo djơ̆ ôh tơlơi pơpư̆ lŏn tơnah kơtang kar hăng anŭn čơdơ̆ng mơ̆ng hmâo mơnuih ƀơi lŏn tơnah. 
And the great city was [divided] into three parts; and the cities of the nations fell: and great Babylon was remembered before God to give her the cup of the wine of the fury of his wrath. @ Plei prŏng čơđang pơpha hĭ jing klâo črăn, laih anŭn khul plei prŏng amăng abih bang lŏn čar tơglưh hĭ, laih anŭn Ơi Adai hơdơr kơ plei prŏng Babilôn, kiăng brơi ñu mơñum čơlŭ tơpai tơlơi Ơi Adai hil kơtang. 
And every island fled, and mountains were not found; @ Abih bang plao ia rơsĭ đuaĭ kơdŏp laih anŭn khul bul čư̆ arăng ƀu ƀuh dơ̆ng tah. 
and a great hail, as of a talent weight, comes down out of the heaven upon men; and men blasphemed God because of the plague of hail, for the plague of it is exceeding great. @ Hmâo hơjan pler prŏng, boh kơtraŏ ñu sa boh rơma pluh kilôgram, mơ̆ng adai lĕ trŭn ƀơi ană mơnuih, tơl ană mơnuih hơtơ̆m pah kơ Ơi Adai yua kơ tơlơi răm ruă mơ̆ng hơjan pler anŭn, yua kơ tơlơi răm ruă anŭn krip yip biă mă.
And one of the seven angels, which had the seven bowls, came and spoke with me, saying, Come here, I will shew thee the sentence of the great harlot who sits upon the many waters; @  Giơ̆ng anŭn sa čô amăng tơjuh čô ling jang djă tơjuh boh čơlŭ rai hăng laĭ kơ kâo: “Rai bĕ, kâo či kơčrâo brơi ih ƀuh tơlơi phat kơđi đah kơmơi hing ang rih răm, pô hlăk dŏ ber ƀơi ngŏ khul glung ia. 
with whom the kings of the earth have committed fornication; and they that dwell on the earth have been made drunk with the wine of her fornication. @ Ƀing pơtao ƀơi lŏn tơnah ngă tơlơi soh rih răm hăng ñu, laih anŭn mơnuih mơnam ƀơi lŏn tơnah ăt măt yua kơ tơpai rih răm ñu mơ̆n.” 
And he carried me away in spirit to a desert; and I saw a woman sitting upon a scarlet beast, full of names of blasphemy, having seven heads and ten horns. @ Yang Bơngăt Hiam gom kâo, laih anŭn ling jang ba kâo nao pơ tơdrŏn tač. Pơ anŭn, kâo ƀuh sa čô đah kơmơi dŏ ber ƀơi rŏng sa drơi hlô mriah tơthu bă hăng anăn tơlơi pơhiăp ƀrưh hmiah kơ Ơi Adai. Hlô anŭn hmâo tơjuh boh akŏ laih anŭn pluh ƀĕ tơki. 
And the woman was clothed in purple and scarlet, and had ornaments of gold and precious stones and pearls, having a golden cup in her hand full of abominations and the unclean things of her fornication; @ Đah kơmơi anŭn buh ao mriah tăm laih anŭn mriah huč, pơhrôp ñu pô hăng mah, boh pơtâo yom laih anŭn boh pơtâo ačung. Ñu djă amăng tơngan ñu sa boh čơlŭ mah bă hăng tơlơi sat, tơlơi grĭ hơƀak mơ̆ng tơlơi rih răm ñu. 
and upon her forehead a name written, Mystery, great Babylon, the mother of the harlots, and of the abominations of the earth. @ Ƀơi athơi ñu hmâo čih laih sa anăn bă tơlơi hơgơ̆m: “Babilôn prŏng prin, amĭ kơ ƀing đah kơmơi rih răm laih anŭn khul tơlơi sat tŭt lŏn tơnah.” 
And I saw the woman drunk with the blood of the saints, and with the blood of the witnesses of Jesus. And I wondered, seeing her, with great wonder. @ Kâo ƀuh đah kơmơi anŭn măt hăng drah ƀing rơgoh hiam laih anŭn drah ƀing ngă gơ̆ng jơlan kơ Yêsu. Tơdang kâo ƀuh ñu kâo kơtuă hling hlang biă mă.
And the angel said to me, Why hast thou wondered? *I* will tell thee the mystery of the woman, and of the beast which carries her, which has the seven heads and the ten horns. @ Samơ̆ ling jang laĭ kơ kâo: “Hyư̆m ih dŏ kơtuă hling lĕ? Kâo či pơblang brơi kơ ih thâo tơlơi hơgơ̆m kơ đah kơmơi anŭn, laih anŭn kơ hlô ñu đĭ hmâo tơjuh boh akŏ laih anŭn pluh ƀĕ tơki. 
The beast which thou sawest was, and is not, and is about to come up out of the abyss and go into destruction: and they who dwell on the earth, whose names are not written from the founding of the world in the book of life, shall wonder, seeing the beast, that it was, and is not, and shall be present. @ Hlô ih ƀuh hlâo dih hmâo laih, ră anai ƀu hmâo tah, giăm tơbiă mơ̆ng hlŭng dlam laih anŭn nao kơ tơlơi răm rơngiă. Ƀing mơnuih dŏ amăng lŏn tơnah ƀu hmâo ôh anăn čih amăng hơdrôm hră tơlơi hơdip mơ̆ng rơnŭk hrih lŏn tơnah, či kơtuă hling tơdang ƀuh hlô anŭn, yua kơ hlâo adih ñu hmâo laih, laih anŭn ră anai ƀu hmâo dơ̆ng tah, samơ̆ ñu či rai dơ̆ng.
Here is the mind that has wisdom: The seven heads are seven mountains, whereon the woman sits. @ Amăng tơlơi anai khŏm hmâo tơlơi rơgơi laih anŭn tơlơi kơhnâo: tơjuh boh akŏ jing tơjuh boh čư̆, anih đah kơmơi anŭn dŏ ber. Gơñu ăt jing tơjuh čô ƀing pơtao mơ̆n: 
And there are seven kings: five have fallen, one is, the other has not yet come; and when he comes he must remain [only] a little while. @ Rơma čô amăng ƀing gơñu tơglưh laih, sa čô ăt dŏ wai lăng, laih anŭn sa čô pơkŏn aka truh ôh. Tơ ñu truh, ñu kơnơ̆ng dŏ ƀiă đôč, ƀu sui ôh. 
And the beast that was and is not, he also is an eighth, and is of the seven, and goes into destruction. @ Bơ kơ hlô hlâo anŭn hmâo laih, samơ̆ ră anai ƀu hmâo dơ̆ng tah, ñu anŭn jing pơtao tal sapăn, ñu ăt jing amăng ƀing tơjuh čô pơtao mơ̆n, laih anŭn hlăk nao pơ tơlơi răm rơngiă. 
And the ten horns which thou sawest are ten kings, which have not yet received a kingdom, but receive authority as kings one hour with the beast. @ Pluh ƀĕ tơki ih hmâo ƀuh anŭn jing pluh čô pơtao aka ƀu mă tŭ ôh tơlơi dưi wai lăng, samơ̆ gơñu či mă tŭ tơlơi dưi jing pơtao hrŏm hơbĭt hăng hlô anŭn amăng sa mông. 
These have one mind, and give their power and authority to the beast. @ Ƀing pơtao anŭn hmâo hrŏm sa pran jua jao brơi tơlơi kơtang laih anŭn tơlơi dưi gơñu kơ hlô. 
These shall make war with the Lamb, and the Lamb shall overcome them; for he is Lord of lords and King of kings: and they [that are] with him called, and chosen, and faithful. @ Gơñu či pơblah hăng Ană Triu, laih anŭn Ană Triu či dưi hĭ hăng ƀing gơñu, yua kơ Ñu jing Khua Yang kơ abih bang ƀing khua yang laih anŭn Pơtao kơ abih bang ƀing pơtao, laih anŭn ƀing dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Ñu jing ƀing Ơi Adai hmâo iâu laih, ruah laih, laih anŭn jing ƀing tŏng ten, ăt či dưi hĭ mơ̆n.”
And he says to me, The waters which thou sawest, where the harlot sits, are peoples and multitudes and nations and tongues. @ Laih anŭn ling jang laĭ kơ kâo: “Khul glung ia ih ƀuh anŭn, anih đah kơmơi rih răm dŏ ber, jing ƀing ană plei pla, ƀing mơnuih lu, ƀing kơnŭng djuai mơnuih, laih anŭn khul tơlơi pơhiăp phara phara. 
And the ten horns which thou sawest, and the beast, these shall hate the harlot, and shall make her desolate and naked, and shall eat her flesh, and shall burn her with fire; @ Pluh ƀĕ tơki ih hmâo ƀuh laih anŭn hlô či bơrơmŭt kơ đah kơmơi rih răm anŭn. Ƀing gơñu či mă hĭ abih mơnơ̆ng ñu hmâo, ngă brơi ñu dŏ mơhlŭn; gơñu či ƀơ̆ng asar đah kơmơi rih răm, laih anŭn čuh hĭ ñu amăng apui. 
for God has given to their hearts to do his mind, and to act with one mind, and to give their kingdom to the beast until the words of God shall be fulfilled. @ Yua kơ Ơi Adai hmâo pioh laih amăng pran jua gơñu khŏm ngă tơlơi Ơi Adai kiăng; gơñu sa pran jua hrŏm hơbĭt jao brơi tơlơi dưi wai lăng gơñu kơ hlô, tơl boh pơhiăp Ơi Adai dưi krĕp djơ̆ hĭ. 
And the woman which thou sawest is the great city, which has kingship over the kings of the earth. @ Laih anŭn đah kơmơi ih hmâo ƀuh anŭn jing plei prŏng prŏng prin wai lăng ƀơi ƀing pơtao lŏn tơnah.”
After these things I saw another angel descending out of the heaven, having great authority: and the earth was lightened with his glory. @ Giơ̆ng kơ tơlơi anŭn kâo ƀuh sa čô ling jang pơkŏn hmâo tơlơi dưi prŏng trŭn mơ̆ng adai, tơlơi guh kơang Ñu bang rơđah abih bang lŏn tơnah. 
And he cried with a strong voice, saying, Great Babylon has fallen, has fallen, and has become the habitation of demons, and a hold of every unclean spirit, and a hold of every unclean and hated bird; @ Ñu ur kraih laĭ:
“Babilôn, prŏng prin hmâo tơglưh laih, hmâo tơglưh laih yơh!
Ñu hmâo jing hĭ laih anih dŏ kơ ƀing yang sat,
Par hruh kơ ƀing yang bơngăt grĭ hơƀak,
Amăng kơ abih bang khul čĭm laih anŭn hlô grĭ arăng bơrơmŭt;
because all the nations have drunk of the wine of the fury of her fornication; and the kings of the earth have committed fornication with her, and the merchants of the earth have been enriched through the might of her luxury. @  Yua kơ abih bang djuai mơnuih mơñum laih tơpai tơlơi rih răm hơƀak drak ñu,
Ƀing pơtao ƀơi lŏn tơnah ngă soh tơlơi rih răm hăng ñu,
Ƀing sĭ mia ƀơi lŏn tơnah jing pơdrŏng yua mơ̆ng tơlơi amoaih kluh rơgao hlah ñu.”
And I heard another voice out of the heaven saying, Come out of her, my people, that ye have not fellowship in her sins, and that ye do not receive of her plagues: @  Giơ̆ng anŭn kâo hmư̆ asăp pơkŏn mơ̆ng adai laĭ:
“Ơ ană plei Kâo, tơbiă bĕ mơ̆ng Babilôn!
Anăm ƀing gih mŭt hrŏm hơbĭt amăng tơlơi soh ñu ôh,
Kiăng kơ ƀing gih ƀu či tŭ mă tơlơi răm ruă hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ñu;
for her sins have been heaped on one another up to the heaven, and God has remembered her unrighteousnesses. @  Yua kơ tơlơi soh ñu dăp đĭ glong truh pơ adai,
Laih anŭn Ơi Adai hơdơr kơ tơlơi soh sat ñu.
Recompense her even as she has recompensed; and double [to her] double, according to her works. In the cup which she has mixed, mix to her double. @  Ngă bĕ kơ ñu kar hăng ñu ngă laih kơ arăng,
Pơglaĭ bĕ kơ ñu dua wơ̆t lu hloh tui hăng bruă ñu hmâo ngă;
Pơlŭk brơi bĕ kơ ñu dua wơ̆t lu hloh čơlŭ ñu hmâo pơlŭk brơi laih kơ arăng.
So much as she has glorified herself and lived luxuriously, so much torment and grief give to her. Because she says in her heart, I sit a queen, and I am not a widow; and I shall in no wise see grief: @  Hơdơ̆ pă Ñu hmâo pơ-ư pơang ñu pô laih anŭn hơdip tui tơlơi amoaih kluh,
Ngă bĕ kơ ñu tơlơi tơnap laih anŭn tơlơi kơ-ŭ kơ-uăn dơ̆ anŭn mơ̆n.
Yua kơ ñu laĭ amăng pran jua ñu:
‘Kâo dŏ ber hrup hăng sa čô đah kơmơi pơtao!
Kâo ƀu djơ̆ đah kơmơi djai rơkơi ôh,
Kâo ƀu či hmâo tơlơi kơ-ŭ kơ-uăn ôh.’
for this reason in one day shall her plagues come, death and grief and famine, and she shall be burnt with fire; for strong [is the] Lord God who has judged her. @ Yua kơ anŭn yơh, amăng sa hrơi tơlơi răm ruă či truh kơ ñu:
Tơlơi djai, tơlơi kơ-ŭ kơ-uăn, tơlơi ư̆ rơpa.
Ơi Adai či čuh hĭ ñu amăng apui,
Yua kơ Khua Yang, Pô phat kơđi ñu, jing Ơi Adai bă hăng tơlơi dưi mơyang.”
And the kings of the earth, who have committed fornication, and lived luxuriously with her, shall weep and wail over her, when they see the smoke of her burning, @  Ƀing pơtao ƀơi lŏn tơnah hmâo ngă laih tơlơi soh rih răm, laih anŭn tơlơi hơdip amoaih kluh hăng ñu, či čŏk hia laih anŭn ur krao tơdang ƀuh asăp apui dŏ ƀơ̆ng ñu. 
standing afar off, through fear of her torment, saying, Woe, woe, the great city, Babylon, the strong city! for in one hour thy judgment is come. @ Yua kơ hwĭ kơ tơlơi ruă tơnap ñu, hnŭn yơh gơñu dŏ pơ ataih, laih anŭn laĭ:
“Răm ƀăm yơh! Răm ƀăm yơh! Plei prŏng prin biă mă!
Babilôn plei pơdrŏng kơtang!
Kơnơ̆ng amăng sa mông đôč, tơlơi phat kơđi hmâo truh laih kơ ih!”
And the merchants of the earth weep and grieve over her, because no one buys their lading any more; @  Ƀing sĭ mia ƀơi lŏn tơnah čŏk hia laih anŭn kơ-ŭ kơ-uăn yua kơ ñu, yua kơ arăng ƀu blơi dơ̆ng tah gơnam ƀing gơñu sĭ mia. 
lading of gold, and silver, and precious stones, and pearl, and fine linen, and purple, and silk, and scarlet dye, and all thyine wood, and every article in ivory, and every article in most precious wood, and in brass, and in iron, and in marble, @ Khul gơnam sĭ mia: mah, prăk, boh pơtâo yom, boh pơtâo ačung, bơnal kơbuă añĕ ară, bơnal mriah jŭ, bơnal suai hlăt, bơnal mriah huč; khul mơta kơyâo ƀâu mơngưi, khul mơnơ̆ng ngă hăng bla, hăng kơyâo yom, hăng kong, hăng pơsơi, laih anŭn hăng boh pơtâo marbrơ, 
and cinnamon, and amomum, and incense, and unguent, and frankincense, and wine, and oil, and fine flour, and wheat, and cattle, and sheep, and of horses, and of chariots, and of bodies, and souls of men. @ kơđuh hol, mơnơ̆ng mơnâo, mơnơ̆ng ƀâu mơngưi, ia jrao phĭ, ia jrao ƀâu mơngưi, tơpai, ia rơmuă, tơpŭng, pơdai tơpŭng; rơmo, triu, aseh, rơdeh aseh, hlŭn laih anŭn bơngăt mơnuih. 
And the ripe fruits which were the lust of thy soul have departed from thee, and all fair and splendid things have perished from thee, and they shall not find them any more at all. @ Hơdôm mơnơ̆ng hiam ih amoaih đuaĭ laih mơ̆ng ih: “Abih bang tơlơi pơdrŏng sah tơlơi kơdrưh kơang ih, rơngiă laih mơ̆ng ih, laih anŭn ih ƀu či ƀuh gơñu dơ̆ng tah!” 
The merchants of these things, who had been enriched through her, shall stand afar off through fear of her torment, weeping and grieving, @ Ƀing mơnuih sĭ mia khul gơnam anŭn, ƀing dưi jing pơdrŏng laih yua mơ̆ng Babilôn, či dŏ ataih yua kơ hwĭ tơlơi răm ruă ñu; gơñu či hia laih anŭn kơ-ŭ kơ-uăn, 
saying, Woe, woe, the great city, which [was] clothed with fine linen and purple and scarlet, and had ornaments of gold and precious stones and pearls! @ laih anŭn laĭ: “Răm ƀăm yơh! Răm ƀăm yơh! Kơ Babilôn prŏng prin anŭn, hmâo buh brơi laih bơnal kơbuă añĕ ară, bơnal mriah jŭ, laih anŭn mriah huč, pơhrôp hăng mah, boh pơtâo yom, laih anŭn boh pơtâo ačung! 
for in one hour so great riches has been made desolate. And every steersman, and every one who sailed to any place, and sailors, and all who exercise their calling on the sea, stood afar off, @ Yua kơ amăng sa mông abih bang tơlơi pơdrŏng sah ñu răm rai laih.”
Abih bang ƀing khua kompăn, abih bang ƀing mơnuih đĭ amăng anŭn, ƀing mă bruă amăng kompăn laih anŭn abih bang ƀing mơnuih sĭ mia ƀơi ia rơsĭ, leng kơ dŏ dơ̆ng pơ ataih, 
and cried, seeing the smoke of her burning, saying, What [city] is like to the great city? @ laih anŭn gơñu ur kraih tơdang ƀuh asăp apui ƀơ̆ng ñu: “Aka hmâo djơ̆ ôh plei prŏng pă prŏng prin kar hăng plei prŏng anŭn!” 
and cast dust upon their heads, and cried, weeping and grieving, saying, Woe, woe, the great city, in which all that had ships in the sea were enriched through her costliness! for in one hour she has been made desolate. @ Gơñu prui ƀruih lŏn ƀơi akŏ gơñu, čŏk hia, kơ-ŭ kơ-uăn, ur krao laih anŭn laĭ: “Răm ƀăm yơh, răm ƀăm yơh kơ Babilôn prŏng prin anŭn, anih ngă brơi kơ abih bang ƀing mơnuih hmâo kompăn ƀơi ia rơsĭ jing pơdrŏng sah yua mơ̆ng tơlơi pơdrŏng sah ñu, samơ̆ kơnơ̆ng amăng sa mông đôč arăng pơrai hĭ ñu laih.
Rejoice over her, heaven, and [ye] saints and apostles and prophets; for God has judged your judgment upon her. @  Ơ adai, hơ̆k mơak bĕ yua kơ ñu, Ơ ƀing rơgoh hiam, ƀing khua ding kơna laih anŭn ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo ăt hơ̆k mơak bĕ, yua kơ Ơi Adai hmâo klă kơđi laih ñu tui hăng tơlơi ñu hmâo ngă kơ ƀing gih!”
And a strong angel took up a stone, as a great millstone, and cast [it] into the sea, saying, Thus with violence shall Babylon the great city be cast down, and shall be found no more at all; @  Hlăk anŭn, sa čô ling jang bă hăng tơlơi dưi kơtang mă sa boh pơtâo prŏng hrup hăng sa boh rơsŭng prŏng, glŏm trŭn amăng ia rơsĭ, laih anŭn laĭ: “Ơi Adai či glŏm trŭn plei prŏng Babilôn hrup hăng anŭn mơ̆n, laih anŭn ƀu hmâo hlơi ƀuh ñu dơ̆ng tah. 
and voice of harp-singers and musicians and flute-players and trumpeters shall not be heard any more at all in thee, and no artificer of any art shall be found any more at all in thee, and voice of millstone shall be heard no more at all in thee, @ Arăng ƀu či hmư̆ dơ̆ng ôh amăng ih dơnai ƀing pĕ brŏ, laih anŭn ƀing adoh, ƀing ayŭp đing klơt laih anŭn ayŭp tơki; arăng ƀu či ƀuh dơ̆ng ôh amăng ih sa čô mơnuih kơhnâo bruă kơ djŏp mơta bruă, laih anŭn arăng ƀu či hmư̆ dơ̆ng ôh amăng ih dơnai rơsŭng dar. 
and light of lamp shall shine no more at all in thee, and voice of bridegroom and bride shall be heard no more at all in thee; for thy merchants were the great ones of the earth; for by thy sorcery have all the nations been deceived. @ Tơlơi bơngač apui kơđen ƀu pơčrang dơ̆ng tah amăng ih, asăp dra hơđŭ dăm han ăt ƀu či hmư̆ dơ̆ng tah amăng ih, yua kơ ƀing sĭ mia ih jing ƀing mơnuih hmâo tơlơi dưi ƀơi lŏn tơnah laih anŭn yua kơ abih bang djuai mơnuih leng kơ lĕ amăng pơjâu mơnăn ih plư pleč.
And in her was found [the] blood of prophets and saints, and of all the slain upon the earth. @  Laih anŭn amăng plei anai arăng ƀuh drah ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo, laih anŭn ƀing rơgoh hiam, laih anŭn abih bang ƀing arăng hmâo pơdjai laih ƀơi lŏn tơnah.”
After these things I heard as a loud voice of a great multitude in the heaven, saying, Hallelujah: the salvation and the glory and the power of our God: @ Giơ̆ng anŭn, kâo hmư̆ amăng adai adih hmâo asăp kraih kar hăng asăp kơ sa phung mơnuih lu laĭ: “Halêluya! Tơlơi pơklaih, tơlơi guh kơang, laih anŭn tơlơi dưi mơyang lơ̆m kơ Ơi Adai ƀing ta, 
for true and righteous [are] his judgments; for he has judged the great harlot which corrupted the earth with her fornication, and has avenged the blood of his bondmen at her hand. @ Yua kơ tơlơi Ñu phat kơđi jing djơ̆ gal laih anŭn tơpă hơnơ̆ng; Ñu hmâo phat laih kơđi đah kơmơi rih răm prŏng, pô hmâo pơgrĭ lŏn tơnah hăng tơlơi rih răm ñu, laih anŭn Ơi Adai hmâo phak ñu yua kơ ñu pơdjai ƀing ding kơna Ơi Adai.” 
And a second time they said, Hallelujah. And her smoke goes up to the ages of ages. @ Phung mơnuih lu ur kraih sa wơ̆t dơ̆ng: “Halêluya! Asăp apui ƀơ̆ng plei prŏng anŭn đĭ nanao hlŏng lar.” 
And the twenty-four elders and the four living creatures fell down and did homage to God who sits upon the throne, saying, Amen, Hallelujah. @ Dua pluh pă čô kŏng tha laih anŭn pă drơi hlô mơnơ̆ng hơdip bon laih anŭn kơkuh kơ Ơi Adai, Pô dŏ ber ƀơi gre pơtao, gơñu laĭ: “Amen, Halêluya!”
And a voice came out of the throne, saying, Praise our God, all ye his bondmen, [and] ye that fear him, small and great. @  Laih anŭn hmâo asăp ur tơbiă mơ̆ng gre pơtao, laĭ: “Bơni hơơč bĕ kơ Ơi Adai ƀing ta, Ơ abih bang ƀing ding kơna Ñu, ƀing hwĭ pơpŭ kơ Ñu, ƀing anĕt laih anŭn ƀing prŏng.”
And I heard as a voice of a great crowd, and as a voice of many waters, and as a voice of strong thunders, saying, Hallelujah, for [the] Lord our God the Almighty has taken to himself kingly power. @  Giơ̆ng kơ anŭn kâo hmư̆ hrup hăng asăp phung mơnuih lu biă mă, hrup hăng dơnai lu glung ia, laih anŭn hrup hăng dơnai grơ̆m đah kơtang, ur kraih: “Halêluya! Yua kơ Khua Yang jing Ơi Adai Dưi Kơtang ƀing ta wai lăng. 
Let us rejoice and exult, and give him glory; for the marriage of the Lamb is come, and his wife has made herself ready. @ Brơi ƀing ta mơak laih anŭn hơ̆k kơdơ̆k bĕ, laih anŭn pơpŭ pơ-ư pơang Ñu, yua kơ phĕt pơkol Ană Triu truh laih, laih anŭn Bơnai Ñu hmâo pơhrôp ñu pô giơ̆ng laih. 
And it was given to her that she should be clothed in fine linen, bright [and] pure; for the fine linen is the righteousnesses of the saints. @ Arăng hmâo brơi kơ bơnai Ñu buh ao ngă hăng bơnal hơbuă añĕ ară, bơngač laih anŭn rơgoh hiam,” bơnal hơbuă ară añĕ anŭn jing khul bruă tơpă kơ ƀing rơgoh hiam.
And he says to me, Write, Blessed [are] they who are called to the supper of the marriage of the Lamb. And he says to me, These are the true words of God. @  Ling jang anŭn laĭ kơ kâo: “Čih bĕ: Mơyun hiam yơh kơ ƀing mơnuih arăng hmâo jak kơ tơlơi huă ƀơ̆ng tơlơi pơdŏ rơkơi bơnai Ană Triu.” Laih anŭn ñu laĭ kơ kâo: “Anai jing khul boh pơhiăp sĭt mơ̆ng Ơi Adai.” 
And I fell before his feet to do him homage. And he says to me, See [thou do it] not. I am thy fellow-bondman, and [the fellow-bondman] of thy brethren who have the testimony of Jesus. Do homage to God. For the spirit of prophecy is the testimony of Jesus. @ Kâo bon ƀơi tơkai ñu kiăng kơkuh pơpŭ gơñu, samơ̆ ñu laĭ: “Anăm ngă tui anŭn ôh! Kâo jing ding kơna mă bruă hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ih laih anŭn hăng ƀing adơi ayŏng ih, jing ƀing djă pioh tơlơi gơ̆ng jơlan kơ Khua Yang Yêsu Krist. Kơkuh pơpŭ bĕ kơ Ơi Adai.” Yua kơ tơlơi gơ̆ng jơlan kơ Yêsu jing jua pơmĭn kơ tơlơi laĭ lui hlâo.
And I saw the heaven opened, and behold, a white horse, and one sitting on it, [called] Faithful and True, and he judges and makes war in righteousness. @  Hlăk anŭn kâo ƀuh adai pŏk hĭ, anai nê hmâo sa drơi aseh kŏ! Pô đĭ aseh anŭn hmâo anăn jing Hơnơ̆ng Ten laih anŭn Tơpă Sĭt. Ñu phat kơđi laih anŭn pơblah amăng tơlơi tơpă. 
And his eyes are a flame of fire, and upon his head many diadems, having a name written which no one knows but himself; @ Mơta Ñu hrup hăng jơlah apui, ƀơi akŏ Ñu hmâo lu mŭk pơtao; hmâo sa anăn čih ƀơi Ñu, ƀu hmâo hlơi thâo ôh, kơnơ̆ng hơjan Ñu pô đôč thâo. 
and [he is] clothed with a garment dipped in blood; and his name is called The Word of God. @ Ñu buh ao phyung hmâo añrŭ laih amăng drah. Anăn Ñu arăng hmâo pơanăn jing Boh Pơhiăp Ơi Adai. 
And the armies which [are] in the heaven followed him upon white horses, clad in white, pure, fine linen. @ Ƀing tơhan amăng adai leng kơ buh ao ngă hăng bơnal kơbuă añĕ ară kŏ laih anŭn rơgoh hiam, đĭ aseh kŏ đuaĭ tui Ñu. 
And out of his mouth goes a sharp [two-edged] sword, that with it he might smite the nations; and he shall shepherd them with an iron rod; and he treads the wine-press of the fury of the wrath of God the Almighty. @ Sa ƀĕ đao ƀơ̆ng biă mă tơbiă mơ̆ng bah Ñu. Hăng đao anŭn Ñu koh ƀing djuai mơnuih, laih anŭn Ñu či wai lăng ƀing gơñu hăng sa ƀĕ gai jra pơsơi. Ñu či juă kơthŭng djet boh kơƀâu kơ tơlơi Ơi Adai hil kơtang, Pô Dưi Kơtang. 
And he has upon his garment, and upon his thigh, a name written, King of kings, and Lord of lords. @ Arăng čih ƀơi ao phyung Ñu laih anŭn ƀơi pha Ñu sa anăn: PƠTAO KƠ ɃING PƠTAO, KHUA YANG KƠ ɃING KHUA YANG.
And I saw an angel standing in the sun; and he cried with a loud voice, saying to all the birds that fly in mid-heaven, Come, gather yourselves to the great supper of God, @  Giơ̆ng kơ anŭn kâo ƀuh sa čô ling jang dŏ dơ̆ng amăng yang hrơi. Ñu iâu abih bang čĭm dŏ pơr ƀơi tơ̆ng krah adai hăng asăp kraih: “Rai bĕ, pơtŭm pơƀŭt kơ tơlơi ƀơ̆ng huă prŏng Ơi Adai hmâo pơkra laih, 
that ye may eat flesh of kings, and flesh of chiliarchs, and flesh of strong men, and flesh of horses and of those that sit upon them, and flesh of all, both free and bond, and small and great. @ kiăng kơ ƀơ̆ng asar ƀing pơtao, asar ƀing khua tơhan, asar ƀing hmâo tơlơi dưi kơtang, asar aseh laih anŭn asar ƀing đĭ aseh, asar abih bang mơnuih rơngai laih anŭn hlŭn, anĕt laih anŭn prŏng.”
And I saw the beast and the kings of the earth and their armies gathered together to make war against him that sat upon the horse, and against his army. @ Giơ̆ng anŭn kâo ƀuh hlô glai laih anŭn ƀing pơtao ƀơi lŏn tơnah hrŏm hơbĭt hăng phung tơhan ƀing gơñu hmâo pơtŭm pơƀŭt glaĭ kiăng pơblah hăng Pô đĭ aseh laih anŭn hăng phung tơhan Ñu. 
And the beast was taken, and the false prophet that [was] with him, who wrought the signs before him by which he deceived them that received the mark of the beast, and those that worship his image. Alive were both cast into the lake of fire which burns with brimstone; @ Samơ̆ arăng mă hĭ hlô glai anŭn, laih anŭn pô laĭ lui hlâo ƀlor hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ñu, pô hmâo ngă laih ƀơi anăp ñu khul gru kơnăl, hăng tơlơi anŭn pô laĭ lui hlâo ƀlor plư ƀing hmâo mă tŭ laih tơlơi čih mrô hlô glai laih anŭn hmâo kơkuh laih kơ rup ñu. Arăng glŏm hơdip abih dua gơñu amăng dơnao apui boh pơtâo kơsŭm hlăk dŏ jă. 
and the rest were slain with the sword of him that sat upon the horse, which goes out of his mouth; and all the birds were filled with their flesh. @ Ƀing ăt dŏ glaĭ leng kơ arăng pơdjai hĭ hăng đao tơbiă mơ̆ng amăng bah pô đĭ aseh; laih anŭn abih bang čĭm brĭm leng kơ ƀơ̆ng trơi hăng asar ƀing gơñu.
And I saw an angel descending from the heaven, having the key of the abyss, and a great chain in his hand. @ Giơ̆ng anŭn kâo ƀuh sa čô ling jang trŭn mơ̆ng adai, tơngan ñu djă kơmla kăl hlŭng dlam laih anŭn sa ară hrĕ čuăk prŏng. 
And he laid hold of the dragon, the ancient serpent who is [the] devil and Satan, and bound him a thousand years, @ Ñu mă ana grai, jing ala đưm adih, jing yang sat, laih anŭn Satan, laih anŭn akă hĭ ñu amăng sa rơbâo thŭn, 
and cast him into the abyss, and shut [it] and sealed [it] over him, that he should not any more deceive the nations until the thousand years were completed; after these things he must be loosed for a little time. @ ling jang glŏm hĭ ñu amăng hlŭng dlam, kơđơ̆l laih anŭn kơđŏm hĭ bah amăng anŭn, kiăng kơ ñu ƀu hyu plư ƀing djuai mơnuih ôh, tơl abih hĭ sa rơbâo thŭn anŭn. Giơ̆ng kơ anŭn Ơi Adai či phư ñu dơ̆ng kơnơ̆ng ƀiă hrơi.
And I saw thrones; and they sat upon them, and judgment was given to them; and the souls of those beheaded on account of the testimony of Jesus, and on account of the word of God; and those who had not done homage to the beast nor to his image, and had not received the mark on their forehead and hand; and they lived and reigned with the Christ a thousand years: @  Kâo ƀuh lu boh gre pơtao, laih anŭn arăng brơi kơ ƀing dŏ ber ƀơi anŭn tơlơi dưi phat kơđi. Kâo ăt ƀuh mơ̆n bơngăt ƀing mơnuih arăng hmâo čơ̆ng laih tơkuai gơñu yua kơ ƀing gơñu ngă gơ̆ng jơlan kơ Yêsu, yua kơ boh pơhiăp Ơi Adai. Ƀing gơñu ƀu kơkuh pơpŭ kơ hlô glai ƀôdah kơ rup ñu, laih anŭn kŏn tŭ lơi tơlơi čih mrô ñu ƀơi athơi ƀôdah ƀơi tơngan ƀing gơñu. Gơñu hơdip glaĭ laih anŭn wai lăng hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Krist amăng sa rơbâo thŭn. 
the rest of the dead did not live till the thousand years had been completed. This [is] the first resurrection. @ (Ƀing mơnuih djai dŏ glaĭ ƀu hơdip glaĭ ôh tơl sa rơbâo thŭn anŭn abih hĭ.) Anai jing tơlơi hơdip glaĭ tal sa. 
Blessed and holy he who has part in the first resurrection: over these the second death has no power; but they shall be priests of God and of the Christ, and shall reign with him a thousand years. @ Mơyun hiam yơh laih anŭn rơgoh hiam yơh kơ ƀing dưi tŭ mă hrŏm hơbĭt tơlơi hơdip glaĭ tal blŭng hlâo! Tơlơi djai tal dua ƀu hmâo tơlơi dưi hăng ƀing gơñu ôh, samơ̆ ƀing gơñu či jing ƀing khua ngă yang kơ Ơi Adai laih anŭn kơ Krist, laih anŭn gơñu či wai lăng hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Krist amăng sa rơbâo thŭn.
And when the thousand years have been completed, Satan shall be loosed from his prison, @ Giơ̆ng sa rơbâo thŭn abih hĭ, Ơi Adai či phư hĭ Satan mơ̆ng anih krư̆ ñu, 
and shall go out to deceive the nations which [are] in the four corners of the earth, Gog and Magog, to gather them together to the war, whose number [is] as the sand of the sea. @ laih anŭn ñu či tơbiă nao kiăng plư ƀing djuai mơnuih dŏ djŏp djang lŏn tơnah, jing phung Gôk laih anŭn phung Magôk, kiăng pơƀŭt glaĭ ƀing gơñu kơ tơlơi pơblah. Mrô arăng yap phung anŭn jing lu kar hăng čuah pơ hang ia rơsĭ. 
And they went up on the breadth of the earth, and surrounded the camp of the saints and the beloved city: and fire came down [from God] out of the heaven and devoured them. @ Phung gơñu ling nao tar ƀar lŏn tơnah, laih anŭn wang jum dar kơđông phung rơgoh hiam laih anŭn plei arăng khăp hơeng; samơ̆ apui mơ̆ng adai trŭn rai laih anŭn čuh pơrai hĭ ƀing gơñu, 
And the devil who deceived them was cast into the lake of fire and brimstone, where [are] both the beast and the false prophet; and they shall be tormented day and night for the ages of ages. @ laih anŭn Ơi Adai glŏm hĭ yang sat, pô plư ƀing gơ̆, amăng dơnao apui boh pơtâo kơsŭm, amăng anŭn hmâo laih hô glai laih anŭn pô laĭ lui hlâo ƀlor. Gơñu či tŭ tơlơi ruă tơnap hrơi hăng mlam truh pơ nanao hlŏng lar yơh.
And I saw a great white throne, and him that sat on it, from whose face the earth and the heaven fled, and place was not found for them. @  Giơ̆ng kơ tơlơi anŭn kâo ƀuh sa boh gre pơtao kŏ prŏng laih anŭn Pô dŏ ber ƀơi anŭn. Lŏn tơnah laih anŭn adai đuaĭ hĭ mơ̆ng anăp ƀô̆ mơta Ñu, laih anŭn ƀu hmâo dơ̆ng tah anih kơ ƀing gơñu. 
And I saw the dead, great and small, standing before the throne, and books were opened; and another book was opened, which is [that] of life. And the dead were judged out of the things written in the books according to their works. @ Kâo ƀuh ƀing djai, ƀing prŏng wơ̆t ƀing anĕt, leng kơ dŏ ƀơi anăp gre pơtao; laih anŭn lu sŏp hră hmâo pŏk hĭ. Sa sŏp hră pơkŏn jing sŏp hră tơlơi hơdip ăt pŏk mơ̆n. Laih anŭn arăng phat kơđi ƀing djai tui hăng bruă ƀing gơñu hmâo ngă laih, kar hăng hmâo čih laih amăng khul sŏp hră anŭn. 
And the sea gave up the dead which [were] in it, and death and hades gave up the dead which [were] in them; and they were judged each according to their works: @ Ia rơsĭ ba glaĭ ƀing djai dŏ amăng ñu; Tơlơi Djai laih anŭn Plei Ƀing Djai ba glaĭ ƀing djai hmâo dŏ laih amăng ƀing gơñu; laih anŭn rĭm mơnuih tŭ tơlơi phat kơđi tui hăng bruă ƀing gơñu hmâo ngă laih. 
and death and hades were cast into the lake of fire. This is the second death, [even] the lake of fire. @ Laih anŭn Ơi Adai glŏm hĭ Tơlơi Djai laih anŭn Plei Ƀing Djai amăng dơnao apui. Dơnao apui anŭn jing tơlơi djai tal dua. 
And if any one was not found written in the book of life, he was cast into the lake of fire. @ Hlơi pô anăn ñu ƀu hmâo čih ôh amăng sŏp hră tơlơi hơdip, Ơi Adai glŏm hĭ ñu amăng dơnao apui.
And I saw a new heaven and a new earth; for the first heaven and the first earth had passed away, and the sea exists no more. @  Hlăk anŭn kâo ƀuh adai phrâo laih anŭn lŏn tơnah phrâo; yua kơ adai blŭng hlâo laih anŭn lŏn tơnah blŭng hlâo rơngiă hĭ laih, laih anŭn ia rơsĭ ƀu hmâo dơ̆ng tah. 
And I saw the holy city, new Jerusalem, coming down out of the heaven from God, prepared as a bride adorned for her husband. @ Kâo ăt ƀuh mơ̆n plei rơgoh hiam jing plei Yêrusalem phrâo, trŭn rai mơ̆ng Ơi Adai hăng adai dih, hmâo pơhrôp laih hrup hăng sa čô dra pơkô̆ pre bưp rơkơi ñu. 
And I heard a loud voice out of the heaven, saying, Behold, the tabernacle of God [is] with men, and he shall tabernacle with them, and they shall be his people, and God himself shall be with them, their God. @ Kâo hmư̆ sa asăp kraih tơbiă mơ̆ng gre pơtao, laĭ tui anai: “Anai nê, sang Ơi Adai dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng mơnuih mơnam. Ñu či dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing gơ̆, laih anŭn ƀing gơ̆ či jing ƀing ană plei pla Ñu, Ơi Adai pô yơh či dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing gơ̆. 
And he shall wipe away every tear from their eyes; and death shall not exist any more, nor grief, nor cry, nor distress shall exist any more, for the former things have passed away. @ Ñu či sut hĭ ia mơta mơ̆ng mơta ƀing gơ̆, laih anŭn ăt ƀu hmâo dơ̆ng tah tơlơi djai brŭ, tơlơi kơ-ŭ kơ-uăn, tơlơi čŏk hia, ƀôdah tơlơi ruă nuă, yua kơ abih bang khul tơlơi blŭng hlâo rơgao hĭ laih.”
And he that sat on the throne said, Behold, I make all things new. And he says [to me], Write, for these words are true and faithful. @ Pô dŏ ƀơi gre pơtao laĭ: “Anai nê, kâo či ngă pơphrâo glaĭ abih bang mơnơ̆ng.” Laih anŭn Ñu laĭ dơ̆ng: “Čih bĕ, yua kơ khul boh pơhiăp anŭn năng lăp đaŏ kơnang laih anŭn tơpă sĭt.” 
And he said to me, It is done. I am the Alpha and the Omega, the beginning and the end. I will give to him that thirsts of the fountain of the water of life freely. @ Giơ̆ng anŭn Ñu laĭ hăng kâo: “Giơ̆ng laih yơh! Kâo jing Alpha laih anŭn Ômêga, jing čơdơ̆ng phŭn laih anŭn hnal tuč. Hlơi pô mơhao, Kâo či brơi ñu mơñum đôč đač mơ̆ng akŏ ia tơlơi hơdip. 
He that overcomes shall inherit these things, and I will be to him God, and he shall be to me son. @ Hlơi pô dưi či mă tŭ khul tơlơi anai ngă kong ngăn; Kâo či jing Ơi Adai ñu, laih anŭn ñu či jing ană Kâo. 
But to the fearful and unbelieving, [and sinners], and those who make themselves abominable, and murderers, and fornicators, and sorcerers, and idolaters, and all liars, their part [is] in the lake which burns with fire and brimstone; which is the second death. @ Samơ̆ bơ kơ ƀing lêl, ƀing ƀu đaŏ, ƀing grĭ grañ, ƀing pơdjai mơnuih, ƀing rih răm, ƀing pơjâu, ƀing kơkuh kơ rup trah, laih anŭn abih bang ƀing pơhiăp ƀlor, anih pioh brơi kơ ƀing gơñu jing dơnao apui. Boh pơtâo kơsŭm dŏ jă nanao. Anŭn jing tơlơi djai tal dua.”
And there came one of the seven angels which had had the seven bowls full of the seven last plagues, and spoke with me, saying, Come here, I will shew thee the bride, the Lamb's wife. @ Sa amăng tơjuh čô ling jang hmâo djă laih tơjuh čơlŭ bă tơlơi răm ruă hnal tuč rai pơ kâo hăng laĭ: “Rai bĕ, kâo či kơčrâo brơi ih dra pơkô̆ jing bơnai kơ Ană Triu.” 
And he carried me away in [the] Spirit, [and set me] on a great and high mountain, and shewed me the holy city, Jerusalem, coming down out of the heaven from God, @ Yang Bơngăt Hiam gom kâo, pŭ ba kâo pơ sa boh čư̆ prŏng glong biă mă, laih anŭn Ñu kơčrâo brơi kâo ƀuh plei rơgoh hiam jing plei Yêrusalem, mơ̆ng Ơi Adai hăng mơ̆ng adai adih trŭn rai, 
having the glory of God. Her shining [was] like a most precious stone, as a crystal-like jasper stone; @ tơlơi kơmlă kơ tơlơi guh kơang Ơi Adai; tơlơi kơmlă Ñu kar hăng sa asar boh pơtâo yom biă mă, kar hăng sar boh pơtâo jaspidi, bơngač jơngeh hrup hăng mơnĭl. 
having a great and high wall; having twelve gates, and at the gates twelve angels, and names inscribed, which are those of the twelve tribes of [the] sons of Israel. @ Plei hmâo bơnư̆ prŏng laih anŭn glong, hmâo pluh dua boh amăng jang, laih anŭn ƀơi amăng jang anŭn hmâo pluh dua čô ling jang dŏ. Laih anŭn ƀơi amăng jang anŭn arăng čih anăn pluh dua kơnŭng djuai ƀing ană Israel. 
On [the] east three gates; and on [the] north three gates; and on [the] south three gates; and on [the] west three gates. @ Gah ngŏ hmâo klâo boh amăng jang, gah kơdư hmâo klâo boh, gah dơnŭng hmâo klâo boh, gah yŭ hmâo klâo boh. 
And the wall of the city had twelve foundations, and on them twelve names of the twelve apostles of the Lamb. @ Bơnư̆ plei anŭn hmâo pluh dua atur, ƀơi atur anŭn arăng čih anăn pluh dua čô khua ding kơna kơ Ană Triu. 
And he that spoke with me had a golden reed [as] a measure, that he might measure the city, and its gates, and its wall. @ Ling jang pơhiăp hăng kâo djă sa ƀĕ gai pơkă ngă hăng mah, kiăng pơkă plei anŭn, amăng jang, laih anŭn bơnư̆ ñu. 
And the city lies four-square, and its length [is] as much as the breadth. And he measured the city with the reed twelve thousand stadia: the length and the breadth and height of it are equal. @ Plei anŭn pă mơta thar, yong ñu mơđơr hăng da ñu. Ñu pơkă plei anŭn hăng gai pơkă ñu, laih anŭn hmâo dua rơbâo pă rơtuh kilômet; yong, da, laih anŭn boh dơ̆ng ñu mơđơr kar kaĭ. 
And he measured its wall, a hundred [and] forty-four cubits, [a] man's measure, that is, [the] angel's. @ Ling jang ăt pơkă mơ̆n bơnư̆ plei, dơ̆ng ñu hmâo năm pluh met, tui hăng gai pơkă ană mơnuih, laih anŭn ăt jing gai pơkă ling jang mơ̆n. 
And the building of its wall [was] jasper; and the city pure gold, like pure glass: @ Pơnăng bơnư̆ ngă hăng boh pơtâo jaspidi, laih anŭn plei anŭn ngă hăng mah rơgoh, bơngač jơngeh hrup hăng mơnĭl. 
the foundations of the wall of the city [were] adorned with every precious stone: the first foundation, jasper; the second, sapphire; the third, chalcedony; the fourth, emerald; @ Atur bơnư̆ plei ngă pơhrôp hăng djŏp mơta boh pơtâo yom. Atur tal sa ngă hăng boh pơtâo jaspidi, tal dua hăng boh pơtâo saphirơ, tal klâo hăng boh pơtâo kalsêdôn, tal pă hăng boh pơtâo êmêrôt, 
the fifth, sardonyx; the sixth, sardius; the seventh, chrysolite; the eighth, beryl; the ninth, topaz; the tenth, chrysoprasus; the eleventh, jacinth; the twelfth, amethyst. @ tal rơma hăng boh pơtâo ônik, tal năm hăng boh pơtâo karnêlian, tal tơjuh hăng boh pơtâo krisôlit, tal sapăn hăng boh pơtâo beril, tal dua rơpăn hăng boh pơtâo tôpas, tal pluh hăng boh pơtâo krisôpras, tal pluh sa hăng boh pơtâo hiasin, tal pluh dua hăng boh pơtâo amêtis. 
And the twelve gates, twelve pearls; each one of the gates, respectively, was of one pearl; and the street of the city pure gold, as transparent glass. @ Pluh dua boh amăng jang ngă hăng pluh dua asar boh pơtâo ačung, rĭm amăng jang ngă hăng kơnơ̆ng sa asar boh pơtâo ačung đôč. Jơlan amăng plei ngă hăng mah rơgoh, bơngač jơngeh hrup hăng mơnĭl.
And I saw no temple in it; for the Lord God Almighty is its temple, and the Lamb. @ Kâo ƀu ƀuh ôh sang kơkuh pơpŭ amăng plei anŭn, yua kơ Khua Yang jing Ơi Adai Dưi Kơtang laih anŭn Ană Triu jing sang kơkuh pơpŭ kơ plei anŭn. 
And the city has no need of the sun nor of the moon, that they should shine for it; for the glory of God has enlightened it, and the lamp thereof [is] the Lamb. @ Plei anŭn ƀu kiăng kơ yang hrơi ƀôdah blan pơčrang ñu dơ̆ng ôh, yua kơ tơlơi guh kơang Ơi Adai pơčrang plei anŭn, laih anŭn Ană Triu jing apui kơđen kơ plei anŭn. 
And the nations shall walk by its light; and the kings of the earth bring their glory to it. @ Ƀing djuai mơnuih či rơbat nao hăng tơlơi bơngač plei anŭn; laih anŭn ƀing pơtao ƀơi lŏn tơnah či ba tơlơi guh kơang ƀing gơñu mŭt amăng plei anŭn. 
And its gates shall not be shut at all by day, for night shall not be there. @ Khul bah amăng jang plei abih hrơi ƀu krư̆ ôh, yua kơ pơ anŭn ƀu či hmâo mlam dơ̆ng ôh. 
And they shall bring the glory and the honour of the nations to it. @ Arăng či ba tơlơi guh kơang laih anŭn tơlơi pơpŭ kơ khul djuai mơnuih mŭt amăng anŭn. 
And nothing common, nor that maketh an abomination and a lie, shall at all enter into it; but those only who [are] written in the book of life of the Lamb. @ Abih bang ƀing hơƀak drak, ƀing ngă tơlơi bơrơmŭt khĕl, ƀing pleč ƀlor leng kơ ƀu dưi mŭt amăng plei anŭn ôh, samơ̆ kơnơ̆ng ƀing mơnuih hmâo anăn čih laih amăng sŏp hră tơlơi hơdip Ană Triu đôč dưi mŭt.
And he shewed me a river of water of life, bright as crystal, going out of the throne of God and of the Lamb. @  Ling jang kơčrâo brơi kâo ƀuh ia krong tơlơi hơdip, bơngač jơngeh hrup hăng mơnĭl, tơbiă ro mơ̆ng gre pơtao Ơi Adai laih anŭn Ană Triu, 
In the midst of its street, and of the river, on this side and on that side, [the] tree of life, producing twelve fruits, in each month yielding its fruit; and the leaves of the tree for healing of the nations. @ ro tơ̆ng krah jơlan plei anŭn; Ƀơi dua gah hang ia krong anŭn hmâo phŭn kơyâo tơlơi hơdip, ñu mơboh pluh dua wơ̆t amăng sa thŭn, rĭm blan ñu mơboh sa wơ̆t, laih anŭn hla ñu arăng yua kiăng pơsuaih ƀing djuai mơnuih. 
And no curse shall be any more; and the throne of God and of the Lamb shall be in it; and his servants shall serve him, @ Amăng plei anŭn ƀu či hmâo tơlơi hơtơ̆m pah dơ̆ng ôh, samơ̆ gre pơtao Ơi Adai laih anŭn Ană Triu či dŏ amăng plei anŭn. Ƀing ding kơna Ñu či buih bruă kơ Ñu; 
and they shall see his face; and his name [is] on their foreheads. @ Ƀing gơñu či ƀuh ƀô̆ mơta Ñu, laih anŭn anăn Ñu či dŏ ƀơi athơi ƀing gơñu. 
And night shall not be any more, and no need of a lamp, and light of [the] sun; for [the] Lord God shall shine upon them, and they shall reign to the ages of ages. @ Mlam ƀu či hmâo dơ̆ng ôh, ƀing gơñu ƀu kiăng kơ tơlơi bơngač kơ apui kơđen ƀôdah yang hrơi dơ̆ng ôh, yua kơ Khua Yang jing Ơi Adai či pơčrang bơngač kơ ƀing gơñu. Laih anŭn ƀing gơñu či wai lăng hlŏng lar.
And he said to me, These words [are] faithful and true; and [the] Lord God of the spirits of the prophets has sent his angel to shew to his bondmen the things which must soon come to pass. @ Giơ̆ng anŭn ling jang laĭ kơ kâo: “Boh pơhiăp anŭn năng lăp đaŏ kơnang laih anŭn tơpă sĭt. Khua Yang jing Ơi Adai kơ bơngăt ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo, hmâo pơkiaŏ nao laih ling jang Ñu kiăng bơrơđah brơi kơ ƀing ding kơna Ñu khul tơlơi giăm khŏm truh.
And behold, I come quickly. Blessed [is] he who keeps the words of the prophecy of this book. @ Anai nê, Kâo rai tañ. Mơyun hiam yơh kơ hlơi gưt tui khul boh pơhiăp laĭ lui hlâo amăng sŏp hră anai!”
And I, John, [was] he who heard and saw these things. And when I heard and saw, I fell down to do homage before the feet of the angel who shewed me these things. @ Kâo jing Yôhan, pô hmâo hmư̆ laih, laih anŭn hmâo ƀuh laih tơlơi anŭn. Giơ̆ng kâo hmư̆ laih anŭn ƀuh, kâo bon kơkuh pơpŭ ƀơi tơkai ling jang, pô hmâo bơrơđah laih khul tơlơi anŭn kơ kâo. 
And he says to me, See [thou do it] not. I am thy fellow-bondman, and [the fellow-bondman] of thy brethren the prophets, and of those who keep the words of this book. Do homage to God. @ Samơ̆ ñu laĭ kơ kâo: “Anăm ngă tui anŭn ôh! Kâo jing pô mă bruă hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ih, laih anŭn hăng ƀing adơi ayŏng ih jing ƀing pô laĭ lui hlâo, laih anŭn hrŏm hơbĭt hăng ƀing gưt tui boh pơhiăp amăng sŏp hră anai. Kơkuh pơpŭ bĕ kơ Ơi Adai.”
And he says to me, Seal not the words of the prophecy of this book. The time is near. @ Giơ̆ng anŭn ñu laĭ kơ kâo: “Anăm kơđŏm hĭ ôh khul boh pơhiăp laĭ lui hlâo amăng sŏp hră anai, yua kơ mông giăm truh yơh. 
Let him that does unrighteously do unrighteously still; and let the filthy make himself filthy still; and let him that is righteous practise righteousness still; and he that is holy, let him be sanctified still. @ Hlơi pô ƀu tơpă ăt ngă nanao tơlơi ƀu tơpă; hlơi pô hơƀak drak ăt ngă tơlơi hơƀak drak nanao; hlơi pô jing tơpă ăt ngă tơlơi tơpă nanao; hlơi pô hơdip rơgoh hiam ăt hơdip rơgoh hiam nanao.”
Behold, I come quickly, and my reward with me, to render to every one as his work shall be. @  “Anai nê, Kâo rai tañ, djă ba gơnam apah bơni hrŏm hơbĭt hăng Kâo, kiăng apah bơni kơ rĭm čô tui hăng bruă gơñu hmâo ngă laih. 
*I* [am] the Alpha and the Omega, [the] first and [the] last, the beginning and the end. @ Kâo jing Alpha laih anŭn Ômêga, Pô blŭng hlâo laih anŭn đŭt tơdơi, jing Čơdơ̆ng Phŭn laih anŭn Hnal Tuč.”
Blessed [are] they that wash their robes, that they may have right to the tree of life, and that they should go in by the gates into the city. @  Mơyun hiam yơh kơ ƀing mơnuih boh ao phyung gơñu, kiăng kơ hmâo tơlơi dưi ƀơ̆ng boh kơyâo mơ̆ng phŭn kơyâo tơlơi hơdip, laih anŭn dưi mŭt amăng plei găn mơ̆ng khul amăng jang. 
Without [are] the dogs, and the sorcerers, and the fornicators, and the murderers, and the idolaters, and every one that loves and makes a lie. @ Khul ƀing asâo, ƀing mơnuih ngă pơjâu, ƀing rih răm, ƀing pơdjai mơnuih, ƀing kơkuh kơ rup trah, wơ̆t ƀing khăp laih anŭn ngă tơlơi pleč ƀlor, leng kơ dŏ gah rơngiao plei.
*I* Jesus have sent mine angel to testify these things to you in the assemblies. *I* am the root and offspring of David, the bright [and] morning star. @  “Kâo jing Yêsu, hmâo pơkiaŏ nao laih ling jang Kâo kiăng ră pơthâo khul tơlơi anai kơ ƀing gih amăng phung sang Ơi Adai. Kâo jing Phŭn Akha laih anŭn Ană Tơčo Đawit, Pơtŭ Sêng mơguah.”
And the Spirit and the bride say, Come. And let him that hears say, Come. And let him that is athirst come; he that will, let him take [the] water of life freely. @  Yang Bơngăt Hiam laih anŭn Dra Pơkô̆ hrŏm hơbĭt laĭ: “Rai bĕ!” Laih anŭn brơi abih bang hlơi pô hmư̆ laĭ: “Rai bĕ!” Hlơi pô mơhao, brơi ñu rai bĕ! Hlơi pô kiăng, brơi ñu mă tŭ bĕ đôč đač ia tơlơi hơdip. 
*I* testify to every one who hears the words of the prophecy of this book, If any one shall add to these things, God shall add to him the plagues which are written in this book. @ Kâo pơhiăp pơsĭt hăng abih bang hlơi pô hmư̆ boh pơhiăp laĭ lui hlâo amăng sŏp hră anai: Tơdah hlơi thim tơlơi hơgĕt dơ̆ng amăng khul tơlơi anai, Ơi Adai či thim brơi kơ gơñu khul tơlơi răm ruă hmâo čih laih amăng sŏp hră anai. 
And if any one take from the words of the book of this prophecy, God shall take away his part from the tree of life, and out of the holy city, which are written in this book. @ Laih anŭn tơdah hlơi pơhrŏ hĭ khul boh pơhiăp amăng sŏp hră tơlơi laĭ lui hlâo anai, Ơi Adai či mă hĭ črăn ñu dưi hmâo kơ phŭn kơyâo tơlơi hơdip, laih anŭn tơlơi ñu dưi mŭt amăng plei rơgoh hiam, hmâo čih laih amăng sŏp hră anai.
He that testifies these things says, Yea, I come quickly. Amen; come, Lord Jesus. @ Pô ngă gơ̆ng jơlan brơi kơ khul tơlơi anai laĭ: “Sĭt biă mă, Kâo rai tañ.” Amen. Rai bĕ, Ơ Khua Yang Yêsu!
The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ [be] with all the saints. @ Rơkâo tơlơi pap mơ̆ng Khua Yang Yêsu dŏ hrŏm hơbĭt hăng abih bang phung rơgoh hiam. Amen.
